29.description: West Town Bikes is an amazing resource for our community.  Teaching anyone who is interested to maintain and safely ride their bikes and supplying tools to do so with.  Thanks West Town Bikes!!Ciclo Urbano is really great as well.  Good prices, nice service and affordable used bikes!

42.description: West Town Bikes is amazing.  The people who work here have helped me so much with fixing up my beloved bike -- the best part is that i leave the shop so empowered.  there is such an emphasis on teaching/learning, which is so great. I mostly come during the open shop nights,, spend a few hours cleaning and working on the bike.  there has always been so many helpful people at the shop, again its seriously great.  and at the end of the night,, you drop $10 bucks in the bucket and all people are super satisfied :)

23.description: This place is close to my house and I've given them three chances to help me solve some minor bike issues. They have successfully let me down each time I've gone there. I'm not the kind of person who is going to cause a big fuss. I'm going to give businesses a chance to help me out with what they supposedly "do best", and IF (after 3 tries) they still can't seem to get it right, I'm going to go elsewhere. I'm not really a die hard bike person. I ride a bike in the city but I am not the bike-riding hipster type who knows how to fix slightly complicated bike issues. I am completely willing to pay the professionals to do that for me. I was really hoping that these guys could be my go-to bike shop. But alas.... Visit #1: My breaks were squeaking to high heaven. I paid a fair chunk of change and they held onto the bike for about 4 hours. When I returned they told me everything was fixed and fine. *** I immediately biked down the block and discovered that the breaks sounded the same as they did when I went there originally. ***Visit:#2: I went in to ask them to fix my tire that continued to go flat (something about the air valve of the tube being pinched). It wasn't super pricey but I expected them to check out the actual wheel to find out how the problem kept occurring. 2 hours later I picked it up and rode it home.*** The following morning, I went to go unlock my bike from where I parked it the night before (immediately after I left their shop) and found that the tire was (once again) flat.***Visit #3: Got a new bike! Needed a new U-lock. Went in to buy the lock and needed to add the simple mount onto the frame. I told them that I was certain that I could just do it myself but if I needed help, I would ask. I proceeded to make it happen but the mount was requiring a bit more muscle than I could muster up. I asked for help. One of the guys began helping and then told me that the mount was as tight as it would go. I was certain that that wasn't the case because it was still appearing to be all loosey goosey. (I've had these locks before)So I continued to struggle with the damn mount.  The dude, meanwhile, proceeds to walk away and put price labels on random boxes and completely ignores the fact that he has not yet finished helping me accomplish this simple task.  I finally do everything myself and leave the store.....annoyed....per usual. I'm sorry, but I get that you're  pretentious hipster bike shop and you need to give off the "I don't give a shit" vibe.....but there needs to be an occasional customer service vibe every now and then. I also accept the fact that most of these services were things that (if I were a bike person) I would be able to fix myself....but.....bike places like this exist for a reason. So I feel like if I'm coming in and giving you money, you might consider helping a lady out and saving the sass for someone who is not a friendly customer. I will not be back to this place. I don't care that I live 2 blocks away. I will bus my bike over to Logan Square and let the dudes a Boulevard Bikes help me in the future. At least they'll charge me for repairs that they ACTUALLY take care of, while being a bit more friendly.That's that.

47.description: Me and my bike, we're best pals. But when my girl started clickin' and clackin' in ways that were generally not good or healthy for a bike, I got worried.And then I remembered West Town Bikes.West Town is close to my house, a 5 minute ride. It is a wonderland of friendly people who know what they are doing, glorious, GLORIOUS tools, and great music. Kisha helped me get my bike up onto one of the bike stands (which I'd never done before) and taught me how to tighten the bottom bracket (also a new skill for me). She also helped diagnose what I thought might be the other problem (which wasn't a problem at all). We also discussed an upcoming class in replacing brake cables (ooohhh) and just talked bikes in general.I'm totally in love with this place. All this awesome, for a low fee (donation!) of 10 bucks! I would have totally donated more too if I could have afforded it right now. This is one of the most fabulous resources I have ever come across. I plan on totally taking advantage of it as much as possible. I love getting grease under my nails. I love working on my bike. You should totally support them, and help keep them going. I feel bad for any city that doesn't have somewhere like this at their disposal.

8.description: The guys here are quick, efficient and experts of their craft! They were able to fix my back tire, give a few pointers and have me on my way in twenty minutes! Prices are great, work is done properly and staff is friendly, what more could you ask for?

31.description: Great open shop Tuesdays and Sundays - call for times. Don't miss it unless you are opposed to a friendly atmosphere surrounded by bike tools and a handful of very talented mechanics to help you for free. yes, you will have to pay for parts.

34.description: I love everything about this place! I like it so much I don't know where to begin. Maybe I could start with its mission in the community, to provide bike education to Chicago's youth or maybe I could start with the adult programs and how they taught me to build an maintain a bike. Ciclo Urbano/West Town bike is a great organization and I look forward to going to the store and open shop hours in the years to come!Oh and I can't forget the people that work there are a lot of fun as well!

16.description: I recently donated a mid 1980s mountain bike to these guys since I heard that they teach neighborhood youth how to fix bikes with donations of this sort. I have no idea if they were able to salvage a bike I bought when I was 19 back in the 1980s, but I hope someone learned from the experience. I tend to come here to buy tubes, but they have the "open shop" nights for people to come in and fix up a bike. This is a great service to anyone who wants to fix a bike and learn something when doing it.So, if you just bought a 25 year old bike and want to turn it into a hipster machine these folks can help. And, yes, donate! They not only fix bikes, they make Humboldt Park a better place by helping kids.

13.description: I agree, this place is one of the best cycling resources in the city.. The staff is very knowledgeable, they're friendly and real. I'm not a hipster or even a bike enthusiast. I'm merely a commuter with a humble, old creaking bicycle, that is slightly falling apart.My first time in West Town Bikes, I needed to fix a flat (because I don't know how), and buy a helmet. They don't have a big dizzying selection of accessories, but they will have what you need. If you're looking for fancy schmancy gadgets, you're better off going to REI or something. Came in again another time because the chain guard of my old bike sort of fell off one side and was just dangling on the cranks.... just awful. They found parts that would fit it back together and even adjusted the brakes for me. Wonderful guys. friendly environment. I hope to come to one of the classes/workshops here to learn.

11.description: Its sad that I had started to write a review about this place a looong time ago and never finished it.. and when I started it it was a 4 star review.Now I have decided to finish it making it a solid 3 star review. I used to go to this shop a lot. Ive had 3 complete tune-ups done here, they converted my bike into a single speed here and Ive ordered a ton of parts from them. Ive given them a lot of business for 2 reasons.1. because they are a co-op. A neighborhood effort designed to make a positive impact on the business and bicycle community of Humboldt Park& 2. Because they were new and lacked the pretentiousness hipster attitude you get from a lot of shops in the Wicker/Bucktown/Near North Areas.They used to be very helpful. Very insightful and had a open workshop where for a small donation you could bring your bike in and work on it yourself and get inside tips from the people who work there.I used to rave about this place and tell everybody to go here. I swore by it.Well, that has now officially changed.I have been in there twice in the last 2 months and have gotten very little help and tons of attitude. Their prices have gone up considerably. And sometimes its really hard to even tell who works there, who works there but isnt working there at that time and who is just hanging out. And most recently a good friend of mine went there to bring in a bike and a stroller to get some flats repaired and his bike tuned up and told me this awful story about how because he knocked on the door a couple minutes before the shop opened on a saturday , and simply asked if he could bring his items in the shop and come back when they opened to discuss the repairs instead of having to wait outside (because he didnt have his lock with him).. was actually yelled at for knocking on the door and then got into a verbal altercation once the shop opened about how a shop has hours for a reason and they cant just open their doors because they are there working, and then the "shop manager"  told him that maybe he should take his business else where..Well.. With all the other shops around, and new ones popping up.. especially one very new unnamed shop that actually has 2 original members of West Town Bikes working there.. I think taking our business elsewhere per the "shop managers" suggestion is exactly what we will do..Keeping in mind.. that shop manager is not an owner.. Nor would anybody running a co-op for the right reasons ever say anything like that under any circumstances..

39.description: What a wonderful resource for the cycling community here in Chicago. Kudos to Alex  and his crew for running such a community-oriented bike shop.  I've gone to West Town on a couple of occasions for the 'open shop' (Tues evenings and Sat afternoons) and would heartily recommend it to anyone that rides a bike.  The staffers are very helpful and the atmosphere is laid-back and welcoming.  Got a flat or a problem with your gears?  Bring your bike to West Town and take a shot at repairing your bike on your own!  The volunteers and other folks tinkering around will be more than happy to help you out.

37.description: I took the women's and trans bike maintenance class, and I can't say enough good things about my experience. I know relatively little about my bike, and when I brought it in it was in pretty bad shape. Mia and Liam are great teachers and super knowledgeable. If you ride your bike even semi-regularly, this class is more than worth the investment - West Town also offers open shop night (the first and third Wednesdays are women and trans only) so you can apply and practice what you've learned. This is really the best deal in bike maintenance. And if you take the class now, you'll be a pro by the time spring rolls around. Seriously, sign up NOW.

0.description: If there's a 10 star, this place would get it.  Not unlike ADTS (All Day Tire Shop) and every other 5 star establishment, they know their product/service and know it in such an effortless and unscripted way.Living in the area for 10 years me and my Son have come to know and love the guys who run this place. Young guys and girls just doing what they're passionate about and in a way that makes you want to return just for biking inspiration...if you're ever in need. But if there is  a more conventional reason to come, you'll be glad you did.

38.description: I live no where near here, I don't ever go here, I really need to go here, it is a wonderful place from what I hear, I don't think any bike shop in the city has such a great reputation - from what I hear....Why haven't I gone here?If you want:Your bike fixedTo learn how to fix it yourselfBuy a new bikeTalk to bike expertsHave a funky cage, fender or seat post madeGo here.....they rock!Best Bike Shop in the City - Hands Down

51.description: I just learned of this resource and am hooked. Great non-profit org offering OPEN SHOP TIME and donation-based, low-cost workshops on bike knowledge and bike repair. I ride it all day, I better get to know it better! Everything from how to fix a flat to how to tune and re-assemble your ride....Visit their webiste for a calendar of classes, including workshops for women and transgendered folks, and to register with the proper instructor. westtownbikes.org

27.description: Great place.  Took our bikes for a tune up.  Brought my bike in and they took a look at it, checked the gears and whatnot.  I was ready to pay $65 for a tune up, but they said it didn't need any service, just some air for the tires.  I really appreciated their honesty.Only hitch came when they finished working on my wife's bike, but never called her to say that it was ready to be picked up.

32.description: One girl changed my tube changed in minutes for cheap. Good conversation and even dinner recommendations too. I think I might take a class. Best shop I've been to.

48.description: This is an awesome resource. This is a place for all of you DIYers who love their bikes. Don't be left high and dry if you have a flat tire or if you need to clean up your bike or lube your chain....let the wonderful people at West Town Bikes teach you how to be confident and savvy when it comes to your bike.I've only been to one workshop here and I almost immediately started using my newfound skills. The workshop I went to wasn't very crowded (probably cause it was cold, windy and rainy) and I got personalized attention. I cleaned my bike, lubed my chain, changed my brake cable, adjusted my breaks and even got to look at the truing wheel. It was very educational and I can't wait to go back to learn more.This place is run by donations so it's affordable for anyone. Definitely give as much as you can. Think about how much money you save compared to going to a shop. Even just fixing a flat would cost $10 at a shop. Learning this stuff is a good investment. In addition, if you're ever wandering about what to do with torn up and dirty old tshirts and clothes, WTBs can always use donations of items.Check out their website and sign/show up for a class or workshop as soon as possible!

44.description: I think this place is wonderful. Hands down. So specifically, I have been in on a few occasions. I stopped by once right after the opening to buy some tubes for my bike, and had a nice chat with with Alex, the director about my vintage cycle. The shop carries basic bike needs and is working on extending their merchandise as more people come in. On my next visit I was looking for some white bar tape and stopped in hoping I wouldn't have to go too far for it. They had exactly the kind I was looking for! It makes me happy that this place is in the neighborhood, because the area is lacking in a bike shop, and especially one that doesn't have a pretentious attitude. Now for my review of the Working Bikes part of the shop: I needed to swap out a freewheel on my bike. This is a pretty simple thing to do mechanically, but you need a special tool. I took advantage of WTB's women and transgender open shop night. They had the tool I needed, along with all of the other stuff I needed for the job, including a vice and bike stands, which are things that I don't get to use often in my home-mechanic efforts. It was really great and the women instructors were really helpful and gave me some great tips on how to best do the project and also for how to get my chain tension right when putting the wheel back on. This was great because while a guy can put a wheel back on and get the chain tension right in a matter of minutes, sometimes us women have to do it a little differently, and it was great to learn some ways to make it easier.West Town is a welcome addition to the neighborhood!

24.description: One of the best bike shops in town. They'll fix your bike or show you how to fix it your self, whichever you prefer.

7.description: This place is great! I volunteer with VeloCity Bicycle Cooperative in alexandria, va. I like visiting different coops when i travel. Mikey, Pat, and the other volunteers were really friendly, took lots of time out to explain thier noble mission. I was able to help all evening long and loved it. If youre looking for a place to learn to fix your bike, learn more about bikes by volunteering, or just want to help a really wonderful grassroots organization, id highly recommend west town bikes.It was by far my favorite thing about visiting Chicago.

49.description: If you're tired of spending $100 on a bike tune up (aka have some shop tighten some screws or cables for you) then learn how to do it yourself!This place is amazing. My first time there was about 3 weeks ago and I've been back 4 times since with my two bikes! This is coming from a girl who barely knew what an allen wrench was! So don't feel intimidated if you don't know anything about bikes!Tinker Town Tues is led by Alex, the guy who runs the shop. He's really patient, super helpful, and will show you anything you need to do. Since I've started going he's shown me how to change out my back v-brakes completely, adjust the brake cables, adjust the shifting cables, make headset adjustments...etc! This was all stuff I had just paid $50 to get done at a bike shop. Now I have the pride of knowing I can do all this myself! Make sure you go early to get a stand cause it fills up pretty fast!They've got bike stands, all the tools you'll ever need, degreaser, lube, and even spare parts if you need something that they charge only a small amount for if anything!It's a suggested donation of $10 to use their things, but you could get away with less if you just went in to clean your chain or make a quick adjustment....or in my case more cause you love them so much!Great place. Super friendly environment. I made new friends the first night I was there whom I've since, riding all over town!They even have a ladies night! check out their website for scheduling info. 13/52

40.description: i took several classes with these guys (bike tune up and maintenance class) and i am so damn smart about bikes now.  a -- everyone is super fun; b -- they know their shit; c -- classes are affordable and conveniently timed; d -- there's a bike shop right there so you can buy stuff as you fix stuff.  i have come to know several people affilitated with west town and they are the nicest people around.  they are activists as well helping youth feel empowered.  shop here and buy stuff to keep them going!

30.description: Went here for Ladies' Night to get a rack installed.  It was raining and I was the only student for most of the night.  They were so great about teaching me.  Especially since none of the hardware fit my bike and there was a lot of tinkering.  This probably should've taken less than an hour, but instead took the whole night.  Remember to donate!  I don't think my instructor saw me deposit money into the can, so I hope she doesn't think I'm bogus.  Make sure they see you do it!  I also got a quick lesson on flat repair (it was almost closing time), which is nice, because I always feel like an idiot bringing in a simple repair like that.

46.description: If you want to learn how to work on your bike, this is the place for you.West Town Bikes is a community workspace that offers classes and open shop nights where you can learn anything and everything about your bike. WTB operates by donation, so for just $10 you have access not only to tools and stands, but instructors who are friendly, patient and extremely knowledgeable. This is a perfect place for beginners to learn how to change a flat tire, or for someone more advanced who wants to overhaul a bottom bracket. Whatever you want to do, there will be an instructor there to help you every step of the way. They also have a Women's/Trans night, which is really awesome, because it can sometimes get intimidating in the cycling world.WTB is also very involved in the community with youth programs and is just an awesome organization that we are really lucky to have in Chicago.  Go, learn about your bike.  You'll love it.

1.description: I had a bike stolen a week ago. It was a Bianchi Carbon 928. They do not make these frames anymore so they are very rare in Chicago. After it was stolen, I posted about it on the Chicago Stolen Bike registry.West Town Bikes came a calling! Someone had brought the bike in, and they knew that it had to have been stolen (12 year old with a $2,000 bike). They didn't let him leave with it, and they searched for the bike on the registry. They gave me call! They were incredibly kind, and are helping me with all of the minor fixes that need to be made. Really trust worthy and amazing bike shop/non-profit.

9.description: "you're riding brakeless. that's illegal, and we don't service brakeless bikes". me: what? i've had my bike serviced here before. lots of times. guy goes to the back to ask someone. skinny asian dude looks at me while the first guy points at me. first guy returns. "we don't service brakeless bikes". me: pfft. lame.

26.description: i went here to buy a u-lock - i bought it which was fine, but i had some weird experiences with the staff.....dude:  nicole and I drove in and this one dude was like "oh man that's so cool what is that a cb360 i used to drive cb360s back in the day but i don't have one now yeah it was so cool about this cb360 that i had i had this one and then another one but i don't have them now wow that's so cool that you have a bike that looks like my bike that i used to have wow" (note: mine is a cb350 which is the best selling motorcycle in US history - don't be amazed if you see one - they, literally, could not be more common) - he really wouldn't let me shop because he wanted to tell me about his bike that he used to have - he seemed like a nice guy, but way too excited - actually..... I'm not 100% sure that he was working there - I will say that it was hard to tell who was a customer and who was working....girl:  there was some really annoying hipster girl working there - she was dumb and i wanted to punch her - the shop stocks different manufacturers and models of u-locks - I'd never bought one, so I wanted to know what was the difference between the high- and low-end models from one manufacturer - they appeared to be the same size, but one had a higher safety rating and price tag - her response was, quite literally "um, yeah, well, like, some of the locks are like made from like different materials and stuff so they're like you know like more expensive because of that" - THAT was her expert opinion on the matter - girl, if you read this, take a tip:  if you don't fucking know, just admit it - otherwise, you sound like a moronmanager: then this dude, I think he was the owner or manager (he seemed to be a "senior staff member" if you will) came over - I think he could tell I was getting annoyed by this annoying chick - he was very nice and very helpful and helped us to make informed decisions about our locks.  he answered all of our questions and we really liked him - I wish I had talked to him first and avoided those other two clownsI would consider going back here, but don't show up on a motorcycle and don't ask the hipster girl any questions

25.description: The people here are really nice, and fixed my tire right away.  I got a new tube and tire for a great price.  If you do have to wait, go to Nelly's (no relation to me!!) across the street, they are another great Humboldt Park restaurant I recently tried out.

12.description: These people care more about you and your ride than anyone else in town. The mission and activity over at West Town are really wonderful.  The prices for parts and services are very reasonable.  The staff are very kind and work very hard for a cause in which they believe.  And they are widely-loved and darn good at what they do as a result.   I recommend open shop night, where extremely knowledgable professionals will work with you on your bike.  They always give you the tools to make informed choices, right down to replacing parts with new or (equally good) used ones.High-five, West Town.  Keep it up.

21.description: I attended a really fun and informative open house here, with the focus that evening on cargo bikes, bikes designed to haul big stuff.  There were dozens of different types of bikes parked on the street out front, any of which you could ride.  Most were brought in by owners, some provided by cargo/Dutch bike dealers.  Nice pot-luck style buffet inside the shop, a good place to meet the city's cyclo-rati.  Seemed like a real community center with lots of little kids and families around.  A Chicago gem.

17.description: Great bike shop, I know nothing about my bike sad to say, so every year I get a tune-up.  So as per usual I took it in but this year I decided to try a new place, we were able to have our bikes checked out for free and were told that a tune up wasn't necessary,  saving us $75.00 pwr bike.  They guys inflated the tires on the spot for free and we were good to go! Will definitely be back here!

10.description: This place is great. i've been to many bike shops in the city and this one is by far the least populated by assholes. I have never been more comfortable in a bike shop-- They don't treat you like they know more about bikes than everyone in the world and that you're worthless unless you blog about bikes all day. (joyride bike shop, logan square)  West Town Bikes will go out of their way to satisfy your needs! i had a problem with my bottom bracket and they fixed it up at no cost! These guys (and gal) are the best!

5.description: This is one seriously cool place. I came to get some minor things adjusted on my bike, and I stumbled on the donation based fix it yourself workshop going on. The teachers were incredibly nice, patient, and I had an unexpected fun adventure that afternoon learning about bike repair, and bonding with my bike.  It would make a great place for a date! The best thing about this place is that they teach young people how to repair bikes as a vocation and the donations support their efforts. One more totally amazing thing about the West Town/Humboldt neighborhood. Go bond with your bike!

3.description: Super friendly staff. Everyone is incredibly helpful about any possible problem, bicycle related or otherwise, and not in the least bit pushy or condescending (unlike most cycle shops).There is also a decent selection of parts and bikes, and everything is reasonably priced.

35.description: I recently donated a mid 1980s mountain bike to these guys since I heard that they teach neighborhood youth how to fix bikes with donations of this sort. I have no idea if they were able to salvage a bike I bought when I was 19 back in the 1980s, but I hope someone learned from the experience. I tend to come here to buy tubes, but they have the "open shop" nights for people to come in and fix up a bike. This is a great service to anyone who wants to fix a bike and learn something when doing it.So, if you just bought a 25 year old bike and want to turn it into a hipster machine these folks can help. And, yes, donate! They not only fix bikes, they make Humboldt Park a better place by helping kids.

19.description: This is the best bike shop that I have been to in Chicago.  They offer bike classes at a cheap price, so you can fix your bike without having to take it in to a shop everytime something goes wrong.  After taking my tandem bike to Rapid City and either being told they can't help me, I took my bike to West Town Bikes and fixed it in their bike shop for free with the help of staff for a small donation.  Everything I wanted in a bike shop.

28.description: LOVE this place!!! I had my bike stolen this winter and have been on the hunt for a nice used bike and I found it! After going to a few bike shops in the neighborhood and being laughed at for not wanting to spend over $300, I came here, told them what I was looking for and they showed me the perfect bike, it was a used frame with lots of really nice upgrades- fancy new brakes,(forgive my lack of bike terms) a fancy crank, single speed conversion and a plethora of other great upgrades. They also said the woman who donated it was super cool and the bike had some awesome juu juu-  I absolutely LOVE it!! I also love the fact that I was able to support a great cause as they are a non-profit and all about bike education and community building. Another great thing was in 30 days they said to bring it in for a check-up to make sure everything is working well on the bike and then in 90 days to bring it in for a free tune-up, how awesome!!

45.description: Now, keep in mind I have only been there once after hearing about them for freaking ever and being a hardcore SmartBikes fan. That changed recently (see my review for them. Oof.), so I thought I would give West Town a try. They. Were. Amazing. Super nice and welcoming. Invited me into the back to see HOW they were fixing a recurring problem on my cycle. And they didn't even charge me (I think because I looked to freaking pathetic at that moment. ha.) They have open shop nights Sundays and Tuesdays where you can learn to handle all the little shit on your bike yourself. The staff is amazing. Made me feel right at home. Explained things in laymen's terms. Showed me what was going on. And cheered me up on what had otherwise been "one of those days". I'll be back there. And I'll probably bring them beer.

33.description: Went here over the holiday weekend because my friend bought a new seat for her bike but didn't have the tools to change the old seat out. Not only did they change this out in about 1 minute, they also did it at NO COST even though she bought the seat elsewhere--for more money than they sold it here I might add! They were so nice! I like that they work within the community to support affordable transportation. This is a valuable organization worthy of support!I will be back!

43.description: (Rough Draft Review)I stopped by the shop and was greeted by one of the repair/salesmen.  I told him what the problem was (chain not locking into place when gears are changed) and he took my bike and put it on the rack.  He said, "Don't worry, it's free.  Some people ask me not to do this since they think I'll charge; this is just an assessment."  Within a minute he pinpointed the problem, fixed it, and gave my bike back to me.I was very impressed and I'll definitely be back to take a class or two.

2.description: Broke as balls  but need my bike. Super friendly & helpful. Ill be back when I have more $.recommended

18.description: This place is close to my house and I've given them three chances to help me solve some minor bike issues. They have successfully let me down each time I've gone there. I'm not the kind of person who is going to cause a big fuss. I'm going to give businesses a chance to help me out with what they supposedly "do best", and IF (after 3 tries) they still can't seem to get it right, I'm going to go elsewhere. I'm not really a die hard bike person. I ride a bike in the city but I am not the bike-riding hipster type who knows how to fix slightly complicated bike issues. I am completely willing to pay the professionals to do that for me. I was really hoping that these guys could be my go-to bike shop. But alas.... Visit #1: My breaks were squeaking to high heaven. I paid a fair chunk of change and they held onto the bike for about 4 hours. When I returned they told me everything was fixed and fine. *** I immediately biked down the block and discovered that the breaks sounded the same as they did when I went there originally. ***Visit:#2: I went in to ask them to fix my tire that continued to go flat (something about the air valve of the tube being pinched). It wasn't super pricey but I expected them to check out the actual wheel to find out how the problem kept occurring. 2 hours later I picked it up and rode it home.*** The following morning, I went to go unlock my bike from where I parked it the night before (immediately after I left their shop) and found that the tire was (once again) flat.***Visit #3: Got a new bike! Needed a new U-lock. Went in to buy the lock and needed to add the simple mount onto the frame. I told them that I was certain that I could just do it myself but if I needed help, I would ask. I proceeded to make it happen but the mount was requiring a bit more muscle than I could muster up. I asked for help. One of the guys began helping and then told me that the mount was as tight as it would go. I was certain that that wasn't the case because it was still appearing to be all loosey goosey. (I've had these locks before)So I continued to struggle with the damn mount.  The dude, meanwhile, proceeds to walk away and put price labels on random boxes and completely ignores the fact that he has not yet finished helping me accomplish this simple task.  I finally do everything myself and leave the store.....annoyed....per usual. I'm sorry, but I get that you're  pretentious hipster bike shop and you need to give off the "I don't give a shit" vibe.....but there needs to be an occasional customer service vibe every now and then. I also accept the fact that most of these services were things that (if I were a bike person) I would be able to fix myself....but.....bike places like this exist for a reason. So I feel like if I'm coming in and giving you money, you might consider helping a lady out and saving the sass for someone who is not a friendly customer. I will not be back to this place. I don't care that I live 2 blocks away. I will bus my bike over to Logan Square and let the dudes a Boulevard Bikes help me in the future. At least they'll charge me for repairs that they ACTUALLY take care of, while being a bit more friendly.That's that.

41.description: First off this place is an asset to the community.  It is a nonprofit and gives back in so many ways.  Sure they're a retail shop as well, but they don't mark up their prices insanely, and you know when you buy there you're not putting money in someone else's pocket you're actually helping other people get bikes, learn about bikes, and benefit the overall community. They are extremely knowledgeable and won't treat you like you're a dumb ass.

50.description: This is an excellent resource for newbies. It's not really a bike shop so much as a bike clinic shop. They offer classes in a whole lot of different topics ranging from basic maintenance to how to race at the velodrome. Here are some classes they offer:Women and Trans Mechanics WorkshopHow To Build Your Own BikeDo Your Own Tune-UpChicago Community Bike shopIf you ever wanted to learn about how to fix your bike without feeling intimidated about it in the least, try this place out. Every class has a recommended tax-deductible donation suggestion of only $10.00.This is REALLY one of the best things to happen to cycling in Chicago because learning how to fix your bike can be a really intimidating thing to newbies and they're all about reducing that so that everyone can love biking. Knowing what's going on and how to maintain your bike yourself is incredibly empowering, especially when you hit up a new shop and it's some jack-ass who wants to rip you off and pull one over on you.

4.description: 5 STARS FOR THE YOUNG KIDS WHO FIX THE BIKES. They are all willing and helpful. A bike to me is a chain, two tires and pedals...and handlebars. I'll be the first one to tell you I pretty much don't know anything about bikes, as these workers have figured out, and I have never been made to feel stupid for it. Not pretentious at all, nice, funny and polite. 5 STARSAs for one of the bosses....I hope this is seen: I understand that failure to deny service on a bike with a seat that is loose is a liability hazard, but as a customer I don't know that...until you let every customer in the shop at the time know that. A team is a team. No one should be singled out in front of one another and especially not in front of customers. As a non-profit organization focused on teaching young people on the importance of working and independence, it would be nice to see a more evolved boss-employee dynamic. Certainly this could have been addressed on the low-low, one-on-one, perhaps NOT in front of the register. It was uncomfortable for me as a customer and I think this behavior is something that needs to be addressed.BUT I digress, this place is great. I like to give my money to shops with a focus on youth.

6.description: Best bike shop in the city hands down!  Know what they're doing and won't take advantage of you. Very reasonably priced. Don't forget to throw some love in the tip jar.

22.description: YESSSSSS!!!!  competitive prices, knowledgeable/courteous staff, they answer their phone,  oh gee-wizz they don't make you feel dumb cause heaven forbid, you don't know everything there was ever known about bike mechanics.   enough from me... go there yourself and check it out!

15.description: What an amazing bike shop the community is very tightknit and they have a lot of outreach programs for adults, teens and children. They give people the opportunity to learn how to build bikes and work on bikes during their free classes and open shop. CU is connected (retail) Miley and Alex are really friendly. highly recommend it.

20.description: This is the best bike shop that I have been to in Chicago.  They offer bike classes at a cheap price, so you can fix your bike without having to take it in to a shop everytime something goes wrong.  After taking my tandem bike to Rapid City and either being told they can't help me, I took my bike to West Town Bikes and fixed it in their bike shop for free with the help of staff for a small donation.  Everything I wanted in a bike shop.

36.description: I came in with my bike on open night and needed to make a few adjustments to the brake and gear cables. The two guys who helped me out were very friendly, un-pretentious, and taught me the basics of how to make the adjustments while standing back and letting me perform them. Will definitely be back.

14.description: One of the best cycling resources in the city. The guy behind the soul of the project, Alex, is super passionate about cycling and bringing the opportunity to underpriviledged kids in the city. The classes they offer are great - I took a winter maintanence class which really helped me to understand the anatomy of my bike. The free course on how to fix your flat, check ABC, is invaluable for beginner cyclist.Open nights are great to use their gear (they have way better stock for gear than some of the fancy-looking shops) as well as to socialize other DIY type. Best of all, people here are super friendly and help out in any way they can. Women, kids, men without fancy gear, you will find all those here (though i am sure they welcome those with spiffy looking attire as well).One advice: please tip the mechanics!!! they don't get paid much and do this job out of love~

58.description: Dig this place a lot. Good selection of beer and the food is good too. The nachos are my go to here and always fill up. Monday Night trivia is fun here too. Really laid back with board games available and a pool table.

56.description: Throughout my entire life, I have been on the hunt for the perfect patty melt. No matter where I am, if there is a patty melt on the menu, I WILL order it. It's this personal rule that I have, and sometimes it's a let-down in places where there are other *really* good things on the menu.I still don't think I've found the perfect patty melt, but beetle's goes in the top 5 or so. Though they did commit the #1 sin with regards to patty melt production. It arrived almost well-done when I ordered it medium rare.The true gem here is the beer selection. It's great, and the service is too. It was surprisingly not busy here on a Friday night during a Blackhawks game. I hope they're doing okay because their food and drink are both way better than several bars I've seen packed from wall to wall on a Friday night.

29.description: Great option for the area, nice layout, plenty of room, pool.  Proper neighborhood bar.

42.description: The food is not worth the price. I've gone on two different occasions. The first time I had the fish tacos, which were bland with the exception of the small amount of pico de gallo I got. The second time I got the mac n cheese and that was just a joke. Honestly, if you're going to spend $11 on mac n cheese, go to Lockdown. FAR BETTER. The mac n cheese was gritty. It tasted like it was powdered cheese. They burned the garlic toast that came with it too. I've gotten a better meal from Aldi for half the price. Literally.I also ordered waffle fries. They felt like they were frozen and tasted like it too. The only seasoning seems to be what the fries were originally fried with. So, what they added on the conveyor belt and then froze?Overall, the atmosphere is nice. The bar is well stocked with awesome choices. The decor and aesthetic is very pleasing and relaxing. Trivia is even fun. Just eat before you go there.

23.description: This place is Kick Ass.  Good food, substantial portions, you can eat hella late, consistent service & proper bartenders.  For less than twenty bucks you can get a hell of a plate of food, a shot, & a beer.  Perfect for those budget minded folks with a pit and their stomach and thirst that needs quenching.

47.description: One of my neighborhood watering holes, this place never fails to provide me friendly service.  Fish and veggie tacos on taco night are decent , and the caesar salad is different (no croutons) but still yummy.  This isn't the best place to catch the game but for someplace that is walking distance it's more than serviceable.

8.description: Delicious food. Well made cocktails. Friendly bartender. Nicely decorated, but still lived in space. If I lived in Chicago, I'd come here often, I think. The waffle fries were the best (generally have no opinion on waffle fries). I loaded my waffle fries with hot sauce (Cajun Chef - super delicious hot sauce) and blissed out in hot sauce and fried potato heaven. Really great burger too.

31.description: Very relaxed and open place. They have a good menu and a very good selection of beers.

34.description: GOD HELP ME, beetle, close up for a month and get a facelift! I've been going here for six years and literally nothing has changed. in a bad way. in fact, it's gotten much worse. the beer taps are clearly musty & never cleaned, the food went from decent bar food to slobbish, flash-frozen mush, and the vibe is best described as an empty shell of its former self. i want to be a regular so bad. it has no reason not to be awesome. but nothing ever changes. the worst was when we went a few weeks ago and a crazy drunk guy at the bar wouldn't leave me alone and nobody seemed to notice. i asked for my food to go and got out as quick as possible. in a competitive neighborhood, there's no good reason to go back.

16.description: I was here recently for a short study session in the afternoon and I loved the place & the staff was very friendly. Their cheeseburger was decent, I'll try their waffle fries next time.

13.description: Great service & drinks. Food is pretty good. What ruined it for me, but not for others in the bar was all the kids, toddlers, infants...when I go to a real bar I prefer it to be adults only.

11.description: This place is a local neighborhood spot, which I am all for, but I also think that a local neighborhood spot should have good service too...and well...we had to work a little hard to get a drink and put in a food order here. Granted it was during a game, so clearly there were more people in here than usual, BUT we were ordering lots of food and drinks for dinner...But the beer selection is pretty good here, it is like a nicer, bigger dive bar, where you can tell if people don't know you there, it is because you are visiting from somewhere else which I think is nice actually--although I was one of those people visiting from somewhere else! ha ha The food was okay--large salads actually! Who would have thought that this dimly lit bar actually made a decent salad? I felt weird ordering it, but wanted some vegetables if I could with all of the beer I was having...Plus Matt J. got a giant sandwich which was so so but it came with pretty tasty waffle fries. Those things are addicting for sure. So had the food been a little better, and had the service been a little better, I would have rounded up from my 3.5 rating, but rounded down for now.

39.description: I used to love this place but it lost its touch. The tacos are not good on Tuesday anymore and I had brunch for the first time this past weekend and it was disgusting. Yes it's a bar and yes it's bar food but please lose the brunch menu and if you must eat please stick with the burgers. Also when someone asks for a recommendation and the bartender says "everything is delicious" that usually means nothing is worth eating. Ordered some greasy corn beef potatoes with eggs that looked freezer packed and microwaved since the yolk was solid. Music sucks too, it's all top 40 garbage. Drinks I give 4 stars, a little overpriced compared to the dive bars and old oak nearby but the food is horrid, it is a bar so I won't judge on the food as much. Super pissed my Saturday brunch was ruined because the staff couldn't give an actual recommendation.

37.description: This place has a great ambiance! Nice chill place to grab a hearty burger and a beer! Bring your crew because it's a great place to talk and eat. The waffle fries are where it's at!! I ordered a portobello mushroom burger, and it was delicious. If you're vegetarian, you defiantly got to come check this place out. If you're craving something sweet, I wouldn't put this on the A-list. The brownie Sunday tasted like it was sitting in the fridge uncovered. But nonetheless, this place has great service, great burgers, and nice cold brews!Pros:-Great service-Large seating areas-Chill, comfortable ambiance Cons:-Doesn't satisfy your sweet tooth.

0.description: I was super impressed by this place! The interior is a great dive bar-y feel but in a beautiful homey feel that you wouldn't expect out of the area. I went to watch a bulls game with a friend and our server who seemed shy at first lightened up and was super sweet! The food was really tasty and their burger list exceeds any neighborhood bar standards anywhere. I'll be returning just to try them! Really great for a date or just a fun weekday hang out. There's w few cozy seats (the fireplace is perfect for a chilly Chicago night!) 4 stars purely because the wing sauces don't taste house made which was a disappointment!

38.description: Food was great. I had the Elvis Burger and it was deeelish! the only thing that I didnt not like about the place was the lighting its was kinda hard to read the menu with small fine print. but other wise a great place to have drinks with friends or coworkers. as well to eat dinner.

51.description: I was here a few weeks ago and I was very impressed by their beer selection and their menu is really extensive too.  I had a really good burger there and their waffle fries are heavenly!  Get there early as the place can get super crowded. I would totally go back!

27.description: Came in for a quick Monday night drink and surprise it was trivia night!I'm  shocked by the 1 start reviews, I loved the atmosphere. I thought the place was decorated really great with a Damask painted wall and an amazing crystal chandelier in the front room. Our server was really nice and chatted with us for a bit which is rare these days.Beer menu was great, I ordered the first one on the list $5 for a bottle of Abita Strawberry Harvest Lager, brought out with a rocks glass, but that's cool. The menu looked really good, classic bar appetizers hummus, wings, cheese curds, nachos. They also server brunch, which looks low key but nice. They offer 6 pizzas all for $10, 9 burgers, 6 sandwiches and some salads that can be turned in to wraps.They have a sidewalk patio and a pool table, I will definitely be back to check it out again!

32.description: Was The Beetle the best bar/restaurant I have ever been to? No. However, did I enjoy one of the best burgers of my life? Absolutely.If you had told me as a kid that I would grow up and put peanut butter on things like burgers, I would have called you a wacko. However, I have to say, the "Elvis burger" with bacon, peanut butter, and fried plantains was insanely delicious. Paired with Revolution Brewery's "A Little Crazy" and dining al fresco, I hope to make it back for another delightful afternoon very quickly.

54.description: What a great neighborhood bar! I was riding around on my bike on Easter trying to run errands (which surprise, surprise, didn't work out) and felt a bit peckish. I saw this place was open and enjoying life so I stopped in.GOOD CHOICE.$5 Bloody Marys. Delicious waffle fries. Good burgers. Nice bartenders. In fact, that was a big appeal to me. It's always nice to go into a homey bar on a Sunday afternoon and just have a chat with a bartender about random things.Basically, to cure a hang over, go get some hair of the dog at this place on a Sunday.

48.description: I love Nicki S.'s review from 4/23 saying its nice to see good neighborhood bars going up. Its been there since the 70's and the new ownership for several years. haha! durrrrrThe place has become better over the last year. It finally got some beer specials and some good beers. The burgers have always been good. It just needs some sort of "oomph" to forge ahead. Some kind of signature. It's missing something. Taco night? Live music? $2 draft day? I don't know what it is....but it needs "something".Update 2015: It has gone down since I left a review a couple years ago. The burgers, which used to be really good are now like frozen patties from a box. It doesn't do anything for holidays very well, have any fresh ideas. Just stagnant. They put some nice work into one of the areas (fireplace, new booths, wall) that are very nice. It is what it is "A-OK" = 3/5.

44.description: Wake up beetle! You are in one of the most amazing neighborhoods and you have no idea how much you're failing to cater to it. I live a block away and come here probably about once a month, maybe less and only when I'm bored and extremely lazy to cook. But you don't win here really, service is horrible(this comes from me  -a server myself), food is pretty bad too, but  I still come here with hopes that one day I will be surprised by some amazing experience. Tonight, I came with my daughter and asked if I could sit outside(I knew I could, but wanted to make myself visible to the staff), bartender was nice and told me to go ahead and grab a table. After sitting for 10 minutes, I got up to leave, as I didn't get any attention from anyone, but as I am leaving, a server marched in and was ready to take an order, just to realize we didn't even have any menus. after another 20 minutes of no food, me and my 4 year old were done... I went inside and asked if i could get the food and lemonade to go. The bartender informed me they don't do liquids to go, as they don't have  a license for it. maybe i'm a little confused about this being a true story, but I've lived in chicago for 9 years, been coming to beetle for the last 6 and I have never heard of no liquid to go license thing. How did this just appear all of the sudden. beetle make me angry, I want to love them so much, but they just make me hate them instead...

24.description: Walked in to order some food to go (2 things) on a Sunday afternoon. The bar had 16 people inside w 2 bartenders/servers. Granted the Bears were on so maybe the bar was more packed compared to a normal Sunday afternoon, but it was NOT loud (not that you could tell given the bartender's uncalled for rude attitude towards me). She looked at me like I was speaking a foreign language, rolling her eyes at me saying she couldn't hear me when I could understand her perfectly. Frustrated and/or exasperated for no apparent reason, she asked me to write my order down which I said ok to if she gave me a paper and pen, and she commenced w the eye-rolling and finally just took my order at the computer like a normal server. It sounds like I'm being harsh but the whole sitch was so bazaar that I was 2 seconds away from walking out w/o ordering bc I was treated SO rudely for no reason. To justify this review, she knew she'd f'ed up bc she was trying to be really nice after that. Sorry Lizzie (the brunette w curly hair), first impressions are everything in the service industry and you f'ed up the Beetles' for me.Glad that was the first time I've ever been there bc now I don't have to waste my time trying it out at night when there will be even more people for her to deal w. Don't want to imagine what that service is like...

7.description: Came in for a quick Monday night drink and surprise it was trivia night!I'm  shocked by the 1 start reviews, I loved the atmosphere. I thought the place was decorated really great with a Damask painted wall and an amazing crystal chandelier in the front room. Our server was really nice and chatted with us for a bit which is rare these days.Beer menu was great, I ordered the first one on the list $5 for a bottle of Abita Strawberry Harvest Lager, brought out with a rocks glass, but that's cool. The menu looked really good, classic bar appetizers hummus, wings, cheese curds, nachos. They also server brunch, which looks low key but nice. They offer 6 pizzas all for $10, 9 burgers, 6 sandwiches and some salads that can be turned in to wraps.They have a sidewalk patio and a pool table, I will definitely be back to check it out again!

49.description: After a hard Sunday of nerding out, my friends and I were ready for some sustenanceGood beer selection, killer burgers and no sports blasting in the backgroundI mean what more could a girl ask for?

40.description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed the Beetle yet! This is a great place to have in the neighborhood if you just wanna get food and beer! Service here always good and everyone is super chill. All the food is delicious, and they had pretty good craft beer selection on tap. I love that it's never super crowded! I have to make it a point to come here more often though!

53.description: Great beer list, friendly staff, plenty of TVs, okay volume, great food served until midnight, & overall a chill place that has a little bit of everything.  There's a pool table, a fire, and board games.  This is the ultimate cozzy place to chill with your friends and it never gets super over-packed.  My boyfriend and I have been going here for a year and there has never been a single thing to complain about.  If you're into the chill atmosphere, then you'll LOVE this place AND they've also got outdoor seating for the summertime. What more could you ask for? BTW... if you love Emma Stone, Colleen is the closest thing you'll get! She's great & also has a really awesome sense of humor! :)..I'm actually going there again tonight! ;)

30.description: Well, for starters...it's Saturday afternoon. Table we wanted to sit at wasn't wiped down. My friend wanted a Miller Lite. They r out of Miller Lite, bud light, COors Light. No spinach for a salad but we weren't informed until 7 min after we ordered. Gnats filled the place. My salad was ok...caprese salad. Mimosa...yuk! Chances of being back...I WON'T!!!

46.description: Stopped by here for a quick drink after dinner across the street at Kai Zan.  There was a check in offer for buy one get one drinks, but they said that meant one person had to drink both drinks.  Lame.The bar itself was a bit drab and service was slow.  Not really a place I would go out of my way to drink at.$5 mimosa special on Saturdays!

1.description: The food is ok but the service is continually an issue. Half full drinks, terrible servers that are self important and slow service. I wish that this neighborhood place was  great but it is bad each time I patron this place.

55.description: I like the beetle. There's nothing crazy about it. The lights are dim, they play decent music, they have sports and movies playing on their flat-screen TVs,and the food is good. It's a relaxing environment. I've taken numerous dates there because they play the music just low enough to hear someone as you converse. My friends and I use to play pool there during the summer. I even took my dad there one time for a few beers and a few games of pool lol.  Overall it's an decent bar, there's not enough women though, other than the bartenders. I'd recommend this bar for its good food and drinks at fair prices. Hope this helped, take care.

9.description: This was my go-to neighborhood bar until...I ordered a spinach beet salad for take-out and it had a huge, dead fly in it! I immediately called the bartender who took my name and address down and "promised" that I'd get a gift certificate in the mail as reimbursement.  It's been a month now and of course, no gift-certificate, and I'm still grossed out.

26.description: This place is a local neighborhood spot, which I am all for, but I also think that a local neighborhood spot should have good service too...and well...we had to work a little hard to get a drink and put in a food order here. Granted it was during a game, so clearly there were more people in here than usual, BUT we were ordering lots of food and drinks for dinner...But the beer selection is pretty good here, it is like a nicer, bigger dive bar, where you can tell if people don't know you there, it is because you are visiting from somewhere else which I think is nice actually--although I was one of those people visiting from somewhere else! ha ha The food was okay--large salads actually! Who would have thought that this dimly lit bar actually made a decent salad? I felt weird ordering it, but wanted some vegetables if I could with all of the beer I was having...Plus Matt J. got a giant sandwich which was so so but it came with pretty tasty waffle fries. Those things are addicting for sure. So had the food been a little better, and had the service been a little better, I would have rounded up from my 3.5 rating, but rounded down for now.

25.description: Food: AverageFood Recommendation: Mushroom pizza, burger and waffle fries. Do not get the (strange) artichoke dip or (dry) hummus. Drinks: A nice beer selection, wine, liquor. Allagash white is consistently on tap. Price: Average. There are no $4-6 appetizer options. Atmosphere: Good Parking: Street- kind of tough sometimes. Wait staff: Uncomfortably bad. It often feels like I am imposing on their evening. Receiving water or a check is a monumental task- be prepared to wait.I would give a 3-star if it were not for the wait staff. Its an OK place, but probably not worth a special trip. If you're in the neighborhood, there are many other phenomenal places to eat and drink.UPDATED to a 3 star-- Haven't been since but I received a nice message from the owner who said they changed things up. Cheers to you. I hope its better!

12.description: Stopped by here for a quick drink after dinner across the street at Kai Zan.  There was a check in offer for buy one get one drinks, but they said that meant one person had to drink both drinks.  Lame.The bar itself was a bit drab and service was slow.  Not really a place I would go out of my way to drink at.$5 mimosa special on Saturdays!

59.description: I really like it here. I'm not exactly sure why, but there is something about it that makes me keep wanting to go back. I went for lunch one cold afternoon and sat next to the fireplace and played board games with my friends. The veggie burger was surprisingly delicious and the beer specials are decent. I had the Scoutmob deal which is what brought me in in the first place. It made the pricing more than reasonable. Monday night trivia is really fun and the bartender was really great.

21.description: Seriously lucky I could not give zero stars! Food was mediocre at best. Service was horrible. And where do they get off charging a $2.50 fee for sitting in there....?!?! So I ordered a burger and fries and a soda my husband did the same and because we did not order alcohol we get charged?!?!?! You are in Humbolt Park! Not freaking Michigan ave!

17.description: This place, at one time, was consistently great, with meals, and service. Over the last year,...I continue to visit this convenient spot... Only to be further disappointed!!-in the winter it was always uncomfortably cold, and the server just seemed like it wasn't bad that we had to keep our coats on to eat. Most recently, they charged us 3.00 for 2 waters.. And rang them up as soda. ;-( Shameless. They mess up my order almost every time I'm there... And the servers are only "occasionally" friendly.  2stars... No, only 1.

10.description: The Beetle is your friendly neighborhood bar and grill, but way cooler.  The servers are friendly and will get to know and welcome you.  The food is also among the best for bar food that I've encountered.  Try the Southeast Nachos or the Steak Salad; they're awesome!

5.description: Eh, I didn't actually get to eat or drink here. The hubs and I stopped by on a Sunday afternoon for an early dinner, were seated promptly on the patio, and then were left alone for 20 minutes before we left.  The menu looked decent, but we needed to get a drink order in sooner!  Simply make sure your servers stop by every 5-10 minutes or so, especially after they personally seated the guest.  We might try to stop by again, just to see if it was a staffing fluke that day.

3.description: I live right down the street from this place and I have to admit that I didn't like it as much as I do now. It's a great neighborhood bar because it's spacious and the drinks are affordable. Not all of the food is great, but I do recommend the sliders with all of the fixings and waffle fries. The tacos are meh and you can find better authentic tacos at different places in the neighborhood. There's a pool table if you want to play and a wrap around patio. It's cool for a quick lunch or brunch to get out! Lastly, one thing that I wasn't a fan of was when they told me that I had to tie my dog on the outside of the gate if we wanted to eat on the patio. I'm sorry but I've never been told that before in a restaurant and so we opted to not eat here because our puppy needed to be closer to us.

35.description: This place, at one time, was consistently great, with meals, and service. Over the last year,...I continue to visit this convenient spot... Only to be further disappointed!!-in the winter it was always uncomfortably cold, and the server just seemed like it wasn't bad that we had to keep our coats on to eat. Most recently, they charged us 3.00 for 2 waters.. And rang them up as soda. ;-( Shameless. They mess up my order almost every time I'm there... And the servers are only "occasionally" friendly.  2stars... No, only 1.

19.description: I just love this place. The food is so good for bar food. I highly suggest any of the pizzas and for burgers "The Trucker" is the way to goJessica is pretty awesome too. One of my favorite bartenders. All in all this is one of my favorite spots in Chicago

28.description: Decent menu with average prices. We ordered the cheese curds as an appetizer and they were good. We were not very impressed with their pairing with a sweet mayo. I ordered the fish and chips and while the waffle fries were very crispy and delicious the fish was nothing to write home about. Advertised as beer battered but reminded me of fish out of your local grocers frozen food aisle. Atmosphere was as expected for a bar; however the single waitress seemed to have some difficulty keeping up with the entire floor. It took 15minutes to get her attention to get our bill.

45.description: Yum..  Really like hanging here.

33.description: Oh Beetle, what happened? I've been going to the Beetle since I moved to this city 5 years ago. It used to have good food and fantastic service.  There have been some dramatic changes in food that have caused me to stop eating there. But, service is still good and the ambience is pleasant.  Ok place to hang out before or after eating out.

43.description: This bar is always empty. Service is mediocre, usually. If you sit at the bar you'll get the best service. Food is good; Especially the pulled pork pizza.  Try it. Good place to go and hang out and still be able to talk with your group. Not a good place if you are looking for atmosphere.

2.description: I love this bar! The food is pretty great, you should come for brunch when Lizzie is working and order the fabulous bloody and the Huevos Benedict.

18.description: GOD HELP ME, beetle, close up for a month and get a facelift! I've been going here for six years and literally nothing has changed. in a bad way. in fact, it's gotten much worse. the beer taps are clearly musty & never cleaned, the food went from decent bar food to slobbish, flash-frozen mush, and the vibe is best described as an empty shell of its former self. i want to be a regular so bad. it has no reason not to be awesome. but nothing ever changes. the worst was when we went a few weeks ago and a crazy drunk guy at the bar wouldn't leave me alone and nobody seemed to notice. i asked for my food to go and got out as quick as possible. in a competitive neighborhood, there's no good reason to go back.

41.description: First, I'm biased because I live down the street an will always continue to come here (good or bad). It's just so close to my house! But seriously. The fish n chips is awesome!!!! Also, the fact that they have old chub Scottish ale on nitro doesn't hurt their case.

52.description: The food is decent. The drinks are good. What really impresses me about this place is the size, service, location and ambiance. It's tucked away in West Ukie village so the clientele is a big mix of people. It's relatively chill during brunch hours and it's a great place to get a bite, do some work ( web development in my case ) and chat with the staff. I really dig it and will continue to do come here. They also have good DJ nights occasionally.

50.description: I've been to The Beetle twice in the last month and I really like the ambiance and the specials.  The first time I visited with 2 friends on a Thursday after we had dinner in the neighborhood.  We enjoyed the Thursday special which included $3 Domestics and $3 Abita Seasonals.  I knew that night that I wanted to go back to try some brunch.  A friend and I went back a few days later for a shot at their weekend brunch.  I had the Chilaquiles and they were just ok.  Reminded me of some type of Mexican nacho instead of a breakfast dish.  The $5 mimosas and bloodies hit the spot though.  I definitely plan on revisiting this joint to try their pub trivia as well as their Gourmet Pizza special on Thursdays.  I did meet the owner while there for brunch and she was very friendly and accommodating.  It's nice to see good neighborhood bars going up in the area!

4.description: Didn't have to work late last Friday so I was super excited to go meet up with some friends for dinner and drinks. The excitement went up a notch when I saw this place had an $8 fish fry. The fish was decent. I enjoyed their coleslaw and waffle fries. My beverage of choice was Central Water's Mississippi Mud Porter. Delicious. Overall, a fun evening in a casual, divey bar that I would definitely return to.

6.description: This place has saved my ass a million times when it's ten below outside and need chow! Good specials and friendly staff too. $2 tacos on Tuesday

22.description: I know I'm a minority in this, but why the fuck even bother with the vegan burger if you don't have any vegan bread? Beer is good and pool table - Just sayin.

15.description: Food: AverageFood Recommendation: Mushroom pizza, burger and waffle fries. Do not get the (strange) artichoke dip or (dry) hummus. Drinks: A nice beer selection, wine, liquor. Allagash white is consistently on tap. Price: Average. There are no $4-6 appetizer options. Atmosphere: Good Parking: Street- kind of tough sometimes. Wait staff: Uncomfortably bad. It often feels like I am imposing on their evening. Receiving water or a check is a monumental task- be prepared to wait.I would give a 3-star if it were not for the wait staff. Its an OK place, but probably not worth a special trip. If you're in the neighborhood, there are many other phenomenal places to eat and drink.UPDATED to a 3 star-- Haven't been since but I received a nice message from the owner who said they changed things up. Cheers to you. I hope its better!

57.description: This is a great little neighborhood spot.  I've never had a problem getting a seat.The beer list is decent-to-good but not really extensive, but they do a good job of rotating taps so there's something new to try while also ensuring that they've got a good enough variety to please everyone.The food is above-average bar food, but I wish they had more vegetarian options - as far as I can tell, there isn't even a way to get decent nachos without meat.What I like most, though, is the atmosphere.  It's laid back and casual.  There's a great - but seldom empty - table to one side right by a warm fireplace, snag it if you can.  Even if you can't, I like how the place doesn't blast music.  It's the only place I know within reasonable walking distance that has food and good beer and where you can go on a Friday or Saturday night to meet up with friends and actually hear each other talk (heaven forbid! Talking to friends while socializing!).  That alone clinches this place for me, and is greatly appreciated.

20.description: A average looking newbie bar in the city. The food was being ordered often by the twenty something young crowd so it must be good as the one cook looked ultra busy even though the place was not crowded. Nice service and another strong bar on Chicago Avenue  in Ukrainian Illae part of Chicago. The food looked really good and the kitchen appears open late so this place is highly recommended over White Castle

36.description: Arrived about 7pm. The food was average. Not bad but nothing to write yelp about lol. There was 2 TV's however not in the place we sat and I could not see the Hawks game. A few more TV's would go a long way. Great price on beer with $4 drafts. The biggest disappointment was the service. Once the waitress finally made it to us we got our food and did not see her again until the check came. No interaction at all. I was prepared to spend more on drinks however we decided to just go to another place. I see why there was only 2 other people in the place. Perhaps its better known for late night music however there is a large untapped market segment they are missing out on.

14.description: I am so happy that The Beetle is my neighborhood bar!! First of all the food is great and it is a comfortable place to brunch, dine, or simply drink. Also- they rent their space for small occasions and get togethers and they absolutely go out of their way to help out and accommodate no matter the occasion. I recently had a babyshower there and they bent over backwards to help me plan it and make sure everything was smooth sailing. It was so stress free and convenient and I can't thank them enough. I worked with Colleen on the organization part of it and Kristen and Jessica the day of. All of them were so nice and helpful. They had great response time and made sure that everything happened according to plan. Their pricing was great as well and they are more than willing to work with you. I would definitely suggest them for small get togethers!!!

0.description: If you're out of beer or smokes and live in the neighborhood, this is your place.  It's a no-frills liquor store with a decent selection of cold domestic beer (not so much on the imports) and full array of liquor behind the counter.  They also have a small selection of packaged dry goods in case you want some food with your drink.  The clerk is very friendly and helpful.  The prices are reasonable.  If you live near Division on the west side of the park, this place sure beats the walk to Foremost, especially in the dark.

29.description: This place is the sh*&! The staff there are always so sweet to my little boy.  Pat gives us the best advice while reminding us of the benefits of having a CVS card.  I love the friendly atmosphere and professionalism.   This place is top notch!

42.description: I have found the portal to hell and this is it. Last time I was there, the pharmacy LOST my prescriptions, made me wait 40 minutes for them to figure it out and still messed them up. Of course as it goes with PHARMACIES they are never WRONG. So, long story short, they shorted me on some pills and gave me a generic when I really needed a brand name. Beyond that, their wine selection is for hobos and the lines are long. I hate this place.

23.description: I wish I could give this a higher rating because it is a stone throw from my house. Jack and Jenise are the best while others act like you are bothering them. Always a long wait and never any customer service. I usually only have 1 ease Rx that needs filled and always there for at least an hour.

47.description: My boyfriend got mad at me because I couldn't find the toothpaste in here once.  Like, he was MAD.

8.description: The day we moved into the neighborhood, we got all our stuff moved and walked over to this CVS to buy cleaning supplies and pop and chips and all the crap you need after a move. We're walking in and the alarm goes off and a dude runs past us with two cartons of Newports and two flustered employees (they were older ladies) following him slowly. First impressions can be misleading, but in the case of this CVS they're pretty much right on. We're in here all the time for basics (it's the CVS that's close so what can you do) and have seen some wild stuff in and around this place (mostly just harmless people-of-walmart trashy type stuff, I don't mean to imply that it's not safe). There's one register with a cashier (often closed/broken) and four self check out lanes (they should lock up the sadist who designed these things), there's usually a long surly line on evenings and weekends. Using the self checkout lanes almost always turns into some farcical you-vs-computer thing like something in that Terry Gilliam movie Brazil (if you've ever seen that one). Decent selection of candy but they don't carry Lemonheads (how can that even be). All that said, it's usually a better experience than going to the Family Dollar.

31.description: The Yelp community is dead on this time.  Although in order to give an extra star I would have to find a twenty dollar bill on the floor.The self serve check out is the most fucked up in all the land.  You will surely be treated like a leper by the staff that averages 2 weeks on the job.  Between the hatred for customers and the hatred for the worker,  I can only assume management is hiding behind bullet proof glass enjoying the show.  Pharmacy?  No not for me thanks,  I would rather grind my own pills from the bones of cadavers before letting these dregs dish out my prescriptions.Try to dodge out of the self check out line because four people at once need to be carded?  Good luck,  as soon as you lose your spot the entitled powertripping bitch at the counter will walk off on break,  she will look you in the eye with such pleasure it will make your guts roll.  Then,  the poor soul who is still on shift will skip you and go to the folks who look like they may go postal,  there are usually three of those in line at any given time.

34.description: As someone else mentioned, there is always something shady going on in the private parking lot.  I hate being asked for change by the same haggard old lady EVERY time I'm here.  I've seen several scams taking place out here.  Once a lady was using her disabled child in a wheelchair to harrass customers, yelling at them through their closed car windows.  The employees can be super lazy and not helpful.  I'm so happy they now have self check-out.  It makes my trips here so much easier.  But hey, it's open 24 hours.  It's bright.  It's clean.  It's near my house.  Guess I'll just have to keep feeling guilty about not handing out my spare change as I exit.

16.description: only less than 50% functional checkouts, not staffed well, doesnt carry basic itemsUPDATE: just had another awesum moment @ this worlds greatest CVS. 4 ppl "working" all walking in different directions w/their backs purposely towards the checkouts (where they "work"). i flag 1 down + she stares me down + gives me the silent treatment while she comes over to my flashing 'Assistance Needed' register. amazingPREVIOUSLY: another nite, another CVS run, in which a broken checkout is being 'fixed' by 1 of the "workers" whois srsly just punching the checkout in the face (in its screen) while saying "FUCK". this place is amazing

13.description: This place is awesome because you are guaranteed to witness a robbery every 3rd visit. People watching is some of the best west of Western. There's usually long line at the Red Box on the weekends, so be sure to plan ahead.

11.description: I'm truly beginning to believe this CVS is the portal to hell.  The store itself is fine.  It's the checkout, and the employees who allegedly work there that are the problem.  I had an issue one time because I brought my own bag.  The machine didn't like that, so it called for help.  Finally, a woman started sauntering over, only to detour to someone else who was also having a problem.  The machine told me again "Help is on the way" to which I audibly replied "Really?".  When she finally slowly walked over, she couldn't figure out the issue was I had already bagged my own items.  When I pointed it out to her, she replied "We have those on sale".  I'm like "What?", to which she gestures to my headphones.  After she takes forever, her response is to try and sell me something?And one other checkout "helper"- A coupon wouldn't go through because I entered my phone number wrong.  I told her I didn't want to buy the product without a coupon, to which she complained that she'd have to void the whole purchase.  I replied "Fine", and she chose to walk away.  I pushed the help button, to which she finally came over and voided the sale so I could start over.  During this she was complaining she wanted to go on break.  This was with all four registers flashing.  Lady, you weren't going to go on break anytime soon.

39.description: It's kind of a bummer that even though I'm giving this 1 star (zero if possible!)
