I know I'm going to keep returning, since it's conveniently located.However, at least I know that I need to factor in at least 40 additional minutes of wait time whenever getting a prescription filled... and you should do the same.  Oh and make sure you're mentally prepared to be ignored for at least 5 minutes before they even make any motions to accept that you're standing there. I can't testify to this but I'm guessing it's a bit ironic if you're waiting in line for blood pressure medicine!Patience is perhaps too much of a virtue at this place. Sometimes, I really feel like the pharmacists are doing the R&D behind the drugs as you wait, rather than simply filling little bottles with the pills.

37.description: I waited in the pharmacy line for about a half-hour today (per usual), but I don't blame the employees working in the pharmacy for this. Truthfully, I like these people. They're always super nice to me, apologizing profusely about the wait. I can see they're working their butts off, and I feel for them. I blame it on corporate. Apparently, corporate cut their hours, plus they've had to absorb all the prescriptions from another local pharmacy in Ukrainian Village that closed, so they're absolutely overwhelmed. While I was waiting in the line today, an older gentleman behind me complained to the manager, who didn't do jack about expediting the line. All he said was to call CVS corporate about it. And the older gentleman had suggested an easy solution to the line problem:  Have everyone take a number so they can do their shopping in the rest of the store or take a seat, instead of having to stand in the line. But the manager just ignored the idea.Also, I've got to add- the women working check-out are a joke. They're ssssoooo slow and rude and put-upon. One of them was annoyed that I hadn't cut off the coupon from a receipt before handing it to her. "I don't need the whole receipt!" She snapped. Ugh. I'm glad I'm not her daughter, but i feel sorry for whoever is. Thankfully, there are some self-check out stations now. We'll see how those go.On a side note, there is always something shady going down in the parking lot. Trying to figure out what is going on in the lot is actually the best part of the CVS experience...

0.description: This pharmacy is simply the BEST. The two pharmacists are simply amazing. My prescriptions are not typical meds. Most have to be special ordered and require complex dispensing calculations. The pharmacists were both beyond helpful in making calls to pharmaceutical companies to secure information, calls to my physicians to get additional information from them and spending time discussing my meds with me. I sincerely appreciate the pharmacy staff at this store!

38.description: the employees here suck. i think they have a union thing going here because i've never seen an employee here who deserves a job. i love it when everyone is on their lunch break at the same time. i love that they seem all pissy and miserable because they have to take a minute out of their day to do their job by pushing some fucking buttons and perhaps placing some items in a bag. i especially loved the time my cashier was shit canned wasted and when she gave me too much change guess what? i took it as compensation for all the assholery i have to deal with just to buy a tube of toothpaste. if there was ever an employee at this place who might have smiled once, then i am not speaking to you. and there is hardly a chance of you existing because literally, with no exaggeration, i have experienced nothing but lazy, bitchy, attitude from EVERY SINGLE EMPLOYEE EVERY SINGLE TIME. i'd rather scratch my own face off and pour salt on it while being dragged by a speeding truck than to go to this place again.

51.description: This location used to be an Osco Drug and I've visited this store for almost ten years.The abrupt shift to CVS disgruntled everyone.   The store has a different layout and there are always long lines of unhappy shoppers.   The prices are a bit more as well.Many years ago, I brought my family to the Osco when they visited Chicago as we all needed stuff and we all like killer sales.Upon ringing my little bath fizzies up, my sweet cashier shouted, in front of my mother, "Girl, if you have this many balls in the tub there better be a MAN attached!"Gotta love her.The same woman, once the store became CVS, whispered to me, "Can you believe how bad the new store is?"I miss Osco.And, to the previous poster, the restaurant you are referring to was known as the Light House, I believe, and I was saddened to see it demolished.   Best place in the world to get grilled cheese and tomato sandwiches at 1 AM.

27.description: This CVS is terrible. I had to have my doctor send my electronic Rx in to these idiots 3 times before they finally got it.. and when they got it, they gave me the wrong dosage. My boyfriend also got a prescription filled here and they gave him the wrong dosage as well. I don't trust them and you shouldn't either. I now have to get my doctor send my prescription to the Walgreen's pharmacy in the building I work in.

32.description: Could someone please tell me what the fuck is wrong with this place? It's as if I gathered 10 random strangers off the street and decided to open a pharmacy.  The annoyance starts not only in real life waiting for hours with no communication from anyone as to why your prescription is taking 3 hours (have these people heard of a place called Walgreens? They don't have a problem filling my scrip in the alloted and approved time) But even when you CALL the store to fill your scrip the god damn auto system has like 4 fricking languages and goes on for 5 minutes before you can even choose a prompt. I hate this store. I hate it so much that I called the complaint # poking out next to the spanish People magazine that said "CVS corporate" and  was shocked to hear it go straight to some dudes personal VOICE MAIL!  Are you kidding me? The pharmacists run around like chickens with their heads cut off or look at you with apprehension as if know they are not doing their job appropriately.  They must get their assess handed to them on the regular (well deserved if you ask me).In addition to this, that annoying lady in the parking lot should be arrested and last time I was there 2 customers got into a fist fight in the check out lane. This place is a piece of shit. I'm sticking to my effective and smaller Walgreens.

54.description: ZERO stars!!! Why oh WHY Yelp won't you give me the pleasure of giving me NEGATIVE stars or at least zero!?This is absolutely the most piss poor excuse for a drugstore, EVER.  There has never been an occasion where they have not screwed up my pharmacy order in some bizarre way when I come in and order the same exact medications every month for months and months on end.  Then some snarky little pharmatech  has the nerve to give me attitude when I express my obvious hostility and disgust at the fact that they can't put 30 pills into a bottle and slap a label on it in a reasonable amount of time.  I can order my meds days in advance and STILL have to wait for 30-40 minutes to get them when I get to the pharmacy.  Oh and then the LINES.  They not only screw my scripts up each and every time, they manage to screw everyone else's up as well, making the pharm queue oh let's say about 12 deep at any given time.  There is absolutely no excuse for this abominable service.  As soon as I was able, I switched to a more amenable pharmacy near my work.  (they aren't great either, but much better than this medicinal hellhole)

48.description: "Oh, hey I'm going to pick up a Dr. Pepper across the street at CVS, I'll be back in 5 hours."convenience store?  i think not!  total bullshit.

44.description: Totally agree with all the reviews.  I switched my prescptions to Dominicks, where they are so helpful, and actually work to get your order out.  The cashiers here are so bad, I agree with one poster who says they probably have an inside bet as to who can take the longest with customers.  I also cannot find anything in this store--items are places wherever I think.  I swear I must do 8 circles before I find toothpaste.  And there is usually no one to help.  Don't go here if you can help it.

24.description: Pharmacy under new management since 4/2011. Stop by for a visit.. We'd love to hear from you!

7.description: U know when ur really sick and the last thing u want to do is wait in a line for ur meds. They get that here. They rushed me out the door when I walked in and they could tell I was struggling. This pharmacy is awesome. They are always very friendly and work with the doctors offices real well (even with all of the healthcare reform). Screw waiting at target for 45 minutes (and ur script is STILL not ready). Plus they aren't just store employees (like target) they are legit pharmacist.

49.description: If the USPS ran a drug store, this would be their trophy location.Few CVS stores are worth review, but this one is... it's the worst i've ever been to in my life.There's ALWAYS a long line of people... I've never even been to a CVS where there's an actual "line" ... it's like going to the post office.  you wait in a very long line behind a post that says "wait here for a cashier to call you" ... The store itself feels like they moved a bunch of aisles in some weird fashion without any budget to make it look nice.  It just looks awkward, I don't really  know why even...  they do have booze, but it's over priced from what I remember, and I'd rather buy mystery vodka at the local polish store than wait in this terrible line.it's unfortunate that this store that I live just a few blocks from is so crappy... if this were a nice store i'd probably be here 3x a week getting stuff, but as it is now I don't even go once a month.

40.description: We don't enjoy writing negative reviews of other business in our neighbor but the pharmacy at this CVS has been problematic since our first prescription. The first prescription we brought their was for my wife's monthly hormone. The girl who took the prescription information suggested that we sign up for automatic monthly renewal whereby we would get a phone call to three days before the prescription was to run out & the prescription would be ready and waiting for us.Two days after running out and realizing she had run out I went to CVS to get the prescription & to find out what happened to the automatic renewal. Nobody had an answer at that time but the same thing happened the following month. This time I spoke with a different girl who said for whatever reason this particular prescription was not eligible for automatic refill that she had no idea why the other girl had me go through the trouble of getting all the information for automatic renewal.They were always a little slow in filling the prescriptions but they were close by so it wasn't an issue till a week ago. Please follow the timeline - Catherine leaves her doctor's office at Foster in California at 4:30 - the prescriptions had been sent to CVS - via the doctors who use A prescription writing machine in other words electroniclly & instantly transmitted to CVSShe stops at our shop - Windy City Parrot - to pick me up as it was now a little after five. We putzed around the shop until about six - providing ample time to get the prescription filled. It's six o'clock we walked in to CVS we are at the end of a line of eight other people waiting for the prescriptions. At 6:20 on face-to-face with a pharmacy technician who says the prescriptions aren't not ready and they can't even find them to fill. A man behind the counter are shuffles through a bunch papers and eventually locates the 4 prescriptions that have been electronically transmitted for convenience. I tell him I'll be back in an hour and we go home which is to 2 1/2 blocks away.I go back at 8:20 that evening and stand at the counter - two people working and I am being ignored - one girl was very busy filling up a drawer with empty pill bottles, she make three trips while the pharmacist on duty rearranges mechanical items on the counter in an OC kind of way. I finally yell "hello I'd like to pick up my prescription" - the girl comes over and asked me for my name - guess what prescriptions aren't ready yet. And she can only find three of the four now - I get the pharmacist who I now explain the timeline to and very rudely say "I want my stinking medication & I want to go home you've had the prescriptions for three hours." I patiently wait for another 10 minutes and the drawer filling girl comes back and starts explaining the medications to me. She says insurers picked up the first three then gets to the fourth when an says "you're insurance picked part of this but  it's still is pretty expensive." I say something to the effect of "oh well what can you do, how much do I owe you I would like to go home". She rings it up and it's much more than anticipated, I bring this to her attention say "you just told me the insurers picked up three of the four." She says I did not, and now wants to argue with me - not a good plan for her because I am a master arguer and she was way out of her league. So we concluded the transaction. I feel that if they inepet at handling their paperwork, the possibility that they are just as inept in handling the pharmaceuticals was high.  And that's when I made the decision to take the next prescription to Dominick's down the street.

53.description: Time pretty much stands still in this place. It most likely takes more energy on the workers part to go as slow as they do at all times, than if they just did a half-assed job. Your going up to the cash register with items makes the cashiers visibly annoyed. If you can, avoid this place.

30.description: Good wine selection. Staff is from mars and one lady is so old she needs to retire. Just a quick place to pick up some forgotten item and not to spend your whole link card on. Self checkout is ok so you don't have to deal with the old lady behind the counter.

46.description: I would MUCH rather hit Nevada Liquors a couple blocks west of this CVS location when I need to pick up a quick 12-pack or two.  The line @ this CVS is absolutely ridiculous...if I need more staples than just ice or beer, its worth it to make the extra hike to the Dominicks @ damen/chicago. Basically, avoid at all costs, unless its an absolute emergency.

1.description: I go because I can walk there, despite:-receiving a box of expired meds-receiving a prescription bottle that was filled with the medicine that I was prescribed as well as an identical looking diuretic-being bribed to not answer the customer service survey with a gift card-it always being a colossal shitshow in there. But today, TODAY, took the cake. My prescription was dispensed IN A SANDWICH BAG. It was labeled with my name and info, but IT IS IN A SANDWICH BAG.

9.description: I love this pharmacy staff, especially the pharmacist Emril! His customer service goes above & beyond every time! Even if my prescription is called into the wrong pharmacy,  he always makes sure to take care of his loyal patients!  He is always smiling and is very good at communicating any issues or side effects of your prescription.  I will always come to this pharmacy as long as Emril is on staff!!  The other female pharmacist is also very sweet & good to her patients, Emril has just gone the extra mile for me several times :)I worked at Walgreens for 8 years, but my insurance only allows me to go to CVS.  I was extremely reluctant at first, but the staff here has won me over! :)

26.description: What a terrible CVS!  I am glad there is a better and closer on to my house because I am never going to enter into this one again!All I wanted was to develop my pictures - $15 later and all of them looking terrible, I asked two people for help.  Their answers were "I don't work in this department".  Someone finally called over the woman who DID work in that department over the intercom and five minutes later I stormed out of the store because I was tired of waiting!

25.description: If I should stay, I would only be in your way. So I'll go, but I know I'll think of you ev'ry step of the way. And I will always love you. I will always love you. You, my darling you. Hmm. Bittersweet memories that is all I'm taking with me. So, goodbye. Please, don't cry. We both know I'm not what you, you need. And I will always love you. I will always love you. (Instrumental solo) I hope life treats you kind And I hope you have all you've dreamed of. And I wish to you, joy and happiness. But above all this, I wish you love. And I will always love you. I will always love you. I will always love you. I will always love you. I will always love you. I, I will always love you. You, darling, I love you. Ooh, I'll always, I'll always love you. *This song brought to you by the Sarcastic Post of the Day Society.

12.description: The pharmacy staff is phenomenal. Friendly, attentive, helpful and knowledgeable. I have recently started using this as my neighborhood pharmacy after moving here two months ago and have been very pleased with the service I have gotten. The pharmacists are very professional and acknowledge me as a consistent and loyal customer. I always enjoy chatting with them and appreciate their promptness in processing my orders!

21.description: only less than 50% functional checkouts, not staffed well, doesnt carry basic itemsUPDATE: just had another awesum moment @ this worlds greatest CVS. 4 ppl "working" all walking in different directions w/their backs purposely towards the checkouts (where they "work"). i flag 1 down + she stares me down + gives me the silent treatment while she comes over to my flashing 'Assistance Needed' register. amazingPREVIOUSLY: another nite, another CVS run, in which a broken checkout is being 'fixed' by 1 of the "workers" whois srsly just punching the checkout in the face (in its screen) while saying "FUCK". this place is amazing

17.description: Has anyone seen a cashier?.. Especially with the self-checkout moderator Chowing down on a muffin...Pretty..

10.description: This is a basic CVS. I came here during Valentine's Day and the card section was obliterated. There's hardly a cashier section, rather it relies more on self-serve machines. I'm fine with that, but it does take away some of the customer service. There is a TINY little case for cigarettes if you want to buy some.

5.description: This place is my personal hell.There is somehow always a line at the checkout even if there isn't one when you walk in the store.  The self check out stations are rarely working and the staff is not even close to helpful.  They all seem so miserable!Additionally I don't understand all the good reviews about this pharmacy.  I was having a severe allergic reaction and was ignored by a pharmacist while trying to get a prescription filled.  There is also a male pharmacist there who will not address women.  Ever.  I went here all the time because I had to.  Thank god I moved.

3.description: Giving stars for the very nice store manager and the sweet ladies who are so helpful at checkout.A nice big and clean store.Lost 2 stars because the pharmacy staff will flat out ignore you, talk to each other like you're not there, and takes forever to Fill.

35.description: To whom it may concern,Since moving to Chicago, I've noticed that customer service is definitely lacking especially in corporate establishments where there seems to be no one around to put employees in check. Nowhere is this more apparent than at the CVS located at 2427 W Chicago Ave., Chicago, IL. They offer a wide range of services and products that I use everyday and are located near my apartment so they were an obvious pharmacy choice when I moved to the city. I have been frequenting this location for nearly four years now and I've decided that I will never again return to this store.First of all, there is a large homeless community that at all hours are soliciting right by the front door. I'm forgiving of this as they are respectful people and are never too pushy when asking for help. Actually, the homeless are far more polite than the employees you are forced to deal with once you enter this establishment. The customer service at this CVS is absolutely appalling. If you can get anyone to even look at you during check out you are treated to a group of people who apparently HATE their jobs. Between the grumpy old ladies who are on the verge of sleep and the younger employees who continue talking to coworkers during checkout one is sure to leave annoyed. Add this to an uncaring pharmacy staff who have lost more than one of my prescriptions (one that was even enrolled in the Auto Refill service they offer). Needless to say I've since switched my prescriptions, but would still stop by to pick up odds and ends.Today, I walked over to 2 pharmacy employees, both with CVS name plates. They appeared to be having idle chit chat, one pharmacist was outside the pharmacy area one was on the inside. I approached them asked them a general question about product location. I was quickly dismissed with an angry glare and a mumble of "we don't sell here." They continued talking/ignoring me. Since the comment the angry lady made didn't make any sense I re-asked my question thinking perhaps she had misunderstood. The lady then gave me a look of disgust and the man she was speaking with said, "we don't work here, ask at the front!" After putting up with years of terrible customer service I just snapped. I dropped the two items I was holding for purchase right where I stood and stormed out the front door. I got into my car and looked around the ill lit parking lot and decided today is the last day I will EVER deal with CVS pharmacy, PERIOD!

19.description: The Yelp community is dead on this time.  Although in order to give an extra star I would have to find a twenty dollar bill on the floor.The self serve check out is the most fucked up in all the land.  You will surely be treated like a leper by the staff that averages 2 weeks on the job.  Between the hatred for customers and the hatred for the worker,  I can only assume management is hiding behind bullet proof glass enjoying the show.  Pharmacy?  No not for me thanks,  I would rather grind my own pills from the bones of cadavers before letting these dregs dish out my prescriptions.Try to dodge out of the self check out line because four people at once need to be carded?  Good luck,  as soon as you lose your spot the entitled powertripping bitch at the counter will walk off on break,  she will look you in the eye with such pleasure it will make your guts roll.  Then,  the poor soul who is still on shift will skip you and go to the folks who look like they may go postal,  there are usually three of those in line at any given time.

28.description: This place is insane. It's got all the basics, and you can get wine and beer. Good enough. But I've seen things here. Things that would make you wonder. I saw a guy shoplifting here once, and when he was approached by an employee he dropped what he was taking and began walking out. Apparently he's done this before from the way the employees were acting. Before he left though he passed a display of Axe body spray, picked one up and began spraying himself all over. "That's not a tester!" someone yelled. "It is NOW!" he shouted back, dropping the canister on the floor and running out.But that's not the reason for my 2-star review. In fact, that alone should give it a 5 star review. In general I find this place to be kind of grubby and the employees do not give two toots about anyone shopping there (unless you're turning Axe cans into testers.) The pharmacy employees are nice but often seem confused. I know that dealing with a steady stream of medicine-needing people, many of whom speak languages other than English, can wear a person down. But I've had prescriptions held up for days because the person behind the counter doesn't know what to do with my Rx paperwork. I finally switched all my prescriptions over to a mail order service, and for anything I need right away I've moved on to a much friendlier, faster, organized pharmacy elsewhere in the city.The self-service checkout is nice, but if you're buying alcohol you basically have to shout to get someone to come over to begrudgingly key in the magic code for being over 21. Sorry, lady, I know you're so busy over by the photo kiosk dancing to Chamillionaire, but you are also like WORKING HERE so please help the customers. Seriously homegirl was getting down. Good dance moves though.One time, the self service checkout thing didn't give me the right change and it took 3 people to figure out how to get it to give me my dollar. I really only come here if I'm desperate. Sadly, that is more often than I'd like.

45.description: Cool little mom and pop drugstore in my neighborhood.  Some pretty nice ladies work there.  Service is not always the fastest.  It may be the slowest.  I do not know.  They will not let you return frozen food.  One time I saw a lady try to return a frozen individual lasagna and they would not let her.  That is really the only negative about this place.  They have rat traps.  Close to Burger King.

33.description: I've been going to CVS for years.  I would like to comment that if you are going to drop off or pick up a prescription, maybe this is not the CVS to go to...I think the staff is helpful and they do apologize profusely, however if you go at certain times you will be waiting for a very long time.  This CVS has changed a lot in the past couple of years and the people that have been going there in the past couple of years have gotten pretty ghetto looking.  And yes, there is one lady that is out in the parking lot always asking for money.  This is just a convenient place to run in and pick up something that you need, but I would not recommend it there. LD

43.description: have you seen their rent-a-cops?  mmm beefcake central

2.description: I've always had a positive experience coming here. They have anything that you'd need and I'm always greeted when I come into the door. You generally have to check yourself out which can be a little cumbersome sometimes but you do it anyways. It's nice to be able to come here for quick things that we've forgotten from the grocery store down the street. I love their new bags! Also, we get red box videos from here when we want a stay at home night and love that it's so close to where we live

18.description: If I should stay, I would only be in your way. So I'll go, but I know I'll think of you ev'ry step of the way. And I will always love you. I will always love you. You, my darling you. Hmm. Bittersweet memories that is all I'm taking with me. So, goodbye. Please, don't cry. We both know I'm not what you, you need. And I will always love you. I will always love you. (Instrumental solo) I hope life treats you kind And I hope you have all you've dreamed of. And I wish to you, joy and happiness. But above all this, I wish you love. And I will always love you. I will always love you. I will always love you. I will always love you. I will always love you. I, I will always love you. You, darling, I love you. Ooh, I'll always, I'll always love you. *This song brought to you by the Sarcastic Post of the Day Society.

41.description: Another yelper accurately described this store as the portal to hell. The few times that I have desperately tried to fill a prescription here, I have either had to wait for at least 15 minutes just to drop-off (guess they never heard of multitasking), another hour to pickup, or had my prescription lost completely in the span of 45 minutes: "I swear I remember filling that one...but it's nowhere to found! Guess I'll poke around looking for it in a leisurely fashion while you wait, then another 10 minutes later will finally concede that it's really gone and fill it again." That's what I call service. Now, the checkout ladies are the real highlight of the CVS experience. Not because they are good at their jobs, or even sane for that matter. But rather because they are like the neighborhood cooks performing at their highest capacity, which is substandard even for a CVS. Somehow this actually ends up being endearing/amusing rather than infuriating, which is what it should be. This is particularly so after the zoo like circus that you'll have to linger around with while you wait to checkout. It's a weird mix of hipsters, homeless people, and families of like 8 all at CVS together to buy a single gallon of milk as a bonding experience. It chips away at whatever sense of yourself you have and makes you wonder if you're one of them until you finally reach the counter and realize that it's just all one big joke.

52.description: I have to admit this place takes a little getting used to... Don't go in during the day if you're in a hurry.  The lines are a little crazy and some people act like they don't see the 12 person line and simply walk right up to a register.  Another problem is they tend not to order enough CTA passes.On the plus side:- 24 Hours.  Need a Coke, some Q-Tips and some Doggie Steps (As Seen on TV) at 4am?   No problemo!- Staff can actually be pleasant.  I have been offered help to find something and pleasantly greeted.  It isn't always the case here, but I've been to locations with far worse service.- The pharmacists have had no qualms about ringing me up for a couple items when the general line is ridiculously long.- Clean inside, unlike other CVS or Walgreen's locations.- Well-lit, good sized parking lot.Also, I don't know if anyone else has noticed but the former restaurant across the street has been demolished.  Who wants to bet it's going to be a Walgreen's?

50.description: I must be a complete idiot, cause I think I walk laps in this store trying to find things.  I honestly think there's no method to the organization.  And I say this because the CVS near my dad's house I don't have this problem.    Also, EVERY time I go into this CVS I end up waiting in line.  I feel like the employees have a bet going to see who can take the longest checking someone out.  I switched to CVS cause Walgreens started to suck, but maybe I'm going to have to go back to Walgreens.  Thing is I grew up where the headquarters of Walgreens is, and for me to disown Walgreens is sac religious.  But I may just have to go back to good ol' Walgreens.

4.description: I like this CVS. It is close to my home. They always have what I need, or I expect to be in a drug store like CVS or Walgreens. The staff is very friendly here. They greet you when you come in, and wish you good day when you leave. I always use my rewards card at CVS. I recently got a $10 off coupon when I spend $40. This is easy to do in a drugstore. They have a coin counter machine, flowers in a fridge, liquor/beer, ATM, and a Redbox outside the store. It is very convenient.

6.description: I went to CVS to try to get a refill on my differin prescription but my coupon expired and without the coupon it would be over $200! ridiculous! very disappointed I walked away and decided to look on my phone for a coupon online. I came back to the register thinking I found something but unfortunately I didn't. Jenise ended up giving me suggestions on where to look for coupons online she was very patient! She was even looked online through her phone because my phone sucks. In the end I just ended up getting the generic brand. Jenise was such a sweetheart, she had by far the best customer service I've ever experienced.

22.description: Terrible customer service.  Incredibly rude, power trips and the like.  Terrible.

15.description: This place is the worst.  I watched this giant eastern european dude walk right out the front door with a huge container of vitamins.  The alarm went off and staff simply ignored it.  I said, "that guy just stole something from your store!"  Employee responded, "I'm not going after him.  It happens all the time."  What???Shame on you, CVS!

20.description: The worst cvs I have ever been to! You cant find anything. They never have what you need. Staff is rude. I hate that it is the only cvs near my house.

36.description: Imagine the worst in life.DMV waiting lines.Anything IRS related.Getting a ticket when you are just walking to your car.Being drenched in the rain. Better yet, splashed by a car.Winning the lottery and dying the next day (wink, wink, Alanis).Being yelled at by a total stranger, and reply - only to find out that he is your future boss.Holding your neighbor's baby son right as he throws up his lunch.All this, time 10 = CVS Pharmacy Counter on Chicago and Western.So completely OVER CVS that I am giving my business to the local pop store. At least I am sure they will care.

14.description: While I have always had issues with CVS's deceptiveness, with having to read the very fine print to get a posted item on sale.... Or placing non-sale items right next to a very similar regular price item, in hopes the consumer will not pick-up the on sale items and pay full price for the very similar labels next to the sale items... Slick!.....However, I gave this CVS my first time ever prescription for a generic item... First time they charged me around $22, today after my phone rang off the hook with pre-recorded reminder messages about refilling at CVS.... I re-ordered my prescription... This same item two months later, is now $56.00.  After hearing that, I walked out.Pharmacist Sher was inept the first time I was there and someone else had to take care of me.... Today, she handles me again and offered me no discount, no empathy or explanation why my prescription has now tripled the price,since my initial order.She could care less!I guess CVS was banking on convenience of location getting me hooked on CVS, that one would over look gouging for the same common item a month later.  WRONG!I spoke with my wallet and walked out.... as anyone else should too that encounters such bad behavior.... Chicago grown Walgreen's or Costco, here I come!Screw you CVS and your carpeted stores that are meant to slow you down so you hopefully buy more!  CVS is a rip off!

58.description: Damn, this place is great. Popped in here after Riot Fest, and were starving. The noise level is HIGH, but eh . . . we really didn't care about that.The $6 Tall Boy-Shot-Taco special is great, and I may take advantage of that when I visit the Roger's Park location, but that's not what I got on this night.What I got were three absolutely delicious BBQ Pulled Pork tacos. They were juicier than regular tacos, but such a fantastic flavor. I sopped up every bit of the delicious BBQ sauce. Also snagged one of my awesomeboyfriend's al Pastor tacos - those are always a favorite, and these were no different. Also great.There's veg stuff, really unusual tacos - Portabello, sweet Potato, Grits and Kale, and Avocado tacos. I could see combining a few of these with the meat tacos, 'cos avocado YUM. The usual array of beers, and - it's a bar, so it's going to be loud and crowded. Cute outdoor area. I loved the vibe and liveliness of this place, I'll visit the Rogers Park location more, I'm sure. Not much of a fan of Humboldt Park, but they don't get stars taken off for that, I had a great time here.

56.description: Best Taco place in the area, hands down! A fantastic twist on traditional recipies. Not to mention the amazing deal... Tall boy, shot and taco for $6?! One would be foolish to pass that up. I'm a HUGE avocado fan and the spicy avocado is an instant classic, then again, there honestly isn't a bad thing on the menu.

29.description: Best tacos in the city, better than Big Star. Best for me:1. Spicy avocado2. Pulled Pork3. Beer Grilled Chicken4. Grilled Sweet PotatoAll tacos are $3. Bartender/staff are friendly/cool.Handy to remember it's cash-only but they do have an ATM.

42.description: Very good food. Waiter seemed uncomfortable having conversations with guests. Drinks were great!

23.description: This place has great tacos and margaritas hands down. But the service is very slow. I waited 20 minutes to get sat with my friends and then another 15 just to get my drink. The service was friendly but they were obviously understaffed. They have a great combo platter though for tacos which is great. My work mate ordered the burger medium rare and it turned out to be a super thin low quality patty I would not recommend unless drunk and order it medium well at least! I'll be back for the margaritas for sure though they are worth it!!!

47.description: Stopped in on a recommendation from a number of shop owners in the area after visiting the special holiday edition of California Nights. Visited a number of the great vintage shops on the strip and was intrigued by the taco bar offerings at this place. I had heard of this place, but didn't recall how. Although the No Bullshit Special (a taco, shot and beer) was intriguing, I wanted more food and less booze!  Opted for three tacos based on server's recommendations. Surprisingly, the grits and kale taco was outstanding. A little sweet and flavored with some cheese, this odd combination was surprisingly tasty! Also enjoyed the grilled sweet potato taco and the brisket taco, although I added a little of their homemade bar-b-que sauce to the brisket to sweeten the deal. The homemade guac and chips was some of the best I've had! Friends enjoyed the bar-b-que pulled pork sliders and three alternate tacos (hangar steak, portabello and PBR chicken). Home fries were an extra treat. Funny thing, this morning when I visited their website, I realized the reason I knew the name was that one recently opened right in my own Rogers Park neighborhood!

8.description: I am definitely satisfied with all the food and drinks I've had at Bullhead.  I came here initially on the suggestion of a coworker and we both really enjoyed ourselves.  He had had the food before so he knew what he was in for, but I didn't know what to expect.  I'll be honest: I was a little wary of a hipster taco joint in this neighborhood since I detest Big Star, but Bullhead Cantina was spot on.  The menu is small, but the tacos are excellent.  The spicy ones are SPICY, so beware, but they're pretty good.  The beet taco is THE BEST so get several.  I was also happy with the fried chicken and sweet potato, but that beet one is the best.Beer is cheap, whisky shots are cheap, and there's pretty good service at the tables.  ATM in the back since this establishment is cash only (which is kind of annoying) but you can at least get some money if you need it.I've been here a few times since my first visit and I'm always happy with the tacos I order.  They don't change, they're always tasty, the service is always fine, and there's never too many people here.  Good times in my mind.  Wifi is free, also, just ask for a password.

31.description: Overpriced and bland -- maybe because I was only in it for the tacos. The only really good ones were the sweet. The rest were a far cry even from the average taco stand. This place might seem worthwhile if you're either already drunk, or in for the booze.

34.description: Bullhead hit the spot last night and I'm giving it 5 stars for the experience as a whole because the service was great. Read on to see what I mean. We got here around 9 pm on a Saturday and were seated immediately. We had been here before and really enjoyed the smoked margarita, so we ordered them again. When they came, they tasted nothing like the ones we had had before... These tasted like water, tequila, and not much else. It's always a little awkward to tell the waiter when you don't like something, but our guy was totally cool about it. He let us order something different and keep these weird tasting drinks, and explained that he thought something funky was up with their mix. The Paloma I ordered instead was much better and we got on to enjoying our chips and salsa. All the tacos here are good so just pick any of them and you'll be happy. I had the mixed greens salad with chicken and really enjoyed it, mostly because it contained a lot of cilantro and portobello mushrooms which surprisingly was a great combination. And of course, any bar who turns the tv to FRIENDS when it comes on will automatically steal my heart.

16.description: Bullhead hit the spot last night and I'm giving it 5 stars for the experience as a whole because the service was great. Read on to see what I mean. We got here around 9 pm on a Saturday and were seated immediately. We had been here before and really enjoyed the smoked margarita, so we ordered them again. When they came, they tasted nothing like the ones we had had before... These tasted like water, tequila, and not much else. It's always a little awkward to tell the waiter when you don't like something, but our guy was totally cool about it. He let us order something different and keep these weird tasting drinks, and explained that he thought something funky was up with their mix. The Paloma I ordered instead was much better and we got on to enjoying our chips and salsa. All the tacos here are good so just pick any of them and you'll be happy. I had the mixed greens salad with chicken and really enjoyed it, mostly because it contained a lot of cilantro and portobello mushrooms which surprisingly was a great combination. And of course, any bar who turns the tv to FRIENDS when it comes on will automatically steal my heart.

13.description: Horrible customer service. It seemed like the server was super inconvenienced by me coming in. There was barely anyone there and she never greeted me or gave me a menu. When I walked over to her after 10 minutes it was just attitude. Never going back.

11.description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots. You can't beat the $5 shot and beer combo and the delicious $3 tacos - unless you're there on a "Wacky Wednesday" in which case it's 2 for $5 tacos. The tacos are not your regular Mexican fare. They get creative. The veggie options include a sweet potato one, spicy avocado (and it IS spicy), a kale one and a portobello mushroom. All are tasty, but my personal favorites are the sweet potato and avocado. I usually have those two tacos and order the fresh guac, which is some of the best I've had in the city. The guac is not too salty and very flavorful. You can tell it's fresh.The margaritas are also good and not the typical margaritas. You can get a pomegranate marg or a smoky version and they also have a more classic version. They compliment the food quite nicely so if you're into margaritas, try at least one (if not all) with your meal. If you're feelin really frisky, get the shot and beer combo as well!The staff is always very friendly and patient. It's hard picking which taco you want! The space can get pretty full but I usually never have to wait for a table. You can also sit at the bar. It is CASH ONLY. So arm yourself with cash or hit up the ATM inside. That's why they get 4 (1/2) stars from me. Cash only drives me (and probably most people) crazy! Go plastic, baby! Otherwise a great place to have dinner and drinks!

39.description: Like the Boiler Room? This is its taco-twin-sister.Great atmosphere and friendly bartenders are what creates a return-customer. The tacos do take a bit of time to arrive (but this is mentioned on the menu) - Good food takes time.Can't beat their taco-shot-tallboy deal. They should offer a 2-taco (plus shot and tallboy) for $8, and a 3-taco for $10, I'd order more tacos!

37.description: Absolutely amazing tacos.  Of the six I have tried, they were all noteworthy.  There are many vegetarian options that are interesting and unique such as roasted beet and sweet potato.  The sauces and toppings are innovative making the traditional meat tacos unlike other restaurants.  The specialty cocktails are affordable, delicious and strong.  Wish I lived in Chicago.

0.description: Amazing food, great service, and delicious drinks. And the no bullshit deal. Call mom I know where I'm going for dinner.

38.description: This place is spot on! The tacos are incredible.  I love the grits  and kale taco, and the roasted beets taco..the Cadillac Margarita with the smokey tequila should not be missed and on Wednesdays (?) Drinks specials make them CHEAP! Mellow vibe, great food, delicious drinks.

51.description: We came by a few weeks ago during Riot Fest weekend, and they weren't offering their normal tasty tacos... It was much slower service, higher prices, and worse food that weekend.... It was like a trifecta of blah.

27.description: GREAT patio. Cash only. Cocktails are strong and the tacos are cheap. I really liked the pastor (how can you go wrong with that one though?) and hanger steak tacos. I didn't like the portobello. My vegetarian friend loved the beets and avocado tacos. They have a lot of vegetarian options.

32.description: I can't believe it has taken me so long to come to Bullhead Cantina, it's definitely a neighborhood gem. I generally frequent Big Star, but the long waits are too much lately. What sets this place apart from other taco joints in Chicago is their large variety of vegetarian options, cheap pricing, and really authentic delicious corn tortillas. I tried the kale & grits, spicy avocado, & sweet potato tacos and my boyfriend had the steak, beer chicken, & carnitas. The kale & grits taco was TO DIE FOR, so buttery and delicious. I found that their vegetarian tacos are a lot heartier than other places I have been to. My non-vegetarian boyfriend even said he would order it next time. The smoky margaritas were strong and a good addition to the tacos. We will be back soon!

54.description: This place is good when it's good, but really bad when it's bad. The service has been great each time, but the food is incredibly hit or miss. But $6 for a beer, shot, and a taco is a deal that can't be beat! It's worth a try if you're in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't travel specifically to dine here.

48.description: Just went here tonight. Holy shit, the burger was so delicious. Going back on Tuesday for the special. Nomnomnom

44.description: Great selection of gourmet tacos! Go here if you don't want to deal with Five Star. Great drink/taco deals and you won't have to wait an hour to be seated.

24.description: TLDR: okay tacos (2.5/5 stars), BAD BAD BAD service (1/5 stars), very loud music (1/5 stars)I was in the mood for taco tuesday and apparently they have a pretty sweet $2 taco special and $2 draft beers.  So we get there and we're one of the few people there (4 other patrons).  So here is the play by play:0:00 min -  we are seated, I immediately order 3 tacos (kale and grits, roasted beets, and grilled sweet potato) and a friend orders another 2 (pastor and roasted beets).2:00  min - waitress walks over to the cashier and seemingly pushes stuff into the system.. la la la.. 10:00 min - waitress comes back and asks for our order again. WHAT?? you haven't even put them in yet?? 35:00 min - i asked the waitress if they're coming out soon.. oh, turns out they haven't made them yet and OH, we're out of the ingredients to make your taco. would you like to get another one?  UH NO, i haven't even received the first order yet!  the waitress blames the computer printing system for not printing out the order and she assumed the kitchen was slow because they usually are.. but she'll make sure they're being made now.40:00 min -another worker comes over to see if we need anything. i tell them we've been waiting 40 minutes for some tacos..45:00 min - we finally get our tacos. all 4 of them.. after 45 minutes. NOTE, from the time the waitress actually made sure they're being made to us receiving them was only 10 minutes.SOOOO.. what about the tacos? they were good but very simple.  Each taco really only had the stated ingredient plus some pieces of lettuce.  I had to dress them up with hot sauce to bring out more flavor.  They ended up comping the entire bill (ok, they better for $2 dollar tacos) but would I go there to wait almost an hour to get 2 tacos? HELL NO!Also, the environment is of a typical divey bar but they play REALLY REALLY REALLY loud music (mainly rock and country). As there were only 4 other people there, it was surprisingly really hard to hear anyone else in my party.  We had to move closer to the outside porch so the sound would be drowned out.

7.description: Bullhead Cantina was a very good spur of the moment Sunday dinner decision.  (Sunday was also $5 margaritas; they also have a big whiskey list). I tried the steak, pastor, tilapia and grits & kale tacos. Yes - that is right - a grits and kale taco. While normally I don't go crazy for veggie tacos and it seemed like an odd choice, this one was delicious and full of flavor. I also really liked the fish and steak tacos.  The pastor was very good don't get me wrong, but I would probably try some of their other tacos (more creative, less traditional tacos).  I had a taste of the southern fried chicken taco and it was very different and tasty.The food was tasty and very reasonably priced.  All of their tacos are $3 and the drinks didn't seem to break the bank (good specials too). It is Cash Only (ATM inside). The other plus is that we were able to grab a table right away.

49.description: First time here last night , absolutely loved it , pomegranate margarita was on point ,5$ Fridays love it...tried the burger n fries yummy n not bad at 7$..carnitas n steak tacos were delicious.. The waitress was super friendly even gaved me my drink on the house for  bein my birthday :) ...love this place,can't wait to come back n sample their other drinks and tacos

40.description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots. You can't beat the $5 shot and beer combo and the delicious $3 tacos - unless you're there on a "Wacky Wednesday" in which case it's 2 for $5 tacos. The tacos are not your regular Mexican fare. They get creative. The veggie options include a sweet potato one, spicy avocado (and it IS spicy), a kale one and a portobello mushroom. All are tasty, but my personal favorites are the sweet potato and avocado. I usually have those two tacos and order the fresh guac, which is some of the best I've had in the city. The guac is not too salty and very flavorful. You can tell it's fresh.The margaritas are also good and not the typical margaritas. You can get a pomegranate marg or a smoky version and they also have a more classic version. They compliment the food quite nicely so if you're into margaritas, try at least one (if not all) with your meal. If you're feelin really frisky, get the shot and beer combo as well!The staff is always very friendly and patient. It's hard picking which taco you want! The space can get pretty full but I usually never have to wait for a table. You can also sit at the bar. It is CASH ONLY. So arm yourself with cash or hit up the ATM inside. That's why they get 4 (1/2) stars from me. Cash only drives me (and probably most people) crazy! Go plastic, baby! Otherwise a great place to have dinner and drinks!

53.description: Love this place... Best tacos and whiskey selection around. Very solid cocktails. Good atmosphere. Cash only but there's an ATM.

30.description: I am definitely satisfied with all the food and drinks I've had at Bullhead.  I came here initially on the suggestion of a coworker and we both really enjoyed ourselves.  He had had the food before so he knew what he was in for, but I didn't know what to expect.  I'll be honest: I was a little wary of a hipster taco joint in this neighborhood since I detest Big Star, but Bullhead Cantina was spot on.  The menu is small, but the tacos are excellent.  The spicy ones are SPICY, so beware, but they're pretty good.  The beet taco is THE BEST so get several.  I was also happy with the fried chicken and sweet potato, but that beet one is the best.Beer is cheap, whisky shots are cheap, and there's pretty good service at the tables.  ATM in the back since this establishment is cash only (which is kind of annoying) but you can at least get some money if you need it.I've been here a few times since my first visit and I'm always happy with the tacos I order.  They don't change, they're always tasty, the service is always fine, and there's never too many people here.  Good times in my mind.  Wifi is free, also, just ask for a password.

46.description: Food was great and service was excellent! We tried several of the tacos: sweet potato,  southern chicken, BBQ pulled pork,  and brisket. $2 taco Tuesday is a great deal and it was within walking distance of the apartment I was staying at.

1.description: Went there recently and the tacos were awesome!  What makes this place better than most taco places is you can order one taco at a time and try various ones.  I had the brisket, kale & grits and avocado.  All 3 were awesome but the brisket and kale were amazing and the avocado was just okay.  I highly recommend them and I will absolutely go back.PS - I'm gluten free and they were very accommodating for me.  I believe the owner said the first time we were there a few years ago is gluten free and understands Update:  since this review I've been back like 5+ times and there tacos are amazing!  My favorite 3 are the hanger steak, pulled BBQ pork and kale & grits.  I could eat these 3 nights a week.

55.description: The food quality to price ratio here is pretty awesome. Went early on a Friday night, snagged a table on the patio. Bonus that drinks were on special for $5, in addition to the already cheap taco prices. Definitely a win-win in my books... walked away with tip & tax for less than some BYOB places. Oh, and the spicy avocado taco! Yes! Will return.

9.description: GREAT patio. Cash only. Cocktails are strong and the tacos are cheap. I really liked the pastor (how can you go wrong with that one though?) and hanger steak tacos. I didn't like the portobello. My vegetarian friend loved the beets and avocado tacos. They have a lot of vegetarian options.

26.description: One of my favorite places in Humboldt Park. Everything is fair priced and the tacos are great. Can't beat the "No Bullshit Special": Taco, Shot, and Tall Boy for $6Cash only!

25.description: Great corner spot. Cash only and good drinks. The tortillas are exceptional and the carnitas tacos are really good.Fair price and very friendly Owner.

12.description: We went in here on our 2nd chicago trip on the wednesday before riot fest and we absolutely loved this place, service was superb and the menu options looked and smelled great, too bad we allready ate so we just drank some cocktails but those did the trick.Minus one star for our return trip on the very busy 1st day of riot fest (the bullhead is next to the park), we got a spot but left after waiting more than ten minutes with staff ignoring us even after we asked to be served. I am def. sure that this was only during this weekend and would love to give them a second chance if we ever end up in chicago again.

59.description: Pama luna margarita is very choice when it comes to drink options. They have a very delicious variety to their taco bar. Highly recommend the pastor and beer grilled chicken. Great place for a low key night.

21.description: We keep wanting this place to work. The food is decent, however, the service and drinks just don't cut it! The drinks are weak and overly sweet, which is not my style. Last time we went (for the 3rd time), the service was horrible! We waited at least 10 minutes for every step of the process...the place just doesn't seem to have it together.

17.description: Bullhead Cantina, I have so many good things to say about this place. I live in Humboldt Park and this place truly is a neighborhood gem.First off, the food is awesome! Hands down, my favorite chips and salsa. You can tell everything is freshly made. The tacos are creative and absolutely delicious. My favorites are the hanger steak, the brisket, and the pastor. But there are quite a few to choose from, including vegetarian options. And they all have unique toppings and sauces.The drinks here are also good as well. I would recommend either the smoked margarita or my personal fave the Humboldt Hillbilly, which is your choice of flavored moonshine and ginger beer. They also have a great selection of beers to choose from, on tap, canned, or bottled.The service is here is on point! So friendly and very helpful if you have any questions. They treat you like a regular here. Inside, the place is very cozy and cute. There's old beer memorabilia and old coke refrigerators. Finally, the best part about this place is the price. You can't beat some of the specials they have. Obviously the $6 taco, shot, and tall boy (everyday!), but almost every night they have something going on. Even without the specials, the place is really well priced for what you get. Overall, Bullhead Cantina is quickly becoming my favorite go-to place. It's cool, it's cheap, and it's delicious. What else can you ask for?!

10.description: This is the best place in Chicago that I have been to that has several vegetarian tacos options that are all super delicious!

5.description: 5 stars for the drinks and beers1 star for tacosGranted I was here on $2 taco night, but from what I was told they are the same tacos that are on the menu every other night.Regardless, the tacos were not good in the slightest bit. The sweet potato tacos were sweet potato french fries, which came semi under fried. The portobello mushroom tacos had some greasy substance dripping off of it, and the beet tacos were suspiciously hard. Who can complain about $2 two brothers draft among other crafts tho?!Will return for drinks but I will definitely dine elsewhere for food

3.description: YES! YES! YES!  I heart that they always have specials and besides their specials their Margaritas are pretty legit AND their food:  mouthwatering. I can honestly say I didn't know what to expect BUT i left wanting to come back for more a few hours later.... Effin Yeah Bullhead Cantina!

35.description: This place is really great. Amazing guacamole, delicious tacos, not packed like sardines while waiting for good food. If you are sick of waiting at places that rhyme with schmig schmar or schmantique schmaco, take a walk to Humboldt Park instead. Bonus that it's across from the actual park, you can go for a stroll in some "city nature" after you eat or take it to go for a picnic instead. Down to the nitty gritty (pun intended): The grits and kale taco is to die for and I love the spicy avocado taco. Grits and kale comes with a bourbon pineapple glaze/sauce hybrid that adds a nice sweetness that I happen to love in my tacos. The mushroom and sweet potato tacos were acceptable, but wouldn't be my first choice. Really a great place for vegetarians, they have five taco options that are meat free. I'm telling you to go here if you're sick of waiting for food elsewhere but really, come here anyway, wait or no. The food here is much better than other popular taco joints that keep making "best of" lists. Last tip - cash only but they have an ATM.

19.description: This place is really great. Amazing guacamole, delicious tacos, not packed like sardines while waiting for good food. If you are sick of waiting at places that rhyme with schmig schmar or schmantique schmaco, take a walk to Humboldt Park instead. Bonus that it's across from the actual park, you can go for a stroll in some "city nature" after you eat or take it to go for a picnic instead. Down to the nitty gritty (pun intended): The grits and kale taco is to die for and I love the spicy avocado taco. Grits and kale comes with a bourbon pineapple glaze/sauce hybrid that adds a nice sweetness that I happen to love in my tacos. The mushroom and sweet potato tacos were acceptable, but wouldn't be my first choice. Really a great place for vegetarians, they have five taco options that are meat free. I'm telling you to go here if you're sick of waiting for food elsewhere but really, come here anyway, wait or no. The food here is much better than other popular taco joints that keep making "best of" lists. Last tip - cash only but they have an ATM.

28.description: Bullhead Cantina was a very good spur of the moment Sunday dinner decision.  (Sunday was also $5 margaritas; they also have a big whiskey list). I tried the steak, pastor, tilapia and grits & kale tacos. Yes - that is right - a grits and kale taco. While normally I don't go crazy for veggie tacos and it seemed like an odd choice, this one was delicious and full of flavor. I also really liked the fish and steak tacos.  The pastor was very good don't get me wrong, but I would probably try some of their other tacos (more creative, less traditional tacos).  I had a taste of the southern fried chicken taco and it was very different and tasty.The food was tasty and very reasonably priced.  All of their tacos are $3 and the drinks didn't seem to break the bank (good specials too). It is Cash Only (ATM inside). The other plus is that we were able to grab a table right away.

45.description: Bullhead exceeded my expectations.What I expected was a run of the mill "cantina" run by gringos.We received some very good tacos along with the shot n' a beer special for the night. The tacos were good, and after a few I was definitely satisfied. The specials were cheap enough to partake in more than one.Go.

33.description: Amazing food. The tacos are simple and delicious and the guacamole is made in house. The house margaritas are a perfect compliment to the food. Most of the tables are bar tables so the seats can get a little uncomfortable after a while. They have outdoor seating in the summer, which is always a bonus. It's cash only, but they have an ATM in case you blank.

43.description: We went in here on our 2nd chicago trip on the wednesday before riot fest and we absolutely loved this place, service was superb and the menu options looked and smelled great, too bad we allready ate so we just drank some cocktails but those did the trick.Minus one star for our return trip on the very busy 1st day of riot fest (the bullhead is next to the park), we got a spot but left after waiting more than ten minutes with staff ignoring us even after we asked to be served. I am def. sure that this was only during this weekend and would love to give them a second chance if we ever end up in chicago again.

2.description: The bf and I came here on a Tues night for $2 tacos and $2draft beers.  We ordered the 2 of each: brisket, hanger steak, fried chicken, and bbq pork tacos.  The hanger steak was the best one and the fried chicken  was my least favorite one. The server was friendly and attentive. FYI, this place is cash only and they do not charge tax on the sub total.The ambience is really dark and loud inside.

18.description: Best tacos in the city, better than Big Star. Best for me:1. Spicy avocado2. Pulled Pork3. Beer Grilled Chicken4. Grilled Sweet PotatoAll tacos are $3. Bartender/staff are friendly/cool.Handy to remember it's cash-only but they do have an ATM.

41.description: The kale and grits taco is fabulous! I have been craving it ever since I tried it for the first time last week. I took one star away for the noise level which I don't like. It is very loud but I guess that is to be expected in a bar type atmosphere. I also wish it was open later. It seems to close very early even on a Saturday.

52.description: Go to this place of you want to get drunk, full (of yummy tacos), and feel like you did it all for less than $20. Because that was our tab, $17 each, for 6 tacos, 2 orders of chips and salsa, 2 bloody Mary's, 2 tall boys and 2 shots of bourbon. Whaaaat? Brisket taco was my fave. My only complaint about this place was I felt like the chicken in my chicken taco was that weird, processed fake chicken breast that you get in airport food and certain chain restaurants that I absolutely despise. So avoiding the chicken, I will be here a lot. It's too cheap not to go! Also I was reading some earlier reviews about a bad beer list. I assure you they have an extensive beer menu and interesting selections. So just go already!

50.description: Here's their EVERYDAY special = PBR Tallboy + Shot of Whiskey + Taco for $6. Why are you still reading this review? Just go. My friends and I tried every taco on the menu and encountered no disappointments. As long as that special is still on, I will definitively be coming back.

4.description: There are bars in Humboldt Park! Woot.Great place to stop by after an intramural game. Good specials, including tacos and margs

6.description: TLDR: okay tacos (2.5/5 stars), BAD BAD BAD service (1/5 stars), very loud music (1/5 stars)I was in the mood for taco tuesday and apparently they have a pretty sweet $2 taco special and $2 draft beers.  So we get there and we're one of the few people there (4 other patrons).  So here is the play by play:0:00 min -  we are seated, I immediately order 3 tacos (kale and grits, roasted beets, and grilled sweet potato) and a friend orders another 2 (pastor and roasted beets).2:00  min - waitress walks over to the cashier and seemingly pushes stuff into the system.. la la la.. 10:00 min - waitress comes back and asks for our order again. WHAT?? you haven't even put them in yet?? 35:00 min - i asked the waitress if they're coming out soon.. oh, turns out they haven't made them yet and OH, we're out of the ingredients to make your taco. would you like to get another one?  UH NO, i haven't even received the first order yet!  the waitress blames the computer printing system for not printing out the order and she assumed the kitchen was slow because they usually are.. but she'll make sure they're being made now.40:00 min -another worker comes over to see if we need anything. i tell them we've been waiting 40 minutes for some tacos..45:00 min - we finally get our tacos. all 4 of them.. after 45 minutes. NOTE, from the time the waitress actually made sure they're being made to us receiving them was only 10 minutes.SOOOO.. what about the tacos? they were good but very simple.  Each taco really only had the stated ingredient plus some pieces of lettuce.  I had to dress them up with hot sauce to bring out more flavor.  They ended up comping the entire bill (ok, they better for $2 dollar tacos) but would I go there to wait almost an hour to get 2 tacos? HELL NO!Also, the environment is of a typical divey bar but they play REALLY REALLY REALLY loud music (mainly rock and country). As there were only 4 other people there, it was surprisingly really hard to hear anyone else in my party.  We had to move closer to the outside porch so the sound would be drowned out.

22.description: Reasonable prices for tacos and drinks, plus close to Garfield Park Conservatory.

15.description: Grub hubbed from here recently, we got the southern fried chicken tacos, grilled hanger steak taco, beer grilled chicken taco, grilled sweet potato taco w/chips, salsa and guacamole.  All arrived fast and no complaints about any of the things we ate.  Will have to check out the restaurant at some point and see how it compares.  From the looks of the other reviewers, seems like I'll be in for a good time and a full belly :)

57.description: Amazing tacos, great service, delicious margaritas. And it tastes the same every single time you go there. Their service is seamless. Highly recommended!

20.description: Love the Special but.....shady bartender who I had to ask for the itemized receipt. Sketchy math.  Don't trust this place.

36.description: Bullhead Cantina, I have so many good things to say about this place. I live in Humboldt Park and this place truly is a neighborhood gem.First off, the food is awesome! Hands down, my favorite chips and salsa. You can tell everything is freshly made. The tacos are creative and absolutely delicious. My favorites are the hanger steak, the brisket, and the pastor. But there are quite a few to choose from, including vegetarian options. And they all have unique toppings and sauces.The drinks here are also good as well. I would recommend either the smoked margarita or my personal fave the Humboldt Hillbilly, which is your choice of flavored moonshine and ginger beer. They also have a great selection of beers to choose from, on tap, canned, or bottled.The service is here is on point! So friendly and very helpful if you have any questions. They treat you like a regular here. Inside, the place is very cozy and cute. There's old beer memorabilia and old coke refrigerators. Finally, the best part about this place is the price. You can't beat some of the specials they have. Obviously the $6 taco, shot, and tall boy (everyday!), but almost every night they have something going on. Even without the specials, the place is really well priced for what you get. Overall, Bullhead Cantina is quickly becoming my favorite go-to place. It's cool, it's cheap, and it's delicious. What else can you ask for?!

14.description: I've had friends tell me about Bullhead for quite a while now but I just hadn't made my way over until last weekend, Sunday to be exact, and I can't believe I waited so long.  This place was phenomenal!My moms drives out from the 'burbs for some mother-daughter quality time and that time always involves taking her out for lunch and drinks.  The moms loves Mexican food just as I love a tasty taco so, Bullhead it was...We drove over, parking was super easy, and popped in shortly after 12:00 pm.  Only one other table was occupied, it was a great time to sit down.  My moms and I both ordered a margarita, which are only $5 on Sundays.  My mom got the smoked margarita and I was a little nervous because not everyone appreciates the smokey Mezcal but she loved it.  I ordered the pomegranate margarita and it was divine!  We also ordered chips, salsa, and guacamole.  All of which are worth making a trip to Bullhead for on their own...tasty cocktails and even tastier chips, salsa, and guacamole.  What's not to love?As we sipped on our cocktails, we perused the taco list, all of which sounded delicious.  My mom went with the spicy Avocado taco and the Fried Chicken taco.  I went with Pastor and Carnitas. I tried a bite of the spicy avocado was so tasty and unexpected.  I didn't think an avocado taco would have much going on other than sliced avocado chillin inside of a fresh tortilla but I was wrong.  I highly recommend it.  The fried chicken was super tasty too.  The chicken was tender, the breading was crispy and it all worked really well in the taco.  The pastor was amazing! I don't like a lot of pineapple and they only put a healthy little chunk in mine.  The carnitas was delicious too.  I know, i know, I'm not really describing the guts of each taco very well but they were all so good that I feel you simply must go and taste these big guys yourselves.  The tacos are stuffed full, the tortillas are perfect, and each bite feels like you've just painted your very own happy little tree (obligatory Bob Ross reference).  I HIGHLY recommend Bullhead Cantina.  Our server was an absolute peach, the guy in the back was working his ass off as it started to get busy just as we were wrapping up and I took the last few sips of my second 'rita (this girl was tequila happy and taco drunk).I can't wait to come back!

3.description: If you don't want your nails to look like a five year old did them, then don't go here! I walked in requesting a soak off. Instead, they yanked my nails off (something I could've done at home if I wanted to be in pain) but whatever, it was already late so i couldnt go somewhere else. I decided to get a gel overlay because my nails were so thin. The overlay wasn't bad, but the clumpy, cheap nail polish was horrible & didn't look any better on my nails. Ugh, never again.

1.description: Only because i had to give atleast one star! Went here as this is one of the only places I can barely catch open when i get off work. The nail tech at the front door was EXTREMELYYYYYY RUDE!!!! She got an attitude with me after i told her she was burning me with the drill after about the fifth time. I told her if she was in a rush she did not have to do them and she said "FINE!!!"

2.description: My Baby get all the big girl love her

5.description: 4 stars for the eyebrow wax.-3 stars for cleanliness.  I may change my rating if I ever get my nails done here...

6.description: I was hopeful because this place is right outside my door - but I suggest you save your money for a bus ride to someplace less creepy.It isn't particularly clean and seeing the rather dingy stations I decided just to get a polish change instead of a full on mani-pedi -- this sort of strange old man did my finger and toe polish change and even that made me a little nervous - the results were pretty sloppy and the whole atmosphere just made me cringe. The guy did some cuticle work on my hands that was seriously suspect.

7.description: Magic touch is inexpensive and close to my house. I do wish that their spa was cleaner, though I've never have had a problem directly with getting infections or fungus from their tools.  I wish their nailpolish was better quality it can chip easily if you are not careful.

0.description: NEVER go on a weekend. Go early as possible.Ghetto... is all I have to say. Prices are standard.I've been going here for yeeeeeeaaaarrrssssss, Tanyia is the owner. She isn't always there so I usually call. I don't like anyone else doing my eye brows... if Tanyia isn't around and I'm desperate, her daughter Christine is my next option. Anyone else, don't come near me.

4.description: My friend introduced me to this place a few years ago.  It's close to where I live and therefore I've given this place a shot a few times.  The thing is, they're really inconsistent.  This is the reason why my friend starts going to other salons, but she usually comes back.Things I don't care for about this salon:1 - The smell!2 - The attitude3 - The fact that they feel the need to ask me a few times if I'm getting my eyebrows done.....they ask everyone, but damn, quit making me feel like my eyebrows look jacked!4 - The shitty parking lot it's located inIf you go, go to Steven...at least if you're going to do pink-and-whites.  There is also one lady who's horrible, but I always forget who it is until I see her.  The plus is that their manicures are pretty inexpensive.  I've paid $25-$30 for french tips and my friend paid $45 for pink-and-whites and a pedicure.  You just really have to know who to go to and who to avoid.Oh, and this place is located in a little strip mall like area in Humboldt Park, keep that in mind.  Frequently there are children in the salon who feel the need to leave an item of theirs on every chair or run around.  Sometimes the parents stop them, sometimes they don't.  If you can't handle children then this might not be the best place, or you definitely need to go early.  I've also had fun conversations with obvious regulars.  It's an alright place, nothing to go out of your way for, but also not a place to run from screaming.

3.description: Stay away from L&L Appliance Mart!  I will never give them my business again.  I was sold a coin operated washer/dryer set for which I can't find parts anymore because it's over 25-years-old.  I didn't realize how old the set was until I had it serviced by another company.  L&L sold me the set for $600.  These hunks of worthless metal aren't worth $25 at the scrap yard.  Also stay away from their Montrose and Lawrence locations...it's the same people.

1.description: Will not stand by their work. Will not warranty their products.  Will sell you used items that are infested with roaches causing tenants in your investment property to hate you.  Do not use these people. They will hang up on you and do nothing to help you. Then they will not answer your calls from any number you have called previously.

2.description: I am a property manager and have used L&L several times after being referred by a fellow property manager - they are a lifesaver!  Whenever I need to replace an appliance (and I have now used them for ranges, dishwashers, washer/dryer, and refrigerator) they always have it in stock and available for delivery within days.  They also do installation and they will remove the old appliance.  Everything I have bought from them has worked great.  Overall thumbs up for Moishe, Adam, and the team at L&L.

5.description: I was referred to here by a contractor buddy. Know what you're looking for in advance and have a dollar range in mind by checking online first. I bought a brand new Kenmore Elite H/E Front Loader Washing Machine with a few scratches and dings. It was brand new with a warranty and I paid about 40% less than new. My contractor buddy bought a subzero stainless fridge for 60% less than a appliance place was selling it for. They specialize in scratch and dents so be aware. It's a very rough block in Humboldt Park and it's like walking into Fort Knox. I grabbed a guy from A/A next door and he helped me deliver it. I would go back, no doubt. Shop online first, haggle when you get there, you'll get great deals!

6.description: rip off stay away scam artist all L&L appliances in chicago are run by the same people they will rip you off especially if you are elderly please don't give them your business i had a broke dryer they came out and fixed one problem and then broke something else on the dryer and wouldn't fix it without another service call which is another 65.00 plus part so you see what i mean by scam and because my parents are so old they allowed this guy to walk out without fixing the item "HE" "THE REPAIR GUY" broke and i had no control over the situation so (PLEASE STAY AWAY )!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I GIVE THEM NO STARS

0.description: Leaving my beautiful front-loading washer and dryer behind when I moved was tough.  I decided to be frugal and buy a used set, and I got a stacked washer/dryer for $550 at L & L.  They delivered it on time.   It was scratched, dented, had some lint inside.  But it worked fine for some 4 months.  Then the dryer set on fire.  Entire 2nd floor was filled with black smoke so thick I could not even see, fortunately I acted fast and put it out with a fire extinguisher, burning my hand in the process as the handle had melted off, and then the fire dept came as neighbors saw smoke billowing out of the windows.  My load of laundry was incinerated and now it permanently reeks of burnt polyester in here.  So I will be back to L & L soon this week to buy a new set!!!  This time I will buy a better quality dryer and be very careful using it, lest my house burn down.

4.description: I been buying stuff at L and L for about 10 years now and I have decided to never use them again.  It seems each year they get worse and their appliances never work and it can take weeks sometime to get a repair guy over.  Most recently I bought a washer and dryer set and they dryer that they brought over did not work on day one.  They said they were going to bring over a repair guy for a most recently purchase dryer and I waited over a week for him to show up.  In addition, I bought two refrigerators over the years and both had cock roaches.  The first time I thought maybe it was a flute so I made the mistake and bought another one a couple years later and the second one had roaches as well.  I spend more money paying terminex then I did buying the refrigerators.  Never again will they get my business.
