1.description: If Walgreens were a guy it'd be the my childhood sweetheart.  I love Walgreens and grew up where the HQ is located, so I have a special spot in my heart for them.  However, it hurts to not give them 5 stars.  I have no problem finding anything in the store, I know the place like the back of my hand.  Although it was slightly painful to not even have the place open to 12, in fact this place closed at 10pm!!!!  Is that possible?  In my world Walgreens is open 24-hours.  Also, I got a bit of a rude attitude from the employees there.  I walked in 10 minutes before they closed and I was almost kicked out of the store.  Ha, that WAS NOT going to happen.  I only wanted heated knee bandages.So, really, unless you get here with more than an hour to spare I would suggest scurry on over to CVS.

0.description: this Walgreens is only so-so. every time i go in there is inevitably someone outside peddling bootlegged dvd's, cd's, or socks. or they stand out there with their hand out.prices on household goods (such as laundry detergent or Swiffer refills) are higher than the Wal-mary down the street. seems like cold food is more expensive as well.they have a Chase ATM which is great, but expect to be in line a while if it's the first of the month.pharmacy is ok, but because they are open 24 hours & they have a drive through there can be miscommunication.calling the meds in or getting something adjusted is a pain.

28.description: This is definitely the best place I've ever been to to get a manicure and pedicure. Their customer service is really awesome and the owners are very nice! It's definitley beats any other place along North Avenue to get your nails done and it surely rivals any classy salon you'd find in Lincoln Park and Wicker Park.  I will definitely be going back to get the Royal Treatment for my nails!  The nail tech Maria is a total sweetheart and she does a good job!    Also, the spa is very clean and well kept and and I liked that alot!

1.description: Migdalia's salon, is comfortable and homey.  It is clean, and everyone there treats you with respect.  The coffee is a nice touch.  Last time I went there Migdalia was able to move another customer so that I could get in that Saturday.  I was especially thankful as we were traveling for the holidays the next day. So this is my shout out to her!  As far as my stylist goes, really sweet, but she just didn't seem to get my hair...gave her a second chance, still not happy.  Really wanted to like this place.  Will make the extra drive for someone who knows my hair.

9.description: Absolutely love the way my hair came out always satisfied with the results!!  Migdalia is always so nice and makes you feel very welcome

29.description: a good friend of mine was totally bummed when she found out that her wedding pictures sucked. really sucked. what do you do when your wedding pictures suck? take them again, of course! the good part is that its another reason to wear your wedding dress, which would otherwise rot in a closet for the rest of your life. the bad part is reconstructing how awesome you looked on your wedding day.  for my friend, this meant getting her hairs and nails redone. i don't know how she found migdalia's carribean spa. she said she was googling places in chicago sort of near our area that did french tips. i'm not too up on manipedi lingo, but don't most places do fake nails? i digress.i wasn't sure what to expect going into the place, but what i found was a nice, clean salon with really friendly staff. i'm used a very wham-bam approach to getting my nails done, with minimal conversation from the manicurist other than "what color?" and "what shape?", so i was pleasantly surprised to find that mine was really chatty. we talked about her daughter and my sister's troubles with cps and she advised me never to get married. as for my nails... saturday to wednesday (today)... they are looking a little rough, but hey. beauty fades. quality chat with your manicurist is forever.

23.description: Love this place! I always get the best service and the facial technician is amazing and really knows her stuff!! I will always return here for my facials!!

5.description: I've been going to Migdalia's for a few months now and I absolutely love it. My stylist is Suyi and she does a great job every time. I'm usually in and out in a little over an hour which is unheard of! The salon is clean and bright and they always have upbeat music playing. Migdalia is always in the salon taking care of things and she knows her customers and greets everyone which I find to be a nice touch for any small business. Definitely worth checking out!

31.description: A few friends and I went here today to get our nails done. Two of us got pedicures while the other got a manicure. The staff was super friendly and nice. The pedicure massage chairs were really comfy and awesome. My pedicure overall was great.However, I had a purple color and a glitter applied to my toe nails and a few hours later I noticed that 3 of my nails had smudged and are ruined. I'm the only one out of the three of us with smudged nails. I'm not sure what brand nail polish they used. I really wish that they had a wall of nail colors to choose from and had OPI available.

25.description: Really, Really, upset with this place. I left from there crying!!! It took me a year for my hair to grow.  I decided to give place a try after reading some reviews on yelp. I specifically told the lady to cut my hair in layers to it give volume. I let her do her job, when she was done my hair was really short from the bottom part. It looked like it was just chopped off. After a year of growing my hair it was gone in a matter of minutes. I asked to speak to the manager and said she would try her best to fix the problem. The best option was to go shorter to fix the first mistake. I guess this place is hit or miss based on the positive reviews. Please be cautious if you plan on visiting this place.

12.description: After spending 3 hours on yelp doing my research (obsessive, I know!) on the closest places to my apartment that offer good cheap waxing services, I made a decision to go to Migdalia's on Kedzie & North(Just to the right of the BP gas station).  The reviews on here are hit or miss, but it depends on what it is that you're looking for.Well for my first visit today I came in to get an eyebrow and upper lip wax, and was sent to Magali to do it.  She's this sweet Ecuadorian lady who's dominant language is Spanish, so I spoke to her in Spanish the whole time.  She asked throughout to make sure the wax wasn't too hot, and my eyebrows turned out perfectly! They were cleaned out, just what I needed because she clearly understands that they shouldn't be too thin!  I had about 3 hairs to pluck out when I got home, but I much prefer it that way because that just means that they were super careful and didn't want to over re-touch it.  The eyebrow wax is $15, the upper lip-- $5, and I tipped her $3.  I will definitely be returning for other services they have! They are very welcoming and the owner, Migdalia makes an effort to get to know you by your name and make sure you are well taken care of.  Definitely a go-to spot in the Humboldt Park neighborhood!

21.description: I love going to Migdalia's everyone here is always nice and friendly. When you walk in you get welcomed not just a simple hi. Levy is the one I always see and she does a wonderful job with my hair.

16.description: had my lash extensions today!! So beautiful..they look and feel natural - great service! I am very happy with my investment into myself! Can't beat the price!

17.description: All this salon cares about is money, its not about quality. Never again.

10.description: Yessssss Levy did my hair justice!!!!! I was initially scared about coming here because I am an African American woman with natural hair. I spoke with Migdalina who assured me that they were capable of taming this thick course hair of mine. Boy was she right!!! My hair was straight, looked, and felt amazing when Levy was done. It was a ton a heat but worth the visit. I can't wait to make another appointment (of course after I give my hair time to recover)!!!!

11.description: I've been going to Migdalia's for the last 3 years and I have never been disappointed. From the moment you walk in, you feel like you're visiting family. From the hug as they greet you walking in, to the cup of coffee they offer you, it is truly a welcoming atmosphere. The only stylist I've worked with is Maria, and she is amazing!!! Prices can be a little high, but I think it's so worth it.

26.description: A friend of mine highly recommended Maria. I walked in and the owner greeted me with a smile and kiss, everyone there was so friendly. I was offered something to drink and asked if I was comfortable. I value costumer service.  My appointment was at 3:30 ( I'm a stickler for being on time for my appointments) I waited 20 minutes. Maria washed my hair made small talk and asked what I wanted. I explain and she gave her suggestions, which I appreciated so much, after all I'm not the professional. She asked if I wanted a blow out and after hearing the price ($30) I decided no. When she was done with the cut I was very skeptical about her work, she had cut alot, I then decided that I did want her to blow dry and style my hair. She then said that she had  client and I would have to wait 20 minutes. So between starting my cut and finishing she had another client line up and couldn't stay with me another 20 minutes despite making me wait 20 minutes. I didn't appreciate that so much. Overall I did LOVE my hair cut, I would defiantly recommend and be returning to Maria.

27.description: I visited this place twice and was disappointed both times. The first time I went in for a fill-in, the lady was really nice but her work was really bad. She suggested I get a acrylic fill-in with a gel finish (I was confused but she said it was cheaper). I arrived at 1pm and specified I needed to be done no later than 2:15pm (more than enough time for a fill-in) she assured me she would be done. She worked at a turtles pace and I kept reminding her that I needed to be done by 2:15 so I can pick my kids up at school. It was 2:00 and she was barely done. I had to get someone else to get my kids and by the time she was done it was nearly 3pm and the nails look horrible uneven and bumpy.The 2nd time I visited this location was about a year later. I went back because I ran into the owner ( nice lady) and I explained what happened and she assured me that I will get better service. I went in there with my newborn daughter and wanted her to get her ears pierced. The ladies there were very nice and assured that they can pierce her ears with no problems. The lady marked her ears and pierced the 1st no problem  but when she did the 2nd ear she missed the mark and asked if she can redo I was a little hesitant but my daughter was calm so I let her. She tried again and missed again she tried to say the baby moved but she didn't I was very surprised how calm and still she was. She asked if she can try again but before I could respond my mom grabbed my daughter and walked out. They never apologized and blamed a newborn for their error as well as charge me for the full piercing. I never returned and have told everyone I know to never visit.

0.description: After reading several reviews about Midgalina's I decided I would let them put the Keratin treatment in my hair. I am African American and was a little skeptical at first about going to a Dominican salon. I'm so happy I did. Suyi did my treatment, and did a wonderful job! My hair has shine and is so straight and silky. We weren't able to communicate much because of the language barrier, but she knew exactly what to do and how to do it. She's fast and very through. I definitely recommend this salon!Danita

20.description: I absolutely love this place!  I have big curly hair and this place knows how to tame the mane! Maria and Levy are my main ladies but you can't go wrong with anyone there. Migdalia understands "ethnic" hair , so she makes sure her staff can handle anything that comes their way. This is definitely a one stop shop, you can get your hair, nails, eyebrows, facials, and all sorts of other things done here. On top of being so great, Migdalia is also very reasonably priced.I have been coming here for years and they have always been great.

19.description: I came to Migdalia's for a no-chip manicure based on the positive reviews and it's location. When I first came into the salon they were playing a hip-hop station, which is fine by me, but it quickly switched to Hispanic pop music, which I should have seen coming as this is a Humboldt Park nail salon. They don't have any TVs or even magazines so I was completely and utterly bored throughout the manicure. They only have about 20 colors available for no-chip, most of them variations of pink or purple. The woman who did my nails also could not speak English, which is usually fine by me but as I said, I was very bored. She did a great job on my nails and had they lasted longer than a week this would have been a 3 or 4 star review. Less than a week later my thumb nail's polish pealed off, I mean half the nail just came off. A few days later my other nails started chipping. Also, I called ahead and asked for pricing and they said their no-chip was $30, but I was charged $35. The pedicure chairs looked great and comfy, and the hair stylists seemed to do a good job on their clients. This is just not a place to get no-chip.

33.description: Migdalia's Carribean Spa is wonderful everyone is so nice the spa looks beautiful my nail artist Yara is gifted no one can do nail art like she can. The owner, Migdalia is wonderful she greets you when you enter the spa makes sure you are comfortable. All the employees there are gifted. Everyone is truly skilled in their craft from hair to nails to eye brows they just know how to do everything to perfection and everyone dresses so wonderful I love this place if perfection is what you are looking for in a Spa then you have to go here :)

2.description: I regret not finding Migdalia's sooner! I started getting blowouts for my natural hair with Suyi in July and she does a fantastic job! She's fast, thorough, and makes my hair look and feel glorious. I no longer live in Chicago, but I will schedule an appointment with Suyi whenever I'm in town.

34.description: I've been going to Migdalias for over a year already and just yesterday I got my hair highlighted and was satisfied with the stylist choice of colors....I didn't know how I wanted my hair, but they helped choose a color that was suitable for me. Migdalia is an outstanding host she has always shown attentive care and made my visits the best experience I have encountered. I highly recommend this salon....the staff is great and the atmosphere is a great place to spend a day of pure pampering

32.description: Really amazing service all around. My husband and I came here for pedicures and haircuts and we were not disappointed. First of all, it is very clean and trendy in here. Don't let the Humboldt Park address fool you. Everyone is super friendly and Migdalia, the owner is always asking how things are, if we're being taken care of. It's so different than the typical spa. But the real kicker is the pedicure. You know how you usually get your toes touched  here and there a little, they put your feet on a hot stone and you're supposed to be experiencing this wonderful relaxing sensation...uh, no. THIS is the real deal. This is pure and consistent pampering: your feet are scrubbed, and your callouses and hard spots are exfoliated with two types of paddles. Skin, SKIN just falls off your feet like a heavy January snow. I'm not exaggerating, there's no way to explain it except to try it yourself. There was no time limit either. These pedis went on for over an hour, if there's still dead skin, they're still scrubbing. And the best part was that the women handling my husband's feet told him that she couldn't exfoliate anymore, it would damage the skin...so that was professional and we would definitely go back! And the best part is that my pedi has lasted almost three weeks.The haircut was really good too. Maria (who also did my pedi) talked to me about my options and gave me a really thought out cut and amazing blow out. For practically three hours of pampering, we paid probably half what we would at a foo-foo spa and we actually felt relaxed and looked great. Highly recommended!!!!

18.description: This place is amazing! I love Migdalia and her crew. Maria is my main girl but I have used Levy in the past and she is also really good. Migdalia greets you with a warm kiss and her husband will bring you the coffee. They really do make you feel special.Maria never minds dealing with my thick, curly hair - she does an amazing job. My hair is so smooth and sleek. I love the job Levy does on eyebrows.Everything is very reasonably priced!

13.description: This salon offers just about every service a woman would ever need. The customer service is excellent! They are very accommodating and attentive. I have have to say Shaira is amazing! She is my go to girl, mani/pedi haircut whatever I need she has it covered.

4.description: I had two people tell me to come to this salon so I decided to give it a try. I called and made an appoinemt and they took me in the same day, which was great. When I got there, the owner/ manager was very nice and welcoming. I explained that I wanted dark blonde highlites and showed a picture. The outcome was not what I asked for at all and my trim was chopped in all weird ways. I might of had bad luck with the wrong worker, but never will go back.

24.description: I really love this salon! Trust me I've had my fair share of salons in Chicago that promise to do a good job, and you leave dispointed by their work and an empty wallet?? I do think the salons prices are a bit much but everyone at the salon is friendly and my stylist Maria is the absolute best when it comes to color, so to me it's definitely worth every penny! The owner Migdalia always greets you at the door and her husband is always offering fresh coffee so it's a plus and a win-win for me! Definitely give this place a try!!!

6.description: I called to bring my grandma in for a trim and a blowdry, that was much needed. I was able to get a next day appointment, with Maria. We were greated very warmly. The decor is beautiful. My grandma loved her hair and Maria was very sweet and did an excellent job. They are 5 minutes from the house, so they will be my go-to from now on.

22.description: This place is amazing! I love Migdalia and her crew. Maria is my main girl but I have used Levy in the past and she is also really good. Migdalia greets you with a warm kiss and her husband will bring you the coffee. They really do make you feel special.Maria never minds dealing with my thick, curly hair - she does an amazing job. My hair is so smooth and sleek. I love the job Levy does on eyebrows.Everything is very reasonably priced!

15.description: I absolutely love this place!  I have big curly hair and this place knows how to tame the mane! Maria and Levy are my main ladies but you can't go wrong with anyone there. Migdalia understands "ethnic" hair , so she makes sure her staff can handle anything that comes their way. This is definitely a one stop shop, you can get your hair, nails, eyebrows, facials, and all sorts of other things done here. On top of being so great, Migdalia is also very reasonably priced.I have been coming here for years and they have always been great.

7.description: I have been here several times and the service has always been great! The owner is a lovely and friendly woman, and the atmosphere that she creates makes me feel as if I was back on la isla. I've gotten two haircuts for two weddings- most recently my own - and the ladies are always willing to be flexible with my requests/suggestions. The wax service is also nice, and they make my eyebrows look very clean (and never overdone).

8.description: Migdalia's offers professional care with a personal concern for the clients. Migdalia and Pablo are kind and just like family. I love my every visit.

30.description: I called and was able to get a same-day appointment for a full foil. The woman I spoke with was very friendly and warm, which only made me more excited to get my hair done somewhere that's so close to home.The salon itself has a very relaxing atmosphere, with lots of comfy seating and a cheerful color theme, providing a nice balance to the energetic Latin music and rapid-fire conversation filling the air. The owner is incredibly friendly and came over to introduce herself during my visit, which added to the overall friendly neighborhood feeling of the salon. The stylists themselves looked put together, and appeared to truly enjoy their profession.When I got there, I sort of stood around a while since there doesn't seem to be an official receptionist to greet anyone, and the rest of the staff seemed busy. After a few moments, I was introduced to my stylist and quickly realized we'd be working through motions and gestures, since she spoke no English and I spoke no Spanish. A coworker translated for me, and we settled on my services and got started. I had wanted my highlights touched up, and they had suggested getting lowlights to freshen up my overall color, which I agreed was a great idea. I picked out the lowlight color from the color swatches myself. I have very thin, fine hair that is very quick and easy to do, so I figured I'd be in and out by lunchtime.I ended up spending *4 hours* in the chair -  my whole base color was dyed the darker "lowlight" color I had chosen, and then was highlighted over this base color. This meant bleaching out the color she just put in (pointless!) AND bleaching over my old bleached highlights - ouch! The end color result, while really pretty, was significantly darker than the color I walked in with - definitely *not* what I had wanted. I also ended up with a REALLY uneven haircut, and while she gave me an excellent blowout, she just did it without any indication it was an additional fee.I was absolutely exhausted by the time I left, not having had expected to spend 4 hours there. (It usually only takes 2 hours max, even when I do my base or lowlights!) While everyone was friendly and sent a smile in my direction, it was pretty tough sitting still for that long and not being able to have any conversation whatsoever with your stylist. The cost of the services was not at all what was expected because something was lost in translation (literally), which was frustrating, but overall was still within an acceptable range.So, would I go back? Probably not, but don't discourage others from trying them. I think my experience was a one-off, and not the norm. Their prices are reasonable, the staff was very sweet, and they use excellent color and product. I would like to get my nails done, since their nail techs seemed really talented. I would recommend being EXTREMELY clear about what you want and what you DO NOT want, moreso than usual, and being able to speak Spanish would definitely be a bonus.

3.description: If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. I have never had a better salon experience in my LIFE than the first time I came here. I heard about this place from some friends and being new to the city and not having a salon yet, I figured I'd check them out. I am SO glad I did. I called during the daytime to make a same-day appointment, which is usually frowned upon in salons, but they fit me right in! As soon as I arrived, I was greeted with a big hug from the owner, Migdalia herself! She was genuinely sweet and welcoming. She set me up with Magali, who gave me a wash, cut and blow dry. Now, mind you, my hair is very thick/coarse/curly/frizzy/dry, so I wasn't sure if they'd be able to help smooth it out and make it look straight. Boy, did they prove me wrong! After she was done with me, my hair looked better than it ever has. Magali was so sweet and took very good care of me. I came in a few days later for a dye with Magali and she did a great job - again! No surprise there. What I love about the salon is that they use top quality, high end products that get the job done. The facility itself is very beautiful, well-kept and nicely decorated. Prices are affordable for what you get with the level of service and top notch products. I cannot wait to go back and try some of their other services. They are a full scale salon and spa so they offer facials, manicures, pedicures, etc. I have now found my go-to salon and couldn't be happier!

14.description: Noticed a lot of little rookie mistakes in my mani/pedi. but the service and friendliness was better than most! And everyone was so accommodating. And Migdalia was just the sweetest. If I could put her in my pocket and take her out to spread cheer I would.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring

3.description: Not sure what the reviewer below got but I will trek 50 miles to get Chinese from somewhere other than here. Being new to the area, I actually used his review as the reason to give it a try. Never again. I am of the belief that all Chinese restaurants should be graded on a single recipe. Its as level of a playing field as you can get with similar restaurants. Mine is General Tao/Tso Chicken. While some places make it with no veggies, some with broccoli, and some with green peppers, onions, and carrots, they all tend to follow the same basic sweet/spicy sauce over fried chicken base. So being that this was my first time, I order the General Tao chicken lunch special. I was intrigued because for $5.80 it was advertised that  I would get the chicken dish with shrimp fried rice, egg roll, crab ragoon, and a water or soda. In reality, I did not get any crab ragoon, the egg roll tasted as if it was freezer burned then cooked in month old oil (I couldn't finish it and that is extremely hard for me to do with any food), and I am not entirely sure if I actually got chicken or just fried spongy batter. There was no chicken texture inside the ,soggy, pancake-like batter and a few of the larger pieces I peeled apart only to question "is this chicken?". The rice was mediocre and highly oily with a handful of salad-sized shrimp, but the Dr. Pepper was as reliable as always. I give it two starts because the lady smiled and said thank you... something I don't take for granted around here.

1.description: Best Chinese takeout outside of china town. We order from here quite often and the food is always perfect!

2.description: I have ordered this food on multiple occasions, because it is super close to my work and it is decently priced. The food pretty much stays consistent, as far as taste is concerned. They give a pretty decent portion of food for what you are paying--I can usually get my fill for lunch and take it home for dinner or share with a co-worker. I usually get the orange chicken which comes with a huge portion of shrimp fried rice and the choice of two crab rangoons or egg rolls. If you are in Humboldt Park and want some quick Chinese during your lunch break or for dinner, I would definitely suggest ordering from here or stopping in. It's not great, but it isn't bad either--it just is and I am okay with that. More accurate rating: 2.5

5.description: The first place we tried in our new neighborhood and I wasn't too disappointed.  I was expecting worse since the outside of the place looks like fort knox, but hey, I guess you can't really judge a book by it's cover.  The service was fast and courteous (we got delivery) and the food was slightly above average.  We got free soda and the price wasn't bad for what we ordered.good pot stickers, good fried rice, good chicken...good times.

6.description: Woo-hoo! SO happy Gen Hoe is open again. They were closed for over a year after the liquor store next door caught on fire. This is our favorite Chinese restaurant (outside of Chinatown) and we've really missed it! Their food seems fresher and less oily than other places we've tried. And now, the new menu includes a section devoted to "healthy dietary" options, which I look forward to trying. Welcome back to the neighborhood, Gen Hoe!

7.description: i think we found our new favorite local Chinese. huge menu, huge portions at a reasonable price, ready in ten minutes. the parking lot to pick up helps a ton as well. will definitely go again!!!

8.description: Awesome.  Just found this place. Order online was so easy. They have a great system and great food.

0.description: I order from this place at least once a week. Comfort, take-out Chinese food.  Combo fried rice and orange beer are my go-to orders. Not food for the health conscious. Unless you want to order from the steamed veggie section of the menu. (I never have, never will)I'm pretty sure I'm addicted to this stuff. MSG perhaps? Don't really care, I'm hooked. This food is perfect when your plans include coping from a stressful work week by sitting on the couch and binge watching shows on Netflix. I even bought my own chopsticks for home to enhance my Gen Hoe eating experience. It hits the spot. Free crab rangoons when your order exceeds $15. I'm pretty sure the lady who answers the phone recognizes my voice and order. If your plans involve watching Adult Swim all night, then do yourself a favor and order some Gen Hoe's. Unless it's on a Sunday, because then they're closed. Sorry.

4.description: By far the best Chinese in Humboldt and Ukrainian Village. If you don't want to trek 5-ish miles or more, then this can't be beat. Plus they absolutely have the best vegetarian Chinese you can get outside of Lakeview and Chinatown. A real gem. (yeah, it might not deserve 5 stars, but I can't give it 4.5).

3.description: a good-sized grocery specializing in foods from Latin America.  there is an associated pananderia in the building and law offices upstairs.  I've driven past here 564645 times and finally stopped in on a quest for huitlacoche.  I found two brands, non-adjacently.  small can for $5ish and big for~ $8.  they had a few other things that tempted me, so I may be back.Parking is on the west or east side of the building, in narrow lots, or on the street by the entrance.  It's a little tricky with the one-way sidestreets, and you may have to walk a little to get to the entrance, but it's not so bad.

1.description: Well I ask a guy in the deli I want a pound of  krakus ham I catch him eat aslice from the ham he just cut from a coustoumer w/ his bare hands no plastic glovesEwwwwwGrossThas totally discus thing see ppl doing thisGet a break & don't doo thatThat's what ppl get sick

2.description: This place use to be the closet Mexican grocery store to me before I moved. The meat is always well priced and fresh looking, and if your looking for carnitas then this is definitely a place you should check out. I'm not sure of the lady's name who is there early In the weekends taking orders but she has won me over with her exceptional customer service! She always offers me and my daughter samples of the soups,cheeses, or other types of meat they are serving. She also makes sure to separates the fat from the meat which I like because most places won't and would just throw that in to make more weight. But the only thing I don't like when I go there is that there is alot of people hanging out in front, either selling all kinds of things like a flea market, or standing by the liquor store. If I were the owner I would place No Loitering signs everywhere. Think about it, how many people do you see doing that in front of a Jewels, Mariaños, or even Food for Less on North ave and Cicero?

5.description: This place is awesome.  This is the right spot to get your meats, fruits and veggies.   Can you get 10-15 limes for a dollar anywhere else?  Or four packs of tortillas for a dollar?  This is one of the first spots I go to when I'm planning a nice meal... especially if you need some Hispanic food products.In addition to that, a bakery is attached.  You can get a bunch of little pastries or bigger cakes for parties.  One of my favorite purchases here though is the bolillos...three for a dollar or sometimes 4 for a dollar.  I can make a mean torta.Lastly, there is a place to eat in here if you don't have time to cook.  It is a little place, but the prices can't be beat.  I definitely recommend trying it out.

6.description: Okay, since someone pointed out that no one Yelp's about my neighborhood, I thought I would. Here goes.Eff Jewel, eff Dominicks, eff Strack and Von Til. Not only because they won't dare take the leap of faith I did to move to this neighborhood. No, also because they suck compared to my (yes, MY) Carniceria Jimenez. Tell me where else I can purchase a fully cooked rotisserie chicken, all the fixin's for a salad, a 32 oz tall can of beer and a telenovela magazine (ok, I don't actually buy them but I COULD) for under $10. Not at those bourgoise grocery stores. Only at my poquito Jimenez. Don't get me started on their fantastic tres leche's cake. It ain't diet food, but its damn good. They have a whole bakery attched to the back of the grocery store where you can buy 4 still warm, freshly baked bollilos for $1. And a FULL liquor section. I'm talking balls to the walls liquor. A whole wall of refrigerated beer. And at least 5-6 shelves of hard liquor.They also have a restaurant area in the front. It serves already prepared Mexican fare which I have yet to try, but you guys will be the first to know when I do.I love this place. Don't be a jerk, come support my neighborhood (which I don't think even has a name yet, seriously) grocery store and stop by my apartment. We can enjoy some of that fresh baked bread over tall cans of brew.

7.description: I was in the area today, and wanted to find a place to have a quick lunch.  While I can't comment on the grocery shopping, the restaurant up front has some good food and quick service.  The view from the restaurant area into the produce made me wish I had some time to shop.The Food:The menu is up above the grill area and had a pretty wide variety of traditional food.  I quickly decided to go with a Pork Burrito and can of Coke.  Overall, it was a good value ~$6.00 for a giant burrito and $0.65 can of Coke.  I was totally impressed with the fresh avocado sliced up an added in as it was prepared.When I'm back I'll try the tortas.  They looked awesome.The Service:Quick counter service.  Place an order for the food and then follow the food down the line to pay and select your drink.  The place was busy, but it moved fast.The Setting:Casual with a bar/barstools for solo eaters or small groups and larger tables.

8.description: @HeatherZ.     "(...my neighborhood (which I don't think even has a name yet, seriously)"I don't think I could've said it better..it doesn't have a name. I argue over this all the time. It's not Humboldt Park and it's not Austin! haI grew up going to Jimenez, not weekly like most normal people shop for groceries, but several days a week actually. Always lived so close I could drive and get there in less than 10mins. While certain things are a  bit more expensive than other stores like Jewel, for example, at times, I'd rather pay more at Jimenez than to get stuff from other stores. The most expensive things, in my opinion, are usually the 'american' things-like cereal. I usually get all my produce from Jimenez. There is no way anyone else has a better selection for a better price. Everytime I visit another stores produce section it reeks! At Jimenez, it does not. Their meat selection is also the best here. My family and I will not, for any reason, shop for meat anywhere else. No matter what the prices are. This stuff is fresh. They have the best carnitas!! I remember back in the day when it was a self-serve and people ate way too much before actually buying any! lol Now, they are at the end of the counter at the butcher shop area. FYI, no need to take a number for just carnitas. Now, the rotisserie chickens are self-serve, used to be the other way around. The taqueria, don't even get me started. The best costillas en salsa verde EVER. The prices are reasonable and you get a lot of food-all 'platillos' are served with rice, beans, salad and tortillas. Their horchata, totally awesome. They also make some delicious huaraches (no, not like the shoes-the food).Their bakery-great conchas and always fresh bread. I believe Mexicans call them 'bolillos' and 'pan largo' (french bread). They also have cakes but I can't comment on those since I'm not big on cakes myself. My family loves them though. All in all, great place all around. Easy parking, except on the weekends--although, there is plenty of it-just hard to get a close-to-the-door spot. This location does NOT compare to the others. I believe there are now five other locations, 4204-16 W North Ave location is THE best one. And the owners, SO great.

0.description: This place is the BOMB.COM Can't go wrong going to this place!Food, drinks are fresh and delicious. Been coming here for last 2 years, I taken my family here as well. Just a great place to grab great Mexican food.

4.description: I usually get the shaft. I mean, I usually get the shaft when it comes to smaller Mexican restaurants. They cater more to people who eat beef and pork and I don't so I usually end up eating chips and guacamole or rice. BUT I eat chicken and if 'm lucky the chicken isn't an afterthought sitting in a bin of oily juice or left to dry out under some heat lamp. At first I thought I wasn't so lucky because the menu at this place didn't list any chicken items. I did a quick scan of the "food bar" and I saw a pan of delicious looking roasted chicken staring back at me. I must have been drooling on the counter top because the cook offered to use the roasted chicken and make tacos for me. A short while later, I was feasting on some heavenly roasted chicken tacos with all the fixins. Absolutely delicious at only $1.50 a pop. Quick, tasty, cheap.

1.description: I got my septum pierced with my friend in august at the old Chicago St. location. The piercer was a girl named Vanessa, and the piercing was ok, although she didnt use a clamp and I do feel like my piercing is slightly crooked. She also cleaned my nose with rubbing alcohol (not cool). Worse than that, they pierced me with externally threaded jewelry which is jUST TERRIBLE for a fresh piercing. I went back in to have it looked at because it wasnt feeling too good and Vanessa said she couldnt see me because she was leaving and to talk to this other guy. the room i talked to him in was kinda dirty and he was just tattooing some other guy in there. He was acting kind of unprofessional and even my mother thought so. I dont really recommend getting a piercing here, the guy even told me to put Neosporin on my piercing, which is crazy if you know anything about piercings, I'm pretty sure he also told me I could use alcohol on it. I just don't recommend this place. I only went here because you get $20 every 6th or 7th piercing but I'm definitely not going back.

0.description: So here's a fun story. My boyfriend and I went to forever ink to get a very simple tattoo done. It was a shadow of a silhouette. Nothing detailed or anything. So our tattooer Mario aka "Carnal"  was very helpful and very nice. And that's really the only reason I tried my best not to write this. Anyways, a little back ground on my boyfriend? My boyfriend has had multiple tattoos done, by multiple people. He also has a very painful spine problem (scoliosis), that being said, he can handle pain relatively well and has never been in pain when in came to tattoos. Mario mutilated my boyfriends skin to the point where he was in so much pain he was close to tears. But we let it slide, we figured Mario just had a heavy hand. A couple days later, while the tattoo was healing we noticed a big bump of ink cluster. We call and texted Mario about it and he said it was the tattoo "just healing" again we let it slide we figured we'd give it a couple more days. Days later, the tattoo was SO bad it turn purple, blue, pink, and green. THIS WAS AN ALL BLACK TATTOO.  I called Mario again and nothing. I called the shop and we had "just missed him."I contacted other tattoo artists that I know for help, and they all came up with the conclusion, after inspecting it, that the arm was over worked.They all said it was over worked. My next step was to confront Mario, not even ask him for money back or anything at first, just wanted to see how we could deal with the situation. I spoke with another artist there because once again...Mario was not there. They assured me that they would make Mario contact me and offered to have him fix it.Never did I get a call from him. Never did I get a message back. Nothing. My word of advise is AVOID this place. There are a million other better places to go to.
Love them been going for years now

1.description: Came in months ago with co-workers being that it is under new management. We had to take our meals to go because we sat seated nearly the whole hour of our lunch time with no food placed on the table. We went ahead and paid for take out at the register and still had to wait to leave out the door. Today five of us coworkers returned (ordering ahead on the phone) and received our plates timely. We were told by the waitress who was nice we could pay separately while dining in. When it comes time to pay the bitchy cashier/cook/maybe management refuses to ring us up separately. After I offered to pay the bill on behalf of all of us (I know where everyone works ) I realized we are charged a gratuity which we were gracious to already leave on the table in cash. Normally I would of returned to receive my cash back but this refusal to work with the customer was not the waitresses fault. We liked her. Some of us wanted to tip better individually with our separate payments. She would have earned more. Customer service such as this caused less money in tips to the waitress and five less patrons of business due to being so damn greedy. We will also spread the information to the other staff of a large building. Looking forward to the next new management staff...scratch that...next new establishment period in due time. It will happen, I'm sure of it!

9.description: Been  here a couple of  times, keep  going back can't  get enough  of the Mofongo, this is green  plantain smash with butter and  garlic, absolutely delicious and u can stuff  it with shrimp  or buttered chicken, the best. Highly recommend, and for dessert, OMG coconut  Flans, best of the best.

23.description: It started out with the restaurant calling to say that one of the items we had ordered through GrubHub was only available on Thursday.  Ok.  I can see how that would happen.  So we made an alteration for a similarly priced item and moved on - no love lost.  The food came rather quickly and we live in a gated apartment so the gentleman called when he got here.  When we opened everything, it looked like B grade take out.  I don't mind that.  But, I live near some really great places around Humboldt Park and it just doesn't compare.  So, with all of that, we are at around a 2.5 stars.  What REALLY got me was that we ordered Sancocho.  We both tried it and agreed it had an off putting flavor.  So we started pulling stuff out.  It was pigs feet and tripe sancocho.  I do believe that using all the parts of an animal is important and has a place, but I also think that's something you should share.  Pigs feet and tripe do have a specific flavor and it's an acquired taste.  And it's not one I have.

5.description: By far the best steak jibirito I have ever had. Super flavorful and good portions at a very reasonable price. Probably one of the top 5 sandwiches in the city!

25.description: The Restaurant is a Family place, the food is the Real Thing from the PuertoRican cuisin, service and attention is real good and the most important economic part: Prices are really fair, definitely I WIL BE BACK. Pedro A.

12.description: Waited approximately 2 minutes to be greeted. Hostess for carry out was vey rude care free charismatic. Did not even get the correct order. Had to close my business again in order to get the order corrected. No apology by hostess or anyone in regards to the issue. She's to busy singing and dancing instead of attending to the customers who pay her salary. The male here who appears to be the "manager" also made no attempt to correct the issue. The kitchen area is not the cleanest either. City of Chicago should have never issued them a business license.

21.description: I hope they can do better eventually. Really nice people. The steak in the jibarritos was very hard, tostones were overcooked and really dry, no garlic on them after I asked for it, morcilla was really cold.

16.description: The food was great. Our server and everyone was really nice and friendly.  I loved their empanadillas and tostones. Wish I lived in Chicago, Take me back!

17.description: El Nuevo Borinquen is nothing like the old Borinquen. The food is so tasteless. The rice is hard, Jobaritos only came with one thin slice of steak and no flavor, the caldo de pollo con Mofongo needed some more sazón and adobo. I also ordered some alcapurrias that had no taste and one of them had a big hole in the middle where all the meat must off fallen out when frying it.  The hole was filled with oil and they had the nerve to serve it like that.   NOT EVER GOING BACK!

10.description: First time I've had mofongo since being in Puerto Rico. Was everything I wanted it to be!!

11.description: I don't think there's such a thing as a bad jibarito.  None that I've experienced.  However this one was not bad, just a bit plain. I was missing a garlic taste or more seasonings on my chicken one.  I enjoyed the rice and beans that came with as a side.

26.description: On this MLK day, the service seemed a little slow. The food was great- had the stake Jibarito with arroz con habichelas and was not disappointed. I had to translate a bit for my friends, as it seemed like the staff isn't fluently bilingual. But if you're a spanish speaker you won't have any problems here.

22.description: The food here isn't the greatest. I don't think I would return. It's a decently sized restaurant too and they were decently busy. Our server seemed very lazy. Gave us a pitcher of water and didn't even pour us the water. How lazy can you be? I give them an extra star (or else it would only be 2) because we left valuable photos there. It was a fat photo album and they wrapped it in a bag for us to come back and pick it up. I'm just really grateful that they cared a little to not throw it out.

0.description: I stopped in for lunch with my uncle. We had the sopa de salchicion and it was good. Also had tostones con mojo. Fresh and flavorful.The waitress was nice and timely with our meal. Music could be lowered a bite.Other than that, I was very pleased with the food, service and prices.

20.description: Quality does not match the cost. The rice had a funny taste and the rellenos de papa look like fried chicken, not the smooth texture you expect. The steak jibarito was average but I've had better. The alcapurrias are actually good, probably the best part of what I ordered. This wouldn't be the first place I'd go to for Puerto Rican food in Chicago.

19.description: Nothing like the original. Decent service not great, but the food is not the same. The rice had no meat and the Jibarto sandwich was dry. If your looking for a decent jibarto just go to the orginal  on western. Once again I will say the food has completely changed not the same recipe.

2.description: Same old place with just a new sign.  Walked in and out of the restaurant after 10 minutes. The 4 dirty tables with the tip from the previous patrons gave it away.Sat at a table for 10 minutes and no one even acknowledged my presence.  Restaurant wasn't even busy.I stopped coming to this place 5 years  ago and it took 5 minutes to remind me why I stopped patronizing this dump.

18.description: The previous owners of this place had seem to let it go. I went back and gave it a try. the staff was extremely helpful got my food in a flash and it was very good.

13.description: This place is delicious, I get the steak jibarito every time I go. Call it in ahead of time and it's ready to go by time you get there.

4.description: The food here isn't the greatest. I don't think I would return. It's a decently sized restaurant too and they were decently busy. Our server seemed very lazy. Gave us a pitcher of water and didn't even pour us the water. How lazy can you be? I give them an extra star (or else it would only be 2) because we left valuable photos there. It was a fat photo album and they wrapped it in a bag for us to come back and pick it up. I'm just really grateful that they cared a little to not throw it out.

24.description: The food is great service is great the place is super clean will definitly return reminds me of moms cooking

6.description: I feel so bad! I was here weeks ago and told myself to put a review up but completely slipped my mind. The service was so wonderful I can't even stress this enough. I walked up to the board with not a clue on what the hell to order. I rarely experience Puerto Rican food and they were so sweet when my boyfriend and I stared and they gladly helped us. They told us about their best ones and even gave back round on the cuisine. The waiting was decent and they even gave us a sample of their flan. The food was delicious. So great and I can't wait for more. I don't think it'll be too great for every week consumption but I am definitely making the return back when I don't feel so guilty indulging in such wonderful food. I can't thank you enough for the wonderful service and teaching me about the food and a bit about the culture!

15.description: I love the food here people are really nice too you I'll come back again.ill tell my friends about this place too order for there party's

7.description: Really good ! I had veggie jibarito ( sorry if the spelling is wrong ) it's sooooo good! Highly recommend this place !

8.description: My husband and I wanted try this restaurant with the new management we will never go again . The steak Jibaritos had no flavor the rice con gandules had no flavor.  My pork chop meal was horrible I felt that they cooked the pork chop in bad oil.  It was just bad we never go again .my pork chop tasted like Cod fish just bad . Then to top it off the bill was over $40.00 it was just two dinners I felt that they jacked up the price to get more money out of us. Never again!!!!!Oh and the tostones were really bad greasy and thin just bad.Just not a happy customer

3.description: It was nasty. If you don't know how Authentic Puerto Rican food is supposed to taste then it's for you. I'll just stick with my grandmas Puerto Rican cooking.

14.description: Quality does not match the cost. The rice had a funny taste and the rellenos de papa look like fried chicken, not the smooth texture you expect. The steak jibarito was average but I've had better. The alcapurrias are actually good, probably the best part of what I ordered. This wouldn't be the first place I'd go to for Puerto Rican food in Chicago.

58.description: Went after hours on Sat night and someone book the place for a buffet party.  The mushroom and beets soup with garlic bread was so good.  My favorite was the sauerkraut pierogi, stuff cabbage, meat pelmeni, berries crepes, the chocolate mouse cake and coffee.  It's was all for $25(w/o tip tax) !! Love the food and byob. Will back for the cookies and pastries.

56.description: Very nice! Great atmosphere and good service. We were here for a meetup .  Really liked it. Banana crepes and chocolate crepes were fab! Will be back.

29.description: Group of ladies came here after the visit to Ukrainian Museum nearby for lunch. Everyone was happy with their soup, sandwiches or cakes.We were served shortly after ordering. Friendly service!Good business they have.

42.description: If you want to try authentic Ukrainian food, definitely visit this place. Shokolad is a welcoming neighborhood cafe with a moderately priced food, nice and helpful service and great menu options. As I'm writing this review, I'm craving their yummi varenyky (stuffed dumplings, or in other words, pierogi). I frequently visited the restaurant with my friends, particularly for a Sunday brunch, and it was always a great experience.

23.description: Wow. This place is just a total standout.The space feels extraordinarily European -- it's clean, well lit, all the details are right down to the feel of the glasses of water and the carafes they leave on the table. The woman who works the register and who waits the tables is Eastern European, and it feels all the more authentic when elderly Ukrainian couples come in and start doing shots at the table next to you (it's BYO, FYI -- and yes, this did happen; there were several rounds of shots).The food is at the perfect price point, and all of it is perfect for what it is. I'll admit -- I've only had sandwiches and ice cream here. But they've all been really, really good. And they come with two coleslaws, though it doesn't seem quite right to call them that; one a vinegary cabbage slaw, and another carrot one. Both are entirely fresh and clean tasting, and it's so refreshing to have a sandwich that doesn't come with potato chips or french fries. I couldn't pick between the two if I wanted to.The sandwiches themselves are on buttery, pressed bread, and are never too dry -- I'm not sure how they seem to ensure it every single time. And I would be remiss not to mention the stunning cakes in the glass case near the front.This place is great. The only downside is that they close at 6pm. Clearly they know their clientele. :)

47.description: Everything here is very good! I really like their chicken panini. Their desserts are worth missing a day in your diet for - they have these "acorns" filled with a light mousse - OMG!

8.description: Everything was deliciously perfect at our first culinary experience at the quaint lil Shokolad Cafe!My husband and I were wandering the streets around here with some time to kill and decided to pop in here.  We were pleasantly greeted by a kind woman (possibly named Tania, as it was printed on our receipt) as we walked in for our first Ukrainian dining experience, and it was WONDERFUL! After we were seated and began browsing the menu,  a 1 liter caraffe of water was placed before us, which I know is not a big deal, but little touches like this make me very happy...I tend to consume enormous amounts of agua when eating.We started off with a large bowl of the Borshch which came with a side of 2 rolls (see my pictures) and it was completely foreign to us to have magenta colored soup, but it was stellar!  The spices were so perfectly flavorful, we were both quickly slurping it up... nice image I know, but we ate it as fast as politely possible, it was so darn good!Then our potato pancakes w/ mushrooms & coslaw, and 3 rasp2 crepes came out.  We ended up sharing everything because it was too delicious not to share! Each bit was better than the last, it was sensational! The nice lady who greeted & seated us was perfectly timing visiting our table for water refills and chit chat, she was lovely and personable.We ended our Ukrainian culinary experience with a Chocolate Mousse cake with Passion Fruit layer to go, and went back to wandering the neighborhood & errands down on the shirt 3 mile jaunt to the Magnificent Mile...all the while raving to each other how AWESOME our lunch had been! Deliciously amazing food, local small business, fair prices, classy updated decor & fun atmosphere,  if we lived downtown, this would quickly become one of our favorite regularly attended spots.  As it turned out, we ended up going back hours later, after we were done with our shopping and cruising the Magnificent Mile, and grew hungry again.  We both decided we should absolutely stop here again on our way back out to the 'burbs.  We rushed over because they close by 6pm, quite early, and it seemed strange for us, but as long as they still had some of that sweet sweet hot magenta stew, we would be happy!So for our 2nd meal time here in 1 day, we ordered the Borschsh, a large bowl again of course, and decided to try their most popular flavor of perogis: The Mushroom & Terragon.  They come in 1 dozen, unless you specify that you only want the half dozen. We got just 6, but we should have known how delectable they would be and gone with the full dozen! Ohhh my word, they came out, and were presented to us swimming in a gorgeously comforting cream sauce. Best. Perogis. Ever. I'll admit they are a bit newer to us, just the past few years, but these took the cake for numero 1 top perogis in our book.They have a cooler case in front with drool-worthy baked goods, and I had to exercise great will power strength not to take them all home with me, they all looked so appetizi, and everything we had here had been absolutely stunning in flavor and quality... it felt as if we were guests in this nice gal's home and she was feeding us her homemade treasures from recipes perfected over the decades.Seriously this place is the bomb dot com.My husband and I might need to do some business in the neighborhood again soon, and we talked about making a stop back in here again, or heck we might just make the hike from the 'burbz just because we want to be back here!Can't wait until our next bowl of hot steaming magenta amazingness!Que the omnomnomss......

31.description: Everything was deliciously perfect at our first culinary experience at the quaint lil Shokolad Cafe!My husband and I were wandering the streets around here with some time to kill and decided to pop in here.  We were pleasantly greeted by a kind woman (possibly named Tania, as it was printed on our receipt) as we walked in for our first Ukrainian dining experience, and it was WONDERFUL! 34.description: Man, this place is good!I went there at least 3 times in one week and the food was delicious every time. I had the mozzarella and tomato crepes, the ham and cheese ones, and the chicken and zucchini entree. They were all great! The little garlicky carrot salad accompanying the crepes was tasty, and so were their hash browns and dill potatoes. I haven't had such good hash browns since Denny's. I know, I know. You can't compare the two, but I gotta say Denny's has some killer hash browns. And Shokolad, too! My friends ordered the nutella crepes and loved them as well. The service was great and the place was nice and tidy. I can't rave enough about this little gem. The prices are more than affordable. I tried the Midnight cake (chocolate mousse with passionfruit) and the Napoleon. Yep, you guessed it! Tasty, both of them.People, go try it! You'll thank me.Oh, I'd say it's Ukrainian Village, not Humbold Park. Can't wait to try their soups next time I'm in Chicago. Keep up the good work.

16.description: Shokolad. A pastry & cafe. A dining experience.This corner cafe brings the charm of a quaint Ukrainian town, to the streets of Humboldt park. They provide a variety of breakfast, lunch, and pastry treats. Whether you are craving a hearty meal, a light snack, or even just a cup of coffee, this spot is sure to fill all of your needs.

13.description: The BEST Ukrainian food ever. My wife and SIL are from Ukrainian grandparents that came over on the boat in 1913 and they say that Shokolad is as good as they ate when they were children (1948-58). Shokolad was filmed by NBC in Chicago on how to make perogies.

11.description: Very tasty food, feels like in Ukraine (i was visiting my friends there a few month ago). Salads were a specialy fresh and yummy. My husband in love with borsh. I will definitely recommend it to my friends.

39.description: I absolutely loved the meal and the service we had at Shokolad. Our server, Inna was very knowledgeable and shared some wonderful Ukrainian dishes.  I don't usually have sweets during breakfast or brunch but by her recommendation, everything sounded so good and tasted even better.  I'll definitely be back.

37.description: Stopped here on the way out of town and would recommend it. The food was very good and the service quick. Excellent menu with interesting & delicious options.

0.description: After staying in the Ukrainian Village for a few days, I noted to my husband that we hadn't had any Eastern European food. We had stuffed ourselves with hot dogs, Japanese food, and exotic cocktails, but hadn't sampled any Old World cooking. We had seen charming babushkas and heard the church bells from the Orthodox churches, but I had yet to plunk pelmeni in my mouth, and that was a problem.We found Shokolad and all was well. The borscht was phenomenal and full of flavor which comes with a few tasty rolls on the side. We sampled some of their exceptional pierogies-some with meat and some with mushroom and potato. All of this loveliness was ours for under $20, and managed to be filling without being overwhelming. This was one of the last meals of our Chicago trip, so we were waddling around like penguins from all of the rich food that we had eaten.Definitely a stand-out in this charming part of town.

38.description: I went here for lunch a few days ago and was blown away. It was recommended by a Russian friend. The cafe was empty when we arrived, but it soon filled out around noon. Service was how I like, attentive but not in your face. Everything was fresh. I didn't expect food of this standard to be served in a cafe like setting. I had the veal with noddles and cream sauce and my boy friend had the potato pancakes. Both reminded me of a grandma's home cooked meal. Prices were very reasonable.

51.description: BYOB :) Cannot get enough of this place. Friendly service, freshly made dishes, amazing dessert case! Really authentic menu that represents well Ukranian/Russian dishes. My friends and I love coming here!

27.description: The food: 5/5.  It's everything you'd expect from your typical Eastern European fare. Their menu is tailored to Eastern Europeans, as well as the least adventurous locals.  Being  Ukrainian, I always go for the crepes, which never disappoint. My companion had a ham& cheese omelet and a French toast and said he enjoyed the meal. The service: 3/5. While the waitresses are surprisingly friendly, there are usually only 2 of them, with one working the counter and the other one waiting on tables. Sunday brunch gets very busy, so prepare to wait for a while if you go then. Overall: 4/5. Would recommend for brunch whether or not you're up to trying Ukrainian food.

32.description: We were doing some other business in the area and were looking for a place to eat lunch.  We stumbled upon this gem and to say that we were impressed is an understatement.  The service was very attentive without being overbearing.  The interior was nicely made up and welcoming.  The food was amazing!I ordered the potato pancakes with mushroom sauce along with the borsch.  I've never had borsch before, but I am totally a fan now.  The potato pancakes were very filling, delicious, and satisfying.  The flavors of both were surprising (in a good way) and left us discussing how much we love their food.  We also had some raspberry crepes which were very well crafted.We left pleasantly full and extremely satisfied with Shokolad but little did we know that we'd be back.Fast forward a few hours and it was time to eat again, and we were still in the neighborhood.  We were so impressed with our last experience that we thought it would be foolish to pass on another dining experience here.  We ordered more borsch and some pierogies.  Once again we were amazed at the flavors, service, and tastes.Bottome Line:Borsch=awesome, potato pancakes=awesome, this place=awesome

54.description: Great food. Simple with fresh ingredients. Very pleasant atmosphere

48.description: I am new to the neighborhood and read the great reviews about this place, so I tried it out. Their cake is to die for! The problem is their customer service makes you want to die. My belly is full of delicious cake, but my heart has indigestion from the extremely rude way I was treated. I can't recall doing anything wrong or not being considerate, so I'm not sure why I deserved to be treated in such an unfriendly way.There were two young women taking orders and waiting tables. The place seemed busy, so I could understand if the service was quick and not overly friendly, but outright rudeness is not okay. I was served by the darker haired girl. She waited on me the last time and was not rude but not exactly friendly either. Maybe she just doesn't like the cut of my jib? I ordered a piece of walnut cake to go and asked about the chocolate mousse cake after I paid. Another lady walked in at the same exact moment and wanted to know about it too, as there was no label describing it, and it looked so yummy. After hearing the description, I asked if I could get a piece of it as well. I went to pay with a ten dollar bill and two pennies. The girl behind the counter seemed annoyed that I gave her two cents on the thirty seven cents and even said, "that's not going to help." She seemed really annoyed that she had to wait on me and made me feel like she was doing me a favor by allowing me to patronize the business. The other lady who wanted the mousse cake was actually really cool and friendly. When I went to leave the store, I said thank you. The other customer acknowledged me and said you're welcome! (We had been chatting about Thai mango dessert, so maybe she thought I was thanking her for information.)The girl behind the counter said nothing for the whole transaction other than the quip regarding the pennies and did not respond with a "you're welcome" when I left the store. Have you ever been to a business where you leave feeling like sh*t and that you did something wrong? That's exactly how I felt after my second and last trip here. All three types of cake I tasted were fantastic, and I was really looking forward to trying the crepes, borscht, pierogis and other savory treats. I literally live right around the corner from this place. But now that won't happen. I promise I won't come back! And that's my two cents.

44.description: Everything is excellent, food exceptional! I love this place and trying to come back as often as I can:))5 stars with no questions! Keep it up!Everybody should try borsch with garlic bread!

24.description: Loved every bite! We had great food and wonderful service. Can't wait to go back. While you're there make sure that you try there pierogies. They are very delicate and all in a very unique sauce.

7.description: The food: 5/5.  It's everything you'd expect from your typical Eastern European fare. Their menu is tailored to Eastern Europeans, as well as the least adventurous locals.  Being  Ukrainian, I always go for the crepes, which never disappoint. My companion had a ham& cheese omelet and a French toast and said he enjoyed the meal. The service: 3/5. While the waitresses are surprisingly friendly, there are usually only 2 of them, with one working the counter and the other one waiting on tables. Sunday brunch gets very busy, so prepare to wait for a while if you go then. Overall: 4/5. Would recommend for brunch whether or not you're up to trying Ukrainian food.

49.description: I had the Varenyky, veggie dumplings in sauce at their food stall at Daley Plaza, it was delicious! will go and visit the restaurant to taste their extensive menu.

40.description: My New favorite neighborhood restaurant and pastry place. I had the seared tilapia with cilantro lime mayonnaise and mixed greens. Great hot sandwich, great value and excellent service.

53.description: I truly enjoyed my brunch here.  The husband was not as enthusiastic.  The crepes are delicious.  The pastries are delightful.The coffee is very good.Service is slow, but just fine.I'd enjoy going back.

30.description: Good coffee and decent pastries. Only one server who struggled to keep time with the patrons. Otherwise solid.

46.description: I used to go to Star Lounge Coffee all the time and didn't even realize that there's a pretty good brunch place/cafe right across the street! This place seems popular among the Ukrainian locals. It's a nice change from your typical American/French breakfast place. I got the ham and cheese crepe which was good. Food tasted fresh and light which was great from your typical greasy breakfast food. Just the perfect amount for lunch with enough room for their desserts! I didn't find their service to be slow, but the restaurant was pretty empty for a Saturday lunch time. I'll come back next time for something more Ukrainian (They have your typical pierogis and other Ukrainian food items that I am not familiar with).

1.description: The food is alright. I love the Borsche (I think the small is ~$4), but don't like the pelmeni (~$10 for a dozen) and the entree which is the weekend special beef stew $11 (sorry can't remember the name). The pelmeni is just okay and the stew seems like a regular stew to me.Although I think I ordered the wrong thing since the pictures of other food look so delicious. So I think I might go there again to try something different.The service is very slow and not attentive. There are only 2 waitresses for Saturday lunch.

55.description: Shokolad means chocolate in Russian and I think Ukrainian. I would know, I consider myself Russian but I was born in Ukraine. Anyways, enough of my life's history for now, this is yelp after all. I came here since it is a pretty well rated Ukrainian  cafe/pastry shop so I wanted my parents and I to relive the "Ukrainian experience." We got here on a Sunday around 2pm and it was pretty packed but we were able to get a table right away. It's got a cute, simple, clean cafe vibe. I wouldn't exactly describe it as authentic eastern European by appearance. It took a little while to be approached by they only had like two servers for the whole place. Maybe they weren't expecting it to be super busy at that time, but it was. We started with the borsch, which is a traditional red beet Ukrainian soup. We got the large bowl for $5 and shared it and it was just okay. My mom's tastes a little better in my opinion but I did love the little bun buns that came with it. They were these little bread rolls that were quite tasty and were nice to dip in the soup. My parents got the Vareniki, which are like pierogi's stuffed with different things. We got the chicken as one order and the potato as another order. I definitely like the chicken ones more, but I wish they came with like a cup of chicken noodle broth, just like my grandma used to make. Both vareniki came with sour cream and Korean carrots which were pickled. The potato vareniki were good but they weren't excellent, they need a lot more fried onion to really bring out the flavor but that's okay, we devoured them anyway. We also got this beef and potato dish served in clay pot with lima beans along with those bread bun buns again. And again, the bun buns were the best part. The dish lacked a little flavor for me, as it was more garlicy than anything else and I'm not a fan of too much garlic. By that point we were too full for dessert and they honestly didn't look too appetizing to me. Overall, the food was just okay, nothing special, the prices were decent and the service was just eh because the poor girls were running around like crazy trying to accommodate everyone. I honestly don't know what would get me to come back here, well, besides those scrumptious bun buns. But then again my own bun bun doesn't need any more volume in it if you know what I mean.

9.description: I really like this place.  The food is simple and tasty. I usually always get the pelmeni (mmm... With white vinegar) and/or the cheese blitzes.  My husband has tried some of there specialties like the duck and the pork dishes.  Their prices are more than reasonable, and the food is always delicious.  As previous reviewers mentioned, the service can be a little slow but, for a Weekend brunch, why would you be in a rush anyway ;).

26.description: I want to give 2 stars, but I don't want to ruin their ratings. I went specifically for breakfast. The interior is very cute. It was breakfast time, but the other people ordered from the lunch menu. I got the 2-egg breakfast special. It was just alright.

25.description: The crepes and pastries alone are superb and savory. Came in too late for breakfast but ended up ordering the Ham and Gruyere Crepe. Glad I did.

12.description: The pastries are good here. I sometimes run in and grab them before visiting some of my teachers. A friend had an ok sandwich from here. The thing is, they aren't always the friendliest and most attentive place. My friends got a coffee to go from here and said it was decent. In this neighborhood it's not one of my go to's.

59.description: I love them for their sweets and pastries. My favorite is Drunken Cherry, Opera, and another one that has passion fruit in it, I think it's called Midnight something. Being a European, this is my little haven. Nowhere else can I find cakes of such exquisite taste -- they are not overly sweet like majority of pastries I come across, the cakes are very very filling, but as you eat them they taste light. Customer service is very nice -- the girls that work there are very friendly and polite. Their cakes are always fresh yum!!! I wish they were open later though because by the time I come from work they are closed .

21.description: I love Shokolad! I've been brunching, lunching, dining and everything in between pretty much since they opened up 5 years ago. Naturally, it was my go-to when it came to ordering my wedding cake. We met with the chef, Halyna, she was so sweet and accommodating with helping us decide the flavors/fillings/decorating details. The cake testing was a lot of fun and our 4 tier wedding cake was delicious,carefully delivered and beautiful :) Thanks Shokolad!

17.description: This was my first time trying borscht and pierogies - super delicious! We got the mushroom and potato pierogies in a creamy tarragon sauce (per the suggestion of the waitress). Definitely a great first experience. We also got the roast beef panini which was amazing. If we ever go back, will definitely try some of the desserts.Also, our waitress was super sweet. A great stop in Ukranian Village!

10.description: Wow. This place is just a total standout.The space feels extraordinarily European -- it's clean, well lit, all the details are right down to the feel of the glasses of water and the carafes they leave on the table. The woman who works the register and who waits the tables is Eastern European, and it feels all the more authentic when elderly Ukrainian couples come in and start doing shots at the table next to you (it's BYO, FYI -- and yes, this did happen; there were several rounds of shots).The food is at the perfect price point, and all of it is perfect for what it is. I'll admit -- I've only had sandwiches and ice cream here. But they've all been really, really good. And they come with two coleslaws, though it doesn't seem quite right to call them that; one a vinegary cabbage slaw, and another carrot one. Both are entirely fresh and clean tasting, and it's so refreshing to have a sandwich that doesn't come with potato chips or french fries. I couldn't pick between the two if I wanted to.The sandwiches themselves are on buttery, pressed bread, and are never too dry -- I'm not sure how they seem to ensure it every single time. And I would be remiss not to mention the stunning cakes in the glass case near the front.This place is great. The only downside is that they close at 6pm. Clearly they know their clientele. :)

5.description: Old World charming. A European cafe, in the sense that you can order anything--from coffee to a snack to a full meal--in nicely decorated surroundings, and feel comfortable and well-taken care of. Having a place like this in every neighborhood, if not on every corner, is what we lost because of Starbuck$. With Starbuck$ replacing local cafes In Europe, it's easy to understand why many hate U.S. food franchises over there.But I digress. Here the borscht (they call it borsch) is a tasty beet soup with a chicken stock base, served warm. Although some call it sweet, the only sweetness comes from the beets. In my opinion this borscht is right in the middle, between the ones with added sugar that are cloying and the ones that are tart. Here there is a nice mix of shredded cabbage and diced beets in the soup; often you get one or the other. Served with delicious brioche rolls. Then came sweet cheese crepes, which were the same as blintzes except they were folded into triangles instead of rounds. The crepes were incredibly fresh tasting and delicious, and the sweet cheese filling was rich, for a perfect combination. Topped with powdered sugar and served with berry compote and whipped cream, this dish could not be better.Perhaps you never experienced the homemade creations of an East European grandmother. If so, come here to catch up on Old World goodies before they're completely gone and forgotten.

3.description: Love this sweet neighborhood cafe. Went here with friends and we got a sampling of the different perogies, both savory and sweet. All were delicious but we especially liked the simple cheese as potato ones. The food is simple, but made well and with lots of flavor. The pastries here are also really nice.

35.description: I made the mistake of ordering a small borscht. I should have ordered a gallon. It was incredible! The bread with garlic oil with which it was served sent it over the top.My pierogies were light, but certainly not the best I have ever had. The staff is sweet and the desserts look gorgeous. I just wish I actually had some room to sample one!

19.description: Love butter? Love better? Come here. Real food by real people. I have been a regular here for several years. The coffee is strong. The cookies are huge and the breakfast sandwiches are big and delicious. Every time I cone here something new catches my were and I walk out with something more than i walked in for. Also the baristas are super cute.

28.description: Shokolad makes what might be the best mushroom soup in the entire world.  They also make omelets that are so wonderful they defy description.  Everything they serve you has an extra little touch - something special that you didn't expect.  They also have dazzling pastries!Considering the quality, the prices are very reasonable.  I can't wait to eat there again!

45.description: Whaaat this place is so good. Some of the best Ukrainian food ever- potato pancakes are bomb, the cucumber dill salad was refreshing and tangy, and my friend's tomato basil crepes were seriously epic.Service is slow but it's part of the charm- blaring top 40, furntiure that looks like it's all from West Elm, and lots of bedazzled faded jeans abound. Fret not, the Ukrainian stuff here is legit, moderately priced, and delicious.

33.description: BLEW ME AWAY.  This place is just awesome. The food is so fresh and crisp. I recommend the blueberry pierogies and raspberry crepes. I also had the chicken and mushroom omelette and chicken panini! *drool* I'm coming back for sure! It's extremely cheap for the quality and portion sizes.
