The servers were very friendly and attentive

43.description: Love the pastries love the egg sandwiches love the omelets love the pierogies  love the potato pancakes and love the authenticity. So glad it's a block away

2.description: A few weeks ago while randomly walking down the street from my barber appointment, I stumbled onto this pastry and cafe spot.  Having a sweet tooth that afternoon, my focus was on a cup of coffee and something savory to satisfy my palette.  To my amazement, I was pleasantly surprised what this small place offered which was delightful.First, I realized that as a French speaking individual that I was not the only Ex-pat in the place.  As I quickly learned, most of the patrons were Ukrainian.Second, the coffee was great and the atmosphere what I expected from a small shop.Third, the hostess and server at the front were ever so graceful in helping me maneuver the menu and pastries to hone in on what would satisfy my flavored taste.Fourth and last, worth mentioned that as an African American, I felt at home in the restaurant as any other patron would feel.  And to that end, I send kudos to the hostesses for being so humble in welcoming all patrons.Another local ethnic small business that deserves our neighborhood attention.  Stop by and say hello while you enjoy a great cup of coffee and great sweet treats.

18.description: Loved every bite! We had great food and wonderful service. Can't wait to go back. While you're there make sure that you try there pierogies. They are very delicate and all in a very unique sauce.

41.description: This place is AIGHT.  I wasn't super impressed with the pelmeny--i thought the meat was kind of dry. For otherworldly pelmeny that's generously seasoned with dill and other greens that's perfectly rich...Magic Jug is where it's at. It's a hike, sure, but it's what's up.

52.description: Whenever I am in the neighborhood, I naturally gravitate towards Shokolad.  Visited when they first open, bit in between and now.Ukrainian Sweet Cheese Crepe ($8.75) is a 3 piece ensemble with just-right sweet cheese, some berries (2x the portion is desired), and an amazing whipped cream.Coffee serving is per cup ($1.75) or bottomless ($2.75).  It's nice to have an option.

50.description: Finally, I found the place where I can eat great food. Meal was well cooked in the way it should be. Definitely will come back soon!!!

4.description: Raspberry crepes have fresh berries and the borscht is great.

6.description: Excellent food. The holubtsi (cabbage rolls) are my favorite and are served on Fridays. They have just the right proportion of rice and meat, and are served with a subtle, yet flavorful tomato sauce that is just perfect.

22.description: Love butter? Love better? Come here. Real food by real people. I have been a regular here for several years. The coffee is strong. The cookies are huge and the breakfast sandwiches are big and delicious. Every time I cone here something new catches my were and I walk out with something more than i walked in for. Also the baristas are super cute.

15.description: The egg sandwich is good. Some items I find a little over priced. The servers are nice. The Ukrainian aspect is authentic to the neighborhood which is nice.

57.description: I'm Russian and grew up eating this food, so I had high expectations. The borscht was just like mama makes at home. It came with some amazing bread and garlic butter dipping sauce...my fave! Followed by crepes that where delicious! Clearly this is a family owned, authentic establishment. Ill be back!

20.description: The egg sandwich is good. Some items I find a little over priced. The servers are nice. The Ukrainian aspect is authentic to the neighborhood which is nice.

36.description: I've never been disappointed at this Ukrainian gem. Shokolad's style of borsch is a great version served hot with delicious, yeasty rolls accompanied with garlic oil for dipping. Can't go wrong with the savory pierogi or pelmeni.

14.description: We were doing some other business in the area and were looking for a place to eat lunch.  We stumbled upon this gem and to say that we were impressed is an understatement.  The service was very attentive without being overbearing.  The interior was nicely made up and welcoming.  The food was amazing!I ordered the potato pancakes with mushroom sauce along with the borsch.  I've never had borsch before, but I am totally a fan now.  The potato pancakes were very filling, delicious, and satisfying.  The flavors of both were surprising (in a good way) and left us discussing how much we love their food.  We also had some raspberry crepes which were very well crafted.We left pleasantly full and extremely satisfied with Shokolad but little did we know that we'd be back.Fast forward a few hours and it was time to eat again, and we were still in the neighborhood.  We were so impressed with our last experience that we thought it would be foolish to pass on another dining experience here.  We ordered more borsch and some pierogies.  Once again we were amazed at the flavors, service, and tastes.Bottome Line:Borsch=awesome, potato pancakes=awesome, this place=awesome

3.description: Fast delivery. Good food. We will be ordering from here again!

1.description: Once again in the pursuit of finding my go to Chinese restaurant and I have failed or they have failed. In the rice was a piece of some type of plastic that made me loose my appetite and was very unsettling. The rice is ok the orange chicken was off too sweet and chicken wasn't cooked all the way the crab Rangoon were good and the beef lo mein was bland. I will continue my search .

2.description: Sometimes Chinese takeout just hits the spot. When I'm in town and the craving hits, I like to order from here. The prices at Chen's Garden are good and they use good quality meat. There are cheap places that cut corners and use gristle-y meat, but this place doesn't. The chicken wings are mouth watering.  My favorite dishes here are jumbo shrimp fried rice and chicken chop suey.

5.description: Just ordered delivery for lunch. I ordered a Large Sesame Chicken and my coworker ordered the Same but as a lunch special for just $5 Hers came with a free can of soda, 2 times the rice as mine, an egg roll and just as much meat. I got ripped off. Definitely great food and great lunch specials.

6.description: Still like this place (the only caveat being: be careful what you order, read my original review) and that it's three blocks from my house.  They currently have these $3.50 Big Six Specials (choice of: an egg roll and shrimp fried rice, Sweet & Sour, Kung Pao or Orange Chicken, a MASSIVE shrimp egg foo young, or three wings, all w/ a generous portion of steamed rice).  Surprisingly, the portions are large, too.  So I just picked up two of these (the egg foo and the orange chicken, both were deelish) and two egg rolls, easily enough food for two people and leftovers, for $10.55 including tax.  Unbeatable.  Also, they do deliver and take plastic for any orders over $10.

7.description: I enjoy the food when I feel like chinese takeout. You can't beat the lunch special price. I recommend the egg rolls and fried rice.

0.description: Lunch special is enough for two. Food is always hot and fresh upon delivery arrival. The orange chicken and egg foo young are my favorite and never disappoint. Chen's is my go to Chinese takeout restaurant.

4.description: Food was good. But different than the Chinese I'm used to. Very fast service!! Would possibly go again.

3.description: This is a great place to get hookah tobacco. The owner is very nice, and knowledgeable

1.description: Found the hitters and grinder I was looking for. The lady was super chill and helpful. I enjoyed my experience and my deals.

2.description: On a recent trip to Arabia, I learned about hookah smoking, a flavorful way to get my nicotine fix.  So glad I was able to find Monadnock on Dearborn.The man behind the counter was knowledgeable about this device and even recommended flavors to me.This is a great place for all your tobacco needs and even for a funny conversation with a friendly proprietor.

9.description: Guy behind counter would not acknowledge or even look up. Had to wait for girl to come behind counter for service. Don't need to pay for rude-ass service.

10.description: Great place to stop in for a cigar/cigarettes in the Loop... just steps from Van Buren and Dearborn. The service is professional and they have a great selection to choose from.

4.description: The portly gentleman behind the counter who also happened to be the owner was very helpful in helping me select my cigars, they had a very nice selection.  I bought some cigars for myself and as gifts for some friends  who absolutely loved them! They also have a fine selection of Hookah tobacco and accessories in the store!  While the store owner is extremely knowledgeable and very helpful when it comes to tobacco related products he was a bit on the chatty side but I suppose it comes from his love of tobacco.

6.description: Very friendly service & well acquainted with the product! The young gentleman was informative and helped me pick out a cigar that would meet my taste. Need a cigar & in the Loop, stop in!, I certainly wiil be back.

11.description: Remarkable selection and professional service. If you want a quality cigar in the Loop this is the place to go! They don't seem to charge "loop prices" so load up on goodies and supplies while you're there!

12.description: Interesting tobacco shop in the loop.  Too upscale for the kids to buy anything, thank goodness!  Only recommended for Chicago souvenirs.  Don't smoke. :)

5.description: This place is great! The owner was vey knowledgeable and honest about the products..and had no problem answering the questions I had! I would recommend this to store to everyone! Thanks again..you made my visit worth it!

13.description: Good tobacco shop. Good if you need a cigar when you are in the loop. It is actually located on Dearborn.

7.description: Awesome tobacco shop in the Loop. They have everything! I was looking for some K2 tobacco the other day and surprisingly enough they had it in stock! Cool shop owner too.

8.description: good customer service, great prices and selection.

0.description: Fantastic little cigar shop. In addition to bulk tobacco (super hard to find) they have a good selection of sticks at decent prices. They also have "alternative smoking devices" for those of you who choose to smoke various herbs and spices in lieu of tobacco.Will be going again, even though I live closer to another cigar shop.

12.description: jimmy's is not the nicest nail place i've ever been. the prices are cheap but you pay for what you get. nothing seems very clean - nail clippings and other kinda gross stuff on the floor. i guess if you just need a cheap mani/pedi it's only $30.

7.description: I live close to this salon and I have been going there for over two years.  My experiences just keep getting worse and worse.  I will not be returning!First off they are very rude and make you feel that you are inconveniencing them by coming to their salon.  This last time that I went in I wanted a pedicure.  I waited for about 10 minutes until there was a nail tech available.  Finally I sat down in the chair and the water was cold.  Who wants to put their feet in a cold tub?  As she started my pedicure she failed to file my nails so that they were straight so I asked her if she could fix it.  She was clearly annoyed.  She had completely forgotten to give me a foot massage until I reminded her.  She wanted to get me out of there as soon as possible.  I am thinking that I could have done a better job myself painting my own nails.I wanted to inform all the people that are thinking of going here to find someplace else.  They prices are cheap but you get what you pay for at this place.  If you want a relaxing pedicure don't go to Jimy Nails.

3.description: I am never disappointed by Jimmy's nails. I get acrylic nails and I am actually complimented on them when I go here vs anywhere else. I'm reluctant to post this only because no one seems to know because there hasn't been a wait when I've come here!

1.description: The woman worker was very nice, but literally left me with a chemical burn on my fingers while she abandoned me at here station to service two trashy girls who walked in after me.  The trashy women were swearing at people on their phones.  One girls was threatening to meet up with another girl for a knife fight.  I never went back after I received my chemical burn.Horrid place to relax

2.description: Please do not go to this place !!! That stupid man owner in there is sooooo rude and impatient!!! I went last week to get a full set except I wanted a coffin shape, I asked him and he said ok I'll see what I can do. The whole time he is doing my nails he huffed and puffed and kept telling me that the length that I wanted was too long and it was actually a medium Length. Wtf cares how long or short you want your nails when you're the one who's paying for them!' My point is that this place should just be closed because the service is so terrible! Do not go here!

9.description: I came in to get a fill in. Cheap, fast and skilled!  My nails looked twice as good as they did when I had got them done at another more upscale nail salon in the area... and for a third of the price!! I will definitely be going back to Jimmy's whenever I need my nails done.

18.description: Jimmy rocks.  Unfortunately, his place is overrun by hoodlums!  The pedicures are great, but what's not great is listening to a screaming 17-year-old demand that Jimmy redo her acrylics because they aren't long enough.  Last I checked, frito-lay-chip was standard acrylic nail length, so why the complaints?

10.description: I've tried more expensive and fancier manicures and pedicures and Jimmy Nails is by far the best. They're fast, they do a great job and they're cheap. $30 for mani-pedi. No lie.Sometimes when I go for pedicures, I sit next to construction worker type dudes, which I find very charming. I love Jimmy Nail!

13.description: I use to frequent this nail place regularly since I lived near by I also, use to bring my daughter along for mini manis and/or pedis. I can say the mani and pedis for their price is amazing! However, I never really liked the way they treat their customers? I almost always never got a hello when I walked in and mind you I went their for years? The last time I was there with my child,  I stepped in the restroom and my daughter was waiting for her mani,  however  there was an available nail tech, but for some reason she didn't want to do my daughter's mani. When I came back my dauther told me the older lady (I think she's Jimmy's wife) that works there told her daughter to do my dauthers mani, and she flat out said no? IN FRONT OF MY DAUTHER?! what!! I never went back!! I just about had enough of bad attitudes or "nail techs" that don't say hello or even look like they enjoy what their doing?? I will never go back.

16.description: I went to Jimmy Nail after reading the limited yelp! reviews.  I was looking for a salon close to where I live and thought why not... Well, this place was AWFUL.  Sure, they're fast, but fast doesn't mean thorough.  I felt like the woman doing my nails was geniunely not interested in being there.  She globbed on the nail polish so thick that even over 6 hours after going there my toes were ruined!  She was not careful when painting my fingernails and there was definitely still nail polish underneath my fingernails even after she cleaned them up!  I will NEVER go back to Jimmy Nail!

17.description: Fortunately I went early on a Tuesday evening, so I was the only customer there. My pedicure was FANTASTIC!! Kim was great - gentle & skilled. Good prices as well -  only $22 for a pedicure and it's $30 for a mani/pedi.

15.description: Efficient, skilled, and cheap is a pretty good recipe for a manicure. This isn't the place for a fancy cocktail of lotions and scrubs, or even casual chatter; the women of Jimmy Nails are quiet and get down to business with a minimum of frills. However, for $10 for a manicure that's holding up quite well, I'm sold. The standard warning for chemical smells apply, so for some people I could see it being a deal breaker.

0.description: Jimmy does great work on my nails! I love all the technicians there and they are all so friendly. I highly recommend them. Just make sure you tell them exactly what you want and you will be happy. I can't wait to come in again! See you soon Jimmy :)

5.description: I had a great experience here. It was clean, easy to park at and they were very friendly. They offered me a magazine the minute I sat down and joke about the Food Network with me - asking if I was hungry and if I wasn't would I mind watching Food Network. We even chatted about local restaurants in the area.I got a mani/pedi. It was very inexpensive AND it looked great! After my pedi was done, I saw one of the people scrub out the tub - which to a clean freak put me at ease. If you are looking for a spa like experience this is not the place, but it is great  nail salon. They were very considerate too... once I thought my nails were dry they checked them again, just to be sure. I have been to too many places that just try to rush out out the door, they don't... they want to make sure your nails look great once you leave. I will be going back.

11.description: I had to get a pedicure and my place that I love, Strong Nails, was too far for me to get to on a cool night.  I traveled to a hair salon that told me that this would be the closest one.  I agree that they have a diverse clientele here.  There were quite a few people here when I got in and they seem to have regulars, and seem to give discounts when you bring other people in or spend a certain amount of money.  I'm not sure if the do this for regulars or in general.  Regardless, they are very affordable.  I just had a one color done, and they did a great job.  My test is always a french, but I didn't feel like risking it.  I will have to go back and see what they can do.

8.description: After just watching Dr. Oz review things you shouldn't do before, or during a pedicure, I was hesitant to get one this year.  But, beauty first, right?  lol  Anyway, I got a pedicure here today.  The salon itself is nothing fancy, but I did check to make sure they wash out the tubs with soap or disinfectant after each client--they did.  (Apparently many salons rinse and wipe down, which doesn't clean it.)  I was talking to my friend, so I forgot to make sure they cleaned the tools after each use (I am hoping they did).  My pedicure was fine.  No cuts, chips, okay selection of colors.  I didn't get a calf massage at all, but that's okay.  It was quick easy in and out.  It's not a spa atmosphere, but if you need a basic pedicure, I would go again.

4.description: Dude, I love Jimmys Nails. Sometimes when I am out for a walk or get off at my Blue line stop, I peer over and bite the bullet. The only place in Chicago I have found that uses a razor, A GOOD RAZOR, for my dead skin. They always show me that they cleaned everything out, and I never have gotten an infection or pain or anything.My pedi and mani come out looking marvelous. The prices are amazing, and those massage chairs are the bomb.com.

14.description: I went to Jimmy Nails for the first time yesterday.  I go to both nice and cheap nail places, and I know I will get what I pay for... so I wasn't expecting an amazing spa experience.  That said, I had a gel manicure and a normal pedicure.  The pedicure was fine, maybe 2.5 stars as they skipped some steps other cheap nail places will do.  The gel manicure, though, was a nightmare.  I left and my hands were throbbing with a dull ache.  I ignored it as I was in the midst of a very busy day, and indeed, the pain subsided by the evening.  However, I woke up last night at 2:30am (14 hours post-manicure) with the throbbing pain back, and having spread to my wrists.  It was terrifying, frankly.  I soaked and scraped the polish off right then and there.  I woke up 4 hours later pain free.  I have had CND Shellac (a reputable brand) gel manicures on several past occasions, never with any problem.  I don't know if it was this place, my body on that day, or what, but this whole experience frightened me so sufficiently that I will never revisit this place, or get another gel manicure.  I also intend to notify the State of Illinois as this was a frightening health issue for me.  I should point out that in hindsight, I know they used CND Shellac color, but I do not think they used CND Shellac 'base' coat or 'top coat' (whatever you call those when you do a gel manicure).  I think what they used were in anonymous bottles... or at least, they weren't in CND Shellac bottles.  Makes me wonder what sort of chemicals/brands/etc they were/are mixing or using.  Scary.  Oh, and the whole light drying process involved in a Shellac manicure was not handled methodically.  At nicer places, they will time out the amount of time your hands are under the light.  This didn't happen at Jimmy Nails.  In closing - you can find much better cheap nail places than this one... try Lovely Nails or Rose Nails, both on Lincoln Avenue near Fullerton.

6.description: Great price, and best mani/pedi I've ever had.

3.description: I didn't visit the store personally, but placed my order by phone. They were helpful to verify that I wanted a bouquet for delivery (no vase) and not an arrangement (with vase).My wife loved the flowers when they were delivered, and the delivery driver was very pleasant.Thanks to Mike T. for leaving his earlier review so that I was able to find the store through Yelp.

1.description: Looked for florists located near my cousin's place and found this shop via Yelp. Called to phone in an order (congratulatory arrangement for a new baby). The staff was super nice on the phone and had it prepared to send the same day without hesitation. My cousin was thrilled to receive it and even sent me a pic of what she received-everything was just as discussed. Recommend!

2.description: The owner takes great pride in her work and it shows. Always use her for all  occasions and I am never disappointed.

0.description: From the moment you step foot into this quaint flower shop you are greeted with positive energy in an atmosphere filled with beautiful scents and gorgeous flower arrangements! I love coming here to get flowers for special occasions, it's that place where you get a heartfelt story with your purchase!

4.description: Flores Del Amor is a hidden gem!  Today, a coworker had some flowers delivered by a mutual acquaintance.  I was amazed by how beautiful they were.  Being that it was Mother's Day eve, I was in the market for flowers, so I asked where to get a similar arrangement.  Joe (our m/a) said, "Follow me"...so I did, to 2611 W Division Street in Chicago.  Immediately as I walked in, the owner, Janette Maysonet greeted me and started reviewing my options.  She asked who the flowers were for.  I told here a little bit about the recipient and within seconds, she pointed to the lower left corner of the display case exclaiming, "Fire and Ice...Princes Diana's favorite!"  She was SO right.  The vase was trendy and the flowers were fresh and beautiful.  Her price at a minimum was twenty percent less than I would have expected to pay at a premium florist...and Janette could not have been nicer.  It's a little off my beaten track but not by much, and it was worth the trip.

58.description: Closest thing to home-cooked Puerto Rican food. Owners are always welcoming. Very inexpensive, decent-sized portions, and best of all, BYOB.  Owner  even said he was going to add some background music, the only thing would be to improve their outdoor eating area.

56.description: I liked this place well enough.  I would go back.  Service was helpful although a bit rushed.  The food was fine, although I didn't think it was particuarly special.  Food doesn't need to be special, though, sometimes what you really want is just traditional, standard food from a region, and they fill the bill for that.

29.description: As soon as we walked in the owner greeted us. He was so sweet.I love the mural on the wall, showed the many cities that make up Puerto Rico. I ordered the bistec encebollado, it came with rice/beans, salad and plantains. Parcha juice (passion fruit juice) was yummy.My bf got the chuleta frita mofongo.Random: Bathroom was pretty clean

42.description: This restaurant was fantastic!  Great service, great bistec, and was still able to catch my flight out of Chicago!  Highly recommended

23.description: Food was delicious! The owner was so nice and very personal. Our server is the owner's daughter and she was so friendly and helpful! We've never had Puerto Rican good before and her recommendations were great! #14 and #24.

47.description: The food is delicious, has decent portion sizes, very authentic and great service. The complimentary bread before your meal is amazing. You feel like you are at home with  the service and the food is definitely made with some love. It is only shy from perfect due to its appearance and some house keeping. Walking up to the storefront, the gazebo looks like it needs some repair and is dull and dirty. The table out front wobbled and looks like it sat outside for a bit. The entrance I believe is designed with accessibility in mind but if you do not notice that you can trip. The bar seems out of place and the space would probably be more useful if it had tables instead since it can get packed during peak hours. Finally, yes I know your bathrooms are clean and inviting but I do not need printed signs telling me about it. I think with some tidying up and maybe some floorplanning, this place can easily become the anchor restaurant in the neighborhood.

8.description: My boyfriend made a mistake and ended up here instead of papa caches.  He picked up some jibaritos for lunch and they were the worse! The rice was aweful, but unless Puerto Rican rice is home made it really isn't good, but this one was beyond bad. Everything tasted like it was made this morning.  I was looking g at the pics on yelp and all the food looks horrible! I come from a family of great cooks especially Puerto Rican food and I could tell, just from looking at the pictures that this food lacks.  Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

31.description: This place is simply Puerto Rican cooking at its best.  I took a group of teenagers there for a high school field trip, and they were all impressed.  RICE / ARROZ:  Restaurant-style arroz con gandules usually is a far shot from homemade, but La Plena hits pretty darn close.  Best restaurant-made arroz con gandules I've ever had.PORK / LECHON:  Once again, the best I've had at a restaurant.  So rich and juicy.  And the plaintain it came with, very good. SPEED:  The speed of service isn't that fast, but it's because the food is so homemade and given a lot of care.  There were 17 of us there, and they brought plates out two at a time.  It also gave us time to enjoy the......AMBIANCE:  What a beautiful establishment full of murals depicting all sorts of sites and scenes from Puerto Rico.  That definitely filled some time while we waited for our food.  The owner explained the murals to us.  The parcha to drink... so refreshing.  I highly recommend La Plena.  Puerto Rican dining doesn't get better than this - and that's from me and a group of teens!

34.description: Went there with a friend for dinner. We showed up a bit late so they were out of some options but that was not an issue. I had a steak entree and friend had chicken. Both of us were pretty pleased with our decision. The service was excellent and they were really sweet because they let us stay, eat and chat while they were cleaning up with the 'Closed' sign on the door :)I definitely need to go back to try more stuff!

16.description: Very nice, friendly family owned restaurant in Humboldt Park! I ordered a jibarito one of the best jibaritos I've ever had super fresh and hot! This is definitely my new go to for Puerto Rican Food.

13.description: Came here after work with co workers. Since the day was early we were the only ones, which was nice. We were greeted by an older man, I'm assuming the owner. He was nice and told us we can sit wherever we wanted. The place was very nice, clean and the art on the walls were beautiful. Since it was BYOB we brought our bottle of Mascato. Overall the food was good, service good and the place clean. I will definitely will be returning.

11.description: My family and I went to La Plena for my birthday, it was a treat.The food was excellent and the service was very good. They were closing early that night but stayed around and made great food for our party of eight. Make sure you try the Jibaritos!

39.description: The food was outstanding. I had the Pollo Frito and it was by far the best fried chicken I have ever had, and I consider myself a fried chicken expert. Great prices abd BYOB. Would make a great date spot.

37.description: J-Lo has a song "I Luh Ya Papi" well "I Luh Ya La Plena!" I was introduced to this restaurant by my niece who is 27, and, WOW, was I glad that she took me here several months ago. She mentioned it to me recently. Then, I wondered, did I ever write a review for this place? We ordered the following: Bistec Encebollado and Bistec En Salsa. (Bistec = Steak) They were thin, tender and very delectable. El sabor was excellent. This cut of steak is known as "palomilla" in Spanish, and is used in preparing Cuban, Puerto Rican and Colombian cuisine. The key is to marinade the steak for 24 to 48 hours, because it provides incredible tenderness and un fantastico sabor. The service was hospitable and on-point. Our water glasses were kept filled and our Server was very sweet and attentive, but not overbearing. We really, really enjoyed our dinner which was served with platanos maduro (sweet plantains), rice and beans. I do not like pork (which is "lechon"), so I cannot speak to the "lechon," but I can certainly give an honest review regarding el bistec (steaks). Both were worthy of 4-1/2 stars. The price-point reasonable ($21 excluding tip and tax). I know authentic, flavorful Puerto Rican food very, very well. When it comes to Puerto Rican cuisine you could say I am an expert. I grew up with a Puerto Rican mother and all my friends always told her to open up a restaurant. She never did, but our house was always filled with friends who would come over specifically to EAT my mom's cooking!  I was expecting a loud and obnoxious crowd of customers, but surprisingly the restaurant was pleasant and peaceful. They also have a huge bar. We purchased the last of the six guava pastelillos ($1.50 each) which were OMFG off the chain delicioso! I am planning a trip back for breakfast some time soon. Yes, they serve desayuno. We ate the guava pastelillos the next day with a taza de cafe con leche. Aaaayyyyy que rico y exquisito. Would I go back again? Did I enjoy what I ordered? Was the price-point reasonable? Was service hospitable and decent? Was parking easy? Was the food flavorful and delicioso? Were portions generoso? Si, si, si y mas!

0.description: Went there last night in a group of eight, so we were able to try a wide selection. Everyone loved what they got.  I had the steak in sauce & my wife had the steak with onions. Both were very good but the sauce on mine was incredible.  The Puerto Rican rice was also outstanding.  We split a jibarito and it was as good as you can get.  The tostones were the best I've ever had. This is all homemade food.  You can see the woman (owner) preparing everything in back.  Awesome service, too.  It's BYOB (no fee), so we all brought wine.  It's a great, friendly place with outstanding food.

38.description: This place definitely makes some authentic Puerto Rican food but I was left unimpressed. My lechon was decent, though nothing to write home about and my Arroz con Gandules tasted slightly like an ash tray or cigarette, unfortunately. My friend said the same thing about his too. The staff was friendly and the inside was not too bad either. I'll look to go back there again to see if it was a fluke.

51.description: La Plena is amazing. I had to get my hands on a jibarito and La Plena did not disappoint. The plantain was crispy and the meat was juicy and flavorful. The restaurant was clean and bright with a lovely mural on the wall. It was incredibly clean and well maintained. The service was fantastic and the people could not have been friendlier. Will definitely be going back and would highly recommend this spot.

27.description: I came here for lunch. Everything was very good and it was a smooth enjoyable experience. Definitely coming back.Couple of points:1. Food was very good, all the flavors are on point. Had lechon, arroz y habichuleas coloradas, and tostones. The lechon was very good, had just come out of the oven. They did give me cuerito (pork skin). Rice was exactly how I would expect it. I am not a huge fan of habichuelas coloradas (red kidney beans), I prefer rosadas (pink beans) but they were solid.2. The tostones are probably the BEST tostones I have had in Chicago. For some reason most restaurants in Chicago serve extremely greasy tostones or are too soggy. These were not greasy at all, and had the right thickness and crunchiness to them. Exactly how they should be cooked.3. They gave us legit pan sobao with butter. I had never seen pan sobao in Chicago before, it was great.4. The restaurant is a true family business. The mom is the cook, the dad is the manager, and the daughter was our waitress. They were very welcoming. The service was very good and attentive.

32.description: Definitely worth a visit.  Easy off street parking.  The staff were very friendly to this "gringo" and his family.  .  I had Puerto Rican food--or so I thought--before and frankly was never all that impressed.  Tasted a lot like Mexican, I thought.  But I decided to give it a try again, and I am glad I did.This experience was completely different.  I felt like I had been invited in to someone's home.  You could see (and smell) the cooking process.  By the time the food arrived, I was already salivating. As I said earlier--definitely worth a visit.

54.description: We were in Chicago last weekend. My wife loves PR food. After reading the reviews decided to try it. We were not disappointed. All the reviews were spot on. The owners were so friendly and welcoming. The restaurant was super clean and the food was great. All for a good price. We ate there and bought food to go for later at the hotel for about $35. Next time were in Chicago we will be back!

48.description: Went there for lunch. Had the beef stew and the jibarito. Not the very best food I had, but it was still very good (especially the jibarito) and reasonable priced. Very friendly and personal service. Can recommend this place, especially if you wish to experience puerto rican food. Would go there again.

44.description: La Plena is an extremely pleasant family-owned restaurant.  Both times I've gone I've been treated like royalty.  A great experience if you don't mind being the only table dining at the time.  Entrees are quite generous, accompanied by rice, beans, and plantains.  Sometimes it is closed unexpectedly; call in advance if coming from afar.

24.description: Its hard to not give these guys 5 stars. Everyone here is so friendly, you feel like your eating at a relatives house. The food is great, home cooked classic Puerto Rican food. I got the Jibarito and my wife got the chicken stew, both were really tastey. We like thats its BYOB and no corkage fee. If your heading to Division street for PR food, this is the spot to be sure and visit.

7.description: Definitely worth a visit.  Easy off street parking.  The staff were very friendly to this "gringo" and his family.  .  I had Puerto Rican food--or so I thought--before and frankly was never all that impressed.  Tasted a lot like Mexican, I thought.  But I decided to give it a try again, and I am glad I did.This experience was completely different.  I felt like I had been invited in to someone's home.  You could see (and smell) the cooking process.  By the time the food arrived, I was already salivating. As I said earlier--definitely worth a visit.

49.description: Fell upon this spot last week and I'm still dreaming about the jibaritos! The owner is super friendly and will patiently walk you through the menu. Pollo was juicy, tostones were crisp and everything was melded together with cheese and garlic aioli (amaze-balls). Will be back!

40.description: The food is delicious. I ate there 2 days in a row this week and will be coming back for 3rd time this week. The Staff, Epi and Cory are so nice and inviting. they greeted me excitedly by my name when I walked thru the door  The parking seem to be pretty good which makes it even more easier to come to. thanks again Epi and Cory and the rest of the staff for great food and atmosphere

53.description: Very delicious Jibarito for a reasonable price.  The only reason they do not get a perfect rating is because they do not have things like papa rellena and alcapurias.  Overall, good food

30.description: Had the roast pork with rice and plantains. Simple dish but done extremely well. I will definitely be back to explore more menu. The whole staff was also very friendly, even while showing up just before closing.

46.description: This food is very authentic and delicious. The prices are very reasonable! It actually tastes better than some of places on the island!

1.description: This is homemade Puerto Rican food. Pollo frito and mofongo are the best items in the menu. The surrounding humboldt park area has several Puerto Rican restaurants. This particular one stands out for its home cook food. Next to the trucks in the parks this is the place to go for PR food.

55.description: The Best Puerto Rican Restaurant ever!! Good food, good company, good prices. VERY VERY CLEAN!!!!I recommend to everyone!!

9.description: As soon as we walked in the owner greeted us. He was so sweet.I love the mural on the wall, showed the many cities that make up Puerto Rico. I ordered the bistec encebollado, it came with rice/beans, salad and plantains. Parcha juice (passion fruit juice) was yummy.My bf got the chuleta frita mofongo.Random: Bathroom was pretty clean

26.description: It is authentic food from the island. The taste is amazing, but the service was horrible... We got there at 7pm and when we order the waiter said that most of the plates weren't available because they were ready to close at 9pm (Yes, two hours after we walked in). Four people walked in at 7:30pm and the waiter basically told them to leave because they were ready to close. Like I said, the food was really good but sadly it's not a place that I would recommend or either go back again.

25.description: Great food. Nice and quick service.  It's a great place to introduce yourself to Pr food. The prices are fair!

12.description: Refused to serve us because "3 tables just came in" uh sure. There were clear open tables and I thought the man was joking until he said we'd have to wait 2 hours.

59.description: I am usually not free with 5-star reviews but this place was great and met all my expectations. Here goes:Visiting Paseo Boricua after my friends insisted I go while I am in Chicago. Unfortunately, we found many places in the area closed on Mondays but not this place! We stopped in for lunch and were greeted by the owner who was very friendly and took time to explain menu items to us. We ordered tostones, I got pasteles and a pina colada and my husband got sierra frita with arroz y gandules.The tostones were great, I did ask for "mayocatchup" which I would recommend anyone do when ordering tostones, he brought some right out and that kicked up the flavor in a great way (There was, by the way, no american cheese in the vicinity of the tostones, as another reviewer mentioned). The pasteles were great and my husband enjoyed his fish, portions were plentiful and the owner chatted with us for awhile about our visit and hometown, I felt welcomed like a guest in his home and would love to go back (which was a nice break from the run of bad service at restaurants we have been experiencing lately). While we were there, there was a guitarist playing at the bar. The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated, bathrooms phenomenal. My husband and I got out the door for just under $30 for a more than plentiful lunch including tip. Would definitely recommend this place and would definitely go back!

21.description: Came here after work with co workers. Since the day was early we were the only ones, which was nice. We were greeted by an older man, I'm assuming the owner. He was nice and told us we can sit wherever we wanted. The place was very nice, clean and the art on the walls were beautiful. Since it was BYOB we brought our bottle of Mascato. Overall the food was good, service good and the place clean. I will definitely will be returning.

17.description: Food was very good but it took 90 minutes to get it. Not really worth the wait. When we complained we were told to order ahead the next time.

10.description: Greeted by the owner, staff very friendly! I didn't understand what coquito was and they gave us a sample and it was so yummy!!! Food was great!

5.description: The combination of a welcoming environment (music and murals), energetic staff (all family), and savory reasonable priced food makes La Plena my go to for Puerto Rican food. I always get the Jibarito sandwich (Chicago classic) and have been tempted to order another one to have for the next day. My friend had the Mofongo which he still dreams about occasionally. The flavor is just on point! To top it off, if you like a beer or wine with your meal, it's BYOB.

3.description: This restaurant is as good as it gets.  Food is fresh, extremely well prepared and the portions are huge.  Staff is super friendly and handled our group of eight with ease.  There was also a group of 25 and they never missed a beat.  I had the steak and onions and my husband had the steak in sauce.  OMG!  I highly recommend.

35.description: First time there and we will def be back. Walking in the restaurant the brightly painted walls gave a good atmosphere. The murals were beautiful and made me want to visit Puerto Rico more than ever ;-) I was greeted to what seemed to be the owner. And his mom (I think also chef) They were very friendly and welcoming.Food:I had the Carne guisada con arroz blanco y habichuela  (just like how my grandma use to make it! It was awesome!) my husband had bistec encebollado con arroz y gandules (he was all over the steak but left a lot of the rice). All in all the food is great, staff was friendly. We will definitely be back ;-)

19.description: This place is simply Puerto Rican cooking at its best.  I took a group of teenagers there for a high school field trip, and they were all impressed.  RICE / ARROZ:  Restaurant-style arroz con gandules usually is a far shot from homemade, but La Plena hits pretty darn close.  Best restaurant-made arroz con gandules I've ever had.PORK / LECHON:  Once again, the best I've had at a restaurant.  So rich and juicy.  And the plaintain it came with, very good. SPEED:  The speed of service isn't that fast, but it's because the food is so homemade and given a lot of care.  There were 17 of us there, and they brought plates out two at a time.  It also gave us time to enjoy the......AMBIANCE:  What a beautiful establishment full of murals depicting all sorts of sites and scenes from Puerto Rico.  That definitely filled some time while we waited for our food.  The owner explained the murals to us.  The parcha to drink... so refreshing.  I highly recommend La Plena.  Puerto Rican dining doesn't get better than this - and that's from me and a group of teens!

28.description: From the second you step foot in la plena you feel like you have been coming here for years. The owner is super friendly. I had the jibarito with lechon and it was by far the best jibarito i've ever ate. I definitely recommend this restaurant, you will not be disappointed!

45.description: Outstanding food. Quality as good as expected. Never a disappointment. I've had most of their dinner dishes and always walk away fulfilled. Very reasonably priced and the service is unbeatable. All the other things like the gazebo looking dirty is nonsense. You're coming here for THE FOOD. Best place for authentic food. I'm a lifer!

33.description: Great Puerto Rican food in a competitive market.  If jibaritos are your thing, there's hardly a better place for them.  BYO!

43.description: Outstanding food, the best place for authentic puertorican food , It's make me feel like I'm in Puerto Rico . Good energy , friendly people but the most important the food was amazing . I recommend this place 100%

2.description: Great food great customer service!!!! Got 2 chicken jibatitos to go rice was great!!!! For sure 2 Thumbs Up!!

18.description: The food is authentic and delicious. The lechon and pastille Is On point. The service is excellent. BYOB is a fantastic idea. My wife and i will definitely return again.

41.description: The arroz con gandules was well seasoned with plenty of beans. The plantains were soft and sweet.  The service was fine and the proprietor was very nice to me.  The problem was the lechon.  I've eaten lechon from a lot of different places, and this was not the best.  Ok, it was awful, just the worst.   Dried up and super-salty.  It even looked dried up like beef jerky. As soon as I saw it, I knew I'd made a mistake ordering it.  It was just incredibly salty.  All I could taste was salt.  Maybe their other entrees are good, but you should stay away from the lechon, unless you're in the mood for jerky.  I could not finish it, not because there was a lot, it was just so salty and dried that it was not worth it, it was so bad, so I threw it away.  Here is some advice to the lechon chef: cut out at least half the salt, and when the cooked meat has dried up after a few days you can throw it away. Microwaving days-old lechon does not work.

52.description: Absolutely love La Plena!  It's a great neighborhood restaurant where all the dishes are made from scratch.  We ordered the Bistec encebollado (steak sauteed with onions) and the Fricases de pollo (chicken stew).  Both were amazing dishes and very generous portions.  I'm happy that I stumbled across this place while in the neighborhood and will definitely be back.

50.description: Wow! This place has excellent, authentic Puerto Rican food! I would definitely recommend it. I went with some friends that are Puerto Rican and they love going here. The food is amazing, the people are friendly & genuine and the ambience is great, making you feel right at home, almost like you're on la isla. The maduros were sweet and crispy and very delicious. El mofongo con lechon was excellent and very tasty. The lechon was tender, juicy and flavorful. Los tostones were crispy and good. Piña Colada was great! The bistec encebollada was delicious. Las habichuelas were ok. El arroz con gandules was good. Overall, this was a great experience!

4.description: Great food, great service. I loved the Sopa de Pollo and Tostones. The food was served quick, the decor is beautiful and the restaurant  is very clean. The owner was friendly  and very funny. We had a great time, I would recommend  this Restaurant.

6.description: If you are looking for the authentic Puerto Rican flavor in Chicago. ..then you must visit LaPlena. This place is well maintained, nicely presented, fitting music selection paying on the background, with excellent food at fair prices and outstanding service with a smile. This was our first time here and after visiting four other PR restaurants in the area, I can say with certainty that La Plena was the best among all of them. I encourage you to come over and make your own mind. I'm very sure you will not be disappointed.

22.description: I'm picky when it comes to Puerto Rican food. One of my closest friends is Puerto Rican so I've had a fair share of home cooked delicious meals from her awesome grandmother. However, I've never had a jibarito before. I know, I know. I also want to punch myself in the face for that.So of course, our awesome server knew right away that my friend and I were going to order that. I got a steak jibarito with arroz con gandules and a side of tostones. The jibarito was pretty good, but they overdid it a bit with the mayo. The rice can't compare with the good stuff from my friend's grandma, but it was still tasty. The tostones were definitely some of the best tostones I've had. They weren't dry and they had a perfect amount of garlic. I ate the whole basket of tostones.It was pretty impressive...but my stomach was going to explode. Customer service was great, definitely felt at home here. Overall, pretty good food and good service, but I'll be exploring other PR places too.

15.description: I just browsed thru yelp and found this five star puertorican restaurant, which that's what I wanted, a five star restaurant well almost but for me is a five star :)... Is was pretty welcoming, family oriented and the service was good too as well... Will recommend friends to come. And would definitely come back again :)...

57.description: I love this restaurant! The food is always delicious and fresh! The server is attentive, and the ambiance is wonderful. The place is really clean too!

20.description: All i have to say is wow....the food here is fresh and mouthwatering.the steak jibarito is sooooo good.the rice with abichuelas is soooo good....mos def a repeat customer

36.description: Enjoyed eating at La Plena in the Humboldt Park area of Chicago.  Unfortunately we went late and they had run out of a lot of things on the menu.  I had a jibarito for the first time, not bad and my husband enjoyed the lechon.Good prices and portions with an authentic P.R. feel to the place that makes me want to go again when I am visiting the Windy City!

14.description: I'm picky when it comes to Puerto Rican food. One of my closest friends is Puerto Rican so I've had a fair share of home cooked delicious meals from her awesome grandmother. However, I've never had a jibarito before. I know, I know. I also want to punch myself in the face for that.So of course, our awesome server knew right away that my friend and I were going to order that. I got a steak jibarito with arroz con gandules and a side of tostones. The jibarito was pretty good, but they overdid it a bit with the mayo. The rice can't compare with the good stuff from my friend's grandma, but it was still tasty. The tostones were definitely some of the best tostones I've had. They weren't dry and they had a perfect amount of garlic. I ate the whole basket of tostones.It was pretty impressive...but my stomach was going to explode. Customer service was great, definitely felt at home here. Overall, pretty good food and good service, but I'll be exploring other PR places too.

1.description: A favorite in the neighborhood. This hidden gem is ideal for the anyone interested in learning! There are so many wonderful books here! The variety of topics is nearly endless; out of print, obscure and famous works can be found in the collection. Looking for a unique gift? It's a great place to find someone that special piece of literature. Most impressed with the large selection and knowledge of Mr.Gippert.

0.description: Along  side of the Bloomingdale Trail and tucked away in a combination ware house combining  artistic studios, For Dog Sakes( that sales organic dog food-see my yelp review for this) and a large truck repair shop, is Kurt Gippert Bookseller. I stumbled across their outdoor book sale and felt like a pirate who discovered a long  buried treasurer. I found "The Complete Political Works of Whittier-1894","170 Chinese Poems", a signed copy of Maxwell Street by Ira Berklow,"Gourmet's Menu Cookbook", and "The Complete Chinese Cook Book". I might pass on the Squirrel, but spicy frog legs, duck, and squid, yum!  All of these were hard back additions, and I brought another ten books, all this for under 35 dollars! Seeing that I'm a serious  bibliophile in the making, the owner took me in the back to see his serious works. Gippert has rare works thousands of years old that sell for thousands of dollars. Most of his business is done online for buyers in New York, where people actually appreciate books!But hey, if you love books, seriously check this place out what ever your budget!

12.description: Definitely the best place I have found in the city for basic guitar/amp head work. Friendly and informative service was a huge plus, this will be the only place I bring my gear to until I manage to find something even better.

3.description: My experiences with Specimen have been few but consistently stellar. Ian is helpful, not condescending, and provides great service. This can be a rarity in the world of guitar music: it contains a lot of guys who are often jerky to girls. Specimen had my Danelectro set up the same day I dropped it off and not only does it few new again - they succeeded in noticeably lowering the action. Ian himself commented that he was very pleased with how it had turned out.Other cool things about Specimen: the location has lots of parking. The space is full of musical oddities that I long to play with but am probably right not to touch. It's peaceful and kind of magical in here.

1.description: Nice guitars but not the greatest place to get your guitar or amp repaired.  Possibly this is dependent on which intern works on your equipment.  More focus on cosmetics and gimmicks than true fidelity.  Of course this is always an opinion of the consumer.

2.description: I've gone to Specimen a few times for bass amp repair, even though this is not their specialty, Ian is straight forward and timely with his repairs. He's also a fascinating person to talk to about the gear he's constructing. (Those horn amps Andrew Bird uses are his invention, and he makes small ones for stereo and computer speakers).There is no store front, so call ahead to see if they can help you out. Then press the Specimen buzzer and wait to be buzzed in (through the door on the left!). On my last visit I had been having some weird issues with my bass head, and was told if it wasn't a tube issue, it may have to go to SWR for repair. A tube was replaced and the next day I got a call! Great service!Guitar-making classes, guitar set-up workshops, vintage guitar and amp repair, these are what Specimen does best. But they've always done right by this bass player, as well!

9.description: Took my Fender Strat to Ian's shop a while back for pickup change and am very satisfied with the workmanship, service and price. Speciman is well respected by musicians in Chicago and I will be taking my guitars there for all my repairs...

10.description: I'm confidant most of Chicago's professional musicians have known and loved Specimen for a long time, but it's probably true that they're not the most likely to write reviews on Yelp (Andrew Bird, you should be up here!).  So, if you're looking for repair, classes, beautiful craftsmanship, just interesting conversation, Specimen has been holding down the fort for 25 years.

4.description: My guitar amp's not vintage or fancy, but I love it.  And when the reverb stopped working, I was sad. Ian and his staff got the little guy sounding its best again in short order. The repairs were efficient and reasonably priced. Ian kept me apprised of progress and called me to ask whether I wanted new tubes installed (a helpful, but not imminently necessary maintenance item). The amp was back to me in a couple of days and sounds much, much peppier and way reverby again. I've also had guitars of varying levels of crappiness set up here in the past, all of which were improved by Specimen's caring work. This is also an extremely cool place to look around, with lots of custom guitars, amps and speakers being constructed right there on the premises. Two important items for weaklings such as myself who prefer not to lug heavy equipment farther than necessary: Street parking right outside their shop is easy, but you will have to carry your shit up one flight of stairs.

6.description: I have taken at least 4 electric guitars in for everything from basic setup to special mods (unity gain buffer installation), took the basic setup class myself, have had an acoustic guitar repaired (crack on top) and have had several amps repaired/given an overhaul.I've found Ian and his team to be not only totally professional and competent, but to be that rare breed of folks who not only don't mind explaining in detail all the work options available, but people who genuinely seem to enjoy talking about what they do, which is clearly a side-benefit to them really enjoying what they do.  These are real professionals, and they aren't bottom-rate in terms of pricing, but they are absolutely fair and reasonable.the workshop is worth a trip in its own right, btw, as Ian builds numerous guitars and amps, and it's a mini-museum.

0.description: Specimen is fabulous.  They've worked on one of my guitars, one of my tube amps, and I've built 2 tube amps in classes (those amps are fab). I've also watched the techs working on guitars and amps.   There's tremendous care, and an old school sensibility of doing it right and making it last forever.

5.description: Love this place! Myself and my whole band have had *tons* of work on our guitars/basses/amps at specimen. They have awesome prices, do top of the line work, and have a faster turnaround than any other shop I've ever been too. Ian, the owner, knows his stuff like you wouldn't believe and has been able to find solutions to virtually any kind of problem we've thrown at him. He's actually completely saved our asses on multiple occasions by finding quick fixes for things the have broken day of a show or studio session. I absolutely recommend trying specimen. Really good people and they do great work with personal service.

13.description: Great and respectable place to bring your gear. They will give you honest opinions on your gear, which is more valuable than just getting a quick fix.

11.description: I love a man with a vision.  Ian Schneller is a mad genius with guitars and amps and creates unique instruments that are both useful and beautiful.  His horn speakers are absolutely beautiful-- what I wouldn't give to have at least 2-3 of these in my house.  It is nice to know that Chicago's long history of manufacturing quality musical instruments is continuing at Specimen.  Please go visit!

8.description: I just returned from attending a three day class at Specimen, where we built a reproduction Deluxe amp from a Mojo Tone kit.  While I have been a guitar player for over 30yrs, the inner workings of tube amps have always been more than a little mysterious, leaving me at the mercy of friends who know more, or repair guys.  My knowledge consisted of soldering basics, where the fuse is located, and what happens when you incorrectly exchange tubes (smoke and fire) Attending this class seemed like a good way to learn, and have a nice amp at it's completion.  I'm happy to say that the class exceeded all my expectations.  I cannot remember spending three full days, completely absorbed in something so interesting and satisfying.  Ian Schneller is equal parts artist, mad scientist, and gifted teacher.  He was patient, funny, and extremely generous in sharing his hard won experience about how to, and how not, to assemble and wire our amps.  A bonus to the class, was exposure all the other incredible things Ian does in his shop (an incredible space)...one of a kind speakers, extraordinary handmade guitars, and custom amps.  I plan on going back to build one of Ian's hi-fi amps, as well as purchasing a pair of his Little Horn speakers.  I would enthusiastically recommend attending one of Ian's classes, as well as consulting him for guitar or amp repair.  Check out his comprehensive website, and feel free to email me with questions about the class I attended.

14.description: This is how guitar shops used to be. Mom and pop owned places that had their own personality, their own tastes, likes, and dislikes, and their shop and inventory reflected that. These days with the dumbed down lowend-crap pushing Guitar Centers and all the mall "something for everyone but nothing for me" kind of places, it's a rare comfort to visit places like Specimen. Ian has a vision. No, it may not jive with what most shredders and riff-monkeys might want, but he doesn't seem to care. He follows his vision and makes very unique and well playing instruments that appeal to a somewhat niche buyer/player. His school for guitar and amp making opens his shop up to anyone who wants to get their hands dirty and wants to learn the craft of building their own. Ian's craftsmanship is second to none and his instruments are as well playing and sounding as they are beautiful works of art. I own two of his instruments and look forward to more in the years to come.

7.description: Specimen is NOT a typical store -- there is no storefront, there is no parking lot, there isn't even a sign in sight.  It's completely different, and that's exactly what makes Specimen stand out!  Set within a giant warehouse, there are several "works in progress" scattered throughout in various levels of completion.  Even if you aren't a seasoned musician, you will find this place intriguing.  If you've ever wondered what goes into the making of a guitar, amps, etc, Specimen is your little piece of heaven on earth.Ian restored an (approximately) 40-year old guitar to perfect playing condition.  He was courteous, professional, clearly talented, and extremely pleasant through the entire process.  I cannot possibly say enough great things about this place.A friend of mine recommended Specimen, and I am eternally grateful to him (thanks, Dave).  I was initially skeptical about taking my family heirloom to a place that wasn't ranked on Yelp (there were no reviews when I first dropped off my guitar), but now I cannot imagine going elsewhere.

3.description: Came here after work late night. In no man land, west of Kimball on North. If you find yourself in this area, surely go here, it's a find. Went around 1am and this place was POPPING. Take out line was nearly out the door. Decided to sit down, why not? Lotta people there, including cops, which is always a good thing - they know the yummy places! Got a steak burrito and chorizo taco for under $10 pre tip. And the burrito was huge! And awesome! That was with avocado too. The chorizo was extra flavorful, along with the steak. Really really good. Quick service considering how slammed they were. Salsa was fresh and delicious. For sure will come back since it is close to me. I saw enchiladas were around $8. Must try!

1.description: This place is great for those after the club, party, or whatever type of late night you have that leaves you craving tacos. You will probably be too drunk or tired to care that the service is bad, which won't even matter when all you want to do is fulfill your drunk cravings. I speak from experience.  (LOL)Today I was sober and visited the restaurant, eh totally different experience.I was able to fully soak in all that was bad... The table salas were sour (?) , the waitresses appeared to be on a different planet, I had to request drinks, straws and silver ware (because my plate was delivered, and I sat there wondering if they wanted me to use my hands) um ok? I ordered a cheese enchiladas plate, it came with beans, rice, and the typical lettuce on the side. I must say that the beans were delicious! Everything else was so so.

2.description: This place has amazing food and I am so glad I came here on a friend's recommendation.  He lives in the neighborhood and says that this place has hands down, THE BEST Mexican food.  My instructions were to the get the salsa verde, horchata and a torta. Si, mi amigo... y gracias.(This place might have formerly been "Birrias Huentitan" but their menus have been updated to "Taqueria Huentitan.")WHAT I ORDERED (DINE-IN):1) Small horchata2) Lengua taco with onion and cilantro3) Carne Asada tortaAfter you seat yourself at a booth, a kind server will place chips & salsa on the table.  The salsa was searingly hot and fresh, has a kick that lasts for a second, and keeps you re-dipping your chips then re-sipping horchata for the cool down.I devoured the lengua taco in a heartbeat and could have eaten a few more but I had to save room for the torta.  The lengua was tender and so, so good, the salsa verde a great complement.  The simple ingredients (lengua, diced onion, chopped cilatro and two corn tortillas) and made the best taco.  Next time, I could just order a whole bunch of tacos and call it a happy day.The torta was also great, in a way that the buns were brushed with butter/oil and then toasted.  The neatness of how it was put together (unlike other tortas I've had), framed each layer of lettuce avocado, tomato, mayonnaise, lettuce and al pastor.  It was stuffed to the max and... get this, they put AVOCADO in their tortas (not just as an extra)!You know like when you eat a towering, stacked burger and the moment you take a bite, it becomes an ugly mess?  This will not happen to your Huentitan torta.  It's perfect.  They've perfected everything.  And I should really wrap this up or I can keep going.  The only words you'll ever need to know here: tacos, horchata and salsa verde.

5.description: This was the SPOT during my younger years! I remember almost every weekend after a booze fueled night we would stop he here at 2,3,4 am and there would still always be a line! Don't get it twisted though, the same cooks from like 15 yeas ago are still in the kitchen,and they move so fast its unbelievable. They don't write anything down,they look at you, say "what you want?" then execute your order in lightning fast speed.The food is very affordable, fresh and tastes good when your sober but tastes incredible when you are drunk LBVS. With that being said DO NOT DINE IN!!! This is the kinda place you wanna just  grab and go. Although there is plenty of seating to dine in, should you choose to do so keep in mind you will be solicited by several people to for money and or to buy socks, perfume etc throughout your entire  meal. Its also the hood so you never wanna stay still to long, keep it moving. So if your passing by late at night and your hungry its definitely worth stopping for a quick taco fix.

6.description: A hidden gem. Fast, cheap, delicious, and the portions are ridiculously generous. Well worth a 10-minute walk from the west end of the 606.

0.description: We got a to-go order. food was GOOD, but they messed up my order. Can someone answer me how much avocado in burrito is? Is it .50 more? Anyway, I ordered taco dinner with 3 extra tacos, 2 dinner burritos and 1 reg. I went over it repeatedly with the cook and he even reiterated it to me.Also, they didn't tell me that they'd charge extra if I chose a taco dinner, 1 taco being lengua. I heard them talk about it in the back amongst themselves, but they never told me regardless. Once I got home I realized there are no rice and beans for the 2 burritos. Thankfully enough, they charged me accordingly, I think.

4.description: I just ordered from Taqueria Huentitan with my significant other, and we got quite disappointed.First, the website said the order would be delivered around 10:25pm and 10:35pm, but it arrived at 10:02pm. Which sounded great, since we were super hungry. But the deliver guy was super rude, he didn't say a word and just handed it to me. Not even goodbye. It might have taken me a couple of minutes to get outside, but I was totally not ready for the order to come. It's winter time dude, you don't go out in pyjamas. When we unpacked the food, well... at first it looked ok, but then I opened my taco and saw meat inside (I'm vegan), whereas I ordered a vegetarian one. Also, our fresh orange juice had been thrown without any form of support in a paper bag, itself in a plastic bag. As a result, and without any surprise, we opened the paper bag and discovered a pool of orange juice, and a plastic glass floating inside. There was a little left in it, that we tasted. Too bad, it was really good. Maybe you should train your delivery people a bit better. And take better care of the way you pack your orders.I give 2 stars because the food was fresh and tasted ok. My spanish rice was not very tasty but not bad either, the guacamole was good (not exceptionnal), and my girlfriend's burrito was good, althought the pastry was a bit undercooked.

3.description: Ian's gallery is the spot to be when you want to get creative. Ian is a true teacher and mentor. Ian really likes to interact with students and give them positive feedback on their creativity. He is a very positive mentor. Ian provides a fun space for people to really dig a little deeper into their imagination. Ian is a passionate artist with a great gallery where people can have a relaxing class.

1.description: I have been to many art gallery's before for Byob wine and painting and this was not what I was expecting. The instructor I think his name is Ian seemed strange (couldn't make eye contact) and when I asked for advice on how to do a technique he wasn't helpful at all he was so short with me (made me feel like I'm stupid for not knowing how) He then walked away and carried on talking with the other women. Maybe he knew them but I felt really awkward almost like he was flirting with them or was mad cause I asked for advice/help. The place was dirty and I just felt out of place. However the space is nice but service wasn't.

2.description: I have been to BYOB painting classes with groups of friends two times. The first was at his old location and the second time was at his new location. Both spaces are great and I have had a fantastic time each time. There was a nice groupon deal the first time. You bring your own drinks and then have the opportunity to create/paint whatever you want. If you want to work off of a picture, Ian will help guide you and show you different techniques you could use. If you want to go abstract, he will show you ways you can play around. I love doing classes there (and would more often if I had the money), because you get to be creative, do your own thing, and hang out with your friends. Everyone's painting looks different too, which I love.

5.description: I have taken two "wine and painting" classes with Ian. Not only is it a totally fun weekend activity to do with friends, it is also a great way to meet people and socialize in a new way. Ian sets himself apart from teachers in similar venues in the way that he interacts with his students. Ian makes the effort to develop an individual relationship with each and every one of his students. He is seriously invested in seeing every painter go home with a piece that they created and are happy with. If you don't finish, he offers to send you home with supplies, invites you to come back to work on it, and continues to reach out to see how things are going. It is rare to meet such a genuinely kind and generous person. The gallery is clearly much more than a business for Ian. He strives to create a community and invites every painter to think of his gallery space as "home". I have only worked with him twice, yet I feel like I have a friendship with him.In addition to being a fantastic art teacher, Ian is an extremely talented artist himself. He is very passionate about his work and will gladly describe his artistic process and talk to you about any given piece for as long as you will let him. He is very inspiring to talk to and seems to awaken the artist within each and every individual. You will not be disappointed!

0.description: We have been to the gallery twice and there is a reason behind that. When we first signed up for the class, we were not too sure what we were getting ourselves into. I have walked by other painting classes and have seen HUGE groups of people painting the same thing while the instrutor was in the front on a headset microphone. But this was not the case with Ian. We had a small intimate group, which means we got pleanty of attention.When we walked in, the studio was clean and had beautiful pictures displayed. Ian was very personable and made our group very comfortable from the beginning. He gave us a demonstration and stepped back and let us run wild with our ideas. He checked in with each person and gave useful tips for each piece. Its crazy how we were all in doubt of our skills before we walked in, and walked out IN LOVE with our creations! Ian really brought out the artist in us all. I then went back with another group and they all loved it as much as my first group did.Can't wait to come back for more!

4.description: I am so happy to have found this art gallery! I've attended two art classes here, and I always have a great time! The classes are BYOB, and they usually provide some finger food. Ian (the artist/teacher) starts off by showing the us a couple of cool abstract techniques that we could incorporate into our art. But what I really love most about this class is that Ian will help you with a drawing/painting idea that YOU want to create. I've seen some of my FB friends attend other art classes... and the whole class would work on the same drawing/painting! I mean, not ever person wants to draw the Brooklyn Bridge or a vase of flowers! I wanted to paint a unicorn! And a unicorn is exactly what I painted. :) Any who, you can bring in your own ideas and paint it! I would recommend printing out a couple ideas that you would like to paint or saving your ideas on your phone. Make sure to charge your phone and bring your charger just in case.

58.description: Went there for a date with the girlfriend, the lady at the front was really nice and helped us out with everything. Reminded me of my Titi from back home. Also helped out my Mexican girlfriend figure out what to eat. Really great customer service and great food.

56.description: I travel 45 minutes every time, each way to eat here. Love it! I feel like I'm back home everytime. Love the jibarito sandwich and the pernil :)

29.description: Love this place. If your new to PR food then come here. You have a bunch of options before your very eyes.  Great food, pleasant people and good service.

42.description: I just went in here yesterday, the lady who served us was really sweet. I had never had plantains, so she gave me two different types to try first and then prepared a vegetarian jibarito for me. Their caramel flan was also really good! Definitely go here if you want go get some peurto rican food in Chicago!

23.description: If you are looking for a place to eat or planning a big event, I highly recommend La Palma!!!!!   When planning an event, ask for Antonia, she is the best!!  I needed paStelillos and arroz con gandules for 250 people, delivered to the southwest side at   9am, and Antonia made it happen!  The food was fresh, delicious, and delivered on time.  Thanks to Antonia, I had hundreds of happy teenagers (and that never happens).  She took about 20 phone calls and a thousand questions and helped me every step of the way when planning the event.  I could not be happier with the food and service that we received!!

47.description: Best Jibarito in Chicago!!Their food is delicious and cheap.The staff is super friendly, they make you feel like you are eating at a friend's house.If I lived closer I would have to get there by rascal scooter because of how large I would be from eating at La Palma every day of my life!Keep it up!HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

8.description: Just finished eating at this place the second time around and it's even more delicious than the first. They have a special jibarito called the el chapo...a traditional jibarito with a Mexican twist. The meat is full of flavor and extra tender. The employee Antonia always greets us with love. The appetizers (papas rellenas) are also very delicious and the prices are very affordable. Hands down the best Puerto Rican food I've stumbled upon.

31.description: They catered an event I helped plan in October. Food was amazing (according to everyone too!) ... Tastes authentic. Just as good as eating in PR

34.description: The food here is good for what it is-a Puerto Rican buffet. The yellow rice doesn't taste like authentic Puerto Rican rice  and was bland; it tastes more like Mexican rice to me. The jibarito was whatever. I was really disappointed because I had a taste for the kind of Puerto Rican food that my grandma would make and I thought it would be good, considering how many stars they have. I wouldn't come here again.

16.description: This is a tiny nondescript place that is part self-serve and part service but the food is the main attraction!I'm Puerto Rican, born and raised in NYC and grew up on this food and I have to say.....this is the BEST pernil and arroz con gandules I have ever had in my life.  The pastelillo was not so good (hard and dense) but the pernil and arroz con gandules is to die for. Check it out!!!!!

13.description: Amazingggg food and hospitable service. Very welcoming. My new favorite spot. The owner greeted us as we came in and introduced us to all the specials.

11.description: First. The food is awesome but they charge you extra and be like oh well. My mom and I went here, my mom got Bacalao and  Malanga, she told the server she wanted the dinner. He put 5 pieces of Malanga n a spoon of bacalao. They lady charged us saying malanga  only comes with dinner  if it's 4 pieces! Then said we had too much bacalao...the server gave us food we only told him wat we wanted...smh she was jus like oh well take it up wit The Manager Orlando. I will not go back here because  it's always a problem  with them charging us extra for something.

39.description: Good Puertorican Food!

37.description: This place is amazing! The food was amazing! And oh my gosh the manager was the sweetest person ever! This will be the first place I go when I come back to Chicago =)

0.description: Today November 11,2015. We met the sweetest woman named Antonia Rodriguez.  I told her we was visiting from California. I told her we came all this way for her food.   She took great care of us right away.  The food is cafeteria style meaning you serve yourself mostly.  I had the Puerto Rican rice with roasted pork. My wife had white rice with beans and beef stew.  My wife's food and mine  was absolutely delicious.  We also had a two sandwiches that Antonia suggested one steak and the other chicken.  Oh my god the meat was so tender and juicy.  I'm Puerto Rican so the food is like my mom's.  If we have time we will get some to take home back to California.  We both highly recommend the food and the hospitality of Antonia.  Amazing food,  Carlos Guzman

38.description: amazingggg jibarito sandwich. seriously...AMAZING. on par with all of the other great reviews. love the character of the place and staff.

51.description: I don't give out Five stars but for this place i would give them 10.. they keep it simple no frills no fuss, Great food Great Service.. the only thing that would make this place better is if they delivered(HINT HINT)... But all in all I must say #1 spot for my PR food Fix...
