27.description: My first Puerto Rican restaurant! I have always wanted to try a jibarito and finally decided to come to Humboldt Park to try one. Definitely glad I did. The plantain was fried perfectly and the meat was juicy and seasoned well.

32.description: La Palma has the BEST jibarito sandwiches in town! I have tried them at other locations but NO ONE can top La Palma Restaurant. Try steak or chicken, DELICIOUS...I've enjoyed both. I visit frequently at least once or twice a week for lunch/dinner. The jibarito sandwich has so much flavor. I'm hooked! Every time I visit the service is excellent. The owner and staff are friendly and welcoming. Never had a bad experience. An experience every Chicagoan or visitor MUST have!! Definitely 5 stars!!!

54.description: Ever since wanting to cut gluten from my life, I have been trying to find a sandwich option. Enter, the jibarito. My friends and I went here on Friday the 13th and each ordered one of these wondrous delicacies. We didn't even specify what meat. We were told to sit and wait and they would arrive at our table. We received steak. While the meat is tremendous and the plantain "bread" was a great change-of-pace, it was the phenomenal garlic sauce that made this thing unbeatable.This place vows that you will not leave hungry. Well, it was so delicious that we tested that theory by each ordering another round, this time pork. This must have been taken as a challenge because the second sandwich was even more jammed full of meat along with more pork on the side along with some fresh chicharrons. This one was even better, we all agreed. Next time, I will have to try the chicken, maybe two. Just amazing.

48.description: Let me start off by saying that I myself am Puerto Rican so I know a little something about Puerto Rican cuisine.  After reading the rave reviews this place had I decided to try it out, after all we are always looking for good Puerto Rican restaurants. I've had better! I can only assume that the people who wrote the reviews either have no clue what Puerto Rican food is supposed to taste like or they know the owners. Walking in there's no clear direction as to where to go to order your food, aside from that there's no way to know how much you will be paying for the food you select so basically they can charge me whatever they feel like charging me and I wouldn't even know. The majority of the food they have under the heat lamp is dried up. Why would they sell that to their customers. When I pointed that out to the woman who I assumed was the owner or manager she said I know but it will take 20min for me to make you a fresh one (talking about the blood sausage). I bought some anyway because my daughter was insisting she wanted some and as I suspected it was dry and hard to eat. They don't seem to remove the nerves or fat from the steak so even though the flavor was tasty it was ruined by me having to pull that grossness out of my mouth. Why doesn't the woman at the steam table speak English!?!? C'mon now! It's 2014 people. Even speaking Spanish didn't help me communicate with this woman so I finally just pointed at stuff and nodded. The pasteles were flavorless, a disgrace to our heritage. We will never buy food from this place again. We will continue our search for the perfect Puerto Rican restaurant.

44.description: It used to be fantastic. The food now is pretty normal. Nothing extraordinary, but their pork is still their number 1 thing. That alone is 4 stars.

24.description: Oh man where to begin..... Let me start by saying I'm Puerto Rican and have tried plenty of prican food around this area.  I have to say that I was so disappointed, I had been looking forward to going to this place all week.  I went on a Saturday afternoon, was not crowded.  when I walked in I literally said to myself "what the fu@$" its so small inside hardly room to walk.  We got a table quick were greeted nicely.  I went to the bathroom and right away I knew the place was going to suck.  No it wasn't dirty, it was ghetto!!! The toilet paper just sitting on a ledge where literally everyone is touching the whole roll! Sick!!! The paper towels are located outside the bathroom (wtf).  Oh and forgot to mention I was with 3 other ppl.  2 of us ordered the jibarito with arroz con gandules and habichuelas. The other person ordered a pork chop w/rice and beans. Ok so the food wasn't the worst I've had but not the best and the quantity SUCKS!! My jibarito was so small, but I'm also use to the big ones that were served @ boriquen.  Anyhow while I'm eating some (gangbanger type of looking dude) walks in with his gf and kid sit at the table next to us and literally I lost my appetite after listening to him talk very loudly saying and I quote "I was raised by nig$ers so I don't speak Spanish" omg I was ready to just stand up and leave but unfortunately my friends were still eating! This place is just so poorly ran.  I think it gets all the hype bc of the style of how they present the food and all of the options.  That doesn't mean its good though.  Why would u want to eat pork chops or anything else fried sitting under a lamp? I believe this dump was even announced on TV for great prican food. This place is an embarrassment to prican food. I would never return.  I also noticed a lot of the customers are usuals that live close by (listening on the convos).  Oh and by the way one of the other biggest disappointments, I was really looking forward to eating the rum cake.....its literally yellow cake out of a box with rum on it $3 a slice.  Seriously can't even make the cake from scratch. This place is a dump.

7.description: Ordered food from La palma for my daughter's party. Ordered the following:Pernil: delicious,not dry and people loved it.Arroz con gandules: goodPastelillos: delicious. Sadly I had one from their grab and go display when I went to pay the balance of my order... and that one was stale. But the ordered ones were fresh, tasty and on point.Papa rellena: good. Pollo guisado: a little oily but good flavor .My family and friends enjoyed the food and I was happy to have ordered from them. Antonia who handled my order was super nice and just great to work with. I also purchased from the grab and go area an alcapurria and it was by far in my opinion one of the best I've tried. Crispy outside, tender inside with a great flavor. I was so pleased.Also ate their tembleque (coconut custard type of flan) which was off the hook delicious!! Its a little place but they have a decent goal of pleasing their customers with home made Puerto Rican food!  Happy

49.description: La Palma Puerto Rican Restaurant is a prime example of why the WeDeliver team LOVES what it does. Not only does La Palma provide authentic, delicious AND nutritious Puerto Rican cuisine, but it continues to strengthen a 15-plus-year relationship with the Humboldt Park community. The fact that we can do our small part and ease the delivery process for a neighborhood staple like La Palma is at once exciting and humbling.The food is rich with flavor and tradition. La Palma graciously served the food at our last celebration of community, and not a forkful of food survived! Thank you Rolando, Jessica, and the entire team at La Palma; your cooking is magnificent and your warmth and sense of community is inspiring. Our delivery specialists, many of whom are from the neighborhood, have told us how thrilled they are to provide you same day delivery and extend the La Palma brand to all corners of Chicagoland.

40.description: I died and went to heaven. I don't care where you live in Illinois, please come by and check out La Palma.I am well traveled and been to major cities to eat - I am a foodie and La Palma is a treat!Head Cater was cool and provided other recommendation on the menu.I'll be back!

53.description: OMG I'm still hurting. My whole family is sick today. We went to a birthday party yesterday and our host catered from here and today we are ALL paying the price. After research on what everyone had we narrowed it down to the ground beef "PASTELONE" dish. Even my little boy got sick. My older son had everything except that and he woke up fine today. Even the host of the party called to apologize. Over 15 people today had a special event with their toilets. Sorry guys for the tough review, I love Puerto Rican food but I love my family more.

30.description: Best Puerto Rican food outside of my mother-in-law's kitchen.  We recently moved to Chicago and we were lucky to find this little slice of heaven.  The Jibarito (both steak and pork) is one of the 5 best things I've ever eaten.  Alcupurias, slow roasted pork and rice and beans are out of this world.  Antonia runs the show making you feel like family.  She recently came through for us when we wanted to make last minute additions to our already large carry out order for the holidays.  Would recommend this place to the novice and experienced eater of Puerto Rican cuisine.  The staff is super friendly and will help you choose and try items off their menu.

46.description: Located in the heart of Humbolt Park, I must say I was a bit weary coming here to dine in but a friend assured me that this was the spot. I was worried because I am not puerto rican and i didn't know if they were going to be friendly with me. We enter and see a charming little place with a "cafeteria" feel. A real mom and pop type place that is serving up quality food. There are two sections of food. Fried food in one display case (Self serve) for your choosing, and the individual type of foods in the other case (they serve you). Of course I had to choose my favorite, Chicharrones fried crispy, arroz con gandules, and bistec guisado. Best choices I could have ever made! These people don't skimp on their serving sizes either. The arroz con gandules was so flavorful and  soft without having an over powering taste. It was the perfect accompaniment to the chicarrones. The Bistec guisado was a stewed beef, stewed so long that the meat was fork tender and sweet. LOVED IT! I also tried the plantain ball with meat inside and that was TO DIE FOR! It was so crispy on the outside and soft in the inside, how did you guys do it? Magic? Yeah I know it was magic. The service was good and they were very nice to me. I am glad they welcomed me in their restaurant to eat some delicious puerto rican fare.

1.description: I honestly hate writing bad reviews, especially for small business's but I just have to. My mom was in town and being Puerto Rican, she was obsessed with the idea of going to Humboldt Park. I'm new to Chicago so I looked up reviews, decided on this place and head over to Humboldt Park.My mom grew up in poor neighborhoods and I have family still residing in poor areas but this area is just ew. Dirty, dingy, eerily empty streets and the restaurants connecting apartment (I'm assuming is part of the restaurant) had wood/cardboard covering broken windows.The place is ok. It really is Puerto Rican in the sense that it looks like one of those little dingy shacks where they sell food for cheap in Puerto Rico. The food is decent, not the best. The alcapurrias tasted like they were mixed with flour or something to make them look bigger and the meat in them wasn't that good. The only good thing here is the Sorrullos. They are Delicious! The service is horrible. The young cashier girl and the dark skinned older woman in the kitchen were really nice people but the owner is so mean and treats the staff badly. She berated the young girl for getting paper stuck in the register. I felt so uncomfortable, she went IN on her. Poor girl. All in all, it's an ok spot but I think theres better places to eat some Puerto Rican food.

55.description: So, I went to this restaurant today. I was craving Puerto Rican food. The place isn't the nicest area, the restaurant is small. However the employees were very nice and friendly, and the food was very good, I wouldn't say the best Puerto Rican food I ever had but very good indeed. Bottom line, I would return to eat there again.

9.description: La Palma is one of my favorite restaurants in all Chicago! Happened on this place when I used to live in the neighborhood, but come back just for a jibarito or the chicken stew with rice and beans as often as I can. If you're not sure what to get, ask Antonia for a recommendation, she'll hook you up!

26.description: Had taste for pasteles and stopped in here for some with some co workers. Order arroz gandules and chicken. Awesome food very tasty and the meat fell off the bone. Steak and onions where tasty add well. Nice little joint to sit down and eat

25.description: So I came here a couple of weeks ago with my son and mom, bc they wanted PR food, and my mom LOVES this place.  We used to come very often before, and BEFORE the food was DELICIOUS!! I'm rating the place on my most recent experience, here is my review: The place was packed, but we found a table to sit at.  Since it was my cheat day, I decided to go all out.  Picked a porkchop and a pincho, and lechon, I couldn't wait to sink my teeth into.  Ordered mine and my son's rice and habichuelas.  Rice and habichuelas on point. Porkchop, cold and stiff, pincho, cold and stiff, the meat was like rocks.  Couldn't indulge on the 2 items I picked and had my mouth watering!! SMH.  Mom's food was ok, and so was my son's.  The kicker...when I went to pay the bill.  Over $30 for the entire thing....smh.  Despite me mentioning that the food wasn't great.  I won't be coming back.

12.description: This place used to be really good about 13 years ago. I recently went and the jibarito was so small.  And the prices have gone up.  Food was good but don't think I will be returning anytime soon.

59.description: The BEST!!!!!! OMG it was good.  It's like walking into your friends house and there mother is right there to make you a home cooked meal

21.description: Love, Love, Love Puerto Rican food! I went to this place in my teens so it had been a while since I last went here. I moved up north so it is harder or just longer to get here. My daughter was craving her P.R. food so we decided to take the drive. It was well worth it. The food is still delicious! We had the carne guisada (beef stew), arroz con gandules (rice with peas), and relleno de papa (stuffed potato). I'm getting hungry now just writing about it!

17.description: HELL TO THE MOTHA F N-O......no no no people this isnt what ppl should think is the AUTHENTIC puerto rican food experience.  The real experience is food made to order, not food sitting under food lamps, go to mcds for that crap!! Ok so when you walk in they greet you like they know you, ok, thats cool but if your making me feel like im home then cook like you at home.  Everything is sitting in food warmers and the portions especially for the jibaritos are extremely small!  Not worth the money and one more thing i made add,  i think they have too much on the menu, i think they should shorten it and focus on making a few things taste great.  Too many things on the menu and most of them are so bland.....thats all i have to say, theres just so many great places in chicago to get pr food, this isnt one of them.

10.description: Delicious food! I had the pollo guisado, arroz con gandules and habichuelas pintas. All so tasty! Friendly service, and great prices for the portions. I will make this a staple. Can't wait to try the desserts!

5.description: This place is amazing! I love Puerto Rican food! I stopped in to get my bf some Puerto Rican food since he had never had it! They are super friendly and super quick and super sweet! I would definitely recommend coming here! The service was awesome! And the food was great! Arroz con gandules! Pernil! Alcapurrias! Mm mm MMM

3.description: First time entering this Puerto Rican restaurant, and I was in disbelief how clean, neat and welcoming the staff was. They have all there food in display where you can see all the food and how fresh it looks. I tried there vegetarian jibarito in stead if had vegetables and yuca did not need meat at all. I also tried there coconut flan it's a must try desert!

35.description: Delicious jibaritos, but not a lot of seating so go eat in Humboldt Park! Service was pretty slow, but I might have just been really hungry?

19.description: So I came here a couple of weeks ago with my son and mom, bc they wanted PR food, and my mom LOVES this place.  We used to come very often before, and BEFORE the food was DELICIOUS!! I'm rating the place on my most recent experience, here is my review: The place was packed, but we found a table to sit at.  Since it was my cheat day, I decided to go all out.  Picked a porkchop and a pincho, and lechon, I couldn't wait to sink my teeth into.  Ordered mine and my son's rice and habichuelas.  Rice and habichuelas on point. Porkchop, cold and stiff, pincho, cold and stiff, the meat was like rocks.  Couldn't indulge on the 2 items I picked and had my mouth watering!! SMH.  Mom's food was ok, and so was my son's.  The kicker...when I went to pay the bill.  Over $30 for the entire thing....smh.  Despite me mentioning that the food wasn't great.  I won't be coming back.

28.description: I go often and I must say they are very nice and have good service.  I have ordered for pick up and sat and ate. Either way they are nice and friendly. Its a small place but nice.  Hopefully they do good and expand and open other locations so people all over the city can taste the food.  I will be going back as I have been.. It's my weakness.. Lol

45.description: Dudes...if you like plantains get the jibarito with sweet plantains and chicken...its tender and expertly seasoned! All the desserts all delicious, the rum cake in particular is not for the faint of heart (heavy on the rum just like I like it)!!!

33.description: Where do I begin.. Let's start with the big girl behind the counter with no customer service as soon as we walked in that should have been an indication of it's not gonna be a good experience! She had a fock it look on her face! We seated out self, no problem.. Ok/ the place was empty, second red flag...Then we ordered the man brought the food out to our table to us, he was nice, but the food was blan with not much flavor, worse part the entire meal was cold, the pork the steak sandwiches and rice! All cold!!  Worst pr food I ever had! Now I check my receipt and see she effin over charged me and shorted me on my change too! Wow!!...!!!I won't go back and I'll make sure I tell my friends and my huge pr family how much this place suck$. Btw thanks yelp for the bs reviews that said this place was 4/ stars!

43.description: I was pleasantly surprised by the food here. Being a native Puerto Rican (I moved to the States three years ago), I am always looking for good PR food when I'm homesick. Unfortunately, I haven't had the best of luck... until I went to Las Palmas today. After 6 hours of being on the road, my husband and I were starving so we Yelped Puerto Rican food and this came up. It doesn't look like much from the outside. Inside, you have the option to create your own "to go" plate (you literally serve yourself) or ask them to make you a plate if you are dining in. They have everything to typical Puerto Rican fritters (alcapurrias, rellenos de papa, empanadillas, etc) to comfort food (lechon asado-pork, carne guisada-beef stew, pollo guisado-chicken stew, white rice and beans, rice with pigeon peas, cuajito-pig ear stew, etc). You can also order "Jibarito" Sandwiches (meat with fried plantains instead of bread. I had the beef stew with white rice and my husband had the lechón (pork), both were delicious and flavorful. I asked for an order of fried plantains (tostones) and they were made to order (fresh, not frozen). I had a piece of vanilla flan which was ok. It had good flavor but I prefer flan to be creamy which this one wasn't. Overall, the staff was very inviting except for the lady that cashed us out who refused to answer me when I spoke to her in Spanish and then went off to speak Spanish with someone on the phone. The food was very authentic. It reminded me of home.I loved the food there and would go back in a heartbeat whenever I am in Chicago again.

2.description: Needs salt!!!!The food looks amazing but it's so tasteless and bland that once it goes into your mouth its disappointing.Don't get me wrong it's as authentic as Puerto Rican food gets but it's so bland and disappointing. Myself and my girlfriend found ourselves with our hands attached to the salt shaker. I love Puerto Rican food and so does my girlfriend but this one lacked the explosion of taste in  your mouth that Puerto Rican food has. They are know for their sofrito and delicious condiments but this food was just bland. The rice, lechon and tamales were well made just bland and tasteless.

18.description: The jibarito sandwich here is on point. Authentic borinquen food here. I miss the cuchifritos of NYC. This is the closest thing to hometown goodness in the CHI. My favorite spot in the windy city when visiting the fam in Humbolt. Juepa!

41.description: Food is delicious comfort Puerto Rican food!  Hits the spot and makes you feel right at home.

52.description: La Palma's makes a damn good Jibarto. One of the best I've ever had honestly and I've tried a lot of Jibarto's. The steak is so tender and bursting with flavor. I will definitely be making a return visit to La Palma's.

50.description: Love this place. They catered our event tonight and the food was a hit. All the food was great, but I'm glad they had veggie options.

4.description: Great place to have lunch.  The peppersteak was tender enough to cut with a spoon. The variety is about six different entrees. Whenever I'm in the hood this is a go to spot..

6.description: The service was good and the ladies were awesome! They were really friendly and took time to explain what the food items were. It was our first time eating at a Puerto Rican place! The portions are big too. We saw several people thinking it was a pick up order type but were highly encouraged to dine-in as we were.

22.description: The food was awful. I paid $25 and the only thing edible was a piece of malanga, and yuca. The rice was edible but had little flavor and with the juice from the chicken it became salty. Chicken/potatoes were so salty, I couldn't eat them and the pork was overcooked to the point that it was tough and couldn't eat. I would recommend going a little more north for way better food. I also ordered 2 pasteles, again no flavor. This really is not what real Puerto Rican food taste like!

15.description: I ordered food for a special event, the meat was smelly, and was almost spoiled and pink. We spent over $200, and we had to throw it all out. The rice was overcooked and mushy. It's not worth a single penny for this over priced food. One would think when given food for a catered event it would be done professionally. Should be called La Lies for what they offer. We didn't go back to even confront them about it, because of course they would deny these accusations. Last year our food was under cooked, this year it was cooked too much. And their pasteles were tasteless, and they charge so much for this kind of food? I'd be embarrassed to call it Puerto-rican food.You can't fool this Hispanic!

57.description: Amazing food!!!!

20.description: Giving 1 star to this place! The server/Prepper was very rude and my white rice was hard as if they served it from the bottom of the pot. Piece of advice you are in the service industry and most important part is to give the best service because that's what keeps people coming back. Hopefully the owner reads this and gets on top of his employees. Good luck!

36.description: The best Puerto Rican food that I tasted so far.  Very authentic. The gibaritos are so tasty and delicious.

14.description: We have been coming to this restaurant for several  years and they have maintained the quality of their meals.Several authentic  dishes to choose from and friendly service!

1.description: I noticed that the staff was very friendly.   The service and cut were both professional and inexpensive.  I have had my head shaved with a straight razor there twice, and you get a lot for your money.  I'd recommend it if you're in the area.

2.description: I know a lot of people that go here...and rave about it. I took my little brother here to get *faded* and after 45 minutes waiting, with no acknowledgement even, I took him to the barber around the corner from my house in Lincoln Park. I have seen some great cuts come out of this shop, but the service sucks. Sorry, playas.

0.description: I used to go there exclusively for Fademaster Javi and would make my appointments days in advance. I became a regular, so he had a dedicated slot for me after a while. Being a sports fan, I like how almost every position of the chair gave me a view of a big screen TV with ESPN on it. Fademaster Javi has since moved on, so I'll be sitting with Rafy at Sportz. Kuttz now.

58.description: I can't eat Puerto Rican food that much anymore. It is way too greasy and heavy..However, La Bruquena has always been a restaurant I always go back to. The service is good and I love their arroz con gandules. I'm a huge fan of jibaritos, and if you havent had one, you should definitely give it a go here..

56.description: The mofongo is amazing - much like the entertainment on Friday nights.  Get there early so you can find a table and enjoy a pitcher of your favorite fruity beverage and live music by... an elderly woman and her beat box!Seriously, try the mofongo...

29.description: They don't deserve this post or any of the others they have received. But, I have to warn people: Don't ever eat here! Seriously, the service is horrible. They dont have half the items on the menu. I  don't think I ever heard the words "we are out of it" more times in my life than I did on the day I ate here. And for normal items on their menu an hour after they opened. Unacceptable! The food was dry, glasses were dirty. They wouldn't accept a gift card previously bought & paid for. Ridiculousness! I will NEVER eat at their establishment again. And I definitely do not see how they will continue to remain open for business. I wish I could give no stars :-(

42.description: 3 star for the autentic caribbean dishes,the good thing is abouht the prices .....the bad things is the homeles people :(   they just have one waitress doing all the work when we arrive we ask a guy this is a bar or restaurant??  he  say is a family restaurant welcome.........soo  we deside to try la bruquena

23.description: La Bruquena is a delightful little gem in Humboldt Park. The Plantain appetizers both the sweet and savory are excellent, Our server was  friendly and helpful with suggestions. Not only that she put up with my pathetic attempts at practicing spanish. Also they have an exceptional vegetarian selection of meals, most of which are vegan, all of which are delicious. Highly recommended!

47.description: I have eaten here a few times but always got carry-out. Over the Thanksgiving holiday, my friend from out of town wanted some mofongo so we came here. I did not know what tasty drinks they serve! I wish I had known this when I lived in the neighborhood because I would have been on the patio every weekend of the summer! The food is more in the 3 - 3.5 star range. I always get the steak jibarito and it is good but I think the plantain could use a garlic brushing like they do at the Borinquen. My friend got a steak dish and and order of mofongo. I tried both and I was expecting the steak to taste more like grilled flank steak but instead it tasted more like pot roast. The mofongo seemed a little dry and short on flavor. The service was excellent although it would probably be better to speak Spanish, as there was a bit of a language barrier.

8.description: My favorite puertorican restaurant, amazibg fresh food and i love they have vegetarian/vegan options. Grate authentic puertorican place, salsa music and cool staff.

31.description: The Bruquena continues to be the top restaurant in all Chicago/Humboldt  park area. Nice atmosphere, excellent food. Caldo de pollo con mofongo, jibarito....no hay nada mejor!El dueño, Hector, show up to say hi, very nice and great customer service. Maria

34.description: My boyfriend LOVES this... World Series? Spanish speaking? Good Food? I do not speak Spanish- My weak attempts were corrected with charm by our bemused server. I had the jibarito (my new obsession without fear of the shamelessly lumpy Fat Britney proportions I will soon aquire) with mofogo, fries, beans and rice. Delicious. So delicious, that when the owner came to our table and asked us if it was good I stopped him and said: "No, it was beyond good- it was a tracendental, spiritual experience without compare!"I think he likes me.Wait until I learn to say it in Spanish!

16.description: Went to get a jibarito. My husband and I got the steak because they were out of lechon. Let me just say for $10 I got the smallest thing ever. The meat had so much fat, the tostones terrible. I was very disappointed. The rice would have been good but it was so salty I couldn't even finish it. Wouldn't come here again. The only thing I did like was the parcha juice. Womp :(

13.description: This place is amazing. It's one of the few authentic Puerto Rican restaurants in the area, with dishes as flavorful as the one's back home. Let me start by saying, I was born and raised in Puerto Rico and have been living in Chicago for 6 months now. I had been craving some home food ever since it started snowing but the other Puerto Rican places I had tried just weren't that good (or cheap). This is by far the most authentic Puerto Rican restaurant I have been to in Chicago. I had the chicken breast sauteed in butter and garlic (and onions -yum) because they were out of lechón. I ordered a side of mofongo (mashed green plantains with pork rinds and garlic) and the dish came with a salad (iceberg lettuce and a slice of tomato) and caldo de pollo (chicken broth with potatoes, which is commonly eaten as a side for the mofongo). Since I was pretty upset about not being able to eat lechón and was debating wether to order a side of rice or not- the waitress threw in a small arroz con gandules order for me. Yay!! The portions were very generous, I was full halfway through my plate but ate it all 'cause I don't get to eat such an amazing meal everyday now. My boyfriend ordered the jibarito (which is a Chicago Rican dish and not a thing we eat at home) and it was so delicious we should be making it in the island! My friend ordered the chicharrones de pollo (crispy fried chicken) which were made with chicken breast and they were one of the best things I tried on my visit. The seasoning for all the food was on point. The mofongo perfectly mashed and assembled, it was heavenly. The arroz con gandules tasted just like the one at the lechoneras back home! The meats were not too salty (like in other Caribbean restaurants) but not bland (like in most general restaurants here). The waitress was super nice and fun. The owner of the restaurant went by our table and talked to us. And everyone else in the place was nice and happy. There were people dancing salsa and playing drums in a corner of the restaurant which made us feel just as if we were back home. The prices are super adequate considering the amount of food (enough to take some home or to share with someone) ranging from 7-10 per plate. I am incredibly happy that this place exists. I recommend it to anyone !! And will definitely be coming back.

11.description: The mofongo is amazing! This is a great spot with a lot of awesome/crazy history.People are bashing the margaritas, but it's not a typical Puerto Rican drink so don't be surprised if it's sub par. Opt for a beer or mojito instead!

39.description: I like the food, but I refuse to go back.  I will tell you why.  On Friday evening, I was there with a good friend.  As we were waiting for the check, the owner asked us to sign a political petition.  My friend signed the petition.  I didn't; I refused to sign it.  After saying no thank you to the owner, he wanted to know why.  I told him that my reasons were personal.  Then, he began grilling me as to why my reasons were personal, as if he were picking a fight with me.  Customers should not be subjected to the political ideologies of others, especially the owner's, at a place of business.  The owner should not have conducted himself in an insolent, rude, and brusk manner.

37.description: Food is excellent. Sometimes.However, I have to highlight some of the other bad reviews. The service is bad a majority of the time. It wasn't always like that. Sometimes the food gets to the table cold, and other times it takes a half hour to get the tab paid. It's hit or miss.It's a fair chance you'll see it happen.That said, on a perfect day or night, you will experience some of the best Puerto Rican food you will ever eat. Second to abuela's, of course.This is one of my favorite stops in Chicago, though I go with patience now because of the aforementioned.And this is coming from someone born and raised on the island.

0.description: My in-laws are Puerto Rican and from the island, so I was a little nervous about taking them to ANY Puerto Rican restaurant at all. My mother-in-law wanted a cocktail, so she popped in here to ask if they serve drinks. When the staff replied, (in Spanish) "Hell yes, let's have one," she said she knew we were in the right place. We were the first customers of the day, and on that particular day, they were also preparing to cater 3 quincineras, another good sign in our opinion. We sat on the patio, and the staff opened up the restaurant doors and turned up the salsa music, all to my mother-in-law's delight. We ordered pastelitos, acapurrias, rellenos de papa, and jibaritos. My mother-in-law said it reminded her of her parents home cooking, though of course not quite as good, never can be. We also thought the jibarito was missing some garlic aioli or a sauce, but was otherwise delicious. The mojitos were fantastic! Authentic, quick, friendly staff, good spot. Definitely recommended!

38.description: I was in Chicago last weekend for a family reunion.  I live in Kansas City but I was born in PR.  I hadn't had my mom's cooking in a while so I asked a cousin where I could get me some down home comfort food.  She suggested, La Bruquena!   I have never felt so at home in a restaurant.  I wanted to order everything on the menu because what I had ordered I couldn't get in my face fast enough.  It tasted just like abuela used to make.  The salsa criolla on the mofongo was DIVINE!  It was all perfect!  All of the, what seemed to be regulars were very nice and even came over and talked to us.  One of them actually offered to run a personal errand for me because I didn't know where to get something I wanted to purchase.  I loved this restaurant and the next time I'm in Chicago, it will be one of my first stops!!  Muchas gracias por todo!  Estan representado la isla del encanto muy bien!!

51.description: "So what is "guisada" exactly?"  I asked, halfway through devouring it and ladling it all over my mofongo."It's like....stew. Like beef stew," said the waitress.This was not like stew, because I had a can of Dinty Moore earlier this week, an I'ma tell you, if this is stew in Puerto Rico, I'm going to start buying cans of guisada instead.  Dinty Moore can kiss my brown ass from now on, bitches. I did not know what I was missing.  It's not like Cuban ropa vieja at all - I know this partly because when I asked the waitress if it was like ropa vieja at all, she looked at me like "Bitch, please" and she said, "No. This is better." Look y'all, I'm not trying to be all up in some inter-island food squabbling, I'm just trying to avoid all Dinty Moore in the future....They serve the guisada in a little bowl next to the mound of mofongo, a pile of mashed plantains with some, like, fried bacony pork rinds in it.  It's starchy and kind of bland.  But then you put the guisada on it and the super salty beefy juices get all on the mofongo and collaborate and shit and it is divine - comfort food at its best.There is a loud club either attached or right next to this place, so there's some ambient music.  Elbows up on the table.  Feeding my face.  Leave me alone, I have no more questions, thank you.... Except, can I please have some more of those fried appetizer thingies?

27.description: The epicenter of everything Puerto Rican in Humbolt Park. Once you walk in you are treated like family.

32.description: I'll be very brief as they don't deserve much of my time. Their service was very slow with about 3 tables worth of people.I enjoyed their jibarito de lechon (roasted pork). The rice w/gandules was not good.  Others at my table ordered the following that they did not like the taste of (and they are puerto rican, so their opinion counts) mofongo and maduros.  I should have known better than to order my daughter a grilled cheese here, but i did.  They gave her a warmed up 10 inch long piece of (french?) bread with white cheese, that was not even melted! Needless to say she didn't touch it.  Our party of 4 totaled $73 w/tip.  For Puerto Rican food next time, We will go to Borinquen just a few blocks away on california. I feel that we would have had a better experience if the service was better.  Also, that place is pretty small, so it remained COLD in there due to the people coming in and out letting all the cold air in... almost ate with my coat on.  My daughter wanted to leave after 5 minutes.

54.description: The outdoor patio seating is great.  They do an excellent job making a fun, laid back atmosphere.  The food was okay, not that great.  I have had better jibaritios - specifically across the street at La Plena.With that I bring you the bad...The service was awful.  I am not sure how much of it was the fault of the waitress...  She seemed semi competent.  I think the problem was the fact that they were really busy and their appeared to only be one person servicing all the tables... and acting as the bartender.  Everything took forever and we never got our friend plantains and sweet plantains... They did, however, comp one of my $4 Corona's for the error.  That or they simply forgot to charge me for it, which is likely.Anyway, it's a place I would maybe return to given the atmosphere and decent food, but I wouldn't recommend it or request to come back.  Although, I hear Fridays are fun... so maybe.

48.description: great food! amazing plantains! tasty drinks!i have to admit, this was my first stab at cuban quisine. i made the classic mistake of thinking i could order a margarita. the waiter was polite in his scoffing at my ignorant request and suggested something more amazing and made with mangos.they accomodated us as we walked in very close to closing. the rice is absolutely the best.the atmosphere is beautiful. complete with seasonal outdoor seating, and a party room available upstairs.

44.description: If you like being accosted by homeless people, this is the place for you! OK, that might have been a one-time thing, so let's start from the beginning.  We went on a weeknight and the place was close to empty, except for two tables. We were initially greeted by a waitress who was reasonably nice and took our order. And here's where things go down hill fast. First, my soup comes; it's full of bones. I don't mean chicken meat on the bone, I talking about shards of bones throughout the soup.  Second, a fairly long period of time goes by, the appetizer comes; it's just not good, and we get more than we ordered having to pay for all the stuff we weren't planning to eat. And now we get to the fun part. A homeless man walks in and starts bothering us trying to sell some garbage. We try to ignore him, try to ask him to leave us alone. Meanwhile, the restaurant staff does nothing. They have a few TVs. We realize we've just made it through an episode and a half of Wife Swap, and our entrée hasn't some out, and the waitress is nowhere to be found, neither is any other staff member. Now we're contemplating leaving and are now watching Supper Nanny (why? Because there's nothing else to do).Finally, the food arrives. Obviously COLD. The plantain chips from the jibarito are so hard, you can't bite into it. The final straw, as we're eating our awful food, a man walks in. He greeted like royalty; it's clear he's a regular. He also order's a jibarito. It arrives in about 5 minutes. Seriously, we waited an hour and a half for our food which takes 5 minutes to make!There was a major red flag at the start of this long long dinner. A couple sitting near us was quietly complaining and discussing walking out. We should have taken than as a major cue to leave. Oh well, lesson learned.Oh, and I must apologize if my review got mixed up with the plot of Supper Nanny or Wife Swap.

24.description: when we have a craving for Puerto Rican food that is authentic... we trek are a$$es from the boonies to La Bruquena... whether you are looking for a delicious jibarito, or a plate of guisado with arroz con gandules that never disappoints... or even a "caldito de pollo" to warm your soul... you will be happy you went there. PS) the outdoor patio in the summer is awesome... and don't miss the sangria...

7.description: Food and service was A+ we sat outside with some great music. A frequent flyer Ruiz was a great person to talk to n chris our server was very friendly. Food is made to order n fresh

49.description: After seeing the place on "Check Please" a group of friends decided to check it out, especially since we live in the Humboldt area.  After going in excited to try it out, we left in a very a  different mood.  First off, the good points: Friendly wait staff.  Decent Margarita. Reasonable prices Bad points: food was just not good.  We had three different dishes amongst my friends and I, and all of them were just barely edible.  For three hungry guys to come away not even a little bit satisfied speaks to the quality of the food.  Lacked flavor and the meat was not cooked right. Personally would try some other places in the Humboldt area

40.description: My hats off to Roberto the owner and his wife. They make the best Puerto Rican food in Chicago. Born in Puerto Rico and raised on my cultural food, I can assure you that it's great food! Roberto and family are a down to earth simple family. They love their neighborhood and their culture! This is a neighborhood treasure and if you want the best forget about the rest. The rest are good but La Bruquena is the best. And for you people that want food fast then stick to fast food or food that's been sitting around. If you want quality then sit back, order some tostones as an appetizer and sip one of many great tastings drinks available.

53.description: Oh our lovely brothers and sisters from the island protectorate of Puerto Rico, what amazing things you can do with Plantains as well as pigeon peas!  Those two dishes earned you the four stars instead of the three stars, despite the fact that the food was extremely slow to come out, you were OUT of pulpo (octopus) for the plantain cups that I had heard were so good, AND the beef entree my dining companion ordered was kind of bland.  It would have been just an A-Ok if not for your drinks (and the free drink you bribed us with after we waited for so long) and that delicious Mofongo.Personally, I am not a Puerto Rican Cuisine specialist.  I do know that it is a fusion of Spanish and Carribean.  I ordered the Pigeon Peas in the Mojito Sauce that came with the sweet plaintains and the little side salad; my dining companion had the beef with the onions on it, and got it with the mofongo, and for a replacement appetizer we ordered the fried plaintains and the little fried chickens.  Everything but the beef was really great, and it wasn't that the beef was bad, it just wasn't seasoned in a particularly fantastic way.  The seasoning on the pigeon peas was fabulous, just enough garlic.  The mofongo (mashed plaintains) was flavorful.  The drinks we ordered (we spent more on drinks than anything else!) were really good - they make a mean pina colada, a fabulous guava/rum concoction, and a mojito that those swank River North joints would be hard pressed to beat.Our waitress was slow to warm up to us, which is my only complaint about the table service personally - what did get us was the fact our dinner took forever, and the place wasn't at all packed on a Sunday night.We are going to give this place another shot and hope for a bit quicker service, and most definitely order the pigeon peas, mofongo and mojitoes!

30.description: The arroz blanco con abichuela was OK.  The carne guizado was a little too tough and bland.  Like I said it was OK.  What wasn't OK is how they treated my black friend who didn't know Spanish.  She felt awkward and out of place when she tried to ask for the rellena de papa.  My friend knows what a rellena de papa is and she felt like the staff made her feel silly for asking.  Luckily she had a spanish-speaking friend to interpret.  (they said they were all out of it).  Point is...La Bruquena..if you are watching your reviews....treat ALL customers THE SAME...with respect!  For this, I won't return to try your rellena de papa...when you have it...

46.description: What a fun place with authentic food! The staff is super friendly and helpful in ordering, even with someone like me that takes forever to decide. I've had many items on their menu and they're all yum.  My fiancee and I especially like their pork chop sandwich, carne guisada, and their $5 lunch specials! The lunch specials are specially awesome, you get a lot of good food for very little money! I've also went to parties in their party room upstairs. It has a bar and a pool table that makes parties fun. The owner will even bring out her own set of dominoes for group-play! It seems as if at least one of the owners is always there, on-location, and I think that makes all the difference. I also really like the music they play! =)

1.description: Since this place ends up getting a lot of new faces on Riot Fest weekend each year I'm guessing they brought out all the stops.The owners here definitely know how to lure in a punk rock crowd.  When the line was too long to get into the festival on Saturday morning, I went scavenging for food and I found myself completely lured in by their $1 PBR special.  From now on, I am not going to spend a dime inside Humboldt Park to get liquored up on festival weekend since getting sauced here early in the day is so much cheaper.I was also psyched that the food was less expensive than festival food (and more authentic to boot).  I actually had a hard time choosing which vegetarian entree to get.  The recommendation of the owner was the garbanzos over rice.  It was delicious but the portion size left a lot to be desired.  The rice was not well seasoned itself but the garbanzos had just enough kick to require swigging a bit of PBR with each bite.  Since I was still a little bit hungry, I almost ordered more but the wait time it took for my first meal discouraged me from doing it.Seemingly knowing that the crowd was waiting a long time for their food (and even drinks) since the place was seriously understaffed for the large crowd that wandered in, the owner brought us all free "Puerto Rican eggnog" multiple times.  This was sort of like a very sweet white Russian and I only required one to really get me ready to rock when combined with the cheap beers.But the fact that the crowd needed pacifying due to the waits was definitely a problem they needed to overcome to be considered a bar I'd look forward to coming back to.

55.description: most horrible service i've ever experienced. we were waiting for half an hour just to be noticed by waitstaff, a couple other groups just walked out of frustration, and since they took so long with our food we finally said lets just take it to go, so some of us left leaving only one person to stay for the food, when our friend came half the food was missing, and i went back to let them know what they were missing and they were like i don't know what you're talking about. the food itself sucks and isn't worth it. go across the street to coco or latin american restaurant.

9.description: The appetizers were good after that everything went south literally my plate of food had no flavor my food was cold when it came out...never coming back here

26.description: Such a wonderful gem on Paseo Boricua!  Traditional Puerto Rican cuisine with natural ingredients, gluten free and MSG free.  I love the garbanzo dish, and the arroz con gandules, rice with pigeon peas.  You will love the special seafood dishes presented on Fridays.  This family owned restaurant is full of love which is demonstrated through their food.

25.description: Disappointing on so many levels.  My family and I decided to try this place Sunday evening when Bullhead was packed from all the Rioters.  It looked nice, had a nice outside area and hey, patio tables open!  We grabbed one.  Within seconds we had menus in our hands....and then it stops.  It took 27 min to bring us water and order a beer.  We only sat there for this long because we were chatting and forgot we didn't order until my daughter complained she was hungry.  This happened about 20 min in, mind you the host was in front of us the whole time and didn't think to ask if we needed anything.  We sat for 6 more minutes before my hubs went in and I stood up to start heading elsewhere.  The couple behind me decided to let me know "the service isn't great, but it's worth it"(which turned out NOT to be the case)..So the hubs comes back with the server and I am starving at this point so we sit back down and finally order our drinks.  She comes back 8 minutes later with our drinks and water and to order.  We order an appetizer which the hubs asks for asap to shut our kids up who have now been sitting patiently for 35 min (1 1/2 year old & 4 years old) and started acting up. 32 more minutes goes by (now I'm really minute counting since the loud table of adults behind us started dropping the f-bomb loudly, talking in depth of sexual encounters and past stripping experiences. I swear, I could careless if others swear, but swearing in a restaurant with kids around?  There is a children's menu which lead me to believe this was a family restaurant).  So we get our food 32 minutes later all together, appetizer and dinners.  Kids meal came with fries that were crispy, which I like, but fries that taste like fish are not my favorite.  Our fried chicken app also tasted like fish but were still decent.  No one ate the fries.  I ordered a jiabarito.  It was the blandest jibarito I've ever had.  Hubs wasn't thrilled with his milanesa either.  I'll stick to El Boriquen for my jibaritos and go elsewhere for family outings. A few other things that upset me: the waitress had an attitude when she came up to our table and stated "I'm getting off but I guess I can help you".The host man didn't tell the rude table of grown ass adults to stop swearing so loudly in front of children and stop talking about gross sexual content while in a restaurant where others are eating in close vicinity.  We also had to get the waitress to bring us the check after waiting for her to come back to our table when we finished our meals.

12.description: I've been only 3 times. The sevice was always great. The atmosphere is nice. I like the outdoor eating area. I do think it is overpriced, the portions are small, and they only had Tabasco for PIQUE WTF? Get with the program and get some Puerto Rican pique (hot sauce) this is a nice Puerto Rican restaurant for god sake! Another customer lend me his Puerto Rican pique which he had brought with him. Thank you kind sir now I can fully enjoy my mofongo con carne frita.

59.description: This cozy neighborhood Peurto Rican resturant boasts Mofongo con carne frita (mashed green plantains and fried pork) as their signature dish.  Although their menu is small, you'll find plenty of rice, beans and pork dishes as well as many other delectable Carribean delights. I had the "Compesino", which is a pork sandwich on fried plantains. The meat was very tender and the plantians were heavy on the garlic. Very yummy!  This is definitely a resturant you go to if you have a taste for something different.

21.description: Food was super awesome. Jibarito was on point, the pork was very tasty, they also had these ground beef and potato balls that were heavenly. I would definitely go back. Below zero weather cant stop me.

17.description: great authentic food! highly recommended.Went with a few of my friends and had a great meal.

10.description: Very rude and inattentive waitress staff. I was first in line at the bar trying to order a drink and she wouldn't take my order. People coming to the side of the bar after me was getting served because they spoke Spanish. I'm Puerto Rican but don't speak Spanish so I.guess my money was no good.  Had the balls to ask to keep the change for a tip

5.description: That service in that's rest.its very worst and very expensive to be at Humboldt Park ! They charged me $29 for mofongo dishes! I never came back with my family after that!

3.description: I've eaten a pretty good deal of Puerto Rican food, and this place is definitely great!  One super-unique thing is mentioned at the end of this review.  FOOD:  Very good lechon, and I ate some of the best habichuelas I have ever tasted.  Couldn't tell what the secret ingredient is, but oh my goodness was it good.   My wife had a jibarito and was very good.  They apparently offer these really unique drinks on the weekends, one of which was a rabbit stew listed on the menu.  Call or email them to ask ahead of time.  SERVICE:  Really good, very attentive.  Owner came and intro'd himself to us.  AMBIANCE:  A lot of locals come here  and hang at the bar or at the tables near the window.  Good cultural experience.  The design and layout is very nice, very clean, very well-kept.  It's a bit trendy-er than "La Plena" which has more Puerto Rican murals on their walls, but there's still some art work around.  They should have chosen between the music and 'Ellen DeGeneres' on TV - not have both running at the same time.  Slightly noise-polluted.  :-) PRICE:  Not bad.  We both ordered a soft drink, although no appetizers.  After tax and a 22% tip, we made it out under $30.00!  We parked on Washtenaw in order to avoid paid parking.  ALCOH-NOG:  Ok, so they make this egg nog mixed with vodka around the holiday seasons.  They offered me a free shot of it.  It was a sweet burn down the throat, that's for sure!  They sell good-size bottles for $20.  We'll be back!

35.description: Driving in Humboldt park area and noticed La Bruquena and found parking in front. Friendly waitress and casual, low-key atmostphere. Obvious regulars hanging around but still felt welcome. Partner and I had the campesino and Rikitiki sandwiches in which flattened cooked plantains are used instead of bread . We split the sandwiches and both enjoyed the chicken and pork. Pork was a bit spicy with garlic but delicious. The bill was cheaper than we thoughyt it would be. Not a fancy place but if you are in the area check it out. Sabroso!

19.description: when we have a craving for Puerto Rican food that is authentic... we trek are a$$es from the boonies to La Bruquena... whether you are looking for a delicious jibarito, or a plate of guisado with arroz con gandules that never disappoints... or even a "caldito de pollo" to warm your soul... you will be happy you went there. PS) the outdoor patio in the summer is awesome... and don't miss the sangria...

28.description: This places gets two stars because of their outdoor seating and their food is okay. With so many different options for Puerto Rican food in Humboldt Park, this place can't really compete. They fixed up the place a bit so it is better than Borinquen.The service here was never good so I stopped coming here. Especially since I discovered La Plena down the street!

45.description: LOVE THIS PLACE for Puerto Rican food!! Have been going to this place for over 20 years!!! And the owners are great too! Can't beat the prices either! Have to try their Mojitos! :)Keeping it real, they have one server that is on her game the others seem to wonder aimlessly and lack personality, this has resulted in very slow service so if you have time to kill and you're not starving, come in and enjoy the atmosphere (visual and musically), the people and most of all the food!!!

33.description: A bit disappointed by the lack of vegetarian pasteles (MY FAVE),  but I tried the beef one nonetheless which had hardly any meat (which I consider a good thing).  Also tried the side of sweet plantain which was just fried plantain chips.  Both were a little cold but made up for in yumminess.    My friend had the jibarito and a beer.  Both our meals unexpectedly came with yellow rice and beans, and bread with butter.  Fantastic.  Great staff, they were even friendly and comforting when I left my credit card and returned later that night to retrieve it.  Will surely return.

43.description: I'm gonna keep it simple. Phenomenal food and out of this world mojitos. Perfect place to relax with friends and have great conversation. I promise I will be going again soon.

2.description: My GF is Puerto Rican and her parents suggested this restaurant for some authentic Puerto Rican food. I had been craving mofongo for months after returning from Puerto Rico on vacation.We made reservations for our group at 6:30 PM on a Saturday. It was pretty much empty inside, only a few other people.Home of the slowest service. Call it island time if you want but do not come here expecting much. Many items on the menu were not available. They do not have a full bar but they do have rum and beer. 1 staff member on duty seating people, working the bar, taking orders and bringing out food.When the food did come, it was nothing special. I'll spare details but the only items worth eating were fried. Anything fried tastes good though.

18.description: I was so excited to find a substantial vegetarian menu here! The owners were so nice and checked in on us to make sure that we enjoyed their "original" recipes. I will definitely be back.

41.description: really nice puertorrican restaurant... u go there often and the owner gets to know you... next thing you know u are "buddies"!  their flaw has always been service staff... it's slow and sometimes they forget you are a paying customer.

52.description: By far my favorite PR restaurant!The food, music, and atmosphere are great.  We probably stop by once a month for a Mojito and some chicharrones y arroz y arbuchelas!!

50.description: The food at La Bruquena was OK. The thing that is very amazing about this little place at Humboldt Park is its authenticity. The wait staff does not speak very fluent English, and made it difficult in ordering some of our meals. Its been a couple of months since I visited the food that I had was OK, but that was my error in selecting the wrong choice. My fiancée ordered the chalice of beef which was very good. We would try this place again. My recommendation is to, make sure you have an idea of what you want, or are ordering as the description on the menu all sound the same, but what you get is very different from each other.What I found interesting about this place, is that its definitely and escape from the city, it provides a cultural and dining escape. Its like going to a small restaurant in Puerto Rico and having to decipher the menu, and trying to talk to the waiters. The food is very authentic, what you don't get in the food you definitely get in culture and atmosphere

4.description: Terrible Sunday experience.1) front patio full bees2) no waitress to seat people 3) no credit cards accepted 4) no water during appetizers had to go inside and ask for water and sauce5) check with inaccurate prices, no taxes explained 6) why they are in business? Avoid this place and please cook home instead.

6.description: We popped in here for a Margarita while walking down Division to Riot Fest.The interior is bare bones. The bathrooms are marginally clean, at least. The bar looks like someone's basement. The Margaritas are terrible - too sweet and tart in that "margarita mix" type of tart. I'm not sure there was any booze in my drink. That's a $7 drink? I don't think so.Food? Yes, there was food there, and we might have had some if not for . . .You were obviously trying to draw in the Riot Fest crowd, and it might have worked had you not been BLASTING shitty Tom Petty music out the windows, up to 11. Clue: empty patio on a nice day. We might have gotten a snack or two, but the music was awful. Clearly, we are okay with loud music, we're on our way to Riot Fest, that wasn't the problem. It was the BAD, mainstream, classic-rock type music blasting that was the problem.. Why not play Riot Fest type music or hey . . . some cool Puerto Rican music! There were some Conga drums, why not have someone playin' 'em? What a concept!

22.description: iive  experience better  the  waitress  judy  very  nice the  food  okay , i did  not  like  the old  ladies  at  the  bar is this not  a family  restuarant the  cursing and the  disrespect to  other  customers .i would  not  go  back, lol  as  i sat  thr,   a man trying  to hit on  me   (flirt )really iam  trying to  eat!!    judy  was  nice  enough to tell    him to  stop.!! i think  the  owner  should  step  up and  control his  drunk  customers and  make a much  friendly place, for  new customers or any  customers ,judy or judith  hope  iam  writting  your  name  correct, thank  you  for your  wonderful  service  the  owner  should  learn  from you  how to  run  a  family  restuarant.

15.description: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! They claim to be closed at 11. I came in at 930 sat down  and had a gentleman tell me the kitchen was closed! Drove 30 minutes from the south side for nothing. I've worked at a restaurant before and if the kitchen is closed, you let your customers know before hand. Will never come back to this place

57.description: La Bruquena has quickly become my favorite PR restaurant, which may not be saying much considering I'm still new to Puerto Rican food.  My main dish is the kikiriki, which is basically a chicken breast on fried plantains instead of bread.  I ask for some garlic to be added, which really pulls the thing together.You can usually find parking within a block, and the service is always helpful and friendly - especially with the culture and language barriers.

20.description: The food was so bad that I considered dining and dashing. I was not able to even eat the smallest portion of my meal-- for around $13. The waitress messed up my order and was not willing to compensate in any way. Cool that they have a poetry event monthly, but other than that avoid at all costs.

36.description: What a great PR restaurant!  First time having this type of food found it simular to Cuban food. Ordered pork sandwich on plaintains. Excellant !  The side of rice with peas very flavorful. My wife had an empanada type dish made with plantain dough. Also tastey. Love mojitos, these were the best. Very sweet and friendly waitress. Will be back!

14.description: I came back from a vacation in Puerto Rico craving Puerto Rican food.  I decided to give La Bruquena a try to satisfy that craving!  Walking into the place, there isn't much of an ambiance.  I wasn't expecting too much, but it just fell flat to me.We started off with drinks.  I wanted a mojito, but they were out of mint.  They were also out of seafood and their credit card machines were not working.  Tough break for them as the market had been closed the prior day and a cable was down affecting their internet - that didn't help my experience.To start we got 3 apps: 1) empanadas (I couldn't eat them because they are not gluten free, but my friends enjoyed them), 2) tostones with shrimp (the plantains were really dry, and the dish did not have much flavor), and 3) fried green bananas w/ beef (these were gluttonous, but good with the red dipping sauce).  For dinner, I had mofongo, of course.  The chicken was pretty dry, but I enjoyed the plantains and sauce.  They also brought out plantain french fries with ketchup/mayo sauce for us to try.  Those were really tasty - apparently a new addition to their menu.Overall, I think this place is pretty authentic, but I am eager to try other places in Humboldt Park to satisfy my craving!

0.description: I have lived in this city my whole life but I have never once stopped in Humboldt Park. Yes I have driven past it and around it but today I drove through it and did I find some fun, cool and interesting places to eat.My second stop was at Papo's Taco Truck...he had a sign hanging out that said $1 Taco Tuesdays...deal of the day if you ask me.  So we stopped by and I noticed that there location was not on Yelp yet, so I decided to add them.The first thing I noticed was how clean the truck was.  I also noticed that they could tell I was not one of there regular customers.  The staff inside of the truck was so friendly and nice.  I love customer service and this location was so welcoming and inviting.We ordered a Relleno de papa...which reminded me of an Italian Riceball.  It was a Potato ball that was deep fried and had meat inside of it.  It was really good and was not greasy at all.  Check out the picture...sorry for the bite but my wife could not resist before I was able to get the photo.  She did sell me on the fact that the picture looks better if you can see the yummy meat inside.  So I will give her that one.I also had a Sorrullo which was a sweet corn bread that was deep fried with cheese on the inside.  I really liked it...it was like a desert and a meal all in one.One of the things I noticed was how clean this food truck was.  In fact, the back door was open so you could see directly into the food truck.  They have nothing to hide here just there good food.We also met a few customers who were sitting at a table just behind the truck enjoying some lunch.  One of the patrons showed me his Jibarito Sandwich.  It looked so good...it was grilled steak with grilled onions in between two fired plantains that acted as the bun for this amazing looking sandwich.  He even let me take a picture of it...I really wanted a bite but that would have been too much to ask for after just meeting this nice guy.  We then started talking food and after a while I found out that this customer was also the owner.  He was such a nice guy and told me next time I come back I have to order the Jibarito...I said, "But it isnt on the menu!"  And he told me, "Just ask for it!"  I love that!  It's like knowing the secret menu.I loved meeting the owner because he loves his food truck.  He is also one of the newest food trucks in the park...only being here for a year.  He first started out with Mexican food but has since also added Puerto Rica Food too.  As we talked food we were able to meet another owner of the food truck down the street.  He came over for some lunch...talk about respect between the food trucks in the park here.  It is like one big happy family and they were so accepting of me and my wife.  He also invited us down to his truck to eat but honestly I had no more room to put anymore food.  I really feel like I stumbled on some hidden food truck mecca in the park.This truck also has a TV mounted on the back of the truck, so you can check out some TV while you are eating your food at the table.  Now I went during the week and it was not that crowded but I heard that on the weekends it can get really crowded with all of baseball and soccer games going on in the park.I am proud to be the first person to find this food truck and add this location to Yelp.  Being open for a year and not a single review on Yelp makes me so sad.  I also encourage other Yelpers to check out all of these amazing food trucks in Humboldt Park.  You can drive around and see all of them out or just stop at each one and start eating.  I love Chicago...this new adventure makes me feel like I am in some foreign place...but I am so excited for a new found place to eat in Chicago.I am coming back for that Jibarito!!!  And if you never seen one of these delicious and unique sandwiches, then check out my photo of it!!!  YUM!!!

28.description: In the empty stretch of nothingness where I work, delivery becomes a necessity sometimes. One can only eat so many chicken tacos before wanting to cut somebody. Enter Golden Chef. I've tried a couple of other chinese food establishments that delivered this way and I couldn't tell you any of the restaurant names since the menus were promptly disposed of. It's been bad. One dreary day, desperately craving chinese food, I found a menu for Golden Chef online and decided to give it a try. The menu is the typical fare found on pretty much every other chinese menu in Chicago and to my great happiness, orange chicken is one of the available lunch specials. The food arrived quickly, portions were enormous and most importantly, the food tasted good! Like I ate my lunch special for 3 days in a row good and I HATE leftovers. Cheap, quick and delicious - and they deliver to the craphole that is Hermosa. Yay!

1.description: This is my favorite place for Chinese food in Humboldt Park.  Unlike See Thru Kitchen, they offer tofu.  In fact both the fried and fresh tofu are great choices.  New China has tofu as well, but it doesn't taste as fresh.  I asked for my food spicy, it was prepared to my liking.  Sauces are overly sweet like at many take-out joints.

9.description: All week I had a serious craving for Chinese food, so I decided to finally indulge on a Friday night in.  I called to order takeout and was told it would be about 20 minutes.  My order was ready to go when I arrived, and the lady behind the counter was really friendly and funny.  I ordered the veggie egg rolls and the walnut shrimp with veggie fried rice.  There was  $2.50 upcharge for the fried rice.  The veggie egg rolls were just ok---not a lot of filling.  But, the walnut shrimp was on point, and Golden Chef seems to be one of the only places in the neighborhood that has it on it's menu.  All in all, it was fast, affordable, and tasty.  I only wish the egg rolls were a little better.

29.description: The food is always really, really fresh. The delivery is fast and the portions are large. It's not fancypants Chinese food, it's "I don't feel like cooking, let's get Chinese" food. With the dinner or lunch special, I can make 2 meals of it. I went to Tasty China and it wasn't as fresh, so Golden Chef has been the favorite.

23.description: We always order this.  It has never failed us once.  :)

5.description: This place has the best take out Chinese around. You will not find better quality and portions for the price,there's no question about it. My friends and I have ordered from this place countless times and I've never been disappointed. The last time I ordered from here I had a lunch special and the amount of food I walked away with knocked my socks off. It was something like $5 and I had enough food for the entire day...it is worth noting that I'm a big eater. They even include a drink and an eggroll w/ the lunch special, its just ridiculous. Try it!  ; )

31.description: I give this a Meh, not because the food is necessarily bad, but just because there is really nothing that makes it stand out to me.  This place, along with Tasty China across the street are virtually identical cookie-cutter Chinese fast food joints.  From the menu and pricing all the way to the actual food itself.If you live in the hood, this stuff is totally decent, just don't expect to get the equivalent of your favorite Chinese restaurant.TIP:  While it may appear that Golden Chef and Tasty China are your only two Chinese options in Humboldt Park, you can actually order from Lee's Chop Suey which has REALLY solid fast food Chinese.  Or if you're a real baller you could have some Papajin or Friendship delivered.

25.description: finally!! after trying almost every chinese takeout place in the area (most were extremely disappointing), i found one that's actually great! it's inexpensive, with large portions, quick delivery time and efficient staff. all the food we ordered was tasty and not even very greasy, though a bit more salt on everything would have been good. not my favorite 'greasy' chinese takeout EVER, but definitely the best in this neighborhood. this is my new spot, ill be ordering often!

12.description: This place is as good as I've had in the area(Humbolt Park) so far. I've had 5 different Chinese restaurants in this neighborhood and I've had Golden Chef 4 times and This place is hands down THE BEST. I may do another update someday if I have a bad experience but every time they've killed it so far.. I just wished they stayed open a little later.

21.description: My wife classifies this as "hangover-grade chinese." Ample quantities to quell dietary unrest. Nothing more, nothing less.

16.description: In the empty stretch of nothingness where I work, delivery becomes a necessity sometimes. One can only eat so many chicken tacos before wanting to cut somebody. Enter Golden Chef. I've tried a couple of other chinese food establishments that delivered this way and I couldn't tell you any of the restaurant names since the menus were promptly disposed of. It's been bad. One dreary day, desperately craving chinese food, I found a menu for Golden Chef online and decided to give it a try. The menu is the typical fare found on pretty much every other chinese menu in Chicago and to my great happiness, orange chicken is one of the available lunch specials. The food arrived quickly, portions were enormous and most importantly, the food tasted good! Like I ate my lunch special for 3 days in a row good and I HATE leftovers. Cheap, quick and delicious - and they deliver to the craphole that is Hermosa. Yay!

17.description: I can't tell the difference between this place and Tasty China on the other side of North Ave. In fact, aside from the prices at this place being a few cents higher, they might as well be using the same kitchen. Just the same goopy, salty, bland Chinese takeout you find splattered all over Chicago.

10.description: I'm originally from New York, and anyone who knows anything about New York is that we New Yorkers pride ourselves in being Chinese takeout snobs. Golden Chef Chinese Kitchen is by far my favorite Chicago Chinese take out joint. Chicken wings are the best in the city. Chicken & Broccoli w/garlic sauce, shrimp lo mien and pot stickers are my favs. Fast delivery and carry out doesn't take long, either.

11.description: So while I was initially very enamored with this places value, I was overlooking the fact that there is a layer of dust on the shelf which displays their to-go sizes about a half inch thick. Since they have not cleaned it off in the year and a half I've been going there, that kind of grosses me out. Also the last few times I've ordered the fried rice has been way under-cooked and almost crunchy. I go elsewhere for my chinese now.

26.description: I can't think of one reason to complain about Golden Chef...except that I wish they had a location in Lakeview by where I live--I only order when I'm in Logan Square at my boyfriend's house. Everything on their menu is good, the prices are amazingly reasonable and the delivery is fast--usually takes 30 minutes and never more than 45. They also have a coupon for 2 free egg rolls when you spend $15. My favorite Chinese takeout in this city by far. Highly recommended! :)

27.description: First of all this joint aint in Lincoln Park. I don't even go to Lincoln Park.This is the take out Logan Square's version of Lao Sze Chuan. Good Cheap Chinese take out only exists in New York, but this is the closest you're gonna get for take out.  For a neighborhood joint, I give it four bowls of rice! and they got the Buddhist shrine in the corner. Tres New York, son! Hopefully they will open up a nice  restaurant in Logan Square, because if their cheap food is this good, imagine what they could do with a real restaurant!

0.description: Golden Chef hooks it up!  I agree with a previous poster who said this place has the best takeout Chinese food around, like north of downtown.  I felt like a five-year search for the answer to my cravings for Chinese food ended when the Golden Chef Delivery Guy showed up at my door.  I have since ordered from the Golden Chef 3 times, and each time the food has been tasty, consistent, fast, cheap, and generously portioned.  I have since picked up takeout for dinner, and the place is a little sketchy, especially at night.  It's not the kind of place I would go to dine-in, probably ever, but I will still call upon Golden Chef with regularity for his tender cuts of tasty stir-fried meat and vegetables.  I highly recommend Mongolian Chicken or Beef, if you are in to that sort of thing.

20.description: Love this place. This has been one of my favorite spots to get Chinese and I cannot stress enough that you should try their sweet and sour chicken. Oh man it's so good. Get the special if you like it to come with shrimp fried rice, instead of the plain white rice. They just recently added the walnut shrimp to their menu as well and I am thrilled. Plus their prices are super affordable. Go check it out for yourself, you won't be disappointed.

19.description: The food is always really, really fresh. The delivery is fast and the portions are large. It's not fancypants Chinese food, it's "I don't feel like cooking, let's get Chinese" food. With the dinner or lunch special, I can make 2 meals of it. I went to Tasty China and it wasn't as fresh, so Golden Chef has been the favorite.

2.description: Very good pepper chicken and shrimp lo main. The only Chinese restaurant i eat in the Humboldt Park area.

18.description: Golden Chef has never disappointed me.  It is what I have come to expect from my staple neighborhood Chinese food restaurant-fast, fresh, hot and cheap(in a good way) Always hits the spot!

13.description: Very fresh and delicious. i was looking for a good place to get Chinese food from but any  places i tried before around the area wasn't a success. i ordered Singapore noodles and they didn't had a problem substituting the pork w the chicken and it was awesome, the orange chicken also delicious, the fried rice probably next time i will order i  will ask them to add a bit more soy sauce to it it was a bit dry. Will definitely go back i love their food!

4.description: In my quest to find the best Chinese food in Logan Square this was a second place contender. I ordered the usual fried rice, orange chicken, pot stickers along with hot and sour soup and an egg roll. Orange chicken was alright, not the greatest I've had, but still better than 90% of the garbage in Logan Square. Pot stickers were the same usual bland ,wet junk people in Logan Square have come to expect. Egg roll was surprisingly bad as well (don't know how you can screw that up). Fried rice was pretty decent. You can tell it was made the usual lackluster way of soaking it completely in soy sauce until it almost turned completely black, but it wasn't terrible.        This was my first time trying hot and sour soup.
