It had a peculiar taste, but wasn't as bad a miso soup (which tastes like straight p**s around here no matter where you get it from).      I'd still have to give this place a pass though. Food quality was just between poor and decent. Non-consistent food=non-consistent customer.

24.description: Not a comfortable restaurant where you can sit and eat in but! .... the food is delicious. I suggest eating at home instead of the greasy off balanced tables.

6.description: My roommates and I eat here a lot. They know when we decide to order there. This place cooks everything to order. Plus it is around the corner. If you are looking for a Chinese food joint to take home and relax to watch a movie this is your place.

22.description: For years this has been my go-to-place for cheap Chinese. It's not AMAZING, but it's good food at a good price. I usually stick to the Mongolian Beef and Orange Chicken Lunch Specials (the lunch specials come with shrimp fried rice, egg roll, and a soda from 11:am-3pm for $5.15 each). One special is enough for two people. Or if it's past 3pm I really love the Chef's Special #3 House Special Hot Chicken ($5.50 for a small). It's really spicy (try not to eat the jalapenos hiding in the spicy sweet sauce), has a good mix of chicken, squash, peppers and comes with white rice. Feel free to drizzle that all over your rice :)Definitely not a sit down and eat place. Order and go home to eat. It's not that you're not welcome it's because there are only two tables.*Also, they charge a 30 cent credit card transaction fee on purchases under $10.

15.description: I'm not sure why this place has an average of 4 stars. Maybe I'm not a Chinese food aficionado but I found the food to be bland and boring and I won't be eating the leftovers.

7.description: I have ordered from this place for a few years now. I have ordered the Kung pao chicken & orange chicken dinner special. For the cheap price they give a huge portion! Fast delivery and friendly. The food is good and always hot when delivered. The crab rangoons and pot stickers are delish! Give them a try!

8.description: Ever since Eat First II closed, this is my go-to Chinese take out joint. Large menu, stellar crab rangoon, lots of food for the price and they deliver to me in Wicker Park within 15 minutes every time. Quality has been consistent.

30.description: For counter take out, I really like this place. I am not to fond of "unfancy" chinese, but there aren't too many options in west humboldt. This place uses all fresh stuff, and is very consistent. My fave dishes are the Mooshu, and the Mongolian Chx., My husband likes the Kung Pao. worth the stop and better than Tasty China and China STation and mon lung.

3.description: 2nd time potstickers were not cooked all the way and I got sick had to toss them out. Even tried heating them longer.1rst was really good Outstanding chicken wings

14.description: Golden Chef is the only Chinese that I will get delivered. The pot stickers, moo shu, and salt and pepper squid never miss the mark. They are fast, delicious, polite and inexpensive. What else could you ask for?

28.description: To be honest, I only eat here because it's on my block. It's good for a neighborhood place, cheap enough and good enough to go for the convenience. The guacamole is worth the trip alone. The service is fast and while sometimes the meat is over cooked the veggie burrito with avocado is great and super filling. My friend always gets the chicken tacos and devours them so I assume they are good as well.   I wouldn't sit in and eat because there isn't much atmosphere but it's definitely not the worst meal you could have.

1.description: This place is fantastic. Called late night and they stayed open for us for a few extra minutes while we hustled over. Food isn't fancy but a dang good burrito.

39.description: I've been their once... the first time it was pretty good and they made me a limeade by throwing a whole lime and some sugar into a blender, which was pretty tight. The second time i went I'm pretty sure the chicken was rancid, and I totally got the runs... maybe only go there once?

9.description: We chose this place over many options on yelp because it was the closest to our house. Now we are full of regrets.The burritos are not the best. Very bland and unsatisfactory.I give the place 2 stars because at least they are nice people who run the place and it's not expensive. Also, believe it or not, I've had worse.

29.description: A mixed experience. Small, no-frills cantina/diner-style taqueria.Salsa was exceedingly oily and thin without much flavor.Ordered carne asada taco dinner- came with 3 tacos, rice and beans.The tacos: beef tasted stewed rather than grilled, but was reasonably tender. Tortillas were soft yellow corn- had not been rewarmed-average. No aguacate or queso fresco.Beans: good, homemade refritos.Rice: basic, tender.Bill: dinner was listed as 6.50, but when i added a 20 oz soda my bill was almost 10.00- irritating.If I have to get a taco in my immediate neighborhood it will suffice, but doesn't compare to thelocal riqueno options in terms of flavor.

23.description: Forget pasadita, this place is the real deal.  Their pastor and picadillo are both great. The gordita is awesome. The tacos come standard with avocado!! Oh, and loud spanish TV!!!  My favorite local spot for basic tacos.

5.description: Came here late at night as it was the only place open for dinner. Ordered a burrito with Carne Asada, beans, pico de gallo, guacamole. It was decent, quite large, your standard average Mexican (if burritos are really considered Mexican). Wasn't horrible, but I wouldn't seek this place out for high quality or ingenuity.

31.description: If by "pricey" people mean "it's $4 for a huuuge burrito," then yes, it is pricey. They can add in stuff that does up the price (a burrito is not a burrito without el aguacate), but it's still less expensive than, say, Chipotle, and about a jillion times more authentic.Eat in -- the chips and salsa are really really good. Just thinking of the horchata makes me want some.I only give it 3 stars because I specifically said no sour cream but they put it in anyway (and charged me for it), and the burrito was very uneven. All the beans were in one end and all the lettuce was in the other. I'll go again, though, and hope for better beanular distribution next time.

25.description: Surprise surprise- good eating!  They don't speak much English, and my Spanish is poor- but we got the order in and the food was quite good.  Tacos and burritos were great- simple food done well.There are  a few tables for eating there- however, we live a couple blocks away and "dined at home".  PS  They have Mexican Coke in the bottle- mmm-mmm!!!

12.description: If I had to review this place in one word? "Microwave."If you want more words, well, the chorizo burrito suizo was bland and fell apart when I took it out of the to-go container (microwaved burritos tend to do such things). Nachos were average. Nice people, lots of drink options. Place could use a cleaning.

37.description: This is very nice food but it's definitely my walking destination.  It is a bit on the pricey side but it's open very late and a great option for late night.  My first experience with Mexican chicken soup was here...  Uhm it's bright red, and full of chickens!  The hot sauce here is no joke, it can get very hot, seems to vary though.If you like Mom and Pop and really love burritos this is a great stop, but I can't give higher marks for just being convenient.  Although, if they gave free chips and salsa to go with their burrito I'd probably go a lot more often.

21.description: Yummmm!! Small place, big taste... This isn't the fancy restaurant u go to look at wall decor, its a quick taco joint where they hv delicious fatty food! I love getting the burrito here...This is my late night go to stop when I just want a good taco or burrito fast...Super inexpensive!  Staff are friendly & accommodating...Glad they opened around the corner and its open late...Great news for taste-buds, dreadful for waistline! After a night of drinking, this is the got to spot...;-)

16.description: LOVE this little place! Not too many places are open as late as they are. Great for a mid-day snack of after a night out on the town. Their tamales are GREAT & you can't go wrong with one of their burritos.

17.description: Went back recently and nothing has changed - in a good way. Same abuelita at the stove, same decor (updated with a fish tank and a flat screen), same delicious Chile Rellenos. I love this place!

10.description: I have been to Super Burrito twice, both times the place was empty. I ordered a chilaquiles breakfast and asked for it non spicy and it was extremely hot. The coffee was very watered down. The second time I went I got a veggie burrito suiza and after they made it they used a microwave to melt the cheese, and the side of chips it came with were stale. I wanted to like the place but you can get much better Mexican food down western at Arturos and Lazos.

11.description: I Love Mexican food and at one point in time this was my favorite place to grab lunch/dinner. The tacos here were awesome, the way the tortillas and the perfectly seasoned meat tasted almost brought tears to my eyes but it just isn't the same anymore. I've been going to this place for years (its literally a few blocks from my place) but lately I've noticed the portions of food have gotten drastically smaller and the food is cooked/prepared in such a lazy manner. After seeing the difference I've started feeling like maybe its worth trying other places when its 12am and I'm starving. Another thing is, me or does it seem like the prices are always changing? A taco dinner is about $7.50 on the menu but I usually end up paying almost $12???????

26.description: All I got to say they have the best authentic Mexican food. if you are looking for real home Mexican food this is the place.

27.description: Tried it yesterday. I really wanted to like this place more, because I liked how much it looked like being in someone's kitchen and I really liked the two ladies working there. But, as far as the food is concerned, I thought it was bland and blah. I ordered a veggie burrito and honestly, it just lacked flavor. The guacamole was decent, but also could have used a squeeze of lime and a dash of salt.I should have stuck with my original plan and gone to Chipotle.

35.description: I lived a block away for five years, and consistently Taqueria Super Burrito has _the BEST_  Carne Asada Gorditas I have ever eaten. And that is saying a lot, considering that I went on a Gordita hunt across the states of northern Mexico, trying to find the best ever, but nothing lived up to the deep fried goodness of Taqueria Super Burrito. The salsa is spicy and good.You people trying to get all fancy with pork burritos and this and that--don't. Don't try to order a Vegetarian Burrito from here! what do you think this is whole foods? The CARNE ASADA GORDITA, people!What a gem!

8.description: Coming here reminded me of being back home. Two very nice Mexican older lady's run this operation. Great spicy salsa, friendly service. The tacos are actually crispy enough and wont break on you. They fry the taco's just a little so they last and not tear up. I absolutely hate it when a taco falls apart half way through. The prices are on point and the food is great. I recommend any one who is looking for straight traditional Mexican food. This is as traditional as it gets! :-D

0.description: It was too late  by the time we arrived here, but the weird thing was that 30 mins before their closing time they were almost closed. However, the lady in there was very accommodating. When we went in she made us fresh vegetarian burritos and one order of tacos both of which were great tasting. It was nothing special or different but tasted really great. Good old, great tasting food. Great for a quick bite of satisfying mexican food.

38.description: Giant veggie burritos and horchata right around the corner from where I live? Hell yes. Plenty of vegetarian options, never a long wait.....but if there does happen to be a line, just sit down and watch some Telemundo. The owners are always super nice, too. It is more expensive than I would like, but the portions are pretty big so I forgive them. It's cash only, but they have an ATM inside so don't freak out too much!

20.description: Living in L.A. it's hard not to be extremely picky about Mexican food.  Complimentary chips and salsa were good, but thought the salsa lacked a little seasoning and heat. The asada burrito also lacked some seasoning, but was OK.  A little seasoning goes a long way.

19.description: Great authentic Mexican food and there signature super burrito for 10 dollars can feed 3 people. You can also combine meats in the burritos for no charge

33.description: I would give 3.5 stars.This is another place that is right by my work.  My co-workers and I eat here at a regular basis.  I pretty much keep ordering the same thing -- Steak Sope.  I usually order 2 cuz they are in a smaller size compared to other Mexican restaurants.The only complaint I have is the people working there dont always wear gloves and hairnets and I caught them giving change to other and then go right back to cutting food. making the dough quite a few times.  I never said anything to them since they all speak limited English there.  I pretty much just keep it to myself an my co-workers and we all agree -- "See No Evil".

2.description: Greatest spot in the city for TRUELY authentic Mexican food.  Sweet staff!  Son muy amable!Killer salsa!  I always take some to go even after I've eaten.  Honestly, the place isn't that pretty but who cares the food is worth it!

34.description: I have been confounded by the lack of a good vegetarian burrito in my neighborhood. Don't get me wrong, the burrito at Irazu is amazing, but sometimes you want a Mexican style burrito, as opposed to the Costa Rican variety.So I texted "vegetarian burrito chicago" to the Google text thing and this was the first thing it delivered back. A ringing endorsement? Maybe not.Anyway. This place had a filthy front door. It looked like it hadn't seen a drop of windex since Cinco de Mayo. Also, the floors looked recently unmopped, and it just had a general air of not so clean. But, it did have an authentic feeling, from the shrine to Mother Mary underneath the television playing Telemundo, to the tall glass bottles of Pepsi, Mexico style. The two of us ordered the Vegetarian Burrito, which is 4 dollars a pop (yet, somehow the total came to 10 dollars and 30 some cents). They arrived and were enormous. I thought that I wouldn't be able to finish it in two meals. However, most of the bulk of the burrito was taken up with lettuce. Don't get me wrong, there were beans and rice in there, but it wasn't as filling as it looked. I found the burrito to be somewhat bland, this may be because I ordered it without cheese or sour cream, but I doubt it. It just seemed like the beans and rice were missing any exciting flavor. It was certainly edible, just not enough to make me excited about ever going back.if you only have a few bucks in your pocket and are hungry, go to Sultan's. If you insist, give this a try... the rest of the menu isn't really vegetarian friendly, but who knows, if you enjoy eating animals maybe there are some gems on the menu. The vegetarian burrito is not one of them.

32.description: I usually stop in here while working next door at the repair shop.  I'm hooked on the torta with milenesa steak with all the veggies....yum yum is that tasty.  If you dare to try or are with someone, try the super torta.  My buddy had one and was I impressed on how he consumed all of it.  The Horchata is really good also.   I can pass on the chips, as they are ordered and not home made.  Bad part is that they aren't a 24 hour joint.

18.description: Yummmm!! Small place, big taste... This isn't the fancy restaurant u go to look at wall decor, its a quick taco joint where they hv delicious fatty food! I love getting the burrito here...This is my late night go to stop when I just want a good taco or burrito fast...Super inexpensive!  Staff are friendly & accommodating...Glad they opened around the corner and its open late...Great news for taste-buds, dreadful for waistline! After a night of drinking, this is the got to spot...;-)

41.description: This lil' dive is right down the road from our flat.  After having frequented the establishment for over 5 months now, the owners finally recognize us.  I thought they never would, but since we always order the same thing, 2 vegetarian burritos, they now smile when we enter the building.  EUREKA!These burritos are humongous and are $4.  We love this lil' place in walking distance of our home.

13.description: *Staff does not use gloves or tongs to prepare food*Yes you read that correctly. I watched as the woman plunged her bare hands into the individual ingredients such as cabbage, avocado, etc to prepare the orders. Had I seen that first I probably wouldn't have ordered at all but I figured, hey I'll just ask them to use gloves for mine. Apparently "they don't do that." but after asking them to remake mine a different associate used tongs. The food tasted good, and I'd likely be a repeat customer if they got their hygiene together. Until then I won't risk it and won't encourage anyone else to.

4.description: For a good burrito late... go to Lazo's.I came here because we were feeling lazy about getting up to Armitage and Western.  A friend had warned that he found a bone in his burrito, but I figured it had been awhile since and I'd give it a shot.  I should've just kept it in that realm of mystery and kept wondering.The burritos were bland and took forever.  I got a chicken and a steak, one pared down and one with almost everything.  Both were equally disappointing, so much so that the 8 beers I'd had earlier couldn't even make them taste good.  On top of that, it took quite awhile.  There were only about 4 people ahead of me (3 of which had already ordered) but it still took at least 20 minutes to get my food (I stopped counting after a bit and just went into regret mode).  It seemed like it would have been the same had I dined in except I had to walk home to eat my food.  Which is another issue, since between the greasy menu and the grubby water cup (necessary since I had no idea when I might be leaving), I couldn't see myself really wanting to eat here regardless of how hungry I might be.I did learn a valuable life lesson, however.  Just get the cab to Lazo's.

24.description: I'm usually fond of a good hole-in-the-wall, as long as it lives up to the "good" part. But Taqueria Super Burrito is among the nastiest places I've eaten in Chicago, offering a memorably bad burrito. Oily, grisly, yet somehow tasteless carne asada tossed into a stale tortilla with a bunch of gross additional ingredients. The whole thing was rancid. As if the food wasn't bad enough, a gross fishtank sat next to the counter as a model of uncleanliness.

6.description: nothing special, but a good solid meal. artisan tacos??? not here. the good stuff is the here

22.description: Good food and very cheap. Perfect for a quick dinner or lunch. I've come in as they were closing one time and they still made some food for me. Love the ladies who work there.

15.description: Tasty food and the sweetest abuelitas cooking, but nothing exceptional. It's a neighborhood taqueria and nothing more. But it is open late so that's a thing.

40.description: Awesome vegetarian burritos and horchata. It's a little on the pricey side, but it tastes great and the burritos are huge. Also, they're open to ridiculously late hours for such a small place!

7.description: Not the worst place. Food is cheap but very bland. Service is acceptable meaning you can get your order in a timely manner  They need to sweep the restaurant floor more often because when I came there was food all over the floor.

36.description: Right around the corner from me, and wonderful for midnight munchies. The burritos are mediocre, as far as burritos go, but the horchata is good. You DO get free chips and salsa if you eat in, which I've done once. Usually I take out. I don't think that it's all that pricey -- about the same as most other small burrito joints.

30.description: Meh is a perfect description. If not for a 45 minute wait at Kuma's (my first destination choice) I'd not have eaten here.Went on the advice the two A list friends that were with me, but I was underwhelmed. Good guacamole. Pork burrito was overcooked, and I didn't think it was all that cheap.

3.description: great quick taco joint! I'm always looking for a convenient taco place close to my house and this may be my new favorite.  OK, let's just put it out there, this place is no frills and seems like you're in a family members house which isn't a bad thing just a bit dingy, the good thing is the food is tasty enough to make you forget that.  Went with an easy choice of the taco plate,  2 steak one chicken for me and that ended up being a solid choice.  If you have the tacos with everything that gets ya sour cream, lettuce, tomato huge slice of avacado and cheese, perfect! . The chicken had a great flavor and is more shredded than chopped just the way I like it and the steak we perfectly seasoned and cooked.  Rice and beans lacking a bit of flavor but still ate them.  Make sure to get the horchata, some of the best I've had.  To wrap it up, don't let the actual restaurant looms scare you away, this is a real gem with solid authentic eats!

14.description: Would've been a one the first time I was here.   Bland, tough steak, bad meat to toppings ratio, small, somewhat expensive tacos.   Went back after hitting Starvin' Marvin mode after a softball game, and flavor and ratio was much better.   Still run of the mill when compared to hole in the wall Mexican joints, but run of the mill is better than dog food.

0.description: This place is super tacky. The owners are rude to their neighbors. The Audrey Hepburn and Paris inspired "artwork" the other reviewer talked about is from Ikea. It's hilarious they think they "cater to a preferred luxurious clientele" with how they operate and design the store. They have poorly hand written signs in the windows on fluorescent poster board bought from Walgreens. Super classy.

58.description: I absolutely love the steak, egg & cheese sandwich, along with the chicken sandwich. Their pastries are pretty tasty as well. The reason for such a low rating has to do with the extremely poor customer service I receive every time I attempt to patronize the cafe. They are entirely too slow, plus I really feel as if they don't want me there because of my ethnicity, as I patronize other places in the neighborhood (I live there) and don't receive the same coldness as I do there. One of the cashiers even took it upon herself to speak negatively about me in Spanish to another co-worker as if I don't understand the language. As I stated, I live in the neighborhood. Despite the pastries and sandwiches, I will never be back not recommend another person.

56.description: I finally go the chance to go here! The pastries are 4 stars but the customers service is what warrants this place one star. The girl at the cash register was extremely rude. Walking in, it was obvious that I didn't speak Spanish nor had I been here before. I asked her for a guava and cream cheese pastry and she said they ran out so I asked her what she had left. She just pointed at the case, all filled with pastries that looked exactly the same and told me that was all she had left. She then left the restaurant and I had to wait for another couple of minutes until she came back. When she came back, I asked her what the flavors of the pastries were and she said one kind was just guava, one was just cream cheese and one was apple. Was that that hard? I thought it was so rude, especially since I had gone in, being so excited to try the pastries. Now, the pastries lived up to their name. The guava pastry was flaky and delicious, and I had an apple turnover that was divine as well. Come for the pastries, but the service is just horrible!

29.description: These guys make an outstanding sandwich!

42.description: I can't say enough about this restaurant; you have to try it out!The coffee and variety of food here is not only delicious but, the staff and cozy atmosphere provide a pleasant experience that will call you back again and again.

23.description: Everything you've read about the coconut oatmeal is true.  It is amazingly good and you have to try it.  I also highly recommend the sandwiches - especially the roast pork.  It is a full sized meal and a great value.  The space is small but definitely worth checking out!

47.description: My family and I moved into the neighborhood and this has been the most amazing find. Great food, awesome coffee and a wonderful vibe inside. Always love supporting local places and this is a must to try!

8.description: Cafe Colao is a great neighborhood spot for coffee, cortaditos, sandwiches (including breakfast), and neighborhood meetups. Having lived in Humboldt Park for five years, I can't believe it took me this long to visit Colao. The service is great, and so friendly. They remember their customers, and it has  a great neighborhood feel, and cops have been known to visit. You gotta trust any business that cops frequent! (Since they dine out all the time...)I look forward to visiting Cafe Colao when I'm back in Humboldt Park.

31.description: The coconut oatmeal is amazing. You should probably phone in your order and pay cash because the whole operation is a bit disorganized and you may end up waiting up to 30 minutes for oatmeal and a sandwich. The ringing out seemed to take forever as well.  The coffee was great and they gave me a free pastry for the wait so at least they acknowledge their customers.

34.description: Amazingly good food at good prices.  The breakfast sandwiches are full of fresh and delicious ingredients.  I die for the avena de coco. Ufff sooo sweeet.  The potatoes on the breakfast plate are so damn greasy but equally delicious. Ok now we gotta talk about the costumer service and the lengthy time for completion. 1. Obviously the "short lady" as described earlier, may not seem the friendliest woman ever;  she is actually nice and you just got to ask her something like "How is your day?" Or "Wow, you seem overwhelmed by all these orders and you are here all by yourself. " I really like her. She is cool and works hard.2. This is obviously not a Starbucks, so don't expect a quick 2 minute latte with all the bells and whistles. If you are in a hurry, try it at your own risk but dont get upset or give bad reviews if it takes longer than you thought. Overall excellent.   Sit by the bar to get to know the "short lady" she is funny!!!

16.description: I came here on a whim, brought by a man whose taste I completely trust and was blown away by their food! We got a turkey and cheese sandwich, and the turkey was seared to enhance its flavor, the cheese was nice, gooey and melted, and the sautéed red onions gave it a depth of flavor that was perfect!, while sautéed red peppers gave the whole sandwich a sweet, smoky undertone. Combined, the flavors were absolutely phenomenal! Can't wait to try their coffee...

13.description: This place is delicious. You must try the pastelillos de guayaba (pastry with cheese and guava) and quesitos (cheese pastry). I couldn't eat enough of these tasty pastries. The cafe colao was also very delicious.

11.description: On the Paseo Boricua you will find in a little storefront Cafe Colao a taste of Puerto Rico through very nice coffee, great sandwiches and pastries, and really friendly service.My wife and I stumbled here on Sunday morning almost by accident after one of my favorite breakfast spots in the city - Nellie's - was closed due to some construction.  Take it from me - don't let the modest, small space shy you away from heading from all over town to try out a few things and get to know a neighborhood staple in one of Chicago's unique and culturally significant stretches.  From the traditional tripleta sandwich ("tripleta" meaning triple, as in kinds of meat: steak, and two kinds of ham), to their version of the medianoche (Cuban sandwich), to the pastelillos and quesitos from the baked goods cabinet, to the coffee made to order right before your eyes, the way you want it - everything I have tried here is good.However if you need that one, unique eating experience that you can't easily find elsewhere as the excuse to come down - make certain you put on your list of items to order the Avena de Coco (coconut oatmeal).  They do it really well here, and ensure it is freshly made and actually completed to their satisfaction before handing over to customers.  How do I know that?  Because on that fateful Sunday morning, we got the last order of the batch that was completed and saw no fewer than five orders behind us be denied since the newest batch being worked on wasn't completed yet.  So delicious!

39.description: Sandwiches were amazing and that guava&cheese pastry was alright too. Service took way too long though. Took about 30mins to get my sandwich... other than that went there twice in a row for brunch. I don't eat pork but lots of folks were saying that the media noches was on point.

37.description: This little hole in the wall on Division street is home to some of the best sandwiches and an amazing coffee. Try the tripleta, coconut oatmeal,  and a cafe colao and your good to go. Enjoy

0.description: Adore this place. I moved to Humboldt Park just within the last year and this place, blocks from the crib, was a real find. The coffee is great, the sandwiches amazing. I love the chicken and cheese, and the lechon especially. The steak, or steak/egg/cheese is a best seller too, for good reason. At this place they will actually sell out of sandwiches! Which is a great sign; means they make a certain amount of meat in advance, and when its gone, its gone.The prices are great. Most sandwiches are 5.50 and very large, for good value. The grilled cheese is only like 2 bucks, for one of the best deals in the neighborhood!I think the service is great: big shout-out to Carmen and Madi in particular. Cafe Colao is never going to be confused with S-BUX, with the pasted on smiles and the fakey-corporate friendliness, but that's OK with me. They are real people -- be nice to them and they're gonna be nice to you right back.

38.description: I loved it! Had the Avena de coco, que rica! It reminded me of my abuela's Avena de coco!

51.description: Some of the best coffee you'll find in Chicago - let them make it their special way and just enjoy the ride.  They recently switched from styrofoam to paper cups, which only makes me love them more.  You feel in touch with Humboldt Park when you spend time here-- they always have information about events and other Paseo Boricua businesses.  Great range of people coming through, including young people, families, cops (a sign of how goof the coffee is!).  Coconut oatmeal or an egg sandwich will save your life after a night of too much partying.

27.description: I met up with some girlfriends this past weekend to check out Cafe Colao.  We were in luck because upon our visit Mayor Rahm Emanuel stopped by and had lunch there as well.  I'll never forget this place now!  I tried the Steak, Egg, and Cheese Sandwich and it was pretty tasty, well sized portion.  For $6.25 it was definitely worth it.  I also tried a couple of the pastry items: Pastelillos Guayabano, Cheese Roll, and the Guava and Cheese.  Among these three, I would get the guava and cheese again.  The cheese roll was all wrong for my taste.  There was just way too much cheese and I am a person that LOVES cheese. I took one bite and that was it for me. I also tried a latte which is one of the best I have had.  I was able to drink it no problem.  If you are in the area, give this place a try.  The food is affordable.  It's a small place, but has a couple of tables.

32.description: I have two words for you: LECHON (PORK) SANDWICH. Ok, THREE words if you translate. This item is not typically listed on the chalkboard menu, but I ALWAYS ask... and they ALWAYS have it. If you're unfamiliar with Puerto Rican pork sandwiches, you are truly missing out in life! This is not American pulled pork - drowned in barbeque sauce, concealing all of the spices/flavors. This is slow roasted, spiced and rubbed to perfection, tender and melty goodness. The pork sandwich is served on Cafe Colao's French bread (made in-house), along with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cheese, and mayo. Toasted. It perfectly crunchy, warm and gooey and I AM DROOLING!I feel compelled to write a bit about the quality of service as this is always a source of contention at Puerto Rican joints: Unfortunately, my peoples are known for the "cojelo con take it easy" mentality. They will take your order with not much of a smile, or silly elevator banter. They will get you your food... when it's ready... in due time... And you will wait, because it's the best darn sandwich you've ever had and you're hooked. This is not the place to go to when you're in a hurry, or when your bus is 6 minutes away - giving you JUST enough time to run in and grab a small coffee. NO. This is a place to visit outside of rush hour on a lowkey day... like on a Sunday. Just say hi, drop a little conversation starter (if you that's the experience that you're looking for) and the ladies up front will follow suit. They are not MEAN, NASTY or SCARY.Please also try the Quesitos (keh-see-toas). Quesitos are pastries filled with cream cheese and in some cases, a combination of cream cheese and guava paste. They're amazing. The tornillos (corkscrews) are also good as are the pastelillos (pas-tell-ee-yose). Pastelillos are flaky puff pastries filled with a layer of guava paste in the middle, and topped with powdered sugar. Sugary deliciousness. Don't forget to have some coffee. It's strong and they've figured out the right cream and sugar ratios. Oh! And I can't forget the hot chocolate! It's made with REAL MILK. :)

54.description: I love this place! Great atmosphere and amazing food and coffee. I have had the breakfast steak sandwich with egg and cheese. Out of this world! I love coffee and had a latte. Top notch. I recommend stopping in for breakfast on a Saturday or Sunday morning. The pastries are delicious too. You're doing it right Humboldt Park! Keep it up.

48.description: My boyfriend's family lives in Humboldt Park down Division, so they're only a block or two away from here. They brought back sandwiches one morning and the ham and cheese was delicious (ordered without lettuce/tomato). I was looking for a place to pick up breakfast one morning and remembered Cafe Colao. When reading some of the reviews I was a bit hesitant - people said the employees and cashier seemed to be unfriendly to non-residents or people of different ethnicity - I'm Filipino and my boyfriend is Puerto Rican. The reviews intimidated me a lot because I thought I'd feel unwanted. However, I said, screw it, I don't care, I just want food. So I went anyway. I had wonderful customer service from who I assumed people were talking about. She was a young girl, maybe around 20. She was very friendly and apologetic when she couldn't hear me - I had lost my voice that day. It's a tiny cafe with dim lighting but I could tell there were some regulars there. I ordered a ham and cheese with everything, but I could do without the lettuce and tomato. I think there was something about the lettuce and the sauce they put on it that I could have gone without, but other than that I enjoyed it and it was not intimidating at all. Seems like a quaint little cafe great for the regulars there.

44.description: Great breakfast spot in Humbodt Park! The steak, egg and cheese sandwich is delicious and a great deal. Wonderful coffee! The service can be a bit slow when it's crowded, but there's free wi-fi and the food is worth the wait!

24.description: On the Paseo Boricua you will find in a little storefront Cafe Colao a taste of Puerto Rico through very nice coffee, great sandwiches and pastries, and really friendly service.My wife and I stumbled here on Sunday morning almost by accident after one of my favorite breakfast spots in the city - Nellie's - was closed due to some construction.  Take it from me - don't let the modest, small space shy you away from heading from all over town to try out a few things and get to know a neighborhood staple in one of Chicago's unique and culturally significant stretches.  From the traditional tripleta sandwich ("tripleta" meaning triple, as in kinds of meat: steak, and two kinds of ham), to their version of the medianoche (Cuban sandwich), to the pastelillos and quesitos from the baked goods cabinet, to the coffee made to order right before your eyes, the way you want it - everything I have tried here is good.However if you need that one, unique eating experience that you can't easily find elsewhere as the excuse to come down - make certain you put on your list of items to order the Avena de Coco (coconut oatmeal).  They do it really well here, and ensure it is freshly made and actually completed to their satisfaction before handing over to customers.  How do I know that?  Because on that fateful Sunday morning, we got the last order of the batch that was completed and saw no fewer than five orders behind us be denied since the newest batch being worked on wasn't completed yet.  So delicious!

7.description: I met up with some girlfriends this past weekend to check out Cafe Colao.  We were in luck because upon our visit Mayor Rahm Emanuel stopped by and had lunch there as well.  I'll never forget this place now!  I tried the Steak, Egg, and Cheese Sandwich and it was pretty tasty, well sized portion.  For $6.25 it was definitely worth it.  I also tried a couple of the pastry items: Pastelillos Guayabano, Cheese Roll, and the Guava and Cheese.  Among these three, I would get the guava and cheese again.  The cheese roll was all wrong for my taste.  There was just way too much cheese and I am a person that LOVES cheese. I took one bite and that was it for me. I also tried a latte which is one of the best I have had.  I was able to drink it no problem.  If you are in the area, give this place a try.  The food is affordable.  It's a small place, but has a couple of tables.

49.description: i do not go here anymore , supposibly i called the health inspectors?? lol thank u who ever did me that favor ! no lost !its obvious someone feels the same way i do! yes sandwiches okay but,  customer service !horrible they tend to top thr old milk with new milk, unsafe !they refuse to serve fresh milk at customer request who says no??!! to a customer , when they r paying for thr food, beware check ur milk people , over priced and bad customer service! i now go to cafetin taino 2706 w. division right by family dollar real puerto rican coffee, the customer service is excellent thr sandwiches are a plus u want real puerto rican coffee and good food go to cafetin taino, i give them a ten stars!thr prices are affortable not over priced  cafe colao needs some pointers from this place and yes iam picky and guess what, they give me what i want and they say customers are always right so check them out, iam happy now !great customer service and the owner serves u with a smile all the time!!and the cashiers too!    f.y.i  if customers r calling the city on u ? thrs something wrong with u not the customers obviously people need to beware, i can get puerto rican food any where, thr's a lot of great other places ! but a lot of places r not customer service tolerant and cafe colao is one place that gets and (f )grade ,  i found a great place down the street! everything happens for a reason , i should not have to pay for excellent customer service it should come with it!! See u guys at cafetin taino:-)

40.description: The rating is an update to their guava pastries..all of which I've tried. Awesome. So unique because guava is not something you see very often. And just tasty. I am tempted to go get one right now writing this.

53.description: I made the mistake of ordering the breakfast platter and waited 1hour for my food as i watched other patrons walk out with theirs Unbelievable

30.description: Cafe Colao is a great neighborhood spot for coffee, cortaditos, sandwiches (including breakfast), and neighborhood meetups. Having lived in Humboldt Park for five years, I can't believe it took me this long to visit Colao. The service is great, and so friendly. They remember their customers, and it has  a great neighborhood feel, and cops have been known to visit. You gotta trust any business that cops frequent! (Since they dine out all the time...)I look forward to visiting Cafe Colao when I'm back in Humboldt Park.

46.description: Friendly service, cute decor, good coffee, and great sandwiches.  The pastries are solid too!  Definitely recommended if you're in the neighborhood.

1.description: First time I came to this cafe - I ordered cafe colao it was pretty good. We didn't order any sandwiches, lady taking care of us was not very friendly ? She seemed a little annoyed by our questions but we have never been there. We decided not to order anything else and probably won't go back either unfortunately.

55.description: That's was a surprisingly damn good turkey sandwich.    Enough said.

9.description: Best little coffee shop in the city. The sandwiches and pastries are fresh and made to order. Very small space so plan on taking it to go. The best Puerto Rican oatmeal I have ever had!!

26.description: Cafe Colao isn't blow your mind off amazing but they definitely have some pretty good food for great prices! I came with a few yelp friends and we were lucky to grab a seat. The interior is very small and so the seating is also fairly limited. There is only around 5 small tables and on the day we went, 2 were reserved as the mayor of Chicago decided to stop by too! Order at the front, food will be brought out to you. I enjoyed my steak, egg, and cheese sandwich which can be easily split into two portions. I also supplemented my meal with a guava with cream cheese pastry which was a nice addition. I liked that the cream cheese wasn't terribly heavy but also wished that there was more guava filling in there. All in all, a good place to stop by in Humboldt Park. It seems very neighborhood friendly as people seemed to continuously come in and out to order. Easy parking right outside.

25.description: This cafe is the closest your going to get to a real cafe in Puerto Rico.  The soup is great especially if it's salchichon. The sandwiches are very P.R. authentic I add avacado to all of them. The coconut oatmeal is the best. The quesitos are very good and so are the pastelillos de quava. And of course the coffee is delicious.  I have been going to Cafe Colao for about 15 years it never disappoints.  If you are Puerto Rican living in the Chicago land area and haven't gone shame on you.

12.description: There's something special in the cafe con leche - not sure exactly what, but it's definitely better than 'Murican coffee. And the price is right too! In the summer I get an iced mocha latte with a shot of coconut - don't ask questions, just do it! You'll thank me later. Pastelillos and quesitos de guayaba will probably give me diabetes one day, but they are sooo good - especially when they're really fresh.Many seem to have written something negative about one of the girls who works here. If you stop by regularly and try chatting with her, she's actually a pretty nice person. We should all try talking to people we see in our neighborhood more often!

59.description: Excellent! I love the guava and cheese pastry. I brought some to the office for a birthday and people flipped. Takes a while to order because this place is so popular. Get there early if you want to grab a lot of pastries. They go fast.

21.description: This place was not good. The service took forever (I only ordered 1 steak,egg and cheese sandwich) then when I finally did get my sandwich, the steak tasted so old and over salted it actually smelled terrible. Owned by the same people who own Nellie's cafe" down the street, I really wouldn't recommend it. It is also way overpriced in my opinion. If you are looking for great, reasonably  priced  food in the area, definitely check out "Papa's Cache". They know what they're doing.

17.description: The avena de coco looks great. My guava pastry was delicious.

10.description: someone send me the paperwork necessary to legally immerse my body in this place...I guess that means just walking in and hanging out for a while...but still I want it to be known that Cafe Colao is consistently my best kept secret (until now mother f*ckers), and you're welcome. puerto rican breakfast sandwiches on freshly baked bread (in-house); forget about it. also, super cool to patron a Latino-owned and operated business! "keep it moving papa!"-cham

5.description: Cafe Colao isn't blow your mind off amazing but they definitely have some pretty good food for great prices! I came with a few yelp friends and we were lucky to grab a seat. The interior is very small and so the seating is also fairly limited. There is only around 5 small tables and on the day we went, 2 were reserved as the mayor of Chicago decided to stop by too! Order at the front, food will be brought out to you. I enjoyed my steak, egg, and cheese sandwich which can be easily split into two portions. I also supplemented my meal with a guava with cream cheese pastry which was a nice addition. I liked that the cream cheese wasn't terribly heavy but also wished that there was more guava filling in there. All in all, a good place to stop by in Humboldt Park. It seems very neighborhood friendly as people seemed to continuously come in and out to order. Easy parking right outside.

3.description: Massive bowl of coconut oatmeal for less than $5. They do their oatmeal with a smooth consistency more like cream of wheat or sweet grits. This would be my number one breakfast pick although the restaurant also has quite a few baked goods on display.Latte was fine but nothing to write home about.Tripletas sandwich = griddled bread with roast pork, steak, ham, and melted cheese - very satisfying. Limited seating - a handful of two-seater tables.

35.description: The sandwiches, quesitos and coconut oatmeal are all delicious. However, the customer service is very bad. It is embarrassing to see so many Puerto Rican owned businesses failing in the service component. Below is the process I went through to get one chicken sandwich, a quesito, a cup of coffee and a bottle of water. 1. I walked up to the counter and the short lady behind the counter did not acknowledge my presence, so I stood there awkwardly while she SLOWLY got drinks from the cooler. 2. She finally walks over after a few minutes and asks me rudely, "what do you want?" 3. I place my simple order - no deviations from the menu. 4. After about 15 minutes of waiting, I ask the short lady if I can get my coffee and quesito now while I wait for the sandwich to be made. Again, she does not acknowledge my request but simply goes in the kitchen for several minutes while customers are waiting in line. 5. After about 20 minutes of initially walking in, I finally get my coffee but no quesito. 6. 30 minutes later my sandwich is ready and she puts the quesito in the bag, but does not include my bottle of water. 7. I watched this woman for 30 minutes botch one order after the other and act extremely rude with customers. A few suggestions:Smile and say hello to customers when they walk in. Try and get coffee, pastries or anything that is easy grab quickly to customers. If the sandwiches are going to take more than 10 minutes, you should inform customers, so they can plan their lunch time accordingly. Say thank you to a customer for their patronage.

19.description: I have two words for you: LECHON (PORK) SANDWICH. Ok, THREE words if you translate. This item is not typically listed on the chalkboard menu, but I ALWAYS ask... and they ALWAYS have it. If you're unfamiliar with Puerto Rican pork sandwiches, you are truly missing out in life! This is not American pulled pork - drowned in barbeque sauce, concealing all of the spices/flavors. This is slow roasted, spiced and rubbed to perfection, tender and melty goodness. The pork sandwich is served on Cafe Colao's French bread (made in-house), along with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cheese, and mayo. Toasted. It perfectly crunchy, warm and gooey and I AM DROOLING!I feel compelled to write a bit about the quality of service as this is always a source of contention at Puerto Rican joints: Unfortunately, my peoples are known for the "cojelo con take it easy" mentality. They will take your order with not much of a smile, or silly elevator banter. They will get you your food... when it's ready... in due time... And you will wait, because it's the best darn sandwich you've ever had and you're hooked. This is not the place to go to when you're in a hurry, or when your bus is 6 minutes away - giving you JUST enough time to run in and grab a small coffee. NO. This is a place to visit outside of rush hour on a lowkey day... like on a Sunday. Just say hi, drop a little conversation starter (if you that's the experience that you're looking for) and the ladies up front will follow suit. They are not MEAN, NASTY or SCARY.Please also try the Quesitos (keh-see-toas). Quesitos are pastries filled with cream cheese and in some cases, a combination of cream cheese and guava paste. They're amazing. The tornillos (corkscrews) are also good as are the pastelillos (pas-tell-ee-yose). Pastelillos are flaky puff pastries filled with a layer of guava paste in the middle, and topped with powdered sugar. Sugary deliciousness. Don't forget to have some coffee. It's strong and they've figured out the right cream and sugar ratios. Oh! And I can't forget the hot chocolate! It's made with REAL MILK. :)

28.description: Super quick,economical and quality food,  why else would you spot the Mayor here? My yelper friends and i decided to meet here for brunch. We were surprised the place has literally 5 tables and 3 were reserved, later got to know it was for the mayor and his assosicate. I ordered the egg and chesse sandwich along with a latte and guva pastry. When i started to dig in realized they gave me the wong pastry, it was easily replaced. Great place to get some brunch, wish the seating area was bigger though.

45.description: Today is the first day that I've been absolutely DISAPPOINTED with Cafe Colao. Ordered a ham egg and cheese sandwich and when I got home to eat it the bread was different, BURNT and it was so bland I couldn't believe my taste buds. I've been here plenty and honestly every other time was more than satisfactory :) hopefully it's just one off day!

33.description: Decent Cuban sandwiches, coffee, and pastries. Not as great as cafecito but still decent.

43.description: Awesome sandwiches!! They are so tasty and served warm! They have great pastries and coffee too! Only bad thing is they don't have a restroom, I am 8months pregnant and had to leave in a rush to find a restroom:/

2.description: As a native to this side of the city I really like patronizing businesses like Cafe Colao. By that I mean smaller in capacity, independently owned and been around for a while. It's a shame that Cafe Colao doesn't wanna take advantage of the up and coming booming neighborhood that they're so conveniently located in and choose to provide mediocre food and close to no customer service at all. I've literally gone here over 5 times and at first I tolerated they're rude service because I was so stuck on spending my money at a locally owned shop.  Well, that's the last time I'll ever do that. Not only is there coffee absolutely horrendous, but by the way these folks talk to you it's as if they don't want business at all.  During my last visit, there was like 2 other groups of people in the restaurant and right as I was about to utter my order the lady behind the register shouted out "THERE'S AT LEAST A 20 MINUTE WAIT SO IF U DONT WANT TO ORDER THAT'S OK" I laughed.20 minutes? That's nothing. Especially for some Sunday brunch in Humboldt park. Most of these restaurants round here have 20 minute waits just to get a table. I told her I was in no rush and she sounded upset about my relaxedness and angrily took my order.  I then asked for a glass of milk to go with my pastries. She took the gallon out of the fridge, poured me up and I grabbed a seat. I went to take a sip of the milk and almost puked, the milk was entirely spoiled. Honestly at first I was gonna just bring the glass up and ask for a new one, but after such a terrible ordering experience time after time I just left my pastries and glass of natural yogurt (lol) at the table. So technically they owe me money. Just kidding I hope they went and bought a new gallon of milk with that.

18.description: Everything you've read about the coconut oatmeal is true.  It is amazingly good and you have to try it.  I also highly recommend the sandwiches - especially the roast pork.  It is a full sized meal and a great value.  The space is small but definitely worth checking out!

41.description: This place is my go to spot for sandwiches, pastry, and cafe con leche. Ive lived in the neighborhood for over 6 years and just started frequented this place about a year ago.  The sandwiches are out of this world! I get the ham, egg and cheese and the cubano at least once a week. The guava and queso pastries are equally as good and I am a sucker for pastry so Ive had some good stuff and this ranks up there, the crust is so buttery and flakey. Its perfect complement to a cafe con leche! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Oh and the prices are very fair here. I almost don't want to tell anyone about this place b/c its already super busy.

52.description: Dude.. I don't know what happened here but the service is so slow...  I gotta wait 15 minutes for an iced coffee and 10 just for them to aacknowledge me. Oh and I asked for an iced coffee... so please stop asking if I want an iced mocha.I don't!

50.description: This place smells like heaven! Their coffee and pastries are wonderful as well. The service may be a little slow, but whatevs I hardly am ever in a hurry, The only thing that makes this place a 3 star cafe instead of a 4 star is the younger cashier. She has a nasty attitude and always seems to be in a bad mood. Even if you try to be friendly towards her, she is just nasty back, I'll go here anyway, but they should maybe take her off the register and find her something else she could do. Some people are just not people persons. Anyway, it's a nice place, with delish coffee and tasty food. Stop in.

4.description: Love this place!! The coffee is amazing as are the pastries. Great prices on the sandwiches to which are delicious. Def try the steak, egg and cheese!

6.description: Super quick,economical and quality food,  why else would you spot the Mayor here? My yelper friends and i decided to meet here for brunch. We were surprised the place has literally 5 tables and 3 were reserved, later got to know it was for the mayor and his assosicate. I ordered the egg and chesse sandwich along with a latte and guva pastry. When i started to dig in realized they gave me the wong pastry, it was easily replaced. Great place to get some brunch, wish the seating area was bigger though.

22.description: There's something special in the cafe con leche - not sure exactly what, but it's definitely better than 'Murican coffee. And the price is right too! In the summer I get an iced mocha latte with a shot of coconut - don't ask questions, just do it! You'll thank me later. Pastelillos and quesitos de guayaba will probably give me diabetes one day, but they are sooo good - especially when they're really fresh.Many seem to have written something negative about one of the girls who works here. If you stop by regularly and try chatting with her, she's actually a pretty nice person. We should all try talking to people we see in our neighborhood more often!

15.description: Actually chanced upon Cafe Colao while we were waiting for our laundry to be done. We had the breakfast plate and egg ham cheese croissant and it was the best breakfast we had in Chicago during our 3 day stay here!! Even better than the other highly rated brunch restaurants around the area. Homely and simple place, nothing fancy, but we were blown away by the taste, esp the breakfast platter. Cosy place with nice owners :) worth a try if you're ard the area! :)

57.description: Hands down the best sandwiches on Paseo Boricua! I have had a few of their sandwiches but my favorite is the chicken and cheese with Avocado. The chicken is shredded and all the topping fresh. The coffee is good but not the best I have ever had. If you just want a sweet treat get the guava and cheese pastry. All I can say is buy more then one. They are amazing! Really great place to have breakfast or lunch with friends. The cafe is small but they have a patio outside. It is a really cozy cafe and a must if your in the Humboldt Park Area.

20.description: someone send me the paperwork necessary to legally immerse my body in this place...I guess that means just walking in and hanging out for a while...but still I want it to be known that Cafe Colao is consistently my best kept secret (until now mother f*ckers), and you're welcome. puerto rican breakfast sandwiches on freshly baked bread (in-house); forget about it. also, super cool to patron a Latino-owned and operated business! "keep it moving papa!"-cham

36.description: Great food and good service.

14.description: I live a few blocks from this place. It's located a block from the Park which is great. Two stars because of the long wait times (I've had to wait up to 30 minutes for a iced coffee and sand which), the rude customer service interactions (cashiers waiving their friends to the front of the line while everyone else waits as they have a conversation) and the overall inconsistency of the food/coffee.

3.description: DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE! Zero stars if possible  they have the worst service I have ever seen I placed and order thru grub hub for delivery and my order never came not a single call was made and my door bell was never rang when I tried to call the store there was no answer. When I called the store the next day  the phone person tells  me "I wasn't here and I'm too busy here's the managers number".You would think the Manger would be more helpful he was worse instead of explaining  to me any reason at all why my order never showed he just blamed me saying I didn't answer the phone. When I asked for a refund his response  was "you have to call grub hub I have nothing to do with that", I WILL NEVER ORDER FROM HERE AGAIN AND I DO NOT RECOMMEND  THIS PLACE TO ANYONE HORRIBLE SERVICE  AND WORSE MANAGEMENT. If you do want a good place with GOOD SERVICE I recommend  la bomba I've order there many times and the food and service is great.

1.description: Need to seriously up your game.

2.description: It wasn't the best atmosphere more like a little whole in the wall place but I'll give my thumbs up. For my first boricua joint in Humboldt Park it wasn't bad but it wasn't the best. If you're looking for a quick meal and can't seem to find anything than this is you're go to place.

5.description: Hmmm I don't know how I feel about this place.. I came in on a Thursday night and it was empty!! I was so excited to eat an Alcapurria ( goole it ) and they surprised me by having both kinds of Alcapurria's  and if your Puerto Rican, you know there are some with Platanos and some with Yuca and the Yuca is good!! Well I think I the ones that got fried more than it should but I can tell they had some potential if they weren't so badly fried! I also order a relleno de papa it just lacked a lot of flavor I'm hoping the chef was having a bad day!!  I also Ordered a Jibarito with Rice and I was expecting a lot more the Tostone didn't have much flavor and the meat which is Bistec (steak) was lacking a kick to it. Not sure if I would return immediately or go out of my way to come back but if I am around I think I would give them another chance to step it up.. I see the potential!

6.description: Great lunch specials for a good price. I had the pork with rice and beans accompanied with tostones. It was all very delicious.

7.description: If I could give this place Half a star I would. And that .5 of a star goes to the arroz con habichuela (sp?). I went with my sister yesterday to get some PR food, didn't feel like asking my aunt to cook. She ordered fried Pockchops and I had the porkchops en salsa and we shared a pastele. First of the pasted was way too pasty and was salty. We each kept note of that but shouldn't have counted on at least the food being good. :-( her fried porkchop was a step from being burned and dried up and had mountains and crumbs of the Sazon and salt all over them. She took a bite and didn't even finish it. My porkchop I decided to share with her...mine was exact opposite. It was just boiled in water, it seem and drenched in the salsa. Suffice to say, I made mistake of already ordering a to go dinner for later. The beef skirt steaks seemed like they were just boiled in a pot of water with two sliced up whole head of onions!!!!! ANNNNND, we are still feeling the effects the day after! DISSSGUSSSTIIINNNGGGGG!!!! just stick to the little trailers in the park! Even there my uncle ate there and got food poisoning from the morcilla.

8.description: I go to the location at Humbolt park in a small trailer and I order the juicy  lechon pork platter special with arroze con grandueles and tostones all this for $7 dollars, what a deal!! Big portions and very tasty, this is the best value for your dollar, eat half for lunch and the rest heat it up for dinner

9.description: I was born and raised in Puerto Rico so I know how Puerto Rican food should taste. I ordered the Puerto Rico Sampler; two 'sorullitos' (tasted really really good, two 'alcapurrias' (they weren't bad but not really authentic...there's no potato in the meat filling), two 'papas rellenas' (pretty good) and two 'pastelillos' (the dough tasted old and it left kind of an after taste in your mouth). We also ordered 'Sandwich de Pernil' and that's was actually really good. I would order it again. And also ordered a side of 'tostones' and they were really good but the plantain was a little on the ripe side. I would go back to taste other things off their menu.

0.description: I'm a really lazy person when it comes to writing reviews....but I just had to share my experience considering I've tried a few PR restaurants around here and haven't found the right one to suit my pickiness (my grandpa from FL makes the perfect PR food so I'm a it biased)...So my cousin and I were walking around Humboldt Park today  trying to find a restaurant who sold Mofongo (cousin was craving it) and were open (Mondays aren't popular I guess). We found Coco's but my Aunt suggested we try out Latin American Restaurant because she said it was cheaper. It was only a little further down so we walked in and were seated right away. It was pretty empty but did have a few customers in and out while we there ( late afternoon). I ordered the lunch special and the waiter was very nice and let me substitute chicken breast for the chicken leg special without an upcharge. I also got tostones as a side instead of rice. The lunch specials comes with a soda as well All this for $7! Anyway, the tostones were just right and the chicken breast was marinated in a sofrito sauce that was finger licking good. I even used it as a dip for the tostones. Oh yeah and I also ordered a bacalaoito that was the size of both my hands put together  that only cost $1.25 (I had to split with my cousin). My cousin got her mofongo and said it was delicious as well .We also both commented on the interior of the restaurant in that it reminded us of old Puerto Rico .I was impressed by the cleanliness and size of the bathroom. The restaurant is also more spacious than what I've seen in other PR restaurants on Division St. Overall, I was impressed by Latin American Restaurant and will definitely be a regular customer. Delicious cheap PR food, look no more!

4.description: Disgusting. Horrible food. Terrible. Not clean. Can of RAID sitting on counter in kitchen window. DISGUSTING. I WOULD NEVER RETURN.

1.description: I used to get my haircut here all summer. I only stopped because I no longer have a car and it's a pain in the butt to get to otherwise. I love going here. Even though they're all Puerto Rican, they all cut African American hair no problem!Relatively cheap haircuts. It's $12 for a cut and line, $15 if you want it tapered, too. Not bad when I've paid $20+ at other places for sub-par haircuts.I highly recommend it if you're African-American and looking for a barber on the west/north side.

2.description: The owner of this place is cool people. The barber's Santiago appoint and station here can hook people up really well. And it doesnt matter if your not Puerto Rican hahaha.  They can cut Afro hair as well. I kind of grew out of going to this Barber.  But if I am in the neighborhood I tend to stop in just to say hi to Santiago  and i might get a lining.

0.description: Santiago is a great fucking barber.  Similar shops in the area are not consistent or even give white people a good hair cut. Super tight fades and a very relaxed environment. GO WHITE SOX.

58.description: Won't be back, the people are rude, quick to rush you to take your order which was taken wrong. Prices are way to high, for a steak jibarito with no rice 8.50

56.description: Had lunch today since my brother raved about their food. I left very full and very happy, chicken was moist and flavorful! Rice and beans were delicious plus the tostones we're amazing!!! I split my meal between me and my 3 year old and it was the perfect amount. Will be coming back soon. Only complaint is the kids options were lacking, maybe a kids meal with a chicken leg and a little rice would be better.

29.description: Come here frequently for the jibarito steak sammich, roasted chicken is also the bomb. Best Jibarito in the city and take it from a true chicagoan! Definitely check this place out.

42.description: Oh this place was so delicious! Roasted chicken bathed in garlic, BATHED I SAY!! Friendly service and didn't have any issues getting a table. Definitely going back!

23.description: The food is good when they don't let the chicken dry out.I've ordered though grub hub multiple times and they keep messing up my order. Either they totally forget items, add cheese to one but not the other, or pick what they give you instead of fulfilling the order. Not worth the headache anymore. See ya

47.description: Papa's steak jibarito is fantastic.  I order about one per week on average.  It comes with rice, which can sometimes be under cooked, but I'll let that slide.  My one gripe about this place is the staff - they're unfriendly.  I get it, it's stressful when you're busy and trying to serve a dozen people, but you're in the SERVICE industry!  Be thankful to all your customers.  I feel like I'm being an inconvenience to them when I'm ordering takeout - the lady on the phone actually sighed when I asked if I can place an order for pickup!  Then put me on hold for several minutes until someone else picked up the phone.  If I wasn't so hungry at the time for a jibarito I would have hung up!  But I digress..  I'll keep ordering the steak jibarito from them and I'll keep dealing with the unfriendly staff because they do have good food at reasonable prices.  At least until I find another spot with an equally as good or better jibarito with a staff that actually welcomes their customers.

8.description: I've finally decided...hands down my favorite PR restaurant. From the rice to the tostones, I'm a raging fan. It's a nice location in the Humboldt Park hood and easy to find. You can smell the rotisserie chicken from their parking lot across the street. You better beware though, it smells that fantastic from the immense amount of garlic each is slathered with. If you're not careful, it can stay with you for the rest of the day. I always make a point of having a fizzy drink with my dinner; I'm convinced it helps. Most of the time it's my Caribbean favorites Kola Champagne or Coco Rico. They also offer ginger ale, root beer, Pepsi, and parcha (AKA passion fruit). There are daily dinner specials but my favorite day at Papa's is Saturday. The one day a week lechon is awesome. It's easy to find this over salty, greasy, or dry in other places, but Papa knows pork. It's perfectly seasoned on its own, however Mama has a kick in the mouth green hot sauce that pairs wonderfully with the roast pig. The tostones are reliably good. Some other places don't change their oil enough or they half cook the plantain in advance. Papa seems to clean the fryer regularly and make the delicious twice fried platanos to order. Garlic makes a not so subtle appearance on these babies too! Before I rave any more, I have to remind you that this is a mom and pop operation. They can easily run out of specials before they close. Sometimes that means you'll have a wait before you get your paws on the next batch of pollo chon. Sometimes that means you'll go without the lechon next Saturday. You can't rush the process. Speaking of rush, I don't think I've been here when the place wasn't full. So be smart or be patient! It's easier getting a table during the summer since the outdoor enclosed patio doubles the seating. If you're logical you'll read that to mean you can sit down while you wait for real Puerto Rican grub. In all seasons, between diners and their busy delivery service, I highly recommend calling ahead for takeout service. I had leftovers for breakfast this morning and I already want some more.

31.description: Mother of fucking god is their jibarito the best thing I've ever put into my face. I try to go here weekly to get my steak jibarito and Kola Champagne fix and I never leave disappointed. Although, I never arrive home from the drive to the restaurant with the food I just ordered because I've eaten it on the ride back. I would highly recommend coming here for the jibaritos. The proportions between the meat and the plantain and the veggies and cheese are so beyond perfect. I haven't had the chicken here yet, but if it's as good as the jibaritos, I'm definitely going to be slam dunking them into my face soon enough.

34.description: This is great for jibaritos! Enough said. I grew up coming to this location with my mother for lunch. We both enjoyed this place and the owner is pretty awesome. Other than jibaritos, its just okay food.

16.description: Loved this place!! Went with some coworkers on a Friday for dinner to try their jibarito sandwich. It's a BYOB place so we picked up some coronas and limes on the way. We sat outside in the front where they have an enclosed patio-like area. The weather was warm so it was really nice to eat out there.The staff was so friendly and helpful! The waitress noticed our limes and offered to cut them for us. She also brought them back in a nice little to go container. All of us got the jibarito and it was DELICIOUS!!!! I had the steak which was well seasoned and the crispy plantains were a good replacement for bread. Also had a side of Spanish rice which was pretty tasty too. Overall, awesome food and service. (The waitress brought my friend a to go box without us even having to ask) More of a dive though so don't go if you're looking for something more fancy and upscale. And don't forget to BYOB :)

13.description: I love the food here but the service for the first time was rude. I  guess I have to take it to go instead. I recommend restaurants for a living I wouldn't as of this last experience ever recommend a client here again. But the food is delicious.I change my order from a go to a dining in and I brought a friend and they just took my order out of the bag and presented to me in my carbon box at my table. I waited a half hour to be served glasses for our drinks very very rude. I'm in the service industry and it's pretty embarrassing that in my own neighborhood the service is this absurd.

11.description: Love this place everything on the menu taste like moms cooking....Only down fall is that even tho its BYOB they dont offer buckets of ice to keep ur wine/beer cold

39.description: My sister suggested this place just a block from her place . The steak jibarito is a winner ! Loved the fried garlicky plantains used as the "bread" for the sandwich . I could pass on the rice it was served with though. I thought the rice was little overlooked or dry for my taste.

37.description: The best jibrarito sandwich i have tried. Loved the steak flavor combined with the garlicky plantains.Can't wait to try other items on the menu.

0.description: This place, and basically the entire neighborhood, was wonderful! I had a jibarito for the first time - a Puerto Rican sandwich that is pretty  specific to the community in Chicago. Basically, instead of bread, the sandwich is on two large slices of fried plantain! It was absolutely delicious. Our server was super sweet, fast, and helpful explaining a couple of menu items that my friends and I did not know! I wish I remembered her name. The owner was great as well! At least, I'm going to assume he was the owner. He was super friendly and welcoming and cracked a few jokes with us. It's a pretty small restaurant, but on a Friday evening it wasn't very busy. It's definitely a small "hole in the wall" family type restaurant. The only small issue was that we couldn't split our check, but it was stated on the menu and my friends and I worked it out ourselves. I appreciate that if you're going to have that policy, it's clearly stated! So that was nice.Over all, a great place. The food and the service and the atmosphere felt very true to Humboldt Park, and that is worth it's weight in gold in this gentrified city!

38.description: Everything on the menu is phenomenal!The service is somewhat slow when busy but all the food is freshly made so that is totally understandable.  It is truly worth the wait.You won't be sorry. There is something  for everyone! !

51.description: The best part about this place (beside the food)is how everyone plays musical chairs to give up their seats to those waiting for food to go or eating in. I love this place man, the best rice, fried plaintain sandwich (Jibarito - HIB A REET OH) and good nice owners who care about the quality of food and service. I always feel very welcome with my family here. Been coming for years and I hope to for many more.

27.description: Ordered a steak Jibarito. Which is basically a sandwich made of fried plantains. The meat was juicy and the plantains had this fresh garlicky taste. There was also this welcoming and homey feel to the restaurant. Loved my food and the place.

32.description: First, this isn't a white tablecloth, tuxedoed waiters kind of place. Family owned and run with good food and reasonable prices.  Wasn't familiar with this place until Doña Rosa's Ibis Restaurant at North and Campbell closed a number of years ago. Tried other restaurants on Division and a couple long established spots near California with no success. Then came across Papa's and have been going since.  One major plus for me is no pork in the arroz con gandules or the beans. Can't eat due to medical condition and believe me, being Puerto Rican and not being able to eat pork or red meat was initially difficult. However, learned to live with it and haven't had either since 1992. The jibaritos, yuca with garlic olive oil, rotisserie chicken and arroz con gandules are the bomb! My wife and son also enjoy the bistec encebollado. Small place with about 7-8 tables inside so try hours other than lunch and dinner rush so you can sit down and enjoy. Also have outdoor seating during the summer and year 'round free parking in lot across the street. Don't forget to ask for Carmen's homemade hot sauce! Better yet, take a bottle home. Buen provecho!

54.description: I had arroz con gandules and chicken... The chicken was delicious and staff is really  friendly. I would definitely recommend it.

48.description: Loved this place!! Went with some coworkers on a Friday for dinner to try their jibarito sandwich. It's a BYOB place so we picked up some coronas and limes on the way. We sat outside in the front where they have an enclosed patio-like area. The weather was warm so it was really nice to eat out there.The staff was so friendly and helpful! The waitress noticed our limes and offered to cut them for us. She also brought them back in a nice little to go container. All of us got the jibarito and it was DELICIOUS!!!! I had the steak which was well seasoned and the crispy plantains were a good replacement for bread. Also had a side of Spanish rice which was pretty tasty too. Overall, awesome food and service. (The waitress brought my friend a to go box without us even having to ask) More of a dive though so don't go if you're looking for something more fancy and upscale. And don't forget to BYOB :)

44.description: So... I can say I've had Latin food for the first time. My friend took me here while visiting Chicago. I don't eat meat so my friend suggested the veggie jibarito sandwich with rice. It was grilled onions, lettuce, and other veggies between two large slices of plantain. It was tasty. However, it was extremely salty and greasy. If you worry about high blood pressure, this sandwich is not for you.

24.description: Went here a couple days ago with friends and I ordered " Mamas salad " which wasn't your ordinary salad, it was more like stir fry and the chicken was dry. I probably should've read the menu when it said "Grilled Veggies over a bed of lettuce", I was kind of dissapointed. My friends enjoyed the regular rostiserre chicken plates which is great. Another downside is they do add 20% gratuity to their checks already even if it was only 4 of us, which we didn't expect. Overall, it was ok.

7.description: Im very disappointed with papa cache it used to be one of my faves :(. The food is awesome besides the rice. TRY THE HIBARITO! But the service sucks. The girl on the phone is so rude and sounds so annoyed by anything I say. Im also disappointed that they no longer take orders over the phone. What about the elderly people who don't know how to use grub hub... The delivery guy is always forgetting something. Maybe its because its always busy but please try to be more nice to people you might just get more customers.

49.description: Oh yes! This was an amazing find - thank you again Yelp! Looking for something in the neighborhood either Puerto Rican or Spanish - the reviews drew us in. It's small and casual. We sat ourself in what is probably an outdoor but with the weather they had it tented in. There was maybe 5 tables inside/5 outside. I noticed they do a ton of pickup/takeout business. Well I couldn't get passed the recommendation of the steak jibaritoe - it was amazing served on pan fried plantains with the home made hot sause I MEAN heaven!!!
