B/f got 1/2 chicken that he loved too. Service amazing - it's BYOB but there is a liquor store across street. Easy parking. Super nice workers and the food - my mouth is watering just writing about it. We will be back!

40.description: Disappointed to say the least. I was looking forward to trying this place after reading all the great reviews...But when I got there they were closed. I called and the person there told me that they were not open yet because the staff was late and she didn't know when they would open. Total lack of professionalism. They announce there supposed to be open at 11am. Total joke!

53.description: This place is great, but they take forever and a day to make your food. With a little patience, you'll be good to go though!

30.description: Could not decide between the jibarito and the chicken so that gives me good reason to return!   Went with the chicken which was very tender and tasty.   The tostones were perfectly crisp and garlicky.   The yuca was amazing!!!  The service was great.

46.description: I love this place!!!

1.description: Slow.  Terrible service.  Nobody every shows a hint of a smile.  Place can be empty and will still take 40 minutes to get two sandwiches.  Terrible and it's too bad because the jibarrittos are great.Edit:Food was terrible this time too.  Plantain overcooked.  Chicken dry.  1/2 Star

55.description: So delicious! Must try the chicken, has some secret, famous sauce that's amazing! We also had the steak jibarito which is also amazing! Its a hidden gem, very unsuspecting from the outside but a must try. Will def be back!

9.description: Go. If you want authentic jiberottos then there isn't another spot. The owner is this warm , bubbly Latina that treats everyone with a smile and as if u are la familia. The chicken is great also but runs out fast so don't come at 9pm thinking you will get the chicken. The place I'd definitely a dive but you won't regret it at all. I love love this place.

26.description: I had the steak jibarito and Puerto Rican rice. It was incredible as take out and will definitely order again. Hit the spot! Very fast delivery too.

25.description: I love the food here but the service for the first time was rude. I  guess I have to take it to go instead. I recommend restaurants for a living I wouldn't as of this last experience ever recommend a client here again. But the food is delicious.I change my order from a go to a dining in and I brought a friend and they just took my order out of the bag and presented to me in my carbon box at my table. I waited a half hour to be served glasses for our drinks very very rude. I'm in the service industry and it's pretty embarrassing that in my own neighborhood the service is this absurd.

12.description: The food is good when they don't let the chicken dry out.I've ordered though grub hub multiple times and they keep messing up my order. Either they totally forget items, add cheese to one but not the other, or pick what they give you instead of fulfilling the order. Not worth the headache anymore. See ya

59.description: DO NOT use the delivery services!  I go on lunch at 12pm everyday so I decided I would call my order in as soon as they open at 11:00am. At 11:08 I placed the order, 1:08 my lunch still wasn't here. I called over 15 times and got no answer. 1:15 my food was here but my lunch was over, then there was a $7.00 delivery charge. Now that SUCKS!!!

21.description: This is for a to-go order. This place seems to cater more to frequent goers. The girl that answered the phone was not too friendly, and when I asked a couple questions about the menu - she seemed annoyed by the fact that I even had the gall to ask them. Arriving to get my food was no different. People that were behind me in line were allowed to cut in front of me, who all seemed like they were acquainted with the owners/workers there. One person cutting is OK, but three did it in the time I was there. Not cool. When I did get to tell her why I was there, my food was already there waiting for me to pick it up. I ordered the Camarones en Salsa, and the other ordered Jibarito con Arroz. The Camarones was really lackluster and had about 5 shrimp in it. The price tag? A whopping 14.50! The Jibarito con Arroz was a bit too greasy for the other's liking. They do their rice well though.Another nice touch - they give you complimentary fried plaintains! A bit over-salted.All in all - LOSE THE ATTITUDE because that's enough for me to never come back again. The food is good, but that type of money can get you something better in Chicago.

17.description: Oh my Gosh, the best ever! ...if you haven't had a jibarito. ..get one here!  I promise you will not be disappointed!

10.description: My favorite classic jibarito that is true to how i always remember them tasting! Aside from the jibarito, the chicken dinner is fantastic. I love the service too everyone is always welcoming. Summer time also isn't complete without enjoying a lunch out front.

5.description: This is for a to-go order. This place seems to cater more to frequent goers. The girl that answered the phone was not too friendly, and when I asked a couple questions about the menu - she seemed annoyed by the fact that I even had the gall to ask them. Arriving to get my food was no different. People that were behind me in line were allowed to cut in front of me, who all seemed like they were acquainted with the owners/workers there. One person cutting is OK, but three did it in the time I was there. Not cool. When I did get to tell her why I was there, my food was already there waiting for me to pick it up. I ordered the Camarones en Salsa, and the other ordered Jibarito con Arroz. The Camarones was really lackluster and had about 5 shrimp in it. The price tag? A whopping 14.50! The Jibarito con Arroz was a bit too greasy for the other's liking. They do their rice well though.Another nice touch - they give you complimentary fried plaintains! A bit over-salted.All in all - LOSE THE ATTITUDE because that's enough for me to never come back again. The food is good, but that type of money can get you something better in Chicago.

3.description: Yummmmm......saborrrrrrrrr *rolling "R" horribly*After going through a stint of earing chicken nuggets and fries from Wendy's for about a month (and 10 pounds later. Preggo problems), I have finally shaken the desire for that crap and am back to desiring hot, home cooked food. While coming from the north side of the city, I was not looking forward to rattling through pots and pans to cook, while my begging dog claws at my ankles at 10 something at night. I sighed as I continued driving down Division Street. The options around in either direction didn't appeal to me at all - Burger King, McDonald's..... BARF!!!! As I passed under the big Puerto Rican flag, I immediately thought about how I stopped at about 3 PR food trucks through Humboldt Park a few days ago (don't judge me) and how good a jibarito would be. I then passed Papas. It was a sign from the plantain gods!!!!I pulled a uturn and stopped. It's a very small place that you would totally miss if you weren't looking for it. There's plenty of street parking though. The inside is pretty small but that does nothing to take away from the PR feel of the place as you smell the aromas of the island and gaze at all of the celebrity pics on the wall. I ordered my chicken jibarito and rice and beans. The place was packed and normally is, but that doesn't take away from their service.The taste - delicious! Plantains were perfectly cut for the sandwich. I hate when thick pieces are cut. It was fried to perfection and the garlic, olive oil, and seasoning blends were mouth watering. I wish I had more rice and beans as well. I devoured my food. They totally made a faithful patron out of me and my belly!VIVA PUERTO RICO! :-)#WhoNeedsLoveWhenYouHaveFood #ChiTownFoodieChic

35.description: Now just with some personal background info of em before i went to try the food. I was around the area a while back for the Puerto Rican fest which greatly disappointed me when i was cheated out of my money for just ok food.But moving along i decided to give it another chance and came here because I read all the positive review of people mentioning on this location which in my final verdict i agree with them this place in indeed amazing. Upon arriving I notice this place wasn't a really big location, but noticing the chicken in the chicken in the background roasting in the oven got me drooling. Was seated immediately given a small area, but at the moment it wasn't busy because it was after dinner hours. The waitress was on point in taking our orders even taught us something new of the difference between white and yellow cheese (which was shocking to learn the white cheese was american cheese and not yellow.. weird).What i order was the Jibarito con arroz (chicken cause i saw them roasting). First time ever trying it seemed like a a sandwich essentially. The patties used were flatten platens which gave it a very crispy taste and added texture to every bite and since the chicken was roasted to cook it was still juicy and like the meat ripped apart with each bite with such ease.FINAL VERDICT!!!!this spot is the place to go for Jibarito con arroz i really loved it if u haven't noticed what i rated it already. But if you believe that there is somewhere else better please send  me message of your  suggestion.. love eating..

19.description: Hopefully they increased the quality of the delivery processes because the food is great.

28.description: What? I've never wrote a review for papa cache?This place is nothing fancy, but the Food is awesomeand that is the most important thingIf your a vegetarian who likes Puerto Rican food, go here nowThe rice is veggie too, so you can finally eat the riceI would give it five stars, but the wait times are a lil long(Ppl standing in there waiting have said the same, ha!)Plus one time I got veggies on side, and they were old, not fresh, no buenoBut other than those two drawbacks, all my other experiences have been greatI like the veg jibarito, the tostones, the yucaThe inside is small, but they have outdoor seating nowAnd it's byob, always good!And street meter parkingCall your order in if you want to go, but I can't promise it will be ready when you get thereBut it will be worth the wait

45.description: Just came home from a terrible experience at this restaurant. My boyfriend and I were seated outside in the nice tent area. We were hopeful that this was going to be good. But it was TERRIBLE. It took so long for the old waitress lady to take our order. She didn't even have a pen and had to borrow mine to take our order. We watched a Puerto Rican couple sit down after us, eat and leave, while we waited 50 minutes for our 2 jibarito sandwiches. We get the feeling that it was subtle racism. The waitress never checked up on us after the food finally arrived. The jibaritos were garlicky, which was nice, but they are small and definitely not worth waiting 50 minutes for! We also ordered 2 jibaritos to go when we ordered our meals, but they were not ready even after we finished our meal. An hour and 10 minutes to make 2 stupid sandwiches? No way we are ever going back and we advise others to go elsewhere.

33.description: Outstanding food and value. My boyfriend and I went and shared the half rotisserie chicken and a steak jibarito. The skin on the outside of the chicken was so flavorful and crisp and if you like spicy food request some of their homemade hot sauce. We had never had a jibarito before and it was so addictive. The food was a bit slow to come out of the kitchen and it was a bit hard to get the waitstaff's attention because they were busy, but the food made those things easy to overlook. We will be back!!!! Yum!!

43.description: Awesome spot. Food has a nice authentic look and taste.Sat outside on the patio, enjoyed the small breeze. Must try this spot.I had the Jibarito con arroz (Chicken with cheese) delish!Order the small beans, it's enough for two human beings (maybe 3) or 1 starving monster. Also.... BYOB!I see 3 heat lamps if it's chilly outside. So you need to try it.

2.description: Best steak jibarritos, ever! If you come here, you definitely have to try it... super tasty!!Whether you're dining in or ordering take-out, the staff is fast and friendly. It can get pretty packed, especially during spring or summertime, but the food is definitely worth the wait. My mom has gotten the rotisserie chicken for our family and everyone loved it!

18.description: My overall experience was good. Papa the owner is always engaging in conversations with his customers making the atmosphere welcoming. The waiters could be a little more friendly. The food was delicious I had Steak I highly recommended it.

41.description: The food here is really good. I would just say the service isn't that great. They never checked on us or offered a box. We sat there for a while waiting for the check.

52.description: Great food!! Service is quick too! Prices are great!! Eat outside so that you don't get the strong food smell on your clothes unless you don't care!!

50.description: The chicken is muy sabroso and inexpensive. Best roasted chicken I have had in a long time. Juicy and well seasoned. No dry white chicken meat nor undercooked meat. Papa Cache is now my go to place for roasted chicken, even if I have to drive all the way from the Southside. I also loved the Puerto Rican side dishes. The baked yucca with sautéed onions was delicious. I love the arroz con gandules so much that next time I'll order an extra order. Can't wait to try more dishes at Papa Cache.

4.description: Great food! I ordered to-go and had it delivered to my hotel through GrubHub. Food arrived on time and was nice and hot! I had the Bistec with arroz con gandules, and tostones, with flan for dessert. I am Puerto Rican from the Northeast and it is hard to find authentic PR food when I travel. This place made it happen! Delicious and I would definitely recommend.

6.description: Wonderful jibarrito. The meat was cooked to perfection and had great flavor. Just the right amount of toppings and the plantain was crunchy and the right thickness. The arroz con gandules or 'Spanish rice' as the woman called it... Lol. Was flavorful and fluffy. They don't have pasteles (Puerto Rican tamale), rellenos de papa (meat stuffed potato), or morcilla (blood sausage) that I could see. But they had plenty of other dishes there that made your mouth water. They even have chicken on rotisserie in the back. The smells of the shop were fantastic! I will come back.

22.description: Steak Jibarito was fantastic. Don't hesitate to go on a cute byob date, didn't make me gassy. A+

15.description: Can you say JIBARITOOOOO? (That's pronounced hee-bah-ree-to) They are so delicious and nutritious. Ha, probably not nutritious, but DAMN are they good! If you've never had one and you want a different Chicago culinary experience, try this place out! Here's the low down. Fried plantains serve as the "bread". Sweet and lovely. It comes with avocado, cheese (the choices are, and I quote, "yellow or white"), mayo, tomatoes, lettuce and some sort of meat if you like. I am a veggie monster, and it's enough without the meat! That little bad boy is flavorful and greasy to the max! You get a side either spanish rice or red beans and rice. A whole meal for $7 and some change. Worth it. Or if you're like me, you eat half and save the rest for your drunken late night snack. Perfect for soaking up the booze. I usually choose the latter. Absolutely wonderful. Take it to go or pop a squat inside. It's a bit cozy but if you want a real Humboldt Park experience, this is it! YUMMMMM.

57.description: VIVIR MI VIDA......Ay Papa's Cache is definitely sabroso y la comida (food) tiene mucho sabor. Ahaaw, so I actually heard the song, "Vivir Mi Vida" by Marc Anthony playing here. It took me away to a tropical oasis vibe, and I wanted to do a few salsa steps. Hey, I'm sure I would have gotten the glare-down "WTF are you doin' look!" There is a definite Barrio vibe here. Everyone, from Abuelas to Niños comes for the knockout kick-ass authentic Puerto Rican comida featuring several dishes dashingly presented, and others simply massive: Mofongo al pilon de bistec (savory shredded beef over mashed green plantains) and pernil con arroz y gandules (roasted pork shoulder with pigeon peas and rice) are big enough to split. We love that this place is BYOW (bring your own whatever), and has a reasonable price-point. Over the years, we have been here over 12 times. I was shocked that I had not written a review for one of my favorite Puerto Rican restaurants (or if I want to change it up and get my freak-on with other PR joints I hit up La Plena or Juanita's). Papa's Cache has been my jam for the last several years. It's definitely a juicy gastronomic paradise if you are into this type of food. Papa's hace que mi vida valga (Papa's makes my life worth living)!  ;DIf you enjoy Tostones (fried plantains that are NOT sweet) then try the Jibarito de bistec. The Jibarito contains generous flavorful tender steak meat and the tostones serve as the bread that holds it all together. These tostones have a crispy exterior and tender interior. Although deep-fried they are not greasy. The Jibarito (pronounced "He-Bah-Ree-Tow") is a Puerto Rican sandwich that is very popular here. Is it healthy? Hell no! It is loaded with tons of fat and calories. There is nothing healthy about a HE-BAH-REE-TOW!!!  If you eat these everyday you may end up with clogged arteries or high cholesterol for that matter. Hey, if you consider fried food healthy you better look up the fooken definition. The tostones are deep fried, but once in a great while I crave this type of food. Come to Papa's -- he satisfies me every single damn time! Papa's will satisfy you too (hey, I'm talkin' 'bout food here, not sex)!BTW, their house made ají is delectable, aromatic and a must-try. The flavor is spicy, unusual and complex, with overtones of black pepper and coriander kicking up the food flavor by several notches. I like their coffee -- it is robust but not bitter yet strong -- and reminds me of a strong Espresso (not "EXpresso"). Some guy on Yelp Talk got bent out of shape, because some people spell it "Expresso" and not "Espresso." You say "Tomato" and I say "Tomata" ....Hey, who gives a flying fook...but I digress....oh yeah, back to the food. It is perfecto, sabroso y por la maceta! I see that we have a couple of "Debbie Downer" reviews here from people who have less than 10-reviews. Get over yourselves, and go have a can of beer! If you call in your order at 11 am and receive your comida at 1:15 pm, well this is about right, because Spanish people (and yeah, I am half-Latina) operate on a different time zone. If you calculate that time to West coast time (not Central time), then you received your comida on time! ;DMy sister is married to a Puerto Rican guy. They met while in Graduate School, and his Mother, who is deceased, used to make the best Puerto Rican food I have ever, ever had. Every time I have eaten here it brings back memories of her delicious Puerto Rican comida. Damn, I miss her cooking! The service is non-effusive, so it receives 4-stars. This is not a fancy joint. It is a down-to-earth restaurant with friendly service and wonderful philoxenia. Also, parking is not difficult in this area of the city. This is a super small joint, so if you plan to have dinner here, go early especially on a Friday or Saturday. NOTE TO SELF: Wear my work out Yoga pant next time (hey, you better wear something that stretches or you'll have to unbutton your jeans when you get to your car)! "I fell in love with Papa's Cache Sabroso Warm wind carried on the sea, he called to meTe dijo que te amoI prayed that the days would lastThey went so fast."Oh yeah, it went way too fast, so I'll be back again for my next jam of Puerto Rican chow down. I am always super fain and super sate whenever I eat here!Check out "Vivir Mi Vida" youtube.com/watch?v=ziUI…

20.description: This is more of a grub hub review. I ordered on grub hub around 7:30pm. My order was supposed to come around 9:30pm. I got my order around 10:10pm. Not only was my order late but all my food was smashed. The rice was covering my jibarito and tacos. I had to dig with a spoon to figure out if all the food I ordered was even there. I called grub hub and they said they'd call the restaurant. The restaurant only gave me $15 back (less than half of the total cost). If we were to bring the food back, they wouldn't do anything about it, given the time (closing time). I'm super disappointed, especially since I liked this place.

36.description: We went on Friday evening and it wasn't too crowded. They have BYOB and give complimentary French bread bites. We ordered a chicken jabrito with Spanish rice, it was a plantain sandwich- chicken breast, lettuce, tomatoe and cheese. Hubby ordered a chicken sandwich. It's peurtorican cuisine. Service was quick and they have a parking lot right across the street. I deducted one Star because I found the sandwiches to be a little too oily.

14.description: My son and I went this prior Saturday for the first time. We ordered steak sandwiches and I had a side of arroz con gandules and he had the arroz blanco with habichuelas. All the food was fresh and flavorful. OMG they have this green garlicy hot sauce that I would bath in it if I could. You have to try it...My new fave spot...

58.description: One of the best beefs I've ever had growing up in Chicago. Old school place, delicious beef.

56.description: Great Classic Beef Sandwich - Perfect Hot and Sweet Peppers - Excellent Greasy French Fries - Bare Bones Dive-y Atmosphere - Fun Guys Behind the Counter - Good Eating - Authentic - Hits the Spot!

29.description: Italian beef and fries.. That's the ticket! Worth the drive west for a juicy dipped Italian.

42.description: Wow, what happened Joe Boston? You used to have 5 star beef sandwiches. I picked up 2 beefs to go last night and had to check the bag to be sure both were in there. (Because the bag was so light.)  There was about 1/2 the amount of meat in there than in previous visits. And the bread was totally stale. Did I just catch you on a bad day, or are you getting cheap?  I'll give you one more chance, but you better get it right next time or I'm done with you.  One more thing...clean the place up, it's nasty dirty in there.

23.description: Well-spiced beef, generous portion for the price. The fries were undersalted, but that's easy enough to fix. Prices were great -- definitely worth the trip to this out of the way hole in the wall!

47.description: Hands down the worse Italian beef sandwich I've had. If you like your sandwich soggy to the point where it's literally disintegrating in your hand than this place is for you

8.description: Every once in awhile I have an Italian beef that Just knocks my wig back....... This isn't one of those times. I must admit,  it wasn't disgusting, but it didn't have that uumph to it. I loved the fact that individually I could taste the cheese,  the meat,  the peppers and the bread. With that being said,  the meat was tasteless. That was my only complaint aside From The thing being so darn small.

31.description: Def the best beef!  Better than portillos.    We shared. Combo. Sausage and beef. Cheddar and hot peppers. Soo good!

34.description: Did I go to the wrong place? I bought a groupon $30 for $16.50(Three $10 groupons). The beef was pretty light on the meat compared to most places in Chicago. Bread didn't hold up and the beef didn't have any seasoning. Fries sucked. The inside was disgusting. Sticky tables, over flowing trash, broken chairs. I can't imagine the kitchen is that clean. Johnnys is way better, so are Portillos and Als. That being said, I'm not going back. If anyone wants the two other groupons(expiration 10/3/2014), send me a message and I'll email them to you for free.

16.description: Pop in and treat yourself right. Joe Boston's serves up a perfect Italian beef, and the atmosphere and location couldn't be more romantic. Ok, I'm kidding about that but the sandwich is exactly what it's supposed to be. Delicious, messy and 100% Chicago. Pop in, order, eat, leave happy.Take note, Italian beef is good but the sausage and the peppers & eggs not so much. In fact they are terrible.

13.description: Solid Italian beef. We got it spicy with cheese and dunked well. Bread was nice and juicy soaked in jous and it held up all the way through.

11.description: As a non-Chicago native, I was surprised to learn of the Italian beef's existence as an adult. The ten years that have passed since this revelation have been a quest for the ultimate beef. Well, friends, on this day, that quest has come to a triumphant end. Joe Boston is the king of The Beef.

39.description: Pretty decent Italian beef but not that memorable. The inside is also clean but pretty nondescript. If you're in the area and  want an Italian beef, it's a pretty good choice but I wouldn't travel for miles to go here.

37.description: I use Johnny's as the gold standard for Italian Beef in the Chicago area. Joe Boston's beef is perfectly good, but not as good as Johnny's to my taste buds. It has to do with the seasoning of the beef. Johnny's beef is more flavorful. Of course, if I'm in the neighborhood, I'd stop and have a Joe Boston beef without hesitation. Again, the flavor is a matter of personal preference. Service: They don't have the concept of queueing here, which should be fundamental. People just crowd around the counter and it's impossible to understand who is next.Atmosphere: It's a beef stand. Could be updated.It's nice that they have pepper and eggs, but only on Fridays. Too bad. C would order that any day of the week.

0.description: Joe Bostons has the best Beef, Fry, and Pop deal in all of Chicago. The price point is decent but the beef is 100%!! So so good with awesome Giardiniera.Along with the beef sandwich from Bari on Grand and Pops on Kedzie, this is the BEST italian beef sangweech in Chicago.

38.description: This place rocks.  I searched yelp for "beef" because I didn't want the hassle or expense of going to a Al's or Portillo's... There's easy parking here, great value for the money, and delicious beef sandwiches.

51.description: If I didn't get fries, this would have been 5 stars.  But the fries at Joe Boston's are pretty weak.  Crunchy, bad ketchup, served kibbles-and-bits-style (I'm a big fan of full-length fries; I know I'm weird in that way.).  Skip the combo, bring a drink with you and buy the sandwiches to eat in your car.But the beef, oh my goodness, my Italian beef dipped was magic.  Incredible flavor, spicy, shredded beef was tender, bread was not totally soaked through five minutes later (like the dipped is at Al's).  $7 for a big sammich, fries and a drink, and that drink can be Mountain Dew?  Yes sir!  I'm actually surprised, given the legend of this place, that only 80-something Yelpers have reviewed this spot; something is very wrong with this picture.Staff was great (guy in the kitchen clearly has been using his script of one-liners for years) and the decor is just as divey as you would expect.  I'm actually thankful that Boston's is not open later, because bad decisions would be made here regularly otherwise.

27.description: It's 30 degrees on Chicago's streets, I walk in for warmth & its 5 degrees in this place.. Geesh! Anywho, I ordered a combo, extra juicy w/fries. Received it quickly & left since it was freezing in the place. My fries had no salt & were hard. My combo was just OK. The Italian sausage was skinny & looked sick. It tasted even worse. My beef meat was just OK as well as my under dipped beef. (I requested extry juicy/dip). So it's safe to say I came, I saw, I conquered. I'm not returning tho.

32.description: Great Italian beef sandwiches at this location.  Unfortunately, I do not know all the Chicago-Italian-beef-lingo: hot peppers, sweet peppers, dipped, not dipped, and he had some other questions where I did not understand what was being asked.After I ate my sandwich I wish I had purchased a second sandwich as the first was so good.  I will be back!  And I loved the fact that there was not a single thing on the wall.  Other hole-in-the-wall restaurants have too many pictures, tchotchkes, and other nonsense on the walls.  The bare-bones look sets Joe's Italian Beef apart from other divey restaurants.Free street parking! You don't see that in Chicago often.

54.description: This is the real deal Italian Beef. No frills no decor just some of the best Italian Beef that I have ever had.The help is friendly and the food comes promptly as ordered. My one criticism.... If you want cheese on your beef it's cheddar not mozzarella. The beef is great and it doesn't need cheese. A group of 6 ate for less than $45.00 Forget Portillos, forget Al's, sorry Mr. Beef but I am a convert to Boston's and I hadn't known about it until a couple days ago when I found it on Yelp!

48.description: Good sandwich and meal. Flaw is that it's in a super sketchy location in humboldt park and both times I went there the only patrons looked/acted like addicts and hookers. It's def a well known establishment. I am sure I will go back sometime soon!

44.description: The Italian beef was absolutely amazing. Joes is a true neighborhood chicago gem when it comes to casual dining. If you have had a long day at work and are looking for a place to find a meal that makes the day melt away as you enjoy each juicy bite of a dipped Italian beef and where customer service is 100% this is the place to go.

24.description: Joe Boston is the best. They are my place for an Italian beef sandwich. If you take me to Al's I will punch you in da chroat, take you r keys and burn your tires bald driving to Boston's. Den I'll eat two dipped beef sammiches in the front seat before taking a nap.

7.description: I've grew up in the area and this place is still my favorite.  Every time I'm in town this is a must stop!  The Italian beef has so much flavor.  Everyone that I've taken here has been very impressed! Try it out you won't be disappointed.

49.description: I had to update on a second trip.I got the combo- Sausage and beef piled high on beefy-deliscious au jus bread.  I could not have enjoyed my experience more.Its out of the way, but way worth it!

40.description: I've been to probably 50+ beef joints since I moved back here 7 years ago. And stumbled on this place by accident on Thrillist. If you are driving by and didn't know to go here you would probably drive right by. But you'd be making a huge mistake. It is now, hands down, the BEST beef I have EVER had!! If you haven't been and love Italian Beef you have to come here!! Amazing!!

53.description: Drove a long way because of great reviews , but was dissapointed with the bland italian beef and the barely cooked fries. $7.00 for a beef fries and drink.....won't be going here again.     ON THE PLUS SIDE THE WORKERS HERE ARE AWESOME!!

30.description: It's the best if you dine in instead of take out.  The fries were cold after they got home even though the sandwiches did sustain the entire journey.  I asked my husband to bring them home after his work day was over because we had to use up the groupon before the expiration day.  I will stay diligent to make a trip to there from now on.

46.description: Decent Italian beef, but I left disappointed. The sandwich was consistent with what I expect at an Italian Beef place, but I found the service dismissive and unfriendly. The eat in experience is unpleasant, as the place reeks of grease. Take-out is an option, but make sure not to get the sandwich dipped or semi-dipped, as you will end up with some soggy mush.On the whole, the sandwich is reasonably satisfying, but not worth a trek.

1.description: We came here after my girlfriend saw the taping of food network's "the best thing I ever ate". We dined in and we have to say their beef sandwiches and cheese fries were a let down. Just bland, no flavor, no seasoning.It might be that we compare Italian beefs to our favorite Al's beef on Taylor St. Well we have to say Boston's doesn't come close to Al's in flavor sorry.

55.description: Seriously now! The best freaking italian beef in Chicago...HANDS DOWN. No joke. The place needs some kinds updating but whatever. The beef is ridiculous and that all that matters. They are nice, they serve great beef and sausages and they are happy to see you.

9.description: A REAL Chicago Beef Joint!!Old School.Great Beefs, Sausage, Combos and Hot Dogs.

26.description: I went with a group, and we were very split in our opinions, some were very happy and some were very much not. The beef tastes like beef that is cooked in water, their was no flavoring to it. The bread was fine. The peppers are good. The fries were very soggy. The guys behind the counter are very unpleasant. They yelled at me when I didn't order fast enough and then when one of the people at my table was too busy talking to hear their order called, they harassed him. It's a total hole too. It looks like 1 good Chicago wind would blow it down. And after the disappointment, I had to drive back for like 30 minutes to get home. Not impressed and wouldn't recommend.

25.description: This place would have been at least 4 stars had I not got the fries and a hot dog..I'll start with the good...the beef is excellent, no complaints about that at all..Great flavor, melt in your mouth texture(pause), sweet peppers were well proportioned and had good flavor as well, bread was nice and soft and the "dip" was also good, not too sloppy not to dry. So no problem there..The fries are no good, small crunchy salt-less fries. The hot dog was probably the worst I've had, it was the size and texture of a slim jim on the most stale bun in Chicago. Also "everything" means only mustard, relish and onion. I wasn't even mad cause the beef was so good. I'll definitely return for the beef..

12.description: I'm an idiot have driven by the place many many times. never stopped ,never cared, don't know what's wrong with me. stopped today it was f****** delicious I want to slap myself for being stupid .i won't make that mistake again .will stop just about every time I Drive by I will be 462 pounds the next time I write a review on Yelp don't be an idiot stop get a beef

59.description: Ehhh, it was ok. I had their beef late on a Tuesday night so maybe it was an off day butI've definitely had better. Definitely could have done without the fries as they were major freezer burn. I'll have to try this place again but probably not.

21.description: This place is an ugly, weird out of place hole in the wall in a forest of abandoned wharehouses. Just the way I like it...Normally I am a fan of trendy and cool spots that serve fancy cocktails and lively cuisines. However when it comes to beef sandwiches give me the hole in the wall that serves up fat, juicy beef sandwiches all day long. This place embodies Chicago, a real old school joint. It was established to serve the many blue collar workers that worked in the area many decades ago. Those places have mostly left but Boston's still stands proud catering to a new gentrified crowd. After a rather dissapointing experience with Bari's beef a few weeks ago it was nice to get back to familiar tastes. The beef just melts in your mouth along with nice peaks of oregano. Good bread that held everything together, i was rather pleased with my beef. This is what a chicago beef should be like. Unfortunately it does NOT unseat Mr. Beef on Harlem as the best beef I've ever had. While the flavors were very good a few subtle shortfalls spelled its doom for top spot. There were some nice peaks of oregano but it didn't explode in my mouth like Mr. Beef.  Also the beefs here are kind of small and not as much beef jammed inside, it seemed like i just took 3 bites and it was gone. Oh BTW, what's up with those fries (controlled portion)? Are they not the most boring fries ever?  Mr. Beef's fries are better and more plentiful.Overall a very good beef and the type of place a beef joint should be in. They would make my top 5 beefs list. Just NOT #1.

17.description: It's the best if you dine in instead of take out.  The fries were cold after they got home even though the sandwiches did sustain the entire journey.  I asked my husband to bring them home after his work day was over because we had to use up the groupon before the expiration day.  I will stay diligent to make a trip to there from now on.

10.description: Flew into Chicago O'Hare in the morning and used the blue line and went straight to Kenzie station.  Took a bus that dropped me a block away from Joe Boston's.  Not the nicest area of town, but fine right before lunch.  No line.  It's about a mile walk from the Blue line and a little less using the red line.  2.5 stars for accessibility.It's on my bucket list for food--Best Thing I Ever Ate food network program (see wikipedia)--so it was the first thing I tried.  Ordered the Italian Beef with cheese and sweet peppers, dipped.  I was hungry and inhaled it in about 5 minutes.  Similar to a Philly cheesesteak but tastier and wetter since it was dipped.  Noticed that the fries were frozen in a bag.  Did not try.  Not exactly gourmet.  3.5 stars for the food.  More of a dive than a date place.Should try the Italian Beef and Sausage sandwich, dipped.  If I come back that is what I would try.

5.description: This place is great! I love their Italian beef sandwiches are great! I usually get the beef and sausage combo dipped with hot and sweet peppers. The service is great as well. My favorite is James who makes the drinks he is friendly and welcoming. They have great chicken sandwiches as well.

3.description: This place puts Al's to shame! Not that thats hard but still! I hear a lot of complaints that the staff isn't friendly but they've always been cool with me and IT'S A BEEF JOINT, what do you really expect. Definitely a must for any Italian beef lover or beers fan.

35.description: This is still the best beef in town. Rarely will you catch a line, and is still a decent price. Last time I went to al's on taylor  I was charged to dip?? Crazy. Boston's is the best!

19.description: Def the best beef!  Better than portillos.    We shared. Combo. Sausage and beef. Cheddar and hot peppers. Soo good!

28.description: Pop in and treat yourself right. Joe Boston's serves up a perfect Italian beef, and the atmosphere and location couldn't be more romantic. Ok, I'm kidding about that but the sandwich is exactly what it's supposed to be. Delicious, messy and 100% Chicago. Pop in, order, eat, leave happy.Take note, Italian beef is good but the sausage and the peppers & eggs not so much. In fact they are terrible.

45.description: Sadly, i am just able to give 2 stars for that place. It's not even about the Italien beef sandwich, which was ok. The problem is the environment and the CLEANLINESS. I never saw such dirty garbage cans like this in my entire life! They are disgusting, obviously never got cleaned  at all. It's just not possible to enjoy anything when you are surrounded by dirt... And the big question for me is: How the kitchen looks like if they are not able to wipe trash cans?? Sorry. Complete no go... It's not a "first-date-restaurant" for sure :)

33.description: Just okay. Nothing special. Bread was not great. Beef was kind of bland. There are much better places. What was quite hilarious was when I asked the clerk for a beef and sausage combo, he looked at me with a glazed look. Like I was asking for a filet mignon. Very weird.

43.description: Best Italian Beef found for Chicago.  It was a place that was featured on Food Network a couple of years ago.  Highly recommended for their delicious Italian Beef, and the excellent food value for the price, makes it well worth the visit.

2.description: I heard you can't leave Chicago without getting Italian Beef.. so we did just that on a random Monday. After getting off the train, we walked around a mile to go here, and it was totally worth it! We got their famous italian beef sandwich with au ju dip and it came out in minutes.The beef and bread was soaked in the sauce, so everything was soft and tender. The quality of the beef was good, and it goes extremely well with the peppers! We killed our sandwich within minutes, and was left wanting more. Glad I got to try the italian beef here, as it did not disappoint! Let's see if I can find a good spot out here in LA....

18.description: Great Italian beef sandwiches at this location.  Unfortunately, I do not know all the Chicago-Italian-beef-lingo: hot peppers, sweet peppers, dipped, not dipped, and he had some other questions where I did not understand what was being asked.After I ate my sandwich I wish I had purchased a second sandwich as the first was so good.  I will be back!  And I loved the fact that there was not a single thing on the wall.  Other hole-in-the-wall restaurants have too many pictures, tchotchkes, and other nonsense on the walls.  The bare-bones look sets Joe's Italian Beef apart from other divey restaurants.Free street parking! You don't see that in Chicago often.

41.description: I bought a groupon and each time I went it seemed the food got worse. First of all the restaurant is located in a diverse neighborhood, so why do people look at you like you came in to rob the place. Second, the fries suck, they could do better serving homemade fries. The third issue is the italian sausage on my combination was terrible. If you make a product that is subpar maybe you should buy it from a vendor. I saw the owner who I saw on a television food show that showcases Chicago food. Talk about lifeless, this guy lacks the character needed to run a succesful establishment. Anytime you visit an establishment and you are the only one ordering from the time you come in, to the time you leave, something is wrong.

52.description: Au jus kidding me?I was in Chicago this past weekend and I had a list of foods I most definitely wanted to get while there... an Italian beef was high on my priority list. I was initially going to go to Al's due to several approvals of it from Adam Richman (of Man v. Food fame), but I took to Yelp to see what was said about it. After reading that Al's was overpriced, undersized, overrated, and underwhelming (among other things), I decided I'd be better off going where the locals seem to go -- Joe Boston's.For the love of God, thank you. For $7.50, I got a dipped Combo (as recommended) with sweet and hot peppers, fries, and a Sierra Mist, because they were out of Mountain Dew. Damn!Within just a few minutes, I got my food and dug in... it didn't last long. I ate my sandwich so fast, it was almost gone before my friend got his. It took me until I was a couple bites from finishing when I realized that I didn't get the hot peppers -- only the sweet. I was slightly miffed, but the beef was so good, I hardly gave a care at all. I will say that the spicy peppers on my Italian beef would have taken me to a high I haven't been to before in my life with food... and I'm scared of heights. Maybe it's a good thing they forgot the spicy ones. The fries were hothothot out of the fryer. They had absolutely no salt on them, but I didn't really miss it... there was plenty of salt in my Combo.Joe Boston's is the definition of a dive. I've learned from many restaurant visits that the dives can often have some of the best food, and Joe Boston's is no exception to that. The only thing I'm not fond of with Joe Boston's is its location. Being an out-of-towner, I had no idea what station would be the closest. Looking at a map, it seemed to be the Green Line stop, California. If that's the closest, that's awful. I had to walk 1.25 miles through a rundown neighborhood to get to this place! As it turned out by the time I got there, it would have made a hell of a lot more sense to have just driven there and parked in the street. Ah, well... live and learn.Joe Boston's, I'll be coming for you the next time I'm in the city -- one of the highlights of my trip, for sure.

50.description: Oh it was delicious!!! This was the best Italian beef I have had in a long time!! And it was so cheap too! For $7.00 you got fries, an italian beef sandwhich with a drink. The sandwhich was a decent size and very filling! I scarfed mine down so fast. They people were also very nice and I am very glad I went! Especially after reading all the reviews Al's has gotten lately.

4.description: This place is an ugly, weird out of place hole in the wall in a forest of abandoned wharehouses. Just the way I like it...Normally I am a fan of trendy and cool spots that serve fancy cocktails and lively cuisines. However when it comes to beef sandwiches give me the hole in the wall that serves up fat, juicy beef sandwiches all day long. This place embodies Chicago, a real old school joint. It was established to serve the many blue collar workers that worked in the area many decades ago. Those places have mostly left but Boston's still stands proud catering to a new gentrified crowd. After a rather dissapointing experience with Bari's beef a few weeks ago it was nice to get back to familiar tastes. The beef just melts in your mouth along with nice peaks of oregano. Good bread that held everything together, i was rather pleased with my beef. This is what a chicago beef should be like. Unfortunately it does NOT unseat Mr. Beef on Harlem as the best beef I've ever had. While the flavors were very good a few subtle shortfalls spelled its doom for top spot. There were some nice peaks of oregano but it didn't explode in my mouth like Mr. Beef.  Also the beefs here are kind of small and not as much beef jammed inside, it seemed like i just took 3 bites and it was gone. Oh BTW, what's up with those fries (controlled portion)? Are they not the most boring fries ever?  Mr. Beef's fries are better and more plentiful.Overall a very good beef and the type of place a beef joint should be in. They would make my top 5 beefs list. Just NOT #1.

6.description: The beef sandwich here is outstanding. I prefer a Philly style cheesesteak sandwich. Chicago style Italian beef is great though. This place was on my list of places to try. I was hungover and just wanted to nap. I was driving back to the Airbnb with rest on my mind. I saw Joe Boston's on the left and knew it was a divine sign to stop. The staff working were extremely friendly and helpful.

22.description: This is the beef place. Home made beepers made right there on the premises. Can't speak on the other stuff because I always get a combo dipped with sweet peppers and Vitner's chips and a Pepsi. I drive pas a lot of beef joints to go here. Give it a go.

15.description: I live in the area and had the stroke of genius to call to ask about party orders for my upcoming birthday. I spoke to Spiro who is the owner. He helped me through the whole process and provided everything I needed to prepare and serve the sammies. He was wonderful - a total standup, hard-working Chicagoan with a business that embodies everything this city stands for. When I came to pick up my order, he was working in the kitchen preparing customers' orders. He packed up my order himself and gave me tips on preparing the beef and using the sternos. I got a pound and a half of beef, gravy, bread pre-cut into party size portions, sweet & hot peppers, sternos, a rack and tray with lid all for $30! He even gave me a Joe Boston pen! If you live in the area and are having a celebration, you should definitely check this place out. Heck, if you live anywhere in Chicago and have a hankering for quality, homemade italian beef or sausage, you should check this place out! Spiro told me that Hungry Hound just rated them #2 italian beef in Chicago, but they will always be #1 in my heart. Thank you, Spiro! I'll definitely be back.

57.description: Here's the problem with Joe Boston's: you have to deal with the crippling depression that invariably accompanies the last bite of their Italian beef sandwich.Al's? Portillo's? Buona? The fuck outta here. No, no and no. And a resounding "NO" to any other Italian beef joint whose name may now be bubbling to the surface of your misguided thoughts. Joe Boston's is the real deal--no frills, no nonsense, and certainly no bullshit.You walk in and are greeted by the delightful individual at the counter. You place your order, which is for an Italian beef, dipped, with hot peppers. You pay. You wait, briefly, as your food is prepared with the utmost skillfulness and care. You receive your sandwich, sit down and promptly enter a sanctified cathedral of deliciousness. And shortly thereafter, you begin to weep bitterly as you realize that the holy moment has ended. You've finished your beef. In my experience, this weeping continues until the next time you make the trip to Joe Boston's--which should be as soon as possible.

20.description: I was asked chicken or beef ... I had no idea what my friend was asking. When they arrived with the food it smelled really good. I took a bite of my chicken sandwich and was in shock how juicy the chicken was. It had the perfect amount of tomato, lettuce, and they asked for light cheese. This is a place I will be making the trip to.

36.description: If anything comes close to Johnnie's this is the place.  Joe's is an institution in Chicago. A place where you know exactly what you're getting.  A great Beef or Combo sandwich at a great price.

14.description: It's a real greasy spoon. Fair price, nice guy behind the counter, questionable clientele but room for improvement! A coat of paint, sand the floors and reorganize the layout and it's a becomes a better joint.

58.description: I needed some "ME" time and I found this place. I went in for a mani/pedi and the service was great. I got to pick a choice of movie to watch, they asked me if I needed a laptop while I got my pedi. The service was friendly and accommodating. I will definitely go back! I just saw they do henna tattoo....I love that!  I may go back for that too!

56.description: Sonia called me back and apologized for my bad experience almost immediately after my last review.. But I am still reeling from the damage to my hair. Three months later, and I'm still mourning. It is THAT bad. So, I think I'm never going to change my mind about this particular salon.

29.description: I made an appointment at the North Ave location in the middle of October for the morning of a friends wedding. I was told no problem and they confirme, I even let them know I was using a Groupon. I walked in this morning to be told they only have one 10am appointment and it was not for me. It must be mentioned that one of the girls said that wasn't telling the truth. Yes, I'm lying about making an appointment and it's not even remotely possible that someone in your salon made a mistake. I am only giving 2 stars because one of them was really nice and said she would take care of me. But I will not be coming back. I do not support businesses that call their customers liars.

42.description: I went to Sonia Herbal Salon a few weeks ago for a self outing! I thought the staff were friendly. I went for an eyebrow thread, massage and a henna tattoo. I thought the person who did my henna tattoo and eyebrow threading did a great job. Regarding the massage, I thought the massage therapist was OK but there were people watching TV in the next room. It was very loud and distracting. After the massage, I asked one of the people who worked there if I could get a discount because of the distraction and it took away from the massage. She called the owner and the owner actually said no because I had a discount from the special. I was a little turned off by the response. But I liked all the services I received regardless. The massage was good but I thought hearing the TV in the next room was unnecessary and very distracting. I would definitely go back for a henna tattoo that was my favorite event there.  The place is not the most glamorous but for the price I thought it was fun to go to!

23.description: THIS PLACE SUX A$$.  I'd really like to give this place a NEGATIVE 10.  Ugh what a mistake.  I bought a deal off groupon for a couple services (bit too personal to disclose).  The person who helped me was really nice. BUT she took me into a back room that had fluorescent lighting and just awkward and uncomfortable.  The service was done quickly, in haste, no attention to detail, and also required my participation.  (???) WTF.  It was the MOST painful spa service EVER, and I've received DOZENS of them.  It was also very messy and I came home in a sticky mess that smelled like baby oil and baby powder all over my pants.  A couple months later, I reluctantly went back to redeem the rest of my groupon.  After all, pain has no memory.  Same woman helped me.  Sh*t.  She again felt rushed as she was finishing a pedicure.  Required my participation to create some leverage.  And again the most painful experience ever.  Worse than giving birth.  I left with an incomplete service, bleeding, and again doused with baby oil and powder.  The "esthetician" who I don't think really has a license got mad at me for not providing enough "leverage."  OMG.  It was my fault?  I told her I had never ever had to provide "leverage" before and this has NEVER happened.  She profusely apologized.  I didn't realize the extent of my injury until I got home and my clothes were ruined.  It took about a week for my injury to heal.  Called to talk to the manager.  She didn't return the call.  Called again and she suggested to go to my doctor and get checked out and they'd cover the cost.  It would take more than 2 weeks to get appointment.  I just wanted my money back.  In response, she said contact groupon.  POOR  CUSTOMER SERVICE. POOR QUALITY OF SERVICE.

47.description: I love this place!  I only started threading about a year ago, but am a total convert.  I am pretty OCD about my eyebrows and was very reluctant to let anyone else touch them.  I was an avid plucker for years and my brows looked good, but Abaigael C. talked me into trying threading.  And now my brows always look GREAT after I leave here.  I don't even have to tell them about my weird mis-matched brows, or how if you pull out one little hair on my left brow it messes up the whole shape (told you I'm OCD!).  They do a great job every time.  Even came in after I had to do a last minute emergency wax elsewhere and had totally botched, misshapen brows.  They fixed the shape and told me to come in again in three weeks and it would be back to normal.Have also tried the lip threading - yikes!  Yesterday she waxed first and then threaded a little which was much less painful.  But again - they do a great job every time.  Afterwards, they'll put on antiseptic, lotion, or neither based on your preference.  I always used to go to Sonia's on Clark but have moved closer to this one and love this location, also.  The Clark street location is cheaper, but if you go here on Tues-Thurs they will give you 20% off your services.  So I walked out hair free for $18 + tip!

8.description: The BEST place for threading!! The staff are always so wonderful and the salon is always spotless! I have friends who swear by Sonia mani pedis! Really great prices and EXCELLENT service!!

31.description: I've been searching for a place to have my eyebrows threaded in Wicker Park for almost a year now. Well this was certainly worth the wait!I stumbled upon this place after getting a (horrible, horrible) haircut next door. This was a Friday evening and I was able to walk in and be seen immediately. I initially asked just to have my eyebrows threaded, but decided what the hell...why not pay a couple dollars more for the $20 deal of a facial massage and eyebrow threading.... I'd never had a facial massage before this and boy was I in for a treat!The woman who took care of me was very kind, gentle and AMAZING! I almost fell asleep! I will definitely be going back at least once a month to receive this treatment again and again!

34.description: I bought a groupon for a mani and pedi and every time I called to make an appointment the owner, Sonia, was very rude to me.  The first few times I thought maybe she was just having a bad day.  But when she called me to check if I was going to make my appointment and left a rather rude message I was shocked.  When I called her back to tell her she had the wrong date she literally chewed me out!  I was so stunned!  She told me she didn't want my business and to never go to her salon.  I couldn't even get two words in because she was yelling at me the whole time!  I have never been treated like that before in my life!  My family was visiting from out of town and heard the entire conversation and they all insisted I write this review because it was so uncalled for and rather shocking.  Needless to say I will never support this business!

16.description: I didn't realize that Sonia Herbal Salon does threading.. I'm sick of having to go so far to get my eyebrows threaded, and the other salons that do threading in this area have been so unreliable. Elo Salon fluctuated their prices and kept replacing their threading girl.Parlor 836 was always closed whenever I go there, despite their printed hours saying they were opened. You never know.Glad that Sonia does threading. Ask for the auntie. She's gentle with the threads.Would come here again.

13.description: I've never written a review for any type of businesses, but SONIA HERBAL BEAUTY SALON Ute a must!!!- on North Ave, and I believe they have another one open as well. Worst experience ever. I cannot believe the service and people they have working there. I don't even know where to begin, but here I go.A. I made an appointment for a reason, I arrived on time and still waited thirty minute. When I approached someone thithes worker started insulting me omg I couldn't believe this I would've walked away but I was in shock.B. The workers among themselves yell at each other I believe a Polish and Arabian lady- this was awful because the Polish lady was the one that highly disrespected me.C. In a business the client is always right- no matter the issue.D. This place is dirty!E. The variety of colors is the worst because they look so disorganized, empty, and dirty.F. There is no respect for workers or the clientele... I feel horrible for staying after yerk years of manis and pedis this is the wurst experience. I don't have enough weirds to describe this horrible place.G. Do not buy a groupon- that's the reason why I'm here.I am very disappointed and I'm planning to take some sort of action this place cannot stay open is a harmful environment. STAY AWAY!!!

11.description: The salon is owned by really nice Indian women who will accommodate your every need. I've been here twice. The first time I walked in off the street for an eyebrow wax, but then found that they do threading!!!  I was impressed by how quick and thoroughly the service was. When I arrived for my mani-pedi they knew exactly which services I had booked and offered me tea (much appreciated in the cold winter!) The massage chairs both massage and heat and have moveable neck support.   They even have a cute little pink chair for little girls coming with their mommies. After trimming, filing, cuticile removing, scrubbing, exfoliating, washing, lotioning, and massaging, they give a hot towel patdown. Then nails are painted with the color of choice!  Pretty mush the same process for hands and feet.My technician was an Asian male... Probably the only non-family member on staff. He was good and didn't try to force a conversation.  My complaint is that he did cut my cuticle a little bit. It bled, but he put some green stuff on it which stopped the bleeding and made it not hurt at all.The pedicure lasted well over a week without chips, the manicure only about 3 days before severely needing removed.

39.description: Not impressed.  Dirty, cheap decor, blah service and a terrible mani/pedi.

37.description: Went to the Uptown location. The salon was nice and the threading was quick, didn't hurt any more than plucking. Love the way she shaped my eyebrows, very friendly, very reasonable prices. Will definitely be going back!

0.description: I love Sonia Herbal salon!  I come here every two weeks, walk-in, to get my eyebrows threaded and they do a great job.  It costs around $12 and is walking distance from six corners and open relatively late.  Definitely a good spot to check out if you are a fan of threading in wicker park!

38.description: I just had the most painful bikini wax of my life here. I actually had to stop it because of the EXTREME pain. When I said that it felt like the skin was being ripped off, the woman "comforted" me by saying that she'd ripped the skin off before, and apparently, it wasn't currently happening to me.  The worst part, besides the trauma that will possibly keep me out of any waxing salon for months, was that while I was gritting my teeth, I was being blamed for the pain. I also noticed that the cleanliness has completely flown out the window. I should have turned and run a lot sooner once I saw hair on the floor and had to change the paper on the table myself. The eyebrow threading is still solid, but I'm searching for a new place... once I feel like I can look at a pot of wax without having nightmares. Stay. Away.

51.description: I go here to get my haircut. Its nice to be able to get in on short notice and get a cut for $10.'

27.description: Stopped in for a no-chip manicure that I scheduled thru Lifebooker and left very happy. Manicure was fast and efficient and I enjoyed the little extras (hand massage/hot towel). Will go back for another no-chip!

32.description: I have been going to Sonia's salon for about a year now.  I first found out about the salon through one of those deal websites, and thought I would give it a try.  I must admit that the appearance of the salon is much different than that of most I have been to (not as glitzed and glamoured).  However, I can attest that it is a small trade off to the work that is done by the owner.  I have tried different estheticians in the city, and she is by far the best I have ever had!  Sonia (the owner) has performed the majority of my waxing and threading, and I couldn't be happier.  Her work is great and the prices are very affordable.  I choose to drive up north for her services, even though there is a salon within walking distance from my apartment! Pros: Easy street metered parking, appointments generally run on time (longest I've ever waited was 5 minutes), and friendly management.

54.description: Ok, I've had a few services done here, and Johanna is wonderful - she does threading, nails and massage.  So for her, I would give 4 stars.  But, the hair salon part of it, not so much.I should have realized that it wasn't a good sign if someone was available last minute for a cut and blow dry.  There was a young girl who cut my hair and blew it out.  She used a ridiculous amount of hair spray and the cut itself, well, I could barely tell.  My hair didn't have that smooth feeling that you should have when someone blows out your hair - especially after a haircut.  Plus - it took her like 2 hours.  Ridiculous!I get the feeling that the people who work there don't like their jobs - wait scratch that - I think their boss must be rotten.  Not a pleasant salon feeling at all.  They need new management or something; I went several times and just haven't had the urge to go back even though I do like Johanna.

48.description: Threading, where they take some sting, twist it tight and remove unwanted hair from your face is a delightful alternative to waxing. Although its a bit more painful, since it is similar to tweasing, it takes the same amount of time and the estitician has more control over your eyebrows. the best part, the cost. For eyebrows and lip(what?! I'm Portuguese) was $15 bucks. YES! $15 bucks. Take that Trim.

44.description: I am excited to say that I've found my new threading salon! I was a D'Bellagio customer for a few years and wouldn't have found Sonia's if they hadn't closed. They are incredibly friendly upon arrival and only charged $12 for eyebrow threading! I went mid-day during the week and sailed right in.Afterwards they told me about their package deals and I picked one up for a mani, pedi and facial that included a face and back massage for cheap. They also assured me that they only use herbal products. I'm excited to go back.

24.description: I didn't have a stellar experience here- I showed up about 10 minutes before they opened, for a mani/pedi. It was super hot outside, and when the receptionist showed up early to open, she told me to come back when they opened, instead of letting me sit in the shop for the 8 minutes before they officially opened, which I thought was pretty rude. I had a Living Social gift certificate, and when I showed it to me she asked if I had an appointment (I didn't). Then she proceeded to tell me that I needed an appointment, but because they had an opening she would "allow me" to make one. The whole time I was there, only one other person showed up, so I'm not sure why she was so hesitant to accept my business. They played loud music videos and the magazine selection was skimpy. My manicurist was really nice and thorough, which is why I'm giving two stars. The place looks pretty beat up, and I wouldn't come back. There are plenty of other nicer places with better customer service, magazine selection, and ambience.

7.description: I used to come here all the time for threading. Over the weekend I came for a mani and pedi. There was a new girl working and not sure how to use the credit card machine and the manager helped. I believe on accident my card was charged twice.. once bc thr new girl was not sure how to use the machine ans the second bc the second time with the manager which added the tip at the second transacation. Sunday i checked my account I was charged twice for 44 dollars. When I called they told me I would have to come in on Tuesday to talk to the manager. Which was fine bc on sunday the transactions where still in pending status on my bank statement.Meantime, Tuesday morning I called my bank to confirm the charge went through twice and they asked before filing a dispute on the charge to go to the salon To If It Could Be resolved.Tuesday Evening I  go in to the salon with my bank statement Printer Out For Them and also pulled my information from chase app on the phone to show the two transactions were debited from my account just for them to.arguee saying no their settlement doesn't show that. I don't understand what happened to customer service. I have my chase app to show when the transaction occurred as well as my statement.. called my bank while there..the salon still not budging that they made a mistake. Bc I wouldn't listen to her explain how a settlement statement works ... (which I completely understand a settlement transaction .. I didn't need an explanation I just wanted the issue resolved.) She then told me she would called the cops to have them look at the statements. Which is crazy... I told her not worry I would have my bank dispute it.I left and will let my bank file a dispute. A little ridiculous.  Sucks I loved going here for my eye brows having girls day with my mom and aunts. Going here with.my friends. The way I was treated I will never ever return or recommended this place. Now I wait...

49.description: You get great service at a great price. I go there for mani, pedi, facials, eyebrows, wax.....pretty much everything, and I couldn't be more happy whit the service. They use all naturale herbal ayurveda products, that cant't be found anywhere else.

40.description: I was excited to go to Sonia's because of the good yelp reviews and cheap prices. When i got there i was rushed into a chair for threading, even though i asked for an eyebrow wax. While the woman that did my threading was very nice, she never asked me what i wanted done and when i said to "just clean it up" she ended up thinning out my brows more than i would have liked. They look fine, but it's not what i wanted. I'd rather spend 5-10 bucks more for a better job where the waxer actually listens to what I want.

53.description: I went here for Threading and a Pedicure as a walk in on a Saturday. The Pedicure was $30, you can't beat the price, and the salon was very clean and nice. It looks fairly new inside the salon, and the pedicure chairs even vibrated and were adjustable. A movie was playing on the Flat Screen TV while I was there, but only about 4 people came in for services outside of me. The Pedicure was average, but for $30, its pretty no frill. The staff was only moderately friendly, and could use an injection of customer service. I will give it another try though maybe it was just me...The threading was great and quick. I was pleased. and actually gives it the 4th star. Parking: Street meters available on North. I saw plenty, but you may need to walk a block up from Paulina.

30.description: Arrived on time for a 1pm appointment for a mani/pedi. Was asked to wait for 5 min, which quickly turned into 10. Then when I was asked to have a seat. Before sitting down I inquired about magazines. In the time it took me to walk 3 chairs to grab a magazine, they'd sat the only other girl in the salon down in my seat. When I asked them what just happened, they mumbled some gibberish out, which I couldn't understand.  I proceeded to wait for another 15 minutes before someone else could see me. It went downhill from there. I gave this place 2 stars (instead of 1), because my nails look alright, but after being there for 1h 45 minutes, they better.Ultimately, I would not recommend this place.

46.description: I didn't even have a Yelp account until today but because of my awesome experience(s) at Sonia's, I actually took the time to set-up one.. Let me 1st say that Sophie is AMAZING. The first time I came here I was just in the area and popped in to see what they were about. I asked about threading and Sophie explained it to me no problem and I agreed to have it done. Sophie did an AWESOME job. I use to be a slave to eyebrow waxing but after how great she didmy brows with threading, I'm sold. Well, I went back 2 weeks later and had brow/lip threading, brazilian bikini waxing and mani/pedi done all one the same day for less than $100.00. I came in at 6pm and by 8pm I was out the door and every service was to my pleasing, honestly exceeding my expectations. An asian guy did my pedi and a hispanic girl did my mani and they were both great as well. I usually dont do this cause I have way to much going on to write reviews but I have to give credit where credit is due. Check them on Tues, Wed and Thur. They have 20% off waxing and nail services. I think it may be more services included in that special but I cant be sure. Anyway, try them out and once u finish getting all dolled up.. walk a couple steps to Bar Louie's and show it off. :)

1.description: There are many great places to get your nails done in Chicago, especially on Division and/or North Ave. Unfortunately this is not one of them. There were a myriad of problems (listed below) that made this one of the worst mani/pedis I've ever had. - When I made the reservation, I let the woman know that I had a groupon for both a no-chip manicure and a no-chip pedicure.  She said it was no problem and made my reservation for both services. However, when I got there, they only had an appointment for a manicure and then told me I could only use one of my groupons. So right there I've lost $20 and I had to talk the staff into finding the time to provide both services. - They had a display of fake nails that showed all the no-chip colors.  Once I selected my colors, the staff were unable to locate those colors. - The nail tech said she didn't know how to do any nail art, not even polka dots. - The color that the nail tech used looked nothing like the nail display color that they were eventually able to locate. Overall, this was a very negative experience. My nails came out looking fine, but not spectacular. If you're looking for a good mani/pedi, I would look elsewhere.

55.description: I only needed a haircut but since my hair is curly I hate going to a cheap-o greatclips where they always cut so unevenly and carelessly.  Based upon reviews I decided to try Sonia's...Since there are multiple salon's on this street, I was pretty confused from the outside looking in. The building looks as if it only does nails and not hair.  When I walked in to let the receptionist know that I was the 4:30pm appointment, the receptionist yelled to the back room to get my stylist.  I was kind of taken back because I thought quiet sounds were the "norm" in a salon... not yelling.  Looking around I noticed there was one big screen tv mounted on the wall that BLARED a movie... not serene music or calming sounds. The area where they cut hair is in a seperate room connected by a small hallway.  This "next room hair area" consisted of about 4 stylist stations and two hair washing stations... Absolutely NO music was playing... so you were forced into conversation to ease the silence...Olga was my stylist, and very friendly! We didn't chit-chat much.  She was straight-forward, very professional, and no messin' around.  After about 20 minutes, I was done. (only needed a trim)  She didn't have a diffuser to dry my curly hair, so I opted to just leave it wet.  (I needed a shower when I got home anyway).She escorted me to the receptionist. TV still blaring... and my total was $35. But since the "deal of the day" was 1/2 price haircuts.... it was $17.50!! You can't beat that price for a haircut.... even at a supercuts!

9.description: Just went here yesterday with my boyfriend to get a mani/pedi. I was told that my bf had to wait for a bit. I soon found out half way through my service,he had to wait till im done so my tech can work on him!! There was three techs but only two can do pedi!! Got a shellac manicure, worst ever. It was bubbly on 7 fingernails and it look so far down that i needed to get it redone again! When i told them about this they were extremely rude and tried to justify that it was ok!!!

26.description: I didn't realize that Sonia Herbal Salon does threading.. I'm sick of having to go so far to get my eyebrows threaded, and the other salons that do threading in this area have been so unreliable. Elo Salon fluctuated their prices and kept replacing their threading girl.Parlor 836 was always closed whenever I go there, despite their printed hours saying they were opened. You never know.Glad that Sonia does threading. Ask for the auntie. She's gentle with the threads.Would come here again.

25.description: I knew I was going to be hanging in Wicker Park on Sunday so I was on the search for a place to get my eyebrows threaded. Very few places (from my experience) are open on Sundays so I was glad to find Sonia Herbal Salon on Yelp. I popped in before I left the neighborhood and was in and out in 5 mins. I can't complain about the no wait, $12 eyebrow threading.

12.description: I used a Groupon for a mani-pedi here, and the overall service and the feel of the place were ok, but not stellar. You have to pay for street parking, but it's not hard to find a spot. You should call ahead and make an appointment, because the day that I came, I showed up an hour or two before closing and they were all booked up. The physical space is a bit dated--the decor includes bizarre posters of sultry women which could be straight out of the late '80s, kitchy drapery, and fake flowers. The space is clean, though chairs are pretty worn and in general it seems like not much has been updated in the past ten years. This is no-frills place where you might want to get a quick lunchtime manicure, but not plan a bachelorette party. I remember the selection of colors being pretty good. The woman who did my nails was really nice and fun. However, the whole procedure took longer than expected (about an hour and 20 or 30 minutes) and I started to get worried about my parking meter expiring after an hour. Overall, I was satisfied with the service. However, once I went outside and looked at my nails in the light, I was disappointed with the quality of the manicure. The tips of my nails were bubbly the application of the polish was uneven--in other words, it didn't look professional. It was an ok experience, but I don't plan on going back.

59.description: I finally cut 9 inches off my hair to donate to Pantene. (Sorry locks of Love! I couldn't wait for another inch!). I cannot remember who I went to, but she did a great job and I've gotten so many compliments from people who work in my building but never talk to. After she cut it, and styled it, I asked her about highlights- it was a last minute impulse. She had another appointment right after me, so I felt really bad that the second appointment waited, but she was so nice about it and reassured me it was okay. Too bad she is in Chicago because I'd definitely go back. Plus with their 50% off sale, my haircut and highlights were around $50. Totally insane. BTW, the first time I was in Chicago, I went here for eyebrow threading and had another great experience.

21.description: I have been going to this salon for a few years now for manicures and pedicures, and I think they do a great job! I see one person in particular (Susanna), and she always does an amazing job with her mani's/pedi's. I have not once received a bad manicure or pedicure from her; they are always perfect! Her manicures usually last me about a week, and the pedicure lasts for 3-4 weeks (I usually put on another top coat a few days afterwards to help). I have also tried the no-chip manicures there, and she does an excellent job with those, too. She is a pro, not to mention a sweetheart, and I have told her many times that she is the best, and I don't want to go to anyone else!

17.description: This was my first visit to Sonia Herbal Salon & I had a good experience overall. I was a walk-in and a girl named Zara threaded my eyebrows. The two important factors - how they shape them and clean up surrounding little hairs - were done well by Zara! The price for eyebrow threading here is $12. (I wasn't thrilled about that but have been spoiled by the suburban threading places I've always gone to that charge only $6). Zara also recommended a skin treatment lotion from the Shahnaz Husain line. She was great about explaining how to use it and and didn't oversell the product. I would definitely come back!

10.description: Their no-chips are $20 when you pre-purchase 5 of them, otherwise $25 is their regular price. There are no frills, but they remember you when you come back and do a great job. The no-chip lasts me at least 3 weeks and they are willing to do extra coats until it looks proper. Appointments are sometimes hard to schedule, but for the price you really can't complain.

5.description: Being in a hurry, i came here based on reviews & price for eyebrow threading ($8 on website) compared to surrounding places on Yelp.  I should have tweezed my brows myself.  I asked for cleanup of brows.Pros:Walk- ins accepted, friendly staff, painlessCons: website stated $8, was charged $12, lady said "oh, we have other location".
