Website does not say there is different prices for the two salons.  On door front states $12 for thread & wax (I had one, not both services).  "Cleanup" of brow was B-, stray hairs were left on top corner of right brow & left was left noticeably thicker.  Total of not even 5 mins spent

3.description: I was waiting here for 45 minutes before being told they were going to close. They seemed nice to customers that had been there prior.I wod not come back here at all.

35.description: The specials have changed.  I recommend going on Sundays to take advantage of the brow & lip threading for $18.  Zhara is still the best threader in Chicago (unofficial title given by me) but her twin sister is also really good.Since my first review I have tried getting manis and pedis here.  For the price they're great.  You can even get nail art for $1 extra.  Want a cute flower on your toe? Yes, please!

19.description: First, they gave me the whole "we are really busy this afternoon" speech when I called to make an appointment.  It's just not true.  I went there same day in the afternoon and it was empty.On with the review:A.  It's just the little things that stick out:  old & half full nail polish, dirty work stations, dirty walls, mediocre massage, NO magazines!B. Went there for a mani/pedi and yikes on the filing.  My nails are crooked in some places and polish already chipped in two places.C.  Uh no drying station for your polish!  I had to sit at the station I got my mani at.  How would that work if it actually got busy?Honestly it was a Groupon that got me there, but nothing to bring me back.  As I've learned before I'll stick with my ladies @ Nail Salon on Division.

28.description: The salon is owned by really nice Indian women who will accommodate your every need. I've been here twice. The first time I walked in off the street for an eyebrow wax, but then found that they do threading!!!  I was impressed by how quick and thoroughly the service was. When I arrived for my mani-pedi they knew exactly which services I had booked and offered me tea (much appreciated in the cold winter!) The massage chairs both massage and heat and have moveable neck support.   They even have a cute little pink chair for little girls coming with their mommies. After trimming, filing, cuticile removing, scrubbing, exfoliating, washing, lotioning, and massaging, they give a hot towel patdown. Then nails are painted with the color of choice!  Pretty mush the same process for hands and feet.My technician was an Asian male... Probably the only non-family member on staff. He was good and didn't try to force a conversation.  My complaint is that he did cut my cuticle a little bit. It bled, but he put some green stuff on it which stopped the bleeding and made it not hurt at all.The pedicure lasted well over a week without chips, the manicure only about 3 days before severely needing removed.

45.description: This salon is great...excellent service and the staff is so friendly!I have been there more than once they offer fabulous facials, manicure and pedicure...I recommend to take advantage of their 10% off on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.. You'll save a couple of bucks!

33.description: First, they gave me the whole "we are really busy this afternoon" speech when I called to make an appointment.  It's just not true.  I went there same day in the afternoon and it was empty.On with the review:A.  It's just the little things that stick out:  old & half full nail polish, dirty work stations, dirty walls, mediocre massage, NO magazines!B. Went there for a mani/pedi and yikes on the filing.  My nails are crooked in some places and polish already chipped in two places.C.  Uh no drying station for your polish!  I had to sit at the station I got my mani at.  How would that work if it actually got busy?Honestly it was a Groupon that got me there, but nothing to bring me back.  As I've learned before I'll stick with my ladies @ Nail Salon on Division.

43.description: I love this place!Staff is super friendly.I go a combo eyebrow threading and 30min massage for $45.Cynthia, the massage therapist...amazing!I had never done threading before but I'm glad I did.I am coming back here as often as possible.

2.description: The 5 stars are for Susanna. I got a regular pedi 2 weeks ago and it's still going strong! She gives impeccable manicures. I've found my new nail shop in Wicker Park!Love me some Susanna!

18.description: I knew I was going to be hanging in Wicker Park on Sunday so I was on the search for a place to get my eyebrows threaded. Very few places (from my experience) are open on Sundays so I was glad to find Sonia Herbal Salon on Yelp. I popped in before I left the neighborhood and was in and out in 5 mins. I can't complain about the no wait, $12 eyebrow threading.

41.description: I use to always get my eyebrows threaded and then I stopped going because quite frankly it hurt like no ones business. So I went back to waxing because my nail girl did it. Well they started to get uneven and the waxing just wasn't doing the job, in fact it was making them way worse. I finally started to let them grow. I can never do it for too long because I feel like some furry creature. But they were growing long enough to get started with reshaping so of course I came to Yelp to seek out reviews on threading. I found Sonia's and saw good reviews of Zara so I called and they got me in right away. Zara was super sweet and new what she was doing. Still hurt like no other but hey beauty is painful right lol. She showed me how she was reshaping them and showed me what hair to not touch so that she could do more shaping once that section grew out. The only bad thing about this place is that its very cramped. Everyone is right on top of each other so you hear everything going on and you can't even relax for a moment.

52.description: I went back for treading and once again am not disappointed. It is never busy and one of those places where everyone looks up anxiously awaiting your arrival when you open the door. A man and women were at the pedi station and I could feel the disappointment when I stated I only wanted threading done. I would of gotten pedi/mani but needed to be dollar conscious. Maybe next time I will try something other than threading. Tue-Thur you can get 20% off services too.

50.description: This is the best salon in the area - they have great prices, are conveniently located, and their staff is incredibly sweet and accommodating.  I love their discount on weeknights and they play movies in the main area, which is great while getting your services!  Another plus is you don't have to make an appointment, I've always been able to walk in and be served right away - even just before close.They really take their time with the mani/pedis and have been really great about touching me up when I (inevitably) mess up my nails the next day  :-)   I recommend them for this and their waxing.  Yay Sonia!

4.description: I've gone in for a regular manicure and a no-chip manicure and both looked great and lasted a long time. The quality is excellent for the price--only $25 for no-chip! The decor might fool you as it looks a little lackluster, but don't let that deter you from going there. I would definitely call ahead for an appointment though because they are usually pretty busy.

6.description: I came here the day before my wedding to get my eyebrows threaded. I took a huge risk going somewhere I had never been to before to get my eyebrows done. I waited for about 10 min which is not bad at all. I had gotten my eyebrows threaded elsewhere before and it didn't hurt that much, but here it hurt like hell. It was so painful! But the end result was perfection! I loved the way my eyebrows turned out.

22.description: I used a Groupon for a mani-pedi here, and the overall service and the feel of the place were ok, but not stellar. You have to pay for street parking, but it's not hard to find a spot. You should call ahead and make an appointment, because the day that I came, I showed up an hour or two before closing and they were all booked up. The physical space is a bit dated--the decor includes bizarre posters of sultry women which could be straight out of the late '80s, kitchy drapery, and fake flowers. The space is clean, though chairs are pretty worn and in general it seems like not much has been updated in the past ten years. This is no-frills place where you might want to get a quick lunchtime manicure, but not plan a bachelorette party. I remember the selection of colors being pretty good. The woman who did my nails was really nice and fun. However, the whole procedure took longer than expected (about an hour and 20 or 30 minutes) and I started to get worried about my parking meter expiring after an hour. Overall, I was satisfied with the service. However, once I went outside and looked at my nails in the light, I was disappointed with the quality of the manicure. The tips of my nails were bubbly the application of the polish was uneven--in other words, it didn't look professional. It was an ok experience, but I don't plan on going back.

15.description: My review is targeted to the OWNER of the salon, NOT the service/employees. I frequent Sonia's, as it's down the street from my place. Also - the girls are so sweet, always remember me & the service is great. As we all know, it's been a very COLD (below freezing) winter. Last week I stopped in for a quick mani before heading back to work, it was following 2 days of well below ZERO temps. The heat hadn't been working in the salon for over 4 days AND the girls were still required to work. There was ONE SPACE HEATER in the center and the thermostat read 43 degrees. That's ridiculous. I only stayed because I felt so bad for those girls. I understand it's a business and you need to make money, but that's terrible management. If I were those girls, I'd have walked out.

57.description: I have to admit -- I've only been here for one service , threading, when I can't get in with Rashida B and her magical eyebrow shaping skills.  I'll need to check this place out for their other services. I have heard good things about their mani/pedi services...Back to the threading -- I always get the same girl (which is a good thing, unfortunately I don't know her name).  She does a good job -- however she put lotion on my face the last time and I really didn't appreciate that.I think $15 for an eyebrow threading is a bit steep -- but it's the closest place to my house so it's worth it to me to not have to drive all the way to Devon to have this done. I recommend going -- the salon is very clean and the staff is always friendly.  They also sell OPI nail polishes which is a plus -- I've gotten some very cute colors that I hadn't seen elsewhere there.

20.description: Great No-Chip manicures.  I've had two now and a different girl for both.  They both paid great attention to detail and the manicures lasted the full two weeks with no chips/peels.  Great value for price.  Pedicure was good, nothing spectacular; decent color selection.  I will keep going back.

36.description: I purchased a Yelp! deal for this "spa" - $60 mani/pedi, front Brazilian and facial.  I went last week and had had an awesome threading experience before.  However, this time during the wax the woman answered the phone and then put the waxing stick in her mouth to talk then used it again on me.  She didn't listen to my waxing instructions.  The facial felt like she was using Crisco, and hence I have acne all over my face this week.The mani/pedi was ok except for the old polish that basically melted into my shoes the minute I slipped them on.  I should have eaten the $60 when I walked through the door, but my stupid self didn't trust my guy.The treading is great.  Everything else is TERRIBLE!  STEER CLEAR!

14.description: Now that I live in the city, this is my go-to place for eyebrow threading. There is usually minimal wait, easy parking, and the eyebrows look great afterwards! I haven't tried any of their other services, but find them reasonably priced and friendly. The location isn't exactly close to any public transportation (about 5 blocks from Damen-Blue), but it's worth the walk.

3.description: Love this place!  We come here at least once a month for lunch.  We have repeatedly used them for catering.  The people are warm and the food is great!  Decent prices too.  We will continue to come for sure!

1.description: Thank you Steve Dolinsky "The Hungry Hound" on WLS-TV Channel 7 Chicago for mentioning this place on the news. We've been hooked ever since!!! Small grocery store with a great Puerto Rican restaurant in the back. Added bonus - grab a 2 liter or Malta from the fridge and pay for it all at the end!! They even gave us cups with ice to share the 2 liter!! Arroz con gandules, alcapurrias, Jibaratos, and even mexican food like burritos and tacos!!!!Great little hidden gem in Humboldt Park. Open from 7am to 6pm daily!

2.description: If Heaven were a place on Earth! This little gem is right near my house and I couldn't be happier. YUMMMM!

5.description: I love the people here and the food. Great food for awesome price.Fast service. I work by a nearby hospital and all of us love this place.

6.description: 4.5 starsNice hidden gem just a block or two south of the Norwegian American Hospital.  The inside isn't anything fancy, a convenient store atmosphere with an open walk up kitchen in the back with seating in the middle.  Prices were really good as a pork with rice and beans dish was $8 and came with fresh bread and green chile sauce.  Portions were of generous size.  My only complaint was that I wish the rice and beans hardly had any flavor.  I know traditionally rice usually doesn't have a flavor to begin with but this tasted like plain white rice.  I also got a Malta Goya to drink, which reminded me of an amber or Oktoberfest beer minus the alcohol content as it tasted very malty.  I like how they put various plates of dessert (flan, raspberry cheese cake, cinnamon, and coconut rice pudding) in the fridge doors since you can take one whenever you want without asking.  I highly recommend the flan, delicious!Service was very good as they let me read the paper while eating without paying for it.  Seemed like they get plenty of regular customers that know each other quite well.

7.description: I'm inclined to agree w. George T, this is prob some of the most authentic Puertorican food out there...I wouldn't know that personally but in my estimation, a place like this couldn't exist if they didn't serve anything other than the real deal (especially for the majority of the HP locals, read: PR).It's about a 5 iron from mi casa i've been a few times over the years.  It's part (small) grocery store, part (smaller) restaurant and it's a family owned and run show.   Very charming folk who are always helpful in explaining "what the hell is that" to me and even offering a sample or two.  I've done a few brekkie items, some empanadas, a sort of potato ball w ground pork (fantastic) and a masa thingamajiggy and, of course, the Jibarito.  All quite tasty, if not totally unhealthy.  But hey, live it, love it.

8.description: This place is effing gross.  gross food gross service gross drinks gross atmosphere gross tables.  don't do it.  and it's overpriced to boot.

0.description: Such nice people, great affordable sandwiches/puertorican yummies with your regular handy corner store all in one. Love it!

4.description: The people who work there are nice and friendly and seem to keep the place clean. The food is really good and I can pick up a few groceries while I'm there. Super awesome! I recommend the jibarito!

1.description: I've seen Starship Salon at almost every #VeganVortex and kept meaning to stop in. I finally made an appointment with Jill after seeing some of the killer bobs she'd cut on the salon's Instagram account. Jill is a hair wizard (or warrior, as her business card reads) and this salon is a gem. It's 100% cruelty-free and you can opt to only have 100% vegan products used on your locks. They serve Dark Matter coffee and offer vegan snacks on holidays - I just went in on Halloween and was treated to vegan chocolates. It's a tad out of the way for me, but worth the trip because everyone is so nice and my hair always looks amazing. Their online booking system is a godsend for busy people, too.

9.description: This was my first time going to get my hair cut in years and I was so excited to be coming here. With great reviews who wouldn't be?? Me hair is fairly curly and I came in with the knowledge that the wonderful Jill will work with my curls. I came in and was very much welcomed and offer drinks. Oh and the smell when you walk in it absolutely magnificent. The massage with my hair wash was on point and very refreshing with a nice touch of lavender. And thoughout my whole haircut I had very nice conversation and tips on my hair and about the products. Love the experience, the smells, everything. Love it all. Definitely would recommend.

12.description: I made my first appointment at Starship this weekend - trying to find a nearby salon I love has been difficult for me.  The hunt is over! I couldn't recommend this tiny gem more! Affordable cuts, welcoming atmosphere, cruelty-free products that work and extremely kind staff. My hair is difficult and quirky - and Laura seemed to make every snip with thoughtfulness and care.  While I was there, a woman walked in with her 1-year old son without an appointment. The owner of the salon quickly had mom and son in his chair - snipping away! Inviting, cheerful and professional, I recommend this place in a heartbeat.

21.description: Trisha, the salon's owner, did a fantastic job on my hair.  She definitely knows what she is doing.  I also love that this salon promotes eco-safe, animal-friendly products.  Classy and comfortable atmosphere.  Would recommend to anyone!

16.description: My hair was extremely parched and fried as a result of multiple bleaching sessions at a different salon. I came in to Starship looking for a trim to help my hair get back to a healthy state, but I left with so much more! Jill took the time to answer all of my questions regarding vegan products and recommendations for my hair. Before cutting it, she applied a deep conditioning treatment that gave my hair the hydration it was in desperate need of, and by the end of my visit, I was left completely blown away by the difference. When I left, my hair looked and felt so healthy, silky, and soft. Aside from my haircut, I really loved the atmosphere of the salon, their mission, and the overall attitude of the staff. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly. One of the things I loved most was that--during my visit--one of the stylists came across a June bug while sweeping, and she kindly picked up the little guy and helped him get back outside. I don't think this would have been the case at another salon. I see myself coming to Starship for a very long time!

17.description: Trisha is a great stylist and I'm so impressed with her new salon.  She is professional, technical and intuitive.  You can tell that she also teaches other stylists because she is able to use the industry terms to achieve the look you're after--and then break it down to make it understandable.  She always helps translate what I'm looking for into a look that is fresh and modern.  The fact that her products are environmentally friendly and cruelty- free is just the icing on the cake. Oh- also I love the online booking.  Makes it very easy to get an appointment and will send text reminders, too.

10.description: My husband and I love Starship.  We have tried several other salons and this is the only one where we are both consistently happy with the results.  And I love that they only use cruelty-free products like we do at home.  The only downside is that word seems to be spreading....it's not easy to get an appointment!

5.description: **BEST SALON IN CHICAGO!**Let me list the reasons why:- Super easy booking online. I booked for the next day and could probably even have booked for the same day since this place is not yet discovered.- Complimentary Dark Matter coffee (the best coffee roaster in Chicago IMO), a selection of teas, or water as you wait.- Jill, my stylist, was very easy to talk to and the sweetest hair stylist I've ever worked with.- All the products are vegan! How did I not realize vegan salons existed before?! I discovered them at a Vegan Vortex event, and I've been trying to veganize my beauty routine (NOT easy), but Starship Salon does all the work for you by carrying high quality hair care products and makeup in store and all vegan. Yay!- Gorgeous, sun-soaked space, like straight out of a magazine- No pretension whatsoever. The space and the staff are low-key and genuine. Everyone seems happy to be there.- Great location for biking or parking (free parking in the surrounding neighborhood). Right next to Star Lounge Coffee and just down the street from Squasht (a super cute shop). - Haircuts start at $55-$75 depending on your stylist. It's a little more than I'm used to spending, but it's such a treat to yourself, great quality work, and a great experience. And on top of all that, all the products are vegan. Well worth the visit!

11.description: I tried this salon for the first time because I heard you could get an all vegan hair service. I was given an appointment with Laura Ann Evelyn and she was so friendly and knew all about their vegan hair products. I needed my roots done and she matched my color and covered all my grays beautifully! Also my blow out was full of body and smooth she really did a great job! Everyone in the salon was very nice and helpful. I will definitely be coming back for my touch ups and will get my next cut here!

22.description: Trisha is the best of the best.  She takes the time to really understand what type of hair style you want and what fits best with your lifestyle. She is also a great teacher.  I really like that she shows you different ways to style your hair. I don't feel that many stylists take the time to consider that aspect like she does.The salon is beautiful and quaint. The place holds a lot of positive energy and is a great addition to the neighborhood. They use Kevin Murphy products and I really like his products and ethics.

0.description: Constance is awesome. At other salons, I sometimes have a hard time communicating what I want. Constance is a great listener and always spends time consulting with me at the start of appointments. She does my color and is very thoughtful about it, sometimes getting input from the other stylists. It seems to me the stylists really work as a team. In general, the salon is convenient (because of the online booking feature), the people are kind, and the products are quality (although expensive).

20.description: Trisha is a great stylist and I'm so impressed with her new salon.  She is professional, technical and intuitive.  You can tell that she also teaches other stylists because she is able to use the industry terms to achieve the look you're after--and then break it down to make it understandable.  She always helps translate what I'm looking for into a look that is fresh and modern.  The fact that her products are environmentally friendly and cruelty- free is just the icing on the cake. Oh- also I love the online booking.  Makes it very easy to get an appointment and will send text reminders, too.

19.description: Trisha is the best of the best.  She takes the time to really understand what type of hair style you want and what fits best with your lifestyle. She is also a great teacher.  I really like that she shows you different ways to style your hair. I don't feel that many stylists take the time to consider that aspect like she does.The salon is beautiful and quaint. The place holds a lot of positive energy and is a great addition to the neighborhood. They use Kevin Murphy products and I really like his products and ethics.

2.description: I actually prefer all my hair products to be conflict-filled and controversial. That's the only downside to Starship, since they offer cruelty-free products. I'm also a lover of blood diamonds.Starship has a really chic space, whatever that means. If you go, make sure you look up and appreciate the cool ceiling. I went to be Constance's hair model (she's a newer stylist there). She did an amazing job, and I look even better than I did when I arrived. I didn't know that was possible. I'm also very humble.I'm Asian, and so there's this consensus that you must go to an Asian place to get your hair did right. Well, a few months ago I went to a non-Asian barbershop in Chicago and, compared to this haircut, it was pretty bad. Thus, I was quite wary coming into Starship. But WOW Constance did a great job. The owner was very nice and accommodating as well and has 10+ years under her belt/scissors. Starship knows what they're doing.

18.description: O.K. Haircut took too long. Really was expecting more.

13.description: WOW! Finally a place that lives up to its name. I had long hair back to middle of my back. The pictures say the rest!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Trisha and Lorelei and Trisha's father couldn't have been more kind. Very hard to find a good stylist that listens. I will be back!

4.description: I received a partial highlight and cut by Constance at Starship Salon a few weeks ago. She did an excellent job listening to what I wanted before the hair work began. She even got out her iPad to look at colors and styles with me to make sure she did exactly what I was wanting. I'm so indecisive and I really appreciated her patience as I was trying to figure out how I wanted my hair. The final color was perfect and the cut was done in a way to bring out my facial features. Starship uses Kevin Murphy products - which are incredible and smell so good. The decor was simple, but chic and everyone was very welcoming. I look forward to returning to Starship for my next color and cut!

6.description: Started going to Starship after my old salon shut down. Not only is Starship SUPER close to my house, Mark gives a KILLER haircut. He really spends the time making sure it's perfect and I always leave feeling fabulous. I love that they are vegan-friendly and use Kevin Murphy products. Kevin Murphy is my favorite line. I'm going back in a few weeks to get dolled up before returning to work after surgery and I know that I'll look like a million bucks when I leave. Love you all! PS-my hubby goes to Mark, too, and always comes home looking like a totally hottie.

15.description: I hate getting my hair cut. After many terrible experiences, including (but not limited to) multiple mushroom cuts, Disney teenybopper layers, and a haircut that got laughed at by my family as soon as I walked in the door,  I have avoided haircuts if all possible. Thankfully, I found Trisha (through my cousin's recommendation). She makes my hair look great. I'm not great at expressing what I want done but she takes my several pinterest pics and does magic. I've loved every haircut and every color service.Her beautiful salon and her cruelty free products/services are also a huge plus.

7.description: Jill is the best. Followed her to Starship from another salon, as I haven't found anyone else who can cut my annoyingly fine hair into the bob of my dreams!  Haircuts never disappoint. And love the cruelty-free products.

8.description: So many times over 20 years I requested ash blonde for my highlights and no hairdresser could get it. Until I met Jill. Not only she knows what she is doing also she is cool. She is up to date with fashion. Have you tried to show a picture of a model/celebrity to your hairdresser to get the style without them make you feel weird about the comparison?  I was going to show her a picture of me, but my last picture that showed in my phone was of a model. I wasn't going to show her that. But she saw it,  got her iPad and search for images of that model. HOW COOL IS THAT? As an animal activists this place rocks. They used only cruelty free products.

3.description: This place is adorable! All the staff are super friendly and totally unpretentious. Laura has done my hair color three times now, and I'm really happy with her work. She does a great job of clearly explaining what's going on and getting feedback from you throughout the process. I had damaged my hair pretty badly trying to bleach it myself, but Laura helped me bring it back to life. It looks and feels about a million times better.

14.description: I was referred to the salon and Jill by a friend. Jill listened to me and then provided me with options I had never considered. For 10 years I've been getting the same cut, and it never looks good in the summer. Jill encouraged me to consider a summer cut that would be different from my winter cut. It's a big departure for me - and I love it. She did a fantastic job and walked me through how to get the look I want at home. And it's so nice to have a cut for the summer that I don't have to blow dry - it's too hot already! The salon is small, clean and so nice. I was offered a beverage (I chose lemon water) and it was served in an actual glass - no plastic! Great experience all around. I also made my next appointment for 3 months from now - which I have never, ever done before. I usually let 3 months go by, and then hate my hair until I finally break down and try to get an appointment right away - which never works. Their online appointment system works well, and you can get a text and email reminder. Thumbs up all around. Thanks, Jill!

3.description: I had a great visit tonight! The selection won't blow your mind, but the customer service and product quality was substantial. I look forward to stopping by for all my tobacco related needs in the future. Also, they offer a lifetime warranty on Magic Flight box, so, check it out!

1.description: Shop here if you like does that are randomly closed, if you like overpriced tobacco and other items. Also, if you like weirdo bullies that are random and controlling, come in. I think price, time, and professionalism matter.

2.description: This establishment has no respect for you time. Walked here, sign was already up that read: Will Return in 5 minutes, been waiting 11. Don't advertise a deal to get business & then close your place during operating hours.

5.description: The friendliest staff i have ever met. Extremely helpful as well.

0.description: They have had the accessories I have needed, for gifts, every time I have spontaneously needed them.  They are no Iwan Reis but no reason to give them anything but the best review.  In fact I don't recall a humidor... more of a hookah supply shop in my mind.

4.description: i have experienced nothing but top notch service from this location! Very knowledgeable manager (Bri) and great selection of smoking / vaping accessories. I would recommend this shop to all my vaping friends!

12.description: Wonderful pastries and wonderful Cuban sandwiches. Please note their correct address is 3335 W. North Avenue.

7.description: I was heading to a party and wanted to bring something different. Not the big cakey things one usually finds at Dominicks'  or the like. So I fired up Yelp and was directed to San Juan.It's a little tough to find -- I think I broke one law getting to this place -- but when I got in it was quick service. Someone in line was even telling me how amazing everything was. And it was. You can tell they're freshly made and delivered to order. I quickly snatched up about 30 or so pieces to bring and it was under $15.I noticed they also serve sandwiches here. I want to check that out sometime, too. But in terms of dessert, I'll be returning.

19.description: MMMMM! The best Puertorican bakery!!!! The mallorcas are really good and the sorullos.... mmmm.

1.description: I had one so-so and one meh experience here. The first time I had a Cuban sandwich and cafe con leche which were pretty good. I took some pastries to go. Those were either not good or just okay. The mom and daughter who were working that day were friendly and very nice.This time, I got a pastelillo to go. I noticed a fly trapped inside one of the enclosed glass display counters. It was on one of the donuts. Definitely not appetizing! The ladies from last time were not working and service was somewhat disorganized.I bit into what was supposed to be a flaky, powdered sugar encrusted guava treat when I got home... and immediately spit it out. Despite being bought on a Saturday afternoon, it was stale and tasted like it had somehow absorbed all the funky smells going on in the bakery. Maybe I've been watching too many episodes of Gordon Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares lately, but I'll be sticking to Roeser's or Cafe Colao from now on.

2.description: I was super excited to find a puerto rican spot in Chicago!! Being a Florida girl in a Chicago world I was ecstatic to find Puerto Rican bread....it was delish! I also got macaroons, spanish sugar cookies, and a quesito. It was ALL fabulous!!! I will be back!

9.description: El amor de Puerto Rico is clearly demonstrated at the San Juan Bakery where amor (translation = love) goes hand in hand with the fresh ingredients used to bake their delectable, quality, oh-so-good and tasty sweets.  I was introduced to this place by a friend who lives in the area.  Although my friend only weighs about 120 lbs I am amazed she doesn't weigh more since she eats here about once a week!  I took her word for it -- she always raves about their Cuban sandwich as well as the penil asado (pork) and bisteq (steak).  All of their meat sandwiches are very tender, succulent, flavorful and fab-u-licious.  They have the best Cuban sandwich I have ever tasted (I grew up in Florida so I know an authentic Cuban sandwich when I eat one).  I committed the ultimate sin by eating things I never really eat.  The temptation was huge, and I caved -- what can I say -- it was worth every freakin' calorie and fat gram!Try their light and flaky pastry filled with guava (also know as pastelillos de guayaba) with a light flaky crust that is not too sweet.  Wow, this brought me back to my childhood when I lived in Coral Gables, Florida.  I highly recommend you try their other sweet treats too.  I recommend anything filled with guava and cheese (combination of both) or any pastry filled with cheese.  If you eat here, you will not have to eat for the rest of the day!  The San Juan Bakery has perfected the art of the Cuban Sandwich.  The show "Diner, Drive-Ins and Dives" should come to the San Juan Bakery for the sandwiches alone!  Guy Fieri, put this down on your "Bucket List" of "must try it" the next time you visit Chicago!

6.description: My 3 year old love there sweets ,so we will alway goo back until she can so I've had better ,.LOl .They are very cheap too!

18.description: Best doughnuts I've ever had, hands down.  2 for $1.

10.description: The phrase "diamond in the rough" is so often abused and so often used incorrectly...  but in the case of San Juan Bakery it is not so.  After strolling around Humbold Park on North ave.,  my wife and I walked into this small bakery curious to see what they had.  We have walked and driven by this location many times and never thought much about it due to the many other bakeries in the area.  Upon entering and scrolling through their litany of fresh pastries we noticed that they also served fresh made sandwiches.  This peaked our interest, so we decided to have lunch.HOLY CRAP!!!  THE BEST Cubano sandwich we have ever had!  The pork was sooo good that it was almost unfair...  and the balance of ingredients was almost artistic and in a way original... as if this Puerto Rican bakery had perfected the Cuban classic.   Almost everything on the sandwich was made in-house from the bread to the roasted pork!  And not only was it an outstanding sandwich, it was huge and $4.99!As full as we were, we couldn't resist the urge to find out if the pastries were at the same level as the sandwiches.  Big surprise...  yes they were.I almost didn't want to write this review, because I want it to be a secret...  but some secrets have no sanctity when it comes to food this good.

13.description: From the jump I have to say, San Juan would easily get 5 stars if they didn't close by three in the afternoon.   Second, I should confess that this is a bakery yet I've never had their pastries, which look delicious.  No sir, I am here to tell you of the best Cubano sandwich in the city.  Scratch that, best sandwich in the city.  Yes, their pasteles are great and flaky/crispy on the outside.  The Jibarito Sandwich is good, but not the finest in the neighborhood (tostones had been frozen).   The Cubano makes me weep though.  Granted, everyone seems to make this sandwich differently and this would be of the Puerto Rican style... French bread pressed flat, ham and pork, cheese and pickles (hot peppers by well made request).  Somehow it takes 20 minutes + to get a sandwich, but you know what?  I dont care.  Its that good.

16.description: Bfast sandwich & coffee... Yummm

17.description: I have never wanted to YELP anything before and so this is my first post.... OMG! I got the chicken sandwich which they flatten and it is SOOOO good. I also tried one of those cheese filled pastry and almost died. I will be returning very soon.

15.description: Great place for awesome puerto rican sweets.  I always like to get the quesitos de guayaba.  Its cram cheese and guava filled pastries.  the sandwiches are great.  Not too pricey and awesome friendly service.  The best puerto rican bakery in town.

0.description: Best pastellos de gustaba. Omg!!  I could stay and eat there all day!  Everything is so good and their homemade pan  de bollo!  Da bomb!!

5.description: Love it here, always eat chicken sandwich, they are big and delicious. Love the quesitos!

11.description: I went awhile ago, but San Juan Bakery deserves my Yelp.  The Puerto Rican group at my school had an event a long time ago and I remember eating these pastries and thinking happy Puerto Rican thoughts.  I asked where they got it from and they said "San Juan Bakery."  It's a long trek from my school, but damnit, I will travel for some pastries.  I got a whole box of the guava filled ones with powdered sugar over it.  Got another box of the guava-cheese sweets....I lived off these boxes in June.  If only these places were closer....

8.description: So disappointed. {super sad face}  I went here looking for pan sobao (if you're Puerto Rican, you know what I'm talking about) and didn't find it.  But, I figured I'd try something else.  My mom and I decided to order a sandwich and cafe con leche.  At first, the girl was about to brew regular coffee when I said it was espresso that I wanted... she seemed bothered... in fact, she seemed bothered the entire time we were there.  She then proceeded to tell me that we would have to wait for someone else to make it because she didn't know how to work that machine... didn't really matter... it was still terrible.  Then she tells us that there will be a wait for the sandwich because they were preparing four other sandwiches ahead of ours.  Apparently, they only have one sandwich press and counter and, therefore, can only make two sandwiches at a time.  I'll give you this... the steak sandwich was good... but not good enough to go back for.As a last resort, I decided to try some of the pastries.   Nope... they didn't do anything for me.  In fact, I thought they really lacked in flavor.  I can get way better pastries at other bakeries.  I've actually had pastries in San Juan, Puerto Rico that were absolutely delicious... these weren't even close.After anxiously wanting to try this place, I felt totally let down.  I definitely won't be returning.

3.description: My friend and I when there this morning minimum order w/ debit card is $10 DLLs So she pay and order 2 bread w/ cheese was big roll  and cheese inside huge Was good & freshAll look really goodCroissant , conchas etc etcI will go back for shure Next time I will took some pictures

14.description: great place to eat with good food and a very nice staff. I frequent here when I can, they have great prices and a nice selection of sweets but you can also stop by for lunch. I'm a fan of the steak sandwiches and will be picking one up today as well. They have cute little tables to eat your sandwiches and then you can pick out some desert. Is nice for a quite simple date as I go with my boyfriend often.

4.description: Wow, I went here to pick up a 'special' order and they did a fantastic job. I still cannot get over how inexpensive their goodies are -- just amazing prices. The bakery is located on North Avenue about one block east of Kimball Ave (on the south side of North Ave). I had a sweet tooth on 6/2/2014, so I drove all the way here for my 'sweet' fix. It was well worth the drive, my time and gas, despite the ugly, rainy morning. It was the sunshine in my day!

3.description: This place is amazing. I happened upon it one day when walking down California with some friends. It's so conveniently located by both a coffee shop and bar, and it's full of so much eclectic art and toys that I really didn't even want to leave.The best part is the small staff. They are so helpful and knowledgeable with everything, I know I'm going to become a regular. Especially with the big comfy couches and collection of zines, it's an incredible place to visit and hang out!

1.description: Despite the sweltering heat, inside and out, I had a fun time.  With tons of goods to peruse and proprietors who obviously are having a grand old time, how could I not?  I finally got to purchase The Lonely Doll and there were many other goodies to behold.  Nudge is a venue for some offbeat, artistic stuff including an appearance by Chicago's own Jan Terri among other performances, visual arts and general creativity.  I'd totally check out their friendly, fun digs again.

2.description: The future of retail/art is alive in this toy store/gallery/hang out space.-Great Prices-Incredibly welcoming and friendly staff-Fun stuff/cool art-Big projector with movies going on a back wall-A community board up in the window with happenings around the neighborhood, job postings, etc.A no pressure, no attitude art spot that's great for people of all ages.  I really like this place and am so glad to see a spot like this in Humbolt park.  While you're there check out the continental next door for a cheap cocktail or go across the street for a great coffee served by a super friendly couple.

0.description: I went to this place while visiting Chicago, its amazing! Such a unique take on gallery organization. This whole place is its own piece of art, filled with art! There are so many things to look at. I spent over an hour in here just to see everything. There are awesome toys, handmade jewelery, fun silly crazy and even serious art in all price ranges (I bought a painting form the five-dollar wall, there's even a $1 bin and a $9,000 panting).They teach kids art classes and throw other events. I love the variety and style.

58.description: What a amazing place! Service was great! Our food was so flavorful! The price was so reasonable. We will be back.

56.description: As far as Indian food goes, Rangoli is as good as it gets in Chicago. In addition to the food, a couple of other positives are that it's BYOB and it's within walking distance from the Western Blue Line station.  Dishes:Gobi Manchurian - The complex flavors, spices, and preparation of this dish almost convinced me that I could live happily as a vegetarian.  Seriously, at first I couldn't believe I was eating just vegetables.  Absolutely delicious.  It's spicy, but what did you expect?  It's Indian food!Butter Chicken - Tender chicken in a mild, but flavorful sauce served over fluffy rice.  This will be the "non-spicy" part of my standard order at all Indian restaurants going forward.Lamb Vindaloo - The heat from this dish is unique because it's not a spiciness that will burn your mouth like a spicy Thai or Mexican dish.  It's a subtle heat that you feel internally.  Your mouth won't burn in pain, but you'll feel it on the inside.  Be prepared do some serious sweating while eating this dish and consider adding some yogurt to the vindaloo to dilute the burn.  Even if you have a high tolerance for spicy food, you will absolutely feel a kick.  To me that's a good thing because I love the flavor and the heat.  But, keep in mind, if you're out on a date and you want to avoid the embarrassment of looking like you just ran a 5K, you might want to pass on this dish.  I'm not talking about a slight glistening that can be alleviated with a simple wipe of the brow and a sip of ice water hot.  I'm talking blotting yourself with a stack of napkins, eyes watering, and downing a whole pitcher of ice water hot.  I'll gladly eat this in the presence of my buddies, but I wouldn't dream of ordering it with a chick sitting across from me.  If she see's me sweating like that, it should not be as a result of eating lamb.That said, you've been warned regarding the vindaloo.Garlic naan - delicious and very useful for scooping up sauce and rice off of your plate.  Gulab Jamun - yummy Indian donuts soaked in a sweet syrup.  If you have room for dessert, give it a try.If Chicago has a better Indian restaurant than Rangoli, I haven't found it yet.

29.description: Rangoli has decent food, but they have some of the worst staff and delivery I've ever seen. They take forever and their phone number only goes through like 3% of the time, so good luck if you need to get in touch with them. I've had terrible experience after terrible experience with them. They need to get shut down and replaced with an Indian restaurant that will actually complete an order and answer the phone.

42.description: We ordered through Seamless. It took over 2 hours!!!! The app said 60-70 mins so after 90 mins I called. I'm pretty sure they hadn't worked on my order yet because the woman was very confused, asked for my name and address multiple times, said GrubHub about three times, and then ended the call with the ubquitious "the driver just left"About 30 mins later we received our food. It was piping hot which is great but is what lead me to believe that our order hadn't been picked up.The food smelled wonderful. I ordered buttered naan and received regular naan. I wasn't going to call for the $1 difference but it furthered my annoyance. We loved the Gobi Manchurian. I ordered everything at the least spicy possible and our dishes were super spicy. I'm a wimp when it comes to heat but even my boyfriend was sweating and drinking lots of water. It was painful to eat but we were so starving and it did smell great.

23.description: I was so happy Rangoli opened so close to me. I have had their food many times and delivery to my house is always on time. I have tried most of the menu all has been fabulous and my favs for sure are the Butter Chicken and the Vindaloo Shrimp. I love the authentic spicyness and the freshness of the sauces. I will warn you though you will want to order extra for leftovers and you may go back for seconds or thirds! Thanks for joining the neighborhood Rangoli!

47.description: Restaurant is in a nice location and has a very warm and festive ambiance, but the service is horrible and the food was way too spicy. Even though we asked for it to be not too spicy.

8.description: Okay, so I was soo excited to try this place since I've had it on my bookmarked list for quite some time and heard so many good things about it. However, I left thinking, I'm glad I tried it but it was nothing special or amazing. I read that it gets super busy so I decided to check it out on Sunday afternoon for an early dinner right when they open at 4:30pm. Well that was genius since no one was there and we got to pick any table we wanted. They have one table right by the open doors which is nice when the weather is great to catch some Chicago breezes. I mean you know it's about to get hot in your mouth so you need some extra air, right? Right. So upon arrival, the place is very nice decorated with little pillows, funky chandeliers, definitely liked the vibe. The service was good the entire time as everything was brought out fast and served hot just like we like it.Here is what we got that some people recommended with our friends to share: Gobi Manchurian -Cauliflower florets golden fried, saut'eed with chopped garlic, ginger, spring onions, with a hint of soy sauce. Super yummy, my hubby hates cauliflower and loved this dish so it's a must get and get it medium spicy.Keema Samosa (2pc) Crisp, deep fried turnovers stuffed with mild minced lamb and peas. These were a little dry in my opinion and couldn't really taste the lamb nor the flavor of it.Chicken Tikka Masala- Marinated white meat chicken cooked in tomato based sauce with herbs and spices. Something we get at every Indian restaurant and it did not disappoint. Loved dipping all their fresh naan into it. Oh, and get the butter naan, you'll thank me later.Vegetable Biryani-Basmati rice and vegetables cooked in aromatic spices; served with raita. Okay, so I didn't love this version as I've had others I liked before. Plus, our curries came with rice already so I wasn't sure why a server didn't let us know before we ordered this as well. Lamb Rogan Josh-Boneless lamb cooked with mild dry red chilies with a hint of yogurt. Our server told me to get this dish and he said it's a little spicy. A little spicy?! OMG, it was on fire. I can't tell you my thoughts on this dish since it was basically fire in my mouth and I couldn't taste anything else.Overall, some classics like tikka masala were awesome, loved the gobi manchurian and of course all their naan, but other dishes were all so eh. I'm really happy we didn't have to wait an hour to sit down because then I would have really been disappointed. Not sure if I'll be back but maybe I would carry out if I was in the area.

31.description: I was so happy when I found an awesome Indian restaurant on the West Side of Chicago.  I am obsessed with this place!!  Everything that I have gotten has been delicious.  I have ordered the gobi manchurian:  Spicy and great crunchy appetizer for vegetariansbagara baingnan:  Very spicy with great flavormalai kofta:  sweet tasting, personal favorite that I have gotten so farbindhi masala:  go to dish for anyone trying Indian for the first timeI can't wait to go back and try some other dishes.  Thank you, Rangoli!

34.description: I am Indian and LOVE this place. It is also quicker to get my Indian fix at Rangoli vs hauling all the way to Devon.

16.description: Chug your wine, 'cause you are outta there!Starting off, I want to say that if I could separately rate the food versus the service, my rating would be different. However, since I cannot, this place get a 3. I didn't want to do 2 stars, but the service was so horrific that I wish I could give them a 1 star. If this peaks your curiosity, read on.A group of us came for a 7:30pm reservation. By the time everyone showed up it was closed to 7:45-7:50. We were seated in the front, in 2 tables. There were 7 of us total, but they only gave us 3 chairs. if you have been here before, you know that each table is essentially good for 1 person on each side. We were forced to have 4 people on one side, which was very, very, very annoying, as there was so much food on the 2 tables that eating was a sport - make sure you don't spill on yourself, make sure your arm doesn't hit the other person next to you, make sure your smallest movements don't cause a domino effect of things falling on the table. It wasn't thought out well. I asked for another chair, so we could at least have 3 people on the side, and rudely I was told they had no chairs and that we would need to have all 4 on one side. Who does that? How do you not have enough chairs? We ordered a ton of food. A ton. The food was fantastic. I would come back here for the food anytime. However, the service was shotty. We ordered naan, and it came last, after all the food, and we had to ask again to make sure they were bringing it. After they brought it, we asked for the sauces, which should have already been given to us. Nope. We had to ask. And they were not the most polite about it. We had to continually ask for these sauces, as there were 7 of us, and they gave us 1 small dish. We also had to keep asking for water.Normally, these things would not bother me as much if the last thing didn't happen. But it did, so now this place is tainted in my mind.We finished eating and since it's a BYOB, we were still finishing our wine bottles that were open (3). We were asked by 2 separate waiters that we needed to go, because they needed our table. I have never, ever, been asked to leave an establishment when we are still not done with our drinks/food. I could understand if the entire place was packed, people were waiting in line outside or in the front, or if we were there for 3 hours and still not leaving. But we weren't even there 1.5 hours and were being forced to leave. We had full wine glasses full of wine, and we had just had the table cleared! It was appalling. You NEVER tell your guests they have to leave when your establishment offers BYOB, forcing them to essentially leave what they have behind.We ended up chugging our wine because we got asked again to leave. All of us were in shock that they had the nerve to ask us again to leave. We were respectful the entire time, but it seemed the politeness only was one sided. It's a shame, really. Because terrible service is a big factor in choosing where you want to spend your money. There are plenty of restaurants in chicago to choose from. Even though the food was great, the service is what got me. It won't be the first place I'll suggest for indian from here on out, so if you don't care about being treated like you don't matter, then go to this place. If you actually want the establishment to appreciate you as a customer, then I would suggest going elsewhere.

13.description: Excellent and authentic.  When they say spicy...they mean it!  We ordered several things and they were all very good.  I had the food delivered by Caviar and the prices were reasonable.  I will definitely be a repeat customer.

11.description: I do have a confession to make ,I don't like a whole lot of Indian places in Chi town which I admire so I wasn't expecting this spot to be great either but it turned out to be a pleasant surprise.During our recent trip we were craving some good Indian food and decided to venture out of downtown area. The location of this area is quite unassuming and there are not a whole lot of eateries around this place.The place itself is not huge but has some decent seating area , the white wall background with dim lighting added up to the décor.They have a menu which is a good mix of traditional Indian and some Indian fusion(Indian Chinese) fare. We decided to try to both , we indulged in -* Gobi Manchurian - Tender pieces of cauliflower cooked in tangy, sweet and spicy sauce. Cauliflower is coated in a flour layer before tossed in sauces.* Paneer Masala - Indian cheese cubes cooked in creamy tomato sauce.* Lamb Biryani - Traditional basmati long rice cooked with curried meat.* Plain and garlic naan - Bread with butter and garlic flavor.First the food overall was really good.Gobi Manchurian is a must try it had some really good flavors. The entrée paneer dish was also tasty , we wanted little more spice so we got the Indian pickle on side($1 extra). Biryani was also really flavorful and it is recommended to pair it with raita(curd with mix veggies).It was definitely worth driving from downtown to eat at this restaurant.

39.description: very disappointed! I called on 29th september evening to cater for the weekend and was informed they were very busy can i call in the morning, ok so the customer has to call according to their non-busy hours. Things got hectic and today friday i call back and the person who spoke to me didnt know anything about catering and said someone will call @ 4pm. so after hearing nothing i call back and i am told its too late for an order, really? i asked just a few items and i could hear someone saying "cant do it,No" very bad customer service. You just lost my business! going somewhere else, who cares to be respectful of their clients.

37.description: I've been here twice , today was my second time going there with my bf. We've had a great experience here , amazing food, especially their mango chicken and their Naan bread. what I love about it , is that they bring the food pretty quick, and service is great . Love it , thanks to My bf for taking me there and to Rangoli for an amazing food , we will definitely go there again!!

0.description: Rediscovered Rangoli after years and still very impressed! So wish they were located closer! We tried the paneer butter masala and it's the real deal! The pav bhaji is as good as ever. The only challenge with this place is how tiny it is! Tables are setup NYC style where you have no privacy in conversation.

38.description: I've been waiting for over two hours for my delivery order... I don't even care how good this food is - there's no way I'll ever order from here again.

51.description: We started with the onion Bhajee. Onions in spiced chickpea flour, tossed with herbs and beautifully fried. It was like an Indian bloomin' onion and unsurprisingly addictive. The Mutter Paneer was silky and savory with it's fresh homemade cheese and peas in a buttery cream sauce. Perfect. On the menu, the chicken Vindaloo is described as being "hot and spicy" and holy hell, boy oh boy, is that ever an understatement. It provides your body with waves of sweaty thunder bolts that makes you both nervous and excited to be alive. Beautifully seasoned and really really spicy. I attempted to cool my mouth with some onion naan dipped in mint chutney but NOPE that was spicy as hell too. At that point I said fuck it and dipped some of the garlic naan in the perfect spicy pickled onions. Sure it was all really hot, but it was also so so delicious and harmonious in my mouth. I was in love. Sweaty sweaty love.

27.description: Ummm yeah probably the most authentic Indian food I've had in Chicago - the spicy is 'real' spicy, the food is very good, good take-out options, a no-frills-just-good-food kinda place. My recent favorite joint!

32.description: So good here! This place is one of my fav Indian restaurants, and it's BYOB!  I've dined at the restaurant as well as ordered grubhub and it's always been fantastic....The only thing I don't like is that they don't accept reservations. Get here at a decent time or you'll have to wait a while. HIGHLY recommend this place!

54.description: Great chicken masala. Beware, when they say spicy they mean it. The service is a disorganized, as is the front of the house, but the food and ambiance made up for it. Some of the better Indian food I have had in the city.

48.description: Excellent food!! :) fast service and very enjoyable!! And great delivery in the neighbourhood. Tasty, spicy, and happy they are here in humboldt park :)

44.description: The food is decent, but never, ever, order delivery. 2 of 4 times, the food took over 2 hours. The first, chalk it up as bad luck. The second? Bad business. I'll take my (delivery and dine-in) money elsewhere.

24.description: Best indian food I've ever had! I'm a huge fan of the samosas, Chana masala, and dal makhani. If you dine-in, it's byob

7.description: Rangoli was a very pleasant surprise. We went recently to celebrate Diwali, the Indian Festival of Lights, symbolizing good wins over evil. I give it 4 stars and not 5 only because the food was 'super HOT' aka chilly hot, not the temperature. My wife can't handle a lot of heat but by the end of it, she too had watery eyes and needed yogurt to cool her palette. Please emphasize the level of heat in advance. Even with Diwali, we were able to secure a reservation the same day for 5 of us. *star*BYOB - *star*Food - we ordered yellow lentils with goat, chicken chettinad, chicken tikka masala, assorted Bread, the shrimp appetizer, and tandoori chicken. Everything was flavorful and the taste varies from dish to dish. We also got some gulab jamun and mango kulfi for dessert. *starValue & Service - the restaurant was very busy but service was fast. Everything came out timely. The bill for all our food with tip and tax was $100. *star*

49.description: The food was amazing, we had gobi manchurian which was really superb. Small space though, but the food tastes really authentic and they have fast service which really impressed me. One of the best Indian cuisine restaurant in Chicago.

40.description: I took a few people to introduce them to Indian food and thanks to Rangoli, they are now hooked.  The tandoori chicken was one of the best I've had - super flavorful with a kick to it.  The butter chicken, chicken korma, matter paneer, and garlic naan were all delicious.  I feel like some Indian restaurants tend to water their food down or the basic items will lack in flavor, but not here.  The servers were great - friendly and attentive and seemed so happy that we enjoyed the food.  And by far the best ambiance I've experienced at an Indian restaurant.  Beautiful, dimly lit, intimate, a good balance between modern and traditional Indian décor, great place for a date but also a few communal tables to accommodate groups.

53.description: Rangoli is a nice place with a great ambiance.  The food is good, but the portions are tiny.  There is better food at more reasonable prices at numerous locations closer to Devon street.  However, if all you are looking for is good indian food with a great ambiance then this is your place.  I would say overall look elsewhere...

30.description: Every time I order food from rangoli, my stomach is in knots. Total anxiety about whether I'll get it on time or at all. 30 minutes late and counting! It gets a star because it's OK Indian food/the only Indian place near Logan Square.Update, a few weeks later: Well, what do you know, my delivery is late again and the phone number to this business is not going through. GET A GRIP. Yall are just terrible.

46.description: We went in around 6 pm on a Sat night, and the place was packed.  Great Indian food, and wonderful customer service.  try the onion bhajee.  can't go wrong with indian style onion rings. =)

1.description: So far... the best Indian food in Chicago! and it's BYOB.We ordered:Butter Chicken(Chicken Makhani): so good, fresh, creamy and flavorful(my favorite!)The Garlic Naan: fresh and soft. Shrimp Vindaloo: good but might be TOO spicy for some. Chicken Tikka(appetizer): moist, tender and flavorful!Only complaint is that wish their service was little more friendly. Overall, the food was great! It's great to have a decent Indian place to go in a neighborhood. We will definately be going back!

55.description: I'm so glad there is an Indian spot in my hood.  Tips1. Get the Gobi Manchurian 2. Also pick-up, delivery is slow to non-existent (trust me its just easier that way)3.  Hot is really hot  ( I love spices but I could not finish my food, it was so spicy)4. Garlic Naan5. Garlic Naan6. BYOBMy only complaint is the portion sizes, I swear take-out is half the size as dine-in.   I just want them to give me more  than 5 pieces of chicken in my "chicken" tiki masala.  Felt like a sample sized portion.  Order a bunch of different stuff if your trying to feed a group.

9.description: So good here! This place is one of my fav Indian restaurants, and it's BYOB!  I've dined at the restaurant as well as ordered grubhub and it's always been fantastic....The only thing I don't like is that they don't accept reservations. Get here at a decent time or you'll have to wait a while. HIGHLY recommend this place!

26.description: Best Indian food in the West Town/Humboldt are. Wish I knew about it sooner. For sure my goto Indian spot from now on. The take out is still great too.

25.description: This review is based on one takeout order. Based on the favorable reviews, I was super excited to try Rangoli. I phoned ahead and ordered naan, two samosas and chicken tikka masala. The naan, samosas were standard and tasted fine. The disappointment came in the tikka masala because all the chicken pieces were dry. The masala was spot on but had the chicken been cooked better, I would have given Rangoli a fourth star. Loved the interior decor of the restuarant (check out the photos).I may give it another try but I'm not cruising 32 MPH on a Chicago Speed Zone of 30 MPH to go back.

12.description: Very bad customer service. They do not care of customer satisfaction. We were told 40min wait but took more than an hour. The guy was not happy having people come to the restaurant and wait. Ability to handle large crowd is zero and when you complain they respond with arrogance. Very arrogant people. This is the first place i have ever walked out regretting about choosing the place. Pathetic  service. Food is good but I would prefer a place who cares about customers rather than serving good food. Never going back to this place.

59.description: Food was great - flavor was on spot!The temperature of the dishes brought out all the flavors and spices.Service was okay but don't let that detour you from visiting and enjoy the food and drinks with family and friends.Like most of Chicago, parking here can be squeeze.

21.description: Chug your wine, 'cause you are outta there!Starting off, I want to say that if I could separately rate the food versus the service, my rating would be different. However, since I cannot, this place get a 3. I didn't want to do 2 stars, but the service was so horrific that I wish I could give them a 1 star. If this peaks your curiosity, read on.A group of us came for a 7:30pm reservation. By the time everyone showed up it was closed to 7:45-7:50. We were seated in the front, in 2 tables. There were 7 of us total, but they only gave us 3 chairs. if you have been here before, you know that each table is essentially good for 1 person on each side. We were forced to have 4 people on one side, which was very, very, very annoying, as there was so much food on the 2 tables that eating was a sport - make sure you don't spill on yourself, make sure your arm doesn't hit the other person next to you, make sure your smallest movements don't cause a domino effect of things falling on the table. It wasn't thought out well. I asked for another chair, so we could at least have 3 people on the side, and rudely I was told they had no chairs and that we would need to have all 4 on one side. Who does that? How do you not have enough chairs? We ordered a ton of food. A ton. The food was fantastic. I would come back here for the food anytime. However, the service was shotty. We ordered naan, and it came last, after all the food, and we had to ask again to make sure they were bringing it. After they brought it, we asked for the sauces, which should have already been given to us. Nope. We had to ask. And they were not the most polite about it. We had to continually ask for these sauces, as there were 7 of us, and they gave us 1 small dish. We also had to keep asking for water.Normally, these things would not bother me as much if the last thing didn't happen. But it did, so now this place is tainted in my mind.We finished eating and since it's a BYOB, we were still finishing our wine bottles that were open (3). We were asked by 2 separate waiters that we needed to go, because they needed our table. I have never, ever, been asked to leave an establishment when we are still not done with our drinks/food. I could understand if the entire place was packed, people were waiting in line outside or in the front, or if we were there for 3 hours and still not leaving. But we weren't even there 1.5 hours and were being forced to leave. We had full wine glasses full of wine, and we had just had the table cleared! It was appalling. You NEVER tell your guests they have to leave when your establishment offers BYOB, forcing them to essentially leave what they have behind.We ended up chugging our wine because we got asked again to leave. All of us were in shock that they had the nerve to ask us again to leave. We were respectful the entire time, but it seemed the politeness only was one sided. It's a shame, really. Because terrible service is a big factor in choosing where you want to spend your money. There are plenty of restaurants in chicago to choose from. Even though the food was great, the service is what got me. It won't be the first place I'll suggest for indian from here on out, so if you don't care about being treated like you don't matter, then go to this place. If you actually want the establishment to appreciate you as a customer, then I would suggest going elsewhere.

17.description: I was so happy when I found an awesome Indian restaurant on the West Side of Chicago.  I am obsessed with this place!!  Everything that I have gotten has been delicious.  I have ordered the gobi manchurian:  Spicy and great crunchy appetizer for vegetariansbagara baingnan:  Very spicy with great flavormalai kofta:  sweet tasting, personal favorite that I have gotten so farbindhi masala:  go to dish for anyone trying Indian for the first timeI can't wait to go back and try some other dishes.  Thank you, Rangoli!

10.description: I came here on a Saturday night for a birthday party, we had a group of 16.  So they do take reservations and they do accommodate large groups, however, our large party did dominate the restaurant.The place is BYOB without corkage fee.I thought the food was good. I'm not an expert in traditional Indian food. Myself and my whole party enjoyed their food. The service was good.I'd come again.

5.description: We'd just returned from three weeks in northwest India and wanted to treat our neighbors to an Indian dinner. Advised by Rangoli staff, we ordered half pans of butter chicken, tarka dal, and mutter paneer (peas & cheese), along with a dozen veggie samosas, plenty of naan, and two regular orders of aloo gobi. Wow! Not only were the portions enormous--ten of us barely made a dent--but the food was delivered piping hot and on time to our home in LP.  Rangoli's dishes were every bit as good--if not better--than what we'd eaten in Delhi and cities in Rajashtan. Indians use a ton of vegetable oil in their dishes; thankfully, Rangoli doesn't!

3.description: My friend and I were at the Garfield Park Conservatory and in search of somewhere to eat for dinner. We did a quick search and Rangoli popped up. We arrived around 7pm on a Wednesday and it was packed! We put our names down and waited about 30 mins. It was a little awkward because there was nowhere to stand and wait except for near the door where a small crowd of people were already standing. We patiently waited for a table to open and when one finally did, we were informed that it was reserved! For such a small restaurant, I don't think it's a good idea to take reservations or at least just have one large table reserved for big groups. While waiting, we looked at the menu and figured out what to order.We ordered: veggie samosaslamb saag w/basmati ricemutter paneergarlic naanEverything was delicious! The lamb was so tender and the garlic naan was fresh and hot. I had been craving Indian food for awhile and was extremely satisfied with all the dishes. I was stuffed and we still had plenty of leftovers to bring home. All the food was reasonably priced. If I lived in the area, I would go there more often or order take out. I want to go back and try their other dishes!

35.description: I love Indian food, and I love "Indian spicy" as opposed to "white boy" spicy. That is why I love Rangoli. This is the best Indian food I've ever has had outside of a few choice home-cooked meals I've been spoiled to in the past.I have only had takeout, and it has always been ready before whatever time the site says. They pack everything nicely to stay warm.My favorites so far are the chicken '65 and lamb josh rogan.

19.description: I love Indian food, and I love "Indian spicy" as opposed to "white boy" spicy. That is why I love Rangoli. This is the best Indian food I've ever has had outside of a few choice home-cooked meals I've been spoiled to in the past.I have only had takeout, and it has always been ready before whatever time the site says. They pack everything nicely to stay warm.My favorites so far are the chicken '65 and lamb josh rogan.

28.description: Came here with my boyfriend, my best friend, and her husband. We have a wide variety of tastes and can handle very different levels of spicy - Luckily Rangoli's had great, clear descriptions of the food, including the spice levels marked very clearly. We found something for everyone, sampled what we could handle of each other's food, and everything tasted great. The place is smaller but very cute and cozy, well decorated. Definitely the best Indian place in the neighborhood.

45.description: I've been here twice. I felt the food was more on the heavy side. It was just too thick and heavy, and not light enough to let the faint flavors of Indian spices come through. I gave up and haven't returned.

33.description: Rangoli was a mesmerizing experience. They have the best lamb samosas in the city. Beautiful pyramid shape and accompanying sauce. I had butter chicken as my main dish, which is a bold choice on my part - but it was perfect, with thick cubes of chicken and perfectly seasoned rice. The best part, though, about Rangoli is the fact that they serve chilled water without ice. Ice is overrated. Oh, and the price is pretty great too, as well as the plentiful parking nearby. 5/5 would go again (because I already have).

43.description: Here's the catch-22: Rangoli is best with pickup or delivery (you get more food, meat is more tender...I know it's weird!) BUT pickup is never ready on time and delivery is always 30-60 min late. I've been eating there regularly since they opened and this has always been the case. I think the problem lies in management because the food it so good.

2.description: Went last night with a few family members and we ordered a ton!Appetizer:Keema Samosas: A little dry, but with the chutneys this was delicious! There was more dough than I would prefer, but it was still good.Main Dishes:Lamb Rogan Josh: Not as soft as I would like it. Those who usually like this type of dish enjoyed it though.Kadai Chicken: Yum! Flavorful and would definitely order again.Mutter Paneer: GET THIS! If you don't usually like mutter paneer, you still need to try this. It is the best mutter paneer I've probably ever had. I love that the paneer pieces were smaller too so I could get a piece with each bite.Butter Chicken/Chicken Tikka Masala: We got both dishes, but couldn't tell the difference between the flavors of each. The flavors were still amazing and butter chicken is a staple at every indian restaurant, so I would still get it.Also, their garlic naan is soft and has a ton of garlic...which is a good thing!

18.description: Loved it!! Food was great - not the absolute best overall Indian food I've ever had, but it was close! One of the vegetable curries we tried (had pineapple in it) was one of the best veg dishes I've had in recent memory. What really made our experience great though was the service. When we ordered the lamb vindaloo (which had 3 chilis next to it), the server cautioned us about its spiciness, so we we asked for it to be medium spicy instead. Even with that adjustment, it was ridiculously hot to our weakling palates. Our server and a guy who I think might have been a manager kept their eyes on us, checked in to make sure it wasn't *too* spicy, and then kept our water re-filled and gave us a cooling yogurt sauce when they saw that clearly it was. I really appreciated their level of consideration and desire to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.Will definitely be back!

41.description: I've only had take-out from this place twice and I'm obsessed!Hands down the BEST butter chicken I've ever had in my life. The sauce is so good I would eat it without any chicken in it. The garlic naan is bomb too. We tried calling but it was so busy my brother had to order it online and pick it up and he said there were people everywhere. My brother eats all types of cuisines but favors Pakistani and Indian food and he craves this place too. Wish they were open before 4:30pm and wish they had a location a little closer so I could get delivery. Have to try more dishes. I'm very impressed.

52.description: Loved, loved, loved Rangoli. My mouth is watering just thinking about their food again; I hadn't had Indian food that good in a very long time! I tried the onion bhajee and chicken tikka for starters. The chicken came sizzling and covered with fresh veggies, and was divine - a must try if you're dining here. The bhajee was my least favorite dish of the night, but don't get me wrong, it was still really good - very crispy and wonderfully spiced. It's just that compared to the rest of the excellent meal it was probably the dish I could do without. For entrees, we had the chicken vindaloo and the bhindi masala (an okra dish). We were warned that the vindaloo was very spicy, but I actually thought the bhindi was way spicier and there was little heat in the vindaloo in comparison. Both dishes were delicious, but do be wary about the spice in dishes that aren't marked as hot on the menu. We also got the garlic naan, which came fresh out of the oven and was smothered in fresh chopped garlic. It was delicious and paired perfectly when dipped into the vindaloo/masala. The portions in pictures may look deceivingly small, but we ended up having to take half our food home because there was so much. We each paid ~$25 which I thought was extremely reasonable given both the quality and quantity of food.The server was very attentive, and made sure we always had water. He overheard me mention to my friend that we didn't have knives, and he came over with a couple right away. The host was cold and scowl-y which I normally wouldn't give a crap about when the food is this good, but he was much friendlier to another party which was really off putting (and the reason I can't give 5 stars). Regardless, I recommend Rangoli to anyone looking for some absolutely fantastic food, that's also reasonably priced!

50.description: Spicy authentic rich Indian food. BYOB. All men waiters carefully attend to a limited number of tables. I ordered the Lamb Rogan Josh "mild dry red peppers with a hint of yogurt". It was very hot and very good. Brings to mind a roasted habanero vegetable blend. Complex flavors, like the best of home cooking with a preference toward sadism. I can't wait to cook breakfast with the leftovers. Mutter paneer had fewer peas than usual and a hint of thai peanut sauce. My wife had chicken vindaloo. Upon consultation with the waiter, she had it "medium", which to her was very hot. Compared to my dish it was mild, but we're talking Indian mild, not American mild. A great value considering the byob factor.

4.description: This review is based on one takeout order. Based on the favorable reviews, I was super excited to try Rangoli. I phoned ahead and ordered naan, two samosas and chicken tikka masala. The naan, samosas were standard and tasted fine. The disappointment came in the tikka masala because all the chicken pieces were dry. The masala was spot on but had the chicken been cooked better, I would have given Rangoli a fourth star.
