Loved the interior decor of the restuarant (check out the photos).I may give it another try but I'm not cruising 32 MPH on a Chicago Speed Zone of 30 MPH to go back.

6.description: The food was very tasty and delicious especially the lamb biryani For sure I will make it again

22.description: Took my friends for some good Indian food and nice evening. Great decor, good lighting, small space and good food. Saturday nights are busy though so get urself a table reserved. The service needs some improvement and they are short of waiting space.

15.description: Rangoli got it going on. Rangoli has surpassed my expectations every time. I've been here with friends, family and even hosted my hubby's surprise 30th bday party. For the party, the staff let me bring a cake beforehand, decorate the table with corny bday crap and when his fam rolled up with coolers to BYOB (which is why I love them), they didn't even bat an eye. Their food is phenomenal. Something that stands out here is the gobi manchurian which I always get. It tastes like calamari but it's cauliflower. How the f? I've had the samosas, naan, roti, tikka, the kofta which were all excellent. Recently I said yolo and tried the navratan korma, which was sweet and peanuty and a beautiful break from spicy food when you need it. Hubby loves the lamb korma and pretty much every lamb dish here. Every time I've been, I've shut the place down and they've never said a thing. Truly the nicest staff ever!I love Rangoli forever ever.

57.description: Super solid Indian with having yo go all the way uptown to get your fix. Only 4 stars because our friend got sag palak and did not enjoy it- saying there was a rancid aftertaste.

20.description: This place is legit!   I've been to Devon Street spots and other restaurants around the city, but Rangoli is the place I crave!  Great, authentic environment; friendly & attentive staff; & amazing food!   I love that their food brings the heat - there's no dumbing it down for Westerners.  BYOB.A must!   This place gets busy, so make a reservation or come prepared.   They deliver too!

36.description: This is by far my favorite Indian in the City.  I truly love every dish I have ever ordered here.  I also like that it is BYOB.  The only with I have is that they would put tea lights or even the little fake battery candles on each tanle.

14.description: So cozy and very authentic! We sat with a large group at the front big wooden table and we had the best time. Great conversation, great food and since it's BYOB the bill comes and you are just shocked and thrilled at how inexpensive it is! We got about 12-16 diff dishes for 8 people and shared it all and it was a perfect amount! We will for sure be back!

58.description: Excellent service, Molly and Cuba are very professional. I have brought two people in for piercings, and Cuba was great at explaining every step of the process, and very patient. Also, an excellent selection for piercing jewelry. Would highly recommend to anyone.

56.description: I brought my daughter here to get her nose pierced for her 18th birthday. Cuba was great! My daughter was apprehensive about the pain involved, but she happily reported that it wasn't that painful at all.  Cuba did an amazing job and he fully explained how to care for the new piercing.  Molly was professional and helpful as well.  I am actually considering going back to get my own nose pierced.

29.description: Great unique jewelry! They helped me find a style and metal of jewelry for my sensitive skin and gave me ample information about care and use

42.description: I'm crazy about Identity.Molly pierced my nose in April 2014 and she was very professional. The shop is sanitary and they make a point of showing you that they have sterilized the equipment before starting.I went back in today for another piece of jewelry and received the same professionalism as last year. Claudia helped me pick out a piece and walked me through how to change it for when I decide I want to.It is a bit more expensive, but the quality, experience, and professionalism is well worth the cost. I wouldn't go anywhere else.

23.description: They have an incredible selection of jewelry. I can't laud them enough for their professionalism. When I need new plugs I will most definitely be back.

47.description: I actually got an account just to leave a review about this place. I always thought about getting piercings but never actually seriously considered getting them until I got here. I got double lobes, auricle and cartilage done. Molly was an absolute professional and made sure that I knew everything was sterilized, explained what she was doing when I couldn't see and was as gentle as can be. She was very thorough in explaining after care and future jewelry changes. I had such a positive experience that I decided to go back and get my nose pierced and plan to get more piercings in the future. I can't give this place a high enough rating!

8.description: These ladies made me feel comfortable and right at home. Molly did such a great job with my industrial. The place was sanitary, small and comfortable. All they do is piercing so this is one of the reasons I picked this place. They have great pieces to choose from and they also offer free anodized options for piercing.

31.description: I had an issue with my septum piercing but they were really nice about it and offered to refund me fully.

34.description: Fantastic experience at Identity today. Molly was so friendly, patient, helpful, and clear. Everything was clean, open, and bright, felt right at home. Love my cartilage piercing :)

16.description: After searching for various places to get a piercing I finally decided to give this shop a try. I went in to get my conch piercing, it was super easy to get to and parking isn't that bad. The girl at the front is very nice and helps out when it comes to picking the jewelry. I got pierced by Micah and he made me super comfortable, he was fun to talk to and when it came to the actual piercing he was very gentle and made it less painful than I thought it would be.I'm also super happy of how they take the time to sterilize the jewelry and make everything super safe and clean (the shop is super clean too!) I'm super happy I came here and I'll definitely come back for more !

13.description: What a lovely shop. Went in to get an old piercing re-pierced. From the ladies in the front to the guest piercer Nathaniel, everyone was helpful and charming. The establishment was very clean. These folks clearly know their stuff and provide great customer service. They were willing to answer questions but not at all pushy. Highly recommended.

11.description: A friend and I both got our tragus and helix pierced there a few months back. Molly immediately made us feel very relaxed and answered any questions we had which were alot. The store was bright and clean. Rooms were comfortable and very organized. Molly assured us that everything was sanitary. Would definitely go back if I decide to pierce anything else. The only reason im giving it 4 stars is because my friend had to go back and get another one because the tragus jewelry was to small for her and skin grew over it. She's perfectly fine now, got a longer piercing and enjoying it.

39.description: I really liked this place.  Its small place but they have a lot of options there.  I found exactly what I was looking for and get 2 nose rings for under $100.  Everyone that worked there helped me out a lot and they were all super nice and cool!  They even switched out my nose ring for me.  Next time I need more jewlery ill be coming here for sure!

37.description: I've been to Identity twice for a nostril and helix piercing and I am beyond thrilled with both. I was given both piercings by Molly, who is one of the co-owners along with her partner Cuba. Everything is super sterile, you can easily tell, and they sterilize every piece of jewelry for about 10 minutes every time they do a piercing, change of jewelry, etc. Molly briefed me on how to take care of my piercings and haven't had infections on either of them! Once I had to take my nostril piercing out and couldn't get it back in because the whole closed and they repierced it for free and sterlized my jewelry for free. Super awesome people who genuinely care about their work and are great at it. This shop tends to attract the heavily pierced, heavily tattooed crowd but I didn't feel out of place when I went in (I'm a preppy ballerina). HIGHLY recommend it. Fantastic place!

0.description: So great!  Everyone from the guest piercer who did the work to the gals up front who helped me choose jewelry were so nice and professional!  The shop had a comfortable, un-intimidating atmosphere and a beautiful selection of hardware.  Everyone really took time with me to talk through what i wanted, made great recommendations, and asked great questions.  Aftercare was thoroughly discussed and sterilization practices were held to the highest standard throughout.It's been almost a week since I got my industrial done, and it's healing perfectly.  Clean, no swelling, no infection.  One friend just commented that it didn't even look like a fresh piercing, but something I'd had for a while that she just hadn't noticed before!  Really, really, happy and would recommend Identity to anyone looking for a great piercing experience.

38.description: If you want the best, this is where to go. Amazingly friendly knowledgable folks. The cleanest, most beautiful shop I've been in. Hands down best jewelry selection in the city as well. Can't recommend this place enough!

51.description: I called about a week before asking about pricing and Molly was very nice. When I went in, she was with another customer, but did say hi and said that she would be with me in a minute. She was very friendly and helpful. They had a lot of different options for earrings, at different price ranges. The shop was very clean and sterile. Molly was professional and made sure that I was 100% before I left. I will be going back for any other piercings I need!

27.description: Wow. My first experience here couldn't have gone any better! I came in last Saturday (without an appointment) to get my septum pierced. I sat for a short time and had some water while they sterilized and prepped the tools. I was pierced by Cuba and he was assisted by Claudia, who was in training. Claudia showed me the sterilized tools and then swabbed (cleaned) the inside of my nose. I laid down on the table and Cuba searched for the "sweet spot" in my septum. He was explaining to Claudia how to do the piercing, and then it was over in literally less than 10 seconds and I didn't even feel a thing. Not even a pinch. My eyes didn't water at all. I asked him "Is that it?" "Yup, it's over." "Well that was awesome!" Claudia quickly massaged the inside of my nose with some q-tips to reduce swelling and bruising, and then I sat up and it was over. In and out of there in about 20 minutes. Also, their jewelry is badass. I got a coupon for 15% off my next visit, which can be used for jewelry or a piercing, so I'm definitely purchasing my next ring there. The shop is clean, the staff friendly and professional, and the price was reasonable. A few days later my piercing still doesn't hurt and is doing well. Highly recommend this place!

32.description: Identity Body Piercing is clean, proficient, and affordable. I had a very positive experience from start to finish and will most definitely return. Staff is fun, knowledgeable, and professional. I highly suggest a visit here if you are considering a new piercing.

54.description: Found this shop on Yelp and am so glad that I did! The shop is very clean and they have a great selection of jewelry. I got double cartilage piercings yesterday which were done by Cuba. He is meticulous when it comes to measuring and takes his time.  He explained everything to me and made sure that I saw everything was sterile.  Molly helped me pick out my jewelry and answered all my questions.  She also gave me information on the aftercare. They are both awesome and very friendly which made me feel comfortable. Great customer service. I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to get a piercing. I will definitely be back to get more jewelry once my piercings heal. The place and people are fantastic!

48.description: I got my tragus done here and they were  awesome. I was impressed with their knowledge and selection. Thir process of sanitation was extremely thorough.

44.description: My experience with identity body piercing was the single most horrifying and painful experience I've ever had. I visited identity earlier tonight to have them remove jewelry that was completely inappropriate for my piercing that I bought from them earlier this week. The jewelry, a small studded septum clicker, was TOO SMALL and immediately started digging into my tissues. Right away I could tell something was wrong. Do not trust these people to give you their professional advice. They only want the sale. They are kind and friendly, but horribly lack expertise for customer service skills. I called to ask if they would remove it and take it back, their prices were unreasonable, and they refused. The next day I really started to get scared. I am a professional in the advertising industry and am in charge of client relations. So far I've gotten away with non traditional 'fashion statements' if you will, but my nose started to swell, I couldn't make facial expressions without wincing, and the jewelry in my nose became flush my skin as it cut deeper and deeper into my septum.Worried that I made a bad judgement in trusting them the first time with fitting my nose to the right jewelry size (that's a main responsibility and requirement for THIS JOB), I was hesitant to go back and have it taken out. But I went back anyway, with much anxiety, because I wanted them to actually physically so what they did to my face. I'm uploading pictures you can check them out too. The worst was yet to come. The blonde woman who I think was the owner was trying g to avoid me and assigned a guy to take out the clicker. He was unnecessarily rough and rushed. It's making me tear up just thinking about what happened and the pain. I could barely control my breath or sobs of pain long after I left identity. My friend who came with for support said I was wailing in pain like I was in labor, she could hear me from the other room. I felt incredibly violated. So completely disrespected. He poked, prodded, and grabbed the inside of my nose, ripped my tissue with pliers causing blood to gush, then he realized maybe he was wrong. He was tearing at the hinge side of the ring instead of the clasp. I had to go through it all again. They were 100% UNAPOLOGETIC. I received no refund. No discount. No apology. No respect. No sympathy. I've had body piercings my whole adult life... Lots in the face, lots in my body, and I've NEVER had an experience like this. After the ring was out he looked me right in the face and made excuses for the jewelry being too small. Blamed me for having a cold? And causing the swelling myself? My piercing was healthy and 3 years old. This was not my fault, and they did not own up. Do not trust these people. They have beautiful pieces, and hopefully others have had better experiences with them. I do not wish this on anyone. There is now a visible, seeping, deep cut in my septum where the ring sat to remind me I made a bad choice going to identity. Never again. It's embarrassing and I don't know what I'm going to do at work and when I have in person meetings with my clients. Never, ever again.

24.description: clean, professional, friendly& awesome... worth every penny, you won't be disappointed going here

7.description: My sister and I went to Identity on her birthday to get our tragus' done. The shop was insanely clean and comfortable. Molly pierced my sister and Cuba did my tragus and conch.  They are both very kind people and explained ever step they were doing as they went. Sterilizing and cleaning were done right in front of us. They have a huge selection of products to choose from. It was pricey because they sell really nice body jewelry.  It was kinda far from where we were coming from, but we were both super happy we tried them out! Identity was definitely worth the drive!

49.description: Had a simple ear piercing here today. Molly explained the sterilization procedure and performed a surgically perfect pierce. I really liked the concept of a speciality piercing shop-- it provided a place for a well rounded selection of earrings, and also it allowed for a calmer, more comfortable atmosphere. Highly recommended.

40.description: Good place. After having a bad experience somewhere else, this shop totally put me at ease. Their staff was all friendly and knowledgable and they also carry a beautiful assortment of jewelry. I got 3 cartilage piercings done and am very pleased. It isn't the cheapest place in town but when ramming needles through your flesh you should be OK spending a little more money on a place that's legit. They make sure everything is sterilized properly and were patient with me when I was changing my mind about the positioning of the earrings. Also, I really don't like needles and I asked that they don't show me the needle and they respected that request. I liked this place a lot and I'll go back for sure.

53.description: Cuba and Molly were fantastic. Molly did a beautiful job on my conch piercing. The shop is incredible- whether you get a piercing or not, it's certainly worth a look around.

30.description: Molly pierced my nose one weekday afternoon, and it was great! The shop is very clean and inviting. The staff is friendly but not pushy. They'll make you a cup of coffee while your equipment is sterilizing. They have a great selection of jewelry, and I 100 percent see myself coming back to buy some.Personally, it was important for my to go to a place that specialized in piercing. I suggest you do the same!

46.description: As a native Chicagoan and current Brooklynite, I've gotten piercings all over the place. But the experience I had at Identity was by far the best ive ever had. They are incredibly sweet, friendly, and helpful and have an amazing selection of jewelry for ridiculously reasonable prices. Maybe most importantly, they took their time sterilizing their tools and I could tell they knew their shit. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

1.description: After thorough research of piercing shops, I chose Identity to get my septum pierced. The shop itself is very clean and they have a great selection of jewelry to choose from which I was thrilled about. The lady who helped me select the jewelry was nice and very patient with me ( I was having a tough time picking a ring). Cuba pierced my septum and placed the jewelry in. He had me sit up and told me the piercing would look a little crooked until I was able to change rings because the retainer I chose was wider than my septum. I was bummed but trusted what he said to be true. He laid me down once more, took the retainer out, and using the same entrance pierced my septum again! He said he wanted to fix the angle. I appreciated that he wanted to make sure it was pierced correctly, no complaint there. After going through the pain of having my septum pierced again, I looked in the mirror. The retainer was still crooked but I believed what Cuba said about the retainer being wider than my septum, and once it was healed I could switch to a smaller retainer and it would be straight. After a few days I took a better look at the piercing and it was very apparent that it was pierced completely crooked!! The left side was pierced signaficianlty higher than the right side. Unfortunately I was out of town when I made this discovery and would not be back for another 2 weeks. Tired of looking at my stupid $80 mistake ($60 plus a $20 tip!!!!!), I took the retainer out. I am truly disappointed with this shop. I had such high hopes that I was in good hands. Had Cuba been honest with me and told me he had pierced it crooked, I wouldn't be writing this review. I feel completely scammed and will never return to Identity.

55.description: Got my tongue pierced by Cuba. I was nervous about getting pierced in general but Cuba was awesome! He explained everything and kept me calm. Honestly it hurt but nothing that is not tolerable. After the piercing he allowed me to look at it and I absolutely love it! Cuba was very detailed in explaining aftercare, recommendations for proper healing, and even discussed foods/drinks to stay away from during the healing process. The shop is wonderful. Extremely clean and inviting. I would highly recommend this shop to anyone looking to get a piercing!

9.description: Identity has to be the cleanest piercing shop I have ever experienced, and I have visited quite a few. The aspect I liked the most is that it is only piercings and not a tattoo shop. I was a bit nervous because I had my nose pierced in high school, and it got infected continuously for the little over a year that I had it. Molly pierced my nose and was wonderful from start to finish. She was kind and welcoming when I first entered the shop and so were the rest of the staff working. I really appreciated that she showed me the sterilized equipment before she did the piercing and gave great instructions for aftercare. The aftercare had to be one of the most important parts, and the simple instructions did the trick. After three months my nose piercing had healed beautifully. I will most definitely be back to purchase jewelry and when I can finally decide what to pierce next.

26.description: Got Pierced here the other day. Everything about this place was perfect. We were immediately made to feel right at home and comfortable. The whole place and everyone there were completely professional and clean. I even bought a piece of jewelry for another piercing I already had, and they sterilized and changed it for me. I didn't even have to ask. I would definitely recommend this place and will be going back for any other piercing needs.

25.description: I went in there while on a mini trip to Chicago and I was unsure of what I wanted done. Everyone was so helpful and I ended up getting my Tragus pierced with the help from the nice women that works there. I love it! I will definitely come back

12.description: I'm so happy that i was recommended to Identity Body Piercing. Its definitely convenient for me since i only work 2 blocks away! I called day of to get my septum pierced and they got me in within the hour. When i walked in i was greeted very warmly and got helped to pick out my jewelry. I was very pleased to see how incredibly clean the studio was and that they really take the time to disinfect the space before i even entered to room. Cuba did my piercing and he was quick yet efficient! i can't get over how nice everyone was and appreciated my business! I LOVE my piecing and will be back in 6 weeks to get new jewelry! thanks again guys!

59.description: Got my septum pierced here yesterday, and Cuba was so great about the whole process. I will definitely be going back here for any jewelry changes, questions, or future piercings!Really clean and very efficient. He explained the whole process and was very professional.

21.description: I first heard about Identity when I went to get my ears scalped by Chase Campbell last January, and I wish I knew about this place sooner because I am obsessed! Molly, Cuba, and Klaudia are the best in the business and super friendly. They have the most body jewelry out of any piercing studio I've ever been to, so there is something for everyone. They also do custom orders, which I love because I can be picky/specific sometimes. I've been here so many times weather it's to get a new piercing, pick out some new jewelry, or just cause I was in the area and wanted to pop in for a visit. As long as they are in Chicago, this is the place I swear by (:

17.description: My experience with identity body piercing was the single most horrifying and painful experience I've ever had. I visited identity earlier tonight to have them remove jewelry that was completely inappropriate for my piercing that I bought from them earlier this week. The jewelry, a small studded septum clicker, was TOO SMALL and immediately started digging into my tissues. Right away I could tell something was wrong. Do not trust these people to give you their professional advice. They only want the sale. They are kind and friendly, but horribly lack expertise for customer service skills. I called to ask if they would remove it and take it back, their prices were unreasonable, and they refused. The next day I really started to get scared. I am a professional in the advertising industry and am in charge of client relations. So far I've gotten away with non traditional 'fashion statements' if you will, but my nose started to swell, I couldn't make facial expressions without wincing, and the jewelry in my nose became flush my skin as it cut deeper and deeper into my septum.Worried that I made a bad judgement in trusting them the first time with fitting my nose to the right jewelry size (that's a main responsibility and requirement for THIS JOB), I was hesitant to go back and have it taken out. But I went back anyway, with much anxiety, because I wanted them to actually physically so what they did to my face. I'm uploading pictures you can check them out too. The worst was yet to come. The blonde woman who I think was the owner was trying g to avoid me and assigned a guy to take out the clicker. He was unnecessarily rough and rushed. It's making me tear up just thinking about what happened and the pain. I could barely control my breath or sobs of pain long after I left identity. My friend who came with for support said I was wailing in pain like I was in labor, she could hear me from the other room. I felt incredibly violated. So completely disrespected. He poked, prodded, and grabbed the inside of my nose, ripped my tissue with pliers causing blood to gush, then he realized maybe he was wrong. He was tearing at the hinge side of the ring instead of the clasp. I had to go through it all again. They were 100% UNAPOLOGETIC. I received no refund. No discount. No apology. No respect. No sympathy. I've had body piercings my whole adult life... Lots in the face, lots in my body, and I've NEVER had an experience like this. After the ring was out he looked me right in the face and made excuses for the jewelry being too small. Blamed me for having a cold? And causing the swelling myself? My piercing was healthy and 3 years old. This was not my fault, and they did not own up. Do not trust these people. They have beautiful pieces, and hopefully others have had better experiences with them. I do not wish this on anyone. There is now a visible, seeping, deep cut in my septum where the ring sat to remind me I made a bad choice going to identity. Never again. It's embarrassing and I don't know what I'm going to do at work and when I have in person meetings with my clients. Never, ever again.

10.description: They have an incredible selection of jewelry. I can't laud them enough for their professionalism. When I need new plugs I will most definitely be back.

5.description: Molly pierced my nose one weekday afternoon, and it was great! The shop is very clean and inviting. The staff is friendly but not pushy. They'll make you a cup of coffee while your equipment is sterilizing. They have a great selection of jewelry, and I 100 percent see myself coming back to buy some.Personally, it was important for my to go to a place that specialized in piercing. I suggest you do the same!

3.description: Awesome experience!!!)Cuba did such a great job, and I'm so happy I've my upper lip piercing done at this place!He was passionate with me, and made it as painless as it only could be!also store is really stylish, and they have a huge selection of products!go check it out whether you need get piercings or buy some jewelry!the best experience in Chicago!)

35.description: I had to get a bunch of piercings taken out a while ago, and I made the mistake of going to Tatu Tattoo that time. I try to not repeat the same mistakes, so I went to Identity this time. The only reason I knocked off a star was because I just tried to go back again today (to put my jewelry back in!), and they were closed even though they weren't supposed to close for another hour. There was no sign or anything to explain, unfortuantely. I'm trying to give the benefit of the doubt that it's due to the weather (we're on tornado watch...), but I'm still frustrated. On my way home from Identity, I passed Infamous Ink, so I stopped in there. They were completely empty. Two guys stood there staring. They didn't greet me or ask what I needed. I asked what they charge to put in jewelry that I brought. They quoted me a price -- and then began backtracking on it!! Nothing is more aggravating to me than that. If you're that worried I won't tip, then I'll save everyone the favor and not give you my business in the first place. At Identity, they actually acknowledge you when you arrive and offer you tea and candy (admittedly, I was insanely jazzed up for more candy when I went back tonight, which only adds to my disappointment that they were closed). They sterlized the tools while I ate all their candy. They took my jewelry out and were very, very nice about it -- constantly making sure that they weren't tugging too hard, etc. I enjoyed the atmosphere there.They charged the price that they said they'd charge, and I tipped more than 200%. When I stormed out of Infamous Ink tonight, I straight up told the guy I was going to Identity (even though I knew they were closed early already) because of their prices and cited the specific amount. He was stunned at how little they charge. I went to school at IU and Bloomington is where I've had most of my piercings done (or redone...), and the piercers there don't charge anything to change/remove/put in jewelry. I get that this is Chicago and everything is expensive, though. However, it never ceases to amaze me that these tattoo/piercing parlors that all within five seconds of each other aren't more aware of each others' prices. To credentialize myself a little more on the matter of piercers all within five seconds of each other, I also had a lot of piercings done at the Silver Room on multiple occassions when I was in high school. I liked them a lot, but they don't pierce anymore. Identity will win all my piercing-related business for forever!

19.description: I'm crazy about Identity.Molly pierced my nose in April 2014 and she was very professional. The shop is sanitary and they make a point of showing you that they have sterilized the equipment before starting.I went back in today for another piece of jewelry and received the same professionalism as last year. Claudia helped me pick out a piece and walked me through how to change it for when I decide I want to.It is a bit more expensive, but the quality, experience, and professionalism is well worth the cost. I wouldn't go anywhere else.

28.description: This place is great! I got my nose pierced by Molly who made the whole process a breeze. This place has the best selection of jewelry with reasonable pricing. Would highly recommend this place...they really know what they're doing.

45.description: I had to give this place five starts for their friendly service and accommodations! My sister and I had our nose pierced by Molly who is super sweet and down to earth! We both appreciated her fore warnings for all steps. She explained the entire process and even took her time to explain after care. While we were waiting we were looking at their awesome jewelry while sipping on some Lemon Zinger tea made from their Keurig which was a nice little touch! Definitely recommend this place!

33.description: i bought a belly button ring here (I've been having trouble finding one that isn't obnoxious and ugly), and I was absolutely shocked how great the quality was. For something plain and seemingly simple, it has an awesome screw-on tip so I don't lose the ball. I want to come back and buy some jewelry -- they have tons of gorgeous stuff at really reasonable prices! My boyfriend is definitely getting a pair of plugs from here.

43.description: I can't recommend Identity Body Piercing enough. I came in to get a rook and tragus piercing, which were both done by Molly. She happily answered all of my questions about aftercare, everything was extremely clean, the selection of jewelry was fantastic, and both Molly and the apprentice there that day (Claudia I think?) were so warm and friendly.  I had a wonderful overall experience and will be going back.

2.description: So I had heard so many good things about this place and I was really disappointed. I found that the whole process took way longer than expected, no one was in any hurry to help me out, so I spent ages in the shop just waiting to be helped. Everyone was just hanging out, lazing around- which is a chill environment for a saturday with your friends, but was unfortunate for anyone wishing to be helped promptly in an actual business. I had to get to work after and I thought that an hour and a half would be sufficient.The young girl who helped me pick out jewelry ended up retrieving the wrong piece once the time came and I did ended up with a larger stone than I wanted which was more expensive and looked a little silly in my nose- at that point i was running so late that I didn't push the point. I also did not feel that the piercer was friendly or had a good manner- but maybe he was just hung over or having a bad day or something. When the piercer took out the jewelry I was previously wearing, he bent it irrepairably, not even asking if I had wanted to keep it for use later- this really upset me as the jewelry was my property and he basically ruined it, since I don't have the tools to fix bent jewelry. I felt that for such an expensive piercing experience, the service should be absolutely top notch. I don't want to tear down their reputation because most people clearly love this place, and I think they have a lot going for them in terms of the location and the property but I was just upset by the service that I got and walked away with such a bad taste, after I was preparing for a really good experience. For your money you can get something with at least as good service, jewelry and quality for a much lower price. If you want something specialty and have all day to hang out and be assertive this is a good choice, otherwise, I wouldn't go the distance

18.description: They have the best jewelry and Molly is a very talented piercer!!! Their shop is so clean and they make you feel comfortable.

41.description: I got my septum pierced in January by Cuba and also brought along a friend who got her nose pierced by Molly. This was actually my first ever piercing experience other than my ears when I was a child, so I was a bit nervous but they made the process quite simple. We had a great experience and I really trusted their professionalism. :) They showed me how they sterilized their equipment and my jewelry before the actual piercing process, which I really appreciated. After the piercing, Molly explained how to clean our piercings and answered my questions thoroughly. I think Identity is a little bit more pricier than a typical tattoo/piercing shop you'd fine in the city, but honestly I believe you get what you pay for and they specialize in piercings only! I'm so happy with my septum piercing and 3 months later it's doing just fine and healed well. I will definitely be back to buy some of their beautiful jewelry soon. All their nose piercings are the same price with basic jewelry. They also change your jewelry free for you!

52.description: Cuba was so great! I went with my friends, one for her cartilage, the other for her lip. I didn't get anything today but everything was very clean and professional, and everyone was polite to us, and patient while my friends picked their jewelry. Don't be afraid if google maps tells you this place is closed- it's very much open.

50.description: Great! Answered all my questions and made this a good experience.

4.description: I went here on a whim to get a piercing with a friend. I got my upper ear fold...not sure what the name is...as I'm not a professional piercer of any nature at all. I would have given this place 5 stars however I felt that the individual that pierced my ears was a little bit snobby when he found out this was my first piercing. I also went back for follow up care since it's sill sore after 6 months.... and the person behind the cash register wasn't any nicer. I find it ironic on how I can be discriminated against because I'm too 'clean cut' looking?  I'm not sure I'd go back. But the piercing itself was a solid job. They do know their pericing.

6.description: Nothing like going into a piercing shop and not being immediately judged for not having a gauged nostril or something.Super nice and patient. Made me feel heard and gave me advice even though I just stopped in to buy jewelry. Will be heading back when I decide to pierce the next whatever on my body. WAY TO BE DECENT, SOCIAL HUMANS!

22.description: I went to this place based off yelp reviews and it was definitely a great experience. Molly was very professional, quick and informative. I barely felt the prick when she pierced my nose and I have had zero issues since! Highly recommended. It's not cheap but you get what you pay for and you wouldn't anyone else doing it any other way :) I tipped generously because I loved their service!

15.description: I really liked this place.  Its small place but they have a lot of options there.  I found exactly what I was looking for and get 2 nose rings for under $100.  Everyone that worked there helped me out a lot and they were all super nice and cool!  They even switched out my nose ring for me.  Next time I need more jewlery ill be coming here for sure!

57.description: My wife and I went to get our septum piercing together here and it was the best experience!  I would suggest this place to anyone interested in any kind of piercing. Cuba and Molly are amazing and knowledgable.  They make you feel very comfortable and our piercing didn't even hurt.

20.description: Very knowledgeable staff, unique jewelry selection, and very high class studio.  I would highly recommend these guys to anyone!

36.description: I wanted to get a piercing done and I had gone to the alley and they guy there was so rude! Needless to say i was skeptical going somewhere else for fear of being treated the same. That was not the case at all when I came to Identity Body Piercing one Sunday night. I initially talked to Cuba who explained everything to me with patience and kindness. I then met Molly who ended up doing my inner conch piercing. She is such a beautiful person , so kind , gentle and made me feel at ease. I have recommended everyone who asks me about piercing because I know I wanted to feel at ease and be treated right from the person who is going to pierce me. In conclusion go to this place they are amazing and will take care of you !

14.description: Went in very nervous to have my dermal removed.  The process was quick and easy.  I would definitely return for any future piercing needs.

0.description: This is an excellent spot for Estheticians to get their steamers, mag lamps, equipment, gloves, hot towel cabinets, and wax supplies. They fix equipment, & they are local.

3.description: I have been going to this botanica for years. The owner is a sweetheart which is also a big selling point. I have yet to go to a botanica in Chicago that has the same herb selection that she has. She also has a very extensive candle and statue selection. The store also offers incense (stick & powder form), bracelets, amulets, scarves/panuelos and even homeopathic remedies. Don't let the huge Native American statue in the front of the door scare you off. The owner speaks English and Spanish so you don't feel like a total dork if you ask for something incorrectly. I highly recommend this botanica, and have even brought out of town guests to this botanica when they have needed things.

1.description: I ADORE Victoria & respect the power of light & love she puts into everything she does. Besides dressing & blessing candles & objects of power  I especially look forward to her Special Cleansing  New Year Bath EVERY YEAR!   Her care and attention to every client is proof this is not just a business, it is a "calling" for this wonderful woman.  The energy is so positive you can't help but feel better about the open road ahead. I agree wholeheartedly with the other reviews stating it's well worth the trip as well as  her store's offerings . So I wish YOU ALL .Health Wealth & Happiness . ^_^ VIVA !

2.description: This botanica has a great selection of candles, herbs, and Santeria supplies. The owner has offered to order certain items for me in the past. Very helpful and accommodating. I also like the resident cat. Very friendly...lol This place always seems to be busy. I hope it stays that way. It's the only botanica on Division Street and it adds a little Latin flavor to all the gentrification in Humboldt Park.

5.description: botanica victoria is a strong hold in the paseo boricua community.  she offered a brief lesson to my students (they are reading "bless me ultima" by rudolfo anaya) about science and herbs.  her knowledge and generosity are respected in el barrio.

0.description: Hands down my favorite botanica, and worth the long drive for me from the north side. The owner, (Mz. Victoria I presume?) is lovely. Smiley, sweet, chatty and helpful. Their supplies are many and well stocked. The best part? They still carry plaster saints. Most people have gone over to the resin variety. They're...ok. I like my old school plaster though and they're getting harder to find. She has a great selection of charms, herbs, jewelry, saints, candles, everything the practitioner could want. And she cuts keys. A random and helpful addition to her other services. I was thrilled, and I'm not even a practitioner. I go for the ambiance and nostalgia. And the art supplies.

4.description: I really like this store. The lady is really very nice. She has a large selection of herbs and statues to choose from.

58.description: Awesome breakfast and lunch is fantastic! Such a great local place and will be back many more times!

56.description: Outstanding brunch and normal menu.  Gotta try the oatmeal!

29.description: oye latinos!  oye puerto rico!the other Sunday I straight up passed on sex, for brunch at Nellies. do yourself a solid papa, take on the breakfast buffet or Nellies special. try not to cry tears of golden unicorns when you taste the avena de coco; you can cry, just do it silently. "who needs to sit hungrily for 2 hours for brunch in a bar that your roommates were puking in just hours earlier...f*ckin really tho"-cham

42.description: Yes yes yes yes yes. Gimme all that delicious Puerto Rican food. I had been to Nellie's once before for and event where they did the catered style food and was impressed, but when I went yesterday for breakfast my mind was blown. I ordered the El Coqui Sandwich and it was easily two meals - that bad boy is HUGE. And amazing. And the ingredients are super fresh. My friends got the coconut oatmeal (avena de coco), the veggie omelet, and the pancakes, and we were all stuffed and happy when we left. I have heard wonderful things about their brunch and will need to go back one of these weekend.

23.description: Best egg sandwich ever. Big, delicious and great price. Good coffee too, with refills. Enjoyed. Thanks.

47.description: Tasty, hearty breakfast.

8.description: Food was amazing but the service was terrible. We were never even acknowledged after 15minutes of just sitting there...finally we had to request a waitress. The place was not even that busy so there is no excuse for the negligent service. We were never offered water or checked up on even after receiving our meal. I really loved the food but the service was a deal breaker. Jibarito, coconut oat meal are a must!

31.description: Nellie's is a great place for breakfast.  The coconut oatmeal is stupid good.  Can't wait to come back.

34.description: This is temporarily closed.  We tried calling and phone wasn't working.  Usually the Avena de coco and Maduros are super yummy!

16.description: I came in here with four friends for a basic brunch. The service was awful. We had about 4 different "servers" erratically checking up on us, sometimes 4 within a couple minutes, sometimes no one would come by for 20 minutes.No one knew what the heck they were doing. Two of our "servers" would ask if we wanted coffee, and they brought it to us 30 minutes later. One of the servers kept sticking his arms over our table to grab plates that still had food on them. He repeatedly asked if we liked the house-made hot sauce and if we wanted to buy some. We waited 30 minutes for a check, and we finally went up to the cash register to get it. The cashier ran the wrong ticket, and then he finally ran our ticket, but grabbed it and walked away for a few minutes. He came back, and they ADDED A 20% AUTOMATIC GRATUITY.This is shameful! We only had a party of five - we weren't told there would be an auto-gratuity and 20% GRATUITY IS FAR TOO MUCH. The service was horrible.The food was bland.To top it off, I got FOOD POISONING later that evening from eating their bland, watery omelets and cold, flavorless ham jibarrito.

13.description: I love Nellie's brunch on Sunday, I haven't ate anything else here. The brunch is $16 and has unlimited Orange juice and coffee. Most people think of Old Country Buffet, Cici's pizza or some grimey chinese place when I say buffet....... this is not like that. They have a chef in the back that will make your omelet's anyway you'd like, homemade desserts, great oatmeal, bacon, sausages....etc. Well worth the price! ** The neighborhood could still be sketchy on the side streets, try to park on Division. If you are riding a bike, double check that the pole is screwed to the base!! Many thieves unscrew the base before hand, you use a U lock to secure your bike but it doesn't matter if the pole can be pulled out. lol.

11.description: Came for the brunch buffet. The Avena de coco (coconut oatmeal) was clearly the best part, especially on a very cold day. The service was ridiculously on point! We had about 5 waiters helping us. The made to order omelette guy was outstanding; he pointed out what to try in the buffet. The lasagna was savory, sweet, and terrific.

39.description: The weekend brunch is amazing with all the Puerto Rican favs and traditional American breakfast foods. It's $15.00 a person with unlimited coffee and OJ. The coffee is not good but if you want good coffee go to Cafe Colao right down the street. I think they are owned by the same people. The OJ is great! The  Avena De Coco is the best I ever had (sorry abuela). Great place to take people from out of town. Be prepared to wait if you go during peak hours but it's worth it!!

37.description: Hello Nellie's!! I wanted to try something new so my breakfast buddy and hooked up and went to this quaint little place. We read there was some big wait times but we go there about 11ish so the wait was next to nothing. Im guess because Sunday mass was still in across the street. I was also intrigued because of the strange hours of operations (Wed-Sun 9am-3pm)  We went with the buffet ($16.00 all you can eat) They had an awesome elderly gentleman there hooking up the freshly made omelets right in front of you all while telling great stories of his days as a young man in Puerto Rico. He made everything with fresh veggies and a special seasoning that he could/would not reveal the secret to. Hmmm They also had French toast, Pancakes, Chicken, Rice and the famous Coconut Oatmeal. Yes. I did have seconds of that. Another awesome bonus was all available juice was included in the buffet! This was quite a good choice and I will be back. If you're in Humbolt Park make a stop at this neat little place.

0.description: AVENA DE COCO... That is, if you happen to be in like or in love & absolutely obsessed with the warm, stick to your stomach, full of flavor (that scream "Caribbean") coconut infused absolutely AH-mazing oatmeal, then THIS my Yelp! Friends is your place to go. And mine to say the least. P.S. Go for the Avena but visit the buffet while you are here, you will not be disappointed.

38.description: Great breakfast! I gotta go back n check out their brunch buffet. Can't go wrong with the Nellie's special. Da avena de coco is da shiet!

51.description: Awesome coconut oatmeal!  Eggs made to order.   Not a huge buffet but everything was tasty!

27.description: I had to go and see for my self with all great reviews , to start walked in there is assign stating to wait to be seated not really a female at the end of the bar looking at you . I walked over she asked may I help you is not welcome to Nellie's,   I told her table for one she replied table for one got my table she offer coffee it as a while before she got the coffee but gave it to another 'waitress '  I ordered the nellies special I got my oatmeal it was good when I finished got my omelet really fluffy and hot but looks like all the ingredients were finely shredded not having flavor at all and they never come by the table    to offer more coffee or to see how is everything also overpriced 15.00 for just that I don't have a problem paying for good breakfast ,but service ,quality, and price no go usually give a second try but  not on this time

32.description: This review is based solely on the weekend brunch. Without a doubt the food is 4-5 stars. The gentleman they have makes the best omelettes to order.  However the service is horrible. The service is nonexistent. I have gone 3 times in 3 years and each time it is the same thing. Nobody comes to check on you. Nobody refills coffee or water. I went this past Sunday and I am still waiting on my glass of orange juice.  Do not get me wrong, everyone is cordial and nice. However you need to tackle someone to get any attention. The only reasons I keep going is because I want to see a Puerto Rican place do well and I hope their service gets better. Every time I have gone, it was to take non-Puerto Rican out of town guests and introduce them to something different. They loved the food but hated the service.

54.description: $14.95 for the all you can eat breakfast buffet available on Saturday and Sunday. Overall the buffet was pretty good. The coconut oatmeal was available, and my husband went back for 3rds. I had to abstain due to an allergy but it smelled amazing. The omelets they make for you are good, but they use eggbeaters unless you request fresh eggs, something I wish I had known about before starting. Nice selection of fresh fruit, and they also offered fried plantains. I got them two separate ways. The first time they were kind of old and therefore not terribly appetizing. The second time, I got them as they were being put out and they were simply divine. A word of caution. The orange juice is listed as "fresh squeezed" but we watched them pour it from a store bought jug. Be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes to get sat as they're pretty popular. We opted to sit at the bar so we got served much faster than others. We will definitely consider going back, even if it is a bit of a trek from where we live.

48.description: This is truely a diamond in the rough. The food is fresh, authentic and all around delicious! The customer service is beyond comparing. I felt like I was at home with how approachable everyone was. One thing that you must try is their homemade oatmeal! Once you get a taste of this treat, your world will never be the same. If you are near or far and want to try a real authentic Puerto Rican meal, nellies is your destination! Besides, nellies is in the heart of Chicagos greatest Puerto Rican cultured neighborhood.

44.description: Coconut oatmeal. Good god. It is amazing.I needed to a dedicate a paragraph to that.Onward, had breakfast there a few times and the food is definitely good. Great sandwiches, egg based dishes, and awesome sweet plantains. The service the last time was a bit slow so hopefully they can take this as feedback and try to work on that. I'd definitely recommend a stop by. Why not? Easy parking, no waiting, good food.

24.description: Amazing local joint in the hood. The breakfast sammies are HUGE, and they are only 6 bucks. Great spot. If you're near WIcker Park hit this place up. The workers are always really nice too.

7.description: Nellie's is a warm neighborhood restaurant with a delicious and different coconut oatmeal and interesting art on the walls. I enjoyed the generous Nellie's Breakfast Special with a fluffy omelet and garlicky toast while my friend had thick slices of French Toast and a heaping side dish of bacon. The woman who took our orders was very competent but be prepared for somewhat young and inexperienced bus boys.

49.description: HOLY MOTHER OF BREAKFAST SANDWICHES!  Get the El Coqui with a cup of coconut oatmeal.  Thank me later.  I think I may defect to Puerto Rico - oh wait - they are practically American so that probably won't work.  The vehicle for the eggy goodness was the most delicious Cuban type bread which was lightly garlic buttered and toasted.  I'm starting to drool just writing this.  We originally planned to go to Bongo Room but it was a crazy 40 minute wait.  So we Yelped 'nearbys' and Nellie's came up.  You Yelpers are sooooo AWESOME!Great parking, cute place, good coffee which our server kept flowing almost non-stop.  The buffet looked amazing and is dedicated to an entire room with a made to order omelet station.  One of my favorite breakfasts in Chicago.

40.description: I had to go try Nellie's after reading the yelp reviews.  This was a day I wanted to eat semi-healthy, but I ended up having the buffet.  The only healthy thing was the fruit.  If you like to eat and can eat a lot, then the buffet option is for you!  They have omelettes, waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage, french toast, pancakes, Puerto Rican lasagna (yummy - would order this by itself), coconut oatmeal and many other food items.  I would say everything was good, but what stands out is the lasagna and the oatmeal (more authentic).   My husband had the Nellie's breakfast special and said he would definitely go back for it.  I had a bite and would definitely go back for it (I liked the plantains on top).  The oatmeal was good, but nothing I would go back for.Customer Service:  The girl we had should stay at the cash register.  She couldn't put down her phone long enough to take our order (kept on texting).  I'm amazed by people's customer service skills.  I hope our tip went to the other hard workers there  (the busser was acting more like our server).  I'm taking 1/2 a star off for this. It's definitely a place to visit to see if it's the right fit for you.  They have good food and the price is right.

53.description: This is truly a hidden gem ! I have gone here quite a few times and it just gets better each time. Best deal is the buffet brunch. Food is great and service was outstanding. Shout out to the servers Ashley and Eddie always know what I'm going to order.

30.description: The way they do the seating for the Sunday brunch isn't fair or consistent. You can have a party of 2 waiting for 45 minutes and then a party of 6 walks up and they seat them right away. Finally it was our turn, or so we thought. Then they seated 2 adults and a child that came in after us. Their answer was that they need to sit at least 3 people to a 4 person table.  And no apologies were offered.

46.description: Nellie's is a quiet place where to have a brunch in the Portorican neighborhood.Nothing fancy, but the French toast combo (eggs and bacon) was as good as expected. Friendly service and a good experience overall.

1.description: Nellie's has been on my bookmark for over a year now.  Humboldt Park is going through some sort of transformation and diversity is gradually implanted in this area of town.  Rosa J. has explored and visited many places and neighborhoods in Chi-town, yet she hasn't had lots of footprints in Humboldt Park.  Perhaps she needs get on that CTA #70 bus more frequently.  Hubby and I came for their AYCE breakfast/brunch.  For $15.99 per person (as of 12/13/2015), you can sample an assortment of Puerto Rican yumminess.  Yes, my understanding of anything Puerto Rican is "Zero," with a capital "Z."  However, I am still "livin' la Vida Loca" with all the good food I can find in town.  There were several highlights in my AYCE brunch date with Ms. Nellie: - pastelon: it is "sweet plantain lasagna" in English.  I couldn't tell what it was with the first glance, but it didn't bother me since I take chances on everything I do in my life.  It was more savory than sweet, so it's appropriate for being a breakfast/brunch item since my tolerance for sugar is higher before 1200 hour.  - potatoes: they had a unique seasoning, which I couldn't precisely pin-point what it was.  I was quite diggin' those sautéed potatoes though!  - coconut cinnamon oatmeal: oatmeal and I are usually strangers and we don't converse.  Nevertheless, coconut and cinnamon were the catalysts that helped me take a second look at that gooey oatmeal.  Ummm...maybe he's just as attractive as an Italian supermodel.  He just doesn't dress fashionably like other dishes on the buffet table.  -made-to-order omelet: a friendly older gentleman was in charge of this station.  He could oversee four (4) omelets at a time.  I'm a sucker for omelets.  I had mine customized with feta, spinach, onion, mushroom, and green peppers.  The "youngest" young man was attentive.  He was so cute when he filled our orange juice ALL the way to the top of glass.  We didn't ask for more coffee because I was afraid that our coffee would be too full to have room for the creamer (jk).  I will definitely come back again.  Be sure to dress in layers so you can remove the sweater or cardigan since the venue is toasty warm, especially when you step into the buffet bar in the back room.

55.description: Went there for breakfast with a really good friend of mine. I had the Coqui Scramble, which consisted of eggs, avocado, veggies and bacon, with a side of home potatoes. My buddy had the coconut oatmeal. Not only did I max my plate, I tried some of her oatmeal, also, and it was fantastic! Everything was super delicious. The service was not particularly solicitous, however they did a good job ensuring my coffee was refilled (which is a MUST for me lol). I can't wait to go back and take my hubby with.

9.description: I went here twice for breakfast and lunch in one day. That's how much I love Nellie's. I called in my lunch order and they were efficient and courteous on the phone. A big plus for me.  I had that yummy coconut-cinnamon oatmeal for breakfast.  For the larger size, it is way too small and overpriced.  I could have easily eaten 2 but I'm not spending $9 for oatmeal.  For lunch I had the knock my socks off chicken jibarito and maduros.  They give you SO much rice/beans to go with it.  What a filling, worth every penny meal. I have had the mofongo on another occasion and it was just OK.  Unimpressive.

26.description: Today was my first visit. 12:00 noon on Thursday. Although the restaurant was not "packed", I noticed there were quite a few large carry out orders. It did take them a reasonable amount of time to bring the food. Not fast but not slow and expected for a restaurant that serves delicious food at lunch time. The ambiance reminded me of the Dominican Republic. Loved it. Simple. The food was Delicious! Served quickly after preparing. I had their special Tortilla Boricua which is an open faced omlet. I asked to substitute toast and was offered a delicious bowl of fruit. The service was great. If you need something, ask for it with a smile. This is a lesson in life that well take you a long way. Relax! Also, consider avoiding the weekend lunch buffet if you do not like crowded, busy, delicious restaurants!THE OATMEAL....... ! I'm definitely coming back for the Mofongo!

25.description: Of course it was a must try knowing that this place is famous for their Coconut Oatmeal.  Puerto Rico is in the house......my goodness this food will put you in food coma. I decided to come here for breakfast and boy am I happy that I did. The atmosphere is surrounded with beautiful artistry. My lovely breakfast choice was the Nellie's Breakfast Special. The breakfast special is enormous and delicious. This lovely meal includes an omelette with cheese, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, onions, sausage and sweet plantains. The meal comes with a side of garlic bread and cup of the most delicious coconut oatmeal you will ever have in your life. Nostalgia was present as I tasted each bite of this savory oatmeal it reminded me of the oatmeal my grand mother used to make growing up. I could not even finish my whole meal it was so filling.You honestly can not go wrong by ordering this special or just coming to this place period. The staff was super friendly and the food came out extremely fast. Overall, I had a tremendous experience!

12.description: Great food and even on the weekends it is rare to encounter a wait time of more than 15 minutes (usually there is no wait at all). Has a pretty good buffet for inpatient consumers; however, the service is rarely as good as the food and identifying your actual server/paying for the bill can be frustrating at times.

59.description: I'm not a huge fan of Puerto Rican good, so take this review with a grain of salt. I went here for brunch with a few friends. The food was good, but not great. Same with the service. I'd recommend this place if you like Puerto Rican food.

21.description: I am someone who can be very frugal with my money so $16 for one meal has to be worth it. Well, the brunch buffet is definitely worth it! It's probably the best brunch buffet I've ever had. Whenever I have someone visiting from out of town, I always suggest this place. The brunch includes:An omelette stationPastelon de huevo Avena de coco (coconut oatmeal)French toast PancakesBaconSausageSeasoned breakfast potatoesToastSeasonal fresh fruitCoffee and orange juiceMake sure you try the avena de coco

17.description: Came in on a Sunday morning and was tremendously pleased with everything! Our waiter was funny, quick and gave my friend and I avena de coco on the house. Wouldn't have spent my morning any other way.

10.description: I am someone who can be very frugal with my money so $16 for one meal has to be worth it. Well, the brunch buffet is definitely worth it! It's probably the best brunch buffet I've ever had. Whenever I have someone visiting from out of town, I always suggest this place. The brunch includes:An omelette stationPastelon de huevo Avena de coco (coconut oatmeal)French toast PancakesBaconSausageSeasoned breakfast potatoesToastSeasonal fresh fruitCoffee and orange juiceMake sure you try the avena de coco

5.description: Of course it was a must try knowing that this place is famous for their Coconut Oatmeal.  Puerto Rico is in the house......my goodness this food will put you in food coma. I decided to come here for breakfast and boy am I happy that I did. The atmosphere is surrounded with beautiful artistry. My lovely breakfast choice was the Nellie's Breakfast Special. The breakfast special is enormous and delicious. This lovely meal includes an omelette with cheese, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, onions, sausage and sweet plantains. The meal comes with a side of garlic bread and cup of the most delicious coconut oatmeal you will ever have in your life. Nostalgia was present as I tasted each bite of this savory oatmeal it reminded me of the oatmeal my grand mother used to make growing up. I could not even finish my whole meal it was so filling.You honestly can not go wrong by ordering this special or just coming to this place period. The staff was super friendly and the food came out extremely fast. Overall, I had a tremendous experience!

3.description: Great authentic Puerto Rican food and American breakfast options taken up a notch. You HAVE to try their buffet and they're BYOB! Best place in Humboldt park West Town for breakfast and brunch. Not to mention the best Puerto Rican food on paseo Boricua weekdays for lunch.

35.description: Looove the plantains in the omelette!I've been here twice and both times I've gotten the Nellie's special. You can't go wrong with it. A cup of the coconut oatmeal, and an omelette with plantains in it (ingenious!) and you get a piece of bread with it too.  If I remember correctly, they kept my coffee cup full. This can make or break a breakfast meal so bravo for that.  It seems to be family run and they are pretty friendly but both times I've been here it has taken forever to get someone to come over to take our order. That's why I took a star off. Parking is easily found on Division. Will definitely be back.

19.description: The food and service is good, we got there on a Sunday and they had just opened. There was no where for us to sit. They where waiting for people to come in that had a reservation. So we were forced to leave or sit at the bar. The buffet is $16.00 to much for an ok breakfast.

28.description: Fresh, hot and ready! Love the brunch buffet! And the fresh omelet with sofrito....Mmmm...like no other! Super clean and beautiful art work! Definitely will be back!

45.description: Super rico de Puerto Rico!  Breakfast here is fantastic.  I had the El Coqui sandwich which was eggs, tomatoes, cheese, onions and mayo on garlicky french bread.  The eggs were nice and fluffy, and all fresh.  A side of fried bananas (maduros) was also delicious: naturally sweet and lightly browned.  You must try them! My cousin had a roast pork jibarito, which is a sandwich made with crispy plantains instead of bread.  She also adored hers.  The service was friendly, and the restaurant was clean with nice Puerto Rican art all around.  The waiter accidentally spilled our milk, and got some on my cousin.  He apologized many times, and then brought us complimentary coconut oatmeal.  This was super tasty, if a bit liquidy for my taste.  But, a very nice gesture.Lastly, if all of the above doesn't convince you, just go to check out the bathroom.  It was reminiscent of some chambers in an old Spanish castle, and you could wash your hands while sitting on the toilet if you so chose.  This was entertaining to me.

33.description: What can I say.. this place is great... Ask for the Coqui scrammble . You won't be disappointed.

43.description: Great, authentic, Puerto Rican cuisine. Puerto Rican art you want to take home. Famous for Avena De Coco and for good reason. The best oatmeal in the city.Caveats: -Do not dare touch food from a person's buffet plate. I nearly was kicked out for trying a sausage from my boyfriends plate.-bill can only be split twice.

2.description: I ate breakfast here this morning. My friends' brother-in-law (A Chi-town native) suggested we try it out based on word-of-mouth suggestion from his co-workers.Our party of four all had the breakfast buffet. We were all blown away by the customer service. Most of the servers/people attending to the tables were very young adults and at least two of them had to be less than 18 year old teenagers. They were absolutely fantastic! They were very courteous, pleasant and were always buzzing by to re-fill the drinks and to remove plates. My friend was so impressed he left a $20 tip...The food was fantastic as well. A lot of others reviewing Nellie's already summed up the buffet so I won't dive too much into it but I was for seconds on the Pastelon de huevo. The Coco Oatmeal was very unique and tasty, especially when I added the fried plantains to it. The one thing we all raved about was the omelette. The man making them must have seasoned them with something special because we could taste something a little extra in there--but it was a good thing ;) I had mine with feta and all veggies and would of went again had I not doubled up on the other items!I don't live in Chicago but if I ever come back I will be returning here.

18.description: Delicious, clean, easy street pay box parking. Courteous service. Went in for breakfast and the coconut avena (oatmeal) is so delicious it's a must! The coqui breakfast sandwich, amazing and oh so filling also a must! My kids had pancakes and the other had the standard eggs, bacon, potatoes. They loved it. Standard breakfast prices. Wepa! Check it out....

41.description: I'll take Nellie's over any of the nearby overpriced, overrated brunch places. The authentic Puerto Rican breakfast is something you won't find anywhere else in the city. Having a Groupon all the time (with the ability to take out!) doesn't hurt either! Some of my favorite features include the special Puerto Rican omlette with plantains cooked inside, the plaintains themselves, the El Coqui breakfast sandwich (massive), and of course, the coconut oatmeal! It's a bit out of the way for some, but close enough to Wicker Park & Ukrainian Village for those who don't know about it. This place is definitely worth going West of Western for.

52.description: I was so tempted to stay in the area so I could order off the lunch menu later in the day. That's how much I loved the breakfast at Nellie's. A group of us came in for breakfast on a Sunday. They were almost empty when we arrived at 930 (yeah we like to start the day early on Sundays sometimes) but by the time we left, the restaurant was full with a line of folks waiting to be seated. My husband and I went with the Breakfast Buffet--it was the best way to sample some things on the menu and plus, kids under 3 eat for free!  The two others in our group went with the breakfast special and omelet and both looked really good. There is quite a lot to choose from in their buffet--Pastelone de Huevos (which is like an egg strata, with a layer of ground beef and plantains) breakfast potatoes, bacon, sausage links, pancakes, french toast, an omelet station, Maduros (sweet plantains), fresh fruit and the Avena de Coco (the famous coconut oatmeal dusted with cinnamon). There's also fried chicken and arroz con gandules. My husband and I split an omelet we had made at the omelet station. We ordered what was basically the omelet in the breakfast special. An open faced omelet seasoned with sofrito, cheese, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, salchion sausage and maduros. It was fantastic. Very flavorful and well-made. The oatmeal was not like any other oatmeal I've had, it was very creamy and filling. The coconut milk adds so much richness and flavor. Perfect comfort food. My other favorites of the buffet include the little pieces of fried chicken. So crispy on the outside but very tender on the inside. And the plantains--a bit sticky from the carmelization, not overly sweet either. And they use fresh ripe plantains so no hint of bland/bitterness. Service was so friendly and anticipated our needs. Our server was funny and kept us entertained by his jokes and friendly banter.  Our coffee cups never went empty and water glasses were always filled.

50.description: I would love to give this place four stars! Come on its Puerto Rican breakfast! Sadly it only gets one star based on service. I have been to Nellies a good amount of times but have decided based on my last visit to never return. The service is terrible and there is a certain guy who works there who has made me very uncomfortable every time I've been there. I am actually saddened to walk in and see he is still employed by you guys. He is above all very rude and makes comments that have made various people who have accompanied me on separate occasions feel very uncomfortable. I love the food here and the oatmeal is to die for but it's just not worth the hassle!

4.description: Great buffet option for breakfast! Not the flashiest place in town, but a super nice and attentive staff. I would definitely g

6.description: The food at this place is phenomenal. The coconut oatmeal is just as delicious as everyone says it is - portions are big and prices are very cheap. You have to be prepared to deal with a loud, chaotic environment in there, and the service is slow and lacking in charm - probably not somewhere to bring your grandma visiting from out of town. If you're good with dealing with all of that though, you're in for a great meal. Get there early or make a reservation. We got there at about noon on a Sunday and fortunately had a reservation, because the wait time was an hour and a half.

22.description: I came here since it's a well known restaurant in the neighborhood.  My friends and I ordered endless cup of coffee throughout the whole visit we only got served 2. I had ordered a side of sausage and got bacon instead.  Food was good but bad service. Young kids on their phones while taking orders.

15.description: Avena de coco is delicious! Ordered the Nellies Special which was great, the sweet plantain was different, but good! I also took a few bites of The El Coqui sandwich which was also great...no complaints on my end.  Will definitely be coming back to try out the brunch buffet they have on the weekends!

57.description: The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because of the disorganized table service. Maybe if we had had the buffet we would have fared (pun) better. But seriously, the coconut oatmeal is SO good. I had a chorizo and egg breakfast which was outstanding as well. The side order of "one egg" for our daughter had to have been like 4 scrambled eggs and the hot chocolate they brought her was creamy and delicious. We loved the coffee, but didn't like that we had to wait for refills. Everything we needed we literally had to flag down someone to help us:  napkins (there's a 5 year old at the table--a waiter should just set those down first thing!), a place setting for all three of us (until our food was served there were only 2), actual milk or cream instead of those homogenized plastic packet thingys would have been preferred. But the food on the plate itself? I will certainly be back someday for that. So wonderful and worth the spotty table service.

20.description: Delicious, clean, easy street pay box parking. Courteous service. Went in for breakfast and the coconut avena (oatmeal) is so delicious it's a must! The coqui breakfast sandwich, amazing and oh so filling also a must! My kids had pancakes and the other had the standard eggs, bacon, potatoes. They loved it. Standard breakfast prices. Wepa! Check it out....

36.description: I wanna give this place a better review because their food is great and the gentleman that makes their omelettes is cool and funny, but their table service SUCKS. Their waiters are consistently neglect my table. The male waiters only come by when I'm with a woman, otherwise they don't come by at all. I have never had a refill on water, coffee, juice, etc without having to ask several times. Idk why, and I genuinely love this place, but like many locally owned establishments in Humboldt Park, if you don't know someone who is friends with the staff, prepare to be neglected and have the slowest service possible.

14.description: Today was my first visit. 12:00 noon on Thursday. Although the restaurant was not "packed", I noticed there were quite a few large carry out orders. It did take them a reasonable amount of time to bring the food. Not fast but not slow and expected for a restaurant that serves delicious food at lunch time. The ambiance reminded me of the Dominican Republic. Loved it. Simple. The food was Delicious! Served quickly after preparing. I had their special Tortilla Boricua which is an open faced omlet. I asked to substitute toast and was offered a delicious bowl of fruit. The service was great. If you need something, ask for it with a smile. This is a lesson in life that well take you a long way. Relax! Also, consider avoiding the weekend lunch buffet if you do not like crowded, busy, delicious restaurants!THE OATMEAL....... ! I'm definitely coming back for the Mofongo!

3.description: I just happened to stumble upon this location.  Nice big store, and very clean.  Unlike other thrift stores I've been in, clothes and other items were neatly displayed.  However, I was surprised at the high prices on some items.  But just like most thrift stores, if customers take their time and look around carefully, many great deals can be found.

1.description: If you're one of the hopeful bargain-hunters for their tan-tag Saturday $0.69 sale, you need to come in when the door opens at 0900 hour, bright and early.  I'm not that serious, so I thought I would see what a Saturday was like in a Salvation Army Family Store.  I came a bit too late; by 1700 hour there were little tan-tag items left.  I saw some possible candidates awaiting for me to purchase them; however, their conditions weren't pristine enough for my liking.  Other than that amazing $0.69 tan-tag sale at all the north-side Chicago SA stores, the white-tag items were 25% off, depending on what week of the month is.  There's a rotating schedule delineating what color-tag will be on sale at whatever percentage of discount.  If you can't keep up with all the discounts and tag-colors, Salvation Army thrift stores are pretty technology-savvy.  The big TV monitors will occasionally flesh the sales information, as long as your eyes can catch it.  This particular location isn't at the best neighborhood, but there's a huge parking lot and very easily accessible.  I was still on my feet patronizing my beloved CTA.  The CTA 53 (Pulaski) and 65 (Grand) buses can take you there, safe and sound.

2.description: I called this morning at 7:15 am.Charles answers the phone. I asked what time they opened today (Saturday after grand opening).  He told me 8:00.   I cleaned up and jumped into the car.  I did not want to miss all the good stuff!Needless to say it is now 8:20am and the doors are locked.  Being the thrift fool that I am I waited till 9 o'clock. There was a good amount of people waiting to get in. Good amount of furniture.   The prices on the furniture is kind of high.  WARNING...No discounts until March 17 because the store just opened.Racks and racks of clothing.  Why do places always place plus size clothing next to maternityy????? Place is bright, clean and large.  It would be nice to be able to get 2 carts down an aisle.  It killed me to pass up Lenox Poppies On Blue coffee cups.  99 cents each.  I really do not need them though.Nice DVD selection.One problem I did have was that my partner in thrift was not around to keep me away from the books.  Oops!I would stop by again once the discount sets in.  Interested to see if furniture prices go down.

5.description: It's new.  It used to be the Hobo store, which I miss.  It's cleaner than many.  Large.  Lots of furniture. Lots of housewares.  Record albums.  Books.  Rugs.  Lots of clothes, but that's not why I go.  Nice big parking lot.Pretty decent all around.Why only 3 stars?  Salvation Arny as a whole has got a pricing problem.  As in, much too pricey.  I heard an ad over the radio, "thanks for shopping the high end thrift store" or something along those lines.  Yeah, I don't think so.  I'm really getting bored and weary with their over-pricing.
