0.description: The pricing structure of the SA stores overall teeters dangerously on the brink of full-on retail. This particular location of SA is totally not near any of my other errands. It has surly customer service and idle cash registers and I grow a long white beard while I wait to pay for my stuff. Yeah yeah, I know the "new" SA has wider aisles, a cleaner shopping experience, ample parking. Whatevs. So does Target, and their prices ain't that much higher than the SA's now.So why the hey do I bother going to the West Humboldt store, and why am I giving it four stars?Because Wednesday mornings from 9:00 to noon is EIGHTY SEVEN CENTS A POUND SALE TIME!A corner of their parking lot is sectioned off for this blessed weekly event and they roll out troughs and troughs of the items that are unfit to sell as "upscale thrift".  Grab a cart if you dare and start digging. (It's pretty crowded though so I suggest using a basket or bringing your own canvas bag.) Inventories vary from week to week. There could be bales of 5K t-shirts, or enough winter scarves to choke a Yeti, or Hammer Times where I can buy a whole box of pink parachute pants if I want. (I don't.) But you know what? I have gotten a TON of crazy crap, as well as some tres chic items NEW WITH TAGS, plus also designer clothes in decent condition for my daughter. The best part is, if I get something home and it sucks, I can just donate it when I come back the next Wednesday. Who cares because IT ONLY COST 87 CENTS. Eighty seven cents! Jeebus. I know, right?

4.description: We were in this nice new place we had over 200 bucks worth of stuff that we were going to purchase in our cart. One of the employees decided that we didn't need it and while we were shopping they put all of our stuff back and took our cart. When confronted the manager asked his employees if they had which they all denied but somehow some of our items were back where we had found them.... hmm so not only did they put our purchases back up but then had the gal to lie right to our faces about it when jesus they put the stuff back! Forget this place and their idiot employees

3.description: Nice Clean friendly..you get in in out quickly and at the right price. ..full service shave and cut for around $25

1.description: made an appointment over the phone when I came in the guy I talked to acted like he has no clue. Sent me to a guy that wasn't busy he did the worst job ever. left a small patch of hair on top and a bald fade everywhere else lol. I look like a clown. never coming back

2.description: For the last 2 years traveling to the Windy City, It was always a challenge looking for a real barbershop, don't know why I never used yelp to find a barbershop. I was glad I found Jayuya's after reading great reviews. The minute I walked in Barber (Tito) took care of me and hooked me up. Great atmosphere feels like you are in the island listening to great Salsa, Merengue and Reggaeton.

9.description: This review is solely for Jose - I was looking for a barber to give my then 1 year old son a haircut. A friend recommended Jose, whom he had been going to for years. I had to book an appointment with him a couple of weeks in advance. When I got there i was the only female and the only Mexican in the place, which i thought was funny, but it is right in the heart of Humboldt Park. Jose was right on schedule and took my son in right away. He did a good job on the cut and when it was time to use a machine on him he pulled out a lollipop right away. He made my little guy comfortable, happy, and the best part is the haircut was amazing. Two years later, he is still my son's barber. My only complaint is that I have to book the appointment weeks in advance, he is good and has regulars with WEEKLY appointments.

10.description: I just returned from a hair cut there and would never go back!My experience: (weekday)After asking one of the barber's how long the wait was specifically for him, he replied, "I only do appointments." I understand this because after waiting for 56 minutes, I noticed he was the best barber there so I wanted him as my barber. During this conversation another barber scolded me like a child and said, "Just sit down and someone will help you." In my head, I thought, "This hair cut better be worth it because I drove all the way to Humboldt Park for this."Four people who came in after me (at least 30 minutes) received a hair cut before me.When the barber who scolded me across the room finished with his client, he walked him over to the cash register where I was waiting and in front of me made douche bag comments.The barber said something to the effect about new people coming in and thinking they deserve service.I looked him straight in the face as he said this but he looked away continuing his conversation.25 minutes later, Angel the barber took pity on me and called me over to his chair.Overall the haircut was a 7 out of 10. When my haircut was over I tipped him $20 because I wanted to make a statement to the other barbers there: They missed out on a great opportunity to keep a new client, and a generous tip.But in the end, I guess they do not care about customer service because the locals go there and anyone who is not a regular is going to be treated substandard. If your time is valuable, go somewhere else!

4.description: We drive two hours every two weeks for my boyfriends haircut. He's mixed (Jamaican and Irish) so it's hard to find a place that can cut his hair the way that he wants it. The guys here take their time to do it right. You should really make an appointment because they are busy and their customers are loyal. They will cut the hair of those who make appointments before walk ins( as they should). This is definitely the place to go for a detailed cut and shave. They'll even clean up your brows.

6.description: Great barbershop in the Humboldt Park area. My husband's go-to barber is Kerly for at least the last 6 years. Most of the time leaves his hair right on point even after a few switches in style over the years. Didn't meet Kerly 'till recently when my husband insisted on taking our 1 year old here for his haircut. So by appointment on a Saturday, Kerly was so sweet and patient with our son and left him looking very clean cut and handsome. I left telling my husband that he has to share his barber with our little man from now on.

11.description: It's the usual story for me... I need a haircut, I'm busy with something else, and I end up not getting one for weeks on end.  In the profession I'm in, I need to clean up, so after those few weeks go by, it becomes unacceptable.Decided to look around and see what places to try, and figured Jayuya with it's big ole five star rating would be worth a shot.Get into the store at 10:00 AM, and every one of the barbers look busy so I sit down in a chair and wait... and wait... and wait... and wait...After an hour, I've decided that since I've waited here this long, I'm just going to wait it out and see what happens.  At this point, I've seen a few things:1.  These guys can do PHENOMENAL art work on your head.  I mean carving out Bob Marley as a design so that it's amazing and clean!  Crazy razor work.2.  They often take breaks and just hang out and chat with the customers and themselves.  Getting a new customer is NOT their priority.3.  They will bump up people they know past you.  I don't know how many people walked in after me and ended up getting a seat before me...About 10 minutes after the hour, one of the guys asks me what kind of cut I want, and I let him know I just need the top cleaned down and the sides buzzed down to a 1 blade.   Another hour later, I finally get a chair.  He tells me he's sorry for the wait, but typically on weekends they work by appointment only.  That helps explain it a bit, since I was starting to feel like as an Asian guy in a Puerto Rican barbershop, no one wanted to give me a cut.  And then he proceeded to cut.And he cut beautifully.Worth the wait?  Absolutely not.  I will not be coming back here on a weekend without an appointment.Worth getting your haircut?  Absolutely.  I get the feeling it'll be awhile before I become an "ol boy" that knows people there, but I'll be back a few more times to get the nice clean up they did for my hair.  $14, and then some tip?  Excellent cut and excellent price.Verdict:  Come here and check it out.  DO NOT come on weekends with no appointment because you will lose your freakin mind.

5.description: No other barber like Kerly @ Jayuya. Razor fade .. I have been coming here for 3years. He's on my speed dial. If I need a quick cut,trim, a refresh --- he's been there. Excellent Humboldt Park service! Go beyond Western Avenue, mi gente- Division Avenue is safe!

7.description: This is the place to go for a great haircut, good atmosphere, and clean location.  Don't come in without an appointment as you will have to wait a long time.  Book an appointment with Jose Luis or Ray as these guys are the best and they will have you come back again and again...

8.description: So me and Puerto Rican husband visited this barber shop today. Let me just say Kurly did an amazing job. My husband likes the 40's gentleman cut and that is exactly what he got. We come all the way from Indiana and it is well worth it!

0.description: I travel a lot for work switching cities every couple of months. It's always a daunting task to find a barber with whom I entrust my head to. Needless to say I always have to put my feelers out and find just the right barber, typically Puerto Rican and Dominican Barbers I've found to be best. Jayuya is a primarilly Puerto Rican barbership located on Paseo Boricua in Humbold Park. There are a bunch of similar barbersshops on this strip but I was referred to Jayuya from a client so I thought I'd give it a shot. I was told to see Kerly and was very happy with this referral. Kerly is a great guy and takes a lot of pride in his craft. He can do regular cuts, tapes, fades, faux hawks or even do intricate designs on your scalp. I choose my basic low tape and he has hooked it up every time.Definitely a welcoming place and quality cuts would reccomend it to anyone.One word of advice is to call in and make an appointment as it will take a while to get seated as a walk in .

3.description: I have...or should I say HAD....frizzy hair that required an hour a day to get semi straight.  Vanessa recommended the Kerotine (not sure of spelling) straighter.  All I can say is AMAZING and no formaldehyde!  My hair still has body but with the slightest bit of heat...the frizz goes away.  I did it right before I went to Miami.  Normally a trip to Miami would require me keeping my frizz top in a bun....I wore it down the WHOLE time.  Vanessa also recommended the Morrocan Oil which has done wonders for me as well.  THANK VANESSA!  You Rock!

1.description: Okay, since wedding season is approaching, I have to stop procrastinating and share with all future brides my wonderful experience with Vixen Beauty.  Vanessa and her assistant did a fabulous job with my hair and make-up!  I was very nervous going with a new stylist for my wedding in Indiana (my regular stylist was not able to travel from Illinois to Indiana on a Saturday).  I had a very specific look that I was going for and Vanessa totally delivered :-)  Without a doubt, if you are searching for a stylist and make-up artist to travel to your wedding location, Vixen Beauty is an AWESOME choice!  Now, I will try to post some pics :-)

2.description: I hired Vanessa to do hair and makeup for me, my sister, and my mom for my June wedding and she did a PHENOMENAL job fulfilling our requests. None of us regularly wear makeup and were concerned about a stylist using a heavy hand on the makeup and hairspray, and we told Vanessa that. Well, she listened and it looked PERFECT. I got so many compliments throughout the night, and it was such a relief knowing that I could sit back and relax and be taken care of.  She was punctual every time we met (always on the early side) and I can't recommend Vanessa enough.

5.description: What great service!  I received a call from Vanessa, my stylist, checking up on how I felt about my hair style, color and cut.  This is such a nice touch and very unexpected.  I am definitely a satisfied customer and will be back.

6.description: Excellent comfortable space to have beautiful hair created!

7.description: Vanessa at Vixen Beauty Lounge is fantastic.  She's epitome of a  seasoned professional, she gives you high end hair services with a smile and great stories to keep you entertained!  The salon has a great retro/classy feel ...a great find in the neighborhood

8.description: Vixen is great.  The girls are so up to date with what is going on in makeup and hair.  Amazing work and really down to earth.  Really nice space, very relaxing, and great location.  The eyelash extentions are amazing!

0.description: Can we be hetero-normative for a minute here?  Okay.I know most men wouldn't automagically feel gravitated to go to a salon called Vixen Beauty Lounge, but I'm here to tell you to put your hegemonic preconceptions about the name of a business away and go have Sara cut your hair.  What's so great about Sara, you might ask?  I, perhaps like you, have curly hair.  Now you know what I'm talking about.  Curly hair, for some reason, has resulted in a complete haircut failure at 95% of the salons that I've ever gone to in my entire life.  Seriously.  It got so bad that for a number of years I would go 3-4 months in-between cuts because I was so scared of the result I would get.  I started getting Napoleon Dynamite references on a regular basis.  One time I was walking home from a haircut and two friends got off a bus 3 blocks early just to laugh at my haircut.  True story.  It was that bad.  NO MORE.  Sara regards cutting curly hair as an art form, and she's a fantastic artist.  I'm sure she cuts straight hair just as well, but I'm telling you, if you have curly hair you need this woman to cut it for you.  As a bonus, it's on the paseo boricua and there's an awesome coffee place next door.

4.description: I love Vanessa!  She is so great at everything she does!  I have been going to Vixen for the past year and just love the way I look when I leave.  Vanessa is so personable and loves to talk about fun ways to do your hair, makeup, etc.  Every time I get my hair done she does something different with it at the end to show me how I can do it differently than my normal way.  I can't wait to use her for nails and waxing because they are just adding those services on.  Vanessa cares so much about her business and loves what she does which is so refreshing!  Her prices are unbeatable and she is quick too, its not like I have to sit there all day to get my hair looking good! Parking is street parking around the area so make sure you give yourself an extra 5 minutes to find a spot.  Extra bonus:  You are offered a glass of wine while you get your hair done!  NICE!

1.description: The owner was very nice and accommodated me as a walk in. It was just a quick undercut trim, but he was precise and professional, and he made me feel comfortable as a woman walking into a men's barber shop. I'll definitely be back.

2.description: family owned and run great place for a fresh fade when theirs a game it will be on that's for sure

0.description: My boyfriend and I passed City Cuttz on our way to Dark Matter Coffee next door and both commented on how he needed a haircut. We stopped back after hitting up an ATM (the barbershop is cash only, fyi!), and after a short wait (some regular customers were there, it seemed), my boyfriend got a great buzz cut and shave. The owner and other barbers were friendly and paid great attention to detail on all their cuts. The shop is clean and welcoming, and as I live less than a block away, my boyfriend will definitely be back.

58.description: Had dinner here with a buddy on opening day.  We each had the burger, and it was outstanding.  I would loosely compare it to Au Cheval, with two patties and lots of melted cheese and some delicious aioli.  The fries were also good, although not the best I have had.  I also was able to sample a couple of the appetizers - the smoked trout and the stuffed pepper, both of which were really good.  I live near this place, so I a will likely be back on a regular basis as long as this place keeps up the great work.

56.description: The burger was incredible and as another reviewer mentioned, Au Cheval is a good comparison. Drinks were on point - I had a Manhattan and my wife had the Execution (mezcal drink). The small bites were also legit. We had the deviled egg salad stuffed pepper, the pork belly confit, the ricotta and bacon on toast, and the smoked trout on toast. All phenomenal. Also had the paresian gnocchi, which was delicious, but could have used a few more pieces of gnocchi on the plate - the pea, mushroom, carrot mixture made up for it.

29.description: The food is great here. Top picks is the burger, pork sandwich and the chicken. Prices are high for the neighborhood but can't complain with a 1am kitchen. The bar staff is inconsistent with cocktails and cliquy as it appears to be brought over a more Blind Ribbon crowd. So you gotta be in with the "in crowd". After 4-5 visits, the Best night to get a properly made cocktail is on Friday night it seems and best servers are short blonde girl and a guy with dreads as they tag team the tables. The rest just stare and often question if it's their table or the other. Some nights the bar is playing super loud annoying obscure punk music and some nights they Are playing the 80s. The 80s are more welcoming as the staff seems to be more into it also. Patio is great also. Hopefully things will develop more into the coming months after opening.

42.description: If you like to pay for overpriced food, this is the place to go. The so called "traditional spanish tapas" are not only pricey but they have no taste. The food was disgusting, especially if you're used to some good cooking. Their prices are unreasonable for the amount of food you get, which is almost nothing. Some of the drinks were also unreasonable and nothing special. I went in with a couple family members to try out this new local bar and when the waitress went to sit us down the door guy came powerwalking and cut in front of us before we got to sit and offered the table to two other guys. He did not apologize for cutting in front of me, which really displeased us. We will not go to this place again. It was a big disappointment and a waste of money.

23.description: I'd probably toss it 3.5 stars if Yelp let me but it being a new spot, I like to let a place get in the grove before being too judgey. I've now been here 4 times so I feel like Ive got a good gauge on the place. Service has been pretty good, friendly, and attentive so thats really solid. The food however has been lackluster for myself and my party. One time the server or kitchen staff totally forgot an entrée and the whole table was done eating by the time it came out... that should have been comp'd but the excuse was it 'just took longer' - it was a pulled pork sammy, so the excuse was BS.. just say you forgot to write it down and see what you can do to hook it up on the bill, pretty standard stuff. The burger rules but its about the only thing on the menu I can see getting again. So when sitting up the street at home wondering where to eat, its like if we want Haywood, then we know were going to get burgers.. and I dont always want a burger. The chicken looks so good on a plate and in pics, but it wasnt good.. I found it weird and rubbery, like it was reheated or something. Sucks because its literally one of my fav foods and for $18 its got to be good. I like a place that does like 5 things awesome.. dont offer a huge menu that you cant keep up with.. make it great, efficient and reasonably priced.. Haywood has a small menu but so far I am not impressed with the quality or price over all. Last time we sat outside the A/C unit was so freaking loud that instead of getting more wine, we split... I hope they fixed this!!They have some reasonably priced wines so thats a big plus.

47.description: Great place. Drinks are really solid and so is the beer list.  Food menu is small but it will evolve I'm sure.  Really good place to grab some low key drinks any day of the week.  Nice relaxing atmosphere, very friendly and knowledgeable service.  I will be back

8.description: I have been wanting to try Haywood Tavern and it exceeded my expectations. A girlfriend and I grabbed a drink and quick bite late this afternoon. The atmosphere is cozy and more rustic. We tried a few small plates that we both loved. The smoked whitefish was a big hit and the raclette (just a pot of cheesy goodness with crudites) was superb.

31.description: Awesome bar, awesome owners and a great addition to the California and Augusta intersection.You can get a great cocktail and amazing tapas style bites or go all in with cheap beer and a damn fine burger and fries. A cozy bar for winter and a stellar patio for summer. Haywood's got it all.

34.description: Completely ok.The Octopus was really super. This place actually serves 1-2 bite plates. Really. So be careful to ask about quantity when ordering. The octopus above made a fine small appetizer, although it is listed as a main, for example. If ordered as a main, it would have been a huge disappointment. I think this is one reason for the "$$" rating, as menu item prices are pretty low.

16.description: Amazing food, amazing drinks, and even better service. The staff is friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable. Thanks for being my neighbor!

13.description: Went there recently the week after grand opening. It's definitely a neighborhood bar that is comfortable, unpretentious, and inviting that you can revisit time and time again. We went on a Monday and I had a party of 3 arrive that were seating promptly at around 6:30pm. I was pleasantly surprised at how full it was for a Monday, when restaurants are typically closed.  For food we ordered the gnocchi with duck egg(sublime), the half chicken (succulent), the pulled pork (decent), the burger (solid), the pork belly bite (decent), and anchovies (love that they serve this. think traditional Spanish tapas bar). All said and done, we had 3 beers, 4 mains, and 2 appetizers, and walked away with a $100 tab and very satisfiedSummary: Great selection of beers and cocktails. Great food that is reasonably priced, especially considering the quality. Great ambiance. Looking forward to chef's menu expansion as well as the patio area being open for the summer. Solid restaurant, will be back for sure.

11.description: This is a very nice neighborhood tavern with many beer and drink list that compliments their food menu. They also have many nightly specials.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting.  It took us about 15 min. to get a table.  That allowed me to discover a drink called "THE EXECUTION OF EMPEROR MAXIMILIAN".   This is a very tasty cocktail... no gulping down this one. Our service was very good.Once seated at a table we ordered the ROASTED HALF CHICKEN with potato-parsnip puree, glazed garlic jus and the STEAK FRITES pan roasted sirloin, blue cheese butter, garlic aioli.  Both were very good.  This isn't your typical bar food.This is a great place to stop by for a relaxed evening out.  There are many bars to stop at in Humboldt Park and this is a great one to start the process!!

39.description: This place is the real deal. Awesome food, creative menu and fantastic drinks! Would highly recommend and will be back many more times!!

37.description: Come out and show some support to our local neighborhood establishment!!!!! Next time your in the area stop by and enjoy some special cocktail drinks and upscaled bar food in their back patio space. Great spot for low key, low profile time spend w/someone. Love the unpretentious vibe which I love to stay clear from. Next time your in ask for Kenneth a very attentive & personable server.My husband & have been here once prior. FYI: Before I write a review I like to go to places more than once.Decided to have this be the 1st stop on our Sunday Fun day & we were even more impressed with what the owners & sous chef have going on in their kitchen. (tapas influence;))Started off just doing the "bites" 5 for $14.00 enough for 2 people and (2) bites just as our server stated. The Salt Cod Croquettes w/Hazelnut Romesco sauce was actually surprisingly pretty good, especially when at times I've had Salt Cod that was pretty salty. (I personal thought this bite was missing a little kick to make the overall Croquette a huge success).The White Anchovy, Olive, & Pipparras Pepper was fresh, clean and tasty.The Confit of Pork Belly, & Pickled Pepper what else can I say.... U can never go wrong w/pork belly. (I do wish the pickled pepper was as big as the piece of pork belly,  it left me wanting more pickled pepper.;))The Baby Beet, Cucumber, & Smoked Feta which I loved probably the most. Best finish was the Deviled Egg Salad Stuffed Piquillo Pepper.All we need is a small selection of gluten free beer, considering they do already have a big selection of beers & speciality cocktail drinks.

0.description: Great Experience My daughter was attending a program at her school across the street, so we decided to kill some time while we waited. MAKE A RESERVATION!  We didn't make a reservation, but we weren't given attitude, and were seated.   We are far from trendy, but felt welcomed.   Drinks - nice selection, interesting combinations, and tasty. Service - slower pace than I am used to, but I thought it was attentive and pleasant. Everyone working there seemed happy to be there, so it gives the place a great energy.  Ambience - like I said trendy, fun and welcoming, and very cozy.  Food -  excellent.   I was a little worried when I didn't see any salt or pepper shakers, as my husband salts everything without tasting, but even he said the food had excellent seasoning. I had Steak Frites - cooked perfectly.   However I do agree with another review it could be hotter.  I'm not a huge fan of fries, but gobbled everyone up, they were crisp and seasoned perfectly. My husband had the chicken - it was juicy and also cooked perfectly.  I did have one problem with my food, and I hate to complain when I'm out, so I debated.    I finally decided I was going to say something to the waiter, I saw him tell the manager, and the two of them went back stopped the cooks and addressed it.  Again, no awkwardness, and I was glad I did.  So, I would definitely come back for the food and service.

38.description: We had the Salmon Toast and a cheeseburger with several of their "Bites." OMAHGAH. These guys know how to COOK!

51.description: We went on a Saturday night and it was pretty busy, but we got a table. I ordered the burger and it was delicious. The cocktails were fantastic. The service was also great. Overall, would come again and would highly recommend.

27.description: This place is right down the street from where we live. Good for us. Bad for our bank account. Everything I've had is great, the menu changes a bit but it's always delicious. Cocktails are good and priced well.Staff is always really nice. Tonight they went over and beyond. I got a new ring today and wore it to the restaurant. By the time I got home I realized the piece was missing. I called the restaurant on the off chance they found it, and lo and behold they got it! When I got there one patron said he saw the search, complete with flashlights and extra staff and everything.Thanks Haywood for taking the time to search for a girl's silly piece of jewelry she lost and finding it and being awesome about it. I will give you all my money.

32.description: Love this place! The food here is outstanding and the service is exceptional. I'm usually not one to order a burger but they have one of the best burgers I've ever had. Check them out!

54.description: It's a good neighborhood tavern. The burger is outstanding. The roasted chicken, on the other hand is just average. It took much longer than the said 25 minutes and is plated a la carte, when it's really should have some mashed potatoes or something to pair with the tasty sauce poured over the chicken. The wine list is lovely and the beer list is even better.

48.description: My advice- go to the bar for drinks, don't stay for dinner.I stopped in this joint because it was on California st, and adjacent to the art opening I was attending with my date. We were hungry and it was there. This is like so many new "gastropubs" very limited,extravagant, and overpriced menu. Their portion size is ridiculously small. Started with a "small bite" of the confit of pork belly- it is literally 1 bite. Had to order a second so we each could have some. She ordered the Half roasted chicken- and that is accurate- it was still bleeding and cold in the middle- despite the warning it would take extra time to prep. She wouldn't let me send it back. The "salad" was just greens, no dressing.I had the cheeseburger and fries, and will admit it was tasty. However only order if you like your meat on the rare side; outside was seared, but entire inside was pink. Fries were tasty, what you would expect- never got more ketchup for them when I asked.We went for a 2nd dinner because this one wasn't satisfying.The wine selection was limited, but tasty. Prices are what I would expect by the glass.The staff were friendly and right on top of replacing our drinks before they were empty.

44.description: Super cute place that is a fun addition to the neighborhood. Check it out for a drink, but know that it is a bit more expensive than most other places nearby.

24.description: Stopped in to pick up my FIL who had met and friend and checked this place out. It's a nice, chill atmosphere which a unique, not your average bar food, menu. We sat at the bar, Scott was attentive and friendly. He was also amused, rather than confused by my FIL's antics (it really can go either way). I tried the special that evening which was a lobster roll on a toasted bun with homemade chips. Very tasty. The father-in-law tried a pork belly lollipop and said it was delicious. I looked through menu and saw many things that looked intriguing. I was told the menu changes often, keeping things interesting.  I would come back again and try some other menu items. This bar is not in my neighborhood, so it would take something like this type of menu to get me out to August and California. My only complaint, and I am stretching here, is that they don't have Baccardi and my husband would be sad about that if he joined us. I had Tito's vodka and was happy, I know they have Ketel and a few other vodka choices. I'm sure we will be back to test out some other menu items.

7.description: Great neighborhood tavern with solid beer and drink list that pairs nicely with the food menu. Atmosphere is dark and cozy. Was there with a group of 7 people, so we tried nearly everything on the menu. Our server had great energy and her recommendations were on point. We tried several of the bites, the whitefish dip, pork noodle soup, steak frites, and a few other things on special. I'd go back for the octopus dish. Overall it's a great place to snag an upscale but reasonable dinner before barhopping at the nearby Humboldt joints.

49.description: signs of a new restaurant trying too hard: too many a-ffected hipster servers. the smell of formaldehyde from the recently darkly stained wood. shades 1/2 drawn making it very (too) dark inside at 5pm. modest mouse blasting. the cheesey fake-fancy font and scrolly patterns on the kinkos printed menus. this place is awlright, but it's forcing soul it just ain't got, yet. i feel like they're trying to land with both feet in in this still mostly blue collar, latino neighborhood as an instant higher-class neighborhood joint without feeling out the hood, first. you can't just open a place with a fancy chef and hipster everything and expect to be authentic. again, it's that trying-too-hard feel. the food was very good. the ambiance is trying to mimic similar places (think lulu cafe, the winchester, telegraph) without feeling original. it's identity-less. hopefully this will come in time & they'll develop their own personality.i want to like this place, but i'd prefer to travel east a mile or so on the same street-to the winchester, which is similar in vibe but not so try hard and with a MUCH (much) kinder & genuine staff.

40.description: I am really excited about this new neighborhood spot. It's at the corner of Augusta an California. The interior is masculine, new looking...it will improve with age I think. I did love the sconces but slightly dimmer would be nice. The bathrooms adequate but nothing special. Now that we got all that froufrou out of the way we can get down to the meat and potatoes if you will. First, we ordered a beer and cocktail (the golden arm), both lovely. Second, the food. This is a small plate restaurant, which we did not know, but found out quickly. We ordered the Deviled Egg Stuffed Pepper, Tortilla Espanola, and the Grilled Provoletta...all wonderful and fun to share, but not really a filling. We then decided to order the Ricotta Bacon Agrodolce which was amazing. The food was great. This is my opinion: My only problem with this place is the lack of reasonably priced meal type bar fare. I like the small plates but when you go out to dinner every night you need more. I guess my expectations were a little different. I was hoping for a neighborhood gastropub that you could get a drink or dinner any night. It's a little more upscale than that. We had Two beers, one cocktail, and four small plates...$56.00 including 20% gratuity. I would go back but maybe on Thursday and not Tuesday.So...we are back on a Monday a few months later...it's the only place open in a two block radius and the crowd is pretty small...and they still have a pretty unimpressive and expensive menu that is just so depressing for me ( just my personal opinion )...

53.description: Came here Friday evening and although it was crowded we were seated within 15 minutes and were able to get a cocktail at the bar. Cocktails are good and well priced, the beer menu is well put together, and the food is delicious (Really enjoyed the deviled egg salad stuffed pepper and smoked trout). Service was also on top of everything which was impressive for just recently opening. A great addition to the neighborhood. I hope this area continues to flourish.

30.description: I have been here on Sunday brunch and it is very very disappointing..we walked in and it seemed a nice place and atmosphere but as soon as we saw the menu we were a bit disappointed for the brunch, nothing really outstanding or new. I ordered a sandwich with sausage, egg and cheese and the sausage was sweet! Ugh! Pretty gross! And the most interesting thing is the waitress when I asked her how they made the sausage she answered in a defensive way instead of asking if I like something else since it was clear I did not like the food. End result, a bill pretty expensive for food I can definitely make at home! So..be careful! At least for brunch!

46.description: Went there recently the week after grand opening. It's definitely a neighborhood bar that is comfortable, unpretentious, and inviting that you can revisit time and time again. We went on a Monday and I had a party of 3 arrive that were seating promptly at around 6:30pm. I was pleasantly surprised at how full it was for a Monday, when restaurants are typically closed.  For food we ordered the gnocchi with duck egg(sublime), the half chicken (succulent), the pulled pork (decent), the burger (solid), the pork belly bite (decent), and anchovies (love that they serve this. think traditional Spanish tapas bar). All said and done, we had 3 beers, 4 mains, and 2 appetizers, and walked away with a $100 tab and very satisfiedSummary: Great selection of beers and cocktails. Great food that is reasonably priced, especially considering the quality. Great ambiance. Looking forward to chef's menu expansion as well as the patio area being open for the summer. Solid restaurant, will be back for sure.

1.description: "Sushi?""I'm really not in the mood for Asian. Let's get a burger!""No, I don't want anything greasy. Why no sushi?""I've already had Asian 3 times in the past 2 weeks. If I didn't go to Serai this week, I would suggest that we go there.""So what are you in the mood for?""Hm, a burger, or I could do pizza.""I already had Boiler Room twice this week. What about banh mi?""You know that counts as Asian right?"This debate of what to eat continued for about another 10 minutes until I pulled up Haywood Tavern on my nifty Yelp app. I've been stalking all of the restaurants and bars popping up at the intersection of California and Augusta for a while now, and Haywood Tavern was one of the places on my list to try (to be honest, all of establishments at that intersection are on that list). And thankfully for my boyfriend and I, they had something to suit both of our tastes - a burger for me (yes!...I sound like my sister) and a half hunk of chicken for him. We started out with a few small bites - the cod fritter, deviled egg stuffed into a pepper, and the pork belly bite. The cod fritter and the deviled egg stuffed pepper were really great - both of us agreed that they were our favorites. The pork belly was unfortunately whatevs, it was a bit lacking in flavor and tenderness, but the bites were a fun concept.Now on to that burger I was craving so badly - it was delicious!!! A double patty gluttonous cheeseburger that was so perfect. It came with a ton of fries that my boyfriend and I devoured, but sadly they came out cold. The half chicken that my boyfriend ordered was delicious - super moist, flavorful, and definitely filling. There were roasted garlic cloves all around the plate that were delicious - don't be afraid of them or the garlic breath that you assume that you'll have after the fact. It must be magic, but my garlic hummus gives me more garlic breath than biting into those tender cloves.Overall, I really liked Haywood Tavern. The beers were great (pabst on draft!), the service was amazing, that atmosphere was fun, and the food was tasty. Hopefully it will prevent future dinner debates for you as well.

55.description: I think I had false expectations about what this place was going to be, it's a little pricier and more upscale than I expected. The drink prices aren't bad, but the food was a little over-priced and my burger was almost raw. It is definitely more of a small plate type of place, which was not what i was expecting from a "Tavern". I am sure that people will enjoy the food they put out, and the concept they are going for, it just was a little out of my price range and I wasn't impressed with the offerings.

9.description: The bar was slow on a Saturday night but the draft selection was nice I ordered the salmon brunch item when I came for brunch and it was excellent and perfect for a September morning I have not yet dined for lunch/dinner but I will make my way over soon! I noticed they have good happy hour specials too

26.description: Wandered in here last night wanting to try someplace new-- have been looking for a spot in the neighborhood for ages, and this place is great! There's a cool old tin ceiling inside, decor is cool and comfortable without being presumptuous - it's simple. Huge patio. Jason, one of the owners, was manning the bar - awesome guy, helpful, knowledgeable. We had a great time, the food is stellar... overall an incredible addition to Humboldt. Will definitely be back!The burger is to. die. for.

25.description: Disappointed by a burger that was medium well when I asked for medium. Our waiter also never stopped by to check in on us..

12.description: Stopped in to pick up my FIL who had met and friend and checked this place out. It's a nice, chill atmosphere which a unique, not your average bar food, menu. We sat at the bar, Scott was attentive and friendly. He was also amused, rather than confused by my FIL's antics (it really can go either way). I tried the special that evening which was a lobster roll on a toasted bun with homemade chips. Very tasty. The father-in-law tried a pork belly lollipop and said it was delicious. I looked through menu and saw many things that looked intriguing. I was told the menu changes often, keeping things interesting.  I would come back again and try some other menu items. This bar is not in my neighborhood, so it would take something like this type of menu to get me out to August and California. My only complaint, and I am stretching here, is that they don't have Baccardi and my husband would be sad about that if he joined us. I had Tito's vodka and was happy, I know they have Ketel and a few other vodka choices. I'm sure we will be back to test out some other menu items.

59.description: Had a lovely meal on opening day. Highlights: an entire trout that was wonderfully fresh and tasty, anchovy/pickled veggie appetizer, peas & ham side, as well as other delicious pickled veggie sides. Sneeze Guard drink does not disappoint. Restaurant itself is bright and beautiful. Will definitely go back for more.

21.description: Brunch at Haywood was amazing, great ambiance, eclectic & quaint vibe; food was delicious - will definitely go back for dinner, the menu looks great!!

17.description: My wife and I came here with a few friends a couple of weeks after opening. We had:Pork Belly ConfitSalt Cod CroquettesDeviled Egg PepperOctopus a la PlanchaSmoked Pork SandwichCheeseburgerHalf Roasted ChickenGnocchiAnd we had a special but it is not listed anymore (Keep it fresh, keep it sexy, Haywood)I am not going to a dish-by-dish rundown like some because I am not a food critic.We ate on the patio and ordered quite a few cocktails. The service was wonderful, the cocktails were INCREDIBLE, the food was other-worldly. Super complex flavor combos working together, and working well. We were hiiiighly impressed. My favorites were the deviled egg, the pork belly confit, the chicken, the burger, and the pork sandwich. We just ordered everything and shared everything, a great strategy. Very comfortable, unpretentious attitude even thought the food and the cocktails deserve to be served at any of the higher priced establishments in the city.Everything was great, we can't wait to return!

10.description: The food is fantastic!  The staff are the best!  What else can I say about Haywood that hasn't already been said about kittens, sex, sleeping, or a day at the beach.

5.description: Went here for brunch. Great service. Great Bloody Mary. Great brisket on Texas toast. Looking forward to coming back.

3.description: Saw an article on Thrillist about hot places in Humboldt Park and Heywood Tavern was on the list. My husband and I decided to try it out. The bar was really simple, but cool. It was slightly bigger than a dive bae, but had a trendy feel to it. The menu was very gastropub.For drinks, my husband ordered the Augusta and I ordered the Escape to New York. He felt his drink was just average. It may be my personal taste, but my drink had strong cinnamon overtones, making it feel like I was sipping on Fireball Whiskey.For food, we ordered the burger, steak frites, and smashed potatoes. The burger was pretty delicious. The patties were well seasoned and the sauce was mouth watering. I think the steak frites had the potential to be good with the accompanying Bleu cheese butter, but the steak was cold. It felt like they let it sit for a while before serving. It kind of took away from the experience. The fries on both the steak and the burger were overdone. At least the garlic aoili was delicious and had an addicting quality. The smashed potatoes were not what we expected. We were expecting something more similar to mashed potatoes but this was like a warm potato salad with a tart yogurt flavor.This may have been a one off experience so I would be willing to give this place another shot.

35.description: Went here on a Friday night and sat outside. The food was really tasty, especially the grilled octopus.  The drinks were also amazing. I can appreciate any place that knows how to properly make an Old Fashioned. This is a great low-key neighborhood spot, and I will definitely be back!!

19.description: The food here is on par with anything on Randolph St or in Logan Square but without the ridiculous scene that comes with those places. Haywood is mellow, with a great staff and excellent food. If you live nearby, you're doing yourself a disservice by not checking it out. Highly recommend.

28.description: My wife and I came here with a few friends a couple of weeks after opening. We had:Pork Belly ConfitSalt Cod CroquettesDeviled Egg PepperOctopus a la PlanchaSmoked Pork SandwichCheeseburgerHalf Roasted ChickenGnocchiAnd we had a special but it is not listed anymore (Keep it fresh, keep it sexy, Haywood)I am not going to a dish-by-dish rundown like some because I am not a food critic.We ate on the patio and ordered quite a few cocktails. The service was wonderful, the cocktails were INCREDIBLE, the food was other-worldly. Super complex flavor combos working together, and working well. We were hiiiighly impressed. My favorites were the deviled egg, the pork belly confit, the chicken, the burger, and the pork sandwich. We just ordered everything and shared everything, a great strategy. Very comfortable, unpretentious attitude even thought the food and the cocktails deserve to be served at any of the higher priced establishments in the city.Everything was great, we can't wait to return!

45.description: Simply wonderful. Great cocktails, very solid beer selection and the food is wonderful. Tie that in with great atmosphere and a good-looking interior, and I'm coming back again and again. Love it.

33.description: Best chicken I've ever ordered anywhere! Great food, great drinks, great people!

43.description: Stopped in after attending the California Nights event down the street. Very inviting interior and wait staff. The pulled pork sandwich was fabulous! Will be back again soon.

2.description: oh mai that burger is good. that is all.

18.description: I love Haywood! I live down the street and it is so nice to have the addition to the neighborhood! Jeri has served us here every time I've been in and she is awesome! Super friendly and attentive and always explains each special and dish that is being served up!They have great beers on tap and the food is amazing! I highly recommend the double cheeseburger and the gnocchi!

41.description: Great food!  Had the pastrami pork belly to start then the 5 different bites which are equally amazing then the cheese burger to top it off. One of the better burgers I've recently had.

52.description: Hot. Young. Brash. Executive Sous Chef Tommy Sheean does it again with nothing but local, minimalist fare and a wry smile.  The cuisine is so delectable that you'd swear a virgin was sacrificed in the kitchen prior to opening to appease the Tastebud Gods, in fact I haven't been able to confirm that a virgin WASN'T sacrificed.  While it isn't the cajun-inspired homeless fare with a danger element we've grown accustomed to from Sheean, there is something on the menu to satisfy even the most discerning of tastes.  The only thing that could've improved the dining experience would have been the soft melody of Patrick Swayze's "She's Like the Wind" floating delicately into our ear drums during consumption. Bravo, Haywood Tavern.

50.description: Finally excited about a new local neighborhood joint. This place has a nice vibe but more restaurant than bar. Delicious cocktails, menu is simplistic but tasty. We tried the pork belly and the bacon ricotta appetizer. More like tapas portions. For mains I tried the burger and fries. Was very good. Some special sauce on top took it to the next level of what I would classify as a great burger.Could work on the ventilation as it got kinda smokey from the kitchen, you leave smelling like you've been in the kitchen.Would also be nice if they had carry out option, hopefully down the road after getting their bearings.

4.description: This review is being given to convey constructive criticism only.  We sincerely want this neighborhood place to succeed. First off, Haywood is really cozy on the inside and the service is pretty good.  Then we get to the food.  We went on a Sunday night, so I am not so sure they had their first string players in the kitchen.  We ordered the octopus that was rubbery and vinagary (tip: boil the tenderized octopus with wine corks), steak frites (not seasoned), pork chop (was way overdone--you could use it as a weapon), gnocchi was fried like tator tots and needed more seasoning. Overall, the dinner menu needs some attention to attract the type of crowd I think they are trying to bring in. The food, for lack of a better way to put it, lacked love. Please, please give it more attention as I would love to become a regular at this cozy spot.Side note: they were good enough to comp the porkchop.  Good call on their part.

6.description: Loved this one; will be back. Environment is cozy and polished, but nobody was dressed up -- it was great. Service was very friendly and informed.Has the mushroom and feta bite, which was more flavorful than anticipated, to start. Raclette was tasty. Gnocchi entree was delicious. Favorite part of the experience was the "fire in the hole" cocktail. If you like smokey, try it!

22.description: I love Haywood! I live down the street and it is so nice to have the addition to the neighborhood! Jeri has served us here every time I've been in and she is awesome! Super friendly and attentive and always explains each special and dish that is being served up!They have great beers on tap and the food is amazing! I highly recommend the double cheeseburger and the gnocchi!

15.description: The food is great here. Top picks is the burger, pork sandwich and the chicken. Prices are high for the neighborhood but can't complain with a 1am kitchen. The bar staff is inconsistent with cocktails and cliquy as it appears to be brought over a more Blind Ribbon crowd. So you gotta be in with the "in crowd". After 4-5 visits, the Best night to get a properly made cocktail is on Friday night it seems and best servers are short blonde girl and a guy with dreads as they tag team the tables. The rest just stare and often question if it's their table or the other. Some nights the bar is playing super loud annoying obscure punk music and some nights they Are playing the 80s. The 80s are more welcoming as the staff seems to be more into it also. Patio is great also. Hopefully things will develop more into the coming months after opening.

57.description: The cocktails are delicious!  I also tried the gnocchi and ricotta/bacon appetizer and both were awesome!

20.description: Had the brunch the other day and truly fell for their house made sausage, I truly have never had breakfast sausage that made me think of it later! The chef makes this himself and I could not waiti to go back to have brunch there again. Good Job Haywood!

36.description: Fantastic! Favorite new spot in Chicago. We had grilled Octopus and steak tartare to start. Then Roast Chicken. Chef Rodney says the chicken is his classic dish that never disappoints  and i totally agree. Interesting cocktails. Amazing murals in the bathrooms,

14.description: Exemplary, tremendously tasty food and awesome service. Not your typical bar food you expect. Their items are unique and delicious. You won't be disappointed. The patio is wonderful and cozy as well and the place is far from pretentious and is on point with the quality and price!Recommend:Deviled EggOctopus A La Plancha*Try their special, whatever it is, it's awesome!*

1.description: Whatever happened to common courtesy??  My grandmother always taught me to speak to people and polite. When you work in retail, you get paid to do it. Not the case at this location. I had associates walk right past me without even a simple "hello" or "do you need and assistance?"  10 count it 10 people including a supervisor walked past me as I shopped. The only exception was a young lady ( Maria) and the cashier ( Samantha). Needless to say I will not return to this store. I would rather travel to Melrose Park.

9.description: This menards is pretty much like any other hardware store out here. It's clean,.the workers have Good attitudes and are very helpful. You can go in, get what you want and then go about your day. There is hardly ever a line or wait for anything and that's what I like most about going here. I would recommend this place to everyone!

23.description: WOW!!!  This blows the other Menard's (I had been to the now-closed Diversey and the obiquitous Clybourn/Wrightwood) out of the water.  They sell EVERYTHING, even limited groceries, all manner of home appliances, a full lumber department, bathrooms and kitchens, even a limited selection of books and media.  Very nice staff who actually seem to like working there.  The sheer size of the store is a bit overwhelming (I spent two hours in there gawking and only spent $30), but I'll definitely return soon when we look for a new bathroom vanity, or a new washer.  Maybe not the best if you're looking for only a couple of things and to get in-and-out quickly, but otherwise nice place.

5.description: I Like this Menards.... NOT that they aren't all the same merchandise wise, but this one is always stocked with everything I need, and the staff is helpful. The prices are a little higher than places like Walmart, but you can actually find staff to talk to when you need help, and they know what they are talking about. Also, they have registers and people are manning them so you don't have to wait forever when you're ready to leave.

25.description: Swoon I'm in love.  Finally a hardware store that's close to home that isn't crap city.  You can find almost anything at this Menards.  The layout is large, the decor is modern.  They have a huge selection of patio furniture, appliances and light fixtures.  Also per usual Menard's standard their glove aisle is vast.  A spiffy pair of gloves runs about $10 and I like to use them when I ride my motorcycle.  And I will be prepared if I need to randomly hop off my bike and do some emergency gardening.

12.description: As far as big house project centers go this one just shot to the top. Big loud shout out to Amber who seemed to be orchestrating everything from the front desk. We started a patio project and she was super friendly and accommodating to us. Even the guy on the forklift was super helpful. Huge thumbs up on customer service here. Double for Amber. We will be back. Keep hiring people who are good with people.

21.description: So 3 Mexicans decide to throw up a big wood fence (true story) So they decide to go to the New Menards on North ave..................And In AWE they were as they stepped foot inside!!!!!!!! Holy smokies its the mother of all Menards!!!!! I mean its huge!! Its like the Super 3 Lb burrito of burritos, you know the one that needs 2 flour tortillas to hold all the meat.....Walkin around I lost the other 2 mexicans I was with I had to dial my cell to locate them thats how huge this store is.....they sell food dvd'sclothesoh and Lumber!Their Lumber yard out back is awesome! The dudes out there driving the forklifts were very helpfull and helped us find the lumber we needed and helped us load the wood into the truck!-1 star because they dont sell booze!+1 star cause the chick in the service desk waived the late charge of the truck we rented (first 75 minutes is $18.99)! yeah...well we took 3.5 hours!Shake  & bake seal of approval! Hipster infestation level: 0 Yeah thats right no hipster wander east of Pulaski!

16.description: We've had a hell of a week/ weekend.  I will spare you the details but let's just say that the drain declogger crystals that I needed to purchase did not live up to it's name.   It claimed to be safe for all pipes...it ate a hole in ours in less than 10 minutes.  My husband decided that this was the perfect opportunity to replace our sink.  We were over the pedestal style and wanted something different.  My bathroom has been the bane of my existence, anything would be an improvement.  I had exactly in my mind what I was looking for, the brand, dimensions, etc.  It was available at Menards, Lowes and Home Depot but each one was slightly different.I have to admit that I was annoyed and offended by the clerk on duty.  He offered a low end and a high end version of the particular vanity that I was interested in.  I found the higher end version cheaper at their competitor and apparently he did not believe me and wanted to argue.  I didn't bring it up to haggle.  I just wanted to know if they carried it in a 30" because blah blah was out of stock and they sold it for $$.  I was personally done with the conversation and already decided that I would not purchase my vanity there.  My husband went along with the clerk and let him go into detail that the inside hinges were better, and that the model had legs where the one that I was comparing probably did not..  I really didn't give a damn.  I was done.Aside from the bathroom department, this Menards is worth going to if you have a project and want to find more options.  Stuff is fairly low priced here and it definitely inspires one to want to DIY.

17.description: So 3 Mexicans decide to throw up a big wood fence (true story) So they decide to go to the New Menards on North ave..................And In AWE they were as they stepped foot inside!!!!!!!! Holy smokies its the mother of all Menards!!!!! I mean its huge!! Its like the Super 3 Lb burrito of burritos, you know the one that needs 2 flour tortillas to hold all the meat.....Walkin around I lost the other 2 mexicans I was with I had to dial my cell to locate them thats how huge this store is.....they sell food dvd'sclothesoh and Lumber!Their Lumber yard out back is awesome! The dudes out there driving the forklifts were very helpfull and helped us find the lumber we needed and helped us load the wood into the truck!-1 star because they dont sell booze!+1 star cause the chick in the service desk waived the late charge of the truck we rented (first 75 minutes is $18.99)! yeah...well we took 3.5 hours!Shake  & bake seal of approval! Hipster infestation level: 0 Yeah thats right no hipster wander east of Pulaski!

10.description: This was my first Menard's.  I didn't even know what they sold for a long time after moving here.  It's not like they have big windows facing the street.  This one is so far from the road it looks like some ominous compound.  Especially with the security car rolling around constantly with its lights on.But I'm a fan of this place.  I like it more than Home Despot or Lowes.  I feel like I get the selection of a big store and lower prices while still kind of shopping local.  This is definitely a Midwest place, and i see they try to highlight some local brands (like Sprecher).This one is definitely a larger version of normal Menard's.  A few months ago, when I first started going, all the employees were pretty lost as far as where everything was.  Now they are a lot better, and can atleast send you to someone who knows if they don't get it yourself.  That's one reason why I like Menard's better, is that you can always find someone to help, unlike Home Despot.Actually, I need to go there now for some weatherstripping.

11.description: Huge Menards on the West Side! While I found parking to be ample, the store is huge and hard to navigate, and was missing a few things I was looking for. On the quest for a winter snow innertube, none could be found among the picked-over decorations one week after Christmas. Heard in the aisles "When is this stuff going to be 75% off?" Indeed. Nobody but bargain hunters are looking for Christmas stuff after the Holidays, so just get rid of it, Menards!No snow toys to be found! Wait, what's that box my foot is hitting by the Christmas decorations? One last snow tube box on the ground, it's fate!I found one employee here to be friendly and helpful, the next to be clueless and not so helpful. I can't believe this location doesn't have a Camping section. I mean, what if I'm going winter hunting? I know it's the West Side of Chicago, but you're also Menards. Don't be so proud you can't have a camping section, West Side Menards!Checkout is in a very weird place on the far west side of the store. My checkout girl was less than thrilled to have a job as a checker at Menards and didn't say a word to anybody in line. Nice manners, babe!Oh, but as Allan M. said in his review, Sprecher soda fans, rejoice! I haven't seen this many kinds of Sprecher soda (pop) since I toured the brewery in Milwaukee. Rejoice!

26.description: What's that glow I see coming from the west side?  Oh, it's just the new super huge, glorious, heaven on earth Menards.Holy cats and dogs, folks.....I about tinkled my pants this place is paradise.  Tools, oh tools....garden center?!  Huuuuge garden center?!  Grocery?!  Yes, milk, frozen pizza, Nestle Quik, butter?!  Pet center, tools....everything all shiny and pretty.I think I need to go lay down now.

27.description: HOLY MOSES!Its the Super Mega of Menards!They have a large Appliance Center! Yes! this Menards sell Appliances! This location also has a Garden Center!Oh! The Tools shelves and shelves of tools!Oh! I think i just Orgasmed.

0.description: Okay, I don't have a home and I'm very illiterate when it comes to home improvement, if you know what I mean (Menards is for people with homes, not apartments, like me), but when I came here last night, I came here looking for some onion seeds for my church pastor so he can start his garden this year. Because of the cleanliness, ease of navigation, and pricing of merchandise at this place, I'm definitely coming back here for anything that I may need for either myself or someone else. Many ACE/True Value hardware stores are independently owned and operated and do not normally have many of the things I'm looking for. And when they do have them, their prices are higher than at Menards. So, when it comes to anything for around the house, apartment maybe, or whatever, go to Menards. Don't waste your time with the local hardware stores.P.S. I've known Menards for years and one of the things I've always liked about Menards is its salespapers in the Sunday newspaper. Look at the bottom of each page, and you will find an inspirational message. I've always loved that!

20.description: This was my first Menard's.  I didn't even know what they sold for a long time after moving here.  It's not like they have big windows facing the street.  This one is so far from the road it looks like some ominous compound.  Especially with the security car rolling around constantly with its lights on.But I'm a fan of this place.  I like it more than Home Despot or Lowes.  I feel like I get the selection of a big store and lower prices while still kind of shopping local.  This is definitely a Midwest place, and i see they try to highlight some local brands (like Sprecher).This one is definitely a larger version of normal Menard's.  A few months ago, when I first started going, all the employees were pretty lost as far as where everything was.  Now they are a lot better, and can atleast send you to someone who knows if they don't get it yourself.  That's one reason why I like Menard's better, is that you can always find someone to help, unlike Home Despot.Actually, I need to go there now for some weatherstripping.

19.description: What's that glow I see coming from the west side?  Oh, it's just the new super huge, glorious, heaven on earth Menards.Holy cats and dogs, folks.....I about tinkled my pants this place is paradise.  Tools, oh tools....garden center?!  Huuuuge garden center?!  Grocery?!  Yes, milk, frozen pizza, Nestle Quik, butter?!  Pet center, tools....everything all shiny and pretty.I think I need to go lay down now.

2.description: Avoid on-line purchases from this company.  The return policy makes it impossible to return an item.  Worse: if you are buying a system (in my case a chimney where the parts must match), then discover you need a simple part to complete the system, you're going to be told - you have to come to the store to get that.  the stores are 1/2 a continent away.  A bad on-line shopping experience

18.description: Well I moved to my apt with me n my wife on july. Well we had to make copies of the keys. So I took them to walmart to get some copies, got home, doors wouldn't open. So went back and got my money back.So to home depot I went, same thing happen as in walmart. So I remember that there's a menards neraby. So got into the car an I went to it. So went to where they make copies, took me a few minutes to find the person that was doing the keys, the store is HUGE, so unlike my 2 previous attempts to get keys, I see they use a machine that makes the copies an the saleperson doesn't do anything, great!So I got home an it turns out the clerk used a smaller key than mine. An hence the 4 stars n not the 5. But went back, found the clerk, an in less than 5 minutes I was out of there with identical keys as the original.And they worked!

13.description: Psst, Sprecher soda fans in Chicago! You need a sudden fix of whatever Sprecher sodas you crave, and you're sad you can find such a limited variety at Jewel, or whatever other grocery store you normally go to? Come here, and you can stock up beyond your wildest needs.It's even a Menards w/a better than expected food selection, and I certainly have to think this is a small beacon to hope to nearby 'food desert' neighborhoods struggling with attracting something better than run of the mill corner stores. (and of couse, know it doesn't solve their probs, but seeing selection like this has to at least mean something) They even have a greeter at this store, something I rarely have seen at many Menards, and certainly not at the Clybourn location. Obviously this blows the Clybourn location away by a great bit, but isn't as non-car friendly.If by some weird chance you don't drive here, I will warn that the store is a lot closer to Kostner Ave. than it is North Ave. Just a heads-up, if you do take the bus here. Seriously, do everything in your power to drive(like I did w/others) or Zipcar your way to this one!

4.description: I called this menards a few times today and I get a busy signal Its a good that there are a few menards nearby

24.description: Wow, if all Menards stores were like this one, I'd never go back to Home Depot. Alan, my cashier, was so nice. What a crazy name for a cashier. Alan. Anywho, I went there looking for flooring and they had a huuuuuuuge selection. The staff didn't harass me as I shopped and they were helpful when I asked some questions. I ended up buying a few extra things because of this great sale they had going. I really hope they keep up the good work.

6.description: I ordered bifold doors and when they arrived there was a hole in the cardboard and a 2 inch square hole in the hollow core door.  I informed Menards by email and was told they would check with the vendor for a solution.  After a month of waiting they have not responded.  I would not use them again.

22.description: Wow. I remember Menards from my childhood and it sure has come a long way. The catchy tune remains the same.  This Menards is pretty insane. Its HUGE and bright and stocked. The employees have always been super helpful and I feel happiness every time I enter.  I definitely prefer Menards to Home Depot - greater variety of goods, a more pleasant atmosphere and it is MUCH easier to get assistance. I just bought a fixer-upper and I think I'll be at Menards a lot. Can't wait!

15.description: The bonus: This Menards is H-U-G-E, and has a play area in the middle of it, so while my partner is wandering around in some someday-I'll-tear-down-a-wall-or-build-a-deck fantasy world (boring!) I can take my child to "the park" and 2 out of 3 visitors are having a great time. Also, Home Depot has dubious politics, so in my own fantasy world I like to think that spending my money here makes a difference somewhere.The terrible: We ordered a BOATLOAD of lumber from them (not cheap!) and arranged to have it delivered. Not only did they come 3 hours after the promised time range, but they refused to put the lumber in our backyard, leaving it in the alley instead. When my partner called to ask that they come back and finish the delivery, the guy on the phone actually started yelling, saying we didn't tell them it was supposed to go somewhere their forklift wouldn't fit. Huh? We aren't really sure how we were supposed to know we needed to ask about that, considering there are no signs about forklifts when you place a delivery order. Blah blah blah... eventually they came back, but not for another hour, during which we had to sit in the alley and babysit our wood.

7.description: I love this place. There are some very knowledgeable employees in this store but not the teens or younger employee that they tend to hire cannot provide guidance of where certain things are located. The hardware manager knows everything, she is awesome. The guy in heating cooling is also helpful and very informative. The store is generally well stocked and very clean. I tend to shop here over their competitors.

8.description: A couple of years ago I purchased a house in a nearby neighborhood and this Menards has been my go-to location for several home improvement projects.  I've gotten everything here: ceiling fans, dog toys, bird seed, a toilet, plants, patio furniture...you get the idea.This is the only place in Chicago that carries my favorite Sprecher soda and I've made special trips here, just for that.The workers are helpful and the prices are better than their competitors.  It is clean and well stock.  I'm a fan!

3.description: I placed an order online to pick up in-store and was notified by email that one of my items was unavailable but that the rest of the order was ready for pick up. However, when I arrived only one of the 4 items I ordered was given to me. The rest had been sold. I was highly bothered by this seeing as how I had prepaid for these things and they were supposed to be put on hold for me. I can say that the gentleman who was assisting me was beyond helpful and even double checked the inventory to make sure my items weren't overlooked. I sent a follow-up email asking if perhaps the items were sold before I placed my and never received an answer. While the associates at this locating are very helpful, I feel as though this mix-up was swept under the rug once my money was returned.

14.description: this store is clean but they have no service people that really can help you ..

58.description: This is the only Mexican place in the Division and Western area and I was happy to see it replace the sandwich shop that was there. I ordered the barbacoa tacos and my girlfriend ordered the flautas which she tries at every place that has them. The tacos were amazing! The meat was soft, well seasoned, and melted in my mouth. I love steamed beef and Paisano does these quite well! The flautas were good (although my GF likes them soaked in oil "for your health" as she puts it) and she really liked the guacamole and was happy with her flautas. She also showed me her rice and said "is that normal"? Yes, the arroz had a tiny sprinkling of green peas, little carrots, and little potatoes in it. The ground beef in the flautas had some potatoes mixed in. This is is a common way to make rice or ground beef, but I have only been to 2-3 taquerias where they do this. Every region in Mexico and the Southwestern USA has its own style and some of the cooks around here must be from a place where tossing those things in is considered cool. Hybridity is the name of the game in the Mexican kitchen and I thought the little peas tasted great! Big plus around here: Open at 9 am! If you are not familiar with Mexican food - try breakfast wherever you can. I am happy to see a taqueria open for breakfast. The breakfasts are $4.99 and the Chilaquiles Juevos and steak plate is only $6.99. In a part of Chicago where the brunch munch crowd rules the streets on Saturday and Sunday and places on Division, or the trendy Humboldt Park places make you wait an hour and charge $25 for a half slice of toast and an a-la-carte menu I am happy that I can stroll in here, get a cup of coffee and eat an amazing plate of Juevos a la Mexicana for just a few bucks more than McDonalds! This is a simple no-frills taco place with a small friendly staff. Our server came out and asked us how things were a couple of times and seemed happy to have us there.

56.description: Went there with my friends on saturday after Wicker Park fest ended. Needless to say, we were not sober. But what a great little Mexican joint! The food was cheap and authentic, not to mention tasty! I got the super burrito with beef and it was super good. Also everyone there was very friendly and we made friends with most of the staff there. I'm coming back there next time I'm in the area.

29.description: Just ordered from here. They are right down the street from my house, but I had it delivered because I didn't want to pack up my three kids and walk down there. Kinda happy I didn't anyway. They get 1 star for not laughing at me for having it delivered 1 block away. I ordered online on their website simple and easy no snag ups and got my receipt in my email two seconds later. They get one star for that. Less than 20 minutes later I get a phone call saying the delivery person was at my apartment so they get one star for that. I go downstairs and she wasn't there. I called her back and told her the apartment was kinda hard to find (even though I wrote this in the instructions for delivery online, but I digress) she comes to the side of the building where I am and rudely shoves the bag of food at me and says thanks, and walks away.....okay?.... This is why I hate tipping before the people come to the house (you have to when you order online and use a CC). So they loose a star for that.It smells ssssoooooo good. I open it up and eat my tamale...very disappointing. They were kind of rubbery in a way...gross.. So I moved on to my chicken tacos. They were neither bad, nor good. So they don't gain or loose a star for the food. It was cheap, and it got here fast. Whatever.Overall, I'm happy I'm no longer starving, but def not moved by any means by El Paisano Tacos. Would I come back again? Probably not. If I have another craving for tacos I live in Humboldt Park, I shouldn't have trouble finding them some place else.

42.description: Beef and cheese enchiladas were really good. Rice and beans--not so much. Combo burrito was just good--nothing extraordinary. Pico de gallo was very good.

23.description: Take it for what it is: a carry-out Mexican joint for those nights where you say, "f*ck it, I need a burrito." Breakfast burrito is available at all hours, thankfully. Service is always fast and friendly. The red sauce is not to be trifled with - spicy and satisfying. Very generous portions and dirt cheap. Glass Coke bottles with real sugar.

47.description: The downside of living in Streeterville is not having cheap, fast Mexican food around. I was so happy to get a promotion code on seamlessweb and found out that El Paisano delivers to my area!I pigged out and ordered 2 super burritos, 2 tacos, and 1 Horchata. I preordered my dinner at work in the morning and the delivery guy came exactly 2 minutes after the time I requested. Extra stars for being friendly and on time! I loved everything I ordered except guisado de puerco aka pork stew in my burrito. Somehow it was so spicy and greasy it gave me heartburn! Everything else was delicious. The burrito came with big chunks of avocado. Everything came with pico de gallo and 2 types of sauce-the salsa verde and the red sauce. I am a sucker for horchata and El Paisano's was perfect with a hint of cinnamon. This definitely will be my delivery place from now on for mexican food.

8.description: Authentic Mexican food and for a very reasonable price. We were craving good Mexican food and looked for take out options via Grubhub. We order a steak torta and a carnitas dinner plate. They were delicious!  I'm Mexican and this place passes the authenticity test. I will definitely order from it again !

31.description: I love my hole in the wall Mexican joints, and this place is my fav! which might also have something to do with it's 1 block proximity to my house, but whatev's, the folks at Paisano's are 5 star people! The servers are always amazing and by now can sometimes predict my order. They're friendly, helpful and always smiling, so tip them well my fellow yelpers! The veggie burrito is a bargain at $4 and the tortas and tostadas are also very solid and tasty! It's also a great chance to practice your spanish watching tv that is only en espanol. :)

34.description: This place is usually so good, but I've been waiting for over an hour for my food. Even good food isn't worth waiting that long. Total turn off.

16.description: We order from here a lot because the food is usually good, not outstanding, but consistently good. The service however is seriously lacking. We ordered delivery tonight and an hour later we called because it hadn't arrived. They were not apologetic at all and said they called (the directions were to knock on the door) and then left. What's the point of special directions of they don't read them? They also charged us a second delivery fee to come back. We won't be calling them again anytime soon.

13.description: This place is...not good. I'm pretty sure the only reason they get business is because it's local and there are a ton of other businesses around it and not too many places to eat. I don't like writing bad reviews but, no.

11.description: We ordered a steak burrito and tacos overall okay however steak could have been better! Beans are a little dry..

39.description: Cheap, amazing steak tortas! People are very friendly they give you chips and two types of salsa when you dine in!

37.description: I love El Paisano.  Good food, friendly staff... and their logo is a cowboy riding a taco.

0.description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. This is my go-to Mexican delivery, so much that the delivery guy knows me and realized when I moved a few blocks. The good: carne asada with loads of onion and a whole cooked jalapeño (not canned), mushroom burrito suizo for when I'm trying to stick to veg options, the salsa verde is spicy and yummy, and the tortilla chips are fresh and not the grocery store kind, which is huge bonus. The bad: the fries are inedible, but skip the American fast food items and you'll like the rest of the options.

38.description: I can't believe I passed this place up a million times a day and never gave it a shot. I've been living in this neighborhood for about four years now and have now decided to try it out. I usually get my taco fix at la Pasadita. But today was a lazy day and I didn't feel like heading that way. I first discovered the online option in which scored  some major points  (because of my lazy mode that is).  I opted for the combination 1 which came with Carne Asada (fairly nice portion) and a Chile relleno.
