Also, Cermak has raised their prices on produce so it's the same price to get them at Whole Foods. Also, Cermak's produce has been looking wilted lately. I love to support my local grocers, but unfortunately Cermak does not make that possible!

9.description: As a first-timer at this store, it meet all my needs and expectations.

26.description: Cermak is the go to easy grocery as it is just down the street from where I live.My roommates would probably write a better review as this is this is their main grocery spot.  I used to come here more often but don't find the need to anymore, unless it is to just pick up something really quick.  Cermak's location is great for the area.  The prices are reasonable for the fresh items like meat, fruits and vegetables.  Center aisle items can be a little bit more expensive than other stores.  But if you want to find some good Latino food this is the place to go.

25.description: Stocking up on fruit!For the record I know that Cermak Produce is a chain ofstores here in the Chicagoland area.But, what I didn't know until my visit today was that this is a greatchain of stores, beginning with this one on North Avenue.It's an extremely busy location, right in Humboldt Park and Ifound so many great things to love about this place!Starting with the merchandising/presentation.. yes.. they knowhow to pull the buyer in with all the great visuals.Everything is neat and tidy, Nothing looks sloppy or out ofplace here.Lots of staff on the floor, replenishing supplies as needed, helpingcustomers.Everything here is so well stocked, absolutely no empty spotsof anything that I could see.A great meat selection as well as a very busy deli counter whichwas selling luncheon meats by the pound at some of the lowest pricesI have ever seen.Nice and friendly cashiers too!I am so impressed by this store/location, to me it runs like a welloiled machine.And.. even though a bunch of munchkins came in with their Teacher on likea school field trip that could not even deter me.There is simply too much to love here, great prices, great selection,a great staff.Who could say No to that?

12.description: Love having this place down the street. Amazed at how long lasting some of the produce is even in my cheap, old fridge. Granted I need to learn better storage and such for some items (don't refrigerate your tomatoes! Kills flavor.) This place has great deals on produce, eggs, milk, all fresh and never had an issue. Pantry staples however are a bit expensive. But fantastic to be so close to this kind of quality.

59.description: by far, the best grocery store I have been too in Chicago.  All of the produce and fruit is great - it's my main grocery store with some supplements from Aldi for stuff like garbage bags, butter, milk, etc.  I used to go to Jewel, spent $140 a week on a family of three - Aldi+Cermak= $90...with much better produce.  Amazing.  Just wished they carried alcohol.  Apparently I am a high-class drinker and don't like the generic beer at Aldi.  Oh well.

21.description: I'm pretty stoked about this little grocery store.I don't think I've been excited about a grocery store in my entire life. They're not exciting places!So. Get this. There's a Jewel a couple blocks from where I live and it has the crappiest of crap crap produce. Somehow Cermak Produce is stocked full of fresh, delightful looking fruits and vegetables right out of the Garden of Eden. Say WHAT?! I know, right?And then it's CHEAP as dirt. This isn't even Whole Foods that rapes my bank account when I want a firm, non-rotten tomato. Then (because I think it caters mostly to my Mexican homies) Cermak Produce also has some pretty exotic fruits and veggies (can I introduce you to calabaza and chayote?). I don't have to go on an adventure just to find that weird, unfamiliar ingredient for that obscure recipe I want to try thanks to Cermak Produce. Sayonara Whole Paycheck!I've seen cray-cray lines waiting at the meat counter at Cermak Produce but I haven't been brave enough to check it out myself. I definitely have this mindset that price equates quality when it comes to meat and am dubious that Cermak Produce can really deliver to my er... pricey... standards. Might be good for you though!Cermak Produce also has all kinds of Mexican cheese. I'm used to having a choice of two (count that: one, two) kinds of cheese of the same brand. Cermak Produce has more brands of Mexican queso than what I know what to do with. Likewise, they have a cornucopia of chorizo, refried beans, dulces (candies), and pan (bread). That said, they don't have those go-to brands to which I'm accustomed for other kinds of cheese (e.g. cheddar or mozzarella).The isles have always been clean and the check-out has been efficient. There's some sort of bank or credit union or something past the registers. Anyway, it's the parking lot that has me most concerned. It's often jam packed! Good for Cermak Produce but bad for keeping dents off of the sides of my car.

17.description: My husband LOVES Cermak,  especially the butcher department.  I am impressed with the about of produce they do have, and the rad stuff you can find!Good selection of things, some priced lower then Jewel (tofu), some WAY higher (OJ). However, when you live a couple blocks away, its really a wonderful thing.And when they're grilling in the parking lot, its impossible to pass up.

10.description: I had the worst experience ever shopping in this store, the cash register women refused to sell me eggs just because I had already bought some eggs and I re-entered the store to get more eggs! Yes, so what? What if I made up my mind and decided to get more eggs!And over that i bought a Hershey bar and she drop my chain in the registry counter and didn't even say sorry! So f****ng rude!I honestly would not shop in this store ever again.

5.description: Great selection here. A step above Stanley's and Tony's. Not sure that I would get seafood, but it's great that they have an option.

3.description: Came here to buy what we need for a good spicy chili... But watch your stuff. Someone broke into our car while shopping here!!!! Sad world. Just one of those days when you personally lose faith in humanity.

35.description: As you glide into the tight but ample parking lot you hear the sounds of Mexican radio coming through the doors as customers leave this little food oasis in a part of West Town that has few options. If you are looking for a place to grab all the fixings for the next cookout, or find some unique re-fried or canned beans (they have many different kinds, featuring different recipes), then you have come to the right place. This place is a typical Mexican fruit, veggie, and meat market, and caters to those who want to get all the fixings for salsa, as well as those looking to pick up staples in a part of the city that needs more groceries. I am a vegetarian, but for the meat eater in your posse this place has everything you need. Want good fajita meat? They have it in piles. My father Guadalupe always suggests you ask for it tenderized. They just toss it in a machine and the skirt stake is ready to soak in beer with a little salt and lime juice (Asada here we come!) The vegetable market is very Latin (Mexican and Puerto Rican) so don't expect whole foods layouts, but you can get all the fresh cilantro (they even had mint), tomatillos, and a nice selection of fresh hot peppers. The tomatoes were ok (not great). This place also does alright as a go-to grocery store since they have at least general coverage in most other areas. My mom loves Camay soap and they have this once quite common US brand in stock (imported from Mexico), like Mexican "Coke-a-Cola" from Mexico. Isn't it funny that you have to get US "originals" imported from Mexico? Well, they have both Camay and Coke, and toilet paper. This place is very Chicago. You have to love a Latino style market named after Anton Cermak, the Czech immigrant mayor of Chicago with roots in Pilsen (I think) who figured out how to appeal to and welcome the great diversity of immigrants in Chicago (he also made sure they were voters) before he was assassinated in 1933, but for more on Mr. Cermak, check out another website. I just think it is cool that history, food, music, and culture all come together at Cermak Produce and also that they accept credit and debit cards! Hum a little Mexican pop music and get yourself some food as you ponder the street names of Chicago. Damen, for example, was named after a priest who founded Loyola University!

19.description: Carnitas can be purchased by the pound on the weekends. Lechon is available by the pound as well. Score!

28.description: I love you, Cermak Produce. Where else could I get broccoli, tomatoes, onions, lemons and limes, red and green peppers, carrots, celery, plus two pounds of ground beef for under $10? Nowhere. They are practically giving this stuff away. I usually buy canned/boxed brand stuff elsewhere, but for fresh produce and meat, this is where you want to go.As an added bonus, the staff has been nothing but nice to me every time I've been here.

45.description: I love Cermak. Things that were too expensive to buy at Jewel or Dominicks are now part of my every day diet because they are so cheap here...Things like- avocadoes, red, yellow and orange bell peppers, mushrooms (portabella included!). Seriously, these used to be treats for me, but no more! Do not overlook the deli for fresh feta either- $2.99 per pound, and that's the regular price. I dare you to find it for cheaper at Jewel. In need of some fresh parmesan? The deli can get that for you for $4.99 per pound, and they're happy to give you a 1/4 or 1/2 lb. I don't eat meat, but the mister does and has always gotten good things from the meaty deli. Also not to be missed, the bulk items hidden under the produce. You can usually find dry beans for slightly cheaper than the packaged ones in the aisle. Another upside- you can get in and out of the store with everything you need for a week in about 30 minutes. I'm bummed I wasted so much time and money going to Jewel when this gem was so close!(they don't carry booze though. that's pretty much the only downside...)

33.description: I live within walking distance of a Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Treasure Island, Dominick's and Aldi, yet I hop the bus to shop at Cermak on North Ave. With the exception of egg whites and reduced fat peanut butter, they have every grocery that I need. I read a review in which someone complained about there not being enough Asian variety. Well, it's not an Asian market. It's Cermak Produce, not Cermak Avenue, so there.Cermak is the only supermarket where I'll buy produce. The quality is always tops and more "mainstream" stores can't touch their prices on most. As another reviewer observed, the cashiers can be rather generous with the bags, so I tend to consolidate before leaving the store. A minor inconvenience, but not a complaint. The cashiers are all cute, so I don't mind spending more time there. ;-)If I were a pork eater, I would not be at a loss at Cermak because they have just about every part of the pig there, fresh and ready to go. Fotunately, for me, they have a great selection of and great prices on frozen fish!Something that the Cermak experience has over other supermarkets is that their employees seem to like, or at least appreciate, working there (unlike what you'll witness/encounter at Jewel and Dominick's). That alone inspires return visits.

43.description: The produce here is so inexpensive and good! We were buying some ingredients for a signature black bean salad of mine that I make, and that tends to be quite the hit and potlucks. Ingredients included:-2 cans black beans-1 stalk of cilantro-2 large haas avocados-2 yellow bell peppers-1 red onion-a package of corn (4 total)-1 pack of cherry tomatoes-1 pack of peach rings (these were not part of the salad, don't worry)All of the above cost us $15!!! That's it. The same above ingredients at any other store would be somewhere in the $20's or even double the price. Cermak produce also carries other products, from toilet paper to meats, cheeses, cleaning supplies, etc. This is a great place to come if you're planning on making some tasty Mexian cuisine. It's a bit of a trek for me coming from the north side, but the savings is worth it I'm quite sure.

2.description: While Mayfair Market in my hood (Albany Park) is sufficient enough for my everyday grocery needs, Cermak Produce really wins almost every single category I desire as a grocery store.They always have quality grocery varieties, fresh meat, hot-food selections, and bakery assortments.  Although I have to say they don't necessarily have the cheapest prices on fresh produce, I can count on their qualities regardless.  For the most part, their prices are still better than what you will see in a Jewel-Osco or an Aldi.  In this particular location, you will people with different races and ethnicities.  There are also hipsters shopping here as well since it's not too far from other neighborhoods in proximity (Logan Square, Bucktown, and Wicker Park).  If you need to grab something to eat on the way to work, for lunch break, or dinner break at your work place, there's a plenty of hot-food selections, which I don't normally see it at Mayfair Market in Albany Park.  Their pastry and bakery items look quite amazing and delicious as well!  Unfortunately, I couldn't find non-organic spinach at this Cermak.  All I saw was the organic options, but I prefer the loose-leaf ones sold in a large clear plastic bag, like what I've seen at the Chicago Produce (Albany Park) and Stanley's Fruit Market (Noble Square).  I use spinach in my omelets a lot, and not being able to find this item here was pretty disappointing.Anyways, I still think highly on Cermak Produce and wish there was one in close proximity to my apartment.

18.description: Produce here is AMAZING. That is all I can say. Everythingn else is a bit pricey, but I do like their arrachera is really good too. Makes for really yummy tacos.

41.description: They have a Cuisine de France bread machine that makes the best fresh baguettes all day long.  Warm and flaky crust.  OMG.  I can't get enough of those.

52.description: In order to have a successful snow day, one must have tons of snacks, movies and liquor. I popped into Cermak Produce for the snacks- authentic tasting tortilla chips and the absolute BEST guacamole and pico de gallo in the city. I also grabbed a few off-list items: sliced pineapple sprinkled with chili powder,blueberry waffles and chocolate eclair ice cream bars, of course! The prices here are great! Whole Foods guacamole, pico and pineapple are almost just as good but cost twice as much. I love this place.

50.description: its a great spot for cheap veggies and fruits that is for sure, good prices on the staples as well.

4.description: This has become my new local grocery store. I like their prepacked section because I can get chia seeds, spices and wasabi peas for cheap! I wish they had a better selection of seafood instead of individually vacuum sealed tilapia and whatnot. There are definitely some obvious markups, but the best part about this location is the daily fresh baguette bread!

6.description: Ok, I realise that it's a bit bizarre to go all the way to Chicago from London and rave about a supermarket...but that's exactly what I'm going to do. So many things! They have a great selection of produce, some fruits and vegetables that I have never seen or heard of before. If I hadn't been about to fly home the next day, I would have tried everything! As it was, I got a bell pepper that was twice the size of anything I can get in the UK, some delicious guac and hummus, and some really nice apples. I had to hold myself back for practicality's sake but if I lived in Humboldt Park I'd be here all the time.

22.description: since there aren't any major grocery store chains in my new hood, the CP is a great place to go, in lieu of a jewels or a dominicks.  owned and operated by all the mexicans in chicago, it's hottest grocery store in logan square.  this place has everything: herbs on the cheap, fresh baked bread, pigs' feet, almond milk, crumbly cheese, takis, decent sales, an aisle solely dedicated to beans, cebollas, nut meats, weird brand names of all your favorite types of packaged cakes.there's not much of a "healthy" section - i.e. whole foods-type shit, but that's probably expected.  it's nice because it's larger than one-a those small grocery shops.  captain obvi strikes again.  but you know what i mean.

15.description: Ok for the basic produce, but I still prefer Stanley's. Considering this is one of the only stores in the neighborhood, I go there a little more often than I'd like. The prices on produce are fair, but everything else is expensive.

57.description: After moving to Humboldt Park, I thought my grocery options were pretty much limited to the small and pricey store on Division and Rockwell or the Family Dollar. Thank GOD my roommate told me to walk north to this place! They have a great selection of fruits and veggies, and, as everyone else has said, something tasty is always on sale. Also mentioned in most reviews is the deli counter, which is--to say the least--abundant. I'm very timid, so the first time I went, I was damned intimidated to take a number and order my lunch meat. Behind the counter, you're likely to see something like 4 guys running back and forth, yelling at each other in Spanish. I don't *really* speak Spanish, so I didn't know how well my attempt to achieve some sliced turkey would go. No problem! They're busy but they're very nice, and have no problem speaking English. They have all of your basic grocery needs. If you're looking for a specific recipe (I like to make spaghetti with white clam sauce), you still may need to get some ingredients elsewhere, but stop here first and check! The prices are fantastically low, to the point where I almost can't excuse myself for shopping at a Dominick's or Jewel, even with those stupid member cards.

20.description: This location is very spacious and well organized. I swear not a single jalapeño pepper was out of its place. Price is very reasonable. Check out was extremely fast since almost all of the registers were open.

36.description: Cheap produce - Hey yo!The real secret, though, is the massive, what I like to call "Treat Section," located towards the back in the produce area.  Everything from cheddar/chipotle and raspberry, strawberry or blueberry yogurt covered pretzels, chipotle peanuts, dried nuts, trail mixes, dried fruits....  Seriously awesome selection of fun stuff.My favorite, though, are the corn nuts.  Holy bee-jeebus, these crunchy little nuggets are light and delicious.  Imagine the old-school Corn-Nut treat and picture it lighter and airer and fresher.  And priced at under $2 for a HUGE portion, it's insanley cheap.Done and done.

14.description: This is my favorite grocery store in Chicago.  When I shop there with my little girls, I'm greeted by name, with endless smiles.  Seriously affordable produce and meat selection!  I started shopping here 11 years ago, as a young college student, and I am so happy to see how their selection is becoming more diverse to suit the needs of a changing neighborhood.  Ask a manager to stock what you want that they don't carry, and they'll do their best to get it on the shelf!  At my request, they started carrying my favorite brand of balsamic vinegar and organic milk, and they did!  It's even selling well :)  Also, deliveries of purchases over $50 are free.

58.description: This is a Chicago landmark, I don't know too many people from Chicago that haven't been here at least once. I can personally say that I remember going to this place growing up. I love their red hots and their fries are delicious.  It gave me memories of walking here with my brothers to grab a hot dog during the summer. This is a cash only place so make sure you have some handy. I have never been disappointed, try it.

56.description: The food is disgusting! Fries are extremely soggy and gross. Got really sick after eating here... but still gave the place the benefit of the doubt and tried it again... uuummm... never again!  Can't even drive by without smelling the food and throwing up a little in my mouth. Yuck!

29.description: My family and I frequent this place at least twice a month. We have been coming here for over 20 years and the quality of the food has remained excellent. The polish sausage here is like no other. It is moist without the hard casings most other polishes come with. The fries are the best not too crunchy, not too salty, perfect. I cannot say enough good things about this place. It really has the best polish in town. The area might seem a little sketch but it is well worth it. You will be in and out in under 3 minutes tops.

42.description: Awesome hot dogs and love the fries. A favorite of mine since I was a child P.S. don't even try to ask for ketchup! don't do it!

23.description: I stumbled upon this place a few years ago and kinda just went in. A hot dog is a hot dog, right? Not so. Something they do here just makes these dogs perfect... Especially late at night. It's cash only. There's no ketchup available. It's minimalistic and great.

47.description: Not a fancy place by any means, but an amazing place for a polish and fries. My number one spot for a dog in Chicago. Delicious.

8.description: Classic food! Original polish taste has never changed. The fresh cut fries are good also. Hot dogs and tamales are great.

31.description: I've lived a few houses from Jimmys for about 2 years now and I've seen the owner only 3 times. He's an older gentleman with a large, wild white beard, and he rides a Harley. I think he may be a mall Santa during the holidays. The food is swell. They steam/boil their polishes to keep the juiciness intact. Fries are soggy, sure, but they're supposed to be. Potatoes are weird guys...

34.description: My favorite hot dog joint, the onion,mustard,relish,and hot pepper have its own unique taste, blend, fries are the best, I can eat here everyday. Double dog extra salt on my fries and a large ass lemonade.

16.description: You know you have to try a place when you always see city workers, utility workers and our very own local law enforcement stopping by to grab a bite.   Whether you order a hotdog or a Polish. Fresh-cut fries always come with your order. Not the healthiestChoice. But those fries are so addicting after the first bite.  Oh yeah, And this is another one of those hotdog joints where you just don't ask for ketchup only.

13.description: Being here in Chicago for the first time, we had to try the hot dogs here.  I was told that they had the best hot dogs ever!  So, upon looking for a place, we came across this place on yelp.We ordered the Polish Sausage which also comes with french fries.  The polish dogs came with onions, relish, mustard, and hot peppers.  Somehow, I expected them to come with a bit more of the toppings, but it was just a little bit.  I can see why everyone love the hot dogs here though, but the polish dog here itself was pretty good in terms of texture.  Beware, there is not ketchup available, and I heard that in Chicago you shouldn't even ask for it! The french fries itself were okay, but I wish they were a little more crispy. Overall, not too bad for my first hot dog in Chicago plus it was pretty affordable.

11.description: Great neighborhood spot, original Vienna beef dogs and absolutely no ketchup! been coming here for years of late night bites and afternoon delights. no frills place but the best on this side of town, Jimmies is an institution.I have bought my 3 sons here and hope to bring grandchildren somewhere down the road.

39.description: In the world of Chicago style hot dogs, there are 3 places that set the gold standard for the all natural casing Vienna Beef hot dog- Gene and Jude's in River Grove, Nana's in Streamwood, and Original Jimmy's on Chicago's West Side at Grand and Pulaski.  There's these 3 places, and then there's everybody else- literally.  They are all Vienna Beef Hall of Fame members and for good reason.  All three places feature the "other"  style of Chicago hot dogs, also known as the Depression Dog or Minimalist Dog.  This is not the original, drag it through the garden hot dog (i.e.  mustard, neon green relish, chopped onions, tomato slices, a kosher dill pickle spear, sport peppers, and celery salt)  served everywhere else.  This is the stripped down version of the Chicago style hot dog.  It consists of only mustard, relish, chopped onions, and sport peppers.  That's it.  And Gene and Jude's, Nana's, and Original Jimmy's are the quintessential examples of this style of hot dog.  All 3 places feature fresh cut fries that are wrapped around the hot dog to keep the hot dog warm.  But what makes Jimmy's fresh cut fries better than Gene and Jude's and Nana's versions are that Jimmy's fresh cut fries are FRIED TWICE.  Yes, you read that correctly.  They are fried twice, which gives Jimmy's fresh cut fries some extra crisp crunch.  More importantly, the extra frying gives Jimmy's fries some extra flavor, too.  And Jimmy's fries are fatter and bigger than the fresh cut fries at Gene and Jude's and Nana's.  They are crispy on the outside, and almost pillowy soft on the inside.  In the end, this is what makes Jimmy's fresh cut fries the best fries you will ever have anywhere in America, and the world for that matter.  Jimmy's all natural casing Vienna Beef hot dog is a little smaller than the version sold at Gene and Jude's and Nana's, but not by much.  It's excellent in every way, and you have to leave some of the fresh cut fries on the hot dog when enjoying a Jimmy's Vienna Beef masterpiece.  The place has been around since 1954, and it's standing room only.  There are no seats, and the best seat will be in the comfort of your car.  The neighborhood is pretty bad, but Jimmy's always has more than a few of Chicago's Finest eating either inside or in their squad car in the parking lot, so you will be safe and happy all at once.  Coppers always know where to get the best, classic, Chicago street food, and they identified Jimmy's as the best hot dog in Chicago many generations ago.  In addition, Jimmy's serves one of the best Vienna Polish sausages in the city at any given time.  The same family still runs the place, and they are ALWAYS there on scene doing what they do best.  They even sell Jimmy's t-shirts now for a mere $10.00 USC.  Places like Jimmy's are becoming fewer and far between these days, so it's important to celebrate them as frequently as possible.  Jimmy's has defined the intersection of Grand and Pulaski since the 1950s.  They are the ultimate example of the neighborhood institution, along with Johnnie's Beef in Elmwood Park and Gene and Jude's in River Grove.  And as always- NO KETCHUP at Jimmy's!  Jimmy's was one of the original members of the Vienna Beef Hall of Fame, and one bite into their legendary hot dog will prove to you why they are one of the founding members.  Good stuff.

37.description: Being here in Chicago for the first time, we had to try the hot dogs here.  I was told that they had the best hot dogs ever!  So, upon looking for a place, we came across this place on yelp.We ordered the Polish Sausage which also comes with french fries.  The polish dogs came with onions, relish, mustard, and hot peppers.  Somehow, I expected them to come with a bit more of the toppings, but it was just a little bit.  I can see why everyone love the hot dogs here though, but the polish dog here itself was pretty good in terms of texture.  Beware, there is not ketchup available, and I heard that in Chicago you shouldn't even ask for it! The french fries itself were okay, but I wish they were a little more crispy. Overall, not too bad for my first hot dog in Chicago plus it was pretty affordable.

0.description: Love love Jimmys  the old school Chicago  staple; no frills, cash only, no ketchup. Perfect in-n-out spot! (I just wish the hot dogs were biggerlol)

38.description: This is the only place I eat polishes. Truth be told I don't even like polishes...unless they're from Jimmy's. Love to eat in the car and relish the smell again later lol. I always order a polish and fries with hot peppers a tamale and a lemonade. It's always great.

51.description: I love this joint. No fancy service, cheap prices, and hot dogs and fries that will make you want to slap your mama!

27.description: Best hot dog in the world.  No contest.  I have dreams about you, Jimmy's.  I miss you so so much.  NO KETCHUP FOR LIFE! :D

32.description: Hands down best hot dogs and polish dogs in chicago. I have tried so many hot dog places, this place takes the cake nothing compares, if you come to Chicago you gotta get a hot big here, also it comes with awesome fresh cut fries

54.description: They serve a dog with a casing the same style as Gene & Jude's in River Grove.  So if you like their dog, you'll like this place.  The fries are delicious.  Hand cut and double fried, the way they should be.  If you know the neighborhood, you know what too expect.  HOWEVER, the afternoon I was there a flock of seagulls (no, not the 80's band) was flying around the parking lot.  I had to dash inside because I was afraid I had entered a Hitchcock movie.  If you're in the neighborhood stop in.  But there's really no reason to make a special trip over here.

48.description: Service was fast, and the hot dogs were good.  The fries used to be so-so, but the last couple of times I went there, the fries were absolutely delicious!  Very filling.  I did appreciate that they had the right amount of salt on them.  Too many fast food places either put too much salt or no salt at all on the fries.  I also appreciate any fast food place that has Pepsi products as opposed to Coke.

44.description: Either you love this place or you're wrong. Period.

24.description: Jimmy's is #1 for hot dogs, polish sausages, tamales, etc...It's an old fashioned CHICAGO hot dog stand. If you're a yuppie with a snobby/snotty attitude....stay away. I've been going to Jimmy's for 40 years, it hasn't changed. The other hot stands have, but not Jimmy's. The neighborhood is 'rough' and there's sure to be a beggar standing at the door but if you want a real Chicago hot dog, polish, fries, tamale, etc...Jimmy's is the place.They had a yelp rating/contest for hot dogs and I couldn't believe Jimmy's wasn't in there. It should've been #1. Guess the judges were too afraid of the neighborhood. For a real old fashioned hot dog stand...it's Jimmy's!

7.description: The best hot dog place in the world! No one can beat this place. Don't ask for ketchup.

49.description: My dad took me here last March for the first time and it was love at first bite.  I originally had the hot dog. I was a little nervous due to the fact I love pickle and ketchup on my dogs. They do not have either there.  So I get onions and relish. Every order comes with the most delicious fresh cut fries you will ever come across.  A little on the salty side but I do not normally eat this kind of food or any kind of salty food in general. The hot dogs melt in your mouth when the dog and bun crunch together.  I finally had the polish the other day and boy oh boy. Better way to go. Same blissful experience as the hot dog. The Meat in the polish just has a better taste.  By far best hot dog joint in chicago period.

40.description: Place is overated hot dogs are very small and thin. The only thing that was good were the fries. Ordered a small pepsi and got it in a very small coffee cup SMH

53.description: You need a genuine Chicago Dog, it is Jimmy's.  The Fries were the best fries i had in a long time. I think most people would go to that facility, just for the fries. that have a very delicious after taste. I know of two places for the best hot dog. That is Chicago, and I forgot the other place. Don't even think about ketchup.  Jimmy's has high quality Chicagoan service.  You come in and always feel welcomed. This Jimmy's show their customers a lot of courtesy and offer a very good meal. I gave it 5 stars because of the fries. If you go to Jimmy's you know what I am talking about.

30.description: I work in the area and when I crave a hot dog I turn to Jimmy's.  The best part about the dog is that it is a Vienna beef dog, the only kind I eat. It is on the thin side but the heap of greasy fries do fill you up!  Don't spill anything in your car because it will forever stink that fried smell. Always remember this is a cash only place and lock the car doors!

46.description: Have loved Jimmys since the early 60's when I lived in the area. As I went into my teens in the early 70's I ate there a lot! A friend of mine and I would get one hot dog each. She would then give me her hot dog and I would give her my fries. I still don't eat a lot of fries. However, I am only giving the place 4 stars and that's because I think to charge for H2O is ridiculous UNLESS it comes in a bottle. I myself wouldn't even pay for a bottle of water, I would just make sure I have one with me. I am positive that Jimmy's makes enough money to live comfortably without charging for water. Other than that NO KETCHUP has always been a great idea. TRADITION at its best.

1.description: My first experience was very pleasant. Rushed right in at lunch time with no wait, picked up a couple Chicago depression dogs, but only could finish one. Couldn't even finish all the fries so I shared them with the birds. I had been sitting here for a while and a homeless man walked up looking for a handout, as he wanted to get a hot dog. So I reached around to the back seat and pulled the extra hot dog out of my cooler and wished him a Merry Christmas.Will certainly have to stop back for a polish and a friend recommended a tamale after they saw me check in here. Same friend told me that he was glad to see that I was here during the day. Yes he grew up in this area as a kid and the neighborhood has taken a bit of a turn. #thugsdontbothermeClosed Christmas Day but open New Year's Day.

55.description: Its hard to beat this wiener!! Has a great snap condimints fresh comes with killer fries. Took about 30 seconds to order make my dog an b out the door. Witch helps when ur sneekin around on the clock.

9.description: I had been craving a Polish for so long it was just crazy  I drove by this place but it was always packed ..I went earlier than usual and found a spot right away ! They have the best polish anywhere I am glad I finally tried it fast service and friendly too .

26.description: Before the "Chicago Dog" was defined, there was Jimmy's (since 1954), no tomato slice, no celery salt, no ketchup, no pickle. terrific fries, and i've never gotten indigestion from there (likely because of high turnover). try the Polish with everything, no onions

25.description: Love there polish! My moms favorite spot to get polish when she comes from Puerto Rico. Mega love!

12.description: Good hotdogs. Good fries. Fast service. But don't ask for ketchup or talk on your phone while ordering!!!! It is frowned upon in this establishment to the point where they have signs everywhere!

59.description: Why do I even eat here. It's like going to McDonald's once a year. Every time you go you realize why it's been a year since you ate here.  It's disgusting!

21.description: You know you have to try a place when you always see city workers, utility workers and our very own local law enforcement stopping by to grab a bite.   Whether you order a hotdog or a Polish. Fresh-cut fries always come with your order. Not the healthiestChoice. But those fries are so addicting after the first bite.  Oh yeah, And this is another one of those hotdog joints where you just don't ask for ketchup only.

17.description: I've lived a few houses from Jimmys for about 2 years now and I've seen the owner only 3 times. He's an older gentleman with a large, wild white beard, and he rides a Harley. I think he may be a mall Santa during the holidays. The food is swell. They steam/boil their polishes to keep the juiciness intact. Fries are soggy, sure, but they're supposed to be. Potatoes are weird guys...

10.description: I have nothing but good things to say about Jimmy's Red Hots.  This was my first visit and will not be my last.  The employees are very courteous and are very quick to get your order prepared quickly!  The food is terrific!  I highly recommend the Polish and fresh cut fries!!!!

5.description: I've been coming here for years and nothing has changed. They sell amazing Vienna hotdogs and Vienna polish sausage,Great fries,great tamales for an affordable price. If you're in this side of town you must give them a try you won't regret it.plenty of free parking.

3.description: Amazing hot dogs and fries, and even more amazing is the price, if you are low on funds and got 3 bucks you can eat like a king. The only downside is you need cash they don't take card, they have an ATM but it's one of those high fee ones. Yeah and the feeling of your impending murder is also a downside. Besides that this place great.

35.description: Came here for lunch around 12:30 and was in and out in less than 2 minutes! I had the polish sausage and the vienna beef hot dogs - both of which were great. The polish is a lot bigger than the vienna beef, so if you're hungry go for the polish; I'd consider the vienna beef more of a snack. I got both dogs w/ everything on it - mustard, onions, relish, and hot peppers. Like others have said, don't even bother asking for ketchup. Each dog came wrapped w/ a good amount of fries. The fries were fresh and had a good combo of soft and crunchy fries and the right amount of salt on 'em.The place to go if you want a great Chicago-style hot dog w/ fast service at an affordable price.

19.description: You know this place if your from Chicago and for all you cry babies whining over no ketchup, that is how this place has always been. Chicago is known for not putting ketchup on hot dogs so if you love ketchup so much than go to a sissy hot dog stand and have a ketchup sandwich. Anyway the food is always super hot  and comes as fast as you order it. There is always someone in there selling socks or something so you might come up on some socks with your hot dog#Chitown bred Hotspot

28.description: I had been craving a Polish for so long it was just crazy  I drove by this place but it was always packed ..I went earlier than usual and found a spot right away ! They have the best polish anywhere I am glad I finally tried it fast service and friendly too .

45.description: Tasty, fast, and affordable. Very thankful to have this place close to my house. When seeking a cheap and delicious meal, I head to Jimmy's for a two polish dogs w/ everything and fries. Who knew something as simple as a hot dogs could make such a lasting impression. As many suggest, beware and do not ask for ketchup, even if you want to dip your fries in them. Dogs generally come with onions, relish, mustard and hot peppers. The hot peppers can be very spicy sometimes, but I enjoy some good heat. I cannot stress how much I love the french fries. At times I find myself needing to throw them away so that I do not overeat and feel disgusting after. The french fries are crispy and fluffy. They kind of have a sweet taste. Almost as if they were brined in some sugary substance or they sprinkle some sort of spice mixture with sugar in it. Come one, come all and try the hot dogs and french fries.

33.description: DISGUSTING!!! Dirty extremely dirty! They keep the potatoes that make the fries on the floor! It's disgusting. They are super rude as well!

43.description: One of the best Chicago-style dogs in the city and still a great deal to boot! Extra special because they wrap the home fries right in the paper with the dog in a steamed bun. Don't plan to eat in (standing room only), so be prepared to either take it to go or relish it (pun intended) sitting in your car like we did as kids!

2.description: So cool. Went here with some friends who were here for the weekend visiting Chicago. It's not only an awesome hot dog but also just a fun experience to visit. It's no frills, cash only, no ketchup type of place. There aren't any seats inside, but you can stand at the counter and eat with a small group. Most people seemed to be getting theirs to go. They give the hot dog to you in a rolled up paper pouch that can be reheated. I'm usually a ketchup / mustard person when it comes to hot dogs, but I went with the recommend "Chicago style" everything dog this time and recommend it. No need to mess with a good thing.

18.description: Why are all the smallest places the best?! Jimmy's has been here forever and for $2 you get an awesome hot dog with fries.....amazing fries. Simple. Consistent. Great parking.

41.description: Yep.This is one of my TOP SPOTS in Chicago thats for sure.I would even call it FAMOUS IN CHICAGO.Because people from all over come here.The neighborhood is  pretty bad but it doesn't stop us serious foodies.I would go thru the deserts and caves of Afghanistan if someone told me theres a place that serves GREAT FALAFEL!!! FOR REAL!!!! Anyway,I'm giving Jimmy's a definite THUMBS UP!!!

52.description: If you want a true Chicago dog and not the schizophrenic pickle and whatever else mess you normally see, hit up Jimmy's for a Depression-era dog. Onions and mustard with the best salty fries on top -- it's all you need. Ignore the neighborhood and the potentially gruff service. Don't mention the word ketchup. Best red hot/Polish in town.

50.description: You know this place if your from Chicago and for all you cry babies whining over no ketchup, that is how this place has always been. Chicago is known for not putting ketchup on hot dogs so if you love ketchup so much than go to a sissy hot dog stand and have a ketchup sandwich. Anyway the food is always super hot  and comes as fast as you order it. There is always someone in there selling socks or something so you might come up on some socks with your hot dog#Chitown bred Hotspot

4.description: Best Vienna beef hot dogs and polish sausage in Chicago hands down. Food is always consistent and fresh. Service is always fast. Been coming here since I was a kid, and my food never makes it home. Who doesn't enjoy their hot dog or polish in their parking lot?  Free fries with sandwiches! Cash only.

6.description: Came here for lunch around 12:30 and was in and out in less than 2 minutes! I had the polish sausage and the vienna beef hot dogs - both of which were great. The polish is a lot bigger than the vienna beef, so if you're hungry go for the polish; I'd consider the vienna beef more of a snack. I got both dogs w/ everything on it - mustard, onions, relish, and hot peppers. Like others have said, don't even bother asking for ketchup. Each dog came wrapped w/ a good amount of fries. The fries were fresh and had a good combo of soft and crunchy fries and the right amount of salt on 'em.The place to go if you want a great Chicago-style hot dog w/ fast service at an affordable price.

22.description: Fast service and absolutely delicious hot dogs and sausages. Our order consisted of the "everything" option which essentially gets you fries in addition to a standard Chicago style 'everything' order.The hot dogs could be a little meatier. That's my only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars.

15.description: Tasty, fast, and affordable. Very thankful to have this place close to my house. When seeking a cheap and delicious meal, I head to Jimmy's for a two polish dogs w/ everything and fries. Who knew something as simple as a hot dogs could make such a lasting impression. As many suggest, beware and do not ask for ketchup, even if you want to dip your fries in them. Dogs generally come with onions, relish, mustard and hot peppers. The hot peppers can be very spicy sometimes, but I enjoy some good heat. I cannot stress how much I love the french fries. At times I find myself needing to throw them away so that I do not overeat and feel disgusting after. The french fries are crispy and fluffy. They kind of have a sweet taste. Almost as if they were brined in some sugary substance or they sprinkle some sort of spice mixture with sugar in it. Come one, come all and try the hot dogs and french fries.

57.description: I have been to Chicago several times, but never had the opportunity to try their famous hotdogs. So yesterday, while thrifting with some local friends, they decided to take me to Jimmy's. I love that they only do red hots, polish and fries. They aren't pretentious and they don't try to be something they are not. If you want the best Chicago dog, come to Jimmy's. That's what my friends say anyways. I loved my polish with everything. And the fries were SO good. The lemonade was average. I would definitely go back!

20.description: For all you know-it-all gourmet loving ID10Ts out there, the hot dogs are supposed to be soggy. Service complaints? Seriously?! Go to McDonalds if you want "friendly" service and digitized food. Know what you're getting. If you're hungry with a dying need to eat a tasty hot dog with the best fries, and you aren't a sensitive, stuck up snot, this could be the place for you. Be fearless and enjoy the experience for what it is.

36.description: The best polishes in town. Their fries are awesome a meal at it's own. Tamales are very good. Friendly place to go check it out they've been there for years. You won't regret it.

14.description: Best hot dog in the world.  No contest.  I have dreams about you, Jimmy's.  I miss you so so much.  NO KETCHUP FOR LIFE! :D

29.description: OMG everything here is amazing!! Great sandwiches, first. If Jacob is there, have him make your sandwich: you can actually taste the love. Excellent beer selection and Dustin always has a smile and good recommendations. Music is fun. It can get a little hipstery so bring your bike chain.

42.description: They price gouge on certain alcohol AND require you to buy additional goods to have the privilege to purchase what you came in for.

23.description: This isn't the sandwich you can order for a lunch delivery and expect to work effectively the second half of the day. These guys definitely have a mission to feed people. Plenty of bang for the buck and fast Grub Hub delivery as well. Now, I have to admit that I went into this with the expectations of getting a more authentic deli style sandwich, which this isn't, but I was overall happy with my order. The star of my sandwich, The Beast, was definitely the Haus Sauce.  Really tasty. Outside of that, your getting a sandwich that is a notch or 2 above a Jimmy Johns quality. I'm not crazy about the bread. A bit too hard for my taste, but I'm full and I most likely order from them again based on the speed and the amount of sandwich you get for the money. I probably will split one next time because I got nothing done for the second half of the day, I'm not eating dinner, and I' m going to sleep immediately after I'm done typppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppp­pppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppppp

8.description: We ordered the West Sider and the Beast for delivery. Both were delicious! I ate the west surer, which for me was a good amount of meat and the garlic sauce was incredibly flavorful. I was only able to eat half of it and I saved the rest for lunch because it's such a large sandwich. The Beast, however, my fiancée ate. That sandwich was HUGE.  My fiancée is a big guy, but he wasn't even able to eat it in one sitting either. All in all this place is fantastic and we will be ordering from here again.

31.description: So glad we stumbled upon this spot! The great selection of beers on tap (including a 2013 Bourbon County stout aged in a rye whiskey-yum!), friendly atmosphere, and awesome sandwiches make it a unique neighborhood gem. Looking forward to the patio seating when it gets a liiiiiiittle warmer.

34.description: YUM! It was so good I had to have it twice this week :)

16.description: Very impressed with this new place! Great beer selection and very good deli sandwiches. The bar tender was a likable guy and I will certainly return. I'd go 5 stars if they offered chips AND a side. Hint, hint...

13.description: I loved both sandwiches I have had here: The West Sider and the Italian. Huge, delicious, and awesome.  I need to eat here more often. The side salads are tiny in comparison to the giant sandwich, but who cares, I'm only there for the sandwich anyway.

11.description: If you are looking for a massive old fashioned Italian style sub, this is the spot. You're paying a subway price for fresh French bread, an inch of satisfying deli meats, and a variety of quality veggies and sauces. If you're looking for 10 different craft beers on tap...this is also your spot. The 8 seat bar welcomes any who wants a good beer with a heartfelt conversation and the 6 or so tables lend themselves to a quick weekday night out with friends. It's also right across the street from Humboldt Park so how can you go wrong. Great addition to the neighborhood.

39.description: Fantastic 30-seat neighborhood sandwich and craft beer spot, with a nice liquor store attached.  20 very good beers on tap at reasonable prices, plus a selection of spirits (including the ubiquitous Malort).  Excellent service, especially Dustin, to help you find the right beer for your tastes or make you a fantastic sandwich with no trendy crap on it...  just a solid sub on good bread that reminds you of what a good simple sandwich was 15+ years ago.  The attached liquor store has a very nice selection of wines (the best in the area by far - and quite reasonably priced) and craft beers as well as a full supply of whatever hooch you may need to help tackle a bad day!  This is a perfect place to have a nice sandwich, have a few beers, watch a game and then pick up a few things for home or for drinking in the park across the street.  Such a great addition to the neighborhood with solid genuine people running and operating it.

37.description: Very impressed with this new place! Great beer selection and very good deli sandwiches. The bar tender was a likable guy and I will certainly return. I'd go 5 stars if they offered chips AND a side. Hint, hint...

0.description: Repeat. Awesome. Love it. The husband got the Blvd sandwich this time and thought it faboo.  This place is a must-try. Turns out some of the drinking establishment patrons saw our sandwiches last week and ordered for the first time, then a total of three times in the week alone. Fans, fans, everywhere fans. Do it!

38.description: This place is amazing! I can't believe they have bourbon county!! Great place to grab a responsibly priced craft beer.

27.description: So freaking good. Huge portions and very tasty sandwich options. Thrilled to have this new addition to the neighborhood! The liquor store attached is also convenient.

32.description: Pretty solid sandwich with a good beer list.  Place is small and so is the menu, but good grab n go type of place.  They give you a good solid potion of meat on the sandwich a well.

44.description: Really friendly service. Great beer selection. Had a veggie sandwich and they will customize how you want it - no onions or mayo for me. Good little spot to watch NFL too.

24.description: Vegetarian review here: Was in search of a good 'ol sandwich spot, and saw that vegetarians love this spot. So I was disappointed when I was underwhelmed with my Nothin' But Veggies Sandwich. It was barely "ayight." It had lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, and a few other veggies but I don't remember what they were because it was that unmemorable for me. The garlic mayo didn't stand out either. Also, the "side" it came with was more like a "bite" of potato salad lol. Again, this is a vegetarian's perspective---the bf who eats meat liked his sandwich---I just don't think this is worth going to for a vegetarian.

7.description: What could be more chill than beer and sandwiches, and that's Humboldt Haus!  For lunch, I got the West Sider Sandwich (the turkey/pastrami one).  The French bread was crusty on the outside, but soft on the inside like it should be.  Unfortunately, way too much garlic mayo and "Haus dressing," a semi-tart sauce.  The taste of the meat was masked.  Everything was so drenched, and my sandwich was getting soggy in my hand.  This was the equivalent to the big mac's of sandwiches.  When I eat sandwiches, I like fresh bread and ingredients without a lot of condiments so this isn't for me.

40.description: This is a great addition to the neighborhood.  The sandwiches are great and reasonably priced, and the beer selection is pretty good as well.  Perfect place to stop in, grab lunch and head to the park.  I'm really looking forward to having this nearby when the weather turns.

30.description: Normally I like to write frilly reviews packed with semi-redundant adjectives, but all I'm going to say here (other than this preamble which is currently contradicting itself) is that the sandwiches here are up there with the best I've ever had. And also there is beer.

46.description: Love that this place just opened up a couple of blocks away. They have a great selection of beers on tap, the sandwiches, with fresh sliced meats, have been fantastic so far. and the service was as friendly as it gets. I recommend this place for a quick lunch or a nice chill drink spot with a friend.

1.description: It's really easy to miss Humboldt Haus as it's tucked away in a completely nondescript building on North at the tippy top of Humboldt Park. I've driven by it a million times, and while I've noted the "Sandwich Bar" marquee, it's over shadowed by the "LIQUOR" sign next door. But being next to and connected to a liquor store is a good thing. The beer selection is top notch and the cocktails are great. The sandwiches start off on the right foot with fresh bread from D'amaro's bakery. Next up fresh toppings, meat and cheeses with homemade sauces. They've got the ratio down.Definitely recommended for a reasonably priced lunch and also a great spot for a simple but flavorful weekend brunch.

9.description: A great regular spot for sandwiches and amazing beers. Selection of beers on tap is superb. You'll always find something you like without being overwhelmed with too many options. There is talk of hot foods coming which will be even more awesome. But if it stays sandwiches, I'll still be happy.

26.description: Great sandy addition to the hood. Ordered the haus online first, and second time I decided to go in to the actual store.SO COOL. I love that it's a sweet little bar that backs up into a liquor and beer shop.

25.description: It took me awhile to write this review because I'm still trying to recover from the Meat coma I was put in by the absurdity of the sandwiches my roommate and I ordered. It was probably about a month ago, after a long night out my roommate and I were looking for a sandwhich shop that we could pick up from. We decided to try out the Humboldt Haus as it was only a couple of blocks away. Walking in you find a nicely laid out and extremely clean area with super friendly staff working away. We both order the exact same thing. Large Beast Double Meat... Needless to say it was absolutely delicious and the perfect cure to the left over alcohol swirling around from the night before. Though I will never order the BEAST with double meat, because it is completely unecessay and ruins their already perfect meat to bread ratio. I've picked up a couple other times since then and each time they didn't disappoint.

12.description: It took me awhile to write this review because I'm still trying to recover from the Meat coma I was put in by the absurdity of the sandwiches my roommate and I ordered. It was probably about a month ago, after a long night out my roommate and I were looking for a sandwhich shop that we could pick up from. We decided to try out the Humboldt Haus as it was only a couple of blocks away. Walking in you find a nicely laid out and extremely clean area with super friendly staff working away. We both order the exact same thing. Large Beast Double Meat... Needless to say it was absolutely delicious and the perfect cure to the left over alcohol swirling around from the night before. Though I will never order the BEAST with double meat, because it is completely unecessay and ruins their already perfect meat to bread ratio. I've picked up a couple other times since then and each time they didn't disappoint.

21.description: I loved both sandwiches I have had here: The West Sider and the Italian. Huge, delicious, and awesome.  I need to eat here more often. The side salads are tiny in comparison to the giant sandwich, but who cares, I'm only there for the sandwich anyway.

17.description: My new favorite sandwich shop.  The place is cool, they have a great beer selection, and the 9" Italian is the best I've had in a long time.  Will be back frequently and recommend strongly for those looking for a true deli sandwich.

10.description: Vegetarian review here: Was in search of a good 'ol sandwich spot, and saw that vegetarians love this spot. So I was disappointed when I was underwhelmed with my Nothin' But Veggies Sandwich. It was barely "ayight." It had lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, and a few other veggies but I don't remember what they were because it was that unmemorable for me. The garlic mayo didn't stand out either. Also, the "side" it came with was more like a "bite" of potato salad lol. Again, this is a vegetarian's perspective---the bf who eats meat liked his sandwich---I just don't think this is worth going to for a vegetarian.

5.description: The West Sider is delicious especially with  the garlic sauce. The Sandwiches are pretty large so no need for double meat. The only thing I would change is the cheese on the sandwich and I didn't care for the potato salad, chips would of been better. I'll definitely go back!!!

3.description: Here it is, I finally found my favorite deli in the area! The West Sider sandwich was awesome, and had fresh ingredients. This place has 10+ craft beers on tap too. I also appreciated the West coast rap they were playing. Great food, beer, and music, what else can you ask for? The attached liquor store has a great beer selection. I will be back soon!

35.description: I ordered sandwiches for a business meeting (10 people).  My lunch was scheduled at noon, and I placed the order at 11am just as they opened for business.  Order included the West Side, BLVD, Italian, Nothing But Veggies and a custom Turkey sandwich.  I wanted to comment on a number of things:1.  These guys did a great job of getting the sandwiches made AND delivered in an hour.  Gentleman taking the order was very nice and accommodating- dont know if my order put them into a rush, but I requested to please have the food ready by noon, and they were able to do it.2. Delivery guys were very polite- didnt just hand over food in silence like other delivery people, they actually said hello!3. Sandwiches were GREAT!  Everyone at the meeting really enjoyed the sandwiches- we had visitors from California and Wisconsin (if that gives perspective on taste buds).4. Sandwiches were a good size, very satisfying.PS- the Haus dressing is really good.

19.description: Friendly and knowledgeable service. Owner provided a sample of a great beer and made some astute recommendations. Will definitely be returning.

28.description: A super cute place with really delicious sandwiches! Great vegetarian options and a lot tastier than some of the chain sandwich shops in the area.

45.description: Nice little liquor store & bar next door.  Sandwiches look good, 20+ beers on tap, and friendly service.  Will definitely return soon!

33.description: I've had sandwiches from here twice this week. Had it for the 1st time Tuesday & went with the veggie, it was great. Tonight I had the westsider, it was really good. Def a contender for my new favorite sandwich spot.

43.description: The Italian sandwich and the West Sider were both great. Lots of beers on tap. Great addition to the neighborhood!

2.description: This place has everything you could want. Awesome and inventive sandwiches and booze. I wish they would sell their sandwich sauce by the jar!I'll be back FOR SURE.

18.description: Pretty decent beer selection and made to order sandwiches. This place is a great local bar and worth a stop in.

41.description: Awesome sandwiches and really friendly staff.  Oh yeah, and some great beer selections.

4.description: This is a nice place right by the park with a relaxed atmosphere, clean and they have a nice selection of drinks. The sandwiches are awesome and pretty good sized. Their garlic mayo is excellent. I usually get "the boulevard" or build my own. There's also a liquor store connected so if you need to grab booze while eating it's easy. I highly recommend the sandwiches here whether eating in or to go.

6.description: AMAZING sandwiches! Trust me, when you want a real deli sandwich, Humboldt is the spot . Fresh local bread brought every morning, sauces made in house and they load up the sandwich with meat and cheese.  I had the Italian and it was so good. Salami, capicola, pastrami and provolone, yum! That's a proper sub. The staff is super friendly, and they have 20 craft beers on tap AND a bar. That and tvs, what more could you want? A liquor store to take some drinks to go? Yeah they have that too.An amazing (and unexpected) wine, beer and liquor selection is attached and Johnny, the manager, has to be the coolest dude ever. He even sets aside some of the more rare beers ( goose island bourbon county, zombie dust, etc) for his regular, loyal customers. ( so go there often :) ) Thank you Humboldt Haus, I will be back.

22.description: Great place to grab a bite to eat. Great wraps and sandwiches. I will be going there more often and the price is just right.

15.description: Pretty solid sandwich with a good beer list.  Place is small and so is the menu, but good grab n go type of place.  They give you a good solid potion of meat on the sandwich a well.

20.description: If you are looking for a massive old fashioned Italian style sub, this is the spot. You're paying a subway price for fresh French bread, an inch of satisfying deli meats, and a variety of quality veggies and sauces. If you're looking for 10 different craft beers on tap...this is also your spot. The 8 seat bar welcomes any who wants a good beer with a heartfelt conversation and the 6 or so tables lend themselves to a quick weekday night out with friends. It's also right across the street from Humboldt Park so how can you go wrong. Great addition to the neighborhood.

36.description: I have ordered their BLVD sandwich about once a week since discovering this place. The bread is perfect, the meat is fresh and plentiful, and the gestalt is great. Good beer selection (which they also deliver). Not a fan of their macaroni or potato salad, which is sweeter than I like, but if that's your jam now you know.

14.description: Friendly staff, cute looking joint.$20 for 2 sandwiches (the beast & all veggies), 2 bags of chips, a side of macaroni salad, and a side of potato salad. Not a bad price, as the sandwiches are pretty big (bigger than the large sized sandwich at Potbelly).The beast had too much meat on it for our liking, but the meat lovers out there would go crazy for it! The garlic mayo on the sandwiches was delicious. Bread was fresh and held its own.We weren't a fan of the macaroni or potato salad, but I don't think they were bad. Just a little too sweet and mayonaisy for our taste. The serving size was very tiny!Really great chip selection ("DIRTY" brand).It's within walking distance of our house, so we will definitely go again.

3.description: La Perla is our favorite place in the neighborhood. It's rarely busy, has great service, and the al pastor tacos and burritos are great.

1.description: This used to be my go to spot, but a torta then gave me food poisoning. Take your chances at this cash only, quaint, quite tasty spot. The staff is great.

2.description: TACOS TACOS TACOS So i have been scanning the city for random taco places to get another taco fix. I do not know where this random taco craving came from but at some point i ate nothing but tacos for a month! Now that i am thinking about it; i think i want a Taco!!!Well this place was a very random stop. I was driving down north ave and as always was starving again. I saw this place, busted a U-turn and walked right in. I seated myself and the server came ASAP with water, salsa and chips. I ordered 3 steak tacos with lettuce, cilantro, tomatoes and cheese. My tacos came up in less than 5 minutes and YES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They were amazing! I absolutely do not have any complaints! I have been back over 13 times (check my "check ins" LOL). I have tried so many different taco places and this one by far is my favorite place.  The steak was seasoned just right, the salsa verde was great and their horchata is very tasty. Service as always is fast and friendly! I like this place and would recommend it to all my friends.Ugh i think i am going to go get a freaking taco now

9.description: Tasty burritos. My fiance and I are looking forward to trying more of the menu.

10.description: This place is a reliable Mexican spot for any of you Humboldt Park residents.   I haven't tried a ton of stuff here, but  I really like the Tacos De Chile Relleno, Tacos A La Mexicanan and the Torta De Milaneza.As an aside, this place is open until 2:00 AM Monday through Friday and 3:00 AM on Saturday, so if you find yourself drunk and hungry in Humboldt Park, you do have an option other than the McDonalds next door.

4.description: I came here during RiotFest 2014 (when it should be said that all of the local restaurants were slammed with the influx of hungry concert-goers) and had 2 great experiences.  The burritos are hearty, flavorful, and were equally good both times that I ordered them (I went for the chicken; a friend tried the beef.)  The burrito was neither dripping wet nor full of rice as a filler, just a well made (and skillfully wrapped!) burrito that stayed tightly wound until the last bite.  This place is a hole in the wall and easy to pass - I suggest looking extra hard for it!  The menu also boasted a huge selection of tacos, and had the burrito not been so delicious, I would have tried them on the second visit.  FWIW, the staff was also quite friendly.   This place deserves your attention.

6.description: Friendly service, great tortas!

12.description: There food is awesome! It looks like a little hole in the wall, which means it has the best food! If you get the dinner, good luck finishing it. They give a lot of food and A LOT of guac!Cons: Only cash and no margaritas!

5.description: As far as taquerias go, I'm glad La Perla is just around the corner in my neighborhood. The food has always been solid on my visits, from their al pastor to the assortment of dishes "a la Mexicana" -- with tomato, onion, beef, and jalapenos. I also find the veggies they use to be particularly fresh. The menu isn't too huge (better for indecisive want-everythingers like myself), but has enough variety that I keep finding new things I like. Ask for the green sauce, which they don't keep out on tables, pour until your heart is content, and be glad you chose this mom-and-pop spot over one of the overabundant fast food chains nearby. A burrito will only set you back about $4.50 and last most folks for two meals, so it's well worth the cash, too. They're not breaking any new ground here, but La Perla's food is dependably good and makes for a solid choices for a good, quick meal on the block.

13.description: Worst Mexican food joint ever. Not only does the food suck but the odds that you will get what you ordered when you walk out of there is a crap shoot.

11.description: This place is so close to me, but I forget to go there.  Maybe it's because their burritos put me in a stupor.  They're great.  Solid.  Actually, I forget to go there because I can never remember when they're open.  And it's cash only, yo.This is the kind of place that is a true hole in the wall.  Good luck getting your order across in English (get ready to point at what you want).  Of course, I speak just enough Spanish to make sure I get the burrito al pastor.  That's good because that's all I ever want from here.  They're awfully friendly here and they make a great burrito.  I hope they're doing OK.

8.description: This place is a block from my house. I'm becoming more of a mexican food fan than I already was and my waistline is feeling the aftermath.  This place is super good.  I think the guac is good, the tostatdas are good, the salsa is hot but has tons of flavor.  And they're like burger king - "have it your way".  The people are nice and service is good and it makes for a great snack at 2 am.

0.description: Excellent place close to home. My favorite in the neighborhood. Wonderful service. Good burritos. Love the paintings on the walls.First time I came here they were playing Chronicles of Riddick on the TV in Spanish. I got stuck inside because it was raining so hard so I got to watch that on the TV with some other people. It's just as good when you can't understand the dialogue. A classic.

7.description: I love this place. They have quality Mexican food for a good price. Tortillas taste like they are made fresh on site. The service was good and my parents truly enjoyed their dinner.

1.description: Horrible customer service. Get ready to stand in line for a good while even when there's only one or two people in front if you. Even in the case of a long line the employees often refuse to open another register. The store is usually a complete mess & when you try to ask for help finding something they usually never give you a real answer or put any effort into looking but rather tell you that they guess they don't have it if you didn't see it.

2.description: This place is bright and clean, most of the time anyway. It can get pretty messy when they are changing merchandise over for the the holidays and seasons. The staff isn't the friendliest but if you know what your looking for and have the ability to be able to find it on your own you should be fine. I usually pop in here for odd and end things, as well as snacks and drinks in the summer time. Long lines can form quick in here but they are pretty good at getting people checked out quickly so the line doesn't usually last that long.

0.description: I come to this Family Dollar a lot because it's in my friend's neighborhood and we get many items for our volunteering events from this location.We don't come here because its the best but we do come here because it is convenient.  Some of the staff is great and some you can tell is just there to get a pay check!On my last visit we were made to stand outside for about 5 to 7 minutes after their stated opening time without an explanation on why we had to wait!We were told as we stood there by another customer that this is common and sometimes you have to wait up to 15 minutes before they open up the door!The store is some time chaotic and untidy and I don't know if its because it's a high volume of customers but I find that in many Family Dollar Stores.I even tried to buy a kids tray for my grand daughter but no one could get the trays apart so I was unable to buy the tray and I wasn't told when I could come back or if they would have other trays.  I went to another Family Dollar and it was the same problem so I don't know if they need to think of a different way of displaying the trays.Bottom line not the best but not the worst...We will continue to come here and get our supplies for our volunteering events!

1.description: Tobacco Supplies. Hookah Supplies. They have a huge selection of Hookah flavors (with and without Nicotine).  The person behind the counter is also usually helpful and answers any question that you may have.

0.description: I was immensely impressed with the manager of the store. She was extremely knowledgable and had a great business sense about her. The store was clean, easily shopped, and full of quality merchandise at a very competitive rate. Definitely going to make this my only destination!

3.description: I go here for a quick manicure whenever I can't haul my butt all the way out to my favorite place on Western.  They've always been very efficient, quick and affordable.

1.description: my experience with this place is EH. Nothing special. They hurried through my fill and I could see the difference between the color where the fill was and the old part of the nail. That has never happened to me before. I only came here because my normal place is next door from my work and it was my day off. This place is close to my home, so I came here. not impressedLuckily my normal nail place was able to fix the color issue the next time that I got my nails filled. I have never used a color on my nails always a french tip so I know it wasn't an issue of left over residue from a nail lacquer. Maybe cheap gell? I have no idea.

2.description: Call New Number  773 666 5100Please call new nunver the number it has is not correct  thanks

0.description: This spot is definitely not as fancy as the nail shops a little further down Division, but I am perfectly okay with that. Never overly crowded, never over priced and always a great pedicure. If you are looking for one of the trendy Bucktown shops with organic products and waterfalls to calm you - this isn't the place for you. However, if you are in need of an affordable, good nail job - you won't find a better deal. I have been here three times now and each time my pedicure lasted for several weeks without chipping or fading. Plus the girls give a great foot/leg massage and take their time to really clean/trim my nails. No complaints about this place! :)

58.description: I was walking down the street looking for a place to get a taco when something better came into my field of view: tacos and pizza. I'd like to say that I stood strong, and stuck with my Mexican urges, but alas I am not that strong. The pizza siren's song carried me in.Place was clean, the cashier was incredibly friendly and, best of all, the pizza was cheap! 1.75 a slice almost made me give pause, but it was quality. Not the best slice in Chicago, by any means, but I've paid much more money for lower-quality slices. For 3.50 I had a slice of cheese and sausage (without any wait, and they were still hot). The place was clean even. Thumbs up.Pretty much the only downside I can state is that the trashcan's pedal doesn't work, so you have to lift the lid with your hands. But if that is any kind of dealbreaker for you, you probably haven't left your apartment since Nixon was impeached. You weirdo.

56.description: My boyfriend brought me home a veggie burrito, and it was awesome. I had never been but he goes all the time (and eats meat, I do not) so I was expecting something kinda meh because of the whole pizza/taco thing.  But hey, Taco Bell and Pizza Hut  combined forces and made it work.  Anyway, the burrito  had lettuce, tomato, rice, beans, sour cream, and avocado. It was huge. The red sauce isn't crazy hot like most places, which was nice (the green? Crazy hot). So with a cliche Yelp ending, "I'll be back."

29.description: tacos are pretty awesome! i think the tacos are better than Flash Taco, Picante, and La Pasadita. the huge menu makes this place even better!!

42.description: Chicken tacos, pizza and quesadillas are poppin'! Don't forget the salsa verde. And did I mention CHEAP.

23.description: Oh boy a 10% off coupon! Gotta love these even though they only really take care of the tax or delivery fee (so actually it is "choose your antidote".) This was a new place that started showing up online and I'm doing summer cleaning which keeps me inside so delivery it is! The ground beef burrito & meat lover's pizza w/ a side of cole slaw sounded appetizing so I thought I'd try it out. I placed the order around 7:30pm and get confirmation that it should arrive between 8:45-8:55pm (over an hour for less than 2 miles?) Must be a very busy day. So I'm waiting...waiting...waiting...heck, I've pretty much scrubbed the same pot three times already at this point and when 9:15pm rolls around I decide to give the restaurant a call. The lady who answered the phone was nice and promptly put me on hold to call her driver. A few minutes pass and she tells me he said he's 2 minutes away and apologizes, all is forgiven in a heart wrenching sitcom moment. I get a call a few minutes later and it's the driver asking what building I'm in. The food itself looks great. The pizza has a generous amount of toppings spread throughout with all the sausage, pepperoni, Italian beef, etc. The burrito was big and was tailored to perfection, it's one of those burritos you KNOW is good. So why only three stars after all these compliments? Well quite frankly presentation is not everything and the almost 2 hour wait did not help.The pizza was pretty bland for how many ingredients went into it. Pretty much the Italian beef took over everything except the bread which somehow had more flavor than everything else (and not that good of a flavor btw.) The sauce was scarce and flavor seemed non-existent, if you're going to make good pizza start with a good sauce which wasn't the case here. The ground beef in the burrito was super salty which was a major letdown. Other than that the burrito was probably the greasiest burrito I've ever handled, but somehow stayed together and would've been much better if those 2 flaws were fixed. I would give Guerrero's 3.5 stars had the issues I had with the burrito been fixed and delivery was faster, 4 if they used better quality ingredients to avoid that blandness that came with all their food. For now though all they get is 3. Someday I'll revisit this place and try their bbq ribs & chicken though.

47.description: My friends and I would come here every often. Not because the food is amazing but because you simply you could not beat their prices. Everything they sell is ok but nothing has a wow factor. Recently they jacked up the prices on every single food item and it has all gone up by 30%(I've done the math) That is an outrageous increase to smack people with. Since then I haven't been back because there places with much tastier food for the same price.

8.description: Have been eating regularly  at this place for over four months now.Tonight the owner let me in after they closed so that I could snag the last 2 pieces of delicious pizza and a PiNa Jarritos to wash those sexy triangle of love down, mmm mmm mmm! Anyway you slice it, this place kicks ass. And if you don't like their food, go f*ck yourself. Turn up.

31.description: DONT ORDER DELIVERY FROM THIS PLACE!!!! I was told my order would be here in 40-50 min and an hour and a half later, nothing. I only live 15 min away, all they say is "sorry" and they blame it on the driver. This was my second time ordering delivery and it was late for the 2nd and last time, l Will NEVER order from here again. The worst customer service & mediocre food.

34.description: Walking distance from me relatives house. Had the munchies..so walked over. It really satisfied! I sat at the counter and watched the cook take out fresh chicken pieces and heat them up...very nicely seasoned. Had a chicken taco wrapped in double tortilla topped in onions and fresh cilantro.
