Also had the steak taco and fresh chips with their great salsa Verde. Then took a chicken quesadilla to go...all this for $7! Will go back again.

16.description: Veggie quesadillas. Hands down, the best in Chicago. Huge, fresh, delish. I love you! :)

13.description: Great chicken tacos. I wouldn't expect it to taste so good. The chicken is shredded and has pieces of green bell pepper. Has great flavor. I can't say about the other food. I've only tried the tacos and pizza by the slice. Which is always warm and fresh. Reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is due to the messy seating inside. And the wait time can be ridiculous at times. But it is expected from a place with good food and cheap prices in Humboldt Park.

11.description: This place is GREAAAT! I live near there so it's my Sunday treat more than i'd like to admit. The Italian beef is great. The tacos are great. Pizza is average but pretty cheap.

39.description: Plain and simple. They serve the best food that delivers to the area I live in. Love their tacos, tortas, nachos, and burgers.

37.description: Amazing veggie burrito!! I go here all the time and I love it. Plus you can get crazy variety here. Also the price is amazing for the amount of food.

0.description: You know, nothing here is fantastic but most of it is pretty darn reliable. All their dishes taste good. Value at their price point. Thats pretty impressive for a place that does American, Mexican AND Italian fare! Who woulda thunk it? Prices are veerrrry fair.Its close and easy for me, so I may be a tad biased here.Proximity, prices, and reliability are the hallmarks here.

38.description: Veggie quesadillas. Hands down, the best in Chicago. Huge, fresh, delish. I love you! :)

51.description: Loved this place! I got the beef quesadilla and avocado - so tasty!! Tried it for the first time it was very worth it. Slightly sketch area but didn't feel unsafe at any time.

27.description: Veggie burrito is awesome, and I'm not a vegetarian, usually go for the steak. Which both are amazing. Love the people who work here. Friendly, helpful, funny, and fast. The food is never a disappointment. This place has a great XL pizza deal if ur having people over :-)

32.description: I only go here for the tacos and tortas, extra meat pls.

54.description: As a picky eater, there's very few places I actually like. Hands down the chicken burrito is to die for (hey, in that neighborhood you just might!). Incredibly cheap at just $4.80. If you live in the suburbs you should order an extra for the morning after (I'm pissed that I didn't plan ahead, it really was that good).

48.description: This place is awesome. I still love Guerrero's even though I live on the other side of town and I'll definitely be back. I used to go there like every other day, but understandably they lost a lot of their really awesome specials from when they first opened (mainly like their pizza deals - the personal one is way too small). But the staff here is super friendly and personable. I just know that the last time I was in I wasn't super excited about their specials.

44.description: I always see people here, as it is very close to my building, but I have never ventured inside. I tried it for the first time a few nights ago and it isn't half bad at all. I was a little apprehensive about a taco and pizza place, but I gave it shot anyway.I called in an order for pick up. The woman on the phone was very friendly, and seemed to be in good spirits. I ordered a large cheese pan pizza and an order of mozzarella sticks. She told me the order would be ready in 45 minutes. I walked over and the pizza wasn't ready yet. I waited about 15 more minutes for it, which is fine, that's about the average time for a pizza anyway. I got home and took a look at the pizza. It is very cheesy lol there is about an inch of cheese on top. The sauce isn't very favorable, it isn't bland either. Overall it was okay, but for the price of $19 for the entire order it's excellent!!  I will def come back. I wouldn't say it's the est pizza out there, but I would reccommend if you want a decent pizza for a great price.

24.description: When it comes to service speed, they are lacking. Maybe it was because I went so late at night and the employees were tired. They were also out of the pizza slices that they advertise for; at least three customers including myself asked for it and they wouldn't put a new one in. It's honestly the only reason I went in. I got the fish n' chips instead. The food is pretty good. It's nothing to write home about, but for the price you can't beat it. This is a good late night munchies place. I would eat there again.

7.description: What the heck is going on here Yelpers? The community awards THIS place 4 stars? The FOOD is not good, the SPACE is disgusting, and the STAFF is unfriendly. Was the good cook just off on Friday night or something? Man, this place was terrible and my stomach hurts today.

49.description: This place opened a few months ago and it is a very good place to get a quick bite.This is a family owned restaurant. His daughter, son and whole staff are super friendly. The chicken fajitas are delicious. Everything is good including pizza. The best part is the price $5.75 for a whole pizza...you can't beat that. Give them a try you won't be disappointed. .

40.description: I literally live next door. This place is solid and definitely an affordable choice for lunch or dinner.I enjoy the taco dinner it's a great value and you can choice a combo of meats for the three tacos in the meal. I would skip the pizza, it's not good enough to be part of the restaurant name. Stick to the tacos or grab a burrito.

53.description: I went back to this place yesterday when I returned from the dells.... I would just like to say that the quality of their service and their flavorable food annnnnd their super affordable prices ALL REMAIN THE SAME!!! Its officially my new fave fast food and taco joint in humboldt park...yummy yummy!!

30.description: I live right by here and I'm so glad I have this place so close by. I've been a faithful customer ever since they opened.My favorite thing here to get is the pastor tacos. They make them so delish! Also their pastas are huge and really good. Obviously if you come to a place like this, you wouldn't expect amazing food or 5 star  service but the workers there are really sweet and the food is pretty good. I would definitely recommend this place for fast food.

46.description: Let me start by by saying the food is really good. HOWEVER 3 out of 4 times We have  ordered from here the order was wrong! The first time I let it go. The second time I called to inform them of the mistake only to be told I the costumer was wrong by the same person who took the order, wrote it down properly and continued to argue saying I was wrong despite the fact that it was even correct as she read it to me after we received the wrong order. I was not even going to call the third time we got the wrong order because the food is good until we were given 2-20 oz complimentary sodas.(Diet Mountain Dew and Sierra Mist)I thought "Hey that's really nice" until I opened it and started drinking it and it didn't taste right. I'm thinking they were given to us because the Dew was expired by almost 4 months and the Mist was by 3. I'm thinking next week I must order a pizza from there only if it's been sitting around since Halloween to go with the expired drinks.

1.description: They take forever. With everything. I even called my order is ahead of time this time, and I'm still standing here waiting. The food is really basic. That's not all bad. It's very average. Not good , not bad. There's a sign in the window that says" Dear Customers, our prices will be raised". Hmm.

55.description: "Burgers, tacos and pizza...oh my!"  Guerrero's is a small place that packs a large menu.  If you are hungery, short on time and not sure where to go, head on into to this place.  The menu offers quite a few items to choose from.  Nothing in the store is really expensive.  They do accept credit/debit with a $5.00 min.  It's worth going to...

9.description: The jewel of Humboldt Park (at least for good ol' quick order Mexican comfort food). I always get the same thing - carne asada tacos with onion and cilantro + limes and grilled jalapeno on the side. Pastor is good too though! The hard-working staff is friendly and seem to remember me. A great neighborhood joint! Maybe one day I'll try the huaraches. PS - Salsa verde is the way to go. Dump it on everything!

26.description: Great great great!!! It's so funny because I don't even know what to say their speciality is. But this is always consistent, great, "diner style" cheap eats. It also helps that it's right around the corner from me. But cheap, tasty, comfort food. I'll take it. I normally get the burger. Never disappoints. Not the cleanest, but did I mention..cheap?

25.description: I've owed thud place a review for a while. Very solid, reliable burritos and tortas. Fresh chips and green salsa are always great. I always get a mix of al pastor and asada and its delicious everytime. This is a no frills, primarily take out place that I definitely recommend when your hungry for Mexican. Can't comment on the pizza or other menu items.

12.description: Simple, fresh mexican. Its quick and inexpensive too.

59.description: Good selection of all your late night favorites. A good choice of American-Mexican-Italian menu choices.  Good friendly family owned service.  Pizza is pretty decent, tacos and burritos are really good. I still haven't tried the burgers.

21.description: Guerrero's offers pretty decent neighborhood Mexican food. Quesadillas, burritos, tacos, tortas, enchiladas and the chips and mondo serving of guacamole and not to be missed! If you order the large serving to go you get a (probably) 20 ounce styrofoam cup packed with fresh guacamole and the chips barely make a dent in the bad boy! Definitely worth it. I usually wouldn't recommend eating at Guerrero's. The place is small and can be crowded. There are a lot of people coming in and out and it smells...well...like a Mexican restaurant = oil, meat, fried things. I live next door so I call in an order and pick it up. It's much more comfortable and efficient. You don't have to wait for your food (although it's never more than 10 minutes). If you don't live as close as I do, have them deliver. The drivers are quick! One thing I wish they would change is that the menu posted in the restaurant does not show the prices. If you look at the take away menu, it does. If you walk in and order, it's always a surprise when you pay which I'm not a fan of. You can always ask for the prices or look at the take away menu, of course. The food is, however, plentiful and delicious. I have eaten there more times than I care to admit and I have rarely been disappointed. The jumbo quesadillas are wonderfully delicious. The burritos are epic and gut busting. I already mentioned the chips and guac, which is fresh and tasty. The salsas are spicy and flavorful. The tortas and tacos and enchiladas are all great. They really know how to do it right! A word to the wise: don't order their non-Mexican food items, i.e., the burgers, fries, pizza, etc. Stick to the Mexican menu items and you'll be happy and incredibly full!

17.description: So glad we tried this place! Lots of flavor and huge portions all for such a great price! We tried the broiled chicken and the Arachera, both amazing!!! The rice also had great flavor, I never care for Mexican rice but this rice was was full of flavor! Definitely will be back! Hope the pizza is just as tasty and fresh :)

10.description: Oh boy a 10% off coupon! Gotta love these even though they only really take care of the tax or delivery fee (so actually it is "choose your antidote".) This was a new place that started showing up online and I'm doing summer cleaning which keeps me inside so delivery it is! The ground beef burrito & meat lover's pizza w/ a side of cole slaw sounded appetizing so I thought I'd try it out. I placed the order around 7:30pm and get confirmation that it should arrive between 8:45-8:55pm (over an hour for less than 2 miles?) Must be a very busy day. So I'm waiting...waiting...waiting...heck, I've pretty much scrubbed the same pot three times already at this point and when 9:15pm rolls around I decide to give the restaurant a call. The lady who answered the phone was nice and promptly put me on hold to call her driver. A few minutes pass and she tells me he said he's 2 minutes away and apologizes, all is forgiven in a heart wrenching sitcom moment. I get a call a few minutes later and it's the driver asking what building I'm in. The food itself looks great. The pizza has a generous amount of toppings spread throughout with all the sausage, pepperoni, Italian beef, etc. The burrito was big and was tailored to perfection, it's one of those burritos you KNOW is good. So why only three stars after all these compliments? Well quite frankly presentation is not everything and the almost 2 hour wait did not help.The pizza was pretty bland for how many ingredients went into it. Pretty much the Italian beef took over everything except the bread which somehow had more flavor than everything else (and not that good of a flavor btw.) The sauce was scarce and flavor seemed non-existent, if you're going to make good pizza start with a good sauce which wasn't the case here. The ground beef in the burrito was super salty which was a major letdown. Other than that the burrito was probably the greasiest burrito I've ever handled, but somehow stayed together and would've been much better if those 2 flaws were fixed. I would give Guerrero's 3.5 stars had the issues I had with the burrito been fixed and delivery was faster, 4 if they used better quality ingredients to avoid that blandness that came with all their food. For now though all they get is 3. Someday I'll revisit this place and try their bbq ribs & chicken though.

5.description: Guerrero's offers pretty decent neighborhood Mexican food. Quesadillas, burritos, tacos, tortas, enchiladas and the chips and mondo serving of guacamole and not to be missed! If you order the large serving to go you get a (probably) 20 ounce styrofoam cup packed with fresh guacamole and the chips barely make a dent in the bad boy! Definitely worth it. I usually wouldn't recommend eating at Guerrero's. The place is small and can be crowded. There are a lot of people coming in and out and it smells...well...like a Mexican restaurant = oil, meat, fried things. I live next door so I call in an order and pick it up. It's much more comfortable and efficient. You don't have to wait for your food (although it's never more than 10 minutes). If you don't live as close as I do, have them deliver. The drivers are quick! One thing I wish they would change is that the menu posted in the restaurant does not show the prices. If you look at the take away menu, it does. If you walk in and order, it's always a surprise when you pay which I'm not a fan of. You can always ask for the prices or look at the take away menu, of course. The food is, however, plentiful and delicious. I have eaten there more times than I care to admit and I have rarely been disappointed. The jumbo quesadillas are wonderfully delicious. The burritos are epic and gut busting. I already mentioned the chips and guac, which is fresh and tasty. The salsas are spicy and flavorful. The tortas and tacos and enchiladas are all great. They really know how to do it right! A word to the wise: don't order their non-Mexican food items, i.e., the burgers, fries, pizza, etc. Stick to the Mexican menu items and you'll be happy and incredibly full!

3.description: I love their food. You get more than you pay for. Just had the broccoli and chicken soup and boy was it delish!!!

35.description: I generally avoid places that serve everything you can possibly imagine. However, because of the good reviews I ordered delivery from this restaurant. I had a bad case of the munchies so I ordered nachos, a burrito, and a small pizza. Shockingly, it was all delicious! Not only was it delicious but they made it and delivered it in approximately 2.5 seconds. I'm pretty sure the delivery guy put on a cape and flew over to my apartment......this place is now high on my list of my favorite delivery joints.

19.description: As a general rule, I avoid ordering food from places that are "Pizza & ___" or "____ & Pizza" because in my experience a restaurant is usually only good at one thing.I can't speak to the pizza portion of this restaurant (They make fried chicken too!), but the Mexican food here is dynamite... And I'm not even the type of person who uses the word "dynamite" to describe food.Their tacos are phenomenal. Their salsa is great (Though it would have been nice to get the chips and salsa I paid extra for... That unfortunately wasn't included in my order).I've also tried their burritos, and they're AMAZING. Everything they make with steak is GREAT.Delivery driver was extremely friendly. If my entire order had been there, this would be 5 stars.

28.description: Good for fast Mexican food, and very reasonably priced. Order takeout ahead, they were a little bit slow. Chicken burrito suizo and steak taco were great. Milanesa torta was pretty average. Friendly service. Would definitely give it a 3.5 if I could. Will eat there again.

45.description: My boyfriend was eyeing the tacos at Old Town Social but the place was packed because of Stanley Cup Playoffs (I assume...is it always that crowded on Saturday nights?) so we searched elsewhere. Guerrero's is on the way home, and there was no wait at the walk up counter. We got 3 tacos and a piece of  pizza for $7. Probably the cost of one taco at Old Town Social.We weren't expecting the food to be good at this price point but we were pleasantly surprised. Of the chicken, chorizo, and pork tacos, my bf said pork was best. He said it had crunchy bits, if that appeals to you. He also pointed out the tacos were almost as big as burritos! (If you order them with cheese and avocado) He made me open the fridge to look at the leftover taco so I could see how big it was for the purpose of this review.The pizza, while average portion, was above average flavor for what you typically get from those rotating by-the-slice ovens. I found it difficult to stop eating it even though I knew I was just going to fall asleep. We managed to save a few bites for tomorrow and now the challenge will be keeping the Guerrero's cravings under control. The place is around the corner. And so cheap. Dangerous.

33.description: Wow...after all the positive reviews, I was surprised to have such a poor experience.  Ordered from GrubHub; delivery was about an hour, which was within the window, and the delivery guy was friendly.  But the food?  Wow...total disappointment.Chorizo burrito suizo -- The chorizo lacked so much flavor, I thought they had given me some sort of unseasoned ground beef.  Nothing flavorful.  Burrito shell was stiff, almost like it was stale, but I'm guessing that maybe they baked it too long after throwing the cheese on top.Nachos - Container of standard round corn tortilla chips, and a cup of processed nacho liquid cheese.Garlic Bread -- Honestly, I just threw this in because I needed an extra $1.25 or so to meet the delivery minimum.  But wow, this was the saddest effort at garlic bread I've ever seen.  A french roll opened up, somebody splashed some butter on about half of it, and called it a day.Sorry dudes...I gave your place a shot.  The search for a decent chorizo burrito continues...

43.description: Great food, friendly staff, great service and very clean!

2.description: Cheap. Simple. Fast food and the tacos are actually pretty damn good. Love the $1.50 slice. Horchata is standard but it really is a local gem for po pimpin quick meals. Nothing fantastic, but service is FAST and the MEXICAN food is Yummy and the outside deck in the summer r is a winner.

18.description: You don't (shouldn't) go to places like Guerrero's expecting to have food that is Michelin Star rated food.  That being said, if you want pretty good fare for a good price then you can't go wrong here!  I moved to the neighborhood in the fall and this has become my place when I want a bite to eat without killing my bank account.  I generally stick with the tacos (steak and chorizo) or burrito... the one exception being a below average burger that taught me a lesson not to branch out too much.  However, they sell pizza by the slice that looks pretty decent if you are looking for something a little different.

41.description: As a general rule, I avoid ordering food from places that are "Pizza & ___" or "____ & Pizza" because in my experience a restaurant is usually only good at one thing.I can't speak to the pizza portion of this restaurant (They make fried chicken too!), but the Mexican food here is dynamite... And I'm not even the type of person who uses the word "dynamite" to describe food.Their tacos are phenomenal. Their salsa is great (Though it would have been nice to get the chips and salsa I paid extra for... That unfortunately wasn't included in my order).I've also tried their burritos, and they're AMAZING. Everything they make with steak is GREAT.Delivery driver was extremely friendly. If my entire order had been there, this would be 5 stars.

52.description: Open late, cheap, and down the street from my place. I didn't need more than that, but Guerrero's far exceeded my expectations. I ordered the vegetarian quesadilla to go, and this thing was loaded with ingredients -- cheese, sour cream, lettuce, tomato, onion, cilantro, rice, beans & avocado, served with a side of green salsa. It was more of a burrito than a quesadilla, actually. The rice/beans were surprisingly yummy/ seasoned well, which normally I feel like is a filler ingredient. Avocado was fresh. Definitely delicious and not just convenient.Also, it was $2. Amazing.

50.description: Beefs are amazing and huge, pizza is solid, not blow your mind, but solid.  Tacos are excellent!   Can't wait to try the rib tips.  Prices are extremely aggressive.  This place will do well

4.description: Best authentic taco's I've ever had, highly recommend. Also reasonably priced unlike other places in the area.

6.description: Absolutely delicious chicken burrito. I got a side of chips and guacamole which were very generous helpings. I'll definitely be going back!

22.description: Huaraches!!! Never had one before but this place just made them my favorite thing! Think of a combination between a burrito and a quesadilla made with a big corn tortilla. Less fillings but just delicious!!! Cheesy warm and the meat of your choice. YUM! Plus the people are really friendly.

15.description: This is the ratings for customer service over the phone.  The lady who took my order seemed to be very  rushed.  As I am a new customer when I made my order of grilled chicken sandwich she asked me if I wanted fries, I said what other sides are an option, she said you either want fries or you don't get no side (this is all in Spanish). I told her fries is fine.  I also wanted to order a Huarache plain she rudely said you just want the tortilla I said no just with cheese no meat,  she asked me if I wanted a vegetarian Huarache I said yes when she mentioned it came with beans and rice I asked if it was on the side she said no that it all went inside the handmade corn tortilla. So I said then I don't want the vegetarian Huarache just one with cheese.  With that said if she would have offered to put the beans and rice on the side of would have taken the offer. So for my next item to order I asked her for a steak Huarache ,  she asked me if I wanted everything on it,  I asked what was everything ( since the neighborhood is mix I assumed they had the option of Cilantro and onion  or lettuce, tomato,  onion  and sour cream). So she went ahead and annoyingly said Cilantro and onion.  With that said... Even if you are in rush hour  (keep on mind it's a Wednesday at  about 10:15 pm) you treat your customers nicely regardless if they ask you questions about the menu  HELLO IT'S YOUR JOB!!  SO...  This was my first time ordering and I will think about it TWICE BEFORE ORDERING and this is the only place open.

57.description: Guerrero's is AWESOME!!!! I love this joint.  Since leaving DC I have been craving a carryout.  Don't know what a carryout is well think one part Chinese, one part sandwiches, one part fried goodness and throw in cigarettes, blunts and ice tea for flavor.  Well Guerrero's is as close as I've found in Chicago to this.  They have great Mexican, solid pizza, fresh fried chicken, and good burgers.  What more could you ask from a neighborhood joint.  The staff is super friendly and makes everything fresh to order.  If the solid food wasn't enough to get you there well then check out the prices.  Super cheap for what you get and it's always fresh and hot.  Guerrero's has become my go to joint when I'm not sure what I want to get  or want something fast and good.  Thank the Gods for Guerrero's, now if they could only master some Chinese I'd be in carryout heaven!

20.description: Solid, quick, and a wide variety.  Good fish sandwiches and steak burritos under one roof.

36.description: very nice atmosphere but the food need a little more effort

14.description: After reading the reviews decided to order a delivery. It was said  that was 45 min max and I am less then a mile away from this place. I called they said they were waiting on a driver and still no food.  It took 1h.22min The food was ready and sitting there waiting because had no driver. Do not even waist your time in going to this placeBeans -  watery down and no flavorPizza - bellow averageChicken - for a 1/2 is a way small then average sizeTortillas - they give you a lot but as soon as you open you smell of baking powder. I would recommend to go to Taqueira Moran.

3.description: Two words about John's skills: Rock.Star.  I was amazed at how John handled all 7 of my bridesmaids and myself for my wedding this past weekend.  Not only does he have incredible vision and creativity but he can actually execute as well!  And, he's freaking hilarious on top of it all!  I live in Cali but am definitely going to make a trip to Chicago the next time I need my "hair did".  Love, love, love...

1.description: I have been going to John now for about 2 years... I had been bouncing around from stylist to stylist looking for someone to revive my limp, brittle hair and my cousin sent me his way... She called him a HAIR MAGICIAN... and let me tell you she was not lying!His new loft location is awesome!  Its sleek, sexy and modern... but most of all comfortable, and doesnt feel like your traditional hair salon.  You feel like your visiting a friend at their condo and just happen to be getting a haircut too. Needless to say, I haven't let anyone touch my hair since I started seeing John... my hair feels healthier than ever. I had an appointment today and decided to make it a Girls hair date with my Mom and Sister, making them appointments too... A little about my mom... shes used to cheap, low maintenance haircuts and likes it that way... but I can't tell you how happy she was when John was done with her.  She couldnt stop looking in the mirror and talking about how much she loved it.  After today she claimed her hair belongs to John lol.  Anyway... I can go on and on... but if you havent seen John at JJ Studio... I highly recommend you make an appointment soon to let him work his magic on your hair!

2.description: BEWARE!!! STAY AWAY!!! this is no joke the worst hair salon experience I have EVER had!! I was recommend by a friend to come here so I gave them a chance, and I never will again.  My fiancée and I had an appointments at 1230 and we arrived at 1215.  When we enter the tiny hair salon jon jon (the owner) simply looked at us and when back to work. no one greeted us or even said hello.  We took our seat and waited for our 1230 appointment.  1230 came and went, when around1 pm another woman entered the salon (it was assumed her appointment was after ours). at 130 I was beginning to get frustrated when Jon jon finally finished his client and went ahead and took the 1 pm lady even though we had been there since 1215.  When my fiancée confronted jon jon about taking her ahead of us, he got really angry.  He told us that if we didn't like it that we could leave.  My fiancée was shocked and said to him "but our appointment was at 1230 how can you take someone ahead of us" . He then go even angrier and proceeded to tell us that our appointment was at 1 pm and he had proof through his text messages (yess...he makes his appointments through text messages...very unprofessional) and so that technically he was only 30 min.behind and that we should be grateful that he "snuck us into the schedule".  I then told he that we were not aware he was "sneaking us into" the schedule and told him I would have much rather came when he has actual time to assisted us. He then told my fiancée that he d cut his hair in 5 minutes and then move onto me....(who wants to pay $25 for a 5 minute haircut!) He then  once again proceeded to tell us that if we didn't like it we should leave.  My fiancée then showed him the text message which clearly stated the appointment was at 1230 NOT 1 pm. He then told us " well It doesn't matter! ...like  I said if you don't like it you can leave!"  keep in mind he was doing this in front of other clients which is sooo  unprofessional. well obviously we did not stay.   a few minutes later we received immature text messages from jon jon in regards to the situation.  needless to say we WILL NEVER COME BACK.  not everyone is meant to own a business and jon jon is definitely not one of them... We left his salon and went to a 5 star salon and gladly paid twice the amount per haircut. STAY AWAY

5.description: Wonderful staff and creative up-to-the-minute styling! I would seriously recommend coming here for all your styling needs. Jessica is bomb-tastic!...that is if you want perfectly shaped brows, flawless makeup and of course an awesome haircut. John's been in the biz for years so trust that you are in good hands. They don't take forever like some salons and I always walk out with a little extra pep in my step ;)

6.description: Totally impressed with John-John!I started going to John-John back in 2009 soon after I moved to Wicker Park.  At that time, he was working in a hair salon on Division, but he has since moved to Salon Chick on Chicago Ave in Ukranian Village.  Why do I like JJ Studio?  First of all, John-John is the BEST styler I know.  Kind of funny to say, but he has some sweet hair drying skills.  Second, I have long hair and can be really picky about the way stylists cut the layers, but I've loved every haircut I've gotten from John-John.  Third, he was the one who helped connect me with my fiance.  Long story...but without him I probably wouldn't be typing at this computer right now with a ring on my finger :)John-John will definitely be doing my hair for the wedding!

7.description: love it ! great stylist !

0.description: Great haircut!!!!I came in with THICK, unmanageable hair & left with silky, shiny, layers.If you wan a new look...visit JJ Studio!

4.description: Great haircut! Been a client for about 6 years...I remember asking a good friend where she would get her haircut since she had such beautiful hair and beautifully styled- She recommended John and after the first cut, I don't dare to go anywhere else. I love going to JJ  because he is very good at explaining what cut will look best on you. Of course he will do as you request but  even if you've been getting the same hair cut somewhere else for years- you will notice a difference in a good way. I really like going to JJ because there are times when I've needed a change and he has recommended hair cuts that I never thought I would try- I've gotten to trust him and give it a try---The few changes I've made throughout the seasons and years have always been a hit!

0.description: I had a wonderful time here! I went in looking for a salsa mix CD to gift to my mother and found much more. I don't know what the other reviews are talking about honestly, but the family-owned business is well-run and has been for years. Couldn't ask for a better Latin music store

1.description: OK...so I'm the kind of person who doesn't have too much time or interest in writing "YELPS".  I do read yelps and am grateful to all who do it.  In order for me to be motivated enough to do this, I have to have a really strong impression.  First, let me qualify my opinion: I have cooked professionally for a dozen years of my life.  I no longer work as a chef,  but as anyone who is a true foodie will know; you can take a chef out of the kitchen, but you can't take the kitchen out of a chef. In my time I have seen the Good, the Bad, and the Ugly. So here is my experience:      Today was my first visit to this establishment.  I first walked in to the sub shop next door, but then changed my mind and thought to try 'Tasty'.   I am a fan of egg rolls, and believe that they say a lot about everything else a typical Chinese restaurant offers. I ordered two orders of "Tasty Egg-rolls" and the BBQ'd Pork...also a personal favorite.      So...I'm standing at the counter watching a cook dip his bare hand into a large bowl of raw chicken (no gloves) and mix it with batter, and then squish out the pieces into the wok-fry set-up for tonight's Orange/General Tao/ Sweet&Sour chicken.  His pile of fry- cooked product was considerable.  When he received my order he turned to the island sink for the quicky-rinse, then the quick hand-wipe on the apron towel...then walk over to the walk-in cooler...& walk out with 6-egg-rolls in bare-hand and toss them into the deep-fryer.  I winced.  Then, he walked back to his chicken fry project and got another batch of batter-dipped chicken squeezed out into the wok-fry, displaying considerable cooking experience and lack of understanding about cross contamination, since there was no rinse between.  Once the batch was in, he deftly gave his hands another quick-rinse, and made another trip to the walk-in; this time emerging with a generous bare-handful of sliced pork, which was then tossed into the basket of the other basket of the deep-fryer.  This was done in an expert manner, so as to be able to return to his wok-batch of batter fried chicken without delay.    By the time he strained out the finished battered chicken, my egg rolls and BBQ'd Pork were deep-fried to perfection.  The pork was tossed into a bowl and slathered with characteristic Red Chinese BBQ; and the egg rolls were tossed into classic waxy paper bags.  The woman at the counter bagged up my order and handed it to me.  I politely and with deliberate emphasis told her "Good Bye."     So the next time you are enjoying your "super-generous portion" of Orange Chicken just rememfber my eye witness account of the bare hand in the raw meat and then squishing the batter covered bird through the fingers;  Oh, and the egg- rolls?  I had to look inside: they were filled greasy glass noodles with a few paper thin slices ....yum...T-a-s-t-y.  Though I am pretty sure the deep fryer temp would kill most bacteria,  I will probably  not be making a return visit any time soon.

9.description: Tasty China is fast, prompt, cheap, and abundant Chinese food.  I've been delivering from them for a long time and I've always gotten quick and courteous service from them.  For that Chinese food fix, they've been there when I've needed that the most!

23.description: Wow. I can say I have had very 'eh' experiences with finding decent Chinese food in and near Logan Square. This place is really good. LOTS of food, reasonable prices, and hey - it actually tastes good. I could smell it in the other room before I tore myself away from the computer and I was very pleased. They did quote 30 minutes for delivery (I'm about 6 blocks away) and it was really more like 45, but I'm not complaining.It was just so, so good. I am usually not this lucky. Watch this stuff be like, horse meat or something...just my luck.EDIT 4/12/08: Not taking off any stars for this, but HOLY FREAKING HELL, PEOPLE: if I ask specifically for chopsticks, please do include them and not the pansy-ass plastic forks from Flimsytown! I've asked for chopsticks every time I've ordered and I've never once received them!P.S. love you and your mu shu, baby ;)

12.description: I love Tasty China. The food is great and they always give you a ton. The lunch special is the best deal in the city. You can eat for 3 days on one lunch special.

21.description: Not too bad.  I just moved to the neighborhood and tried it out the other day.  Decent prices, made fresh.  Asked for hot mustard and the packet was all old and brown.  Not the best I've ever had, but definitely not the worst.

16.description: Ok, so just having moved back to (grew up here) Humbold park from Wrigley Ville (and by just I mean a year ago -=O ) I had a hankering for some chinese food.  And me, being super picky about my chinese food, I was a bit nervous having never seen a decent looking place in HP.  Soooo, I got on yelp, read the few reviews on this place, and decided to take a chance on a frumpy looking place!  Imagine how super excited I was when:1) it was a little over $14 for 2 ginormous dinner specials that could have easily lasted us a week were I the type to eat left overs for days. (included egg rolls and sodas!)2) They delivered in the time they promised.and 3) It was f'n good!!!!  def will be ordering from here whenever the chinese food bug bites

17.description: I give this a Meh, not because the food is necessarily bad, but just because there is really nothing that makes it stand out to me.  This place, along with Golden Chef across the street are virtually identical cookie-cutter Chinese fast food joints.  From the menu and pricing all the way to the actual food itself.If you live in the hood this stuff is totally decent, just don't expect to get the equivalent of your favorite Chinese restaurant.TIP:  While it may appear that Golden Chef and Tasty China are your only two Chinese options in Humboldt Park, you can actually order from Lee's Chop Suey which has REALLY solid fast food Chinese.  Or if you're a real baller you could have some Papajin or Friendship delivered.

10.description: Don't let the three stars fool you. Tasty China is great for what it is but I wouldn't go here unless it was a matter of convenience. The value is ridiculously good. I think I paid around $5 for the sesame chicken and it was probably enough to feed a family of five...that's $1 a person!!! BUT instead it fed a family of one (me) over the course of three nights.

5.description: I just move to this neighborhood. They treat me like an old friend. I specially like their Singapore rice noodle and pan fried flat noodle. I think they can make any dish in Lunch special price, it comes with a pop and spring roll!

11.description: BEEN ORDERING FOOD FROM HERE FOR YEARSSS! .... whewww!I love their lunch especial options. I always get the orange chicken lunch special extra spicy yummmmmm . their smothies are pretty good too  my favorite is the mango flavored oneNever had a late delivery!

22.description: I have to say this isn't the best Chinese food you'll ever eat, but its by far not the worst!  I will say though its location is pretty sketch!  Ever since the  Dunkin Donuts moved down the street the parking lot of this strip mall-esque location has become a little scary!  Try the delivery....its twice as convenient with only half the drug dealers!  But seriously, the delivery is pretty quick!

0.description: I had my lunch yesterday in here. It was my first time and really like it. Great staff, everything was clean and neat. I've order some noodles and chicken. It was very tasty and professionally cooked. Thanks.

20.description: Ok, so just having moved back to (grew up here) Humbold park from Wrigley Ville (and by just I mean a year ago -=O ) I had a hankering for some chinese food.  And me, being super picky about my chinese food, I was a bit nervous having never seen a decent looking place in HP.  Soooo, I got on yelp, read the few reviews on this place, and decided to take a chance on a frumpy looking place!  Imagine how super excited I was when:1) it was a little over $14 for 2 ginormous dinner specials that could have easily lasted us a week were I the type to eat left overs for days. (included egg rolls and sodas!)2) They delivered in the time they promised.and 3) It was f'n good!!!!  def will be ordering from here whenever the chinese food bug bites

19.description: Wow. I can say I have had very 'eh' experiences with finding decent Chinese food in and near Logan Square. This place is really good. LOTS of food, reasonable prices, and hey - it actually tastes good. I could smell it in the other room before I tore myself away from the computer and I was very pleased. They did quote 30 minutes for delivery (I'm about 6 blocks away) and it was really more like 45, but I'm not complaining.It was just so, so good. I am usually not this lucky. Watch this stuff be like, horse meat or something...just my luck.EDIT 4/12/08: Not taking off any stars for this, but HOLY FREAKING HELL, PEOPLE: if I ask specifically for chopsticks, please do include them and not the pansy-ass plastic forks from Flimsytown! I've asked for chopsticks every time I've ordered and I've never once received them!P.S. love you and your mu shu, baby ;)

2.description: My coworkers and I have become scarily addicted to this place.  We are particularly addicted to their orange chicken lunch special (which comes with a can of soda for $6).  I've tried chinese foods all over lakeview, uptown, and now Edison Park and Park Ridge, and I love how much this taste like the cheap chinese food I'm used to eating when I lived in the east coast. It's definitely not gourmet but it definitely hits the spot.  By the way, we always pick up so that we don't have to wait for the food.

18.description: First of all for all you haters sayin Tasty China isn't the best Chinese food in the world. Well, DUH. It's in a strip mall; however, Tasty China is the best thing going on North between Western and Kimball bar none!.First: I would eat General Tso's Tofu off their kitchen floor. I have never seen a cleaner kitchen in my whole life, and I've worked in plenty.Two: they have a "vegetables" section on the menu. This is my biggest test when approaching Chinese take-out. I'm vegan, and they're sportin a veggie section. 'Nuff said.C:Wanna talk fast and friendly service? The two ladies on the phone get right to the point without coming off as rude. I've never been so delighted to be asked, "What you want?" And the guys standing at the woks crank that food out in ten minutes. It doesn't matter what you order or how busy they are, your food will be done in under 15-amazing. I live really close to this place, and by the time I walk there, my food is ready.And finally, the food is consistent and delicious. General Tso's Tofu is BOMB. You get 2.5 meals out of it for like $8. How can you beat that? If you a veggie living near North and Kedzie and haven't become a slave to this food, it's not too late. Thank you Tasty China for being an amazingly veg friendly and consistently great part of my week.BTW, don't eat at Golden Chef, it's grimy and sucks.

13.description: I usually only Yelp the bad but this time I thought I would yelp the good this place is awesome the portions are large. They accommodate substitutions without charging you extra. The girl taking orders and ringing the register could be a little nicer when you order but otherwise a customer service is pretty spot on the food is beyond awesome for the price & location and really its just the food is awesome

4.description: This place made me super sick. I had the sesame chicken and was in the bathroom for an hour afterwards. Chicken was gross

6.description: Every once in a while I lose my mind and go back here for food. I have no idea why. It's utterly mediocre Chinese, pretty much the same as a million places all over the city, and I regret it every time I order something off the menu. The lunch specials are a perfectly good deal and perhaps the only reason to drop by this place. Otherwise, ordering full-size portions is a real waste of money and an insult to your tastebuds. Blech. Never again.

15.description: If you are looking for Michelin-rated fine dining, you may not be impressed by the bleak interior, disinterested staff and simple menu. However, if you're looking for consistent, tasty, and incredibly cheap take-out Chinese food you can't go wrong with this place. Try the won ton soup! Whatever you order, expect to enjoy it again for lunch the next day, as portions are huge.

7.description: Scenario A: You want really great Chinese food. You go across the street to Golden Chef.Scenario B: You want Chinese food but have to buy enough to have late-night munchies AND lunch for work the next day? You come here.Scenario C: You want Chinese food but you have to buy enough to have late-night munchies AND lunch for work the next day AND you are feeding an entire barracks? You come here.I ordered their Chicken Lo Mein and got a large-- bad freakin' idea. The container was (and I'm not exaggerating) just shy of a gallon container. WTF?!The food's okay, great for the price, however the egg rolls are sub-par. To be realistic, I'm just happy there's a place that won't insist that I order plantains and rice in my neighborhood (but don't get me wrong, I love all the food trucks in the park!)

8.description: Just tried this for the first time and was very surprised. I suppose my expectations were set low to begin with since I wanted Chinese delivery and of the two other options i had, one had given me food poisoning and the other one the staff were so rude i vowed to never return. Being that I am a man with a spirit of adventure I ordered from here. I got a truckload of food because - as i had never had it before - i assumed i wouldnt like at least some of what i ordered so wanted variety.The stars must have aligned that night because I like it all! Every dish I got was hot and good, and made great leftovers too. I would go so far as to say its some of the best "cheap" chinese food ive had in the city. Naturally its not going to beat china town or sun wah or friendship, but i never expected it to. For the price, its the best game in the Logan area. The only reason i didnt give 5 stars was because I would have to get it again to be sure it wasnt a fluke. Fingers crossed!

3.description: Great food, large portions, good for left overs. We eat there twice a month. We always seem to get the same thing every time.

14.description: Venue = clean. Staff = very friendly. Parking = ample lot. Fried Rice = comes complete with random chunks of hard, completely uncooked (raw) rice. "Chicken" = *extremely* low-grade - even by cheap Chinese take-out standards - and served rather soggy with an odd, unnatural spongy texture (eaten in-house, no traveling).The heavily embedded, pre-flash freeze artificial seasonings added to the "chicken" will easily over-power and clash with any sauce...objective = shield the quality of the meat.

0.description: The girl with the Chrome bag was standing on my foot so I stepped over the fat kid lying on the floor in his American apparel short shorts to stand in front of the two guys with handlebar moustaches.  Unfortunately, the sparkly headband of the girl in front of me kept catching the light and reflecting it back in my eyes so I deftly dodged two boys with identical haircuts and a Karen O. lookalike drinking Red Stripe to kind of hunker behind the door.  I removed my jacket and hung it on a mic stand, but the anarchist/vegan/artpunk/electroclash band needed it for their opening set so I handed it to Maya, who was busy stripping down to her negligee in the sub-Saharan heat.  After being denied reentry following my jaunt to 7-11 for beer I bribed my way back in with a bag of gluten-free brownies I scored off a bike messenger and continued to enjoy the show.I guess they have art here sometimes too.I'm kidding.  It's a good little upstairs gallery space/printing shop, and a fun little spot to see a show, especially if you've brought along some beer.  Just drink fast, because it's hot as hell in there.

3.description: I'm very particular with whom touches my face whether it be a facial or waxing. But once I went to Jenise from the beginning of her esthetician career, I knew I would not go to anyone else. She's a professional in every aspect of the word and my skin has not been better. She's gentle and really knows how to treat every type of skin. Trust me, you will walk out of the spa with a glow that even JLo would be jealous.

1.description: Beautiful space, love love Jenise and her beautiful oasis, skin care, waxing or the usual therapy session, either way you will be satisfied. Quality products and results. There is never a time I'm disappointed with her. I definitely recommend her!

2.description: She just knows what she's doing. What more can you ask for than someone who is passionate and very knowledgeable about their craft. I came out of there feeling rejuvenated  and relaxed. This was my first facial and I'm more than happy to say it was a great experience. I can not wait to see what other magic, Jenise can work to help me maintain and establish a healthier skin/face lifestyle.

5.description: A friend of mine recommended Jenise and I'm so happy I listened. I have very sensitive skin and since I started coming to her for my Brazilians my skin looks amazing. She is unbelievably amazing at what she does. The environment is relaxing and she is extremely knowledgeable, best part is it always pain free!! I highly recommend her and will be a lifetime customer. Thank you for making me my skin look great!

0.description: Jenise is amazing. Her knowledge about skin care and customer service set her apart from the rest. She is so professional and pays attention to detail. I cannot say enough good things about her. I will definitely be a long time client. And my face glows in the dark when she's done with me! Thank you Jenise!

4.description: I've been going to Jenise for 6 months now & she is just amazing! I've never felt more comfortable & she's just a down to earth, all around great person. So fantastic at what she does. I never leave disappointed. Not once.

12.description: When I have moved to Chicago I've been going to "Liliana Spa" salon ever since. Atmosphere at "Lilana Spa" is super friendly and their staff really cares. Plus it is conveniently located in the Ukrainian Village on Chicago Avenue. There is a lot of free parking around salon.This spa and nail salon offers a full range of waxing, facials and nail services. There is also a tanning bed on site : )  What I like about them, that when it comes to nails Lilja and Rita know exactly what they are doing. To tell the truth, besides the excellent service they provide, I should admit that the products they use are of the best quality. The result for me was so obvious. After Lilja's recommendation of the nail hardener and manicure, my nails became strong and healthy for the first time in my life!!! Once you visit this place you will be coming back again and again. I highly recommend it.

7.description: I've been going to the same person to get my eyebrows done for the last 4-5 years and over the last weekend I was in a pinch because I couldn't get in to see her and I had a date on Sunday. So I called up Lilian's Salon because they just so happen to be a couple of blocks from my apartment. They were so nice on the phone and were able to get me in right away which is a major plus. Once there I thought the salon was so cute! The staff was friendly when I walked in, I was taken to the back immediately and although I was a little scared during the process because it was a stranger working on my brows I am not disappointed. She did a magnificent job and I think I may be going to her more often. It's cheaper ($14) and way closer to my apartment. I wish I had gotten the name of the technician who did my brows but I forgot. I highly reccomend going here for an eyebrow waxing and I'm going to be visiting them in the future for other services. The prices on their services are too good to pass up!

19.description: I got highlights and lowlights here after seeing that they were reasonably priced and discovering I could get an appointment on somewhat short notice. I was a little scared at first because someone had to interpret between the hairstylist and me, but the worry was for nothing. She did a great job toning down my summer blonde to something more natural looking. She also worked really fast, which I appreciate! I can't afford to spend 2 hours getting my hair colored. The price wasn't bad either - $80 for 2 colors on 3/4 head.

1.description: Lilian Salon & Spa is great. All I have ever done here is use the tanning bed, but I have literally NEVER had to wait in line. Staff is very friendly and helpful!

2.description: I was really excited to try this place for mani/pedis since I live right around the corner.  I checked on yelp and saw that thy were open, did mani pedis, and walk in were welcomed.  When I walked in there was one lady getting her hair done by one employee.  The rest of the place was vacant.  A second employee came up and was not pleasant at all.  I said hi, cheerfully and asked for a mani pedi.  "NO" was the only word out of her mouth.  I repeated, "No?" and I see a very clearly empty salon.  She repeated no at me again and said no time.  It wold have been one thing if they said no they were booked with future appointments, or they were short staffed it wouldn't have been an issue.  For how rudely I was spoken to I will never attempt to go back and will not recommend this place.  When I left I walked to the Aveda salon one block over where I received Awesome customer service!

9.description: I was really excited about going to this place; it is right around the corner from me and they had some decent coupons on their website.  I also liked the idea of supporting local business.  I made an appointment for Friday night at 6:00.  On Friday morning when I went to print out the 15% off coupon from online it turned out that it was only good Tues-Thurs until 3:00.  I guess this is my fault but the restrictions of the coupon were not obvious on the website until you click the link to print it out.  Maybe it is not exactly false advertising but I was disappointed.  I called to explain my mistake and see if they would honor the coupon anyway- they did not.  I was looking forward to my appointment so much that I decided to go anyway- even though the coupon had been one of the things that sold me on this place.  It was $45 for a manicure and pedicure ($15 for the manicure and $30 for the pedicure) I don't get my nails done regularly but I though most places give a bit of a discount if you get the manicure/pedicure service together.  The actual experience was very slow moving.  My manicure and pedicure experience took about 1 1/2 to 2 hours!  It was not really due to attention to detail during my service as it was the manicurist taking her time and not working with any sense of urgency.  I also got the impression she really did not want to be there.  No one in the salon really spoke to me and I felt like quite the outcast because I do not speak Ukrainian.  Overall I left the experience with painted nails and $45 (plus tip) less in my pocket.  If I come back here it will only be because of its convenient location.

6.description: I've had my eyebrows waxed here twice and am very pleased with how they came out. Both times I was able to get an appointment that same day! The women was very thorough, pointing out areas that I should focus on growing in between appointments in order to achieve an ideal shape. Plus- the service is $14 plus tip and street parking is available.

18.description: This Salon is rare - quiet, sophisticated, clean and they take their time giving the best manicure I think I've ever gotten...don't go if you are in a hurry and if you are letting your cell phone ring all the time - the best thing about this salon is the serenity.  I really like this place!

10.description: Great place.  I have lived in every neighborhood in the city, had haircuts from $10 - $100.  They were all sub par compared to Lillian.  Best men's haircuts in the city.  $15 for a cut and shampoo! Where else can you do that? The girl who does mens hair is very shy and quiet, which i like because I have had too many hairstylist who feel compelled to tell you about their cats or cheating BF.  Excellent service, very friendly. p.s. you may need to tell Lillian how you want your hair and she will translate to the hairstylist.

13.description: I've been coming here for the last two years to get my waxing.  I am picky since my sister is an esthatician but she lives in MN so I can't always hold out for her to do it.  They always get me in right away and do an awesome job.  She always takes her time my brows and lip always look amazing.  The real bonus...22 dollars for brows and lip.  You can't find that deal anywhere.  I'm so lucky I have them right down the street from me.

16.description: This is a wonderful little salon in the Ukrainian Village area. Lillian Spa always has the most perfect shade of essie and OPI nail polishes. After visiting numerous other salons in Chicago this one by far has the best services.  I am now a loyal customer! They are friendly and through. The pedicures are heavenly and the manicures are just great!  My pedicures seem to last forever.When getting a manicure be sure to ask to have your rings cleaned, once they come out of the cleaner  your diamonds just sparkle!

17.description: This is around the corner from my house and hands down the best and most inexpensive salon I've been to!  Lilly, Angela and all the other girls there make it great Spa experience. I've taken my parents, my sister and girlfriends here as well. The Pedi last over 4 weeks, I'm not kidding. The Manis, even with gardening and cleaning, last 2 weeks. Their facials, eyebrow shaping & tinting are all services I can recommend!

15.description: needed a haircut before vacation and didn't want to spend a lot of money for a trim. Decided to hit up Lilian since I heard they were cheap and did a great job. I don't think I have ever had such a quick and awesome cut! Sure I had to have one of the other ladies translate for me but I got exactly what I had wanted. You can't beat $35 for a haircut in the city. Such a cute salon too and parking was easy.

0.description: Recently bought a tanning package since I'm leaving for vacation in a couple weeks, it's a cute salon! & its awesome I can walk here from my apartment :) I haven't tried any of there other services yet but the tanning bed they have is decent and comparable to a level two lay down at LA tan.

5.description: I signed up at Lillian Salon late winter for a small tanning package in preparation for spring as well as our upcoming trip to NOLA.The first thing that weirded me out: the door is never not locked. I've had to ring the doorbell and wait...sometimes wondering if I should walk away...or...wait, is someone? no...okay...The staff was always very very nice and attentive. There is only one tanning bed so sometimes I'd have to wait for someone else, but it was rare. I bought a small tanning package, 150 minutes for $40-something. The best thing about tanning at a small salon like this- they let you tan as little or long as you want and don't frown at you wanting to start out at 5-7 minutes, not the suggested 2 or 3 big named stupid tanning places start. And they never push products on you.Very clean, very nice. Unlock the door and I'll be in there all the time. I also stopped by a couple of times they were supposed to be open and they weren't, but. I'll go back next frigid dark season.

11.description: Where to start!? I stumbled upon Lilian Spa 2 years ago. It' owned by two fabulous women Lilly and Angela... Hence the aptly named-- Lilian Spa. I first visited Lilian for a much needed eyebrow fix. A girl at a Salon in Streeterville had totally screwed up my eyebrows and Lilian was the first spa I found in my neighborhood. After Angela did my eyebrows-- I was her's for life. She spent a while meticulously working to make my brows not only even, but perfectly symmetrical.  I vowed to never let another woman touch my eyebrows...That was until Angela went out of the country for a few weeks.  I was once again in a bind, and decided to let Lily wax my brows. I was absurdly nervous... and Now, I can't decide who's better!!! They are both fabulous and will not let you off the table until you are completely satisfied.  It's easy to get bullied around by people with hot wax, but Lily and Angela both encourage your feedback.  Now, I've referred 4 friends to Lilian Spa and have gotten great feedback.  I have purchased a few spa manicures.  AMAZING! But, this is mainly my eyebrow spot, though they have massage, hair, facials, tanning, etc. If you're looking for a quick in-and-out experience this is not the place for you.  Go to Lilian Spa if you have the time to let yourself unwind, slow down, and enjoy the beautification process...

8.description: I have been happily going to this beautiful salon for many years now. Angela, the co-owner, has always been so welcoming and kind and I really like the way Svetlana does my highlights. I also love how quickly they are able to get me in for appointments. I was completely taken aback by Angela's generosity and concern when I came in just days before my wedding with a huge pimple on my chin. It was a pimple that was deep under the skin and I made it 'spread,' by attempting to get rid of it myself.  She immediately whisked me into the back to apply some electric current (it didn't hurt by the way) to stop the pimple from being infected. I tried to pay her for her services, but she refused.  Thanks to her, my pictures turned out beautifully. It was truly a miracle that my chin cleared up that quickly. Previously I went to Angela for a facial and was very pleased with it as well. She is very meticulous and it was very relaxing. I also discovered that not all estheticians do microdermabrasion like Angela does. Thus, I will go to her the next time I go for a facial. I also purchased a tanning package. It is so nice and relaxing. In brief, this is a great local place that everyone should consider.

3.description: What a wonderful surprise..! and only a few blocks from my home-I have been looking for my new go to salon/spa for...well..Everything*  waxing/hair color/cuts/facials/massage..who knew I would find all my beauty maintenance needs in one lovely spot* I am very pleased with my cut and color,and am looking forward-tomorrow:) to my facial/waxing and massage-Tranquil environment knowledgeable operators/owners very fair pricing..Yay..!!!

14.description: This place is so close to home, parking is always available (you can park by the autoshop across the street), and the service is great.  I consistently get my eyebrows done there, and they always look great.  You get a downtown salon feel at a much lower expense. I definitely suggest coming here for eyebrow waxing, as well as nails. I have never gotten my hair done there, but many of my friends do an I have never heard any complaints.

4.description: I've been coming here for years for a wide range of services - nails, hair, waxing, etc. I am very picky and I absolutely love this place. Very clean and professional. It's quite a bit of a trip for me coming from the South Loop but I still make it out there because nobody has ever done my eyebrows this wonderful. Love it!!

3.description: I found my barber shop!Open Sundays, skilled barbers, and reasonably priced.Not too much talking, no-frills interior, not a bunch of product for sale.

1.description: Found this place on Yelp. I walked in the door straight into a chair where the gentleman quickly went to work.I just moved here from outside Chicago and needed a new barber before starting a new job. To sum it up I will be returning for future cuts and to trim my beard! Hard to beat $15 including tip. Just remember to grab cash on your way - they don't take plastic!

2.description: Good neighborhood barbershop. ThereS usually parking available on Western. I needed an emergency fade and couldn't make it to my regular barber shop so I went in here on a Saturday around 730pm. They have a lot of barbers so I got serviced right away by Noe. He's pretty good got me a good fade in no time. Will have to keep this place as a plan B for sure.

5.description: I just moved to Chicago "Logan Square" area and I needed to find a barber ASAP so my friend suggested Victors to me. I must say I wasn't disappointed. What's even better than the hair cut is the price which is $10 plus tip because the lady did such a great job on my hair, they also give one hell of a good straight razor shave. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a quality haircut at a fraction of the price.

6.description: Great stylists, low prices and easy street parking not to mention beautiful, clean decor!!

0.description: Great price, great service.I walked in on a sunday around 10 to fade and design my undercut.I gave my stylist a general idea and he took it and made it more amazing.

4.description: Was calling around for a barbershop, most were closed on Sunday...I Happen to call this place thats right up the street from my job, only paid $5 for a great lining & the woman was nice & offered to do my eyebrows for FREE. Will definitely come back here...FYI *Cash Only*

58.description: Directly connected with Dark Matter Coffee, Star Lounge serves the best coffee in the city, bar none. There might be cooler coffee shops in the city, such as Wormhole, but there isn't better coffee.I'm a local and a regular but I'm not a hipster and Im not the take my laptop and hang out all day type so I still feel a bit of an outsider here. It helps to get to know a few of the staff (and bribe them with home brews) but if I'm being completely honest, to someone else's point, it took several months of coming here before people acted like they had seen me before and I started feeling welcomed.I get coffee here for friends, co-workers, clients, and family and have yet to have someone not love it. It's worth going out of your way for, and grab a chocolate croissant if any are left, as they are baked and brought in daily from a local Ukrainian bakery.

56.description: I stopped in here on a whim to satisfy a croissant craving. They have ginormous, fluffy chocolate croissants and delicious lattes, perfect size too (8oz)!I'm in love. The staff were friendly and helpful; when I go back to regularly drinking coffee, I am definitely buying dark matter!

29.description: The Mayan Mocha is the best! And the outdoor area is the best on summer mornings before work.

42.description: Best coffee in Chicago! I stop in regularly for espresso and a bag of freshly roasted beans. The owners are awesome and throw great parties :)

23.description: FIVE STAR FOR PROUDLY SHOWING LIVERPOOL FC COLORS!Coffee was pretty awesome too. Ordered a doppio. Got a Unicorn Blood (that's what they call it) ristretto. Super short, but super awesome. Thick and syrupy and oh so sweet.Tons of seatings with a backyard as well. But I stood at the bar and slurped my espresso like a true gentleman. No sparkling water, but that's okay. I wanted to savor the taste of my coffee.Staff were very friendly. Didn't shoo me away as I pretended to be looking at the bags of coffee beans while blocking the pastry display case.For some reason, I decided to go to this location in the middle of nowhere (thanks Google Maps), but you know what? I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago.PS: Free coffee if you buy a bag of beans.

47.description: Love setting up shop upstairs at Star and working all day. It's really quiet upstairs and great for times when you need to get in some uninterrupted work time. It can be a little awkward to make phone calls or have any sort of conversation upstairs because it is so quiet.The downstairs is so loud that you may want to cut your head off. I've been told that I am kind of like my 90-year-old grandma, but the downstairs makes me want to emerge into a hole and never return. The coffee is great. Fun atmosphere. It is just too loud. My grandma would agree.

8.description: What a gorgeous Monday evening in Chicago!  I finally was able to explore the West Town/East Humboldt Park neighborhoods without having to worry about the temperature.  As many of you've known me on Yelp, I can't go on living without coffee.  I've seen people on Yelp rave the Star Lounge Coffee Bar, located just one (1) block west of Western Ave. on Chicago.  I had to pay the visit to find out exactly what this was all about.  They definitely have one of my favorite, the Mayan Mocha.  Nevertheless, I opted to try something different this time.  Hubby and I went with a 20 oz. Agave Mocha.  If you're a cinnamon lover, agave mocha would be right down your alley.  My preference still goes to Mayan Mocha, for it is consisted of the cayenne pepper which I like.  However, Agave Mocha was a great change-up.  I'm especially fond of the sitting arrangements at Star Lounge.  They have a plenty of bar stools so you can watch baristas make your drinks in actions.  The patio they have in the backyard is also amazing and very comfortable to chill for an extended period of time.  Star Lounge is an ideal place to be during the upcoming summer season in Chicago.  Are you ready for the advent of "prime time" in Chicago style?  I know I am.

31.description: I've been to Star Lounge twice now with pretty different experiences both times. The first time was negative; (I only went back a second time because I was nearby; and I'm glad I went back in) and was in the early spring and the second time (very positive) was early summer and I think the key factor was having windows and doors open. On my first trip, the cafe was really hot and the coffee smell was overwhelming (don't get me wrong, I love coffee, but too much can be really distracting); which just made me really drowsy and not very productive. The second time, both the temperature and coffee smell were much more reasonable AND I found the tea menu which I didn't know existed before.

34.description: I love the coffee and the late hours. The Tea is good too. Upstairs is nice. Opens early. Patio is good too. Lattes are superb.

16.description: Very very good soy latte. The space is interesting and provides a good place to catch up with friends. Friendly service+ great atmosphere + really good coffee=world domination!

13.description: Favorite coffee in the city, hands down! I always bring out of towners to this hidden gem (although now dark matter is spreading like wildfire-both excited for them and sad to lose my little secret place)You get fantastic and quality drinks here no matter what you order. Also for 2 bucks you get bottomless delicious coffee!!! Who can beat that! So bring your books, your board games and your friends to spend your afternoon surrounded by good people, graffiti and great coffee

11.description: Best coffee in Chicago, great service, and nice atmosphere.   You can easily spend an hour or more here, with the free wi-fi and coffee-positive ambiance.   The coffee produced by Dark Matter is always top notch.   Have a cup of pressure pressed coffee, and take a bag of Unicorn Blood home with you.Unfortunately, this environment suffers from a MAJOR HIPSTER INFESTATION.    And we're not talking about the bushy bearded, work-jacket wearing, PBR guzzling fun-loving kind of hipster.   What you have here are the trust fund babies on their MacBook Pro's in their outfits from Urban Outfitters (shirt buttoned all the way up to the collar), who will shoot you the stink eye if you sit next to them at the counter.   Unfortunately, slapping these little brats on the back of the head is not permitted.   Luckily, the excellent coffee served here will calm any violent urges, allowing you to peacefully co-exist with all that Ukranian Village has to offer.Bottom line:  If you love coffee, and want to drink coffee in a place that is only about coffee (and perhaps bring a bag of home of amazing beans), this is the place for you.   Just remember, Ukranian Village hipster babies need coffee too, so you might as well get used to it.

39.description: What a gorgeous Monday evening in Chicago!  I finally was able to explore the West Town/East Humboldt Park neighborhoods without having to worry about the temperature.  As many of you've known me on Yelp, I can't go on living without coffee.  I've seen people on Yelp rave the Star Lounge Coffee Bar, located just one (1) block west of Western Ave. on Chicago.  I had to pay the visit to find out exactly what this was all about.  They definitely have one of my favorite, the Mayan Mocha.  Nevertheless, I opted to try something different this time.  Hubby and I went with a 20 oz. Agave Mocha.  If you're a cinnamon lover, agave mocha would be right down your alley.  My preference still goes to Mayan Mocha, for it is consisted of the cayenne pepper which I like.  However, Agave Mocha was a great change-up.  I'm especially fond of the sitting arrangements at Star Lounge.  They have a plenty of bar stools so you can watch baristas make your drinks in actions.  The patio they have in the backyard is also amazing and very comfortable to chill for an extended period of time.  Star Lounge is an ideal place to be during the upcoming summer season in Chicago.  Are you ready for the advent of "prime time" in Chicago style?  I know I am.

37.description: Is it possible to be in love with an espresso blend? Like, take it home to meet the family, married within a week type of love... because that's the level I am at. Unicorn blood may as well be the blood in my body because it fuels my existence. It is the best espresso blend Chicago has to offer. It will please your palate regardless of what it's paired with.

0.description: 5/5I've FINALLY made it to Star Lounge!! I've always stopped by the Dark Matter Coffee Mothership that's around the corner to pickup my beans, but had some time and came to the cafe. My review will be VERY biased as Dark Matter is my favorite coffee roaster. Upon walking in Friday night, it was a bit empty, but that just meant I could roam around and gaze at their interior like I was at a museum without getting weird stares. THIS is my candy store. Wish I had taken pictures of their walls because they actually had little tabs mentioning the artist for each hanging. Naturally, I questioned the baristas about some new beans and they were very insightful and gave great recommendations that suited my tastes. I liked the fact they weren't trying to push any purchases, but were genuine in the recommendations. They told me Friday's are $2 off beans and psh, of course I'm buying a bag then!! You had me at first taste, you don't have to convince me otherwise.I read some reviews and regret not checking out their upstairs, I was too busy rummaging through their merchandise, like "Look at this jar with their logo!" as my friend proceeds to roll their eyes. Small thing that caught my eye was how tiny their main floor, bathroom sink was. I wouldn't suggest this for the claustrophobic, but that thing was cool! Sorry I don't take pictures in the bathroom.I grabbed a cortado and sank into my seat. How can something so small make such a big impact? The Unicorn Blood was velvety smooth with the perfect balance of milk. The worst part was sipping the drink knowing it was coming to an end soon. It was Friday night and wasn't planning on slamming down 5 cortados (wish I could though...). I've bought the Unicorn Blood before, but realized the world of difference in having it as an espresso than the normal pourover at home. Got my loyalty card stamped and took my Giant Step to begin my Friday night in Chicago strong.

38.description: Love this place! Love supreme brew is my favorite and the ice tea selection in the summer is the best around.!

51.description: Aside from the great coffee, the atmosphere is really nice to get some work done (as long as you can deal with occasional rap music playing over the speakers). Their Chai Tea Lattes are also homemade (not from a box) so they're very good.

27.description: Wanted to get out of the city to try something new last week, and Star Lounge was SO worth the trip.Having worked in a few really special cafes, I'm very particular about my coffee. Ever since I got to Chicago, it has almost seemed safer to make my own brew than to buy -- so I've been scoping out new roasteries, buying their beans, and enjoying the atmosphere. I didn't try their brewed coffee in-house (already had a healthy caffeine buzz), but I did buy a bag of their "A Love Supreme" House Blend. I brew with Chemex, and for the past few days I've been really pleased with the taste and quality. The bean isn't over-roasted, and has a nice balanced flavor. Star Lounge has an incredible feel. Very friendly baristas who seem like they know what they're doing -- and that's probably the most important part. The music was a bit loud, but I tend to like that in a cafe, so hey. Only note is that they didn't have a ton of snacking options. But who am I to get picky, you come to a cafe for coffee. tl;dr Loved the atmosphere, beans are well-roasted for home consumption, great place to relax and enjoy a great brew. Definitely going back.

32.description: Ok. Let me start by saying that I LOVE and have loved dark matter coffee for years now. I think they make some of the best coffee in Chicago and will always always always come here whenever I have the chance.Let me follow that by saying that I just had possibly the worst shot of espresso I've ever paid for, served by one of the rudest baristas I've ever met. I've had mind-blowing, BEAUTIFUL shots pulled by WONDERFUL baristas at star lounge, but this was a gross, under-extracted ounce of sludge.I'll stay forever faithful to the unicorn blood, but, please, for the love of good coffee, train your baristas.

54.description: Wow absolutely stunning. Fresh roasts, fine environment. Upstairs chillVery good scene

48.description: I love Star Lounge. Amazing coffee and the most wonderful staff. Very knowledgeable and helpful. Always playing good music downstairs and quiet upstairs. Great place to do some work.

44.description: My favorite coffee shop in Chicago! The vanilla latte is pretty much a good as it gets. The tea is pretty good (but I'm not a huge tea person).  I often come here to work on homework or chat with friends. There's plenty of seating and great atmosphere. The upstairs is good for studying and work because they have plenty of tables and don't play music. The downstairs is great for meeting up with people or chatting with the baristas. I absolutely love the environment here!Also the back patio is spacious and dogs are welcome out there.

24.description: I've lost count on the number of delightful Dark Matter Coffee espressos and specialty lattes I've had here (and the Mothership and Osmium) and never ever ever once have I had one remotely crappy or even mediocre coffee.
