That's it, I'm in love. Who knew I was so easy?p.s. Just don't call me a coffee 'ho (but if you insist, buy me some and prove it).p.p.s. Jokes aside, Dark Matter Coffee is SO GOOD I even do mail order now if I run out of beans in my home brew lineup. I'd probably mail order a Star Lounge barista or accept traveling volunteer visiting baristas too too (DM me, boo).

7.description: 5 stars seems a little much for a coffee shop -- doesn't it?Let me tell you why only 1 out of 20 coffee shops reach this esteemed status:(1) Some of the best coffee in town. This is a must to earn 5 stars. Consistently well brewed. Espresso delicious. Best Iced Vanilla Latte in town.(2) Having come here 20+ times, the Wi-Fi has never been an issue. This is a must to earn 5 stars. Never slow, never finicky, never elusive. BUT, it isn't always easy to connect to it once you're outside on the patio. I'm going to go ahead and try to convince you this was a conscious decision by Star because they want the outside to be free from connectivity, so much as they can help it, for your benefit of enjoying the air, the people, and the space around you. That's why the patio is free from Wi-Fi waves, not because their routers aren't strong enough to reach out there.(3) It's a place for everyone. Outside patio for when it's nice. Downstairs space when you want good, loud music and activity. Bar seating if you came alone or you want to talk up your barista-friend. A couple long, communal tables that make it easy to share with strangers on a packed morning. And, don't fret -- an ENTIRE UPSTAIRS where the music barely reaches for students, programmers, writers, businessmen, and the extreme introverts who can quite literally hide away. There should be a separate Yelp review for "Star Lounge - Upstairs", maybe even a separate tax.(4) Loyalty cards. A place like Star does not need a loyalty card to gain traffic. But they have them, and they are a lovely bonus.(5) Star has as many restrooms as it does menu items. That might not actually be true. But they have 3 restrooms. 2 downstairs and 1 upstairs. Think of the assurance that this gives you, being that caffeine is a natural diuretic..(6) Sometimes, a barista named Dennis works there. He's cool and his babies warrant another star on their own. And his wife cuts my hair and I look damn good.

49.description: If you have a life or even a job to get to in the morning, don't stop here for a cup of coffee in the morning. Well maybe a cup of coffee but certainly not anything as fancy as a latte. Waited for over 15 minutes after saying something at 10 minutes and then watching the barista make an Americano for the gal who had been waiting not even a minute. Had to walk without my $5 or latte. Great coffee but unless you have no where to be, not worth it.

40.description: I've been coming here every so often for the past year because their Mayan Mocha and their Agave Lattes will make you keep coming back for more! The Mayan Mocha has a nice little kick to it and the Agave Latte is the perfect amount of sweet.They play good music and have awesome art on the walls and outside in their patio section out back including works by JC Rivera.

53.description: Great shop. Service feels more purposeful than, say, a Caffe Streets, without losing the independent coffee shop feeling.If I'm not going as far as North & Milkwaukee, Star Lounge is the obvious stop for joe on the go.

30.description: Have been coming here almost every day for 6 months. Always, I get two large iced wake n bakes. ways delicious. Atmosphere is very chill and the staff is wonderful and fast.

46.description: Great, locally roasted coffee in a cool cafe. Super friendly staff as well

1.description: The coffee is good.  Very good, however,  everything else is hard to accept.  This place is dirty.  Dirty doors to bathroom,  dirty walls,  crumbles on the floor next to the walls.  Laud music.  Without noise reducing headphones I couldn't hear my thoughts.  For the crew -  it looks like it's not working place but social networking place.  I would be OK with that if this coffee shop would be cleaner and the line would go faster.  Once again -  great coffee,  lousy place.

55.description: Star Lounge Coffee Bar was my first stop of the day. I walked inside and could immediately see the crossroads of coffee shop and bar. There is a bar that runs up one side of the room, but it serves coffee and pastries. Star Wars inspired paintings lines the walls, a neon sign hangs on the opposite wall, and a disco ball hangs from the ceiling. The outside patio is closed, but graffiti art can be seen from inside. I tried the regular iced latte and the iced agave latte. If you like chai tea lattes, definitely try the agave latte--almost like a cinnamon toast crunch flavor. However, if you prefer the taste of coffee, like me, go for the latte. The flavor of the beans really stands out as something special. If you decide to stay in, you get a nice mug for your hot beverage. Don't forget that there is additional seating upstairs. This coffee shop gets fairly crowded because really, it is worth it.

9.description: Better than Starbucks! After finally trying Star Lounge I don't want any other coffee. My personal favorite is the agave latte!  So delicious and doesn't taste like burned coffee beans! I'm happy with my coffee every time I leave. They also have sort of like a rewards program where after you buy 10 coffees you get one for free. The place is usually very crowded but the baristas still find time to draw a cute leaf or heart and are always smiling and friendly.

26.description: blah blah blah. I still remember about three years ago when this place had not exploded yet and employees were nice and did their job. Now this place has decayed. I don't expect employees to greet me with a red carpet and fan me or feed me grapes like royalty but please! When I order a coffee from the person behind the counter I would appreciate to at least see a person who does not act like my order is an inconvenience. Where do they find these people? They walk around looking miserable and to make things worse they don't communicate with each other. I always have to double check that they've made my drink the way I originally ordered because for some reason it's always wrong. You have less than 10 ingredients or varieties to work with and you can't get it right? I know that poor worker performance is usually the reflection of poor or abusive management... is that what is going on? Who knows. This place blows.

25.description: UPDATE: changed my review from 1 back to 5 stars, they upgraded their high speed, it's now 30mbps.So of course their coffee rocks.  I compare it to Blue Bottle in SF.  Quality, rich beans.  It's got that "beefy" taste I like to call it when you have their mochas or lattes, and coffee that has that beefy sorta taste is the best.  You cannot find a better roaster in Chicago, and no Intelligensia doesn't come close to Dark Matter beans, sorry to tell ya.

12.description: I love this place because of the laid back atmosphere. I've been coming here for more than three years and it's one of my favorite neighborhood spots. They have a great selection of coffee and teas for those that stay away from the caffeine. You can spend your time outside on the spacious patio, downstairs where the music is sometimes blaring a little too loud, or head upstairs to the quiet study space. I prefer to be upstairs. There is always local art around as well as local goodies from independent  places. My favorite thing is being able to grab a fresh Nutella croissant that is from west town bakery here! I seriously had to wean myself off of them because they are addicting. Lastly, but importantly for coffee snobs, the coffee is a bit acidic. I'm not a fan of the dark roast because when I add a milk substitute it doesn't mix well. I do recommend the chai tea latte!

59.description: Favorite coffee shop in Chicago. Great brew, friendly knowledgeable staff, comfy atmosphere. Love the dog friendly patio in the back!

21.description: Good place for coffee and connecting to wifi.It's not a chain and the people working there are serious about coffee but not so much that you feel they are trying to be coffee sommeliers. Good place with a nice outdoor section, wall outlets and wifi.

17.description: I'd been meaning to try this place for a while, having heard about it, but I hadn't gotten around to it and didn't know exactly where it was. So I was biking along Chicago about to pull out my phone to look for a coffee place when I looked up and saw a Dark Matter sign. It was positively providential. My go-to and meter stick is a latte. this one was decent, the coffee flavor was nice, but it was definitely milkier than other lattes ice had recently. Next time I'll try one of their concoctions. But I really liked the vibe, it was unique, and felt very westtown Chicago. there are some coffee places you could easily find anywhere, from LA to new York. This one not so much, imo.You'll recognize the place by the mass of bikes parked outside. there's also a bunch of street parking around. There's lots of seating, including on a nice patio. The chairs out there look like uncomfortable iron things, but you sit down and it turns out they have some bounce, and are like rocking chairs. The spray painted walls and fences outside are great, and I could help but smile upon seeing them. There were a bunch of people waiting, but the barista was quick and it wasn't a long wait. They brew a bunch of their own blends fresh, and I'm looking forward to some home-brewed unicorn blood.

10.description: I went on a trek here because I wanted to try a different local coffee shop in the nearby area and this was next on my list. There were a lot of people there even though it was the middle of the day. Plenty of people were sitting at the bar while there were at tables. There was also seating upstairs, which I didn't even need to check out because I found seating right downstairs near the bar area. I ordered an 8 oz latte and a sea salt bagel with cream cheese. I was a little disappointed because there was a plastic knife, a Philadelphia cream cheese, and he didn't offer to toast it. I know I probably sound like the most spoiled, pickiest person on the planet, but I definitely have received that basic service at similar cafes. I was also a little disappointed by my 8 oz latte because it came in a paper cup. The barista had warned me before ordering that the largest size comes in a to-go cup, but I wish that he had informed me that the smallest size would also come in a paper cup. All of that aside, the coffee was delicious (for coffee--I'm not a big drinker) and also had the most adorable little latte heart! It was very Instagrammable (my favorite). The atmosphere at Star Lounge is great and very laid-back. I felt relaxed there and was also able to get down to business to get work done on my laptop. A lot of the people there seemed to be regulars and there was a lot of greeting each other. I loved that sense of community! So, even though the bagel was two stars and I wanted a real cup for my latte, everything else was five stars. What a cute place!j

5.description: I've lost count on the number of delightful Dark Matter Coffee espressos and specialty lattes I've had here (and the Mothership and Osmium) and never ever ever once have I had one remotely crappy or even mediocre coffee. That's it, I'm in love. Who knew I was so easy?p.s. Just don't call me a coffee 'ho (but if you insist, buy me some and prove it).p.p.s. Jokes aside, Dark Matter Coffee is SO GOOD I even do mail order now if I run out of beans in my home brew lineup. I'd probably mail order a Star Lounge barista or accept traveling volunteer visiting baristas too too (DM me, boo).

3.description: I came here on a early afternoon day and I was shock that it was packed since it was a weekday. The inside doesn't have much tables so my friend and I had to wait awhile for a table. I ordered their matcha which was pretty decent. Their wifi is really fast unlike other cafes. It's a good studying place with nice atmosphere. However, I wish their place is bigger with more tables. They have more tables outside but that is for the summer.

35.description: Unique coffee shop: it looks like a tavern with a long bar. But instead of slanging booze they have delicious coffee and some good-looking pastries (I can vouch for the donut). Pick up some good coffee beans to brew at home while you're there. Last but not least is out back: a concrete deck with picnic tables to enjoy your coffee and sunshine. There is great southern exposure and shelter from the wind so you can sit even when it's a little chilly.

19.description: FIVE STAR FOR PROUDLY SHOWING LIVERPOOL FC COLORS!Coffee was pretty awesome too. Ordered a doppio. Got a Unicorn Blood (that's what they call it) ristretto. Super short, but super awesome. Thick and syrupy and oh so sweet.Tons of seatings with a backyard as well. But I stood at the bar and slurped my espresso like a true gentleman. No sparkling water, but that's okay. I wanted to savor the taste of my coffee.Staff were very friendly. Didn't shoo me away as I pretended to be looking at the bags of coffee beans while blocking the pastry display case.For some reason, I decided to go to this location in the middle of nowhere (thanks Google Maps), but you know what? I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago.PS: Free coffee if you buy a bag of beans.

28.description: Good people and good coffee. Solid patio for relaxing too.

45.description: I'd been meaning to try this place for a while, having heard about it, but I hadn't gotten around to it and didn't know exactly where it was. So I was biking along Chicago about to pull out my phone to look for a coffee place when I looked up and saw a Dark Matter sign. It was positively providential. My go-to and meter stick is a latte. this one was decent, the coffee flavor was nice, but it was definitely milkier than other lattes ice had recently. Next time I'll try one of their concoctions. But I really liked the vibe, it was unique, and felt very westtown Chicago. there are some coffee places you could easily find anywhere, from LA to new York. This one not so much, imo.You'll recognize the place by the mass of bikes parked outside. there's also a bunch of street parking around. There's lots of seating, including on a nice patio. The chairs out there look like uncomfortable iron things, but you sit down and it turns out they have some bounce, and are like rocking chairs. The spray painted walls and fences outside are great, and I could help but smile upon seeing them. There were a bunch of people waiting, but the barista was quick and it wasn't a long wait. They brew a bunch of their own blends fresh, and I'm looking forward to some home-brewed unicorn blood.

33.description: Close your eyes, imagine you are a home owner and you have suddenly decided to do a home make over and turn your crib into a coffee shop... not just one floor.. both floors. Hire some mildly annoyed, but helpful staff and put some sweet skateboard art on the walls. Sell good coffee and quaint espresso drinks served in big white mugs, foam art and all. Play great music and have terribly slow wi-fi. Wait... don't to any of this.. the people at Star Lounge Coffee Bar beat you to it.

43.description: Awesome lounge/bar for coffee people.Music: Usually plays rock/metal(?).Good wi-fi. Free water in glass bottle pitchers.One bathroom with cool "Aztecan" kind of design on the walls.Their brewed coffee is ah-mazing. I can only handle one mug of coffee for the day, but I ended up getting another. FREE REFILLS for here. I am gonna come back to try their other types of coffee.Good for: People chilling/hanging out with friends. Coffee enthusiasts/drinkers.Not good for: quiet study/reading place.

2.description: Pros:  Great environment, nice flavored drinks.  Cons:  Potentially weird service, most of the coffee tastes like slightly burnt blueberries.I like coming here a few times a year when I'm feeling indulgent and want a Mayan Mocha.  Generally their 20 oz is served as two small drinks - I love this because you can space them out over the course of your time there.  For some reason, the last two times that I've been here they have just served it up in one large to-go cup, completely defeating the purpose of my ordering that size in the first place.I've bought their beans a few times and wasn't incredibly impressed.  Still, it's a nice spot to go to when you want to mix it up.  If you want to sit around and sip on a frothy, sugary, spicy coffee drink then you could do a lot worse.

18.description: Star Lounge Coffee Bar was my first stop of the day. I walked inside and could immediately see the crossroads of coffee shop and bar. There is a bar that runs up one side of the room, but it serves coffee and pastries. Star Wars inspired paintings lines the walls, a neon sign hangs on the opposite wall, and a disco ball hangs from the ceiling. The outside patio is closed, but graffiti art can be seen from inside. I tried the regular iced latte and the iced agave latte. If you like chai tea lattes, definitely try the agave latte--almost like a cinnamon toast crunch flavor. However, if you prefer the taste of coffee, like me, go for the latte. The flavor of the beans really stands out as something special. If you decide to stay in, you get a nice mug for your hot beverage. Don't forget that there is additional seating upstairs. This coffee shop gets fairly crowded because really, it is worth it.

41.description: I went on a trek here because I wanted to try a different local coffee shop in the nearby area and this was next on my list. There were a lot of people there even though it was the middle of the day. Plenty of people were sitting at the bar while there were at tables. There was also seating upstairs, which I didn't even need to check out because I found seating right downstairs near the bar area. I ordered an 8 oz latte and a sea salt bagel with cream cheese. I was a little disappointed because there was a plastic knife, a Philadelphia cream cheese, and he didn't offer to toast it. I know I probably sound like the most spoiled, pickiest person on the planet, but I definitely have received that basic service at similar cafes. I was also a little disappointed by my 8 oz latte because it came in a paper cup. The barista had warned me before ordering that the largest size comes in a to-go cup, but I wish that he had informed me that the smallest size would also come in a paper cup. All of that aside, the coffee was delicious (for coffee--I'm not a big drinker) and also had the most adorable little latte heart! It was very Instagrammable (my favorite). The atmosphere at Star Lounge is great and very laid-back. I felt relaxed there and was also able to get down to business to get work done on my laptop. A lot of the people there seemed to be regulars and there was a lot of greeting each other. I loved that sense of community! So, even though the bagel was two stars and I wanted a real cup for my latte, everything else was five stars. What a cute place!j

52.description: I stumbled across this place unintentionally (the coffee shop we drove into the city for had a broken espresso machine... whaaaa?) but I am SO happy I did!The atmosphere here is AWESOME. Cool Star Wars-inspired paintings all over the walls, a long bar counter, friendly baristas that clearly love their jobs, an outdoor patio with some sweet graffiti, Oasis BLASTING (I'm talking concert-style loudness) on the sound system... And that's just the beginning.Their menu is fabulous! Lots of fun latte options that you won't find everywhere. I ordered a 20 oz. Mayan Mocha (espresso, steamed milk, chocolate, agave, cinnamon, cayenne pepper... I may be missing something?) and drank every last drop. The latte art, a lovely little Valentine's Day heart, was just icing on the cake. I didn't order a pastry, but my oh my, they made my mouth water.The bottom line: If I had my own coffee shop, it'd probably be something just like this. I will most definitely be back!

50.description: I was just searching for a nice place to grab coffee. This little coffe shop is soo nice! They have WiFi so I will definitely come back when I need to wrk on something! Love it!!!!!

4.description: While I'm not certain I'm in love with the coffee, I am in love with this space.Star Lounge, seemingly, has taken a converted bar space in Ukie Village/Humboldt Park and turned it into a really awesome coffee shop. They carry doughnuts here - I believe the varieties are from Do-Rite downtown - and many other pastries and sandwiches. The Wi-Fi here is fast and the space for doing work is plenty. As a law student, I am always looking for good coffee shops with places to spread my casebooks out and a good cup of coffee to keep me motivated. Star Lounge even has a backyard for when it's warm out!While I have not had the chance to have anything beyond the pour over or latte, the drip I've had here is a little off-putting. Dark Matter is known to have the best blends in the city, so I think I just need to have another variety next time!Parking is tricky if you're coming from the east, but usually you can get a spot on Maplewood or Rockwell. The #66 bus stops right out front as well for anyone looking to get here via CTA!This must be one of the best spaces I've seen across Chicago - so while my review doesn't give the coffee justice perhaps the space will convince you to make a visit!

6.description: This is the second cafe I visited on the most recent Chicago trip. Dark Matter caught my eyes a few months ago because I began hearing stories that these guys were making coffee with green beans aged in used whiskey barrels. Yeah, seriously and beyond the fact that I love Bourbon and Scotch, the concept had me intrigued yet every time I tried to order the beans, they were sold out online.Overall:I was here Saturday morning around 9AM and it was a packed house. Too cold to sit outside but they have an awesome sitting area with benches and a mural out back. The bar itself is long and seats about 18 people with a few tables scattered around. I ordered an espresso, Chai Soy Latte and a pour-over of their Barrel Aged Eden Coffee. Layout was nice but the line for coffee took a while to get through. They also had some cold brew on draft presumably on Nitrogen and they offered tea as well. Sorry to any Dark Matter lovers, I probably won't return as you'll see from my notes below but maybe I'll give it a second chance next time I'm in Chicago and update this review.Espresso:I was fairly happy with it. It was dense but a bit too bitter for my liking. Nice crema but the espresso was served not very hot like I could have drank it immediately down the gullet which was surprising but also a bit troublesome. Not sure why it was so 'warm' instead of hot but still the taste was okay. 6/10Chai Tea Latte:This wasn't my drink so I only had a sip of it but it was very 'latte' like. Thick, lots of froth, lots of sweetness and the tea was masked by this. I liked it but didn't love it. 6/10Pour-Over, Bourbon Barrel Aged Eden:I discussed this bean with the barista making it. It turns out a year or two ago, the barrel aged coffee offering was 100% barrel aged and now they're blending virgin and barreled beans together to get a good taste. The barista said he was thankful that was the case now because he really loves this product compared to the 100% barrel aged they used to offer.My thoughts? Hmmm, it tasted like Irish coffee or basically straight up coffee with cream and Jameson whiskey added. It was thin, a murky brown color and after 8 sips over 10 minutes, I decided I couldn't finish the cup. 4/10...because I guess whiskey and coffee aren't for me. I went in expecting to buy a bag to take home and am glad I ordered a cup on-site first.Pastries:I split a chocolate Croissant with the GF and despite not being baked on-site, it was slightly warmed with a good flakiness and butter quality. 8/10 but probably a shame that this was the best thing they offered.

22.description: I love this place because of the laid back atmosphere. I've been coming here for more than three years and it's one of my favorite neighborhood spots. They have a great selection of coffee and teas for those that stay away from the caffeine. You can spend your time outside on the spacious patio, downstairs where the music is sometimes blaring a little too loud, or head upstairs to the quiet study space. I prefer to be upstairs. There is always local art around as well as local goodies from independent  places. My favorite thing is being able to grab a fresh Nutella croissant that is from west town bakery here! I seriously had to wean myself off of them because they are addicting. Lastly, but importantly for coffee snobs, the coffee is a bit acidic. I'm not a fan of the dark roast because when I add a milk substitute it doesn't mix well. I do recommend the chai tea latte!

15.description: Not a big coffee connoisseur so I wasn't really sure what to order. The female barista who helped me was very patient... and generous! I told her it was my first time here and she gave me my Cortado on the house. Friendly staffDelicious coffeeGood vibesChill tunesSmooth atmosphereThanks for the pleasant experience, Star Lounge. I'll be back.

57.description: My favorite place in Chicago for a crazy flavored latte. And my favorite place to have a crazy flavored latte on a patio when it's really nice outside.Any coffee shop attitude? Actually, only once when I saw a guy be a real dick to one of the baristas and she laughed it off. I wouldn't even call that attitude, I'd call that service industry coping skills!Also Dark Matter beans are great for making your coffee at home.

20.description: The best coffee in Chicago! Down to earth family owned coffee shop.

36.description: The street it's on seems pretty dead but this place is actually pretty busy. I had the chai tea latte and I would totally order it again. It was delightfully spicy. It has a really hipster vibe and is a great place to just sit on your computer and surf the internet or read a book.

14.description: Top notch.  That's right, this place does exactly what a coffee shop is supposed to do and does it well.  Fresh roasted beans, excellent pastries, quick service and pleasant staff.  Seriously well executed.  Pastries come from West Town Bakery and Do-Rite.  No sad faces here.  Free Wifi and plenty of seating both downstairs and upstairs.  Perfect for reading or doing some work from "home"!

29.description: AWESOME FOOD!!!! Best when you get out the club and looking for a good mexican spot to eat!

42.description: My husband says that the steak used for the steak tacos isn't real steak.  Yesterday I decided to get three chicken tacos and they were YUCK, very dry and too much ?paprika?; one went in the garbage.  The rice doesn't come with red sauce which I don't understand.  But, this place has been the after the party taco spot since my partying days.  After yesterday's chicken taco disappointment, I'm going to start making my own at home, like my momma use to do, YUMM!

23.description: We stopped in because this place was recommend plus hunger had occurred.   I have to say I'm so glad we did.  There burritos was fresh, and well put together.  The steak was not dry at all. I do appreciate that always.  The price was decent and customer service was nice.  Sure I would like my steak to be abit more flavorful however once I add the salsa, I was good. Yes I would definitely go back and recommend this place  for a BURRITO.  Thx:)

47.description: The best tacos I have ever eaten.  I highly recommend the tacos Al Pastor with Cilantro and Onion.  Very few places make it correctly, but at Birrias Huantitan, it is Divine.

8.description: I am a taco fanatic!  Constantly in search of the perfect taco. I'm not sure if it's out there but this place is damn close.Tacos de asada are OFF THE CHAIN!  If your looking for a new trendy Hollywood ass taco place....THIS PLACE IS NOT FOR YOU! You will not find filet mignon wrapped in a tortilla here.   But you will find crazy flavor.   It's the type of place when you park your car and you step out... the sweet smell of grilled meat will slap you in the face.Open 24rs and my babies are priced right at $1.99 each.Nobody speaks English but that's OK because kindness and great customer service is a universal language. The neighborhood is sketchy at 2pm but at 2am when I go it's not recommended.   But I don't care.  I've been hitting this spot since I've been a kid and my precious taquitos outweighs the risk.  Lol...Plus Mr. Bulletproof Vest is up front  watching my back.  And truth be told great food makes everyone behave.Don't be scuuuuuured, I strongly recommend you put this place as a MUST TRY TACO JOINT IN CHICAGO!Maybe I'm right, maybe I'm wrong but the adventure alone is worth the try.  Step out of your comfort zone.: )

31.description: The very many drunken nights at Huentitan! I can't even count the times... the many times, my drunk ass stumbled in here for some tacos at 4am. They have thee BEST carne asada (steak) tacos ever! (I've had them sober a couple times, so I can say that). For all you boushey people, yes it's on North & Pulaski. Get over it, your there to eat the food and review the food, not the neighborhood! This place is open 24 hours as far as I know. Chip's and salsa, oh yeah!I've had the tacos, burritos, horchata (yum), tostadas, tortas, rice (not a fan, but not a fan of any Mexican rice anywhere). I've had it all... Price is right too people, no over priced tacos here. They are no longer cash only, they finally have a machine for cards. If I'm not mistaken it's debit cards only... hell I'll never be able to give you the answer to that, my drunk ass wont grasp it!The memories, the food... Huentitan I LOVE YOU!!!!!

34.description: DELICIOUSSSSS FOOOD!!!! although it gets very crowded after 1 am the wait is worthwhile which in the end you dont wait that long if theirs a huge line because the cooks are so fast but the food is awesome what can i say its everybodys place to go to after a night of partying and clubbing hard! definately will choose this place over el taconazo accross the street anytime!

16.description: This is the spot to hit up after partying all night! Lol. The food is really good. I typically go for the torta de milanesa or tacos- asada or lengua,  yum! The horchata is really good as well and they make a great red salsa.

13.description: Yahoo!  Its been 10 years since I've had a burrito from here.  I used to go to this place at 2-3-4 o'clock in the morning when I lived in Chicago and had the extreme munchies from clubing .  There would be a line around the building to get in.  Its not in a good neighborhood.  In fact its in a bad neighborhood BUT it is the best steak burritto you will get anywhere, Period end of story!!  Very little english spoken in this place.  At least they have a police officer around that provides a little comfort.  THe resaon this burrito is sooooooooo good is because it is loaded with flavor steak but the oil drips down your arm. Obvioulsy not the healthiest thing to eat but it taste sooooooo darn good.  THis is the definition of a guilty pleasure.  ENJOY!!

11.description: I've been going there since I was a kid. There burritos are made to order, awesome taste.

39.description: They have the best tortas ever. Not even exaggerating. Everyone is raving about the tacos, which are good, but the tortas are the best. I don't like that they now have fries, but still in love with them. Now they take cards, love it. And they deliver!!

37.description: Who here wants to go to Hell or burn in the Lake of Fire forever? Eternal damnation anyone? If you do want any of these things, then DO NOT go to Huentitan, because it is a sin that you'll never taste the best tacos, tortas or burritos in the world. I left Chicago 6 years ago and I currently live in South Florida. In 6 years, I have looked everywhere for a descent tasting taco that can rival the authentic Mexican flava (that's right, flava) of Chicago. I live in Sunrise, Florida which is west of Fort Lauderdale and I thought I had managed to finally find a taco/burrito joint in Homestead, Florida - about an hour and a half away.That's right, the best tasting taco/burrito's are over an hour away and guess what? My wife and I make the trek whenever we have a hankering for some authentic Mexican food. You heard right, I'll drive that far for food that good. So, for the last 3 years or so, this Mexican joint became my de facto burrito spot because it had that long lost flavor that I so long for, up until last weekend.You see, that's when my wife and I visited Chicago and I told her we have to stop by this Mexican restaurant because they have the best food ever. We had eaten breakfast earlier so she wasn't that hungry. We ordered a Burrito and a taco to go - the burrito was for later and we decided to split the taco. Walking back to the car my wife was unwrapping our foiled taco, she sat in the front while I secured my overstuffed burrito in our bag. I get to the front and notice she's already bit into the taco. I immediately recognized the expression on her face since I've seen it before, I won't go into the specifics of where or how I've seen it but Iet's just say that the last time I saw that face was during "le petit mort."The next words out of her mouth, with her eyes closed where, "fuck you, get your own." That's right, they were that damn good that I had to back up and get another one! We got out and ordered two more burritos and one extra taco. The extra two were now officially heading to Miami with us, as for the extra taco, it survived long enough to get us to downtown...so long little taco, you will be missed.That taco was so good that I didn't go to the bathroom for 3 days because I didn't want to get rid of it.If you don't eat a taco at Huentitan, a bunny will die. If you don't eat a torta there, a slow and cuddly labrador pup will be drowned, if you don't eat a burrito there, you're offically a communist. So, ask yourself, do you want to kill little animals and read Marxist literature while wearing a Che Guevara t-shirt? If you do, then you don't deserve to eat here. If you however, are a peace loving American who likes to eat and wants to dig into a big fat-ass motherf*!@ing burrito with mad flavor then God bless you because one day you will make it to heaven; unlike those monsterous pinkos.

0.description: Birria de chivo mmmmmmmmmmm!

38.description: I went to get ONE taco here since I had just eaten breakfast and my husband said that he would share one with me because we were down here visiting from Miami and he didn't want me to miss out on what he says are the best taco and burritos in the world!Well, I noticed that first of all they are opened 24 hours so you can get your taco on at anytime! That is always a plus in my book. Also not to mention that there is always a cop or a security officer inside. It didn't seem so much as a bad neighborhood, but well, they are there for a reason. As I saw the person before me order, I noticed the huge portions that they serve. I mean HUGE! H-U-G-E! I ordered a taco with everything and decided to share it with my husband. As I went back to our car which we had 15 minutes worth in the meter, I opened my overly stuffed taco, took a bite, and screamed... STOP! I asked my husband to stop the car because  I was not sharing this taco,  it was too damm good and he needs to go back in and get his own. YES... It was that good! It was amazing. The flavors of the taco were dead on. A true authentic Mexican flavorNot to mention that I also bought 3 burrito's to go, they wrapped them nicely and securely since those burritos made it to Miami that very same day. I had it for lunch the next day and it was amazing! I shared it with a co-worker since I could not eat it all. Seriously, it was good! They too were seasoned just perfect! The ingredients were fresh. Everything was home made and the meat is cut in the back and constantly being brought to the front.

51.description: This place is great! In my opinion, the best Burrito in Chicago. I like to eat there if possible, but the majority of the visitors get the food to go. This is a popular late night munchie place, but be a little cautious with the neighborhood at night. If you eat the food there, you get lackluster service, but you get free chips and a selection of freshly cut onions, tomatos and other topping for your burrito. The other food is really good there as well. I like the fact that they put beans, sour cream and guacamole if you ask for it. Good meat in a tight roll. Tasty cheese on the burrito. Ingredients are mixed well also. Just a great place, and it tastes good even when your'e not drunk!

27.description: BEST STEAK TACOS! Whether you drunk or sober this place has some pretty good food. If you go in and sit down to eat, you get free chips and salsa. The wait staff is nice. I also get steak burritos here too. YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED!

32.description: Whenever I find someone who has never been here or says they know of a great Burrito place, I laugh and we go to Huentitan (or the Burrito place on North and Pulaski to those who can't remember the name because you went when you were too drunk).  I've converted at least 200 ppl this way to the best burritos and tacos in Chicago.I've been going there for more than 20 years and cannot think of a better place to go for Mexican food.  Take my word for it or not, but give the place a try and you'll be hooked for life.

48.description: No u will not get mugged or shot, cause theres always an officer there. Yes its always packed. Have a seat and order its way faster. Everything is amazing. I lived 2 blocks away and am a huge fan. My best experiance was when I was there with my husband and the health inspector was telling the owners he rarely see's small restaurants as clean as that one!!! woohoo! You'll see a lot of ignorant people there... thats y theres a cop. and Dont forget to Tip!I also love that the employees eat there. they know their stuff is good. HAve the Pastor. Nothing comes close any where elseThey area also open 24 hours on weekends and til 5am mon-thu and open back up around 9 or 10am.

44.description: Love this place for late night tacos.  The only place I will eat tacos Al Pastor.  Great prices quick service, best hours.

24.description: Yahoo!  Its been 10 years since I've had a burrito from here.  I used to go to this place at 2-3-4 o'clock in the morning when I lived in Chicago and had the extreme munchies from clubing .  There would be a line around the building to get in.  Its not in a good neighborhood.  In fact its in a bad neighborhood BUT it is the best steak burritto you will get anywhere, Period end of story!!  Very little english spoken in this place.  At least they have a police officer around that provides a little comfort.  THe resaon this burrito is sooooooooo good is because it is loaded with flavor steak but the oil drips down your arm. Obvioulsy not the healthiest thing to eat but it taste sooooooo darn good.  THis is the definition of a guilty pleasure.  ENJOY!!

7.description: Their quesadillas de masa de carne asada are delicious & filling. Their burritos are also spectacular. Overall, the majority of the food is great my only thing is that they can sometimes overfill the burritos with the lettuce & end up putting less meat in them as a result.

49.description: Birria is not an easy thing to find north of the border.  And if you have the word "birria" in the title, you better be sure you're doing it right.  Lucky for you, they do.The tacos are great.  Super great!  Their burritos are good, as are the tortas.  I was slightly disappointed with the pozole, but then I realized I was probably asking too much.This is a taco/burrito place, plain and simple.  Nice service, and they always do good business.  Go for lunch, go late at night, go whenever...  Just go!  :)

40.description: well the reviews were great so i decided to try this and here is the TRUTH.Service-5 starsfood- 3 starsprice-5 starsambiance-1 starThis is the type of place where you order and pick up. Dining in is fast and they are attentive, but i did not like the feel of the place and going there felt a little dangerous. And the food was ok, but here is the deal with the food there. Basically they have all the ingredients premade and when you want something different, say a taco or a tortas or a burrito they just wrap the meat cheese and avacodo in something different. And the meat was not good quality. If you want to impress someone do not take them here. Come here if you are low on money and starving!I had the tacos and the tortas and taco salad. By mistake i tried eating the shell of the taco salad. And let me warn you DO NOT DO THIS! IT tasted very old and i think it was sitting there for a LONG TIME, i feel sick!

30.description: first time i went here was years ago. food is great, and i am talking about over 10yrs of eating here.

46.description: Birra Huentitan is one of those always-open taco stops that cops are always found coming in and out of.  While their food is more fast-food style, this is still a traditional "sit-down" place so expect to pay a tip. The ambiance is nothing to encapsulate in your Polaroid but it does definitely shout authentic from all esquinas. The walls are lined with Spanish-written menus, messages, and other kitchy things from Mexico. There is a jukebox that, surprisingly, a lot of diners feed quarters.  Admittedly, the Latino music (Salsa, Pop, Tejano, etc.) definitely encourages frolicking taste buds.  Foodwise, this place is "la Bomba" (oh, I can hear the groans now...). But seriously, this place does indeed, rock for what it is.  And what it is: everything authentic.  They have myriad Mexican dishes from traditional pozole, to beef, tongue, chorizo, and pork tacos. I almost always order their burritos since I am a a big fan of them in all birras and taco stops across the city (including tasty Las Asadas which I have reviewed previously). Like the traditional taco, I order my burrito with onion, buckets of cilantro, and (sometimes) cheese, but that's it. Oh, and of course... TONS of limes to squeeze on each juicy, meaty bite.  Their horchata, which is one of my most favorite summertime beverages, is made fresh, not with a power mix (the telltale sign of a Gringo-targeted Mexican joint). It is a bit on the sweet side but you can always add more ice to water it down and bring it to a higher level of cool. Their service is efficient and friendly, too, if you speak a little Spanish. This place is really good for diners that like to take the mystery out of hole-in-the-wall dining spots by actually seeing what is being prepared. Their kitchen area is located right by the entrance (viewable from the sidewalk, actually) so you can easily confirm the dish is freshly made and who is actually making it. Piles of various grilled and sauteed meats mingle with tomatoes, onions, and other must-have Mexican accouterments.  The meat is piled so high sometimes that wonder if they are overpreparing the stuff. But just as you think that, you turn around to walk out and see a line of cops, neighbors, and Latinos snaking its way out the door and you think: nope, they got it all figured out.

1.description: I walked over to Taqueria (Birrias) Huentitan today and had a really good lunch.  Two Al Pastor, a Pork Tamale + drink; $7+tip. See attached photo, got the time stamp on phone camera figured out, Rooster's beak was a little watery but had some heat, table service was great. Earlier in the day I had the pleasure of shopping at the North Pulaski Fresh Market, my colleagues were down to 2-1/2 tablespoons of Costco coffee grinds.  Cafe Bustelo, good sized produce, and butcher selection that will bring me back to shop (Picanha?) Looked like good turn over and fresh. (Bedolla Super Foods3850 W North Ave, Chicago, IL 60686)MK

9.description: One of Chicago's most underrated taquerias. It is located in West Humboldt Park so if you're scared and uncomfortable around blue collar Latinos and blacks don't come here. Stick with your wicker park "taqueria". Their tacos and burritos are always excellent. Carne Asada is always cooked perfectly! Juicy, tender, and not burned just how it should be. Their Al Pastor is one of the best also it comes straight off the spit and it's always crispy, juicy, and flavorful. I tried their lengua tacos once and it was cooked perfectly not chewy at all. Others would only give this place 4 stars due to their service but you don't come to a taqueria like this one expecting 5 star service, the waitresses have always been nice and have always taken my orders down correctly. The times I have been here there has been CPD officers taking their lunch here since on duty officers receive complimentary lunch here. (How admiring from the owner) so if you reek of weed or are paranoid about law enforcement don't come here as well, stick to wicker park.

26.description: Best tacos in town......Open late especially on Fridays and Saturdays.....Good spot to hit after a night of clubbing.

25.description: A woman who works for my client wanted to take me out to lunch.  Kind of a belated bday lunch.  So, she said there is a good Mexican restaurant near by.  She said she only goes to this restaurant if someone goes with her.  Well, I understand why as this place isn't located in the best of neighborhoods (Pulaski & North).  We ordered (to go) two chicken tacos (each) with rice.  I must say, it was tasty.  The chicken had a decent flavor. The green chili sauce was very mild.  I was expecting it to be hot.  The rice was your typical orange Mexican rice.  Overall, good food for the money.  If she wants to drive again, I would tag along.

12.description: This place is very well known.  As far as taquerias in Chicago there are a ton!  So I rate this place 4 out of five because though it is worthy of your repeat business the service is a bit shabby and the tacos and salsas are good but not amazing.

21.description: I'm in LOVE with this place.  I'ts an old school joint.  I use to visit the place late nights after the club years ago.  Soooo I Just ate here last night.  I drove allll the way from the West Side to go here for tacos.Huentitan's have the best tacos in town.  The steak is tender and they load up all of the toppings and the seasoning is perfect.  I give this one 5 stars

17.description: This is my go-to restaurant. It's just up the street from my house. After my car accident, I couldn't get up to cook and dinner from here was an essential. Torta de alpastor con todo y aguacate with a side of guacamole and chips and a large horchata! Beyond delicious.. I literally can not order this meal anywhere else. It makes me feel like I'm cheating lol If you haven't tried you must!

10.description: DELICIOUS!  Simple, traditional and delicious!

5.description: All time favorite late night Mexican food go to spot. I love this place. It has never failed me when I'm starving. Early or late the got me every time.

3.description: Love chicken tacos and tostadas from here. Dont really care for the carne asada. Its open late and be prepared to wait in line late fri and weekend nights. This is the spot after the bar/club.

35.description: Perfect hangover food.

19.description: A woman who works for my client wanted to take me out to lunch.  Kind of a belated bday lunch.  So, she said there is a good Mexican restaurant near by.  She said she only goes to this restaurant if someone goes with her.  Well, I understand why as this place isn't located in the best of neighborhoods (Pulaski & North).  We ordered (to go) two chicken tacos (each) with rice.  I must say, it was tasty.  The chicken had a decent flavor. The green chili sauce was very mild.  I was expecting it to be hot.  The rice was your typical orange Mexican rice.  Overall, good food for the money.  If she wants to drive again, I would tag along.

28.description: *Dynomite* This place has some of the best Mexican food in Chicago.

45.description: Something about the sign and building compelled me to stop in. It was also nice to see the guys in the kitchen working from outside. Inside, it's very casual. You place your order with one of the cooks and your meal is made to order. I had the Chicken Torta and the Plantano de Leche Licuado. The Chicken Torta was huge! All ingredients were very fresh. You can see onions, avocados, bananas and all sorts of fruits and vegetables on display throughout the restaurant.I wish that the Chicken was marinated in something as it was kind of bland. They serve limes, raw onions and salsa if you dine in. The Plantano de Leche Licuado was sooooo good. A must have! My meal cost me about $12 with tip. Next time, I'll probably order the Chorizo Burrito (first time I've heard of such a thing!) or the Carne Asada Tortas and/or Tacos. The menu displayed when you first walk in are not the only items they have - they also have a menu full of Breakfast and Dinner items on the tables. If you only speak English, there may be a bit of a language barrier. Don't let that stop you from coming in - it's a very diverse crowd here. It gets busy too - the food is great! The service is a hit or miss. They are open 24 hours on weekends and from 9am - 3am (!) on Monday - Friday. Street parking is available. Pay box.

33.description: This place doesn't look good. neighborhood not great but the burrito kicks ass. Excellent piece of food.  I will definitely  come back soon.

43.description: Never did the goat thing, but everything else here is QUITE good.  They have a smallish menu (don't expect combo plates), but I frequently order chicken burritos, which are good, but the steak tacos are much better.  They're open really late, too (which is usually when I go).  The staff are polite, you get your food to-go quickly, they don't screw up your order and now they take plastic.  Perfect.

2.description: Great Streak made on the grill.. love the food!! Very authentic flavoring. Service seems to be good, nothing to brag about.I wish the $6 Orange juice was cheaper.

18.description: Best Burrito in Chicago. Back in the day, I learned it will also soak up whatever level of Alcohol you have in your system.

41.description: I consider myself a taco expert.. I grew up in logan square/humboldt area so mexican food is like second nature to me. this place is the best. hands down no contest. the steak is amazing and i crave it all the time. 3am is my fave time to go because you see very interesting people there but thats the only downside at all... seriously try this place!!! super cheap and super delicious... really what else do you want?

50.description: No, this isn't five star like Everest is five star.  It's five star in that it really executes well on what it sets out to be: a great mexican joint.  My buddy Dean and I just featured it in Burrito Baby #2.  I had the Pork -- AWESOME -- he had the carne asada.    Totally awesome AND as an added bonus I didn't have to eat dinner.reidcarlberg.com/2008/05…Two people, two burritos, two grande horchatas, tip: $22.

4.description: Every time I come here on a drunken Mexican food excursion and wait in line to order I'm hit with a wave if nostalgia from my teenage years.I discovered Huentitan when I was about 13 or 14 years old and in the early years of my rebellious stage. After a night of drinking, this was thee taco joint to hit up at 1,2,3 in the morning. After all, McDonald's is nowhere near as satisfying as a greasy, delicious steak taco.The ambience is straight hood especially if your out after dark. After all, the freaks come out at night. You WILL be greeted by drunken, money begging drug addicts as soon as u walk up to the front door. Once inside you will wait in line to order your taco. You WILL be surrounded by a number of Gang members, drunken fools, sleazy women and sometimes even  prostitutes and pimps. But if you are wasted it will all be a blur and you wouldn't be worried. DO NOT EAT IN.I always order tacos although I hear they make a bomb ass burrito. Definitely come here after a long night of drinking you will be glad you did.

6.description: I ''ve been going here for 30 years I love the food and service. Impartically I and a great number of my family love the Pastor meat the best in the city.

22.description: If u ain't gettin ur burrito on here then boo for joo!!

15.description: Not too happy with the food on  this occasion.

20.description: best place  for mexican  food  love  it , would love  to talk to the  owner  how do u guys do it.............. thankssssssssssss

36.description: this is the best mexican food in chicago.....except my grandmothers....yes it's true this place can get loud and full of drunk people at 3 A.M. but thats why their is an off duty cop their anytime passed midnight....sober or drunk this is the place to go.

14.description: It is what it is, good fast Mexican food, lived in that neighborhood when it first opened and it's still there for a reason.

3.description: Their large selection  of culinary novels, chef autobiographies and cook books is like the dream library I'd have if I was rich. They have great staff and gathering from how the grand opening just went they will have several chef book signings and food demos. I can't wait to see what wonderful things they do with the venue.

1.description: I felt like I died and went to heaven walking in here.You see, I love to cook, and therefore I collect cookbooks. My current count is over 100, and still growing. I read cookbooks before I go to sleep as if they're novels.  I read "Mastering the Art of French Cooking" like some people read "Gone Girl." I hung on every word.So to say I'm a fan of cookbooks is an understatement. When I first heard rumblings about the opening of this new bookstore a few months ago, I was positively giddy with excitement. I can't believe it's been open a month already and I only just got to check it out this past weekend.Suffice it to say that Read It & Eat will have any and every cookbook you've ever heard of. It's the most comprehensive selection I've ever come across. In addition to all the cookbooks, there are chef biographies and memoirs (and curiously an autobiography of Keith Richards), books on diet and nutrition (and specific dietary concerns like gluten-free or paleo), food history, books on wines, beer, and spirits, specialty cookbooks, regional cookbooks, cookbooks by a specific cooking method or single ingredient, cookbooks for kids, cookbooks for beginners (and for those more advanced)--you get the picture. They have it all. It's pretty mindblowing.The store itself is cheerful and comfortable. The walls are painted a serene sage green  and the ceiling is a bright white. They also have a test kitchen that offers cooking/demonstration classes or occasional tastings. Read It & Eat is a true culinary experience whether you are a novice cook (or just like to eat), or if you're the second coming of Julia Child. I'm somewhere in between.In a world where brick and mortar bookstores are sadly getting to be a thing of the past, I'm so happy this place opened. I feel like it exists just to make me happy.

2.description: I was looking forward to taking some cooking classes here but unfortunately it's Madelaine Bullwinkle yet again. I took a few classes at the Alliance and found the food extremely bland and not well prepared at all. I've taken classes many times in many different cities and this was the first time that I was disappointed in the experience. I don't know where people eat to think that this is good food but it just isn't. Chicago has an incredible food scene so this is baffling. Be nice if we had a choice of different chefs/cooks but this doesn't seem to be the case since Bullwinkle seems to have a monopoly on the cooking class scene.

5.description: In love with this place!!!! My boyfriend had to carry me out of the store because I was Burried in the u real variety of cookbooks offered. Haven't taken a class here yet but I can't wait!

6.description: Great addition to Lincoln Park. 4000 cookbooks and a full test kitchen.

0.description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! The staff are incredibly friendly, the selection is thoughtfully curated and the business answers a need people don't know they have until they enter the store. The titles on their shelves escape the algorithm based recommendations other web based purveyors offer. Other places may offer steep discounts to lure your money, but knowing I am supporting a small business that makes a difference in my community goes way beyond any short term perception of savings. You can't put a numeric value on a physical space where friends can share enthusiasm and build relationships for something as singularly universal as food books. As long as they are open for business, I will go out of my way to support this beautiful store.

4.description: This place has a lot of charm. I stopped by yesterday after a recommendation from Ida Pickney. I met the owner Ester who showed me around the store and provided me with several cookbook recommendations. I actually collect cookbooks and love to try new recipes. I am excited to join the monthly cookbook club and look forward to attending many of the in store author events. I recommend this place to anyone who loves to cook or interested in learning. Great cookbooks!

58.description: I've gotten the lunch special here probably over 50 times, and I can't say I've ever been slightly disappointed.Now I'll be the first to admit this review is highly biased- at the time I was living right on the Paseo Boricua strip, and it was the closest Chinese restaurant. Also at this time, I found myself frequently broke, and frequently drunk at all hours. So keep in mind this is not gourmet Chinese food, this is hangover-ready-greasy-goodness, at an obscenely low price. The people there are really nice, and the portions are heaping. If you're in the neighborhood, they'll have your food ready in 15 minutes for pickup. I recommend Mushu pork and the Sesame Chicken.

56.description: Word of advice: don't order the dinner for two if it's just for yourself!! I feel moreso Chinese now from this.. well not really, but it was a lot of food! I will have leftovers for a while I think..This is your standard Chinese restaurant.. It hits the spot when you want Chinese takeout though I guess you can eat there.. Food is decent.. it is no better and no worse than other places like this..It's really a 3 star place, but I gave a bonus for speed and close proximity between Wicker and Humboldt Park...

29.description: Beware of this business, they are scamming customers on portion sizes. In addition to this, their customer service is horrible. They have pictures of small and large entree containers showing the size of each. I ordered a large Mongolian beef and when I brought it home it was in a tiny container. I called them when I got home and spent 10 minutes on the phone explaining that I had ordered a large Mongolian beef from them numerous times and had never received a small container. They argued with me stating I was lying and said that the large Mongolian beef came in a 'small' container. Well this had never happened before. So after I finished my meal, I went back to the restaurant and compared the containers. As I thought, I was right. They had given me a small entree and refused to acknowledge this even when they saw the containers side by side. For. $11 this was a total rip off. In addition to this, the food was salty and rice portion was measly. Check out Mon Lung on Ashland close to the area, much better service and quality and not out to purposely rip off customers. Also delivery here sucks , took over an hour on a weekday night to deliver just over a mile away.  Stay clear of this dump!!

42.description: I used to love this place and the food and service was good at one time.  However since the new people took over the food tastes awful and the service is shitty......  her attitude is TERRIBLE.  I will look for another resturant to eat at

23.description: Only delivery - food takes FOREVER always but I continued to get it ...until Tuesday night's wait of TWO HOURS+.Delivery times given: 8:30, then 8:41, then 8:40-8:50. 8:59 called GrubHub and they had a 5+ min wait. Called New China at 9:02 and was told, "She's almost there! 3-5 minutes!". Called back at 9:27 to cancel. Calls ignored repeatedly - And repeatedly - I called about 8 times. The restaurant is a 10 minute drive from my place and apparently they don't pick up the phone when they know they messed up.Received food at 9:31 with an apology of "address confusion" ... For 2 hours? I'm sorry, did you think we were in Wisconsin?Seems like the restaurant and delivery person are spending their time doing other things and not delivering.Their excuse doesn't make sense. We have ordered from here at least a 1/2 dozen times in the last three months, including a maaassive order on 10/19. If you're lost, call the phone number on the order.We will be ordering Chinese from elsewhere going forward. Too bad because we liked it. But that's probably because by the time we got it, we were starving and frozen dumplings would be good enough!

47.description: First we ordered delivery and were shocked that it arrived within 20 minutes. When we realized how much food we got for $6, how good the food was, and how the delivery was so quick because it was 1 block away we decided to try it again. This time we got take out and I was impressed by how clean, new and presentable the kitchen and dining area were.

8.description: Have used this restaurant through GrubHub a bunch of times.  They always arrive on time or earlier, and the food has always been great.

31.description: The people who work here are very friendly, the food is good and arrives quickly. I'm so glad it's in the neighborhood.

34.description: What!?!?!  A Chinese joint in Humboldt park?  Get outta here...  I used to say that.  I've driven by this place for years and the thought of going in never crossed my mind.  The other night, I had a craving for Chinese food.  So, why not give them a shot and see what it's.  I went in for Chicken Fried Rice and Pot Stickers to go.  Bam! It was ready within minutes and on my way out the door I go.  Huh, it was good.  The people working there were really nice.  It's not a big place and the dining area can only accommodate 10ish people.  Would it make for a romantic eat in?  It's basic, plain and right to the point. I noticed that they do have a lot of take away orders as people walked in and out. Give it a shot...

16.description: Ordered delivery. Mongolian beef and sweet and sour soup were way too gelatinous/corn starch tasting and the orange chicken was soft and flavorless. Portions were big and arrived in an hour as stated. Overall was disappointed and had to trash leftovers. Won't order again.

13.description: I had a craving for Chinese food last night but our go-to place is closed on Monday's. New China is in my neighborhood, was open, has delivery and good ratings on Yelp so we decided to give it a shot. The delivery took about 55 minutes which for take-out Chinese seemed kind of long but I was also very hungry and perhaps a bit impatient. Maybe they were really busy? The delivery man was very nice however had trouble finding our apartment even after I gave explicit directions when ordering. The portions are HUGE. No joke two small dinner entrees is enough to feed a family of 5. We ordered the following items: Egg rolls - Very crispy but not a ton of flavor. Ended up covering it in sweet & sour sauce which we were given plenty of. There are 4 egg rolls in an order. We thought we were getting 2 so that was a bonus. Egg Drop Soup - Very tasty and still piping hot when it arrived. The size small is plenty for two people to share. Chicken Chop Suey - I can't tell you how it tasted because they delivered Kung Pao Chicken instead. This was tasty however the sauce was very thick and there were some strange veggies in it. No peanuts. I was really craving chop suey so I was disappointed not to have it.Orange Chicken - DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT order this dish. It was awful. The sauce was okay but not great. It seems like they poured the sauce on the chicken hours ago and left it to get mushy before delivering it. After a few bites, we ended up tossing it. :(  Given the portion sizes, the prices were okay but a bit high. Over all, I wasn't impressed and will stick with my go-to place.

11.description: I'm shocked to read such positive reviews of this restaurant. I ordered 3 items, in which I found all of them in pretty bad taste.First off, the crab Rangoons were not terrible but not great. If you don't like onions, this dish is NOT for you. The onions take away from the cream cheese and ruin the taste.I ordered ribs... Don't know what I was thinking.  They were so disgusting, had a very strange tasting meat. It was very fatty and the meat is a mystery meat. I threw the entire dish away. Lastly, I ordered a smoothie and it was super watered down. Not sure if it melted on the way for delivery. Overall, I wouldn't ever order from this place again.

39.description: This place is awesome. I live just around the corner and you can't beat the lunch special. Tons of food so it's basically two meals for $6! Also the potstickers are some of the best I've had.

37.description: Great food! Amazing service! Amazing people! They remember your name and greet you when you call. So nice.

0.description: Ordered through GrubHub - sesame chicken and kung pao shrimp along with crab rangoon. The rangoons were huge, but only because most of it was dough with the cream cheese in maybe 20% of it. Not very good either. The kung pao sauce in my shrimp seemed ok at the time, but as I'm eating the leftovers I notice how watered-down it is. Great spice level though. The sesame chicken was just ok.On the plus side, the delivery was fast and courteous. I just can't see myself ordering from here again.

38.description: Ordered pick up. The order was Kung pow beef and sesame chicken, also got veggie egg rolls. Except for the celery in the Kung pow everything was delicious. It was around $23 for 2 large orders and an appetizer, that was MORE than enough for two people. Next time we will be ordering smaller portions. If you're in Humboldt Park this is the ideal Chinese take-out spot. I highly recommend it.

51.description: Cheap, quick, easy.Big portions of cheap cheap-style chinese food.  Puerto rican fried rice is good.  They also make a good fresh fruit bubble smoothie.I've always had good delivery experiences living so close that i could run there holding my breath.

27.description: My husband and I are newer to Humboldt Park, but when we lived in Logan Square we would go to China Fast Wok and loved it for what it was--fast, cheap, incredibly decent Chinese food, with generous portions. This place is only about a 5 minute walk from our apt, so we decided to give it a go. Got the General Tso's Tofu, Broccoli with garlic sauce, veggie fried rice, and two veggie egg rolls. The tofu and egg rolls were solid. The broccoli with garlic sauce was only a little broccoli with a bunch of onions and some unidentifiable veggies. I guess I could live with that, but, as someone else here said, it smelled and tasted like melted plastic--just super weird. Definitely the worst dish I've ever gotten at a Chinese joint. The veggie fried rice wasn't bad, but had something the looked like a dehydrated slice of corn cob in it. Hmmm...I also have a pretty hardy constitution, but I felt crappy after eating this.Bottom line: I'd go somewhere else. Though it might depend on what you order, my experience was that this place is worse than mediocre and inconsistent.

32.description: Great service and food. The place looks a little sketch from the outside but don't let looks be deceiving. The prices were reasonable, the food was good and it came out fast. Great restaurant, recommended.

54.description: Ordered up from New China Restaurant twice in the past week or so and both times the food came lickety-split and piping hot. The first time I ordered the person taking the order sounded so pleasant that if I were Chinese, I'd want her to be my Chinese Grandmother...though I'm not really sure how old she was, so perhaps she could have been my Mom? Okay enough with the nonsense. The first order was Crab Rangoons and Mongolian Beef (the new style apparently). Crab Rangoons were filled to the brim with whatever gets stuffed inside and cooked to perfection. Very tasty, albeit a bit salty. That was not the case the second time I ordered as those were excellent. The Mongolian Beef was a large portion, but didn't really have all that much flavor. Veggies were still crisp though and the beef was plentiful, so all in all nothing a bit of soy sauce couldn't cure. Second time around I decided to try the Beef Egg Foo Young as I sometimes like to stretch my Chinese food into many meals the following day, and this order definitely allowed me that pleasure. Four patties for the ridiculous price of around $7 is pretty solid, and they tasted pretty good. Nothing phenomenal...nothing life changing, but like I said, for the price you can't go wrong. The only problem was the little container of fluffed up rice which was almost used up with just two of the patties. Whatever happened to Chinese places packing those little white containers with rice until they nearly burst at the seams? This isn't the only place I've run across this problem so I guess times are tough and corners need to be cut. Anyway I would order more food from New China, but will probably try other menu items to see if anything really sets this place apart.

48.description: Anddddd the search for decent Chinese in Chicago continues.  Ugh, yet another dud.  WHY does a city this size have such a hard time landing a decent Chinese restaurant???Alright, here's the deal on this one.Crab Rangoon - Sooooo much cream cheese, sooooo little crab.Moo Shu Pork - Really sweet.  Like weirdly sweet.Shrimp Egg Foo Young - Pattie was fine, gravy tasted like water.  Super super bland.Combination Fried Rice - BLAND.  Tasted like nothing, no matter how much soy sauce we put on it.And that's that.  They made it past one star cause the lady at the pick up counter was really nice, and the portions were big.  Unfortunately we saw no reason to save the leftovers, so a lot of those big portions went to waste.

44.description: The food is bland and has no flavor.  The chicken which was to be crispy was soft and flavorless.  The Orange chicken had more of an orange kool-aid flavor instead of tasting like real oranges.  The steak app was chewy and dull.  I will not be ordering from you again.  You really need to step up your game.

24.description: A solid spot in the neighborhood for Chinese food.  The staff is friendly and very fluent in English.

7.description: This is based off one experience. I ordered General Tso's chicken, and it wasn't good. The meat was very tough and dark. In some pieces, the breading overpowered the meat. I asked for extra spicy, and the chicken was mild at best. To fulfill my $15 delivery fee, I purchased the potstickers, which weren't good either. Again, I experienced this restaurant in a small sample size, but I wouldn't recommend the potstickers or General Tso's chicken.

49.description: Sweet and sour shrimp, made with fresh ingredients, prepared with typical chinese herbs and was clearly cooked to order. Ok, the opposite of what I just said. Sorry New China, for now I'll call you Soggy China.

40.description: Being from the south side of Chicago, I'm accustomed to no frills Chinese takeout. The egg rolls are more in line with what I you get on the south side. Not those itty bitty little fried wanton wrappers that are generally overpriced. The orange chicken was decent. Young's has excellent orange chicken if that is what you are looking for tonight. I will definitely order again.

53.description: I was looking for a good Chinese restaurant in the area and had a hard time finding one.... So I did a yelp search and found this place.It is very reasonably priced. Lots of veggies, which tasted fresh. Big proportions.I had some crab rangoon and cashew shrimp.... my boyfriend (who loves spicy) had kung pao chicken and wonton soup. Both of us were happy, full, and had food for lunch the next day.I will definitely go back!

30.description: I hate to give bad reviews, but this one was pretty awful. My fiance and I ate there last night and nothing was very good. The crab rangoon tasted like onions, the sweet and sour chicken had a strange texture & was overloaded with salt, and the broccoli garlic smelled and tasted like melted plastic - it could not be eaten!The staff was very friendly and the service was fast, but the food was completely inedible. We had to order from another place - totally bummed!

46.description: It's a rarity that my boyfriend is in the mood for Chinese food, so we decided to give this place a shot.  We had food delivered from here, so I can't speak to any inside location experience.  We ordered the General Tso's chicken and I got the Mongolian Beef, which is a standard option in most Chinese restaurants.  I believe we got a large, and the portion was huge!  We were able to have a few meals with this order.  The food was very flavorful and tasty.  I had no complaints, and appreciate knowing that I can order food from here again and will get something good.  The prices are comparable to other spots, and it's nice to have the option of the regular or large portion.

1.description: Inconsistent. The first time I ordered the food was actually good and the rice was PERFECT which is rare for a take out place like this. The second time I placed an order the food tasted f-ing disgusting. Like it had been sitting around for days and they just kept adding grease in attempt to revitalize it. Uneatable, really.I tossed it in the garbage.

55.description: I get loads of restaurant menu fliers in my mailbox.... So, I gave this place a try.... First order.... basic Chinese fare, beef chop suey etc... Excellent!  Arrives piping hot as with most Chinese take out joins.  The food is packed in reusable plastic trays, nice.Second order next week in fact.....Sweet and Sour shrimp... Lord!  What a disaster!  One container of just oversized onion ring looking discs with way, way too much fortune cookie dough around a puney piece of shrimp that one would have to research under the lens of a microscope to find. The batter was too excessive and hard as nails.  Not the least bit appetizing or flavorful.  Horrendous!  Threw most of it straight in the trash.... The sweet and sour component came separately packaged with one tomato and one green pepper and one piece of pineapple, seriously!  I have never had sweet and sour anything from a Chinese place that came anywhere close to the abortion I witnessed here.How can a Chinese place make excellent chop suey and completely screw up on sweet 'n' sour shrimp?I am afraid to try anything else here for fear I'd be wasting money on something I would not find the least bit appetizing.......Signed,Disappointed

9.description: Ordered takeout from here on the first. Waited over an hour for it to arrive which isn't an issue since it was a holiday. That being said we ordered 4 dishes and every single one of them was completely tasteless. The orange chicken was terrible, the fried rice was bland, the crab ragoons were filled with onions (I love onions and but this was horrible). We tried about two bites of each and threw it all away. $40 down the drain. I would never eat here again.

26.description: Great food!!!!! Great price !!! Me and my girlfriend wanted to order local and stay in, so we gave it a try.   What a great surprise !!! Food tasted great with ample leftovers.  We will definitely go again !!!!

25.description: This place needs to have higher reviews, cuz it's the most bang for your Chinese food buck in the West Town area! Orders are always ready fast and steaming hot. The containers are packed tight as hell. Seriously! I can eat until I'm stuffed, and the carton is still practically full. And when I ask for extra spicy, they sure deliver!Their lunch special is off the hook - entree, fried rice, egg roll AND a can of pop for $6.25! Now that's a deal that could blow up the Great Wall itself. Damn. And they got Grape Crush. Double damn.Food is comforting and guilt inducingly unhealthy like Americanized Chinese food should be. Thanks for banning hunger from Humboldt Park, New China! Keep packin 'em in!PS - And thanks for keepin' it real with real (fresh) mushrooms!

12.description: This place literally didn't get anything right! Ordered the lunch special to share with my boyfriend for lunch along with the 8 crab rangoon (really, how bad can you screw up crab rangoon?) The chicken had a weird texture,  rice was super bland. Eggroll sucked, and somehow the best part of the meal. The crab rangoon is my real issue. I LOVE crab rangoon and this was by far the worst I have ever eaten. It was FULL of chopped onions. No crab. Cream cheese was bland. Literally Inedible. And it didn't come with any sort of sauce. Terrible. Just flat out bad. Will not be back. Also I have no idea why this place has any good reviews. Thumbs down.

59.description: needed quick, fast chinese food.  bad choice.  both the orange chicken and broccoli shrimp were covered with an overly thickened by corn starchy sauce, flavorless -- at least be extra salty!!!  the wonton soup was gross -- i spit out the wonton.  very very disappointed.

21.description: Standard Chinese take out. If you're looking for nothing special and just some rice and vegetables then this is your place. I do not recommend the hot and sour soup.

17.description: I really only tried this as an online order, and had it sent to a friend to surprise him with lunch. The food was apparently fine, and pretty typical/unimpressive fare, but despite me tipping $10 on a $23 bill (because I knew his office was a bit of a pain to get to) the delivery guy still arrived and asked my friend for a tip (and he didn't know I had already). No idea if this was the delivery guy, or the restaurant not giving him the tip in the first place, but either way it was super rude and we ended up paying pretty much as much on tip as we did on food that wasn't anything to write home about. Ridiculous.

10.description: 2 hour wait for any food delivery is unacceptable. Not to mention the original time quote was an hour. I won't be ordering from here again. Staff needs a refresher course in managing expectations and the drivers need to learn the general vicinity of the neighborhood they work in and deliver to.

5.description: Only delivery - food takes FOREVER always but I continued to get it ...until Tuesday night's wait of TWO HOURS+.Delivery times given: 8:30, then 8:41, then 8:40-8:50. 8:59 called GrubHub and they had a 5+ min wait. Called New China at 9:02 and was told, "She's almost there! 3-5 minutes!". Called back at 9:27 to cancel. Calls ignored repeatedly - And repeatedly - I called about 8 times. The restaurant is a 10 minute drive from my place and apparently they don't pick up the phone when they know they messed up.Received food at 9:31 with an apology of "address confusion" ...
