For 2 hours? I'm sorry, did you think we were in Wisconsin?Seems like the restaurant and delivery person are spending their time doing other things and not delivering.Their excuse doesn't make sense. We have ordered from here at least a 1/2 dozen times in the last three months, including a maaassive order on 10/19. If you're lost, call the phone number on the order.We will be ordering Chinese from elsewhere going forward. Too bad because we liked it. But that's probably because by the time we got it, we were starving and frozen dumplings would be good enough!

3.description: Don't eat here unless you want to be bedridden for days with body aches and intense vomiting. My girlfriend and I ordered from here last Sunday night. Monday morning came around and she had to sprint to the bathroom, she was throwing up and in intense pain for three days. I assumed it was the flu, as I thought food poisoning only lasted a day. Then my idiot self heated up her plain friend rice Thursday night and haven't left my bed (except to vomit my brains out)  since Friday morning. I wouldn't wish this sickness on anyone. I just left the immediate care and they confirmed that this is food poisoning and some cases can last a few days.

35.description: Pretty decent chinese for Wicker Park area (ok Humbolt).  Like most Chinese restaurants, I grade them mostly on their Mongolian beef.  This is one of the beater ones I've tasted from a take out place.  You have to get the old style, though.  the new style comes with lots of different veggies and things that aren't typical of Mongolian beef.  Overall it's no suburb Chinese food, but they do have great service consistantly, and the lunch specials are great.  Quick side note, egg roll quality is so so.  Used to be better, don't know what happened.  Please bring old, more packed egg rolls back.Stanks,

19.description: I ordered delivery from this restaurant, and the driver called my cell and told me that he was "too busy" to bring it up to my apt. Why did I pay $10 in delivery fees and tip when I had to get dressed to go downstairs, have my order thrown at me, and then have the driver run away? It was my first and last order from this restaurant and from grubhub.com. I even called grubhub.com to complain, and I was told there was nothing they could do to help me or pass along the feedback. To top it off my food was cold was flavorless. So an all around bad experience.

28.description: I haven't found many Chinese restaurants in Chicago that I like -- and if I do like them, they don't deliver to me. But I'm happy to say that New China has made me a return customer.Quick delivery. Great prices for the portion size. And the food has always been consistent and yummy. Crab rangoon, egg rolls, fried rice -- all of it is exactly what I want it to be. Thanks for giving the people of Humboldt Park some much needed good Chinese food!

45.description: I really like this restaurant and fortunately it's just walking distance from my apartment. I have had their sesame chicken and sweet & sour chicken and they have both been fantastic. Not to mention, their egg rolls are absolutely delicious!!! For those of you who read my reviews, you know that I am absolutely a stickler for price and value - fortunately, the value here is incredible. I eat a lot and their portions here easily last for two or more meals and their lunch special only came to about 8 dollars and change including a "complimentary" can of pop.I have ordered take out and delivery from many different Chinese restaurants and this by far is my first choice for right now...might even get some tonight.

33.description: I used to live near here and would go in every now and then for a quick lunch and was never disappointed. Everything was always fresh and there was a LOT of food for the money. The lady at the desk was always really friendly, too.I moved a while ago but was recently in the neighborhood and thought I would order food to my friend's house before we go there. I ordered from New China thinking it would take a while but it ended up being ready before I got off the train. The driver refused to leave the food outside and delivered it to the train stop we were getting off at. He was super friendly and wasn't bothered at all, and I felt like a jerk.Good food, great customer service.

43.description: i should of just had a bowl of cereal for dinner. since i had to anyway. I was told delivery would be an hour. when an hour passed and i had no food, i called again and she said its out on the truck and should get there soon. 30 min later i called again and they couldnt find my order. once she found it on their computer (or took it again) she said 20 min and she would take 15% off. in all, the food got to my apartment 2 HOURS after i had ordered. oh, the veggie egg rolls were chalky. the crab ragoon was ok. but very little crab. the kung pao shrimp was bad. it was bland, and tasted like it could have come out of a campbells soup can, if campbells did chinese food. over all, horrible experience. the price is cheap- but so is the food and the service.

2.description: My coworkers every once in a while order from here. So one day I decided to join in. They have a lot of options for lunch  which comes with an entrée, large portion of chicken fried rice, egg roll, and a soda all for around $7-8. The food is not so bad, pretty standard run of the mill oily MSG filled Chinese fastfood. The chicken fried rice tasted a little stale and cold. Nothing great or bad about it you get what you order, and on the positive side its a whole lot of food,  you can even spilt the lunch deal with someone its that big. Delivery is quick, but just very forgettable food, value if your really hungry.

18.description: Damn this place always finds a way to get my order wrong! 1 out of 3 times I order for delivery, my order is wrong. S.O.B!

41.description: DISGUST is the word I choose to use to define the meal I had. I ordered the sweet and sour shrimp lunch special. Please STAY AWAY FROM THE SWEET AND SOUR SHRIMP!!!!! The dough rings that came with it had a corner of a piece of shrimp in them. Also, the dough rings were extremely hard. They did give me a lot of shrimp fried rice...but absolutely no soy sauce....which left the rice dry. The egg roll taste like it is filled with salt and was partially burnt. The only reason I gave this restaurant 1 star is because delivery was quick....but when I think about it.....It's probably because the food was old and they just heated it up in the microwave. (Headed to the bathroom to purge what I swallowed)

52.description: Ordered food when I house sat my brother's place at the end of December and still very impressive. The order was delivered in 15 minutes (even though it's just around the corner). Moo Shu Pork - awesome (wish they would add more pancakes with it).Mongolian Fried Rice - good, still think the combo fried rice is even better.  General Tsao chicken - still awesome!Honestly, cannot complain about the food from New China. Folks who live in that area are fortunate that there is a good Chinese restaurant around there. Wish they would open one up here close to Gurnee Mills. One can eternally hope... right? LOL!

50.description: Good place i like how fast it came and it was good

4.description: Horrible!Wish I had read other reviews before I orderedAvoid at all costs,Meat tasted old, dried and greasyFried rice tasted of nothing but soy sauce and oilThrew out everything.  Ugh:(

6.description: It was okay. Huge portions, but not great quality. The orange chicken was soggy. The egg roll didn't have much flavor. But the egg drop soup was thick and hearty. Delivered very fast, suspiciously fast. Led me to believe this wasn't freshly prepared.

22.description: Ordered delivery. Mongolian beef and sweet and sour soup were way too gelatinous/corn starch tasting and the orange chicken was soft and flavorless. Portions were big and arrived in an hour as stated. Overall was disappointed and had to trash leftovers. Won't order again.

15.description: This place needs to have higher reviews, cuz it's the most bang for your Chinese food buck in the West Town area! Orders are always ready fast and steaming hot. The containers are packed tight as hell. Seriously! I can eat until I'm stuffed, and the carton is still practically full. And when I ask for extra spicy, they sure deliver!Their lunch special is off the hook - entree, fried rice, egg roll AND a can of pop for $6.25! Now that's a deal that could blow up the Great Wall itself. Damn. And they got Grape Crush. Double damn.Food is comforting and guilt inducingly unhealthy like Americanized Chinese food should be. Thanks for banning hunger from Humboldt Park, New China! Keep packin 'em in!PS - And thanks for keepin' it real with real (fresh) mushrooms!

57.description: Sweet & sour chicken - very goodCrab Rangoon - lots of filling and thus very goodEgg drop soup - very, very bad - i will stick to Jim Ching for that oneHad the food delivered within 25 min and everything was super crispy and hot!I'm sure as I try more dishes, I will update the review

20.description: I was only going to give this place a one star because I don't want anyone else to know or care about this restaurant. Seriously, the number one thing I'll miss about living in this part of town will be this amazing food. Always hot, well priced and the portions are super generous! I'm writing this while I scarf down all my general tsos chicken and deciding how much would be too much left over for tomorrow? Oh, did I mention it is almost always ready for pick up by the time I finish my order and make the walk? Fuckin A. Bravo guys.

36.description: Okay so Chineese places are always a little sketchy to me. I was def a little apprehensive about going in her but someone else was paying so, whatev right.I came with my husband and best friend. They ordered the pepper steak lunch special and the sweet and sour shrimp. I ordered the chicken lo mein. Everything was good. The true test for me is the egg rolls. Not many places have good egg rolls, China House's are delicious.The portions are huge! I only ate maybe 1/8 of the box they gave me and was full. I would def recommend. I will certainly be back!!! :)

14.description: A solid spot in the neighborhood for Chinese food.  The staff is friendly and very fluent in English.

3.description: Okay, I actually remember this Walgreens because the night I went it was pouring rain and the bus driver asked if he could jump in front of me because it was almost time for him to pull off...and when I told him he was driving the bus we needed to get on, so I couldn't let him get in front of me because he would end up leaving us he said he would just put his juice and chips down...lol because he couldn't be late!  He ended up going to camera and we ended up walking!!! Now, I know that has nothing to do with Walgreens but hey I thought it was a cute little story!This Walgreens was clean and the staff was great!  When the line was getting long they quickly opened another one with the I C 3 although I saw about 10 but hey that's just me!

1.description: This walgreens sucks when it comes down to customer service. 5-10 min. phone wait only to be placed on hold 2 or 3 more times. Employees send you off looking for managers instead of paging one to the area. And then when everything is all said and done have fun waiting in line for an additional 15 min. or so. Hope your patient if you're shopping here. I had to give a 1 star rating... only because a 1/2 star isn't available.

2.description: I've only been in to stop at the Chase ATM for some bills to spend at cash only businesses in the surrounding neighborhood. On one hand, this place is a lifesaver. On the other hand, would it kill them to get some bike parking? (Hint, hint) Puh-leeze!!

5.description: This walgreen is one of the closest to my home.. Don't get me wrong the inside is super clean and never messy and most of the time I find what I'm looking for.. but their pharmacy department is the worst! Super super slowwww! I don't kno the work of a pharmacist or if making a prescription takes long but I hate dropping and picking up prescription (thru drive thru or inside) because I am never out with in 10 to 15 minutes.. I'm always there waiting honestly from 35 to 50 minutes. They need more staff or they are just slow on purpose.

6.description: I was super-excited to have a 'new' Walgreen's in the neighborhood (I live 3 blocks from here, and about the same distance from the one this replaced--at Pulaski and Grand--but would rather walk to this one).Of course, the new one is cleaner, brighter, and neater.  Let's hope that lasts.  Otherwise, it's just a standard Walgreen's.  I've always liked that their layouts are all pretty much identical.....makes it super-easy to get in and out of ANY Walgreen's, even if you've never been inside a particular location.  And this one has a decent-sized parking lot.My only complaints: it closes at 10, and EVERYTHING is locked up (I guess both are endemic to the so-so neighborhood).  Sad they have to lock up my $3 deordorant or a $5 bottle of shampoo, but even more irritating is that the last TWO times I had to ask the woman at the cosmetic counter to unlock a case, she was on her cell phone, clearly talking to family.  Fine, but she sees me standing there and doesn't at least acknowledge me for (seriously) 3 to 5 minutes, there's a problem.  I can point and you can unlock if you can't cut it short, but better yet......make your phone calls on your break, lady.

0.description: This Walgreen location is one block from my house and super convenient. I love that they have a deluxe coffee machine and a slushy machine. They also sell fresh fruit, sandwiches, wraps, alcohol and unbelievably sushi too. (although I wouldn't recommend the sushi).    The photo guy Joshua is always nice and lets  me check out at the photo counter even when the check out lines up front are not even full.  Some of the female employees there are loud,obnoxious and ghetto, but hey what would you expect from a Walgreen's in the hood any way.

4.description: This is pretty much your run if the milk walgreens. It's clean though and the staff are pretty helpful and friendly so that's a big plus.

58.description: We're pretty spoiled in Chicago despite our landlocked condition. I've had delicious sushi at countless restaurants, ranging from cheap and simple (such as Blue Fin or Gosu) to innovative and perfect (Hachi's, Indie Cafe). This place is pretty cheap, and all the more so with the use of one of their many coupons in circulation. Unfortunately, this isn't reason enough to visit the restaurant, which bugged me for all sorts of reasons. For one, there's apparently no AC. My boyfriend and I visited on an excessive heat warning day to find only fans to keep us from sweating into our hot lava scallops (tasty enough, I admit), and there was no mention of whether this was standard issue or not (therefore, I assume it is). The staff had strange timing, asking my boyfriend if he wanted to order before I'd arrived, then waiting 10 minutes to check in on us once I was seated with my bottle of sauvignon blanc rising steadily in temperature on the table before us. They were streaming music off Pandora, and it was an enjoyable mix of alt rock and indie, except that they were too cheap to buy a  membership and avoid loud and lengthy commercial breaks. It' $35 bucks a year, people! And well-worth it for some added ambiance, I assure you. Yes, the wall mural on the Southern wall is vibrantly-painted, but the lighting is too dim and dreary to put you at ease within the confines of this black box structure on the bleakish corner of Kedzie and North. I doubt I'll be back unless I want to get a big group in on a weekend without having to wait AND we're already in the neighborhood AND we have a Groupon, oh, AND it's not the summertime.

56.description: I wanted so much to like this place. I live a quick bike ride away from here & wanted it to be good. We had one of the daily deals coupons to check it out. It's in the place that used to be Treat. Decorations in the inside are ok, but their patio is horrendous. With a little bit of imagination they could dress it up. It feels like you're in a parking lot. Treat was marginally better at making the patio more homey, so there's a lot of room for improvement.The real problem is the service. Went at 8 p.m. on a Friday night. It was a 1/2 full, so not massively busy. Our waiter took our drink orders - we asked if they had hot green tea - not exactly an exotic order in an Asian joint. Twenty-five minutes later we had to ask, what about our tea? He said, oh, I've been looking all over the place for it all this time & we don't have any. Really? You spent 25 minutes looking for tea?Food was ok. The miso soup was fine, the agadahi tofu was pretty good. We had the chef's platter sushi/sashimi and it was just ok. It was better than what you get at Katana across from Brand (had borderline sushi there before!) but one step up from what I could get at Jewel's sushi bar. Again, my real problem with the service. Never came by to check on us; I had to go into the restaurant because I couldn't flag down anyone to refill the soy sauce container. We tried get the bus girl to help us, but every time we talked to her she just stared at us. I'm sure it was a language barrier, but if that's the case, she shouldn't work the front of the house. We had to go in and get our check, then again had to go in to pay -- our waiter was busy texting on his cell phone (which probably explains the 25 minute wait for no tea).Granted it's hard to get sushi in Humboldt Park, so if you have a craving, delivery is probably better, but frankly I'm not going back there.

29.description: Very chill spot, great staff and incredibly delicious sushi.  I loved the BLT roll, very tasty. The BYOB option is awesome too. Grab your sake and order some grub here!

42.description: My fiance and I went here for her birthday recently. As far a good, relatively inexpensive sushi goes, this place is terrific. This isn't the place to go to if you're looking to have the BEST fish or the FANCIEST environment, but it's a great place to go on a weeknight to grab some sushi. We went in the middle of the week at 7pm and we were literally the only customer in the entire restaurant. At first I was skeptical seeing as it was empty, but the service was great, sushi was solid, and the presentation wasn't too shabby.

23.description: It was all right.  Boyfriend was disappointed with the size of the sushi roll.  I was a little taken aback with presentation of the teriyaki steak.  Steak was a very inexpensive cut - dry and shoe-leathery.  Miso soup was good - but I'm pretty sure that can't be screwed up.  I don't think we'll be making the walk from our place again :(

47.description: Where was the Jagaimo(potato) with my steak teriyaki entree tonight?Sushi is ok but I really hate it when restaurants don't deliver what is promised on the menu when ordering.  You already give an hour turnaround when placing an order for delivery so, getting it to me after i call to complain really doesn't help me with my meal.  Maybe a future discount would've sufficed.  Customer service really needs some thought.

8.description: This is our go to sushi place. We love it! It's close to home, consistent, fast, good prices, and fresh. We really hope it stays open for a long time! We eat here probably at least twice or three times a month.

31.description: Despite the mixed reviews for this place, I was craving sushi and am on a budget. It's a sushi option in the 'hood and Groupon saved the day! I grabbed a small bottle of sake on the way over because it's BYOB (thank you!) and got my Groupon grub on.I ordered four rolls: Sexy Dynamite, Sweet Potato, Caribbean and Caramel Crunch*Broke girl budget tip: Go stag so you can savor all the sushi goodness yourself. It's not greedy, it's savvy ;) And I had AM leftovers when I got home with the munchies from a long night out!All of the rolls were unique and tasty. The servings were plentiful, and my server was pleasant. Zoku did NOT disappoint! Zoku reminds me a lot of Jaiyen. Not authentic by any means, but delicious nonetheless. The decor is not so fab (alas, the cool wall mural is no more), so maybe skip it as a first date destination. This seems like the perfect late night sushi delivery place. They're open till 2am!The only unpleasant aspect of my visit was the side door issue. Restaurant employees were continually coming and going through the side door that opened up directly into the small dining room. It was negative degrees outside, and I'd be freezing cold every time this occurred. Maybe they weren't aware?All in all a satisfying experience.

34.description: Great neighborhood restaurant.  The staff has been excellent every time I have ordered. I have ordered both rolls and Pad Thai for take out and every time they have been excellent. I appreciate the diversity in food options brought to Humboldt Park.

16.description: This is one of the very few places in town where you can order sushi delivery till 2am and as bad as you might think late night maki may be it's actually not bad.I ordered conveniently through Yelp by way of Eat 24 which was an extremely smooth process. No language barrier on the phone, timely drop off, and didn't even have to walk down my stairs to meet the delivery dude. The rolls were surprisingly fresh, the pad thai was tasty, and their chili sauce added an excellent kick to make my food spicy which is just how I like it. It wouldn't exactly be my first choice for Asian food during normal hours, but if I get a craving after hours again I'd definitely order from Zoku.

13.description: Despite the mixed reviews for this place, I was craving sushi and am on a budget. It's a sushi option in the 'hood and Groupon saved the day! I grabbed a small bottle of sake on the way over because it's BYOB (thank you!) and got my Groupon grub on.I ordered four rolls: Sexy Dynamite, Sweet Potato, Caribbean and Caramel Crunch*Broke girl budget tip: Go stag so you can savor all the sushi goodness yourself. It's not greedy, it's savvy ;) And I had AM leftovers when I got home with the munchies from a long night out!All of the rolls were unique and tasty. The servings were plentiful, and my server was pleasant. Zoku did NOT disappoint! Zoku reminds me a lot of Jaiyen. Not authentic by any means, but delicious nonetheless. The decor is not so fab (alas, the cool wall mural is no more), so maybe skip it as a first date destination. This seems like the perfect late night sushi delivery place. They're open till 2am!The only unpleasant aspect of my visit was the side door issue. Restaurant employees were continually coming and going through the side door that opened up directly into the small dining room. It was negative degrees outside, and I'd be freezing cold every time this occurred. Maybe they weren't aware?All in all a satisfying experience.

11.description: They used to offer free delivery - what happened? Otherwise, totally reliable late night Thai and sushi, good prices, fast delivery. I have never eaten in, so I can't speak to the ambiance, but they certainly fill a neighborhood void among significantly more expensive, but not necessarily better, place. Thanks, Zoku!

39.description: This is one of the very few places in town where you can order sushi delivery till 2am and as bad as you might think late night maki may be it's actually not bad.I ordered conveniently through Yelp by way of Eat 24 which was an extremely smooth process. No language barrier on the phone, timely drop off, and didn't even have to walk down my stairs to meet the delivery dude. The rolls were surprisingly fresh, the pad thai was tasty, and their chili sauce added an excellent kick to make my food spicy which is just how I like it. It wouldn't exactly be my first choice for Asian food during normal hours, but if I get a craving after hours again I'd definitely order from Zoku.

37.description: Great food which was beautifully presented, wonderful service, cozy and quiet. Highly recommend fat salmon sashimi or any other sashimi combo.

0.description: good food, fast service, good portion sizes and prices.

38.description: Slightly overpriced depending on what you are looking to order. Rolls are up there but the thai section is average. Spicy miso soup was very good and full of seaweed and tofu. Sexy dynamite roll was unique, but i wish the krab was inside the roll. It would've made it way easier to eat.  Service was sluggish, but nice. I might come back if i lived or happened to be in the area, but probably wont make the trek back.

51.description: I just received the 3 rolls I ordered from Zoku for about $30. This is what I received. I will never waste my time with this place again.Here is a photo of what I received: imgur.com/MSVVpThe quantity is about 1/3 of what I expected, and what I normally get from any other sushi restaurant. The quality was mediocre, but $30 for what amounted to basically 1 roll is ridiculous. I called, and they weren't interested in discussing it.

27.description: Let's hover more between 3.5 and 4 stars, but I'll round up.  How I haven't reviewed this place yet is weird.  We order from them about once a month, maybe twice, via GrubHub since we've moved ridiculously close by.  Don't be scared because it's in, ooOooOohh, Humboldt Park.What we appreciate the most is that if the husband wants sushi, I can get non-sushi food.  He really likes their miso soup, several types of rolls and such.  I don't know what he gets because sushi grosses me out.  The rolls do add up fast though.I've had the massaman curry which is ok, fried rice which I think was just ok too.  I tend to get the chicken satay and the rama chicken most times which are pretty decent though I think they changed their peanut sauce from the last time we ordered.  It was much more syrupy, like corn syrupy, so not as good.  All in all, it's a surprisingly decent place with super fast delivery that we'll likely keep ordering from.

32.description: My husband and I went with Restaurant.com gift certificate and ordered Kee Mow  and Pork Belly Udon. They are good and reasonably priced. We ordered Kee Mow extra spicy. And it came out really spicy just as we loved. I just wish there would be a little more noodles.

54.description: Yeeuck... Mongolian beef that had all peppers and no green onions? Stale crab Rangoon. Overpriced and not worth it.

48.description: About the cheapest good take out sushi in Chicago you can get. Order online- they have great specials that if you spend $20 you can get a like $10 roll free... Not the best sushi, but definitely best for the price if you're craving some. The environment for eating in isn't really attractive, but I just take out.

44.description: Have always enjoyed ordering from Zoku. My favorite dish is the Korean BBQ. They have made changes over the past year. (I don't really prefer the kimchee they added to the dish, but their sushi rice is really great. I do wish they offered some kind of desert though.) Delivery was on time. Food was still hot. Two qualities I really appreciate. Whenever I'm in the mood to have Korean BBQ delivered I always order from Zoku. Thanks!!

24.description: After coming home after midnight from a long and terrible day at work, I starvingly turned to GrubHub to help me eat my feelings. Zoku made me remember that not all is lost in this sometimes cruel world. Not only was I able to order crab rangoons, sushi, Korean bbq beef, kimchi, and miso soup all from the same place, I was able to order it all from the same place after midnight. The delivery was extremely quick and the food... the food was absolutely delicious. I don't know if I'm just used to late-late night delivery food tasting like it's geared toward drunken a-holes, but Zoku surpassed all my hopes and dreams by bringing me cuisine that was fresh, thoughtful, and satiating. Thank you for feeding my soul and my belly, I owe you one.

7.description: Delicious rolls had OMG and sexy dynamite. Service was good. BYOB:)  Decor and neighborhood are only reasons for 4 stars!

49.description: Zoku is the only sushi in my 'hood of Humboldt Park, so on a recent Friday night I ventured out to check it out. This small restaurant is in the space of the wonderful Treat (RIP), and falls well below the mark of that unique place.Walked in and an employee off-shift was taking up the sushi "bar" area playing with her cell phone. Never looked up. Just  slovenly hanging around. I hate that. I was seated by another waitress, facing the awesome mural wall. Kudos on that. The rest of the decor is adequate. Noticed a few people on dates here, I would probably skip date night here if you're wanting to impress.I ordered the appetizer - Gyu negima- tender beef wrapped around green onion w/teriyaki glazeand entrees:- Spicy Tuna rolls-California rollsAnd then I waited for awhile...then out came the rolls. Gee, that's a kitchen fail. Thanks for bringing out the appetizer AFTER the entree. The "tender" beef was cooked medium well, making it tough, screwing up what could have been a nice dish. I think they were trying to disguise a poor cut of meat, actually.The spicy of the Spicy Tuna was all but missing. The California rolls were adequate.  I will be back or will order the Caramel rolls or some specialty Maki, but I'm not rushing here to do so.

40.description: Frendly staff, good food, and close to the house. Everything we ordered was delicious! Definitely worth it with the Groupon.

53.description: Though I came here with an open mind, I left so disappointed...and still hungry. The service was pretty bad. Once our order was finally taken after waiting for what felt like a very long time, our rather simple sushi took nearly 30 minutes to prepare and my boyfriend's pad thai took another 25 minutes after that (even though there were only 3 other tables of customers, mostly couples). While the waitress was nice enough, she was largely MIA and only came to the table when a plate was being brought over. Our water wasn't even refilled until we got our check (huh?).I tried to encourage my boyfriend to understand that maybe they were understaffed, or had a lot of delivery orders to prepare as his hunger started to get to him, and hoped to hell the food would at least be good.  Whoops...strike two. The food itself was also a major letdown. My "fresh" salmon sashimi was slightly pinkish-gray and oily, and arrived on a brown and wilted triangle of lettuce (why bother?). It was not good. Then, the brown rice version of an avocado and cucumber roll I decided upon actually made me angry that I didn't just eat at home. The rice wasn't brown sushi rice but an overcooked instant-type of brown rice (for which I had to pay an extra $1.50) that was so dry I couldn't finish it. The vegetables were sliced super inconsistently, and some pieces were missing one of the 2 veggies inside. My boyfriend said his midori monster roll was OK, though...but nothing special. When his pad thai finally came, the noodles were good but were scattered with what he termed "gross" beef. He had come starving and didn't even finish it, also turning down a doggie bag. This might have just been the first time I have seen him NOT clean his (and my) plate.We did think the one cool thing was the wall art...but I can say with certainty that we will not be back to see it.

30.description: Terrible.  Two stars for mediocre sushi.  0 stars for the poor service and decor ( i mean...rubber mat liners as a substitute for table cloth??)If you end up visiting despite this review, please don't get the shrimp spring rolls.  It's nothing but lettuce, carrots and half a tail of shrimp.

46.description: Nestled in a sketchy part of the neighborhood. When we arrived, all the tables were full. I have no idea how anyone would randomly notice the place (as the exterior is very dark) unless you were already planning on going there.The futo roll, dragon, and hamachi-negi were amazing. Was expecting tiny roles from reading other reviews, but these were decent in my opinion.Got shrimp spring rolls...okay, but I've never been a spring roll fan. Also got the veggie green curry. The curry was okay, but not many vegetables, and the ones that were there were all baby carrots. The rice was also rather interesting.Loved the 3 rolls that I got, however. The waitress was rather unattentive and had to be asked many times to get our drinks refilled, but luckily there was another server that started picking up her slack. The waitress was very sweet, however.

1.description: The sushi was ok, but the ramen was awesome! Best ramen I've had in Chicago. The braised pork was perfect, the sliced egg was cooked just right; the yolk was too hard or soft. But the best part was the broth. The cloudy goodness was amazing in the mouth. Big thumbs up!

55.description: Not the best sushi I've ever had, and not the cheapest sushi I've ever had, but I've learned that the two are nearly mutually exclusive in Chicago, so I'll take what I can get and Zoku is as good as anywhere around south Logan/east Humboldt park.Granted, I've never been inside, only ever ordered on grubhub, but it's been great every time  - acceptably fresh, even when I get delivery on 100+ afternoons.  Well-formed maki, just the right amount of sticky to the sushi rice, spicy mayo that isn't too spicy.  They're pretty gluten free friendly, too, just make sure to specify that your rolls need to be prepared with clean hands on a clean surface and cut with a clean knife to try and lessen the cross contamination possibilities from things like their tempura rolls (and even if you don't have a soy allergy, you might want to say you do, because I don't think they seem to understand that soy sauce isn't gluten free), and 95% of the time, it'll be fine.No clue as to the quality of service or the ambience, but for quick, cheap, acceptably tasty and mostly-reliable makizushi delivery in Logan Square, Zoku's where it's at.

9.description: The fish is of a high quality. I usually just order a small miso soup and 6 pieces of fatty yellow tail sashimi. Staff is always friendly, their hot meals are great, and you can always go for a quick sprint across Humboldt if you're feeling wAcKy. Haha jokes.

26.description: This is probably my to go to sushi place whenever I want something familiar but yummy. I still haven't had the chance to dine in but I have to say their delivery service is fast and reliable. The quality of their sushi rolls as well makes it worth spending on. My favorites would have to be caramel crunch, shrimp tempura, spider, and the new sweet valentine maki. Other menu items are good as well like Kee Mow and Udon tempura. It's definitely worth a shot!

25.description: This is a new place in town.  The menu is reasonable and the fish quality was good. But the food I ordered was not the food I got.  Still delicious but obviously a little disorganized.  Sushi quality is worthy of a second chance.

12.description: This place is our go to thai and sushi place. Not only is it open late but delivery is very quick. The food I'd always great and it's just a nice meal when you don't want to cook.

59.description: Actually I wanted to rate it zero star...Even though the foods are Ok but we felt like waited forever! Waited for 20 min for water and menu, waited for 30 min for the sushi and waited for the whole dinner time for a ramen, ending up we canceled the order! Very very disappointed and I can say this was my worst diner experience ever! Won't going back!

21.description: I've lived on and off in Humboldt Park the majority of my...ahem...43 years. Imagine my delight to move back and discover a sushi restaurant across the street from my new home. Don't get me wrong...I love an alcapurria as much as the next person but I appreciate diversity in dining. So I dined at Zoku on a Friday night around 10 pm recently. It wasn't too crowded and service was swift. My friend and I ordered a beef appetizer which was tender and flavorful but the true winner was the caramel crunch sushi. Who knew sweetness and sushi was such a magnificent blend. We ordered two other rolls and they were delicious and very fresh but honestly I can't remember what they were because the caramel crunch stole the show.  I'm eager to try the Thai dishes as well and I'll report back.

17.description: We were looking for a place that delivered on a Sunday night. This place is open until 10:30pm and their food was delicious. We ordered four rolls and got two egg rolls for free for ordering $30 worth of food. Our food arrived in 40 minutes. We will definitely be ordering here again!!

10.description: A lot of the sushi is a little heavily over-mayoed but aside from that the sushi overall is delicious.  i love the veggie spring rolls- super filling. The Thai iced tea is so flavorful and is the oerfect refreshment to go with your meal. The art work inside is great, nice ambiance.  I regularly order from here because its local, convenient, and i am never disappointed with their delivery either.

5.description: My partner and I decided to order for delivery since we had gone a week prior and enjoyed the sushi and the cozy environment.Huge mistake. Ordered 2 sushi dishes and two hot dishes. They said it was going to take 25 minutes. After the hour,I called and asked about my order and the girl over the phone said it should be arriving soon.5 minutes later, it arrived. Starving at this point we didn't notice that both the sushi and the hot dishes were packaged in the same bag. We just wanted to eat! That same night at 3am my partner got fever,vomiting etc. She was not able to hold any food down since that meal.After 4 days she finally went to  emergency with 103 fever. Conclusion,Bacterial infection due to FOOD POISONING. The Dr. advised us to contact the establishment,but decided to let the customers know as well. I am partially to blame for not checking the bag and for even accepting the delivery after an hour wait.I do hope the establishment is aware on how they package their sushi or replace the sushi after a certain time.

3.description: The food is delicious!  The miso soup, the edamame, the maki... the proportions are generous, the food is served hot.  The most vegetarian maki options of any place in the city.  The best place for sushi in the city, and i've been to most of them.  It's never been busy when i've been here, but i've only been here late at night.  The hours are great.  Clean atmosphere, good music.  I hope this place catches on if it hasn't already!

35.description: ZOKU MOTHERFUCKING SUSHI.What can I say about Zoku sushi that hasn't been said before.I motherfucking love this joint. I live around the fucking corner and I eat this this shit all the fucking time.FREE FUCKING DELIVERY UNTIL 2AMAND THE FOOD IS DOPE AS FUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUCKsrslydudes:: kotsu don curry 500 times a fucking week. TEMPURA FRIED EGG IN YOUR FACE. Love this fucking place. Spend 20 bones on eat24hours.com and get some free motherfucking miso soup, you know I fuckin love soup!The Delivery Dudes are nice as fuck and it's always snowing and shit and freezing cold so TIP THESEMOTHERFUCKERS FAT. 25 bucks and under = automatic $5 for this cat, the fucking minimum. Homies are feeding families and you're ordering food at 1am.Get real,tip this guy.... TIPHIMSeriously though, good on you zoku sushi. Please start delivering beer and cigarrettes50 FUCKING STARS

19.description: Nestled in a sketchy part of the neighborhood. When we arrived, all the tables were full. I have no idea how anyone would randomly notice the place (as the exterior is very dark) unless you were already planning on going there.The futo roll, dragon, and hamachi-negi were amazing. Was expecting tiny roles from reading other reviews, but these were decent in my opinion.Got shrimp spring rolls...okay, but I've never been a spring roll fan. Also got the veggie green curry. The curry was okay, but not many vegetables, and the ones that were there were all baby carrots. The rice was also rather interesting.Loved the 3 rolls that I got, however. The waitress was rather unattentive and had to be asked many times to get our drinks refilled, but luckily there was another server that started picking up her slack. The waitress was very sweet, however.

28.description: I tried this place using a Groupon and was very delighted with what I got. The sushi was pretty good and fresh. The thai food was also not bad but I'd stick to the shushi. We had the BLT and that was ok since the flavor is quite overpowering. However, we had the octopus sushi and that was my favorite.Service was great, prompt and polite. However, the place was very cold despite the 4 space heaters. But I'd definitely go back.

45.description: Absolutely horrible experience.  We ordered, they showed up 20 minutes late (took almost 2 hours in total).  The food was cold (we had some soup and crab rangoon as well as sushi).  We called back, they left us on hold, forgot us, then tried to take another order, before finally giving us the manager.  He rudely told us we were lying and that he would come and get the food if we did not like it.  We said fine. He came and continued to argue that the food was warm and that we called 20 minutes after the food arrived not that it was 20 minutes late when the driver himself had originally apologized for being late in the first place. After much arguing he finally gave me the money back.

33.description: Ordered delivery, which I'm usually hesitant to do when it's sushi, but I was very pleasantly surprised.Escolar Jalapaño Classic Maki - fresh and crunchy jalapeños had just enough kick without overpowering the hamachi. Sweet Potato Maki - Best roll in my order. There is something about sweet potato tempura that makes my heart sing and this roll brought that love to another level.Avocado Maki - nothing much to say other than the avocado was fresh, creamy and delicious. Vietnamese-style Veggie Spring Roll - not my favorite in Chicago (hence the minus one star), but okay. The sweet peanut sauce was very watery and too tangy, it overpowered the roll. I definitely want to try this place for dinner at the restaurant after such a great delivery experience. And I almost forgot the best part - FREE DELIVERY! Happy sushi-ing!

43.description: Food was pretty good and the service was excellent!  I would recommend this place.

2.description: This is probably the closest sushi place to my house and the prices are reasonable.  It's by no means the absolute best sushi I've ever had but it's pretty good and for delivery, the presentation is still nice.  Also, I think they must have some sort of telepathy because I've never received a delivery order take more than 25 minutes.  All in all a solid local choice.

18.description: We bought a groupon a few months ago and when we got there they were closed so we went somewhere else. Planned to return the groupon but then forgot.Since we were in the area Sunday we decided to use it. After ordering I decided to check yelp and saw that the most recent review said food poisoning. We should have just left then but my boyfriend Said we'd be fine. He was wrong. We both had to call off work and are now suffering from FOOD POISONING. This restaurant doesn't even deserve the star I gave them. The food is not that great and costs too much for what you get. We will NEVER be back.

41.description: i have most definitely experienced better.  as you walk into the place, a musty smell that is reminiscent of a dirty mop left in old dirty water, fills your senses.  it takes a few minutes to acclimate to the subtle wiff.  then we ordered the rolls and talk about portion control!  usually, in a roll, one will receive 6 sections to  a roll.  sometimes even 8, depending on the place, but this place under delivered.  the roll we got had only 5 smaller than usual sections.  the fish was not as good as i thought and proved so about 1 day later.... :(  I had the runs so bad and so did my guests!  never again.  Plus the prices were outrageous.

52.description: Zoku is awesome.  We showed up about 30 mintues before they were going to close and there were no customers left, but they were very willing to serve us.  This was not the first time we have been here, but I was actually surprised that they let us in with all of our beers and sake.  Nobody really gave us any trouble for being there 45 minutes past there closing time.  I love the art on the main wall.   I like the food here over the other places in Wicker Park and the prices are very reasonable.  I think this place will be great too with there outdoor patio for next year as well.  So if you want a quick sushi bite head here.

50.description: Slow service, spent about 30 bucks for delivery which included warm spicy tuna maki  rolls, soggy crab rangoons and broccoli chicken that appears to just be drenched in soy sauce..  Asked for a couple extra sauces but didn't receive.  There are worse things in life, but many better alternatives in Chicago.  Zoku, clean up your act... and when you say 50 minutes, don't take almost 2 hours.. :\

4.description: This is an update to my previous review. It is, with a heavy heart, very discouraging that I have to update my review. Zoku recently opened a second location, further from my house which I have not tried yet, and it seems that the A team has left the location near my house. I suspect the A team has gone to open the new restaurant, leaving the B team in charge at the location at Kedzie and North. BRING KATHY BACK!As a die hard Zoku fan, I was surprised when a received an order that was not only sub-par with falling apart sushi, but the instructions regarding my order had not been followed. I said to myself, well everyone has bad days - no worries - and didn't think twice about it. Then another order, equally disappointing. Ok, people have rough weeks too....I'll  give it another go again. Third time, fourth time - all equally disappointing and at this point I've sunk too much money into second, third and fourth chances. I'm so sorry Zoku, but this isn't working for me - our one way relationship - we're going to have to start seeing other people. Nothing personal, you just seem to have emotionally stopped caring.

6.description: I live right down the street from this place. I can't say my experience with it has been amazing but it's not the worse either. The green curry is adequately spicy. The sushi is alright but I'm not sure I'd eat something with raw fish in it again. I got the futomaki and the maguro one. Like most Japanese fare in town, it's hard to get sushi comparable to Tokyo. I barely see anyone in here on weekdays.

22.description: I went here with a groupon and have been back three more times since April. While the decor isn't 5 star the sushi and VERY good. It's like a little Dive sushi place. I recommend giving it a shot and not being intimidated by the local/decor. Staff was really pleasant as well. They had a nail on their bench that ripped my boyfriends pants a little and literally wanted to take it to get it fixed at a dry cleaner, told us the meal was on them, and fixed it right away!

15.description: I have ordered from this place many times and it always arrives faster than the promise time and everything I have tried is great! From the sushi, to soup, to the noodle dishes, it's always great!

57.description: I'm mostly a fan because I live so close by to this place.  I have ordered take out a number of times usually getting pad see ewe or some such thing and it's always good though I wish the portions were a bit larger.  I did dine there once and had mixed feelings.  The spicy tuna roll was good but I wasn't a fan of the specialty rolls we ordered.  I think it was the carmel crunch.  The prices are generally good (on the cheap side) and they are generally friendly.  I do want this place to succeed.  Located in the building which used to be Treat that unfortunately couldn't make it work.  But, I love sushi and love a place close to home.

20.description: Really enjoyed date night at Zoku tonight! For the veggies, the Zebra was amazing. Spicy Salmon and White Dragon were delish. Started with Tuna Tartar...unique and tasty. Shrimp & Veggie Tempura had a nice light taste as well. All around great dinner. Add BYOB and I'm hooked! Too bad the restaurant was empty on a Friday night. Hello people...check this place out; it's worth the drive or bus trip!

36.description: I expected more food. I'm a hungry guy and I can't shake the feeling that I'm unsatisfied. Furthermore, the food tasted decent. The rating doesn't resemble that. Actually the tuna sampler was really fresh. Mmm... I'd like to have eaten more though. My belly wants more food. And I think this restaurant caters to the taste buds more than satisfying our hungry belly's. One suggestion to the restaurant, add some more food to the plate.

14.description: Loved this place. The service was great but it's also because we were the only people in the restaurant on a Saturday night! We had the sushi chef just bring is his favorite rolls an they were all really good. I didn't love the caramel crunch but their volcano roll was amazing.

3.description: Stephen King did my tattoo and was a very nice guy. place smelled clean, looked clean, and the artist worked with what I wanted and cared about how it turned out. Creamy, the owner, was a creep and used every stupid baby boomer old dude trick in the book to be a jackass to me. talked to me like an idiot and continuously asked me out on a date. maybe the owner should be more professional, other then that it was good

1.description: I love this hope, and there is not an artist in there that I wouldn't let tattoo me. Tony, Steven King, Creamy and soon to be Drex are some of the most talented tattoo artists I know. That are hands down amazing. Tony has done the majority of the work on me, and always charges a fair price. His work on me has been featured in galleries featuring excellent tattoo work as well and three soon to be 4 times in Ink'd magazine on myself.

2.description: Just had a large half sleeve done by Jeremy and had an overall great experience, after only being tattooed once before.   The place was clean, the artists were friendly/humble and listened to my thoughts on the piece.  Jeremy took the time to dissect a very straightforward coin design and turn it into a piece of art.  I highly recommend these guys and will be back.

9.description: I would like to send out a huge shout out to Chicago True Blue Tattoo!   While visiting a friend in Chicago I thought it would be the perfect time to get an old tattoo covered.  Jeremy at did an EXCELLENT job using his amazing artistic ability to design and complete my side piece that now extends down my upper thigh to cover-up an old tattoo.  I couldn't have asked for better service!  Everyone in the shop was very friendly, professional, accommodating and laid back.  My new piece was worth every dime!  I'll definitely be coming back when I'm in the area and in need of more work.  Thanks Jeremy!

10.description: Went in tonight for a tattoo and am so so pleased with the results.  Brian did an excellent job on a tattoo I have wanted for a long time.  He said he can correct a previous tattoo as well which makes me super happy!  Very comfortable atmosphere, incredibly nice guy, and excellent work.  I will definitely be returning for all of my tattoos in the future.

4.description: Just made a recent visit to True Blue tattoo and was very happy with the work that was done on my arm. I recommend if your looking have work done at an affordable and artist driven shop.

6.description: I've only been tattooed by Brian (came here with the intention of having him touch-up a tattoo he did awhile back, ended up talking to him about doing some sugar skulls), but the guys here are great.  The guys are really laid back and the shop just has an overall good vibe.  I've only been tattooed by Brian, but I've seen work from the other guys and honestly, you can't go wrong with any of them.  Brian did three of my tattoos previously, but two of them are flags and one came from a birthday card, so I didn't want much tweaking done.  Well, this time I knew I wanted sugar skulls, but wasn't sure exactly what I wanted.  Initially I didn't want color, I wanted a profile view of them, one female the other male, not too much going on but not too little.  I showed Brian pictures of ones I liked and ones I hated and he came up with two skulls that I love.  I wasn't sure what to expect and when I saw what he came up with I couldn't stop smiling.  As he was setting up I asked him if he thought I should put some color in and he said it wouldn't look bad, so, I went with it and I'm really happy I did.  I felt bad for Brian because while I can normally sit relatively still, tattooing the foot meant there were movements I couldn't control.  When I had to have him stop so I could re-position my foot, he had no problem with that.  When I had to have him stop because it hurt and I needed a minute, he had no problem with that.  When I needed some gum to stop me from clenching my teeth, he gave me some.  Brian's a really nice guy and my tattoos look great!  Definitely recommend True Blue.

12.description: I have gotten my past three tattoos at True Blue and I highly recommend it.  My work was all done by Brian Clutter, who is amazing! One of the pieces he did was water colory looking, and it truly looks like an antique water color painting on my arm. Perfect! My other two were detailed line work and shading, and those look equally amazing! Bonus for how nice and non pretentious the atmosphere and dudes are here. And I swear it is the cleanest tattoo spot I have seen. Bottom line? If you want some excellent work done without the hype and obnoxiousness, go to Brian at True Blue.

5.description: Chicago true blue is a great shop. My girlfriend and I have gotten a combined six tattoos from Tony. He is friendly and really cares about giving you what you want. His line work and shading are top notch. Tony is also very quick! Check out his work on Instagram! He does great work for a great price. Tony -  Afic6 on Instagram!

13.description: Great shop.  I was in there a couple weeks ago getting my fifth tattoo done by James.  As soon as you walk in the place feels good.  There is a pool table in the lobby open for anyone waiting and some padded benches for those who don't want to.  Tattoos can take a while so if your in line its nice to be able to play a couple games with your buddies while your waiting for them to finish up what they are doing. Creamy, the owner is a real solid dude and a great artist as well.  Showbizo is another artist and cool guy. I had a chance to talk to him also.  All the artists are good guys,  they don't mind talking or even playin some pool with you as well.The best part is that you can hang in there without feeling like your in there strictly for business and when your number is up its time to get it done and leave.  I'll be in there soon to finish up the color on my tattoo.  This place is a clean well kept shop run by professionals.  I definitely recommend it.

11.description: Went to True Blue many times this year so I gotta say first I love the free & easy parking.  You can expect a clean, friendly shop of talented artists who charge a fair price.  I go to Brian Clutter, I've seen Jeremy & others do great work too.  These are not amateurs when it comes to custom tattoo work.  If you can imagine it, they can tattoo it.

8.description: I went to these guys for my 3rd tattoo, having went to Deluxe Tattoo for my 2nd tattoo, and L.J. for my very first tattoo (when I was 17). True Blue Tattoo has got to be the one shop that had the nicest and friendliest bunch of guys around. The atmosphere and vibe that I felt were like I was a buddy of their's from get go. The place has a pool table, large and well-lit lobby/waiting area for customers and the inking area is a little bit farther back and off to the side, offering some privacy. I had an appointment for a session with them to do a piece on my forearm, wrist to elbow, of some custom work depicting a scene from a movie, John Carpenter's The Thing. It was the Norris creature and is my favorite part of the movie which is one of my favorite horror films. Contact with artist throughout the week before I got the tattoo was regular, updated with pics of the tattoo and I was able to give input as to what I wanted exactly as needed. Artist was very patient and accommodating, working on me for around 6 hours, taking very short breaks very few times. The music playing in the shop was great, a good mix of metal and hard rock, and the whole shop just had a very pleasing atmosphere to it. When local hoods/gangbangers came in wanting to get some gang tattoos the owner/manager of True Blue quite clearly told them we don't do gang tattoos and that they should go to another place for that. I really respected the shop for refusing a paying customer that wanted some bullsh*t gang crap on them. The owner, who was there during my session and was very friendly and cool to talk to, has been in the tattooing business for 15+ years and was very knowledgeable on the craft and art. The artist gave me my finest tattoo to date, exactly how I wanted it done, and I could not have been more pleased. The shop was extremely clean, organized, and one of the most comfortable experiences I have had in a tattoo shop. During my session, fellow artists at the shop offered to run to the store to get me a beverage, grab some food, etc..My friend who came with me for the whole session was treated just as cool as I was. I can't recommend this tattoo shop enough. My friend is now going to come back to get some of her work touched up and it was because of the knowledgeable artists and  end result of my own extraordinary inking that really stood out in my friend and me deciding to come back again for our next tattoo work. Parking was easy- got a spot right out in front. It is not metered parking on side of the street that the shop is on. That is a plus. They do walk ins. Also cool. Come check them out.

0.description: Stephen King was amazing and very patient with us. One of our best experiences.Thank you!

7.description: I am so very, very happy with my decision to go to True Blue. I started out looking for parlors in the area. I called around to five or six different shops in the Wicker Park region, asking about their shop minimums. Of all the shops I called, the gentleman I spoke to at True Blue was the only person who said anything along the lines of, "Why, what were you thinking of having done?" He asked for details and my situation and showed a wonderful professionalism when discussing my work with me as well as pricing and time. The fact that he showed interest where other shops didn't made me inclined to want to go from the beginning. My friend and I were getting three small pieces between the two of us - her two, me one - and they told me that they would work with me on price because I was getting less done.I ended up exchanging emails with them and going in for our tattoos on a Sunday afternoon. It was pretty quiet, but all the same, the service and hospitality we received was wonderful. Jeremy (I'm pretty sure there are two Jeremys there, so for reference, the one with the long goatee) did our work, and he did it very well indeed. My friend I both felt very comfortable in his shop. The shop, by the way, is gorgeous - the walls are covered in paintings done by the various tattoo artists who work there, and during the process, Jeremy told us that they were going to have their first art exhibit there in a couple of weeks (August 25, folks, I recommend it) and asked us if we would play that night for them (we're cellists, and were getting cello tattoos).All in all, very, very pleased. I recommend this shop highly - the art is great, the people are great, the atmosphere is great (the music they played was awesome, too) and most importantly, we're delighted with our tattoos. Thanks, guys.

58.description: Oh, how I love Farmer's Pride.It's not a big chain grocery (it's probably less a quarter of the size of the Dominic's down the street); but somehow Farmer's Pride manages to have everything I need.  I know the owner makes it a point of, well, pride; because he laughed and told me. 'We have EVERYTHING!' one time when he was able to point out the one obscure item on my list I was sure I'd have to look for elsewhere.A little while ago I heard someone on the radio recommending that, in order to maintain a healthy diet, shoppers should avoid the middle section of the grocery store, where all the frozen and processed foods are.  Ever since then, that's how I've thought of Farmer's Pride: as a grocery store that just eliminated the middle section.  You know, for our health.They've got your basic produce, snacks and dairy--and a lot of other treats like organic cereal, locally-roasted coffee, and heat and serve Indian entrees.  They've got the best butcher counter around, and have me cooking up animal-protein like a fiend (much to the chagrin of my vegetarian boyfriend).  So much to love about Farmer's Pride; but the best thing has to be the price.  I am always amazed how many bags of groceries I can fill for less than $20 at Farmer's Pride.  They always leave me with a little extra in my pocket for when I'm just too lazy to do the right thing and cook.

56.description: You're simply the best. The selection is wide for the footprint, and the value is strong. I'm constantly impressed by both the produce and the meat counter.There is 15 minute parking immediately out front, and there is usually a spot available.

29.description: So I like to have fresh options to cook with. You can't make good food from produce that has been soaking in a bin for dog years. Boyfriend says he can survive on Ramen, Kraft boxes, popcorn  and cans of tuna... I know better- That processed, preserved crapola will kill him! Lucky him, I can cook. So when trying to find a new place to shop, he stumbled on this gem and dragged me in. I was skeptical because it is very small and the one single door is covered in lotto ads (No, I so do not ever play the lottery). It is such a welcome change for endless aisles of Jewel or Dominicks filled with crap you do not want or need!They have huge imported cans of San Marzano tomatoes, Authentic German mustard, really delicious produce options and some really funny guys behind the meat counter!Last Visit (Loosely translated from Spanish):Boyfriend: "I need that, that and more of that."Counter Guy: "What are you going to do with all of that?"BF: "Dunno. She (points at me) cooks it all."CG: "Wha... She COOKS?!?"BF: "She's Italian. She cooks like an Italian, Man. It's nice."Sighs followed. I thought it was hysterical. I've got to bake some cookies for those guys.

42.description: Quite possibly, the perfect neighborhood market.  I've lived in the 'hood for a year now and while I've stopped in once before, last night's visit reminded me what a great little place this is and the fact that I need to visit it much more often!  Great selection of items (many organic/local items) at very reasonable prices, fresh produce and friendly staff.  What more could you ask for?!  Star Lounge coffee?  Well, they have that, too!

23.description: Looked promising.  Live in the neighborhood, thought to stop by for some fresh fruit.  We were undergoing a heat wave.  Went inside for some crisp, sweet, crunchy grapes and a refreshing watermelon.  Saw the grapes first.  Wrinkly and mushy and looked like it was sitting there for a few days.  I ditched the watermelon effort. Boo.I should have never betrayed Stanley's just a few blocks away.  Sorry, Stanley, never again.  You're my man.

47.description: Anyone else remember Edmar's? Well, Farmer's Pride is like a little Edmar's. All the basics- italian, mexican, greek, deli, and sweets plus some extra stuff, at fair prices, and much of it locally branded! Nothing exotic here, but hey, i aint no exotic chef. they dont have it? try Rich's or CVS...come on! you don't ever NEED to go to Dominick's.

8.description: Amazing variety of great products,  fresh produce,  super nice and knowledgeable butchers,  boar's head meats,  and a beer cave.

31.description: My local standby. Free parking right on western.

34.description: It's called Farmer's Pride-- but I'm not sure anything in the store has been produced by local or regional farmers.  Most of the produce had large commercial produce stickers.

16.description: I have been going to Farmers Pride for years.  I live across the street (Ukrainian Village) and its super convenient.  I also was on a budget and this place was a perfect change from going to the supermarkets ( Pete's or Mariano's).  Their produce, bread, and deli meat selections are great.  Additionally, they also have local items such as meat rubs, tamales, baked goods, ect.  I enjoy making my weekly stops here.  Not to mention the people who work there I have been seeing for years are very nice and helpful.

13.description: Farmer's Price is a good local grocer and a mediocre cafe. The grocer is cheap and has a pretty good local selection. The produce is fine, as is the deli meats, although they are not exceptional. Specialty items range from excellent (Tamales on weekend mornings, Spinach Pies up front, and Damato's Bread) to old and stale (Gourmet Popcorn the one time I tried it). The cafe, while cheap, has mediocre food at best, and relatively slow service. The price point, and lack of other neighborhood options to get a breakfast sandwich (ex. bacon egg and cheese) make it an option if you are hankering for a hangover cure.

11.description: I love having this small grocery store in the neighborhood. It is so helpful to be able to park in their 15 minute parking, run in and get a handful of items when I need them. Their selection of organic/healthy pantry items is impressive, and their produce and meat almost always have what I'm looking for- without having to park on the roof at Mariano's and bottleneck into the elevator. They even have their own homemade Greek yogurt! Who can resist that!

39.description: I love my corner store! They have an amazing selection of organic, gluten free and ethnic food items. The prices are fantastic and the people who work here are great. I am in here several times a week, don't know what I would do without them!

37.description: I came in here to use my Groupon and discovered it lived up to all the hype. Great place, nice ethnic choices, cheaper than Dominick's. The handmade dairy stuff was a nice plus. I didn't check out the meat counter, but it looked pretty solid. It's refreshing to see places like this exist as alternatives. I'll most definitely be back!

0.description: Ever since the new owners took over at Farmers Pride Produce, a handful of years ago, the quality of their produce, deli, bakery goods and especially their employees have maintained high quality.Before the new owners, I was a huge advocate of Farmers Pride's products and people.  I continue to feel that way.

38.description: Maybe I'm just not getting the right things, but people have told me that the produce here is supposed to be good, but it always looks terrible when I try to shop here and I usually leave empty handed.  They do, however, carry a ton of local products (bread, grass fed milk from WI, those awesome tortilla chips in the green bag).I try to stick to packaged items when shopping here, just because given the state of their produce I don't really trust their perishables.  Maybe I just need to keep trying.

51.description: OK, lets do this highlights style:- they sell deli meats at pretty good deals most of the time.- their fruit salad mixes are only $1.5 and thats some guilt free snacking. funny thing is though you are very likely to notice something nasty and delicious looking on that huge pile of baked goods right by the register and grab some 2 pounds of coconut cookies for 3 dollars or so. guarenteed! :)- nice bread selection, if they are fresh good croissants that are 3 for a dollar.- they sell cigarettes a tad cheaper then other general stores.- they carry puffins, which is happy making.- avocados are on the small side, but for the price and taste, justifiable.-everything is tagged with a price including Tax, so if you calculate as you go around shopping, that's neat to know.-cashiers are friendly, others not so much. I'm sure some of the staff has been there forever, but some awkward zombieing around with boxes of veggies thrown around can be noticed sometimes.Overall, I ignored this place for so long, but now I hardly go to Dominicks for the core stuff.

27.description: Mainly staples and a strong deli make this a solid place to run out and grab produce, meats, and other necessities.  I wouldn't go here for a full-on "shopping for the week" type experience, but for night-to-night shopping and picking up the couple items you forgot, it's pretty solid.

32.description: I really wanted to love this market.  But for me it had the vibe of a Qwik Mart or 7-Eleven but with some produce and a deli.  I was shopping for produce...they didn't exactly the best variety, selection or quality for the price.  Street parking only...if you can find it.I'm pretty sure the deli is their bread and butter.

54.description: Love this place. Will keep coming back. For such a small place, I always seem to find what I need to keep my kitchen stocked nicely. The meats, fruits, and veggies are always fresh. The service is always great. I ruptured my achilles tendon late in 2009 and they delivered food to me while I was laid up for 60 days. Continued loyalty and recommendations will be my repayment for this store. Way to go Nico.

48.description: We popped into Farmers Pride hoping to find a good deal on bananas while we were walking down Chicago towards Western - the store itself is small, but loaded with tons of fresh and cheap produce - those bananas? 49 cents a pound! Ended up grabbing nearly 4 pounds of bananas for under 2 bucks!Due to the size of the store, it was a bit crowded, but the staff were extremely friendly and willing to help us find whatever we would have needed. It's a bit out of the way from our own house (a good 25 minutes walking) but if we're over in this part of Humboldt, we'll be sure to pop in again for the produce.

44.description: I need to toot the horn of Farmer's Pride one more time.  As we all know, Farmers Pride doesn't have EVERYTHING you are looking for, but for dinner staples, hell yeah.  The Carne Asada (ask them to put it through the "flattening machine" on the grill make mindblowing tacos, the chicken is super fresh, as is all their meat.  HANDS DOWN BEST GREEK YOGURT AND FETA - GET THE HAND PACKED STUFF.  My Tzatziki is way better with the handmade yogurt, and they have the best pita in the neighborhood.  Need Nann?  They have that, too!Always friendly and helpful, I go here as often as possible because as we all know, Dominicks blows.

24.description: I live down the street from FP, and refuse to buy my produce from any other store. They purchase most of their produce from local farmers, and it is generally pretty fresh and incredibly cheap! They also sell Boar's Head deli meat, which is a little more expensive but well worth the extra couple bucks. If you live in the Ukrainian Village, Humboldt Park, Wicker Park area and are  sick of overpaying for your produce from Jewel or Dominick's, I highly recommend you check this place out!

7.description: Love this store! Staff is always amazing and friendly. Owner is great. Definitely cheaper than Mariano's. It's a neighborhood go to for quick in and out groceries and wine/beer.

49.description: This place is smaller than I thought it would be but it got all the basics I need. They don't have much in terms of variety of vegetables but it has good prices (lime 10 cents apiece, leaf lettuce 99 cents, a dozen of eggs 79 cents etc). The place looks clean. The staffs are friendly too. The only drawback is that they don't have a parking lot. You have to park on the street.

40.description: Close to the casa, cheap produce, good people. Anywhere I can go buy single items of produce for a meal that night and spend like $2-$4 is pretty legitimate.

53.description: You can buy boneless skinless chicken for $2 a lb. What else do you need to know?

30.description: I adore this place. I've been patronizing it for almost five years, and they have the best meat I've found in Chicago. Granted, after I found this place I stopped looking. :)

46.description: Wonderful little corner store with almost all of your necessities... I have a new baby and they don't have diapers and wipes, but they do have plenty of produce and meats including a butcher. The new deli and coffee shop is also a HUGE plus, and you can't beat the prices! Did I mention that they deliver?

1.description: Great market, big selection for fresh fruits,vegetables. Also great place to pick up burgers/steaks etc

55.description: This is the kind of corner grocery that everyone wishes hey had in their neighborhood. The selection is big enough to never have to go anywhere else if you don't want to, the store is small enough that you never have to deal with the crowds major chains get, and the people are part of the local community. The prices have always been very good for what you get, and even after being a customer for 10 years, I'm still surprised from time to time at what I'm able to find there.

9.description: Been shopping here for years.  Great family run store that is very conscious of the items they put on their shelves and sell to their customers.  Lots of organic, natural options and everything is priced very friendly for the most part.  Great deli and friendly butchers.  Stop shopping at the big chains and support this local family owned spot.  You must try their homemade Greek soup too....it's to die for!

26.description: a great little market for everything fresh! really good selection of vegetables and fruits and a surprisingly well stocked meat counter.

25.description: I remember stopping in this little hole in the wall back in 1999 when I started working in the area.  I never expected much from the place and truly imagined it would become a Starbucks or something in the not to distant future.  To my unexpected surprise Farmers Pride adapted to the changes in the community and provides a well rounded assortment of grocery items at much better than prices than Dominick's which is just down the street.  The people are always pleasant and shelves always stocked.  In this economy I'd much rather give my money to a small mom and pop than large corporate store.  Recently they added a small deli counter serving up sandwiches and the like.  Haven't tried these yet but it's a nice addition.  Thumbs up on this place.

12.description: Close to my house. The prices are good and they have a decent selection of vegetarian items. For such a little store, they cram almost everything you need inside: fresh produce, quick meals, deli items, and desserts.  The staff is also very friendly and helpful. Great neighborhood store.

59.description: I have a life - and therefore I would not write a review about a grocery store/bodega unless it was the ultimate in grocery stores/bodegas - and let me tell you, this place is the greatest! Friendly Service, Great location, Parking out front, Everything you could ever think of, including Greek Yogurt, Produce, Fresh Meats (You have to try the kilbasa its insanely good), Ice Cream, Tahini, Fresh Bread, etc. I heart this place!

21.description: It's not Dominick's and it has fresh tamales on the weekends.

17.description: I really wanted to love this market.  But for me it had the vibe of a Qwik Mart or 7-Eleven but with some produce and a deli.  I was shopping for produce...they didn't exactly the best variety, selection or quality for the price.  Street parking only...if you can find it.I'm pretty sure the deli is their bread and butter.

10.description: This place rules.I was checking out some apartments for rent and stumbled into this store to grab a drink. What was supposed to be a quick stop turned into 15 minutes.  A cozy market with a huge variety of meats, cheeses, fruits/veggies and plenty of boxed/canned goods as well. Not to mention an incredible selection of root beers with NO HIGH FRUCTOSE CORN SYRUP or poison as I prefer to call it.I've been going back and forth between Ukrainian Village and Wicker Park. It's possible that Farmer's Pride just tipped the scales in favor of UK. The young man at the counter was great. He was polite and well spoken and thanked me for my purchase. Neighborhood gem. 5 stars all the way

5.description: The positive = this place is within walking distance and carries a few items my wife and I enjoy and/or depend on as a conscientious vegan and vegetarian.The negative = the service is terrible. In just the past couple months, I've had these experiences:The guy who works there bagged two crates of eggs vertically with other things, which I didn't realize until it was too late. About half of both were broken by the time I got home (that's roughly $6 worth of eggs). I guess I can take partial blame because I didn't check, but I didn't think I would have to. Who puts a carton of eggs in the bag vertically?Just a few weeks ago, I was walking around the store with one of their baskets. A huge portion of one of the edges had worn through the protective plastic, and the very sharp and no doubt very dirty metal tore my palm open. I showed it to the girl and she basically said, "wow," and offered me a paper towel. That was it.Against my better judgement, I went back today and bought a few things. It wasn't until a few hours later that I realized my old friend eggman had neglected to give me back the bag of apples he rang me up for. So, I'm out even more money but I guess I should be happy I'm not going to have to deal with my hand bleeding all week like last time.I'm all for helping the little guy, but only when the little guy can run something vaguely resembling a functioning operation. Every single time I go in there, something bad happens.

3.description: I almost hate to mention the tamales on the weekends out of selfishness because I want them all to myself, however, that's what brought me into the store at first. It's nice to roll out of bed and pick up fresh, hot tamales on the weekends. In addition, I'm really impressed with their organic and special diet (e.g. gluten free, vegan, etc.) selection. I didn't expect so much in a smaller grocery store. Everyone working in the store is super friendly and very helpful. I just need to figure out the delivery schedule, sometimes they're out of stock, which makes sense since it's a smaller grocery. Unfortunately that makes me supplement by going to Mariano's :(

35.description: Farmer's Pride is a great place to shop!Great prices for quality items and I love old neighborhood grocery store feel to the place.  Wonderful selection of quality meats neatly displayed.Many European items available.What impressed me the most were the Mexican butchers and clerks that are able to communicate and speak in Ukrainian so very well. Remarkable!  ...
