It's almost comical to hear a Mexican speaking Ukrainian.  Great effort to make your base support feel welcome!  Good job! ........Very friendly, jovial and happy staff!  Their boss must treat his employess very well, as they seem to like working here!Love this place and it's real people atmosphere!..... Support your local grocery store and avoid the high prices of Dominick's!

19.description: Great place to pick up some veggies and staple supplies. Produce is priced affordably and good organic selection. Great selection of juices and organic dairy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A great uk village neighborhood business to support.

28.description: Cute little grocery store, appears to be family owned by a Greek family, which I really like.  They had papaya which was exciting for me and they had great avocados for $1.39 (cheaper than anywhere else right now) and lots of yogurt/almond milk/soy milk options.  And I wanted mozzarella cheese and they cut it for me in slices perfectly.  And they have fancy chocolates by the register, which is good and bad.  It's a little crowded (small space) and there's only street parking but it was easy to find.  I would never have come here had it not been for a groupon but I will definitely be back as it is between my work and home commute.  My new favorite shop!

45.description: There are some very positive things about Farmers Pride, the first and foremost thing being the low prices on what seems to be very good quality produce, meat and staples.The problem I have is that there aren't things offered that I am used to finding, notably: chayote, jicama, corn on the cob, heads of different types of greens, different kinds of mushrooms, coconut milk, radishes, and nopales.  While not having a lot of these Mexican ingredients is understandable, not seeing more than 2 ears of corn, no radishes and a very limited amount and selection of salad greens is a bit disappointing.Alas, I have something about Hyde Park that I really miss, specifically Hyde Park Produce Mart with their massive size and a ton of things on offer there (though Farmers Pride definitely have HPPM beat with their meat counter).I will for sure be back to Farmers Pride for their good meat section, cheap prices, and fresh produce (not to mention the fact that this is a locally-owned business which means my money stays away from Dominick's).  So yeah, I'll be back, at least until I can find a place that offers more.

33.description: FU to big chain spots, and a milder bugger off to whole foods/trader joe's this is my go to store for groceries.

43.description: Farmers Pride has added a small cafe with Edy's ice cream and coffee from Star Lounge.I usually go here for just a few items, but apparently they deliver for free in the neighborhood for orders over $40. Nice perk that I'll definitely have to try soon.

2.description: I love the convenience of this store.. I mostly come here to pick up last minute items for dinner.. I could not shop here regularly as a main source for groceries. The quality of produce is atrocious. Meat is okay. Good beer selection - they have many craft beers. Fair selection of frozen munchies and assorted boxed/canned/jarred foods on the shelves.

18.description: Do not make the mistake of grabbing a cart.  You will not be able to maneuver the thing throughout the store, so don't even try.  They don't have everything, but there is a good variety of produce and a surprising selection of cheese.  I've not gotten anything from the meat counter, but there appears to be a lot to choose from there as well.  I would, however, be hesitant to buy anything canned.  I get the sense that it may have been sitting there for a bit.

41.description: I adore this corner market. They have a great selection of fresh, beautiful fruits and veggies, and their prices are extremely competitive and fair. Their meat selection is amazing, you gotta get your meat from these guys. I love their selection of breads, both from commercial and local bakeries. They also carry cans of San Marzano tomatoes - the only shop I've found in the area to do so!  I come here regularly for their produce, meat, Greek yogurt, and for hard to find things I just need to have in my kitchen:  giardinara of all levels of heat, anchovy paste, lox, healthy chips and snacks, spanakopita, barley and other grains, and juices. They're not a mega grocer so they don't carry "everything", but if you want to shop in a more "European" style, this is the market you could feasibly visit every day and make good meals.  I must come here at least three times a week.Everyone who works there is super nice too and will greet you and chat with you about your day. Love this place!

52.description: I like this place, it has what you need for those things that you need in between larger food shopping trips. Pretty good selection of seasonal fruits, veggies, cheeses, and grains. The staff is really friendly and the Sunday homemade tamales are such a treat.

50.description: Love, love, love!This place just kicked Dominick's down to a last resort of places to shop for groceries. While Farmer's Pride is small, it has nearly everything you need for eating healthy.Plus, it's a mom and pop type store, so I'd MUCH rather give them my money over the conglomerates.

4.description: The current addition of more brands and booze just put this shop front and center in the great grocery wars of UK village. It's quite fantastic, and so are the people working there/the owners. Farmers Pride... Get some organic meats in there and it'll be a sure-fire game changer. It'd be magical to never have to step foot in Mariano's again!

6.description: One of my favorite grocery stores in this city. As a lot of people mention, it is a great store in that you don't have to go through several aisles to get the bare necessities on a grocery list. I love their homemade greek yogurt, sausages, great selection of local coffee and everyone that works there is super friendly! The wine/beer addition have just amplified the awesomeness of this local gem. :)

22.description: Go here for the deli, they carry fresh Boar's Head products which is nice. I wish there were hormone free, free range, or grass fed meat options though, but I'm not a regular meat eater so it's not a deal breaker for me. It's the produce that's the real disappointment. Sometimes it's fine if you eat it that very day, or if you happen to catch them on re-stock, but I'm not always so lucky. Today I bought a carton of raspberries that turned out to be mostly mold, the entire thing went in the trash. How can you even sell a product like that? How can you not know it's past prime? If Cermak on North can have quality, fresh produce, why can't you?

15.description: This review is just for the store and not the cafe ( I think the cafe is not in biz anymore ). I go here when I need to get some meat to grill and some sides. They have Boars head slice-able meat and your standard pot salad, tuna, pasta, etc.. The meat is always good looking and reasonably priced. The service is always good and friendly. They have fresh made guac and salsa at the register that I usually cant resist buying. Its nice easy spot to get too for a single BBQ meal and you dont have to worry about all the pains of a larger store.

57.description: Love this place and mad that I only just recently gave it a try.  For such a small store, they really cover the basics, produce, some organics, some health foods, bakery goods, and ethnic foods extremely well at a good price.  Combine Farmers Pride with a run to Rich's Deli up the street every once in a while, and you're covered for most of your regular grocery needs.Cermak Produce was my weekly produce/grocery shop before I gave Farmers Pride a try, but I always had to supplement Cermak Produce runs with shopping at other markets or grocery stores... Farmers Pride is now my one stop shop.  I do wish they stocked some of the local Middle Eastern pita breads, but I think they mainly carry Greek brands.

20.description: You need to spend a minimum of $5 to charge to your debit card.I like that they have fresh fruit/veggies and a deli section. They sell homemade tamales, which is a plus for my boyfriend and his roommates. This is definitely a neighborhood joint that competes with the Dominick's on Chicago.

36.description: I was meaning to stop here for quite a while and when I saw the groupon for Farmers pride it really gave me a reason to go out of my way to stop.The prices here are fantastic, the selection isn't too broad and the produce is a little hit and miss but the prices are about as good as Stanley's and the stuff doesn't seem to go bad as quickly.  I'll definitely stop back here sometime when I don't need to go shopping for the week and only need a few things.

14.description: You need to spend a minimum of $5 to charge to your debit card.I like that they have fresh fruit/veggies and a deli section. They sell homemade tamales, which is a plus for my boyfriend and his roommates. This is definitely a neighborhood joint that competes with the Dominick's on Chicago.

3.description: Went here right after the lunch rush , I ordered a 10 wing special, I looked through the window and the girl behind the counter placed already fried chicken back in the grease, ohh no no no I am not paying $11 for refried chicken that'll taste like oil with a side of they mild sauce. I was in no rush so I had them drop fresh chicken but didn't expect to wait 30 mins. I will probably go back in a year if they still there.

1.description: The ribs were boiled, tuff and had no flavor with open pit bbq sauce.  I will  NEVER go to  this place again.

0.description: Best rib tips I've had of any bbq place in Chicago. Owner was great, very upbeat and friendly. The service was quick, but no lack of quality or taste. Enjoyed my stop there- this is authentic bbq.

2.description: I used to go regularly and loved it.  I would brag to friends they were better other smoked Rib joints and their tips rocked.  But when I went there last night it was very different. I was sad to  discover the portion sizes have gotten much smaller while the prices have gotten much bigger.  Also, the  meat was under cooked which means the tips had too much uncooked fat and the meat was chewy.   It was so good before.  What happened?

5.description: Went by the other day and meat on grill look decent so I order the 20$ link tip combo,  think was XL. Didn't take long to receive. When I got to where I could eat food seemed that it had great potential but was undercooked and the amount served was equivalent to a small /medium from other joints. Maybe it was early and thats all he had ready, but the brother could have told me that and I could have returned. Very disappointed.

6.description: I must say that I'm very impressed with the quality of the rib tips that I get from this place. They are open pretty late, so if I'm hanging out late and have a hankering for tips, this is the place to go at a reasonable cost. I only wish they would put more sauce on the rib tips and not charge for extra sauce, otherwise I'd give it 5 stars!

7.description: Very impressive!  Excellent customer service and the food OH MY GOSH! I ordered 2 mini tips and a slice of caramel cake.  I will be returning.

8.description: First impressions are everything!I was thinking about visiting this joint...yea joint. Call to find out what type of ribs they have and the person who answered (in a very lazy voice). Do you have Baby Back ribs...no madam...do you have St. Louis ribs...no Madam. What type of ribs do you have...regular ribs. I said ok. Then I called back and asked "what is a regular rib...beef, pork? It's pork, pork, pork!! Thank goodness I called first, because first impression are everything and you lost me at regular rib. If your staff is not excited about the product they are selling, how can you expect the customer to be excited about visiting!!

9.description: The bus stop sandwich is a great value...flavorful pork sandwich for cheap! The owner, Ken, is a great guy, a real charismatic neighborhood sort. Please support your local business! A nice option for those craving some Q on the West Side.

10.description: Love this Food, Service was excellent,  Great sauce I had a party they delivered the food to my party on time with plenty of sauce

4.description: I love bro n laws sauce. The owner is always very pleasant when I see him there. Whenever I order they hook me up but when my husband goes in for a order I feel like they short change him. Fries are strictly for collecting grease at the bottom of container because they only give you a few. I have been seeing a steady increase in prices which is off putting. Also seeing employees eating fries from orders is disturbing. Still a fan but don't visit as often because of portion and price ratio

0.description: Happened to see their sprouts of multiple variety show up on the shelf at my local Whole Foods today and decided to give 'em a try.  Not disappointed at all.  Clean, fresh-- obvs, made in the same city.  All the veggie none of the chemicals and whatnot.  A little pricey but not really, and checking out their website, you could save a lot just by dealing with them directly instead of going through Whole Paycheck.  I'm kind of amazed I'm just hearing about them now since they say they've been around since the 80s... maybe just selling to restaurants?If you have an odd love for greens of all varieties, especially in sprout form, this is your one-stop shop.

3.description: Just ordered 8 sandwiches. They're fast. Really fast. The lady on the phone was nice. Place is simple and nice. About 6 bucks a sandwich with egg meat and cheese. Ordered a turkey egg N' cheese. Was a little salty for my taste. Overall good.

1.description: Fast, friendly and did I mention great Ham & Egg Panini's . They serve the best Bustello Coffee!Nice lounge area so you are facing company you keep. Cozy and comfy

2.description: Absolutely delicious sandwiches at unbelievably cheap prices!!! Cute decor, you feel at home here. Had a Turkey Sandwich with a fried egg, definitely enough for two people. Coffee was strong and fresh! Highly recommend!!!!

5.description: Enjoying the BEST breakfast sandwich & café(Bustelo) con leche in town. Come by & say hi to Eddie!

6.description: no stars for this place. ordered lunch and my drink was a tropicana orange juice,well it was spoiled! the fake manager or owner whoever he was got very upset when his waitress told him the orange juice was old. he was talking a lot of bs and acting touch. well we can see how tough he is when the health department and city walk in.

0.description: I love this sandwich shop. Fast and friendly service. Sandwiches are big and cheap. The pastrami and cheese is yummy. The coffee is the BOMB! Fresh and strong just the way you should drink coffee.

4.description: Good..affordable and clean...what else can you ask for...open early for all you coffee needs

1.description: The employees in this location are the best, they are always so helpful and willing to explain everything to you with every little detail. They dedicate all their attention to you as a customer. I will definitely recommend this location to all my friends, and their prices are the best!

2.description: was so shocked to find this one i use to go to one on lawrance ave but now this one is the one for me for great buys sells and deals come here .

0.description: Robert is a great knowledgeable manager, they all make a great team. Don't hesitate if you need help in contacting Robert or Felipe. A +

12.description: Oliver, Carmen and Ambrosio did hair and make-up for my daughter's wedding.  We let the sylists decide how to do each bridesmaid's hair.  Every one of them looked perfect!  (The bride, of course, was even better than perfect!)  When they were finished, if Oliver had told me he raised the price (which he didn't of course) I still would have paid it with a smile because the girls looked sooooo good.  We had a great time as well!  Only wish I could give them more stars.  Instead of "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" it is "OMG, I never even imagined it could get this good!"

3.description: this was my first time going there just as a walk in to get my hair cut highlighted and dyed!! I must say I am super duper happy with the results!!!!! he was working really hard on my hair and stayed late... I'm very thankful that Oliver was so awsome! I def. will be coming back! And he is really really fast/great with the blow dryer :D I recommend this place to who ever wants to get a kick ass job done for a good price.

1.description: went again, I will never use another stylist again. Turns out Oliver does make-up too! (which I may consider if/when I get married..next year?)He dry cut my hair to perfection. I'm in love.

2.description: My most recent visit sealed the deal. Love, love, love Oliver.As usual, I waited until the last minute to make a decision.  This time, it was my bday and after finally rolling out of bed, I decided I wanted to get my hair done for the bday. Problem? It was Sunday. Salons are usually closed. I knew that Oliver took clients by appt only on Sundays, so I gave him a call. No answer. I left him a message. 4hrs later and I'd given up on the idea of getting my hair done. Alas! My phone rings. The voice on the other line "Happy Bday!" It was Oliver. Head to the shop (it's now around 5:30pm on a Sunday) and he took great care of me.  Glasses of wine (score,) excellent service, and he even did my makeup w/out me asking (yes...he does make-up, too.) And he's just so friendly and warm. Amazing personality. He does a great job and the prices are more than reasonable. 5 stars for Oliver and Olivelli's.

9.description: I sat with the store pooch, Benji, as I watched Oliver cut and style my husband's hair. Not only is this the best haircut I've seen on him yet, but Oliver was very attentive, took his time to make sure my husband was happy with the results, and gave him tips on how to best maintain it. My husband is telling me that I need to make an appointment for the scalp massage alone. The price was reasonable and great for the level of service at $25 + tip.

10.description: Oliver is a great stylist as well as makeup artist and all around good person.  I have very coarse, thick hair and he has been the ONLY person to ever cut my hair in a way that looks great straight or even wavey.  I took my mother who is visiting from PR and he's given her another great cut.  (I think she"s coming to visit more often, despite the cold, for his hair cuts)He has loads of patience, is very sweet, and takes his time to learn your likes and dislikes.  He gives great scalp massages on what has got to be the most comfortable chair I've sat on.  I now live 30 minutes away with tons of salons around me, and will still drive in for his services once a week!!Its also a plus that he has late hours, and will stay for you if necessary.LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Oliver!!!

13.description: This salon is great.  And yes -- Oliver gives the most amazing head massages.  I have lots and lots of extremely curly hair.  Most stylist are intimidated by it --especially if they are straightening it.  But not Oliver --- when I leave that salon my hair is silky smooth and I am able to run my fingers throughout.   This is something I am unable to do with my curly hair.Oliver is so great that I have referred two of my other friends.   They tend to visit Oliver every other week

16.description: this place is a bargain for the treatment and expertise you get.  This guy knows how to style hair very well.

6.description: Excellent job, excellent service, excellent price.  He knows exactly what to do with this thicket of curly nonsense I call hair.

15.description: I walked in looking pretty haggard and walked out looking 10 years younger, thanks to Oliver.  I got highlights/lowlights and a trim.  Oliver is  wonderful and a really decent human being to boot.  I don't review many places and I'm really picky, but Oliver is worth a review and deserves smashing success.

0.description: Oliver will pamper you like Huggies with his top notch noggin care. Plus, a free side of great conversation comes with every order. Most guys will never have the privilege to share anything with a playboy model, much less multiple playboy models.Well if you are lucky enough to get Oliver at his new salon, you can finally brag that you were touched by the same hands as numerous playmates (he used to work for playboy). Oliver has helped me win over interviewers in numerous fields with dapper yet understated hair cuts and styling. These were no small feats. I have a big head, curly hair, and numerous natural cow licks. In addition, my quaff is thinning like Christian Bale in 'The Machinist', and my face (especially when I'm out of shape) can be plump like a ballpark frank.Despite these challenges, Oliver has consistently worked magic on my dome turf to get me Superbowl ready. While he works his magic, he also offers engaging conversation by regaling me with stories from his past, and lending an ear to whatever my problems of the day are. He doesn't rush, which can be a shock to folks used to other places. But the care he takes in combination with his skill results in a superior hairdo every time. With those relaxing head massages and facial treatments Oliver often throws in, you'll feel more pampered than the last emperor of China (minus the breast-feeding).Overall - a wonderful place to treat yourself for a fantastic haircut.

5.description: I just got my hair cut by Oliver at Olivelli Salon today, and oh my god it was the best haircut I've ever gotten.  The entire experience was wonderful, Oliver is so sweet and friendly, you get a full shampoo with an amazing head massage, and he will explain to you why he uses the techniques he uses, etc which is rare in hair salons these days.  He asked and listened to what i wanted, and he took his time.I highly recommend this place, I know I've found the stylist I'll be going to for a long time.

11.description: This salon was suprisingly great. I got a cut and color with Arturo and it was really great. Exactly what I wanted, except when the color was first applied, it turned my roots a fiery orange. But he fixed it and it looks great. Only downfall is I was there for 3 hours because of that, and I had somewhere to go, so I basically ran out without having him style my hair. But I'm going to give it another chance.

8.description: Oliver is great. He is a well trained, professional, and affordable stylist in my neighborhood, and that seems very rare these days. He did highlights and cut for a great price. He takes a long time, however. Don't go in there if you are in a hurry.

4.description: 3.5 starsI was a little hesitant to go into a hair salon and let the sylist 'do what he wants' but after a few fateful events today I decided, hey what the hell, why not!Enter the salon on a Monday night at 6:30pm. I was instantly greeted by 'Max', the friendliest dog in the world.  He loved jumping up on me and having me pet him. 1 star.The hair stylist, Oliver, was finishing up on a customer when I walked in so he told his receptionist/assistant to shampoo my hair.  She was a very soft spoken girl, I could barely hear her, she took my coat and purse and washed my hair.  Gentle hands indeed.  She sort of did a massage at the end with the conditioner in my hair but it was so short I almost missed it.  Next, Oliver told her to dry my hair because he would cut it while dry.  Okay with me, I thought. Why not? He's the mastermind, not me. (Note: I had never gotten my hair cut while dry)... but I was into new things, a new day, a new beginnimg, so I was down.  Receptionist/Assistant started to blow dry my hair. I was watching her like a hawk because first of all, she seemed super young and I didnt want her burning my hair but low and behold, her blowdrying skills were awesome.  Everytime I thought I'd feel a burn, it was like she sensed me well and kept the dryer moving so not once did I twitch with fear.  Not even when she was drying the hair above my ear. She knew when to take the dryer away. I was shocked with amazement.  My hair looked so good after her blowdry, the ends were so nice and wavy, full of bounce that I started wondering if I should even get it cut but it was too late, I was already in the chair and my objective was to get a cut.  Next thing R/A did was flat iron my hair stick straight so that 'Oli' would be able to cut it right.By this time, Oli had been sitting watching TV while frequently glancing at my hair. He would also occasionally walk by and grab my hair saying "you have beautiful hair."  Was he secretly assessing what to do with it this whole time? Trying to size me up? See what kind of customer I am so he can figure out the best cut? Or was he just wondering when this darn R/A would freaking finish already?! I like the think it was the first one.Act 2, Scene 1Enter Oli."How much you want me to cut?"Me: "I don't care, as long as its not too short"Oli: "Okay, not too short."In come the scissors and comb.Chop, chop, chop, chop, chop, chop.  Imagine this in super fast motion with hair flying all over place, this is what it was like. I swear he was done in ten minutes.Oli: "okay," he hands me a mirror, "how you like your hair?"Me: "Oh it looks great"I did a double take and thought to myself, 'wait a minute, this looks like my haircut last time, only shorter and with more layers...'Now either my hair and face shape really limit my hairstyle options or I was not aggresive enough about how much I wanted a change.  On the bright side, my haircut looks good and my hair feels great.  Oli and R/A didn't really talk too much so I thought that was kind of strange.  Good work overall.  Price: $45Maybe I should come back with a picture...

14.description: I was pleasantly surprised on my first trip here. My stylist was extremely friendly and attentive to detail. For guys he does a great close shave around the neck line. He puts in the little extra effort. Hair came out great and I will definitely go back.

7.description: I have thick hair and lots of it- which makes a good haircut tres important.  A couple weeks ago I trusted my hair to Oliver and am so happy I did.  I agree w the other review that says the shampoo/massage itself is worth going there... just when you think it's likely over, she lifts your head up and continues- sooo relaxing.  Oliver communicated throughout my haircut, making sure we were on the same page and explained to me best techniques, etc..  I have never been this way with a hair stylist before, but post-wedding, I look forward to giving Oliver free reign to do whatever he thinks best with my hair.

29.description: Huge wearhouse, I probally wouldn't sugest going around the 1st of the month since they do accept illinois link cards. its a hit or miss here really, some stuff is low quality while others are just nicely low priced.  conidering my daughter wanted a toy at target that was 25$ and it was only 13$ at cook brothers i say thats a good deal(same brand). They have electronices, furniture, clothing, toys, appliances. It really don't hurt to just stop in and check them out

42.description: I LOVE COOK BROS.. mainly because around x-mas time you can get lots of toys for kids under the age of ten for a cheap price. My kids love the toys and they have lots of toys under the tree to choose from. I also love their furniture. They have a big display of furniture and household things. I think that Cook Bros. have something for everyone no matter if you have a little or a lot of money. I love the new Cook Bros. warehouse because the old warehouse was so small you wouldn't even want to go there because there was no space to move around and little parking. I LOVE COOK BROS.. and Thanks for moving to the new location... WE NEEDED IT....

23.description: So a Costco and a dollar bill store have a child...This review is what I observed on my first trip.  I've seen the ads for ages but finally wanted to check it out to see what they have.  You can't have to many go-to places for ________.There is a good deal and wiiiiide variety of different kinds of things.  Not everything is of the highest quality, hence the commanding low prices, but there is a good deal of decent stuff that I would buy there.  Electronics and basic major appliances?  Sure.  Same of the somewhat-far-flung-I-never-heard-of-brands?  Mmm, maybe not.  For food and household toiletries and cleaning products, you're going to find basically the conventional stuff.  Don't bother coming here looking for organics or non-gmo food or cleaning products that are Earth-friendly, etc.  Its a basic nuts-and-bolts store.The furniture and clothing is not targeted to the demographic areas of, say, between North Ave up Lake Shore to Montrose then east to the river, though it might hit people of more eclectic taste.  The quality of the furniture, from the several pieces I checked out more from curiousity was not of the highest quality, but if not abused, should last.They do carry a good selection of the Latno products sold in the ethnic sections of grocery stores.Lots of toys.  Good place to go for party stuff for kids.Good prices, decent selections of basic goods.  The sum of Cook Brothers.

8.description: This store has the worst customer service I have ever experienced. I purchase a computer accessory and decided to return it when it didn't work, their return policy stated that I can receive my cash back but the General Manager stated that this was only during Christmas. what a bunch of thieves they force me to get a store credit for merchandise I didn't need. stay away!!!

31.description: This is like a cross between Costco and a dollar store.  Stuff was a bit nicer than I expected, and there are some great deals.  I didn't expect furniture, and they had a lot.  Lots of toys and housewares.  Not much food.

34.description: We stack em' deep and sell em' cheap, Cook Brothers, 1740 N Kostner! I hear this commercial daily and it finally got me in the door. I can't say I was wowed or that I walked away with anything awesome but I did find household items like tissue and cleaning supplies for really cheap and Costco sized offerings of the adobo seasoning that we like. This could be a good place to go if you were moving into your first place and needed somewhere to get some cheap kitchen items like glasses, and small appliances. They have a 30 day return policy so if it truly is crap...take it back. Cook Brothers also has a special place in my heart (a tiny little piece) because when I was a kid they had a toy catalog every Christmas and my brother and I would sit and go through the catalog for hours marking what we wanted. awww....

16.description: Holy stinky Hipsters, how in deee blue hell have I not reviewed this!?!?!?! THis place is awesome! Its one of Chicagos best kept secrets......................as far as retail goes its cheaper than KMART! Its like the motherload of all $1 dollar stores BUT you can find stuff as expensive as $300.00 here folks.And some of the stuff is great! If you look hard enough you can find some gems! I got an awesome deal with a tv stand!You can Also find some cheap stuff...............How can they price it so low I ask myself!? Kitchen Knife set $4.00  WTF!!!!?!?!?!!?!Area rugs for like $8.00 bucks! Holy Mole!!?!?!?!T-shirts $1.00 Pure Insanity!12 piece wrench set $10.00.......put Pep-boys out of business!SHake 7 bake seal of approval!Hipster infestation level: ZERO. Please, those starvin artists/musicians wont dare leave their bikes chained up outside in this hood! hehehehehe

13.description: It is what it is.

11.description: This place offers the worst in customer service. Nobody there helps. Very ghetto and employees dont know what they are doing. Bad experience overall.

39.description: I come here to  stock up on munchies and drinks for the house .Sometimes they will have the .99 cans of arizona tea and juices for .69 ...thats a deal .I also come here for Gift bags ..they have lots of nice styles that you would normally pay $6 for at walgreens for about $1-$3 here .Like other posters here I agree most of the clothes or appliances here at cheaply made so I wouldnt shop for that here ..although they do have a huge section of tolietries for super cheap that I occasionly buy like lotions ,shampoo etc etc .

37.description: I dare say no-one would be suprized if I said this place is a huge warehouse full of things you never knew you wanted. There is a lot of cheap junk in there with the occasional good deal. I went there with some friends for some specific items and it provided what we needed but I don't think I'd go back. Everything is jumbo sized and looks like it fell of the back of a truck in some dark alley (if you know what I mean *wink*). Worth a look but honestly it's like the poor man's Sam's Club. Who knew there was a store where you could buy a jumbo garbage can, a family size pack of Capri Sun and a grill (and I mean the one for your teeth not the kind you cook burgers on)!!! Turns out, there is.

0.description: This afternoon I was invited to the "Cook Brothers" residence, or I should say, the warehouse.Technically, I invited myself since there was no need for membership.  It's located adjacent to the Burlington Coat Factory.  I've passed by this area several times by bus, yet I never paid attention to the existence of this place until I found it on Yelp.  To be honest, there was nothing really exciting.  Don't expect CBW to be an urban version of "Co*tco," because there will be no fresh produce and agricultural products sold here at CBW.  You are correct!  There's no gas station here, either.  All you see is some inexpensive everyday essentials, perhaps many of them are manufacturers' overstocks.  Do NOT assume that everything they sell is at its best price.  "If you wanna be somebody, if you wanna go somewhere, you better wake up and pay attention."  Yes, Sister Mary Clarence is reminding you to do some comparison shopping.  I noticed several major brand body wash, shampoo, and conditioner are better deals at drug stores when purchasing them on sale.  I scored Some Arizona tea and Jarritos soft drinks for $0.69/ea.  By the way, Cook County charges 12.25% sales tax on sodas.  It's slightly annoying because what's wrong with irresponsible citizens who want to be unhealthy?  Government should be hands off on mandating the change on personal behaviors.  Thank you for letting me express my Libertarian viewpoint.  However, this place is pretty good if you're looking for some random bric-a-brac.  Security personnel for CBW is quite tight.  Well, this part of Humboldt Park isn't the safest part of the city.  They have a massive parking lot, shared with the neighboring Burlington Coat Factory.  Otherwise, utilizing CTA #65 (Grand) bus during the day is perfectly fine.

38.description: 'Cook Brothers 1740 North Kostner'....is the jingle that rings through my head as I wonder through this massive warehouse/store. If I ever need a pleather sofa you will be my first and only destination. If I ever need 40 gallons of ammonia you will be my first choice. If I ever need scratchy urban camoflage sweatshirts in 4X, again my first choice.But seriously, this store is what it advertises. A warehouse full of all the junk you never knew you needed and somewhat useful items like cheap DVD players and paper plates. Incidentally, they also sell milk for about 20 cents cheaper than most regular grocery stores.It is a hodgpodge and you can get wrapped up in how many shower puffs they really have. I tried to count but just couldn't keep focused.....

27.description: I was recommended to Cook Brothers for looking for bulk supplies of cheap 50/50 cotton shirts at near wholesale prices. Found the style of shirts I wanted, Short Sleeve 50/50 cotton. Wholesale price was around $2ea. however I could not find a large portion of colors I wanted. I was looking to get around 50-100 shirts so I asked 2 workers who are running around on pickers. They acted like they didn't speak english and kind of waved me off. I then asked some young gal at customer service. I don't think I was very clear that I was looking for large portion of shirts but she said whatever is on the floor is what we have. Kind of bummed out about this. I was looking to screen print that evening. Might come back to by cheap junk at low prices but its alike an Aldis for non-food. A bunch of stuff, made cheap and sold cheap where you'll regret it later.

32.description: If you want to buy gifts for people you don't really like then buy it at this store. This place is full of low quality things. The items are cheap but you get what you pay for. The only good thing to get is the bulk candy. You get a lot of candy for cheap. Perhaps I just figured out where I'm going for Halloween treats! HA!

44.description: This is a warehouse outlet store. It is not a good looking store, it is a working warehouse and the boxes are in the aisles. Very good deals on some general merchandise. They have  toys, food, furniture, kitchenware etc... Some of the items are not very good quality, some are. Take the time to go thru this giant building and you'll find at least a few things like I did. I don't think I've ever seen anything like this store before. The furniture section looks better than the rest of the store. They set up a temporary showroom and some of the pieces were quality.

24.description: Let's go with 3.5 stars, shall we?Man this place ghetto, but you gotta love it. $50 rugs, cheap cleaning supplies...well cheap everything. Some things I would avoid buying, unless you like your things breaking quickly, but you can really find some damn good shiznit here. Although it is a pain when you want to buy something from the "expensive" section in the front because you have to write down the number corresponding to the item, bring it to the cashier who gives you another number and then you have to go to the "pick up desk" and wait for your item. Oh but Pepsi/Coke/Etc are only 99cents and Arizona's are 69cents. So who cares.

7.description: Their customer service and their policies are the worst you will get in any moderate size retail store. Sunday, I bought a "refurbished" Vicks humidifier for $29.99 (I know, I know for that price I could've gotten it new one at Target/Walmart). Yesterday, Tuesday night I took it out of the box and the unit was filthy dirty. It looked like this particular unit had been returned and never made it to the refurbishing area of the manufacturer. So they sold me a dirty, used unit for the price of a new one. Because it was so filthy, I never tested it, but there was a return sticker on the box that said "not working", but the cashier assured me that all the units they sell have been refurbished. So here's the great part. Today, three days after purchase, I went to return it and they don't have a refund policy, they only offer credits. The CS rep offered me to speak to a manager for a possible exception. Apparently this manager thought that I had used the unit and brought it back dirty, therefore she rejected the refund and said I could only have a credit.Obviously, this store  cannot stand behind the merchandise they carry and also hire managers that treat customers poorly and protect their bottom line. She made it obvious that she thought I used it and brought it back after a few days, regardless of the fact that it had very old hard stains on it. Buyer be aware.....They sell a lot of stuff you would find at the dollar store, but they also sell a lot of electronics, mostly generic made in China stuff and some that are actually known brands. A lot of their electronics and appliances are refurbished so you would be taking a huge risk with zero protection and poor customer service. Not worth the risk in my opinion and I learned that the hard way. They probably make a good profit because their client base is mostly low income people from the west side who may not always challenge these unfair policies or write Yelp reviews. I won't be returning here and have already advised family and friends on social media. I hope this helps!

40.description: You pay for what you get. That sums up Cook Brothers. I used to call myself  "thrifty" and purchased Christmas gifts from there. The stuff lasted for about 36 hours then its ready for the garbage. Now, I buy Instant Lottery tickets as holiday gifts.  Its just not worth the long drive up to the northwest side of town.

30.description: Let me tell - Read my post about IKEA.Cooks Brother warehouse may not have the glamorous suburban appeal like IKEA but their prices are aggressively better and competitive.You can find some great deals in this store if you look and especially temporarily furniture. Cooks Brothers is a great warehouse for many items.

1.description: I don't recommend buying furniture from here. I was at the store from 12pm-5:30pm to get an approval for finance when I was told it can be done in 20min. They charge you for installation 30$ plus for shipping 80$. I got a table & a couch from here the couch leg wouldn't screw in and when I called management she said that's how some of there couches are. Like really?? That's how some are made!??? Then they offered to come fix it in the oddest hours of the day and I have to rush home from work to let the guys in and I didn't make it on time due to traffic and they left. So save yourself a headache  DON'T BUY FROM HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!

9.description: I like shopping here and they have hidden gems that is not overpriced. I definitely will be coming back. There is no membership required like Sam's Club or Costco.

26.description: I went here one Friday night in January to check it out because the last time I've been in CB was when it was at Ashland/Fulton, back in early 02. It seems as if this place has really added some merchandise, probably because this is a bigger facility (use to be a Kmart). One large food section I see. This store accepts all forms of payment including the diminishing check acceptance stuff (I'm glad that's diminishing anyway). Anyway, I love the prices that this place still offers. I love how clean it is and how clean it stays. I rarely cross paths with any evil, no-manners fools at this place. The cashiers and employees are really helpful and friendly as well. I can't wait to go back. 5 stars all around for the Brothers!

25.description: Holy stinky Hipsters, how in deee blue hell have I not reviewed this!?!?!?! THis place is awesome! Its one of Chicagos best kept secrets......................as far as retail goes its cheaper than KMART! Its like the motherload of all $1 dollar stores BUT you can find stuff as expensive as $300.00 here folks.And some of the stuff is great! If you look hard enough you can find some gems! I got an awesome deal with a tv stand!You can Also find some cheap stuff...............How can they price it so low I ask myself!? Kitchen Knife set $4.00  WTF!!!!?!?!?!!?!Area rugs for like $8.00 bucks! Holy Mole!!?!?!?!T-shirts $1.00 Pure Insanity!12 piece wrench set $10.00.......put Pep-boys out of business!SHake 7 bake seal of approval!Hipster infestation level: ZERO. Please, those starvin artists/musicians wont dare leave their bikes chained up outside in this hood! hehehehehe

12.description: So a Costco and a dollar bill store have a child...This review is what I observed on my first trip.  I've seen the ads for ages but finally wanted to check it out to see what they have.  You can't have to many go-to places for ________.There is a good deal and wiiiiide variety of different kinds of things.  Not everything is of the highest quality, hence the commanding low prices, but there is a good deal of decent stuff that I would buy there.  Electronics and basic major appliances?  Sure.  Same of the somewhat-far-flung-I-never-heard-of-brands?  Mmm, maybe not.  For food and household toiletries and cleaning products, you're going to find basically the conventional stuff.  Don't bother coming here looking for organics or non-gmo food or cleaning products that are Earth-friendly, etc.  Its a basic nuts-and-bolts store.The furniture and clothing is not targeted to the demographic areas of, say, between North Ave up Lake Shore to Montrose then east to the river, though it might hit people of more eclectic taste.  The quality of the furniture, from the several pieces I checked out more from curiousity was not of the highest quality, but if not abused, should last.They do carry a good selection of the Latno products sold in the ethnic sections of grocery stores.Lots of toys.  Good place to go for party stuff for kids.Good prices, decent selections of basic goods.  The sum of Cook Brothers.

21.description: Cook Brothers is one of those stores that's fun to shop in - but you have to be in the right frame of mind.  The best way to go there is to just go there and see what they have.  In that respect it's the Humboldt Park version of the south side's Continental sales.  If you need a certain color and quality of towels for your bathroom you may end up thinking the whole thing is a waste of time.  It's true they have a lot of  "junk" - I envision whole cities of Chinese factories churning out stuff for Cook Brothers.  However, there are quite a few "diamonds in the rough".  For instance (and I know some people are about to wince and grind their teeth) I purchased my living room furniture from them about 7 years ago - a really high quality sofa, love seat, chair and ottoman for $750.  It's still in excellent condition and is used all of the time.  I figure a comparable set would go for about $3000 somewhere else.  I also found the tile for my kitchen floor there at a cost of about $75.  It's really amazing tile. (No, I do not go in for "ghetto chic".)  However, the last time I was there they had crap tile I would not put in a closet.  That's my point - you never know what they are going to have but you can get amazing deals if you go at the right time.

17.description: We'll say 2.5You get what you pay for... Prices are cheap, service is horrible. I got my sofa and chaise section there at a GREAT price! ALTHOUGH, it took them 3 trips to deliver the correct chaise because they have the chaise labeled as the sofa and the sofa labeled as the chaise. Other than that, the other furniture's I purchased were at a very reasonable price. I won't buy toys or clothes or bedding, but appliances, furniture, SOME foods, and accessories are good.Service is rude though. Very rude. There was no furniture manager/ supervisor on staff until after 3p, and there was no general manger or supervisor on staff until after 3p. So everyone who needed to fix my problem could not fix it until after it was convenient for them.Will I come back for furniture? Yes, only because it's cheap. If the economy gets better, no.

10.description: Very low prices, great products but the employee's seem very rude and they seem like they're annoyed when you ask then for help.

5.description: Would really like to give this place 4 or 5 stars. Bought a bedroom set. Very good price. Had it delivered and assembled. The guys came in time, but slapped everything together. They left a huge mess tracked dirt in everywhere, unloaded boxes and threw them all over the apartment, left parts in the boxes , and left without cleaning up or removing the material they came with. This was a heavy 8 piece set so it came in huge thick boxes that took 2 people almost 3 hrs to break down. My suggestion buy it here, but do not pay them to come in and destroy your house with dirt and boxes and not fully assemble things.

3.description: to bad I can't put 0 Stars,, cheap stuff da brake before ur warranty,  like a tv 4 months today, ,for 699. ,cook brothers I won't Not recommend anybody there ,

35.description: Some of their products break very fast so be very careful. I also purchase  some mouthwash that was outdated, and when I notify the City I was inform that when an inspector went out there were numerous products that was outdated as well. UGH!

19.description: This place is awesome. I cant believe the prices. We ordered a couch from here, i love itttttt. I will be going back again, again, and again.

28.description: How anyone can give this place fewer than four stars is beyond me.  For what it is, it's great.  Cheap household good, huge selection and reliable names. I bought a hand mixer for less than $10 a few years ago, and it is a staple in my kitchen. I regularly stock up on jugs of laundry detergent, making the trip from the South Side a few times a year.  I don't feel overwhelmed by Costco-sized quantities, yet I always find bargains, especially on basic necessities.  Sure, the place is a little grungy, but for the prices, selection and fact it is independently owned, I wish I could give it 4 and a half stars.

45.description: Big warehouse store where you don't need a membership. Pretty nice furniture department, but the general merchandise goods are kinda shoddy. Stick with brands you know, just to be safe.

33.description: My girl tried to buy a grill there (not the cooking kind) and they gave her slip to pay for it at the check out and then told her it was out of stock...I don't know if you've ever seen anyone's heart break before but it was brutal to watch...she had to go to the service desk to get a refund. total buzzkill. oh and i wasn't that impressed with the rest.

43.description: It's a little scary walking in as it isn't your average Target or even Sam's Club.  They have good deals, but the products are usually older (like discontinued Barbies and such).  They have good and cheap small gifts (like stocking stuffers) and they did have my face lotion for super cheap too.

2.description: This place is what it is. A giant space filled with a bunch of random shtuff. I personally would not buy food or furniture here. If you're in the market for some paper products, laundry detergent then this is a good spot to stop. I didn't purchase any of the above, but I did make a purchase. 2- hippyish braided headbands 1.25 each1-cowboy hat. I'm hitting up some country concerts in the next couple months. $2.904- Sprechers orange dream pops. $0.39 each1- Arizona tea chocolate flavored drink well bc I've never seen chocolate from flavored from them. $0.68  Total- $8 and some change If any of my purchases break, get lost or taste like shpoopy I'm not going to try cry about it.

18.description: Let's go with 3.5 stars, shall we?Man this place ghetto, but you gotta love it. $50 rugs, cheap cleaning supplies...well cheap everything. Some things I would avoid buying, unless you like your things breaking quickly, but you can really find some damn good shiznit here. Although it is a pain when you want to buy something from the "expensive" section in the front because you have to write down the number corresponding to the item, bring it to the cashier who gives you another number and then you have to go to the "pick up desk" and wait for your item. Oh but Pepsi/Coke/Etc are only 99cents and Arizona's are 69cents. So who cares.

41.description: Not a very pretty place, in a warehouse-like setting, but the deals are abound.  They have general merchandise (I would stay away from the food if I were you) very similar to a dollar discount store, as well as electronics, furniture (It may not be highest quality possible- but you get what you pay for.)  For just general housewares (towels, pots and pans, etc.) you can get some dirt cheap deals.

4.description: The furniture prices here are great just be careful the brand you choose because you get what you pay for. If you can get a whole queen bedroom set for $150 just keep in mind your dressers will stop opening and closing correctly before a yr.     They offer a payment plan for furniture that claims no interest if your furniture is paid off in 90 days. They do not tell you if you are 1 day late for your payment, or if  your card declines, the 90 day same as cash offer is NULL and VOID and you are stuck paying off like $1000 more than what your purchase was actually worth. Other than that, I strongly recommend for those who would like to rent from other than Aaron's or Rent a Center.

6.description: Deserves "NO Stars" filthy disgusting place where they should be ashamed to provide business in my community. My family, friends and neighbor should all shop at Walmart where at least it's cleaner than this. Im tired of our community getting low end garbage for outrageous prices. The inspectors should shut it down..

22.description: We'll say 2.5You get what you pay for... Prices are cheap, service is horrible. I got my sofa and chaise section there at a GREAT price! ALTHOUGH, it took them 3 trips to deliver the correct chaise because they have the chaise labeled as the sofa and the sofa labeled as the chaise. Other than that, the other furniture's I purchased were at a very reasonable price. I won't buy toys or clothes or bedding, but appliances, furniture, SOME foods, and accessories are good.Service is rude though. Very rude. There was no furniture manager/ supervisor on staff until after 3p, and there was no general manger or supervisor on staff until after 3p. So everyone who needed to fix my problem could not fix it until after it was convenient for them.Will I come back for furniture? Yes, only because it's cheap. If the economy gets better, no.

15.description: This is like hood Target. You can get any and everything here but for way cheap. Dollar store cheap in some cases. I just bought a wastebasket, laundry detergent, and toiletries for all under $10!

20.description: I went to this store today just to look around as I had never been before. I found a lot of great bus and I will agree with the other reviews and say that you have to go there with the right mind frame to look around. Some of the stuff is chintzy, some is an incredible deal! Having said that my husband and I found a great deal on a TV and decided to get it. We got to the check out and the magnetic strip on our card wouldn't read. They tried many times but it wouldn't work. We couldn't withdraw enough cash from the ATM to cover the cost of the TV (500 limit) and it was a Saturday so we couldn't go to the bank. I spoke to the "manager" and asked if he could manually type in our card number, he said no. I asked if he could call the number in to the credit card company, he wouldn't. I was kind of socked, in my mind if someone is about to spend nearly $1000 in your store, it shouldn't be an inconvenience at all. I was really annoyed with the lack of customer service. So, when I got home I went online and ordered a TV from another site, on principal alone. Cook Bros, I wont be coming back.

36.description: I hate to have to dis the Cooks Bros (not to be confused with the Super Mario Bros.) here for a second because on our last trip -which did prove useful if you need about 15 cheap knock-off Barbies to decorate a shopping cart (don't ask...long story) - I bought a blingy skull belt buckle....got home...and realized IT WAS BROKEN. No, not like scuffed....or a bit chipped...like FLAT OUT broke-ed-ed. The little piece that fits in the loop was completely off and then another part fell off as I inspected the damage. AND my friend Stacy was completely disappointed because she wanted to buy a grill for her teeth (again, don't ask) and they were out of the style she wanted. Poor Stacy. She was really heartbroken. So, to review - Pluses: Cheap barbie dolls, funny clothing -great for costumes, great Virgin de Guadalupe framed art for $1.99, bulk granola bars -a value; Minuses: Broken belt buckles, no grills for Stacy

14.description: Best deals in town on anything you could just about think of.hoe can you not like cook bros. My only complaint is the unprofessional cashiers.

3.description: This place is three blocks from my house. I'm always stopping in here because I'm too damn cheap to buy the same expensive toilet paper, laundry detergent, or toothpaste at the local Walgreen's. Why pay more if you can get the same product for cheap?Frugal may be the word. But this place has a lot of brand names for at least 50% off the retail price. Or sometimes cheaper. But they are only getting three stars because sometimes it is a flip smackin' mess in this place. I want to grab the $2.00 broom, and help them sweep sometimes. I think they would have better business if people didn't have to look  like they are looking for buried treasure for their home goods. But that is okay. I still come back for the $3.00 Tide with color bleach.

1.description: This is a very dark, messy, and scary looking family dollar.It is extremely cluttered and disheveled and I would'nt have even come in here but I lost my earmuffs and needed a new pair.Okay.. and I came for my Tootsie Pops too.But.. man, this store needs a major re-vamping and soon cause itlooks really bad.. dark scattered aisles, and the layout of the storeis very confusing!And.. yes.. the cashier person did say "Hola" to me as I entered andsince I took spanish in high school like back in 1978 I knew that meant Hello..However.. I could not find my earmuffs but I did find my tootsie pops..And.. everytime I moved something on a shelf I was afraid that somethingfurry may jump out at me.. and I'm not talking a kitty either!So.. I paid for my tootsie pops and got the hell out of thereCause not much scares me but that store did..Nuff Said..:(

2.description: I really do love Family Dollar in general because you can find so many name-brand products for really inexpensive prices. The FD brand stuff isn't all that bad either. I really like the Interiors by Design stuff because I don't really feel like spending $12 for a shower curtain liner at CVS and I can get it at FD for like $3. It's all the same stuff, just really inexpensive. I do have to agree that this Family Dollar isn't the best in terms of organization. I basically just know where stuff is by now, but I had a really hard time when I first started frequenting there.Oh yeah, and it's right near my house so it's pretty conveniently located. I'm there just about every day or every other day. Beware: The cheap prices may fool you. Stuff adds up really quickly. Don't be surprised if you walk out of Family Dollar spending like $30-$40 on canned groceries/ random ass stuff.

0.description: This  particular store has come a long way. I've been shopping here for years now and more than once I swore I would never go back. Like Never. It wasn't even worth the one star. These days I would give it two and a half. Three was just a bit too generous. They will make you check your bags. Yes it's annoying. I try to stop in before I go to the grocery store across the street. I even give them my empty tote because I'm over being resistant. Some employees are better at requesting you leave them at the counter than others. They should just put a sign to be honest. Plus there's not always someone up front at the registers. However, the employee situation has improved greatly. Still some smart remarks but I no longer go in prepared to have to my blood pressure go up because someone is mad they came to work today. The line situation can be ridiculous. Very rarely does the second register open-it does happen though. It's organized better and the product selection is nice. Slightly better lighting. Snacks, toiletries, household goods, cleaning supplies-those are most of the things I like to buy here. Cat food and litter are cheap-regular brands and discount brands. I feel like the floors could be cleaner. And the shelves too. And I also don't like that they charge a small fee for cash back. Those are the majority of my grievances....and...that...apparently they are not required to iron their shirts.Yes, I said it. I already see the kind of old person I'm going to be.But I will say thank you to one young lady who makes me believe that the quality in customer service is going up. She seems to be working hard at what ever it is she's doing...unlike her peers whose playlists I feel like I'm interrupting when I can't find the Windex. I'm pretty sure her name is Charmaine. I love having her at the register so I'll at least leave on a positive note. There's also a guy with a lil' fro that's nice to have there. This one is still better than the one just south on Division.

4.description: yeesh. i am quite sure that there are bargains to be found in here, but the place is so badly organized that it took me nearly fifteen minutes to find a box of envelopes. i've seriously seen junk shops in a better state.

1.description: Lots of barber shops on Division, what I like about this one is the consistency of the barbers. You can count on your barber to be there day after day, week after week, month after month, and even year after year. In my experience this is a rarity. Lots of barbers in this area are young and are not always committed to their trade. They move from shop to shop, you can't always rely on them. A lot of the barbers here have been here for years. I've been going to my barber every week for about 8 years.Another great thing is that they understand their customers are busy and they cater to that by opening at 6am on Friday and Saturday as it's their busiest days. I find this to be extremely convenient for me and have taken advantage of it lots of times.The environment is usually pretty relaxed especially if you're into sports. They have two big screen TVs on the walls and you can always catch up on all of your sports news while there.

2.description: Great place  for a trim  or a great shave.  Locals and newbies are all welcome. Expert barbers will "do you" right  at a good price. On any given day you can catch the latest boxing match.

0.description: This is great for me - pretty cheap ($14 for my last cut), high quality (I've gotten two haircuts here so far and they are probably in my top 10 haircuts ever) and laid-back, casual environment that makes me feel comfortable. Seems to be a neighborhood hangout spot for lots of young men too, which can have it's pros and cons. Pretty diverse clientele as well, which I think is really cool.

3.description: I am only going to speak of the service of this store because most people already know when you come to Burlington Coat Factory you will be there for awhile as you look through racks and racks of clothing and coats!When I first went to try on some clothes that I wanted to purchase there was no one in the fitting room so I just went back and found my own room.  There were clothes everywhere and it was dimly lit!When I came back with more clothes to try on there was an attendant that time but she just waved me to the back and when I was done I didn't know where to place the clothes I couldn't fit so I put them on a rack that was close to the door instead of leaving them in the room like other customers who didn't know what to do with the items they had.When I was ready to check out the line was long and I swear I was going to put my items down but then a cashier told me to come to her line and that was OK with me!She was very nice and she smiled, asked did I find everything OK and that made the experience of the fitting room not seem so bad...I will comeback to this store and other Burlington Coat Factory stores because if you are willing to look you can find some great deals!

1.description: They have a good selection of clothes but it is terribly unorganized. Tags missing on 75% of the stuff in there and damaged clothing! Now the staff is another story. .... They are by far the most rude incompetent bunch of morans I have ever encountered in my entire life! I bought my son a shirt with a vest and tie (3 piece set) and the cashier argued with me and my husband for a half an hour that it was supposed to have a pair of pants with it. Even after I went myself and got another one off the rack they still needed to go through 2 managers to approve the purchase! From now on I will go the the one in Norridge!

0.description: So this place is huge. Really huge.  I didn't really see anything I liked. I've heard great things about this place and was expecting more. It just didn't hit me that things were great here.The store itself was clean and kept up. Which is always a good sign I guess.

2.description: It's horrible! Clothes, bedding, and random crap strewn all over the aisles. The whole place is a hot mess. I ended up just going to Walmart to get what I needed because BCF was so disorganized and ghetto.  Yes, I'm using the "G" word here!  If they can get their act together and clean up the store that would help tremendously! Sorry but I'm not paying $12 for opened pillows when I could go to another store adn pay $6 for a clean pillow that hasn't been opened yet. Sorry.

5.description: Went in to purchase a crib.Saw no employee around, to ask of they had it and where.I asked someone in the fitting rooms if they can call someone over, and rudely without an answer back she got on the intercom and mummbled something so I figured it'd only be a few til someone helps me out. Waited 10 minutes. Then I went back to the woman at the fitting rooms. She said "ill help u then but I'm new so idk everything" I'm like " I guess.. I just need that crib and she's like " lemme get my manager" at this point I'm thinking "WHY DIDN'T U DO THIS IN THE FIRST PLACE AND WHY WOULD U EVEN HELP IF UR NEW!!!" 10 MINS LATER, some Asian lady comes slowly taking her sweetazz time, and says " we have no cribs at all, idk when we wil but we get shipments everyday" so I said "great, so tomorrow?" And she replied "u should call in to ask, but no doubt it" and just freaking walked away. No apology, no readjustments, nothing. So I walked out an unhappy unpleased person. Horrible assistance, and I expected more from management.

6.description: This Burlington location is horrible. They have great clothes for ok prices but half of the shoes, clothing, etc. has no price on it making it hard to shop. When I asked an employee to check a price for me she wasn't very helpful at all. Every one that I encountered working here has an attitude. I rather go to another store and have better customer service then shop here again. Employees talking among each other talking laud and using profanity glad I didn't bring my kids. No one was in the fitting room to help me, the fitting rooms are a mess. When proceeding to check out the cashier did not greet me not even a hello or smile, She was chewing gum like a cow with her mouth wide open. She also did not  look very presentable wearing a dingy black sweater with holes on the sleeves. When I asked the cashier how much was one of the items that I bought because of course it didn't have a price, she rolles her eyes chewing her gum and points to the screen. Omg I couldn't believe how disgusting the customer service was here. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE.

7.description: If you can FIGHT YOUR WAY THROUGH THIS PLACE .. Plan a day as if it's WORK,, you may come out with some GREAT DEALS!!! .. Not sure if it was because of the holiday season but surely the staff here could make sure that customers could easily walk through isles. Forget about taking a cart down one. It's like a fire hazzard in there one way in.. one way out. The staff was nice. It looks like the Young Mens Hip Department was purchased by Roca Wear.. Something that I don't get into but for a cheap decent deal this is the place to go..Check out my pics!

8.description: I have a love / hate relationship with this place...mostly hate though. The selection is hit or miss. They have TONS of coats (hence the name). Some adorable ones, some bright ones and some I'd never be caught dead wearing.The selection is divided by size and style FOR THE MOST PART but like other stores, not everything is where it should be. You might want to scan other size racks and if you're lucky they'll have the one you were looking for...perfect size and all.The main reason this place loses point is their cashiers. We got stuck with one that was obviously not happy with fact that she had to work so she was moving like molasses. The part that got me was that she answered a phone call while she was ringing up my mom and she just forgot we were standing there UNTIL my mom gave her a piece of her mind. (you go mom!)The location is also not that great but if you want a good deal you shouldn't complain...or so I've been told.

9.description: Not only am I the first to review this, but I had to put the business' information into yelp myself.  I was happy to do because this place is terrific.  Went here on a day when it was raining super hard.  Got really wet on the way there, but managed to stay dry on the way home thanks to my new coat.  Had to go shopping without my girlfriend, which can be dangerous because even though I am buying the coat for myself, I actually look at myself very little.  Reviews were good, and fortunately I was able to confer with an older dad shopping with his kids.  As I was looking at myself in the mirror he nodded and gave me a thumbs up.  That turned out to be the straw that made the camel buy the jacket.Had never been to a Burlington Coat Factory before, but was pleased to find that they have more than just great coats.  Also have cheap socks and really huge shiny pajama pants.  On the way out I miraculously recovered a ten-dollar bill blowing away in the storm for a man in the parking lot.  Step one of three on my road to sainthood.

10.description: it';s ok!

4.description: What horrible service. I was checking out and was next in line. All of a sudden the person in front of me had trouble with her transaction ( of course they would!!). Manager was called over, he opened the lane on the other side, told customers to come around and of course I should be next right? I HAVE BEEN WAITING JUST LIKE EVERYBODY ELSE! But NO, the lady behind me goes in front, the manager nor the cashier says anything.  My turn to check out finally comes, YAY! :S The cashier girl ignores me half the time paying attention back to the transaction the manager should be handling, come on...I just want to check out with my things...GRRR... Cashier: Can I have your phone number to input into the computer? ME: NO...The End.... Another predicted bad experience at BCF.....never fails.  Secret Shoppers beware!

3.description: I don't know about the bad reviews on here or if it was from previous owners but this nail salon is great in my book, I have been coming here for awhile. The owner Helen and her staff are very nice, they always greet you when you come in and service is always great. I usually get the mani/pedi combo and eyebrows, they have a nice selection of colors and it last a long time. The salon is very clean and well kept, it is usually quiet, good for relaxing or a quick nap lol. There is a lady that does massages, maybe one day I'll treat myself and try it but I recommend this salon if you want clean, friendly service.

1.description: What got on my nerves about the place is their inability to schedule a proper appointment and hire enough workers. Upon arrival for my appointment, there was no one available to service me. I asked how much longer and they kept telling me five minutes. The other customers waiting said they were told the same thing twenty minutes ago. So not only did they fail to service my appointment. They also lied to me along with the other customers completely disregarding others having work and trips to make.

2.description: HAD good expectations of this place... Got a pedi and no-chip mani both jobs very sloppy, the man that did my pedi scratch the side of my foot and left my foot very irritated, (I told him as soon as he was done, all he said was "ohhh yeah"), had to color my toes twice because the nail polish was uneven and a second person had to fix my nail because he cut them uneven. My nails were done by someone else who stop after he cut the side of my thumb with the nail filer and ended with yet another person who did a horrible job. Color was very uneven, some nails shorter than the other... Overall the job was horrible and really bad experience for the price paid $60, it's just not worth it....

9.description: There are no recent reviews so I thought I should post. I have been living in the neighborhood for 3 years now, I think the ownership changed, & the bad reviews are from previous owners. I go in there at least once a month (up to 3 times per month) for a mani/pedi, or just one, or a simple polish change. The polish selection is OK not great, sometimes I bring my own polish. They do a good job overall, the prices are really good, so you get what you pay for. I paid $15 for a manicure in Roscoe village & I wanted my nails filed perfectly, they weren't. I have never seen anyone leave crying, & I do see a lot of people stop in to get their eyebrows done. The staff is very nice & sweet. I am a repeat customer! I am going in today for a mani pedi! Enjoy!Update: I think they got some new colors! I got a cute pastel pink on my nails, I heard pastels are in!

10.description: Been coming here for years, very friendly & clean!

4.description: I will never ever return. The four times I have attended this place I have gotten a gel full set with no chip, sometimes with an eyebrow wax. I always tip $15-20. The establishment allows you to pay with credit card but I am always told I have to pay with cash even though other patrons use cards while I am getting serviced. The salon also often ask that I pay before I am finished but does not ask the same of everyone else. I am an African American young woman who recently moved into the neighborhood and I strongly believe my treatment has been racially motivated. Will never ever return.

6.description: Ladies please never go to this nail salon, they do a really bad job. I give this place no stars because I went a week ago and my nails are breaking and the no chip is shipping. Never again would I go to this cheap ass place..

12.description: If I could give this place a minus five star review I would. I just moved near by and checked it out. It's very unorganized and the owner's dog was inside and barked the entire time. But, the worst part was the manicure. The owner used the drill to file my nails. I was half awake and noticed and told her I am not getting fake nails applied and to stop. So, most of my nails are now filed down and thin. And I have to wait for my nails to grow out to be strong again. I'm debating going in to bitch this women out. But, she doesn't speak English. Fuck this place.

5.description: This place is where I usually do my nails. Everyone is really nice. I love how they do my eyebrows and my manicure and pedicure.

13.description: i got my eyebrows tattooed here; it looks pretty sketchy on the outside...and it doesn't look that much better on the inside, but my eyebrows look awesome, and i don't have hepatitis or anything.  she was able to fix my old eyebrow tattoo, which was poorly done at Van's Salon.  all in all, it was a good experience.  pricey, but worth it.

11.description: Staff was nice.  Unfortunately, that's the only good thing about this place.  My usual nail place (Jimmy Nails) was closed so I ended up here.  Nail polish selection was limited (plenty of cheap quality nail polish but just a few OPI & Essie colors).  Pedicure was fine but my manicure looks like a child did it.  Polish all over my cuticles, uneven color, poor filing.  I had to point out spots that were missed.  There was no nail drying UV light, just a tiny plastic fan.  Definitely NOT going back.

8.description: Ever since Helen became the owner, Rachel's have my been my #1 spot! I love how they do my nails and especially my eyebrows. I don't have a complaint yet.. Before Rachel's got a new owner, they were horrible, bad service, but now, they're great :) I will continue going to Rachel's.

0.description: Hands down, the BEST Mani/pedi I have ever received, and at such an affordable price! I'm so glad that I have discovered this place, so close to my house. Very clean and spacious place!

7.description: First and foremost, this is probably the cleanest nail salon I've seen ever!   Helen the owner is super sweet and so is the rest of her staff.   I love coming here especially with my six year old daughter.  They treat us very well!   As far as the service; I have had no chip nails,  gel full and fill-ins, pedicure, eyebrows and facial and I can assure I have been very happy with everything.   My fill-ins do not not look like fill-ins they always look as though I got a fresh new set.  I constantly get compliments about my hands, feet and eyebrows.   I will Continue to come here.    Would recommend it!

3.description: I saw Seth's work at the tattoo here in Chicago a couple weeks ago so felt good about going to him for last piece; black & grey praying hands on my forearm. Empire has a cool, laid back atmosphere. All the artists had cool attitudes & were real friendly. Seth is really easy to talk to and gets excited about his work! He knocked it out of the park! Well above my expectations! I'm proud to have it art added to my growing collections! Thank you for such a memorable experience! I'll be back for more! I'll post a picture once it's healed so you can see his handy work. You need to check this place out!

1.description: Terrible, Terrible, Terrible!If you want to get something pierced, don't go here to Mandy! She pierced my daith (part of my ear). She had to do it twice because she couldn't get the jewelry in. Then she couldn't get the screw in and dropped it in my ear canal. She couldn't get it out! I ended up going to the ER to have it removed. Her advice to me was to take a shower or flush it with saline... needless to say, I ended up at the ER with a doctor pulling it out. This was the most expensive piercing I've ever had with the cost of the trip to the ER. I would NEVER recommend going here!

2.description: Got my second tattoo last night. In love with it. They do great job of going over all the steps on how to take care of it. Also liked that they have conversations with you while getting your tattoo done. Will for sure come here again for my third.

9.description: Great place with talented artists. Nick, SethMark, and Joel have unlimited vision and quality.For any type of art style you might be looking for.A very clean and tidy shop with down earth guys.

10.description: Excellent customer service especially on short notice. I called one morning when I had the day off work just to see if they accepted walk-ins. I explained that I just wanted something quick and wouldn't take long. I was told Spencer would be in at 1:30 and would be more than happy to sit down and look over a few drawings I had in mind. When I arrived at 1:25 Spencer was already there and understood exactly what I was looking to do. Within an hour I was out of there and was more than satisfied with my tattoo. Definitely going back again soon.

4.description: Awesome new tattoo shop in Itasca IL.  My artist was Nick; in fact I have been going to him for the last year for all my tattoos.  This shop has amazing artists and great atmosphere. Easily accessible off Rt 20 or Rt 53.  Nick is always willing to work with you no matter the design; bring in custom, coverup, original or traditional he knocks out all the styles.  Very nice and open to ideas and change.. I was and am very happy with this tattoo parlor and plan on coming back for all my future tattoos..thanks guys!
