6.description: Got my tattoo touched up here tonight...great experience! Was able to walk right in on a Friday and sit down with no hassle. The artists are really knowledgeable without being stuck up about it. I love my tattoo now more than when I originally got it!

12.description: Shop was very clean and inviting. Staff is professional and curtious, you really can't ask anything more of a studio.

5.description: I got my first tattoo here and my artist was Mark.  I have previously gone to other parlors but I walked out since I didn't feel comfortable there.  I would definitely recommend this shop to anyone getting their first tattoo - it's very laid back and clean and I definitely felt at ease.  Mark was very friendly and helped me feel comfortable throughout the entire process.  Both before and after the tattoo he gave me very clear instructions on how to properly take care of my new ink, which was extremely appreciated.Also, I went with two friends (who both got body piercings) and we called on a Saturday afternoon and were told that they could do all three of us as soon as we got there.

11.description: I have known many of the artists here for some time and they all do quality work.  I have several tattoos from Joel, and if you're looking for traditional style work you wont be disappointed.  Clean and knowledgeable with fair prices from dedicated artists, what more could you ask for?

8.description: Like I said in my previous review, my next tattoo would be from them! And yesterday I went and got my tattoo. It's small but I love it so much. Nick was my artist and he was very cool and did really great work and detail considering how small my tattoo was! I will definitely be returning. Thanks guys!

0.description: Was looking for a place to fix a badly messed up piece I let a friend do (BIG mistake!).  After a quick consultation I booked an appointment, I had it fixed by Nick.  He did a great job, was professional, and quick.  What I thought would be a couple hours, turned out to be a little under an hour.  In and out, and now I have a beautiful tattoo I am not embarrassed to show people.  Already planning my next ink!  ;)

7.description: Seth was professional, talented, and calm.  He did such a good job with my watercolor tattoo!  If I get another one I will go back to him hands down!

58.description: Great lunch specials....cheap eats and lots of food.  New menu came out with fresh smoothies.  Not a bad place for carry out.  Not a great place to dine in.

56.description: I'm in love with their crab rangoon...I crave and dream about it.  This is the type of crab rangoon that's crispy and has tons of cream cheese/crab filling.  YUMMY!I also like their fried rice a lot and I'm slowly trying more dishes.  It's definitely a good place to get Chinese food from.  Although, their chicken lo mein isn't want I wished it were.  It's the smaller noodles and I always wish it were the thicker egg noodles.  Maybe they will hear my pleads and change the noodles.

29.description: I'm giving this 4 stars based on what it is, a takeout/delivery Chinese place.  And for what it is, holy wah!  We ordered a couple apps and a entrée each expecting to have just enough for 3 good size eaters.  We didn't even get through a third of it there was soooooo much.  And this isn't a case of quantity compensating for quality, this was really really good Chinese.  And the pricing is really good too.  For the large amount we ordered it was only about $50.  The rangoons are the second best I've ever had anywhere.  They were fast too.  Even when they forgot an order of the rangoons (we ordered 2) they got forgotten order here with the quickness.  If you're in their delivery area and want some good Chinese fast, hit these guys up for sure. OH, and unless you're straight up famished a small order on any of the entries will fill you up no problem.

42.description: The recent Sunday night when we decided to order from China Station, I had been dying for American Chinese food (or whatever it's called) for weeks. I have tried SO MANY Chinese delivery restaurants in my two and a half years in Chicago, and because of my Humboldt/Logan location I have never been successful. So I decided to give China Station a try and used their online ordering system at approximately 8pm. They were scheduled to close at 9pm. Time passed and passed, and the food never arrived. Around 9, I called and called the restaurant with no answer. I checked my bank statement and no charge had gone through, so I figured that they somehow did not get or did not fulfill the order, and left it at that.A few days later I realized I had been charged for the food that we never received. My husband called and spoke to a manager who did a little investigating and found my order had been delivered to the wrong address, and since it was already paid for via debit card, the person who answered the door decided to just take my food. GREAT JOB, PERSON WHO TOOK MY FOOD. Anyway. The manager was amazingly understanding, said she was doing the charge-back, called when she had performed the charge-back, and then drove to my house to personally drop off the printed receipt of the charge-back. Talk about customer service!So, since then, we have ordered from China Station twice. The portions are MASSIVE (a large is very, very, very large, let me tell you). The pork fried rice is very soy-sauce heavy and some of the bbq pork is gristly, but its not bad at all. The chicken moo-shu is cabbage heavy (the way I like it, I am not very fond of mushrooms), and they will fulfill my husband's bizarre request of beef with broccoli with no broccoli or any vegetables extra extra extra spicy with hot chili sauce and hot mustard on the side.Workmanlike Chinese food, but better than every other place I have ordered from save for one other rather expensive place, with EXCELLENT customer service.

23.description: I first ordered from China Station after they left a brochure in my mailbox 4 years ago. This has been our go-to Chinese take out ever since.  No frills, just straightforward Chinese takeout in a brown paper bag - perfect amount of greasiness, but all the veggies still have crunch and the meat is real.   I kind of don't want to count/admit how often I've ordered from here - but I will say it's always quick, delicious and cheap.

47.description: OK so we've ordered from China Station a couple more times and they haven't been able to repeat their initial speedy 15 minute delivery service.  But they always arrive when they say they will and the food is always still hot and packaged well.  So just wanted to updated because didn't want to be accused of false advertising fast delivery service!

8.description: I dont eat here anymore because of the stinch of the place, it always smells like nasty mop water

31.description: I was really hoping that this place would be another hidden gem, but it was just ok.  I am not sure I've had an eggroll that tasted so much like peanut butter.  I didn't really care for that.  I just don't see it being progressive or creative and it's certainly not authentic.  My general's chicken tasted like it was doused with more soy sauce and some hot sauce so it was a bit saltier than I like.  The entrees do come in a small and large size to choose from, but the prices seem a little bit higher than I'd say it's worth.

34.description: Let me just say that I grew up in a small town in central IL where there was only 1 greasy Chinese place within a 25 mile radius so, even though I live right by Friendship Chinese, I occasionally crave some Chinese food quick and sleez style. China Station absolutely delivered. We had the dinner special for 2 which could have easily fed 5. It came with sweet & sour chicken, kung bao beef, 2 egg rolls and shrimp fried rice. We also got free crab rangoon with a coupon. The flavors were exactly what you've come to expect from a cheap Chinese takeout; fair and improved greatly with a douse of Sriracha. The food was about 10 mins. late but, I really was impressed with the green peppers and peanuts in the kung boa - they were crisp and fresh instead of the limp and soggy that usually come with home delivery. The crab rangoon was good too; egg rolls = meh.

16.description: I first ordered from China Station after they left a brochure in my mailbox 4 years ago. This has been our go-to Chinese take out ever since.  No frills, just straightforward Chinese takeout in a brown paper bag - perfect amount of greasiness, but all the veggies still have crunch and the meat is real.   I kind of don't want to count/admit how often I've ordered from here - but I will say it's always quick, delicious and cheap.

13.description: This is exactly the type of place you order from when you are too lazy to cook and just want some greasy, good, cheap chinese food. They are great people who own this joint and the prices are really cheap. You are definitely getting what you pay for. If you have a weak stomach, some dishes may not be best for you, but for a true junk food lover- order away.

11.description: WORST CHINESE FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD.  Okay, look, you're probably thinking, "Oh, it can't be that bad, I'll check out the other reviews..."  But I'm going to reiterate, just in case you glazed over that the first time I said it: WORST CHINESE FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD.1. There were only four small shrimp in the entire order of shrimp kung bao.  Which is fine if all you want to eat are baby corn, onions, and peanuts in a watery sauce.2. The curry was bland and watery.  Oh if only the curry and the "soup" (see article #8) could exchange consistencies.3. There were only three small shrimp in the order of shrimp curry.  Small, as in a little bigger than popcorn shrimp-size.4. They forgot to include our order of crispy wantons.  Which I didn't call about to complain because the only solution I could forsee is them bringing me more food (oh God, please no) or them offering to pay for my next meal (I won't be back, even for free).5. The fried rice had almost no flavor...which makes no sense considering it was dark brown as if they had smothered it in soy sauce.  Also, it was shrimp fried rice (can you tell I'm a fan of shrimp?) and it had about three salad shrimp in it.6. The soy sauce provided was the awful kind that's basically water, salt, and brown food colouring -- look, Chinese restaurants everywhere -- we are not fooled by this anymore!  Get some Kikkoman packets!  Even grocery store sushi comes with real soy sauce!7.  The egg rolls were very greasy and the insides were permeated with this crumbly unidentified matter, kind of like when you cook ground beef with veggies and it sticks to everything -- but these were supposed to be veggie egg rolls.  I didn't finish mine.  And I'm pretty indiscriminate about egg rolls; until today, I have never met an egg roll I didn't like.8. And the pièce de résistance: The egg drop "soup."  This soup was thicker than any creamy chowder I've ever seen.  As it cooled, it continued to thicken to the consistency of gravy.  The flavor wasn't bad, but it was completely unpalatable at this thickness.  I considered adding it to a stockpot full of water and using it as a soup base.  We refrigerated it to see how thick it would get and this Egg Drop Jell-O was born: img857.imageshack.us/img…  That spoon is stuck in there.  This should never happen with any soup.One star because the delivery was timely, I didn't get sick after the little bit I did eat, the pre-packaged fortune cookie wasn't the citrusy kind, they didn't screw up my can of Lipton Brisk ice tea and Yelp doesn't allow me to choose a "zero-star" review.Brad S. hit the nail on the head with "you will end up throwing the food out the window and ordering Pizza Hut."  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

39.description: This place is cutting edge.  Their vegetable egg rolls have peanut butter and cinnamon in them.  That's like something I'd expect from one of those fancy eclectic places that I never go to.Jesus was this nasty.  I don't know how we choked it down.

37.description: I am convinced that there's no good Chinese food in the Logan Square/Bucktown area. I've tried a few so far, and all have failed miserably. China Station included.You know you're in trouble when your appetizer sampler contains french fries.  Yes, you read that right. French fries. The egg rolls were nasty, the fried shrimp were smelly and foul, and the chicken wings were greasy and tough. Only the crab rangoon was tasty, but that wasn't enough to satisfy me.And the ONE thing that I gauge all Chinese restaurants on is their Hot & Sour soup. If you screw that one up I never think about your establishment again. Well, they did. Gloopy and thick, filled with green onions and not much else. Gross.I ordered some other items as well, but I'm not going to rant about their sub-par quality as it would take forever. Just know that this place is terrible and I will never return.

0.description: China Station has always cure me from hangovers and helped me during the day! They are extremely fast delivery and great price for large portions.

38.description: Have only ordered once, but will be back.  It was good, basic Chinese food, good price, nearby, and easy online ordering.  What more could you want?

51.description: Dear China Station-I want to thank you for all the good times over the last year and a half, I will always cherish the memories.  Thank you for always being there for me, even when I'm sick and pouty and wait until 9:30 to decide what I want for dinne r and only have 6 dollars.  I will always keep you in my heart, even after I move out of your delivery range.Love,theresa c.

27.description: Maybe it's just me becoming a food snob, but all I have to say is "Ew."  It's been almost 2 years since I've ordered Chinese take-out in the city and all of a sudden I got the craving...so I ordered sweet and sour chicken and some crab rangoon from China Station on a weekday around 6:30.  Not only did it take more than an hour for them to deliver, but the food was AWFUL.  I've never considered myself picky, but I didn't even want anything to do with this stuff.  The portions were big and the price was alright, but in the big city of Chicago there has GOT to be somewhere better to go.

32.description: Solid take-out place. Everything you'd realistically hope for. We got shrimp with vegetables, sesame chicken, and sweet and sour chicken. Nothing to die for but everything was yummy. Big portions, a small runs about $5.50, was enough for 1 person to squeeze 2 meals out of.  This will probably be our go-to Chinese place.

54.description: we had good food, we ordered late at night and it got there in less than a hour. I recommend the Crab Ragoons A+ on that front. Everything else is yummy. Give it a shot

48.description: I've only ever gotten food delivered from here, but it's always good. Reasonable prices for your typical Americanized Chinese food. Excellent Crab Rangoon and really good fruit smoothies. Friendly delivery people, too!

44.description: After watching too many episodes of "Sex and the City" (in which they were always eating chinese food), my roommate and I had a strong craving for chinese. So we yelped some places and since China Station is really right down the street from our house AND they delivered (we were feeling lazy, and pretty much still wanted to watch Sex and the City) we ordered some food. What's nice is that you could find their menu online so it didn't matter that we had never been there (awkwardly, I just remembered that I threw away the menu that came with the food, DAMN!) So we ordered and they said it would take 45 minutes. In about twenty, our buzzer rang and our food had arrived. I was impressed by the speedy delivery, especially because I was hungry and there was another episode of them eating chinese food.Now, I will say that when I order chinese food, I have a habit of over-ordering, just because I enjoy chinese food leftovers for lunch the next day. I got the beef fried rice, sesame chicken and hot and sour soup. The soup was too sour and not enough hot, the sesame chicken was too dry and the beef fried rice was lacking flavor. Naturally, the rice was easy to fix as I added sirracha and ate to my little heart's content. I suffered through the other parts of the meal, but was not feeling impressed. My roommate ate her food, but I could tell that she too was not impressed.I have China Station three stars because it wasn't too awful; I've had worse Chinese food. Also, the fact that they deliver, are cheap, and give pretty good portion sizes for leftovers means that I am not too offended by the fact that I have to doctor it up a little for it to taste to my liking.

24.description: I have no clue why everyone is hating on this place? I order the Mongolian beef online and it was ready to be picked up in 10 minutes. It was tasty and generous portions. The egg drop soup that I also got was a tad salty but still good. I will be back and I will try other things and update my review. While I understand there is a lack of options in the area there is nothing that should keep you away from trying this place.

7.description: Shrimp fried rice was the best I've had in a longtime. The gravy was good and tasted homemade. The crab ragoon was too sweet for me though. But overall pretty good. I would order again.

49.description: It is always a bit difficult to search out a GOOD place that delivers near Logan Square.  The options are: Thai, Thai, Puerto Rican, Puerto Rican, Puerto Rican, Latino Chicken.  That's about it.  I thought China Station (minus the lame name that is probably a flaw of an incorrect translation) would be a steady Chinese option due to the Yelp reviews.  I was too optimistic...-The Brown Rice looked like black rice (you're thinking too much into it if you thought this was a racial remarks) due to perhaps the soy sauce they use or by overcooking the rice.-The orange chicken was in two huge clumps and was ultra flour-y.  Where's the chicken??  The only thing that made it "orange" was a slice of orange peel on top.-The beef was overly chewy and if it has a rainbow glare to it, no thanks.+I do give them a shout-out for bring prompt with delivery, having everything prepared to chow down (forks, napkins, a million soy sauce packets--perhaps hinting to bland food--all in the bag), and giving us two free Crab Rangoons that I think is their selling point.  I guess we either were given that for not being in their phone system or they just credited us with a non-existent coupon.

40.description: This was pretty horrible. We decided to order our Sunday night Chinese from China Station instead of our nearby tried-and-true restaurant and boy, were we sorry. In time summary: 6:00: we order the food and are given a delivery time of 7:00.6:10: delivery time changes to 7:10. 7:10: we call and ask, where is the food? We're told it should be to our place within 10 minutes, as it left 10 minutes ago. Dim visions of chewy crab rangoon and cooling rubbery orange beef begin creeping into our heads.7:20 food arrives, without the order of potstickers. I call to relay this info and I tell them I'll still take the potstickers if they can be delivered within half an hour; otherwise, just take the charge off the bill. The manager feels bad; says she will bring it out herself in 10-15 minutes. 8:00: still no potstickers. I call back, say forget the potstickers, just take the item off my bill. The person says they need manager approval to take it off the bill, and...the manager is out delivering them. Sigh. 8:20: same delivery guy as an hour ago shoes up and practically shoves the bag into my hands. I refuse it and say that the manager was supposed to have dropped this off herself 45 minutes ago. I tell the delivery guy to have his manager call me. 8:25 manager calls, says things have been "very bad" there that night. I agree and say it's unacceptable. She says she will take the charge for the potstickers off the bill; I thank her. She also says she will give me 30% off my next order if I remind her of this debacle. I decline. We are not ordering from China Station again. Beware.

53.description: Here's the thing - I really really really don't like Chinese food. And for a long time, the only Chinese food I could ever stomach was Chan's Peking III in Poughkeepsie, NY.  (Don't even get me started with Chinatown - blech.)  With Poughkeepsie being so far away, I thought I was done with Chinese food forever.  Well, I was wrong.   Love the food from China Station.  It's delicious. Ridiculously so.  It's fresh and cheap.  Even their delivery guy - Joe - is awesome.  I highly recommend China Station.

30.description: See here's the thing about fried rice - it's tricky. You'd think it wasn't right? Rice + veggies + frying and you're good. Right?Typically I don't buy fried rice from takeout places because I can make my own (quick tutorial on how to make fried rice: take extra long grain or any other kind of white rice and cook it as normal. Store in the fridge for one to two days depending on how crunchy you want it. Chop veggies of choice and fry with aformentioned rice. Season accordingly. Done. See here's the thing, fried rice is day old or more rice that's just being recycled into a dish to cut down on waste.)With that said, there have been rare times where I've wanted fried rice and I didn't want to wait a few days for it - as China Station is a block away, it's the most convenient place. The portion sizes given for the cost are pretty average (fried rice in takeout establishments are usually cheap) - what bums me out about this place's particular fried rice is the lack of flavor. We're talking barely anything at all - no garlic, shallot or anything (mind you, I don't use monosodium glutamate in my own rice, yet it still has more flavor - there SHOULD be a saltiness factor if I'm willingly purchasing something loaded with MSG). Other then convenience, this place isn't worth all that much...

46.description: I always pass by this place and think to myself, "oh this Chinese food place probably tastes like all the other cheap Chinese places".  But then enter yelp and the plethora of great reviews.  Could there possibly be a cheap and tasty Chinese food loophole?  And conveniently located in my neighborhood?  The answer is yes.Now don't get me wrong, the food isn't very exotic or prepared to the the taste of kings and queens.  But for the lack of originality it makes up for in the sheer amount of food and value.  I ordered a large Mongolian beef  and a small moo shu pork to share with my companion, I still have enough food left to host a party.   We could have shared a small order of something and had plenty to spare.  Note: the Mongolian beef was fabulous, a bit gravy overkill but featuring tasty and lots of beef and colorful green onions.  The pork moo shu, eh probably won't order it again, way too much cabbage and that's all I could taste.  Even the giant carton of white rice was prepared well, fluffy and soft, not hard and dry like some take out places can be.  The only big disappointment I had was the crab rangoon.   Which I was very excited to try based on all the yelping suggestions.  Although big in size the flavor was very bland and the wonton wasn't crispy at all.  They did make up for this by including not only fortune cookies with the order but fricking almond cookies.  Which is fabulous, I love both kinds of cookies, so this was a special treat!That being said if you are looking for a laid back evening that involves undoing your pant button to make more room for food and you only have $10 to your name, this will keep your tummy pretty happy.

1.description: Do not, I repeat do NOT order food from here. A very odd flavor accompanied each item I ordered.The egg roll was filled with mystery meat.The shrimp in the fried rice and egg roll was very unpleasant. The pan fried pot stickers were somehow soggy. The orange chicken was just inedible. The breaded part was soggy, the chicken was gristly and the flavor was just off. The rice itself was okay if I avoided the tiny shrimp. Do yourself a favor and try another place!

55.description: Your average Americanized Chinese carry out delivery place.  What sets this place apart from many in the area is it's relatively cheap.  You can get "lunch specials" for $3.95.  That includes whatever entree, rice, and a soda.    You can order these at any other time too--I do for dinner--and they just add a surcharge on ($2?).   I don't know if they make the portion size slightly larger when they do the surcharge too or what?  It's still a good deal though, considering I often even have leftovers.The food itself isn't anything spectacular; actually, it's bordering on "if it were more money, I'd skip it"... but is reliable enough to be considered "average" I guess.  I've gotten delivery from here several times as well as picked up.  It's nothing to look at inside.. Delivery was reliable.

9.description: I always get their orange chicken lunch special all the time its delicious and the lunch special has a big plate of food. The fried rice is delicious and they have some of the Best eggrolls I have tasted. The restaurant is a whole in the wall but the food tastes delicious.

26.description: It's really lackluster.  Ordered the "Kung Bao Chicken" and it had zero peanuts and lacked usual flavors even for fast food American/Chinese versions of that dish.  No peanuts?  No baby corn?  NO PEPPERS????

25.description: Just moved from Lakeview to Wicker Park. On my second night here,  i got that oh so persistent craving for Chinese food. I knew that anything i picked would not be anywhere already near the deliciousness Yummy Yummy on Broadway can provide, so i was prepared for sub-par Chinese.Delivery was quick (35 min in a blizzard!!) Crab Rangoon - one of my staples, was not good at all. The sauce they provided was weird, and it was the typical sysco (or wherever chinese places get their food supply) crab rangoon. Sesame Chicken was pretty decent. Sauce was great consistency and the chicken didn't taste fake. However, the rice was very very dry. Dry like you try to reheat rice the next day dry.. If im in a bind, ill order again. Otherwise i will keep trying new places until i find something as good as Yummy Yummy or Chens in the WP area.

12.description: FIRST GOOD CHINESE RESTAURANT I'VE GOTTEN FOR DELIVERY IN THE LINCOLN PARK AREA!!!! FINALLY!!!!! seriously I've lived in Lincoln Park for about 4 years now and every time I've ordered Chinese I've been disappointed, I tried China Station and ordered potstickers, sesame chicken, mongolian beef, and general chicken with vegetable fried rice, and it was amazing. Not only that, the portions were huge and I definitely got the best bang for my buck! I've ordered from other places in the area and the prices were way higher and the portions way smaller, I've finally found my staple chinese takeout restaurant!!! I think my rating based on the other reviews would be lower if I ate at the restaurant, but great for delivery or takeout.

59.description: Based on the sketchy appearance of China Station, I was VERY hesitant to order food from here. I figured any Chinese restaurant that offers chop suey and lists fried rice as Arroz Frito on their menu probably wasn't going to be offering anything I wanted. Not that I'm a Chinese Food snob. I've been loving on Susie China (on Lincoln Avenue) for years and I think Papa Jin is SO overrated. But, China Station sells chicken wings and french fries. Who wouldn't be skeptical?!?!?! Once again, however, I was proved wrong. I'm not sure who Mike P. talked to, but I  found it very easy to place an order with the fluent lady who picked up the phone. She was actually quite nice! The food arrived in just under an hour, which was a bit long considering I live like 8 blocks away from them. But, they said it would take that long so at least they were upfront about it. Their crab rangoon was SOOOO good. Fresh and crunchy on the outside, warm and gooey on the inside. Mmmm. The orange chicken had just the right amount of heat and the mongolian beef was super tasty. I'm docking two stars because I would never ever ever actually eat at the restaurant and because while the food was good, I still think Susie China's is better. But, since I live so much closer to China Station now I'm sure that I'll be ordering from them again.

21.description: We ordered the Seaseme Chicken and Beef Broccoli, Crab Rangoon, and BBQ Rice.  So here is the verdict.  Large portions.  We were not fans of the Seaseme chicken,.  Beef Broccoli was alright.  Crab Rengoon was some of the best i've ever had. BBQ pork fried rice was decent.  The veggies were fresh, but the food lacked that extra kick that good American Chinese food places have.My advice ... I would read these reviews and be selective about what I ordered.  Service was fast for take out...10 min to cook online order.

17.description: I am convinced that there's no good Chinese food in the Logan Square/Bucktown area. I've tried a few so far, and all have failed miserably. China Station included.You know you're in trouble when your appetizer sampler contains french fries.  Yes, you read that right. French fries. The egg rolls were nasty, the fried shrimp were smelly and foul, and the chicken wings were greasy and tough. Only the crab rangoon was tasty, but that wasn't enough to satisfy me.And the ONE thing that I gauge all Chinese restaurants on is their Hot & Sour soup. If you screw that one up I never think about your establishment again. Well, they did. Gloopy and thick, filled with green onions and not much else. Gross.I ordered some other items as well, but I'm not going to rant about their sub-par quality as it would take forever. Just know that this place is terrible and I will never return.

10.description: Kung pao chicken was decent. Nice and hot temperature wise and perfect spicyness. Hot and sour soup was just o.k. Overall pretty good for a hole in the wall Chinese fast food place.

5.description: When my husband wants some American Chinese food, we would always go there for take out. Great portion for the price. Their singapore noodles is quite good, better than some authentic Chinese restaurants in Chinatown.

3.description: Their egg rolls and fried rice reminded me of another Chinese restaurant that I loved. The orange chicken was just so,so not too spivey though. Quite reasonable for the amount of food you get. If you go for lunch, one of their lunch specials is practically enough for two people, although I did finish it myself. If you dine in, you might wanna bring some Clorox wipes with.

35.description: Good food, its really fast, fairly priced. Way better than other Chinese food in Humboldt Park.

19.description: Three and a half stars?!  This place sucks- there is no way around it.  I will start off by saying that their bbq pork friend rice is not terrible.   But then there is everything thing else that I've tried.  Everything.  I don't expect a gourmet meal from a budget-friendly chinese restaurant, but don't want it to taste like dog feces.  I will order crab rangoon just about anytime it's on the menu where I'm at.  I've given it multiple attempts and still have been extremely disappointed every time.  Egg rolls- foget it.  Any type of glazed entree will fill you with angst.  You won't save any money if you're like me, because you will end up throwing the food out the window and ordering Pizza Hut.  Wing Lee used to get me in the door, but she left long ago...   Point awarded however for the old tv and the horse posters.  The cashier  who probably owns the place is pretty nice as well.

28.description: I ordered takout last week from China Station.  The meal was . . . well it was totally blah. The food didn't have a lot of taste, and the sauce on our orange chicken was a bit heavy for my taste.  But the amount of food for the price made me give them an extra star. They had to staple the top of the fried rice container shut because it was so full it wouldn't close.Food, not great. Bang for your buck, outstanding.  I might try another place, but if I can't find anything better I would proably go back. Finding good Chinese food at a decent price seems to be one elusive beast here in Chicago.

45.description: Some unsung hero in this kitchen is making magic with Americanized Chinese food. The food is surprisingly good, particularly the delightfully crispy, creamy crab rangoon and robust chicken dishes. The sesame and sweet-and-sour chicken dishes are our favorites: thick, tangy sauce with big, soft chunks of ground chicken. To be fair, the chicken can be a bit mealy, and the beef rubbery, but for the price, size, freshness, and overall quality of the dishes, I find this acceptable.What's remarkable about China Station is how generous they are with portions: the dishes are enormous to start with, and you will always get extras of items you've ordered--and sometimes freebies that you didn't order.Service is quick as lightning: by the time we place an order and walk the two blocks over from our apartment, our food is ready. Staff is polite and courteous. Not a sit-down joint by any means, but for coming deliriously close to the nigh-impossible trifecta of fast, good, cheap Chinese food for pickup or delivery, China Station is a hidden gem.

33.description: Got delivery on Saturday night. Orange Chicken, General Tso's Chicken, Vegetable Fried Rice, Chicken Fried Rice, Egg Rolls, Crab Rangoon.Both Orange Chicken and General Tso's chicken TASTED LIKE THEY WERE A DAY OLD. This food truly tasted like it was prepared the night before. The quality of that food was such a disappointment.The fried rice was average. The crab rangoon was ok but under-cooked. The eggrolls were average.$37 for my roommates and my meal, took an hour to deliver. Would not order it again.

43.description: Just moved into the area and was looking for a nice Chinese place -- used Google first and ended up here, reading some great reviews. I concur with all of them. This place is good, cheap, and quick Americanized Chinese cuisine. I have some tips, since this is "my" place for Chinese:* If you over-order, you'll be eating this food for a month. The portions are  absolutely massive. * Crab Rangoon -- best ever. Don't even order it, just make sure you order more than $20 worth of food (easy) and ask for it. I think you can order $10 and get some too.* Fried Tofu -- vegans, this is for you. Grab some of this and the Vegetable Tofu dish and you're good to go, or Vegetable Deright / Hunan Mixed Vegetables (spicy)* Carryout -- takes about 10 minutes no matter what you order. Seriously. Parking around there is kind of a bitch so I suggest the north side of North Ave and then run across the street.* Derivery ;) -- The dude is usually pretty quick, I live a few blocks away so I only do this when I'm feeling super lazy. And they don't rape you on the delivery charge.Personally as far as food I recommend the Mongolian Beef, combo fried rice, the Kung Bao beef or chicken, the Hunan Chicken, and the fried tofu / crab rangoon. Hope this helps!

2.description: Pretty good, just not the best I've ever had. was super nice being able to order through Yelp. Order was ready in about 10 minutes.

18.description: This place got so much better after the new manager took place of the old one. I used to come here once a month because I live a block away. But ever since the new manager and possibly new chef. I've been coming here almost every week. In fact, this is my 2nd time here this week. He would recommend me a different dish every time. And OMG, the fried rice, and the orange chicken. They're DELICIOUS. Even their Vegetable delight dish have plenty of flavor.

41.description: China Station excels in the style I lovingly refer to as Strip Mall Chinese. These guys don't fancy themselves to be reinpreting any dishes and I've never seen much in the way of herbs in their cooking, but they turn out great portions of good Americanized Chinese food. Kung Pao is brimming with peanuts, General's Chicken is breaded deliciousness and the free Crab Rangoon is delightful.This place fill a very important niche. My only complaint: no brown rice!

52.description: Dude.... China Station!  Seriously. [insert wi-five]  Admittedly, this place looks pretty sketchy from the outside... but once you get inside you'll find it to be a family joint with high quality eats and attentive service... plus, it's cheap and fresh and deliciouso (that's spanish for delicious as i'm not sure how to say delicious in chinese).  Anzyways, a sure bet is the innominate yet surprising "General's Chicken" or the exciting mongolian beef. Okay, maybe not exciting.  Or surprising for that matter.  But pretty dang good, anyways.

50.description: Crab rangoon is to die for. Perfectly cream-cheesy and crispy on the outside. My boyfriend and I always get a large sesame chicken, which is crispy and the sauce is sweet and tangy, and a small vegetable fried rice, and thats enough for dinner for the two of us. Perfectly Americanized delicious Chinese food for a good price. Makes good leftovers too.They give a complimentary carton of white rice with every order, and we always tell them we don't want it - we like fried rice better - but they give it to us anyways. We always walk because we live just down the street, so can't say anything about the delivery. The location is nothing to speak of, except they used to have a sign posted that said "No Republic Restrooms" that amused me every time we went there until they took it down recently :(

4.description: I actually give this one star but that seems too mean on yelp.  I don't really like chinese food but a friend gave me some from somewhere that I actually liked two weeks ago.  I forgot the name of the place and thought this was it.  This was NOT it.  Go to China COURT if you want chinese takeout!

6.description: Wow! I can't believe I'm rating this hole in the wall 4 stars. I haven't had the pleasure of dining there and I think if I did I'd lessen the rating. But I've gotten some take out a couple times. I was skeptical based on the other reviews. But sh*t you aren't near Chinatown. You're in West Bucktown. So this is a pretty good alternative. I think they had learned from the other reviews of scarce shrimp and flavorless fried rice. But peeps who think their fried rice is bland are the same white peeps who put soy sauce on their white rice. Blasphemy!This place has been consistent. Their house special fried rice has fresh crunchy vegetables in it. And super generous portions. The box was overflowing with rice. We have leftovers for daysI've gotten the Mongolian chow. A mix of beef, chicken and shrimp. Nicely spicy. Good cuts of beef, chicken and has big shrimp. Not overcooked where the shrimp becomes tough. Curry chicken. Not bad but Chinese curry is not my thing. I prefer Indian or Thai curries. Broccoli and mushroom vegetables. Meh. Sauce kinda salty but the broccoli cooked nice and al dente. Not mushy Crab Rangoon. Surprisingly good. Nice hot and crispy even for delivery. Not oily and stale. Crunchy wonton wrapped around the generous medley of cream cheese and imitation crab. Yummy. The price: $32 including delivery charge. Soooo reasonable. We could've fed 6 people. So cheap. And not bad. Definitely not a triple crown like on south wentworth. But no roaches or MSG either like in Chinatown.

22.description: Three and a half stars?!  This place sucks- there is no way around it.  I will start off by saying that their bbq pork friend rice is not terrible.   But then there is everything thing else that I've tried.  Everything.  I don't expect a gourmet meal from a budget-friendly chinese restaurant, but don't want it to taste like dog feces.  I will order crab rangoon just about anytime it's on the menu where I'm at.  I've given it multiple attempts and still have been extremely disappointed every time.  Egg rolls- foget it.  Any type of glazed entree will fill you with angst.  You won't save any money if you're like me, because you will end up throwing the food out the window and ordering Pizza Hut.  Wing Lee used to get me in the door, but she left long ago...   Point awarded however for the old tv and the horse posters.  The cashier  who probably owns the place is pretty nice as well.

15.description: I have no clue why everyone is hating on this place? I order the Mongolian beef online and it was ready to be picked up in 10 minutes. It was tasty and generous portions. The egg drop soup that I also got was a tad salty but still good. I will be back and I will try other things and update my review. While I understand there is a lack of options in the area there is nothing that should keep you away from trying this place.

57.description: I love China Station--I have to admit, I would never have tried it if I didnt live around the corner, but the first time I ordered I was really suprized.  As the queen of cheap and cheerful I am happy to have such a gem in the neighborhood.  The apps are great- the service over the phone is always pleasant, and my food is always ready within the time it takes me to walk the 2 blocks from my house.  Make sure you ask for extra sauces and for added spices if you need them.  They are very nice about additions/subtractions.  The portions are ENORMOUS and the people below arent joking when they say its enough for 2 or 3 meals with one large portion.Prices are dirt cheap but the ingedients arent gross.  Its definately not organic or anything but they give you a good value.

20.description: WORST CHINESE FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD.  Okay, look, you're probably thinking, "Oh, it can't be that bad, I'll check out the other reviews..."  But I'm going to reiterate, just in case you glazed over that the first time I said it: WORST CHINESE FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD.1. There were only four small shrimp in the entire order of shrimp kung bao.  Which is fine if all you want to eat are baby corn, onions, and peanuts in a watery sauce.2. The curry was bland and watery.  Oh if only the curry and the "soup" (see article #8) could exchange consistencies.3. There were only three small shrimp in the order of shrimp curry.  Small, as in a little bigger than popcorn shrimp-size.4. They forgot to include our order of crispy wantons.  Which I didn't call about to complain because the only solution I could forsee is them bringing me more food (oh God, please no) or them offering to pay for my next meal (I won't be back, even for free).5. The fried rice had almost no flavor...which makes no sense considering it was dark brown as if they had smothered it in soy sauce.  Also, it was shrimp fried rice (can you tell I'm a fan of shrimp?) and it had about three salad shrimp in it.6. The soy sauce provided was the awful kind that's basically water, salt, and brown food colouring -- look, Chinese restaurants everywhere -- we are not fooled by this anymore!  Get some Kikkoman packets!  Even grocery store sushi comes with real soy sauce!7.  The egg rolls were very greasy and the insides were permeated with this crumbly unidentified matter, kind of like when you cook ground beef with veggies and it sticks to everything -- but these were supposed to be veggie egg rolls.  I didn't finish mine.  And I'm pretty indiscriminate about egg rolls; until today, I have never met an egg roll I didn't like.8. And the pièce de résistance: The egg drop "soup."  This soup was thicker than any creamy chowder I've ever seen.  As it cooled, it continued to thicken to the consistency of gravy.  The flavor wasn't bad, but it was completely unpalatable at this thickness.  I considered adding it to a stockpot full of water and using it as a soup base.  We refrigerated it to see how thick it would get and this Egg Drop Jell-O was born: img857.imageshack.us/img…  That spoon is stuck in there.  This should never happen with any soup.One star because the delivery was timely, I didn't get sick after the little bit I did eat, the pre-packaged fortune cookie wasn't the citrusy kind, they didn't screw up my can of Lipton Brisk ice tea and Yelp doesn't allow me to choose a "zero-star" review.Brad S. hit the nail on the head with "you will end up throwing the food out the window and ordering Pizza Hut."  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

36.description: Oh for heavens sakes, is it really that hard to find a decent Chinese place outside of Chinatown? With the abundance of tasty Thai places all over the city, it's a damn dirty shame about the millions of horrid Chinese restaurants outside of the Cermak red line stop area.Of course I only attempted this one because it's literally 5 minutes away walking and I was craving some Chinese. I got the Orange Chicken while my mec got the Mongolian Beef I believe, we split the Crab Rangoon. There is a LOT of food, I'll give them that. Enough for a week of leftovers. It would help if you could eat more than a couple bites though. I ate a small portion, as much as I could as I was famished, and then the mountain of leftovers went into the fridge. And they sat... and sat... and sat. I always eat leftovers, but those leftovers sat for a week and a half before I admitted defeat, I just did not have the will or stomach power to eat another bite. Everything is bland bland bland. Toilet paper with ketchup would probably have more flavour.So, if you need your Chinese, do yourself a favour and just go to Chinatown. I highly recommend checking out Shui Wah in New Chinatown Square; go for their amazing Dim Sum though be prepared to wait on the weekends. And ALWAYS tried the Spicy Squid with Salt; your mouth will thank you for years to come.

14.description: It is always a bit difficult to search out a GOOD place that delivers near Logan Square.  The options are: Thai, Thai, Puerto Rican, Puerto Rican, Puerto Rican, Latino Chicken.  That's about it.  I thought China Station (minus the lame name that is probably a flaw of an incorrect translation) would be a steady Chinese option due to the Yelp reviews.  I was too optimistic...-The Brown Rice looked like black rice (you're thinking too much into it if you thought this was a racial remarks) due to perhaps the soy sauce they use or by overcooking the rice.-The orange chicken was in two huge clumps and was ultra flour-y.  Where's the chicken??  The only thing that made it "orange" was a slice of orange peel on top.-The beef was overly chewy and if it has a rainbow glare to it, no thanks.+I do give them a shout-out for bring prompt with delivery, having everything prepared to chow down (forks, napkins, a million soy sauce packets--perhaps hinting to bland food--all in the bag), and giving us two free Crab Rangoons that I think is their selling point.  I guess we either were given that for not being in their phone system or they just credited us with a non-existent coupon.

28.description: What's the best way to say, "Happy Birthday"?  Mofongo, of course!!  For my [mumblemumble]th birthday, some friends and I headed to Humboldt Park to chow down at SL.  It was a pretty great experience.  First of all, it's BYO.  If you have never consumed copious amounts of wine out of styrofoam cups, you should.  I felt like I was back in high sch...college.  I felt like I was back in my senior year of college.The layout of the restaurant is very welcoming.  You first come into a quick counter, where you can order off a board, look into the display case and point and/or interact with the cooks/cashier.  If you move past that action, you come into a largish dining room with plenty of seating.  That's where we were.  As we laughed at blind dates (mine), flag football injuries and oyster fests that didn't serve oysters, we received our food.  We ordered too much.  I had no idea of the amounts of food you get here, but you won't leave hungry.  That's a promise.  For apps, we got the mofongo (delicious), alcapurria (delicious), maduros (so delicious) and yuca.  Those options could have been meal alone.  But, this is me we're talking about, so I ordered a meal ('natch).  I ordered the fried fish.  I'm not talking about a mounted fish on the wall, singing the praises of getting back a fillet of itself (disturbing - but see what I did there?  You're singing the jingle, aren't you?).  I am talking about a fish (minus the head), dunked in a fryer and served up with yellow rice and salad.  It was awesome.  It was fresh, filling and well seasoned. From what I could tell by the food babies germinating in everyone's stomachs, everyone was pleased with their meal.  And, we all had plenty of leftovers to eat the next day.  Yes, getting a cab later at night on that stretch of North might be a problem, but it _is_ on North Avenue, so one can be dispatched lickety split.  And, after eating all that food, you should probably take a walk anyway, mkay?

1.description: Hi everyone,This place is really bad: 1- service 0 point2- decoration 0 point3- food cold 0 point4- knowledge of food 0 pointthis place sucks!!!I do not recommend this place at all

9.description: Walked out due to no attention given after 20 min. Horrible service. The food in the buffet looks very greasy.

29.description: I ordered the jibarito de pollo(chicken) and the arroz con gandules. Very yummy and filling. The portions are huge and the prices are cheap. I like this place  There was a long wait but it was lunch hour.. so no problema..  And it's near my job.. so go check it out

23.description: I ordered take-out from this place.  (Well, my spanish speaking co-worker did)  I had the chicken soup with noodles.  I am pretty sure I went to heaven for the 15 minutes I was eating it.  It was the best tasting liquidy warm goodness ever.  I am not sure what spices were in that fine bowl, but I will order it again and again!The second time I ordered the BBQ Pork Sandwich and the Chicken sandwich.  My husband and I split these.  The Pork was amazing.  We will come again and get the BBQ Pork sandwich and the rice con condules.Also They do not take credit cards/ debit cards.  CASH ONLY!

5.description: Came in for taco Tuesday. The restaurant  was not packed but we had to wait 15 minutes  for someone to even greet us. Once we were seated it was another 15 minutes until we were asked about drinks. My friend and I both ordered Coronas and two tacos.  Our food was brought before our drinks ever arrived and when our beer came it was warm! The tacos were disgusting and soggy (it looked like the meat was from a can). Extra toppings like lettuce and tomato are an up charge.  We were so disappointed and grossed out by our food that we couldn't even finish it. We ended up leaving and ordering a pizza.

31.description: Sabor Latino on Fullerton and Kimball has great food. The only thing that lacks about the place is its look. It's kind of blah and boring and irritates the eye, but I love their pork chops, their pasteles, their arroz con gandules, and their papa rellenos. The food is cheap and tasty, but they could use a little more decor.

25.description: I ordered for a 2pm pickup 3/27/20 my food was 45 minutes late,i order rice and gandules (it was okay) pernil (it was mixed with fresh & old meat yuk) also bacalao & bananas (the bananas were dry & the bacalao was too salty to enjoy, I also order 2dz pasteles, never got them instead got chicken where the coating was so hard it was not enjoyable. My order came to $106.94 & we were pressed for time so we d/n check the bins before we left so as far as using this restaurant again, I don't think so!!!!

12.description: This place didn't really do it for me. The dining area was very comfortable and nice, but our waitress really did not care to help us or serve us.  She had an attitude when she took our order, and after our food was delivered, we did not see her anymore! I ordered the fried pork jibarito.  The plantains were fried very nicely, but the pork was super dry.  My friend ordered the fried pork dinner and the pork was also very dry.  However, the rice that came with the dinner was excellent!  My other friend ordered the mofango which tasted pretty good.  Overall, not my best experience and I dont think I'll be returning anytime soon.One great convenience about this place is that you can order your food at the front counter where they have A LOT of fried food you can carry out.

21.description: Best puerto rican food the Jibarito is delish!!! .... and if your not that hungry a morzilla con pan or an alcapurria will do you welll! yummmmm

16.description: What's the best way to say, "Happy Birthday"?  Mofongo, of course!!  For my [mumblemumble]th birthday, some friends and I headed to Humboldt Park to chow down at SL.  It was a pretty great experience.  First of all, it's BYO.  If you have never consumed copious amounts of wine out of styrofoam cups, you should.  I felt like I was back in high sch...college.  I felt like I was back in my senior year of college.The layout of the restaurant is very welcoming.  You first come into a quick counter, where you can order off a board, look into the display case and point and/or interact with the cooks/cashier.  If you move past that action, you come into a largish dining room with plenty of seating.  That's where we were.  As we laughed at blind dates (mine), flag football injuries and oyster fests that didn't serve oysters, we received our food.  We ordered too much.  I had no idea of the amounts of food you get here, but you won't leave hungry.  That's a promise.  For apps, we got the mofongo (delicious), alcapurria (delicious), maduros (so delicious) and yuca.  Those options could have been meal alone.  But, this is me we're talking about, so I ordered a meal ('natch).  I ordered the fried fish.  I'm not talking about a mounted fish on the wall, singing the praises of getting back a fillet of itself (disturbing - but see what I did there?  You're singing the jingle, aren't you?).  I am talking about a fish (minus the head), dunked in a fryer and served up with yellow rice and salad.  It was awesome.  It was fresh, filling and well seasoned. From what I could tell by the food babies germinating in everyone's stomachs, everyone was pleased with their meal.  And, we all had plenty of leftovers to eat the next day.  Yes, getting a cab later at night on that stretch of North might be a problem, but it _is_ on North Avenue, so one can be dispatched lickety split.  And, after eating all that food, you should probably take a walk anyway, mkay?

17.description: Tried the Puerto Rican sandwich at the Taste of Chicago festival, it was so bad I specifically remembered the name of the booth.  The sandwich was a skinny slice of steak in a soggy piece of bread with some mayonnaise, that's all.  It was incredible how bad it was, definitely the worst Taste of Chicago booth.  I'm thinking they attended the festival to make some quick money because they really don't put much care into the food and don't expect people to visit their real restaurant.

10.description: I stopped dining here when I realized that there's better PR food within walking distance of my house. The last time I ordered take out the girl behind the counter did not speak English and couldn't figure out how to wrap up a jibarito to go in a container.  She just didn't know how to do it, and I had to mime with my hands how to put a jibarito in a styrofoam container. Lame.

11.description: The food is good. But, for the love of god, TURN THE HEAT ON. You can't enjoy your food when the temperature inside is the same as outside. And faster service would help.

26.description: This place didn't really do it for me. The dining area was very comfortable and nice, but our waitress really did not care to help us or serve us.  She had an attitude when she took our order, and after our food was delivered, we did not see her anymore! I ordered the fried pork jibarito.  The plantains were fried very nicely, but the pork was super dry.  My friend ordered the fried pork dinner and the pork was also very dry.  However, the rice that came with the dinner was excellent!  My other friend ordered the mofango which tasted pretty good.  Overall, not my best experience and I dont think I'll be returning anytime soon.One great convenience about this place is that you can order your food at the front counter where they have A LOT of fried food you can carry out.

27.description: You can get food to go or sit down and eat here. It's delicious authentic Puerto Rican food. If you sit down to eat, some of the waitresses don't speak English very well so you have to know some Spanish. Other than that, the place is great! I usually order the fried chicken with rice and beans, the steak with rice and beans, or the pork chops with and beans and all of them are deeeeelish!

0.description: FOOD:  You can't beat the food of 'Sabor Latino'.  They bring out fresh bread and butter to start, and then the rice, beans, and meat are simply amazing.  The items in the front counter are a nice bit to grab on the way out the door.  I had a jibarito de lechon and was in heaven during my time there.  MANAGEMENT: I think there may be a few gaps with the managing of the store's supply.  They were out of carne frita and diet coke.  What restaurant chain runs out of Diet Coke at 8:30PM on a Saturday night?  And the group next to us took off when they found out there wasn't any carne frita.  I'm guessing they're a little weak on managing food orders and keeping things in stock.  But hey, if they avoid over-ordering stuff in order to keep food fresh and not have to stuff things in the freezer, more power to them. Also, their machine wouldn't accept two cards we had.  Luckily, we had cash, but I think the waitress lost a bit on the tip because OF that.  SERVICE:  Waitress was very friendly and offered good explanations of food items.  My order was mismarked (I had actually ordered a 'cena'), but she made up for it by bringing us a couple of orders of tostones, which we did not actually ask for, but she heard us explaining those with interest to my parents who were with us.  That was really considerate of her.  We just moved to the area and will definitely be back many more times!

20.description: Foods going down hill at this place. Been comming to eat here since you could here the rats running around in the second floor of this place (20yrs). Bacalaito was soggy and oily. Relleno de papa had no flavor. Alcapurria de yuca- no flavor. This is "sabor" (which means flavor in spanish) latino isn't it?? Not going here anymore. 1 star for convinience, other star for PR support... I guess.

19.description: Foods going down hill at this place. Been comming to eat here since you could here the rats running around in the second floor of this place (20yrs). Bacalaito was soggy and oily. Relleno de papa had no flavor. Alcapurria de yuca- no flavor. This is "sabor" (which means flavor in spanish) latino isn't it?? Not going here anymore. 1 star for convinience, other star for PR support... I guess.

33.description: Apparently this restaurant shows up at the Taste of Chicago every year as the only Puerto Rican food restaurant there.  It's around the corner from where I work and I usually get the  chicken jibarito... mmmmm.Not bad at all.It's around $7-8 and comes with yellow rice and beans. The atmosphere is nice, clean, and quiet.The service is excellent.  I'm always asked by about 3 people if I've been helped already.Give it a try if you're in the area or looking for good Puerto Rican.  If you're on CTA, come for breakfast or lunch, not dinner.  The area is shady at night =)

2.description: The staff was courteous but unfortunately the food was nowhere near the taste I wanted it to be. I had asked for an arroz con gandulez y bistec encebollado but the bistec was too hard and I had a problem chewing it. Really expected more from this place but in the end it was just a big let down

32.description: I dig this place.  It's food is great. Their service is courteous and quick.  For those whom have never experienced Puerto Rican food, it's entirely different from Mexican.  I say this because there are probably a good number of people who believe they're same because we speak the same language.  This couldn't farther from the truth.  Puerto Rican food for the most part  is not spicy, there are no tortillas, no re fried beans, not alot of beef.  What you will find is foods using alot of sofrito as their seasoning base, alot of garlic,fried plaintains,pork and chicken, and instead of refried beans there is "arroz con gandules" or spanish rice with green chick peas.  If you feel like trying something a little different head there for a meal.  The price is fairly cheap considering the quality of food you get.  I have been here a couple times and they had live music also.  As for being in a "shady neighbourhood", I don't think so. Go at night you'll be alright. Toma!!!!!

18.description: Horrible service...  Not enough menus. Dirty tables, and rude waitress. Apparently they don't know how to use the credit machine because she also over charged me, then she pulled the money out of the register for over charging my card.

13.description: Ok, so I used to frequent this joint a lot. The pasteles were great. The arroz con gandules were savory, and the carne frita was my absolute favorite. Then the unthinkable happened, my family and I dined in one day and as we were eating...a rat crept across the restaurant floor. I was so taken aback and disgusted that I had to walk out of the restaurant right there and then while my husband paid. I and another guest could not handle it. Then the owner said that someone must've left the door open. Only makes me wonder what else has happened the many times "the door had been left open."

4.description: If you're not from the neighborhood, you're not welcome here. It could not be made more clear by our last experience. We were greeted by the smell of a dining room mopped with a several day old bucket of mildewy water. Our waitress had a ton of attitude and couldn't even be bothered to be polite. Our food was just simply pulled out from under the hot lamps in the front of the store but somehow that took almost an hour. How do you get cold tostones when they were just under a hot lamp? your waitress takes them out and lets them sit, that's how.Other customers (those who were welcome) were served with a smile, ate, paid and left before we even got our food. They claimed they were making what we ordered, but the other customers ordered the same things. We saw the meat pie delivered, it's hard to miss.The final straw was when the bill came and was over $20 higher than it should have been. Our waitress just washed her hands of it and blamed the cashier, who took about 15 minutes to reappear after being told we wanted to discuss some discrepancies. In the same breath she claimed the all the menu prices are correct and then said that the price had changed on two of the items recently. There was so much lying and confusing information being tossed around that we could not work out the bill. We finally left. The food itself was mostly oily and soggy reheated. Why are they using american cheese in their dishes? How it took 50 minutes to give us microwaved rice I'll never know. The tostones and chicken sandwich was good, but its not worth being treated like some kind of outcast because you're not their target clientele.Both the people who ordered the famous jibarrito, threw it up a few hours later.Go to Vida on 35th and Western. It's way better in every way.

24.description: I called it in for pick up and I had the jibarito sandwich an two alcapurrias and a Malta and the only good thing that taste gudd was the malta !!!! The sandwich was dry the alcapurrias were old as if they were sitting there for days!!! Now I did go to the other location on Fullerton and Kimball and had the same and it was freaking delicious and all freshhhhhh ( are they the same owners?)

6.description: Hello I am here to tell you that the food is ok its not the best wouldnt recommend. The service was horrible. The reason why I say this is during last years holidays I was doing something nice for my family. I brought a tray of rice i went to pick it up and the lady got the tickets wrong. I gave her the 60$ she said it was 120$. That was like a hit to my ball sack. I said lady give me my rice, she called me retarded. Would not recommend.

22.description: The food is very good and cheap. I would give 5 stars but they are now charging 50 cents for a little cup of hotsauce that used to be free for carryouts ... not cool.

15.description: Great value for the $$$. Try the Jibarito sandwich...the "bread" is fried plantains. Quite a unique treat for the landlocked Midwesterner!

7.description: A bit of a hole in the wall but the best Puerto Rican food! It is the best I've had and any other place fails to meet the standards they have given me! I just wish isn't wasn't so far away! But I love the is place! Always buy extra to go.

8.description: STAY AWAY! Awful owners, filthy place, and disgusting food. I wish I could give it zero stars. It should be closed down.

30.description: A very neighborhood place, the food is very authentic and tastes great! Stop here for good eats on a budget but don't come for fancy atmosphere.

3.description: I ordered a steak jibarito and did not mind the taste; however, the rice may have been made early in the weekend and it was Monday. After digestion, I am now sick and my stomach is experiencing a burning sensation. Not a pleasant gift from the food! After touching base with a local, I was advised to not go there and now I will agree. I am urging others to be careful when choosing Puerto Rican cuisine, others are a much better choice than this one. Sorry

14.description: I ordered take-out from this place.  (Well, my spanish speaking co-worker did)  I had the chicken soup with noodles.  I am pretty sure I went to heaven for the 15 minutes I was eating it.  It was the best tasting liquidy warm goodness ever.  I am not sure what spices were in that fine bowl, but I will order it again and again!The second time I ordered the BBQ Pork Sandwich and the Chicken sandwich.  My husband and I split these.  The Pork was amazing.  We will come again and get the BBQ Pork sandwich and the rice con condules.Also They do not take credit cards/ debit cards.  CASH ONLY!

28.description: My first time here was on a Saturday. Make reservations before you come, we sat at the bar easily but it was Thanksgiving weekend. The food was delicious. We sampled around the menu, and everything was great. The meatballs and pasta stand out in my mind as being exceptional!

1.description: I really enjoyed coming here and will be coming back again! I came with my aunt and sister to celebrate my aunts birthday. She knew the head chef since she is his landlord and always wanted to try it. When I first walked in it was dark and quiet, which was perfect since she doesn't care for loud and packed. The hosted was extremely nice, he checked in my coat and offered me a spot at the bar while I waited for my party. The bartender was really nice and knowledgable on her drinks. The waiter was extremely sweet and had plenty of recommendations for us, which were all dead on! I got the house white wine, which was pretty good. We all split the raw salmon( was very good but small portioned), the porkchop (which was juicy, tender, and seasoned perfectly but way too much fat on it), the black pepper pasta ( Was the best! They make their own pasta by hand and I can tell. It's delicious! I just wish it was bigger portioned), and finally we got almost all the desserts they offer. The banana rum cake was good but they put too much ginger on top so it was a little overwhelming, the chocolate mousse cake was by far the meal of the night ( let's just say my aunt would only let us have one bite), and then we had some kind of dessert that was towered with berries and whip cream ext. it was great presentation and super yummy!!! I loved this place! Only thing they need to do to get me to change my 4 star to a 5 star is make larger portions. I will definitely be coming back very soon.

39.description: Everything I tried was fantastic. All pasta is made in-house and absolutely to die for. Make sure to leave room for dessert!! I recommend the banana rum cake. Can't wait to come back and try more!

9.description: Things I loved- Staff     Incredible, polite, helpful- Vibe    Lighting was sexy, music was great- Prices    House wine for $5!! Yes please! Portions were also greatThings I didn't like so much- Food was super salty. Every dish was heavily salted. 2 apps, 2 main dishes. Salty AF   I'd prolly go back if I was in the neighborhood, but most likely wont be making a trip just to eat here.

29.description: Thank you to the Bar Marta team, Jeff, Ben, Austin and Emily-our wonderful server, for showing us so much love. We were super pumped before our visit and it did not disappoint. Old fashioned on tap. Whaaa. Seriously. And made with Old Overholt, which is my fav rye whiskey but not a lot of places in Chicago carry that. This like a dream come true for me :)Those gooseneck barnacles on special...ohmygoodness. Still thinking about this as I write this review. Hamachi crudo, lamb tartare and the chicken liver toast were all excellently executed. I love beef tartare in general, but I can get it in many places in Chicago, so Bar Marta stands out for being unique and offering lamb tartare instead. The mussels and clams were out of this world good because it has bone marrow in it. So the broth was extra cloudy, flavorful, and yet not rich. Admittedly and embarrassingly, I was drinking the broth straight out of my spoon from the cast iron casserole dish. For the latter part of the meal, we had the Cacio E Pepe, meatballs, and broccoli leaves. Really, really good. I enjoyed the desserts (banana rum cake and Eton Mess) very much because it wasn't overly sweet.It's rare to have every single dish stand out when you order several items, maybe 1-2 items will stand out and the rest are OK. However, every single item we had last night were stellar. Great work, Bar Marta. Can't wait to be back.

23.description: We tried Bar Marta last night, and it was such a great experience. Each cocktail we tried was unique and delicious, and the food was outstanding! We got there late, so they were out of a couple things by the time we ordered dinner (10:30PM), but I don't feel like we missed out on anything. The meatballs were amazing! We can't wait to come back here.

5.description: Meh. Lesser version of hogsault group and I LOVE all of their restaurants (maudes, Babette's, gilt bar, au cheval). Seems like this place tried real hard to become one of those places but failed. The service is not great either. As soon as we walked in, the hostess was full of attitude and not at all accommodating. She set us in a corner right next to the outside door. As it was a chilly night, as the door opened a gush of cold air would swoosh in on us. Not pleasant and I was also recovering from a cold. I asked the hostess if we could sit elsewhere and she immediately said "NO and I will NOT have anything else available for a long time." Fine, we sat down squished in a corner, cold. 5 min later we see a few bar sits open, she tells us nothing. I get up and ask her if we could move. Begrudgingly, she moved us. As we finally sat down, it took forever for the waitress to get our order. Once taken, it took awhile for the food to come. And once it did, I was left wishing to be at one of the actual Hogsault restaurants. Similar food and concept, just not as great. We ordered:Lamb tartare - really salty but still the best of the night. Mussels and clams dish - literally 5 mussels and 5 clams all in an overpowering thyme broth served in a gigantic pot. Pretty bland and watered down even with the thyme. Pork Ragu - it was good but nothing special. Not something to come back to. Fries - boyfriend loved the fries. As for me, I couldn't figure out the weird metallic/iron aftertaste of the fries. I only ate a few, not for me. Chocolate tart - a chocolate tart you could get anywhere else. Good but nothing special either. The decor was also left wishing more. Cheap take on the Hogsault group restaurants. Bottom line, not worth the drive out to Humboldt park. perhaps this place is strictly for the neighborhood. Pass.

31.description: Old Fashioned's were on point. Once we ordered those, we were instructed to pick out everything we wanted so they could take care of delivering our portions appropriately (and not all at once, etc.)  So we picked everything out and they came in the following order:*The Iceberg & Grains salad was amazing. It wasn't just an overpriced head of lettuce.*Our server suggested for us to try the Chicken Liver Toast - and although it sounds odd, it was remarkable.*Cheese gnocchi was to die for. You can tell each piece was individually crafted to melt in your mouth.*We also had the mussels & clams. They were good, but everything else we tried was beyond good, that these felt simply on par.*Our server convinced us to go with the banana rum cake for dessert - the best way she described it was simply with a noise that meant delicious.  She was right.Overall, the food was amazing and the people there were wonderful.  The place is small, so make your reservations while you can! I'm a bit skeptical about the overall vibe of the place.  Curtains were drawn and I wasn't quite sure what kind of atmosphere to expect when I walked in the doors. My initial reaction was "weird."  Take away the great food, the setting would have felt right if there were clouds of smoke in the air.  Honestly, after the first old fashioned and nibble of food, it didn't matter.

25.description: My husband and I went here with some friends and loved everything about this place! They have Old Fashions on tap that I felt like had potential be gross. It wasn't at all! It was really great and just as good as one made to order. One of the best things about going with a bunch of people is being able to try a lot of things! We ordered the Mussels and Clams, Chicken Liver Toast, Cacio e Pepe, Steamed Greens, and a few others. Everything was simply amazing. Well seasoned and balanced flavors. Our server was great too. I will admit that the host wasn't impressed with us wanting to sit further away from the door when it was cold out, but the restaurant was empty when we arrived so we didn't really pay much attention. I gotta say, it definitely filled up! By the time we left, every seat was full. It's clear this hidden gem, is not going to be hidden for long.

12.description: Made my second visit to Bar Marta last night for a dinner with eight people.  (First of all--that's too big a group for this space.  Stick to six or less and you'll be fine.)  The space is dark, and the service is spotty, but the quality of the food and the drink make up for that so far.Over my two visits, I've tried all of the following drinks--the Absinthe Minded, the French 75, the Hemingway, the Lion's Tail and the Old-Fashioned.  All of them were great and meet the standards of classic cocktails served elsewhere in Chicago.  We've had all of the following food dishes as well:Apps/Sides:  Chicken Liver Toast, Lamb Tartare, Bread and Butter, Beets, Frites, Mashed Potatoes, Iceberg & GrainsMains/Pasta:  Cacio E Pepe, Cheese Gnocchi, Meatballs, Pork Chops, Steak FritesDesserts:  Banana Rum Pie, Chocolate TartThe pasta dishes are very small, but otherwise all of the food has been excellent, truly excellent.  But what makes all of this come home are the prices; cocktails are $10 each, there is a wide range of wines by the glass/bottle that are reasonable, and the most expensive main we've had is $22.  Some of the apps are the size of entrees.  All of that has been great, from the perspective of value proposition.But I would actually pay a dollar more per plate for Bar Marta to hire an additional server or an additional bartender...or both.  It took 20 minutes to receive my Lion's Tail...TWENTY MINUTES...when the space was only about two-thirds full.  I'm a patient guy, but I was surprised that I noticed this.  You'd be amazed how happy you can make people if you just fill them chock-full of drinks, but that's hard to do with the speed of the bar here.  I can't imagine how long it would have taken to make some of these drinks on a Friday night (I came at 7:30 on a Wednesday).  After the Lion's Tail, we got wise as a table and began ordering drinks as we were halfway through our current drinks, but I shouldn't have to think that way.  Our server  was very friendly on both of our visits (we had the same woman), but it was tough to manage getting her attention...at times, I literally raised my hand to wave her over to our table.One of our other party members had been to Bar Marta previously (this was her third visit), and we both agreed that if Bar Marta could iron out the service/speed issues, this place is basically a home run.  (If you're getting a sitter to come over here, like all eight of us needed to do, build in enough buffer time to accommodate for the speed here.)  Also, it's too dark in here, but that's because my 41-year-old eyes struggle from time to time now.  Hogsalt's Gilt Bar is a little darker though, so at least you won't have to use your cell phone's flashlight to read the menu.  But like other spots I love in Chicago, the soundtrack here has generally been great and eclectic and low-key enough to be in the background, not the fore.I'm still surprised how easy it is to get a table right now, but Chicago winters have a lot to do with it...I fully expect this to be a tough ticket by the time spring rolls around.  Go now!

37.description: Bar Marta is the perfect neighborhood restaurant. I loved the speakeasy decor, the house made pastas, friendly service and great wine list. We will be regulars here. Definitely recommend this place to others!

21.description: This may sound like a nit-picky review, however the space just isn't designed well.  It is located on the corner, however every single window is blocked off and the entrance is on the side.  You enter to a dark velvet curtain that is nearly impossible to navigate, and not in an interesting speakeasy or sneaky Violet Hour type way.  Then there is zero space to wait, the bar patrons are on top of the dinner patrons all while the servers are trying to also deliver their food.  The space is two floors, and we were seated in the basement... Parlor... this space is decent and I'm happy we were seated here rather than the first floor which is incredibly too bright, crowded, and loud.  The basement is dark and a bit more calm.  However again, the design is awful.  Their kitchen is in the very back of a long hallway in the basement, so servers are constantly zooming past you and they share the same staircase as patrons to deliver food to the first floor.  When we were leaving we were mixed in the stairs with another couple trying to leave, us, servers, and then we were met by the host ushering new guests to the basement to be seated, it just didn't flow and desperately needs a dumbwaiter.  Service was spotty and the food wasn't anything great.  Based on the other reviews, perhaps we just had a bad experience.  Either way, we don't plan to visit again.

16.description: Would have visited sooner if this place looked more obviously open. The windows are totally blacked out so the building still has the abandoned/under construction look it has had since the previous place closed.The food was very good, although the menu is small so we were able to try everything that we were interested in in just one visit.
