I don't think this often, but I think there could have been more vegetable stuff.The tables filled up fast and then service became very slow. We would have ordered a second round of drinks except we didn't see our server again until all our food was finished. This place is obviously benefiting from being a designated "hot new place", so will be interested to see what happens in a few months.

17.description: Great place great food great musicGREAT chocolate tart!!!! Yeeaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa­aaaaaaaaa

10.description: Killer drinks at reasonable prices.   The chicken liver toast is my go to and one of my favorite things on this planet.  Solid place for dinner or just cocktails and some small plates.  Did i say how much I love that chicken liver toast?  GIMME MORE!

11.description: Dark and vaguely off the beaten path. Great list of cocktails, especially several unusual "old fashioned" style drinks: gin old fashioned, mezcal old fashioned... Music and vibe were not in sync at all, which felt a little weird... Besides that, great.

26.description: Great place great food great musicGREAT chocolate tart!!!! Yeeaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa­aaaaaaaaa

27.description: Meh. Lesser version of hogsault group and I LOVE all of their restaurants (maudes, Babette's, gilt bar, au cheval). Seems like this place tried real hard to become one of those places but failed. The service is not great either. As soon as we walked in, the hostess was full of attitude and not at all accommodating. She set us in a corner right next to the outside door. As it was a chilly night, as the door opened a gush of cold air would swoosh in on us. Not pleasant and I was also recovering from a cold. I asked the hostess if we could sit elsewhere and she immediately said "NO and I will NOT have anything else available for a long time." Fine, we sat down squished in a corner, cold. 5 min later we see a few bar sits open, she tells us nothing. I get up and ask her if we could move. Begrudgingly, she moved us. As we finally sat down, it took forever for the waitress to get our order. Once taken, it took awhile for the food to come. And once it did, I was left wishing to be at one of the actual Hogsault restaurants. Similar food and concept, just not as great. We ordered:Lamb tartare - really salty but still the best of the night. Mussels and clams dish - literally 5 mussels and 5 clams all in an overpowering thyme broth served in a gigantic pot. Pretty bland and watered down even with the thyme. Pork Ragu - it was good but nothing special. Not something to come back to. Fries - boyfriend loved the fries. As for me, I couldn't figure out the weird metallic/iron aftertaste of the fries. I only ate a few, not for me. Chocolate tart - a chocolate tart you could get anywhere else. Good but nothing special either. The decor was also left wishing more. Cheap take on the Hogsault group restaurants. Bottom line, not worth the drive out to Humboldt park. perhaps this place is strictly for the neighborhood. Pass.

35.description: Get in while you can because soon there will be lines out the door at this hidden gem!  For only being open a couple of weeks they are running on all cylinders.  The nondescript location is easy to pass by but you will regret it. It is small and intimate with a large bar, which I think is the best place to sit and eat.  The place reminds me of a combination of two of my favorite places, Maudes and The Bristol.  The drinks are on point with the beautiful mixologists who make preparing all those complex drinks effortless. The food was fantastic! To start I would recommend the liver toast and cesar salad.  My favorite pasta was hands down the Cacio E Pepe - delicious but should be served with a piece of bread to enjoy the left over sauce- wow!  The other stand out was the Roast Chicken with delicious crispy skin but kept its moisture within.  This chicken dish is as good as it get and competes with Bristol and Barbuto's in New York!  The perfect pairing with the chicken were the french fries that came with a SPICY dipping sauce that disappeared fast!We ended the evening on a high note with the warm rum banana bread and ice cream....perfect ending.

8.description: Thank you to the Bar Marta team, Jeff, Ben, Austin and Emily-our wonderful server, for showing us so much love. We were super pumped before our visit and it did not disappoint. Old fashioned on tap. Whaaa. Seriously. And made with Old Overholt, which is my fav rye whiskey but not a lot of places in Chicago carry that. This like a dream come true for me :)Those gooseneck barnacles on special...ohmygoodness. Still thinking about this as I write this review. Hamachi crudo, lamb tartare and the chicken liver toast were all excellently executed. I love beef tartare in general, but I can get it in many places in Chicago, so Bar Marta stands out for being unique and offering lamb tartare instead. The mussels and clams were out of this world good because it has bone marrow in it. So the broth was extra cloudy, flavorful, and yet not rich. Admittedly and embarrassingly, I was drinking the broth straight out of my spoon from the cast iron casserole dish. For the latter part of the meal, we had the Cacio E Pepe, meatballs, and broccoli leaves. Really, really good. I enjoyed the desserts (banana rum cake and Eton Mess) very much because it wasn't overly sweet.It's rare to have every single dish stand out when you order several items, maybe 1-2 items will stand out and the rest are OK. However, every single item we had last night were stellar. Great work, Bar Marta. Can't wait to be back.

0.description: Really great Sodikoff spot to start off and surprise a date.First off it's in Humboldt park so when you drive there, she thinks you're taking her out for super casual Puerto Rican mofongo or something. Then you get there and the windows are all blacked out so the place even looks closed until you walk into the curtained foyer to find this intimate lounge like supper club that reeks of hipster luxe. Great, well thought out plates that ooze with richness. Roasted oysters and chicken liver toast were a standout. Very attentive service as well.End the night at Sodikoff's California clipper for some live music.

38.description: Food was tasty. Cacio e Pepe very nice. Everything seasoned nicely. Food runner Dave was attentive and informative.

20.description: Visited this restaurant with a few friends on a Friday for dinner.  Despite it being on the corner of a somewhat desolate street (you technically can't miss it), it is kind of "hidden."  The venue itself is pretty small and walking to and away from your seat/table was cramped.  Overall, I think the food was good, but my lower rating mostly attributes to the fact that not one, but multiple dishes were overly salty and the dessert was a disappointment.  While I was tempted to try the roasted chicken, which appeared to have the most mentions on other people's reviews, I ordered the skirt steak which had a side of their handcut fries with aioli which was pretty good albeit salty.  I tried my other friends' dishes which included the pork chop and the cacio e pepe.  The pasta was pretty good despite it not looking particularly unique, but it was one of the other dishes that was high on sodium.  The pork chop was tasty...ample meat to share as it was pretty big and it was cooked well.  We ended the meal with their banana rum cake which was mediocre.  The cake itself wasn't particularly special.  The candied ginger, I felt, didn't particularly pair well with the cake and (I think?) there were banana pieces on the plate as well, but couldn't tell.  It absolutely didn't complement the dish.  The texture of it felt like I was eating pieces of dried ice cream?  I think I spent more time dissecting what was on that plate than what I should have been doing - savoring a sweet delight!

19.description: Cocktails and service are spot on. Our server was knowledgable about the wine list, menu and how the food is prepared and served. The crudite appetizer and the special of the night - grilled oysters - were delicious. The main dishes have potential, but all our entrees (four, total) were seriously over-salted. Hopefully in time a lighter hand on the finishing salt will resolve this issue. I do hope to dine again, but at the very least I would go back and enjoy cocktails at the bar.

33.description: Warm, dimly lit, intimate space.  Great for laidback after work drinks and light dinner or date spot with your boo.   Met a friend after work and spent the evening at the bar.  Bartender whose name i didnt catch was not only very friendly but very helpful with the menu items.  Although we only had a smattering of small plates everything from the pickles and olives, winter green salad,hamachi crudo chicken liver toast and banana rum cake was on point.  Wish this was closer to where i lived otherwise i would be a more frequent guest for sure!

2.description: My fellow foodie couple suggested Bar Marta for a double date and I immediately got excited. Dark, intimate, inviting. We arrived early for our 6pm reservation and was seated promptly by our very kind waitress. I will say, the wait staff here is top notch! Drinks were in order, so we decided on some old fashioneds. We went with the classic....but they have a couple other funky twists on the old fashioned made with gin or tequila for example. Very innovative! The classic was super bomb...I mean, my hubs went on to have 3 of them;)The menu is larger than I had imagined...and everything was enticing. We decided on a few small plates to share and then ordered our own entrees...which we also tried. Our waitress even brought extra plates to encourage the entree sharing. For starters we went with the baked oysters, and chicken liver. YOWSAS! My only regret is not ordering more oysters. The chicken liver was good, it was very rich and came with in a hearty helping. For mains, we ordered a couple of the pastas, the pork chop, and I went with the steak frites. All of it was so yummy! I would say all of the plates are on the small side, even the entrees, so order accordingly. We went on to order the banana rum cake for dessert. It was out of this world. I would have to say one of my fav dishes:)After dinner drinks, of course, why not. I was so in the mood for a chocolate martini but much to my dismay they did not offer one. I asked the waitress and she said she would see what they could come up with. BAM! Chocolate martini! She said they had a little bottle of chocolate liquor left over for a tasting and the bartender whipped me one right up. I'm not sure where this little magic bottle came from but I'll take it. Now THAT is service. This simple gesture totally upped my experience and made it that much better. Again, their service is on point.For a trendy evening with good food and good drinks, Bar Marta is a sure fit. Need more bonus points: free street parking! Holy hell that's right!

34.description: Outstanding evening - not often a brand new restaurant has it together so quickly. Friendly knowledgable, helpful staff, truly delicious food, great cocktails and wine list, good scene with music that adds, not overtakes. Unpretentious. Quality matches portion size and prices. Dishes that stood out: chicken liver toast (WOW - this alone is worth a trip), any of the homemade pastas, soup, smoked eggplant, chocolate tart. Great addition to hood.

32.description: Amazing addition to the neighborhood. Great wine and beer selection. Food was really good too! We had some of the night specials - the grilled oysters were to die for. I am 100% sure it will become a neighborhood destination and people from other areas will come here very often as well.

18.description: My first time here was on a Saturday. Make reservations before you come, we sat at the bar easily but it was Thanksgiving weekend. The food was delicious. We sampled around the menu, and everything was great. The meatballs and pasta stand out in my mind as being exceptional!

13.description: Get in while you can because soon there will be lines out the door at this hidden gem!  For only being open a couple of weeks they are running on all cylinders.  The nondescript location is easy to pass by but you will regret it. It is small and intimate with a large bar, which I think is the best place to sit and eat.  The place reminds me of a combination of two of my favorite places, Maudes and The Bristol.  The drinks are on point with the beautiful mixologists who make preparing all those complex drinks effortless. The food was fantastic! To start I would recommend the liver toast and cesar salad.  My favorite pasta was hands down the Cacio E Pepe - delicious but should be served with a piece of bread to enjoy the left over sauce- wow!  The other stand out was the Roast Chicken with delicious crispy skin but kept its moisture within.  This chicken dish is as good as it get and competes with Bristol and Barbuto's in New York!  The perfect pairing with the chicken were the french fries that came with a SPICY dipping sauce that disappeared fast!We ended the evening on a high note with the warm rum banana bread and ice cream....perfect ending.

4.description: Meh.  Meh.  Meh.  I love this restaurant group, so I was particularly bummed at this restaurant.  Everything from the food to the decor was plain lazy.  Why black out the windows if you are not going to do something fabulous on the inside?  Where are the usual fabulous light fixtures and wall art??  Where is the textile variety?  Do better!Our food was meh too.  I LOVED the chicken liver toast and our oyster shooter.  But, the beet salad needed more texture and flavor (cheese?  something?) and our steak frites were plain awful.  It was steak.  and fries.  No butter sauce.  No fabulous aoili - just mayo.  It was under seasoned too.  I didn't even finish.  I always finish my steak frites.  Better to go down the street to the Haywood where their steak frites ROCK with a creamy bleu cheese butter sauce.  Everyone raved about the banana rum cake.  Meh again.  It was a banana muffin with some carmel.  We didn't finish that either.The drinks were good but their glassware and ice presentation was again, boring and lazy.  I love to be presented with a good looking drink like at Longman & Eagle or Maude's.  Not here.  Just boring and over stuffed with freezer burned ice.  Boo.

24.description: Would have visited sooner if this place looked more obviously open. The windows are totally blacked out so the building still has the abandoned/under construction look it has had since the previous place closed.The food was very good, although the menu is small so we were able to try everything that we were interested in in just one visit. I don't think this often, but I think there could have been more vegetable stuff.The tables filled up fast and then service became very slow. We would have ordered a second round of drinks except we didn't see our server again until all our food was finished. This place is obviously benefiting from being a designated "hot new place", so will be interested to see what happens in a few months.

6.description: The outside is so dark, they have black out curtains on the windows so you can't see inside, we almost passed this place up! The entrance is around the corner on Washtenaw rather than Chicago. It almost looks as if it's a vacant store front from the outside! Once you get inside they have a really big beautiful bar, I had the French 75 with my meal, it was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. To start, the salmon crudo was the stand out delicious dish. Definitely my personal favorite among the beets and the eggplant appetizers we also ordered. All were well seasoned and presented beautifully.For an entree I went with the mussels and clams. The clams were nice and plum, for size the mussels comparably fell short. They were seasoned well in a pork broth with the bone marrow, and came with a decent amount of bread for dipping. I do feel like the portions were small. Our server was attentive and frequently cleared the shells which was great considering the table size is on the small side. The meal was delicious all around. Bar Marta as a whole is a little tight for space,  luckily it wasn't too crowded when I went. I imagine dining here can get crazy especially since the waiting area is limited. Our server did mention there's a downstairs so that could accommodate the space issue. Overall I'm glad a new place for cocktails and a great meal opened in Ukrainian Village! They serve food until 11:30 on the weekend which is a definite plus!

22.description: We squeezed a reservation out of this place. Never heard of it and my wife got us a spot for NYE. What a great find once we figured out where it was. Menu is small but everything was spot on. Smoked eggplant spread was awesome. One of us had the roasted chicken and the other had the gnocchi. Both very well prepared. We will be back because of the quality and awesome service.

15.description: Tried Bar Marta last night.  What a surprise.  Somewhat fancy place in a not so fancy neighborhood. Everything we ate was fantastic - oysters, chicken liver mousse, gnocchi and steak. Extremely warm ambiance and friendly staff.  Will definitely go back.

7.description: The food we ordered was fine. Service was fine, and on top of orders. The steak frites was extremely salty. Steak was small, but was tasty. Fries were coated in salt. We're cooked really well too. Gnocchi wasn't my wife's favorite. Too savory. I thought is was good. Very little parking in the area and what is close is all permit only. Won't rush back probably, but it's worth coming once and checking it out.

36.description: So excited to have this place in the neighborhood. Beautiful bar with solid cocktails, homemade pastas that are all incredible and great sized salads. I can't wait to try more.

30.description: Amazing food and friendly service. I stopped in around 6 on Saturday evening hoping to sit at the bar. There was plenty of space when I arrived but within an hour it was packed. I had the ceasar salad which was so good it put to shame any other ceasar salad I've ever had. Then, the banana rum cake...out of control. The atmosphere was nice, great speaker quality for the music. Lovely place. Best one that's been there in the last 7 years. I imagine it will have staying power.

3.description: Came here on a Wed evening with my 9 y.o son, the relatively small, intimate space was nearly full but we were seated promptly at a two top.  He (and I, tbh) was actually *really* excited about the experience, taking in the atmo, reviewing the menu, he asking copious questions, etc but mostly bc of the Mocktail the bartender created for him, 5/5 on all that.I'll just say the food was good if not a bit rich, save for the Crudités with buttermilk cottage cheese dip, which was fantastic and declared "the #1 dish" from the boy.  The noodles in the Cacio E Pepe were equally great, perfectly cooked and the blend of pecorino and black pepper had a strong resemblance to a VERY rich mac and cheese; not necessarily an indictment on the dish but worth noting.  The Mashed Potatoes with whole roasted garlic and rosemary were pretty good as well but also incredibly rich.Beyond those above critiques my issue with this experience is two-fold.  One is when I asked for a bit of bread to take care of the remainder of the Crudités dip, i was taken aback at the $3 charge on the bill....especially when it was *not even listed on the menu* and it was scant 4 half pieces of bread with a ramican of salted butter...it may as well been $33 as the resulting feeling it elicited was the same and If there is ever a more poignant way to make a guest feel 'nickle and dimed' I know of few to none.....the fact our server never mentioned it makes it even more infuriating.  3 or 33 who cares, it's the principle.The other is the pretension of a few of the servers.  I get it, you're a new, hip and somewhat innovative Sodikoff venture, esp in a neighborhood that would have seen this place about 10 years ago had it not been for the decline in the market, therefore it's somewhat expected.  But i've been to dozens of equally innovative, hip establishments with far more congenial and friendly service and it's just galling to me when I say "thank you" to each and every refill of water or removing of dishes there's nothing more than too cool for school crickets.  Get over yourself.I want to really like the place, make it a routine stop since it's so close to home and I can appreciate what they are doing in terms of food/ambiance but time will tell.

14.description: So happy to have this in the neighborhood!  We went there on a Friday evening. I am glad we called ahead for reservations, as they were busy.  But 8 PM wasn't too late for our impromptu dinner.  Wine and beer were enjoyed, and I'll look forward to their cocktail menu another time.  Server was great, and so was the food.  I had the steak frites, and hubs had a pasta dish.  The dessert menu was very tempting, but we were full and not wanting to overstuff ourselves (it was that point in January when you're still detoxing a bit from the holidays!) Looking forward to when we can go back!

3.description: Super cute store with great vintage clothes.  And the owners are some of the best!!Check it out, for sure!!

1.description: Here' the problem.  Nice owner, nice selection.  BUT the hours listed here, on their Facebook page, and posted at the stores are either inaccurate or ignored by the owner.  The last three times I've tried to shop there, first at the California Avenue store and then twice at the 53rd Street store, they were closed, despite my going during stated hours.  It's terribly frustrating and NOT good for business.

2.description: I got a bridesmaid dress altered at the Hyde Park location - and Matilda could not have done a better job! It was a very involved project (hemming, altering waistline and sleeves) but the dress now fits me perfectly. It was also done in a very short amount of time!

5.description: This place is awesome! The quality of their clothes is great!  I bought some amazing cashmere and silk tops for super cheap! No cheap dirty teenage mutant ninja turtles t-shirts here, this is for the classy vintage shopper.

0.description: This isn't your run of the mill re-sale shop. The items they display are well-thought out, great quality and perfect for whatever season we're in.  These items are hand-picked by the owner Kelly and displayed so well that you really feel like you're in a cute boutique. As mentioned, the clothing items are perfect for whatever season we're in, that being said, Kelly updates her inventory often so whenever I'm in there, it's like a whole new line up.  She has also started to carry a few little vintage toddler items. The shoes I bought here have a timeless quality to them, meaning they would match any kind of outfit I wear, not just a "vintage-y" outfit. There are some vintage accessories like belts and scarves too.  Cute place;  wonderful and friendly owner. Great spot on California Ave.

4.description: Meadowlark is a perfect addition to California Ave in Humboldt Park! Beautiful selection of hand picked vintage goods. Great prices, great owners, great store.

58.description: I love the fact that they take hygiene seriously!  The mani/pedis are waterless to cut down on the spread of germs, and I must admit, I did miss the water a little.  However, the peace of mind was worth it.  I was also impressed that the polishes are free of toluene, formaldehyde, DBP and Camphor. And for you Vegans, ZOYA is a Vegan friendly polish!  The also prepped my nail with a ridge filler which really made my nails look smooth and nice.The only downside for me is that is is pricier than a standard nail salon so I will not be able to go as often.One last thing, and sorry if this comes off racist, but I loved the fact that I could understand everyone!

56.description: Haven't been to Sugar fly yet but I am impressed with their phone service. I called in and Charese was fantastic and very helpful. Being that I am indecisive she asked if she could call me right back so that she could tend to a customer. I agreed of course. an hour passed and I thought she forgot about me and minutes later i received a vm from her missed call. She apologized for it taking longer than expected and informed me of how much longer she would be there. Customer service starts with the phone calls... I am excited about going in this weekend and posting about my experience at the salon!

29.description: This is a solid neighborhood salon and boutique that offers a variety of beauty services. It's got a fun, funky vibe and an awesome staff. While this isn't the first place I'd run to if I were in need of an intense pedicure, it's definitely a got-to for simple foot/hand maintenance. Plus, the nail artists (and that's truly what they are) are phenomenal and very creative. FYI: For those who complained about their polish chipping shortly after getting them paint, Sugar Fly offers a guarantee depending on your polish (three-day for regular polish, a week for no-chip) so you can come back and get your nails repainted if your polish comes off.

42.description: My entire experience here was uncomfortable.  From the uncomfortable chairs to the moving pedicure footstool that wouldn't allow you to relax your feet or it would slide off a ledge and fall onto the girl giving the pedicure.  There was also the fact that I was the only customer and the employees acted like I wasn't there, a loud band practicing upstairs, a lack of nail dryer or comfortable place to wait for my nails to dry. It was also a waterless pedicure, under the guise of saving water, but it seemed more like a shop owner's cheap plan to save money.  Don't waste your time here.  Go to Pinky Nail on Damen, or almost anywhere else.  You get get much better for the same price in Chicago.

23.description: I purchased a groupon for a haircut and  I was happy with my overall experience. When i arrived the first thing i noticed was the merchandise at front of the store. i love all the wild styles; big earrings and animal print shoes, lots of wacky styles of sunglasses 2 for $10.  The receptionist was courteous and the store looks extremely clean, fun, and bright. i was glad to see that there was a waiting area with a tv and magazines and big pillows so my other half could have somewhere comfortable to lounge while i got my haircut.My stylist was cheryl and she did an excellent job. she gave me exactly what i asked for and was courteous and professional. she is very knowledgeable about hair care and was happy to answer all of my questions. She was not intrusive or abrupt, my shampoo felt like a head massage, and i had such a relaxing haircut that i actually almost fell asleep when she was blowdrying my hair haha.I would definitely recommend this stylist and this salon for a haircut. I have posted a "before" and "after"  in the yelp photo section if you would like to take a look at the results.

47.description: As of today I will no longer be returning to Sugar Fly. I had been going to Sugar Fly to have Kimberly do my nails for some time now. While it isn't the most comfortable place to sit it - it was okay for a mani, and Kimberly does a good job. She is meticulous. (Pedis are too uncomfortable, see other reviews)I will not be returning because I just revieved a call less than 3 hours before my scheduled time to push back my appointment, by at least 30 minutes on a Friday night. Having made plans to meet with someone at 7:45pm for professional reasons, I am unable to push the appointment back -- I find it unprofessional not to allow your clients the same amount of respect as your cancellation policy, and if out of one's control, at least compensate your returning customer in some way. However, it sounded like it was within Sugar Fly's control, making the situation even more unprofessional:I was told my appointment was being pushed back because of another customer running late -- however, I was expected to move my appointment?Nothing was offered as a result of "another customer running late." I even offered to come in earlier.

8.description: I got a groupon for this and was very disappointed.  I got a pedicure on a regular chair and she brought out an old fashion metal bucket to do my toes. The girl doing my toes might have been a druggy . She definitely seemed a little wacky in a creepy way. It was very uncomfortable.  I kept looking around to see if I was on candid camera or something. No massage chairs and you completely miss out on the best part of a pedicure which is to relax at the foot spa. I also didnt like the setup where you get manicures at. Feels like I'm sitting at a bar waiting for a drink. The girl who did my mani looked like she was fresh out of highschool. She did a horrible job I could of asked a 6 year old to paint my nails. But hey you get what you paid for. I wont be a returning client.

31.description: WORST PLACE TO GET GEL NAILS! Although the workers were super nice and friendly; the nail work was horrible and over priced. My nails turned out to be thick and uneven. It wasn't worth spending $50.

34.description: I only give 2 stars because the staff was very friendly and accommodating otherwise I would of gave 0. I went there and got the $45 mani/pedi and the same day my polish came off. I agree with the other reviews the pedicure station was extremely uncomfortable. I had to go to another nail shop[ exactly a week later because my polish had come off of my feet and hands. I didn't use any groupon deals so I feel like it was a complete waste of my money.

16.description: Please correct me if I'm wrong, but it doesn't look like there is a public health inspection board for nail salons in Chicago.  If there was, I would dutifully report them.  The manicurist (face tattoos) caused my cuticles to bleed, a mere moment after telling her she didn't need to worry about getting every last bit. She assured me that in order to stop the polish chipping, she had to clear my cuticle bed...  Now my manicure looks great except for the giant scab.  She touched the open wound with the tops of at least two bottles, never apologized, and instructed me to go wash my hands in a bathroom with an empty soap dispenser.Much less important than the obvious health risks of going here was the atmosphere.  I do not understand why anyone would want their salon to feel less than totally welcoming and enjoyable.  I walked in and a woman walked away from the counter before I could get there.  Lot's of long pauses and walking away in what seemed like the middle of an interaction...  How does that help them to act like that?  Wouldn't they want to be nice to get better tips?  The whole place was silent, no one spoke to their customers or each other.  My manicurist checked her buzzing phone frequently during my manicure.  Overall, it was a terrible experience.  I'll go back to my regular salon, where no one is nice either, but at least they don't decorate my hands with my own blood.

13.description: I checked out Sugar Fly after seeing a Groupon deal -- a no-chip manicure AND a spa pedicure for $34 (who could pass that up!?). Scheduling Appointment: I called on a Thursday afternoon for a Friday appointment. I had a small window of time I could come in and they graciously accommodated me. On the day of the appointment, I received a reminder phone call about my 5:30pm appointment and they asked if I could come at 5:15pm instead. I said I would try my best and rushed around to make it in time (since they were so accommodating in the first place). Then I received another phone call at 5:00pm asking if I could come in at 5:45pm! I told them that I was already asked to come in earlier and was rushing to make it by 5:15pm. The woman calling said there was no note that I was coming in 15 minutes early, apologized, and asked if I could do 5:45pm instead. So I killed some time and showed up around 5:40pm. I was not taken until 6pm. Not a great start, but it gets better...Technician: She was very professional, friendly, talkative (but not too talkative), happily adjusted anything I asked (although I didn't ask for much), and was very thorough. My only complaint would be that it took SO long to complete my no-chip mani and spa pedi. I started the process at 6pm and did not walk out until 8:15pm!!Spa Pedicure: Overall the spa pedicure was pretty average. Nothing bad, nothing amazing. They use bowls to soak your feet, which didn't bother me. I first had boiling hot water, but my technician happily adjusted it. The bench I sat on was pretty uncomfortable because I'm very short so I had to scoot far forward in order for my feet could reach the bowl. They had a lot of colors to choose from and my pedicure is still going strong 3 weeks later (which is pretty typical for me). I chose a very light color so the technician applied a third coat to my big toes, which I was very grateful for. Unfortunately, one of my big toes did smudge a bit when I put my gym shoes on even though they were drying for a good hour. I probably could have gone back to have it fixed, but I didn't have time.No-Chip Manicure: They had a wide selection of colors to choose from that were on fake nails, which makes picking colors easier than looking at bottles. My no-chip manicure has lasted more than 3 weeks now (25 days) without chipping at all. My nails have obviously outgrown and there are a couple spots where it has just barely begun to peel off my nail now. Overall, very impressive no-chip mani!SUMMARY: PROSLarge selection of colorsExtremely long lasting no-chip manicure -- 25 days!Standard pedicureCONSDisorganized schedulingSlow services -- Over 2 hoursUncomfortable pedicure seating

11.description: I realized the day before a dance show that I'd forgotten to get my eyebrows threaded the day before. I have really thick brows and sensitive skin that is usually irritated by waxing. Unfortunately, the days right before a show are always filled with things to do so I decided to take a change with Sugar Fly because it was convenient.I'd never tried sugaring before and I was not disappointed. It didn't irritate my skin at all. I had less redness than I've ever had with threading or waxing. Completely converted!

39.description: I've been getting my haircuts there for a few months now and I wouldn't go anywhere else. Kimberly does my hair and she does a great job and its only $25 for what could be $30 or $40 easily. It's easy to schedule appointments and the staff is all very friendly. Two thumbs up and five stars!!

37.description: First off, if you are used to a traditional nail salon this place will throw you off . The decor and set up is unconventional to say the least.  I wasn't crazy about it but it didn't bother me either. Just like the other Yelp reviewers, I purchased a living social deal for a 30 dollar no chip mani/pedi. Also if you are used to traditional pedicures.. then this is not the place for you, I think apart of the pedicure experience is allowing the foot spa to help you relax... You will not get that here.. I am no expert in sanitation when it comes to salons so I can not say this is good or bad.... I will say that the hot towels they use may compensate for the pedicure being waterless, however, if you get a pedicure here, do not expect a noticeable difference in callus removal.  My feet/heels did not appear to have any callus removed from them after the nail tech finished my pedicure.. It seems to me that this should be labeled more of an express service because, if you you like a full -out pedicure, this is not the thing for you.  I can not say I wouldn't try it again though. My nails are ok... I got the service done a few days from my visit to this salon.. I will say that the technician did not fully remove my previous no chip polish which was a little annoying and caused bumps and lack of smoothness when she applied the new polish.  The process to soak off my previous no chip was a little awkward as well because the slips kept falling off of my nails which made the process take longer and cause possibly cause the bumps when my new polish was applied.. If you are in the area, and want to spend a little less, I would say go for it.. I would not get a mani/pedi here for a special event though...

0.description: This place had it all- excellent customer service, super clean, and great nails. I got a spa pedi/gel mani groupon for this place and would definitely go back. The whole team made great suggestions about what colors I might like but they were not pushy or overly chatty. They also did not rush me and my friend at all even though we were about 10 mins late for our appt. They have nice silver basins they do pedis in not tubs... Which was different but actually is more sanitary and felt a little more fancier. You sit at a cute bar to do your manis. Also they offered us complimentary wine and refills, were playing fun music and showing clueless on the tv. Not a "spa" feel really if that's what you prefer  but also not loud or crazy. It Was fun and still very relaxing. I will definitely go back as my nails came out great thanks to Vanessa and everyone else was super friendly but not fake or pushy. They also offer hair and hair removal services which looked great.

38.description: Great first experience at this place. The girls at the counter were too cool for school, but living in that neighborhood it's to be expected. The thing is I didn't come to make friends, I came to get my nails done. And it was the BEST no chip mani I've had in awhile. My nails look perfect and it's been almost two weeks. I will be back to see Shakira: my new nail goddess.

51.description: Because this place is eco-friendly, I wanted to like it but I definitely know I will NEVER come here again. I'm looking at my nails just an hour after my mani and the weird way their "special" polish dries makes it look like your nails have been outgrowing the polish for a month. Also, this whole waterless thing means you're not going to get a quality pedicure - they don't scrub your feet and because they don't have nail dryers, their claim that the polish will dry within 15 minutes is false. I'm looking at a whole bunch of botched nails. And, I think everyone who works there is a teenager, not that there's anything wrong with teens but, it's just an annoying experience rather than restful.

27.description: I came in here because I had Living Social bucks. Ordinarily, I'd find $30 mani/pedis expensive but since I had to use Living Social this was the cheapest/closest option. I came in with my own nail polish. The people working here are friendly. The only things I can complain about is the following:1. I'd like my nails completely short and when I expressed that to the manicurist, I still had to ask her to cut a couple of nails short.2. While getting my pedicure I had my purse in the seat next to me. Mind you there was 5 other stations to have a pedicure in but the next manicurist asked me to move my bag so she can have her customer sit there. Why could she not use the other seats which is what my manicurist implied when she showed her displeasure.3. The manicurist was wearing an extremely low tank so when she asked me to put my feet up for the pedicure (shoes included) she wanted me to put on her lap which I thought was weird. Then she kept leaning forward as her breast hit my feet. I was mortified but she seemed to not think anything of it. She also used the same towel that she asked me to place my feet on to cut my nails to put my feet on then she asked me to put my feet back in the water as she threw the nails back in the water that I had my clean feet in. Eww. This alone wanted me not to tip her. (I tipped 10% only)4. Lastly as far as my manicure, she did a good job but afterwards removed the towel she was using to file my nails in and as I moved my hand, I got my filings on my wrist. Cleanliness of doing a mani/pedi should be learned. Lastly, my manicurist was a bit slow as a girl who came in after me finished her pedicure before me.All in all, I wouldn't go back here again as it's a showy salon with a less than average mani pedi.

32.description: I purchased a Groupon for two no-chip manicures.  Pang (the manicurist) was so pleasant and my manicure was so perfect that I requested her for my second visit.  On my second visit, she gave me an ombre look with a glitter top coat that I just loved!!  I was very, very pleased with the service here.  I only wish that the Groupon offer was not limited to new clients only.  With all the Groupon no-chip offers and coupled with the distance I have to drive to get to Sugar Fly Studio & Boutique, it makes me not want to go back to get a full price (but awesome) no-chip.

54.description: I wanted to like this place but it just wasn't meant to be.- The bench chairs are extremely uncomfortable. I'm not tall (5'6") but I felt like a giant trying to keep my legs propped on the little stool.- The nail tech butchered my cuticles. I've never experienced such painful cuticle cleanup.- I've had water-free pedicures before, but they still managed to do something about my dry calloused heels. They will do nothing about there here except a bit of ointment. Dry, dead skin does not absorb lotion or ointment. Good try though. - The polish on my toes smudged within a night (meaning it was applied too thickly).I had a groupon for two mani-pedis but I am just going to eat the second one. It was just too uncomfortable and painful of an experience!

48.description: I loved this place! Was looking for a new nail salon since I was concerned about the cleanliness of my previous spot.  No concerns with Sugar Fly.  It is SUPER clean and I thought the water free mani and pedi was great.  Kimberly did mine and she was great.  I used a Groupon but will go back at regular price since they are very reasonable.

44.description: I got a signature mani-pedi from Lifebooker for an amazing deal.  The place was sort of strange inside; its super huge, but they arent really using the space as a full salon or a full boutique.  But who cares! My polish has lasted 2 full weeks without a chip at all, and this is not the co chip, gals.  Regular old nail polish.  For that reason alone, I am extremely pleased and would go back, because that is really why I went there, right?

24.description: I love coming here to get my legs sugared. Sugaring is better than waxing, shaving, bleaching or whatever you use to get rid of unwanted hair.I don't mind the drive to see Kim because she is knowledgeable, professional and gentle!

7.description: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!The first time I went to Sugar Fly was for a mani pedi deal that I found on Groupon. Kimberly did them and she did a great job. The staff were super nice and the atmosphere is very clean and chic. Today I went back there for a hair cut and blow dry with Cherryl. Obsessed!!!!!!!! I'm just obsessed with the hair cut over all! My hair before the cut was almost to my waist. Yes, I know, long and boring. She met my expectations completely! I could not be any happier with the outcome of my hair. Definitely will come back to Cherryl in the future!

49.description: this place is okay.  you'd never think right off the bat that they're a salon, right?  no where on the facade or just passing by the window would you think they do nail there.  one nail.  it looks like just a boutique with sorta crappy clothing.  but actually, they do nail.  i think i bought their groupons - 2 mani/pedi and 2 no-chips.  they do a dry mani/pedi.  and after coming here 4 times, i dont think i'm a fan, unfortunately.  maybe it's because it doesn't feel complete.  or maybe i'm not comfortable with them pushing back my cuticles when they haven't had time to soften.  i'm sure it's all "safe" since there's less of a chance of bacteria spreading, but i dont know.1st time: mani/pedi.  you sit on an awkward bench that's not that comfy.  the poor girl has to bend super far over to get to my feet.  i just felt it was weird for the both of us.  i mean, like, one day they're not going to be able to sit up - like, an L shape fo' life.  so, the setup sucks.  and she did such a poor job on my pedi, it looked like there had already been out growth (?) on my toes.  i had to come back a 2nd time to get it fixed (the next day) which a different girl fixed, and she thought that i had it done weeks ago because of the gap between my cuticle and the polish.  it was pretty bad.  they fixed it, no problem, and the 2nd girl (i think her name's cheryl) was great.the 2 no chips: they have a great off-white color.  i get compliments all the time.  they did a good job both times as well.2nd time: mani/pedi - was really great.  the girl with the pink hair was super sweet.i'm giving 3 stars because the girls and staff are nice.  it's not your typical place to go, but i'd give it a try to see if you'd like it.

40.description: Great package deals and easy online appointments. I've never had an issue with staff running behind and everyone is very friendly. Street parking is easy, plentiful and cheap! They offer you tea, wine and a hot neck wrap upon arrival. This is my regular mani/pedi/waxing spot and I'll keep coming back.

53.description: My "no chip" manicure is already chipping, less than 5 days later. Too far away to keep coming out here.

30.description: The appointment was easy to make & the location was OK, but the overall experience was disappointing.  The set up for a mani / pedi looks cool but is not comfortable.  There is no where to put your feet up for a pedi except for on the knees of the technician. There is a lot of up selling, which I opted for the deep sea salt scrip.  This did little more then my pumice stone at home.  The Mani wasn't much better since the tech got nail polish on my cuticles for about half my fingers.  Good thing I used a Groupon for the service since I would not be willing to pay full price based on my experience.

46.description: I redeemed an Amazon Local mani/pedi deal here and was very disappointed.  I'm a regular no-chip & pedicure receiver, so I know this place ranks high on WORST mani/pedi spots in Chicago... sorry to be harsh, but it's true.-- Overall Impression:     - the polish brands were cheap (no Opi/         Essi brands),       - my manicurist was not friendly       - their techniques are different, but def         not better than your typical nail salon      - the receptionist offered me tea then           didn't bring it, and almost charged me           x2!-- Pedicure:        - the pedicure station was           uncomfortable as stated below       - the "waterless" technique seems like          a cheap polish change       - No scrub or feet softening beyond          putting lotion on your feet.  Don't          expect any calluses or rough spots to          be removed.  However the hot towels          was nice.-- No-chip:   - UV light machine barely worked      (seemed like a cheap, at-home, drug      store version) and had to re-do several      fingers    - the manicurist insisted on doing one      hand at a time to completion, instead of      saving time by painting one layer on a      hand while the other cures under the      UV.  It took FOREVER!!!** I feel bad for folks that paid full price, because it was definitely a looong, cheap service.  I def won't be back for nails, but the clothes looked decent.

1.description: I think the range of experiences people have had here is due to the varied skill levels of the nail techs. I went with my friend for a no-chip manicure and spa pedicure, and although we were sitting right next to one another our experiences could not have been more different. The pedicure was very quick, which was disappointing because when you pay for a spa-level pedi you can generally expect more than just a quick dip in a foot tub. I don't need rose petals and candles, but at least exfoliate a little. I ended up using a pumice stone as soon as I got home to clean up what the nail tech missed. The no-chip polish selection was a little disappointing, but I found one that I could live with. Which is good, because not only did I have to live with it on my nails, but also my fingerbeds. The manicure was rushed and the polish ended up chunky/uneven on some nails and not even fully covering others. There were lots of spots all over my fingerbeds that the tech did not tidy up. My friend's manicure looked very nice, but mine was a hot mess. I didn't realize how bad it was until I was paying, and by that time the tech had taken another customer. If you try your luck here, cross your unpolished fingers for a good tech. I probably won't take the chance again.

55.description: So I've had 2 appointments here and let's say my first appointment with Kim was a complete disaster. She was running behind because I guess she was new to the whole sugaring process, which is fine. I wasn't seen until an HOUR after my appointment was set to begin and the actual appointment took nearly an hour and a half which I also think is ridiculous not to mention she missed hairs near the bottom of my butt which drove me insane. They felt bad and decided to make my next Brazilian free and credit my account. Great they did something about it! I rescheduled to be seen 4 weeks later (which would have been Dec 11th), but wasn't able to make it in so I rescheduled and went in today. CHERYL was amazing. She worked at a pretty good speed and was VERY VERY VERY thorough. I'm highly satisfied with my 2nd experience and re-booked again. The only downside is my account was not credited for the free one but luckily Cheryl remembered me and was able to call the manager/owner Claudia to confirm, and I didn't have to pay a dime.I would definitely recommend Cheryl for sugar waxing.PS) sugar waxing hurts a trillion times more (in my opinion) than regular waxing but the results are so much better and the product used is all natural!

9.description: I purchased a groupon for a haircut and  I was happy with my overall experience. When i arrived the first thing i noticed was the merchandise at front of the store. i love all the wild styles; big earrings and animal print shoes, lots of wacky styles of sunglasses 2 for $10.  The receptionist was courteous and the store looks extremely clean, fun, and bright. i was glad to see that there was a waiting area with a tv and magazines and big pillows so my other half could have somewhere comfortable to lounge while i got my haircut.My stylist was cheryl and she did an excellent job. she gave me exactly what i asked for and was courteous and professional. she is very knowledgeable about hair care and was happy to answer all of my questions. She was not intrusive or abrupt, my shampoo felt like a head massage, and i had such a relaxing haircut that i actually almost fell asleep when she was blowdrying my hair haha.I would definitely recommend this stylist and this salon for a haircut. I have posted a "before" and "after"  in the yelp photo section if you would like to take a look at the results.

26.description: I heard about sugaring through GroupOn and did a little research and after many reviews on it being less painful than waxing, I decided to try it out. Definitely as painful, if not more than wax....BUTTTT it seems to take a lot less time. I went it there, did my paperwork, went over with Cheryl whats going to be done, was waxed (with more breaks than I think she wanted to take so I could collect my composure) and was out the door in 30 minutes. She assured me that if I don't wait so long between visits (It was several months between my wax and my sugar) it would be less painful, so I may have to try it again. Cheryl was definitely very patient with me.

25.description: Since my first time getting a waterless pedi/mani, they now have water pedi/manis.  This is a huge improvement!  They did a great job!

12.description: I recently got my hair cut here off a Groupon. My hair stylist was very friendly and did a great job with my hair. They put a little too many different products in your hair that I would never use at home, so I could do without. Overall though, it was a good experience.

59.description: Very cute place. this was the first time I had heard of the waterless manicure/ pedicure but it was great, very sanitary. The people are really welcoming and if you can get the Groupon its a great deal.

21.description: Kimberly is an expert at sugaring! I'll definitely be back to see her regularly!

17.description: Cute salon and friendly staff. Unfortunately, my Brazilian was not very well done. I could feel my skin pulling and it was a lot more painful than my previous sugaring and waxing experiences as a result. Reasonable prices but I won't be back.

10.description: Serves me right for not seeing the other negative reviews prior to booking. DO NOT EVER get your hair done here!!!! I was charged double the Groupon I thought I was paying for and left looking like my 3 year old had done my hair. Half, yes I mean half, of the top of my hair was colored in 4 hours and it is a very distinct orange color, the rest seemingly untouched (I was blond when I walked in). I asked to leave for almost an hour and during that time my hair was styled to look like Farah Fawcett after having asked to NOT have my hair styled since my appointment had dragged on so long I was getting late to pick up my child. As I was late I didn't really get to see my hair- I quite literally went running down the street due to time and didn't notice the disgusting job until I was home.I then called crying and asked for a refund and was told "we don't do that"- great customer service.  Now I'm stuck with a botched hair job (both cut and color are nowhere near what I had asked, and my hair is orange!!!!) and no money to fix it, these people should be arrested because this is just a crime. I gave one star only because I had to give something to post this.

5.description: Carly was super professional, knowledgable, and friendly. Booking an appointment was easy. I appreciated they called and let me know she would be running late so I didn't have to wait long before my appointment. The glass of wine and great prices were an added bonus.

3.description: Needless to say I will not be going back here. It's places like this that turn me off from Groupon. I got the deal for a No chip mani/spa pedi or whatever they called it because they basically just stuck my feet in a bucket. The girl who did my mani was SUPER rude. Treated me like I was a 5 year old who didn't know how to get a manicure. I'm not sure of her name but she was a larger Asian girl. Also, my friend tried to call and come in with me and they told her they were all booked up. I was the only person in there the whole time and the workers just stood around chatting about where they were going to go for dinner and drinks. They basically were just too lazy to accept more customers.Also, they offered me wine, which was nice but the bottle must've been open for god knows how long because I got sick almost as soon as I got home.Did I mention my "no chip" has been on for less than a week and four fingers are already chipped off?The ONLY saving grace of this place? The girl that did my pedicure. A SUPER nice African American girl who did a pretty good job considering they gave her a bowl of hot water and a few tools to work with. She's the only reason I gave 2 stars. Basic Point: DONT GO HERE FOR NAILS!!!

35.description: The appointment was easy to make, there were pretty available and the timing worked for me. I started my mani/pedi a few minutes after arriving. The "dry" process probably is more sanitary, but a minute in a warm towel and a little massage isn't the same as a nice warm footbath for 10 or 15 minutes, so there's ups and downs. I didn't get a no-chip, but nonetheless I didn't expect my fingernails to be chipping the same day, and there was some defect/lump in the polish on one of my big toes, so that was messed up the same day, too. But I went because I like to have my cuticles professionally cleaned now and then, and that happened, so I don't regret going, but I wasn't thrilled that the polish was less durable than when I do it myself. I'd recommend it with that knowledge, and I'd go back with the same understanding, but I'd be more likely to try someplace else and see if it works out a bit better for me.

19.description: Here's the things I noticed or experienced:Love the bright colors. They reflect this in nail polish choices too. Staff seem spacey....no sure if it's the personality or drug usage. Not the typical customer service. Staff seem friendly. It's a clean :-)They should invest in another nail dryer for no chips. Switching hands and 30 seconds isn't enough. But they re push the timer and ask you to readjust your hand! No the salon should invest in one that does it accurately. It takes this process longer.My no chip.... Chipped :-(

28.description: While I can only write about the no-chip manicures, I do like this place and think they are great!  My no chips last and last... Appointments can be booked online and it's easy to find a spot to park. Kimberly does an awesome job, is super nice and has never made me wait more than just a few minutes... they have lots and lots of no chip colors available too.  the place itself is clean, and all the staff is very friendly and courteous.  All this with a complimentary hot neck wrap and glass of wine! (or tea) and the hot towel wrap following the lotion/hand massage is the best. I always leave here admiring how nice my hands look and feel.

45.description: I tried this place because of a Groupon I purchased, buy one No-chip manicure and receive two. I then did the research and found out it was also a boutique. When I arrived I noticed a cool vibe in the store and was greeted by Alex. He was friendly and courteous and offered me water or tea. I took water, which he brought me with the color choices for my manicure.  Shakira was great and did a fantastic job meticulously making sure the manicure was  perfect. It was odd to have a dry manicure, but the results were good. The clothes in the store were cute and hip. I would definitely be back to shop and get another mani.

33.description: Bought a groupon for the signature mani/pedi and it is amazing. Pang was the woman who did my nails and she was amazing. My pedicure is flawless and they had a large color assortment to choose from. I got a manicure done with no chip and white tip and it is AMAZING. I have been getting so many compliments on my manicure. Also, the pedicure is more in depth than some places where your feet are massaged, they cut all the cuticles, file the toe nail and soak your feet in a bucket with some fruit. They also wrapped my feet and hands in warm towels. AWESOME!! Sugarfly is on North Ave. and there is a lot of street parking available. They also have a boutique which is really cute. I definitely recommend this place!!

43.description: I bought the groupon for the mani/pedi deal and had it done last week. I called them to schedule an appointment and since they arn't open on Mondays they returned my phone call promptly the next day, which was great and very professional. I even spoke to the girl about getting my eyebrows waxed too. She explained the process and how they use sugar instead of wax and went on to explain how sugar is much better than wax bc it doesn't irritate the skin the way wax does blablabla. She also said it was $15. I looked forward to this visit so much bc I had been working so much and was excited to be able to kick my feet up and get pampered...Well as soon as I walked in to the salon I was turned off by its appearance. The fluorescent lighting and overly white nature of the store is completely off putting. Its like they were attempting a modern feel but didn't have enough money so they just said fuck it -lets go with the no paint look. and dingy ceiling tiles.  Plus theres a really random selections of cheap stripper clothing in the front part of the salon. I don't really know who the hell would shop there.The girl working the counter was not friendly and handed me a bunch of paperwork to fill out, I felt like I was being admitted at the emergency room or something. The amount of papers to fill out felt unnecessary. My nail tech who was actually very sweet (Shakira) was friendly and did the best she could under the poor circumstance of where she works.I will never in my life go back to this salon or get a dry mani/pedi. Concerning the dry mani/edi they dry and explain that they are trying to save the environment from using excess water but lets just be honest and say that the owner of this salon is a cheap ass that can't even get comfortable seating for her employees let alone the customers! So  by saving some money on the water bill customers get their cuticles butchered. Any moron knows that the foot needs to be soaked to be able to get the dead skin off and cuticles removed effectively. I could have done a much better job myself and would have saved myself the money and time!Concerning the wax- the girl that did them did a fine job. She shaped them well and I like the way they look but all ths talk about how sugar is better than wax is a crock of shit. My skin is slightly sensitive/normal and I came out of that salon looking like someone had beat me with a bat. PLUS the dumb receptionist got the price wrong for the wax and charged me $20 when I told her the lady the day before said it was $15.... Anyways I wanted to put this up here so people don't waste their time or money on this place. There are so many other places in this city where you can get much better service for your buck.Sorry Shakire! It's not your fault the owner doesn't know how to run a business. Go find a better job and good luck with school.

2.description: I purchased a groupon for 2 no chip manis for $40. My first appointment was at 4 on a Friday. I showed up a few minutes early only to find that they had 1 person doing nails and she had just started in on someone. I was optimistic they would work it out, I had an appointment. However at 4:45 I had to tell them I needed to leave within 30 minutes and only then did they make some arrangements to have someone start my manicure. Which by the way took 1 HOUR. My manicurist was SO slow. I was so frustrated and I was late to meet someone but I wasn't going to have her stop my manicure after investing so much time already. I also had picked a white polish which was a huge mistake. It looked like a child had painted my nails because it was so uneven. So with an appointment my sloppy manicure took an hour and 45 minutes of my day. Not worth it. However it did last 3 weeks, for better or worse I guess. The staff was very apologetic about my wait time which was nice, and someone called me after I left to offer me a free deep conditioning treatment and blow out for my inconvenience. Very nice gesture however the last thing I wanted to do after my experience was go spend more time there. After a few months I had the guts to make an appointment to go back for my second manicure. I was taken on time which made me so relieved. But that's where the positive stops. My manicurist hurt me - as she was trimming my cuticles she was jabbing me and it caused some of my fingers to bleed a little (see photo). And this manicure chipped after 2 days. No joke - 48 hours after I left I had 4 nails chip. What a waste. The only reasons I'm not giving 1 star is the place was clean and the staff was very sweet and they did try to make amends with my wait time (which I don't plan to use based on my experiences to date). Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else for nails. Don't be fooled with a groupon - you get what you pay for.

18.description: I love coming here to get my legs sugared. Sugaring is better than waxing, shaving, bleaching or whatever you use to get rid of unwanted hair.I don't mind the drive to see Kim because she is knowledgeable, professional and gentle!

41.description: Here's the things I noticed or experienced:Love the bright colors. They reflect this in nail polish choices too. Staff seem spacey....no sure if it's the personality or drug usage. Not the typical customer service. Staff seem friendly. It's a clean :-)They should invest in another nail dryer for no chips. Switching hands and 30 seconds isn't enough. But they re push the timer and ask you to readjust your hand! No the salon should invest in one that does it accurately. It takes this process longer.My no chip.... Chipped :-(

52.description: Let me say right off the bat that there is no one I would trust my hair to more than Cherryl. What I love most about her is that she takes her time--no quickie in-and-out superficial cuts here! I'm a dunce when it comes to hair, so I love that she's always ready with style tips and suggestions. Speaking of hair, Cherryl also gave me my first-ever bikini wax before a beach vacation. I was pretty nervous, but she was friendly, funny, and, well--she took care of business. I'm told that sugar wax may be a bit more painful than strip wax, but it's much better for your skin and a natural exfoliant. The pain was well-worth the results: a no shave, no bump vacation!I dig the simple, clean style of the Sugar Fly salon, and the staff is always friendly. They have a couple TVs, and a pretty decent sound system that could be playing anything from Mariah Carey to Lykke Li to 60's R&B. All in all, a good vibe.

50.description: Sugarfly is so great! The studio has a totally hip vibe and sells cool clothing and shoes, etc. I've been having my hair done by Cheryl for over a year now and she is as good as it gets. She has given me outstanding color and cuts. Everyone at the studio is extremely nice and accomidating. Check this place out!

4.description: Great customer service. I've gotten several manicures here and the people great.

6.description: I purchased a Groupon to get my hair done for valentines day  for $65 .(hair cut, blood dry and partial high lights ). I end up getting one hair  color ) I was charged $60 extra because I has long hair. Total of $125 . wasn't that long any ways . I guess you have to be bold headed to qualify .My experience was great Cherryl did a great job. She offered me wine and I also had tea . she is very professional and was very happy with results the only thing is that I think even with out the Groupon is overpriced.  I looked at their prices for services online .Well that's just my opinion.All I can say she used very good products (Kevin Murphy) and lefty hair so silky omg loved it I recommend this place if you don't care about the price :) totally - Cherryl is the BEST!!! Just for that 5 starts !!!!

22.description: I chose Cheryl based off of the Yelp reviews, and she is adorable and awesome at her job. She helped fix my hair from some bad highlights I performed on myself and made it more natural looking. I also got a asymmetrical cut that I keep getting compliments on. I need to go back soon for a trim!

15.description: Damien did my hair yesterday, and he did a fantastic job. I got a deep condition, cut and blow out. I went in having no idea what I wanted for a cut and he did an awesome job guiding me to what I wanted. My overproccesed hair feels so healthy for the first time in a long time. Thank you!

57.description: I had a keratin treatment and my hair looks great!  Very happy with the results and will return. They also have an amazing boutique with great clothes and reasonable prices.

20.description: I purchased a Groupon to get my hair done for valentines day  for $65 .(hair cut, blood dry and partial high lights ). I end up getting one hair  color ) I was charged $60 extra because I has long hair. Total of $125 . wasn't that long any ways . I guess you have to be bold headed to qualify .My experience was great Cherryl did a great job. She offered me wine and I also had tea . she is very professional and was very happy with results the only thing is that I think even with out the Groupon is overpriced.  I looked at their prices for services online .Well that's just my opinion.All I can say she used very good products (Kevin Murphy) and lefty hair so silky omg loved it I recommend this place if you don't care about the price :) totally - Cherryl is the BEST!!! Just for that 5 starts !!!!

36.description: I used groupon deal $30 for hair cut and Kevin Murphy conditioning treatment". Easy to make an appointment and only waited 5 minutes after I arrived. Sherry, the manager, did my hair cut and I really liked it. It's more or less the same style I always have as it fits me the best but she did it with a lovely twist. I have got a lot of compliments at work.

14.description: I recently got my hair cut with Carly and had a great experience. She was extremely nice and professional. Since this was my first appointment with her, she took the time to ask me some questions about my hair, my styling preferences and my hair care routines before even getting to the shampoo. She was very concerned with getting me the style I wanted and checked in regularly to make sure everything looked good. She always explained what products she was using on my hair, but never pushed me to buy any. I will definitely be booking again.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Coloring

58.description: Found this place by accident, was just driving by and was attracted to all the wonderful greenery. Great selection! plants I have not been able to find anywhere else, and plants I never seen before.  The owner was friendly and helpful, and the prices reasonable.  I'll be back there when ever I need to get more garden supplies and plants.

56.description: I'm really sorry to do this, because I love this little gardening shop.But when I've called no less than 5 times over the course of 2 months and left message after message about wanting to buy more plants for my office, and don't receive any response, what else can I do...If anyone has advice for another resource for office plants, please let me know!

29.description: Not only is it super affordable, everyone who works there is incredibly knowledgable. I bought a house plant there and called the store a few days later when it was looking pretty sad, and they gave me great advice. I continue to call with questions and they always know the answer.

42.description: The best place for anything you need.  The father and son are excellent with customer service and advice on how to keep everything in the best condition.  A wonderful neighbor spot which I love to support and the hire young people from the area which I appreciate as well.  A great hidden gem in Humboldt Park.

23.description: Healthy plants, helpful and knowledgeable (and friendly!) staff, pretty good prices, great selection... This is the perfect neighborhood nursery. I'll definitely be going back!

47.description: This place is magnificent! Just picked up 4 shrubs for my new home and am looking forward to making many more trips to this place as I finish up my front yard and start on my backyard!!! So helpful, I'm a novice when it comes to this but willing to dig in an see how things turn out, so I appreciate all the tips/guidance and that they don't get annoyed at all the questions (that they've probably heard a million times by now). :) And you can't beat their prices or quality!!

8.description: This place is awesome!  Just got our Christmas tree here. The store itself is super cool and the employees were also super helpful. And the tree selection was great, too! So glad we didn't go to Home Depot like originally planned, as this store was 1000 times better for the same price.

31.description: I have bought my Christmas tree here for the past 3 years.. and plan to do so again this year.  They are so nice and the prices are quite reasonable.  Support your local businesses!

34.description: This place is adorable. The staff is very friendly. I came here looking for some soil for a garden I was planting. This was my first attempt at a garden, so I wasn't quite sure what type of soil I would need to get things growing right. The staff was more than happy to help me find what I needed. They asked me what I was going to be planting, and gave me some suggestions that would help me get he results I wanted. They didn't try to sell me the most expensive things, they didn't suggest things I wouldn't need, and they were genuinely interested in what I expected. It makes you feel good to get an honest, friendly business while supporting the local economy as well. I will def be back soon. P.S. My garden is doing fantastic.

16.description: favorite nursery! great selection and prices. friendly, knowledgeable, family owned, and local. I've already been twice this summer. Herbs, veggies, and flowers are all thriving in my humble Chicago garden. And, the community garden across the street is super cute too.

13.description: This place is awesome. I got a few succulents, air plants, a cactus, and a Venus fly trap from this shop. The guy at the register was nice, offered a few suggestions on future buys and what would grow best in this temperature. It's a bit crowded, especially inside but it's very well stocked. Everything is inexpensive and the staff is willing to help find ways to lower the cost of breed be.

11.description: Super cute flower shop plus more! The owner is extremely helpful and goes out of his way to answer all of your questions! He seems extremely passionate and is here to help brighten anyone's day! Flowers here are so beautiful and exotic... tons of options! So glad to have them in my neighborhood!

39.description: We were in the market for a small, live Christmas tree (4 feet). We wandered to the tree lot in front of Big Star to check out the trees and the super unfriendly dudes there quoted us $50-$60 (before tax) for a 4-foot tree. Um, no. It costs less than that to go to a tree farm and cut one down. Legit. Anyway, we decided to check out Adams & Sons instead. We saw an adorable 4-foot tree and the incredibly nice and friendly guy there quoted us $16-- including tax (!!!) for it. Done. for that price we could get multiple trees. I had a moment of "well, if it's so cheap it must be dead and dyed or something." But the tree was so fresh. Cut down that morning fresh. A week later our tree is still green and alive and looks great, and for such an affordable price. Plus, the people at Adams & Son were just so pleasant and helpful. We will definitely come back for flower and plant needs in the future.

37.description: Every year around this time I am in need of purchasing 2 floral arrangements for a memorial service commemorating the death of our beloved Jesus Christ. I've been to 2 other floral shops in years past but this year I procrastinated & waited till the last minute so the usual places were not available on short notice (24hrs) as they usually have to order the flowers. So I found Adam & Sons on Yelp and went in person to see if they would be able to create an arrangement in such short notice. They confirmed it would be no problem and I was actually excited as I saw their website of many beautiful arrangements. Usually the shop will offer a book of pictures to show what kind of arrangements they can do but instead the guy asked how much we were willing to spend. I told him $80-$100 per arrangement (we've never spent more than $85 per arrangement). He said no problem, the florist (i think its his mom) will chose the flowers to fit our budget but she does an amazing job and charged us $100 per arrangement.The next day I got a call that the arrangements were ready so we went to pick them up & unfortunately I was LESS than impressed. In the past $80 covered gorgeous arrangements that included many tulips, roses, carnations & a few other exotic looking flowers.... this time our money got us 4 roses a few carnations & a lot of yellow daisies. Very disappointed!!!!!Dont get me wrong, the arrangement was pretty, i just don't see why we paid soo much for very ordinary flowers. On the bright side, the staff was extremely friendly and its the 1st time i didn't hear the words "we have to order the flowers". Then again, I guess there were no flowers in need of ordering as any florist has roses, carnations & daisies in stock!. I would have given 3 stars if upon arriving to pick up I would've at least been asked, "what do you think of the arrangements, do you like them"? Just make sure i was happy especially since I had no way of knowing what I was getting.

0.description: I love this place. Service is great and has a nice family feel. They sell cut flowers by the stem so you can build your own bouquet...plus they have great seasonal annual and perennials, all kinds of fun indoor plants, cactus, succulents and air plants and some very unique pots and planters. Big outside area is stuffed with plants all spring and summer (and now getting filled up with holiday wreathes and xmas trees.) Year round plant and gardening options and so much more satisfying to buy here (where you can ask questions, browse and chitty chat) than at some generic big box chain store.

38.description: Note: This is in regards to Christmas Tree Shopping only.Bottom Line: Best Christmas Tree we have ever had sold by a great staff for a great price ($60 for 9' Noble).  Will be back next year!My wife & I recently moved from AZ back to the Midwest and we were pumped to not have to spend $100+ on a 5' Christmas Tree this year.  That joy turned to fear when we looked at the local Big Star lot in Bucktown with prices starting at $105 for a 6' tree and were thinking we may have to make the move to fake tree if we didn't find anything more reasonable.That was when a quick search online landed us at Adams & Son Gardens and we could not be happier.  We ended up going with a 9' Noble Fir that is amazingly full and straight as an arrow.  But it wasn't just the tree that we loved as the brothers working there were extremely friendly and helpful and for once in a long time, it didn't feel like we were buying a used car.We are extremely happy with our tree and this will be an annual tradition, regardless of where we live in the city.  Thank you guys!

51.description: This Garden Center is such a wonderful resource for anyone who gardens outside or decorates and improves air quality inside with plants and/or fresh cut flowers.  I can always find unique, affordable and beautiful flowers, pots and plants here.  As others have said, they have an amazing selection of "air plants" that thrive with just a little spritzing.   Everyone at Adams & Son is helpful, friendly and knowledgeable.  And, their glazed pots are glorious.  I'm there once a week - they are everything a business should be, a positive influence on the neighborhood and totally customer oriented.  They don't "talk the talk" about customer service, they "walk the walk."  We need more businesses like Adams & Sons.    Can't wait to see what beautiful seasonal offerings they have today..

27.description: This place is awesome. The prices are really affordable. The staff is friendly. and they have everything you need for gardening. Amazing!

32.description: Everyone that works here is so helpful and friendly. Great neighborhood shop with a heart. I went in looking for a low light, high humidity plant and they showed me at least 10 different options all right by the desk! For a gal with a not so green thumb, they've left me with many thriving plants.

54.description: O.K. my secrete is out.
