This once Mom and Pop family grocery store that has withered the storm of neighborhood change is now a garden and plant store stocked with the most amazing and colorful flora at the most amazing prices. Sure they could rip you off blindly, unmerciless, and coldly like Sprout. But would your family do that to you? This place makes me look forward to spring and they have it all for the average Jane or Joe, to those like myself, who dream of desert and tropical living and until hard work makes the dream come true , desires to populate their home with the most amazing plants to be had in Chicago.

48.description: Great knowledgable people. Great prices!

44.description: We always find heirloom varieties of tomatoes, beets, herbs, and the flower selection and accessories (and candle and incense) are all top-notch! This is our favorite garden center in the city!! We have had some success with Home Depot, Gethsemane, and others in the past - but Adams & Sons has certainly won our continued patronage with excpetional products, service, and everything!

24.description: Love, love, love this place.  I have a deck that I decorate every year and this year we stopped by Adams & Sons and purchased two gardenia trees.  The price was great and the trees are beautiful.  I will definitely return next spring!

7.description: Like the gardener's version of the Les Halles cook supply stores in Paris. I love this place, kinda want to move in and live here...fantastic range of plants, amazing thorough friendly service, super helpful, I got everything I needed and like 10 other things, too. Air plants, succulents, terrariums (terraria?)---an indoor gardener's dream! Reasonably priced, too.

49.description: This place is amazing.  Great selection, great prices, and incredibly helpful staff.  While I do love me some Sprout Home, I go to Adams and Sons to actually buy plants.  They have a fantastic selection, especially when it's warmer out and they fill their outdoor space.  They have some unique, harder to find plants too- I bought a dwarf orange tree there.  Lurve this place.

40.description: Wow....look at that raging bitch below...she must have been a Bridezilla in disguise, and didn't even know it!Because seriously, my bouquet was amazing, and the table arrangements were gorgeous as well. So, far better than O.K., moron.And Irene did it again, this time for a much sadder occasion. I came in with very few instructions: a small budget (we didn't want flowers, just a casket spray for the wake; FYI prices start at a very reasonable $80), two colors (yellow and purple) and a forbidden flower (carnation); the rest was carte blanche. She whipped up something gorgeous on top of being sympathetic in a very unobtrusive way.Competent and professional.I'll come back again and again.

53.description: I bought flowers for me wedding party here.I must say they did fantastic job!!I asked them to pick up the flowers from the market whatever they think it works with our color theme and fit in the budget, giving them a deposit two weeks before the party. They asked me a lot of good questions and advices before I paid the deposit. They picked beautiful flowers which greatly fits in the theme. Their selection was very unique and interesting!

30.description: I am so happy to have found this store for my herbal garden. This store has an amazing assortment for indoor and outdoor plants and seeds, along with all the needs to support your garden. The store prices are very reasonable when I have compared them to other similar stores. Most important - the staff is incredibly friends and knowledgeable! I highly recommend this store for your garden needs!

46.description: Easy to get to, lots of street parking, fantastic selection and awesome prices. Will gladly return for my annuals next year instead of getting them from a big box store - the prices are comparable but the quality at Adams & Sons is better!

1.description: I'm slowly learning about gardening and I had the need to get some planter pots with tropical looking greens for the front porch.  I was told by my neighbor that Adams & Sons had some cute plants, potters and garden essentials.  I'd never heard of it but I love checking out places others recommend. They have lots of planter pots, watering cans and even soil.  Everything for your planting needs.  The lady who was there was very helpful. After I picked out a variety of coleus greens for the planter pots she told me how to plant them and  how to keep them alive.  The gentleman who was there (he was not Tony, I asked ) told me how to care for them in the Winter.  I've never had a green thumb but then again I've never given gardening a chance.  I'm a grown-up now and ready to give it a chance.  My mom has such a green thumb and she will most likely keep these green tropical lovelies alive for me. Anyway, I also want an indoor tree.  The gentleman suggested a tropical gardenia tree that smelled great! Besides the tree there are several other plants that I need to get for my feng shui needs and others simply for superstitious reasons.  Now I know where to get my plants and trees.  I'm a fan!

55.description: Really, really great customer service. Can't say enough, they are great.

9.description: They're the best flower shop and nursery I've been to in Chicago. I'd much rather patronize their family run business than Home Depot for the same item. The owners are always friendly and have great suggestions and recommendations.They're extremely knowledgeable about gardening. They also stock Christmas Trees, but do visit them early after Thanksgiving, since many and more people are buying real Christmas Trees in Humboldt Park.During the summer, they have all of the vegetable and herb varietals you're looking for. They also have "clean air" plants like spider plants, aloe vera, and succulents.You can also walk in on Valentine's Day and get a bouquet made on the spot.

26.description: Love love love!  The prices are great, the selection of plants (and the accoutrements) is fantastic and they are so nice.  One guy (I think it's the son) even recognized me and said "nice to see you again" on my second visit (okay, granted I had just been there two days before).I do my best to support businesses that are in and of the local community.  Adams & Son feels to me like the platonic ideal of old-school local business quality and service plus all the modern amenities you could possibly hope for.  Don't change Adams & Son!  You're doing it right.

25.description: Beautifully cared for plants, and in a small space they had everything I needed: a very well curated collection, and they really know what they are doing and are helpful

12.description: Another Humboldt Park gem. I came here with my sister (who is a plant expert) and she was thoroughly impressed with not only the plant selection, but the prices as well! The plants here are much cheaper than most places and the quality is something you would not find at home depot. The staff here is also super friendly. Definitely coming here from now on for all my gardening needs.

59.description: Well, finally made it down here to check this place out. And to use that over-used Yelpism: "It did NOT disappoint." There, I said it. and I meant it. This garden center is chocked full of deals and good greens. I mean they have huge hanging basket plants for $11.99, more than half of what I would have expected to pay anywhere else. I sailed through like and kid-in-a-candy-store crossed with a bull-in-a-china-shop. Thankfully, you can't break plants too badly. The oldies were on the stereo, and the incense was wafting through the little jungle, giving a nice hippie throwback theme to my shopping spree. I lingered and I touched. I tweaked and I sniffed, and I walked out of there with plants and flowers and veggies for my teensie Ratatouille garden. It's going to be crowded in there once things start to grow. Those chubby eggplants will be taking up all the space.Adams & Sons has very nice people and plants and their prices are really the best around. Take California down there (if you are north.) It's easier and less traffic than Western. From the other directions, I don't know what to tell you. Just go.

21.description: I found this place by  accident and glad I did. Large selection friendly staff, and knowledgable. In door and outdoor plants, cut flowers and air plants! They tell you about the plants. Price was very competitive (cheaper then  fluff stores). They have a very large selection of pots, plants and accessories. If you stop you will not be disappointed!

17.description: This place is adorable. The staff is very friendly. I came here looking for some soil for a garden I was planting. This was my first attempt at a garden, so I wasn't quite sure what type of soil I would need to get things growing right. The staff was more than happy to help me find what I needed. They asked me what I was going to be planting, and gave me some suggestions that would help me get he results I wanted. They didn't try to sell me the most expensive things, they didn't suggest things I wouldn't need, and they were genuinely interested in what I expected. It makes you feel good to get an honest, friendly business while supporting the local economy as well. I will def be back soon. P.S. My garden is doing fantastic.

10.description: I love Adams & Sons and will never shop anywhere else for plants! The selection is so amazing, but what's even more incredible is how reasonably priced everything is. I used to go to a variety of nurseries and larger stores (like Home Depot) for plants, but after coming here, I will never go anywhere else. They have the cheapest prices, the largest selection, the best service and the highest quality products! You can tell that everyone working loves their job and wants to help you no matter how little you may know about gardening. I suggest anyone with an interest in plants, gardening or flowers stop by.

5.description: I know nothing about plants, but have been wanting to start a veggie+herb garden at home. I went to Home Depot a couple of times, but came back, overwhelmed and frustrated with the lack of assistance in the store.One visit to Adams & Son, and I now have a really awesome container garden - plants, pots, soil, compost, fertilizer, tools, everything I ever need. The owner is really helpful, she even grouped the plants in different containers based on how they complement each other! I'll be back!

3.description: We were looking to get plants for our new place and this place was perfect! They have a really good selection of great house plants at pretty reasonable prices.  The guy at the counter was also very knowledgeable and helpful.

35.description: I stopped in after reading the raving reviews and comparison to the other "high end" G* garden center in Lincoln Park. I ended up not purchasing anything but I did like the 'small shop' feel with the personal service. It's definitely a family run business and they were friendly and eager to help. They didn't have what I was looking for (since it sold out) but I still left pretty satisfied.

19.description: I love this family run business. The plants are so healthy. The service so friendly. I live on the southside, but it's worth the drive to get my garden starters from this place.

28.description: Adams & Sons is a Humboldt Park gem. They offer a wide array of plants to choose from for your garden at extremely reasonable and affordable prices. It's always great to support your neighborhood businesses especially when their prices compare to those of the corporate giants!So far this season, I bought some tulip bulbs, marigold seeds and kale seeds at Adams & Sons, but I will certainly be back this year and for many years to come!

45.description: What can I say?  I have been buying my flowers here for many years.  And every spring there are Tony and "mom" with open arms welcoming me back.  Always there helping me pick out flowers for the yard and patio. The best part is they are not just like this with me but with every customer that comes into their shop.  Prices are great and service is AMAZING.  Thank you so much.  I will be coming back!!!

33.description: I feel very happy with this store.  The prices seem reasonable, the staff has been friendly, knowledgeable and I would definitely recommend them.My thumb's about as brown as the plant that your 'friend' can't keep alive,  I know close to nothing about gardening.  Weeds were taking over my lawn for a couple of years, it was getting pretty bad.  The staff at Adams & Sons sold me exactly what I needed.  After much forum reading and online research I thought, "It can't be this simple."  It was.  Now I have an awesome lawn that's getting better every week, I've even got grass growing where it was only dirt before.Pretty happy.

43.description: Found out about this place about three or four years ago.  I go every spring.  I think the guy I always see is Tony.  I think he's one of the sons.  He always remembers me; which, um, would NEVER happen at Home Depot.  Not that I don't appreciate HD, or that I need 'regular' status, but I appreciate Tony remembers me.  Still, the reason I keep coming back is because of the variety of plants and the service.  This is where I discovered the 'lipstick' or chenille plant - which is the one everyone says, 'What's that one?'  More importantly there's ALWAYS someone who can help me and tell me which plants need sun, part sun, or shade.Lastly, I'm a faux gardener at best.  I don't plant anything from seed, but do I set up my baskets and pots myself.  If I were really into it, I know I could find it ALL here.  It's a relatively small place, but it's deep.  It's packed with lots of plants, herbs, seeds, flowers, cut flowers, cacti, beds, soils, watering gadgets, gardening gadgets, and other stuff that I dismiss because I don't have time or another green thumb.It's a pop and sons operation and feels like it.  It deserves your patronage.  It's good stuff.

2.description: Holy shit. Did not know how amazing this place was. I wrongfully assumed it would be expensive given the size of it and its location and I wish someone would have slapped me sooner and make me go here. For a smaller store they have SO MUCH inside. I am so impressed with their plant selection. They really squeeze a ton of stuff inside there. And succulents are really popular right now and they have a great selection. Their planters are also beautiful and their prices are super competitive. If you're an adult and you don't own a plant yet then stop into this place because first of all, it's awesome, and second of all, what's wrong with you? Plants classy any home up.

18.description: The best garden store I've found.  Their prices are cheaper than the big-box stores for both plants and hardware/pots/soil.  The owner is super friendly, makes you feel like he remembers you and is glad you're back.  I overheard him talking some young guys through their first ever houseplant yesterday.  He's also helped me diagnose pest problems in my plants.

41.description: Great customer service!I am looking for apple trees for my art show in October, and called 10 gardening centers for information. Among all centers, Adams and Son Gardens is the most helpful. It not only provides me information regarding the size and type of apples, but also the availability of various apple trees. Although I have yet to purchase the apple trees, I already have a good impression of Adams and Son Gardens, and look forward to working with it.Item: N/AService: 5Decor: N/A

52.description: I used Adams & Son Gardens for a May wedding. They provided the bridal bouquet, corsages, and boutonnieres. I contacted this place based on Yelp reviews (thanks everybody!) and was disappointed to find out that they were booked for the date I needed. I decided to try to use them anyways and DIY the arrangements since their prices were so affordable.When I visited their location to check out prices and options, I was helped by an employee (the owner maybe?) that asked what I was looking for. When I told him the few things I needed for the wedding, he said that the florist (whose name escapes me at the moment) was booked that day but might be able to squeeze in the few arrangements I needed. He left her a note and she got back to me the next day to say that she could fit them in! AND she could do it within the budget. Hallelujah! In person, I would have hugged her (so probably a good thing it was over the phone). Everything (bridal bouquet, 3 corsages, 3 boutonnieres) was ready on time the morning-of and looked fresh and beautiful - that is, until the bridal bouquet was out in the wind and rain that came to celebrate that day...The service was friendly and helpful and the product was fresh and beautiful. Give them a visit for your botanical needs and wants! I recommend them to all of my clients!

50.description: Adams & Son Gardens is a hidden gem. They did the flowers for our September wedding.  I loved our flowers!  I don't know a lot about flowers, my exact words "colorful and pretty". Irene (one of the owners) was so helpful and had so many great and unique ideas! My bouquet, bridesmaids bouquets, boutonnieres, corsages and center pieces were beautiful!! "Colorful and pretty" and way better than I imagined or could try to put together myself. She incorporated the pop color and theme of the wedding but didn't go overboard. There were so many subtle touches throughout the pieces that have my guests still talking! I definitely recommend Adams & Son to anyone shopping for a florist for their wedding or just looking for flowers in general. They have so many great ideas, are open to yours, work with your budget and share in the excitement of your big day.Thank you!!

4.description: I recently started getting obsessed with plants mainly due to pinterest and lifestyle blogs.  I had plants on my mind and wanted to go somewhere with lots of options but at reasonable prices.  When I walked into this place, it was just amazing.  There was so many things to look at and choose from. They give you a little red wagon to help you keep your plants on.  That was my downfall, I all of the sudden felt the obligation to have to fill up my wagon.  An hour or two later, with a wagon full of plants and plants I never intended to buy, I finally left. I haven't been allowed to go back since then.  I have no self-control while I'm there and no more space in my little condo for more plants!

6.description: This place is a gem! They have a huge selection (the place is jam-packed with an assortment of plants, planters, and different types of soil), the staff is knowledgable and eager to help you find what you need, and best of all - everything is reasonably priced.  I will definitely shop here again!

22.description: Super knowledgeable ,  super nice.  I only regret not starting to garden the first time I drove down California!  These guys know their stuff.

15.description: Cute shop. Not snobby or way overpriced the way a lot of florists can be these days. Just a good neighborhood florist with nice basic bouquets.

57.description: This is tied for my favorite nursery in the city (along with Jayson Home & Garden).After horrible recent experiences at City Escape Garden Center, I decided to give this place a try yesterday and I was blown away.The staff is THE FRIENDLIEST staff I've ever met.  The owner, Tony, is a really helpful fellow and took time to show me the plants I was looking for and was really nice and seemed happy to have me there.  His mother, Irene was also helpful when I needed orchid pots, hanging baskets, soil....etc.  And their assistant, Nate, is also very helpful.Their prices can NOT be beat.  A flat of annuals was 11 bucks. I bought two flats and a gorgeous hanging basket (same plant in same exact basket was 35 bucks more at City Escape, no joke). They have a huge indoor space as well with tons of pots, and everything from fresh flowers to incense and orchids. It's a really cool place to get lost in. I was wondering around for well over an hour. I highly recommend this place. Can not wait to go back.

20.description: As a budding gardener, this is my usual weekend haunt. They have a large selection of plants and succulents, planting containers, and all types of soils and fertilizers. Shopping here is very enjoyable, and the service is top notch! It definitely has that family owned business feel, which is a great contrast to the huge Lowes and Home Depot gardening centers. I never feel overlooked or lost, and everyone is always willing to help or give great advice. Everything is affordable and priced fairly. Parking is free, and they even help you load up when necessary. If you haven't found a gardening HQ, I strongly suggest heading here.

36.description: I love this shop. I have been going here for the last few years for houseplants, seeds, and flowers for my garden. They are always super helpful and friendly. I know that I can be an annoying customer because I always have a million questions, but all of them (mother, father and son) have always been willing to chat with me and answer all of my questions. They often have really cool succulents and unusual indoor plants. The flower selection in the spring is good too. Many of the more common flowers they carry are usually cheaper than any of the big box stores, too! I highly recommend this store to anyone who likes to garden and also support small local businesses!

14.description: I come here for all of my gardening needs.  Pots, food, herbs, plants, flowers, etc.  It's super convenient location makes it my go to spot.  But the quality and the great prices can't be beat.  I've become somewhat of a familiar face around this shop, and Tony always has great tips for the care and handling of the different varieties of flora.  He always lends a hand when carrying things out to my car.  Seriously great customer service.

1.description: It pains to me write this review because I was so excited about this place. An amazing location, with a great view, made even better on nice sunny days. Unfortunately, the food is just ok and the service leaves a lot to be desired. We walked here with our dog via the 606 on Sunday looking forward to grabbing brunch. There was no host stand, just a sign that said to seat yourself. Luckily we found the last umbrella'ed table and sat down. Maybe it would have been better if we hadn't. 15 minutes until anyone even acknowledged our existence when a bus boy came by with waters. He was under the impression that we had already ordered (but then wouldn't we already have had our waters....)21 minutes until the server finally showed up with menus AFTER I finally went inside to see if anyone would actually come to our table. After 40 minutes from the moment we sat down (I only know this because I checked my phone when we got there to see how long the walk from Bucktown took), we got our mediocre french toast and breakfast sandwich. There was nothing really wrong with the food, but it wasn't anything special. I could have easily made both at home, minus the cost and walk. Really what got me about the whole experience is the fact that nobody cared that tables are waiting so long for a menu, drink, food, etc. I had plenty of time to observe other tables and see that their experiences seemed pretty similar. The only thing I can think of is that the owners hired waitstaff that had never worked at a restaurant before. (I have and I know how it can be when things are busy, etc. but it was not busy while we were there and no matter how busy it should not take a server 21 minutes to come see their table!)So, so disappointed. The 2 stars are for the location and dog friendliness. The only way I'd come back is to pick up a coffee or pastry to go.

9.description: Stunningly sited next to the Humboldt Park lagoon, we had a delicious and well-prepared lunch. I ordered the veggie burger topped with plump and juicy mushrooms and my husband had the Monte Cristo.  We left not a bite. If service was lagging it was improved by our charming server.  Music was a kind of Caribbean-jazz mix which was delightful and just increased my enjoyment. I could have stayed all afternoon along with the very happy babies and leashed dogs also enjoying lunch. A dish of water was brought out for one very satisfied pooch.  Lots of free parking!  I'm coming back for those gorgeous doughnuts.

12.description: I'm so sad to say it, because I wanted to love this place, but it was awful. It's in such a great location, so at least we had something pretty to look at while waiting more than 20 minutes for our lemonades, but man. I'd like to give it another shot, but this place was a joke when I visited. There was only one other table there and lots of staff, but I had to ask a second time for our drinks after waiting about 20 minutes for them, and we still waited a while longer after that. The food was nothing I'd ever come back for either. We asked for our check, and waited another 20-30 minutes before anyone finally emerged with that. The wait staff was very friendly, but it couldn't make up for how unbelievably slow everything was.

21.description: I'm so excited to have this in Humboldt Park! Beautiful outdoor location with seating that overlooks the lagoon. I've stopped in several times for coffee and a snack and have not been disappointed. They serve Glazed and Infused donuts, have a full coffee/espresso menu, homemade pastries, and some entree dishes on the menu. I especially like the jamon, juevo, and queso breakfast sandwich. They also have a nice, spicy chai latte that you can get hot or iced.The owners and staff are very friendly and remember my coworkers and me each time we stop in. It seems like they are still working out a bit of the workflow kinks, but that will improve as they get more time under their belts.Great new Humboldt Park cafe!

16.description: Holy shit!! What is going on in this place!!?? I live near by and have been in half a dozen times now and for the life of me can not figure out why it takes a minimum of 30 minutes to get breakfast. Especially when there are only a handful of customers. Every Goddamn time I have to ask for the butter/jam that is clearly on the menu. No salt/pepper on the table (i wouldn't need if the cooks seasoned the food) You also must ask for ketchup/hot sauce (also wouldn't ned if the food had any flavor) All I want to do is get some breakfast here people!!! just came from there and I'm so fucking livid right now I can hardly put my thoughts into words. 2 eggs, potatoes, toast with butter and jam and a goddamn iced coffee! I order the same thing every time and getting it is like pulling teeth! hour and a half we were there today! They didn't charge us for our coffee but my guess is she fucking forgot. Like everyone else in the hood, we were excited about having something besides a taqueria to choose from and I have been patient and given it multiple chances, but after today thats it, I'm done. They say that 90% of restaurants close in the first year.....and this is the perfect example of why. People with zero restaurant knowledge opening one and fucking it up! Great location, practically captive audience, and they will fail. The menu has no real focus, the cooks are hacks, the staff have had zero training and the owners have no leadership skills. Selling someone elses doughnuts is not a business plan that will carry them through the lean times. Good luck ladies.....your gunna need it!

17.description: I have to say I was pleasantly surprised when I came here one morning while walking my dog. I had heard about it and decidedly to give it a try. I got the ham egg and cheese breakfast sandwich which came with a nice side of fruit. I was afraid it was going to be the typical humboldt park omelette sandwich, which grew up on/love, but am a little tired of. This was a nice runny sunnyside egg on a slice of ham on a nice roll. Was awesome. Definitely gonna come back and give the rest of their menu a try. Overall im happy that this spot has a real menu rather than halfassing the food and relying on the cool location.

10.description: This place gets 3.5 stars.5 stars - view, ambiance3.5 stars - food2 stars - service - friendly but slowWe had brunch around noon on a Saturday with our two year old. We ate outside because of the gorgeous weather and the ability for our squirmy toddler to run around. It was not busy by any means, but the service was slow and inefficient. Lots of tables around us had not been cleared.We ordered our food, asked for water. Water did not come until the food came, which took about 20 minutes. Kind of a long wait considering it was not crowded. A couple sat down near us, and they left after 10 minutes because no one came to their table to serve them.When the food finally came, it was good, but not great. I had an omelette, which was $12. It did not taste like a $12 omelette. The jam and toast which came with were actually quite nice. After we were nearly done with our meal, our waiter came to tell us about the donut specials. I would have rather heard about these before I ordered and ate my meal, but whatever. Maybe they consider donuts dessert.They only have 3 high chairs, which is a bummer. Not enough for this very family-friendly place.I really want to like this place. I'll probably come back (because it's so nice to sit outside) but with lowered expectations.

5.description: Delicious brunch! With the highlight being their French toast. Yum! I also had to order their grilled cheese sandwich, which was not part of their brunch menu, but they still made it for me (I had read some good reviews on it and had to try since I LOVE anything cheese).  My husband had the burger and he enjoyed how juicy and tasty it was.  Also, the service was outstanding and we enjoyed having brunch with a nice view of the lake. CPD was there patrolling to insure everyone was safe (we know of the concerns most folks have with this park has and we are all for safety first). I'm glad we visited and will be back for sure. This place is another example of the area transformation slowly but surely we are seeing in the area.

11.description: Best view, great food. Erica is the hardest working GM in Humboldt Park and surrounding communities.Must try for any Chicago resident. Don't be afraid to drive from all sides. Recommendation is the burger! Yes the burger. Just try it!Keep up the good work.

22.description: Amazing location and view. Such a great idea. Service is a little spotty, hopefully they get it figured out soon. It's BYOB for now, which is great, apparently they're working on a liquor license.I had the grilled cheese with apples and onions with fries and everything was delicious. It was grilled cheese though, so hard for it not to be.They also serve breakfast and dinner dishes that sounded good. So far so good, hopefully they fix the service issue and this place sticks around.

0.description: Since this place just opened I dont like to have too high of expectations but I must say the food was great! Now, there is more to a place then food alone and where they need to step it up is the service. I would have to give it 1 or 2 stars for service but being new, I dont want to ruin its overall rating. We waited around 10 mins before someone came and asked, 'do you know what you want' - I just dont understand what happened to some people in the service industry.. no, 'welcome' or 'is it your first time here?'... or ANYTHING besides what you get asked when you want up to the counter at McDonalds. This is not fast food, so I expect to as very least be welcomed and perhaps told about the food, etc.. I do not think this is too much to ask. Even at most fast food joints they at least say, Welcome to Subway!Once we ordered, the food took a while but whatever, the scenery was nice.. but she never came around again to ask how it was or if we needed anything else. After a while of being done eating we had to flag her down for the check and she didnt even ask if we enjoyed, etc.. Just a poor showing to a couple of really smiley fun loving patrons. Anyway, the salmon was great as well as the veggie burger.. so we will let these guys get organized and def make it back.It's got probably the best view in the city outside of downtown rooftops or beach view restaurants... you just cant beat the beautiful oasis that is the Humboldt lagoon.

20.description: Beautiful spot, great service, and had a tasty and unique grilled cheese with onions and apple. Also the fruit cup actually had fruit I like: strawberries and blueberries. Plus they charged my phone.

19.description: Beautiful location, delicious food. AWESOME burger!

2.description: So great here. Such a hidden gem inside of humbolt park that you would not know about. Great views of the pond, the park, and surrounded by flowers. So nice and relaxing. Menu is good too. Try the grilled cheese and egg sandwich. Service is also friendly and fast. And...It's byob. So come now and bring your fave drink.

18.description: Beautiful spot, great service, and had a tasty and unique grilled cheese with onions and apple. Also the fruit cup actually had fruit I like: strawberries and blueberries. Plus they charged my phone.

13.description: This was my third trip to The Boathouse Café.  I was so excited when this place opened.  Finally!  A place to sit, relax, and eat in Humboldt, my favorite park!The first time I went, I sat down at a picnic table.  My dog got water right away... and then no one came back for half an hour.  There were only two tables and ours was the only one without food.  When someone finally did come, we were given the menu, we asked for our drinks, and the drinks didn't come for 15 minutes.  My friend ordered one of the pastries, which we watched as it sat on a plate, ignored, for another 15 minutes.  My friend finally just went inside and grabbed it herself.  The wait staff seems extremely young, and if I had to venture a guess, they are the completely-uninterested-in-working-at-a-restaurant young family members of the owner.  This is Chicago, hire a professional staff, they are everywhere.  Chalk on another 20 minutes for the check, you're looking at 1 1/2 hours just to get iced tea and a ready-made pastry.  The pastry was delicious, but nothing I would wait 1 1/2 hours for.However, I chalked this up to it being a new place.  After all, it was beautifully situated and I walk my dog there all the time.  As a waiter myself, I know how stressful it can be to open up a new place.  I decided to give it another try.  This time I actually went inside to order an iced coffee.  They said they were out of iced coffee, so I ordered an iced tea.  The waiter ROLLED HIS EYES and sighed hugely.  It took fifteen minutes to get an iced tea to go.Today was my third and, I am sad to say, FINAL trip to The Boathouse.  I sat down, my dog got a water bowl immediately (dog service was 2/2).  Then I sat down to write.  After about 20 minutes no one had taken my order yet, and I witnessed the manager/owner scolding his young waiter for not waiting on someone else for the last 30 minutes.  After about ten more minutes the (I'm assuming JUST legally able to work) young waiter finally asked me if I wanted anything.  I asked to see a menu... twenty minutes go by and no menu.  Finally, the owner/manager who had given us the dog bowl in the first place, came and asked me if I had been waited on yet and when I told him no one had, he called over a young lady who seemed to be in charge of the even-younger waiter and asked why no one had waited on me yet.  This girl, whom I had never spoken to and assumed was a customer because she had been sitting at a table chatting with people the whole time, said, "No, I asked her if she wanted anything and she said she didn't."  It was certainly bold to lie in front of both your manager and the customer you are lying about, I will give her that.  I usually try to stay pleasant, because like I said I've been there and you never know the day your server has had, so I said, "Well, that isn't exactly true.  I asked for a menu from the young man, and never got one.  I have never spoken with you before.  I would really just like a menu and and iced tea."  I have never received a death stare quite like that lol. The manager very quickly got me a menu and my sweet potato fries came out quite quickly, but without their aioli.  They took a whopping dollar off of my bill.  The manager took care of it quickly, but was about 40 minutes too late stepping in.If I could offer one piece of advice to this owner, it is to NEVER hire family.  They will run your business into the ground and not lose a second of sleep over it.  They've already lost you at least two customers that I know of, not including myself.  I was very excited about your restaurant, but there are many other places I can spend my money that have exceptional service and are cheaper for better food.

4.description: Boathouse Cafe has a lot of potential: a great location, good food, and the staff is really nice. However, a nice staff isn't enough to overcome amateur-hour service issues.First off, it seems as if the staff rotates taking tables, rather than each one being giving a section. This means when it's busy they can't really keep track of who's waiting on who--either you'll sit there with no one approaching your table (because the staff assumes someone else already took the table), or you'll have more than one server try and wait on you. My advice? Assign sections and stick to it. Much less confusion for everyone.We sat outside (as did everyone else that morning) rather than sit inside. It was pretty close to when they opened so it wasn't too crowded yet. Our server approached us with menus and took our beverage order, then came back a short time later to take our food order. So far so good.I ordered an omelette with three ingredients, and my husband ordered fruit and granola, as well as two eggs. He asked about the choice of toast, the only options were white, challah, or ciabatta. He chose ciabatta. I noticed the waitress didn't write anything down.A few minutes later she comes back and asks me to repeat my order, which I did. If you're not a seasoned server (she clearly was not), it's probably best if you write things down if you can't remember.Then we waited. And waited some more. The outside tables were filling up fast. It seemed as if no one had their food.We finally got our food...after about 35 minutes. And of course my omelette was wrong, and the potatoes that were supposed to come with my husband's eggs were inexplicable replaced with a salad. We pointed this out to our server, who asked if my husband ordered potatoes. He had to point out that menu stated they were served with the eggs. She apologized and asked if he still wanted them. I chose to eat my omelette as is because I sure didn't want to wait another half hour for my correct food. The toast was most definitely not ciabatta. I'm pretty sure it was Wonder bread.To make up for the long wait, she gave us an apple fritter on the house, so that was nice. She was always friendly and tried to do her best, but man, I'm pretty sure she may have never waited on tables before in her life.We also noticed that people who arrived at least thirty minutes after us were served their food only about 5 minutes after we got ours. Why did we have to wait so long while their food was served in a reasonable amount of time? The world may never know.The food was decent, nay, good. Everyone was nice. The view is lovely. I think I'll wait a bit to return though. They really need to polish their service.I truly wish them well and hope they improve their service, because this place has a lot of promise.

6.description: A beautiful early Saturday morning visit here and I don't regret it. It had an exquisite view, fantastic relaxing atmosphere and the meal was satisfying. The hostess greeted and seated me immediately. The plate I devoured included, 4 French toast wedges with a coconut drizzle and a dab of strawberry on the side. While Complimented by a savory cup of coffee. I wanted to try the glazed infused donut but I was told they had not been delivered yet and they would be delivered within the hour. I would have given them 4 stars if they had the donuts, I so desperately wanted to try. Hey u can tell a lot about a place from their donuts !! I will return because the food was flavorful, ambiance was relaxing and it was definitely worth my time and money. My next visit will be during the evening and I want my donut!

15.description: What better way than to spend a 90+ degree day eating al fresco at the Boat House Cafe!  12pm weekday lunch.  Got seated straight away at an umbrella covered table.  Amazing view of the lagoon.  Erin K was a great server who gave us water and menus as we were seated.  Lunch menu is a little limited.  There were a few vegetarian items so I ordered the grilled portobello mushroom burger. The grilled onions were great!  French fries were crunchy & not greasy ... dill pickle was a bonus. There were 2 veg salads that looked good and a grilled cheese with fruit salad I saw @ next table (looking quite edible).  Love that dogs are welcome ... fun to watch nature.  Want to come back & try the brunch menu.  Check out the inside ... nice and cozy.  In fall the BHC is opening the upstairs for additional seating.

7.description: I'm so excited to have this in Humboldt Park! Beautiful outdoor location with seating that overlooks the lagoon. I've stopped in several times for coffee and a snack and have not been disappointed. They serve Glazed and Infused donuts, have a full coffee/espresso menu, homemade pastries, and some entree dishes on the menu. I especially like the jamon, juevo, and queso breakfast sandwich. They also have a nice, spicy chai latte that you can get hot or iced.The owners and staff are very friendly and remember my coworkers and me each time we stop in. It seems like they are still working out a bit of the workflow kinks, but that will improve as they get more time under their belts.Great new Humboldt Park cafe!

8.description: Amazing location and view. Such a great idea. Service is a little spotty, hopefully they get it figured out soon. It's BYOB for now, which is great, apparently they're working on a liquor license.I had the grilled cheese with apples and onions with fries and everything was delicious. It was grilled cheese though, so hard for it not to be.They also serve breakfast and dinner dishes that sounded good. So far so good, hopefully they fix the service issue and this place sticks around.

3.description: Perfect location and beautiful views. Stopped in for brunch on a Saturday. Food was delicious and staff were super nice and excited to be there. Their pastry chef is from France and holy cupcake did all the treats look amazing. I was also excited to find out this place is open YEAR ROUND and building upstairs seating for the cold months. Perfect place in my favorite Chicago park to stop in for a meal or for some coffee. Also very dog friendly and lots of seating so good for groups!

14.description: Enjoyed the ambiance of sitting on the patio for lunch. Beautiful setting in the park. The people that were working there were kind and attentive-you could tell that they cared about doing a good job. The lunch was decent and acceptable-I had a veggie burger. It wasn't anything exciting and could have used a special sauce or some cheese for pizazz but it was still good. Now, the clincher for what took my review to 5 stars: THE DESSERT!!! Apparently they have a pastry chef from France who is obviously very talented. I had the most outstanding chocolate cake with raspberries! It wasn't too sweet and it was divine perfection! I wish I had bought some slices to go! I'm really looking forward to coming back to try out more of her creations!

0.description: Fall time is proceeding and kids are going back school come to Kabnet Barbershop and Salon we have the best excellent service, professional and classy upscale environment! Massages are available as well! Gives us a call! Love my experience and yall would to as well! Thank you!

58.description: Really enjoyed this spot.  Most importantly,  the bartender was knowledgeable and helpful.  I liked that the drink menu was short, to the point, and changed daily.  Big backyard, nice atmosphere, and real tree camo in the bathrooms!  Can't wait to come back on my next trip to Chicago!

56.description: The lead bartender is a delight and extremely talented - Josarya (sp). It's a cozy masculine vibe w beautiful checkerboards in the tables and mounted animal heads everywhere. I sat inside but there was a large patio outside too. I was there on a Monday night and it was busier than I expected, but my understanding is that Mondays are usually extra mellow. The drinks were excellent! It's the kind of place you can tell them you like "a sipper" and you usually drink rye whiskey but tonight you'd like to try Gin and your taste buds will go to the moon.

29.description: Embarassing in every way.A group of established scenester developers took an old bar, spruced it up to look like a Northwoods bar that has lain untouched since 1948, and put in a reel-to-reel tape machine gimmick. (I'm not even convinced it's actually playing mixed songs on tape....I've actually spliced and taped reel-to-reel [and I'm 29, not 79] and didn't hear any of the familiar hiss or clicks, even though the reels move).Like every other pretentious fake dive with a theme that is popping up in odd areas of Chicago, the prices for the house cocktails are astronomical. Don't forget to bring (lots of) cash, as it's paper money-only. Caught a bartender grooming his beard in the mirrors on the bar.Don't forget to wear something flannel, vintage-styled work boots, or glasses with ironically-colored frames. Otherwise, you'll get judgemental stares from all the "hunters" and "outdoorsmen" that come to play chess at Sportsman's Club.

42.description: I came here over the weekend with some friends. I like the "hunter" look. Plus, free games! I wish there was a paper menu. I felt bad standing in front of the door because it was the only way I could read the menu on the wall. The bartender was super helpful! I don't remember the name of my beer. It had a retro looking car on the can and it was a bit sour. CASH ONLY although they do have an ATM at the end of the bar.

23.description: Cool dive bar! I loved the atmosphere, but the inside is very tiny and it's hard to order a drink on a Saturday night with only 2 bartenders. The drink menu board is located right when you walk in so it's difficult to read if you are at the other end of the bar. Bartender made me a gin drink like I asked for, but set it down and walked away before I could even ask what was in it.

47.description: One kind of vodka? Seriously, what kind of bar only has one kind of vodka - and it's Wodka, not even Grey Goose or Smirnoff or anything normal.I'd like to love this bar, I really would. It has a great space, fun built in checkers on the inside tables, large patio, dead animals tacked onto every surface. Really loud but cool music. I just didn't love the experience because of the basic lack of choice and horrid overpriced booze. My friend got a Heifeweizen that was $7 and tasted like PBR. I got an $8 cider that tasted like ass. They do offer cheapo Hamm's for $3, and seem to have a plethora of whisky and bourbon and tequila, which I guess is the hipster drink menu du jour: two shots and a cheap Hamm's or PBR sidecar. The overall choices seem so random and limited, like they have a small budget and just get whatever is on sale that week at Costco, or seemed interesting to the owner or is trending on Tumblr.Let's talk about the hipsters. I try to love them, I really do. Well, really I just try to ignore them, like the curmudgeon I am. If you are cool with them, or want to show off your new ironic mullet and thrift-store 70s vintage Tshirt, it's a fine place.I think if maybe I went there on a Tuesday at 3 pm, I'd like it, but then only if I was in the mood for bourbon and a game of checkers.

8.description: I decided to drag my friends here for my birthday drinks after having dinner somewhere else and we almost turned away since there was a small line forming and it was only 9pm!  A place that takes cash only and serves cocktails has a line already??  I didn't know where else to go and my friends were already arriving so we decided to stand in line.  and I'm glad we decided to stick around, we loved this place.The first thing we noticed when we got inside was that the place was not packed at all, plenty of room to sit so we're not sure why they decided to keep people outside, but it helped from keeping the place from getting too packed and that was nice.  The bar itself was pretty small, but it was a nice night so we decided to sit in the outdoor area.  They have a decently sized outdoor area too, so there were plenty of seats for all.As for drinks, I've been on a huge bourbon kick so I immediately went for the Sportsman's drink... ugh, not exactly what I was thinking it'd be.  It reminded me of Russel's Reserve small batch bourbon, which is a bourbon I have been sorely disappointed with.  I love old fashions so I decided to order their version... nope, wasn't a fan of this drink either.  The wife had a grapefruit bourbon drink with ginger beer and that, surprisingly was really tasty.  there was another more refreshing limey drink, which I can't recall the name and that was really tasty too.  It was probably the group favorite of the night.  They do have some beers on the drink menu as well, but really, you're coming here for one of the expertly mixed cocktails.  While my usual go tos were a disappointment, the other drinks were excellent.Overall, my friends and I enjoyed ourselves here and the outdoor patio area was great.  They have different cocktails every night so we may come back here and try this place again and see what other drinks they may have for us.

31.description: SO HIPSTER. Definitely NOT a "Sportsman's" club. Yes, there are fake deer heads hanging on the walls as decor, but I can guarantee you none of the hipster clientele would survive a hot minute in the wilderness.  With that said, this place was pretty interesting. There's an indoor section with cushy booths and an outdoor patio, which is where we hung out. The outdoor decor was pretty sweet. It had a working fire place, big wooden tables for groups, and pretty christmas lights strung on trees. So whimsical. +1 for allowing small dogs in the patio.The drinks were nothing to write home about, & a bit pricey for this neighborhood. Overall, I'm glad I stumbled upon this little place. Cash only.

34.description: Went to sportsman a few months ago, had a great time! The bartender, or shall I say bartendress was stunning in his red sequin dress. Bartender, I'll have a tall cold glass of milk! Great outdoor seating and checkers inside. Shot machine, yes please! This place has everything.

16.description: Broke Hipsters beware. All your extra cash could easily be spent at the Sportsman Club. It's super cheap, has a great crowd and a pretty killer outdoor patio so it's easy to all of a sudden be the end of the night if you stop in this place. There's a low life special which is a Hamm's and shot of either whiskey or Malort for $5. Besides that it's really easy to keep your tab low too. Not just cause of the small prices, but it's cash only as well. The hunting theme is consistent all throughout the interior and overall the staff is really nice and not too cool for school which you'd maybe expect from a place like this. Overall the Sportsman's Club is a pretty solid neighborhood hangout and I'm looking forward to seeing more of it in the future.

13.description: I like coming here and sitting on the patio. The location is cool too. They have a lot of craft drinks. They are a bourbon and whiskey based bar so don't come in bitching if they won't make your Moscow mule with a copper mug.

11.description: Great atmosphere (good spot for a date if you can get a booth) with a decent selection of drinks/brews. It is cash only, but the low life is a good deal. Checkers can be played at each booth. Recommend checking it out at anytime, but definitely more appealing when the outside area in the back is open.

39.description: Great cocktails and a wonderful outdoor patio. They have had a great DJ each time I've been here and the music has been excellent. We've been here lots and the only downsides are that it can get pretty packed and it is cash only. It's always awesome to find great craft cocktails and not feel like you are getting ripped off. This is a great place to bring out of town friends.

37.description: Broke Hipsters beware. All your extra cash could easily be spent at the Sportsman Club. It's super cheap, has a great crowd and a pretty killer outdoor patio so it's easy to all of a sudden be the end of the night if you stop in this place. There's a low life special which is a Hamm's and shot of either whiskey or Malort for $5. Besides that it's really easy to keep your tab low too. Not just cause of the small prices, but it's cash only as well. The hunting theme is consistent all throughout the interior and overall the staff is really nice and not too cool for school which you'd maybe expect from a place like this. Overall the Sportsman's Club is a pretty solid neighborhood hangout and I'm looking forward to seeing more of it in the future.

0.description: Ring ring ring ring ring ring ring: Banana phone! Ring ring ring ring ring ring ring: Banana phone! I've got this feelingIt's so appealingFor you and me to get togetherand sing!Ring ring ring ring ring ring ri

38.description: Came to Sportsman's Club when it first opened and haven't been back since. If you're lucky to sit at a table and want to play chess not checkers you need to ask for a set from behind the bar and have an additional form of ID for them to hold onto until pieces are returned. The boyfriend and I each ordered different cocktails yet the tasted exactly the same and not strong enough for the serving size.

51.description: After doing some serious drinking for most of the day, one of my buddies decided that this would be our last stop...not to mention he lives across the street from the place.A DJ was playing some pretty good tunes to set the tone for a late Thurs evening. It was packed which meant limited standing space. They had some pretty nice booths that contains built in checker games (I lost). Before we actually got a seat, we went outside to check out the back patio. Not bad and it was crowded as well. Pretty good beer selection and staff was really cool. Definitely a gem for the area.The place is cash only FYI

27.description: Cozy place, but really small when you can't go outside.

32.description: Love this spot, so excited that it opened just a couple of blocks from me! Drinks are a tad pricey for the area, (I believe they hover around $10) but the bartenders are so friendly and knowledgeable that it takes the sting out. They've always been happy to offer suggestions or just make up new drinks based on what I tell them I like, and they've always been delicious. It's too bad it's not a bit larger inside (though they do have an awesome patio for summer) and I wish they served food, but outside food is allowed. Checkerboards on the wooden tables make for a fun time. This place has definitely been a great addition to the neighborhood!

54.description: After two Coors Lights at Do Division and enough people-watching, my lady-friend and I decided we needed a real drink. It was the perfect excuse to hit up this spot that's a stumbling distance from both of our places.While the patio was full, we were able to snag one of the booths inside. I think we just hit it at the perfect time to allow us to have the perfect experience. About 30 minutes after we arrived, the place was quite packed. We tried two cocktails on their daily menu. I couldn't for the life of me tell you what was in mine, but it was tequila-basd, and it was delicious. My gal pal's was scotchy-scotch-scotch based, and it was heady and complex and delicious. For $10, you get a generously-boozed, hand-crafted, delightful cocktail. Money well-spent, I say. The bartenders were very friendly and approachable, and the crowd was a decent mix. Honestly, I like the fact I can just come as I am (jeans and a tank top) and get a nice drink without feeling like I'm out of place.Unfortunately, we had to leave after one drink, but that drink left such a lovely taste in my mouth, I will be back. I need some patio action along with a stiff drink in my life.

48.description: This is the hipsteriest hipster bar I have ever been to in my life. Before you jump down my throat for saying that, I assure you that I don't mean that as a negative or positive statement, but it pretty much assaults you in every way while you are there. The decor, the menu, the bartenders The drinks were good, but nothing exceptional, though they definitely want you to think that. I hate cash only anywhere - and it was also hot and packed. The back beer garden was pretty cool. I think this place will probably do just fine since people obviously love it but it's not my thing and it's a little overrated, in my opinion. I would definitely return, though - assuming it wasn't quite as busy since it's not so amazing that I wouldn't just go somewhere else instead

44.description: Excellent cocktails. Friendly bartenders. Cool decor. A little small, but with the back patio now open, that issue is alleviated, at least until the weather cools too much. Bring cash or use their ATM; they don't take cards.

24.description: A hipster bar worth loving! Stately outdoor fireplace, Victorian chandeliers, antlers galore, creative cocktails, great playlists on reel-to-reel, kind bartenders, dark wood, Art Deco bar, dimly lit, decent street parking.... This is where I'll be parking my duff this summer. Note: cash only!

7.description: This spot is a good addition to the broke hipster combination of Empty Bottle and Lockdown Grill one block north - a cool, cash-only cocktail place that takes after the Whistler as a completely unpretentious place that nevertheless takes its drinks very seriously. You can buy a drink with a $5 bill and get change back (and it is cash only), or you can get one of the constantly rotating cocktails that are usually priced at $10. There are a few small booths as well as a patio in the back, but it's also an easy choice to sit at the bar and enjoy the comings and goings around you. They live  up to their name by having a number of taxidermied animals lining the walls (what's the deal with hipsters and taxidermy? Sort of a weird cultural alley to go down), but overall the wood-heavy decor gives a very comfortable lived in vibe. If you have a friend visiting from out of town and you want somewhere chill to grab a drink and catch up, this is the place for you.

49.description: Unfortunately I can only leave 4 stars because I only had one drink, but this place was fucking cool. The rotating menu is such a genius maneuver and one that takes a lot of balls to pull off effectively. Patio was huge with plenty of room to mingle around or sit. My one complaint would be the music level which I'm sure during more crowded times of the day would've been fine but we had to move to be able to have normal conversation. More so than the volume was the crackling of the speakers, so may want to look into that. The reel to reel in the cabinet up front made me feel like I was in my grandfather's basement bar in the 50's, a great nostalgic touch. Well done guys, and thanks for a properly made cocktail!

40.description: Such a cool place! It's got a chill, laid back vibe, cash only, beautiful patio out back and the tables insides have what looked to be checkerboards built into them.Though it was humid we sat out back to enjoy the beautiful ambience created with the lights strung across like a scene right out of Pinterest. The bartenders were friendly and didn't mind answering our questions about what was in their cocktails. I went with the mezcal mint lime cocktail. Such a refreshing cocktail! Seriously, my friends were trying to steal sips of my drink while I wasn't looking, it was that good. Definitely hope to back!

53.description: Very good Manhattans and Old Fashioneds at $8, nice little booths with checkers boards built in the table, a large patio, and stuffed animal heads. What else do you need? Free parking right in front? You got it!

30.description: cash only but a comfortable layout / noise level and they have a working ATM!! cushy booths and some interesting mixed drinks.

46.description: Hipster, with quality craft cocktails, chess at the tables, cozy setting.

1.description: This place feels a lot like the room your funny uncle took you to when he wanted to touch your privates. There are weird taxidermy animals everywhere, a loud 8 track or something playing, and a lot of guys with beards that are looking for girls with short hair.That said, they do new drinks everyday and I saw some guy fall down and his embarassing genitals fall out of his pants from behind. So you know, all in all a good night.

55.description: I'm no hipster, although this is clearly a hipster bar. But it's still an awesome bar on its own merits.I've heard it's super duper crowded on weekends. On a Tuesday night during a thunderstorm it was just the right amount of crowded. Most stools and booths filled, but not much more.The barmen are very friendly and fun to talk to, and everyone gets a free glass of water when they arrive, which I think is very kind.There's a lot of peculiar rotating cocktails on the board way up by the ceiling. Frankly any place that has a special where it's a weird mixed shot and a Miller High Life (called a Low Life) wins it in my book.

9.description: Such a cool place! It's got a chill, laid back vibe, cash only, beautiful patio out back and the tables insides have what looked to be checkerboards built into them.Though it was humid we sat out back to enjoy the beautiful ambience created with the lights strung across like a scene right out of Pinterest. The bartenders were friendly and didn't mind answering our questions about what was in their cocktails. I went with the mezcal mint lime cocktail. Such a refreshing cocktail! Seriously, my friends were trying to steal sips of my drink while I wasn't looking, it was that good. Definitely hope to back!

26.description: Great add to neighborhood! Cocktails are on point, and the staff were super helpful when I had questions about the menu.  Looking forward to checking out the patio this Spring!

25.description: Inside the concrete jungle that is Chicago you have Sportsman's Club (SC). Its a place that is dark accentuated by the darkened wood features. They use an old reel-to-reel music player that plays mellow vibes. Deerheads on the walls and chessboards in the tables. The vibe evokes feelings of being in a log cabin that keeps you warm and safe from the cold and sometimes scary Minnesota wilderness. There is a special feeling any time a place can whisk you away to a completely different world.While their comfortable vibe is great its their drinks that keep me coming back. Usually I order the Amaro Machine which of course is made with Amaro, an Italian Liqueur that's sweet, mesquite and smokey. I follow this up with the Sportsman's Cocktail, made with Very Old Barton Bourbon, Amaro, and bitters. The drinks are always consistent and delicious and play strongly into the warm inviting wilderness vibe.My service experience has always been top notch as well. You can easily converse with them and they will even charge your phone for you if your low on battery. Also check out Jacyana, one of the up-and-coming female bartenders in Chicago's cocktail scene. She is easy to talk to and makes great drinks. I am not one to usually go to a bar by myself and just drink and converse with bartenders. But with the atmosphere, drinks and hospitality here I do and I will continue to come back. Next Monday probably!

12.description: Embarassing in every way.A group of established scenester developers took an old bar, spruced it up to look like a Northwoods bar that has lain untouched since 1948, and put in a reel-to-reel tape machine gimmick. (I'm not even convinced it's actually playing mixed songs on tape....I've actually spliced and taped reel-to-reel [and I'm 29, not 79] and didn't hear any of the familiar hiss or clicks, even though the reels move).Like every other pretentious fake dive with a theme that is popping up in odd areas of Chicago, the prices for the house cocktails are astronomical. Don't forget to bring (lots of) cash, as it's paper money-only. Caught a bartender grooming his beard in the mirrors on the bar.Don't forget to wear something flannel, vintage-styled work boots, or glasses with ironically-colored frames. Otherwise, you'll get judgemental stares from all the "hunters" and "outdoorsmen" that come to play chess at Sportsman's Club.

59.description: The bartenders here are friendly and were super informative when I asked them about the drinks.  I basically ordered something on their suggestion and they took the time to explain it as well as the history behind it.

21.description: I really enjoyed stopping by here a couple of weeks ago. It was the first nice Saturday afternoon in a long time in Chicago so my friend and I sat in the back and brought in some Leghorn Fried Chicken (which was delicious btw). I ordered a shot of Wild Turkey and a High Life, and it was a cozy afternoon enjoying the sunshine and catching up with an old friend. The patio in the back was really nice, tucked away, and everyone in the crowd was super chill and relaxed. I really liked the place and the combo with the Leghorn chicken definitely needs to be repeated!

17.description: SO HIPSTER. Definitely NOT a "Sportsman's" club. Yes, there are fake deer heads hanging on the walls as decor, but I can guarantee you none of the hipster clientele would survive a hot minute in the wilderness.  With that said, this place was pretty interesting. There's an indoor section with cushy booths and an outdoor patio, which is where we hung out. The outdoor decor was pretty sweet. It had a working fire place, big wooden tables for groups, and pretty christmas lights strung on trees. So whimsical. +1 for allowing small dogs in the patio.The drinks were nothing to write home about, & a bit pricey for this neighborhood. Overall, I'm glad I stumbled upon this little place. Cash only.

10.description: Really cool spot! Inside its dark & kinda rustic looking, great booths on the south wall. Deer antlers and other oddities dot the walls. Great beer list (Mostly Local) & even better cocktail list albeit short as they only offer 5 different ones. The Tequila one was the standout/ so good & refreshing! The kicker here is the back "Beer Garden" area complete with an outdoor fireplace & a small bar/ just a beautiful drinking area. The music was great & they had a good DJ spinning some old school shit. Service was great- they had 3 bartenders up front.. One of which was very helpful and the other was just too damned hot for her own good! A tad on the pricey side but I'll def be back to this joint, that's for sure.

5.description: Inside the concrete jungle that is Chicago you have Sportsman's Club (SC). Its a place that is dark accentuated by the darkened wood features. They use an old reel-to-reel music player that plays mellow vibes. Deerheads on the walls and chessboards in the tables. The vibe evokes feelings of being in a log cabin that keeps you warm and safe from the cold and sometimes scary Minnesota wilderness. There is a special feeling any time a place can whisk you away to a completely different world.While their comfortable vibe is great its their drinks that keep me coming back. Usually I order the Amaro Machine which of course is made with Amaro, an Italian Liqueur that's sweet, mesquite and smokey. I follow this up with the Sportsman's Cocktail, made with Very Old Barton Bourbon, Amaro, and bitters. The drinks are always consistent and delicious and play strongly into the warm inviting wilderness vibe.My service experience has always been top notch as well. You can easily converse with them and they will even charge your phone for you if your low on battery. Also check out Jacyana, one of the up-and-coming female bartenders in Chicago's cocktail scene. She is easy to talk to and makes great drinks. I am not one to usually go to a bar by myself and just drink and converse with bartenders. But with the atmosphere, drinks and hospitality here I do and I will continue to come back. Next Monday probably!

3.description: We were looking for cocktails before dinner and found this lovely spot!  Wow.  Vintage bar..yep!    Great booths...Yep!    Fancy chandeliers in a laid back setting...Yep!  Great spot with local brews, tasty cocktails, and friendly staff.  We will be back...soon!

35.description: Sportsmans is a really great place,  love the northwoods feel of the taxidermy, flannel, cozy booths, and wood paneling. If you are feeling like a Lowlife, try their Beer and a Whiskey shot deal for $5. You will probably regret it, but hey the name should have warned you. Their patio is where it's at, unfortunately it closes at midnight because of the neighbors. At this point on a busy weekend, the interior bar becomes a bit too packed for comfort so either belly up to the bar or swim on down to the next Western Ave. Watering Hole.

19.description: This place proves it's worth the hype and the consciously hipster decor with an excellent drink menu and bartenders that know what they're doing will actually speak to you! Great place to take someone to prove you're cool. But seriously, check this place out.

28.description: I have been out to many spectacular bars since living in Wicker Park the past two years but this is not a well managed establishment. While out having a cocktail on a busy Saturday night at the Sportsman's Club with a large group of my friends I was wrongfully accused of destroying the bathroom and asked to leave. I would not recommend this place to anyone and will be sure to let all of my friends/family members/clients know of my experience.

45.description: I'm giving a four star rating because the staff is great and the drinks are delicious. I've had some great evenings with friends playing checkers in the booths, analyzing my existential crisis at the moment over well-crafted cocktails, having good conversation on a nice summer evening in the beautiful patio, and anthropologically studying the urban lumberjack in his natural setting. However, I give the after 7pm crowd a 1.5 star rating because that's when I feel the douche bags roll in and the bar goes from a cozy, intimate, and welcoming neighborhood setting to an instantaneous meat market where everyone is too cool for school. The bar completely loses all of its charm. I still have a soft spot in my heart for Sportsman's, but only during certain hours of the day.

33.description: The most charming little bar in Chicago.  Interesting looking folks, friendly bartenders, chess/checkers on the tables, and a patio with an outdoor fireplace and big tables for groups.  $8 Sportsman's Club Cocktail is the highlight here.

43.description: Thanks to Greg, one of the finest barkeeps the City of Chicago has ever seen, I'm upping my review to 5 stars. My last few visits have been legendary and hope to continue along that route. The owners obviously took my advice and taught their bartenders some manners following my previous review!

2.description: Another unassuming place on this street! Where do all these people come from? Wow I would never have known about this place had my girl friend not bring me here :))) Dive-y but not really either because of the cute chandeliers. This place gets packed later in the night but we didn't have a hard time waiting for drinks.Perfect for a pre- or post-dinner drink if you're having dinner across the street at Boeufhaus.

18.description: LOVE this place! The bartenders are so nice and the drinks are great. Cannot wait to go back.

41.description: Visiting someone in the area, everyone agreed to try this place. Get in early for outdoor seating. It is a cash bar, so be prepared. Not the place if you prefer Miller Lite or Bud Lite, it's Old Style and Miller High Life along with other choices. The taco place,Tatoco, across the street will deliver to the bar to, so that is a major plus.

52.description: Cash-only bar. Great, full-flavored, balanced cocktails. They have chess sets built into the booths which was cool when you have a particularly awkward, anti-social date. The bar interior is made to look like those old timey sports clubs: mounted, stuff heads, jockey-type decor. It's fun because the crowd is youthful, dares I say hipster, but nothing overbearing or makes you feel out of place. Awesome spins on negronis and old-fashioneds.Less one star because I would've drank more if they accepted debit/credit.

50.description: We walked into this bar 11 on a Friday, overly crowded and made our way to the bar.  Bar tenders were rude and pretentious, wouldn't make a guy a cocktail when they were closing in an hour, but for a gal more than happy to make anything they wanted.  The decor inside is cool and think this bar has potential, the drinks we got were okay and nothing too special and wouldn't define them as 'well crafted'.

4.description: Vintagey lounge in Humbolt Park. Cosey and a little divey but a super cool find. Cash only.

6.description: Dim and sexy, a great little after dinner date night hideout. They make a great, string Manhattan!

22.description: This place proves it's worth the hype and the consciously hipster decor with an excellent drink menu and bartenders that know what they're doing will actually speak to you! Great place to take someone to prove you're cool. But seriously, check this place out.

15.description: Came here a couple a weeks ago with a friend. It was a Tuesday night and it was super casual and a neat experience. The cocktails were delicious and my friend loved the whiskey selections. Will come back again. It is my new favorite spot. btw cute ass dj ;)

57.description: I think the irony of this bar is completely lost on me. Northwoods dive bar full of taxidermy (well, and hipsters) meets hip cocktail "lounge?" This place is just strange. And contrived.A group of friends and I came by on a Saturday evening from a nearby art gallery. The place was packed, so we sidled up to order some cocktails. It took foreverrrrrr, I'm assuming because my guy friends in their button-down shirts weren't "cool" enough. I think skinny jeans, flannel, and ironic facial hair probably would've helped them. There was definitely a pretentious, hipster vibe here; if that's your thing, this may be your place.The cocktails were decent, but nothing to write home about and surprisingly expensive ($10?) for a place that looks like it does. Extra points for a sweet patio out back which would have made me more complacent about the entire experience, but it was a bit too cold to enjoy it.

20.description: One of my favorite bars to chill at when I'm trying to get my mid-week drink on, especially after a bite at Bite Cafe. Conscientiously divey chill atmosphere with a great patio combined with more-than-adequate mixology drinks that are reasonably priced (they do egg white drinks pretty well). Was tipped off by one of my favorite bartenders at another bar that this was an "industry bar." Sometimes a random tamale guy comes by while you're getting your drink on. Those tamales are delicious.

36.description: As an experienced hunter I was thrilled to learn of Sportman's Club in Chicago.  A place where I could gather with fellow hunters and fisherman to share our recent adventures.  From the moment I walked in I felt at home with a hunting theme running from floor to ceiling.  I looked around and saw plenty of flannel.  Plenty of beards.  I pulled up a seat at the bar and started regaling the patrons with my recent bear hunting trip to the Upper Peninsula. I told them about a wonderful fishing expedition to Canada and some issues we ran into with Customs upon our return home.  I was looking for the other Sportsman's Club patrons to share their similar stories but received none.  Perhaps they were just shy?  I prodded for more information but none could relate.  They looked at me like I was crazy. Imagine that? An actual Outdoorsman being viewed as crazy for dining in an outdoorsman themed establishment by a bunch of city dwelling, hand sanitizer using twerps that have never taken down a full grown male moose charging them from 100 yards away. I could only take so much.  As a respected hunter and fisherman I needn't spend another second in such an inauthentic establishment. There is no difference between what Sportsman's Club is attempting to do versus what someplace like Rainforest Cafe is trying to do - essentially build a fake atmosphere for their patrons - 90% of whom will never actually partake in the real life activity.You know who has a more authentic environment with just as good of beer and food?  TGI Fridays. Go there instead.

14.description: I really enjoyed stopping by here a couple of weeks ago. It was the first nice Saturday afternoon in a long time in Chicago so my friend and I sat in the back and brought in some Leghorn Fried Chicken (which was delicious btw). I ordered a shot of Wild Turkey and a High Life, and it was a cozy afternoon enjoying the sunshine and catching up with an old friend. The patio in the back was really nice, tucked away, and everyone in the crowd was super chill and relaxed. I really liked the place and the combo with the Leghorn chicken definitely needs to be repeated!

3.description: The Scoop Neveria is another hidden gem in Humboldt Park.  They opened a few weeks ago and I've had nothing but great experiences at this new ice cream shop.  They serve Mexican ice cream of all flavors, some flavors are very unique but they also have traditional ice cream flavors.  Ever had a Gansito? It's like a Mexican twinkie that's been dipped in chocolate and it has cream and jelly in the center. Well, The Scoop Neveria has the Gansito ice cream flavor! And it is heavenly!  They have a huge array of paletas (Mexican Popsicles) to take home.  They are all freshly made with fresh ingredients and surpass any paletas I've bought from ice cream carts I see in the summertime.  They have amazing ice cream sandwiches. I just had one today that was freshly made wtih a crisp chocolate graham cracker, coconut ice cream, and it was rolled in coconut flakes. It was really good.It is a family owned business and they are so nice.  I have come to get ice cream here several times since they've opened.  I really hope that they will prosper in our neighborhood, and I'm glad to see them opening a  great business along the North & Pulaski Avenue corridor.  This place is as good as it gets!

1.description: I tried the cookies & cream ice cream & it was delicious! Also took home an arroz con leche, nanche, & nuez paleta. Yum! The space was small but nice & clean.
