2.description: We walked here from the west end of the 606 to get some ice cream.  The ambiance has a little to be desired but they have about 20 flavors of ice cream and a selection of sorbets that seem to be made in house.   I sampled an ice cream which tasted great,  but I decided to keep it light and order sorbet.   The mango sorbet treated delicious and had a wonderful smooth texture,  with some bits of real mango. My friend and I also shared some Cheetohs con queso as a snack.  The staff was super friendly and the prices are are low!

0.description: I was surprised by the greatness of this place. I had a snack attack and yelp led me here. I was a bit skeptical, but i do what I am told and yelp did not lead me astray. The place takes credit, with a $5 minimum however at their prices you can scrap together enough change to cover it. A sugar cone with a GENEROUS scoop is 1.50+ tax. A waffle cone with a HUGE helping of 2+ scoops is only 3.50. Milkshakes are under 5 bucks and the other prices follow the low threshold. The ice cream flavors are written in Spanish and English. While the translations could be better, all the ice cream is visible and you can guess or sample. The place is outfitted with 3-4 tables, a deep couch and a TV which was playing some kid friendly cartoon. If you are in the area or plan to go for a walk around humbolt park stop by and enjoy a true neighborhood spot, with competitive prices and great products!

3.description: If you're looking for an authentic Latin experience this is where you go. This is how it is in Latin American countries when it comes to going out for evening of dancing and drinks. People are pretty down to earth and just looking to dance and enjoy the evening. That is what this place is known for. They have great music and good dancers. The drinks are fairly cheap compared to many places and it's casual attire. Not the best neighborhood, but like anywhere else just have to be careful and take precaution.

1.description: This place was great! I'm from NYC, and this place reminded me of home. I got the fried chicken pieces, which were really. I could see myself frequenting thus restaurant.

2.description: This review aims towards the perception of its weekend night life.  So I went on a Saturday night and literally walked in then out in an elapse time of 5 minutes.Im new to Chicago, moved from Miami about 3 weeks ago of this post.  Born and raised in NY Washington Heights (Central of the Dominicans).Upon walk-in its a small open area then a bar.  It was like 1am and Im like "Why is this place so empty?  Like less than 10 people.  I notice other people walking in towards the back and behold...thats where the dance-floor was located.WELCOME TO THUG CENTRAL.Hoodies, fitteds, bandanas, sneakers, 17 yr olds....Im Like oh hell no.The DJ had tracks from 1995.  This was a major embarrassment.  Since the population of Dominicans here is 1.5% it makes sense.Ill return to try the food at another time setting.  **Yelp should have separate El Sitio accounts (One to rate it as a Restaurant Non-Night life hours and another account to rate it as a Bar-Club nightlife.  The ratings would be more accurate.

9.description: The sign on there said that the place was open, but the lights didn't seem to indicate so.  The owner or cook let us in and told us that he was going to close the place down early since the weather was kind of crappy out and he wasn't getting a lot of business.  I guess we opened the place up for dinner.  It's a huge place, and it seems like it could be pretty happening over the weekends.  It would be a great place to have a party.  They do have karoake, and a dj there on the weekends.  The interior of the place was casual, warm and inviting.  The prices for the entrees range from $10 to $20.  It seems to be pretty authentic Dominican food.  The hot cocoa here is phenomenal - I wonder how in the world I can get this recipe.  I had the passion fruit juice drink and we started out with a salad that was pretty simple yet unique and tasty.  It was just lettuce tomatoes and slightly cooked green peppers that gave the salad a flavor of that with a light sauce that wasn't super vinegary tasting.  They are known for their fried chicken and tostones.  I got the beef with the Puerto Rican rice.  I loved how tender the meat was.  The tostones were probably the best I've ever had - so crispy and like a step above french fries.  If only the place was closer I would order out from there a lot, and if I do happen to be passing by again I will definitely pick up to go!

10.description: This may be the only place I've ever seen on Yelp that had an average (at the time I first saw it) of all five stars. When you see that, your reaction is either "Fake! Planted reviews!" or "I got to get up in that," depending on your faith in humanity. I chose the latter.I feel bad for being the first review not to five-star El Sitio. I wanted to give it five stars. I'm an optimist. I want everyone to be happy. I want to do nothing but heap praise. So I'll at least start out by saying that the meal was nothing short of kick-ass. We got the Pico Pollo, their signature dish, an awesome take on fried chicken, with fried plantain chips. I will go so far as to say that their fried chicken is among the best I've had in the city. The spice profile is distinctively different from any fried chicken I've had. What was interesting was that it was all cut up in such a way that you can't really tell what part of the chicken you're eating. Sounds weird but it was kinda fun, like you're being forced to think about chicken in a new light. The plantain chips are tasty as can be. We also got the yucca simmered with red onions, and man oh Manischevitz, that stuff is good. Yucca is awesome. It's like "nature's potato."So, yeah, the meal was pretty terrific. Not five stars, but four stars. Nothing about the meal was mind-blowingly off-the-charts, but it was a lot of very delicious food for very reasonable prices.The next star comes off due to the service. We went on a super-gloomy rainy Friday, and when we went in, the place was empty. Dead. One other table, apparently full of friends of the owners and / or staff. Now, under such conditions, I think it's reasonable to expect that:- The food should not take forty minutes to arrive.- We shouldn't have to flag down someone to bring us our left-over containers.- We shouldn't have to go to the counter to get the check.Now, the service wasn't rude, mind you. The staff was for the most part very friendly. But they seemed more interested in singing along with the loud Dominican music and watching pro wrestling with their friends than taking care of the one table they had for the night.Also weird was that one of the servers wouldn't put things on the table. I'm eating my chicken and I have to put it down because he's holding my Diet Coke up for me to take. WTF huh?But the food was great, the portions were huge and the prices were very nice. So I can't say I wouldn't go back. It's just, you have to know what you're in for. And it could have been a weird day for whatever reason, so if I'm being unfair, the other five stars will balance me out. God bless Yelp! God bless averages and aggregation! And God bless all of earth's creatures, especially the ones they hacked up and served to us, because man were they delish.

4.description: Excellent! Their location in West Humboldt Park leaves much to be desired (in safety terms) but their Pica Pollo (Fried Chicken) which comes in a large party plate with plantains was delicious. Waitress was very friendly and the "Domincan Horchata" was good but too sweet.

6.description: I came here on a rainy Friday night with a friend. Yelpers were raving about their Pica Pollo so that is what we ordered. I also ordered one of their fruit (non-alcoholic) drinks. I'm hard pressed to remember what it is but it really wasn't that special. I asked the waiter about the fruit drinks, asking what the differences are and he really couldn't tell me. He was at least able to tell me which one most people order.The music was insanely LOUD. We were the only table having dinner that evening. There was another long table playing cards and chatting it up which I'm assuming were the servers and their friends. Two HDTV's were showing wrestling and other sports events. Our food took FOREVER to arrive and the service was lousy. When I say FOREVER I mean around 45 minutes to an hour. That is ridiculous for a place that is not busy. Fried chicken really isn't my fare so I thought it was okay. It really doesn't look like your standard drumstick, wing, breast cuts - seriously strange cuts. The portion sizes were generous for the price (I believe it was $8 for a gigantic portion of food). It came with a salad which was okay. The neighborhood is a bit shady even for me. There were dudes holla-ing at chicks walking their babies across the street. Wow. Probably won't go back. Sorry!

12.description: This is the spot to chill with my beloved Dominicans! Unlike La Alianza Deportiva Dominicana, which was a kinda a fire hazard, among other things, El Sitio is different- bar/restaurant (overpriced and not too good) plus dance floor and all the bachata bumpin you could possibly handle. A bachatero from NYC came a couple months ago....The place is surviving well. A little pricey for drinks (Brugal/Presidente), but they gotta maintain the place! The atmosphere is of course more formal than the last spot, but that's ok. Now your surroundings merit your outfit, ladies!

5.description: Our food was cold and our beer was expensive and hot.  Only positive was the live band but in between sets they had an old guy playing music from a phone. Overall just a bad experience. Visited this place once but never again. As Dominicans would say, "Esto es un toyo!!"

11.description: El Sitio is the shit. I spent some time in The Dominican Republic, and every time I order food from here it takes me back.  The cooking is authentic, everything is fresh. The spot has beautiful exposed brick and a really great sound system. I went to a couple parties here last summer and it was a good time. The owner is real cool, always there, super nice. And, my favorite part is the autographed picture of Juan Luis Guerra. En una palabra, FUEGO! :)

8.description: This is going to look suspicious, but 5 stars all the way!The food is AWESOME. And the portions are huge. You can eat twice, really. I rec the Bistec Encebollado (steak with onions... and green pepper with rice and your choice of beans -- pinto is yum). I've also had their Pollo Guisado. I think it's called Guiso, though. I don't remember.I've tried the fried chicken, which is also really good. I've gone during off peak times, so it's been empty and relatively quick service. Everyone who walks in says hi to you in the spirit of the hospitable Dominican ways... though they are not very formal there. It's like chilling at someone's house.I guess they have a big area in the back for dancing, but I've never been. The area is a bit run down but don't let it scare you off!

0.description: Food still great.Hours are sucky, i think they open whenever they feel like it...lol.Call before you go.

7.description: Great place (I'm not sure if it's a lounge/bar/restaurant/ball room/reception room, but it's large) for authentic Dominican food.  I enjoyed everything I had.  The tostones are the best I have ever eaten here in the States.  Their known for the Pica Pollo, so that's what I ate.  Very good fried chicken, a bit too bony for my liking but tasty.  They also offer you three different types of rice and bean types, amazing!  Prices are not bad with $8-10 for an entree and the portions are HUGE allowing you to take left overs home.Please be advised that the neighborhood around the restaurant isn't the best at night.  Something that is so family Latino is how the older man (most likely the owner) sits at the front of the restaurant with random friends and family and chats the night away.  At the same time, he watches outside for any drama or perilous activities.  Everyone was really sweet and truly Dominicano.  Best part are the large screen TVs that project a channel directly from the Dominican Republic.  If it weren't for the location, it would probably be packed.

58.description: Went there for the first time last night and loved it. The staff is very passionate about their wines. Try the Crusts! The poached pear one + reisling = amazing!

56.description: Rootstock has it all. Great creative, delicious menu that changes all the time but holds on to a few main-stays in the event you need something familiar after a long day. Ridiculously well curated wine list, great drinks, reasonable prices, intimate atmosphere, extremely friendly service, and a stellar brunch to boot.This is my spot for so many casual dinners, dates, and of course birthday celebrations.

29.description: This place is awesome!  Personable owners who bartend, serve and host. Excellent foodie cuisine. Cozy, hip atmosphere. A hidden gem. Try the squash soup w smoked trout.

42.description: I've been afraid to write a review because I want to keep this place my secret!! They have THE BEST burger in the city, plus the rest of  their ever changing menu is made from seasonal, local farm to table ingredients,  which both my conscious and my taste buds appreciate.   Wine and beer list is fantastic.  The staff is very knowledgeable and polite.  The atmosphere is hip and cozy.  There's so many positives.  Stop reading,  just go!

23.description: Love this place. It's my favorite joint to go chill out, have some amazing food and there's always and interesting wine and beer list to try. The menu changes regularly and the creativity applied to simple dishes to share is amazing. Johnny is so friendly and all the staff have the same casual welcome each time you go. Despite a number of new places springing up around the area, this place still rocks the best.

47.description: I am a free lance wedding planner, and had never heard of this gem!  My clients said that they wanted to have their rehearsal dinner here.  I wanted to see the space, and they wanted to eat, so we decided to go for dinner.  Everything was awesome.  Not overdone or pompous, just damn tasty food, a cute ambience, and attentive, but not intrusive service.  I go out to eat 3-4 times a week and this is just as I said earlier in the review, one of those gems that I will keep around for quite some time!  Menu changes constantly!  Small, cute, relaxing space!

8.description: The food and beverage are still good, but the service has gone down a little. On our most recent trip plates were dropped with no explanation as to what's what. We ordered chef's choice charcuterie, and we played a little game amongst ourselves trying to bullshit each other what it was that was in front of us. Same with a couple other dishes. Everything was so beautifully prepared, bit of a shame.

31.description: I would leave a negative star but can't Service sucks I've gone there many times and they judge a book by its cover. I've stopped by for a bite to eat and have been ignored more then twice, three, times maybe more. Heads up mf I'm in the business.

34.description: This has become a standard for us after a repeated visits in 2014. The wine list is extensive and the menu changes frequently enough that we would go back every 2 or 3 months and not repeat what we order. During the summer months, we often go on a week night the and sit outside to enjoy the cooler evenings. We like the romantic and cozy feeling inside if we are on a date night!

16.description: Took five guests for a early dinner. Started with great oysters and followed with some burgers, pork belly (far too small) and a great squash and foie gras soup. Well priced wine. Not cheap but very reasonable given the quality. Such an unlikely area for such amazing food.

13.description: One of the best burgers I've ever had. Good and unique beer selection. Friendly staff.

11.description: I usually sit at the bar and can say the level of awesomeness is always consistent. Im a huge fan of the chicken liver pate, and I never fail to find a red wine that suits my needs. Keep up the good work and I'll see you guys soon! Thanks for being good neighbors.

39.description: Some of the best burgers in town. The beer and wine list is very impressive and the staff was super friendly. Val was very understanding when my SO wasn't digging the sea urchin and decided to exchange it for something else. Atmosphere was super chill -- having to come through the side door made it feel like you were going to someone's house. All in all a great restaurant for some delicious food on this stretch of California.

37.description: This place is great. Small menu, but that's fine, since everything on it is so well done!Dark, cosy ambiance - this is a winter restaurant! Friendly waitstaff.The burger I had was just incredible. Juicy, delicious and savory - and really, enough for two to share. Short review, but just go here. It's good.

0.description: Great beer and wine list, and fantastic food! My boyfriend was impressed with their German beer selection, and I loved the red wine I decided on. The food was soooo good. We split fries, a salad, the burger, and the crispy duck. All was amazing. Will definitely come back for a casual quiet meal! Love that there was no wait, it's a casual atmosphere, great for a delicious weeknight dinner.

38.description: Never had a disappointing meal here, ever. Burger is amazing. Taken several foodie friends and they loved it. Can be a bit pricey, but is worth the treat.

51.description: Proper beer, wine and bites.

27.description: Awesome burger! Not sure how they do it, but it is smokey, creamy and the combination is a burst of heaven in your mouth. The ambiance is dark, cozy and warm, very relaxed and chill.They have other unique dish combinations, but the burger is always my favorite.

32.description: Dear Rootstock. I'm madly in love with you. Not just a little. A lot. You're exactly what I've been looking for all of my life. Quaint, sexy, hip, mysterious, dark.Let's just talk a minute about the environment. Please see above. Every word holds true. This place is sexy. The dimly lit room was romantic. Paired with a couple bottles of wine and some sweet desserts, Rootstock makes for a killer date night.I haven't had a chance to try their actual menu. However, I was super impressed with their beer and wine selection. Even more impressed by their desserts and candies. ((Helllloooooo bacon toffee!)). Our service was great. As a girl who doesn't drink a lot of wine, and virtually no beer, our server was able to make some recommendations based on flavors I enjoy. With a wine and beer menu that size, I needed all of the help I could get.  Amazing ambiance. Phenomenal service. Stellar snacks. Now, all I need is to get back for dinner!

54.description: Brilliant, creative chefs in the kitchen at Rootstock and really special wines. Come for a special occasion or just to sit at the bar alone or with a friend on a weeknight. Service is perfect.

48.description: I'm not sure how we came to know about this place, but I'm glad we did. Went here with another couple on a Saturday night. Took a little bit to get a table, but when we did, it was a great one in the front by the window. We had excellent service. The waiter was super helpful in helping my friend select a cocktail and he was super knowledgeable in assisting me in selecting a wine. I love that personal attention from someone who knows what the heck they are talking about!The 4 of us shared a bunch of plates and we enjoyed pretty much everything that touched our mouths. The food wasn't the most super amazing food we've ever had, but it was delicious and consistent. Prices overall are a bit high, but not surprisingly so. Definitely worth a return visit at some point.

44.description: WOWZERS, what an amazing place! I love the atmosphere. It's the perfect amount of quiet, the (GOOD) music is playing at just the right level. You can actually hear your dinner companion.The staff rocks & the food is superb. Did I mention they support local farmers?! Geez, such a great option in the neighborhood! I suggest you check this place out!

24.description: The beer selection here is incredible. I think the beer I ordered was called Moody Tongue - would highly recommend that. The burgers were also really good. This is a nice calm place you go to have nice conversation. Love the ambiance.

7.description: Love it here! Have come in a couple of weekday nights and it's always great. It's never full, but decently crowded. We sat a cute little table in the corner with huge chairs last time we were in. Their charcuterie and cheese board is amazing! It's plenty of food for two people, and I always appreciate meat and cheese offerings. We also got the steak tartar which was delicious! Our server was great when it came to picking wines for us to drink.

49.description: Came here for a late dinner on a weekend and expected a wait, but the place was empty. We were greeted by a waitress when we walked in, but it was odd that there was no host stand and that to find a staff member, you really had to walk through the restaurant (by the bar). It's a small, intimate place, but if it were busy, I could see that causing confusion. There is some outdoor seating as well. It was dimly lit with a small candle on each table. The decor was eclectic and screamed garage sale, but in a cute way. None of the dishes matched, nor did the tables and chairs. The menu is small but had some good options. We shared a selection of 3 meats/cheeses for an appetizer, but I wasn't thrilled with our selections. It was OK and the price wasn't terrible, but definitely not the best charcuterie plate I've had in Chicago. My friend ordered the steak and it looked delicious, but I didn't try it. I only had the appetizer. His steak was served with some grilled onions of various types. They were a bit odd and the plate seemed a little empty, but I think that's just a personal preference. I wasn't overwhelmed by anything here and don't feel the need to return, but it's worth trying if you've never been.

40.description: The first time I ate here, I had a burger and it was quite good. I brought my boyfriend last week and was very underwhelmed by the food. We had a butternut soup that was average. The curried cauliflower with squid was overly salted, we left half the plate untouched. My boyfriend's burger was good but mediocre. The handcut fries were great! For a so-so meal and 1 beer, the tab was pretty outrageous, $50. I like the look of Rootstock, like I'm in the Clue mansion, but the chairs are uncomfortable and the tables are too low, even for a tiny person like me. Better to just enjoy the wine and beer list, skip the food.

53.description: I love this place. One of my all time favorites. If you ever get a chance to pick the brains of the owners (who also work there) don't miss the chance. I have had some of the most unique wines here - and appreciate the recommendations! Amazing wine & beer list, small but delicious menu and wonderful unique atmosphere.  Tiny and quaint. Dark and warm. Patio in the summer.

30.description: Excellent food excellent service. I love the ambiance. The waitress was really knowledgeable and personable. Would return there in a heartbeat. I can't recall the name of the dish- but I had a beef stew of some sort with the bone marrow. That was sooo delicious. I would return there for that dish alone.

46.description: Awesome place.  I was brought here by a friend during a business visit to Chicago, and it was really worth the drive out of downtown.The vibe is great.  The lighting is soft but not overly dim, the sound level is just right for casual conversation, and they have an amazing wine list to pair with their great food choices, mostly small plates to share.  Order one of everything and enjoy the menu flavors that they change on a regular basis.If this place were in San Francisco, I might classify it as upscale hipster, but it definitely has a unique feeling of its own.  Make sure to enter the restaurant down the side alley on the left to get the full experience.  We had an extremely pleasant waitress who was knowledgeable about the food and wine, and towards the end we were glad-handed by one of the owners.  Very comfortable place to hang for a fun evening.

1.description: Rootstock is good. Really good. I'm never overly impressed with any of the service, but the food is fantastic. The servers are thorough in their wine knowledge and def recommend some tasty drinks.  Tucked away in-between a residential building and a auto shop, I can always trust that Rootstock is gonna provide a quality Sunday brunch with no wait and only half the hipster sas.

55.description: I have been to Rootstock twice and both times I was very happy with their wine lists and beers on tap.  They have a very unique selection and very friendly bartenders who can help out a lot.  We also got the cheese and charcuterie plate which had some hits and misses.  Not sure I would go with it again, but would instead just stick with the unique wines and beers.97/365

9.description: MTV True Life: I went to a wine and beer bar for the burger.Now that that's out of the way, I have to say the burger was delicious. Good meat blend, grind was not too fine/coarse. Maybe a little under seasoned but otherwise was great.I literally can't comment on anything else because that's all I had.Conveniently located by a divvy station. Would ride to again.

26.description: HOLY S*** this place has the best burger ever. Being from Cali, all we have is in-n-out so this was a holy burger experience and my tastebuds were blessed. Also, swaggy beer and wine list.

25.description: Best brunch in the city. You can't go wrong with anything you order. Also one of the best bloody Mary's I've had... And I've had quite a few. Every time I dine at rootstock, I leave happy and wanting to return again soon. The service is always wonderful, and I like the quaint space. They also have a great beer list and their wine list is very well organized and easy to navigate. I've never been here and had a disappointing experience. I highly recommend it to anyone who asks! The dinner is also phenomenal, I just love brunch the most :)

12.description: Hands down best Fries in Chicago.   Also despite being located in a central hipster location the service is exceptional and friendly.     Also if you like booze they have an amazing wine and brew selection.     Get involved.

59.description: I almost don't want to tell you about this place because I don't want it to be anymore jammed than it is.  Rootstock rules.

21.description: Great vibes, extensive wine list and good small eats.The cheese and charcuterie board was phenomenal! Many homemade jams, mustards, and pickled veggies. The pate is to die for!

17.description: This has become a standard for us after a repeated visits in 2014. The wine list is extensive and the menu changes frequently enough that we would go back every 2 or 3 months and not repeat what we order. During the summer months, we often go on a week night the and sit outside to enjoy the cooler evenings. We like the romantic and cozy feeling inside if we are on a date night!

10.description: Possibly hands down my fav cozy up to my man date night Wine Bar, in Chicago. Food is flawless, wine selection out of control. Hilarious and friendly staff!Love love love

5.description: I've passed by this place so many times and finally made it in.....Great dark ambience, non-pretentious, candle-lit, huge wine selection and nice cheese/charcuterie plates. The staff is knowledgeable about all of the wines, which I always find to be a plus. (they also play good music) :)I highly recommend this place!

3.description: I really like the environment. When I first went there it felt very welcoming and very home-y feeling for some reason. But overall food is good service is excellent and couldn't ask for a better night. Highly recommend this place. Gets choices of wine. :)

35.description: I'm a sucker for service and they nailed it.  Ordered strictly off of recommendations from our server and was incredibly impressed. Highly recommend the escargot paired with an order of the fries. Top that with a bottle of the sparkling rose and you're livin the high life.

19.description: I absolutely love this place! It's such a hidden gem with a great ambiance; it's dimly lit, cozy, and has great acoustics. It'll be my go to place for a date from now on! I tried the steak tartare, eggplant crostini, fries, and burger - everything was delicious and did not disappoint.

28.description: Great meal, Get the burger, get the Charcuterie Board, get the oysters, get everything.  Yummy Food, Great Beers, Try this spot.

45.description: This is a gem in Humboldt Park. Haha! The area was shady, I'm not gonna lie but this restaurant is far from it. The service was good, they're very friendly.The fries were good because of the dip! And the hamburger was so gooood because of the dressing and well, the quality of the meat was excellent, too. They change their menu often which I think is interesting except for the heavenly burger!They have vegan choices, too. The eggplant was excellent.The ambience was kinda intimate. They have a wide selection of wines and beer if you drink. I'm gonna be back for sure. :-)

33.description: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place NYE when the place we were going to eat was closed. I'm so happy we found this place! A 2 top had just opened up right when we walked in. I had a Three Floyd's Zombie Dust, it's definitely the best American Pale Ale I've ever had. My boyfriend had a glass of red. We started with the oysters, they were just the right size and tasted amazing. We then had the snails and mushrooms. The toast was so buttery and just melted in your mouth. We split the cheeseburger. I may go as far to say that it's the best cheeseburger I've ever tasted. The meat was so fresh tasting. This place is excellent! We will definitely be going back to this place many many times.

43.description: My hubby brought me here on a date night. We had an amazing time. The best wine collection. Great service and amazing ambiance. Cheese pairing with wine was great. Its definitely my new favorite wine bar. I highly recommend for a date night and a girls night out

2.description: My friend lives around the corner and had heard about this new place through a co-worker.  At least I think it's newer? We went on Monday evening when it was opening at 5pm and stayed until 7:30! We really enjoyed our time.  We sat at the bar and were the first ones there so we chatted with the bartender for a little whom was very pleasant, attentive, and knowledgeable on her wines. God, I love a good bartender!!  They are too rare these days.They have a great drink selection- Wines, cocktails, whiskeys, bourbons, beers! My friend and I both ended up trying and loving this white they had and should've got a bottle because we ended drinking 4 glasses each, yikes lol.  It was unfiltered, almost like a cider. YUM! They specialize in old-style European wine which I thought was fun and different.  I love to try new grapes and not have to see the same wines on a menu- I had never seen any of these before! For food we ordered their sheep's milk cheese plate, steak tartar (with hard-boiled eggs, like a homemade pickled relish, dill, so good), and a burger.  I was very happy with the food although we did have to send the burger back (HATE to do it) because my friend is very particular about her meat.  I like mine bleeding so I would've been fine but to each their own I guess.  The bartender was more than happy to do so but we did expect some kind of discount on that since we had to wait to eat until hers was done.  We did not receive that so I did deduct a star, a little disappointing.  Other than that though it's a small menu that probably changes a lot with New American type small plates.  Will go back, if not for the drink list alone!

18.description: Great vibes, extensive wine list and good small eats.The cheese and charcuterie board was phenomenal! Many homemade jams, mustards, and pickled veggies. The pate is to die for!

41.description: I didn't know this place was this good, I didn't expect or think or even believe that one would find heaven in humbolt park. This meal was transcendent ... Service impeccable and drinks perfect. Not expensive and not frou frou, it's a little cozy sexy spot perfect for a person who loves food. Three foodies all blown away.

52.description: Really terrific food. It was inexpensive and fairly accessible by car. We would love to come back and eat here!

50.description: I love wine. Its fun to try different wines and this is a good place to do so. Your not going to get away cheap but when your ready to pony up the dough, its worth it. The menu is minimalist but obviously caters to a foodie crowd. They do have a burger that is good if you need more than some of the smaller plates. I would be in here much more often if I could afford it. I dont like the communal table outside. Its not hip or Euro for me, it just sucks.

4.description: I sat at the bar on a busy Tuesday night.I started with a glass of cava before moving to the flight of five sherries for $18I started with an amazing cheese spread for the appetizer which comes with amazing house made complementsMain course was the bucatini carbonara, nice and thickThe Dessert was chicken liver patè and an order of their homemade chocolate with some type of blueberry complement.  So so so goodWill return soon

6.description: I highly recommend Rootstock bar, the food is FANTASTIC! Grab a table or sit at the bar, it's cozy and you will want to just hang out all night. I can't resist the Bouqurones when they are on the menu or try the charcuterie which has local organic cheese's and house made pate (YUM) with a glass of crisp white wine...Perfection! Jamie one of the owners is often behind the bar and assists with my wine selections...always amazing choices! I love the Bucatini with lamb, mussels and the Burger is my favorite in the city!  The menu changes all the time with seasonal small plates and vegetarian choices that are so tasty!  This is a great place to bring a group share food, drink and hang out. The wine and beer menu is exceptional, the staff is very knowledgable and will help you to choose something new that will not disappoint! I can't wait to go back!

22.description: MTV True Life: I went to a wine and beer bar for the burger.Now that that's out of the way, I have to say the burger was delicious. Good meat blend, grind was not too fine/coarse. Maybe a little under seasoned but otherwise was great.I literally can't comment on anything else because that's all I had.Conveniently located by a divvy station. Would ride to again.

15.description: It was just ok... And for the taste, ambience, pricing, and service for a Wednesday... Just ok.  Unfortunately, at that point I rather schlep into Wicker or Logan.

57.description: Rootstock was the first restaurant that I tried in Chicago that didn't make me homesick for California. First, and most importantly. The wine list is phenomenal: go for bottles. Not sure what you want? I haven't been steered wrong yet by the servers or bartenders -- they know their stuff, and are enthusiastic about sharing. I love the Cabanon and Occhipintis they stock - really stellar. Second, the food is great: ingredient-driven and satisfying. I love the house-made terrine, the selection of cheeses, and have yet to be disappointed by a salad or app. But really, I go for the burger.

20.description: I wish I could give this place 7 stars, what an awesome find!! We had dinner at BeoufHaus and then came here for drinks and I was sooo much happier with my cheese and charcuterie after dinner than our $200 dinner at BH. The wine and food was amazing, super cool and chill atmosphere and great service. A+++

36.description: Based on customer service alone, I'm giving this place five stars! Tonya was so wonderful and accomodating of my request to purchase and mail a gift card for a friend in Chicago (I'm in Texas). I'll definitely be visiting Rootstock on my next trip!

14.description: This place is great. Small menu, but that's fine, since everything on it is so well done!Dark, cosy ambiance - this is a winter restaurant! Friendly waitstaff.The burger I had was just incredible. Juicy, delicious and savory - and really, enough for two to share. Short review, but just go here. It's good.

3.description: Hi there this is the 2nd review I've done in some time I'm a Line Cook(11 years experience) and have been cooking as a hobby for a longtime. I like to try difrent recipes and to be honest with the price of Avocados getting good quality items is hard to find.      So if your looking for good avocados look no further than buyers flee market, at mark up cost you can get 2 for 3 at regular stores even on special, AND Pricing for wholesale products even from distributors is still high. here I can purchase a boxed crate of avocados for 6 bucks! you heard right 6 bucks granted you will need to know about foods to see what your getting and some of the Avocados you will need to through out but on average for what you pa you still get a great deal.The key hear about avocados is knowing wich ones are good, Very green means there not ripe, striations with a touch of green means there about to go ripe , and then just enough texture of black with a firm tender skin means there ready to eat. Most of the ones you find there are green/black coloration, you will need to check them to make sure that there is no bruising or any of the sort.All in all there are other items at the market aswell. while I can't speak for the rest of the stuff that goes-on at the flea market I know I get a great deal on produce

1.description: Before you can get into the flea market get ready for plenty of congestion especially since the holidays are fast approaching!There are many stores within the Market I can't say that they are very cheap but if you look around you will find a deal or two!It is very big and I believe they have used up every square footage!I like to go for the music not for the clothes, furniture, doctors, speakers etc.  I have seen a couple of T-shirts that I thought was cool and a few knickknacks but I don't do crowds to well and there is always a crowd in this place that's probably why I have only been here twice!SN: Watch yourself when you are driving in the area especially around peek hours people are in a rush and I have seen a few fender benders.

0.description: Bootleg movies, stereo systems, speakers, clothes, shoes....everything is negotiable! You'll feel like you are in the marketplace of some 3rd world country at times but it is worth it. Take the kids here for an adventure! I give them $20 and they can buy soooooo many things. Best Value around if you don't mind dealing with crowds.

2.description: Just a bunch of junk, half of it's probably stolen... Smelly, noisy, and full of people. Not planning on returning. If you really feel like going though, I'd recommend parking on the street a few blocks east / southeast of the place to avoid the annoying long lines.Credit cards are only accepted at a few booths, so bring cash.

5.description: I will not be returnig to this flea market. i have been to flea markets in different states and this was the worst. you pay $1(.50 cents per person) to get in and honestly i wished that i didnt.  This place is big, but its ghetto, and every aisle made me cringe. i couldnt understand why i even wasted my time honestly. we walked the whole flea market, we didnt buy anything. we went for some items, but i couldnt see myself spending money in there, not even on the food. every aisle is a regurgetation of the previous aisle, some of the things they were selling you could find in your local 99cent store.

6.description: I AM MORTIFIED!  I went to this flea market this morning and I will not go back.They have a booth called Zarate's Pet Supply.  I thought I was going to cry.  There were filthy cages filled -stuffed- with animals disregarded and neglected.. dying in their own waste.  I AM NOT EXAGGERATING!  One lizard was dead  and his skin was sunken around his skeleton and had started to MOLD (in the cage with others who are going to meet the same fate soon).  I WISH I WAS EXAGGERATING!  I counted 7 different dead animals while I was there- for my 5 minute visit!  That is not even addressing how many were sickly or noticeably abused and neglected.  I have owned many different animals- I know when they are not well taken care of and it is obvious to me that this company is all about the dollar and not the animal.  There is a special place for people who do this to animals- I hope they find it... SOON!

7.description: It is good place if you are looking for cheap stuff. I got my computer repaired there for pretty decent money comparing with other repair shops and the technicians were knowledged and friendly.

8.description: This flea market is huge I been here so many times and I love this place. Just the food could use a little bit of work but other than that everything is good to go.

9.description: If you need cheap clothes, furniture, speakers, or Mexican spices - this place is for you.  If you happen to need anything else besides that, than don't really bother coming.  Admission is only 50 cents, but it's alot of the same stores over and over and over again.  Plus, I thought there would be really good homemade food, but the hot food consisted of polish sausage, hot dogs, italian beef, and nachos.  The churros were NOT good at all even!  Don't think I would go back anytime soon..

10.description: As far as flea markets go, I don't think the Buyer's Flea Market comes close to being good. True it is big, but there isn't much variety of things to be sold, and there are many many repeat stores. If you live in the area, then it's alright, but I've had better experiences at the New Maxwell Street Market downtown on Sunday morning. As far as the food, there are pretty much two stalls selling chicken, fries and pizza. I don't remember seeing much Mexican food (maybe it depends on the time of year you go), maybe some churros and pina coladas. Two stars!

4.description: Hmmm...I'm kind of perturbed at the experience Lori B. had. I've never seen dying animals up in this place. It is ghetto and kinda dirty but it's a flea market not Neiman Marcus. They have cheap things but sometimes you find old country items for your home. It's an experience.P.S. Fifty cents per person to get in. Cash only. lol

1.description: Great food, open early and late. We came with our 19 month old son, we asked for a specifically made quesadilla and it was made perfectly. The food was made fresh and the meat cut very well. Good family style food. I am very specific on the cheese quality on my food and it was definitely great and not oily. Would definitely visit again!

0.description: I wanted to add this picture of my Chilaquiles today. I don't know how this could be made to more delicious. Perfecto!

3.description: This is the closest CVS to my house, and it sells booze cheaply ($3.99 for a 6 of tallboy PBR, for example).  Those are about the two nicest things I can say about it; as has been stated, the layout is just really weird: the pharmacy is all the way to the right, unlike any other drug store I've been to.  The food is WAAAYY in the back on the right, and the booze is all the way on the left (again, unlike any other CVS), so if you're on a food-n-booze run, you pretty much have to schlep all over the store.  But I'm being nitpicky.  The staff actually are pretty nice, and again, I don't have to step foot in the nasty, overpriced liquor stores (nor risk a parking ticket) in the 'hood nearby if I want a bottle.This particular store almost merits four stars but CVS in general gets like two stars: I don't like them.  They're a lot more expensive, disorganized and have less merchandise in general than the Oscos they replaced.

1.description: I go to buy mascara, Cetaphil, cold remedies and miss Target tremendously as CVS costs considerably more but comes without the Boyfriend tantrums. Yes, he is grown- I explain this to him as well. No, I've never known a grown man able to tolerate a Target shopping expedition. I hate this place and should throw a retaliatory tantrum- but I'm grown and have my pride. For one, you have guys in the parking lot begging for change or trying to stop you to tell you some sob story... I say "No, Thank You" and go inside. I wish they could shoo out the obstacle course of beggars and cons from the parking lot!I will film a video and post it on YouTube- on my left whiny boyfriend. On my right, whiny beggar wanting cash for gas, food, bus fare... Wa, wa, wa... CVS is again, much pricier than other drug or convenience stores. It is cleaner than most Walgreens or 7-11s and usually stocks just two of anything other than toilet paper or mascara- so if you need dishwashing detergent (for a third higher cost than Target) you are frequently SOL. Toilet Paper and mascara for double the price? Always in stock. Which, besides the free tantrums, is all I ever pay too much for here anyway.

2.description: Aside from having one huge parking lot there aren't many perks to this location.  I feel like a rat in a maze, entrances and exits are blocked off, you have to enter the store through a turnstile, you can't walk out the store this way, you have to go all the way around even if you're not purchasing anything.  It's a lot walking.  And I can't understand the layout of the store.  They do seem to have a very large alcohol selection.  Which I typically feel the need to booze it up after shopping at said CVS.And unlike most CVS stores I've encountered there is no public bathroom available.  If you really need to pee at a CVS I recommend going to the location on Chicago and Western or Milwaukee and Western.  They have toilets there.

0.description: Twenty one cars could do donuts in this parking lot at the same time and they would never graze each other! The parking is that plentiful!Minuses: Security Guard felt the need to take my empty eco tote while I shopped. Okay, a man's got a job to do, but here's a tip: If you see me walking OUT with a full eco tote and not going to the checkout, that's when you nab me for stealing. I can guarantee I was the first customer here to ever bring their own bag!The layout is confusing. I'm sure I'll get used to it, but it seemed that aisles were changing direction mid-glance as if I was in Jim Henson's "Labyrinth"! I expected David Bowie to pop out at any moment to tell me about a special in cosmetics!Plusses: If you have a CVS card the deals are really good. There were great prices on a few things on my list, and because I'm a savvy CVS-card carrying shopper, I bought an extra shampoo and got a $5 coupon for my next visit, which was like getting that shampoo for free.This CVS has a huge liquor department, and it seems to do a booming business. It's good to know I can get some great deals on cheap liquor here, so close to my apartment.

4.description: Yeah, that third star is earned due to proximity to my home.I chose to go to CVS for a quick pick up of some classic home cold remedies for my pops: half gallon of OJ, Puffs with Lotion, and three cans of Campbells soup. I also brought along some change from my change cup to cash-out at their Coinstar unit. After pulling into the HUGE parking lot and picking my "favorite" spot, I loaded my pocket with that ziplock of pennies, nickels and dimes. I laughed to myself as I entered thinking if the Coinstar wasn't working. Well, hah, it wasn't. To shop with three extra pounds in one pocket makes walking a fun, marching band-type experience.This CVS did have all I needed to pick up and I believe the total was around twelve bucks.I did have to wait a minute or so as a conversation about vacations was shared amongst CVS employees and a customer, but I guess it was interesting enough that I picked up on vacation, huh?To not note their liquor section would be a tragedy. If you need most of the common drinks, check out the north side of the store.Overall, nice little stop for some of the essentials but be prepared to read those isle marquees. And if you need a Coinstar, try Jewel on Milwaukee North of Division.

28.description: Good place to come to for bikes, plus its in my neighborhood.  I didn't buy anything here since they didn't have that much in stock but I like the customer service.  I would come back.

1.description: It seems like it's all been said before, but-- I hit a pothole on my way home last night and didn't realize that I had knocked my bike seat backwards until about 20 minutes into my morning commute, when I felt like I was falling onto the back wheel. I stopped by this shop, where a guy with red hair and a great smile told me I had bent the seat beyond repair. He offered advice on picking out a new bike seat (only when asked, which I appreciated), told me a few things about the bike locks I was looking at, and didn't shame me or insinuate that I was stupid, despite the fact that what I did (riding in the morning without assessing the damage) was indeed pretty stupid.If you're looking for a place with friendly service, relatively cheap prices, standard & good gear, and a bike pump out front, this is the one. Highly highly recommend.

9.description: Awesome

29.description: Mia at CU built me my soulmate bike. I came in to try out one of the bikes they had advertised on their website, which ended up being too big for me (not difficult seeing as I am 4'8".) Mia, seeing my dismay, told me that she had a junior cross bike frame that had been donated that she'd been waiting to build up for someone. Fast forward a few weeks and I came in to try the bike out--and lo and behold, it fit without a single adjustment, and came fitted with top of the line parts and even a custom wheelset built by Alex. The staff here know their stuff and I cannot recommend any place more for people with specific bike needs like me.

23.description: I am so glad I took my very beat up, broke down bike to Ciclo.  They did a great job, did it quickly and did it for the price I had been quoted.  I am happiest about the fact that they got all the repairs right the first time unlike a few other places I've been to.  I'll definitely go back again for next my next spring tune-up.

5.description: I visited the shop a total of 3 times until they were able to fix my bike. After multiple assurances that my bike was fixed and fully repaired. I paid $81 for a mediocre tune up that wasn't even finished the first time I came to pick it up. The tune up was said to fix my flat tire among other things, in which they told me would be covered under the specific tune up package. After receiving my bike, the tire was not properly fixed to the rim, resulting in the flat not being fixed. Then having to leave my bike there for another day, they specifically explained to me it was the inner tube that needed fixing, an additional $5.49. Also having to take a $10 cab ride to work. The next morning, the tire was flat again, in which I had to walk the bike to the shop AGAIN, in order to fix the flat. They stated, it was bad tubing and replaced the tube again. They also stated after I asked them about these rips in the tire if it was the tire. They specifically said no, those are just little tears from wear and tear. Another $10 cab ride to work.The third day, my bike looked fine the tire was enflated. I went from Division/Homan to Ohio/Grand before I got yet another flat tire. I called them about the issue again, they said Ok it's probably your tire. So an addition to the $81 tune up package, plus an additional $18 for a new tire. I will hopefully pick up my bike today good and ready to go. I realize this is maybe not considered a professional shop, however, my expectations were high in the sense they should have inspected my tire the first time in order to rule out any possible issues and to proceed to the fix. As what I assume, is procedure when fixing a repair. That's how you know what repair needs to be done. The guys in the shop were friendly and seemed knowledgeable however my specific experience leads me to believe that they are not in terms of solving difficult problems. The initial bike tune up package I agreed to, in my opinion was not worth the $75 base price and I wish I would have just googled how to do simple maintenance on my bike rather than paying them to do it and would have gotten my bike fixed at Kozys Cyclery instead, as I have had much better experiences with them. All in all I wish I could receive a refund for the tune up package, but I doubt that will be happening. I paid $99 total for mediocre repairs--if you want to call them that and overall was not satisfied as their incomplete repairs have caused lead to me to be late to work almost the entire week, and paying $40 in cab fare. Not to mention the added stress I endured going through this entire process that could have been avoided and they could have had a happy customer had they finished their job in the first place. Et. Final, I will not be visiting this repair shop in the future. However it is so close to my house, I will gladly make the trek elsewhere to avoid the stress again.

31.description: Overall, Ciclo Urbano is a great addition to a growing neighborhood. As a novice cyclist, I have tinkered with an old Schwinn that I rescued 3 years ago but without the ample supply of bike repair tools I have been looking for a way to learn more and find a cost-friendly alternative to minor repairs. My first visit to the shop last week was great. I discussed wheel building and single-speed conversion with one of the guys for about 15 minutes, so I decided to come back last Saturday to see what the open shop hours were like.The open shop is great! They appear to have ample bike stands and plenty of tools, along with a bike wash station. The staff is very helpful in providing instructions of what you need to do, and with what tool you need to do it. The price is right too. They suggest donations of 10 bucks per hour you are there, which is much better than a typical shop labor rate.My only reason for holding back a star is that the same enthusiasm that I was greeted with on my initial visit was missing from the open shop visit. Also, and this is a pet peeve I have of most bike shop staff, there is still a little sense of attitude when it comes to dealing with those of us that are not bike experts. Some friendly advice for the staff: if you want to sell yourselves to the community as a place to learn, you're going to have to lower yourselves to the level of the casual biker who doesn't know anything.

25.description: For some reason, I was traveling farther away for my bike repair. But now, I certainly don't have to! These cats are right down the street! I walked in to get my back tire fixed, and it took them less than ten minutes (way faster than the hour it would have taken me!) and cost me the smallest of fees. I was incredibly impressed by their chill vibe and friendly service...and now that I see they have classes and the ability to make used bikes into custom-made-for-you bikes, I'm thinking about getting myself one! I hate to say I was surprised to have such a great place in the neighborhood...thank goodness it's growing for the better! As long as I live in Humboldt Park, this will be my bike shop.

12.description: This shop is amazing and has helped me recover my sister's stolen bike! It was stolen out of my storage unit and happened to turn up at their shop, and the manager Michael was suspicious so took note of the serial number and tracked down my sister to let her know, but it was too late to call the police since there was no confirmation. They took note of the bike and kept a look out for it, and sure enough it turned up back at the shop 2 months later! If it weren't for the amazing manager and his staff I don't think I would have ever seen this bike again. They truly went above and beyond a normal shop and really tried to help. I appreciate their integrity and honesty, and I would definitely go back to buy a bike or repairs. They also do great work servicing the local community which I have a lot of respect for. A happy ending! Thanks again!!

21.description: Great bike shop for sales and service.  My husband recently got an AMAZING deal on a used bike that had been donated.  The staff was friendly and knowledgable about what add ons the bike needed.  They also have a small but really good selection of bike accessories, including: fenders, helmets, lights, etc.  I was really impressed with their selection of youth and kids bikes.We hope to get back there soon for both service and maybe to buy a used road bike.

16.description: Excellent service & prices! Ciclo Urbano is buzzing with activity and a friendly atmosphere. I was able to get my bike repaired and save some money.I decided to ride my mountain bike on a trail for the first time this summer. Unfortunately, I got stranded with a non working bike in the middle of a forest with mosquitoes voraciously attacking me and deer feeding on grass in the background. Fortunately, I was able to walk back to civilization and have a family member give me a ride back to my car. The next day I was determined to get my bike fixed, so that I could use it before the good weather passes me by. The rear wheel on my bike wasn't moving when I moved the front pedals. I did some research on the internet and found out it had something to do with the rear hub assembly. There were several videos on YouTube were mechanics  were servicing the free hub cartridge of the rear hub.However, when I went to Performance & two Kozy's bike stores the mechanics told me the rear hub couldn't be serviced and that I had to buy a new wheel for $90, chain for $20 and rear sprocket cassette for about $40. My bike is a 16 year old Trek 820, so I didn't want to spend close to $200 for the repair. Luckily, I came across Ciclo Urbano while doing a search for bicycle repairs and used bikes on Google. As soon As I brought my bike and explained my problem, Jean Carlos & Felix knew what was causing my problem. They showed me the Shimano free hub cassette replacement part; and I gave them the ok to replace the part. Jean Carlos replaced the part within 30 minutes. He did what three other so called professional shop mechanics said was impossible or too time consuming. He let me watch him while he worked and answered a lot of my questions. You could tell he loves what he's doing. He also replaced my rear shifter cable, replaced my chain and adjusted my brakes for much less than my previous estimates.The store and bike shop have a friendly vibe and you could sense the camaraderie amongst the young mechanics. I love the fact that West Town Bikes and its store Ciclo Urbano support the youth of the community by teaching them bicycle repairs with their workshops. It's nice to see a business that supports the community instead of corporate greed. I will definitely return to Ciclo Urbano for any future repairs and purchases.

17.description: I came here looking for a bike.  As i was locking my old bike to their rack outside,  i saw a group of young men (middle schoolers) talking shop.  Ciclo Urbano has some really cool new bikes and a decent selection of used, however, nothing that fit my particular needs.  I spoke with a woman (didn't get her name) at length.  She was so wonderful.  She gave me tips about what to look for and where to look.  I   wanted so badly to support this place with a bigger purchase but instead walked out with a blinky light, great suggestions and a smile.  I know that their selection changes daily so I'll be back.  Check this place out.  They do good things.

10.description: I had a tune-up done earlier this week. The turnaround was faster than any of the four other Chicago shops I've used, and the new chain they installed is great. I could tell the bike was test driven after work was completed (because the seat height was off), and I'm glad. I'll be coming here again for things I can't fix on my own.

11.description: Went in again, and could not be happier.  This is totally my favorite bike shop in all of Chicago so far.  These guys are very unpretentious, which is greatly appreciated.  In some bike shops I've been to, I've asked how something works and was given a rushed explanation as if they didn't have the time or will to share these esoteric bike secrets to a lowly novice.  Nope, not here.  I asked what kind of fiddling was being done to my bike, and it was explained to me complete with pointing at specific things and answers to little questions along the way. I went in for a flat, but ended up getting that fixed, a new tire AND a quick little tune up for dirt cheap!  These guys are so rad, and you should absolutely get your bike fixed/tuned/filled/cleaned here.

26.description: Awesome

27.description: Here's a rarity for me: an earnest review.  But Ciclo Urbano is entirely deserving of one.  The folks at Ciclo Urbano were friendly, cool, and helped me pick out a bike that worked for me.  They also gave my girlfriend's bike a tuneup for an incredibly modest price, all within less than an hour.  And unlike every other bike shop within a 10 mile radius, the folks at Ciclo Urbano are awesome, helpful, and 100% attitude free.  I really can't recommend this place highly enough!

0.description: Hey I gotta say first class treatment all the way from their boss to the workers in the shop they believe in the red carpet treatment unlike a lot of our military processing centers but that's another story.  Brought my bike in n they killed it my bike is awesome thanks a million and as I said I'll swing some more Army pens your way. If you need work on your bicycle this is definitely the place to go to hands down.

20.description: It's been a little over a year since I had my wheels built here and they're still going strong.  I haven't even lost a spoke (hope I didn't just jinx myself).  If you own a vintage bike with original wheels, you know that braking in the rain is a nightmare.  After consulting the Internets, I learned that chromed wheels were notoriously slippery and alloy was the way to go.  That said, it was totally worth it even though they cost twice what I paid for my bike at Working Bikes.  It was a bit of an issue replacing the wheels, because originally they thought the pre-fabbed wheelsets would fit.  But because of the weird sizing on my Schwinn, they didn't fit and had to be handbuilt.  Things to keep in mind, I believe the default choice is quick release with plastic levers.  So if you have a preference for bolt-on or want to pick your own quick release skewers, make that known!  Mine function just fine, but I think the metal levers are aesthetically pleasing.  Also for some reason, any time I take my bike elsewhere for repairs they comment on my new wheels and then when I tell them about the shop, they always say they learned from Alex!

19.description: Great bike shop for sales and service.  My husband recently got an AMAZING deal on a used bike that had been donated.  The staff was friendly and knowledgable about what add ons the bike needed.  They also have a small but really good selection of bike accessories, including: fenders, helmets, lights, etc.  I was really impressed with their selection of youth and kids bikes.We hope to get back there soon for both service and maybe to buy a used road bike.

2.description: When I brought my bike out of storage the tires were flat. Of course I was not paying attention when pumping air in it and the rubber, as it was inflating, popped off the rim. Luckily I walked right to this awesome spot and brought the bike in and they fixed it right away. It took less than ten minutes and only $16. I hopped on my bike and biked 35 miles around the city today.

32.description: Okay. My bike works fabulously after taking it to Ciclo Urbano, so A+ on the mechanics. HOWEVER, I have to say that I didn't appreciate my bike being referred to---in front of me---as a "Barely Working Bike" (having bought it at Working Bikes). I don't care whether the guy who works at Ciclo Urbano has a mega beef with Working Bikes. Not professional. Clean up the customer service act and you'll have it made! Good luck!

18.description: Great shop in the front, great programs in the back. Ciclo Urbano offers affordable and honest bike repairs and a friendly staff. They offer memberships which entitle you to a discount, and you can participate in a variety of open shops (in the back) and classes (I took build-a-bike) as well as volunteer opportunities. Located on Paseo Boriqua, Ciclo Urbano/West Town Bikes is a true neighborhood gem dedicated to putting more people on bikes, and teaching kids to love bikes! Great staff, great shop, great mission.

13.description: This bike shop is very close to my house, so I have gone in consistently over the years and have seen how it changed. I used to go in and be frustrated because they did not have what I needed. Once they were even sold out of chain lube. Last year though, they got a new Manager and he has really improved the quality of service and product dramatically. Not only is he very informative and actively problem-solvies with customers to get them what they need at a price they can afford, but he also stocks the shop thoughtfully. They still don't have 20 kinds of everything you could need (I wish they had more purple accessories), but they do have all the essentials in stock consistently. They can also help you understand the difference between the products they do carry, and they are happy to special order anything that they don't. Most importantly, mechanics at Ciclo are trustworthy. I've taken my bike in in a panic, assuming that it would be a costly fix or that something needed to be replaced. They quickly took a look at it, diagnosed it and were often able to adjust away my blues for free. Now I try to go to Ciclo for all my bike needs. A great staff and proceeds support youth programming. What else could you want?

4.description: Riding home from work yesterday, I broke a spoke on my rear wheel. I had been breaking spokes recently so it was time for a new wheelset. I'm new to the hood so I needed a new local bike shop. I walked down to Ciclo Urbano and Anthony took care of my bike right before closing time with a new set. Purchased and installed while I waited! They were bumping some classic 2000s hip hop, which is great to listen to while getting your bike worked on (try it out sometime). I also had a discussion with Felix about the benefits of yoga. Definitely bring that up when you go in. Great crew, can't wait to go back for all my bicycle service needs.

24.description: Great shop in the front, great programs in the back. Ciclo Urbano offers affordable and honest bike repairs and a friendly staff. They offer memberships which entitle you to a discount, and you can participate in a variety of open shops (in the back) and classes (I took build-a-bike) as well as volunteer opportunities. Located on Paseo Boriqua, Ciclo Urbano/West Town Bikes is a true neighborhood gem dedicated to putting more people on bikes, and teaching kids to love bikes! Great staff, great shop, great mission.

6.description: On a talent scale of one to Lindsay Lohan, my bike riding skills sit very low.  Like, haven't been on a bike in 15 years low.  Suffice it to say when i made the decision to purchase a bike I didn't have the slightest clue what I was looking for.  After a recommendation from another bike store (Comrades- shout out cuz they were some cool peeps as well) I came to Ciclo Urbano looking for a used bike.  Enter Emily- clearly a seasoned rider and professional badass, she was one of the most helpful people I have ever worked with, in any vertical.  She was patient, put up with my novice like questions, sent me on a test ride and told me honestly that at that time they did not have a bike to fit my smaller than average frame.  She told me the right questions to ask and explained different options.  She invited me to check back and recommended other places to look.  Although I did end up getting a bike elsewhere because its slim pickins for us vertically challenged folks, I will certainly be back to Ciclo Urban for any service I need for Champagne in the future (yes, I gave my bike a stripper name).

22.description: Fantastic Service!!!!!!I was driving by this place on Sunday when my GF convinced me to stop here and look around. Hector made us feel valued and important even though we didn't buy an expensive bike. The prices on used and new bikes are affordable and realistic and the service is excellent. I didnt feel like I was dealing with " Bike snobs" for 1 second, and i felt like i was dealing with down to earth real people. I'll go back there for all advice and maintenance on my bike and my GF will too!!!!!

15.description: If the service at Ciclo Urbano was75% as good as its excellent social mission, I'd go back. But the service sucked (I dealt with a manager) and the work done on my bike was inadequate. I had to go to a different shop for a tune-up less than two months after I got my bike back from Ciclo Urbano.

7.description: Amazing place. Alex Wilson is truly a hero of the community. Come here to buy everything you need for a bike, forget the big corporate bike stores. This place is doing great things.Not only does this place have great products, a helpful staff and convenient location. They run a free bike workshop in the back and do camps and training for youth in the area. Feel free to drop in with random questions, everyone is super helpful.Ciclo Urbano is truly the heart of Chicago Cycling. I met the guys from this store years ago when Alex and Chopper Carl rode by me on the way to critical mass, blasting music from a bike stereo and waved for me to join in. This kind of summarizes why this place is so great. Love giving them business and donating my time to their non for profit section West Town Bikes. I encourage anyone and everyone to come check it out.

8.description: Mitzvah: a good deed done for the pure desire to do something good without expecting anything out of it for yourself.That might not be how all my people define that word, but that's how I do. Ciclo Urbano, you did me a mitzvah today. May you get lots of love in return for all the good you do.My problem: I went on a trip with my bike and when I came back and put it back together again I sort of did it wrong. And lost a few parts? I humpty-dumptied it, all right. I wanted to throw my allen wrench across the room, but I went to your shop for help instead. And not only did everything on my bike get fixed, but the lovely Brandon (I hope that was your name, man) took the time to show me how to do a better fix-it job myself the next time I pack/unpack up ye olde bike in a box.First, he encouraged me to watch everything he did up close and take in all the lessons. Seriously? Seriously.  He even asked me some questions about my bike's fit and made some small adjustments to the bars and brakes. Another amazing person in the shop went and took the slight wobble out of my back tire as well. The result? Holy crap, my bike rides better now than it ever did before. For a bike that was already well-fitted, I didn't think that was possible.Maybe it was a slower day for the crew, but even on a slow day I never would have expected this kind of attention and care, ever. It was not only the opposite of the alienation I've felt from mechanics at many other bike shops, but it was actual camaraderie. It's something that means so much and takes so little and I have only thanks to give. The handful of tips I learned will save me a lot of heartbreak in the future. Nice going, you guys. Big fan.

30.description: I have been here a couple more times since they opened and feel like they really took care of me.  I purchased a helmet which I thought was very reasonably priced.  Then I went in with a flat tire.  I know they really encourage the education part of their shop, but I work alot and just didn't have time to fix it myself.  I dropped off my bike one evening and came back for it the next day.  My flat was fixed and there was no charge.  They work for donations and only charge for material!  What an awesome place; to have this service available in a lower income neighborhood is great!

3.description: All right, y'all, here's the deal. I usually only write reviews if I've been somewhere a few times and I really have a true feel for the place. That is the case with Ciclo Urbano. I bought my bike there a year ago and have been going in here and there along the way to buy more things or have my bike looked at. The staff has always been 100% friendly and polite (and usually pretty funny too!) and I have walked out of the shop satisfied every single time. I forgot that I was due a 6 month free tune up. The manager, Michael, honored my tune up almost a full year later. They are definitely very busy so try to schedule an appointment for maintenance work. If you're going to shop for bikes and they're busy, they'll help you no doubt, but they also try to juggle all of the customers so be patient. They do bikes right. You get to try out as many bikes as you like (you just have to leave an ID at the counter) and they will make sure the bikes fit you. Everyone knows EVERYTHING about bikes there. It's amazing. And this coming from a chick whose father AND brother custom build bikes at home! So don't be afraid to ask questions about the bike, parts, labor, riding in the city, workshops on how to fix a flat, etc. They have answers. They also have community workshops in the back space. How awesome is that?!? And to sweeten the deal, the prices are very reasonable and on certain things you can bargain on the price (like the used bikes and maybe even the labor). But darn it they're so awesome and do so much good for the Humboldt Park community, they deserve every penny. Hands down the best place I've been for bikes. My still rides like a champ and now has a sweet bell, fenders, a front basket and rear rack installed. I'm ridin' with style. Go to Ciclo Urbano and find your sweet ride too!

14.description: Fantastic bike shop. I completely agree with Missy S.'s review:1) Incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, respectful staff2) Great prices and focused on customer service over cash3) Great communication with the customer during repairs4) Unbelievably fast turnaround on repairs.I've been to a dozen shops around the city and live next door to another excellent bike shop, but I still make the commute here. Highly recommended.

12.description: Turkey Chop caters to those looking for beef and pork alternatives. I was invited as a food blogger, and I had a chance to try a number of dishes, including the Turkey Chops, the Turkey Tips, Sautéed Spinach (which was prepared like greens), Sweet Potatoes, Dirty Rice, and Peach Cobbler for Dessert. (I'm surprised that I didn't instantly fall asleep after eating all of this food!)They really go all out with the Turkey Chops (like smothered pork chops) and the Turkey Tips, which were my absolute favorite. If you like rib tips, then you will love the turkey tips - they are grilled, and they are very well seasoned and are served with a tangy and delicious bbq sauce.Turkey Chop caters, so I can definitely see the turkey tips showing up on one of my party menus in the future. The prices are also very good - the turkey burgers were only $5 and they looked like they would definitely fill you up. The other thing that I loved is that they had cornbread, but it was prepared like a pancake. I've never had cornbread this way, and I really enjoyed it - vey innovative! I'll be back...

7.description: I came to Turkey Chop for the first time on 07/18/14 with my youngest son for dinner. I was referred there by a friend of mine. And I am SO GLAD I followed up on his recommendation!!! Turkey Chop is AMAZING!!! The food is EXCELLENT!!! The atmosphere is AWESOME. And the staff is WONDERFUL!!I had the turkey tips with sauteed spinach and corn. And my son had grilled shrimp with mac&chees and sweet pototoes. The Jamaican punch was nice as well; he loved it.Everything was so good, I could not wait until my oldest son got back in town the following Saturday so I could take him. We went that Saturday and he had the Texas turkey burger and fries. HE CLEANED HIS PLATE!I definitely recommend Turkey Chop as an alternative for those who does not eat beef or pork. This makes eating out so much easier! You can NOT go wrong with Turkey Chop.

19.description: My son took us to this restaurant last night and we throughly enjoyed the food, the service and the positive community spirit emanating from this charming establishment.  I had the Honey Q'd Turkey Tips, Collard Greens and Sweet Potatoes.  The turkey is sliced and grilled in a amazing way; you's swear it's a pork chop!  I'm looking forward to going back and trying the peach cobbler. Thanks!

1.description: Never order through groupon for delivery or period . We waited almost 2 hours before I finally called. They never even prepared our order because they were busy. The only good thing is that groupon gave me a $10 voucher. Oh and I got a full refund. Again, never order food for delivery

2.description: Really good food - the service was quick. I ordered ahead of time - the meat was juicy, the mac and cheese is to die for!

9.description: Im here twice a week at least. The 2 for $5 jerk tacos are very tasty and spicy. I also get the $9.99 jerk dinner with dirty rice and mashed potatoes(some of the peel is in it). You can pretty much order anything off the menu and be satisfied though.

6.description: Let me preface by saying I get to work in the community and I'm a big supporter of their efforts and mission to give West Humboldt Park residents access to healthy meals and a great place to eat!All Turkey Chop employees are great people and you feel like they are there because they want to be. Food: I ordered off the lunch menu a burrito with Jerk Chicken. It was a California-style burrito and it did pack some heat, but I really enjoyed it! A suggestion would be to allow some add-ins for the burrito (avocado, etc.).I give five stars based on the food and mission and service. This place really is great to see on this part of Chicago ave. Hope to have more options in the area.Keep up the great work!

18.description: We brought a group of 8 people here this afternoon and were super impressed with the service and the food.  Everyone was very friendly and accommodating and there were lots of healthy, but very flavorful options.  Everyone was very happy with what they ordered!  The owner sat down with us and answered our questions about how he started the restaurant and his intentions to bring a healthy alternative to beef to the neighborhood.  The heart of this restaurant is beautiful- they offer free cooking classes and free meals to people that need them.  We will definitely be back!

10.description: A little Pre Thanksgiving Turkey!Okay, let me start this review by not thanking Groupon for this deal..Geez, Groupon, I thought we were on a roll, a real meeting of the minds goingon here...Today that was pretty much squashed!Now, I have eaten at the other up and coming turkey restaurant, and I foundthat one to be 4 gobble worthy..And..
