I really wanted to like this place because it has the nicest young womannamed Crystal working there and she was working really hard and was nice toeveryone..So, this review is absolutely no reflection on Crystal...However, we started off on a bad foot when I pretty much came to Turkey Choptoday because I was craving Turkey Spaghetti and I was told due to a largecatering order they had this morning they had no more spaghetti..Well, that pretty much sucked big time because thats what I really wanted but Inow had to find a substitution..So, I decided on these Honey Q'd Turkey Tips and Some Turkey Chili..And I was offered my choice of 2 sides with the turkey tips and I chose garlicmashed potatoes and Italian style green beans, the sides were fantastic, theturkey tips were horrible..There were pieces of bones and gristle and fat??(Where the hell did the fat comefrom on that turkey?) and I actually wound up throwing most of it away..The turkey chili I thought had more promise but it was extremely/hot spicyand that kind of threw me..Also had 2 pieces of garlic bread that had way too much garlic salty stuff on it,Warning to any vampires.. Turkey Chop has lotsa garlic.. stay away.. or enterat your own risk!The restaurant interior is quite small, but there are about 8 tables, and they havesome lovely artwork on the walls, and.. they have Crystal..But, I will not be returning most likely, because for the most part exceptfor the phenominal sides this was not a good dining experience..2 gobbles is the best I can do..So disappointed....

13.description: I really have to give this place 5 stars for quality, service and atmosphere. It's not in the best neighborhood, but this place truly steps it up to deserve 5 stars.First of all, I was pleasantly greeted at the door by the owner, I think. She was real sweet and made good menu recommendations. I had the Texas Turkey Burger with the Fresh Cut Fries to go. The burger was cooked very well, tasted so good I dissolved it on two red lights home. I will be back to try more items on this menu when I'm in the neighborhood for my non-profit.Thank you Turkey Chop, real nice job on the quality and service!

16.description: Very good food and excellent service. Definitely a gem in the inner city. Highly recommend.

17.description: I was really excited to read in the newspapers and online about the owner of Turkey Chop opening a NEW place along Chicago Avenue in West Humboldt Park.  I dined in here a few weeks ago with a friend and the service was great and the prices were very very cheap. The food was really really tasty-- I think I had the best spinach quesadilla I ever had.  Also their peach cobbler was fantastic.  I am really hoping that this place will stay around for a long, long time!  My friend really enjoyed her food too.  Their fries are fresh cut and everything is very healthy and tasty.  I would totally go back!

15.description: Second time here and both times it was great. Whatever you do, definitely get the sweet potatoes and mac-n-cheese! Both are amazing. The fried shrimp was also delicious. Great addition to our neighborhood!

0.description: Great food, great staff. Met the owner, couldn't have been nicer. Looking forward to coming back here often.

5.description: Not a good experience at all ! Worst delivery service ever ! So I found turkey chop online due to its good ratings & reviews I thought I would give it a shot & was very excited . Everything started from ordering over the phone.When ordering the meal it gave me an option of two sides & corn bread, but they were all out of corn bread so I asked if could substitute it for something else & they said no I didn't have that option I would just lose out on the bread . So I chose my 2 sides of fries & Mac n cheese. So after they told me my order would be delivered "within" the hour, 2 hours passed and I hadn't received a call from them so I took it upon myself to call them & see what the status of my order was . A man answered & said "don't worry your order will be there soon, our delivery had 2 orders to deliver" so when I asked them if my food was going to be cold he answered & said "I hope not" never apologizing for the delay . Once the food arrived my drink was all watered down from the ice melting . I opened my food while the delivery driver was here to discover my fries were cold & soggy! I was very upset after waiting 2 hours  !hot drink & cold food is not what I anticipated . So I refused the food & asked to speak to management for a refund . The delivery person then told me I would have to call them . I put the delivery driver on the line (had phone on speaker) the manager was rude said "there's nothing I can do about it, you either want the food or not" Fast forward. I chose NOT . When discussing my refund I asked how long would it take for me to receive my funds on my card he said by the end of that same day .Forwarding . I had to call the NEXT day to due to no refund being processed . Management then rudely spoke to me in an angry manner saying "don't worry you'll get your money" . Due to being unable to process the refund a delivery person was sent out to give me my refund cash the next day! After all of this I chose to get a meal elsewhere! I would not recommend this place none the less delivery

11.description: Food is really good. They run out of items off the menu fairly quickly so go at the beginning of the week. Their dine in service needs some work. Staff isn't always the friendliest. Their portions are huge and definitely recommend the Mac and cheese. Almost all their items are amazing. I will definitely be back just taking my order to go next time.

8.description: I had the pleasure of visiting Turkey Chop this week with my family. The food was absolutely amazing. I ordered the turkey chops with sweet potatoes and dirty rice. When I tell you it was better than any pork chop I have ever eaten it is definitely no lie. Everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection.My boyfriend had the turkey tips with mac and cheese and roasted vegetables. His only complaint was he was mad at himself for not getting an extra order.I ordered the patty melt and fries for my son and it was delicious. Seasoned, juicy, cooked to perfection. The fries tasted as if they were homemade.If you are wondering rather or not you should give this place a try the answer is simply... Absolutely!! Not only is the food here delicious but on Mondays they close the business to the public to feed the homeless.

3.description: The food at the restaurant is amazing, people are nice and friendly, and i love that the owner gives free food back to the community an Monday's everything about Turkey Chop is simply WONDERFUL.

14.description: I was so excited to try this restaurant!  I was so extremely disappointed with the service I couldn't even give the food a chance.   At first the order was only 15 minutes late to be delivered.  Which is okay, that happens, but when I walked outside to retrieve it the delivery person discovered they brought the wrong order.  Then, I heard nothing from them for 20 more minutes. Then I get a call that they are cooking the food again.  Which was a nice gesture if it would  have been done in a timely manner. Fast forward.  The food was an hour and 45 minutes late.  When it finally came they didn't even have the food in a bag so immediately I lost the fork.   That was just so strange to not have it be in a back because there were various sauces that came with it. I will not order again from this restaurant and frankly the food was not very good. And even though they cooked it again ( supposedly)  not warm at all.  Maybe it's a better in restaurant experience because again i was so excited to try this restaurant because of the positive reviews here.  I just can't imagine giving this restaurant a second chance.  .

4.description: Nice spot to eat at. Was in the area visiting a church and this place was recommended for their soul food. I had the turkey tips with cabbage and macaroni and cheese. It was a bit pricey at $12 for the portion sizes but part of their proceeds go to soup kitchen so I can't complain with that. The mac & cheese was okay. A bit runny and a little salty but still good. Cabbage was good. Tips were a little better than good. Tips had a great flavor, well seasoned and just the right amount of bbq sauce. Others had the turkey chops with mashed potatoes and collard greens, turkey meatloaf, and jerk wrap. Everyone enjoyed their food with no leftovers accept for the meatloaf person because they do give you a huge portion of meatloaf. Even though their meals are a bit high, they have burgers and wraps for $5. I would definitely try this place again. I really appreciate that they advertise helping and giving back to the community.

1.description: When you walk into this darling little shop you are instantly inspired and can always find something for a casual night on the town or something more special like a wedding or event.  Their shop is in a super fun up and coming area of the city and is a must place to check out!!  I love that they have local designers, jewelry, scarfs to all sorts of different clothing options!  You have to go check it out!!

2.description: Lovely little store with pretty sweaters, cute jeans, nice jewelry and more. It's got a small, carefully curated selection and I'll be checking in regularly. It's a great addition to the neighborhood.

0.description: I stopped in Comfort Me a few weeks ago and was delighted to find an great selection of cozy chic clothes in a variety of price points. I bought a dress and a vest and both have turned out to be winter staples for me! Bethany, the owner, is a delight and has an awesome eye for styling and trends. Also, the interior is amazing- with vintage furniture and fixtures that I'd love to have in my own house! I love this shop and will definitely be coming back! I highly recommend this shop- it's a great destination  in a trendy part of Hyde Park.

3.description: I went to see Rich at Wild Wind on the recommendation of a friend who has the most beautiful and colorful sleeves I've ever seen. Rich brought my idea to life above and beyond my expectations. The lines are impeccable and the color is spot on. Additionally, he was a calming presence for this tattoo newb. The shop is clean and comfortable and the art installation on the back wall (which will be changed regularly) is really sweet. Great experience for my first tattoo . . . it will not be my last. I'll definitely return to Rich and Wild Wind.P.S. The laser photo backdrop is a fantastic touch!

1.description: Rich is an awesome guy. He really knows how to bring an idea to life. I came to him with a really vague idea and he turned it into a beautiful piece of art. Rich is most definitely the friendliest tattoo artist I've ever been to. We were talking about how delicious coconut flavored everything is as he was drinking some coconut flavored sparkling water. As I'm about to leave that night, he goes, "wait one sec" and comes back with my very own can of sparkling coconut water. Right on.

0.description: A few months ago I decided to finally start working on getting my sleeve done.  It has been a long time since I got a tattoo and now that I'm older I wanted to be careful about what I get.  I went in to a local tattoo shop that had decent reviews and talked to Rich.  When I showed him a pictured of what I wanted he explained to me that if this were made into a tattoo, after a few years it would blend together and I would not be happy with it any longer.  He could have said sure and made some money but he showed integrity by telling me that.  I talked to him about what was looking for.  I really like the hand sketched look and I showed him something I liked.  He went in the back and sketched up my samurai.  It looked great once it was all done;  even better healed.  I have gotten a ton of complements on how clean the lines are.  A few months later I contacted Rich again and he told me he opened his own shop and if I was still intersted he could do it at his new shop.  He did such a great job that even though it was further from my house I went by so he could  measure out where I want it and for him to make the next one look like it goes with the first. We set another appt and when I came in he had the new addition sketched up for me.  I told him what I wanted tweeked and he went back and made the changes.  He put the outline on my arm and I knew it would be perfect!  It looks great and I am already getting complements on it.  Too bad it's getting colder and I will have to cover up soon!

2.description: Rich came highly recommended to me by a good friend, is the first and only artist to tattoo me, and I have no plans to change it up. I have seen him once every year for the last three years to get a yearly tattoo and that rule is the only reason keeping me from having Rich tattoo me all the time. He is a friendly dude and honest with his assessment of customer ideas - which I appreciate as a relative newbie to tattoos. Yet to get tattooed in the new place, but excited to come in this spring.

5.description: I've been going to Rich since I moved to Chicago. Chris is also pretty cool ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

6.description: Rich is quick, friendly, professional, and extremely talented, with so much versatility in his art. The shop is so unique! Check out their "GWUG" (Get What You Get) box for $80 a piece!

7.description: I could not be happier about the tattoo that Chris did for me the other day. I have been wanting to get it for a while as it means a lot to me and Chris exceeded my expectations! I have a friend that recommended him and I am so glad he did! He took pictures of my nesting doll from my grandfather and made it a beautiful piece of art on my arm. He was very nice and easy to talk to as well. I will be recommending him to my friends and I will be back as well. Thanks Chris!

8.description: Rich is an awesome artist and great guy! He helped me turn an idea into a tattoo that I love (and since I'm not terribly artistic, it was great to have a thought partner who is). I trusted Roch  throughout the process and couldn't be happier with the result. Wishing Rich and Wild Winds success!

9.description: I've known Rich Marafioti for a good amount of time and he's done all my tattoos. I was excited to hear that he opened his own shop and going into Wild Wind tattoo did not disappoint. The space is really awesome, super clean,  and not intimidating at all. Rich is a great guy and will work with you until you are happy with what you want to get. His main goal is to make the process fun and exciting, like it should be. In terms of getting something you will have for the rest of your life, you can definitely trust Wild Wind to deliver a work of art. I will definitely stick with them for the rest of my tattoos and would (and have) recommended them to anyone.

10.description: Rich is currently working on my 3rd tat from him. He is the ONLY artist I have ever returned to for additional art. Rich's attention to detail and grey scale shading is some of the best work I ever seen and IS the best work I have on my body.

4.description: Been getting all my tattoos from Rich for quite some time. Very professional, clean and of course talented. Every time I have an idea for a tattoo he comes through with an amazing design that's almost better than my original idea. I highly recommend this place and of course Rich!

58.description: The bouncer was rude and that signature drink with the grape soda sucked! Plus when we went in there on a Wednesday night at like 10 p.m. their was about nine people in the entire bar. LAME

56.description: While subdued Monday through Thursdays, the Clipper turns into a real hootinanny on Fridays and Saturdays.  Bring cash, an open mind, and your dancin' shoes.  Great range of age cohorts, brought together by an appreciation for live music (typically dancable country-western).  A back room with patio furniture offers a quieter hangout spot, but the main area is eerie and fun with red lighting and vintage leather booths.  The tamale guy is pretty reliable around the midnight hour.  Old timey cocktails are something of their specialty, but honestly it's more of a PBR or whiskey-ginger place.

29.description: Great drinks, Excellent music jukebox, overall a great place where you take a seat and really appreciate the atmosphere and vibe. I was in Chicago with a few friends, and some of our local friends took us to this place. We went on a Monday night, so there wasn't that many people, the place has an awesome setting, and the bartenders were great! Next time i'm in Chicago, ill def make this a place to stop by.

42.description: Still cash only after the renovations. Drinks are a little more expensive now, so bring more cash than you are used to bringing.I know people are up in arms because the Clipper went through an update, but the neighborhood is changing, so business interests change as well.The upholstery in the booths looks the same but got an update, the bar got some work done, and it looks like they tried to keep some of the history that the Clipper had. I will say it was hard to read the menu cause it was so dark in the bar, despite the red mood lighting.I'm not sure how I feel about the renovations, but the times I've went it's been full and people seem to be enjoying themselves. The drinks are improved, beer list is more expansive, and the soap is better in the bathroom. Those are Sodikoff trademarks.Let's see how the neighborhood embraces Clipper 2.0.

23.description: I like this bar. You can usually eventually find a table if you're patient. It's a little crowded for my taste on weekends. But music is good and they have fun cocktails. Purple Martin. Yum.

47.description: Still a unique spot, with fantastic lighting and delicious drinks, but since they re-did things over the summer, the place just feels somehow off. Drinks are more expensive, the sidecar is not what it once was (and the bartender gave me a hassle for inquiring about the change), and overall the atmosphere feels like it is reaching to fit in with other trendy cocktail lounges on Division or Damen rather than working to its former strengths. If you've never been and want a good old fashioned, then it's definitely worth visiting. If you have loved it for a long time as my friends and I have, it's still worth visiting, but I look forward to it less than I used to. Maybe they will hit their stride again this autumn.

8.description: I regret not taking any photos of this place because the photos on yelp are not a helpful sense of what the atmosphere is like. I was expecting a more dive-y casual "lounge", maybe I got this idea judging from the outside photo of the bar. Bar or lounge? Are those different because if so I'm not trying to go anywhere on yelp that is labeled as lounge for a good time. Let me clear somethin' up. I'm not the rowdy have to dance all night type, but I appreciate a bar that invites the opportunity to meet people and welcomes all characters.I had been wanting to come here for weeks now and when I finally got in, I lasted 2 minutes. It's a decent sized place but it's all table. There are really low 4 person booth seats that FILL up the bar and no place to mingle. If I wanted to sit at a table with 3 of my friends all night I would stay at home with them rather than treck to a bar. (side note: I think I know where Heavy Feather got their inspiration..bleh) It was a bit pretentious feeling and right off the bat I did not feel comfortable being there, even with all the tequila that was in me! But, the bar was completely full, so they must be doing something right. Beats me.It's cash only and drinks are more than I'm willing to spend.

31.description: Meg and I stopped by for drinks this past Friday night; damn, I can't wait to go back.  Funny menu, classic cocktails, cool vibe, live music, board games, good prices.  We tried the Lion's Tail (of the standards offered at a few places around town, this is one I try everywhere) and the Gimlet...both were as "Easy Drinking" as the menu said they would be.  I would still take the Lion's Tail at Barrelhouse over this one, although I would take the Clipper's version over the one at Bavette's.  The Gimlet was tasty and the two drinks together were $17.  Done and done.

34.description: I never write reviews but this place deserved it.My first and only experience here happened yesterday and was absolutely terrible. I showed up at 11:15 to find a 10 person line and thought it wouldn't take long to get in...I was wrong. They were running at 1 out 1 in. After 30min I finally made it to the front of the line a bartender came out and told them to hold the line. After about 45min of waiting in line my girlfriend was able to come out and convince the bouncer to let me inside. Of course all along they kept claiming capacity althought the bar capacity was not clearly displayed anywhere inside.After waiting in line this long you would think the bar would be packed. The bar was far from packed there was many empty tables and plenty of standing room. So I tried to find a napkin or paper towel to blow my nose there was none on the bar or in the bathroom if you plan on waiting bring your own they have none. So I then started the adeventure of purchasing a drink. This can be a 30-40min adventure and they even have the audacity to brief you "this could be a while". The bartenders are very good at looking extremely busy but they can only make 1 drink at a time. It also seemed like they get overwhelmed easy and have one pace which is slow. It also appeared that the reason they held the line is because they couldn't handle servicing a packed bar.I will never return here and if you are considering it and value your time avoid it at all costs.

16.description: The bartender was rude and pompous. You want a remote hipster bar with a rude bartender you're in the right spot. I'll pass, you're not that great.

13.description: It's our first time here and my husband and I really enjoyed the venue, the look and feel of the place. The drinks are not cheap but the drinks are top notch and they do NOT skimp on the alcohol. We will definitely be coming back. Oh, and the female bartender is on FIRE!!  She rocks! Come check it out.

11.description: Such sexy lighting & everyone is always rlly nice + drinks are strong and delicious A+++++

39.description: I've been going to the Clipper for about 8 years.  With the change in management came some good things and some bad things.  The cocktails improved significantly, but the price went up by at least $3/cocktail.  The variety on the cocktail menu took a significantly positive leap.  You can get multiple cocktails made with whatever base liquor you like.  The interior is darker with the windows being covered up, but I don't mind...it's a cocktail lounge and should be dark.  Overall this is still my go to west side cocktail bar.

37.description: Oh, you know, this is only the best place in the world. After wimping out of a rainy, chilly, cookie-monster-rock-filled Riot Fest one Friday night, we were in search of 1) a bathroom and 2) a warm place to dry out and have a cocktail. Traipsing down California like hopeless nomads, we came to the Clipper, which was due to open at 8 p.m., just a few minutes later.  The doorman came out and was unwelcoming and short. ("We're not open yet," he said, as he pulled out his stool and slammed the door once again.  But mere moments later, we were carded and allowed entry. Now from the outside, I figured this would be the type of place that had specials on MGD in cans.  But when we entered, it was a beautifully cozy and warm spot.  Red leather and old-wood furniture.  I learned it had recently been restored to its mid-century greatness. After a trip to the bathroom, we bellied up to the bar and had a wonderfully friendly bartendress (didn't catch her name, unfortunately) who welcomed us and shared a small laminated book that was the cocktail menu.  Reading it by candlelight, we discovered many interesting concoctions and were overwhelmed, asking for recommendations.  We both got bourbon drinks -- the Lion's Tail and the Brown Derby -- and both were well-made.  Also, nine dollars. Take that, Violet's Hour or Aviary!  We would have stayed much longer and enjoyed more cocktails and people-watching, but were meeting other Riot Fest refugees.  I can't really speak to the crowd, as we were there right as it opened and left not that long after, so it was pleasantly empty.  Must go back soon!

0.description: Another gem in a neighborhood filled with gems. We went here for some post bowling drinks and we were not disappointed. The mood is definitively chill and laid back, and the color scheme is definitely...red.  They had some live music  playing on the Friday night we went, but honestly I was just surrounded by so many awesome people that I really didn't even hear the music. I spent the rest of the night ordering some Old Fashioned and just flowing from one convo to another with my co-workers.I will definitely  come back here when I can enjoy the ambience, but the atmosphere is plenty good. The bar has a nice old school feel, and the booths are roomy and comfy. The drinks are plenty strong, but a friendly reminder that this place is cash only. Bring a guap or a wad of wrinkled singles, however you roll, just make sure you got some paper money with you.  Have fun and  soak up the vibes.

38.description: I don't even write yelp reviews anymore, but I had to trudge out of the darkness because this place--or its "remodel"--has left my little heart broken.I was really trying to avoid seeing whatever it was morphing into and had written it off as a place to go to anymore, but it's in *my* neighborhood, blocks from my house, and I had to see. Now don't get me wrong; I wasn't just dying to hate it from the start. I like Sodikoff's Green Street Meats, for example, because even though it's not a place made for me, it does what it does well and feels right.New Clipper absolutely 100% does not.1.) The vibe is gone. It's just done, obliterated. Now it's got a failed David Lynch set vibe to it, half awkward seating at The Lodge in the front and slightly cleaned and glossy new booths as they used to be towards the back.2.) It was pretty apparent that the staff is new. For such a homey and intimate spot (despite its size), ya gotta have some charming bartenders. Alas.3.) I fear that they've gotten rid of the honky tonk and bluegrass, but I just checked their website and there's a "Coming Soon" so maybe I am wrong and the best thing that can come out of some new rich dude funding is better pay for musicians. I was simply there on a Friday night & no one was performing.4.) I got real, real pissed in a serious type of way about the fact that they are still cash only (I will never have an issue with cash only at a mom & pop establishment, I most definitely do at something basically part of a restaurant group--stop).INTERESTING FACT: they are cash only and they have a scotch that's over $200 on the menu.Let's think of what kind of crowd they're trying to attract now. Surely not me. It's okay, new Clip, the feeling is mutual. It's just me and the memories of the old place from now on.

51.description: We came with guests from italy and they did not accept foreign passports. Big disapointment.

27.description: What once was my dream bar has now become a nightmare.Where are the adequately priced cocktails?Where are the bartenders that checked their pretension at the door?Where are the horribly amazing country western bands that used to play here?What I'm getting at is I miss the atmosphere the Clipper had prior to this new ownership. They took away everything that made this place special. I might even be able to handle the slightly over-priced cocktails (especially for the area - we're not wicker park or logan square quite yet), if they still had that twangy live music I love. Worth a visit, especially if you used to frequent. Worth frequenting? That's for you to decide.

32.description: Yes more please... Saturday night review: dark and cozy.. Relaxed loungy feel to it.. Think violet hour on a casual Friday.. The staff is courteous and talented. The drinks are yummy and a little pricey. The price is justified by the customer service, the quality of the drinks and the ambiance. Plenty of bar seating (no backs on stools, I would give another star if they did)...booths and some tables round out the place. I sat at the bar but it noticed that there were not any servers. You have to order drinks from the bar regardless of were you sit. That didn't seem to bother anyone because the the place was full of customers. I had some of the best manhattans there. The music was smooth and the lighting was dim enough to see but dark enough to enjoy the mood. Leave the pretentiousness at home when you come here.. I will be back..

54.description: I had my hear broken in this bar.  Thankfully there was a Rusty Nail to keep it together.

48.description: RIP. Now the Clipper is the same as all the other craft cocktail bars popping up all over Logan Square. For a bar that has been cool since the 1930s, it amazes me that they come along and make it feel inauthentic with forced decor. Lose the pretentious attitudes, lose the lame bookshelves and leather recliners, and bring back tap beer.

44.description: Had an excellent evening here on Friday 10/17/14. Sat at the bar, directly in front of where drinks are made. Had a total of 3 cocktails. Had the improved whiskey cocktail, basically the same as the Sportsmans Cocktail at Sportsmans on Western, yet I will say it was much more aromatic which made it very delicious.My lady friend had 3 different prosecco based cocktails and raved about them all.If you want a cocktail experience in a very laid back atmosphere I'd highly recommend The California Clipper. I'll be back soon.

24.description: Super excited to go check it out after hearing rave reviews about the reno's and after going to CC ferns multiple times.. but completely disappointed.. Walked in and no signs posted about cash only... WELL my friend and I had enough cash between the two of us for 2 beers but seriously.. As a bar owner/manager/whoever.. Let folks know on the way in that it's cash only.. Bc otherwise you have the horrible bartender CHASE you out of the bar for two PBR's that weren't even touched.. We didn't even put a finger on them and the curly haired brunette chased  us out as we walked across the street to the two other options that take credit cards..Bartender lady.. Your bar was PACKED of awkward hipsters with weird beards that there was no need to chase us out when we told you.. "Sorry we didn't bring enough cash." Tend to your patrons.. Not us who didn't touch or walk out on drinks,. Sodikoff, CC ferns takes credit why not Clipper??

7.description: Met up with a Tinder date here. Big fan of grape soda on the gun, not a fan of the bartenders giving me weird looks for ordering it with rum and then finding out a few months later it's a drink special. Tinder date went ok but guy wore really high black socks with shorts and I'm pretty sure he wasn't in a band or skateboarded. He went to the bathroom and said, "I'm going to the bathroom, I'm not doing coke in there." Clearly, he was doing coke in there. Haven't been back in awhile, but with grape soda on the gun and good bathrooms for doing cocaine I might have to check it out again.

49.description: This place USED to be cool, and I'd forgive the newly-acquired pretentiousness IF: they had not TURNED AWAY THE TAMALE GUY when he tried to make his usual rounds.You have no kitchen in there, so why was this OK?! Extra star was awarded for remodeling. Lookin good. Also that one guy who works there is hot. Over and out.

40.description: Unique divey ambience, free bluegrass bands almost every night and excellent drinks. What's not to like?!

53.description: The Clipper is my favorite place to be onThursdays when Tom Musick is playing. Dim lighting, ridiculously hilarious door guys, amazing bartender and board games galore... Perfection.

30.description: Came here for drinks last night. Drinks were good but insanely overpriced. Wasn't going to write a bad review until the following happened: I realized tonight when I was getting ready to go out that I'd lost my wallet, last seen in a booth at California Clipper. I called before they opened and left a voicemail. I called back after they opened and no one answered. I called about 15 times. So I drove down to the bar to ask if they'd found my wallet. When I arrived there was a line to get in. The bouncer wouldn't let me in so that I could ask the bartenders about my wallet. He asked someone who worked there to ask at the bar and the guy came back and said no one had found a wallet. I'm sorry but a game of telephone doesn't exactly instill confidence when your cash, cards, and ID are missing. First of all, I am not scamming to get into your overpriced trying-to-be-cool bar. I just want to find my wallet. Secondly, I had to drive all the way down here because you're too cool to answer the phone, and when I arrive you're too important and popular to let me in to ask about my wallet, I have to wait on the curb? That's just poor manners. Get over yourself. Never going back here.

46.description: This is a review of the remodel. I used to go to clipper pretty frequently. The lighting is so dim now, I couldn't read the new menu, and I have good eyes. Maybe they are having trouble paying the electric bill lately! It's more like horror show red now, the lights were barely on, and everything was in a eerie red glow. I kept waiting for Freddy Cougar to pop out of one of the bars! The fake books on the bookshelves and stuffed leather chairs just seemed super pretentious, and not cool or fitting in with the character of the bar. Since, there is no way you'd be able to read them in the darkness. The boardgames appeared to be gone, but it was hard to see anything there.I ordered a Purple Martin, and the waitress said they don't have that anymore! COME ON!!! Even they though added 100 other drinks, why no purple martin? I thought that was the signature drink there! Lame. I ordered a couple other mixed drinks, and the prices seem higher now and the drinks seemed kind of off. I was hoping at least the bathrooms would have been extensively remodeled but alas, the only thing that seemed to be different was a privacy door, some fancy looking bottled soap, and an extra cheap looking sink. That was the only part that I thought needed changing, was adding clean modern bathrooms.Also, on a Saturday night there was no band. Although, they reassured me that would be forthcoming. I sure hope so! I mean this was already a classic bar from the 30's. I don't get why they had to crank up the fake pretentiousness factor. It was already a really cool place to go. Why mess with a classic? Now I'm less than excited to go back.

1.description: There's two types that go here:1. The die-hards who'd come for live music and grape pop cocktails long before the remodel.2. The newcomers who arrive in the middle of a show, take photos, play board games, don't pay attention to the music, talk loudly, ignore the musicians, binge-drink, and leave at 11 in the middle of a show because they're "bored" and want to keep bar hopping. Keep the Clipper alive. But don't be a part of the #2 subset. Appreciate the hard work that goes into live music. Dance and clap. But don't roll-up 5-deep and talk over the music and moan about how there's no seats to play a board game on, then order 10 cocktails and shots and hold-up the bartender for 30 minutes. Go to Guthrie's or some other dumb shack in Wrigleyville for that. I'm not saying the Clipper has to be a library, but you shouldn't have to act like you're at a sports bar in a college town, either. Nor be a craft cocktail snob. Nor show up in your nasty knit caps and pretend you're in some newly-undiscovered dive. Grow-up and appreciate the arts. The Clipper is the last hope in Chicago of seeing good live music without paying an arm-and-a-leg, or sitting in some stuffy concert hall.

55.description: CASH ONLY This place is dripping with history and has such a great feel, why did I never get there till only a few days ago?!? I walked in early on a Tuesday night into the glow of the red lights illuminating the walls and giving the room a cozy vibe, bellied up to the bar and ordered myself a drink. As I sipped at my beer and chatted with the bartender my eyes wandered around the bar taking in the images that so many have taken in before. She shared a folder full of old pictures, one dating all the way back to 1937... so cool. Pull up a stool and take a moment while you are there to think about all the generations that have passed through before you and revel in the fact there are no televisions to be found. Added bonus... it is allegedly haunted!!!CASH ONLY

9.description: Women can vote. Calvin Coolidge isn't President. There are more than 48 states. The Internet. There's no excuse for a CASH ONLY bar. Bartenders were pros on a Saturday just after opening,  but recognised with a disparaged eye the frantic search for cash when I was surprised with the  BS "CASH ONLY" sign (after ordering). I rarely keep cash &  have just enough for a cab home if I do, but I lucked out & had enough to cover the drink  & a small tip. Great drink. Sorry I couldn't order more &  tip a lot more as I had intended, before magically being transported back in time to an era before women could wear trousers. My last trip to a Hogsalt restaurant resulted in my portion of the bill coming out to about $170 (inclusive of 25% tip), which was promptly paid with plastic. It's just dangerous for a lady to walk about in Chicago with real cash! Please help me give you money & stop this nonsense!

26.description: drink was lovely, well crafted.  The venue has been refurbished with a caring hand. It looks fantastic

25.description: My favorite bar in my hood. It can get a little hipster snooty in there, but the bar is gorgeous and cozy and the drinks are delish. Great place to meet up with friends. They were supposed to have live music in there (which would be amazing), but I don't think they figured out how to make it work. Maybe in the future.

12.description: This place is awesome! Relaxing cozy envionment and great cocktails.

59.description: It's1938 again as you walk in....awesome neon backed bar,beautiful woodwork and great bands....cool staff and a great art deco vibe makes this one of the finest places in town....martinis and specialty drinks or shots and a beer,it's all good....not fancy by any means but still totally classy...love it!

21.description: Great atmosphere. Good drinks. Excellent service. My new favorite local bar to grab drinks.

17.description: What once was my dream bar has now become a nightmare.Where are the adequately priced cocktails?Where are the bartenders that checked their pretension at the door?Where are the horribly amazing country western bands that used to play here?What I'm getting at is I miss the atmosphere the Clipper had prior to this new ownership. They took away everything that made this place special. I might even be able to handle the slightly over-priced cocktails (especially for the area - we're not wicker park or logan square quite yet), if they still had that twangy live music I love. Worth a visit, especially if you used to frequent. Worth frequenting? That's for you to decide.

10.description: Fantastic hole in the wall with true speakeasy character! The dim red lights in here always make me feel like I'm having a secret rendezvous. Almost every night there's live music and the drinks are strong classics. They even have the James Bond vesper!Definitely a fantastic place for a date or a meeting with your local P.I. Cheers!

5.description: We went here for a joint BDAY with my best friend and had a great time. The drinks were great and the space was awesome. I highly recommend it for cocktails! CASH ONLY!

3.description: Really cool spot with really solid cocktails. There's no BS, their drink list is posted above the bar, and they are all well balanced made the right way. I had the old fashioned which was perfect. My wife had the shaved ice cocktail where shaved the ice on some 1940s machine. You can also get a beer and a shot for $3. I tried the Genesee cream ale, nice unique beer.

35.description: This place has changed after the "remodel." So dark I can't see shit. No more grape soda gun which means no more Purple Martins. Seems they ditched the "authentic" lounge feeling and went for a more polished, pretty look. I mean, it's alright and the male bartenders were handsome, but the vibe is noticeably different. Kinda sad.

19.description: Best cocktails/dive bar I have even been too. Growing up in LA this place reminds me a lot of a bar in Echo Park. I really loved all the staff members they were super sweet when it came to my questions about the cocktails. I will come back! Thank you for a lovely experience!

28.description: Cool old diner with a 50's-60's vibe. The drinks were pretty good, but nothing extraordinary. Beer and a shot for $6 is a great way to get the night started!Lots of seating so it's a good place for larger groups in my opinion.

45.description: "Leave well enough alone" someone once said. This used to be me and my hubby's favorite spot to grab ourselves a true, old fashioned cocktail in what used to be a vintage lounge where you could actually hear yourself talk.  Alas, not anymore. Now, the drinks are more expensive (fail), the decoration ostentatious, the lighting way to low, the music too loud, and the poor bartender who fixed my drink had to ask the other bartender how to make my drink (a drink that was on the menu... shouldn't you know how to make the drinks that you advertise?) We walked in, full of hope for the remodeled version of our dear Clipper, only to be disappointed with a marketed flair of "vintage". To be fair, both our drinks weren't awful. They tasted fine, in the end. The menu was the only cool thing that they added. If you are looking for a different, retro-esque experience, go ahead, give it a whirl. But if you remember what the old Clipper Lounge was like, and enjoyed and appreciated that, then you will be saddened upon walking in the doors. We will commiserate with you.

33.description: Justin Long made my drinks and it was pretty awesome. He was clearly well trained and quite knowledgeable. He told me a funny anecdote about the origin of flight. Also, I think the red lighting has the same effect on me as the yellow sun has on superman.The bearded guy winked at me a bunch. I'm not sure if I liked it or not. I will definitely be back. Probably every Friday.

43.description: How to ruin a perfectly good bar 101.This place used to be a unique spot for an affordable, non-fussy cocktail. I went back and brought some friends who have never been and I was kind of embarrassed. I talked the place up as it used to be, and lo and behold we walk into a bar that has been recently made over in a bad way. They somehow found a way to up the pretension factor to the max. The decor is forced now, feels a little too try hard, which would be fine if the bartender I had actually tried hard. I had one 'meh' cocktail and we headed off. My eyes felt like they were going to bleed 10 minutes in because of the stupid red lighting. Nothing will really bring me back here, which I'm sure won't have an impact because there is a new crowd here now anyway.It's a shame that this place changed. I think they are trying to find a way to alienate all the people that used to come here and bring in a new (read: more affluent) crowd to spend money here. I don't think I'm their target demographic anymore sadly.

2.description: Cool bar, good drinks, dim lighting. It's the sort of place where you can have a romantic date or bring someone you're embarrassed to be seen with (potentially a combination of the two).If you like fruity drinks but don't want them to taste too sweet, this place has lots of them. Prime example, their Mai Tai is one of the best I've had in a long time.Taking one star off for the country band that was playing that night. It didn't match the vibe of the place. The band was good but out of place. The moments when they took breaks from playing were also our favorite moments during the visit.

18.description: I've loved this location for years, but the new ownership's drink pricing is way, way too high. This is Humboldt Park, not the Gold Coast.  As I perused the drink list I was repeatedly stunned by about how the "standard" cocktails were priced, as well as the "upgrade" pricing... and the choice of the "upgrade".   It was laughable to anyone who's even moderately informed about bourbon. Oddly enough though, the beer pricing was reasonable.  I'd return for a beer.... perhaps more if the rockabilly bands return.  Other than that, I'm happy the place is still in business.

41.description: It would have been nice for the new owner to do his homework before ruining what used to be my favorite bar in chicago. He took the heart and soul away from what used to be the best bar in town. Bring back the old staff, especially robert and michelle. Bring back the live music. Bring back the tamale guy. Get rid of the oppressive juke box and cheesy interior. So sad.

52.description: Great old Chicago place in an up and coming area.  Look for revamped cocktail menu coming soon!

50.description: Throwback!  We stopped in here after a visit to Rootstock next door.  What a different feeling!  It's easy to imagine this place as a bustling diner in the 40s, 50s, and 60s, complete with the vinyl booths, seats, chrome everywhere, and the whole deal.They've done a good job converting it into a fun bar, and I imagine on Friday and Saturday nights this place is packed (we were there on a weeknight and it was kinda dead).  They also seem to have a music setup for some fun live music evenings. Take a look at their bar menu and try out some of their unique concoctions.  It's not cheap, but it's definitely an experienceNote: cash only :(

4.description: This was a very nice place to listen to some excellent nuscians. Nice cozy spot to chill.

6.description: Well.. This was always my Favorite bar in Chicago. Great cocktails, and the Best whisky sour in my experience so far and believe me, I am a bartender so I know what is good. The vibe is great too. But the reason I don't give it 5 stars is..The bartenders here before were cool and friendly.. And now the staff changed really often.. At least every once a while I'm here the bartender changed. I don't know what's going on. At least the drink is still good. But the last time I was here, I ordered a whisky sour again, and the price raised. I asked the bartender, "I usually got it for 10 bucks, now I wonder what whisky you got for me." And he replied, "it just the price listed on the menu."Fine... At least you should be a bit friendly and tell me what whisky it is.. I pay my bill to get a good drink not a "you are cheap" kinda suggestion. It's my favorite bar in Chicago and don't break my heart please. Luckily I'm not coming back anymore.

22.description: A once amazing place has sold put to the wanna be pretentious and snooty...uhm...maybe one out of 100 are the real deal...if that makes any sense...so sad this place has changed so much.  sigh.....

15.description: Still cash only after the renovations. Drinks are a little more expensive now, so bring more cash than you are used to bringing.I know people are up in arms because the Clipper went through an update, but the neighborhood is changing, so business interests change as well.The upholstery in the booths looks the same but got an update, the bar got some work done, and it looks like they tried to keep some of the history that the Clipper had. I will say it was hard to read the menu cause it was so dark in the bar, despite the red mood lighting.I'm not sure how I feel about the renovations, but the times I've went it's been full and people seem to be enjoying themselves. The drinks are improved, beer list is more expansive, and the soap is better in the bathroom. Those are Sodikoff trademarks.Let's see how the neighborhood embraces Clipper 2.0.

57.description: Great spot on a drinking tour Riot Fest weekend. The decor in this place is outstanding if you love old bars as I do.

20.description: It's our first time here and my husband and I really enjoyed the venue, the look and feel of the place. The drinks are not cheap but the drinks are top notch and they do NOT skimp on the alcohol. We will definitely be coming back. Oh, and the female bartender is on FIRE!!  She rocks! Come check it out.

36.description: Very cool spot. My boyfriend and stopped in for one cocktail before heading to a NYE party. The bartenders were very nice and made great drinks. Wish we could've stayed longer to hear the band. Excited to check this place out again when we can stay longer and try a few more drinks out

14.description: The clipper has great drinks, an awesome atmosphere, and often you'll even get some live music. I love that they have games to play, but the atmosphere is usually too dark to play. My only complaint is that it is cash only, but they have an ATM on site.

1.description: I love this store not only because I can walk to it while I am on lunch, but they have really cute items and all sizes. I sometimes wont go into a boutique because they only carry XS and Sm but she has larger sizes and some plus sizes which is great! The jewelery is great and unique. Prices are GREAT! I've told all my friends about it. Go check it out yourself and you can see what a cute and great store this is.

0.description: I loved the store , it was very neat and welcoming I wore a few items this weekend and got a lot of compliments , this store is definitely a must visit thank you maribel for referring me !

29.description: So, I come here a lot. At least once a week, er, twice. Everything on the menu that I have tried has been preeetty good. But what really gets me is...The prices are more than reasonable.The place is hella cleanThe guys working here are some of the friendliest in town, I swear.Good job, boys.

42.description: This place is awesome!  I'm a Humboldt Park native and it's so refreshing to have a real burger joint like this in the neighborhood.  The food is GREAT!  Fresh, non-greasy, and delicious!  You actually won't feel guilty about eating a burger and fries or a gyro b/c the food isn't the least bit oily!!!!The service is impeccable!!!  The owner and the cooks go out of their way to make sure you're comfortable and the best part is they take the time to remember you!   Whenever hubby and I go, whether together or on our own, we're treated like royalty, and that's something that just doesn't happen anymore.I've told my entire family about Nick's and we've all been blown away by the food and service.When people show you that they're grateful for your service, it makes you feel appreciated and you just have to go back.  That and the food keeps me a loyal customer!Please don't change the recipes, service, or cleanliness of your restaurant!  It truly stands out! :D

23.description: I go here at least once a week. Would go more if my cardiologist allowed it. Food is great. Service is great. They're really a step above any other greasy spoon type places in the Humboldt Park area.

8.description: Best chicken on Pita I've had. Great guy that works the counter. You can tell he respects his regulars! Check this place out if your in the neighborhood!

31.description: Definitely a Fast pace restaurant you'll keep coming back too! Delicious gyros, ribs, and shrimp basket then come back for more my fave gyro..When its busy its busy..Nick and cooks are very friendly and hospitable. Very clean place, def affordable. You'll be able to feed the entire family on the go.. Loved this place since I've discovered it.. Thanks Nick!

34.description: Yummy yummy!Ordered 2 gyros and cheese fries and was 95.5% satisfied with what we ordered. The remaining 4.5%?  Largely accredited to the fact that it's already gone and also that I wish the meat was a big crispier.Their prices are beyond fair.  The food is fresh (ya know, for burgers and gyros and fries and such).  The actual restaurant is very clean and the staff is super friendly.  I will definitely be returning.  If you're in this neighborhood, stopping in for lunch or dinner is highly recommended!They've also added some Lenten delights with a fried shrimp basket and fish sandwich.

16.description: Okay my husband and I finally went to this place last month and the service was wonderful. The food was great for the location. I really have no complaints for this place.

13.description: The food at Nick's is fresh, good, and reasonably priced. It's definitely far better than your average local fast food joint.What really makes Nick's stand out is the service and the restaurant itself. The space is extremely clean, with lots of seating, and comfortable. It's not your standard hole-in-the-wall sub shop where you can't wait to get out of there with your order. Everyone on the staff is extremely friendly, accommodating, and just nice to deal with -- again, not something most places like this seem to care about in the least.A couple added bonuses: (1) all drinks are from a self-serve fountain, so you get all the refills you want, and (2) they have an actual grill, so burgers, etc. have a nice charred flavor that definitely ups their game.My one wish would be for them to use fresh fries instead of your standard frozen crinkle cut variety, but this is not the end of the world. You get a lot of fries, by the way...probably more than I've ever been able to finish.Just note that the hot dogs, even with everything, are not quite exactly classic Chicago style, since the buns don't have poppyseeds and I don't think they use neon green relish. But whatever. The hot dogs themselves are definitely the real thing, with a great snap.Nick's deserves credit for really putting customer service and quality first. It's not gourmet food, but it's always a good experience and I make it a point of going here instead of local competitors.

11.description: Into it. This place is great, lincoln park hotdog shop feel in Humboldt. Definitely an asset to the neighborhood.

39.description: I live right around the corner from this place, so I eat here about once a week.  Totally solid burgers and fries.  I always get the onion rings as well.  The grilled chicken sandwich is awesome too, especially if you add bacon.  Nick is always extremely friendly, as is his staff.  They all recognize me as a regular.Just because they don't have a tip cup, don't be afraid to tip them.  Even if you tip them with a beer outta your 12-pack!

37.description: This is my local hot dog shop and I love it.  Everything is made to order.  A good alternative to fast food.  They arent stingy with fries so get a combo.  Damn good bacon cheesebuger.  I cant say enough of the good prices and the guys behind the line are courteous and keep the place clean.  This is a great addition to a humbolt park community starving for new buisnesses to come into the neighborhood

0.description: Gyro cheeseburger was big and tastey. Nick was behind the register taking orders, giving recommendations, and working hard. There was even a guy in front of me who thought he forgot his wallet after ordering some drinks, and Nick was going to give him the drinks anyway. Staff was friendly and warm, burgers and fries were delicious, and I will definitely be back for another extremely affordable meal!

38.description: i heart nicks on north! good gyros and Sascha is the nicest guy ever. nothing better than having a great go-to dinner place right around the corner that isn't terrible chain fast food!

27.description: Food is tasty, employees are nice, place is clean.

32.description: Good fast food. But hey how can you mess up hotdogs and gyros?

44.description: What a delight to see a good hot dog joint in Humboldt  Park!  It is one thing this area has been lacking and I am happy to see they are doing it right.  There are a few other options for dogs within a mile or so, but most of those places are filthy, have crap service and unmemorable food.  Upon walking in (just to grab a menu) I was greeted with enthusiasm from the cook.  If I hadn't just eaten, I would have definitely stayed...  so I made sure to go back two days later with my wife to eat.The first thing I will say is that this place is VERY CLEAN!  I met and spoke to the owner and found that he is from a family of restauranteurs and businesspeople that own many good places in Chicagoland including the Vas Liquor Store located in the same strip mall as Nick's on North.  He actually was going to open the restaurant in the north suburbs, and I am glad he didn't!My wife and I didn't go for a full meal, just to try it out and quench some small hunger pangs between lunch and dinner...  so we ordered a hot dog with everything, a chili cheese dog and fries (the owner threw in drinks on the house, with free fountain refills, which was very nice).  The food was great!  Good Vienna Beef snap on the dogs and everything tasted fresh.  Service was very fast and the cooks made sure to ask me exactly what I wanted on my chili cheese dog (rather than just making it with chili and cheese and throwing it in front of me).  The owner even brought our food to us at our table and cleared our table when we finished...  that is service that I think a lot of other hot dog (or fast food) places ignore, but it is one of the reasons I will be returning... not that I expect that, but it shows that they care.  If I had any small complaint it would be that the hot dog buns were not the traditional chicago steamed poppy seed buns and that the hot dog with everything didn't have sport peppers (which when I got home and looked at the menu I took 2 days earlier it said "sport peppers on request", so next time I know :).  All in all, we were very happy with the food and both of us have eaten at countless restaurant in the city.When we were eating a customer ordered cheese fries with gyros meat!  It isn't on the menu (but I am starting to think it should be without even trying it)...  and they made it for her.  Again, this is service that other restauranteurs can learn from.  Bravo!A great new spot that I will frequent and I wish them all the best in their new endeavor!  CHECK IT OUT!

24.description: I walked in, was greeted by the cook, and immediately felt I would like the place. Everyone was friendly and the food was solid. No complaints!

7.description: Friendly, fast, delicious!Excellent customer service. They'll get you in and out and on your way with yummy food in no time! Good for lunch in under 15 minutes! The greek salad w/ chicken is my go to.

40.description: The best cheeseburgers!! My husband and I loooove this place.The cookes are very nice always.

30.description: This is one of my favorite greasy spoon type joints around my house. Everything is delicious, the employees are nice and it feels like home every time you go in there. 5 stars!

1.description: Great Food, Friendly staff!! And most importantly... CLEAN BATHROOM!! If you live in the area and this a must stop place!

9.description: This is a go to greasy spon. They have good food. The owners mom makes the baklava it's delicious.

26.description: great greese pit food. the cheese fries are yummy, the prices are right, and if your not watching your weight then go for it. the inside is clean and they have dr pepper. The italian beef rocks and the gyros cheese fries are a greesey delight

25.description: From the minute the guy behind the counter asks you, "What you hungry for BOSS?" the Nick's experience starts.Everything is clean, prepared fresh, and there's a real pride to their cooking grub.Their chicken strips are the bomb, burgers have a nice taste to them from their seasoned grill, and their specials are amazing!  They had these pork chops, rice, garlic bread, and drink for 6.99 once.  I'm actually going back here today for a NICK BURGER which is a double bacon cheese burger with gyros.  Stupid right?   Yeah cause I'm stupid like that.  Stupid like a fox for great food in the 312!  5 stars, and they deserved every one of em.  Not to mention, it's a one-stop for your weekend party supplies as there's a Vas Formost next door.  Order your food, go pick up your booze, come back and it's ready.  It's a WIN-WIN!!!

12.description: My go to place. Clean, friendly staff that are very accommodating, and the food is great. Greek salad with chicken, gyros, burgers...I have tried it all and it's all quality.  Not a lot like this in Humboldt Park. Keep it up Nick!

21.description: There is "No Better Place" to eat than Nicks on North in Humboldt Park. The food is cooked on the grill served fresh and hot with the best of ingredients. The prices are reasonable considering the quality of food is outstanding. I waked in a couple weeks ago for the first time ordering a Greek salad, Chicken Shush Kabobs, and Gyro. Today was my third time there and they seem to surprise me every time I try something different. The feta cheese and olives to my surprise was of very good quality, it's hard to find good quality food in this neighborhood So I'm extremely lucky this place of mouth watering food is close to home, why should I go anywhere else when I have a piece of Greek Heaven right around the corner.  Please Try It Out For Yourselves!! I highly recommend this place and so does my entire family..

17.description: When you think Chicago food . . . U think pizza and hot dogs. . . This place has some of the best hot dogs around.. . . Plus the nick's burger. .   A double patty, double bacon, and gyro meat. .   amazing.

10.description: Nick's is great. Anyone who gives this place a bad review is my enemy and i will fight you.

5.description: The food was AMAZING!!! The only reason I don't give it a 5 star is because they didn't have a high chair for my 1 yr old boy.

35.description: Staff is super nice. The place is neat. And the burgers will blow your mind. Not ordinary greasy spoon. It's REAL substantive grilled beef. They have crinkle fries, which I love. The food was fresh. Can't believe Ive missed out this place for this long. This is really going to hurt my diet plans

19.description: Everyone that works there is friendly. Their Italian Beef is good, and they have daily specials that are great for a change of pace.

28.description: Great restaurant.Awesome food.Highly recommended !!!

3.description: Very fast service, always on time by time I get there! The food is really good. Favorite is the whole chicken dinner very tasty, gyros cheese burger really good. They're very friendly thanks

33.description: I have been to this place a few times for lunch. The place is clean. They have a lot for parking and the food is good. i have had the burgers, hot dogs, and the fries. The fries are really salty and crispy just like I like them. You get a good amount of food for the price and everything is cooked while you are waiting. The owner and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Is definitely my go to place for a quick lunch.

43.description: I had been wanting to try this place since it opened and am so glad that I did! The owner of the place is a funny guy, very entertaining as my roommates and I ordered and waited for our food. I'm not too picky about my food, but my roommate is. Not only did they make her hot dog exactly how she wanted it, but, to quote her, "It was the best hot dog EVER". I, myself, ordered the Italian Beef and it was wonderful! The facilities are very nice and clean and the staff couldn't be more charming. I recommend getting the fries. They were perfectly crisp and salted, some of the best I've had from a hot dog joint!

2.description: They do it right.  What sets it apart is the friendly staff.  They treat their customers like they're valued & appreciated.

18.description: So, I come here a lot. At least once a week, er, twice. Everything on the menu that I have tried has been preeetty good. But what really gets me is...The prices are more than reasonable.The place is hella cleanThe guys working here are some of the friendliest in town, I swear.Good job, boys.

41.description: Top notch customer service! The owner and cook are genuinely nice people and you can totally tell. So far I've only had the cheeseburger special and it was really good. They grill the meat and you can definitely taste the difference. The fries are delicious and fresh. It makes for a great treat. I'm very grateful it's in the area.

4.description: Obsessed with the Greek salad! I can literally eat it every day! It's like a neigborhood portillos!

6.description: As far as fast food goes Nick's is the best in the neighborhood. Clean, great service, fast, friendly and good quality ingredients. Their beef combo is awesome, gyros, dogs, salads and their burgers are super good too! Their menu has a lot to choose from so there is something for everyone. I hope they are here to stay. Wish they were open later but 9 is descent.

22.description: I moved to Humboldt Park a couple months ago and this is only restaurant I've ate at. I've been here a handful of times and tried almost everything on the menu. Everything is fantastic. My favorite thing on the menu has to be the chicken breast dinner. You get a ton of food for I believe under $8. On top of the food being great, the people that work there are awesome...maybe because I'm there atleast once a week lol. Seriously if you live in the area you should check this place out. Way better than the Mcds next door.

15.description: I moved to Humboldt Park a couple months ago and this is only restaurant I've ate at. I've been here a handful of times and tried almost everything on the menu. Everything is fantastic. My favorite thing on the menu has to be the chicken breast dinner. You get a ton of food for I believe under $8. On top of the food being great, the people that work there are awesome...maybe because I'm there atleast once a week lol. Seriously if you live in the area you should check this place out. Way better than the Mcds next door.

20.description: The food at Nick's is fresh, good, and reasonably priced. It's definitely far better than your average local fast food joint.What really makes Nick's stand out is the service and the restaurant itself. The space is extremely clean, with lots of seating, and comfortable. It's not your standard hole-in-the-wall sub shop where you can't wait to get out of there with your order. Everyone on the staff is extremely friendly, accommodating, and just nice to deal with -- again, not something most places like this seem to care about in the least.A couple added bonuses: (1) all drinks are from a self-serve fountain, so you get all the refills you want, and (2) they have an actual grill, so burgers, etc. have a nice charred flavor that definitely ups their game.My one wish would be for them to use fresh fries instead of your standard frozen crinkle cut variety, but this is not the end of the world. You get a lot of fries, by the way...probably more than I've ever been able to finish.Just note that the hot dogs, even with everything, are not quite exactly classic Chicago style, since the buns don't have poppyseeds and I don't think they use neon green relish. But whatever. The hot dogs themselves are definitely the real thing, with a great snap.Nick's deserves credit for really putting customer service and quality first. It's not gourmet food, but it's always a good experience and I make it a point of going here instead of local competitors.

36.description: The lads and I from work usually eat take out from here about once a week. We usually get the gyros, greek salad with chicken, or the cheeseburgers.  For a gyros stand, this place isn't too greasy (unless you get the gyros cheese fries).Humboldt Park doesn't have many great lunch options, but this one definitely doesn't disappoint.

14.description: I agree that the service is great!  Good Mozz sticks, good fries.

3.description: Space Oddities is a store for people who are into finding rarities, pastimes, and alternative worlds. From unusual x-rays and creatures fermenting in jars, to an amazing book collection and an assortment of very unique, quirky, and even haunted finds - this is a store that everyone can find something that tickles their funny (or weird) bone. Not only are the goods interesting and beautiful, but the store features local handmade goods like Tarot Decks and Prints from local Artisans. Sarah, the shop owner, is super friendly and of a supersonic clan all her own. She sometimes hosts shows to showcase local music, and features writers and local zines too. Sarah also reads Tarot cards and is a wonderful reader. She is genuinely friendly, hilarious, and eccentric in the best ways. Visiting the Store is worth it it for the added bonus of chatting with her. Highly recommended!

1.description: Go for books, jewelry, taxidermy and general witchy good vibes. Space Oddities is always hosting a tarot readings, a traveling band or some of Chicago's most interesting artists. A cozy spot that's a perfect place to stop in with a coffee on a lazy Saturday.

2.description: If you are in Humboldt Park - you should check this place out. Such a unique addition to the neighborhood. The shop is full of all things weird...which equals awesome.The artwork is killer, too. Definitely will be back!

0.description: I'd only learned of Space Oddities recently, and happened to be near its location today so I stopped in to see it in person. It's a great store with a lot of items that, I suppose, might be considered odd. In my opinion it's more of a shop that curates a relatively small but extremely interesting collection of books, tarot cards, and other things that you just can't get at your average store.I also should really compliment the service and the really funny woman running the store. It was exactly what great customer service should be. I am, currently, trying very hard not to go back tomorrow and buy a ton of great things that I resisted on this visit.

4.description: This  store is cool as hell.  Lot of great sci fi paperbacks and vintage board games.  And toys.  Just cool stuff.

58.description: "Can we go to Komoda?!" my date asks after leaving Tommy's for lunch. I had no idea what it was and she compared it to Urban Outfitters but not as gay-her words not mine. She also said she would buy everything in the store if she could. She also yelled out, "Yelp!" after seeing the 'People love us on Yelp' sticker on the window-which attests to her growing affection for Yelp.Anyway, the store reminds me of hodgepodge of apothecary, stationary store, toy store and assorted bric-a-brac store. It's a small space but it is filled with so many different items but arranged so well that it doesn't seem cluttered. The cards can be a little weird but I still really enjoyed it,  the books also had the same slightly skewed range of topics, a little weird but interesting. 'Armchair quarterback playbook,' 'Stuff every man should know' definitely an interesting selection along with other books that didn't really hold my attention. The jewelry section was what caught my date's attention which was really vast, but the display also had a collection of Buck knives as well as a lot of different lotions and perfumes, as well as some shave oil and other grooming items. The cosmopolitan mix of clothes, books, toys, stationary, jewelry and lotions is enough to earn three stars right off the bat.What else stood out was the service. My date asked where the owner's dogs were and she said they were home that day. Funny thing is that someone else came in a few minutes later and asked the same question. She still gave the same chipper reply that the dogs were home today. She was super cheerful and also ran her store the way she wanted it wanted it to be run which also impresses me. The thing that puts Komoda over the top I can sum up with the following anecdote:My date really liked this little robot toy that she wanted to buy but her practicality wouldn't allow. I surreptitiously took the little thing off the table and when my girl was busy looking around I managed to get the owner's attention while she was unpacking merchandise gestured for her not to say a word and gave her my credit card. She rang it up and even wrapped it by the time my date was ready with her purchase. It was funny that she got nervous for me but she managed to put the beautifully wrapped soon to be gift out of sight, rang my date's purchase up, hid my receipt out of the sight of my girl's eyes and then packed my stuff into a bag before my date could even notice what was in my shopping bag. I can't express just how above and beyond she went it's an effort like this that would keep me coming back.

56.description: Sherri is the sweetest person. I love that a place can exist where a little boy is riding his tricycle around, followed by 2 watchful and friendly dogs, and all sorts of adorable little things can be purchased. I don't think there's a single thing in there that I wouldn't like to own. The only reason I don't go in more often is because I ALWAYS walk out of there having spent money that I shouldn't have.

29.description: Komoda is a great place- a wide assortment of gifts and things you want to buy for yourself and friends. Gifts for babies, the full Tokyo Milk line, beautiful handmade jewelry, and unique planters and handmade items. I always walk out with something. The owner, Sheri, will remember your name and wave hi as you walk past- she is really very sweet. She let me borrow a piece of jewelry until she had ordered more into the shop! When the item arrived in the shop, she emailed me right away. It really went above and beyond the average customer service experience. This is a local business that I will continue to support, and you should too.

42.description: This shop was highly recommended to me, and I was in need of gifts and in the neighborhood-ish. Sherri was quite lovely. And the shop was intriguing...I wanted to touch everything and buy all of it.  Well curated array.  This place is definitely trouble, but I'll be back for serious, many times.

23.description: I've been getting the most unique and lovely gifts for myself, my buddies, and the women in my life from Sherri since she founded Komoda on Chicago Ave. and for years and years before when she was a principal of another shop (that is decidedly less fabulous without her). Sherri pours her heart into keeping a collection of remarkable items in a way that I can only describe as curating. In short (not so short), she's been the go-to source for books, plants, dishes, aprons, cards, lotions, soaps, fragrances, corkscrews, wallets, incense, japanese teapots and cups (!), and on and on for people I love every Mother's Day, birthday, Chanukah, and Christmas for a decade. I can't recommend this place enough. And I always treat myself to some gummi bears or Pop Rocks on the way out. Absolutely lovely.

47.description: SO shoot me.... I don't really venture west of western in my neighborhood... There, for a long time ,wasn't much to venture to. The only thing on Chicago west of western I would go was star coffee bar. But this place is a stand out. cute accessories, soaps and perfume and paper goods ( as well as other goodies as well as nostalgia in the form of candy ). The owner and store pups are awesome too!! It  made for a perfect little trip after brunch at bite! I will be back for some unique gifts soon!!

8.description: super cute shop! :) thanks for being so kind and helpful! I bought a book called "artists, writers, thinkers and dreamers: 50 portraits of famous folks and all their weird stuff" and a bunch of other random goodies. she added a free chapstick! love!

31.description: This store is so lovely!  The products offered range from cool books and beautiful soaps, to personal cards, jewlery, and chicago knicknacks.  Great personal, unique gifts.  Prices are very fair too. What make the store even more charming is its owner.  She is usually perched behind her register entertaining one of her well-behaved kids whom frequent the store as much as she does!  Her very helpful, no pressure approach makes the shopping experience so serene and organic.  The the other woman who works with her is equally as lovely, who also totes around a very charming daughter.  Love supporting this business!

34.description: Komoda is seriously the best place ever.  If you ever need to find someone a last-minute gift, or you feel like treating yourself to (literally) anything, this is the place to go.  I could lose myself in all of the awesome items at Komoda: jewelry, books, stationery, toiletries, accessories, toys, candles.  I've bought Christmas cards, jewelry, and many birthday gifts here.  The owner is almost always in the shop, and she's so friendly and helpful.

16.description: I'm sure that Komoda has enough reviews to keep people shopping here for eternity, but I just want to add my recommendation to the pile. I've been coming here about twice a year for 6 years. I do most of my gift buying at Komoda, because it has a little something for everyone, and because everything is well-priced and great quality. Although I don't come in all that often, Sherri always remembers me and takes the time to catch up with me. In such a big city as Chicago, it is hard sometimes to feel a sense of community, but Komoda provides just that.

13.description: Komoda is an awesome little shop with a vast array of aesthetically pleasing arts, crafts, housewares, oddities, books, greeting cards, gift ideas, incense, candles..you name it! I don't know what the location held before, but the interior has a sort of old-fashioned feel to it, with a modern, bohemian vibe coursing through. I unfortunately decided to first explore the shop just a few months before I moved out of the neighborhood (on Valentine's Day no less), but was very warmly greeted by friendly owner Sherri and her lovely co-worker Liz. I ended up buying some candles and incense that were both of high quality and reasonably priced. I mentioned a book I had recently illustrated, left a copy a few weeks later, and they were kind enough to put it on consignment and sold it within a few weeks! Komoda is a great little business and I highly recommend swinging through and savoring the warm, creative atmosphere and treasure trove of items for perusal and sale.

11.description: Super nice proprietor, great selection of hard to find gifts and quality books, cards, and all kinds of neat stuff behind the counter. Awesome place to stop in and browse.

39.description: I love this store. I feel like Komoda has everything, soaps, scents, jewelry, even quality chidlren's toys and books.I love the atmosphere of the shop too, it's always calm and feels like an old apothecary. I got a great deal on lotion, and a natural smelling perfume. I would've spent way more at Whole Foods for the same kinds of items. Plus, who doesn't love awesome customer service?

37.description: It smells great, it looks great, and you can have a fun time just browsing. For creative gift-giving, it's the only choice for miles around, the prices are right, and on top of it all the owner is just a super-nice person. You could even just treat yourself to something fun for no reason, if you were crazy enough...
