0.description: I found a nice birthday card for my grandmotherNice small book collection, they have 'LOST DETROIT', cheaper than the price at barnes and noble. Many other random cool stuff

38.description: I am posting my first review for this store, because I truly believe that it is one of the treasures of Chicago. A real gift store for ANY person...I buy stuff for my Mom in particular because they have really great jewelry that is reasonably priced - but really impressive.Guys - it can be hard to shop - right? Well this spot is a place where you can shop, find cool stuff for some lady in your life and STILL find something cool you might want for yourself of one of your guy friends.

51.description: I went here when I was waiting for my bro-in-law to show up at the framing place across the street.  Initial impression I had was that this would be one of those overpriced boutiques that would have lots of useless things and a few neat things that were way expensive.  Fortunately that's not what it was actually like.There are lots of neat things, and a few were pricey, but most things were at a real good price.  Ended up getting a scarf for a present and the recipient liked it a lot, and it was a great deal.  It was also wrapped up (and very nicely) at no extra charge.  I also got an bromeliad.  The shopkeep has a big table of air plants, all in good condition, and many kinds I haven't seen before.  You can tell that they are well loved.So I'd say this is definitely worth going out of your way, if you need a gift or just want to get something fun for yourself.

27.description: A true gem...I have never seen a shop like this in Chicago at all. I just followed a loving female friend on her journey to seek out a perfume that could make you smell like books in a library, dew under a tree, or a beach in the year 1966. Though I did not buy anything, I really liked hanging out at the store and something is motivating me to go back and look at some of the other things that I did not look into more detail. Check out the shop right next door as well for some cool pieces of clothing designed by independent designers. I got a really nice fedora (that's what I would call it I guess) from there. I really want to go back to the Ukrainian Village :(

32.description: Fantastic find wondering my neighborhood with very cool items, unique, reasonably priced, beautiful jewelry, friendly and helpful owner with tons of gems to sooth the gypsy soul.

54.description: This store is absolutely amazing.  I always been able to find a gift for a loved one here no matter how picky they are.  There is a great selection of jewelry very reasonably priced that I just love to browse every time I walk in to the store.  Sherri is a very helpful and sweet natured person whose adorable family and dogs often greet you when you come in.  I love this store so much that it is the first place I go when shopping for myself or others.  You can find just about anything here from unique books, cook books, arts and crafts, baby clothes, awesome hats, t-shirts, various artists art work in forms of books and posters.  In one visit I was able to shop for my entire family for the holidays!  I recently purchased a beautiful bracelet for myself and a fun art project kit to explore this weekend.  Thank you Sherri for you wonderful store!

48.description: The owner is the most amazing lady you will meet.Store is awesome.  Great place for knickknacks and gifts as well as for your own personal use, soaps, earrings, diffusers, clothing, even the pencils are awesome!

44.description: I love this place!! I have been getting all my greeting cards here because the majority of them are designed by local Chicago artists. They are witty, quirky, and you're guaranteed not to find anything like them in the Hallmark isle of the local CVS. Recently I started shopping there for gifts in addition to just the cards and have found some great finds. The owner helped me pick out a necklace for a friend's birthday, and when I went in more than a month later she remembered and asked me as soon as I walked in how she ended up liking the necklace!! That is great costumer service :) and totally had me hooked. I love supporting local places, and she will be getting a lot more of my business in the future. Places like this make me happy to spend my money!

24.description: I literally do not understand how one could not love this shop. If you stop by, I guarantee that you will find a gift/adorable little knickknack for yourself or for a friend that you will absolutely not be able to resist buying. The shop's owner is so sweet and helpful and seemed to know every other person who walked through the door, which I loved. There are tons of unique jewelry, stationery, toys/gadgets, books, soaps/candles/fragrances etc. Definitely worth a visit!

7.description: I love this store for gifts.  There is always something new and interesting.  I'm also a huge fan of the Tokyo Milk perfume they carry.

49.description: The owner of Komoda personally delivered a gift to me that my fiance purchased for me over the phone.  Amazing.  I love the ring that he bought, and I had a great time looking around the store.  This place has so many wonderful cards and gifts... I could spend all day and an entire paycheck here! Great customer service and a great selection make me give this place five stars.

40.description: As a guy, this has got to be one of the best places in Chicago to go when I'm looking for that special gift for my fiancee. The prices are right in line with my budget, there's a vast selection of items in the store, from perfumes; soap; jewelry; incense; books...basically items that you don't really see anywhere else. I recently purchased from Komoda a huge bar of olive oil soap (pre de Province--Marseille) and a dish for it to sit on. My fiancee, Jen, thought it was the perfect addition to our bathroom. She really likes the soap because of the moisturizing compounds mostly  consisting of olive oil. I use it because it leaves my skin feeling clean but not dry, especially after shaving. Awesome!My overall experience with Komoda always leaves me feeling as though I've been on a journey to another part of the world: Remember Harry Potter in his earlier movies when he goes to 'Diagon Alley? He exclaims, "...It's like magic!" Well, that's one of the ways that I feel about going into Komoda. On my last visit there and speaking with Sherri (the shop owner, who has this uncanny ability to remember her customers by first names), I told her that coming into her shop was akin to going to visit my aunt as a child. My aunt had so many different and wonderful things to examine and explore; it was the equivalent of an adventure...exciting; mysterious; loads of fun; nice smells--like I could just stay there forever.  Anyway, this is a great place to shop where you not only get great customer service (direct from the owner herself), but you walk out feeling as though you know that you'll be back, even if you didn't make a purchase. When I first visited the shop I didn't make a purchase. Just merely made observations. When I walked out I knew I would be back. And I have every since (three years).My bet is that once you walk in, you're hooked. Sherri and Dominick are as down-to-earth, warm  and friendly as you could expect. Dominick is behind the scenes and works the technical end of the business (Hope you have the chance to meet him at some point--cool beans).  BTW--Keep your eyes peeled for their online store coming very soon! This will be a great value for the customers who have been coming to Komoda since they first opened in 2005 and for those yet to experience what this shop has to offer.Here's a little more insight into what Komoda offers, check out  the link:: Apartment Therapy...http://www.apartmenttherapy.com/chicago/gift-guides/lastminute-gift-ideas-from-komoda-0726­81.

53.description: I have to restrain myself from going into Komoda because I want to buy everything. Gifts? Check. Tons of little tchochkes at a wide variety of price points, plus a few onesies thrown in for the babies. Lots of handmade cards to boot.Cookbooks? Check. I NEED that copy of the Slow-Cooker Cookbook.Jewelry? Check. I am picky when it comes to all things girly, but in Komoda, I want to try everything on.Overall, a great place for gifts and presents for yourself at the west end of Ukrainian Village.

30.description: Komoda is my first choice when I need to find a birthday, housewarming, baby, etc. gift (and, occasionally when I just need a little gift for myself).  The owner is seriously one of the nicest people in the world and offers great advice if you need help finding that perfect something.  Do yourself a favor and check out Komoda!!

46.description: Komoda is my favorite store for gift buying, both for myself and my loved ones. Sherri is always warm and welcoming. I love the vibe in the store and the way everything is set up. I introduced myself the first time I came into the store, as I own a small business in the neighborhood and she has remembered me and greeted me by name ever since! She always makes you feel welcome and will go above and beyond to help you find the perfect gift. I love being able to support local businesses and she sells a lot of products from Chicago artists.  The jewelry selection is phenomenal, at all price points.  You will not be disappointed!

1.description: I was in Chicago to visit a dear friend, and his family in mid-September. Before returning to NYC, I asked my friend's wife, where I should go to buy things for people back in Manhattan. Without hesitation, she suggested I go to "her favorite store in Chicago". This was exactly the suggestion I wanted, as I wasn't really interested in buying people back home anything. Instead, I intended to find a gift for her, and their amazing young daughter, for welcoming me into their home so graciously.I headed down to Komoda on a late Monday afternoon. I pored over an array of quality products, and intelligent gift ideas. As usual, I was quickly overwhelmed with trying to find the 'perfect gift', which this situation called for. I soon found myself consulting the sales associate on duty, Linda.I explained to Linda exactly what brought me into the store, with little expectation that sharing my situation would bring me closer to finding the 'exact gift' that I needed. Linda (who only works once a week-so she's not as familiar with the regulars) was quick to suggest that she call the owner of the store (Sherry), because she 'had a photographic memory' of the stores customers. I agreed. Once Linda had shared some of my description of my friend (and his family) Sherry quickly filled in some blanks, describing their daughter's name, and professions. I was so absolutely surprised by the immediate connection. Sherry made a suggestion (through Linda) from past purchases of my friends wife, which I followed exactly. I also found a couple very cool gifts for the precious youngest lady in the house, including a mind challenging activity book. I even threw in a couple extra things that I didn't come for, likely because I felt so good about the entire experience.In closing, I can certainly see why this store came so highly recommended. Linda was thorough, kind, sweet, friendly, patient, creative and professional helping me find 'the perfect gift'. Her approach to her job I found highly commendable for an employee who only works once a week. I assume that has a lot to do with the hiring and training procedure (starting from the top down), focused on the right person for the company. I was also absolutely impressed at how in tune with her customers the owner Sherry was. It was easy to see that calling her for this kind of information was not frowned upon, to satisfy their client. I felt that this was such a respectable, professional, high-class operation and business, that it has led me to leave this (my first) review on Yelp.

55.description: Dear Komoda,Based on my previous successes with Komoda, I am now permanently stuck in birthday gift buying procrastination mode.  Who says you have to think long and hard for the perfect birthday gift?  Not me!I trust to the furthest extent of my gift giving potential, that you will always have the birthday gift I can't wait to give.  And given your proximity to me (exactly a block away) and ease of gift selection, I now wait until the absolute last minute to buy gifts for my near and dear friends and family (as in picking up the gift on the way to the party).And as such, I will need you to extend your store hours to 7 on Saturdays, possibly 8; or even 9.  At least.  I shudder to think what would have happened if I had decided to stop by for my brother's 40th birthday gift on the way to his surprise party at 6:00 like I originally intended to and found the store closed.  I surely would have cursed loudly and kicked something.  But, the fear of showing up with some lame card from CVS and possibly a battery charger urged me off of the couch and around the corner to Komoda (while Law and Order was on, mind you) with a whole hour to spare before you dimmed your lights and locked the doors.You have yet to fail me.  A wonderful box o' buddist-related trinkets for my mom last year; a handy and original do-it-yourself duct tape wallet for my college buddy in Baltimore.  Sigh, the gift giving goes on and on.  Cool, original, things and easy on the budget.  Thanks,A neighbor on Rice Street

9.description: A definite keeper! I come back every time were in Chicago. After moving to Texas I realized that I'd never find a cozy nook like Komoda. I could spend hours in there looking at every item, which tells you everything is carefully picked. The owner is awesome and has a great aura, there is something for everybody and everything- this is the only place I can find beautiful and unique earrings(being an earring fanatic). After getting broken in, I had to begin my earring collection  again, first stop, Komoda. I bought my pair and the owner gave me a pair :) I cherish ever piece I have. My 10 yr old is just as hooked, so we make it a point to stop by every visit. There are plenty of shops but Komoda feels like home.

26.description: This store is fantastic!  Great gift finds for anyone and Sheri is wonderful.  I was looking for a gift for a christening and she emailed me when a necklace came in that I was looking for.  They always seem to have what I'm looking for and the shop smells so good!

25.description: Extremely friendly and full of unique gifts!

12.description: I live down the street walk past it everyday. Finally walked in and I love it. Got some incense and mustache wax and a molesting. They got a bit of everything

59.description: shit i love this store.  so cute and not terribly expensive compared to other as-adorable boutiques.  got a ring as a gift that wouldn't fit over my ginormous knuckles so i headed over to see if they had something else.  i could have bought everything in it and they gladly exchanged it for the cutest pair of teal flower earrings on earth.  le sigh.  in love.

21.description: Sherri, the owner, is great! I was just looking for a bow for a present and Sherri offered to tie one for me and she used her own material without any charge for the ribbon or the service.  The store is very cute with lots of fun little trinkets, letter press cards, jewelry, perfumes and more.  It's definitely a great place to buy a gift for someone and has great customer service!

17.description: I literally do not understand how one could not love this shop. If you stop by, I guarantee that you will find a gift/adorable little knickknack for yourself or for a friend that you will absolutely not be able to resist buying. The shop's owner is so sweet and helpful and seemed to know every other person who walked through the door, which I loved. There are tons of unique jewelry, stationery, toys/gadgets, books, soaps/candles/fragrances etc. Definitely worth a visit!

10.description: This is a must see gift shop! Not only do they have unique items, the owner is hands on and makes great strides to help with gift ideas. I hit the mother load last holiday season here and found some incredible gifts. I stopped in a few weeks back looking for a specific item, and needed something quickly because I came up with an idea last minute and realized I was missing a basket for the gift's presentation. The owner was so helpful - she ended up finding exactly what I needed (which ended up being a basket she was using). She happily let me have it. I'm not writing this to encourage that she gives items to customers as we all know she has a business to run. This gesture made me a customer for life - not everyone goes out of their way like she did. Highly recommend this wonderful store!! Perfect for the gift you didn't know existed and very likely the person receiving the gift has nothing like it!

5.description: LOVE this place! Owner is a wonderful person, store has great gifts with totally reasonable prices. I almost always come here for any gift giving occasion. Highly recommend and great way to shop local!

3.description: Cutest...store....ever. What an awesome place to buy gifts. It takes me forever to get out of here!!! Bring a cup of coffee with you and take your time.

35.description: Great Store! The owner is very sweet and even remembered my name! They had so many wonderful gifts there and really unusual jewelry, one of my new favorite boutiques for sure.

19.description: Komoda is a great place- a wide assortment of gifts and things you want to buy for yourself and friends. Gifts for babies, the full Tokyo Milk line, beautiful handmade jewelry, and unique planters and handmade items. I always walk out with something. The owner, Sheri, will remember your name and wave hi as you walk past- she is really very sweet. She let me borrow a piece of jewelry until she had ordered more into the shop! When the item arrived in the shop, she emailed me right away. It really went above and beyond the average customer service experience. This is a local business that I will continue to support, and you should too.

28.description: This place is a gem filled with a myriad of mini-gems!Komoda hosts an array of gift items for men, women and children. I visited recently for the first time, searching for a birthday gift. The shop's owner, Sheri, was helpful yet unassuming. She introduced me to her fantastic collection of candles, soaps (some of which are made locally!), personal fragrances and unique cards. Komoda carries the Tokyo Milk brand, which is sure to please anyone on your gift list with an array of personal care products.The prices are superbly fair, which makes arranging the perfect gift package all the more enjoyable.If you live in West Town/Humboldt Park, this should certainly be your most-frequented shop. If you don't live in the area, take a field trip -- you won't be disappointed!

45.description: I love  this store, I stop by here at least once a month and always find something I can't live without.  Sherri has a TON of super cool cards, kids stuff, winter accessories and fabulous, fabulous jewelry.  If you live in the neighborhood you should help support a local gift shop like Komoda, we need more stores like this!!  If you don't live in the 'hood, parking is easy and everything is much less pricey than those gift stores in Wicker Park... plus we're nicer in UkVille :D

33.description: Great hidden gem! I live on the north side so when I saw this place and went in I was so excited to find this great spot. The store is adorable, something for everyone and oh the jewelry. Definitely a place to check out and find a unique something for your favorite people.

43.description: Best store ever! This is the only place I will buy cards! They carry tons of locally crafted cards and I definitely get tons of compliments on how amazing the cards are once I send them!  They carry a lot of other really cool things- definitely a must stop if you need some great cards and a gift and a little gift for yourself too!

2.description: This is my card and gift go-to! Lovingly picked selection of unique, often hand-crafted gifts. She highlights a lot of local artists. The owner clearly loves what she does and is a wonderful person. No pushy sales like boutique places "on the high streets" of Damen and Division, just a genuine person there to help you if you need it. Beautiful jewelry, fun little toys. I'm totally going there today to wrap up some holiday gifts. Seriously, it's a treasure!

18.description: This place is a gem filled with a myriad of mini-gems!Komoda hosts an array of gift items for men, women and children. I visited recently for the first time, searching for a birthday gift. The shop's owner, Sheri, was helpful yet unassuming. She introduced me to her fantastic collection of candles, soaps (some of which are made locally!), personal fragrances and unique cards. Komoda carries the Tokyo Milk brand, which is sure to please anyone on your gift list with an array of personal care products.The prices are superbly fair, which makes arranging the perfect gift package all the more enjoyable.If you live in West Town/Humboldt Park, this should certainly be your most-frequented shop. If you don't live in the area, take a field trip -- you won't be disappointed!

41.description: What a charming little secret of a store to have right by my home!Komoda is a go-to for gifts for anyone. I popped in several times during Christmas season, and it is the only place I buy cards for anyone. Jewelry, gifts, soaps, cute home decor, everything. I love it.Plus the owner is so nice and there's usually an animal roaming around inside. And she'll wrap anything for you!I hope more people learn about this awesome local store full of local merchants and keeps it going for a long time. It rules.

52.description: LOVE this store!  I went with my best friend on a recent visit.  When we first walked in, we were underwhelmed.  However, the longer we were in the store, the more we fell in love.  Her husband, who normally hates shopping, didn't want to leave.  :)They have a ton of cute, unique stuff - and it's all very reasonably priced.  In fact - ten minutes after I left the store and went to another in the area, I saw three of the same items marked 20-50% higher.A few of my favs: rings made with vintage buttons from the 1800s and early 1900s, air plants ($2-4) that you can hang in clear glass globes, and an adorable little windup robot that dances.

50.description: I went here to get a birthday gift for a friend. Tons of cute stuff, some I've seen before with other non cutesy stuff like BUCK KNIVES! The decor is all salvage yard type and the owner was really nice and talkative. I will be going here for all my gift needs from here on out!

4.description: Komonda is a wonderful gift shop and my favorite so far. I still thank the relative who brought me to this shop when I was looking for good gifts for the last Christmas season. Not only did I find creative gift ideas from the shop owner but also a beautiful basket to present my gifts in for free. I have been to Komonda twice and I just won't stop going there.

6.description: This is a wonderful, locally owned shop that has a great variety to offer. I can't imagine walking out of here without finding something to get.They have books, art, incense, household novelties and trinkets, jewelry, bath and shower accessories, and my personal favorite, wet shaving accessories. If you're looking for shave soaps or other wet shaving accoutrements in Westtown, check them out.

22.description: This is my go to place when it comes to last minute gifts, care packages items, etc.... Love this store! Owners are extremely personable and sweet!

15.description: Cool stuff - pocket knives, wallets, stationary, gadgets, trinkets, soaps. Fun to browse.

57.description: I used to have the honor of living across the street from Komoda. I would visit the store and Sherri, the fabulous owner, regularly and admire all of the fun, beautiful, and interesting items she carries there. I always took my family when they came to visit and she remembered our names and preferences. TRUE customer service! I am an especially big fan of Komoda's selection of jewelry, and this was my go-to place for buying presents for friends and family. I really miss it!

20.description: Just an absolutely awesome place.  I had such a good time looking around there.   Walked out with many items.  The owner is beyond helpful and nice.   Such a great place and great owner.

36.description: I LOVE this store!  Perfect place to pick up a gift for anyone.... kids & adults alike.  I always stop in when I'm on my way somewhere and the owner always helps me figure out a perfect gift.  (Plus I like to get a little something for myself as well!)  Very unique selection of jewelry, a lot of it is locally handmade.  And she carries a range of very inexpensive items to ones that are skillfully crafted and more on the indulgent side.  HORRAY KOMODA!

14.description: Amazing, well-curated collection of gifts and special finds for anyone on your shopping list (including yourself)!! I found myself picking up various items and imagining them looking equally as lovely in my home. Wonderful special gifts, terrific customer service, and gorgeous presentation! I can't wait to visit again!

0.description: Accents is the convenience store/gift shop located inside the Sheraton Chicago Hotel & Towers.All the normal convenience store/gift shop stuff is here. Toiletries, snacks, bottled water, soda, newspapers, magazines, books, clothing, tourist knick-knacks, etc.And of course the usual sky high prices.

3.description: I recently held my wedding there and I must admit, it was beautiful.  I loved the way it looked and I especially loved the help and service.  This was a beautiful venue.  I recommend it for anyone and any event.  The staff went above and beyond to ensure my night was perfect...and it was!

1.description: The Institute of Puerto Rican Art & Culture (IPRAC) is housed in an old horse stable right in Humboldt Park. Parking in their lot is free, and IPRAC is also easily accesible from the #70 Division bus.As I wandered in off the street I was kindly greeted by Elijah and I asked about their art exhibit and if I could go on in. Not only did he show me where the art was, he gave me a detailed tour of their inaugural exhibit "Lo Que Trajo el Barco", explaining each and every piece of art to me, including answering my questions about Puerto Rican culture and what certain Puerto Rican symbolism meant. Incredible service! IPRAC's mission is to build awareness and showcase Puerto Rican art, and to make it accessible to all visitors. Mission accomplished.The art exhibit was well worth a visit, but small, so I was also shown other public spaces that will be available for rent or for community classes. The building used to be a horse's stable back in the day that German immigrants prevailed in the area and the hayloft and basement are still unfinished in that style (although I wish I could have seen those, but did not). As dignitaries (hopefully the deep pocket kind) were being given a tour prior to an opening Gala for "A year of Antonio Martorell in Chicago 2011 - 12", I was also shown indoor and outdoor space available for rental. Check out IPRAC's website for event space rental options. IPRAC is a great example of how vacant space can be used to improve the lives of the local community at large. I wish I knew how to say "I wish you many fruitful years" in Puerto Rican slang, but a hearty "Viva!" will have to do.

2.description: I recently attended a party at the IPRAC and it is a beautiful space.  This party used the outdoor courtyard as well as some of the indoor space.  The courtyard was set up with a tent to shield from the sun and potential rain.  I was able to look at some of the artwork which was quite interesting.  It definitely left me with the desire to go back and enjoy the rest of the museum on a regular day.  Hoping to make it back this summer.

0.description: This recent addition to the museums in Chicago is a great example of landmark-quality buildings that sat too-long neglected and are now being revived through strong community dedication. Built at the turn of the last century, when German families were the majority inhabitants of Humboldt Park (and only 30 years after the area received that name), it served then a useful purpose: caring for the carriages and horses of the visitors to the grand park land. After the waning of the age of horse-drawn transportation, the stables building fell into disuse and neglect. Almost a hundred years later, the community and the city's Park District were moved to restore the building. But in 1992, a serious fire destroyed much of the roof and some of the ground floor. Rebuilding that took 6 years. More renovations are ongoing.Today, the building looks brand new, but historically accurate, due to the efforts to make it into the IPRAC. The institute was one of the participating sites in the second *Open House Chicago weekend event (Oct. 13 &14, 2012)*, opening its doors to the general public free of admission charge for guided tours of the facilities. The Institute can host your special event, wedding, or corporate meeting with many amenities you will not find elsewhere. It is well worth your visit as a Chicagoan or an appreciator of architecture. Underway is the restoration of the corner office of Danish immigrant and master landscape architect Jens Jensen, who in the 1890's was Superintendent of Humboldt Park and, later, of Chicago's West Park System.*For more about Open House Chicago (an event of the Chicago Architecture Foundation), see: tinyurl.com/948btuq .

58.description: A great deal on tasty food. BYOB. Nice place to hang out. Good people work there.

56.description: Pretty disappointing. Biscuits and gravy- gravy was already sitting on the skillet waiting for a customer to come through the door and order, hence had very burnt flavor. It also had too much flour and not very good. Grilled chicken was moist but lukewarm. Collard greens- very clean, healthy taste but they didn't kill the bitterness at all. Instead they tried to cover it up with spices but it didn't work too well. Fried okra- dry, boring served as tater tots with ranch salad dressing out of the bottle. Coffee- watery, lukewarm. There's obviously no professional chef in the back, and the person doesn't have natural talent.

29.description: We came here while visiting Chicago for the weekend. Our airbnb was right around the corner so we thought we'd stop by for breakfast our last day here. The atmosphere seems a bit uncleanly and crowded but it in a intimate, homey kinda way. Our server was a sweetheart and was very helpful explaining dishes to us. I orders a spanish breakfast dish. I can't remember the name but I was very disappointed. It did not taste good at all and was very inauthentic. My friends seemed pleased with their meals and finished their plates but I would not have been able to stomach the heavy plates they ordered. I don't think I would go back again and I probably won't recommend this place to anyone.

42.description: This place is a great little hidden gem. Really classic, American vibe and TASTY breakfast. Eggs, hash, and chickens clucking in the back.

23.description: Came in for biscuits and gravy, but the breakfast menu was done for the day. I order a 1/4 dark with Mac and Cheese and fries instead. The chicken was just okay, the fries weren't great (some were practically undercooked), and the Mac N Cheese tasted kind of strange. I had the chocolate cake for dessert, and it was just fine. The place was empty, but it was cute. I probably won't go back, but it's possible that the brunch is pretty good.

47.description: Just left there. Pulled pork sandwich and French fries were great! Cole slaw tasted more like vinegar & lettuce. They closed at 10pm and we were rushed out like we were qualifying for the Grand Prix! Then were asked to bus our own table. Just based on this alone, I wouldn't come back. Save yourself the long trip out of the city, not worth it. Now I have to go somewhere and really FEED.

8.description: Meh....I ordered the Sausage Gravy & Biscuits and felt completely underwhelmed.  I really wanted to like them, but a couple things: 1.) Biscuits were hard and cold 2.) Sausage Gravy had no Sausage 3.) Sausage Gravy was bland and tasted like flour with maybe a hint of bacon grease.  The awesome sweet tea they had saved the day though, it was probably one of the better sweet teas I have had.  Don't know if I will be coming back...

31.description: This place is a great place to sit on the patio and have brunch in the sun. The service is friendly (not hipster) but not annoying. The food is farm fresh...like you can see the chickens. They cooked my weirdly specific egg order perfectly. And it's quaint. Also they open at 8 on weekdays and you can pop in to pick up a quick egg sandwich on the way to work.

34.description: Amazing southern comfort food.  I have dreams about their sauteed spinach... So very good! Quirky cute decor, friendly staff! We are repeat customers!

16.description: By far my favorite restaurant in my hood. The portions are huge and the cost is not. I love the sides and their black bean cakes are the best I've ever eaten. Definitely recommend this place for a homey feel with good food. Also it's BYOB. I may be biased bc they are 2 blocks away

13.description: Got a carry out and was expecting something great.  Unfortunately, it was mediocre...the corn pudding was extremely dry, which made it inedible.  Their chicken was good though and their banana pudding.

11.description: The food here is great! I'm a creature of habit and almost always order their omelettes, but I've tried several of their dishes and it's definitely satisfying. The service is great and the country style food always hits the spot. If you go on the weekend you may have to wait to be seated but during the week, you can just walk right in and order.

39.description: MMMMM comfort food!Tasty and not greasy chicken.  The corn pudding reminded me of crumbled cornbread with corn kernels added.  Wish it was a little more moist but it was still tasty.  I've had better mashed potatoes and gravy yet these still hit the spot.  Efficient order taking over the phone when I placed my workplace's order.  This will be a new regular place for us!

37.description: I love everything about this place - the chalk board menus, the tacky table cloths, the framed pictures of chickens lining the wall, the americana decor, the fact that you (most of the time) order at a counter window AND I REALLY LOVE VISITING THE CHICKENS. It's completely all over the place, which somehow all ties together. Then there's the food - southern comfort at it's best. I dream of their brussel sprouts and become way too excited every time I see them on the specials board. Go here. Eat anything. Eat everything. Leave satisfied and happy.

0.description: I love this place!I take my clients here because it is as authentic of a restaurant as you can find and they serve genuine, honest food in a no frills manner.It is one giant room with quirky chicken and egg art all over the walls. There are booths on one side and tables in the middle. You make your choices off the chalk boards and then order at a window from the owner, usually.Then the food comes out to your table and it is excellent. The food cannot be criticized and the coffee is exceptional.Go here. Support this kind of raw, ragged entrepreneurism and eat well in the process. Then come back with others and show it to them. It's an experience worth going out of your way for.

38.description: Cute cute cute! My girlfriend moved into this area and every time I visit, this is our joint! So super cute...nice folks and the food....yum yum! The catfish is fried to perfection and juicy! All the sides just scrumptious! Southern comfort done cute!  And I dig a lil BYOB joint er'now and again! Hits the spot!

51.description: Great food. Got the 1/4 Dark Chicken with 2 sides, collared greens and mac-n-cheese. Hit the spot. I went in the midafternoon so it was empty but its a cozy restaurant with a distinct grandmas kitchen type feel. Ordered and came out within minutes. I asked the gentlemen at the cashier some suggestions for sides and instead of just giving me a suggestion, he gave me samples which was an awesome touch and made the decision easier. I think there were well over 10 sides or something so for an indecisive guy like me it can get difficult haha. The food itself was delicious, juicy chicken with nice skin on it, and the collared greens mmmm, mac-n-cheese was good, standard stuff. There was also some flatbread type pitas that came with it along with a special salsa. It was a great combo, dip the sauce in chicken or bread, mmmmm. Look for my picture in this section! Definitely would come again.

27.description: We stopped by Feed for a nice Saturday morning brunch on the 4th of July. It was beautiful sunny day, so we opted to sit around back on the patio, which had some cute strung porch lights, just enough shade, and 5ish tables. You had to walk around the block and through some people's backyards to get from the main front part of the restaurant to the patio in the back, but it wasn't too hard to find.  Lively, but not-overcrowded. We got to sit down right away without any wait.I got the pulled pork hash with 2 over medium eggs and a slice of wheat toast. The hash browns were a mix of Idaho potatoes and sweet potatoes, lightly salted and seasoned, and browned to perfection. Sweet onions and pulled pork were grilled into the potato mix and then everything was topped with the fried eggs and toast. I thought the pork had a bit too much gristle/fat in it and didn't have any nice crispy bits like you'd normally get in pan fried pulled port or carnitas. Pulled pork shouldn't be disappointing, but this definitely was (really, how can anyone do fatty pork badly?). Everything else on my plate was done really well though.My 2 friends got the chicken and sausage pesto hash and the blackened catfish benedict (both were summer specials). The pesto hash was delicious (and I mean delicious!), but definitely on the heavy side and a little too much oil for any one person to eat. It was basically potato hash browns, pan fried sausage and chicken thigh pieces, all coated in pesto and topped with eggs/toast. I should have gone with the catfish benedict, which was pepper cornbread topped with blackened catfish, poached eggs, and hollandaise sauce. This was by far the best of our three dishes and I would come back to Feed again just for this dish!

32.description: I lived in New Mexico for nine years but this place has the best huevos rancheros I have ever had. Really nice patio.

54.description: I used to love Feed, but now they are just alright. I don't go as often as I used to. I stopped by on Friday. I brought someone who had never been and we ordered for dine-in, but I had to change the order to carry-out.  Although it was almost 40 outside, it was very cold inside. We couldn't take off our coats. She ordered a lemonade. It was morning and the container that held the lemonade had very little in it. It looked as if it had been leftover from the night before and tasted like it, also. The breakfast was very good.

48.description: Great food. Homey decor and a very relaxed atmosphere. A whole wall of chicken pictures. I ordered Special of the day steak and sides of Mac N Cheese and Collard greens. Since we were done eating almost at closing time, our cashier gave us each a banana pudding.

44.description: Feed's fried chicken is like crack! Seriously. I'm one of those fried food snobs. I never eat the stuff. But if I take a bite of this chicken I can't stop.it's crispy. It's light. It's everything you want fried chicken to be. Better than Mom's. The pulled pork sandwich is good too. One star off for serving some of the sides in Styrofoam.  All round good Southern style food.

24.description: Came here on a Sunday around 1pm.  We were seated quickly and given water right away. I love the interior! Cute and quirky. Reminds me of some breakfast places in Madison. Had the fried green tomato Benedict. The cornbread was tasty, but very crumbly and therefore hard to get on the fork. The tomatoes could've been thicker and more substantial.  It's a great concept that was done poorly. The potatoes were amazing, though! As for the service... It was a little spotty, but it seems like another server who was scheduled didn't show up. Maybe that's why they have service issues? Too loose of expectations with their servers?

7.description: Had some of the worst corn pudding imaginable. My friend thought it was stuffing it was so dry. The service was unfriendly on a Sunday at 1 pm. Heard this place used to be good. But I have no evidence to support this claim.

49.description: I really hate the word "vibe" and its current overuse with people my age, but the best/only way to describe this place is that it has a very relaxed/comfortable vibe to it. Their decor is quirky and the menu is straight-forward...simply delicious. I've only come here for breakfast, but their omelettes, bacon, biscuits and gravy...all on point. Try their cornbread. Just do it

40.description: Are here for the first time today after living in the neighborhood for years. I don't know what I was more impressed by: the food or the service. The guy working totally took care of us above and beyond!! Could not have asked for a better dining experience.  Keep up the good work :)

53.description: I couldn't find anywhere on their website that, although this is considered a "Southern/Soul Food" restaurant, the chicken is broasted/rotisserie style, and not fried chicken. When I think "chicken" and "Southern," there is no alternative but "fried."With that said, the chicken is good. The sides were better than I expected (having been surprised when I ripped open a bag, discovering broasted instead of fried chicken) and I would definitely eat hear again.Two things keeping me from eating here more:1. The chicken isn't fried2. The price is a little high for broasted chicken. If you can make your own roast chicken, you will have a hard time swallowing the price.

30.description: Just left Feed. Tried to have brunch here this morning and walked in there were about 5 tables in the restaurant. Waited almost an hour for food. Waitress kept having to come back to tables asking what they ordered. Table of 4 next to us ended up leaving because they were waiting so long. When we finally did get our food, it was gross. Sausage patties were like hockey pucks and pancakes were cold. I was hoping for this place to be good but it was an absolutely frustrating experience. The manager comped our meal (that we didn't eat), but he blamed a new server for everything, which I thought was inappropriate. You're  running the place, take some responsibility. Anyway, would not ever come back here again.

46.description: Service was subpar.   Food was lukewarm and we were rushed out, had to buss our own tables. Just left and would not go there again. P.s. The macaroni and cheese was not ok!!

1.description: Ordered - Fried Catfish Sandwich1/4 chickenSides - Mac and Cheese, Fried OkraThe food is classic southern soul food. The best fried okra I've had so far in Chicago. Most of it was fresh and hot and just what you would expect. The Mac and Cheese was a little lacking in flavor and barely warm, but really can't go too wrong with cheesy carbs. It was a little unclear to us at first how the chicken would come (fried vs rotisserie). It was not fried, not sure if the do this or not.

55.description: Love the chicken and fries here! Definitely recommend! I wish we lived closer to this spot!

9.description: Obsessed with this place. For a healthy, home cooked meal, this is the spot! I have yet to try something from the menu that I haven't liked. Customer service is good also.

26.description: This is a cute little homey place on Chicago avenue. The food is ok and the space can be sometimes overcrowded. It's like a soul food diner. What's cool is the urban garden on the side of it which I'm sure provides some of the food that they serve. It's a hidden neighborhood gem bordering the west side. Check it out!

25.description: The fried green tomato eggs benedict is the best breakfast I've had in Chicago. It's a must!

12.description: We stopped by Feed for a nice Saturday morning brunch on the 4th of July. It was beautiful sunny day, so we opted to sit around back on the patio, which had some cute strung porch lights, just enough shade, and 5ish tables. You had to walk around the block and through some people's backyards to get from the main front part of the restaurant to the patio in the back, but it wasn't too hard to find.  Lively, but not-overcrowded. We got to sit down right away without any wait.I got the pulled pork hash with 2 over medium eggs and a slice of wheat toast. The hash browns were a mix of Idaho potatoes and sweet potatoes, lightly salted and seasoned, and browned to perfection. Sweet onions and pulled pork were grilled into the potato mix and then everything was topped with the fried eggs and toast. I thought the pork had a bit too much gristle/fat in it and didn't have any nice crispy bits like you'd normally get in pan fried pulled port or carnitas. Pulled pork shouldn't be disappointing, but this definitely was (really, how can anyone do fatty pork badly?). Everything else on my plate was done really well though.My 2 friends got the chicken and sausage pesto hash and the blackened catfish benedict (both were summer specials). The pesto hash was delicious (and I mean delicious!), but definitely on the heavy side and a little too much oil for any one person to eat. It was basically potato hash browns, pan fried sausage and chicken thigh pieces, all coated in pesto and topped with eggs/toast. I should have gone with the catfish benedict, which was pepper cornbread topped with blackened catfish, poached eggs, and hollandaise sauce. This was by far the best of our three dishes and I would come back to Feed again just for this dish!

59.description: My friend suggested this place, and I am glad he did. All the sides (collard greens, sweet potatoes, macaroni and cheese) were on point, and the chicken was the bomb diggity. We got gluttonous with it and tried all the desserts (root beer float, peach pie, and banana pudding) and these too were fabulous. The guy at the counter was super nice, and didn't look at me like I was dumb when I didn't know where the pops were. Even though they were busy they didn't try to rush us out of the place. My mother has required that I bring her here, so I'll be back!

21.description: Everything was perfect. Nice guys. Cash only. Wish I would have had a cold beer or 2 with me. BYOB.

17.description: In my honest opinion:The food here is just mediocre. Got the 1/4 chicken, dark meat with Mac and cheese, and corn pudding. The chicken was ok. Comparable to your grocery chain $5 rotisserie bird. Nothing too exciting. The Mac? The texture is a bit too soft, flavor on the bland side, and the cheese tastes a bit processed. The corn pudding was less "pudding" and more "crumble". My friend ordered the white meat chicken and it was pretty dry. Mashed potato was lumpy and lukewarm, and gravy was cold and lumpy as well. They serve you the chicken with flour tortillas instead of bread which is new to me when it comes to southern cuisine. But I'll take it. Pulled pork sandwich was good, but the bread didn't quite hold up. It was pretty much soaked through and unable to be handled as a sandwich is supposed to. Bummer. And the sweet tea had a bit of a soapy flavor. This could be because it was the bottom of the dispenser, not sure. It doesn't seem like the establishment is too concerned with keeping the drink dispensers, or salt and pepper shakers full as we had to search for the salt. And don't get me started on the bathroom. Two words: must (smell) and mold. Sorry Feed, I probably won't be back.

10.description: That was the most horrible soul food place, that I had ever been to the macaroni and cheese was cold and the stems were still on the spinach and the fried chicken taste just like it came out of a bag nothing about that chicken was fried. It GIVES SOUL A BAD REP!!##

5.description: Stopped by for lunch because I was studying at a nearby cafe. The location isn't the best. There didn't seem to be many other open restaurants nearby per Yelp. The interior was heavily chicken themed. Lots of pictures of chickens all over the walls, including a picture of a baby's head on a chicken! Not many people present on a Monday during lunch time. I did not get a good vibe from the person at the counter. I made eye contact with the woman at front and wasn't greeted at all, even after I initiated. Definitely felt like she wasn't having a lot of fun. The fried chicken was average, maybe a bit better. None of the sides were particularly appealing. The mashed potatoes with gravy was bland in my opinion, the corn pudding was dry, and the mac and cheese was tasteless. The fried okra was on the better side and seemed fresher, as I did see the cook putting the frozen ones into the deep frier. Reasonable prices, but cash only.

3.description: I liked what I got, but wasn't blown away by the food.  I had the BBQ Chicken sandwich and a biscuit.  I probably wouldn't order the biscuit again, a little dry.  The sandwich was enjoyable, but didn't stand out as any better than many sandwiches I had.  I will say that if I were to go back, I'd like to try their gumbo.  I just wanted a side or cup of it, but I was told that it was $9.50 which is the price of the gumbo meal.  A side gumbo for $5-$6 would have been nice.

35.description: Southern style fried chicken, sweet and savory pulled pork, sweet and charming staff...but honestly, I just come here for their sides. A very picnic-blanket looking interior, lots of Rooster and Chicken memorabilia. A place for rooster fans. Definitely.

19.description: The place is nice. Feels like an authentic southern spot with only a few minor incongruities. The pork chop special was excellent and the collard greens, fried okra and mashed potatoes we enjoyable. The pulled pork sandwich was completely unpalatable. I won't bite you with details but don't order it unless you like stuff that is terrible.

28.description: Such a good find!! The roomie and I came over and split the fried catfish and the pulled pork sandwiches.  Sooooo glad we split it cause I couldn't decide between the two. The decor us awesome! The guy behind the counter wasn't friendly but he wasn't rude either. I wish this place was closer to home!

45.description: I really enjoyed this place. The "down -on-the-farm" feeling made the experience memorable and complimented the tasty lunch. I would like to go back and try other things offered on the menu. I would encourage a visit to this little gem.

33.description: Called ahead of time to order for dine-in since we were short on time. At that point I was told they were out of chicken. When I asked how long it would be he said 10 minutes. Well 50 minutes later the chicken wasn't ready. In addition, they were out of many of the sides. Food was just ehhh. Too much garlic in green beans. Lets just say we won't be back. Im a stickler for good service.

43.description: Some things I'd recommend to try is the chicken duh and especially the catfish sandwich which I liked even better than the chicken and I'm a chicken guy so that says something. The fish was buttery silky juicy crusted to perfection and just perfect. Comes on a sandwich with this amazing sauce on the side which can get messy so be ready to lick your fingers. And the fingers of your friends who are also eating there.Chicken was good. No surprises there. Moving on...The sides were a let down unfortunately.... the corn bread pudding was too dry, the biscuits were dry AND flavorless, the fries were ok, the slaw was ok too but not the best out there so I wouldn't get too excited about the sides. Focus on the chicken and the fish. The heavy hitters here. Apple pie was da bomb though. It was hard sharing it bc it was just sooo good. Get extra.

2.description: FEED is right. I always leave here stuffed and with leftovers. The food is great. Classic soul food. I usually get a quarter white with two sides: Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. sometimes corn pudding. My only grievance is that sometimes my mashed potatoes are a little cold. But that's it. I'm sure if I told them they'd heat them up but it's not a big a deal to me. I have never tried any of the specials for some reason but I heard they're great. The decor is very cozy and kitsch. Staff is super nice and welcoming. One time I was here and Killer Tomatoes Strike Back was on. An interesting yet welcome selection as someone who is a big fan of comedy horror and the like. Try the Thai iced coffee, it's the best I've had in Chicago I think.

18.description: We had brunch here based on the raves about the chicken fried steak.  It looked great on the photo in Yelp, but what we got was a lukewarm dish with gravy about the consistency of mashed potatoes, not bad flavor but not that great either.  On top of that, all the cups and glasses smelled strongly of soap and imparted a soap flavor into the coffee, water, orange juice and sweet team.  When I complained about the cups, the first thing I asked was if they had a dishwasher machine.  They immediately said "Oh, did they taste like soap?"  Turns out, they don't have a machine, just a badly trained dishwashing person.  I won't be back.

41.description: I just left the restaurant and all the food was pre-cooked...want come back again because I like my chicken hot off the fryer...

52.description: I've had some meals here that were spectacular like the black bean patties and fried chicken, but I've had other meals served to me cold.The staff isn't as friendly as id like them to be. I've been here over 10 times and have definitely spoken to everyone except the cooks. But I still give this place 4 stars because it's independently owned and places like this are needed in Chicago. In the summer it's great to have a beer and chill out back in the hidden patio.If people learned to not  have unreal expectations about restaurants they won't be so sour about their experiences. I'm down with feed.

50.description: LOVE the vibe of this place.  Hidden back patio is great too, especially when you're having brunch and chickens are crowing next door, feels like a rural town.  The poultry themed decor inside is effing amazing too.   Great date spot if your girl isn't pretentious.

4.description: Stopped by for Sunday brunch because of the great reviews on Yelp.I am not exactly sure what there is to rave about. I ordered the biscuit and gravy with two eggs, and my friend ordered a bowl that had the works. We also ordered the corn pudding, mashed potatoes with gravy, and mac n cheese on the side. The cheese kind of smelled/tasted like... velveeta.I'm sure that we may have just ordered the wrong things but not only was there a bit of a wait (30+ minutes...) but my food was lukewarm to cold, the mashed potatoes and gravy resembled that out of a tv-dinner box, and the mac n cheese was... pretty gross, to be honest. My biscuit and gravy dish was incredibly disappointing - if would have been only slightly better had it come out hot. I had wished that I just ordered a biscuit with eggs at that point, but I could not even scrape the overwhelming amount of bland gravy off of everything. The taste... was like leftover rotisserie chicken + bacon grease with cornstarch.The one decent dish - corn pudding (basically corn bread pudding). Alas, it needed to have come out hot.Is hot food so much to ask for?

6.description: Came here on a Sunday around 1pm.  We were seated quickly and given water right away. I love the interior! Cute and quirky. Reminds me of some breakfast places in Madison. Had the fried green tomato Benedict. The cornbread was tasty, but very crumbly and therefore hard to get on the fork. The tomatoes could've been thicker and more substantial.  It's a great concept that was done poorly. The potatoes were amazing, though! As for the service... It was a little spotty, but it seems like another server who was scheduled didn't show up. Maybe that's why they have service issues? Too loose of expectations with their servers?

22.description: There's something so charming and fun about this place. It's off the beaten path so it feels like a little secret place that you've discovered. Love the pulled chicken sandwich and fried chicken! Come hungry and be ready to make a mess.

15.description: So there are many places nearby that you can go for a variety of different foods. However if you're looking for home cooked, solid, tastey grill chicken and southern-style sides this is the place to go. I also think they are very reasonably priced. I especially liked the decor is very eclectic and service staff was very nice. We have gone back several times and think it will be an all time favorite for us.

57.description: There's a toy chicken egg vending machine here! Remember those from the grocery store, you would ask your mom for a quarter and then you put it in and the chicken would spin and cluck and spit out a ring that would get stuck on your finger? Yup I had a doctor cut two of said rings off circa 1988.Oh very important, they are CASH ONLY! The ATM is next to the chicken machine.Now... we went around 1pm on Sunday and there were only 4 or 5 other people there. Feed puts the shabby in shabby chic(k). Actually it's just shabby. But that's ok, we came to eat. The menu was small, but our waitress mentioned several specials and she pointed to a few blackboards with lots of things on them, probably more than what she listed for us. It's too bad they can't have them written down and inserted with the menu. I opted for the eggs benedict and bf got the pozole. I regret not getting one of the specials because the eggs benedict was just marginal. Instead of English muffins, the eggs were on cornbread. The eggs were cooked perfect! The fried green tomatoes they sit on were ok, but the cornbread was blah. The corn pudding which I subbed for the potatoes was pretty good. The bacon I got on the side was awful- cold, dry, flaky, not good.Bf wasn't psyched about the pozole since it was a really thick stew instead of a soup and was fairly bland. We each had a side of Palmolive with our waters, I think the cups needed another rinse cycle. It even was in the coffee mug.Our waitress was incredibly sweet, and including tax and tip our 2 drinks and 2 entrees were $35. The food just wasn't that good for the drive we made out here. I would consider giving this place another try, but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way or wait for a table here.

20.description: This is the only place on the West Side worth going to. There is nothing out here. I work in the Ghetto, and it is a wasteland for non-junkies. This is the only place within a reasonable drive, and they have some killer choices. The hanger steak rocks, the goat cheese omelette rocks, the blackened catfish, can you guess???, ROCKS!p2.liveauctioneers.com/1…i dig this joint, and so should you.

36.description: I really wanted to like this place but the service sucks so bad. I wouldn't come again or recommend it to anyone else based on that alone. At first we sat on the patio. After about 10 min of waiting to get a menu, I had to call over the waitress and ask her for one. This would be excusable if it was super busy, but it wasn't. We went inside because it was getting really windy so we had to go through this process again. The same thing happened. We had to wait a while to get our menus. Then had to wait a while for the waitress to take our orders. Then she forgot our coffee! Again, this would be excusable if it were busy, but it wasn't. I couldn't help but notice that some of the other people around us, who arrived AFTER us, were getting timely service. But I could also see that some people around us looked frustrated as well.I ordered the black bean cakes to be told that they were out of them. I ordered fruit and was told that they were out of fruit. No fruit?! I mean, it's 11am on a Sunday. Where's the preparation?? You know you're going to be busy today but you're out of things at 11am?? That doesn't mean they were sold out. That means there wasn't any prep. Ridiculous. To top it off, we waited more than an HOUR to get our food!! Never coming back again.

14.description: This is the only place on the West Side worth going to. There is nothing out here. I work in the Ghetto, and it is a wasteland for non-junkies. This is the only place within a reasonable drive, and they have some killer choices. The hanger steak rocks, the goat cheese omelette rocks, the blackened catfish, can you guess???, ROCKS!p2.liveauctioneers.com/1…i dig this joint, and so should you.

58.description: Solid 3.5 stars.I live in the neighborhood and found the rave reviews for this relatively new to the neighborhood pizza place.  All in all, I love that I'm supporting local business, glad that they are doing good things.  Reason for 3 and not 4 stars is that it's good but along north ave not the best and not doing crazy things that warrant 4 stars.  Would def recommend locals to try it out because it's a solid choice especially to satiate a craving for pizza.The goods:- The filling is made of awesome ingredients -- meatball meat was moist and tasty, sausage did well- The deep dish is not what you could classically consider a deep dish -- it's an in between which is great b/c honestly sometimes pies are so filling you can't eat more than 1 piece- The dough is good, although would copy another poster in saying it doesn't taste hand tossed, probably pre-made/bought - Good amount of sauce, not too much and not too little. And the sauce itself was goodThe being-picky:- The mozzarella was pretty thick and when taken home was not the best, very tough tasting- Chicken tenders -- I get it, they don't specialize in tenders, but they're pre-bought pre-made tenders.  Overall, I liked it.  Not re-inventing the wheel, which I don't think they are intending to do.  Solid pizza choice if you're in the neighborhood.  The daily $5 pizza/soda special sounds like a great deal.

56.description: Their thin crust is awesome! Great pizza at a good value. Super cheesy pizza so if you don't like cheese I would not recommend. The owner is always nice and they have a great deal on weekdays. I can't wait to try the deep dish but the thin crust is so good I have ordered it every time so far.

29.description: I'm lucky enough to work down the block from WTP and I think they have some of the very best pizza on the north(ish) side. The staff is beyond friendly and accommodating and did I mention the pizza is great? If you find yourself in the area do yourself a favor and swing by!

42.description: Deep dish is awesome. The spinach and garlic one is particularly amazing. I often call in advance and request vegetarian slices and the owner will accommodate. He is so nice! Thin crust is not thin enough and pretty doughy. But the $5 slice and pop deal can't be beat!

23.description: Placed an order for jalapeño poppers and the chèvre pizza over the phone when the grubhub app was down- can't remember the last time I called for delivery rather than ordering online. Gentleman on the line was super friendly and promised to have our food here within the hour. About 40 minutes later, I realize I'm in a dead zone in my apartment. Jog to the other end of the house and get a voicemail- pizza's ready for pickup. I feel awful- what kind of jerk has her phone off when a delivery person is stuck in the rain on a Saturday night in the middle of a very important Hawks game? I call the shop right back, apologize, explain I was hoping for delivery. Nice guy checks the delivery tracker- no problem. Pie is on its way. Food arrives in no time- literally still within the hour as originally promised, even after the mixup. Delivery guy is incredibly friendly and apologetic. On to the food- poppers are above average but not outstanding. That's cool though, they hit the spot. The chèvre pizza, though, with red sauce & chèvre & mozz & fresh basil presented in a sweet chiffonade, is fabulous. I've always had a difficult time finding solid thin crust in the neighborhood and while this wasn't the cracker crust I was truly craving (this is a bit thicker than cottage style and chewy), it was great. Nice balance of ingredients and the goat cheese really hit the spot. Two items isn't a worthy assessment of a full menu, but the awesome customer service and delicious tasting of their offering totally warrants a full five stars. Excited to try more.

47.description: We live a couple of blocks away and decided to try out based on great reviews. We each had the thin crust pepperoni slice special . For 5 bucks you get a large portion and a drink . Super inexpensive and very tasty. We got it fresh out of the oven! We will be back. We were so full. The owner is very nice too. It is in the back of a store , which is a little weird. However , don't let it stop you from trying .

8.description: Just ordered from this pizza shop it arrived so fast, about 45 minutes faster than grub hub said! Delivery dude was very friendly. I ordered the 18" 1 topping w/ 2 liter deal. Pizza is good with some spicier sausage. Pizza was definitely not bland, and crust nice and thin & crispy. While it is not the best pizza I have ever had it is a great option for quick pizza delivery. I will order from here again, maybe trying more exotic toppings.Update: owner messaged me back right away saying thank you! 5 out of 5 for response and clearly very kind people that work here! Will be making it a regular stop/grubhub order.

31.description: West Town Pizza is AMAZING...   Great balance of flavors, and well made crust.   I understand Sam makes his own sausage too.   This is an excellent pizza joint.   Please enjoy!

34.description: On our way to the Chicago History Museum we  thought we would grab a quick slice from West Town! This place was exactly what we were looking for! You walk into this convenience store, and head to the back for the pizza counter. Directly in front of the pizza counter there are a few stools and a counter area to eat at. So convenient ! The pizza is fresh and delicious, the staff is super friendly, and there is a lunch special that includes a slice (either thin or Chicago Style) that is as big as your head and a soda for $5. You simply can't beat this place!

16.description: I'd driven past and not gone in because it's in this random little corner store, and I was dubious. When I finally confirmed on Yelp that it was here, I dropped by for some quick takeout. It's definitely smalltime. They only had one type of thin crust and one type of thick crust available for slice sale, not sure if that's always the case, but when I asked if there were any other varieties coming soon the guy behind the counter looked at me like like I had three heads, so I'm thinking the limited choice is the norm. I got a thin crust sausage slice with a soda for $5. The slice was basically a quarter or fifth of a pizza, the equivalent of two of what I consider normal slice size, and more than I could eat in one sitting. This reminded me a lot of a mid-range New York slice, at least when looking at it from above, although the crust wasn't crispy enough, it was still sort of doughy and not as good as standard New York fare.Overall, if you order a pie or are okay with limited selection, it's not a bad option, and was a decent slice. I'm glad I checked it out, and I expect I'll stop back in. It seemed like there was plenty of easy parking nearby. There's no seating. One could go to Humboldt or Wicker Park.

13.description: We ordered from West Town Pizza based on the Yelp rating therefore I feel compelled to post a review since there is NO WAY West Town Pizza is a 4 star Pizza option.  We ordered the pizza at 6:15 and it arrived around 7:40.  Fine, it was a Friday night.  However, the pizza was completely cold when it arrived - so much so that the congealed cheese separated from the crust when we pulled a piece from the pie.  We called and they did offer us 25% on our next order but given the great number of delicious restaurants in our neighborhood I'm fairly certain I would never return.

11.description: I tried the pizza and it was GREAT! I've never tasted a better slice of pizza or sauce, and I can't wait to try more items off the menu.The owner also has great customer service. West Town Pizza Shop is a must try!

39.description: West Town Pizza Shop is disguised (sneaky!) in a standard looking convenience store. The first time I came here, I thought, where the heck is this pizza shop hiding? Follow the good smells to the back of the store where you will find a delightful gentleman cooking up subs, salads and pizza. The thin crust is legit; and for $5 a slice (soda can included), the price is right. I highly recommend giving this place a whirl and picking up a slice or a whole pie. An excellent addition to the hood!

37.description: Ordered thin pizza, the crust was some pre made product, not good. Salad was meh. Bosco sticks tasted like burnt garlic powder. Summary: a pretty gross experience. How this crap compels someone to go into the pizza business I will never understand. My delivery order for these 3 items was 47$. Order somewhere else.

0.description: West Town Pizza Shop is an exceptional place to grab a food, specially their gluten free pizza was delicious! The staff were awesome and good at making pizza. It was very laid back and affordable place to go. Highly recommended place to visit Enjoyed very much

38.description: Very, very surprised by this gem. I have had pizza in so many different establishments; this by far my all-time favorite. The owner (I think) is a charmcharismatic guy. I'm a neighbor who will be returning frequently!

51.description: Must say my staff had many positive comments about our pizza yesterday.  We tried out the Buffalo Chicken on and it was tasty.  We order pizza extra crispy and it was.  Very delicious.  I always get questions on where we got this pizza.  West Town Pizza is definitely a staff favorite at ASI.  Thank you for serving us well.

27.description: This is not the place to order from if you want cheap pizza quick.  It was moving day and I was hungry.  Pizza seems to be the go-to when you're in a hurry, hungry, and all your dishes are packed up.  I looked this place up on yelp, saw it had 1 "$" sign so I figured it was cheap.  I ordered 1 small and 1 medium (both had 2 toppings) and without tip, it came to $41.00.  I was not impressed.

32.description: Food arrived after 70 minutes. The delivery guy Benito was the only good thing about this restaurant. The food was not hot. It was soggy and not crispy. We paid for extra ranch but we didn't get nothing. The honey mustard was not good, it was like grainy. DO NOT GET HONEY MUSTARD OR PAY FOR EXTRA RANCH. IT'S A TRAP!!!!!!! DO NOT AND I REPEAT DO NOT ORDER DESSERT. The cheesecake on a stick we ordered was pre-made. They did not make them themselves. Same thing goes with the cannoli. NOT GOOD. I only gave it two stars because it was cheap and Benito is friendly. So yeah.

54.description: I'm really confused by the high rating. I recently had a 14" pepperoni pizza delivered via GrubHub and I was SO disappointed. I had such high pizza hopes based on the reviews. My pizza had a little cheese, a little sauce, and a little pepperoni. The crust was flavorless. I will not order again.

48.description: We just moved to the neighborhood and West Town Pizza was the perfect welcome.  They've got thousands of customers and Sam, the owner, immediately made us feel like we were old friends.  I've only tried the thin crust so far and It's outstanding.  If you're looking for bar greasy thin crust, this isn't Pat's.  There's a time and a place for Pat's!  This is homemade stuff and Sam is back there busting ass!  Try the Maplewood or the tuna specialty pizzas.  The poppers left much to be desired, but the desserts more than made up for them.

44.description: This pizza shop is located in the back of habibi convenience store. They offer five dollar slices of thick deep dish pizza with a soda. The pizza is fast and hits the spot, and surprisingly enough they have great espresso. This place has potential I hope they expand to their own store front.

24.description: Just ordered from this pizza shop it arrived so fast, about 45 minutes faster than grub hub said! Delivery dude was very friendly. I ordered the 18" 1 topping w/ 2 liter deal. Pizza is good with some spicier sausage. Pizza was definitely not bland, and crust nice and thin & crispy. While it is not the best pizza I have ever had it is a great option for quick pizza delivery. I will order from here again, maybe trying more exotic toppings.Update: owner messaged me back right away saying thank you! 5 out of 5 for response and clearly very kind people that work here! Will be making it a regular stop/grubhub order.

7.description: West Town Pizza is absolutely great. The owner Safa is incredibly friendly and puts a lot of effort into making awesome pizza and other food.  I've had the pizza several times and it is consistently outstanding. It is also a great deal.Truly a hidden gem and worth a special stop to sample the pizza. Stop by and try it!

49.description: "Deep Dish" pizza?? I got two inches of crust and almost (!) a half inch of toppings. I'm sorry, but filling me up with crust doesn't make you a deep-dish pizza. Because of all the good reviews, I'll try something else next time. For those of you who raved about the deep-dish, please get some better experiences.

40.description: Super fast delivery!

53.description: You should come here. Eight blocks in any direction, this is by far the best pizza by-the-slice place. I'd take this place's deep dish over the Chicago staples (Giordanos, Lou's, Pizanos, whatever) any day. Plus, none of those places sell by the slice, and here you can get huge, deep dish slices are 5$ with soda after tax. I'm going to go ahead and recommend the spinach and garlic. Usually when you get garlic on a pizzas it's cooked or roasted, but here there's a real strong flavor of raw garlic, which is way better.I haven't had thin crust, but I'd assume it rocks. I haven't had the thin crust, so I'm not sure how it measures up, but everything I've had on the menu rocks, so, my assumption is it's great. Pasta with marinara is great. So's the arabiata .Also, the owner's super friendly, the kinda guy to remember you when you come in. It's always great to come here. You won't regret it.

30.description: The pizza is excellent and $5.00 slice with a canned drink cannot be beat.  The only thing that surpasses this pizza is how nice the owner Safa is.

46.description: Bosco sticks had a weird taste.Got the chicago style thin crust, its definitely better than your cheap pizza options but not the best Ive ever had.I had my order delivered so maybe thats why I wasnt so impressed.Next time Im in the neighborhood Ill try the by the slice option.But honestly, if you are having an entire pizza delivered to your place there are much better options to consider.

1.description: I don't know if it's because I'm from the East Coast, but it's been a struggle to find good thin crust pizza in Chicago. This was not it. Wish I'd stuck to a frozen pizza. Almost no crust, no love in the sauce, and mediocre cheese. Sad and disappointed after all the good ratings on here.Here's an update to my review since I've received a couple rude messages from the owner: the point of a review is to share your customer experience. It's not to just give compliments. I leave MANY positive reviews because I'm having great experiences in Chicago. This was not one of them. If you're a business owner unprepared to hear what people really think, you should probably just stop checking Yelp. Or perhaps make an effort to offer your customers a great experience instead of sending them hostile messages to go back to where they came from. Diners, beware!

55.description: I loved the environment, staff, food.Anyways I'm only giving this place a 4 because I've been once since moving to Wicker and I understand I should temper my enthusiasm, but I really liked it.  Light years ahead of anywhere in Lakeview (my former domicile). I looked  up on Yelp "good pizza places" cause I wanted a Chicken Parm. This place had great reviews, so why not?This place reminded me a lot of the delis back home in the North East/long island sound area. Ya know what the best sandwich places are? The kind that when you walk in they look like a Mini Mart and then the kitchen/deli is in the back. The fries were lights out, as was my Chicken Parm. The fact that 3 people behind me ordered the pizza is a sign that I need to expand my order. Go here! Also not for nothing, the employees were talkative and awesome!

9.description: I'm a big fan of this place. The staff is always very friendly when I call to order, and the pizza arrives quickly. If you're looking for unique, gormet pizzas this isn't it, but it's definitely tasty and quick and gets the job done.

26.description: I'm very confused by all the rave reviews. We got a caprese pizza and bosco sticks delivered on a Saturday night. It was fairly fast, but it wasn't very hot. Bosco sticks were fine. Typical. The pizza itself was not good at all. Crust tasted like cardboard and the sauce was very bland.Not a go to pizza place.

25.description: I'd driven past and not gone in because it's in this random little corner store, and I was dubious. When I finally confirmed on Yelp that it was here, I dropped by for some quick takeout. It's definitely smalltime. They only had one type of thin crust and one type of thick crust available for slice sale, not sure if that's always the case, but when I asked if there were any other varieties coming soon the guy behind the counter looked at me like like I had three heads, so I'm thinking the limited choice is the norm. I got a thin crust sausage slice with a soda for $5. The slice was basically a quarter or fifth of a pizza, the equivalent of two of what I consider normal slice size, and more than I could eat in one sitting. This reminded me a lot of a mid-range New York slice, at least when looking at it from above, although the crust wasn't crispy enough, it was still sort of doughy and not as good as standard New York fare.Overall, if you order a pie or are okay with limited selection, it's not a bad option, and was a decent slice. I'm glad I checked it out, and I expect I'll stop back in. It seemed like there was plenty of easy parking nearby. There's no seating. One could go to Humboldt or Wicker Park.

12.description: One of the best pizza places in Chicago. Owner is really cool and cares about his customers. Beef sausage pizza is awesome.

59.description: So I live on the same block of this place and at this point have tried just about everything on the menu, or have had friends over who've tried things and it's amazing. I saw it more as a cheap slice at first as you get a huge slice and a soda for five bucks but it's been consistently good and I finally started trying new things from salads, pasta and the sandwiches.
