It's all really solid but the sandwiches are really where this place shines outside of the pizza. The ciabatta bread is freaking perfect (I make bread and lived in Europe for years, so I'm a bit picky about bread) and the topping to bread ratio also is just right.What makes all of this so cool is that the owner is a nice guy who loves to chat and cares about his food a lot. We've had chats about dough and making the perfect crust and I love that I'm getting food from someone who actually cares. For the same price as a subway 12" or a frozen pizza you get some pretty serious food and really fast, basically run by one guy with occasional kitchen help and it shows.

21.description: This place is a real hidden gem in the neighborhood. Quality made to order with excellent fresh ingredients and a lot of different unique options. Everything I've ever ordered has been great and Safa the owner is a cool guy.

17.description: Delicious pizza by the slice or whole pie, along with some yuppie stuff like kombucha and blood orange soda. The pizza place is a couple of counters and a walk-up window in the back of a very generic looking bodega. Don't be scared - the bodega owner is super nice and friendly, as is the guy running the pizza operation in the back. If I'm feeling nostalgic for the weird, real, comforting griminess of New York, stopping in here for a $5 jumbo slice and soda hits the spot perfectly. It isn't polished or perfect or trendy - it's just some guy in the back of a bodega making ridiculously good pizza, and I hope it never ever changes.

10.description: Dropped in with my cousin while visiting Chicago. This place is super low key, located in the back of a corner store with maybe 8 or 9 stools and a counter. Don't let that fool you. The owner was very friendly, the pizza was some of the best deep dish I've had in my life, and the prices will beat any of the more famous places that I've tried. Would definitely recommend this spot to anyone looking for some bomb deep dish without any frills. 5/5!

5.description: Great thin crust pizza!  Have not had a chance to try their other menu items yet, but based on the quality of the pizza, I would say this place is great.  Will definitely be coming back to try other items.  Owner was very nice and the food was ready pretty quick!

3.description: Some of the nicest people on the phone when placing a delivery order. Polite and patient-- even on a Saturday night! They even had a Yelp deal that I suggest you check out: $18 for an 18 inch pizza plus a 2 liter soda. Delivery was fast and efficient. Awesome Greek salad and a pretty good pizza.

35.description: Don't be afraid to order from this place based on the outside of the building. It looks like your average convenient store on North Ave, but it's not. The man at the front store is friendly and so are the employees in the back, where the pizza place is. Quality ingredients, cooked perfectly, and held up the next day. This place is definitely going in the pizza rotation. I can't wait to try more things from them. We live in Logan and they don't deliver to us - that's  the only disappointing thing.**EDIT**After my review I was contact by West Town Pizza who said they'd deliver to us. WOW, what excellent customer  service! We've  already told our friends about this place but will continue  to spread the word.

19.description: I've ordered delivery from West Town a couple of times. The pizza will never be my favorite, because we have so many amazing pizza places, but it takes like how you imagine and want a pizza to taste. It's yummy, the staff is friendly and delivery is always super fast!

28.description: Super fast delivery and great pizza at a decent price! When we're talking local pizza, this place is first on my list with Dante's at a close second (West Town Pizza is less expensive, though).

45.description: This place is a true gem! Try it today.

33.description: Ordered from here for the first time tonight (2/21) and wow was their pizza amazing.  The crust was the perfect thickness, has plenty of cheese and sauce, and was all around perfect.  I am so glad that I decided on trying out a new pizza place.  I am looking forward to ordering from them again, and actually checking out their location.

43.description: This place is delicious and cheap. I don't know if I've ever written a review before so to get me to the place would have to be quite respectable.

2.description: So far nest Pizza in the neighborhood and I live in Logan Square. They offer delivery, but only up to kedzie, I'm fine with it. Any ways, onto the food part.. that why you're reading this right? So first and foremost this place is perfect for the show Diners Drive ins and Dives. The reason for this is that it's actually situated in the back of a convenience store. Oddly enough this didn't deter me from trying out the pizza. It's only been two occasions in which I've ordered and I have not been disappointed at all. The gentleman at the front is very friendly in person and on the phone ne makes you feel like you're part of the family just by his introduction and how he speaks to you which is rare in a business where food service is more about speed then qualityAs for the pizzas, I have only ordered one kind and it's because they cater to this particular type of pizza. I can tell you is all that this combination is genuinely delicious so my tip to you would be to try their pizza with Italian beef french fries and gardinaire. Sorry if I misspelled that last one. Next stop is their Arancini... enjoy!

18.description: I'm lucky enough to work down the block from WTP and I think they have some of the very best pizza on the north(ish) side. The staff is beyond friendly and accommodating and did I mention the pizza is great? If you find yourself in the area do yourself a favor and swing by!

41.description: Lunch options at work are usually limited to what's within walking distance, or a joint that delivers in a reasonable amount of time. West Town is the kind of place that tells you a time and shows up 15-20 mins earlier. That, and the food being incredibly above average for this area is what gives them top marks.Roast beef sandwich is a 9/10Pizza 7/10Chicken tenders 6.5/10

52.description: A really solid choice for pizza, indeed.  Ugh, we are just a mere two blocks off their delivery area which is frustrating, but, we order it for delivery to a nearby bar.Thin crust pepperoni is always our pie of choice and it's good.  The crust is thin, almost the correct thin (in my book), the sauce is good, has a hint of smoky flavor to it, and always arrives hot and fresh and fast.  It's not an inexpensive venture, but it's not too far off the farm.  The one bummer is that they close at 10 pm, which for us is sometimes too early.I say, yes, try it!

50.description: Fantastic pizza, great service. The owner was very kind and helped us with directions and tips for traveling. I had the spinach garlic deep dish which was delicious! For $5, it was definitely worth the money (you also get a free soda). Could not recommend this place enough!

4.description: I tried the gluten-free pizza because I had a crazy craving for pizza.  While the delivery was in the normal timeframe (within an hour after placing order), and the delivery guy called to give me the heads up he was arriving, I was a bit disappointed with the GF pizza.   Next time I'll look further away or go to pick up from another place.

6.description: On average we order from West Town 3-4 times a month. We are right down the street. NO MORE.My boyfriend is extremely lactose-intolerant. I specified no cheese on our order via grubhub and his sandwich came with cheese. When I called, a man picked up and at first told me that a meatball sub didn't come with cheese. He then proceeded to ask two other cooks if they had put cheese on my order and they all said no. He told me I was lying. WHAT?? I even said he could take this sandwich back when they delivered the correct one. He told me that he didn't have time to remake my order, he had other orders and that I was again, lying. He said "get a refund" and when I asked if he was going to refund it for me he said "You do it via grubhub. Call them. I can't help you." Needless to say I was super pissed & had every right to be. After I let him know this, he sent me off with a "f%^k you too." Awesome.Update: Just realized that the entire order was wrong. Where I ordered ravioli I now have a chicken sandwich (I think, looks very disgusting). I would call back and let them know but he'll probably say I was lying again.

22.description: Just ordered delivery and was very disappointed! Our margarita pizza was cold and flavorless. The crust tasted like cardboard. The Bosco sticks were just okay but also cold and the marinara sauce was terrible.

15.description: I've ordered here several times now and it seems the staff have trouble listening. Imagine being a frequent customer of an establishment and keep having to keep repeat yourself, they don't even try to pay close attention to what you are ordering.

57.description: The flavor of the sauce, toppings, cheese, seasoning are all great. The crust, however, at least the thin crust was a bit like cardboard. I normally always eat my crust, I'm not one to throw out any of my pizza, but the thin crust left much to be desired.

20.description: West Town Pizza is absolutely great. The owner Safa is incredibly friendly and puts a lot of effort into making awesome pizza and other food.  I've had the pizza several times and it is consistently outstanding. It is also a great deal.Truly a hidden gem and worth a special stop to sample the pizza. Stop by and try it!

36.description: We've gotten delivery both times and it was super fast -- almost unbelievably fast and we probably live just on the outside of the their delivery area but they still come to us when we order on GrubHub (but not when we don't).The first time we tried the thin crust and it was warm and tasty. The second time we tried the deep dish and this is definitely the way to go! YUM. The pizza was almost too hot to eat when it got here (a full half hour before the ETA). I was impressed because like I said, we're not that close.The deep dish is prefect. It's just me and my husband here so the first time I ordered the 16" thin crust because it says it's for 3-4 people so I thought we would have leftovers. Well, we didn't!So, the second time I ordered the largest deep dish they have, 18" and we couldn't even eat  half of it so there's a big difference. We got the West Town Special and it was delicious.The thin crust pizza is still good but I think they need to perfect it because the crust isn't thin enough. 5 stars because everything is right about this place!

14.description: I'm very confused by all the rave reviews. We got a caprese pizza and bosco sticks delivered on a Saturday night. It was fairly fast, but it wasn't very hot. Bosco sticks were fine. Typical. The pizza itself was not good at all. Crust tasted like cardboard and the sauce was very bland.Not a go to pizza place.

12.description: Try to forget about the lard used to create these masa covered masterpieces.  The tamales are just wonderful.  You can get a variety at $1.14 per or get a dozen for $11.  My personal favorite is the cheese and jalapeno tamale, but the pork, chicken, and beef are also excellent.  They even have a couple of dessert varieties, sweet corn and pineapple/strawberry.  Yum!A trio of tamales with their delicious Horchata (sweet drink made with almonds, rice, and cinnamon) for under $10 makes me happy on so many levels.

7.description: Fabulous tamales and I intend to try every flavor!! I tried  the pork both red and green, the pineapple, the sweet corn and the cheese with jalapeno all YUMMY! Do your tamale loving self a favor and eat these NOW (or at least as soon as you can)...A special call out to the horchata...wonderful!!

3.description: Once you try these tamales you'll keep coming back for more. They are so goooooooood...this place only sells tamales!  This is a Chicago's must!

1.description: Fresh tamales and champurado, yum! Go early in the morning or on Sunday morning/afternoon to get the moistest, freshest tamale selection. Tamales come in red or green varieties of pork, chicken and jalapeno & cheese. There are even strawberry and pineapple tamales, which I have not tried yet. My favorite by far is puerco rojo followed by pollo verde. A dozen costs $16, half dozen $8, single $1.35.Champurado is smooth and rich with a hint of cinnamon. On weekends they offer walnut and eggnog flavor in addition to the typical chocolate. There is also arroz con leche as well as fresh squeezed orange and/or carrot juice.Knowing Spanish is helpful. Although sometimes they get someone from the back to wait on me, since my Chicago hueda pronunciation is no bueno. I will bike to west Humboldt for fresh tamale breakfast any day! Your coworkers will love you if you bring some to the office. PS - Cash only, so bring your dinero!

2.description: Come early (especially on the weekends) in order to have a chance to try all the flavors. This little mom and pop restaurant is nothing short of heaven- some of the best tamales in Chicagoland. Full of flavor and meat, you can't go wrong. Also get some Atole to go hand in hand with your tamales, they all flavors including chocolate, guava, champurrado, and a few others. CASH ONLY.

9.description: Best tamales ever!! Specially reds with pork and strawberry.. Also atoles, champurrado is my favorite :)

18.description: I had their tamales for lunch at work. They where very cheap and very tasty i suggest any chicagoan bring themselves and any outsiders to this hidden gem. I have had many tamales in this town, these are the best so far.

10.description: I like their tamales they are good, only thing is that most times the staff are all not on the same page...it's aggravating annoying.I there every other weekend with the family. But when I just want to pick up they won't want to have them ready they just say they have them and for u to go in. I've done that and they wore gone then u wait on more for 30 minutes if lucky if not an hour. I've ordered big amounts for party and they won't take your order... They will say to go in at the time new batches are done, I'm not saying everyone 2 persons from there are the best at helping. I'll call and ask which just came out they ignore me and say they are all from today over and over when I keep asking which just recently came out same answers then she will ask how many dozens are u going to come get. And u always need CASH... But they are good no lie, I just wish they be friendlier however they don't speak to you like that when your there. Hmmm

13.description: Just a reminder! This place doesn't accept credit cards... CASH ONLY! But absolutely worth the trip to get some cash and head over west.. They were the warmest, fluffiest, green salsa was right on.. Strawberry was the best dulce i've ever had, and even tried and elote tamale.. Delicious.. The arroz con leche was so yummy.. I order champpurado, and she gave me a small arroz con leche for me to try.. Very friendly, clean and all in all a great experience.. And yes I won't be drivng to 47th anymore to look for a vedor.. This place is a shop, they open at 6 a.m. and open late..

16.description: Place is so good, they run out by the end of the day.Only tried Chicken and the strawberry flavor and they were awesome. Lots of chicken inside and the spiciness hit the spot for me (I love spicy). I was a bit hesitant ordering the sweet tamales but it was pretty tasty.

17.description: best tamales i've had in chicago.  really well made, the meat is not too fatty and they have a good balance of filling and masa.  worth the drive!

15.description: I love tamales!  so when I wake up too late to go to my favorite tamale lady I come here :DIts great to know you can satisfy a tamale craving any hour of the day  :D

0.description: I love tamales. And this is the first place that makes them so yummy and so authentic! The corn tamale is addicting!The pork with red sauce is just so good. On North Ave. If you live close by then you've probably been there. If not, just drive on over and bring your cash, it's cash only. Oh, and you don't have to go on a drunkin night. You can also have tamales for breakfast...they open at 6 am.

5.description: CORNY WRAPHave you ever looked at a recipe for making a  homemade tamale.  It will take you hours and when I say hours I do not mean like 2. I am leaning more towards 5-6 hours and that is not including the eating part. I always have a dream where I can whip these up at home but the reality is that this is not going to happen. Recently a friend decided to bring these to a morning meeting instead of donuts. I thought it was a great idea except for starting my day out with lard. I really made an effort to block the though of lard in my veins and dived in. As we sat there and ate my friend told a story about his adventure buying these. He arrived at 5am to order them and learned he needed cash. He then went to an ATM and upon his return there was a line out the front door. The moral of this story is to always have cash when ordering Mexican food because you just never know. We laughed and dove into the tamales and all enjoyed them. I love tamales but I always find the corn to be dry. This has been something I've experienced since having my first one over 30 years ago. I found one restaurant in Chicago that made a juicy veggie tamale but they are no longer in business (RIP La Finca). I really wish I had that recipe. I did not go to this place to pickup the tamales. They were basically delivered to our meeting. I was amazed that they were still warm in the sealed plastic bags they were packed in. Remember it was 9am and he grabbed them at 5:30am. I was just really happy to have an authentic treat for breakfast. I will say it was my first morning tamale. If I was to judge these with every tamale I have ever had then I would put these on the line of traditional authentic tamales. We had two different flavors to choose from. There was a chicken with red sauce & pork with green sauce. Typically these two are flipped (pork & red and chicken & green) but I enjoyed the different combination. Personally I think most people don't order those and our dear friend picking them up was not in the know when it came to ordering. The staff basically ordered for him. He will be ready the next time, if there is a next time. I am giving these tamales a 4 star rating because they are consistent to what a good Chicago Mexican restaurants offers. Now if you have a kick butt tamale then please send it my way. Also I know many places are making yummy topping sauces. Please don't send me there because I could cover an old shoe in green salsa and it would taste amazing. So grab your cash and get in line because these tamales are hot out of the steamer. Next time surprise the office at the 9am meeting with these instead of a box of donuts. They will probably be talking about you for weeks. Who knows they may even call you "The Tamale Guy"!

11.description: Cash only but great tamales. I had the green chile and chicken, corn and peppers and cheese. Very tasty, the thing with tamales is you need to be careful there isnt too much masa and not enough filings. THese were filled nicely, a bit stingy on the fillings but not much. They sell atole and champurrado, didnt have it but I will when i come back.

8.description: Pretty good tamales! Having made tamales from scratch before I know how much work is involved and how easy it is to get them wrong. This place churns out hundreds a day so they must be doing something right.chicken and salsa verde were my favorite but the cheese and pepper ones were ok just not as flavorful. Horchata was on point and great compliment to the spicy tamale. Not a fancy place (counter service) but they do have tables for dining in.Cash only!

4.description: This place is incredible. Cheese, chicken, or pork tamales wrapped in paper for $1.35, melt in your mouth. The salsa verde is so delicious, it's like they've just picked the tomatillos. For another $1.35 you can have a sweet tamale for dessert, strawberry pineapple or corn. The staff are so nice, and you pick a seat at these huge wooden tiled tables to eat. It's like being at a big family tamale dinner.

14.description: SO, woke up early morning and had a crave for chicken soup. Couldnt find it anywhere! So i see a tamale lady on the corner an I decided to see fi she has any chicken green tamales. She was out. So I ask does she know where they sell fresh tamales, and she pointed it this way. Ironic huh?So I go inside, its pretty small with like 3 or 5 tables. but they have atoles of different flavors and big hoyas of tamales with different types of meat or style. I was in heaven at that moment.I decided to order 1 1/2 dozen of tamales.1 dozen of green chicken and the half of rajas con queso.The green chicken tamales were decent, could be better if they added more sauce to it so it wont be too dry.The biggest disappointment was the rajas con queso, they only had one big slice of rajas across the tamale an sometimes the cheese was on one side of the tamale.The pricing wasent bad either. $12 for 12 tamales or i think it was 1.35 per.Would come again when im craving some tamales though an skip the corner lady.

6.description: This is the beat tamale place in Chicago, the state and the whole of North America (including Mexico). So moist and tasty. Wowzers! I go here at least once a week to cure my tamale cravings. If you are within an 5 hour commute do yourself a favor and stop by. Yummy in my tummy!

58.description: Rachael is amazing.  She's great at listening to what your issues are and coming up with a custom plan to help you, even if it's a little out-of-the-box.  She helped me release some scar tissue resulting from surgery and stretches me in ways I'm not capable of stretching on my own.  She's a great body "listener" and really knows how to manipulate your body to get it to its healthiest place. Highly recommended!

56.description: I started going to Rachael after getting a stellar recommendation from a friend. I keep going back because I'm very pleased with the results for my multiple maladies ranging from chronic low back & SI joint pain to plantar fasciitis. If you are looking for a frou-frou, aromatherapy, soft touch, relaxing, B.S. massage, this is NOT the place for you. But if you need a customized treatment that targets specific issues, there is no better place. It is a perfect fit for me because I want to feel better physically TOMORROW, not just more relaxed today. Very low key atmosphere, close to my home and the price can't be beat. She is tremendously accomodating when I'm in serious pain. And she even seems to sense when I need to come in and proactively texts me. I highly recommend her!

29.description: Rachel is the woman! She is truly amazing at her craft. I knew within minutes I'd be a client for life. She's revolutionized my outlook on what it's like to take care of myself. I can go on and on so try for yourself!

42.description: I had my first session with Rachel today and am so excited to have a new go-to person for functional massage therapy. With Rachel, it's evident that she's into the science of it all and not wed to any particular approach - it's a blend of approaches. I do Crossfit, strength training and rowing and have all of the issues (mobility, tightness, etc) associated with each. I really appreciate Rachel's broad yet deep knowledge of how everything works together - and how certain issues are red herrings for others.Most importantly, I get the sense that she has integrity. She's just one of those people that are great in their chosen field and don't capitalize on that at the unnecessary expense of others. Refreshing.Results: I'm sore (as expected). And... I also PR'd a problem lift by 19 pounds after seeing her.

23.description: I found Rachel and Chicago Body Work more than two years ago, and am so glad I did. The services she provides are amazing and have helped me with managing severe chronic back pain.  Rachel is a consummate professional who also treats her clients as friends. I'm happy I have her and her practice in my life.

47.description: I went to see Rachael on a recommendation from a fellow long distance runner. I was experiencing acute symptoms of plantar fasciitis in my right foot that was keeping me from running at all. My experience with Rachael was fantastic and this past Saturday, I was able to run 15miles PAIN FREE in my foot! Rachael is incredibly kind and mild mannered. She knows the techniques she uses are different from a traditional massage session and she is fantastic and talking you through each step of the process. The atmosphere is relaxing and comfortable and frankly, it is effective body work. You should absolutely give Rachael a  try and you can expect to feel revived, relaxed and relieved after visiting her. I'll be recommending Rachael to others without a doubt.

8.description: I found Rachel and Chicago Body Work more than two years ago, and am so glad I did. The services she provides are amazing and have helped me with managing severe chronic back pain.  Rachel is a consummate professional who also treats her clients as friends. I'm happy I have her and her practice in my life.

31.description: Rachael was great. I came to her because I have had intense neck and back pain for months. I even went to physical therapy to try and improve my situation. Shortly after PT, my symptoms came back. After seeing Rachael, I feel so much better. She was kind, intelligent and extremely knowledgable. I felt very comfortable during the entire session. I was really sore for a day or two after the appointment but it was worth it. When I went to leave, she noticed I didn't have any gloves with me, and gave me a pair of her own for my walk home! Overall, she's great and I would highly recommend her services.

34.description: I've only used this service once, but it was awesome. Rachael is super nice, down to earth, and takes the time to explain everything or answer any questions you might have. It was the perfect blend of professionalism and friendliness, which is really the best combination you could ask for in a total stranger who's working intensely on your body. She followed up with a text a few days later, just to make sure I was feeling better (I'd gone to see her after I'd been on bed rest for a week and my muscles got incredibly sore and stiff), and even gave a bag of epsom salts to take home and soak in a bath to get the most out of the work she'd just done. I went through the ROLFING process (a super intense form of bodywork) back home on the east coast a few years ago, and it was honestly life changing, but I hadn't found anyone in Chicago that was as effective, until now. If I ever am in need of bodywork again, and I'm in Chicago, this is without a doubt who I'd go to.

16.description: Rachael is fantastic. I have chronic pain due to muscle spasms, and I feel like I accomplished more in two visits to her than I did in months of physical therapy. I don't see her to be pampered, I see her because she is knowledgeable, easy to talk to, and good at beating my trigger points into submission without making me feel like I'm dying. I'd recommend to anyone looking to get a serious massage at a reasonable price. She also has plenty of information to share on causes of pain, and has helped me to treat my issues better at home.

13.description: Chicago Bodywork is fantastic.   I hurt my shoulder and have been there a few times now and it's been incredibly effective treatment, and the communication and explanations have been top-notch.  Super friendly, absolutely effective, just plain fantastic.

11.description: Rachel is  a real healer. Always leave pain free. I strongly recomend anyone with pain should seek Rachel's help.

39.description: Rachel is the best!!!!! I went to several  other "therapists" but they didn't help me at all! i have pain in my legs, feet,  back & shoulder, Rachel has giving me my life back! i was unable to stand for too long,  & i was unable to walk without pain, and after ONE session with her i could walk without pain. today was my 4th visit and i will not go to anyone else!!! she targets the areas that i have problems, she uses tools that are awesome, and she is very smart and sweet!! i love love love her...thank you for moving to Chicago!

37.description: I decided to give Rachel a shot after reading the reviews here and I'm so glad that I did. I came in with lower back pain and a neck injury and after just one visit with her, I felt amazing! She definitely focuses on healing and not just massage. She knew about several previous injuries just by touch!! If you want to get real healing and advice on how to keep your body out of trouble, do yourself a favor and schedule an appointment. I can't wait to go back!

0.description: After 25 years of writing scripts, hunched over a computer, my spine has started to look like that of Quasimodo. My neck is so tight, there are times I can barely move it. More seriously, my posture has started to manifest as nerve pain down my arms and numbness in my hands. It's gotten so bad it keeps me up at night.I've gotten a million massages, and sure, they feel good, but they never last. $150 down the drain. Which is how I know that Rachael is ridiculously, amazingly skilled. She's the first person to actually work not just on my neck and back, but on the tightness in my chest, shoulders and sides. I'm just two sessions in, and I'm stunned by the difference. Remarkably, I can actually sit up straight now and hold my neck in a more natural position. It still aches a bit to do so, but the point is, I can do it! I had no idea that all the tightness was keeping me permanently hunched.I honestly thought that I'd done too much damage to do anything about it. I know now that that's wrong. I'm convinced that with a few more sessions, I'll have undone a lifetime of laptop hunching.

38.description: AMAZINGI suffered a horrible pinched never about 8 months ago, and have not recovered 100% since.  I have gone to several massage therapists, some better than others, but none really did the job 100%  Then I came across Chicago BodyWork and Rachael in my neighborhood.  I'll say it again... AMAZING.  If you are looking for a relaxing spa-treatment, this is NOT the massage for you.  If you are looking for PAIN and/or DEEP STRESS relief, this IS the place for you.  My range of motion is better than it's been in MONTHS after just one session.Rachael - I AM a believer!  Thank you!

51.description: Rachel is fantastic and really knows her stuff. 2 weeks ago, fed up with suffering from general winter stiffness and muscle soreness and wanting to find someone for regular bodywork to balance out my active lifestyle, I was in search of a massage therapist in my area with a little more to offer than just a scented candle spa massage. Found Rachel through yelp and needless to say I will be calling only her from here on out. She has an extensive knowledge on the sources of pain and tension in the body and a calm but extremely effective touch for working them out. Not to mention she's the best deal in town with a flexible and accommodating schedule. Highly recommended.

27.description: I'm just going to echo what everyone else here has said. Rachael is a true healer. I've had countless massages over the years, and none can touch the level of awesomeness I got out of Rachael's work. After just 1 session, she fixed a chronic pinched nerve in my neck and taught me what to do to keep it from coming back. It may be more intense than what you're used to, but this is not a spa massage. It's therapy. And it's incredibly effective. Rachael's the real deal.

32.description: If you believe that massage is a practice for healing, and not only for spa treatment, then Rachel is who you need to see.  When you are invited into her studio, you can see all the evidence of her study on the body and she can show you on diagrams what will be worked on to help you with your unique need. I have been experiencing numbness and tingling  in my arms and hands, particularly after sleeping.  She worked on me using a vibration machine, massage, working pressure points, manipulation techniques, and she even gave me a bit of homework.  Her personality is warm and professional, and she is surrounded by an air of peacefulness.  She truly listens to your needs, and works to heal your body long term.  She is the only person I want working on my body other than me.

54.description: Rachael gives some of the most creative, focused, and lasting body work I've ever received.  As a dancer with a slew of alignment problems and chronic injuries, I am always seeking out a more comprehensive body work approach.  I feel that I've found it in Rachael.  In a visit, she might do intense range of motion stretches with me, stuff that feels as deep as Rolfing, Chinese medicine techniques like cupping, and any other assortment of amazing methods.  The work can be tough, but Rachael's calm energy is trustworthy and she gets the job done.  I can always trust that with Rachael, I will have a body work session customized toward my specific needs.  She has a great ability to "read" the body and has several times revealed to me the actual root of a problem that I was feeling somewhere else.  She manages to completely fill an hour-long session; I always leave feeling amazed at how much she accomplished that span of time.Though I do love a Zen-like massage experience with scented oils and tabla music, I have come to believe that Rachael's approach is far more productive in terms of my health.  She "keeps it real" and gets to the root of the problem in as many ways as she possibly can.  I may leave with some marks and bruises, but the actual lasting benefits and healing power are far greater than with any other massage I've experienced. Rachael's work is super affordable and so good.  I would highly recommend her to anyone, but especially to dancers and movers who are looking for a more comprehensive approach to body work.

48.description: I was on a 2 week vacation in Europe and between lugging around heavy baggage and bad hostel beds, I felt a tightness on the right side of my middle back.  I felt totally off balance like a car pulling to the left.I had a massage from Rachel about 6 months prior to my trip.  It was more intense than other massages I've had before, but I felt great afterward.I saw her for the second time and after the massage, my back felt great.  The tightness was gone and I felt totally in balance.If you're just looking for a relaxing spa treatment or have a low tolerance for pain, look somewhere else.  But if you're looking for someone who's not afraid to dig in and get all the knots out, you won't find anyone better.  I would highly recommend.

44.description: Went to see Rachael on a trip to Chicago.  I was looking for a therapeutic solution to a chronic lower back issue not a relaxing massage.  As promised on her website, Rachael provided an excellent diagnosis of the problem and spent over an hour solving it.  Through manipulation and deep trigger point work she released muscles in my back that had been seized for some time.Rachael's bodywork is the most effective I have encountered.  She is open and honest    and an interesting person as well.  She gave me suggestions to maintain the progress we had made.  While I live halfway across the country I will visit Rachael whenever I am in Chicago. She is a rare person and I was lucky to find her.

24.description: Rachael is honestly a healer with super powers!I have had a lifetime of pain and muscle cramping due to an illness and a severe accident a few years ago. I had spent years doing different healing modalities only to reach a point where I had severe pain daily.Doctors said that would be my normal for the rest of my life. Not true.A few months of seeing Rachael and I have an amazing full active life that keeps improving. I 100% recommend that you make an appointment if you are serious about healing and experiencing relief of physical pain. She is caring, warm, and professional. You will definitely have a positive healing experience.

7.description: Had a back and neck issue for months and went to chiropractors a few times trying to fix the pain and lack of motion.  Finally tried another approach and saw Rachel.  She beat the crap out of my back (in a good way) and opened up my shoulder/neck muscles -  I have my range of motion back and feel so much better now.  Thank you Rachel!

49.description: Rachel is fantastic!Her use of Thai massage and trigger point therapy is exactly what I needed for my annoying low back pain. I've seen her twice now, and can honestly say that I got off the table feeling considerably better both times. Her space is simple, clean and inviting; her techniques are varied and her price is affordable.Do yourself a favor and make an appointment!

40.description: Yes, yes, yes if you want pain relief from someone who actually knows that they are doing - go to Rachel!  She massaged hard in places that needed it and were contributing to my pain.  She was excellent with communication and gave me pain relief tips before we met (because our schedules weren't connecting and I had to wait a week to see her).  She has also followed up with me to make sure my pain is down.I have also referred someone there for repetitive stress injury from using the computer all day.  Rachel understands anatomy and knows how to work it!I have not seen her while pregnant, but we spoke about back pain during pregnancy - she is certified in this area and I would go to her in a minute for prenatal massage as she understood the pain I had while pregnant just during our discussion about it.As other people mentioned, this is not a spa massage but I found the environment and her personality to be very relaxing.  Street parking was FREE and easy.   HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

53.description: Great massage!  Rachel is skilled in her profession and knows how to use massage to help people.  Go to Rachel if you're looking for a deep massage to help issues...more than just a relaxation massage.

30.description: I won't see anyone else after going to Rachel.  Intelligent, caring,  professional and just the right amount of pressure - firm yet gentle.  I felt so much better after seeing her and will be back.

46.description: Sorry for the long review here but hope some of this might be useful to all. Alex works for my wife and I. We own a bike shop. Alex went to Rachael first, second and third. Alex doesn't talk (a lot) but when he does you listen. I think his comment when I finally asked was "she knows what she's doing". Then there was an ambiguous comment about BE READY. So I lost 20 pounds and my wife got hotter and we decided to reward ourselves after a quarter century of loving each other with this experience. So we booked consecutive appointments and watched each other as Rachael went to work. I was first - Rachael knows us from the bike shop and briefly asked me about the herniated discs (L1/S5) and went to work. On the lower half of my body. Why? Cause she knows what she is doing. The problem with customers in both of our businesses is ignoring the disinformation. The problem with my back is the effect, not the cause. Curious if Rachael agrees. So my poor wife had to endure an hour of watching Rachael using suction, elbows, body weight and leverage against my aging lower body as I struggled to let her in to get the job done. I walked off the table feeling like an ATHLETE and then was very curious what Rachael's plan was for my wife. Linda was recently out of arthroscopic hip surgery that resulted (after 8 hours) in the surgeon telling her mother and her husband that he was suprised to see the amount of arthritis in her hip and that hip replacement was definitely in her future. In the interim, physical therapy and pain management were the next best plan. He was even so kind as to explain to my mother-in-law and I that my wife had a hip joint very similar to a labrador retriever meaning their is essentially no socket and the hip bone justs rotates around a vague semi-circle of hip joint. Rachael's approach to my wife used an entirely different set of tools and techniques. The suction cup was out a new vibrating tool was in. She immediately noticed a leg length discrepency that Linda verified was identified prior to surgery. I'm guessing less than an 1" but what was interesting to me was could this session get a perfectly healthy hot 50 year old back to even leg length cause I'm pretty darn sure that's what I married a quarter century ago. Yes she did. And (two) Epsom salt bath's later we're really looking forward to our next appointment (s) and the pleasure of Rachael's company. Which is the icing on the cake, cause this lady is JUST PLAIN COOL. Ride on. Eric & Linda Puetz - Smart Bike Parts

1.description: Rachael is a healer/ass-kicker/strong intuitive practitioner. I would consider her more physical therapy/WORK IT OUT massage therapy. She really senses where the tightness is & gets in there to really get at the root of the pain. It's exactly the kind of massage therapy that is hard to find as most people just do gentle touching & do nothing to get at the problem.Highly recommend...her space is really warm & cozy & Rachael puts you at ease as soon as you walk in the door. If you are looking for someone to really work out your issues, she is the best. Very reasonable & worth every penny. Plus, she is an animal lover so there's that :)

55.description: This is not a massage for wimps.  This is a massage for athletes or other people who have persistent pain/aches/soreness/general discomfort that they want to address and are willing to work with Rachael to address them.  This is not for those who want temporary cures or oil-lathered rub downs.  Basically, this is an awesome massage.    I wouldn't go to anyone else.Just two examples of awesomeness.  I'm a marathon runner.  So my hip flexors are basically a mess.  In just my first session, Rachael was able to release muscles that were so tight I thought for years they were tendons or bones.  This was at times a painful experience, but extremely gratifying.  When I complained of a sore shoulder she did this thing where she used pressure points and had me move my neck in different position.  The next day, I had about 350 x greater range of motion.

9.description: Rachel is AMAZING! I had a bad shoulder from working behind a desk and after one session with her, the pain is gone and a I feel completely realigned. My mom booked my appointment after Rachel worked wonders on her shoulder (that's given her problems since forever) and told me it was a "Thai  massage"... Duped. But I wouldn't trade one session here for all the Thai / Swedish / deep tissue massages in my lifetime. Come hurtin', leave healed.

26.description: I think I forgot to rate Rachael after I saw her. I went to see Rachael a few months ago and have not needed to go back. I am actually quite saddened that I don't need to go back because that is simply how amazing her work is! I had been suffering from migraines and chronic tension in my shoulders. One visit to Rachael and now if my shoulders get tense while I am work it disappears by the end of the day. My migraines rarely show up anymore and if they do I can usually discover the cause of them. Rachael is definitely worth going to over anyone else!

25.description: Important Fact #1:  Rachel is very, very good at what she doesImportant Fact #2:  Parking is free and convenientI'll let you decide which of these facts is the most important!I went to see Rachel because I had a chronic problem with pain in my knee that I had been dealing with for years and I had recently developed nerve pain running down my leg and a lot of pain and burning in my hip and buttock area.  Within 4 sessions the nerve pain was completely gone and the pain in my hip and buttock area and knee significantly diminished.  Using the self-massage advice Rachel gave me, and doing a lot of research on body biomechanics and working hard to clean up how I use/mis-use my body, I am now pretty much 95% all fixed up.  It's amazing to be able to use my leg again after years of having to work around the pain.  And my dog is thrilled because now we can jog together.She will be totally honest with you and if she can't help you she won't pretend otherwise.  I wish I had gone to see Rachel first and not wasted my time and hard earned money with a physical therapist and other massage therapists.

12.description: I just started seeing Isaac at Chicago Bodywork.  I love visiting, it's so pleasant seeing Rachael and Lulu.  Isaac has healing hands and the most wonderful spirit.  I continue to recommend him and no one leaves disappointed. He's a healer.

59.description: Rachael healed me! I saw her once a week for a couple of months and my pain disappeared.  She doesn't only help your body relax, but she actually takes care of eliminating any persisting knots anywhere in your body.  Most massage therapist's goal is to relax their clients, but Rachael does not only help you relax, she heals and takes care of the root of the problem with her clinical massage knowledge.  You might be sore after the massage, but you'll feel like new the next day.  Thank you Rachael!

21.description: Rachel is AMAZING! I had a bad shoulder from working behind a desk and after one session with her, the pain is gone and a I feel completely realigned. My mom booked my appointment after Rachel worked wonders on her shoulder (that's given her problems since forever) and told me it was a "Thai  massage"... Duped. But I wouldn't trade one session here for all the Thai / Swedish / deep tissue massages in my lifetime. Come hurtin', leave healed.

17.description: I'm just going to echo what everyone else here has said. Rachael is a true healer. I've had countless massages over the years, and none can touch the level of awesomeness I got out of Rachael's work. After just 1 session, she fixed a chronic pinched nerve in my neck and taught me what to do to keep it from coming back. It may be more intense than what you're used to, but this is not a spa massage. It's therapy. And it's incredibly effective. Rachael's the real deal.

10.description: Rachael is simply amazing. I started to have some foot/knee issues due to working out and walking a lot more than in the past.  I had heard great things about her and finally decided to go.  After my first session I felt great!  Like someone else said, this isn't a feel good massage but she really gets in to the muscles and gets all of it out.  It was really painful but definitely necessary to get back on track.  I knew though that since I do work out a lot that I would need at least another session.  I went back two weeks after and she taught me how to do certain stretches on my own and I feel like a million bucks.  If you are looking to heal please go here!  I can't recommend her enough!!!

5.description: Rachael is absolutely amazing and truly passionate about her work! It was my first trip to Chicago and I happened to stumble upon her through Yelp. I've never received a better therapy massage and when I come back to Chicago in May I will be coming back to see her!!! P.S. I only wish she would pack up leave Chicago and move to Baltimore, MD! Thank you again!!

3.description: Rachael is honestly a healer with super powers!I have had a lifetime of pain and muscle cramping due to an illness and a severe accident a few years ago. I had spent years doing different healing modalities only to reach a point where I had severe pain daily.Doctors said that would be my normal for the rest of my life. Not true.A few months of seeing Rachael and I have an amazing full active life that keeps improving. I 100% recommend that you make an appointment if you are serious about healing and experiencing relief of physical pain. She is caring, warm, and professional. You will definitely have a positive healing experience.

35.description: I am so glad I found Rachel. I have had constant pain in my back, shoulders and neck. She knew exactly what to do to loosen my tense muscles. The bodywork was painful, but so worth it. She told me what to do afterwards to minimize any soreness the next day, I followed her instructions and woke up with no pain. After just one session I feel like a new person. All of the knots I had in my back are gone and I even feel like my posture has improved. I highly recommend!

19.description: Rachael is so wonderful. She not only talked me through all of the steps she would take to help me find relief from my CrossFitter's aches and pains, but she was completely transparent in her areas of focus! Go to her - she is the real deal. Seriously. Just do it. :)

28.description: I have had chronic knee pain for many years due to a life time of running and playing sports, combined with working a desk job.  I found Rachael by searching on Yelp.  I was a little skeptical when I first went to her, but when one of her first statements when I walked in was "my goal is to see you as little as possible" made me realize she wasn't just trying to milk me for money, and after my first session I realized what a miracle worker she is.  After 3 sessions my knee is doing so much better.  Very knowledgeable about joints, how each muscle connects, and what to do to relieve pain with a long term goal in mind.  A+

45.description: Rachael is wonderful! I've been training for a marathon and I've got lots of knots in my legs, calves, glutes, etc. Rachael's techniques have been helpful in helping me to get back to good running form. She has a lot of knowledge about the body and alternative therapies.

33.description: Believe the hype! I won't be seeing anyone else for my back pain from now on. I've paid more money for a "nice" massage that gave me no actual results. Rachel relieved me of my pain for weeks! I sent my boyfriend to her and he immediately booked another appointment. She is also super friendly and will provide you with many tips to help you in between sessions. If you are in need of real therapy she is your girl!

43.description: Rachael was exactly what I was hoping for:   knowledgeable about her craft, kind, and approachable.   Not a pretentious douchebag at all.     She took a chance on me and accommodated my situation with grace and generosity.  If I lived in the area, I would be back again for sure...    I would recommend her to anyone.

2.description: I found Rachael & Chicago Bodywork online after reading other rave reviews. It was easy to set up an appointment directly with her and she was extremely accommodating and flexible to try and fit me in when I was free. This was the first time for me to get a therapeutic massage and Rachael was great about explaining everything she was doing and why. The way she stretched and worked my muscles was like a workout, and for days and weeks afterward I could feel the difference because all the stress and strain wasn't just temporarily relieved but eliminated.  If you're looking for a spa-like massage with more style than substance, this isn't for you, but if you want healing results and an informed professional who'll help you take care of your body long-term, Chicago Bodywork is for you.

18.description: I would rather not post this review as you may take my time slot.....but look no further if you need real work done. Rachael is the real deal. I'm a very active endurance athlete and I can say I've seen it all. Had terrible massages in which it felt like I was being tickled, sessions in which you can tell the person just has no idea what they are doing and really just wasting money. If you are looking to have real work done on your body to remedy what is ailing you this is the spot. Don't be scared off by the idea that this is not a spa. Fixing kinks in the body is not always pleasent but enjoying being post session I always feel much better. No joke, at this point if I feel a tweak I'm heading to Rachael before I'd bother hitting a doctor.

41.description: Yet another thank you to Yelpers for the reviews for Rachael. Bodywork is something that EVERYONE should treat themselves to, even if you aren't feeling pain. Sitting all day, standing all day, being active, riding your bike, running - it all puts us into dysfunction in some way or another. First of all, her communication is fantastic. You can text her and/or call her (pretty sure you can email her as well). She responds quickly and will find a time that works for you. After my visit, she contacted me via text around 2 days after I saw her. That's some great customer service! I was in quite a bit of pain and wanting to see someone immediately to feel some relief. I've had ongoing pain from injuries stemming from running and lifting. I've been going to physical therapy on/off (moreso on) for years, as well as seeing different sports Docs. With the frustration of at least getting some short term relief between physical therapy appointments, I called several massage therapists and body work folks. Rachael was the person I absolutely wanted to see. Just look at her reviews here. Look at her website. She is a person who is clearly passionate about what she does. She loves what she does. I couldn't wait to meet her. This isn't a spa experience. You're in a Chicago apartment in a room with windows overlooking garages and apartments in Logan Square. Bring comfortable, loose clothing. You have no choice but to stay present to the session! For those of you who haven't had active release technique, cupping and Graston technique, you are in for a real treat! Rachael uses similar methodologies and tailors it to what your body is telling her. Her release on iliopsoas and stretches for my sacroiliac joint pain and cupping/IATSM (look it up on her website) work on my knee (which hasn't been the same since knee surgery) is what my body needed. She also worked on my pecs due to the shoulder blade pain I've been having. I requested 2 hours for my first session with her; I felt like a million bucks walking out. To walk down the stairs with no knee pain after her appointment was incredible. She gave me some stretches to do to maintain proper form, suggested supplements to buy as well as what to eat after the session. She is realistic about the knots/soreness/pain that may or may not remain after the session. I truly appreciate her honesty. Prior to my appointment with her, she recommended an Epsom salt soak. The pain had been so bad for days I was waking up in the middle of the night and really agitated. I had never done one before as I thought it was for old people (talk about being a moron!). I slept like a baby that night. She also recommended the bath toward the end of the day after my appointment. It was a good call! The work she does is not particularly pleasant (kudos to the reviewer who said "This is not for wimps!"), but it gets you results. Your body is your home; if you're willing to maintain everything else but your body, that's a damn shame. Your body will eventually tell you with pain that it needs you to do something about it. So do it. Go to Rachael and educate yourself on your body on your own time. Don't just rely on a Doctor to do it. (End rant)I really enjoyed talking to her during our session and hope that more people patronize her and see the relief she brings. She is a really wonderful, strong, authentic person. Free street parking is available during the weekdays on the street her place is located on. There's metered street parking on California as well. She is cash only. Be sure to tip!

52.description: Rachel is amazing. I went to her with severe upper back pain. It was at the point where even walking was uncomfortable and at times, painful. She asked me what my problem area was and she actually listened. As in, she didn't spend 40 out of 60 minutes rubbing my earlobes, toes and calf muscles. She focused on my problem area and when she worked on my chest muscles and shoulder muscles, she explained how those muscles are contributing to my back pain. Seriously knowledgeable. Her website doesn't lie. She's not there to give you the spa experience type of massage. Some parts of the massage were downright painful but when I left, I felt a million times better. I had the best nights sleep of my life that night. Pain free. I really look forward to going to see her again. My only complaint is that I waited so long and lived with so much pain before I booked my appointment.

50.description: I used to get massages semi regularly but through stretching and yoga it became something I really didn't feel the need to do anymore.  But recently I had found myself with some really annoying back pain that made me check out my local massage options.  Well, now I am really grateful for that pain because it led me to Rachael.  Her technique is very different from what I've experienced in the past - there were some interactive moments and overall it was more intense and less relaxing.  But that's the point - her goal is to help you and your body, not charge you for a nap on her massage table.  By working on me she was able to tell which weight lifting exercise I do a lot of (and could scale back on) and suggested ones I could do more of to even myself out and reduce my pain.  While I went there for back pain we actually spent a lot of time on my chest as she explained that it was also aiding in my problem. Well, I feel completely different after that massage, both physically and emotionally.  I know that 'emotionally' part may make some people roll their eyes, but it's true.  I feel so frackin' good all over!  Going to see Rachael for my pain was the best decision.  Even if my back pain never comes back I will continue to see Rachael to work on my flexibility and range of motion.

4.description: I wish I would have skipped physical therapy and just gone to Racheal from the start. I work at a stressful desk job and was having a lot of upper back pain. I also was still having numbness and tingling in my feet after a surgery 2 years ago. Racheal worked out some nasty knots in my back and put a stop to my foot pain, while also explaining how various muscles were interconnected, and showing me some stretches I could do at home in just 60 minutes. She is a genius.If you want deep tissue, actual resolution to your pain, and not one of those dainty frou-frou massages, there is no one better. I have recommended her to all of my friends!

6.description: I've dealt with years of neck pain, tingling and numbness in my elbows and wrists from too much typing/general overuse. Originally found Rachael on Yelp when I moved back to Chicago 2 years ago and saw her multiple times at her previous location. She's amazing. Really. She fixed my original issue immensely and I only see her a 3x a year tops now just to get a tune up. Her prices are extremely reasonable and you get actual therapy not a weird lotiony rubdown that costs $120. She's a genuinely nice person who cares about her clients. Highly recommended..

22.description: Rachael is incredible at what she does. Extremely knowledgeable, and walked away feeling better than I ever have from a massage. Could not recommend highly enough, either for chronic pain or for just a massage!

15.description: Rachael is amazing.  I was in utter agony for months and came to Chicago Bodywork as a last resort.  I spent thousands on chiropractors and physical therapy before coming with no results.  Now I am doing great.  I had a significant decrease in pain after the first visit and keep getting better (have been 4 times now).  I can't recommend Rachael enough!

57.description: By far, the best massage I've ever had.Rachael is super approachable, funny, smart, friendly, and cares about her clients. The reason I came in was that I wasn't able to sleep because my back hurt so badly. She not only corrected it in a matter of an hour, but gave me advice on how to avoid upper back pain in the future. And it was super affordable! I'm a student, so I normally can't afford most things, but it really helps to take care of yourself.Fantastic and friendly; I will definitely be going for years to come.

20.description: Rachel is  a real healer. Always leave pain free. I strongly recomend anyone with pain should seek Rachel's help.

36.description: I agree 100% with what everyone else says. Rachael is positively amazing!

14.description: I've been to Rachael several times and if I could go every day...I would. I have referred Rachael to several of my friends. Her new location is outstanding and it has a private parking lot!

0.description: I live in the neighborhood and saw King Lizzy as it was opening up, and was happy to see the cool T-shirts and other merchandise in the windows so decided to pop in with my sister to see what they have going on in here. As you walk in you will be greeted by a friendly fellow who is more than happy to tell you about King Lizzy and what they are doing or explain the art-inspired and activist-inspired hoodies, t-shirts, and more available here. This place has some excellent neighborhood inspired T-shirts featuring the Puerto Rican baseball player Roberto Clemente (if you don't know much about him, he was a cool guy and an activist), as well as t-shirts featuring Humboldt Park, and a really nice shirt featuring the CTA map in a mirror pattern (I got one). They have a cool T-shirt series called "Outlawed" which features activists like Angela Davis and others. Some of the shirts are heavy cotton, and some are lighter American Apparel style. I prefer  the lighter American Apparel style. They try to make sure they are using fair trade products in everything they do which is pretty cool. Now, there is another reason to shop here. This place is a nonprofit that helps the neighborhood by giving opportunities to neighborhood youth. Now, that is pretty cool. This is a social enterprise that brings area artists and youth together to make some cool stuff. We found that they had stuff in the back so if you don't see your size just ask. The owner also said they were open to doing print orders and custom orders as well. Welcome to Paseo Boriqua King Lizzy!  It is good to see a business doing some good and making some nice street wear in the process.

3.description: What happened to their steak burgers???? I haven't had Remus n a very looong time. I was crushed yesterday that they no longer sell steak burgers!!! Please bring them back they were the bomb!!!!!

1.description: Must try if I'm the area I love the wing dinner with mild sauce. It's a perfect meal for one person!

2.description: My husband was hungry for something fried.  That's how we ended up trying Uncle Remus Fried Chicken.  We got their special which is a great deal.  You get 3 pieces, fries and bread for $4.69.  The fried chicken was delicious, pipping hot and fried goodness.  The fries were bleh and the bread was terrible. If you happen to be in Wal-Mart and are hungry, then this place will satisfy that hunger and make you a much happier shopper.  It was refreshing to have this establishment in there instead of McDonald's.

9.description: Ugh, I'm so torn over this. I lovee their fried chicken, its the only fried chicken i will crave for. I got some dental work done, and this is the first place I wanted to eat it when i could taste again. Their mild saucy is delicious, and their hot sauce is actually spicy. With all that being said- this location (inside the walmart) sucks huge balls. I will drive all the way out here, and they will be out of their chicken breasts, mashed potatoes, cole slaw, wings, legs and or any given item on the menu.It is impossible to gage what will be available from the menu. I just went today at 12:45 and they were out of chicken breasts, mashed potatoes, dark meat chicken. They only had wings left. This is a mere 3 hours from when they opened! And so with that said- I will still probably be back. It's hella good and its cheeaappp.  I would also recommend getting both the mild and the hot sauce. Just beware thtat you might/probably wont get exactly what you want

10.description: The chicken is delicious.  Born and raised a southsider, I tend to lean towards Harold's.  Uncle Remus has very juicy and crispy chicken and the mild sauce is amazing.  I love that they have rolls, instead of just white bread.  It's near impossible to shop in Walmart without the smell of chicken pulling you over.  I'm a big fan.

4.description: Good fried chicken.  Out late on the Westside and before heading back home I wanted some wings.  A friend told me to stop by Uncle Remus. The chicken was fresh, hot and seasoned well. The mild sauce was a little sweet compared to harolds but still good!

6.description: I received a Groupon type offer today in my inbox for another wing place and after checking out Yelp decided not to buy into that offer.  However, by that time the damage was done and I was craving chicken wings.  After a bit of looking on Yelp I found this place and it was only about a mile or two miles from where I live so I decided to try this place instead.As far as the food goes I'd say for me it rates a good solid 3 star rating which some may interpret as being not that good, but in my mind it means it was good food.  I had 10 mild chicken wings and an order of jalapeno poppers to go.  The sauce was real good, but I certainly would not say it was the best I've ever had.  For me prefer a mild sauce that has a slight vinegar twang to it and this one only had a teeney bit of twang to it.  Also, the wings came breaded with a coating similar to what you'd get at KFC.  I'm used to my wings not being coated in a breading so I'd have prefered to not have that, but apparently others disagree with me since others rate it much higher.  As far as the wings go will I ever make a special trip there for them like I did today?  No, however if I happen to be Walmart and have a craving I will pick up a few pieces to hold me over until I can get to someplace else.  When ordering if you like your wings to have lots of the sauce flavoring then definitely ask for extra sauce on it or you will be dissapointed since they do not cook it in the sauce and just squirt it on from what looks like a squirt bottle so it does not get fully covered.For me the best part of my meal was the jalapeno poppers.  The jalapenos did have just a little bit of a vinegar type twang and also just the tiniest bit of heat.  I'm a white guy who although I live in a Hispanic neighborhood just can't handle more than just the smallest hint of heat.  Another personal preference for me is I prefer my poppers to have a cheddar cheese filling and thankfully that's exactly what these had.  I just don't care for the ones that have cream cheese or whatever that white stuff is that in some poppers.  Now I can easily see myself making a special trip back specifically for the jalapeno poppers!Another reviewer alluded to the "danger factor" in visiting this Walmart.  I'll be the first to admit that it's in an area that I'd say is definitely right on the edge of either lower middle class or upper lower class, but it certainly is not a ghetto by any stretch of the imagination.  If I was married I would not want my wife going there by herself after dark, but during the daytime I wouldn't hesitate to say yeah go pick up some things there.  I'm a 50 year old white male and I have never felt in any way intimidated walking to or from this store to the bus stop I get off on at Grand and Cicero Avenues.  If you're the type of person who will be afraid walking into a store where 80% of the customers are African American (I think that's still an acceptable terminology, and if not sorry), 17% are Hispanic and us few whites only make up maybe 3% of the people inside then yeah you may want to avoid this store.

11.description: best damn mild sauce... HATE WAL MART but LOVE Uncle Remus!!! Harold's has nothing on you :)

5.description: Best chicken wings in town!!  I love and crave these wings and they always satisfy.  These aren't your regular sized wings they are big and full of meat, you definitely get alot for your money. They constantly run specials everyday they have a special for a very reasonable price you can't complain.  However the only downfall is the location!, located in the only city's Walmart its always busy and the way can be a bit frustrating. But once you get your food you completely  forget about the long wait!! More need to be available in the city and I will forever be there lol!!Mild sauce is by far the BEST I HAVE EVER HAD!!!

7.description: I don't go to Walmart that often...ESPECIALLY this godforsaken one full of rude ass people, but everytime I go I must stop at Uncle Remus' and get a 5 wings with extra mild sauce drowning my fries and roll. I love their mild sauce. It is sweeter than Harold's. They have pretty good specials too. Service is super slow...ALWAYS....but it's worth the wait.

8.description: They have really good saucy fried chicken along with other good standard to go items. I recently tried their saucy pizza puff - very yummy! It hit the spot after a long day of shopping and running errands. Conveniently located in the North Ave Walmart, if you want a little break from shopping and something good to eat. As other's have mentioned it does get pretty busy cuz it is in the Walmart, and probably not the best place to go if you're in a rush. But if you have a few minutes, it's worth the wait.

0.description: I truly enjoy U.R, their chicken is seasoned and fried well not to hard so it won't be dried out. The pieces are a nice size (well the wings are) since that is the only parts I have had. The only difference to me is this location does put enough sauce on the chicken which I like. The new location in Bronzeville does not. Not sure if the new location that particular cook just didn't do it or what. I would prefer going to the new location but since they are skimpy with the sauce I go out of my way to go to the one on the northwest side. The chicken at both locations is season well and in my opinion way better than Harold's ( I know I will probably get a lot of flack for saying that I truly enjoy U. R. Way better than Harold's they are so overrated to me. But this is Chicago and people love their Harold's.) I like the fact that they put a lot of sauce on their food and you don't have to pay extra for some sauce like you do at Harold's. Some people may truly think it is too much sauce but that is the way I like it and their model is U. R. The saucy chicken, and they truly stand by their words.

3.description: Bean is the absolute best stylist I've ever had. I have difficult hair and a low tolerance for maintenance, and she sends me out of the chair with a cut that looks great with almost no work on my part. She also offers tips and advice on how to avoid looking like a crazy person who doesn't really understand the concept of a flatiron. I've been getting my hair done by Bean since I was in college, so she's been with me through the asymmetrical turquoise hair patch period of my life, and she'll be helping me with my wedding styling later this summer. She's rad-- Her very slick model styling is super impressive, of course, but she's also a very down-to-earth person with a great sense of humor. An absolute artist, and super skilled with the shears.

1.description: Jen has been doing my hair for several years...been following her around from salon to salon...now to her own place! She has done everything from my haircuts to bridesmaids hair and make up to my engagement shoot..now she's doing my wedding! Always on point never disappoints!

2.description: Jen Bean is an exceptional and talented stylist. Being in the industry I've seen my fair share of okay, decent, good and great stylists. Jen is definitely great! Long hair specialist that understands and actually listens to your needs/wants. There can be a gray line between the translation of what the client wants and what that actually means to a experienced professional stylist. Jen handles those situations flawlessly and really gives her clients what they are wanting. She is one of the best stylists that has ever cut and/or colored my extensions. Extensions are a different ball game and need to be cut and colored differently. She found solutions that was the least damaging to my hair as well as giving my extensions shine and elasticity. I haven't colored my hair in years and I did for the first time with Jen and I get compliments daily on it. Highly recommended!

0.description: Jen did hair and makeup for me and a few family members for my wedding in Chicago on May 30.  She did an absolutely outstanding job, and I can't recommend her enough!! I'm not really a hair and makeup person, and I frankly gave her very little direction.  She somehow magically figured out exactly what I wanted, though of course what she ended up doing was far better than what I imagined.  She did a braided, piece-y updo for me that was the perfect balance between elegant and youthful/fun.  She and her assistant (so sorry, the name is escaping me right now) made everyone in the party (age range 25 to 60s) look amazing.  The hair and makeup lasted through a long night of emotional toasts, partying, etc.  Jen and her assistant themselves were fun, very down-to-earth, yet totally professional.  They put us right at ease.Thank you Jen Bean Artistry!!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring

1.description: The FB Art Market was a benefit for the Lisa Tonna Fund. Lisa is a 37 year old anti-tobacco advocate who is battling the disease she's been fighting to save others from: lung cancer.So, that being said, I feel like a complete dick for giving a bad review to a fund raiser. What if I give a big fat, five star review to their awesome intentions and two scrawny stars to their product selection.Waiting outside for friends, we watched the hipsters parade inside. We weren't sure if we'd be allowed in since we didn't have our ironic mustaches, skinny black jeans, foppy unkempt hairdo's or checkered Vans. But, thankfully, there was no dress code. I didn't tell them I hate The Decemberists, because lord knows that would've been a deal breaker.The space upstairs was nice but really cramped. even before going upstairs we knew what homemade goods would be on sale - wallets, cutesy change purses, cupcakes, weird shit made out of ties, cuffs, silkscreened tshirts, messenger bags and odd plushy dolls. We were 100% right.The thing is, if you're doing a fund-raiser, you really ought to have lots of affordable stuff. If you didn't want to drop $18 on a pocket notepad, there just wasn't enough little stuff to buy. I felt bad, but there was no way I could $40 on a stuffed thing with a weird face & three arms.

0.description: My experience at the Firebelly Art Market was delicious and inspiring.  I joyfully browsed the work, slurped my bubble tea smoothie and wowed over the quality of the products all made by hand and/or produced locally.   The artists at the FB market have clever and unique ideas that kept me interested as I meandered..   I never had that "oh i could make that..." feeling - only that kid in a candy store buzz.  Beautifully recycled books, remade clothing, cozy and relevant tshirts... I still think of the sweet little stuffed ice cream cone I foolishly decided not to buy and you can't beat  the dildo selection or creamy raspberry cupcakes (unless of course you swing by their respective local businesses once the market has passed).   FB market conveniently took my credit card... and then my cash when I decided to refill my bubble tea before heading out.   Worth the trip and the extra cash (or credit) to chat with the designer of your one of a kind  garment.  Looking forward to the Christmas fair.

58.description: Everything blew my mind. The atmosphere, the food, the burlesque, the DJ, the people. Grandma J's is doing their own thing, and doing it well and with lots of love. Already recommending dinner and a show to friends, and I want to go back for brunch rrrul soon.

56.description: I went to Grandma J's Local Kitchen because of the reviews I read, and if those reviews were not favorable I wouldn't have gone to this restaurant. The food was OK, I ordered the Asparagus Benedict it took about 20mins for my husband and I to get our food. But that's not a bad thing if the food is hot when its served but it wasn't, and that doesn't sit well with me. My husband ordered the burger with poached eggs, I don't remember the menu name for the dish. But maybe that's the reason it took awhile before we received our order, and that's fine if whenever I get my food it is hot. I'm a stickler for having my food hot when it is served. The waitress did not top off my coffee until she was serving some other customers who happened to come in well after we did, and did I mention they received their food first! And last but not least, when it was time to pay my husband went to the register and stood there while the waitress was having a conversation with a customer and my husband had to walk a couple of steps back to the table where we were sitting to get her attention and she saw him get up in the first place but she never turned her head to see if he was standing there and she should have because she had just given us the check. Bottom Line I Would Not Recommend Grandma J's Local Kitchen P.S. My husband and I are a Bi-racial couple and we are both minority. Hummm......

29.description: I could not stop smiling while eating here and have not stopped talking about it since I left. This was a perfect welcome back to Chicago after being in Japan for a year. The schtick of the restaurant is like walking in to your midwestern grandma's house and the service/vibe maintains the same energy.  The brunch food was creative and flavorful, not over the top greasy and heavy or covered in sauces and they are crazy generous with the coffee. We left satisfied, but not overly full and perfectly content. Great balance of flavor! Hoping to get back for dinner soon!

42.description: Went there and it felt like somebody's outdated kitchen.  Food was ok.  Service was good though.

23.description: This place is amazing! John was our waiter and he seriously went above and beyond. We were traveling from Austin to Chicago and had our pup with us and we called to see if they are dog friendly. He had a bowl of water waiting for our dog Rowdy and he even greeted him by name. Haha The food was unbelievable. We were in a party of 5 and 4 of us got "The Works" and I am so happy I did! Our friend got the morning sandwich and he loved it. Perfectly balanced and an amazing way to start your day! The food, ambiance, and service with attention to detail had us amazed. We will be returning back next time we are in town! Thank you for such an awesome meal! I HIGHLY recommend coming here.

47.description: Amazing! best breakfast in town!

8.description: Great place in Humbolt Park. Incentive dishes with ingredients that you'll feel good about eating.  Local farms, grass fed meats, etc. plus great offerings like kombucha drinks for a bit of a twist.  We had "the works" breakfast plate which was a mix of veggies, cheese, bacon, and poached eggs in a bowl. Home run. Very tastey and filling. We also the Chilaquiles with a poached egg. Was a little dry fore but I didn't like the flavor and the eggs were perfectly done.
