36.description: This place is fantastic.  Exactly what the neighborhood needs.  My hubby and I went there on Saturday for a breakfast date and we had a variety of items off the a la carte style menu.  It was perfect because it allowed us to try lots of different things. We tried a yogurt that had hazelnuts, green apple and fennel...such an interesting combo of flavor and textures.  It was so delicious.  Also tried something that starts with a "g" (can't remember the name), that was like homemade Nutella (but waaaay better) with delicious crusty bread.  To balance things out with some savory stuff, we had the pork chops with beans and a fried egg on top.  Stellar.  Also tried the baked sweet potato with sheeps milk cheese. This place is the real deal.  Go...now.

30.description: I've lived in Humboldt Park since 2009 and I'm excited when new places open in the neighborhood and always happy to support local. My first impression of this place was that they opened before they were really ready. No window coverings or art on the walls, it felt sparse and cold. Well, whatever. I guess not the hugest deal. We sit down and are given the vaguest menus I've ever seen. Several of the menu items are in French and there are ZERO descriptions of the ingredients used. This is a nightmare for a vegetarian. Also, this place is SUPER over priced. And I'll be the first to overspend on food or an overpriced cocktail, but just tell me what I'm getting. On the chalk board it says "breakfast sandwich" - $11. Well, what the hell's in it?? I had an extremely hard time finding anything on the menu that sounded appetizing and I really didn't feel like asking the server 10 questions, as they didn't really walk us through the menu. Everything is also a la carte. It's just a very weird over complicated process to order. My husband wanted to order the vegetarian sandwich, but she didn't seem to even know what was in it - market vegetables. Hmmm okay. Helpful. Well, the sandwich came and there was a hair in it. The cortado was excellent. I ordered a biscuit and a beer, because I honestly couldn't figure out what else to order. We won't be going back.

3.description: Brunch: lots of a la carte items - had the smoked trout and bacon jowl (cheek).   Items are small portions and high quality.

14.description: Sooooo yummy! Checked out this place last night for the first time. Great selection of beer and wine, priced well :). We tried a few things. The squid was AMAZing and my boy friend was sooo happy with his omelette. Cant wait to try more.

28.description: I'm so happy I was referred here. These dudes are more than helpful. They are knowledgeable on all of their products and make sure you leave with what you need. They get all the dang stars.

1.description: Great place! Although the city is cheating us with taxes, they give a great discount, 15% off 3 or more bottle of juice!

9.description: They have this line called chaos that I don't see at many other shops at the moment , that stuff is great. Especially the Black Flag Waffle. If you are looking for some quality juice that is made in Chicago give them a visit. Not looking for some juice sent from the gods? No worries, they have a awesome selection of mods and other accessories ( and many other lines of juice) The workers truly enjoy their job and are very helpful .From beginner to expert vape enthusiasts , this shop is a must see. They have everything you need at a great price.And that Matty guy is pretty cool too.

29.description: I stopped by the new location with my cousin this past weekend, and OMG! I love it! I've been vamping for almost a year now, and pretty much have frequented every vape spot in the Chicago area, but Vape is my new favorite! The set up is cool, the decor is nice, and now they have plenty of space to chill and get your vape on.  If you went to their other location, you are in for a real treat when you see this one. I always have a fun time when I stop in, the guys are super knowledgeable about all they're products and they have any and everything you need as a beginner or a seasoned veteran. Plus, they carry a wide variety of premium e-juice like Mr. Goodvape and some others that are the bomb! Oh, and they're prices can't be beat!Thumbs up guys on the upgrade, you now have a customer for life!

23.description: This is as good as it gets for Vape shops! They are super knowledgeable and extremely helpful. If you're just starting or advance, they treat everyone with respect. They have earned my business as a customer! The quality of juices they carry is epic and they have a great tasting bar. Plenty of room to relax and vape for a while too. Anyone looking to get into Vapes or wanting to try something new, check this place out!

5.description: These guys are the best!! I'm trying to quit smoking and they are so helpful in doing so. Friendly staff and great customer service. I've recommended this spot to a few people and everyone is completely satisfied with the products. Numerous flavors and the juice bottles are affordable and last long. Definitely coming back.

31.description: I'm new to the vaping world, so my buddy suggested going to vape, so once we got there it was a really cool experience... The guys were very knowledgeable about the products and the juices that they carry, and they were very personable.. And I must say that the easydoesit juice is great!!! I'll be back...

25.description: THE premiere vape shop in Chicago. Yes, I started this out with a bang. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They have a very wide variety of everything. Very nice e-juice bar where they welcome you to sit and sift through a vast menu and try each succulent flavor for a premiere vaping experience. As a Detroiter visiting Chicago I can recommend this shop to anyone. Thanks guys

12.description: Great selection. Knowledgeable, friendly staff. This is why I'm a return customer that travels from the suburbs. Highly recommended.

21.description: Go here when you are ready to get something more than the easily breakable and disposable vaporizers you can get at a headshop. Wide variety of liquid flavored and they let you try them!

16.description: JoJo was super helpful. The space is welcoming with a contemporary feel. Lots of great flavors. Prices are good. Lots of different styles of vapes available. JoJo offered me solutions to the problems I'm having with my current vape before he tried to sell me a whole new device. That's integrity right there. I'll definitely go back for refills on my flavors. Highly recommend if you're looking for knowledgable staff.

17.description: My mom gave me one of her vape pens which she used to kick a 30+ years smoking habit. I was skeptical because I had tried vaping before, but didn't know what I was doing and would go back to cigarettes. I ran out of cigarettes yesterday and decided to go cold turkey. 24 hours in, I was feeling super crazy and everything in my body was like GO TO THE STORE AND BUY A PACK OF CIGARETTES. I went up to Vape and Matt helped me enormously and showed me what to do properly. He let me try so many wonderful tasty satisfying flavors. I left feeling so much better and with the true hope that I can quit this time!

10.description: So I was looking for my first mod. I've been reading about them online and I was ready to take the plunge. I was greeted right away by Eric who was fully knowledgeable and broke it down super simple. I didn't feel rushed or any thing. I got a basic mod with a Kay fun tank. It's super simple and easy to use. Even got a ruthless ez duz it on Ice. I absolutely love it. Thank you. Love the atmosphere inside. They have a pretty decent juice bar with a tablet full of flavors to choose.

11.description: THE premiere vape shop in Chicago. Yes, I started this out with a bang. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They have a very wide variety of everything. Very nice e-juice bar where they welcome you to sit and sift through a vast menu and try each succulent flavor for a premiere vaping experience. As a Detroiter visiting Chicago I can recommend this shop to anyone. Thanks guys

26.description: Ok, I don't normally leave reviews for every place I visit, but I couldn't pass on this one.  When I went into Vape I was 100% new to vaping.  After reading the excellent reviews I decided to check it out and what an experience!! The staff was extremely helpful, and the guy that helped me out went to lengths explaining the differences between devices and the pros and cons of each. As you can see in the pictures they also have a juice bar where you can test any and every flavor you would like.  This was a fantastic experience and I would recommend anyone looking for a great Vape store to give this place a try!

27.description: I stopped in yesterday for a mod, while they didn't have the exact mod I was looking for, they did everything in their power to hook me up, and I left with something even better than what I came for. Their selection is bar-none the best I've seen in the Chicago-land area and the prices rival even online Chinese vendors. I was able to taste every juice I could handle, and they would not settle until I was 110% satisfied. I can't say enough good things about this shop, the staff, and the products. If you're shopping anywhere else, you're missing out.

35.description: Nice selection... Hope to see more products on my next visit. I only bought a spacer thing for between my Vivi Nova and Vision Spinner. Nice juice selection... Will ask to sample next time. Didn't bring my vape. Nice friendly peeps, nice overall feel to the shop. A/C works, *phew* :) There is street parking and a Dunkin just a couple steps away, you can get your happy hour on.  thanks!!

0.description: If you haven't switched from smoking to vaporizing you really, really should! This place is tiny, attached to a car wash. But it had the product I needed, and at half the price. I was so excited I did a dance. Quick service, good location. Friendly staff who were explaining to the customer before me how to use an E-cigarette. Now its moved to a larger location with even greater selection. Do hit this one up!

20.description: JoJo was super helpful. The space is welcoming with a contemporary feel. Lots of great flavors. Prices are good. Lots of different styles of vapes available. JoJo offered me solutions to the problems I'm having with my current vape before he tried to sell me a whole new device. That's integrity right there. I'll definitely go back for refills on my flavors. Highly recommend if you're looking for knowledgable staff.

19.description: My boyfriend Ho-Train and are town from Seattle and stopped by this random Vape Shop! Great selection of juices and mods! They are super knowledgeable about mechanical and variable voltage mods and answered all of our questions! Hands down a great place to stop by and have a Vape session! We will be back!

33.description: Vape is an amazing vapor shop with high end mods, tanks, atomizers and a great selection of premium juice. The prices are more than reasonable and the service is five star. Every Chicagoland vaper should stop in.

2.description: Great place. Grabed the ipv3 from vapegut. .....And didn't see bearded clam..place is one of the best in city. Owners are cool and carry the best authentic mods

34.description: My boyfriend Ho-Train and are town from Seattle and stopped by this random Vape Shop! Great selection of juices and mods! They are super knowledgeable about mechanical and variable voltage mods and answered all of our questions! Hands down a great place to stop by and have a Vape session! We will be back!

32.description: So glad I discovered Vape today which is walking distance from my home. They just opened up two months ago so this was the first time I found out they were there. Bought a bottle of a berry / mint / watermelon concoction just to try something out since I was there anyway and I like it a lot. Going to head back in when I have more time and get a battery and sample some juices. Been ordering online so-far but you know, the cost of postage and the waiting . . . so glad something opened up nearby.

18.description: Vape is the ONLY vape shop anyone should patronize and I'll tell you why. These guys give a shit and it shows. Everything about the place is solid. Staff, helpfulness, selection, shop appearance. These guys are true vape enthusiasts and they have a genuine love for spreading knowledge of all things vape related. I went in to this shop over the summer as a beginner with my lady. Neither of us knew dick about vaping. Paul, one of the employees started us off on our vaping journey with care, compassion and mature guidance. He explained everything we wanted to know and didn't talk down to us or make us feel dumb for not being seasoned vapers. I have been to other vape shops in the area and no one compares to the level of service that is provided at Vape. The juice bar is my favorite part of the shop. All their flavors are on Ipads and it makes selecting and discovering new flavors fun. The staff are experts on their products. Often I ask for a recommendation and am rarely disappointed with their suggestions. It's shops like this that keep me from shopping on the internet. I know I could save a few bucks but I like giving my business to Vape. They have actually talked us out of spending money when myself or my fiance got overzealous in our spending. Only hiccup was one time a short Filipino dude shorted us like 200 points on our frequent shopper rewards card but we got it sorted out the next time we came in. Don't even bother with other vape shops. Vape is the only place you need to go. You will not be disappointed!

13.description: I stopped by the new location with my cousin this past weekend, and OMG! I love it! I've been vamping for almost a year now, and pretty much have frequented every vape spot in the Chicago area, but Vape is my new favorite! The set up is cool, the decor is nice, and now they have plenty of space to chill and get your vape on.  If you went to their other location, you are in for a real treat when you see this one. I always have a fun time when I stop in, the guys are super knowledgeable about all they're products and they have any and everything you need as a beginner or a seasoned veteran. Plus, they carry a wide variety of premium e-juice like Mr. Goodvape and some others that are the bomb! Oh, and they're prices can't be beat!Thumbs up guys on the upgrade, you now have a customer for life!

4.description: My friend went here and bought 2 mods from them and got a $250 mod that shocks her finger whenever she presses the firing button, she went back to exchange for the $150 Petri mod, which was better. But the next day, Mattie charged her $10 for a new build?!?! (Who charges for builds???). Plus, when she wanted to use her fivestar points, same guy Mattie had excuses why she couldn't use her points for juices. But other than that, other employees are nice! But those experiences really turned us off from going back.

24.description: Best vape shop in the city hands down!!! Has a wide variety of vaporizers AND juices. Not to mention the staff is great, very knowledgable and patient! Me being new at vaping, Eric helped me tremendously to guide me in the right direction with my purchase. Definitely recommend this shop to everyone!

6.description: I couldn't have had a better, easier experience at Vape.I'm a pack-a-day smoker, and I'd planned on moving to vaping for some time, if only so I could start running again. I went into Vape after reading the Yelp reviews, and I'm glad I did. They gave me a great walkthrough on the basics of vaping, and didn't try to hard sell me on any piece of equipment. They gave me exactly what I wanted -- something simple, something good for newbies.I spent probably too much time trying out different juice flavors. After asking how much I smoked, we found a nicotine amount that would work for me, and went through several flavors. Never once did I feel rushed, and never once did I feel like they were pulling me towards specific products.All in all, it was a perfect experience for a beginner, and I can't wait to go back once my juice is finished. I'd recommend this place to anybody.

22.description: I love this place....High quality juices, tanks, mods, etc. Great customer service and very knowledgeable and patient staff.  Special shout out to Joe who hooked me up with a great kit and great juices.  Very comfortable atmosphere.  If your in the area. ..make sure you stop by for a visit. .. You will not be disappointed! !!

15.description: I'm very new to the vape scene and have juggled between having some friends build ones for me or to just by a quality one from a quality store. After a quick bite in the city I hit Google for the nearest vape stores by me. There aren't many by where I live, so I figured here's my chance. It's a bit hard to spot driving down western, and I missed it once. Walked in waited for the people before me to finish their order and was quickly shown everything there is to know. Before you know it I was buying a vape and couldn't be more pleased. Hopefully this helps me quit smoking cigarettes. But on to the shop, product was good, service was very patient and helpful and answered all of my silly questions. I'm telling you I have completely no knowledge of vapes and these guys guided me from A to Z. If your new to the scene this is the place. And if you're a seasoned pro they have a good amount of mods, nice setting, chilled atmosphere, and a ton of juices to TRY before you buy!

7.description: Is there a 6 star option Because these guys go the extra mile to make sure you had a good experience in their vape shop. Even though there are a lot of vape shops in the Chicago area I think Vape beats them all. I drive 25 miles to get product from these guys and will continue to. keep up the good work!

8.description: Walked in to buy a 150 watt mod and a couple batteries. Had gotten a quote for a whopping 10% off for black friday. One guy wouldn't even get off the couch, and the other guy tried to sell me a $10 Ego kit for $60 or something. What I mean to say, is that he talked down to me. Then I was told that the quote I got on the phone "was not real". I walked out. Save your time, money, and breath, do not shop at Vape.

30.description: Just got into vaping and was pleased to find Vape around the corner from my house about a week ago and I think I have already been in 3 times. I have been to tons of tobacco stores that sell limited amounts of e-cigs and vaporizers but none of them seemed to know anything about what they were selling. Vape is the complete opposite. Joe and Daryl answered every questions I had and their prices are really reasonable even when compared to the online stores. If you're in the area, stop purchasing online...support a local business and stop in to Vape.

3.description: Excellent place. I was just there (by recommendation from St Lucia's Smoke Shop) with intent to take the step from entry level ecigs to a proper 'intermediate' vape setup. The staff members helps me do this with ease, especially Royal (I think that was his name).Thanks. Will definitely be back soon for some more juices.

14.description: Honestly the best customer service I have had in a while. I always come in with problems and they maintain a positive attitude and set me up. They do great builds and are the experts of the Chicago vape scene. Matty knows what he is doing and he gave a great customer experience. I work in the service industry, and I am pretty stern about good service, and Matty is awesome!!!!! Thanks Vape!!!!

12.description: This place is worth checking out if you are in the area/live nearby. Great prices on food and drinks (plus lots of special). Food seemed pretty good and the service was great as well. It's a fairly new place, so don't let the lack of reviews scare you off.

3.description: The service was a little slow, but friendly. The food brought me back to my childhood!! I had the midnight and it put me to sleep.. I ordered one to go!.!.!

1.description: If you can make it down to Señor Pan, on North Ave., please do so. The Havana cafe is very nicely decorated, but the food was mediocre at best. Our appetizer arrived with our entree and that alone was a bad sign. I ordered the special of the day which was fried pork chunks with black beans and white rice.... The rice/beans were good, but the pork lacked flavor (except for the heavy garlic flavor ) and my friend had a breaded steak sandwich and the bread was so hard she almost broke her tooth! Steer clear of the lemonade as well cause it is SUPER potent and not in a good way. I really hope they find their way because it would be great to have this new addition in the neighborhood.

2.description: Ok folks, let me just talk to you for a minute. If you like grease, this is your spot. Everything is basically fried. Currently, the bartender who has been here for two weeks is at odds the manager. Not a good thing when you sit at the bar and  hear all the troubles of the business. But guess what, that ain't none of my business!. Owner is trying his hand and is a good guy. Cut him some slack.... You may love the place!... Movin on....

9.description: The service was excellent.  I had the breaded chicken, rice, black beans and sweet plantains.  So good! They just need Bacardi :-) great atmosphere.

10.description: La Havana used to be the Division Street Bar and Grill, which I was very sad to see go. I'm not sure why it took so long for the new place to get up and running, but it's nice to see a bar and restaurant opened up right across the street from me again. The layout is pretty much the same as the old bar, but the food is different. I went in a few weeks ago right when it opened and I have to say the food was certainly better I expected. I was surprised it was Cuban and not Puerto Rican, but it was still tasty. There is not a ton for a vegetarian to choose from but I had some steamed veggies and rice and beans. It was filling enough and the garlic sauce packed a punch! I think it will be a decent neighborhood spot, so I would check it out. The staff is still learning the ropes but maybe after the month or so they've been open it's better by now. What they lacked in competence they made up in friendliness.

4.description: Love this place. Not to mention, it's in our hood and makes for a great place to grab an amazing smoky margarita (a must try), and a meal. The food is delicious (great job, cooks!) they have great daily specials, wonderful servers, an amazing bartender, and a relaxing and friendly ambiance. If you want to watch the game or just hang out with friends, this is the spot to come if your in the Humboldt Park region! We had my birthday party here, and everyone had a great time--thanks, team at La Havana!

6.description: Delicious!! ordered Talapia fish w/garlic lemon came with congri "Cuban rice w/black beans" you have try Cuban tamale it's to die for with shredded pork on top pretty nice size & only 3 bucks the restaurant is decorated beautifully a gem in Paseo Boricuavery classy nice date place, Owner is very friendly and attentive told us his chef is from Calle 8 Miami great tasting Cuban cuisine

0.description: So happy this is next door to my building. I have been here a few times and I have enjoyed myself every time. I have tried the steak sandwich, the Chicken sandwich, and their Hot Wings. Everything I have eaten has been pretty good. I did have a small complaint about the steak being a little over cooked, but they corrected and I was content with that. BTW... Wednesday it's $0.25 wings. Can't beat that with a stick. Their drinks are good size and prices perfect!!! It's a lovely option over Mas o Menos next door for a drink when I'm at home. I was excited when La Havana Cafe came in because I WON'T go in Mas O Menos at all. So Thanks guys!!! The staff is always friendly, sometimes they play music, and they have large TVs if you like watching the games.

5.description: This was some good tasting Cuban food.  Porked seasoned just right. Yuca (Boiled Casava) had a very tasty garlic sauce...best I've ever had.  Tostones not too well done nor under-cooked..right in the middle how it's suppose to be.  The owner came over and talked to us over 15 minutes, a really nice man.  The waitress (Jena) was so nice.  Coming from Libertyville.Il (1hrs drive) we will make a special effort to eat there again and invite friends when in area.  Saludos y buen provecho a todos.

13.description: Went here for brunch over the weekend, drinks were good and lots of specials! Had the tamales, really good w/ chicharron on top! Cuban sandwiches were good as well!! Great addition to the dead Division strip!

11.description: On my second day stranded on these shores by a storm from the north my unbathed body found this tavern's fare most uplifting.

8.description: I love this place because it has fab cocktails for cheap, and delicious apps that we eat for a meal-worthy feast. Plus, it's just a short walk away. Close, great food and drink for a reasonable price: can't get any better than that!

14.description: Worst service ever. Have lived in Chicago  over 10 years...seriously...worst service ever. Ten minutes for soup?! WHY THE HELL DOES IT SAY "VEGETARIAN" AND "SIGNATURE BREAKFAST" ON THE BUILDING??? No breakfast is served and veggie options were limited to small appetizer and side options. Those two words on the building LITERALLY drew me in. I never got my fries, one of the very few things I could order and the waiter didn't tell me until half way through my soup that he couldn't fill my full Empanada order then offered me meat substitute options after I made it very clear I'm a vegetarian by asking "where's the vegetarian options", "which soup is vegetarian?" and "do you have a breakfast menu, because I don't see any of the breakfast items on here?". Plus, even if he didn't pick up on my blatant requests and the content of our conversations, I would say it was pretty obvious by my 3 small veggie sides. I never asked for the fries bc by then I was over it and just ready to leave. And I wanted full proof that the service I was experiencing was really as terrible as I was perceiving it. Had to make sure I wasn't just thrown off and already bitter because of the misleading eating options listed on the building. This place won't last long in a neighborhood that flourishes on great food AND serving the community. Also, false advertising right on the building. Disgraceful.

7.description: Great empanadas great service exceptional place . Good Cuban food at a good price.  Severs are friendly nice ambiance. It has quickly become one of my favorites.

0.description: Worth the trip if you're within a few miles. The guys know what they're doing. They're also quick and to the point also not to mention extremely reasonable prices. All my friends will be using this shop...

12.description: Bought a Groupon ($3 for $6) and was able to purchase a Basil Chicken Sandwich and a pop (Good-o Kola - which happens to be SUPER sweet). Apart from that I bought two small cupcakes (Chocolate chip and blueberry) which were pretty good, a little over prices but well worth it ($1 each, one-third-of-a-fist sized cupcakes). All in all they won me over, might be here for lunch every day.

3.description: I love this place. The food is awesome and the atmosphere is so peaceful. Everyone who works there is very sweet. I stop by here whenever I need some Cafe con leche y pan con mantequilla:p!

1.description: The food is great, guess the yelp coupon  is no longer valid. I think the girl up front didn't want to bother she said they were reorganizing but I think honestly just didn't wNt to be bothered . The owner came out and was very nice. Didn't wNt to share his fried chicken recipe tho.

2.description: The food and coffee are great... friendly staff and you get bang for your buck...except....One Friday morning I came to the cafe for an iced coffee. The gentleman at the counter... must have been new... older man, asked if I wanted a large or medium. I asked for a large. He poured about 1 cup of steamed milk into a Styrofoam cup, a little ice, and the rest coffee. The ice immediately melted. I asked for a plastic cup so I could use a straw and he seemed confused. He then poured the coffee into a plastic (medium sized cup), threw out the rest, and charged me for a large. The coffee is usually really smooth and perfect, but this one was luke warm and basically milk with a hint of coffee. Hopefully the owner can help him so they don't lose business.... we need more cafes like New Life in the hood!

9.description: Two thumbs up for me...Comfy environment, good food/sandwiches and absolutely love the chocolate chip frappes. For those who say it's pricey, what would a couple dollars or cents be, if knowing that, that little extra is helping women get rehabilitated or a bed for a man to sleep on for the night or a bag of food on Saturdays for a family in need...that's just the beginning of what this cafe is about!

10.description: The salads have way too much dressing! The Basil Chicken sandwich is the way to go.

4.description: This is a cafe I come to again and again. Most of the time, it's not overcrowded compared to other cafes so it's the perfect place to come and have a conversation with a friend or get some work done away from the office. The free WIFI is a plus and it works great with my usual Cafe Con Leche (latte). I've been there many times and they've been good at remembering my order. The food is good too but I particularly enjoy the pasties. Definitely worth coming to. By the way, I find it pretty awesome that the business actually gives back to the community in a huge way. (That's a bonus)

6.description: Pretty good food at a great price. They even have discount days for local businesses. Friendly staff.

0.description: This is a great breakfast or lunch place! Also, their coffee and specialty drinks are awesome. Great food as well. You can grab something original such as a BLT or chicken sandwich or something with a little more Latin flavor. Great atmosphere as well! Everyone is very friendly and the service is great!

5.description: It's a little cozy cafe filled with students studying.  As soon as I walked in, I felt like I walked into the floor community room in a dormitory.  Not that it was bad, but it stimulated my college nostalgia.  I purchased the groupon deal and was about to expire soon, so I used it before my shift this afternoon.  I ordered the basil chicken sandwich (came with chips as well), a large caramel macchiato, and a stack of three (3) snicker doodle cookies...all for $2.45.  Score!  The portion of the coffee was generous.  They didn't have enough seating to accommodate a large group, so I would recommend people who wanna utilize a small group study or just to hang out.  The only thing that I wish they could improve is the hours of operation: too bad they don't open on Saturdays, and Sunday hours are concurrent to the church service.  Therefore, the actual cafe will be closed.  I have one (1) more groupon to use before it expires next week.  They do accept credit cards (minimum $1).  All food items were made to order, except pastries were pre-made and pre-packaged.

13.description: Huh?  Religion with my coffee??? This cafe is an extension of a mission church group I think.  This place is hard to understand.  There are limited tables here : 4. The food doesn't look that great - typical sandwiches.But...I paid 5 dollars for a three shot medium sized americano! Can you believe it?? I pay less at starbucks!! I was very turned off by that price.  (In contrast, at starbucks the vente americano with four shots is 3!)There isn't much atmosphere....maybe it has just opened.  I'm happy about the convenience of proximity of this place... just a few blocks away, but I won't come here often on account of the prices.

11.description: New Life Cafe is truly more than a cup of coffee...This is an amazing social enterprise where the proceeds revert back to programming for women who have been trafficked, those struggling with substance abuse, homeless, or any life controlling challenges.  They also support a local homeless men's shelter.  As if that was not enough - the food is excellent.  I absolutely crave the Kei Salad and Coconut Oatmeal!  YUM.  And yes the coffee is great.  Highly recommend you support this local business that in turn supports our community.

8.description: The basil chicken sandwich is on my crave list! Not a huge place, but staff is always friendly and helpful and the coffee prices are very reasonable--I mean, 2.50 for a large cafe con leche? Awesome.

14.description: Neighborhood gem i'd say...This place is about a stones throw ( ok, maybe pick-up and throw again) form my house, and it's fabulous. For those days when your all hung over (except sunday...) and you don't feel like making coffee of all the crashers so you send them somewhere, or when your working from home and you don't feel like making lunch. Bottom line, it's cheap and everything made fresh! The ladies that work there are al very sweet, and you can chilli in a nice recliner if you like while you dine.I recommend the esther (comes with chips) 4.50  and a snapple

7.description: All I had was coffee. It had way too much sugar. The barista did not seem to know how to use the espresso machine.  It was terrible. Would not go back.

3.description: Amazing prices and great place to hang out. They have a pool table and plenty of TVs. Cash only, but the prices are so low, it's hardly a problem. Did I mention the $5 pints of Dragon's Milk? Love this place!

1.description: Wow, I used to hang out there back in the late 70's and early 80's with my now ex-husband.  It looks like they kept a lot of the old wood.

2.description: Legit neighborhood bar. Good atmosphere. Good drink specials.

5.description: Stumbled upon this hidden Gem on Saturday! We will be back! Great service, awesome history, and great crowd! If you live nearby it's def. a place to check out!!!

0.description: Hidden gem dive bar. My boy just did a carryout of crown royal, '74... bar has been open since 1909, has a $5 shot/beer combo, $1 pool and a laid back cozy atmosphere. My first time here.Very nice!!

4.description: When I moved to the neighborhood it was super dog friendly. Richmonds however is not. It seems clean and respectable. However I was disappointed when they wouldn't allow me and my dog when the bar was completely empty. The bartender said she would love to allow us in but the owners won't. My roommate and I as well as our buddies would come in consistently if they allowed dogs. If your not a dog owner, it could be a decent neighborhood sports bar. Too bad I love hockey and soccer. I would love to walk the dog over and watch whatever hockey or soccer game.

12.description: Bibi is amazing - skilled, quick and full of good nature. My lashes are deliciously natural-looking and pretty, holding up nicely on week three without the crazy clumping that I came in with. I've tried most of the lash places in the city and it's really the best deal. Totally worth the drive just to say hi.

7.description: I'm rating one star because of the following 95% of the individual semi-permanent eyelash extensions fell in One week ($125). The salon does not look like in the inside the way it looks online, it was really dirty, unorganized, and hood looking. The only reason why I'm giving two stars it's because the owner was super super sweet! And that's really the only truthful review about this salon.

3.description: This place is the best I've been to! The service was very thorough although it was pretty inexpensive. I've paid $70 for something much more basic than what I got here for $55! The staff was very attentive and pays attention to detail. Their eyebrow service is great too! My eyebrows were a mess and they gave me some tips on growing them out because I had over plucked. They look so much better now, and I'm so excited for when they grow in. Definitely going back in 2 weeks!Bibi and the crew are so nice, and the ambiance at the salon is great, they make you feel really comfortable. I always feel great when I come out of here! Overall, it's the best nail salon I've been to, my mom loves it here too. Really guys, you have to go here.

1.description: I decided to give One Stop Salon a try because of the great reviews I read on Yelp. I must admit, when I arrived I wanted to immediately turn back around because there was a 45 minute wait. Well....l it was certainly worth it.  This was by far the best no-chip manicure and no-chip pedicure I have ever received!Now the clientele is a little hood. Okay..... it's really, really hood, but the service is great and BiBi (the owner) is very accommodating. All the technicians are good, but my favorites are Mike, Kevin & K-Fab.

2.description: Bibi is amazing! I made sure to make an appointment as you some of you ladies suggested and you were absolutely right! I set up an appointment and as soon as I came in and checked in, Bibi greeted me and remembered me from over the phone! Appointments are always seen before walk-ins which is nice because they get very busy. Bibi and the staff here are so sweet and knowledgeable. She did my nails exactly the way I wanted. Usually when I go to nail salons I'm always hesitant to ask for a full set because they are usually so rough on my nails but Bibi did an amazing job! This place is close to home plus I found parking right across the street for free! I think I have finally found a nail place I can actually stick to!

9.description: I had an event to go to Sunday night and came in Saturday night after another salon had completely ruined me. But BiBi saved the day. She did my lashes to perfection and found the perfect polish I was looking for. I had been here before but tried to find a location closer to my house. Forget the distance I will never stray again!

18.description: Let's be honest, there's many places you can go to get your nails done but seriously, this is the place to be! Not only are the services stupendously diligent and prices beyond resonable but the customer service is outstandingly inviting and soothing. I never wanted to leave! Jump at the chance to check this place out as they are newly established and have some great deals - not to mention they cater to all different service types ie facials, eyelashes, waxing, etc, etc. Don't forgot to inquire about their no-chip manicure/pedicures which are amazing! My technician, Bibi, had perfectly polished nails she'd done over a week ago so I jumped at the chance to experience it myself. So far, so amazingly good! Thanks guys - keep up the great work and I'll see you soon!

10.description: Words cannot express how satisfied I was with One Stop!! The only way to describe it is: BEST EXPERIENCE EVER! Sunny and BiBi are amazing. BiBi is truly an artist and Sunny makes getting your nails done fun! They have gained a new customer for life!!

13.description: Bibi does wonders on your eyebrows!!! She does an EXCELLENT job!!!

16.description: This place is awesome!! I got my no chip mani there and it's the best thing ever!  Let's not forget the other services they offer. Going back there today for my brows and pedi and more no chip mani!!

17.description: I can't stop raving about the service to my friends!! It's the way that they carefully take care of every details of your nails and brows! It's always a wonderful experience going there. And always come out satisfy. They're are so friendly and courteous. Believe you me, this is not a place to pass up.

15.description: A total diamond in  the rough! I can't wait to go back here. My pedicure was so thorough, well priced, and the color just won't quit! This is probably the first time in memory that I have to go back because my feet are getting too scaly, and the polish hasn't even chipped yet. I really have high hopes for the manicure lasting a super long time as well. All the staff is super friendly and good at what they do. It's pretty far into Humbolt park, which gave me pause when I first found it on lifebooker, but its well worth the trip over there.

0.description: I have gotten my nails done all across the city of Chicago and by far Bibi's shop has surpassed every nail job I've ever had. I'm extremely picky and hard to impress but this woman did it. Even when I find a place I like I always find something they could have done better but not here! I was also lucky enough to walk in on a slower day (although I hear and believe it gets packed so call In and make an appt first or be prepared to wait) definitely worth the wait. I told her what I envisioned showed a picture of the shape I wanted and she killed it! Super happy!!!! If you want beautiful, show off, make me feel confident nails this is the place to come to!

5.description: Brought my daughters (7 and 3) in to get polish and for a pedicure for myself.  They took great care of the girls, did great work on their nails, and got all three of us done at nearly the same time.  They even gave us a discount for the girls' work!  It was a wonderful experience.

11.description: Bibi is incredible! I went to the salon for my first time today to get my lashes touched up, and boy did she touch them up!! They look amazing. She took a lot of additional time to make sure they were perfect, and the glue does not sting or irritate the eye at all!! Bib's down to earth attitude and kindness really show- I will definitely be back for my lashes, but also to try out their nail services. a++++ Give this salon a try!

8.description: Make sure to make an appointment cuz this place gets packed! It's worth the wait! Everyone is very attentive, friendly, not pretentious at all which i love, good quality work for great prices. Although the salon is located in a somewhat "sketchy" neighborhood, but for a hell of a GREAT service that BiBi, Amy and crew provide, I wouldn't mind going there again!

4.description: Lash extensions are my newest obsession.  Its like the push up bra, spanx, butt pads, high heels, etc.  Every female has so many options to change whatever they want bigger, better, more defined.  Poor, poor males...they have nothing.  Maybe a sock to stuff...or lifts for their shoes.Bibi does such an amazing job on the individual extensions and oh so cheap!  lifebooker.com/referral/… $79 for glam look with a touch up!  FAN-FREAKING-TAS-TIC!Also, I got a pedicure and a no chip mani.  They have about a ba-zillion colors in regular and no chip polish so you will not be disappointed.Easy street parking.  Easy appointments either calling or they always respond via FB.As stated in my other review, the salon is pretty standard nail place with some extras.  They have very nice massage chairs for the pedis!

14.description: WOWOWOWOW!!! EYELASHES ARE OUT OF THIS WORLD! I never ever do this Yelp review thing, but this place rocked my world lmao! HA! I have been searching for a place to do my lashes THE RIGHT WAY and I have finally found it. The service is absolutely stupendous and the people here are extremely kind. Not once did I feel rushed and they make you feel like family! My eyelash tech was Amy and she is The Bomb! I also decided to go for a pedicure and I got 3 Massages! Not your typical 30 seconds! I think my leg and foot massage lasted 20 minutes alone! This i the place to go and did I mention the prices? SUPER REASONABLE! Extra long gorgeous lashes And my pedicure $40!!!! AMAZING!

6.description: I am very picky when it comes to my nails. I have tried so many different salons. And seem to never be satisfied. But Bibi has changed my mind about all of that. She is so neat, the salon is very clean and her work is spectacular. I am always pleased with her design work. Her no chip manicure always lasts me 2 weeks minimum. I think these nails are going on 3 1\2 weeks and no chipping. She is always very up to date with her designs and color of polish. I can't help but rave about how much I love One Stop Salon!

58.description: I don't think so.Parking lot: a mess. It wraps around the building and has all kinds of opportunities for accidents.Entrance: a mess. The entrance and exit are in the same place. When you enter, if you continue forward then you'll be at the end of the register lines. If you turn right, you'll enter the store.Isles: They're literally a mess. I saw freezer doors left wide open in the freezer section. I saw merchandise on the floor. The shelves were not orderly. The shelves were not fully stocked.Specialness: There is blue tape on the floor showing people which direction to head down isles. WEIRD.More Specialness: I waited at the register for a few minutes while FOUR employees talked talked talked. One of them eventually said, "So and so? You have a customer." So and so walked back and forth a couple times gathering her belongings before scanning my items. I told her that I didn't want a bag. What does she do? She bags my stuff. Thanks for nothing.P.S. Did I mention that the entry area smelled like pot?

56.description: This Walmart is a fucking disaster. We've been twice, once on Black Friday. The time that wasn't on BF, there were OK deals, but the staff and the clientel were just not so welcoming. The shelves weren't fully stocked and stuff was everywhere.On Black Friday 2011, we went to Walmart about 30 minutes after the sale started. It was a madhouse. Shocking to me, nothing was actually marked "on sale" and you had to basically have a scavenger hunt to find the sale items. I swear to god it was just a game for them.It was just ridiculous to see at the cash registers all the items that were tossed aside because people wound up picking up the wrong merchandise that they assumed was on sale. Nevertheless, it was all about the damn TVs. But literally nothing else was in stock - no blenders, no microwaves, no towels, no speakers. There was NOTHING. Definitely didn't plan well enough ahead of time.We went to Target across town and it was a completely different scene. There were no crazy mobs, everything was in stock, and the place was fully open and fully staffed. I really don't like Walmart.

29.description: This is by far thee worst Walmart in the World! Food is expired most of the time, restock is sloppy, employees are rude! The checkout lines literally at times may keep you waiting about 15-20minutes. It's the sloppiest laziest Walmart I've been to. I hate it! With a passion I don't understand why they haven't done anything about it. The manager from this place sucks obviously. They need to get someone new to take charge.

42.description: The people who work here are lazy - stupid - rude. End of story!! Never helped me properly i ended up getting the wrong thing... and the girl or 'growing' lady was busy on her cell phone talking to her home girl so I never got a chance to buy what I needed to get - I just raced off in the shopping cart - because they were too busy socializing. After I told the lady at the register what a lazy dumb bitch she was, she goes... 'maybe she was just too busy to talk to you, u know?' - ohhhhh yeah thats right!!! because im the customer soooo whoever works at walmart doesn't really need to help us because the prices are sooo low and we're the lucky ones to even be there... ok yeah. suck my dick - because it doesn't exist.

23.description: BAd service, 26 cash registers and only 3 open?????? Wtf????? Never come back, 1 on diversey is perfect, they know how to work

47.description: Wow! This is the LOUDEST walmart I have ever been to in my life!!Screaming, crying children, and screaming crying parents. Ghett-O!Lines were insanely slow...worst shopping experience ever...one extra star for all the parking available...but it's walmart, there's always parking!I'd rather make the hike to a walmart in the burbs!

8.description: Actual feces on the bathroom floor

31.description: You know reading the reviews for this store I thought they was over doing it but I am telling you these reviews don't give the store justice. I mean I can't put in words how bad this store is. I was waiting in line and the cashier told the guy this sh@* isn't ring up. WOW! Don't waste your time keep going to the next one.

34.description: It's Walmart. What do you expect?Just don't be out here too late... the location isn't all that awesome.

16.description: Went just to see what was left of the Black Friday items as some of the smaller items tend to still be around after the sale time and even the next day. This year the items i was looking for clearly said that the sale started at 6 pm on Thursday, November  27, 2014 until supplies lasted. Then next to those bigger letters was the fine print stating that the sale prices were also valid all day Friday until supplies lasted. I just happened to find one of the items but apparently it was ringing up as regular price, I had already spoken to one manager who told me that the sale price would be validated as long as it was the exact item from the ad. When I went to pay, the manager dealing with the line refused to validate the price of the items despite the fine print in the ad. She didn't even have the courtesy to come up to me and talk to me but was rather yelling at me from a minimum of 20 feet away while she insulted my intelligence with her choice of word, and while the cashier cursed me out under her breath when I was not even speaking to her. I asked to speak to a the higher manager but was simply told the same thing that the line/register manager said. Therefore, I called 1(800) Walmart but was simply told to leave contact information so that a district manager could be sent a report on it and call me to resolve the issue, but having had to deal with similar situations in the past I know that I will most likely never hear from anyone. I left everything I would have purchased after this and my mother returned everything she had just payed for. I know Walmart can afford to lose hundreds of dollars of purchases, and so it doesn't care about customer service as it makes an enormous profit but bad customer service like this is not deserved by anyone especially when something was clearly advertised in their own ad at the top of every single page.

13.description: OMG, look at the picture. That is EXACTLY what you will see when you get there.I know this was going to be a bad experience when I first got there as I went to the customer service line to return something. The lady that was helping customers, was yelling and rolling her eyes at another employee who apparently forgot to clock out for lunch. She was actually very fast in assisting me but I felt sorry for the employee she was yelling at.We decided to look around in this Wal-Mart for some items since we were already there. It is strange how disheveled the entire store was. It was as if the store had a going out of business sale and decided that instead of putting the items back, they just piled more items on  top. The great this about this was that you can tell if the item you want has been picked through since pretty much anything that looked as if it were in a "normal" store was untouched. The funny thing was that there were tons of employees around working. I'm not sure what they were doing but they certainly were not replacing items back in the original location. It is really embarrassing place to look at and really depressing as you can see the neighborhood it is in. The surrounding place isn't really upkept either and it seemed it just spilled into the store.I am very sure that any corporate manager would be highly upset at the condition of this place. Even the bathrooms were a little off. I mean there were three sinks, two soap dispensers (in which one was literally 8 feet off the ground) and one barely working hand blower.The saving grace of this place was the cashier. She was very friendly, very nice, and smiled and thanked us for shopping at this Wal-Mart. Like she knew it was a POS place to enter but she needs a job and is happy that you can over look the mess of the place and still find something you wouldn't mind buying.I'll more than likely will never go back.

11.description: Worst service ever! I will drive all the way to the suburbs if I am in desperate need of a Walmart, otherwise I will go to target. This has to be the worst place for service ever.Workers will ignore you when you ask a question. Will also say its not their department... things are unorganized, it's just awful.The cashiers are the worst! They have an awful attitude. Once I got in line put all of my items on the band and once I got to the actual register she said, are you paying cash? and I said no, credit so she got pissed at me and started yelling that that was a cash only line. I asked okay but where is that stated anywhere at the register or line? I will pay more for an item at a store if it means getting better service. This place needs to be shut down. Plus I'm afraid to park my car in the lot because no one ever collects the shopping carts and you will probably find one rammed into your car. THE WORST! avoid this place if possible!

39.description: This Walmart is always packed be ready for that when you are coming in for something real quick!This isn't the worst Walmart for me but its not the best!I have only came here once where the staff showed me exactly what I was looking for which I say that is a person who truly cares about the customer.If I'm in the neighborhood I try and get here early or later in the day to avoid the craziness of the parking lot.  They do have a big lot but that doesn't stop the congestion and the road rage of other customers.With the holidays  quickly approaching all I have to say is I will go some place before fighting with people over a parking spot!

37.description: Totally horrible place! Really really messy, Walmart as a corporation is horrible, this particular store brings my opinion of them from the gutter to the sewer. This store is just like shopping in a sewer, it smells bad, its dirty, its like a long dark maze and I hate it, I just simply hate it to pieces. I really, really, really hate it.

0.description: The promised gift cards appeared at my door today.  The address was missing our apartment number but it's only a two flat so that shouldn't have been an insurmountable issue.  Our carrier translated the cryptic bar codes and explained that the post office erroneously tried to deliver the certified mail to our previous address, rather than to the current address on the change of address form.So, Walmart did follow through and the gift card delays were due to a postal error.  I feel much better knowing that this store did make a good faith effort to resolve the situation to my satisfaction.Wanted to set the record straight; doubled the rating of this store to 2 stars.  I will continue shopping at Walmart in the future, but will use the gift cards at another Chicagoland location.

38.description: Only go here if you are desperate for something that no other store has, and you need it immediately.  Otherwise, order online and have it shipped to a WalMart express in the loop (there are 2 now) for free.  When our baby was born, this was the only Walmart in the city.  My husband had the joy of finding the "Site to Store" area in the "jewry" dept as one empolyee told him.  Then, he got to wait in line next to a woman who told him that, to keep her kids in line, "I beats them".  Nice.  The employees have always been nice, but we worry about being mugged/harassed/pickpocketed by the clientele.  I would only go here if a) you are desperate, and about to lose your job/spouse/life if you don't get that ONE thing today or 2) you are trying to scare someone away--bring them here--they will never speak to you again..  And leave your wallet at home, carry only one credit card, no cash.  Good luck.

51.description: Letter sent to Walmart:For the second time, I have been gravely disappointed by my experiences at Walmart's pharmacy. First, the good: Half of the employees I have been in personal contact with during my disgruntled experiences have been very pleasant and apologetic.  On Saturday, October 15th, I dropped off a prescription. I was told it would be ready on Sunday.  When I returned on Sunday, I was told it was not in stock and had to be ordered, but that it would be filled by Monday.  I was frustrated by this and asked the clerk why no one had bothered to inform me that the prescription would not be filled in the timeline originally indicated.  He told me he did not know, which lead me to believe that informing the customer in the event of a status change was generally  standard practice.  When I returned on Monday, I was again told my prescription was not ready because the medication had not come in.  When I returned on Tuesday and went to the counter, I was told again that my prescription was not ready.  Upon my nice, but frustrated protests, the pleasant clerk sought assistance and found that the order had arrived, but my prescription had not been filled.  I waited 20 minutes and walked out with my prescription after four trips to the Walmart pharmacy.  So, when I needed a refill, I followed the instructions on my bottle and called two days in advance.  I called this past Sunday and the automated message told me to pick-up my prescription after 10:00 a.m. on Tuesday.  When I arrived at Walmart this evening to pick-up my prescription, I was told my prescription was not ready and that it, most likely, won't be until Thursday.  Again, I was asked why no one bothered to notify me that my prescription would not be ready in the time frame indicated.  Unfortunately, the clerk had no answer. This particular prescription ran out tonight and is not one that should be missed.  I am deeply frustrated with each and every experience I have had at this pharmacy and hope you will shed some light on the inefficient, inconsiderate service I have received.  To have made as many trips as I have is utterly ridiculous and indefensible and exacerbated by the fact that refilling my prescription is shaping up to be a very similar experience.  I had very much hoped my first experience was an anomaly, which is why I didn't complain initially.

27.description: OMG, look at the picture. That is EXACTLY what you will see when you get there.I know this was going to be a bad experience when I first got there as I went to the customer service line to return something. The lady that was helping customers, was yelling and rolling her eyes at another employee who apparently forgot to clock out for lunch. She was actually very fast in assisting me but I felt sorry for the employee she was yelling at.We decided to look around in this Wal-Mart for some items since we were already there. It is strange how disheveled the entire store was. It was as if the store had a going out of business sale and decided that instead of putting the items back, they just piled more items on  top. The great this about this was that you can tell if the item you want has been picked through since pretty much anything that looked as if it were in a "normal" store was untouched. The funny thing was that there were tons of employees around working. I'm not sure what they were doing but they certainly were not replacing items back in the original location. It is really embarrassing place to look at and really depressing as you can see the neighborhood it is in. The surrounding place isn't really upkept either and it seemed it just spilled into the store.I am very sure that any corporate manager would be highly upset at the condition of this place. Even the bathrooms were a little off. I mean there were three sinks, two soap dispensers (in which one was literally 8 feet off the ground) and one barely working hand blower.The saving grace of this place was the cashier. She was very friendly, very nice, and smiled and thanked us for shopping at this Wal-Mart. Like she knew it was a POS place to enter but she needs a job and is happy that you can over look the mess of the place and still find something you wouldn't mind buying.I'll more than likely will never go back.

32.description: This place makes the Walmart in Benton Harbor, MI look like a Saks. This is the single worst Walmart I have ever been to. Poorly organized, messy, and no staff in site if you need help finding something in the maze of random piles of crap. Because of the poor organization, patrons mill aimlessly through obstructed aisles. If you must go here, hope there isn't a fire.

54.description: Worst Walmart I've ever been to. Shelves are consistently empty and when they have anything on them, they're a mess. I've both ordered online to pick up at the store and ordered photos online (1hr) to pick up the next day. Neither time was a success. I received a text for the item I ordered online, saying it was at the store and ready to go. When I got there, they said they hadn't unloaded the truck and it wouldn't be off until the next day. Walmart Corporate needs to get on the same page as the stores. The store never unloads its trucks until 4pm, however, shipments are made in the morning. The majority of people in line with me had the exact same problem. Second item I ordered was a photo online to be printed and was sent an email saying it will be done by 11:30am. I went out the next day, running errands and made Walmart the last stop, assuming the photo wouldn't be done straight away. I was there about 11:45a. They told me it wasn't done and I should check back Wednesday.... 4 days later. I reminded them this was a 1 hr photo print. They said the person who works often calls in sick, so they doubt it would be done today. Another wasted trip, which has now completely eliminated the ease and usefulness of online ordering. Oh, and the majority (not all!) of the staff is pissed at their mess of a job and are rude.

48.description: This Walmart is awful ! Bad customer service, the store is always dirty, things are never in its proper place and the employees are not helpful at ALL.... Stay away from this Walmart..

44.description: Everything there is always out of order, how long does it take to fix a atm machine, or the gift registry machine.......and they only had one person working the customer service department  during rush hour....need to train there employees to be a bit more friendlier.

24.description: Please Beware!!! Do not shop at this Walmart it is super awful! If I could give this store 0 stars I would. The store manger Bill and Angie are the worst managers ever. The customer service is rude and the store is always messy. Their Pre Black Friday sale was joke, none of the items were in the shelf, everything was still in boxes. People were lined up to buy sale items for 3 hours and customers were told the items are all missing come back later we will look for them. Do not go here for BlackFriday! The employees hold the items for themselves.

7.description: Agree with all the reviews. Terrible customer service.Never order online takes forever and btw they lost one of the items I order :/

49.description: Low Class, Good for Nothing employees who talk to each other about their Bebe kids,getting their hurr done for the club on Saturday night, how much they hate their jobs and what latest drama they have with their baby daddies....ALL while they are checking you out and act like you are bothering them.I hate this Wal-Mart and go only when ABSOLUTELY necessary. (Dog Food is cheaper here). They never have anything in stock. Everything is messy.Most of the clientele is pretty low class too.Save yourselves the gas and frustration.

40.description: Yikes! Nothing good to say about this place. Poor customer serviceAwful Lighting - It gives you a headache.Totally unorganizedCrowdedGHETTO!Take the extra 15 minutes and travel to the Wal-mart in Skokie or take your business to Target.

53.description: Oh, so i have reviewed this walmart before based on their customer service & management. Now here comes the vision center review.GRIMEY!My 1 star is not for the quality of the O.D, that' not for me to judge but for the board. He was polite, nice and i paid out of pocket , so he got a good chunk of money. I got about 4 diff types of contact trial samples, i went in for colored and regular contact visit  ( all the said the word trial on the lens directly btw, which is okay), asked him to write me a script for both color and regular. Also he told me something that i didn't know- apparently he doesn't like giving away samples because people don't come back 2 him to purchase their contacts (and i guess get them from 1800 contacts instead), hinting that he wanted me to come back and get them through him. I just smiled, and thanked him for his time, moved on with my life.Fast fwd 3 months after appt. I finally got some money to purchase them, so i went on 1800 contacts, did a SICK price match and got my pair. ( RECOMMENDED!). When 1800 called the doc's office for my prescription, many events occurred.1st- they told 1800 contacts that they were busy and would call them back ( never did.)2nd- Then i called 1800 contacts back a week later, they apologized profusely and called walmart non stop to get my script.3- Same day, i get a call from 1800 . Walmart told them my prescription was EXPIRED (which makes no sense, i get 6 months till it expires!)4- I called walmart on my own , argued with 2 ladies. The first one told me that my script expires 30 days after visit ( which i know is bullshit) . So, i asked if i could speak to someone else, she put me on the phone with her manager, who changed the story &  said that scripts expire 3 months from visit  ( which i know is also crap, i know its 6 months!). Then, she also told me that i only have a script written for clear and not color! and that i would have to REPAY for another visit! Pissed off, i thanked her and hung up.5- Three seconds later, i looked at my walmart recipt from the visit and realized that my 3 months didnt even expire yet!! i STILL had a week till 3 months were over!! So now not only am i supposed to adhere to their fake deadline  ( 3 months vs 6) , they also tried to jip me out of the fake deadline! Ugh6- Finally, i went in personally ( what crap!), and then the lady told me the same exact thing, with the doctor hovering over her. I finally realized the doctor was right there, i asked him if he would fix my script. He nodded as if he was making me a deal, and then said " sure , sure, .. do u plan on buying something from the office?" WTF? Are u serious?? This is my script, u screwed up and now u give me this wicked smile and try to get me to buy something? Anyhow, i said that i have to buy a pair of glasses next week or so. The office then made me wait another 15 min, then she came out with my prescription.GRIMEY.  I will NEVER VISIT dr. Jose Montes's walmart clinic again. It was grimey, a mistake they made and then sly comments on the side. I understand economy is bad, but when you are going to charge me DOUBLE of what 1800 contacts will charge me, why would i order from u?Suggestion? Go make the extra commute and head to the walmart in niles, il. They are SO MUCH MORE ORGANIZED AND THEIR  doc office is so much nicer!

30.description: Dirty. Packed. Ghetto. Sloppy. The makeup section is probably the worst. It seems like they never restock the products. I can never get in and get out quickly.

46.description: I have been calling for two days now just trying to set an eye appointment and no one ever picks up the phone in the clinic.  I checked the hours with the operator and apologized for bothering her (if they don't pick up the phone wihtin a certain amount of time, you are kicked back to her) and she said they are open.  In my frustration I decided to check with you yelpers at your experiences and yipes!  I thank all of your for taking the time and posting your horrible experiences and saving me the hassle.  I think it is a good thing they they don't bother answering.  I will go somewhere else for an eye appointment.  Anyone who can't even bother to pick up the phone to set an appointment probably doesn't care about your business anyway.  Thank you loves!

1.description: Good selection but the crowd can be pretty bad. I try and avoid this Wal Mart and head down to the one on Diversey near Cicero. The times I have been here the item I am looking for is out of stock...or when looking for somebody to point me in the right direction they seem to try and avoid.

55.description: Attitude, attitude, attitude!!!  I am so disgusted by people who are working at stores - especially teenagers (when I was a teenager, it was a privilege to be able to work).  There is attitude from the moment you get sort of greeted all through the store until you try to get out of the parking lot which is blocked by two vendors who are desperately trying to get you to buy their stuff, blocking your way in and out.  The store is so important to the commerce of the neighborhood.  However, if they don't clean up their act, we will have an empty building.  Time to shape up Walmart!!!!

9.description: By far the worst Wal-Mart in Chicago. If you ever need a reason to vote against a $13/hr minimum wage, this place is it. The employees talk to each other the whole time, disregard the customers, don't know where half their inventory is, and are overall rude. Go somewhere else where the employees actually care about their jobs and you'll have a better experience.

26.description: I give this 0/5 stars. Customer service is terrible.General employee knowledge is worse. How can you ask for directions from someone who doesn't know how to professionally talk to a customer? Sales are decent. I'd only recommend this store to people who are in-n-out customers.If you have ANY questions, your best bet is to take it up with google.I've been a frequent shopper here but from my previous experience, I would gladly commute to the Walmart location by Cicero & Diversey.I called with only a few questions regarding the flu vaccinations I was told word of mouth about. The lady that answered was unprofessional in her choice of words, "hold up."She kept me on hold for 30 minutes before I hung up. During the 30 minutes she picked up twice to ask what I was calling for."Oh ok hold up."After the second time I waited 15 minutes before hanging up. Her communication skills were far below average. I would've waited an hour if she had said the pharmacist stepped out, call around xyz, is there anything I can try to answer in the meantime, etc.While in the store, I would ask for directions and be taken further than from where I wanted to go. If I asked about a product they said to try it. I just wanted to know if the box came with batteries or an outlet plug. Just "trying it out" doesn't cut it. Again, only come to this location if you're going to be in and out. Do NOT come or call for general inquiries.

25.description: 23 minutes.That is how long it takes the employees at this Wal-Mart to figure out if they have Trivial Pursuit in stock. They don't.Just forget this place exists. It's useless, not to mention this location is depressing at best and WalMart is ruining the world.

12.description: You don't go to Walmart for customer service.  You go there for rock bottom prices.  You know that, I know that.It is the closest full service Walmart to the loop and easy to get to on the 65 Grand CTA bus.  That being said, it can be a zoo in there most of the time.  I would not consider going on the weekend.Checkout is always a mess and honestly, at the wages Walmart is paying, it would actually be worth the added expense to staff all of the checkout lanes.

59.description: I've gone to this location 3 times too many. The customer service is awful. The employees are awful, don't even try asking for help because they will not give it. I'm sick of the employees treating me like I'm bugging the shit out of them for asking where a product is. Last time I went, another customer tried to fight me ... FIGHT... me.. at a walmart... because she cut in front of me and wouldn't let me check out... even though my fiance was at the handing the cashier our coupons. Apparently I was a "stupid white girl" who was in her way. I refuse to be treated like shit just to save a few bucks. Never going to this place again, I'll drive all the way to Tinley Park for another super walmart, just to avoid another altercation. This place is ghetto, no way around it, and if the store and the people have no respect for themselves, how can anyone have respect for them.

21.description: This Walmart is always packed, it's best to know what you want so you can get in and out! And count on being in the customer service line for a while, I recommend you go in the morning, very early to beat the rush.

17.description: The worst Walmart on Chicago's west side. Granted good customer service isn't really alive anymore.. But the employees there are just down right rude. A simple hello and have a nice day would suffice but they give you stank attitudes as if you just ruined their day by shopping at the store they work at. I would rather go out of my way to shop any day.... This is the last time I will be visiting this Walmart!

10.description: I order a game for my daughter online but for got I had lost my ID so i called store and told manager what happen and he told me as long as I had the pick up email i will be fine, so i get to the store and they tell me no i told them why would i leave my house which i was throwing a bday party for my daughter to pick up a game, i was upset and on girl who i wasnt speaking to said some under her breathe and i said excuse me and she looked away, so i had other things in my cart to pay for and i was next in line and the same girl looked past me and took the people that was behind me and i said you know i was next and she just ignored me, than after she was done with the other people i put me things one the corner and she just walked away and went by the lobby, so unprofessional her name is Shyesha, out of all the people that was working only one person told me to call Walmart and change the pick up name to my friend that was with me, I wish I remembered her name cause she saw i was upset and found a solution and she was real nice. I like Walmart, always find a good deal, I even bought a tv that day, a bday present for my daughter, but this one rude person just put your rating to one star. Don't get me wrong a lot of the people that work at this Walmart are rude and have no customer service at all but they did not treat me as rude as Shyesha. You guys need to have more customer service training.

5.description: Welcome to the hood!! This Walmart should be on welfare. This Walmart has weave stuck in the wheels of all shopping carts. This Walmart does not have carts that roll normally. They either roll to the left, roll  to the right or not at all. Be prepared to stand in line for an hour and even though there are 40 registers there will only be about 4 occupied by disgruntled employees. If you have a question regarding the location of where you might find a product, be prepared to get hit with " DAT AINT MAH DEPARTMENT!" I hate it here, there's never any damn parking!     Ironically they serve the best saucy fried chicken in town.

3.description: This store was terrible even for a Walmart. Most things weren't stocked, or put in the proper place and when I did finally find what I wanted there where no prices marked on the shelves or items which was extremely annoying considering that finding any employee was almost impossible especially one that could actually help you. Beyond disappointed in this store.

35.description: I use to come here a couple years ago and it was tolerable. I see many people say come early or super late which is probably good advice; I showed up around 7. I was already in a bad mood and coming here just didn't help. But the review itself definitely deserves the one star. There's so many bad complaints about this store that my review is probably worthless but I had to add to the negativity this Walmart welcomes.26? Registers and only about 7 were open. No express line was open and I kept hearing available trained register clerks (something along those lines) come to the front. Heard that voiced about five times. Lines were zig zagged and circled around every which way.Rude ass people but that's no surprise because look at the community. People are going to act a fool. When will people learn to be somewhat civilized? I grew up in the hood and I didn't come out acting a fool. Anyways.....Rude ass employees; again look where we're at. I'm sure not all the employees are rude because I bet there are a very few decent ones. BUT this cashier at the register, I didn't see her but all I heard was "this line is closed, I don't know what y'all waiting for." Need I say more...Happen to pass the cereal aisle and that place was EMPTY!Anyways, I had to voice my frustration...

19.description: Ah, the main Walmart that I occasionally frequent. The first thing you notice walking up to it is the beggars outside of it. Usually there's one working the bus stops and another at the front door. Occasionally there's some teenager selling candy or trying to help with groceries (what they do with the pitiful amount of money they make and why they keep doing it is beyond me.) They do actively try to keep away the straight up smelly homeless bums with ragged clothing and only have "professional" beggars like the homeless people selling "Streetwise" magazine or the aforementioned kids selling candy.     In-store is your usual Walmart crowd albeit surprisingly not as ghetto as you would think with this store being so close to the hood. I find it ironic that all the white people and hipsters coming from good neighborhoods go to this place and call it "ghetto" or hell on earth when they don't even know what ghetto is (so exactly why is it ghetto? hmm). The selection they have is alright, most of the things you think they would have are in-stock. The cashiers are pretty friendly and if they get out of hand they are pretty much blacklisted from working at Walmart (Lucille, a cashier that worked here got blacklisted for defending herself from a customer she provoked lol). They even warn me when I'm about to leave something at checkout which is always nice.      I also noted the "undercover shoppers" walking around in casual clothes that I could see were clearly Walmart employees on the prowl for shoplifters. It was funny because some of them even had poorly concealed walkie-talkies. I was dressed to the nines one day and noticed some undercover guy come and try to check what I was doing while I was in the electronics area checking out the computer/video-game accessories. He was trying to be so nonchalant  about it that it became so obvious that I laughed while looking at him which made him walk away in a hurry.      Prices are cheap as you would expect, there's a couple of strip malls within the area as well so it's pretty much a once stop shop if you go here. They accept credit cards, cash, EBT/Link/Foodstamps, etc. as forms of payment.    Due to the area it's in I wouldn't advise shopping here at night though, you're pretty much inviting trouble. As always my advice when dealing with customer service is to not come into the store with a "I'm better than you" attitude. People don't like undeserved arrogance and pick up on it easily.

28.description: This 5 stars is for Terry at the Customer Service Desk. Today we were calling around trying to find an armless sports/camping pop-open canvas chair to use tomorrow.
