(So, online shopping was not an option.)  Yes, I was put on hold for about 10 minutes with a check in at around 4 minutes telling me to hold a bit longer. Terry then picked up the call. She checked on her computer and learned it was not in the store. No, they did not have the item. Yes, I was on hold for too long. Yet, I have to give Terry credit for her excellent customer service and apologizing for my long wait on line. Her determination to help me and not keep me on hold much longer is a good story on how an individual can make a difference even when everything around her is not so great. Thanks!

45.description: Absolutely terrible vision center!I tried to get the woman who works at the vision center's attention long enough to ask her if they accepted my insurance. "Not a problem," she said. So, I took the CTA buses over an hour to get there- when I got there- guess what? They don't accept my insurance. The woman from the phone call claimed she didn't remember talking to me... that's because you WEREN'T PAYING ATTENTION TO YOUR JOB!!! YOU IDIOT!Next step- order contacts. Not in stock- OK, it's not a problem to have them shipped to me. A note is put on the order- they will be shipped as soon as they arrive- of course. Why should I expect any less?I get a phone call about a week and a half later- my contacts are ready to be picked up? WTF?!?! OK- I calmly explained that they were supped to be shipped. Not a problem- they will be. A WEEK LATER- I call and ask- have they been shipped? Oh... not yet.... but don't worry, we'll ship them tomorrow right away. 5 days later- I call again- 8 times- no answer. So I call Walmart and ask to speak to a manager. No problem, I will be transferred.. it rings about 30 times and the same girl picks up the phone again- and transfers me again. After 15 rings, the guy at the vision center picks up. NO- MY CONTACTS HAVE STILL NOT BEEN SHIPPED!!!!!!WOW!!! So now I'm waiting 30 minutes for him to call me back. I have pink eye from the horrible quality of sample lenses Walmart gave me and I leave for a wedding out of town in less than 2 days. DO  NOT GO HERE!!!! It's totally obvious that the knuckleheads who work here DO NOT HAVE A SUPERVISOR. Knuckleheads need supervisors.

33.description: ratchet!

43.description: I wouldn't provide a star if that was an option.  The only positive part of my experience was the no hassle return policy for the television I wanted to return.  The service was slow, unfriendly and overall unknowledgeable.  I wonder how much money Walmart has lost as a result of this location's poor customer service.

2.description: They wouldn't take all my coupons about the store has new managers and they have new rules about the coupons. The workers always seem to have attitude problems.  They always have pulled off things in the middle of rows that need stocking. No workers ever say hi not even managers

18.description: I was driving on my way to a no heat service call I was Passing this Walmart and my contacts were bothering me and I was rubbing my eye so I remove the contact and I could not get it back in so I called this Walmart to find out if I could purchase new contacts here it took over an hour where they transferred me to 10 different people and finally someone told me that yes I can get contacts herebut I would need a prescription so I asked the lady if I can get the prescription there she said yes but I have to make an appointmentif you're passing this Walmart and you need contacts in emergency they will take a long time to give you a answer and They can not help you right away

41.description: This is the first walmart with a uncle remus' chicken place in it.  Now that's just ghetto!  But I did partake in the ghettoness since I love uncle remus' chicken.  As for the store they have what you need but they aren't very organized.  Not a large baby clothing section either.  If you hear that they are having a sale get there right away.  If you don't all the sale items will be gone!  It happens to me a few times.  The people were nice but I've just been to better walmarts in the burbs.

52.description: Their vision center is terrible , stay away ! I ordered a 250 pair of glasses lenses and they completely ruined it. They made it too small and they tried to  shrink my ray bans around them, ultimately disfiguring the frame The lenses had severe visual issues that it made me nauseous and i wanted to vomit after i put them on. I went and complained only to receive the "sir it must be your prescription " answer. I went to another vision center and this is what they said, the lenses were too small, there is a wave like cut to the lens which distorted the image and the lenses were improperly aligned in the frames leaving big gaps. STay away !

50.description: Worst Wal Mart ever!  I bet the theft here is outrageous.  Stay away

4.description: I was looking for a bookAnd not fined itSoon I took some groceriesPrices are really good compare to kmart , jewel or even target

6.description: Called in a Uncle Remus chicken order over the phone. They ask was I paying with cash or credit. Gave them my debit card info over the phone which I thought was because of being busy. I'll never do it again because! I woke up the next day to check my checking account to find that Uncle Remus cashier had charge my debit card three times! with three different amounts! Called the manager of Uncle Remus and was tolded today that she couldn't  do anything,and do whatever we though fit,Really!

22.description: Terrible store.  Go to the one on Diversey if you must go to a Walmart.  The staff here is a disgrace to the retail industry.  They frequently have their aisles blocked with pallets of merchandise waiting to be put on shelves and nobody is even nearby working on putting the merchandise on shelves.  I'm sure the FD would love the way they block aisles with pallets thereby making it harder to evacuate if there were an emergency.  It's not uncommon to go down the aisles and find them littered with merchandise that their customers have dropped and not bothered to pick up.  Yep, I realize that doesn't say much about a lot of their customers, but it's still the store's responsibility to make sure their store is clean and neat.  The only good thing I can say about this store is that at their deli you can get a slice of pizza to eat while you shop, just make sure you save the box it came in so the cashier can scan it so you pay for it.  As far as customer service goes sometimes it's pretty good and other times you get the impression (most likely correctly) that they are there to do as little as possible while collecting a check.  Avoid this place!

15.description: Avoid this place at all costs! If you want to buy makeup especially! They will make you wait an unbelievable amount of time at the jewelry counter (you can't go to a normal register) and then tell you to go to a normal register... All employees were rude, inconsiderate, and seemed to not know how to do their job. I wish I could give it zero stars.

57.description: It's 4:30 on a Tuesday afternoon, and I decided to drive to this seedy part of Chicago, to do some shopping at the only Walmart in the City.  Except, when I pull in to the parking lot off of North Ave, the lot is empty.  Not a single car.  There is no one around.  It's really weird, it should be open, but it looked like a ghost town.  Then, I realized that the power was out almost everywhere and the store must have had to close for that reason.  What a waste of gas, time, and energy.  God must want me to stick with Target.

20.description: Ah, the main Walmart that I occasionally frequent. The first thing you notice walking up to it is the beggars outside of it. Usually there's one working the bus stops and another at the front door. Occasionally there's some teenager selling candy or trying to help with groceries (what they do with the pitiful amount of money they make and why they keep doing it is beyond me.) They do actively try to keep away the straight up smelly homeless bums with ragged clothing and only have "professional" beggars like the homeless people selling "Streetwise" magazine or the aforementioned kids selling candy.     In-store is your usual Walmart crowd albeit surprisingly not as ghetto as you would think with this store being so close to the hood. I find it ironic that all the white people and hipsters coming from good neighborhoods go to this place and call it "ghetto" or hell on earth when they don't even know what ghetto is (so exactly why is it ghetto? hmm). The selection they have is alright, most of the things you think they would have are in-stock. The cashiers are pretty friendly and if they get out of hand they are pretty much blacklisted from working at Walmart (Lucille, a cashier that worked here got blacklisted for defending herself from a customer she provoked lol). They even warn me when I'm about to leave something at checkout which is always nice.      I also noted the "undercover shoppers" walking around in casual clothes that I could see were clearly Walmart employees on the prowl for shoplifters. It was funny because some of them even had poorly concealed walkie-talkies. I was dressed to the nines one day and noticed some undercover guy come and try to check what I was doing while I was in the electronics area checking out the computer/video-game accessories. He was trying to be so nonchalant  about it that it became so obvious that I laughed while looking at him which made him walk away in a hurry.      Prices are cheap as you would expect, there's a couple of strip malls within the area as well so it's pretty much a once stop shop if you go here. They accept credit cards, cash, EBT/Link/Foodstamps, etc. as forms of payment.    Due to the area it's in I wouldn't advise shopping here at night though, you're pretty much inviting trouble. As always my advice when dealing with customer service is to not come into the store with a "I'm better than you" attitude. People don't like undeserved arrogance and pick up on it easily.

36.description: The worst Wal-Mart by far. I am a former Wal-mart employee and I was a department manager at a store in Indiana. I know a  thing or two about Wal-Mart and their policies and this Wal-Mart doesn't follow any of them. It's always filthy, you can not maneuver well in this store, they have so many out of stocks and the employees and management are horrible. I try to avoid this Wal-Mart at all cost I much rather drive the 30 minutes to the Niles store. I only live 5 minutes away from this location and I had a gift card for Wal-Mart and needed some things and had to come to  this location. I understand things get crazy before Christmas but the filth and rudeness are uncalled for. I had a produce employee plow into my cart when he was taking garbage to the back and he didn't say a thing to me. When we went to the toy section there were a group of female employees hanging out by the bike rack saying the f word and talking like they were at home.  I wrote to cooperate and received a call from a Manager named Alexandra she could careless about what I had to say so I wrote to cooperate again about a half hour later she calls back saying that she got a call that I wasn't satisfied with the way she handled things. She was a little nicer this time around but I already had enough with them so I told her I did not want to deal with her I rather deal with corporate because they don't care about this store. It's such  shame this store is like this. If Sam Walton were alive and walked in this store he probably would have had a heart attack and shut it down right away. If you can spend the extra penny some where else do so. You'll save yourself from high blood pressure and a stroke.

14.description: Im all about providing GREAT customer service, but this place is one of the worst places to find it. I don't understand if their front end has a manager or front end lead because the lines are always long, they have no sense of urgency, and they seem to have more personal conversions amongst themselves then making sure the customers are being taken care of in a orderly fashion. Don't get me started on the pallets of merchandise in the aisles laid out all around the store while no one is stocking them. To me, this store's management needs to be reevaluated, too many people their walking around their with no care in the world about the consumer!

58.description: I went here for brunch today with my girlfriends. I love trying new places, in different neighborhoods, and despite this horrific weather outside... I was down for it!Tip #1: It's cash onlyTip #2: You won't be seated until your entire party is present.I thought the food was A-OK as a 3-star suggests. I like that there are many options for the vegan, vegetarian and meat eater in you, so that's a plus. I ordered the Flying Breakfast Bowl and added organic steak because I'm a meat eater! Think Chipotle burrito bowl with eggs for breakfast! It didn't take too long for our order to come, but the food was oddly just warm... not hot... like it would be if it has just come off the skillet. It looked delicious though and fresh so the actual temperature of it was VERY odd. Anyway, my food was tasty. It wasn't to die over but it was good and I sure did eat all of it. No complaints on my end other than the temperature.Two of my friends ordered the Black Bean Cakes which looked amazeballs when they came out! I tried a bite of it and it tasted ok, but yeah... just ok, which was shocking given how yummy it looked. I think it was because the black bean cakes were softer than expected. I was thinking they would be more like the texture of a black bean burger... more together... but instead the cakes were softer/mushier/creamier than expected. It tasted fine especially after adding some Cholula to it. My other friend had the Tofu Sweet Potato Hash and seemed equally satisfied. No regrets checking out Flying Saucer. It may not be #1 on my go-to brunch list, but it was A-OK.

56.description: In the neighborhood selection of brunch spots this place stands it's ground near the top. It gets major points for being BYOB which is always fun. The first time I went the food for both of us was a homerun on a lazy Sunday morning during the summer. However, going during the week in the winter the food seemed to change, not in a good way. Sometimes at the end of a shift I understand the quality is going to go down a couple notches, but it doesn't mean that I'm happy about it. About 2pm we were the last people to get food for the lunch shift that day and the food was pretty mediocre compared to what I had experienced in my last visit. I would need to give it another shot before I dismiss it as a midweek breakfast/lunch option. But I would say friendly, cool vibe, excellent people watching and BYOB. This place hasn't been knocked down from top brunch picks quite yet!

29.description: Im not sure if other peoples gripes are legit about this place. WE love it. Maybe because its "off the beaten paths" of Humboldt Park...aka, Cali n Division, but I think one review got the server and service totally wrong. Like today for instance...NY Day. Had we even encountered a Millennial server, we would have been at the wrong place. As far as I can tell, there are no millennials working here.We were greeted with a warm smile and got a table at 2:30, no prob. Our service was great as usual, no attitude at all. Pretty sure that bad attitude comment came from a millennial hipster reviewer who had complaints about the service. Every time we go to Flying Saucer we are filled with delicious food, a la, The Trucker Bowl and The Chicken Fried Steak with biscuits and grits. Our coffee cups were never empty and the staff was all very attentive. Besides not wanting to tell the world of Yelp that this is the best breakfast place for both meat eaters and Vegans, I want to help get this place closer to being a 4.5 star place. Don't bother with this place if you really want a pretentious hoity-toity brunch, served by a scatterbrained  server.

42.description: So I was in need of some breakfast and have had the french toast from here, which was good. I tried this time the huevous volando. My first complaint was that on their website it said it comes with a side. I got charged extra. When I asked how is my side extra when it clearly reads on the website my meal comes with a side? I was first told by the employee that she does not make the menu up. I went to pick up my order and printed the menu so the employee can see. She then says, " oh, well maybe its a weekend special" Hmmm no where does it say specials. She still never says I am sorry I can clearly see that on the menu it says side of let me fix that. Instead she just says you can talk to the owner about it because she cannot do anything.    When I eat my food it was ok. It was not nasty but not the best in the world. I should have stuck with my french toast. I'm pretty upset by my experience this time. There are not many breakfast places in this area so I really wanted fall in love with this place.

23.description: This is a great spot for breakfast in Humboldt Park. Great atmosphere- sunny and mellow with great  music and a really great menu.  The egg sandwich is one of my favorites,  add well as the kale bowl, vegan pancakes and biscuits with veggie gravy.   It's cash only and reasonably priced.

47.description: I like the simple, organic healthy food.  I like the neighborhood atmosphere.  I don't understand the reviews that say this place isn't kid friendly.  We've been bringing our son since he was 2 months and have never had a problem.  In fact, on at least half a dozen visits, Rebecca (I think she is the owner) has taken my son in her arms and walked around the restaurant with him just because that's the kind of person she is.  Just last weekend, I was having breakfast alone with my son (who is now 14 months) and she took him so I could finish eating.  Worth noting, I don't know Rebecca personally, I've just been a patron for a couple of years.  The service I and my family receive is always friendly.  They even bring toys to the table when my son is there.  I like their commitment to local, organic and house made food.  I have no concerns feeding the food to my son because I know it is quality.  This is the kind of establishment I want in my community.

8.description: Of all the reasons I was glad to land my new apartment, being within an insanely close walking distance from this place is totally one of them. There is a variety of great options, and this is one of those places that will leave you feeling satisfied. I started with the trucker bowl, both before and after I turned vegetarian. It was nice to have a meal that I can say was a before-after experience that didn't leave me feeling like I sacrificed anything. In fact, when it comes to this place the only things I've ordered thus far is the breakfast bowls. They're large portions, always tasty, and definitely leave you full.But four stars. What are the drawbacks? Well, the trucker bowl is my staple, but the food is inconsistent. The ratios are just different, and it's one of those things I would notice. Less potatoes one time, less gravy another. Also, for a cash only, sit down spot, the prices are a little higher. It's not that I'm that cheap, and if I want cheap breakfast I'll make it myself. But of all the spots that I enjoy that are cash only, this is one I feel should update that policy. Back to positives. The music I've never noticed the same thing all the time, and I've heard some great tunes. It's got a fantastic retro-kitchen feel. And the staff is very on their game. As long as they keep the Baza and trucker bowl, they'll have me coming back as often as I remember to have some extra cash lying around on the weekends.

31.description: I will be back to try the amazing looking baked goods. The food is okay, my latte was tasty, good service and ambiance. There are much better tasting places in Chicago but at least the menu is creative and vegetarian friendly!

34.description: A friend recommended this spot, which is good because it's a bit off our standard beaten path, and I'm glad we got a chance to try it! It's an efficient, diner style brunch spot with good service, good food, and a BYOB policy. Be prepared for them to try to seat you at the smallest possible table that will accommodate your party (including the counter) in their effort to keep space open for more/faster turnover.I had the bazza bowl (the "rolls Royce of vegetarian breakfasts") and my boyfriend had the corned beef hash. The bazza bowl was ok- definitely makes you feel like you're detoxing with all the vegetables but a little flavorless. Something you have to be in the mood for. The corned beef hash was not made with the usual type of potatoes (thin strips), but rather with the cubes, and it was too cheesy, but the flavor of the corned beef itself was good. The OJ was a little steeply prices ($8) but I guess that's ok for a BYOB brunch spot. If you are with a vegetarian this is definitely worth trying, as they have a number of vegetarian items and also can make most of the other items vegetarian if you ask. It's genuinely veg-friendly (my dish had like 8 different vegetables as well as rice- very hearty), not just "ok we'll take the chicken off."

16.description: Im not sure if other peoples gripes are legit about this place. WE love it. Maybe because its "off the beaten paths" of Humboldt Park...aka, Cali n Division, but I think one review got the server and service totally wrong. Like today for instance...NY Day. Had we even encountered a Millennial server, we would have been at the wrong place. As far as I can tell, there are no millennials working here.We were greeted with a warm smile and got a table at 2:30, no prob. Our service was great as usual, no attitude at all. Pretty sure that bad attitude comment came from a millennial hipster reviewer who had complaints about the service. Every time we go to Flying Saucer we are filled with delicious food, a la, The Trucker Bowl and The Chicken Fried Steak with biscuits and grits. Our coffee cups were never empty and the staff was all very attentive. Besides not wanting to tell the world of Yelp that this is the best breakfast place for both meat eaters and Vegans, I want to help get this place closer to being a 4.5 star place. Don't bother with this place if you really want a pretentious hoity-toity brunch, served by a scatterbrained  server.

13.description: Disappointing vegan fare. Very few vegan options, and not much on the menu can be made vegan. Our waiter was rude when taking our order, and not open to accommodation. Been here twice and both times the food has been overpriced and underwhelming.

11.description: Me and my girl friends decided on here because they had something for everyone (meat,  veggie, vegan, and everything in between. So the table ordered the black bean cakes, sweet potato hash, and one of the breakfast bowls. I had the black bean cakes that left me wanting something more. You could tell that everything was fresh, but I had that meh feeling. I would say most everyone at the table had that same expression. The person most satisfied had the breakfast bowl, but commented that it was not an appropriate temperature to have just come out.What I will say is that the service is excellent. The waiter really knew the menu and helped everyone with 3 kinds of dietary restrictions pick out something. I thought that was VERY impressive. I also like the vibe of simplicity, focus on the food, and comfort place of the restaurant. Now with all that, I still want an EXCELLENT meal, so I won't be trekking out this way to come back, but if you live in the area or not too far away, I'd give it a try.Remember cash only and your entire group must be present before your seated

39.description: Been here three or four times since my initial tepid review. The vegan taco dishes are to die for. Still not a big fan of their tofu dishes, but vegans, you gotta try these tacos.

37.description: Food is ok.. not bad. A local spot ok for breakfast...but I stopped going because every time I go I get weird attitude from the people that work there. One time because I brought a coffee in from another shop and that was only because I had to wait 30min for a table. Another time I went I asked for ketchup and it was like a chore. Last time there I asked for water. I took a sip and it tasted warm. So...Ok I will go get breakfast somewhere else from now on.

0.description: When Chicago has another Great Fire, I will use one of my buckets of water here.This is reliably good food, interesting weekend specials and generous portions. The Metropolis coffee is hot and strong. The baked goods are yummy and worth buying extra for later at home.Good diners are hard to find in this region where you can come as you are, get a great & filling meal and not spend a fortune. It's a small place and worth the wait if you see a line. (I've never had a wait longer than 20 minutes and the staff does a good job of juggling things and keeping track.)If there's space at the counter, then take it. (It's a great counter.)The owners here are to be commended. They had a dream -- like most of us have and don't act on -- and they have delivered on it for more than 15 years. And it ain't easy. Where else can you find an independent diner providing quality meals at an affordable price on a consistent basis without major interruptions, "renovations," feuds, makeovers, etc.?Like I said: It ain't easy.Anyone who doesn't like the Flying Saucer should either eat at home (too picky) or find themselves a nice, pricey white table cloth bistro (so they can tell their friends they "discovered" some nouveau hipster cuisine that no one else has heard of). Frankly, if you are disappointed here, then there is something wrong with you that counseling and medication might fix. Might not.If the world were perfect and Chicago were a breakfast town (it's not), then every neighborhood would have a Flying Saucer-quality restaurant or two or three. But it's not and we don't. Therefore, this restaurant stands out because it has its regular tried-and-proven dishes, fun specials and is reasonably priced overall.The Flying Saucer is worth going out of your way for and it is as reliable as an old friend or as a relative who has to take your calls.It is yummy and I have never had a bad meal here. My wife and I plan our weekend travel around it to make it there as often as we can and we definitely take friends and family there when we want to treat them to good food in a friendly place.I love the Flying Saucer.

38.description: I visit this place often and am typically never disappointed, but also, never really impressed. I live in the neighborhood, so I can say that the "too cool to be pleasant" vibe of the Saucer is understandable. However, I must also add that though the food is pretty good, the service and hospitality standards leave something to be desired (save for a couple of their staff including their new guy). Hence the reason for ending up smack dead in the middle of a 5 star yelp review. If you visit, the sampler is pretty good, as is their oatmeal (only available on weekends), but I most enjoy their additional options (side of avocado, bowl of fruit, side of egg whites). They also have a cool selection of beverages, but don't expect any ice or any temp above lukewarm in your request for tap water.

51.description: breakfastrules.blogspot.…It was good to get out of the 708 area code for once and try something new. Flying Saucer is definitely culturally slightly different than what we're accustomed to, but we don't judge breakfast places on culture. We judge them on the food and the service, and Flying Saucer scored well on both counts.Morgan gave Flying Saucer five Brent faces because it's her favorite breakfast place and she likes to skew results, so let's move on: Dr. Nick gave Flying Saucer a 3.5. While he enjoyed the food, he felt his corned beef hash was a tad mushy. He was also a little unhappy he did not get ice with his water. ("This is the only place I've been to that gave me water without ice.") Uncle Lenny agrees with that observation. ("Ice should be a given.") Uncle Lenny, however, was pretty happy with this joint even though he "could have done with less potatoes and more corned beef." Brent gave Flying Saucer a 3.5. He says his standard is Chuck's and this breakfast did not beat Chuck's. Ash-tre really enjoyed her breakfast. She would have given it a full five but had to subtract half a Brent face because she was disappointed she couldn't get the lavender lemonade. As for me, my omelet really beat my expectations. I also thought the coffee was bold and strong, which is how it should be. The service was commendable. You don't have to be chipper and witty, you just have to be prompt, courteous and accurate and the folks at Flying Saucer performed as breakfast professionals. Good job, hipsters.The Flying Saucer at 1123 N. California Ave. in Chicago earns a very good four out of five Brent face rating. Morgan is now an official breakfast scout.

27.description: I love the vibe of this place! Not a lot of local buisnesses in that area right now. I frequent Norwegian American Hospital for work, and it is the perfect place to get some vegan lunch and work on my computer!I had the vegan chili when I was there and it was great! I could have done without the corn muffin, but I will be back for sure to check out the taco salad. The neighboring diners both ordered it and it looked amazing!

32.description: The food was just OK, nothing worth coming back for. Coffee (bottomless) was good. For me, austere service is acceptable as long as it's efficient, but this place was just abrasive to the point one might think it was a joke. The staff are a bunch of too cool for school hipster millennials (as am I). There are too many good places in Chicago to eat to put up with their crap.

54.description: OK, quick and fast. I'm mostly vegetarian, sometimes... but I've taken it a step farther for the last 38 days going mostly 'plant based', code word vegan, but not a true die hard vegan, so I can't dare offend the V-crew. So, the last couple of days I have been seriously craving a comfort food breakfast. Seriously. I'm almost dreaming about fluffy scrambled eggs. So, I'm yelping like crazy and I find this place. Sounds decent, close enough, let's go. I go with the Bazza bowl made vegan... can I just say where was the flavor. It was plenty of food all tossed in a bowl but bland as shoe laces. It's places like this that give vegan, excuse me, plant based, a bad name. A little cashew cream would have been lovely to tie it all together, or better yet add a small dab of guac, I'm desperate... give me some lime and cilantro... something. I doused it in Chocula (sp?) hot sauce and got it done. I'm going back one more time to try the sweet potato hash and kale...... wish me luck!  Let's hope it doesn't go down to one star...

48.description: The wife and I love this place. Great breakfasts and lunch options. Fresh, healthy and well made. The chef does some great stuff and she knows what she is doing.I have had several things on the menu and all of it has been exceptional.A good value as well. You get a lot of food for the money which, in my opinion, is reasonable. People don't realize that the price of gas, cattle furthers, shipping produce out of season etc. raise the price of raw goods for a restaurant. The pricier the ingredient the more the restaurant has to charge for the product. Some of the other reviews brought up price and these people don't get it. Support good mom and pop restaurants like this and pay for the quality. You want cheap, go eat at McDonalds who can keep prices low on their crappy food by owning their own cattle.

44.description: I really wanted to like this place. I tried but couldn't. My husband and I went on a afternoon. It's like 20 steps from my house. I got a bowl and my husband a burger. I don't know how it works but I'm almost positive my bowl was reheated. Ew. I paid for microwave food? No thanks. Also I added meat in my bowl which literally looked like scraps. My husbands burger tasted really dry which is just gross. No offense to my server, I'm a waitress and I know the business, but she was not friendly at all, she was in such a hurry I think I came as she was leaving, who knows? Sorry flying saucer, looks like you need to change your name to flying out of my seat.

24.description: My grandparents wanted to go here and so I joined along. As other reviewers states, the wait staff is made up of hipsters who are quick to collect your cash but not to refill beverages. The food was good, not great. My only issue was with the waiter who was very inattentive, which to me is important when I go out to eat.

7.description: Love this book in our neighborhood and we've been meaning to go back! There was a little bit of a wait of a Sunday so we just say in the waiting area. This place is like a tiny little diner with amazing food. We got to sit at the bar and watch all of the magic happen. My partner got the trucker bowl and it was a bowl of awesomeness. With all of the mixings in there it was for sure a hearty breakfast to have. The food came out and if was piping hot, which again, is a must for me but I'm sure not other people. They were extremely helpful when we were looking for suggestions. Get there early and you'll be happy you did!

49.description: This is my favorite breakfast place in the entire city.  I appreciate the vegetarian-friendly menu, fresh, local ingredients and throw-back atmosphere.  My favorite menu item is the Breakfast Burrito with Tofu Hash.  The weekend specials are usually extra wonderful too.  My husband and I once shared these chocolate pancakes that we still talk about.  It's super crowded on the weekends like all brunch places.  It's nice to come on a weekday and linger with a book.My only complaint is that I do not like the coffee.

40.description: Everything is delicious! They have something for everyone: vegetarian options and lighter dishes along with heartier plates. The menu mixes it up with staple breakfast items and creative dishes like their black bean cakes. Great coffee and friendly service too!

53.description: I'm convinced my experience will be better next time I go. Don't get me wrong, the last trip was not exactly bad. My girlfriend and I visited the other day early afternoon on a Saturday. There were only a few people in there dining. The service was prompt and great. However, the food came out as if reheated. My girlfriend had a dish containing refried beans. They looked/tasted as if they had be re-refried. My dish was delicious, but wasn't very hot. Everyone I've spoken with prior to going has said that Flying Saucer is 'hit-or-miss'. I feel like I fell right in the middle of this. The food was great, I just think we missed the rush where the heat and freshness of the dishes we ordered would have been spot on! Overall, I'm definitely going back. I'm convinced this place will knock it out of the park next time. I've just moved into the neighborhood and need a great go-to diner. Come on guys! ;) The decor in there is charming and the staff was friendly. I'd suggest giving it a try.

30.description: Good coffee. Cute neighborhood place. They have BYOB policy. The tables are really small. The service is not so fast though. Be prepared to wait.

46.description: Why, why why??? are people waiting in line for half an hour to get in here?  We decided to give brunch a whirl.  I got the vegan bowl, the boys got the meat bowl and all of us were disappointed by what we got.  As for mine, everything in the bowl was a different temperature (hot egg, cold vegetables, lukewarm everything else) and fairly flavorless.   I took a couple bites and put it in a box because SISTER PANTS here knows how to cook. I put that mess in a frying pan with truffle oil and sriracha, crisped it up, and transformed it into the glorious one-pot orgasm it was meant to be. Hey FS-- that truffle oil and sriracha suggestion is free!  If you want some other ideas, hit me up and I can drop some knowledge on you for a nominal fee!

1.description: SERVICE SUCKSSSSSSSSSSSS! And guess what. I serve for a living. And I am very forgiving when it comes to service. I came here on a weekday to eat alone and asked if i could sit at a tiny table because there were very few people there. But the male server rolled his eyes and said 'ummmmmmm if you HAVE to take up a two top table, then be my guest.' He couldn't even be bothered to hide his disdain. So instead I sat at the bar and ordered to-go, which made the server appalled, visibly. I ordered a coffee for there and watched as he took everyone else's order at the bar and brought them all coffee before me. I even had to remind him that I ordered one. He huffed and rolled his eyes. And THEN went to the very attractive woman sitting next to me and took her order, flirted a bit and treated her the way he should be treating everyone: with fucking respect. So you know what i fucking did?! I fucking paid and told him to keep the change and then I watched as he realized I had left him a ten dollar tip. That ten dollars was worth it to see the look on his face. He looked as if he had just swallowed his whole foot! And then he thanked me and said good bye. Flying Saucer, why do you keep a server on for years who only shows respect when someone flashes them a nice tip? That isn't how this business works. I've worked in Lincoln Park where I have to deal with entitled, sexist bros and high heeled rich white chicks. You are in the heart of humboldt park and the majority of your clientele is probably nerdy weirdos and sometimes maybe entitled white people on the weekends, am i right? So having a veteran server that's chronically bitter and noticeably annoyed with every single customer doesn't really make sense. Have him work in a bar in wrigleyville or in a late night vegan diner in lakeview where teenagers that don't tip hang out. Then maybe he'll appreciate where he's at a bit more. You have such a cute spot with eclectic vintage decor and a place like that would be so much nicer with a kinder server. One that smiles and isn't pissed off at you before you even sit down. Just sayin... I'm available if you're ready to make that leap! ;)

55.description: I'm always down to try new breakfast/brunch establishments so imagine my excitement as I planned a brunch date with a friend at Flying Saucer. Boy what a disappointment that turned out to be. Service was okay. We were greeted minutes after walking in and seated quickly after. After looking over the menu I opted for my go-to benedict and not only was it over sauced with their red pepper sauce (completely overpowered the eggs and eventually the baby spinach) but halfway into eating it I found a twist tie lying beneath one of the english muffins! I called our server over and he apologized for it (not very sincerely may I add...) and promised not to add it on the bill. I think he was more mad about losing the possible tip over the fact that I almost ate a twist tie.I often am willing to give places a second try but with so many great brunch joints in town it's kind of hard to forgive something like a faulty benedict and finding a foreign object on your plate. Maybe next time it'll be better....?

9.description: I are here last week with my wife. The vintage decor is a great! We were seated quickly and our waiter was very friendly and attentive. I had the biscuits and gravy with eggs and it was easily the best I've ever eaten. My wife had the eggs Benedict and she loved the dish. The coffee was great tasting and fresh. I honestly can't wait to go back.

26.description: Flying Saucer has really great biscuits, and none of the times we've always had good to great food.The wait is terrible on Saturdays or Sundays after 9:15. I'd recommend either anticipating a long wait, or going somewhere else.I like that they have meat and vegan options alongside each other.

25.description: I just left this restaurant,  and when the Bill exceeds 35$ for 2 people it should be phenomenal right?  I don't ever really post here , but I feel it necessary today. Besides everything being cold, except the eggs, the corn beef hash was more like paste, very little corned beef, then a full order of chicken sausage was 1 piece cut in half which should be stated on menu!!! The potatoes seemed old to top it off... This is not the place you want to travel from Rodgers park ...wish it was worth it. ...definitely not

12.description: Flying Saucer is a great breakfast spot in the neighborhood. Their vegan pancakes are fluffy, sweet and oh so delicious. In fact, I think they're my favorite vegan pancakes of all time! Their Sweet Potato Hash is great too for when you're in the mood for something more savory. I also love their Spiced Apples and Steamed Kale with Miso Dressing. Sure, they're simple sides but they are magical and I do find myself craving them quite often. I do wish they had a few more vegan options, but I suppose when you do it right, there's no need to add to it. Why mess with perfection? They also make a mean soy cappuccino, which is great for the more blustery months (aka 9 months out of the year). Also, I have never had issues with the service, like some others have cited. Maybe I just managed to go there on their good days or I have just been seated by the nicer servers, but they all seem nice and attentive to me.My only two complaints about Flying Saucer are 1) It's cash only. Not the hugest deal in the world and I usually have enough in my wallet to get what I want, but still, it can be a pain. 2) The add ons can be a bit much. Pay extra for maple syrup and margarine for your pancakes? That's a little silly to me. In the end, I do it and it's not that much extra. But still, who can have pancakes without maple syrup and margarine?If I were to make a suggestion to you, gentle readers, it would be this: go on a weekday for breakfast if you can. It will be far less crowded, you'll get a table right away and service will be speedy and attentive. If that's not an option, they do allow for carry out which is great for brunch in bed (not that I do that sort of thing).

59.description: We ate here near closing time and the service really reflected that. They were slightly rude and on the rushed side. I ordered a salad that sounded really very good on the menu, but was a disappointment when it came out. It ended up being mostly just a lot of lettuce with a small serving of veggies. It wasn't substantial enough for a meal and the flavor was very boring. Mediocre, but seemingly okay if you don't feel like cooking your own breakfast.

21.description: No. Just no.  Nothing warm or welcoming here.  I thought the many Yelp reviews about the staff's bad attitudes couldn't possibly be true, but yes, they are.Totally blah, lackluster interior.  Distant, pretentious, disinterested staff.  Warmish, runny  food delivered by truly condescending waitstaff.  An experience I won't be repeating. Ever.If you are a hipster (all others need not enter the sanctum) in need of a shot of pretentious, too-cool-to-be-pleasant (or even bother to smile) service, by all means come to this overpriced establishment.  But the food isn't worth the prices, there's zero ambiance and - heck - you can be treated badly for far less money elsewhere.People, if you're so unhappy managing this place and working at this place, move on. It's obvious you'd rather be someplace else.  It seems to annoy you to have to work here.  Snarking at your customers and providing middling, half-heated food is not how it's done in a real business.  We're still shaking our heads in amazement at how wrong the experience was.  So bad it was funny!  (btw, We spent the same forty-five dollars for breakfast  at a different place the next day. We were treated well, got tasty, well-prepared, hot food and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.  They earned our return business.)  Yes, we got a great, funny story out of our meal at Flying Saucer, but not the kind that will bring our business back  (or any of our friends' business, either).

17.description: No. Just no.  Nothing warm or welcoming here.  I thought the many Yelp reviews about the staff's bad attitudes couldn't possibly be true, but yes, they are.Totally blah, lackluster interior.  Distant, pretentious, disinterested staff.  Warmish, runny  food delivered by truly condescending waitstaff.  An experience I won't be repeating. Ever.If you are a hipster (all others need not enter the sanctum) in need of a shot of pretentious, too-cool-to-be-pleasant (or even bother to smile) service, by all means come to this overpriced establishment.  But the food isn't worth the prices, there's zero ambiance and - heck - you can be treated badly for far less money elsewhere.People, if you're so unhappy managing this place and working at this place, move on. It's obvious you'd rather be someplace else.  It seems to annoy you to have to work here.  Snarking at your customers and providing middling, half-heated food is not how it's done in a real business.  We're still shaking our heads in amazement at how wrong the experience was.  So bad it was funny!  (btw, We spent the same forty-five dollars for breakfast  at a different place the next day. We were treated well, got tasty, well-prepared, hot food and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.  They earned our return business.)  Yes, we got a great, funny story out of our meal at Flying Saucer, but not the kind that will bring our business back  (or any of our friends' business, either).

10.description: We were in the area this weekend and thought we'd grab the opportunity to have breakfast here, but it turned out to be a letdown. I remember this place being much better in the past -- higher-quality food, and more pancake/waffle selections. The coffee cake was good, but "home fries" were just large chunks of boiled potato finished in a skillet, with no onion or other embellishment, and bacon was cheap and overcooked. I think this may be the result of a slapdash attitude in the kitchen, because every error seemed to point in the direction of laziness: the fruit cup I ordered, for instance, was full of stems, and the orange wedge it came with was sliced at random angles, making it challenging to remove the peel without making a mess. The meal wasn't inedible, but it was far from anything special. I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, nor would I consider it a special treat if I were in the area again.One star bonus because it offers slightly better vegetarian choices than other places around town, although my wife said her trucker bowl with veggie sausage was merely OK.

5.description: Little cafe at the end of my street, and boy are we lucky! Vegan options, old standbys, and my fave which is lox, cream cheese and a bagel. On the California Corridor, which is a gold mine for great places!

3.description: Best breakfast I've had in o long time, if not the best ever. Service was great, I think some people just like to search for things to bitch about.

35.description: Yah no. Service was friendly and good.  Food not so much.I'd been here a few years ago and now I remember why I haven't been back.  So I'm writing this review more for myself than you, because I don't want to forget that I should never eat here again.  It's just a waste of my time. My egg white omelet was oily, the veggies in it were undercooked or not cooked at all, and then the whole mess became watery because they were undercooked.   That's just lazy cooking.  My bf's scrambled eggs were just OK (they were just there, he says).  But his home fries were raw on the inside and inedible.  The only good thing in the dish was the bacon!  They weren't full or busy, but it wasn't super early/late in the morning either, so no excuses.  It was just blah.

19.description: Essentially a middle-of-the-road diner which does a nice job of catering to meat-eaters, vegetarians, and vegans alike.  A friend and I met up for breakfast at about 10:30 on a Sunday; the restaurant was busy but we were seated immediately.  Once seated, our server was always attentive and friendly.My middling review score lies in the quality of the food.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy with the veggie sausage gravy.  The food was served after only a short wait but the food left much to be desired.  The consistency of the biscuits was inconsistent (some parts were considerably tougher than others), the accompanying scrambled eggs weren't really very fluffy, and, overall, the food was very lukewarm even when it was first brought to the table.I really want to like this place and, while I am more than willing to give it another try, the food just didn't seem all that fresh or well-prepared.  Give them at least one visit; here's to hoping that my food experience was unordinarily subpar.

28.description: Surprisingly great brunch near the park! Tons of vegetarian options, but enough meat choices to keep my carnivore husband happy as well. Definitely has the diner vibe. Is cash only.

45.description: A very solid breakfast here! Quiche of the day was excellent (with big chunks of bacon - so fear not, non-vegans, at least I'm assuming it was not vegan bacon?), bottomless coffee was truly refilled often and my friends also gave high praise for their food - both veg and non-veg. I'm planning to return next time I'm in Humboldt Park. It's in a great location to wander around the park after eating, too.As commenting on the service seems to be a trend in Flying Saucer's Yelp reviews, I'll add my opinion. It wasn't warm/fuzzy restaurant service, but it really wasn't bad and was almost entirely good. It reminded me of what you get in countries where the waitstaff doesn't have to pretend to like you for a good tip, although definitely on the quality end of that. They got our orders quickly and were pretty friendly. Definitely none of the issues from other reviews.The only part that was a little frustrating was the aggressive push to turn-over tables, even with the restaurant not full and nobody waiting. I can see where they're coming from on this, since it sounds like typically they are very busy on weekends and nobody wants a table sitting there not spending money, but they were definitely slow enough today that they could have been a little more diplomatic. Maybe we were headed into iced-tea ladies who lunch territory in their eyes...Anyway, overall - recommeded!

33.description: When we arrived to the restaurant, although they had many tables available they wouldn't sit us until the whole party was present. We requested a table by the window and the guy didn't want to let us sit there, he was extremely unfriendly.  We got Rebecca as our waitress, she was attentive & GREAT! During our meal two different guys at two different time came to our table reaching over us to change a small stand sign and to top the salt and pepper. We felt rushed and the guys were very annoying. We spent $74, the food was amazing! The 2 guys ruined it for us. We will never go back. Before we exited the restaurant one of the guys light up a cigarette, maybe that's why we were rushed.

43.description: I can't really say anything bad about Flying Saucer. My boy and I went there for the first time about a month ago mostly for change and randomly picked it. We went there for the first time, and ever since we go there for brunch. It's THE spot.  Service is great, food is perfect... what more can you ask for?

2.description: This place was so bad, it's laughable. Very few vegan options, but I decided the Tofu Sweet Potato hash was the way to go. Microwaved, flavorless bits of sweet potato. Cheap deep fried tofu, no flavor. Watery kale. No garlic, no seasoning, no salt, just BLAND. The cook doesn't know how to cook. I can microwave my own sweet potato for $1 and it'd taste better. My plate came with my choice of side. I got the apples, don't make my mistake. They sucked. Also microwaved. I don't get it.I've never had such a bland, inedible plate of food before. The latte was good. Not good enough to make up for my $10 plate of food that I literally took 3 bites of.

18.description: great vibegreat musicclean placewe're from San Francisco so the vibe was just rightwe had the sampler and the trucker bowlnot to salty, good flavor the owner was really sweet and checked on us.. the staff were pleasant and attentivegreat breakfast place!the only thing missing was decaf coffee  :(

41.description: Rude and incompetent employees all around. Especially the dingbat waitress and the 48 year old balding busboy. I'd rather go to Feed or Bite

52.description: Me and my girl friends decided on here because they had something for everyone (meat,  veggie, vegan, and everything in between. So the table ordered the black bean cakes, sweet potato hash, and one of the breakfast bowls. I had the black bean cakes that left me wanting something more. You could tell that everything was fresh, but I had that meh feeling. I would say most everyone at the table had that same expression. The person most satisfied had the breakfast bowl, but commented that it was not an appropriate temperature to have just come out.What I will say is that the service is excellent. The waiter really knew the menu and helped everyone with 3 kinds of dietary restrictions pick out something. I thought that was VERY impressive. I also like the vibe of simplicity, focus on the food, and comfort place of the restaurant. Now with all that, I still want an EXCELLENT meal, so I won't be trekking out this way to come back, but if you live in the area or not too far away, I'd give it a try.Remember cash only and your entire group must be present before your seated

50.description: Pretty tasty food for breaky or light lunch. I have gotten it to go a couple times and its always pretty good. It gets a little hip crowded so go early or later. The staff has always been friendly.

4.description: Met a friend here for breakfast on her recommendation.  I could see why.  I'd totally frequent this cute little joint for their retro vibes and amazing breakfast burrito alone.  The breakfast burrito is huge, and you can veganize it with tofu hash and veggie-chorizo.  Good tunes were playing and service was pleasant.  Cash only, and I think they have an ATM inside at the back.  It's obviously a very popular spot, so come early or expect to wait.  It's worth it.

6.description: DE-LECTABLE.The only reason I wouldn't give this place a 5 is because I am stingy with my stars.This spot is the equivalent of 'the girl next door." Beautiful, down to earth, and you might not notice it at first, but when she takes her glasses of--WOW. The inside is very quaint, not a lot of seating, so the wait can get decently long. It is well worth it, though. NEVER HAS VEGAN FOOD TASTED SO GOOD-- said the avid meat-eater. And you can also get meat, so YAY variety!Cash only (but there is also an ATM across the street).Overall-- definitely get here.

22.description: Amazing menu variety with just the right amount of quirkiness. Fresh flavors with great service. I highly recommend the Saucer.

15.description: The food was just OK, nothing worth coming back for. Coffee (bottomless) was good. For me, austere service is acceptable as long as it's efficient, but this place was just abrasive to the point one might think it was a joke. The staff are a bunch of too cool for school hipster millennials (as am I). There are too many good places in Chicago to eat to put up with their crap.

57.description: Terrible service. Decent food. What a bummer.Tried bringing my boyfriends mother here TWO times. The first I thought "maybe the waiter is having a bad day" so we tried again. It was right up the street and convenient. NOPE. Just BAD. Bad attitudes. Waiter was abrasive, took forever to get things we needed and we felt like an annoyance. I was embarrassed we had chosen to bring her there AGAIN. But I do like to give places multiple tries. Been there a few times, not on my accord and it;s always been the same. Just such a BLAH experience.My friend warned me before I moved into the area, "just don't go". I didn't get it until I went. Okay, yah, theres just no reason to go. Plenty of other amazing brunch places with better service.The food is good brunch food (nothing to write home about), and the decor is kind of cutesy.  They just need to hire better wait staff I just want hold em and shake em  "SMILE ITS OKAY TO SMILE!! YOU CAN DO IT!!!"

20.description: The food was pretty good, my boyfriend and I got the veggie bowl of biscuits and gravy. I personally didn't like all the fake meat and tofu on it, I think it would be better with just veggies. But the strawberry ricotta coffee cake was absolutely delicious!

36.description: Best breakfast/brunch spot in the neighborhood, hands down. awesome veggie options, great coffee, great prices, friendly staff. Bonus: the australian guy working there is super hot ;). Stop yelping around and go there!!

14.description: Just left this place. The biscuits were decent and that's about it. My friend and I ate here, we got checked on once to see what we wanted to order. I left the man $28 on a $27.30 bill because he sucked. I have worked in the industry and currently work in a kitchen now. My gravy on my biscuits was broken, it wasn't good food nor experience. I always leave a 20% tip not even counting on the food, but AT LEAST the service. The guy (some British fellow with a mustache and no hair) followed me outside to confront me saying "so you're leaving me a 70 cent tip?" how unprofessional can you get? You work 7 AM to 3. I work that everyday and I chose to come here on my ONE day off to be treated like shit. Hah. Place is a joke.

58.description: LOVE parlor 836. I went in last week for their $38 mani/pedi deal. I was surprised to find an attentive and meticulous nail magician :) Small spot, not many employees and definitely did not feel like I was in a fingernail sweatshop. You know what I'm talking about. The ones that shuffle you in and out like a factory with 15 massage chairs lined up agains the wall. A week later and my REGULAR manicure is still gorgeous. I will definitely be back!

56.description: I have been getting my eye brows threaded here for over a year and its great! It's in a convenient location and the staff is very friendly and great at what they do. I got a pedicure here too and it was lovely. I am very particular about my eyebrows and like for it to be quick. Vanessa does a fantastic job every time.

29.description: Parlor 836 is my go-to for manicures, pedicures, and eyebrow waxing/threading in Chicago. Whenever I go, I feel like I'm stopping by to visit friends. Jessica and Vanessa are sisters who run the place -- the former is a manicurist, and Vanessa is an esthetician. I've also had manicures from Linda and ... one other woman whose name I cannot recall.  I'm not picky, because they all do a great job and are fun conversationalists.  Anyway, the service is efficient without seeming rushed, the manis/pedis last a long time, and the threading service is well done. The prices are great (e.g. $25 for a full-face threading, $30 for a no-chip mani, $38 for a regular mani/pedi on Tues and Weds) and the place is always very clean.  93 XRT is typically the soundtrack of choice, and they are quick to offer hot tea, which is great during the winter months.  I recommend Parlor 836 to everyone in my neighborhood and beyond.  They do not have the space to offer facials, unfortunately, and I wish the seating for the pedicures was a tiny bit more comfortable, but otherwise I love everything about it, including that you can text them to request appointments.

42.description: Nice cozy little parlor on Damen and Rice.Went for nonchip manicure here twice, and both times only lasted for 1 week till it started chipping. But I only blame it on the product, I still get it anyway because it changes to a different color when I'm cold! (:-P)Jessica and Linda were very attentive and meticulous with their work.I also love that they apply sunblock on your hands before it goes into the UV light.I'll definitely be back since I don't feel rushed here and the street parking is not too bad.

23.description: Great place! Went for my first Brazilian, it took 9 mins!!!!! Well worth it. In/out done! Vanessa is great!

47.description: I love this place. I've been getting my eyebrows threaded here for about a year and a half, despite moving from 2 blocks away to a 20 min. drive away. I've never had an appointment, but Vanessa always accommodates me with a smile and chats me up each time I'm there (despite only needing threading every 3 weeks or so, she remembers me and talks to me about my trips home to Miami). I've never had a "place" to have any spa-type services done, but the quick, affordable, friendly service at Parlor 836 has made me a regular customer.

8.description: I usually come here to get my brows threaded and they always do a great job! I decided to try out their mani/pedi special on Wednesday and she did a fantastic job! She took her time and really made my hands and feet look fabulous. The paint on my toes didn't chip off for almost a month and continued to look like I had just gotten them done. Props to a job well done. Check them out if you're in the West Town area.

31.description: The service is great in here. Everyone that works at Parlor is attentive and nice to you. I appreciated getting my eyebrows threaded on the same visit that I got my manicure! I would otherwise have to go to two different places. There is something about this place... Whether it's the nice and quiet location or the cozy shop...but something makes you feel at home.Evelyn, the technician was super as well as their well-recognized products. Having said that, my manicure looks great, after a week. However, beware that the experience is not a Spa Manicure experience...no hot towel or paraffin wax in the service. For me, it worked great. I wasn't looking for the extra fancy perks, I just wanted a nice, good quality manicure where I could be in and out due to my busy schedule.

34.description: I love this place.. Amazing treatments delivered with so much love and care. Wonderful space- highly recommended..

16.description: Hands down best place to get your eyebrows threaded! I can always walk right in and leave with perfect eyebrows for the lovely price of $10!

13.description: Linda does the best job with my nails! Just got a French manicure and it is the best one I've ever gotten- highly recommended.

11.description: Randomly walked by and saw they did threading. Checked reviews and they were high so I gave it a try. Thanks Vanessa for a quick and beautiful arch! Will def be back.

39.description: Vanessa is great - I get my brows waxed when I'm not too busy (or lazy) and she is always able to squeeze me in!  I love the relaxed, friendly atmosphere and small shop feel too!

37.description: The entire staff here is wonderful. Beyond talented and kind while working with clients. I've sampled just about every offering they have and I have yet to be disappointed. Vanessa does a wonderful job with my brows, Andrew is a great massage therapist and all of the girls who do nails are fun, friendly and quick.  When I come here for service it's like being with old friends.

0.description: I've only been to Parlor 836 for eyebrow threading, but Vanessa is the best (and fastest) in the biz! I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes to be seen, and the threading itself takes literally 3-5 minutes, if that. *gasps in amazement*Thanks for always returning my brows to their best arched state, Vanessa--so wish I had your skill!

38.description: Very nice parlor. Vanessa is very friendly and does an excellent job threading eyebrows. Will definitely be back!

51.description: I called on a Saturday morning for a eyebrow thread. They had availability right away. It was my first time at the salon, but because of Yelp reviews I decided to check it out. Very cute, small, and vintage salon, nice staff. My eyebrow threading ($10) took a few minutes and I was very happy with the outcome. I'll definitely go back.

27.description: I went to Vanessa for threading for the first time, and I was blown away! My eyebrows look great, and I'm not insanely sore. I think I have a new place...

32.description: I just finished up a phenomenal 60 minute deep tissue massage with Andrew. He was friendly, the pressure was fantastic and he found my knots instantly. Do it do it do it do it. A major Ukrainian Village find.

54.description: Ok. So for whatever reason, yelp AGAIN filtered my post. Stop it yelp!!!! This is a real review. So I'm attempting to re-post it because I love this place: So many great things to say about this place. I discovered Parlor 836 as I was driving up Damen on my way to somewhere else. The first time I went in, the person at the front was very friendly and welcoming. I found out later that it was one of the owners, Vanessa. I didn't have an appointment but she gladly accommodated my sporadic request for an eyebrow threading/tinting, leg waxing and a mani and pedi. Vanessa did my eyebrow threading/tinting and also my waxing. She did a FABULOUS job! I can't recall the name of the girl that did my mani/pedi but she was super friendly and I recall having a conversation with her about our mutual love for dogs. The second time I came in I didn't have an appointment either, again they accommodated me. More recently, just a few weeks ago, I made an appointment because I knew it would be busy due to the holidays. I had scheduled a mani/pedi and leg waxing. Well, while I was there, true to my sporadic nature, I wanted to add-on another service...a Brazilian wax. Vanessa checked the schedule and found out she would be able to squeeze me in, in between one client and the next. My mani/pedi this time was done by one of the other owners, Jessica. Jessica is so sweet and seems like an all around great person. She did a fabulous job on my hands and feet. She's so meticulous in her work and when she was done it looked great. During one of my visits, I found out that Vanessa & Jessica happen to be sisters. I love the fact that we have a local family owned small business in our community that provides amazing quality services. Both are so down-to-earth and I feel like I'm at home when I go there. It's a very comfortable place to be.In regards to the ambiance, the place is very simple but very warm and welcoming. They put out beverages for clients to partake of. They offer to hang your coat when you enter. They adjust the amount of pillows you have behind your back to make sure you're comfy during the pedicure. I can't say enough great things about Parlor 836. They will continue to receive my business in 2013.

48.description: I went to Parlor 836 first out of convenience (I had noticed it several times while walking my dog and thought it looked so cute and clean) and I will keep going back for the awesome staff and excellent service.  I've had both no chip manis and regular manis, and the nochip easily lasted for two weeks+ while the regular mani lasted for at least a week--a HUGE feat for me as I am a nurse and wash my hands constantly, use hand sanitizer constantly, and my hands are always super busy at work.  The pedi is amazing--they use essential oils in the water and it smells like heaven.  The staff are all so fun to talk to and they are sweet as pie.  Vanessa is a whiz at eyebrow threading--my brows look stellar and she is super quick.Also, I work nights and I accidentally overslept and was 30 minutes late to my appointment (yes, I'm that client) and they were still able to accommodate me (not that I am advocating being late...just trying to make a point how great they are!)

44.description: I absolutely love that I no longer have to go to three different places for mani, pedi, threading, massage, & Brazilian. It's all in one place & each service is excellently done. My sanitary standards are met & the prices are more then reasonable. I love that due to a hectic schedule my visits are few & far between, but they remember me every time. I highly recommend this place to all my friends.

24.description: I just moved to Chicago June 1st and was searching for weeks where to get my eyebrows threaded since I'm super picky. After lots of research, I'm very happy I went to Parlor 836. The best eyebrow threading I've gotten! I would recommend that they do a rewards program for people who want to get them done every 2 weeks. I'm in and out of there in less than 10 minutes. This place is awesome.

7.description: The girls here are sooo nice and did a great job with my no chip manicure. I got color changing polish - pink to dark purple - so much fun for my birthday weekend! Three weeks later, only 2 of my nails have chipped slightly. I only need to remove it because of the amount my nails have grown out. I look forward to trying out more of their services here.

49.description: Parlor 836 is bright, clean and inviting. The girls working here a super friendly and great at what they do. It's my place to go when I need a bikini wax, threading, pedi/mani - I've yet to try the massage. The nice thing about the waxing here is that my sensitive skin is barely red at all post-wax (unlike after going to other waxing places I've been to). They do a great job here and are as gentle as it gets.Almost two weeks ago I got my first ever no-chip manicure with a whitish/pinkish milky-translucent polish and as I'm typing this my nails still look great!

40.description: I thought everyone was nice and professional. But, I'm sorry to be a party pooper but I love the threading i got but the manicure was bad and its already fading away after a few hours. They didn't put the oil on so it will last. I feel like $15 is too much. I'm not saying don't go there but I've had longer lasting manicures.

53.description: Parlor 836 is great! I've only gotten my eyebrows and upper lip threaded here but I always walk in  and almost always seen within ten minutes. She's quick and not painful and still does a great job. So glad I found this place and will continue to come here!

30.description: They charge $10 to take off no chip (even if you had it done there) and they don't offer the option of getting just a no chip polish (without the manicure)... I think thats weird, but to each his own I guess.

46.description: My health is of great value to me and getting a regular massage to help relax from stress and tension has helped greatly, finding a therapist with the right skills is not easy and thank goodness I found Andrew and in my neighborhood. Thank you Andrew for your help!

1.description: Fast, friendly, and great results for this first-timer to brow and upper-lip threading.  I'll be back!

55.description: I like this place because, as a person who isn't a total girly girl, they are great at making my feet look and feel great. I am not overwhelmed by terrible pink and I have no fear that I will be talked into some terrible airbrushing. I like that they focus on he feet as a whole, rather than just the nails. As a cook, my feet get pretty rough, and they make them pretty, and it makes me feel great and not ashamed of their nastiness. I like the woman who did my pedicure both times, but I of course forgot her name. She is lovely. Talkative if that is what you want, and quiet if that is your thing. I never remember to bring sandals, and they totally tried to accommodate that with plastic wrap. I did it last time and it worked. This time, I decided to risk the short walk home. They survived the trip, ladies. Thanks!

9.description: So, I smashed my finger really bad about 3 days before my wedding and ended up with a completely black and painful nail. The ladies at studio 824 worked a miracle and figured out how to cover that witchy looking nail with a pretty natural pink color. They always spend a lot of time making sure you are happy as the client. I can't recommend their services enough. Good thing they are across the street from me as I will return for any special needs or occasions I have in the future! Thanks again for your wonderful work!

26.description: I went there with my sister 2 days before my wedding. we were getting mani/pedi/threading. First, we had to pick the colors. There wasn't a big selection of colors. Many of the nail polishes were almost empty. The girls who did our nails were super diligent that it took about 1.5 hours to get a mani/pedi. When we finished, my sister looked over at me and asked "where are the drying machines?" I just shrugged.  Everything looked great, but we had to be super careful. Of course I nicked my nail in the car. I was super careful the whole day. Get up the next morning and there are marks on my nails possibly from the blankets and pillows!  I called to speak the the owner and she offered to have them redone. I didn't live close by and had wedding stuff to take care of. She also told me because it's a heavy coat, it takes a few hours to dry! It shouldn't take a few hours to dry.She also asked which color I used because maybe it was due to the nail polish. My sister's nail polish also started chipping.Very disappointed.

25.description: I am new to the neighborhood and have been looking for a good local nail spot!  This place is it! It's adorable, I love quaint atmosphere and will be visiting regularly!!  They offer a wide range of services but for a good ol fashioned very nice mani and pedi I will be a new regular!

12.description: Best nail service I have received. The regular mani lasted me two complete weeks and pedi I know will last me a loooooong time. Linda did an amazing job! I am returning to get other services!

59.description: I had a marvelous experience here. The atmosphere is calm and the decor is classically pleasant; 104.3fm is underrated. Linda did my mani-pedi; she smoothed my terrible cuticles and callouses effortlessly. Also, she made an excellent color change suggestion.I will definitely be returning.

21.description: I can only speak to nail services, but the ladies here are simply the best, especially Jessica and Linda. They are so meticulous. My no-chips can last upwards of 3 weeks when I get them done here and I only take them off because a) I'm ready for a new color or b) the grow-out is getting too big. Prices are very reasonable, too. I moved out of the neighborhood a few months ago, but gladly make the trip over here when I need a manicure or pedicure!

17.description: Love this place ! Everyone is so down to earth and very friendly! you know you're getting a nice clean mani and pedi and they really take their time with you. highly recommend this place!

10.description: I stopped in hoping to get a manicure and didn't realize I'd need an appointment. The staff were very nice and able to fit me in. The person giving me the Mani was very thorough and took a lot of care in her work. It's a small shop, with limited seating, but considering you should schedule an appointment to be seen, it makes sense. It was $15 for the Mani. I'd definitely like to stop in another time to try out a pedicure. They also offer threading, and massage services which is great for a one stop shop.

5.description: As someone who has gone to this place for the last three years for threading, I can honestly say that there isn't a better place in the area! I was hesitant to come when I moved because I was obsessed with my last eyebrow technician. I definitely have ptsd from some bad experiences. However, Vanessa is just the person for this. She's extremely friendly and pays attention to detail. I never feel awkward asking her to go over an area again because she's also a perfectionist. I love catching up with her and the wonderful crew that works here. The space is so inviting! It's like a boutique nail salon so don't think you're going to find massage chairs here! The colors are bright and the space is comfortable. I love that it's a family run place because they put a lot of thought and care into. My favorite thing is that you can schedule or just walk in. There are busy times so if you don't want to be disappointed then call in advance. If you love your brows and want excellent services with threading and nails then you should definitely come here!

3.description: Love this place. Great job at threading eyebrows. Conveniently located in Ukrainian Village!!

35.description: The absolute BEST manicure/pedicure experience I've ever had. Everyone is so nice and they do a fantastic job. I even have to mention how much I love the decor! All around great experience. Highly recommended.

19.description: Absolutely adore this place!  Was forced to search (for) à new nail-tech,  after 3 attempts I discovered this local...glad I did, highly recommend!

28.description: I went to Parlor 836 because I was given a gift certificate. I was given a prenatal 60 min massage and mani/pedi. The mani/pedi was good. Nothing out of this world but they did do a nice job. The pedi seating is not as comfortable as other shops (the seat is too high so you can't get your feet in the water unless you sit at the edge of the chair (so you aren't able to relax as much as you might like until you are done in the water). Regardless, left with my nails looking great. My prenatal massage was another story. I hope to provide the right expectations for those considering. I went in thinking I'd be on a bed with the whole in the middle (have had these prenatal massages other places) and that's not what they had. Thus the option was to lie on my side. For me in my pregnancy, this is by far the most uncomfortable position (very tight hips) so things were off to a bad start. I was offered the option to skip it and keep the certificate for something else. However, I had saved this to be my last massage (I'm due in 4 weeks) and was mostly upset that this information wasn't provided when I booked the appointment. So I'm on my side and I personally found it worse for my body. Additionally, I was given a fleece blanket to put between my knees for comfort, but I was not comfortable using it as I felt it had been used by someone else prior. When I've had massages in the past, there is a particular pattern that I feel happens to properly work out your back. Not with this experience. It was literally all over the place, from shoulders to my low back and back to my shoulders. It was so sporadic that there were moments where I questioned the experience level of the male masseuse. I was later told he's been doing this for 10 years, so maybe I'm the odd gal out who doesn't care for his "style."  There was clearly frustration from him when I did provide feedback that it was too hard and despite my trying to finish the massage, I was told it was over (10 min before my 60 min were up) I guess becuase it was clear how uncomfortable I was. Nonetheless, it was akward and left me really annoyed. Their pricing is clearly competitive and that's a plus but I would not suggest a prenatal massage from this place. They kindly did not charge me for this portion of my experience which is very nice, but I'm not excited about going back to use the remains of my certificate.

45.description: Love this spot for beautification/relaxation.When my thread-savvy friends told me that Vanessa was a great threader, I knew I'd have to make it a priority to stop here for my occasional thread job.
