They were right. She can almost always squeeze in a walk-in, and she gets you out of there in just a few minutes. She's super friendly, accommodating, and just a lovely person. Five stars just for her.I had occasion to try out their nail services and a massage from Andrew a few months back, and I have been remiss in raving about these services. The sweet gals helped me pick out my polish (sometimes I can be horribly indecisive) and my nails lasted for two weeks sans chip. Did I mention that this was a regular old mani? NO CHIPS. Amazing. Five stars there too.The massage was just what I needed to take me into a higher state of relaxation. Andrew communicates well with you to determine your needs (in my case, early pregnancy combined with training for a half marathon) so he can really do the best work. Five more stars. I think I'm up to 15 stars, but whatever. Suffice it to say, this is a darling, sweet shop, that will make you feel pretty and completely relaxed. I will definitely be back.

33.description: When I get my eyebrows done, I ask for 2 things; thick and long. My eyebrows don't grow at the same pace so getting them to look the same can be challenging. I used to go to Sahan Motherland Salon and Spa faithfully but after waiting over a hour to get my  eyebrows threaded (2 people were ahead of me),  I stopped going and looked for a new eyebrow threader. I tried Days Salon,  Designer Perfume & Eyebrow Threading Salon, and Perfect Eyebrows but didn't get the results I desired so I decided to grow my eyebrows out. I started looking on Yelp daily for eyebrow reviews and Parlor 836 always popped up. After reading the great reviews about Vanessa, I decided to give it a try. NO REGRETS! Vanessa noticed one eyebrow wasn't as full as the other and asked if I wanted to let it grow in more. I told her no-it had been at least a month and I was tired of looking at what I thought was a dirty face because my eyebrows were not done. 4, maybe 5 minutes later Vanessa handed me a mirror to look at my perfectly shaped, matching, thick AND long eyebrows. Thanks Vanessa!!!Vanessa is GREAT!

43.description: Yelp doesn't lie. Great spot. Good customer service. Reasonable prices. They have made a regular customer out of me even though I don't live in the neighborhood anymore.

2.description: Top notch nail service! I had a lovely experience getting a shellac manicure at Parlor836. I came in needing my previous shellac mani removed. I had on a million coats of polish from a not so nice experience I had else where. One of the owners who did my nails took her time to remove my old polish properly and gently. Loving my fresh mani and the color choices they offered! I definitely recommend coming in and trying for yourself. They are also pet friendly:) Support Local Businesses!

18.description: I've been waxing and threading for years... and I won't go to another place again. I came in to do my eyebrows and arms and Vanessa was fantastic. She used this new wax with a moisturizer on my arms and was super quick with it. My eyebrows have NEVER looked as good as they did walking out of there--and I've gone to a LOT of places. Total convert. I'm not a mani/pedi person but I definitely want to try theirs on service alone!

41.description: After reading many positive reviews about Vanessa's threading I decided to go in and give her a try.  I've been getting threaded for about 4 years now and have certainly had good and bad experiences, and I know what an "expert" threader is vs. someone who doesn't know what they're doing.  After going to two separate Thread Away locations here in Chciago (and ending up with uneven brows, missed hairs and more pain than necessary) I let my brows grow for a couple of months and took a chance on Parlor 836 given the positive reviews.  I am MORE than happy with Vanessa and the great work she did.  Also, the facility was clean and easy to get to, even with free parking around the corner. While I was there I was so impressed I decided to get a pedicure and Evelyn did a fantastic job.Overall, this is my new place for threading, pedis and maybe shellac (haven't tried that yet.)

52.description: Just went for an eyebrow threading. My first experience with threading and I think I like it better than waxing.  I was able to phone ahead and get right in, it was quick, easy, and comfortable.  Very reasonably priced as well.  My brows look fabulous again!

50.description: My go-to place for Mani/Pedi. All the girls are awesome, Linda is hysterical and a great conversationalist during my no-chip. I recommend this place to everyone who appreciates a good mani/pedi and good conversation. Plus lots of color options...esp for an indecisive person like me!

4.description: Never waited longer than a few minutes to get my eyebrows threaded. I typically stop on my days off while running errands since its so convient. Beautiful shop with very friendly staff.

6.description: I can only speak to nail services, but the ladies here are simply the best, especially Jessica and Linda. They are so meticulous. My no-chips can last upwards of 3 weeks when I get them done here and I only take them off because a) I'm ready for a new color or b) the grow-out is getting too big. Prices are very reasonable, too. I moved out of the neighborhood a few months ago, but gladly make the trip over here when I need a manicure or pedicure!

22.description: I've been here twice to get my eyebrows done and once for a polish change. They do a GREAT job at both!!  I'd go back in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone!

15.description: My girlfriends and made last-minute appointments on a Saturday afternoon for two pedicures and 1 manicure. The girls who did our nails were super nice and friendly! And omg the foot massage I got during my pedicure was amazing! We were only in the area for the weekend but if we're ever around again, I want to go here! It was also super cheap for the quality of service.

57.description: I have lived in the neighborhood for 2 and half years and only discovered this place last week!  So glad I did because Parlor 826 now saves me tons of gas and time going someplace else  for my eyebrow threading needs.  Huge plus for having Sunday hours.  Oh and good job on eyebrow threading.  :)

20.description: Linda does the best job with my nails! Just got a French manicure and it is the best one I've ever gotten- highly recommended.

36.description: Jessica is simply the best manicurist around. If I go somewhere else due to hours or proximity to work, I'm always disappointed and wish I would have come here instead. Very cute, comfortable, welcoming place with reasonable prices.

14.description: I have been coming to Vanessa for three years for the threading service. She has always accommodating my difficult schedule. I do a full face thread and neck and she has me in and out within 20 minutes. I am always able to get in with a call same day within a few hours. Vanessa is meticulous, very skilled and has yet to miss a spot! I am a forever client of Parlor 836.

1.description: I'm surprised this place hasn't been reviewed yet! They could use some feedback.It was a typical Friday afternoon and my better half is craving Mexican food. I am not picky at all and so we followed to do our research on Grubhub.Chicken torta: Great choice and it being accompanied with rice and beans was a huge plus. Flautas.. hmm.. These were really..empty.. I think they can definitely improve how much chicken they put into them seeing that they were rolled up pretty wide.Here's where I was a bit confused.I had a jamaica and she had an horchata. Or so she should have. There was something off about the jamaica... it wasn't FRESH. I've worked with these two drinks before and it's not just me.Fair food, quiet place when we picked up, maybe we'll come back.

0.description: I didn't know there was such a great restaurant around here. I decided to go with my friends. And the prices are amazing! !!!! They have great deals. The employees are very sweet and nice.  Very friendly!! And the food is amazing! !!!! Highly recommend and highly satisfied! !! I would definitely come back. They do delivery as well. Amazing!!!

1.description: Thank you to Stacey for putting together our wedding invitation , our reception pieces the way we wanted.

9.description: My wife and I got married a few weeks ago and we had Stacey print EVERYTHING.  She took care of our invitations, RSVPs, thank yous, menus, programs and even our place cards.  She is incredibly easy to work with and actually responds when you email her.  If you haven't worked with wedding vednors yet, you will soon understand how rare receiving a response from a vendor actually happens.  Basically we cannot say enough good things about Stacey and her work.  Everyone should use her for their wedding.Check out the vimeo video below to see Stacey in action.vimeo.com/50932248

23.description: I just met with Stacey this evening, and she was GREAT!  She is very knowledgeable and so helpful.  I'm confident that my wedding invitations will be amazing, and I can't wait to sing her praises several more times between now and when they're printed!

5.description: I could not possible find enough words to say thank you to Stacey and Vanessa at Steracle Press. They are incredibly talented and their customer service was second to none. Chicago Brides: for all of your printed  materials, you'd be remiss not to look into this place. This hands-down was my favorite vendor to work with and in a sea of the same... Steracle is the brightest of spots!Stacey and Vanessa went above and beyond to give us the most custom, beautiful invitations etc that were far from cookie cutter. I cannot tell you how many of our family and friends complimented our classy, timeless printed materials that were truly one of a kind. I'd only visit Stacey for any work in the future!

25.description: Stacy did an amazing job on my wedding invitations. She was quick to reply to emails and kept me up to date on how things were going throughout the whole process. My invitations were well above my expectations, and I will be recommending her to all my friends.Its been 6 months since my wedding and people still comment on my invites. Doesn't get better than that!!!

12.description: Stacey is the person to go to for save the dates and invitations. This was my least favorite part of the wedding planning process. She made it easy by giving examples of what others have done in the past. She hand drew several components which turned out amazing.  I had several compliments on them and my sister decided to use Steracle Press for her wedding in Maryland as well. Sorry this is so lateMorgan

21.description: I can't say enough good things about Stacey and her work. We used Steracle Press for our wedding Save The Dates, Invitations and Thank You cards and each piece is a little work of art. We both got numerous calls and emails to tell us how gorgeous our Save The Dates and invitations are. Stacey was a pleasure to work with every step of the way and went out of her way to accommodate us at every turn. She does impeccable work and we would hire her again without hesitation.

16.description: I just picked my my 250+ invitations from Stacey - and I couldn't be happier. She was lovely to work with to design the invitation, and helped create exactly what we wanted for our wedding. The letterpress is beautiful and rich looking, the info card with custom map is perfect, and the design is stunning and fits perfectly with our themes. Everything was exactly on time. Absolutely perfect.

17.description: Stacey of Steracle Press is a true artist, and such a sweet person! I came to her with a specific vision and she worked sooo diligently to make it come to life! My invitations turned out  stunning and I am beyond grateful to have had the opportunity to work with her on them! Her prices are totally reasonable as well, I would even call them a bargain considering how much time and care she put into the whole process.  Thank you Stacey!! I am eternally grateful and every time I need letterpress printing in the future, you will be my girl!

10.description: Thank you so much to Stacy and those at Steracle Press for our save the dates, invitations, and day of pieces.  We received so many complements from all our of guests!  It was so awesome to design our own pieces and also receive input for Stacy on what would work well.  She is so talented, helpful, down to earth and was a great vendor to work with!  We will cherish our wedding stationary forever.  Everything was just perfect, and reasonably priced too!!

11.description: My bride and I really cannot recommend Steracle Press enough.  Stacey is very creative, very helpful, and very accommodating.  She created unique save the dates, wedding invitations, and other weeding paper collateral that everyone raved about.  The best part?  It cost about the same as the cookie cutter stuff you get online.  This review is short so you don't waste too much time reading it and are able to call Stacy sooner!

26.description: I worked with Stacey (the amazing one woman show behind Steracle Press) on my save the dates, invitations, maps, menus, programs and all other manner of wedding stationary goods. All items were letterpress style printing - if that's what your after then talk to Stacey.  I literally cannot recommend her highly enough - she deserves 50 stars instead of just 5. She was easy to work with, flexible, cooperative, and she got everything done fast and with amazing skill. When I added things on last minute she was always willing to make changes and she was incredible about getting rush orders done. For example - I got in touch with her a week before my wedding and asked her if she could make me letterpress programs and menus - a week before my wedding! No problem. Even more of an endorsement was the fact that people RAVED about our invitations. People kept telling us how they brought them in to work to show their coworkers - sounds ridiculous I know but people seriously did. I thought her pricing was very competitive with other letterpress quotes and for the quality and amazing customer service you really can't beat working with Stacey.

22.description: Stacey helped me to create my wedding invitations and I couldn't be happier! I looked into numerous vendors and she was by far the best. She has the most talent, is so fabulous to work with and is the most reasonably priced. She is so patient and her work is absolutely wonderful.She sat down with me and asked me questions about what I wanted. She created numerous samples for me to pick and choose elements that I loved.  I would recommend her highly to absolutely anyone. Thank you so much Stacey!  Anyone looking for someone to help with their wedding or any other invitations, look no further!

0.description: We looked at a variety of different printers for our wedding invites and ultimately felt the most comfortable with Stacey. She's very smart in that she mocked up an on-the-spot design while we met with her for the first time. Hook, line and sinker! Just the small details that got our brains working. And honestly, that design she came up with was 90% of what is on our printed wedding invites! Not only is the final product beautiful, but she was soooooo patient in going back-and-forth with our ever-changing needs. In the end, we loved working with her, the process to print only took a few days and our invites are GORGEOUS. I was the one in the relationship who wanted to cut financial corners to make this happen. I'm glad we didn't. These invites (and make sure to go with the heavy paper!) are worth every penny.

20.description: Stacey did an incredible job on our wedding invites & envelopes. She worked with my fiance' who designed them and did a quick turn around for our upcoming September wedding. She let him stop by for a color check and to make sure everything looked good before they were all done. I researched a lot of local and online letter-press options and Stacey came out on top as far as time and cost. Her work is amazing and we will definitely be using her for our letter-press needs in the future.

19.description: Stacey is absolutely amazing and her prices are totally reasonable (less then the crappy stuff you can get from the paper stores)!  We used her for invitations, menus, place cards, programs and a custom made ketubah.  She does letter press and printing and, as i said, is absolutely amazing.  Our invitations were custom made and turned out beautifully.  She worked with us through the design and was very easy to work with when we had some last minute changes.  We also really couldn't find a ketubah that we liked and wanted to have one custom made that represented our relationship more.  Aside from the difficulty in getting hebrew into a usable format, i couldn't have been more pleased with how it turned out.  She hand drew (and then turned it into letterpress) the design for us.  Of all our wedding vendors, Stacey was absolutely, hands down, the best.  I can't speak highly enough for the amazing work that she did to help us with all our printing needs.

2.description: My experience with Stacey at Steracle Press was absolutely flawless!  I had over 200 wedding invitations made and Stacey helped me customize them every step of the way. Everything was printed quickly and without issue. She is a fabulous artist and even drew my mothers house for the map, which was then made into letterpress. The map is a work of art by itself! My invitation is stunning - on thick paper with gold edges - and my RSVP cards are hexagons... totally unique and reflective of our wedding style.  The whole set will definitely be framed and kept in our family forever. I especially love that everything is made in-house; it was so cool being able to see the press where they were being made. Thank you to Stacey for making this step of the wedding process stress-free and for helping to make it a truly unique invitation!

18.description: Stacey helped me to create my wedding invitations and I couldn't be happier! I looked into numerous vendors and she was by far the best. She has the most talent, is so fabulous to work with and is the most reasonably priced. She is so patient and her work is absolutely wonderful.She sat down with me and asked me questions about what I wanted. She created numerous samples for me to pick and choose elements that I loved.  I would recommend her highly to absolutely anyone. Thank you so much Stacey!  Anyone looking for someone to help with their wedding or any other invitations, look no further!

13.description: Stacey did an amazing job with our wedding invites.  They turned out even better than what we imagined.  She's open to new ideas and gives great advise.  We received so many compliments on our invites- they were unique and really represented us.

4.description: Stacey is super talented.  If you are looking for a designer to carry your unique vision out for all printed items for a reasonable cost, she is your girl!  She creates your custom quote based on your needs.  She has great existing designs and will tweak to make them yours.  I really enjoyed working with her!

24.description: Stacey recently helped me with the design and printing of our wedding invitations.  She was wonderful to work with and had terrific ideas!  Her work is outstanding and I've received noting but fabulous compliments on our invites.  She has a good eye for design, offers sincere and helpful advice, and genuinely wants to create something unique for you!  I can't recommend her enough!

6.description: I knew Stacey was who we wanted to work with from the beginning for our wedding invitations and rsvps. We wanted something simple, but weren't entirely sure of the design direction. Stacey offered lots of suggestions and examples of other designs she had done. They ended up turning out beautiful and she even did some hand-drawn elements of Michigan on the invites!! We received a million compliments and we owe it all to this fantastic designer. We will definitely be using her again!!!

15.description: Stacey just finished personal cards for me and they are beautiful. I had a high level idea of what I liked, and she was able to create multiple options for me to review. It was hard to chose because all of them looked great! I'm really very happy with the results.

7.description: In short, we absolutely love Stacey. She was such a pleasure to work with in every way. My fiance and I are not graphic designers, but decided to design our own wedding invitations as a way to save money & get the look we wanted. Stacey was absolutely fantastic in helping us throughout the process, from choosing the paper, brainstorming together on packaging to getting us other materials & referencing other great vendors. It is so rare to find someone so talented AND genuinely likable in the wedding industry.To sweeten the deal, her prices are very reasonable -- every cent is worth it.Can't wait to work with her again! Highly recommend her for all your stationery needs -- wedding or otherwise.

8.description: Stacey was wonderful to work with. She is always willing to help and is very flexible. Our invitations were beautiful and I got so many compliments on them! She's also reasonably priced compared to other places, but she provides high quality invitations! We needed more invites and she was more than happy to help us. We loved them so much we got our place cards and ceremony programs with her. I highly recommend Stacey for anyone who wants gorgeous invites! Thank you Stacey!!!

3.description: Planning a wedding can be crazy but it's lovely to work with people who are amazing at what they do. I planned my New York wedding from Chicago. After my fiancé (now husband) and I went to Paper source and Papyrus and a few other places that showed us the same books over and over again, I felt crazy because I couldn't find anything that I absolutely loved. I got the idea that maybe there was somewhere that I could have them made exactly like I imagined them in my head. After a quick google search I found Stacey. I went to her awesome studio and she showed me some of her great designs. I picked and chose elements that I really liked and we came up with exactly what I was looking for.  We had an issue with one of my ideas and it's functionality. But she worked with the materials and made it awesome. She addressed each invitation, a process that we went back and forth on for a while since it was difficult to get my guests' correct addresses. But Stacey was so accommodating, always available to talk or meet up, even after hours. The invitations were mailed out and many guests called me to tell me how beautiful they were. A WEEK before the wedding I finally got the final head count. Stacey printed out escort cards in the shape of flags which were placed on sticks and into mini-succulent plants for each guest. She also made menus with each guest's name on them for a 2-in-1 place card/menu...which I thought was brilliant. All-in-all, they were mailed to me overnight to NYC where I received them in enough time to get them to the florist/venue. Stacey and her team are very creative and their work is beautiful. They seem to really care about each of their clients and they do their best to accommodate. Her prices were surprisingly less than those cookie-cutter designs at the stores AND she went above and beyond the call of duty. Steracle Press was one of the most painless vendors I used for my wedding!

14.description: Stacey did an incredible job on our wedding invites & envelopes. She worked with my fiance' who designed them and did a quick turn around for our upcoming September wedding. She let him stop by for a color check and to make sure everything looked good before they were all done. I researched a lot of local and online letter-press options and Stacey came out on top as far as time and cost. Her work is amazing and we will definitely be using her for our letter-press needs in the future.

0.description: Ordered some shirts for my engagement party and they came out fantastic! The owner Mike did a great job and put so much detail into them! I will definitely be using Esteelo in the future!

3.description: Chicago's go to spot for the stylishly conscious gentleman! With a large cache of impeccable wares (suits, pants, shoes, ties, tie clips, hats, etc.) one would find themselves very hard pressed to not exit looking/feeling like a million bucks (with minimal damage to the wallet to boot!). Get the bespoke experience without the price! Richard is also a delight and has quite the keen eye for fashion; he can whip any slovenly rascal into a fetching chap! Three cheers for Richard's Fabulous Finds!

1.description: Ralph Lauren and Hackett London had a VINTAGE baby and named him Richard! Located in Chicagoland's newest neighborhood, The WOW District, RFF is a HIGH END vintage clothing haberdashery. Step back into a time when men dressed! Here you'll find the very BEST in men's vintage AND accessories with a smattering of tastefully appointed home decor. And besides Richards uncanny ability to pull your perfect size, RFF also has a patio in back of the shop that some claim is the "portal to another dimension." Follow his instagram and facebook page to stay abreast of events, book-signings, parties and such!

2.description: This is the first time I've ever bothered to write a Yelp review, but I was completely blown away by the shopping experience I had at Richard's this week after being referred there by a friend.The store itself is gorgeous, and truly a thought-out and curated experience down to the last detail: fragrant fresh flowers, great music, and handsome decorations/displays... so many little things that weren't necessary but that made my time there a treat.The clothing was, of course, the real star of the show, and most items I looked at ranged from about $75 to $245; definitely reasonable. Honestly, Richard's fashion advice alone is worth the cost. I went in a complete rookie and he very patiently answered all of my questions and then some. He was extremely attentive, picking things out for me to look at and explaining why he chose them and how to wear them well. When I left with my pile of loot, he even wrote notes for how to get everything tailored.Overall, Richard's just doesn't seem like the kind of store that exists anymore - but thank God it does! He's earned another repeat customer for sure.

5.description: This shop is as good as it gets. My brother was looking for a vintage look for a wedding in 2 days. (gulp)I yelped to see what was out there, and I knew from the pictures of Richards shop this was the place. I was right! My brother is a tough, picky, thrifty guy. But as soon as Richard introduced himself I knew we were in the right place. He hand picks all the clothes in the shop and they are gorgeous! And completely reasonably priced! My brother tried on a few things that he actually liked. But Richard could tell my brother wasn't completely convinced. He was so great to say ready to try on a few more? And boom - he walks out in a navy striped three piece suit that looked like it was made for him! Richard then took the time and enjoyed picking out a tie and corner pocket to match! Then he suggested some shirts colors that would go with the suit and shoes (he didn't have a large selection at the moment) It was a first rate experience you never find these days! My brother was thrilled with his purchase and his experience! I suggest this shop to anyone. Whether looking for vintage or a modern style! Thanks Richard!!

6.description: You will find meticulous vintage men's at Richard's Fabulous Finds.  You can  count on it being pristine and on Richard to help put the right look together you for.    Everything here is unique and I guarantee you, you won't look like anyone else when you leave and you'll come back over and over again. Richard's merchandise turns constantly so if you see something you love you should snap it up. There are so few mainly men's vintage shops and this one is a real treasure.

7.description: Richard is The Man when it comes to men's vintage fashions and accessories. He's extremely knowledgeable about men's fashion through the decades and will help you put together a look that's classy and uniquely your own. His shop is a hidden gem in an unexpected neighborhood. Easy street parking and accessible by CTA bus.

8.description: I LOVE this place! I had made it a point to stop by his booth any time he was hocking his wares at the Vintage Garage in uptown. (Third Sunday of every month throughout the summer!) I'm not a crazy stylish guy at all, but I love vintage things... and for whatever reason, vintage clothes fit me better. And Richard is unbelievable at sizing up a person and pulling just the right things off the rack. Again, I'm so glad he has a shop now.

9.description: Richard has impeccable taste and style.  There is a vast selection of high end vintage menswear.  Pristine, clean shop.  Owner is gracious and can advise on what best fits body type, etc.  A MUST for the well-dressed man looking for vintage at excellent prices.

0.description: I almost hate to share that I found this place. But if you are looking to find your man some thing classic and everlasting ...this store is it. My eyes had to stop and take everything in. The stores layout is well done with hidden gems in ever nook and corner of the store. The pricing of the items are fantastic. Coats to die for and Blazers that are well well well made. Clearly Richard has an eye that is extremely tasteful! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this shop for the classic fashion forward wearer!!! I will be back - no doubt! Love this store.

4.description: Probably the place I have ever been fortunate enough to stumble upon accidentally. A few things in the window caught my eye and I couldnt resist a look inside. within 10 seconds I knew I had found my new favorite store. This store is packed with all things stately, gentlemanly, and handsome. Any man who likes to decorate his home or his person with classy vintage apparel will find himself at home here. And unlike many specialty stores, everything is priced between what is reasonable and what is an absolute bargain. Richard is very friendly, and will gladly give you the history behind anything in the store. He also helped me load the trunk I purchased into the car. I write this review almost reluctantly, as part of me wants to keep knowledge of this store to myself as to avoid unwanted competition for the gems which im sure will show up and be sold. But I could never keep quiet about such a place in good conscious. if ever there was a business i wanted to be successful, this one is it, and I hope to be a customer for the foreseeable future.

3.description: Yeah...came here once and the place was overridden with cockroaches. They are everywhere in here, it was appalling. There was a cockroach running all over the payphone in here. I saw at least 5 or 6 cockroaches on the walls and a few on the floor. I really don't like using the term "ghetto" as an adjective, but, this place is freakin' ghetto. This was a couple years ago, so maybe they cleaned up. Or, maybe not. I won't be going back to find out.

1.description: Its and OK place ... ONE THING I DO HATE IS THEY NEVER HAVE RANCH!!!! WTFFFF YOU SERVE WINGS BUFFALO WINGS AND DONT HAVE RANCH!!! ????? ....wheeww! anyways ... their food is affordable so far Ive tried their buffalo wings, hamburgers, polish sausage, Chicken sandwich, Philly cheese steak sandwich and their breaded mushrooms and cheese fries :D

2.description: The food here is good and affordable. It is where to get my salty south side fried chicken fix. :)

0.description: Went in for a fish sandwich meal today. Overall good - I forgot to request fresh fries

3.description: This place is a whimsical wonderland of toys and supplies and gadgets that will inspire projects you never knew you wanted to do, ways of fixing things with, say, a handful of popsicle sticks heretofore unimagined, and a newfound commitment to the importance of reuse. Practically, it's a one-stop spot for all things crafty. Politically, it's a chanllenge to our consumer-oriented society of buying new, of our attachment to ownership and profit. Super low prices on stuff that'll help us all dodge the cycle of production-to-store-to-landfill, and so much fun! So much glitter! So many weird fabrics!

1.description: Creative Reuse. But watch that first step (up and then down), they're doozies! Their mission is to accept your cast-off materials, either traditionally intended for artists or alternately that could inspire artistic intentions. If that latter condition puzzles you, they have a list of materials that they will accept (and stuff that they'd rather not get) at their Web site (thewasteshed.com ). Just click on the "donate" hypertext link.So whether you've got materials from a profession or a hobby in the arts or a craft, they may go well here. Just email or phone with your list and Eleanor will let you know.If you are in the arts or practice a craft, you owe it to yourself to visit the shop once in a while. Just browsing the shelves and containers may either help you find something that you're project needs or inspire you to start a project or explore a change in something in work. Like any place that relies on serendipitous contributions for stock, don't hesitate if you do find something that you like. It's unlikely that by the next time you come here, the same things will be around. So grab it when you find something that will work for you.

2.description: Definite go-to spot for high grade colored pencils, sharpie markers in a rainbow of colors, mid-sized cuts of fabric (totally a highlight for people working on costumes/smaller embroidery projects), glue, and tons of weird ephemera varying from the mundane-yet-totally useful to frivolous-and-fabulous. This certainly beats the hell out of Joann fabrics, is far less snooty than Dick Blick, and your total will be a fraction of the price of any dumb big box store, with the added plus of no cinnamon brooms and scented candles.

0.description: Must stop for your creative supplies!   Whatever your project there is something here for you - beading, sewing, crochet, knitting, print making, scrap booking, painting, rubber stamping and everything in between!  Fun place to head into to get the creative juices flowing.

58.description: Came here REALLY wanting to like this place. I was disappointed. The food was decent got the goat cheese flatbread which was really good but literally took 25-30 minutes to get.  The entrees were mediocre but priced good so that was fine. The ambience is kinda mixed. The tables and nautical theme was cool but I dont understand the tacky string blue lighting. It cheapens the place. The worst part was the service unfortunately. Our waitress had no idea what she was doing, she looked lost most of the time and never came to check on us. She was nice but didnt cut it. The drinks were also sub par. I was hoping to like it bc we need good bars and restaurants in the area. Hopefully they will improve over time. Thats all I can really say.

56.description: Great little bar the represents the rise of the neighborhood. I've walked pass this bar several times on my way home but didn't pay to much attention to it until yesterday. I didn't feel like cooking and where can I get a descent burger with fries for this price. best decision I ever made. They had 1/2 pound burgers an fries for $3.50 with the purchase of a drink. My burger was really tasty, well done and juicy, the fries were good as well. I'm a mixed drink type of person, and their menu's really focused on beer, With a little advice from the waitress I ordered and lemonade and vodka, and it was amazing, best part it only cost me $4.00.  Oh I almost forgot the patio area is adorable, its on the back. All in all this place is very nice and laid back, small, but the food along with the daily specials certainly make up for the small place.  I look forward to returning this weekend for their specials. An their selection of drinks are very reasonable.

29.description: Neighborhood place with World Class Service. Awesome Bartender, JOHN is the man. Great Food Deals. Have been there a few times, some I remember, and some..well....Looking for a place that's hospitable & truly appreciates your biz.. this is the spot!

42.description: As a resident in the area, you cannot go wrong with reasonably priced beverages, an owner that cares about the bar, and the neighborhood, a friendly staff and a patio. I have been here more times than i can count and every time it is very pleasant. I would recommend this place to anyone who would ask me for a local spot to relax and enjoy a great night. Probably going to have one of my engagement parties here.

23.description: Fun

47.description: This is a simple neighborhood bar. The back patio is nice in the summer. The beer is cheap. There are cheap food specials too, but from my experiences the food is really hit or miss. Lots of TVs for sports watching. The service is usually friendly, but I think they might have a bit of turnover, so I have been there on an off day too. I have gone a bunch since the place first opened since I live nearby. Go for the cheap beer and sports!

8.description: This wouldn't be a typical place that we'd visit, but seeing that we had a 40 minute wait at the nearby Rangoli restaurant, it was the closest place for us to grab a drink. It fulfilled our needs of having a place to sit and drink, keep warm, plus we could watch the latest games (that night it was basketball- Bulls vs Celtics).  We're grateful that it wasn't crowded and helped us pass the time while our table at Rangoli was getting ready.

31.description: Been here several times and the food has always been delicious. Great specials daily including drinks. So far tried skirt steak, chicken tenders(big pieces), awesome cold&crispy salads. PAULINA is very helpful and knowledgeable about beer ect.. Great food and very affordable prices!

34.description: Our "local" place. We walk over 2-3 times a month. We like the great food specials and staff. It's an easy place to catch a game or grab a couple beers.Summertime opens up the large back patio and that provides a different vibe and it is just as welcoming. The beer selection is small compared to the trendy beer bars but it is diverse enough to suit anyone. Not a destination spot per se but if you visit or live in within a mile definitely put it on your visit list and maybe you will adopt a new standby.

16.description: Preface: I don't live close, I'm in the burbs but find my way into the city to visit friends pretty often. A few of these friends live less than a block away from West on North. Due to the close proximity to where I usually crash on a couch/floor depending on the night, West on North is usually the place we end up later in the night or in the morning/afternoon for food and drinks.Out of all of the times I've been a patron, I've always been treated like a regular. The food has always surpassed my expectations, and we have always had a great time. I've heard from friends that it's family owned, so that might be why is service is great and doesn't feel like a sales pitch. I've seen other posts about it being empty sometimes, I hope that changes. Love this place.

13.description: Great dive but shitty service. It has a decent menu and a good beer selection. The food is good for a dive and they have great specials. The server messed up our order twice and ended up buying our food, which was appropriate at least, but very annoying. I won't be back but would recommend this dive to friends in the area.

11.description: Great neighborhood bar. Good bar food, specials every day- even on weekends. Not too loud and very clean and comfortable.

39.description: I finally checked this place out and they have good food and cheap drinks.  The service was great and we went early on a Saturday evening so there were only a few more customers.  We had BBQ wings and the battered fish sandwich and BBQ pulled pork sandwich-- it was good and affordable.  I would totally come back!

37.description: It almost throws me off how friendly the staff here is.  I go here a lot and even if I've never met the staff member before they treat me like a regular.  It's not the best food and drink selection in the world (honestly if it was a fancier selection they would probably have to charge a lot more), but its just good, cheap, easy-going, un-pretentious, warm and welcoming every time.  Patronize this bar.

0.description: Wow!!!! So awesome! Excellent service! Paulina is super friendly and awesome. She saw my boyfriend and I at a concert and remembered us which made me feel very special. Beyond the service the Mac and cheese is the bomb dot com. Add mushrooms be jalepenos. (Paulina recommended it). The portobello sandwich is also totally amazing, a lil messy but worth it. The patio is a fun place to hang out as well. Can't wait to come back and try more stuffAlso they do screenings of the walking dead and other shows / movies with free popcorn on the patio . So that's awesome. This place kicks ass.

38.description: So excited to have a neighborhood bar in walking/stumbling distance. We honestly go maybe once a week and whenever someone comes to visit we always take them there. Great food, great prices. I'm almost conflicted in telling people to go. I dont want the secret to get our how awesome it is, but I also would never want it to go out of business or raise prices! My husband and I can go here for dinner and drinks for $20. AMAHZING. Lovely outside area with a dark interior for whispering sweet nothings...or watching whatever game is on. We've tried: nachos, pizza (giardiniera and bacon!!), wings, sliders, fish and chips (at a bar?? yes and so good), guac, dynamite tots (da bomb), BLTA, grilled chicken sandwich (eh), buffalo chicken salad (wouldn't get again)Even having a kegerator at home, we still like to go out and West on North makes it worth it.

51.description: Amazing place! Great food and drinks and even better staff! A definite must go to place!

27.description: It really hurts me to give out 1-star because I live in the neighborhood and we need more bars, but here's why:1) The vibe in the bar can be completely destroyed by the ridiculously loud jukebox. 2) The bartender who seems to ALWAYS be working there now might be the most irritable/miserable one I've had in Chicago. She has served me at least 8 times now and she's always pissed off. Hey, it's not my fault you have to watch baseball all day. If you hate it so much, quit working there or else at-least pretend to smile. Don't get mad at me because I order a drink special for God's sake! And you're not getting anywhere close to a 25% tip when you're in a perpetual state-of-hate. 3) Food is pretty terrible. But its cheap, so you get what you pay for. But the food is terrible. 4. Kids, kids, kids. I understand the concept from the Owner's perspective, but its bad for business and for patrons. If I wanna drop F-bombs in a bar during a Bulls game, I shouldn't have to hold my tongue because there's a gaggle of 6 yr-olds running around the bar. I could get over items 1, 3, and 4. But that bartender is literally the worst. Give her some depression pills or something if you insist on keeping her on your main staff. This bar isn't hipster-chic, so you can't get away with the whole "we're so cool we don't wanna serve you" thing.

32.description: The ribs are fall off the bone delicious, coleslaw, not so much. The place has a nice mello vibe at night but the mixed drinks are severely watered down. That was very disappointing especially when you are looking for something to take the edge off.

54.description: West on North is the perfect neighborhood bar. The staff has a noticeable, and sincere interest in getting to know their customers. It's a great place to watch a game, without the over the top, seizure-inducing, Wrigleyville-style sports bar style. Joe (who runs the joint) was super generous in helping out our neighborhood softball team this summer, as were all the bartenders and wait staff. The fried pickles are money, but I think the steak salad is their best bang for buck dish.

48.description: "Yeah, there's this bar I go to that's West of Western..."  At that point, people tend to look at me with a "Hell no!" on their face.  I've lived in Humboldt Park for several years and if I wanted a decent bar to go to, I had to go to Ukrainian Village or East of Western.  Ukie Village isn't bad, but it's not my neighborhood.  When I first noticed this place open, it seemed like it would be just another seedy Humboldt Park bar.  Finally, I went in and found out...it's not seedy?!?! Technically, it's a restaurant with a bar.  Here are some of the details:Environment:* It's clean and open.  * Great patio that also serves as a great place for private parties.  It's comfortable. * I dig the fireplace and lounge chairs in the front.  * The crowd is blended and never had a problem with anyone.  Most of the people that go here are regulars or live in the area.  * Yes, you can bring kids in.  However, I don't recommend it later in the night. * Like sports? There are enough TVs to catch a game at just about any time. The Food: * Daily specials and full menu.  Remember, it's not just a bar.  You could go each day and have something new if you wanted.  * Sunday has become my Wings and Beer night at West on North.  Half off wings Sun/Mon.* The ribs are pretty good.  I'm from KY and know good barbeque when I taste it.  It's close, but much better than what I've had from other so called BBQ shops.  * They do have several options for salads.  I've had the Caesar Salad a few times and it's good. I'm trying to eat more greens and veggies.  You will find these options on the menu.  The Staff: * I've only met a few, but they have a great staff.  I've met Joe, the owner, a few times and he comes out to mingle with everyone.  His goal: make sure you are having a good time and enjoying the food.  John, Scott, Liz and Arwa are awesome.  If you ever go in and you hear someone yelling how bad the service is and how slow the server is, that's probably me.  However, slow and terrible service is far from the truth.  Arwa is actually quite prompt and keeps up with the banter as I'm told I'm the worst customer ever.  I probably am! I'm glad to see West on North in my neighborhood and have always enjoyed going there.  Good food, great staff, great location.  What else could you ask for?

44.description: Officially the new hood bar. Drinks are cheap ($1.50 for a can-o-Hamm's). Service is good. Crowd likes sports and chillin'. In a few words, my kind of place. The food is pretty solid and they have great specials. Bonus? Sweet outdoor patio in the back. As Lloyd Christmas once said,"I like it a lot."

24.description: This is a bright spot in food and drink on a stretch of North Ave. that has nothing else happening (between Western and California).  My husband and I decided to go here for brunch one morning because we felt like going out and wanted to walk somewhere in the neighborhood.  Enter: West on North.  I actually had no idea this place existed even though I passed it every day on my way to work for at least nine months.  It's so inconspicuous that it's hard to notice if you pass by in a car or on the bus.  This is a solid neighborhood spot, though, with cheap drinks and cheap food.  They serve standard bar fare, so don't expect much in terms of gourmet cuisine, but it's tasty and does the job to satisfy hunger.  Breakfast was standard, nothing fancy, but everything was tasty.  On a Sunday morning, this place was EMPTY so there was no issue grabbing a spot at the bar and having the bartender's full attention.  I am hankering to come back on another night to sample other food and partake in their drink specials (beer is so cheap here).  There's trivia on Tuesday nights, so maybe I'll stop by one night in the future to check it out.  All in all, great neighborhood spot for a stretch of North (and a part of Humboldt) that doesn't have anything else going on but a Subway and an auto parts store.

7.description: I love that there is always a drink special of some sort and Paulina is such a delight. Good food and awesome people. I've had a great experience on each visit.

49.description: Love this place, great neighborhood vibe. Awesome specials! The comfort food.... ugh it is not good that I live 2 blocks from here. Tater tots with cheese and chili and sour cream and bacon (if you ask). Bells Two Hearted on tap, 'nuf said.

40.description: Place was recommended to me by a local florist couple. And I'm very happy they did. Pros: Drinks are cheap; the food is great (except for the Caesar salad); friendly, dive bar type of, everybody knows everybody or is willing to mingle with anybody type of atmosphere; and the servers are phenomenal...I've had the same guy and he remembers me and my girl and calls us his favorite couple. Cons: If a game is on the TVs are on mute and the jukebox is going. Closed Captioning just doesn't kick when you're favorite team is playing.

53.description: Absolutely perfect neighbourhood bar. Great food specials. Cheap drinks and wonderful beer selection. They have all the football games on Sunday. Bartenders are friendly and they remember you and what you drink. Love the decor.I had several of their specials. Burger is absolutely amazing, I think it's $3.50 on Wed (huge, with fries). Pizza, $4 on Tue, is way too big for one and it has wonderful think crust. I recommend spinach/goat cheese. Quesadillas are also delicious. Can't go wrong with anything you order. And yes, they have an amazing outdoor patio in the back. The only weird thing - who designed the ladies restrooms?

30.description: This neighborhood place is great! Really friendly staff. Great atmosphere and a plethora of daily specials. Oh, and trivia on Tuesdays with great prizes.I had their steak salad and it was delicious. Steak was well cooked and the veggies were fresh.Highly recommended local bar. Great patio, and not as busy as some other bars in the area. I'll be back many more times to come!

46.description: So nice to finally have a decent bar/grill in out neighborhood.  Very nice interior, lots of TVs, great music and a nice patio.  The staff is very nice and the food is good.  What else do you expect from the people who started Cleo's?

1.description: Love this place. Great staff and food. Good beer selection. From the first time I came in it felt like "Cheers" a olace where everyone know everyone. Tuesday nights are trivia and John the host is at his best. They also gave a patio and do movies in the summer. West friends are best friends!!!

55.description: I was thrilled to find a decent bar, with good food, west of Western.  This place has a good vibe and a nice outdoor patio that you wouldn't know existed if you just walked by.  Food is good and surprisingly cheap for the city!  Brunch, lunch, dinner....all good.  The staff makes you feel comfortable, and despite the fact that some people get scared of going "west of Western", I always feel safe here.  It's on busy North Ave., directly next to a bus stop, and surrounded by other businesses and residences.  Also, I've never seen it crowded.  Good if you want a table, but also makes me nervous because customers = a lasting business.  I hope this place sticks around!

9.description: Yeah, it's about a-ok.  We went a bunch of times in our quest to find a decent place with decent food and beverages moderately near home but this place never clicked with us.  Service was passable, the food not so much at all, and the beverages, they're fine enough.  Things were reasonably priced which lured us back but, we started to feel like we were getting what we were paying for with the food, if you catch my drift.The interior reminds me of strip mall bars in Indiana (it's not a diss, they just aren't uber fancy is all with the mirrors and colored lights and vinyl and slight mullet-y feel).  There are kids around, sometimes past 10 pm even.  Kiiindaaa weird.  The girl's potty situation is the strangest I've ever seen.  One stall but also one toilet in the middle of the room, out in the open, next to the enclosed stall.  So totally odd.Anyway, what really sank this place for us was another paper ticket incident.  The bartender jacked up our tab one night including passing off a couple of the regulars' beverages onto us and since it's all hand written with just tick marks, what can you do?  Someone we were chatting with at a later date said the same happened to him in the past.Soooo, will we be back?  Eh, not so sure.  I've suggested it to the husband a few times and he crinkled his nose.

26.description: Great neighborhood bar! Hamm's cans are $1.50! Fun staff. Very good simple bar food and good specials. Glad it's near by!

25.description: This is my laundry bar!

12.description: This is a quaint little neighborhood bar.  Didn't try the food, but a lot of people were eating leading me to believe it was at least decent.  Dark atmosphere but the staff is delightfully friendly with reasonable prices.  Would  definitely check this place out again!

59.description: What a clean looking bar...I walked in 2/8 about 9:30 and this place is a small bar but cute and sparkly clean....the floors were gleaming....me and Jenise R.  said it a few times on how nice and clean this place was.....We opted for the $3.50 burger special and Daisy cutters on draft...the burgers are HUGE as well as the fries....LARGE PORTIONS very tasty.....my only gripe is I forgot to order my burger well done....The bartender server was a doll....so pretty super nice!there's a lot of tvs and juke box!Welcome to the neighborhood!

21.description: This wouldn't be a typical place that we'd visit, but seeing that we had a 40 minute wait at the nearby Rangoli restaurant, it was the closest place for us to grab a drink. It fulfilled our needs of having a place to sit and drink, keep warm, plus we could watch the latest games (that night it was basketball- Bulls vs Celtics).  We're grateful that it wasn't crowded and helped us pass the time while our table at Rangoli was getting ready.

17.description: This neighborhood place is great! Really friendly staff. Great atmosphere and a plethora of daily specials. Oh, and trivia on Tuesdays with great prizes.I had their steak salad and it was delicious. Steak was well cooked and the veggies were fresh.Highly recommended local bar. Great patio, and not as busy as some other bars in the area. I'll be back many more times to come!

10.description: So the food is so yummy and the male bartender is the booommmmm but if he isn't there they suck lol i repeat if there isnt a guy bartending leave the female bartenders suck and thats me being nice it really seems like they do not like if pretty girls come around but Sunday he's there so go then and tip him good people he's a Rockstar fyi he is the only guy bartender. I give him 5 stars!!!

5.description: Awesome bar food. Relaxed atmosphere. So much cheese on their menu it makes me happy. New neighborhood go to.

3.description: Great neighborhood bar. Cheap beers, tater tots, and even decent pizza on a weekly special. I would also check out their weekly trivia nigh for a good time outside of the normal pub trivia.

35.description: I went here for the first time last night. Decent divey bar- works for me, I'm not too picky. The service was good, the drinks were cheap ($35 for a night of drinking for three of us?!?), the karaoke was fun, easy street parking- I'd go again!The main reason that I'm writing this review is to comment on the women's restroom. I walked in and burst out laughing. It's so bizarre- there's one toilet in a stall, and one outside of the stall next to the sink. So, basically, if I wanted to utilize the facilities while someone was in the stall, they'd be trapped in there until I was done. Very strange, but amusing at the same time.

19.description: To begin, one star seems like I am being extremely generous. I have been to this place one before; there was good service, our waitress even took a shot with us. Excellent. On my most recent visit, I experienced a complete atrocity. I planned a birthday gathering, the woman who helped explain the wristband options was very polite and helpful. It seemed like everything would go smoothly. I arrive at 10:15pm, I immediately notice the bartender being hostile to my group of 3 male friends. 2 of those friends are business owners and I'm immediately embarrassed at how they have been treated. She is very obviously disinterested.  One more small group of female friends arrive, one friend orders a drink (not a wristband) she is very clearly upset by this and responds in a very rude tone that she will grab that drink. I understand I overestimated how many people would actually purchase a wristband, it is still early and still not an excuse for the behavior. We brush this off, maybe she's having a bad day. Maybe she will cheer up when she sees I am bringing in a large crowd, which means a lot of customers, a lot of tabs open. It's barely 11:15pm now. While sitting at the table, my friends and I overhear the bartender saying "THEY ONLY GOT 2 WRISTBANDS" to a fellow waitress. Again, her tone isn't pleasant. It's not even midnight, more than half of my party is still on its way. Again, we ignore this. I move up to the front to mingle with my friends at the bar when I hear 3 women say "They need to go"...I look back to see the women are telling this to the bartender, (they're obviously friends). She is referring to my 4 friends whom are sitting down, talking amongst themselves. The bartender agrees to do something about it and walks away; the women notice I've overheard their conversation and give me very unpleasant looks. I'm instantly very self aware and realize that neither myself or my friends are welcome at this establishment. I don't know if we were being discriminated or if there was just something they didn't like about us. I am in complete disbelief and confusion as to why we are being treated this way. It was very early so I can vouch my entire party (including myself) was sober, non-disruptive and non-confrontational. Once those looks were done, I go table to table and kindly ask my friends to close out their tabs. They're completely unaware of anything, but agree to leave at my request. This is done peacefully.Once we relocate I notice 2 of my friends are missing, turns out they went home after being asked to leave by the bartender. No explanation. Her review is also somewhere below. That's a terrible story that collaborated with what I was feeling and witnessing. My entire party vacated by no later than 11:30pm and spent our money elsewhere. My night wasn't ruined, thankfully. But this experience is so cringe worthy and I'm embarrassed to even repeat it out loud. Worst experience, easily. I hear great things about the owner himself, if you're reading this, I really hope the bartender is disciplined. The night I speak of was Saturday 12/6. I live very, very close and I wish this could've been a regular place for me. Now I just wish I didn't have to walk the same block to be reminded of this awful experience. I am the kind of person who builds a rapport with my bartenders and travel far if I must because I understand they make the experience that much better. Bartenders are the very core of this particular business, they are the face of your company. We all have bad days and even if you had the worst of days, you shouldn't belittle someone who is investing in your paycheck.

28.description: I love that there is always a drink special of some sort and Paulina is such a delight. Good food and awesome people. I've had a great experience on each visit.

45.description: You cannot beat half off chicken wings on Sunday and Monday with one drink purchase. Otherwise it's a typical neighborhood bar. As long as you are not expecting exotic food or craft beer or sophisticated atmosphere , you will not be disappointed.

33.description: Awesome neighborhood bar -- a good mix of young and not so young.  A very welcoming, unassuming place.  Lots of friendly folks.  I'm so glad they are here.

43.description: Attended a fundraiser on the back patio & everyone loved the space and outdoor TV.Staff was incredibly attentive about drink orders, refreshing food & cleaning up. Definitely go back again w/ or w/o private party.

2.description: This is my favorite place to get wings! But not just for the wings, I like to go there for their pizza, burgers, fish fri Friday and the people are petty cool there too!

18.description: This is my laundry bar!

41.description: Mac and cheese has been addressed; all the food here is great and very reasonably priced. Staff is polite and attentive. I still hate the decor...

52.description: The drink prices were good. Magic #9 on tap was perfect. The bloody mary was weak, and the mix was thin and rather sweet. Our server was nice, but she got busy and then wasn't able to be very attentive. She recommended the steak sandwich. Not sure if it was just an off night, but I'm sad to say it was almost inedible. It tasted like it was marinated in a watered-down bottled steak sauce. It was so weird tasting, I was afraid the meat was bad. The tater tots were dry, hard, and discolored (pale, almost white in spots) on the outside. I think they were freezer burned. When the server came to collect my plate and saw that I'd eaten only a few bites of my sandwich and almost none of the tots, she asked if I wanted it boxed up. When I declined, she didn't ask if the sandwich was okay. Hm. My friend ordered the fish 'n' chips, which was fine. We also had the cheese balls for an appetizer. These were fine, but the goat cheese in them seemed out of place with the other ingredients. The sweet & sour sauce that came with them improved the flavor greatly. I wouldn't order them again. Overall I wasn't impressed by the food or the atmosphere. The location is great for Humboldt Park residents, though, and they do have a patio. I'd probably come back for drinks  to watch a game or to sit outside when the weather is nice.

50.description: This is a solid bar in the neighborhood.  The staff is always very friendly and they have great food specials.  Check out the back patio, it's beautiful.

4.description: This is a bright spot in food and drink on a stretch of North Ave. that has nothing else happening (between Western and California).  My husband and I decided to go here for brunch one morning because we felt like going out and wanted to walk somewhere in the neighborhood.  Enter: West on North.  I actually had no idea this place existed even though I passed it every day on my way to work for at least nine months.  It's so inconspicuous that it's hard to notice if you pass by in a car or on the bus.  This is a solid neighborhood spot, though, with cheap drinks and cheap food.  They serve standard bar fare, so don't expect much in terms of gourmet cuisine, but it's tasty and does the job to satisfy hunger.  Breakfast was standard, nothing fancy, but everything was tasty.  On a Sunday morning, this place was EMPTY so there was no issue grabbing a spot at the bar and having the bartender's full attention.  I am hankering to come back on another night to sample other food and partake in their drink specials (beer is so cheap here).  There's trivia on Tuesday nights, so maybe I'll stop by one night in the future to check it out.  All in all, great neighborhood spot for a stretch of North (and a part of Humboldt) that doesn't have anything else going on but a Subway and an auto parts store.

6.description: Great place to grab a beer, they always have a special on tap. I'm impressed with the tasty bar food too and the outdoor area in back. Highly recommended!

22.description: They have an extensive menu - and everything I've tried so far is great. 50 cent wings on Sundays and Monday's (I am a chicken wing fanatic and West on North has some of the best wings I've had in the city). Not to mention other food specials for every day of the week. Their drinks are cheap! It can get crowded sometimes when they play hockey or football, but it isn't ever claustrophobic. And the staff is extremely friendly! This is my favorite neighborhood bar, check it out of you live or are in the area! P.S. They have an awesome patio out back.

15.description: Came here last night after moving a couch across town-I live nearby and it was easy. Inside it basically looks like your average dive bar, which I can't complain about. I love a good dive. They also had pretty cheap drinks and cheap food. $2 Can of Hamms! Don't come here and expect gastropub or even diner quality food. But do come here when you're hungry, in the neighborhood, and just want some good fried food. Because if it exists, they fry it here. I had onion rings, chicken fingers, tots, fries, and a club sandwich. Nothing was spectacular or memorable, but it was still good.

57.description: Hey now, holy cow!  I wouldnt call it a pub but bar is fine.  Excellent outdoor area and EXCEPTIONALLY clean.  They have 3 different ciders and some damn decent beer specials.  My friend and I split the skirt steak w roasted veggies, hummus and cheese balls.  The cheese balls are dynamite as well was the rest of the food.  For a small off the charts type of place I was surprised to see that all of the food was made/prepared in house, ie no frozen bar grub.  The food was fresh and clean and Scott was damn cool as the server.  A friend of mine also went there the prior week and bragged about the ribs and pizza.  Best of all on top of quality the prices were VERY reasonable, almost insane!

20.description: yep. cold as f@@k. called to order food ahead of time. stood at bar for 10 plus minutes. people who arrived & sat down after  me were served beer & WAITED ON at the bar while i stood there...  buy burger then tip. thats all i wanted. then go home.  after waitress walked past me for 5th time, i walked over & said 'yr terrible' then started out.well of course thats an invite to insult me, & treat me like crap.... damn, had some $ wanted to spend it there, yknow get some food. odd concept? called handlebar, order was ready in same time as i stood there while waitress 'visited' with folks. insulted on my way out. mooned the damn crowd & oh yeh, nice she 'has a posse...'ok beat me up for bad service, because thats how you get repeat customers. BOTTOM LINE STOOD THERE & WATCHED  5+ PEOPLE SERVED, I STODD THERE & WAS INVISIBLE. SO YEH, MR OLD CLEOS OWNER, YR PLACE BLOWS. thanks handlebar. friendly, attentive & oh yeh no threat of 'posse'yep kicked yer damn door. u suck ms waitress. not going back. sorry i wanted to buy some food from u.thanks for the insults. nice touch

36.description: I want to love everything about West on North.  I live within walking distance, which is a total plus in the summer because the patio is a really awesome spot ...Pros: rib night - muy excellente; beer selection - super duper; BLT&A - delicious - and TOTS ... TOTS ... did I say TOTS?  The menu is simple, straightforward, and I haven't had a bad meal or beer here.So what are the drawbacks?  It is always super loud.  I have issues with background noise, granted, but I can never EVER hear the waitress.  I'm starting to think about investing in one those ear horn things or, at the ripe young age of 32 - a hearing aid.  Loud groups of patrons frequently add to the noise generated by the very loud jukebox ... Please please please turn it down.Kids.  I noticed that someone else brought this up recently.  I've seen a couple in there enough times that they have to be the owners/financiers ... they always have their kids with them.  It seems that they encourage their other parent friends to come in and drag their kiddos along.  I'm not necessarily opposed to kids being in a bar through dinner time, but when it seems like I'm dining at an out-of-control daycare - there's just a little something wrong with that.The last two Thursdays, we've been in for the rib special - and kids - tons of them - and not controlled kids in a stroller or just out for a walk with their parents.  These are kids who are sitting at their own booths throughout the establishment, running back and forth, and generally having an "unobserved" time.  Before our meal is done, we're both tense and feel like we need to escape.  Our check would be a lot higher if we felt comfortable sticking around.Maybe I need to go on a different day - but when I want to have a brew and unwind after a long day at my own job, I don't want to hang out with or around unruly kids :(

14.description: They have an extensive menu - and everything I've tried so far is great. 50 cent wings on Sundays and Monday's (I am a chicken wing fanatic and West on North has some of the best wings I've had in the city). Not to mention other food specials for every day of the week. Their drinks are cheap! It can get crowded sometimes when they play hockey or football, but it isn't ever claustrophobic. And the staff is extremely friendly! This is my favorite neighborhood bar, check it out of you live or are in the area! P.S. They have an awesome patio out back.

3.description: Just went to Printlab to have an 8x10 enlargement made.  The result is beautiful and the employees who I talked to were friendly.  Great place!

1.description: The owner wrote: " Unfortunately, in every business, communication problems can happen.In our defense, the B&W film we processed, was, and still it is in pristine condition along with its scans.The scratches the client is referring to were all in the Color Film, processed by another Lab."Blaming communications problems on your abysmal work is as unprofessional as the work you did.If the color film was scratched by the other lab, why didn't you inform me?  Please tell me the name of the other lab so I can run your allegation that they scratched my negatives by them.I just discovered that you scanned the negatives BACKWARDS, so you screwed that up too.Since you did the scanning, not the other lab, what you are saying is that the color lab scratched my film, and then you scanned the negatives in reverse.  Strikes me as extremely unlikely.  Unless you can make a plausible case how that could have happened, my negatives were definitely scratched by you.Clearly, instead of taking responsibility for destroying my negatives and all the other things you screwed up, you falsely blame others.All in all, you couldn't be more unprofessional.

2.description: I've been working on this project for 160 days in a row and it was time for my first print and I was so nervous about it which is ridiculous, isn't it? But this really means a lot to me. (massive understatement) Here's how anxious I was this very day: I could not figure out how to open their door. (Push 04, wait for them to answer, push the left door very hard, walk in and go up to the third floor where a calm and smiling face awaits). Street parking no sweat. Very pleased with my print. And seriously-the service was way above and beyond. Thank you Geneva!

5.description: If you are looking for a printer who will care about your prints, get to know you, spend time to make you happy, and work with you on rush orders, this is your printer.  I had a large-scale fine art print that needed to be made with relatively quick turnaround.  Since these prints ARE my artwork, I want to be able to have confidence in the printer who is helping me make them.  I had tried to go to Gamma Imaging first, but they were a huge let down (see story below).    So I called Print Labs and asked if they could meet with me to run a proof on short notice.  They said that was no problem.  As soon as I got to Print Labs, I knew I was in capable hands.  I worked with J.R. who was extremely knowledgeable.  He set up my image on the computer and looked over it very carefully with me.  We spotted a few little areas of distortion/noise and he showed me how to fix it.  Then, as I waited, he printed a to-scale strip proof.  We looked over it together, made a few changes, then he printed the final piece WHILE I WAITED!  He was SUPER nice, VERY helpful, and the quality was excellent (their office is also beautiful and very welcoming).  They were less expensive than Gamma (by almost $100).  I won't go anywhere else.  (My experience with Gamma:  I went to Gamma Imaging in Chicago first to get the image printed.  I called ahead and asked if I could look over my print with someone and see a proof done all in one day, since I was going to drive in (over two hours) to get this print made.  They said that would be fine.  After I got there, they kept trying to charge me for little things.  For example, they told me I wanted a giclee print made instead of an inkjet print made.  When I asked the difference, they said that with the giclee I get access to the printing technician and they print a proof for me for the image.  This is of course, more expensive than an inkjet print, and in addition to the higher cost per inch, you also have to pay for the proof which is between $65 and $85.  When I asked more questions, the guy told me that the giclee was printed with the same printer and inks as the inkjet, so what you are really paying for is the privileged of paying for a proof.  What?!?  On top of all of that, when I asked how long the proof would take to print, the guy said he couldn't print a proof for me while I was there, although I had driven all the way in and they had told me they could over the phone.  In addition, they treated me like an idiot and could have cared less about me or my artwork.)

6.description: these days, there are a million places offering digital printing services.  printlab stands alone among them.  here, you'll find actual artists/master crafstmen who will realize your vision. this is where you go if you want the highest quality prints available. it's where the pros go.  the best part is that they will give you the same level of service as they give to dennis manarchy! it is rare to find a commercial business that offers such artistry and expertise combined with such exceptional personal service.

7.description: The Print Lab is the most unique photo lab in town. I love this place. They offer great customer service and a high quality product. It would be great if we all had darkrooms big enough to make 30 or 40 inch prints, but do not fret, the Print Lab is a can-do place. They make have resources to make huge silver prints. And they are definitely the place to bring any special photo project. They offer a lot of unique services you just won't get anywhere else. Drew, J.R., and the rest are your guys!

0.description: I have been wanting a replacement for Gamma, which I used a bunch  in days of yore, but am sick of their inconvenience (in particular), often snooty attitude, and too-orange envelopes.I'm very happy with my prints and the experience at Printlab.  Parking is easy; the building is an old warehouse -- you have to ring the buzzer and go in. They were exceedingly friendly and helpful.  You'll need to make some decisions on paper and borders and etc. -- the website doesn't have all the info, and is a bit cloudy on what exactly you need to decide -- there are so many options -- the staff showed me a few prints on assorted papers, and made some suggestions on which would compliment my images.  If you have notions of particular papers or qualities they can help you -- it would be useful to have a binder handy that shows some of the options.Note I just got digital prints.  They also work with film (!) so I'm tempted to bust out my awesome old cameras and see how it goes..My prints look really really good.  I haven't gotten the same prints done elsewhere for comparison, but suffice to say they look great.Pricing seems competitive for similar quality prints. They are obviously expensive compared to crappy prints (Target, etc) -- but these are gorgeous, full-service archival prints.

4.description: It took me almost a decade to walk into Print Lab, and I wish I had done it sooner. The owner JR always listens to your needs and budget. It's a simple balance, but not all businesses understand this balance between needs and budget. I may have an idea of how I want something printed, but JR always confirms the best economical way to do it. In addition JR is mindful of schedules that we often don't have control over. I was in a time crunch with a last minute offer for a show & JR went out of his way to meet me and make sure the tests were ready, in order to make the printing schedule. I'm happy to say that his prints have now made it into two museums, and a private collection. Thank you JR for being helpful & mindful of the small independent artists!

1.description: Had a groupon so I went to redeem it. First issue Customer Service: I placed two orders for two people and yes I was alone. Groupon stated two person but what difference does it make if I order two entrees, that created a problem they wouldn't accept my groupon when the bill came. Second the steak meal looked Nothing like the picture, it wasn't even steak it was thinly sliced beef. Third :Place is extremely small, really not a lot of business so try being receptive to the few customers you get. Have one more groupon then I'll never go back! Still have to eat my sandwich which is suppose to be their speciality!

2.description: After many years about hearing about it I finally had the chance to try a Jibaritos Plantain Sandwich from here and I must say I was pleasantly surprised.I'm not gonna say it was the greatest thing I've ever tried but it sure was damn interesting. I guess I was just so used to common Mexican burritos that this Puerto Rican style really threw me off.I'm pretty most people will go either one way or the other on this but still it's something you gotta try.

0.description: Food: I had the steak jibarito and it was to die for. The plantains were cooked perfectly and it was filled with steak, sour cream, melted cheese, lettuce, tomato and a lot of garlic. The rice was the best Puerto Rican rice I have ever had.  Definitely the best Puerto Rican food in the city! The flan was amazing! Can't describe how good it was.Negatives:-The tablecloths were all FILTHY!  The table was even dirty under the plastic topper.-If you are using a groupon and your leftover amount is under 10$ , which it usually is, you have to pay the reminder in cash. We didn't have cash on us and the waitress wanted us to walk a block away to the ATM because we were $7 over! Luckily, the manager let us charge it anyway,Great food but they really need to clean up the place.

3.description: After leaving Grandma J's (see review there) we went to La Quebrada for breakfast, the food was as said below, authentic Mexican and good !  They served us extra tortillas and we took the extras home, sooo good.  Thanx La Quebrada for taking such good care of us !  Again the Cecina was excellant !

1.description: Food look good in the pictures on the wallServices is friendly but slowI asked lime 3 times to get waterI order chilaquiles there OKChips and salsa are good salsa hot hot spicy see you next time to try the seafood

2.description: I always place my order over the phone and every time they got it wrong!!!
