The worst thing is that if u call to complain the rude waitress start swearing and complaining in Spanish with someone else, the last time I ordered was the Huevos rancheros and I guess the food was too hot when they put it on the container that when I took the plate out of the plastic all the food fell underneath, so I called to let them know and the rude waitress had the guts to tell me it was my fault!!! YES my fault! I went there for my money back and she told me not to ever placed an order again on the phone again with them!!  I told her not to worry I will never placed an order again at all with them!!! Wish there was a none star option.

5.description: Very good food.  Very nice service.  Very clean space.  All around, La Quebrada is a great little place.Save the junkie who twice hit up the people dining at each table during the time that I spent there (no one gave him any money, thank God; I gave him a taco -- you can't shoot up a taco), my meal at La Quebrada was great.

6.description: I stumbled in here one day, starving after a long thrifting session.I was surprised by the excellent, fresh hot salsa. I was even more surprised by the handmade tortillas, and succulent, non-greasy cecina (which I had never had before and now love).I don't speak Spanish so there was some confusion and they brought me a whole dinner plate of cecina tacos, but they took it back and gave me the one taco I ordered. (I was less pleased with my other taco, a shrimp taco).  I was truly regretting this by the end - the cecina tacos were so good I wanted more!  For this reason alone (I still feel a bit bad) I will be going back soon to order the dinner plate.This place is a bit out of the way but it's so worth a visit.  Nothing compares.  I've since been disappointed by cecina elsewhere.

7.description: On a slow Monday night Seth and I headed to La Quebrada 3, a restaurant I had heard about for a long time but had never visited. There are 8 La Quebradas around Chicago, each offering something slightly different - Mariachis at one, more diner style at another. The restaurant was started by a serial entrepreneur originally from Mexico. The food is delicious, or so I had heard. After a short drive we found parking in the lot next to the restaurant, and were greeted by a young woman who was uncomfortably bi-lingual. The menu, fortunately for me, was in both Spanish and English, although I ordered in Spanish and our servers spoke to us mostly in Spanish, using English only when we looked at them confused when they spoke too fast.There's the usual breakfast items, Mexican restaurant items, etc that are anything but usual. Flavors are bright, forward, and delicious. Our salsa was one of the best I've had in a long time. And the dishes we ordered - variants of pounded chicken breast with toppings -- were incredible. The tortillas were also delicious and tasted home made. Our bill for two, gorging on enormous dishes of chicken, beans, and rice was $25. It is BYO, but both of us were happy with non-alcoholic beverages.Not too many anglos dine here...but if you do go, it is well worth the trip.And check this out for the menu: laquebrada.net/Quebrada%…

8.description: On a cold December evening we randomly stumbled upon this place while waiting for my wife's battery to be charged at the nearest Autozone.  The atmosphere seemed drab but the staff was all smiles.  The service was intelligent and attentive.  The food however, was very very delicious.  Our order was about as simple as it gets - just some tacos and a few sides - but something about them warmed up our bodies and our souls.  Every bite tasted uber-fresh and tasty.  We weren't choking on salt and lard.  The fresh herbs in the tacos made a huge difference.  The cecina was lean, succulent and tender (not leathery or fatty), and flavorful.  The marinated pork was warm-spicy and almost crunchy with bbq goodness.  Of course fresh banana-chocolate licuados, carrot juice and wonderful warm roasted salsa added to the overall surprise and delight we felt eating here.  I told my wife when we were driving around looking for food, "I just want to find a taqueria."  This certainly was the tastiest, most enjoyable 'taqueria' I've ever eaten at.

0.description: Having lived in the Humboldt Park for sometime, I'd have to say this is one true authentic Mexican restaurants in the area. I love "La Quebrada" for multiple reasons:   Let me state again the fact on how authentic this restaurant is. Being and having a Mexican background I can assure you this fact.  There aren't many places in the Chicago area which offer handmade pressed tortillas, and you can have them here. Their tortillas taste and are as great as their food. I tend to switch the kind of dishes I order every time I'm here, although I always seem to go back to the " cecina albañil". This dish comes with- cecina, which is the type of steak, much thinner but has a great flavor, they add salsa albañil and it's divine- perhaps on the spicier side for some.  I myself love a kick to my food.  But if you're not into spicy type of dishes they can always add your salsas on the side for your own taste. Restaurant wise they're very clean which is primary to a good restaurant.  Food and service is great. I have been a customer for over 6 years and always keep coming back.

4.description: Oh man, so good.  First time here.  Wow, large portions much bigger than expected.  Honestly the nachos plate, or any of the combination plates is well enough for two people.  You will get filled up.  Tasty too.  But know what to expect and you should be happy.  Good fried norteno type food.  We got an order of nachos, a combinacion azteca, and a combinacion campesina.  OH MAN, the Campesina was by far my favorite.  oh man, so tasty, good meats, and sides of rice and beans.  MAN!  I know if i went to a place that I normally do in my neighborhood, it'd cost nearly twice as much for what i got.  We had to take most of the food home, honestly we didn't expect how much it was.  Still tastes good a few days later.  We'll drop by whenever we're in the neighborhood.

0.description: So I stop there now Prices are reasonable $$ they had allSoapCan foodDetergentFramesToysParty stuff etc etc etc Chlotes for kids and adults Home decor.mi fav part is the clearance stuff for ChristmasI spent less than $2  in table chlote ornaments & Garland and this store is clean and organized

58.description: *$5 for Hamms and a shot of whiskey.*Free pool*Fun old school jukebox*Dog friendly*Free to bring in your own food  Corner bar, ftw!

56.description: Oh Archie's how i love thee, let me count the ways:1. You give me free Cheese puffs. Thanks!2. You are located down the street from two of my friends so it's always nice to grab a quick drink. 3. Your Hamm's beer is cheap.4. My dad and my grandpa have been coming here since forever as they used to live in the neighborhood and you know what? I bet you haven't changed a bit. 5. You don't try too hard to get yourself out there. You're a corner bar on a quiet street that's been there since before any of the hipsters that frequent you were born. You let the people come to you. I like that.6. I always get to meet interesting people when I visit you. Yay!7. The tamale guy comes by. Holy crap, maybe I should be giving you 5 stars instead. 8. You're a dive bar, and that's ok with me, honey. I can't wait to see you again. XOXOXO

29.description: Luv this spot!! One of the best dive bar spots in Chicago. Kat is awesome. Please support her business. The beer selection is decent depending on what you like to drink. The specials they have are usually pretty good. The crowds are usually chill with a mixture of all types depending on when you go. Remember CASH ONLY fools!!

42.description: At one point today, after my sixth or seventh piece of fried chicken (brought from outside), and a couple rounds of "Pork and Beam" (a shot of Jim Beam with a 12 oz. chaser of Hamm's), I realized that Archie's has not only been fully discovered, but almost over run.Partially my fault for inviting some friends and bringing a bunch of fried chicken, and therefore enticing the entire neighborhood to come in for a better whiff of that glorious smell.Even with massive numbers and only one bartender working for much of that time, all was smooth (for the patrons anyway).Perhaps it is the Zabrowka (with or without the apple juice chaser)?Perhaps it is knowing that there will be $2.00 Hamm's-a-plenty when your time to order comes?Perhaps a special craft beer special for $3.00 (tonight's was Bell's "Snow Day")?Perhaps it is the free pool table?Perhaps it is knowing that the people who work here don't even mind that my friends and I just stunk up their bar with the glorious smell of fried chicken, and are probably used to this thing considering outside food is allowed?Perhaps it is that strange guy holding a Pomeranian named "Kippy" under his arm?Perhaps it is because Archie's is the quintessential neighborhood bar?Tip: they are licensed as Packaged Goods, so be sure to pick up your 6-pack of Hamm's to go for $6.00.  I'm not even sure if the local liquor store sells it that cheap.

23.description: I enjoyed the drinks. Folk were friendly and there were lots of nice dogs hanging about.

47.description: Archie's is your classic divebar and tavern. I was transported back to Up North Wisconsin, der hey, to those old Taverns my grandparents took me to in my youth. Dim lights, poor ventilation, cheap drinks (they drank, I didn't!), rickety pool table, and good company. Even though Archie's is kind of a scene, nobody's trying to make the scene here, it's just not gonna happen. Try the Zubrowka vodka with the Bison on the bottle and flavored with real prairie grass! It was very fragrant, and even kind of sippable!Belly up with a few friends, a few sawbucks and you should be good to go at Archie's!

8.description: Not only did Archie's lend me a phone cord so I could charge my phone, but when I got a bit carried away and forgot the phone at the bar, Archie's posted on my Facebook page from my phone saying that it had been found and they wanted to make sure it got returned to me. I was so impressed -- thank you Archie's! Thanks for a great night of cheap, good drinks!

31.description: I agree with everyone else, I love archies!Their monthly beer specials are awesomeBartenders are always cool

34.description: Dropped into Archie's while bar-hopping around where I was staying in Chicago a little bit.  Atmosphere was fine, music wasn't great but I dug all the board games laying around and the crowd was pretty mellow.  Drinks weren't the cheapest, but they were well made nonetheless.  About halfway into us hanging there though, the bartender and her friends/co-workers brought in a bunch of rather foul-smelling food and started chowing down on it right there as they worked.  I understand the urgency and all, but is that really necessary?  Plus the bartender was somewhat rude to one of my friends when he want to go get another beer and and she was busy eating.  I'd check out Archie's again but it's not huge on the priority list.  I've been to far better bars.

16.description: You either like it here or you don't. Consider the source.Cheap prices, cheap and craft beer alike, puppies, free pool, free cheese balls (if you are polite). Just a hop/skip around the corner from my abode. What more could I ask for? I love it here for these reasons.Oh yeah, the people here are really nice. I do my own thing and come here alone often, and I've made a lot of nice acquaintances here and had fun. The people that get the stink eye here probably deserve it. If you get put off by that, you best stay east of Western.

13.description: I have a couple of friends that love this bar, but they only love it because they are regulars.  To someone who doesn't come here often, Archie's is about as bad as it gets.  As I mentioned, I know a couple of regulars here, but I don't know many other regulars.  And those that I don't know have given me the stink eye on a few occasions. If you're not a regular, the only thing that Archies has to offer is that it is a bar.It reminds me of drinking in a stranger's garage.  There is a random wall of knick-knacks and non-functional beer signs that have probably been gathering dust for 20 years.  There's also board games that are missing a varying number of pieces.  The prices are good, but you can drink for less at home, and do it comfortably. And that's just "Drinking 101: Saving money at the bar by maximizing the pre-heat"

11.description: How this bar has 4.5 stars on average I cannot fathom. I dared to venture west of Western and I was disappointed, per usual. Like many of you mentioned, it is a dive, and it's supposed to be dirty. But this dirty? Really? I mean what is that smell and what is the floor made of? Add in some creepily filthy hipsters and I'm out. If I'm Dive Crawling (patent pending), I'm staying on the east side in UKV and doing Stella's, J&M, & Innertown. Peace. FYI: I would have given a single star if not for the canines welcome status.

39.description: Dog friendly with monthly craft bottle specials. Free bar snacks, friendly service, and tons of ample bike parking. Can't beat the free games and pool, it really is a fun place to stay and hang out with the locals.

37.description: You can drink cheap beer, eat snacks and play with puppies here. There's a table full of board games and a pool table too. Jenga! Jenga! Jenga! Jenga!

0.description: Love this place.Its like cheers for hipsters. Get in on the free pool. One bartender is a little loony but still nice enough unless she gets really hammered. Adds to the ambiance of the place. Prices are fabulous. Board games are a great time over there too, free to grab and play whatever you want (yes ive been the one of two people playing board games when everyone else is acting "cool" there before) Items on special are always changing and Im always trying them. Great shot and beer specials all the time. Dog friendly which is great except for the occasional mishap. There is some interesting guy from neighborhood who they have come to cleanstuff up sometimes and Im sure it is a mutually beneficial arrangement. Again all part of ambiance and reallness of the place. Good people and good drinks.

38.description: Maybe Archie's doesn't *need* another awesome review, but I need to give it!  Slipping into Archie's is like putting on your favorite pair of slippers after a long day in heels; comforting, soothing and it kind of tickles.  You don't need to be in pain to appreciate this bar, however, you just need to want to relax, make some new friends, chat up the friendliest staff around and leave buzzed with some cab fare still in your pocket.  I heart Archie's.

51.description: Dog friendly spot. I don't have one, but love them, and like to go here to visit with my four legged friends as I drink.  The bartender(s) is so friggin fantastic that I would rather give her my money than most any other spot.  I watched the Bears beat the Pack last season on a Monday night and it was super fun to mock the cheeseheads there as I ate cheese puffs.  The neighborhood has an eclectic mix of folks, now, but Archie's has been there through the good times and bad.  What a great find.

27.description: Nice spot in the middle of nowhere for a cold beer and some chill time with the peeps. It is literally in the middle of a bunch of residential, so it's quite easy to miss. It's on the corner if you ever venture out, btw....Enjoy Suckas'!!!

32.description: Welp,I'm less of a young girl than I was when I wrote my original review, but I still love an old man bar, and now that I have a dog, it's nice to bring puppy to a place where he can meet other doggies and I can have a few beers and possibly more than a few (baskets of) cheese balls.  Archie's has sort of become a default because we can bring Mr. Gonzo, and let a sweet Frenchie hump his face, but that doesn't make it any less of a great night.  I'll order in some Phil's Last Stand next time, and maybe only eat one or two baskets o' balls.

54.description: What others have said. Amazing just the way it is. Don't change a thing. Ever.

48.description: Great beer selection and prices, free pool, dogs allowed, free cheeseballs, good mix of people, good jukebox, family owned....I could go on. I have a lot of good memories from here. I don't live in Ukrainian Village anymore, but I still walk my ass over here sometimes when no other bar will do. I pretty much always find what i'm looking for here. The bartenders will always remember you when you come regularly, and they also know how to put an asshole in his/her place in the funniest ways. You really can't get away with anything but having a good time at Archie's. Make sure you stop by sometime (:

44.description: its a dive bar, but a really friendly and cozy one.  And its dog friendly!  They even have my favorite shot.....Zubrowka!  Its such a weird fun flavor and its a little bit sweet, so its not unpleasant like most shots.  They also have cheese puffs.  Thats cute.

24.description: Off the beaten path. Cool bartenders. Puppy friendly. Good mix of the neighborhood in here. Cheap drinks and decent bar list. Not much to say except that I always have a great time here! A bit hipster but I've been in the n'hood longer than most so I go about my business and drink :)

7.description: Great little spot down the block from my place. Stopped by today to catch a cubs game and despite being alone and not a bar usual I felt welcomed and at home. Dog friendly :)

49.description: What's not to love? Archie's is a fantastic place, no matter what night you go. It's a small local bar where the regulars feel comfortable filling in as bartender and pouring you a drink if the staff step out for a smoke. There are friendly neighborhood dogs who like to visit. Drinks are astonishingly cheap. They give you delicious, greasy cheese puff balls. Their juke box is stuffed with the sort of bands you can get positively sloshed to while you're reminiscing. I've taken groups and out of towners here and everyone always seems to have a rip-roaring good time, probably because it's such a lovely, lovely place where you can always feel welcome. Seriously, stop by and try the Zubrowka with some apple juice. You won't be sorry.

40.description: i dont mind dive bars, but this place smelled like bawls.  sorry.  they did have cheese puff balls - those were grand.

53.description: this place is cool.its close by me.they have drinks too.ive been here more than 3 times.sometimes a house by there called 'dr. whos' has shows.

30.description: Nice Cozy spot in the neighborhood. I like the beer selections. They got a table to shoot pool and board games to play while you sip your deliciousness. The staff is very warm and friendly. Its a dog bar, so be sure to bring your poochie with you!

46.description: Zubrowska, kids.Do it. Chaser optional, unless it's another shot.And then hit the balls like there is no tomorrow.

1.description: This is the epitome of a neighborhood bar. They recently took out some of the bulky decorations which opened up the back tables. Beware when you go during the summer, they have a window unit to a/c the whole bar. Ask the bar tender for a basket of cheese balls with your beer.The pricing of the beers are affordable and decent list. They have a pool table and no food. There are a lot of local regulars which is their base clientele. The problem is that the staff can be a little uptight when outsiders come in and they are not the most accomodating.

55.description: Cheese puffs (aforementioned) YUMMIESSSSSSSSS!!!!!!!Hammeson (aforementioned) SCARRYYYYYYY BUT A++++Katrina the barteneder (aforementioned) SWEETTTYYDOGS. meet a many of them, cute and cuddly. Some may sniffle at this, well...DOGS rule HUMANS getdrunkandloveseeingdogsatbarsGreat Atmosphere. You really don't have to be THAT cool to drink here. Stray from your usual Wicka Paaaahk hangouts and try this cozy delightful little spot. Play a board game. Try the Jukebox. Even play some poolio.Nobody will judge you here. It's HIGH DIVEY. They LUV Archies, You LUV Archies. It's a gosh darn comic strip. If you go here really stoned for some reason like I have, the Marlin will get you everytime.FOREWARNING: The Jenga pieces all have penises drawn on them. DOUBLEFOREWARNING: The Hammeson @ $5 is irresistible and you may end up making out with your toilet the next morning like I have upon first discovery of such cheapage drinkage.

9.description: Go here for the small neighborhood dive bar feel, stay for the cheese puffs & puppy dog company.

26.description: Mama does not approve. Then again, as the "bar that came after Scofflaw" (as I'll now refer to it)...did it really have a shot? I was literally wrenched from the arms of my gin-soaked lover and thrown into armpit Archie's. Here's the deal: *The regulars do not want you here. At all. Ever. I'm not even terribly offensive on that type of "anti-regular" level, but I could feel the icy stares. Sorry, do I smell like gin? No, stop staring at me. Yes? Well, you smell like cheap beer and hatred. *It's gross. I'm sorry it is. It's a dive bar, it's supposed to be...so I surely won't hold this against it, but the dilapidated card tables/chairs, cement floors (I think that was cement?) and a strange mix of it feeling really dark but too bright at the same time. I didn't find it memorable, and besides the great company I ventured here to meet...found it nearly intolerable and time to bolt. Perhaps it was a collision of circumstance and just made for a bad night, but I won't be rushing to return. And I can get into a good dive bar. I'm guessing this establishment won't be sad that I am not going to return...nor the regulars, so no harm, no foul. That's the deal. One beer and OUT.

25.description: Everything a neighborhood bar should be. Daily tall boy & whiskey special, free pool and popcorn, Seger on the juke box, bar tenders with a slight attitude. Don't come here if you're looking for John Barleycorn's.

12.description: Cute local neighborhood Dog friendly bar! Good prices and people:) games available to play and beer for purchase!

59.description: Quite possibly the textbook example of the classic Chicago tavern. Unassuming and inviting as you enter, classic bar back, down-to-earth barkeep, dirt-cheap prices and assorted bric-a-brac including a beer-can Christmas tree over the holidays. Grab an ice-cold can of American beer and have a shot or two of bison grass vodka and you're partying like your granddaddy did...and you might be sitting at the same barstool.

21.description: I like cheese balls and beer to go. I like that i can bring my dog here. Bartenders are nice. Crowd is hit or miss. Some people are awesome, especially if you have a pup with you, others are hipster d- bags. Weekdays are better than weekends.

17.description: Fuck it, I met my husband here. Archie's will always hold a special place in my heart - as long as they keep on with the free cheese balls, anyways.Some people seem to be confused about what a dive bar is. They probably think Tuman's is a dive bar. Dive bars are dirty. If you're complaining about dirt in a dive bar, you shouldn't be there. The floor should never have been refinished, and be sticky to walk on, it's supposed to smell weird, and the regulars are supposed to give you the hairy eye. Dive bars are supposed to be shady places, so really, as dive bars go, Archie's is pretty nice - they actually have top shelf liquors, microbrews, buffalo grass vodka, etc.If you're there, be nice to Elvis. He's a real cool dude and is pretty much the eyes and ears of the neighborhood. When I was trying to decide if my future husband was worth talking to, I watched him hold a ten-minute conversation with Elvis, and that showed me he was good people.Minus one star because sometimes there are just too many boring hipsters.

10.description: Really nice people in here. Totally a dive but not completely disgusting nor is the selection bad (plenty of good craft beers from Brooklyn Brewery, Three Floyds, Dogfish Head, etc.). I would like at least a few drafts but again...it's a dive. The dogs in here running around make it feel like it's a big living room. I don't mind it! Would certainly come back on a cold night!

5.description: Great neighborhood bar. Cheap drinks, free pool, free cheese balls, and there are always cute dogs! I go here for a relaxed time and good company. It is not fancy but it is tried and true.

3.description: A lame psychotic looking bar of people barely twenty one years of age and very cynical and cocky.  te place is a dump as are much of the people in the surrounding areas and this neighborhood bar where outsiders are not welcome. The bartender was constantly going out for a smoke and was like never behind the bar. I had to revie this one bar one time as tried many times looking for parking in the past. it is as bad many have said it was.

35.description: This is a most excellent neighborhood bar.

19.description: Archie's is one of the friendliest bars in Chicago. Rae is one of the best bartenders in Chicago. Do the math.If you walk in, you're likely to be met by a number of dogs who are very happy to see you and get plenty of attention. There's free pool, a relaxed crowd, and plenty of cheap beer. Oh, and there are board games as well.It's the kind of neighborhood bar I wish were near me. You can just drop in, get a few drinks, hang out, and actually make a few acquaintances. I'm just sad it's taken me this long to have visited, and it's even worse that I can't just wander by on a regular basis.

28.description: Before Chicago's last dictator handed over the kingdom to this one, he machine gunned down local family bars with excessive taxes and punitive ordinances designed to turn Chicago's neighborhoods into dull quite vanilla Stepfordville suburbanesque  cul-de-sacs. Part of the plan means force herding the last of us noble urban pirates into "The Chicago Entertainment District" , that includes consumer waste lands like River North and Navy Pier, to drink with the weekend button down Coors lite jelled hair crowd. The rest of the  surviving urban bars have been overrun by midwestern yuppy walkers climbing ( which in today's America  actually means descending), the corporate ladder.Archie's is a secret cove, hidden behind a field of tumble weeds, a busted old school mail box, an abandoned El Camino- minus the doors-, and a rusted bell front tuba chained to a fence. It's an old school family bar now run by the "young un". But let me tell you a couple of things. Make no mistake, Friend'o(s), she's half  Mike Royko, and half  Martha Jane Canary. I saddle up my trusts steed just for their  Bourbon County Brand Stout, which is rarer than Tuareg metal in Iowa. I know the few places that serve it in Chicago. Archie's is relatively close. Generally my way of things, has been to order it with one good whiskey. But when I put boots to bar to order, the young un explained why I couldn't have a shot with it. She spoke so quickly that I just gave up. When I asked for another one she informed me that her policy is one per customer because of the high( 15.00% ) alcohol  content.  And she was not budging, then she politely excused herself to toss some variant of rabbler out upon his snout. It terms out we have certain highwaymen in Springfield in common. She proffered up a Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout,( 10.00%) along with a shot which was a noble compromise. Now, remember this was only my second beer - plus the shot- and I'm no spring duck. so when I signaled for another, I was denied  another Chocolate Stout. She said it looked like I knew how to hold my liquor and  it wasn't just about her protecting the family  business, but making sure that I came back.  At that point a drunk man broke a glass. See she said, and he's walking home. So I asked what dark beer would I be qualified for at this point of the night.  She said she  had just the thing for me, on the house. I saved the bottle, (she would not allow me to leave with out her washing it out), it's called BABA Black Larger( 4.00%) which at first I thought it was near beer. but when I googled it, it is actual beer. I won't be having it again, maybe I'll go with a Heineken, which is lighter than dark beer, but I certainly appreciated her leadership behind the bar. She's might be a young un, but she's old school. One of those legendary bar tenders in training. And she wrestled that huge sword fish up and over the bar after he refused to tip properly.

45.description: best bar on the west side

33.description: Beer, pool & cheese-poofs for under $2.

43.description: I have never, ever encountered such friendly, happy, gregarious bar staff in my life... I want whatever cool-aid they have! Katrina served me some serious pours. I had two drinks followed by issues walking. Witness were present. I think this means she likes me. Oh, and they have a jukebox, a pool table and they allow my Baby Beagle in!

2.description: I feel strange even pondering this review for the sole fact that Archie's just shouldn't be judged. It's a totally unassuming neighborhood meeting spot where you're always welcome, there are bowls of cheeseballs on the bar, a great selection of tasty beers, friendly dogs running around (or behaving themselves graciously), and the owners - Katrina and Jon - are just the nicest people in the world.

18.description: Welp,I'm less of a young girl than I was when I wrote my original review, but I still love an old man bar, and now that I have a dog, it's nice to bring puppy to a place where he can meet other doggies and I can have a few beers and possibly more than a few (baskets of) cheese balls.  Archie's has sort of become a default because we can bring Mr. Gonzo, and let a sweet Frenchie hump his face, but that doesn't make it any less of a great night.  I'll order in some Phil's Last Stand next time, and maybe only eat one or two baskets o' balls.

41.description: Great place to have a brew and meet some neighbors.  Don't forget to play dirty Jenga and call Sharon..."ask her about New Orleans."Daisy Cutter + Cheese balls= 4th meal.

52.description: Run by the same family for over 65 years, and they know how to serve a shot of Polish vodka chilled (buffalo grass).  I took my buddy from Warsaw and he was impressed that it was served cold - supposedly this is the only way to drink this vodka. Always chilled, always neat, always sipped and not chugged like an American barbarian!  Cheap beer and shot deals and a good juke box round out this old fashioned bar. We walked in and were greeted by Jessica and the owner. Both were cool. Now, for a chilled out bar get here before 12:30 on the weekends.  Great place. After 12:30 it becomes more of an "I am in a band and going to art school" crowd. The conversations got funny at this point. One woman was protesting that she was a "better consumer" than the other hipster chicks she knows because she "won't follow the $200 boot fad" which I often wonder about at 12 am myself. Since I heard her say that I have been seeing this fad more clearly. Invest in Hammeson (one Hamms one Jameson's whiskey) and not a pair of $200 boots that every other girl in the hood has. Heck, buy a new hoodie. Wait, that is conformity also. Well, have another Hammeson, and forget about it, and while you are at it have some cheese puffs. Fun, friendly, and in my neighborhood. Perfect.

50.description: This place has everything I need.  Cheap beer, board games and dog friendliness.  That's all you need to know.  Sorry for the boring review, but there's really nothing else to say.  It's an awesome dive bar in a residential part of the neighborhood as opposed to on some strip, plus you can drink beer and play games with your dog!  What could be better?

4.description: This is a dive bar, not a gastropub. It's not fancy craft cocktails and wines, so understand what type of place this is if your not from the neighborhood It is a neighborhood joint, the place has been here since prohibitionSometimes it's packed, sometimes it's deadFree poolCheap drinks, good craft beer selection, $3 craft beers of the month

6.description: I used to be a regular here years ago. Now its too crowded with new people moving to the neighborhood. Good bar though. They allow dogs!! I wish them continued success.

22.description: This place is actually in a small section of ukrainian village off western and augusta. I love it! Not only is it steps from my apartment but they conveniently sell beer and wine to go. They have monthly beer specials, daily shot and beer deals and its located in one of the hippest up and coming neighborhoods in Chicago. The bartenders are super cool, especially Rae (sp?). Whenever I have friends visiting or just stopping in for a drink after work I am never disappointed. It's a younger crowd like myself so that is another plus!

15.description: Mama does not approve. Then again, as the "bar that came after Scofflaw" (as I'll now refer to it)...did it really have a shot? I was literally wrenched from the arms of my gin-soaked lover and thrown into armpit Archie's. Here's the deal: *The regulars do not want you here. At all. Ever. I'm not even terribly offensive on that type of "anti-regular" level, but I could feel the icy stares. Sorry, do I smell like gin? No, stop staring at me. Yes? Well, you smell like cheap beer and hatred. *It's gross. I'm sorry it is. It's a dive bar, it's supposed to be...so I surely won't hold this against it, but the dilapidated card tables/chairs, cement floors (I think that was cement?) and a strange mix of it feeling really dark but too bright at the same time. I didn't find it memorable, and besides the great company I ventured here to meet...found it nearly intolerable and time to bolt. Perhaps it was a collision of circumstance and just made for a bad night, but I won't be rushing to return. And I can get into a good dive bar. I'm guessing this establishment won't be sad that I am not going to return...nor the regulars, so no harm, no foul. That's the deal. One beer and OUT.

57.description: Wow, what a gem this place is.  It's definitely off the beaten path, but the perfect neighborhood bar.  Great selection of bottles, free pool, dog friendly, and awesome jukebox.  I randomly found this joint during a walk one night and we instantly became best friends.

20.description: Archie's is one of the friendliest bars in Chicago. Rae is one of the best bartenders in Chicago. Do the math.If you walk in, you're likely to be met by a number of dogs who are very happy to see you and get plenty of attention. There's free pool, a relaxed crowd, and plenty of cheap beer. Oh, and there are board games as well.It's the kind of neighborhood bar I wish were near me. You can just drop in, get a few drinks, hang out, and actually make a few acquaintances. I'm just sad it's taken me this long to have visited, and it's even worse that I can't just wander by on a regular basis.

36.description: One of my new favorite places to go. not overcrowded, there's a pool table, it's dog friendly, and at $5 for a shot and a beer, what the hell, why go anywhere else. granted, its not the best place to take a date, but who cares about dates. Everyone here is friendly, and it feels like i'm hanging out in a clubhouse, which is pretty cool.There's a giant fish on the wall behind the bar, and a few games to play in case you've got nothing to talk about. Thanks, Archie's.

14.description: I live just down the street from this place and have been there several times and had a great experience.The last time I went there wasn't so.I brought my dog in this time and thought it would be a fun idea to bring his tennis ball. About 5min after I get through the door another dog completely tore his ball to shreds. I confront his owner to which he gave a pathetic "oh I thought that was the bar's ball.. we could like pay you for it or something." Of course there was no sincerity in that whatsoever. Then a bar tender guy comes up to me and blames my dog for another dog vomiting. They then asked me to leave saying they were concerned for my pooch. I had been watching my dog for the whole 5min that we were there and he did not in fact vomit whatsoever. However, I didn't argue because I didn't want to cause a scene especially since this guy made it clear my say didn't matter. They offered to hold my beer so I took my dog home. Obviously he was completely fine and was sad when I left again to go finish my beer. When I got back they acted concerned asking if he was okay and the whole fakeness just really annoyed me.Bottom line: if you're not the guy with the dog who eats every tennis ball he comes in contact with or any regular patron for that matter - DO NOT BRING YOUR DOG.These people are pretentious and cliquey as hell.

0.description: The guys here are awesome. Friendly and professional! Joseph did an excellent job on my tattoo. Paid attention to details and took his time. So happy with my beautiful tat. The place is sooooo clean and well maintained. Definitely recommend this place.

3.description: I live close to this place and for the longest it was another corner dingy liquor store in Humboldt Park. They don't sell booze of any kind here now and opened a small fast food kitchen which follows Halal laws(?!) What the whosits? The food here is straight fast food but with that extra twist. Also they sell some mediterranean fare alongside the pizza puffs. In the front they also sell a nice selection of incense. The men that work here are very friendly and polite. It doesn't feel like Humboldt Park. Oh! And they have an arcade game in the back that has original pac man, dig dug, galaga and mofo Donkey Kong!I know to have a glowing review of a corner store may seem a bit much b ut they are really nice. And the heros/subs are large, tasty and cheap.

1.description: Habibi how you've let me down. more than 6 moths ago I would have given you a 5 star rating but maybe your philosophy of good food or good cooks have changed.Steak tacos used to be great. Order of three with everything crunchy was sooo good with halal meat, but last time it was hiding no crunchy shells by being drowned in sour cream! I can't tell you how gross this was having normally known you to be of quality.Step up the game again over there please.

2.description: I know it seems weird to be reviewing a little fast food joint in the back of a convenience mart but there's a real good reason for that.  They have, honest to everything I hold dear, the best steak tacos in this whole stinkin' city!  Normally I would never order food from a place like this.  No way!  However, they're Halal and my bf brought home some steak taco meat one day just to try and it's awesome!  We've since ordered them again and the meat is consistently good!  It isn't gristly at all, it's really, good meat. For five dollars you can get three tacos, hard or soft shell, with all the regular toppings (lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and sour cream).  The owner just took over the place about half a year ago and has been working on changing the place over.  Go try those tacos... you won't be disappointed.  Oh, and sometimes they have great samosas.  They try to have everything very fresh so it isn't a regular thing but when they do get them too!

5.description: In the past year they've closed the short-order food station in the back, now it's back to just being a usual (pretty cruddy) corner store.

6.description: We moved our design and interactive studio to the neighborhood in January, and Habibi has been a staple ever since. There's not a ton of food in the area, and with a limited selection that includes Burger King and Subway I can say that the little guy blows them away. They are super friendly and the food is good with great prices. I always get the fish sub and fries, and the fries are some of the best around!

0.description: I don't recall how I actually came across this place, but I sure am glad I did.  If you don't live in the neighborhood, you probably don't even know it's there.  However, it's well worth going to find out for yourself.  Everything is made on the spot.  You'll find a full menu of gyros, tacos, burgers, chicken wings and such.  They even have samosas and biryani on the menu, which was a surprise.  I'm really not a big fan of french fries, but their fries are good.  If you get a Gyro Dinner, you get enough for two people to eat off of it.  I think the most expensive plate was $7.50, you won't have to worry bout breaking the bank. I asked about the menu thinking that part of it was Halal and he was quick to let me know that the entire menu is Halal.  Ah ha!  When my Muslim friends visit, now I don't have to drive all the way to Devon just to grab a bite to eat!  I don't mind Devon, but the drive is a bit much for just a bite.  Habibis is just around the corner!   They also do catering.  Have a party or shindig?  Call them for your catering.

4.description: Don't really understand the raves of previous reviewers--it's really slow, you have to wait for your foot in a very cramped area with some odd characters and a tv that was blaring WWF wrestling when I was there. The food was OK, but not worth how long it took, especially considering there is nowhere reasonable to wait for food. It's really cheap and portions are enormous, but that won't be enough to bring me back

1.description: They had a "No Yuppies" sign in the window. I wonder if they have a problem with all yuppies, or just the white ones.Some years back, I got a flyer to come see a poet there. After seeing the sign in the window, I called to ask if I'd be welcome, since I was, after all, a "Young Urban Professional."  The young man said, "I can't say whether you'd be welcome or not. This place is for young Latinos." Wrong answer. You should say, "Of course you're welcome. You live in the neighborhood.Haters, whippersnappers.

0.description: Batey Urbano is a consummate example of what a great radical community of color can dream up to ensure a fundamentally democratic and progressive option for its youth. An ongoing collective of Puerto Rican/neighborhood youth with an internet coffee house, the focuses are on direct democracy, community services, and arts ranging from poetry and hip-hop to much much more. Great spoken word and hip-hop nights and plenty of events, and always a great asset to a community suffering from attacks  by gentrification.

12.description: Clean contemporary sports bar, very friendly staff, huge TVs everywhere. No beer on tap, but their bottle/can selection is extensive, and reasonably priced. Also, there's no food offerings, but they are happy to have you order delivery to the bar.There is a massive projection screen in back with long communal tables...a perfect place for watching a game, or having a big gathering.

7.description: Really nice bar and set-up!  They have nice people on staff, very personable, professional and friendly.  BIG TV's! Perfect to watch our Chicago teams play! They have a good amount of beers to pick from, even if your a craft beer snob. Check it out!They're also adding a kitchen soon! Supposedly in a 2 weeks!

3.description: I wish there were more patrons at the bar. It is clean, the bartender was nice and they had good specials. Only gripe, the women's room setup. The hand dryer is right above the toilet paper rolls. Ew.

1.description: Winner winner BBQ dinner!  Hey, they have food now!  And bam, just like that, sealed the deal for us -- no need to go anywhere else.  Sorry other places we've been going to; you're out.He's had a burger and brisket sandwich, I've had pulled chicken and pulled pork sandwiches, the burger.  The food is good!  Hallelujah, the food is good!  What's more, they had a Monday special where burgers and sandwiches, with fries, are $6.  Whaaaaa?  Nice.And the wings?  Omg, my babe says they are the best he's ever had. And he's had a lot. And never finishes them. Until these. The best he said. What else is new?  Darts.  Jukebox is back.  Photo booth thingie.  Taps are going in!  Awesome!Love it.  *Love it!*

2.description: My boyfriend are I are desperate for a a local watering hole where we can watch football and grab a beer here in Logan Square/Humboldt.   We saw the good reviews (despite no kitchen!) for Boulevard, so we checked it out this past Sunday.    Woof.  There were only a handful of people there, even though the place is huge and has tons of screens.  It has so much potential!   Shuffleboard table, darts, big screens.... and a lovely new kitchen that is sitting unused.   Those are not issues.  The issue was the service.   The bartender took no pride in her job.   They were out of most craft beers listed on the menu, and she said that happens all the time.   When we asked how long they had been open, she shrugged and said she only works there once a week.  I really tried to find a redeeming factor, because this place has tons of potential, but... No tap beerNo kitchenNo clienteleUnenthusiastic serviceOut of Lefthand Milk Stout :(  However, if you want to play a game of shuffleboard uninterrupted, this is your place.

9.description: I like this place! This area was lacking a good sports bar and this place filled the void. All the people working there were really nice and the service is great. I also loved the option to order food in. This is how I discovered the pizza place down the street from here. Delicious pizza and delivered right to the bar.Check this place out! They also have bubble hockey, foosball, and pool!

18.description: Nice bar, great staff, great crowd.  The prices are very reasonable and it's a nice place to hang out and watch sports, listen to good music, etc.

10.description: Alex is the coolest dude! He can make whatever drink you want, and a lot of nights they have infusions!! No food yet, but they're working on it. Small bathrooms, a pool table and different types of seating with a huge tv. My friends have all made this their new neighborhood bar!

13.description: Good sports bar addition for the neighborhood.  They have several large televisions and a great great place to watch sports. They do not serve food, but do not mind if you bring food in.  BYOF, which I don't mind because there are enough places on the block to pick up something cheap to bring in.

16.description: Great sports bar.  Excellent beer selection and bar tenders willing to change channels for the game you want to catch.

17.description: Great place to watch the game and hang with friends.   The staff was great  and the atmosphere was perfect.

15.description: Drove by a few times, and was so glad to see a new bar in the neighborhood! I was even happier after we stopped in. The bartender (owner?) was so friendly and chatted us up about the bar, the neighborhood, etc. We were excited to hear that they will broadcast the World Cup games. Otherwise, it is a great place to watch sports. It is clean and new. The beer selection at this time is all bottles and cans, but they are reasonably priced and iced cold! Also, they have a cool thing called Tune Tug that is an app on your phone that can call up music - it "tugs" with other patrons for whose song gets played next. Free and fun!

0.description: This spot is such a hidden gem.They just recently started serving food at this sports bar and it didn't disappoint. It's a BBQ based menu with a few nice surprises on it, like tacos!I went with my wife and a friend on a Friday night and got seated right away. We ordered nachos with pulled pork on them and had a couple rounds of Moscow Mules then ordered some meals.I had the cheeseburger which was loaded with bacon, my wife had the brisket sandwich which was crazy good, and my buddy enjoyed some chicken tacos which were awesome. I selfishly hoped he ordered the brisket tacos because I wanted to try those instead, the chicken tacos were still very good.We kept enjoying Moscow Mules throughout and finished with the brownie, which was served with ice cream and was a nice finish to the experience.The service was wonderful, one of the owners even checked in on us a couple times too. I thought this was real nice to see, a hands on approach and concern for each customer.The best part was the check though... All we ate and drank, we didn't even break the ninety dollar mark before tip! Absolutely going here again and again.

5.description: FOOD UPDATE!  Full disclosure, I'm not really a carnivore, so my BBQ eating is limited.  However, my dining partner noted the brisket was "solid" and the pulled pork I had was also good - sweet BBQ flavored.  We tried all the sides, and again, solid.  I recommend the slaw (it was a sweet vinegar based jicama slaw - really fresh) and the potato salad.  I don't usually order potato salad as a side, but we wanted to try everything, and it was amazing. A hint of jalepeno to it.  I'm still thinking about it.  Along with the addition of food, there's now beer taps.  While the previous selection of craft beers in bottles/cans was really good, there are some real beer nerd selections now.

11.description: Excellent addition to the Humboldt/Logan area. They offer a range of quality drink options in a relaxing atmosphere where you can both watch the Hawks game and hear the call. Far too many places play the picture without sound and I'm glad to have a new option that has their $h!t together. P.S. The world famous Cemitas Puebla (see my review) is down the street and will deliver to your table here.

8.description: Great local bar! Lots of nice people and huge beer selection. It's a shame it's not busier because it's prefect - huge tvs, tons of seating, excellent service, and wide selection of drinks. Definitely going to be on our regular "hang out bar" list. The bartender said they are adding a kitchen in july. :) even better!!!

4.description: Just opened their new BBQ - DELICIOUS. The brisket nachos literally fuck your mouth with flavor, and the Mac n Cheese with Pulled Pork and Ghost Cheese is nothing short of a full on assault of your tastebuds. No survivors. SO GOOD. Won't be a well-kept secret for long on this side of town! Food +100Service +100Atmosphere +100

14.description: Great bar for the hood. Like everyone else said, nice bar, cool bartenders (blonde girl) nice TV''s for sports and they Foosball, Table Hockey and Pool (which rules). Reasonable drink prices. Can't wait to go here for Bears games.

6.description: Love this place I've been coming here since they open. Friendly staff from the bar tenders to the owners and now they're getting food. Great beer selection from standards to craft beers. Always has the game on. Can't wait for the food

3.description: Horrible. Long lines ghetto as fuck. I drive to other Walgreens when I live next door to this hood mart Nobody ever working nobody can get shit that behind glass

1.description: I wish I could give this Walgreens 0 stars or even a negative score. The staff is ghetto in the sense that everyone there is unprofessional. There are long lines meanwhile employees are standing around talking, eating on the registers, and simply ignoring the customers. I live two blocks away and I vow to never return to this location again I tried way too many times to give them a try on a last minute snack run, but 10-15 mins in line for chips is ridiculous. Honestly, there are other stores more deserving of your business. If you like long lines while watching people gossip and be on there phone ignoring you this store is for you!

0.description: As for the Walgreens as a whole, it's Walgreens. Pretty much the same as the other 50,000 of them. The pharmacy here, however, is great. Everyone I have dealt with there has been pretty efficient, friendly, and extremely helpful resolving confusing insurance issues and prescription mistakes. Definitely well above average.

2.description: I must be a glutton for punishment by continuing to come here. The locations at 1601 N Milwaukee Ave or 2001 N Milwaukee Ave are infinitely nicer and less of a clusterf*ck. You know the pharmacy line is long when an employee walks by and mutters "oh Jesus".

5.description: They are fast with my prescriptions so I keep coming back here. They also have discounts on medications that helps for some prescriptions that my insurance doesn't cover. You just have to ask the first time. They give them to  me regularly now. Beyond that it's a Walgreens nothing special.

6.description: The pharmacy here has excellent, professional staff who are attentive and patient. They are the only reason for 2 stars. The other clerks here are pretty friendly and helpful, too. The woman at the photo counter is professional and friendly.However, everything is locked up - deodorant, shampoo, GUM - so I have to buzz the button to have an associate open it up while I embarrassingly point to the item I want. Their stock is often low and they do not have the same selection as other Walgreen's stores. As much as I love the pharmacy, I am taking my business to another Walgreen's. I gave this location 9 months...

7.description: HUGE parking lot! Awesomeness. But sometimes there are scammers in the lot asking you for a dollar to get back on the bus, etc. Sometimes I give them a dollar anyway because I figure at least $.50 might make it to their baby's belly in food. The pharmacy here is super slow but friendly and polite. I just wish I wasn't given a 45 minute to an hour wait for a Scrip of a very common med. What am I supposed to do, play with the off-brand Etch-A-Sketches in the toy aisle? Well, that's exactly what I do!

8.description: This location is always dirty and crawling with creeps. Their products, specifically drinks, seem to be always out of stock too. Really the only positive is that they have a parking lot.

9.description: It's a Walgreens I know. They carry things that Walgreens carries. Big deal.I literally live seconds away from this place and it's always a dread, why oh why can't there be a CVS near? And I'm not about to walk to W Grocer for overpriced goods, despite their convenient hours.My problem with this Walgreens is the staff is some of the rudest I've ever dealt with. I feel like I'm walking into a Middle School, where the cashier's would rather chat about their baby daddys or who slept with who than to be bothered with your rude interruption to check out. I had one cashier that literally sneered at me, with 6 people behind me waiting to check out, while she carried on a conversation with another cashier whose lane wasn't even open. She sneered as soon as their conversation was done I guess because I was rude enough to bother with checking out NOW as opposed to in 15 minutes, note I didn't even say or posture anything to her.This place needs those self-checkout lanes and it would be perfect.Oh, and all the signs are in spanish only so good luck finding anything if you're english-speaking only as the staff sure as hell isn't going to be bothered with a question. And definite agreement with Elisabeth about the panhandlers. Having gone many a time out of convenience, 80% of the time there is a panhandler right outside the door, while the security guard lolls about and oogles everyone from the beauty department, doing nothing. The whole store should be fired and re-hired. Ridiculous.

10.description: After tiring of the slow and disorganized pharmacy service at the Chicago Ave & Western Ave CVS, and never having liked the Chicago & Damen Dominick's, I decided to try getting a prescription filled at this Walgreens.I have an uncommon prescription, so I called ahead to ensure they had it in stock. The woman who answered put me on hold for a good while after I first inquired. She came back after a while, though, to assure me I hadn't been forgotten and let me know they still needed a few extra moments to answer my question, because they had the drug in stock but were counting the capsules to ensure they had as many as I needed. I minded the wait a lot less knowing that it was to avoid the inconvenience of me showing up only to find them short.When I came, I waited in line only a minute to have my prescription accepted. By comparison, at this same time of day, the pharmacy staff at CVS were generally so occupied as to make customers wait ten minutes or more.I needed to return home soon to meet someone, so I decided to pick up my prescription the next day.Seeing the possibility of better service at this store, I transferred a second, existing prescription there that evening via Walgreens' website and asked that it be refilled and ready by 6pm the next day (after work), the time that I planned to pick up my first prescription. Helpfully, Walgreens' website warned me that this might be too short a window to get the transfer done, but accepted my request nonetheless.There was no wait to pick up my prescription the following day. The woman who rang me up recognized my name and remembered the details of my prescriptions right away, including that I had left with them a manufacturer's coupon card that was needed for a 50% discount on an expensive co-pay. The had also successfully filled my transferred prescription despite my short notice.In my limited-but-positive experience, the staff at this store were attentive and swift in gross contrast to my old CVS.

4.description: I trusted the staff at this Walgreens location to process a roll of film from a disposable waterproof camera. The film contained irreplaceable photos from a recent once-in-a-lifetime vacation.However, the staff is not properly trained and I watched the person at the Photo Center expose the unprocessed roll of film to the store's fluorescent lighting. Every frame was lost.I suppose it's my own fault for trusting the staff at the Walgreens Photo Center to actually know anything about photography. I do not recommend anyone else make the same mistake I did.I will not be returning to this or any other Walgreens store.

3.description: Ok, so I had to update... sorry guys, but the last time we ordered, about a week ago - my boyfriend got so sick within 20 minutes of eating his sandwhich, I literally had to take him to the ER for food poisoning... not cool, guys, not cool at all... needless to say I dont think my boyfriend, or myself for that matter, will EVER eat another turkey sandwhich... :(

1.description: I don't know what sandwich shop  takes an hour & thirty minutes  to deliver a dammn  sandwich. I called the first time the guy on the phone said he just spoke to the  driver  he is five mins away, forty five minutes later i called again and he said they don't have delivery guys they get a 3rd party delivery service. So i told him if my food isn't here in the next ten minutes i would have to call grub hub to cancel my order. The rude PRICK didn't even apologize or anything he said go ahead and call grub-hub and hung up on me. Smh what a fool!

2.description: 1 star for refunding me the price of coffee.Delivery was late.  The bagel (see photo) was a joke.  The driver spilled my coffee (which what was left of it, arrived cold).Terrible experience.  I'll never go back.

5.description: I ordered delivery from here on a weekday lunch through EAT24.  I was excited to find a local place with BoarsHead meat.I was promised delivery 45 min - hour.  Thought that was pretty high considering I lived within a mile, but as they say.., good things come to this who wait ;)After an hour and 15 min, I called to see when it might be delivered.  I was rudely told it was on its way -- without confirmation of which order I was inquiring about.  When I mentioned it was already late, I was asked if I could call back as there were other customers waiting.  Really?  I cancelled my order and requested a refund through EAT24, so the one star is based on service (or lack there of).

6.description: Great place for a quick sandwich. I've had the Italian (amazing!) and the BLT a couple of times and it's always good and really fresh tasting. High quality meat and bread and you can pick from several different kinds of bread that is also sold in the attached store. They actually have a really large selection of sandwiches for such a small shop and the staff are very friendly. I think this is great value for what you get - the BLT is $4.99 and it comes with a drink and chips. Hard to beat.

7.description: Just off the produce market they have opened a cafe with made to order breakfast egg crossiants (served all day), veggie or Boar's Head sandwiches, hand scooped ice cream and Star Lounge coffee.  They are installing a take out window for easier access.  Staff in the cafe is just as friendly as the staff in the market and prices just as reasonable.

8.description: My brother was hesitant to try this place out, but it is walking distance from his office so he went along. The cafe, sandwich and soup shop is attached to the grocery store. Everything you order is freshly made while you wait. I ordered an Italian Sub and my brother ordered the corn beef sandwich and we were both very happy with out meals and impressed by the friendly service! Next time I go consult at my brothers office will return and try one of their breakfast sandwiches that they

9.description: Had a quick sandwich from here after buying some groceries and it was fresh and excellent.  Boars Head branded meat is what they are using for their sandwiches.  Nice addition to their store right on the corner.  I wish they had the outdoor seating set up to eat outside.

0.description: to woo me in, the guy in the store gave me a free coffee ticket. Which i used to walk directly up to the counter and use as an excuse to engage the person behind the counter. it looks kinds spare in there, but it's just an efficiently planned space- look on the wall behind you! there is an AMAZING sandwich menu- I LOVE the sandwich! ANd with top quality meant and cheese, on fresh bread, with some coffee from Star Lounge to boot?!  And free chips and a pop?!This pure genius- as if the Farmers Pride people snuck into my deepest fantasy. GO here, spread the word.

4.description: Just got breakfast delivered and I'm very happy with this place. The delivery guy got here 20 minutes early, this coffee is delicious, and my lemon-pepper chicken panini was great. I'll definitely be ordering from these guys again.

1.description: I first fell in love with Squasht Boutique when I came across the Squasht slouch hats at a street fest. The material/style of the hats drew me in.The owner Lesley Timpe was wonderful! She showed me the different ways to style the hat and was a pleasure to talk to.A couple weeks later I went to see the actual boutique. I never get over to Ukrainian Village much and I have to go back and visit. Lots of cute shops in the area and the best part parking is free on the streets.The store itself is pretty big for a boutique. Besides her own clothing line she sells other locally handmade designer items. I like the affordability. It appeared most of the items were $150 or less. The clothes are updated for the season and the items are so unique. This will definitely be a place I go back to for myself and cool gifts for my girls.

9.description: Feel so lucky that I stumbled on this place while visiting from out of town.Many irresistible things, clothes and accessories, to be had here - locally made by Les and other designers. Nothing can beat the satisfaction of buying directly from the designer. I specially loved some very fun serged knit dresses - stripes and color blocks smartly pieced together from scrap fabric. So great to pick up a dress that I feel excited to wear to the theater that same night, that's comfortable enough to sleep in and I can imagine wearing frequently at work and biking to the beach. What?! Go there now and see for yourself.Fun and easy to wear jewelry, tights, leggings, headbands, hats too.

23.description: It took me a while to visit this local shop that's literally right around the corner from me. I saw a pair of wood-cut earrings in the window recently and knew I had to make them mine.And make them mine I did, but not before checking out what Squasht had to offer - locally produced, independent apparel and accessories. The selection is a bit small, but everything is made with love, right here in Chicago. Although the hats and the dresses weren't really my style, I loved the earring selection and will definitely be back for more!

5.description: I found an awesome hat at Les' shop and it is great for the wintertime. It's very well made and durable AND fashionable. I love her shop very much!

25.description: A dress is a lovely, feminine item of clothing, and it reduces the number of decisions you have to make each morning.  Put on a dress, a pair of tights and boots and BAM, you're ready to go break some hearts. If you are a dress novice, Squasht by Les is a good place to start. I picked up my fav, a little navy blue and red striped number, at Les' loft in September.  I loved it so much that I bought one with the same design and different fabric at Wolfbait & B-girls.  And!  Most of her dresses are between $118-130.  She also has many hats, including those furry aviators that are the thing this season.  I looked like a bag lady when I tried on one of these, but they are très adorable on young girls.

12.description: A dress is a lovely, feminine item of clothing, and it reduces the number of decisions you have to make each morning.  Put on a dress, a pair of tights and boots and BAM, you're ready to go break some hearts. If you are a dress novice, Squasht by Les is a good place to start. I picked up my fav, a little navy blue and red striped number, at Les' loft in September.  I loved it so much that I bought one with the same design and different fabric at Wolfbait & B-girls.  And!  Most of her dresses are between $118-130.  She also has many hats, including those furry aviators that are the thing this season.  I looked like a bag lady when I tried on one of these, but they are très adorable on young girls.

21.description: I have to recommend this great little boutique to anyone looking for original pieces to add to their wardrobe. I was there last for a trunk show for one of the independent jewelry designers that consigns there. I didn't end up with any jewelry, but I did walk out with a fabulous winter hat created by Les. The boutique has a selection of hats, dresses, skirts, hats, and headbands designed by Les; as well as jewelry from other local designers. You can also find Les at many of the local street fairs so keep your eyes peeled.

16.description: Though the store doesn't carry a wide selection of men's apparel, all of the women I know absolutely love this boutique. If you're looking for gifts, this is a great place to pick up something unique. All of the clothes and jewelry are hand made, and many are by local designers, including the shop's owner. If that sounds like your girlfriend's/mom's/sister's cup of tea, you should make a stop here next time you're gift shopping, because it's one of the best boutiques you will find in Chicago.

17.description: I love this place and never fail to leave with a piece of unique clothing that i wear a lot! I never regret spending time or money here! Les is always really nice, helpful, and welcoming!

10.description: This is a great local Chicago design shop also carrying handmade products from around the country.   I love the new storefront and the extended variety of dresses, socks and accessories.   This is also a great shop to go to when you really need a color fix for your color cravings.

11.description: I've been shopping at Squasht for years and I love the store! I moved out of state last year and still buy the cute stuff I see on Squasht's FB wall. Les  is great at customer service -  she always remembers my figure and style and recommend things that will fit my shape and forward my style. I wish I was still in the area and could browse at will! I love that a locally owned, operated business like her's can be successful and am proud to support a great, local designer!

26.description: you may have seen squasht by les's booth at many of the outdoor fests this summer.  while les's main business is hats, she also designs funky, structured, futuristic clothes at very reasonable prices.  do you need any other reason to call and make an appointment now or stop by on an art walk? i think not!  but, if you still must be persuaded not to spend your money at the gap, i'll give you one more.  i stopped into les's studio a few weeks ago to look at a dress. i loved it, but it needed some adjustments, a little longer here, a little taking out there.  at no extra charge les offered to customize the fit.  two weeks later, i picked up my dress and it fits like a dream.  even better, it's fantastically comfortable.  yup, i'll be wearing this dress all winter long, just racking up the compliments.  thanks again, les!

27.description: Wicked cute hats and clothes made of unique fabrics.  Cool, friendly owner Lesley is welcoming and helpful.  Check out their open studio nights during Pilsen Gallery Walks and meet Lesley.  She'll point you in the right direction for something cool and cute.

0.description: As someone who can barely thread a needle, I am in awe of people who can create an entire article of clothing. I entered Squasht on a whim, and liked the cheery items and friendly shopkeeper. I wasn't searching for anything in particular, but ended up loving a loose-knit and delicate slouchy black and white sweater, which has become a staple in my winter wardrobe. The jewelry was all beautiful, but I had to intervene and shut up the little devil on my shoulder whispering in my ear to buy it all. Luckily not before purchasing a lovely necklace for my sister-in-law. Both were splurges, but very reasonable considering the quality.Loved that this boutique offers handmade clothing and goods, with zero pomp or 'tude. Chicago is a bit far from California, but I have their online store open in the next tab and may or may not have something in my cart already! Shhh...

20.description: This is such a cute store in Ukrainian Village!  I made my first stop there to night and bought a super cute winter hat.  If you are in need of cute winter hats as part of you retail therapy for living in Chicago during the winter you MUST stop by Squashed!! It's worth the trip.Leslie (sp?) the owner has tons of super cute and unique clothes and accessories.  If you're looking for cool, hip yet casual clothing that is reasonably priced STOP HERE!!

19.description: I have to recommend this great little boutique to anyone looking for original pieces to add to their wardrobe. I was there last for a trunk show for one of the independent jewelry designers that consigns there. I didn't end up with any jewelry, but I did walk out with a fabulous winter hat created by Les. The boutique has a selection of hats, dresses, skirts, hats, and headbands designed by Les; as well as jewelry from other local designers. You can also find Les at many of the local street fairs so keep your eyes peeled.

2.description: I have never been a hat person. I love hats but have never been able to find one that looked right on my head. All that changed when I met Les at Squasht! With the varied sizes and adorable design I can finally be the hat person I always wanted to be. Plus the are all reversible so it is great to get two hats in one! They not only have great, actually flattering, hats, but they also have awesome, totally unique clothes and accessories. I don't think I have ever worn anything from Squasht without getting a handful of complements. Great shop, great customer service, and awesome finds!

18.description: Perfect!I am driving past rockwell and chicago avenue one evening before Chrismas and i see a corner store with signs that appeal to meLocal, Independant designers, Hand MadeI stop in and Les introduces herself, the artist of most of the items in the store. Almost everything made in her store is hand crafted right here in Chicago. She also carries items from her friends back home in St Louis. Creating art, creating jobs, creating better communities. Thanks for showing us the blue print Les.

13.description: You love cute and unique?You swear by local?You like your shopping with a side of dog petting?Squasht is the place for you!!Discovered two years ago at the Renegade Fair (a hat display is always a sure way to catch my eye, which is fine if you gently let it go unharmed after a couple of minutes), Squasht has become a regular stop of my shopping rotation. They have an amazing collection of my favorite things: dresses, hats (yes, again!), tights and jewelry. Each piece is locally made by lovely Chicagoan digits, and scream originality. Last spring, I bought brass clock hands turned earrings for $15. Believe me, you don't see that every day, on every lobe.The super cool designer, Lesley Timpe, brings a European vibe to her seasonal collection, and favors organic soy-cotton, pima cotton in vintage 1980s prints, vintage velveteen, imported Italian wool, and silk tweed. Lots of nature-inspired motifs and no crappy rayon to deal with. She only offers the real deal. Garments are pretty, versatile, soft to the touch and happy.Yes, happy!Prices are a bit steep if you are used to thrift stores or mass-produced items but it's worth shedding a few extra bucks on quality pieces. Also, sizes run on the smaller side so get rid of your holiday fat before stopping by.....you won't regret it.Tips:- they have an online boutique, with free shopping over $50, and are sold in over 20 retailer boutiques over the country (including one in L.A.!)- street parking is super easy; to make a total Ukie Village experience out of it, stop at Star Lounge for coffee, get some borscht at Schokolad or eat one of the best sushis in town at Kai Zan- plan your trip carefully!!! They close at 5 pm during the weekend. A definite bummer but, oh well, nobody's perfect.

4.description: Come here!

24.description: I love, love, LOVE my Squasht dress!!  I came in on a whim and Les helped me find a beautiful blue-black striped cotton dress.  It fit like it was made for me, and made me feel beautiful, feminine, and fun.  I love that all her dresses have pockets, too!  She will alter the dress to fit you so that it truly is "made to order".  I hope her boutique sticks around because it is dangerously close to my apartment and her clothes are just perfect.My dress was $75, but I did pass by yesterday and she had a sale rack out with everything marked down to $50 or less.  So tempting...go shop now!

6.description: Not only the fact is it right around the corner from me, it's been great for creative and unique last minute gifts.  I'll go in shopping for someone else, and I ALWAYS walk out with some cute accessory I just had to buy for myself.

22.description: I probably own too many Squasht pieces, but in this case I don't mind looking like a cheerleader. The store also has a number of other local independent designers that make pretty much everything you could ever need, from basics to party dresses to sweaters to accessories. Prices vary all over the map as each designer sets their own prices, and use all kinds of techniques and materials, but there's rarely anything in the store over $200, so there's definitely something for everyone!

15.description: I always stop by to grab a gift for my mother or grandmother or girlfriend. They have mens wallets and sunglasses and hats as well, but mostly women stuff. I have never been dissapointed and Les the owner is usually always there and she is an amazing designer! There is a reason she was voted best boutique by Chicago Reader!

7.description: The gods of local gifting smiled upon me (and several of my nearest and dearest) last night... With 30 minutes before a date at Kai Zan (across the street - another 5-star review to follow!) my mum and I made a quick stop at Squasht. I didn't know quite what to expect, but several signs beckoning us in to shop sealed the deal. Side point, really nice to see a boutique open past 530 or 6! Allows me more time to throw my money at them! We were greeted warmly and enthusiastically by the owner (Les) like we were old friends or regulars. We then proceeded to poke through the lovely assortment of gift-like items. The majority of the store is accessories (earrings, hair, socks, wallets/leather goods, necklaces, etc) and clothing (tees, dresses, etc). Everything is handmade and locally in Chicago, at that. Given these descriptors I'm sure you thought (as I did) that it would be crazy expensive. And in fact, it is not! Everything is extremely reasonable. Prices vary a bit artist to artist, but overall I found the pricing on par with the quality and style-factor found in the collections. Les was also super helpful in locating certain items without being pushy at all. You can tell she is extremely passionate about her store and her customers. It made for a great shopping experience. My haul: For myself: *2 Megan Lee tees. 1: Midwest is Best! (in a heart) and 2. Do What You Love. ($26/ea)*a beautiful wallet made with an antique key ($38) For a pending nephew: *2 Megan Lee onesies: doggie and giraffe! ($18/each) For my gal pal: *Amazing kitty shawl/eternity scarf. (price withheld, she's a yelper!) Loved all the jewelry, could easily pick out gifts for a number of people here. The holidays are coming, do yourself (and the local economy/artist community) a favor and get yourself over here to see how many folks you can check off the list. *credit accepted*easy parking

8.description: Thank you guys for being open at 630pm on a Fri night and having my perfect dress! I've been wanting to come here for so long and would have bought several items, e.g. more dresses, hats, scarves, if I wasn't on a dress mission. Love the styles and uniqueness. Had a great experience too just chatting and trying things on. So 'big ups' for your attentive service and great line of products. I'm coming back today! Lol

3.description: The shop owner provides superb customer service...I asked to exchange an item for a different size and when the item was not in the store, she contacted the designer who delivered it the next day.Interesting designs at sensible prices!
