14.description: this is the first time i've ever bought a dress and worn it out of the store. it was that cute. it also helped that two random people who wandered into the store while i was trying it out complimented me on how flattering it was. don't judge, i'd been studying the whole day at Sip coffee over on Grand, and it got too warm for my sweater and jeans. apparently this kind of thing happens when you pop into a cute boutique "to look for a mother's day gift".anyways, les the owner was so nice, and helped me pick out a few dresses to try on. i was there by myself, so i asked her opinion on how they looked, and i thought that she was honest in the fit/overall look, not just saying that everything looked great in order to try to push the sale. also she offered to do alterations, the straps on a great dress were just a little too long (but i ended up getting another one instead).for me, and probably for many fellow students, the clothing is a bit out of my price range for everyday items, but a DEFINITE for special occasions/splurges. lots of unique pieces! the accessories are also super cute and there's certainly more affordable pieces there. i'd love to go back whenever i need a unique gift for "mother's day" or "a friend's birthday."  in case you're wondering, i DID actually get a mother's day gift as well, and les (knowing this was a gift, and without me asking) carefully wrapped it in teal tissue paper, and placed in a nice gift bag adorned with ribbons for me.

3.description: I came in looking for a bookcase and came out with a pair of extremely rare midcentury modern teak chairs made in Japan! I estimate that just one would go for about $1,500. I didn't pay anything close to that. Keith threw in free delivery, too. Man, this little stretch of stores on California is fantastic for serious MCM collectors.

1.description: Awesome prices, awesome pieces. Stop by to check out the ever changing inventory, listen to a few records and hang with the best shopkeep, Keith!Great for barware, records, super affordable sofas and other vintage treasures.

2.description: I could spend hours digging around this quirky yet welcoming little shop. We were on our way back from brunch at the Flying Saucer and popped in for a bit and I walked out with several albums. If my vehicle wasn't already packed to the rim with goodies from earlier stops on my roadtrip, I would have left with adorable vintage lawn furniture, lamps, and more. All around, the prices are more than fair even for the most frugal vintage shoppers and the charming and oh-so-helpful gal working made the entire experience one of the best shopping trips that I've had in awhile. The icing on the cake was I scored the following albums and all for $5 each!Valley Of The Dolls Breakfast At Tiffany's 2 Dolly Parton albums Born In The USA - Bruuuuuuuce Elton John's Greatest Hits Coming from Nashville where these would have been snatched up right away and where prices would likely be inflated, I'm now a Vintage Quest fan for life. TIP: Everything in here is in fantastic condition! My friend scored a delightful retro toaster (still functioning!) for $40 that would have sold elsewhere for between $140 - $180. Great home goods and furnishings were everywhere!

5.description: Such a quirky, eclectic blend of mid century modern, kitsch , and decor.  The shop owner is very helpful ! Make sure you stop by during California nights for a well-attended fun party!

6.description: Great eclectic vintage shop owned by a fellow vintage aficionado. Keith carries an eclectic mix of vintage furniture, knick-knacks, decorative items, vinyl. He's a pioneer in a neighborhood with a number of other vintage and specialty shops. Stop in and say hi!

7.description: Huge fan of Vintage Quest! I make frequent stops in and believe I've purchased something all but three times.  Items are always new and fresh and have just they quality I'm looking forward. I actually may head back today. Cant recommend enough!

8.description: I've been present at several flea markets where owner Keith was a vendor, and was impressed by his selection of vintage industrial finds and vinyl records. Now he's got a whole storefront full of em! Every nook and cranny in this shop is filled with fantastic vintage... It's even piled up on top of itself, but in the most organized and aesthetically pleasing way! There's a bit of everything here but definitely a great place if you're in the market for furniture or decor. Or records. Or just weird unique old stuff you won't find anywhere else.

9.description: This place is great. Cool vintage nick nacks, neat albums, record players, furniture. Half the stuff in my place is from here. Besides that, Keith is one cool cat. You can tell he is passionate about his finds and loves to share them with the neighborhood. Stop in and have a chat and peruse the nooks and crannies for unique little finds.

0.description: Vintage Quest is my new favorite vintage store in Chicago. I'd wanted to stop in several times before, but was never over that way when they were open. Yesterday I lucked out. I went there in search of a birthday gift for a dear friend--specifically, some cool vintage glassware. I went in looking for one thing, and I left with that plus some cocktail glasses an end table, and a record. I wanted to buy nearly half the store, but my wallet and lack of space wouldn't let me. This shop is a treasure trove of vintage furniture, glassware, knick-knacks, and vinyl. What's even better is that the owner, Keith, is a hell of a nice guy. He spends time talking to customers and helping them find cool stuff. I will be back, and I'm spreading the word to my friends about this gem of a store.

4.description: Cute shop full of industrial style hip furniture and mid century madness.I loved the 6 ft long kronenburg beer sign above the counter and the collection of old 50s and. 60s " how to make the prefect cocktail" pamphlets. If metal cabinets like old printers storage cabinets and cool old mailboxes are Needed to complete your hipster palace - be sure it check it out. There's a pop up shop next door and several other antique/ vintage shops along California which will make for a few hour stop.

0.description: For the many years I lived on Division St., not only was J's the NICEST PEOPLE- BEST Prices & Well stocked pharmacy,  lucky me, they were only 2 1/2 blocks away!That was until 2010 & the move, NORTH..waaaaaaaaaayyyyyyy  North .. It takes me at least an hour from Howard Red to Western-Hirsch #49, and I trek South month after month because#1.  They ARE THE BEST! #2.  My Insurance no longer covers 2 of my prescriptions, so this is a slice out of an already pretty chewed up pie-chart. 99%-per cents/ sense-read onGood thing I RESEARCH, so I did NOT Pay anywhere near the $130.00 I was most quoted & would have been charged by the 6 closest pharmacists !#3.  I pay out of MY POCKET,at  J-Discount for BOTH  $64.00.  TOTAL  ^_^Seriously, isn't THAT AWESOME ?!??! Next BEST to FREE!  I AM VERY HAPPY & VERY LOYAL FAN of all good business- people NOT infected by the GREED-Dis-Ease in America & the National Schadenfreude Danse Macabre Troupe & Theater Corporation.OK OK I do have. 1 Complaint-  WHEN are you guys going to come UP NORTH ? WE. People,  WE NEED YOU !  Medicine $ vs, ? Food? Utility Bills? you know.BTW - Looking forward to seeing that #2,  Especially on an IDENTICAL NEON Very Vegas Sign !!  VIVA !  OPEN  9-7 M-F        SAT.9-5         CLOSED SUNDAY

1.description: I was looking for a place that was close to where I live (nothing worse than getting a relaxing massage then fighting traffic home or dealing with public transpo) to get a massage and wind down from a hectic week.There was a bit of a language barrier, but that didn't bother me. The masseuse was 5-7 minutes late and wrapped up 10 minutes early, so I only really got a 45 minute massage though I paid for an hour ($60 + 20% tip).The place was clean and the women were friendly, but it was a bit odd that I had to pay for, and tip, my masseuse before I even received the massage. I probably won't be back, but I'm glad I gave it a shot.

2.description: Clean and friendly. Commutation is a little bit iffy were English is their second language. They are open until ten pm. I would return.

0.description: 30 min Tui Na Massage for $45 was relaxing and effective.  The therapist had a good massage rhythm where the treatment begins and ends as a complete cycle.  I do feel balanced.Price could be better and competitive.Easy to get appointment.Clean simple organized establishment.Beware of towel on headrest as you can get wrinkles and dents on your face for hours.  :-)

12.description: I really wanted to love this place, and looked forward to my trip back here for a haircut in the future...... Unfortunately, my Brazillian Blow Out didn't even last a week! My frizz and waves are all back like I hadn't gotten a blow out at all! Such a shame :( Benito seemed very knowledgable with his techniques he was extremely informative on the products. But the outcome wasn't nearly as exciting as I had anticipated...........

3.description: CUSTOMERS BEWARE - I fell victim to the dreaded BAIT AND SWITCH and my hair suffered for it!!I purchased a Groupon for a deep conditioning, haircut and blow dry to this salon. I called ahead and booked an appointment with Benito (I specifically requested him). When I arrived Benito walked me in but then passed me off to an inexperienced stylist (she mentioned having recently completed beauty school). Benito then proceeded to sit in a corner of the room flipping through a magazine. I explained that I wanted a fairly simple cut (even in the back with some face-framing layers). The newbie stopped several times during the cut and acted confused; Benito barked some orders and she continued chopping. Just when I thought the experience couldn't get any more unprofessional and uncomfortable, the newbie attempted the worst blow dry I have ever experienced. Not only did she pull out chunks of my hair with her bumbling brush maneuvers, she also hit my scalp several times with a flat iron. The torture resulted in a frizzy, puffy mess on my head that was part "I stuck my finger in a socket" and part bride of Frankenstein. To round off SoHo's "cheating the customer" experience, the newbie did NOT deep condition my hair (which was supposed to be included in the Groupon). Instead she stuck some cheap leave-in garbage in my hair, hoping I had been previously lobotomized and wouldn't notice the difference.Moral of the story - AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!

1.description: I usually dread haircuts because I hate the salon environments...but Soho Atelier was a welcomed break from the norm! The salon, while clean and professional, had a much more casual vibe in a really cool building.  The area itself is a little sketchy, but the interior didn't reflect that at all.  Sarah was awesome! Super personal and gave me a great haircut.  I used a Groupon, so it was an amazing deal for a haircut. The only real complaint I had was some confusion scheduling and difficulty contacting the salon. The salon has two locations-- one of which is in Michigan.  It was a little confusing trying to figure out which salon I had actually booked online with.  But they called and cleared everything up within a few hours.  Just be careful if you book online :)

2.description: In love with Soho. I first came here from a groupon I got for a Brazilian blowout with Sara. I recently moved from Los Angeles and needed a new salon. Sara did a fantastic job on the blowout, exactly what I was used to and wanted. Perfect and saves me plenty of time in the morning. Sara has also done my cut and color since and I am always extremely pleased! Benito is also a rock star and makes sure I always leave happy and with beautiful hair :) I would definitely recommend this place!

9.description: I found this place when I was desperate for a haircut and found them through groupon. I called and Sydney was able to get me in that day. My hair was very much past due for a haircut. I have very long hair and it's tough to make it do anything except be straight and heavy. Sydney gave me a fantastic dry cut that has given me tons of body and movement, yet I was able to keep the length I love. She was also very knowledgeable about the products and explained what she was using and why. After working for a few salons and being on a hiatus from a regular stylist because I just couldn't find someone whose style I liked and that I gelled with, I will definitely be coming back!

10.description: I walked into Soho Atelier with fried over-processed light blonde hair, with an orangey brown bottom layer, and an ash medium brown 2 inch strip of outgrowth at my root. I also had a hatchet job haircut that looked like I did myself with kitchen scissors after I got drunk (I didn't! I paid a lot for that haircut in Lincoln Park).I showed Benito a few pictures on Pinterest of the wavy ombre Sarah Jessica Parker hair of my dreams.He comes across almost gruff at first because he's a business man, and you can tell he treats making people look good as a very serious business. As it turns out he is not gruff or serious all the time. He's lovely, fun, and funny. My hair was such a project that I saw a few other of his clients come and go while I was processing and what not. He's super fast without ever compromising quality. Everybody left looking way better than when they walked in.I got a complete hair make-over. He did the color exactly like one of the pictures I showed him. He fixed my hair cut, so it looks awesome now, but will effortlessly grow out exactly the way I want it. He did an express Brazilian blow-out, and my frizzy damaged hair looks totally different. It looks healthy!I feel super pretty. I have that awesome feeling like I just got a new present that I love.

4.description: Benito IS Edward Scissor Hands! He is amazing with cuts. I have friends who have traveled up to 5 hours for his haircuts for years and when I heard he was finally just blocks from me I gave him a try. His specialty is Brazilian Blowouts and I tried it the first time I saw him. It was incredible. I didn't need a flatiron for months! He's also done amazing things with my color too. The only downside is that cloning isn't legal. We need more Benito's in the world! Lol. He splits his time between Holland Michigan and Chicago. His schedule is great for me since my days off are usually at the beginning of the week and it's rare to find a (good) salon open on Sundays and Mondays. If you can work around Benito's crazy schedule you will NOT be disappointed!

6.description: I was very disappointed in my color service that I went to Sally's and dyed over it the next day.  Knowing how dry my hair was, they decided putting bleach in my hair would get me the color I wanted. Terrible terrible mistake. Now my ends are just fried and keep falling off. A week before this, I was in to get low lights. Since I dyed my hair black previously they had to strip the color before putting in color. It came out to be a light brown/red color and Benito told me to come back in to get it toned/lightened-free of charge. The following week after several phone calls, one voicemail, and no call back I decide to just drop by.  They were not answering their phone, even trough the dial pad outside the building--I only got in because someone was walking out. I walked in and reminded him that he said I could get it toned, where he replied saying "toning won't work we'll have to bleach it." Without me knowing how terrible It would be for my hair I agreed. I was charged $80 for something that ruined my hair! Not only was it damaging, it was chunky and a yellow/orange brassy color. So disappointing. I put blonde in my hair last summer at a different salon and it turned out fine and not damaged. Sadly, I liked my cut the first time but will not be returning because of the color service and because of how hard it was to get ahold of them.

0.description: I really enjoyed my visit to SoHo. First, I had a car issue which got me 20 minutes late to me appointment but the owner promised to wait 30 mins before he would leave since I was his last client. When I got there, I was confused on how to get in but when I called the owner thought I was calling to tell him I was going to be even later and that he wouldn't stay. Since he sent that in a text, I couldn't get him on the phone I just figured out how to get up to the salon by myself. Parked right in front of the building, no problem, but then I had to be buzzed in, someone was leaving so I just snuck in, Inside, it's more clear. By the elevator the business names and floors are listed so I made my way up to the third floor and wandered around until I found the salon. After the difficulty getting inside, me running late and having a groupon, I prepared for a bad visit. I got the opposite. B (the owner) was friendly, talkative, and passionate about his businesses. I chopped 14 inches of my hair, which he straightened and measured so the hair could be used by others for extensions. Such a drastic cut didn't freak me out because he angled and styled it in a way that suits my face and is easy for a girl like me to pull off since I can't style hair.Everyone says my hair look better now and think with or without the groupon this place is a find.

5.description: I used a groupon that my friend gave me.  I requested on my reservation for Sydney because of the great reviews she had on yelp.  Love my haircut by Sydney!!!  I can't wait to come back for my next one.

13.description: I had a really great experience here. Finding my way into the building was a little confusing, but once you get inside the salon, it feels totally hip and professional. Benito is very sweet and gave me a really terrific cut, explaining what he was doing every step of the way. I found my way here via Groupon, but for once the Groupon scheme actually works - I will gladly return and pay full price.

11.description: I met Sydney Williams through a groupon when my stylist was unable to do my hair.  She trimmed, conditioned and styled thus leaving me with lush, sexy hair!  She is my new go-to girl and does a mean Brazilian blowout! Check out Soho Atelier and book with Sydney Williams!

8.description: I purchased a Groupon for the Brazilian Blowout Treatment.   I absolutely loved my service, Benito (what a treat!), Gunther (his dog-so cute and well behaved!) and the results (smoothe 'Victoria Secret' Hair.)  I can't wait to try him for a haircut- he gave me the most incredible, effortless blowdry.  It's been 3 months since my service  and  my hair is still extra smoothe! You can't beat that... Although the space itself is this gorgeous, industrial-urban design, it's a bit of a hike for me.  That's my ONLY downfall which has NOTHING to do with his skills or expertise (THAT IS 5 STARS WORTHY!), It was just farther than im used to traveling. I guess I can put that aside for Benito though :)

14.description: Benitzio (sorry If I spelled that wrong) is amazing! He cut my hair and styled it and I think it might be the best hair cut I've ever had. Next time I will go for a brazillian low out!

7.description: What a superb experience! From the moment I walked in, Benito made me feel very comfortable and gave me full attention  (even in a late evening Saturday appointment). He has over 15 years of experience and have worked with top celebrity hairstylists around the world and performed in hair shows across the U.S. His energy is contagious and his talent outstanding! I got a haircut as I never had in Chicago and I'll definitely be returning! West Town is very lucky to have such a hipster salon and amazing hairstylist!

12.description: This shop is great!  Jared in particular is willing to answer any questions and show you around, which makes finding what you want simple and easy.  The prices are also pretty reasonable, and they have some sale items which are affordable.

7.description: I have been coming to this shop since I moved to Chicago three years ago. The gentlemen who work here are always very friendly and extremely helpful. Used a check in and got twenty percent off my items. Extremely happy with service and my products purchased each time!

19.description: Friendly peeps and good selection.  Very kewl stuff in here!  Thanks for opening up in my back yard:) !

1.description: This place is a scam. Insanely low quality. A hookah I bought from there broke within an hour after I bought it and I've own hookahs before I know how to care for them. Scam artists.

2.description: Probably one of the most expensive places in Chicago to buy any form of tobacco or tobacco paraphernalia. Be that as it may, they are open till 2am in case you need that emergency roll of charcoal for your hookah. I love and hate them. Screw you. Thanks.

9.description: They do NOT stand behind their products, and they DO NOT take care of their customers, they wont tell you this when you buy things from them, but the WILL NOT take returns for defective products.  BUYER BE WARE when going in here!!!!11-27-12Its amazing that he took the time to write all that, but would not take the time and care to make his customers happy.  I had the product for a total of 36 days when it stopped working, so his suggestion of "quite some time" should be taken with a grain of salt.   This forum is for all of us to get REAL peoples views on businesses.  So please take his response with a HUGE GRAIN OF SALT, in fact, you better use the whole shaker!   Because he NEVER offered to help me in any way with the manufacturer!  IF they only cared that much!BUYERS STILL BEWARE!!!!  and bring your own salt...and Jared... I did as I said I would, let the Yelpers know how people get treated when purchasing from the store you work at, so I hardly thing that is berating you.12-13-12Thank you Jared for posting that info, I called Iolite and then shipped the unit to them for repairs.  I hope they take care of it.  Thanks for doing the research and getting me their info for me to call them.

6.description: Buyer beware! Was sold an ecig battery. Looked it up later, and realized I was charged double than online pricing. The battery stopped working and they refused to replace it. The other item I bought had additional items withheld per the online offering. This man clearly took advantage of me. I will never return.

18.description: This place is run by a bunch of idiots. Do not go here, especially if you're in any kind of a hurry. As in, you have a life worth more than spending 20 minutes buying a pack of cigarettes. These guys are probably stoned out of their minds, which is cool, but don't screw up everything with something so basic.When you accidentally charged me 41.14 for a pack of cigarettes, and I NOTICED THE MISTAKE, there's a problem. Then when you say that you can't even refund it yourself and you have to call the manager to show you how to punch the three buttons, I know you're an idiot. THEN, when you ring me back up for the 14.14 and charge my account again, instead of refunding me the 27.00 difference like a sensible human would, I'm really pissed.Oh? And I won't get the money back until 3 business days at the earliest? Why, thanks, you exasperating moron. Praise the lord I had just gotten paid or i would be asking you to pay my overdraft fees, too.You know, I wouldn't have been so irritated if they had been even slightly apologetic about it. They didn't even care. Not even a free lighter. I was PISSED. Bottom line: being a dumb stoner is fine, but not if you tie up 40 dollars for my weekend and half a week later. That's unacceptable to me. Their service is pathetic to say the least, and they can't work a credit card machine. Hire an orangutan. At least it'll look good while doing these moron's jobs.

10.description: The Journey3 I bought was $20 more than online. I realize you can't compete with online retailers but $20 over is a bit excessive.

13.description: This place is fantastic! the staff was great, first time in the store and I come out with goodies!!! the guy behind the counter knew what he was talking about and he even ran all the way to the damen blue line stop because of my stupidity I left a item in the store. I highly recommend going to this place just to check it out.

16.description: I see a lot of negative reviews here - thought I should throw my $.02 in...I've only been in here once, but the guy behind the counter was helpful and polite. They didn't have a certain kind of papers I was looking for but he said he'd order them for me. If you don't like the prices, try to bargain with them. Most head shops are willing to work with you on the prices - especially if you're buying a few things. And to the people with credit card purchase issues - BRING CASH. Who shops at a head shop with their debit card? There are 57 ATM's near the North/Damen/Milwaukee intersection - use them. If you pay cash you have a better chance at talking them down on price too.They had a great selection of papers and some decent glass, and they even carry Roor products ("high"-end stoner-ware, heh). Grinders, lighters, all types of stuff in here.Those that have rated this place low - I think your expectations were unrealistic perhaps? For example, when I go to Potbellys and the people behind the counter don't make my food exactly how I asked... I just chalk it up to the fact that they work in a sandwich shop. It must suck to work there, and it must suck to have no other job options. And they must not have any other job options because if they did, why the hell would they still work at a fast food joint? In other words, have some compassion. Not everyone is as smart/perfect as "you" are. Oh and since this is the only head shop in the area, be thankful you have somewhere to shop when you need glass/papers/etc.It's not the greatest place I've ever bought from, but it's far from the worst. And given the location, they probably deal with a bunch of drunk idiots day in and day out, so a little politeness and patience and kindness probably goes a long way no?

17.description: I've only been here once, but from my experience the girl working was very cold, rude and uninterested in helping us. She seemed like she had better things to do then just ring us up and send us on our way. I'd consider going again and browsing, but the customer service really needs to be changed.

15.description: Great little smoke shop. Good selection of tobacco. Nice dude that works there too. He gave me a discount my first visit.

0.description: I honestly do NOT understand how this place has such a low star rating.I LOVE this place.Personally, I've never been a huge smoker. But when it comes to hookah, I can hardly resist, and I have been wanting one of my own for a long time.I found this place on a casual walkabout, and noticed the hookah selection was pretty good, and not terribly priced (though still too much for me to just nonchalantly purchase one). The medium-sized hookah were about $60-70, and the size was perfect for my needs, since i don't need one that's terribly big.Upon going in on another walkabout, they were having a hookah sale, and all their medium-sized hookah were 40-50 dollars. Score!I bought a very nice, medium-sized hookah for $40, then got a couple different flavors of shisha and some quick-light charcoals. Overall, i spent about $60-65. VERY fair price, if you ask me.I recommend this place to anyone who likes hookah; there is an excellent selection of shisha from many different brands, and some are imported from the Middle-east (and are delicious). Now, I'm a real stickler with customer service, too. And the management has always been very helpful and polite. Sometimes they seem to be out of stock of the more popular flavors, but If there is a specific flavor you like that's not available, the management is ALWAYS prepared to order it and have it available for you as soon as possible. Definitely come here. I haven't ever been sorry!

5.description: The first time I went to Ash's, I thought they were a decent smoke shop with average prices and an average selection of products. I bought a few little things, they threw in a free lighter, everything was all good. Then I made a larger purchase there- I bought 2 matching Boom Reload vaporizers, at $80 each. I was unsure of them at first, seeing as I had never heard of the brand, but the staff at Ash's assured me they were high quality, and that they sold them all the time because of how popular they were. What I should've asked was how often people return them. Because when I got home that night and tried out my new toy, I was so disappointed. To be frank, these vaporizers are garbage. I put a pinch of dry herb in its corresponding chamber- all that came out was smoke, NOT VAPOR. It torched my goods, smelt like burning plastic, and the battery took 4 hours to charge, and then died after 20 minutes of being on. Now, I understand that most of this is the fault of the manufacturer. I'm not blaming Ash's for the vape not working. However, when I called them asking about returning it, all I received was attitude and a no return policy that no one warned me about when I made the purchase.They don't tell you this when you buy something, but they only offer exchanges on defective products that haven't been used. THEY DO NOT OFFER REFUNDS EVEN IF THEY SELL YOU BROKEN MERCHANDISE. He wouldn't even do a refund for the vape I never opened. He told me to forget about the one I used once- they won't do anything for you once it's been used. I politely asked how someone is supposed to know if a product is defective or not unless they used it first, and that was when the person on the phone (the same man who sold me the vaporizers) became confrontational and rude, and refused to speak about it any more. I was told if I wanted to say anything more on the matter, I had to come into the store. I thought that that was fair, until he hung up on me as I began to ask their about their hours. Excuse my french but that was when I realized this dude was a total dick. Overall, if you're looking to stop in and buy some papers or a little pipe, you should be fine. However if you're making a larger purchase, you're better off taking your business elsewhere. Because when you get home and shit hits the fan and your new stuff just doesn't work, THEY WILL NOT HELP YOU. Very very disappointing.

11.description: I hate places like this . There only charging so much because they figure they can get it because of there awesome location in a nice neighborhood.the stuff they sell is not worth the price.

8.description: Staff was friendly and they had a decent selection at fair prices. Nice if you're looking for something simple. Make sure to check in for 20% off!

3.description: This is one of the best smoke shops in the city.  This should be your 1st & only stop for all of your smoking needs!  Highly recommended!

14.description: Ash's smoke shop & hookah bar is the bomb-diggety bomb!  They have the best selection of hookah tobacco I've ever seen.  They have flavors I've never seen before... I mean they have triple apple and melon, but have you ever had caramel macchiato or key lime pie flavored tobacco?  They must have like 40 different flavors.If you're into smoking at home, they have a bunch of hookahs, but my favorite are their really beautiful glass pipes.  They have this one that has FIVE CHAMBERS! I mean, really?!? They even have a pipe that is a beautiful elephant that stands up... turn it over and there's the business end.Ash and the guys there are really helpful and friendly... make sure to check this place out if you're into any kind of smoke.I can't wait till they get the back room open with the couches and flatscreen tvs, this place is gonna be off the hook(ah).Rock on guys, can't wait to come back when I return to Chicago!

4.description: I went here today to buy a cigar and it was just awful. It took forever to light and it was just wrapped horribly. Not again.

3.description: This was such a great experience!  Veronica was encouraging and supportive to everyone, including those with limited art experience. We had wine, the Executive Director brought in delicious food, there was music and all in all a wonderful evening. There are a lot of BYOB art spaces in the city, but I do not know any other where 100% of the proceeds go to supporting art programs for youth, so not only do we get to have fun painting and drinking but also you get to do a good deed for youth!

1.description: If you are looking for a fun-filled night with great people, great music, great food and a creative environment..then this is the spot. I loved the relaxed atmosphere. I am a novice when it comes to painting, but the instructor made it stress-free and fun. I really felt as if my creative spirit could fly free! I am definitely going to return (especially because proceeds of this program go towards the youth art program at YSP---a great cause).

2.description: Great food, fun music, pleasant crowd, and your favorite wine.Plus a studio artist to guide you through an art activity, all for charity for less than you would spend out on dinner.Bring a friend, some wine and check it out :-)

0.description: Great instructor.  Unlike most BYOB painting classes, we were able to use mix media (image cut outs and paint).  Its definitely worth exploring your creativity here and knowing your money is going to a great cause makes it even better (Youth Service Project).   FYI they are building the space out, so every time you come you can first hand see where some of your funding is going.

29.description: Really good flavors. Yum!

42.description: Ok I'm a Ukie "Ukrainian" and have been eating Pierogies as long as I could rememberI was never a fan of Meat Pierogies Homemade or else where. Until I had them on the Pierogi Wagon.(Most meat Pierogies that I tried. have a Liver flavor / Iron Flavor.)But not these they are some of the best I have ever had. The sauerkraut and mushrooms are also very good. as with everything else on the menu. I have been a fan of Pierogi Wagon for some time now. and now that theirs a restaurant. I will stop by as much as possible and will recommend as many friends to try this place.If you want some Authentic Polish food you have to stop by here and have a plateI can't wait to see what else will be added to the menu. Some nice simple Polish Chicken Noodle Soup will be nice on a cold day.I would like to see some Chamomile Tea on the menu but that is no big deal and a easy fix.This place will fill you up and satisfy your taste Buds.

23.description: Not only the best pierogi and polish food I've ever had (and I loved Kiev in NYC so many years ago), but this may have been the best family brunch experience I've had since moving to Chicago! Lovely staff, amazing food, simple and welcoming environment. My kids loved everything about it too! We sampled and shared everything, including some dessert pastries, and loved it all! I can see we'll be back again and again!

8.description: This place is amazing and consistently delicious. I've tried nearly everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. They also have a great selection of paczkis and baked goods.  In general, it's a super cute place and a great addition to the Humboldt Park neighborhood. My only negative experience thus far has been going to grab a snack at 2:30 (they close at 3PM) and was told that they were only offering takeout. I am a paying customer and wanted to sit down and eat and came in during their posted hours only to be told that I have to take my food to go. It was just tacky. They should adjust their hours if they don't want to have people in the restaurant past a certain time. Really unprofessional.

31.description: We're in for a cold winter, if November is any indication. The good news is you now have the perfect winter meal courtesy of the Polak Eatery. These pierogis, and an accompanying sausage, will bring a smile to your face and warm your tummy. Delish! More please!

34.description: Cool space, super-friendly staff, and excellent pierogi selection (with all the free toppings you want!)

16.description: Had sauerkraut and potato cheese pierogi-very good. Sauerkraut side, was done perfectly. Polish sausage was generous portion and tasted great. Got a raspberry paczki  to go, and it was good until I noticed something odd on the bottom, looked green/mold like so not sure if moisture got to it underneath.  If I had been in the store, I would have told them, of course, but I took the paczki to go. Regardless, because of the good service and quality of the other items,  I would go back and try other items on the menu as well!  Parking was a bit of a challenge with the road construction on California, but that will likely be finished soon!.  I am willing to go  back and try again, even with the paczki issue.  I

13.description: I love supporting delicious locally owned restaurants like this one! But as for Earth's standards...Positives: The Polak Eatery serves their food on washable, reusable dishes with silverware. Negatives: They forgot about washable mugs and cups! The Polak Eatery serves drinks in plastic, disposable cups with tops and straws and their coffee in wax paper cups.  Please continue your good practices by serving drinks in washable cups, talk about unnecessary waste!Additionally: In response to Barbara T.'s note that stated: "Referring to a POLISH restaurant as POLACK is really tacky. I would take my coffee in the paper cup before I would insult a nationality."This restaurant was called the 'Polak Eatery' before they changed it to 'Pierogi Street'. If you feel strongly about it, please contact Pierogi Street Directly. I am just interested in positively effecting the environment. Thanks!

11.description: I liked the perogies, they were very tasty. I tried the "Hungry" portion, 8 for $11. I really enjoyed them, my only complaint, they were $11, make it 10 or 11 perogies for the same price. Otherwise, mighty nice place in the neighborhood.

39.description: Suuuuuper happy this cafe opened up! love the ambiance, the friendly staff, the fresh intelligentsia coffee...and mosf of all **drumroll** THE PIEROGIES are on-point! i tried the caramelized onion & mushroom, Potato & cheddar, spinach & feta. All delicious and a must have, i was never a big pierogi person, but was so delightfully surprised by the goodness of theirs. They mentioned adding on more items on the menu so im looking fwd to that. Picked up the giant cookie was great too. Love it! Good vibes all around!

37.description: I came cross Polak Eatery via Yelp and figured this place was worth trying out. I'm so glad my boyfriend and I did. We went in late Sunday morning for a "mini-brunch." We weren't starving, but wanted a little nosh to hold through for a late lunch ahead. We decided to order four pierogies ($6) and a breakfast plate (two eggs, piece of kielbasa, two pierogies) ($6). For the pierogies, they allow you to mix and match flavors (braised beef, cheddar potato, spinach & ricotta, kraut & mushroom) and you can choose from a variety of fixings such as sour cream, caramelized onions, sauerkraut, and bacon (thankfully it comes with!). We ordered the cheddar potato and braised beef pierogies. The cheddar potato was perfect because it wasn't overly cheesy or salty. Flavor wise, I liked the braised beef, but it was slightly drier than I had hoped. It wasn't bad enough to warrant a lower rating. The pierogies were nicely prepared -- much better than those frozen ones I used to buy as a child from aisle 3 in the supermarket. Many cultures have a version of a dumpling, but these most reminded me of Chinese potstickers. Slightly crispy or firm on the outside and very moist and soft in the inside. The toppings all work whether individually or all together. They're not random; they show that thought was put into this. The sunny-side up eggs were nicely cooked; runny yolks are always a joy to eat. The kielbasa was tasty and I think it was pan-fried because it had a good crunch outside.Polak Eatery's decor is minimal. There is a mural presumably of Poland's landscape in fifty shades of gray (not the book, but the color). There is plenty of room to move around, but with limited seating. Having said that, I think they could probably squeeze in a couple more tables and chairs. So far, since the business is new, it was full, but not packed. Most lovely was the fact that the business owner, Damien, came by to greet my boyfriend and me as we ate. It always helps to have the owner come out and greet customers. That's how a small business is run. Overall, I recommend this spot. Hearty food, but not anything to make you feel regretful.

0.description: Two main reasons:Off Season PaczkisNutella PaczkisAlso, great Pierogi selection! Definitely going back to try different parts of their menu....and more paczkis.

38.description: Such a great idea.  Great food, nice people.  Wonderful addition to the California corridor.

27.description: I was excited to come here, having been raised in a polish family and missing the homemade pierogis I grew up on. The soup was warm and comforting and the pierogi were prepared right, making up for the lack of authentic fillings but the spicy onions reminded me of dinner at my grandma's house. The space is adorable but it was so cold that I had to eat with my coat on and it was one of the warmer days we've had lately. As a result, my food was quickly cold as well, the side sausage was barely room temperature. I wish I could say I'd be back but polish cuisine is cold weather food and I'd rather not enjoy it actually IN the cold.

32.description: Amazing! Best pierogi branch in Chicago. Ask for the spinach or meat pierogies. Very good!

44.description: WOW!!! Never been a pierogi person at all, but was next door at Humboldt House and starving and thought, "ehh what the heck". The place looks really cool! Walked in and ordered one of each pierogi and all the toppings as well. It arrived at our table moments later and MAN were they good! As I am eating, some really sweet polish women in the corner offer me some wine-- it turns out today is the grand opening! This place is a really cool concept developed by the guys behind perogi wagon. These perogis are delicious!! Hands down the best perogis I have ever had, not to mention they have great polish sausage as well. I went back and ordered another round of perogis and threw a sausage on the order this time. Good choice, Alexis, good choice. Anyways this place is fantastic the guys are so nice and the food is amazing. What a great addition to Humboldt! Welcome to the neighborhood guys!!

24.description: I love supporting delicious locally owned restaurants like this one! But as for Earth's standards...Positives: The Polak Eatery serves their food on washable, reusable dishes with silverware. Negatives: They forgot about washable mugs and cups! The Polak Eatery serves drinks in plastic, disposable cups with tops and straws and their coffee in wax paper cups.  Please continue your good practices by serving drinks in washable cups, talk about unnecessary waste!Additionally: In response to Barbara T.'s note that stated: "Referring to a POLISH restaurant as POLACK is really tacky. I would take my coffee in the paper cup before I would insult a nationality."This restaurant was called the 'Polak Eatery' before they changed it to 'Pierogi Street'. If you feel strongly about it, please contact Pierogi Street Directly. I am just interested in positively effecting the environment. Thanks!

7.description: Enjoyed them very much! Keep coming to Rogers Park!

40.description: So never got to catch the truck. I was excited to see them open a bricks and mortar location right here in Humboldt Park. Went over to get some breakfast and found a clean, (important) modern little cafe that I was very impressed with. Got to speak with one of the owners and loved the enthusiasm and committement to the community. I always like to support new business and especially for young first timers working to better themselves and their community. The food was great! Had the eggs cheese and potato pierogi and a sausage all for $6, can't beat that! Also got an order of the other pierogi offerings and loved each of them. Generous amount of bacon and onions and nice fresh pierogi. I'm sure with customer input and experience the Polak Eatery will only improve and be a regular spot for the neighbors.

30.description: The food is amazing I was speechless how good the food was. Come try this place out and recommend it to all your friends.

1.description: Tried pierogis out of their food truck. I didn't like a single thing. I really don't get the hype. I paid $11 for 2 potato and cheese, 2 braised beef, and 2 spinach pierogis, and a sausage on the side. I got all the toppings they offered except sour cream but that still couldn't save the meal for me. The food was cold which I won't hold against them but it could be impacting the flavor. The pierogis just didn't taste savory and all the stuffing had about the same consistency. How is it that potato and cheese, and braised beef, and spinach all look the same consistency wise ? If I get an empanada and take a bite, I will see strips of chicken and actual chunks of potato. The insides for all of them just looked like compacted mush. I wish I had taken a picture to better explain myself but really I took two bites and threw all my food away.

9.description: As soon as I found out there was a new place in Chicago that sold pierogies near me, I immediately added it to my list of places to try.  The Polak Eatery did not disappoint! I wasn't particularly hungry when I went in, so my boyfriend and I split the 6 mix-and-match, getting 3 cheddar potatoes, then one of each of the other kind.  While I didn't try the meat one, the other 3 were all delicious.  The best part is: they come with all the fixins-- sour cream, spicy grilled onions, bacon, and sauerkraut...at no added charge! The only real complaint I had was the size.  These are some small little nuggets of goodness...two bites and they're gone.  I easily could've eaten an order of 6 by myself, since we didn't order sandwiches.They also serve keilbasa (after 10 years of not eating meat, this is the one thing I still crave) as well as a few other sandwich options, if pierogies alone won't tide you over.  But the real motivation for coming in this particular weekend was the paczkis.  They weren't the best I've ever had (not enough jelly...although can there ever really be enough jelly?!) but they hit the spot.  The restaurant itself is really cute and not hard to get to at all if you're in Humboldt or Wicker Park.  I'm definitely looking forward to coming back here and taking my family next time they're in town.But let me state for the record: While these pierogies may be really freaking good, none will ever be better than my mom's. But she lives in Ohio and does not own a restaurant, so Polak Eatery may just be your best option...unless you come to my house on Christmas.

26.description: Best polish food I've ever had. Get the cheddar potato and spinach ricotta pierogies with every topping and a sausage on the side. It will get you going.

25.description: Was excited to try this one out but regretfully it's the same old pierogies/Polish food. When will Chicago open up a gourmet Polish restaurant? Also what's up with the name POLAK?. It might mean "Polish person" in Polish - but has a very negative meaning in the U.S.!

12.description: Not only the best pierogi and polish food I've ever had (and I loved Kiev in NYC so many years ago), but this may have been the best family brunch experience I've had since moving to Chicago! Lovely staff, amazing food, simple and welcoming environment. My kids loved everything about it too! We sampled and shared everything, including some dessert pastries, and loved it all! I can see we'll be back again and again!

21.description: This place is amazing and consistently delicious. I've tried nearly everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. They also have a great selection of paczkis and baked goods.  In general, it's a super cute place and a great addition to the Humboldt Park neighborhood. My only negative experience thus far has been going to grab a snack at 2:30 (they close at 3PM) and was told that they were only offering takeout. I am a paying customer and wanted to sit down and eat and came in during their posted hours only to be told that I have to take my food to go. It was just tacky. They should adjust their hours if they don't want to have people in the restaurant past a certain time. Really unprofessional.

17.description: Sorry grandma, Pierogi Street makes the best Polish food ever! Just had one of every Pierogi and the Polish sausage. This is not the all you can eat stuff. Very tasty. The staff who I believe are the owners are very friendly. Nice place all around. Don't let construction on California scare you away, this place is worth a visit.

10.description: A good friend introduced me to Polish food a few years ago. I have tried many places and I was not satisfied. As a treat I decided to take my family to this restaurant. We ordered two platters of assorted pierogi, a sausage sandwich and an extra sausage with a side of pickles. Our order came with an assortment of toppings. Our waiter was extremely kind and attentive to our needs. I tried their lemonade and it was delicious. My daughter decided to do a lemonade/ice tea mix and she said it taste great. I will be back one night without the children because this place is BYOB.

5.description: I can't seem to find myself in the right place at the right time to experience Pierogi Wagon, so when I heard the same people were opening a brick and mortar location, I was super excited.Yes, I'm Polish, and grew up between Chicago and Poland, so I'm pretty well versed in the pierogi and kielbasa arena. I dragged my friends to the grand opening as a pit-stop before our drive to the North Shore. When we arrived I learned that neither of them had ever had pierogi before - unacceptable when you live in Chicago! It was around 10:30 am. I ordered the breakfast entree with a couple pierogi, eggs, and polish sausage. Everything was delicious and my friends thoroughly enjoyed their meal but the sausage (!) was really phenomenal. I almost ordered another. The walls lack decor but I'm sure that will change in the coming weeks. Lots of reclaimed wood, grays and warm neutral colors make this place modern, welcoming, and pleasant. Service was above average, so no complaints there. Everyone was super helpful in explaining the relatively simple menu. The icing on top of the cake was that the coffee was really good.Cheap prices, delicious food, great atmosphere, and exceptional staff will drive Polak Eatery to success.

35.description: I love this place. This neighborhood needed a casual spot to grab a quick bite and this place more than fits the bill. The food is simple but really tasty. The staff doesn't make you feel dumb if you don't know what a pierogi or kielbasa is. It's clean and they serve food on real plates with real silverware. I'm quickly becoming a regular!

19.description: I live really close to this place and I love it! You really can't go wrong when picking a perogi, or an open faced sandwich. They have a lot of seating and very quick service, and the staff has always been attentive. My favorite perogis are probably the spinach and mushroom ones.

28.description: As soon as I found out there was a new place in Chicago that sold pierogies near me, I immediately added it to my list of places to try.  The Polak Eatery did not disappoint! I wasn't particularly hungry when I went in, so my boyfriend and I split the 6 mix-and-match, getting 3 cheddar potatoes, then one of each of the other kind.  While I didn't try the meat one, the other 3 were all delicious.  The best part is: they come with all the fixins-- sour cream, spicy grilled onions, bacon, and sauerkraut...at no added charge! The only real complaint I had was the size.  These are some small little nuggets of goodness...two bites and they're gone.  I easily could've eaten an order of 6 by myself, since we didn't order sandwiches.They also serve keilbasa (after 10 years of not eating meat, this is the one thing I still crave) as well as a few other sandwich options, if pierogies alone won't tide you over.  But the real motivation for coming in this particular weekend was the paczkis.  They weren't the best I've ever had (not enough jelly...although can there ever really be enough jelly?!) but they hit the spot.  The restaurant itself is really cute and not hard to get to at all if you're in Humboldt or Wicker Park.  I'm definitely looking forward to coming back here and taking my family next time they're in town.But let me state for the record: While these pierogies may be really freaking good, none will ever be better than my mom's. But she lives in Ohio and does not own a restaurant, so Polak Eatery may just be your best option...unless you come to my house on Christmas.

3.description: Crispy perogi... Yum. My favorite flavor is the spinach. I love how they allow you to mix and match. An order comes with two sides. Not a big fan of their kraut. Menu is minimal without being sparse.  Great service: order up front and take a seat. The server even returned to ask if there's anything else needed. The pretzels looked delish. Cool interior. Love the neutral colored murals.

33.description: Such a great addition to the neighborhood! Not only is the food amazing - the staff is great too. The menu is expanding...can't wait to try the potato pancakes. If you haven't stopped by yet you are missing out!

43.description: I can't seem to find myself in the right place at the right time to experience Pierogi Wagon, so when I heard the same people were opening a brick and mortar location, I was super excited.Yes, I'm Polish, and grew up between Chicago and Poland, so I'm pretty well versed in the pierogi and kielbasa arena. I dragged my friends to the grand opening as a pit-stop before our drive to the North Shore. When we arrived I learned that neither of them had ever had pierogi before - unacceptable when you live in Chicago! It was around 10:30 am. I ordered the breakfast entree with a couple pierogi, eggs, and polish sausage. Everything was delicious and my friends thoroughly enjoyed their meal but the sausage (!) was really phenomenal. I almost ordered another. The walls lack decor but I'm sure that will change in the coming weeks. Lots of reclaimed wood, grays and warm neutral colors make this place modern, welcoming, and pleasant. Service was above average, so no complaints there. Everyone was super helpful in explaining the relatively simple menu. The icing on top of the cake was that the coffee was really good.Cheap prices, delicious food, great atmosphere, and exceptional staff will drive Polak Eatery to success.

2.description: I actually went to their food truck at the Bucktown Arts Festival on Saturday. At the food truck you can get 4, 7 or 9 pierogis for different price points. Since I just needed a snack I got the 4 for $7. They were offering two meat based and two vegetarian options. My friend got the spinach and cheese while I got the braised beef. You have your option of toppings so I got the sauerkraut and my friend had the spicy sautéed onions. Both were really delicious. The onions were indeed spicy but added great flavor to the pierogi. The sauerkraut I got had flax and cumin seeds in it, and wasn't over powering with vinegar. The beef was nice and juicy and had the right mix of seasoning. With a bit of sour cream for each of us we had the right combination. I would love to eat here again and try different toppings. They gave a coupon to their store so I'm hoping to come back and give it a try.

18.description: Very good.  I had each of the five pierogi offered with all of the sides. Though the spinach was my favorite, they were all very tasty. I also had an oatmeal and chocolate chip cookie and Cheerwine. I'll be back.

41.description: Delicious pillows of goodness , the variety is enjoyable , the atmosphere is cozy and welcoming ,hurry to enjoy ....... Just delightful

4.description: I came cross Polak Eatery via Yelp and figured this place was worth trying out. I'm so glad my boyfriend and I did. We went in late Sunday morning for a "mini-brunch." We weren't starving, but wanted a little nosh to hold through for a late lunch ahead. We decided to order four pierogies ($6) and a breakfast plate (two eggs, piece of kielbasa, two pierogies) ($6). For the pierogies, they allow you to mix and match flavors (braised beef, cheddar potato, spinach & ricotta, kraut & mushroom) and you can choose from a variety of fixings such as sour cream, caramelized onions, sauerkraut, and bacon (thankfully it comes with!). We ordered the cheddar potato and braised beef pierogies. The cheddar potato was perfect because it wasn't overly cheesy or salty. Flavor wise, I liked the braised beef, but it was slightly drier than I had hoped. It wasn't bad enough to warrant a lower rating. The pierogies were nicely prepared -- much better than those frozen ones I used to buy as a child from aisle 3 in the supermarket. Many cultures have a version of a dumpling, but these most reminded me of Chinese potstickers. Slightly crispy or firm on the outside and very moist and soft in the inside. The toppings all work whether individually or all together. They're not random; they show that thought was put into this. The sunny-side up eggs were nicely cooked; runny yolks are always a joy to eat. The kielbasa was tasty and I think it was pan-fried because it had a good crunch outside.Polak Eatery's decor is minimal. There is a mural presumably of Poland's landscape in fifty shades of gray (not the book, but the color). There is plenty of room to move around, but with limited seating. Having said that, I think they could probably squeeze in a couple more tables and chairs. So far, since the business is new, it was full, but not packed. Most lovely was the fact that the business owner, Damien, came by to greet my boyfriend and me as we ate. It always helps to have the owner come out and greet customers. That's how a small business is run. Overall, I recommend this spot. Hearty food, but not anything to make you feel regretful.

6.description: Had a snack size of the Potato and cheese pierogi today at Daley Plaza from the Pierogi food truck.  I love a good Pierogi and was really hoping this would be, unfortunately it just wasn't great, just good.  They were lukewarm and although a great size and topped with free toppings, I chose sour cream and bacon, the bacon saved these since the inside of the perogi was a little on the dry side.  I'm hoping it was just an off day for this truck and wouldn't hold it against the brick and mortar location but just can't rave about these Pierogi's :(

22.description: It has been a great pleasure to watch Damien and his colleagues build this wonderful business from nothing except determination and an unflagging commitment to quality.  I enjoy the food regularly from the wagon and have been to the restaurant a couple of times.  The pierogis are the best, and I have real Polish people to vouch for them.  The peppery caramel used onions that garnish the pierogis show that attention to detail, it takes lots of time and careful preparation to get onions THAT good. The meat pierogi also deserve special attention--not just boring ground meat, but flavorful pot roast cooked until totally tender.  Looking for a unique food to bring to a potluck? I recommend getting in touch with Pierogi Street. You will be a hit!

15.description: Food truck turned b&m. Food: stupid good. Simple and done so well it warms my soul. Beef is the star pierogi Decor: supper food trucks hipster style. Think it fits perfectly.People: so very nice and helpful. Seemed to really love what she does. Byob I think

20.description: Food truck turned b&m. Food: stupid good. Simple and done so well it warms my soul. Beef is the star pierogi Decor: supper food trucks hipster style. Think it fits perfectly.People: so very nice and helpful. Seemed to really love what she does. Byob I think

36.description: I'm super happy this gem opened up in my hood. Need more great places like this. The pierogis were delicious, service fast and great ambiance. Please don't let this place leave us. Go eat here!!! $6 pierogi breakfast plate? Yes brunch please!We had 12 pierogis (4 of each flavor - cheddar, beef, and mushroom/sauerkraut) and a sausage. $20 for a fast delicious dinner for 2!

14.description: I found this place by mistake and I'm so glad I did. It's such a cute restaurant and perfect if your not in the mood for a big meal. My friend and I went and had a great experience. The food was great and the service was really nice. Very chill place.

58.description: I've had seven tattoos here. All by Zach. I drove three and a half hours each way to get them done. There will be more in the near future. I won't go anywhere else. The place is clinically clean. You'll know that came to the right place, immediately.

56.description: Not a whole lot new to add, but I wanted to give Zach some more love. I went in this last weekend with my brother and sister to get our "sibling tattoo". Though it wasn't anything incredibly unique (feather with 3 birds), Zach took his time making sure it was what we wanted, but also, and this part I appreciated IMMENSELY, made sure we understood how it would look after 5 years. We wanted to add some writing, but to do so he needed to make it much larger than we had originally wanted, since the smaller writing would end up bleeding together after several years. I really appreciated that he made us realize that rather than letting us tattoo ourselves not fully evaluating the implications.I plan to go back and would recommend Deluxe, and Zach, to anyone!

29.description: Stephanie White was my artist. I sent her a rough sketch of what I wanted done and she cleaned it up and spent a lot of time on my idea making it perfect and I couldnt be happier with the final results. She is very nice and professional. I highly recommend this place to get your tattoos.

42.description: My last tattoo was about 8 years ago, in Savannah, GA. So when I decided it was time to get some new ink in this area, I asked some good friends where they acquired their fantastic ink. "Deluxe Tattoo" they said, and pointed me in the direction of the great Ben Wahhh. Ben was great to work with, from start to finish. Actually, I can't say that, because we're not finished, but... from start to mid point. =) I'll be coming back for more, don't worry. Anyway, we set up the initial consultation and I gave him my ideas, and we set a date some time in the future so I could save my pretty pennies for this piece. I am a woman with a budget, after all. Then, disaster struck, winter arrived and the annual furnace breakdown occurred. Ben was super understanding for my need to reschedule for, yet again, a date pretty far off in the future. By the time May rolled around, we had another consultation. For a minute I thought it had been so long that he had forgotten who I was and what I even wanted, but he had not! He even had my original pictures I had brought him 8 months earlier! We hammered out the details and I (impatiently) waited one week for the big day.  When I walked in the door, a walk in was going just ahead of me. Worry not, ladies and gents, because it was the fastest tattoo I've ever seen done, (and I assume it looked nice because the girl looked quite happy) and I was back in the chair in mere minutes. He showed me the amazing art he had drawn for my piece and I was blown away. Simply amazing. I'd show you a picture of it, but it's currently in that "peely" stage and I'm not going to let my skin healing mar Ben's reputation. Even in the state that it's in currently, (and also unfinished) I have gotten so many compliments on it. I know when it's completely colored in that I am going to have a piece that I will treasure always. You know because it's on my body permanently, but more importantly because it's fucking amazing. I had the chance to "people watch" the other artists and customers for the 3.5 hours I was in the chair, and all the artists seemed like cool people who would be able to give you a piece you're proud of. I watched one guy, whose name I didn't catch, pretty much freehand the most realistic elephant I have ever seen in my life.  This isn't to say Ben's not much for conversation, but I'm a socially awkward gal and totally suck at small talk, so I chose to spend my time checking out the art that covers the walls and  taking a peek at what other people were getting done. I guess I'm saying, unless you have any skills at running a conversation you're golden, but if you're a shy person like me, maybe it would behoove you to bring a book or something.I ramble. Anyway....check them out. Highly recommended.

23.description: Jason Longtin did my tattoo and I could not be happier with the outcome. Great place too. Very professional and clean.

47.description: Me my family and my friends have been coming here for years and they do outstanding work.  Ben the owner and my artist always takes care of me and does awesome work.  Wherever I go I always get asked where I get my work done because it is very detailed and stands out.  When you walk in it is very clean and someone will always take care of you.  They also have many great artists as well.

8.description: Dustin is the man! He has done an amazing job on my boyfriends sleeve and we couldn't be more impressed. He's extremely popular, so I suggest you get into him as soon as you can. The parlor itself is very clean and on close inspection, it looks as if everybody here does a good job. We have been in here at least 4 times and I have yet to find someone that is dissatisfied with their art. Also, please keep in mind that you are not allowed behind the counter unless you are being worked on. I personally like this rule as I could see it posing problems as far as proper sterilization and also it alleviates random people walking around, potentially messing up someone's tat.

31.description: My current artist is Jason Longtin. He is the only artist who has worked on my ink at Deluxe Tattoo - and though I would trust almost every artist employed here given their excellent portfolios - I will continue to get my ink done by Mr. Longtin, for as long as I can. His sketching is phenomenal and his outline and shadowing work is unlike anything I've ever seen. His attention to detail is eerily fascinating and his dedication to the job is outstanding. For my second inking, he took up on a cover-up that (too) many shied away from - and has not only done amazing work, but surpassed all expectations as well. Furthermore, he is always more than willing to listen to your ideas and concerns and will brainstorm with you until his design meets his standards and yours. Thanks Deluxe for being my ink home in Chicago! 'Til next time.XoXo

34.description: Bens done an amazing job of pulling together an A Team of tattoo professionals. The talent in the room was inspiring and my tattoo experience couldn't have been better.  Thanks Ben, see you again when I make it back to Chicago.

16.description: Got a tattoo here from Stephanie and had an awesome experience. The shop is clean and comfortable. Stephanie was easy going and accommodating from the day of the consultation. She worked with me very willingly on the design and the finished product looks absolutely gorgeous. I will absolutely be going back to her in the future.

13.description: Just got my first tattoo done by Bunny! I brought a rough idea of what I wanted and I said I want it more like this or like that, and Bunny did a sketch with which I was extremely happy and went with it! It's nothing intricate - just four words and a lip imprint - but I LOVE it.  Bunny was very professional, made me feel comfortable (guess he saw the fear in my eyes...) and made sure I was OK through out the process.  As for the price, since this is my first one, I don't have anything to compare to, but I thought $150 plus tip was a fair price for the experience, quality and service.  It helps that Bunny is a long haired, bearded eye candy!Thank you and I'll be back!!!

11.description: I had two of my tattoos done by Jim Little during Thanksgiving time. He is a talented artist and would actually listen to what tattoo you want then draw them up and give you different versions of it for you to pick. He is very patient and unlike other artists I've encountered, he is trustworthy and won't intimidate you if you are as timid as me. My friends think these two are the best tattoos I have (although I only have 3). Also the front desk's service is very nice and welcoming, and if you are a walk-in like me, the wait is not long at all, besides, it's totally worth it.  I'm definitely going back there.

39.description: This is hands down the best shop I have ever been to. It was a great atmosphere and all of the artists were very welcoming and friendly. I got my tattoo done by Bunny and he absolutely killed it. He was very engaging and professional. He is a great artist and far exceeded any expectations I had for this piece. I will definitely come back to Bunny for all of my tattoos in the future. I highly recommend Deluxe Tattoo.

37.description: My husband and I are long-time clients of Ben Wahhh. Ben is no BS and straight to the point. He will work with you on any design you want, and is willing to try new things (in which he will succeed). But he specializes in biomech so take advantage of that if you can. He works very quickly and efficiently, and isn't heavy-handed like some artists are. His tattoos always heal crisp and quick (providing you don't skimp on the aftercare, but that goes for any tattoo). I have tried other artists here and there but always go back to Ben and will probably do so until I'm old and gray(er).

0.description: Ok. Dustin Golden is amazing. I walked in for a tattoo and was immediately able to get in. Dustin drew up what I wanted and was very happy to work with me to ensure I liked what he had drawn. I have a few other tattoos and I have felt that some artists are judge mental of what you want to get done. Dustin is not. Not only that, he's amazingly talented. My marigold is AMAZING and I am definitely going to see him for any and all of my future tattoos. (Ps. He is honestly such a nice guy, which made my experience even better). Everything is clean, sanitary, and the staff (other than Dustin) are all friendly. I will definitely be back!!!And the picture- my tattoo is still healing. FYI.

38.description: Traveled 2  1/2 hours each way for 3 sessions with Ben.  He was able to transform my different ideas into a tattoo. Super accessible and easy to work with. Great artist.  While getting tattooed, I could see Ryan, Jim Little, Stephanie, and Zach working.  From little to pig pieces, everything was impeccable within the different styles.  Their interactions with the clients were smooth and pleasant judging by the clients' happy faces with the job.  Even though I always had an appointment scheduled, by the minute I stepped in the shop someone was asking if I was already helped.  Loved the music, got myself "headbanging" at times.  Bottom line... Deluxe Tattoo is a welcoming environment with real artists that can put ideas and feelings into tattoos.  Will definitely come back for more.

51.description: I had Jim Little for my first tattoo! And he was superb! He was nice and did a great job on my four inch writing quill tat. I had a nice convo with him during the process too and he was super awesome! Plan on coming back for another in the future :)

27.description: Dustin is the man! He has done an amazing job on my boyfriends sleeve and we couldn't be more impressed. He's extremely popular, so I suggest you get into him as soon as you can. The parlor itself is very clean and on close inspection, it looks as if everybody here does a good job. We have been in here at least 4 times and I have yet to find someone that is dissatisfied with their art. Also, please keep in mind that you are not allowed behind the counter unless you are being worked on. I personally like this rule as I could see it posing problems as far as proper sterilization and also it alleviates random people walking around, potentially messing up someone's tat.

32.description: Jason Vaughn is stellar. His work is perfect. He is a bit quiet but that is good. He works fast and is impeccable with his attention to detail and the colors he chooses.  Unfortunately he is relocating to LA in October. I will have to get in there for another before he leaves.

54.description: Best tattoo shop in Chicago hands down! I met with Ben a couple months ago for a consultation. He shot me straight and was very upfront with what he could and couldn't do. I find this refreshing, most places will always say yes and do what they can to take your cash. My tattoo was unique, Ben had to tattoo over some scar tissue from a long time ago. The design was executed flawlessly, it actually came out way better than I expected! The shop was in great condition and I loved the vibe between all the artist. It was an awesome distraction from the pain of the tattoo. This is the best place in Chicago without a doubt, I recommend everyone go to this shop!

48.description: I can't even begin to express my displeasure with Deluxe Tattoo. I walked in to have a tattoo done and my friend was already there. We spoke for a quick minute and then I stood at the counter with my ID and drawing out and no one even acknowledged my presence. Not wanting to be a rude person, I waited patiently and still no one approached me for over 20 minutes, even after an artist finished and charged another patron for her tattoo. I then asked an artist if it was too late for a walk in and the guy said probably. He then asked what I wanted and I showed him a series of phrases that were already printed out and ready to be traced and he responded that he had bad handwriting and had been working all day so it was probably too late. Then when I asked to go back with my friend I was told I was not allowed even though I had done it before! I have never been more frustrated with a place of business or felt more passive aggressive rude behavior directed towards me. I will NEVER step foot in that establishment again nor consciously recommend someone get work done there. My first tattoo there was handled by a traveling artist which I suppose  is why my experience was totally positive. You people need a solid lesson in how to treat your customers.

44.description: Out of all the tattoo shops in Chicago, this one came highly regarded and recommended by several people, among different groups of my friends. Walking into the shop, you will find a clean and sanitary studio with artists abound. They are customer service oriented and ensure that their guests are taken care of from the original consult to after care.My artist is Jason Vaughn. He has an amazing talent in art and tattooing and uses it well, creating exactly what you ask for using vibrant colors and careful precision. He is a very quick tattoo-giver, so you won't be spending extra money due to time. Now...when I get a tattoo, I know that I'm going to have this piece of art on my person for the rest of my life, so I greatly appreciate when my artist says it's time to stop. Additionally, I also understand that as much as I'd love to have my friends and family come back and sit there while needles are piercing my skin applying ink, well, besides being boring, it can be distracting to both me and the artist. In addition to being a health code thing, I appreciate the enforcement at the shop This is not your "run-of-the-mill" tattoo studio. This place is for the person that seriously understands what getting a tattoo means to them.The music playlist can use a bit of a make-over, however...but I tend to bring a pair of headphones and zone out to my own tunes...So, if you're looking for an amazing looking tattoo, you've found the right place - and Jason is your artist.

24.description: Super easy. My first tattoo was on the top of my foot (small, solid black). It took about 7 minutes and barely hurt at all. Customer service was good and all of the artists are very friendly. I'll be going back for my next one soon!

7.description: Been tattooed there a number of times - highly recommended.   Outstanding artists,  fun Shop and great management.  I like the whole process and business.

49.description: My experience at Deluxe was awesome! I got my first tattoo here with Stephanie and she was just wonderful. Really calmed my nerves and tended to all my needs. Not to mention her work alone was worth five stars for sure. The place was clean and smelled like a hospital. Which I guess is what you want from a tattoo shop. Only problem was the music....if you don't like metal bring your own tunes for sure! Otherwise I was superbly happy with my experience here.

40.description: I got my first tattoo done here a week ago. I did my research on tattoo shops in Chicago and from what I seen and heard, this is the place to go. I wasn't disappointed. Everyone was professional and really attentive. The shop was well managed and very pristine. Stephanie White worked on my tattoo and did a awesome job on the line work and blending. As an artist myself, I could tell she had a great eye for detail and really treated the piece as a work of art. This is the standard to which I will judge all other tattoo shops.

53.description: Stephanie White is phenomenal. She spent a lot of time fine tuning the tattoo I wanted. I wanted some words placed alongside of my tattoo I had emailed her in advance and after about an hour (and talking though the placement and the font) she came up with something I was really happy with. Plus, we used my handwriting so it made it even more personal. She was meticulous about the placement of it and making sure it was straight and in a place that later in life I would still like it. I picked her because I liked the way she had varying thickness of lines (different gauges of needles?) and the boldness of the color she used seemed to really pop in the photos she has online.  After sitting with her for 3.5 hours and learning more about what she completely does and how talented she is, she has some great water color tattoos. The bird she has posted is so good and completely different than what she has traditionally done. So, that in my mind is talent.  And, she started the water color tattoos because that's what her client had asked her for so I knew she would do my tattoo exactly the way I wanted. I knew she was fairly new to Deluxe Tattoo because I always check their site to see when Hannah was going to come back but when I saw her work I decided to go with her. I'm glad I did.

30.description: Bunny, my tat guy was fantastic. I gave him an idea of what i wanted , and within a week, he drew exactly what i wanted, with great artistic skills. Totally happy with my Bio-mechanical tattoo.  Also, the place is very clean, bright and totally professional.  5 stars, in my book

46.description: Deluxe Tattoo is home to amazing artists. Each artist is talented and does great work.  If you are getting your first tattoo or have many you will like the experience.
