Lynne is such a sweet, hip, happening lady and I was so glad I got the pleasure to meet and talk with her over some tea (that she served up for free in the store btw). This place is great for mid-century furniture and odds and ends at amazing prices. She said she is always getting new things in and the turnover is quick because of her great prices so I imagine the place could be hit or miss.On my particular visit it was a "hit". I purchased an Adrian Pearsall lounge chair for 40 bucks! Lynne will certainly not try to rob you or rip you off. Take a trip to the south side and check this place out!

21.description: The only reason it's four stars out of five is it is out of the way and in my opinion it could be bigger/ more selection. However, the owner alone deserves beyond five stars! Lynne is such a sweet, hip, happening lady and I was so glad I got the pleasure to meet and talk with her over some tea (that she served up for free in the store btw). This place is great for mid-century furniture and odds and ends at amazing prices. She said she is always getting new things in and the turnover is quick because of her great prices so I imagine the place could be hit or miss.On my particular visit it was a "hit". I purchased an Adrian Pearsall lounge chair for 40 bucks! Lynne will certainly not try to rob you or rip you off. Take a trip to the south side and check this place out!

16.description: I bought a cork base lamp from them at the vintage bazaar. I fell in love with it from across the auditorium. Still in good working order. Beautiful! Now I visit their blog on a regular basis looking for my next purchase, hoping to have a weekend free to pop in the shop.

17.description: Too far to drive from the city for items you've been told will be held for you to get there and they are already sold.  Pricing was reasonable when first opened, but now its outrageous.  Don't waste your time driving all the way down there.

10.description: Lynn is awesome! Super nice and inviting. :)I got a beautiful dining set at a great price! Her shop is beautiful and her furniture is above average in condition. I will definitely be keeping my eye on her shop.

5.description: What an amazing store!  Beautiful and eclectic mix of mid century modern and current art plus glass ware and more.  Definitely worth a stop by.Tell them Richard sent ya'

11.description: Lynne is probably one of the most likable and genuine people I have met.  She is so funky and fresh, she treats you like she has known you all your life.Her love for high end vintage furniture design (and vintage in general) is completely contagious!  She is so welcoming and warm-hearted you will want to buy everything!All of her mid-century furniture is collector worthy and her taste level is astounding.Great neighborhood spot.Now, go buy something!!!

22.description: Yes, it's out of the way especially if you are a northsider and have never ventured west of Hyde Park, but it's a tiny store that delivers. I spotted the store's posting on a CL ad for a Knoll style tulip table and thought it was too good to be true. I drove down and snapped it up along with a danish modernist dresser, which I had spotted at a Vill Thrift for $20 less but much too big for my room and not in as good of condition. Lynne let me come back that night with more manpower even though it was her off-hours. I'd drop back in whenever I'm trolling the southside for finds. It's good mostly for refurbished modern chairs, side tables and knick knacks. Join her mailing list and she'll keep you informed of what she's scooping up too!

0.description: An Orange Moon is one of my favorite places in Chicago.  It has the best, most awesome MCM pieces.  Its location is out of my way so I don't get to visit often but I check items for sale on the store website everyday and it's a treat.  I bought a couple pieces from An Orange Moon over the years and I love them.  I'll probably have them forever.  I went to their estate sales a while ago and it was one of the highlights of that year.  I bought a really great (and affordable) credenza and a nice arm chair.  That same year I blew my Christmas bonus on a painting I'd been eyeing  and this painting is still one of my favorite possessions.   100% worth it.And the furniture is only half the appeal of this store.  Lynne is a goddess and an inspiration.  She is so stylish and warm.  She's a real force of positivity and couldn't be any more engaging.  Ty is a great guy, too.If you're into MCM things and you haven't been here yet this is a must-visit.

20.description: Too far to drive from the city for items you've been told will be held for you to get there and they are already sold.  Pricing was reasonable when first opened, but now its outrageous.  Don't waste your time driving all the way down there.

19.description: I was pleased to find An Orange Moon, this store has QUALITY and no CLUTTER. Every item is in mint condition. Vintage Lamps to die for! It beat Northside parking drama and Lynn (owner) knows her business and can offer oral history to accompany purchase it's 50's 60's 40's etc.A real jewel in the City!

2.description: What a wonderful shop! The owner is so nice and helpful the pieces are in such great condition and only wish we didn't have specific dimensions we needed to fit the furniture in so we could buy everything in the store! Can't wait to go back!

18.description: An Orange Moon is a one of a kind experience that every lover of Mid Century Furniture should enjoy. They have a large selection of Mid Century Furniture that will fit the budget of all shoppers. The pieces are in great condition, well constructed and authentic. Lynn is a wonderful person with an extensive knowledge of all antiques including mid century, and a great eye for quality. I was happy to locate this gem on the southside. I would highly recommend An Orange Moon for mid century furniture and other hard to find items.

13.description: Yes, it's out of the way especially if you are a northsider and have never ventured west of Hyde Park, but it's a tiny store that delivers. I spotted the store's posting on a CL ad for a Knoll style tulip table and thought it was too good to be true. I drove down and snapped it up along with a danish modernist dresser, which I had spotted at a Vill Thrift for $20 less but much too big for my room and not in as good of condition. Lynne let me come back that night with more manpower even though it was her off-hours. I'd drop back in whenever I'm trolling the southside for finds. It's good mostly for refurbished modern chairs, side tables and knick knacks. Join her mailing list and she'll keep you informed of what she's scooping up too!

4.description: My wife and I just purchased a cool long refinished vintage sofa from Lynne.  We were out of town and she sent dimensions, and photos to help the process.  She pointed us in the direction of some great movers to get the sofa to our loft.  She even sent pictures of the move in progress... so much fun, and so much detail.She has a great sense of humor, and was very helpful.Every one at An Orange Moon is great.  We cannot wait to shop there again.Good work!

6.description: Absolutely stunning collection of Danish/ Mid-Century Modern furniture and decor. About as classy as you can get!!

15.description: An Orange Moon is the best store by far in the West Bucktown neighborhood near Western Ave. on North Ave.  The furniture is beautiful and definitely shows the talented eye of the owners Ty and Lynne McDaniel.  They will never disappoint if you are looking for that one gorgeous piece for your home.

7.description: I just left one of their "estate sales" .  First of all, there were no signs to identify where the house was, just a couple of stained old pieces of clothing hanging on the garage door.  When we entered there were 3 people sitting behind a table talking.  Nobody said hello or offerred us any information or help.  Nothing was priced, no signage, no customer service.  We left without purchasing anything and of course no one acknowledged us then either.    Bad experience.

8.description: Just purchased a high boy dresser from Lynne at An Orange Moon. Very nice store with a great selection of mid century modern furniture. Lynne was great to work with and very accommodating with my delivery needs. Thanks!

3.description: Have been searching for this store in Chicago for my whole life. So happy I found this place today, and cannot wait to purchase my first piece.

14.description: If you like mid century modern stuff, you should check this place out.  Lots of MCM eye candy and reasonable prices when there's a sale.  I bought a Broyhill hutch during their Labor Day sale last year for a steal, and more recently I bought a chair, mirror, and this funky pew/bench using the 15% Yelp deal you get when you check in there.  If money were not an issue, I would shop here more often!  All the stuff is beautiful.  And the people there are SO nice.  I was impressed by Lynne's hospitality the first time I went there, but this last time they went above and beyond to help me when the pew/bench wouldn't fit in my car.  Someone from the store (sorry, I can't remember his name!) drove it over to my apartment in his car and helped me bring it up the two flights to my apartment.  What a HUGE help to a single gal.  I recommend this place to people all the time.

58.description: This place is the shrimp.  and very affordable.  $8 for a shrimp po boy, coke and fries.  Go hungry because the portions a generous.  I will definitely go back to try the frogs legs.  You can tell this is place with lots of regulars, everyone was friendly and the service was great.

56.description: Polar Vortex antidote!!!!!I hate winter, strongly dislike it at least, Why???? It might have something to do with the fact that as soon as mercury starts to go down I start craving fatty, fried and high in carbos food. And if I don't have a problem with it at all, my doctor doesn't seem to be in the same page with me. So it is the second day of the polar vortex in early January of 2014 and my friend and I are craving greasy, fried food with bread and come up with this place that we had never been to before. We'll give it a try then.We get there and check out the menu. Decided to have the shrimp Po boy  and the crabby patty jibarito. The Po boy was good but the jibarito was amazing. freshly fried plantain, perfectly seasoned and good fillings, sauced up with the perfect chipotle mayo (or that it what the cook said it was, wouldn't blame him if he lied to me to keep the secret, LOL). Also had fried and sweet potato fries, both were decent. They also have beer.Once we were done, I felt energized and with enough strength to face and fight the polar vortex. JSH, good food, cool service, try the jibaritos

29.description: So delicious and what a nice owner. Great ambience!!!!!!Definitely recommend anything with the grilled shrimp.

42.description: We've eaten here before & enjoyed the experience but tonight was awful...It took an hour & 1/2 to get our food delivered. The calamari was cold & horrible. They forgot one if our drinks & substituted another one with Sprite without telling us because they were out of root beer. They didn't bring the juice pack that is supposed to come with the kids meal & no sauce for the fish we ordered. The only reason there is an extra star on this review is because when we called about the drink & sauces they came in about 10 mins with an apology. We're moving out of Chicago in 4 weeks & regret having this as our last experience with Joeys

23.description: I would have never thought I'd get a horrible Puerto Rican  jibaritos.  I'm so disappointed and if anything they stir fried the arroz!!!! I take it the rice was in the fridge and that's the way they reheated it. Who asks how do you want your jibarito to be cooked? I told him well done. Instead it was medium rare. And chopped like fajitas. I literally took one bite $22 lunch gone wrong. Horrible experience. It's sad to say at one point I really liked this place.

47.description: HOLY. CRAP.I didn't realize this place existed. I had never even heard of a jibarito, nor did I think there was an awesome seafood place on Western that delivers into the late hours of the night. Being a big fan of plantains and everything plantain-related, I decided to try this jibarito thing out. I had the shrimp one.I thought for sure I'd end up with some impossible-to-eat mushy sandwich full of rubbery, overcooked shrimp and that it would be 45 minutes late with half my order missing. I was absolutely, 100% dead wrong. The shrimp in the Jibarito is cooked to perfection, and everything in that sandwich is so well-seasoned. The plantains are perfectly crispy enough to stand up as bread. Amazing.Their fish and chips are great too. The fish tastes awesome. This place is a new favorite. I can't wait to eat here again.One little note about the prices: They're CHEAP. Most of their sides cost $2 or less. The fish dishes also seem cheaper than others, but that makes sense, since the others are crab and shrimp. Either way, it's an excellent value for the caliber of food you're getting.

8.description: A great find! We live really close by and have walked past Joey's a dozen times. I had the Shrimp Po Boy and my girlfriend had the Shrimp Jibarito. We both really enjoyed our food - the portions are generous, my Po Boy was only $7, and the food was surprisingly fresh. The baguette, the fixins and the sauce were all spot-on for my Po Boy. We will be back!

31.description: It was a pretty slow sat night.   We placed our order and then the waiter came back and told us they were out of calamari. No big deal,  we ordered some fried cheese instead.   We waited a long time and our apps and entree came at the same time. The cheese was small and underwhelming. My friend got the steak jibarito which was tasty but also very small portion.  I got the shrimp skewer and saw that the shrimp was mushy, falling off the skewer and covered in white slimy substance. For some reason I tried one,  thinking they may have added a cream sauce but to my dismay it tasted like ammonia or lunch meat that has gone very bad.   I went in to tell them and the cook just said "i didn't do nothing wrong" and the waiter went back to get me another one (which I didn't want). The owner came out and I asked for it to be taken off my bill.  They still gave me a second one and it was less mushy, but still had the unmistakable spoiled taste. It lingered in my mouth an hour after we left. I'm hoping it was just a bad batch,  as my friend loves this place,  but I will not be back.

34.description: They have a no guns allowed sign posted. I had to walk back to my car to leave my gun unsecured in my car. You have to wonder if they are being forced to put that sign up because they sell more booze then food or if they are anti-American freedom haters with a death wish:-) I wanted some fish tacos. They only had grilled fish. I wanted breaded. I settled on the shimp tacos instead. The place smelled bad when i walked in. The guy handling the money was the guy serving the food without washing his hands! GROSS! The food was not worth the hassle or the money!  The shrimp tacos, not so good. They wanted $19. For a lobster roll sandwich! Ouch!

16.description: Trying this place for the first time since it reopened. Love the variety and tasty food. Definite recommend to friends

13.description: Very nice spot with liquor and seafood...the food is banging...no bs...they shrimp tacos off the chain

11.description: They have a no guns allowed sign posted. I had to walk back to my car to leave my gun unsecured in my car. You have to wonder if they are being forced to put that sign up because they sell more booze then food or if they are anti-American freedom haters with a death wish:-) I wanted some fish tacos. They only had grilled fish. I wanted breaded. I settled on the shimp tacos instead. The place smelled bad when i walked in. The guy handling the money was the guy serving the food without washing his hands! GROSS! The food was not worth the hassle or the money!  The shrimp tacos, not so good. They wanted $19. For a lobster roll sandwich! Ouch!

39.description: I've tried a great number of jibaritos around the neighborhood (Papa's, Nellie's, some place on Division whose name I forgot, Borinquen) and must give Joey's top billing as my favorite jibarito in the city for their shrimp jibarito! (Tied with Papa's pork and chicken jibarito) The shrimps are huge, fresh, and perfectly fried. Also liked the hush puppies that came with it. The decor inside is also pretty cool. Not just another divey hole-in-the-wall. The employees make sure it's very clean. I have to take the final star off due to the same complaint everyone else experiences - the long waits! It took about half an hour for my friend and me to receive our to-go jibaritos. Luckily the cool ambience and ability to enjoy a cold one made it a little more bearable.

37.description: This place is very much so open and DELICIOUS. I had never had a jibarito until I found this place and it was a great first time experience. I ordered a shrimp jibarito, and the shrimp was very well seasoned, it had a good crunch to the plaintain and it wasn't too greasy at all. I also ordered the shrimp empanada which I thoroughly enjoyed. Not sure what kind of sauce is put in it but it was VERY flavorful. Since this was my first time coming here, I also got a banana bread pudding and OMG... Amazing.. I have no complaints about this place. I love the menu selection, the service was good, they have drinks available, and vegetarian options. I intend on visiting this place as often as I can.

0.description: Tried this place for the first time with my parents. Excellent food!!!!! The server was very nice and attentive, every time we completed a dish or ran low on drinks he was right there.  Excellent traditional PR dishes and really good creative twist.A bonus that shows the passion at this reasturant , as we were leaving we were asked if we knew of any homeless families or families in a hardship to pass on the word that free food will be offered at their reasturant for Thanksgiving. The owner didn't ask for any donation, just to pass the word along the neighborhood  that they would be open to help provide a warm meal .We were going to  coming back for the great food, but now knowing we are eating at a place with integrity makes the food even better .

38.description: The jumbo shrimp was delicious. The breading was a nice touch, but honestly it would have been great in a shrimp cocktail as well. I think most places that fry their shrimp have something to hide, but that is definitely not the case here. Oh, and the sauces were all yummy as well.

51.description: SHRIMP. JIBARITOS. i drove by this place, saw the sign declaring "shrimp jibaritos" and knew I had to try it. at this point we've been back five or six times, and every time Joey's delivers the perfect "sandwich." i'd love to try something else on the menu, but the jibarito is so perfect -- fresh, crispy, salty, savory, seasoned to perfection -- that i always get it. we've tried the hush puppies, which are exactly as they should be -- crispy outside, steamy tender filling. the sauce that comes with sweet potato fries and hush puppies complement them perfectly. a buddy came with me and got the fried shrimp and tells me it was glorious. i was too busy eating my shrimp jibarito to notice.there's a good craft beer selection for a small place and i always go at odd hours so there's never been a wait. the chef prepares everything as you watch, mashing the plantains and concocting the shrimpy cheesy filling. i'm getting hungry again writing this review right now. gonna have to go back tomorrow..

27.description: A great find! We live really close by and have walked past Joey's a dozen times. I had the Shrimp Po Boy and my girlfriend had the Shrimp Jibarito. We both really enjoyed our food - the portions are generous, my Po Boy was only $7, and the food was surprisingly fresh. The baguette, the fixins and the sauce were all spot-on for my Po Boy. We will be back!

32.description: We had a great experience at Joey's. We recently moved into the area and have been checking out the local spots. My boyfriend and I went together for a casual dinner. The service was great - attentive and friendly table service. They have a nice beer list and liquor, too. My boyfriend and I both got the shrimp tacos and shared a plate of fried shrimp. The tacos were delicious! They had a unique flavor, which I appreciated. The fried shrimp was nice and crispy with a good flavor. We will definitely be back soon.

54.description: This place SUCKS! The employees are rude. We ordered $70 worth of food and RUDE employees!

48.description: I am a member/participant of Restauant.com. After viewing the reviews and menu's of several seafood places in the Chicago area, I decided on Joey's Shrimp House and I printed a certificate for $15.00 on yesterday. Upon arrival, I was greeted and I presented my $15.00 certificate to the cashier, who then placed my order. When he told me the total of $20.83 I stated minus the $15.00, he said that was with the $15.00 deducted. I then asked him the prices of the items I ordered (1 lb. Jumbo Shrimp, Crab Salad and Calamari) He showed me the receipt. The prices were much higher than the menu prices online which are: 1 lb. Jumbo Shrimp - $16; Crab Salad - $3; Calamari - $6. I conveyed that to him and also retrieved their menu from my Samsung S4 and showed it to him. He then grabbed the receipt and balled it up. I asked him if had he a menu for the customers and after a bit of hesitation, he gave me the menu. After looking it over I saw the prices were pretty much the same as the online menu for the items I wanted - but he told me that the Calamari was actually $7.00. I went further to state to him that the menu's both in-store and online should convey correct information, because that is what the customer is expecting to pay upon arrival to your business. He seemed pretty shady and the co-workers looked that way as well. I told him no thanks and that I would report this situation, grabbed the menu he gave me and my certificate and left. Not a place I would recommend for doing business...I'd be uneasy about giving them my credit card to pay for my food. It left a bad taste in my mouth and a nervous feeling in my stomach.If it were up to me Joey's Shrimp House would have minus zero (-0) stars. Shady business.

44.description: Pretty good, not great.   Decent value, and the best fried shrimp in the immediate area, but that's a bit of a tallest midget award.   There are several better shrimp joints in Chicago, but most are a bit of a drive away.   If you get a shrimp jones and have a car, make the trip up to Snappy's on Irving Park.   Best fried shrimp north of Roosevelt.

24.description: It was OK. I ordered their fried shrimp to go.The quality of shrimp was alright and there was a lot of breading. I haven't found myself back since.

7.description: WOW, this use to be my place for fried seafood. After today, I don't think I'd recommend you look at the menu. However, if you're looking to get grossed out, feel free. I took my brother in law here today (8/7/15) for his birthday, we had the works with 2 IPA to wash it all down. The food and service was good as usual, but when I stood up to go pay; why did a FAT NASTY ASS COCK ROACH decide to join us.  5 secs After confirming what it was, I called the waiter over to show him then the owner comes, he looks, and has the waiter kill then ask me what was it..... Uhmmm, it was A fucking roach!!! Needless to say he just walked out, I paid the $70 tab +$13 for the tip cause the server did his job. However the owner just left and disappeared, WTF REALLLLLLLY?!!!!Compare the video to the wall of the seating, ITS SICK! Thanks for the birthday gift.

49.description: If you're in the mood for deep fried sea food, look no further. What I like most about this place is the laid back atmosphere: you can just kinda kick back with your BYO-beer and munch on some fried shrimp. Don't know what the fuss is about these hush puppies -- they're okay but I'm a bigger fan of the fried plantains. Although anything will taste amazing with the dips that come with it (seriously, what WAS that dip?)!

40.description: Everything is cooked as it's ordered. The Shrimp Jibarito, hush puppies, & mahi tacos, are my top favs!!! Delic!! Homemade sauces are outstanding. The prices are dirt cheap for the quality. Great find.

53.description: We stopped in here one random Saturday based on a review from a friend. Upon walking in, thought it was a cool and quaint spot. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Because it was our first time, we asked for suggestions. We wanted to try the shrimp jibarito but they happened to be out of plantains that day (bummer) so we ended up ordering the shrimp po boy and the fried shrimp basket with a side of hush puppies. Everything was really good. The shrimp was cooked and seasoned perfectly and you could tell that everything was fresh and pricing was great! We will definitely be back to try more items from the menu, especially the jibaritos!

30.description: Thanks GrubHub. I have had the jibarito sandwich, the mofongo with shrimp and the fried shrimp, they have yet to disappoint. Everything was so good, I can't wait to order again from them.

46.description: I live a block away from this place and never thought to go in... Finally did... and wow I regret not going earlier. Awesome and cheap!

1.description: Kinda disappointed. I work at the hospital nearby and live in HP and my patients would tell me how much they love this place. The population of my patients is predominantly Puerto Rican so it's pretty profound when they say you can get an awesome jibarito and mofongo here.  People have also raved about the shrimp po' boy. So in a crunch the family and I ordered. Ready in 15 minutes. Mofongo w shrimp, shrimp po' boy, popcorn shrimp and fries (for the kids), and hush puppies. We live a few blocks away. The mofongo was cold. I know it's not supposed to be piping hot but it was not even warm. As if they had some left over tostones and mashed it up. No spices. No chicharron or garlic. The shrimp was ok, some almost undercooked and you could taste that shrimpy taste. Didn't eat it bc I'm pregnant and didn't want to get sick. The fries were stale tasting and I usually love freshly cut with the skin on. But these were soooo stale. The hushpuppies weren't included and the hubby had to drive back to get it. These were actually decent. (This is the star). I liked the shrimp po boy. Spicy. Crunchy. Fresh veg w a crunch on it. (2nd star). But the $17 mofongo that was left uneaten subtracted a star. When the hubby called to let them know his order of hush puppies never made it they put him on hold. For several minutes. He then kept calling back and there was a busy signal. They must have left the phone off the hook. And even when he went to go pick up his hushpuppies the phone was STILL off the hook. What service.

55.description: This place is just down right amazing. I have been eating at Chicago shrimp house staples like Lawrence fisheries and goose island for more than a decade. The fry on their shrimp is great, not dry, and very crunchy. You can tell they use fresh oil as you dont get that dark brown or burnt smell off the plate. Frog legs were very moist and large, 3 of us devoured a lb of it. Shrimp tacos, fried mushrooms, and po boy were very tasty. The crab cake sandwich was also stellar but on the small side of portions probably due to the price point of real lump crab. All in all a great dining experience, good staff and amazing eats. the shrimp po boy is the best value there and is quite tasty.

9.description: Went there with a group of eight ..and wanted to try theirDrinks took 45 minutes to finally get the piña colada they had no liquor and we didn't order them virgins !!! Half an hour for a glass of water.. After waiting an hour for the chuleta can can ...and it was horrible no flavor  what so ever and under cooked ... Were they even Puerto Ricans in the kitchen????? The place was still empty and we still had horrible service !!! This is a public service announcement don't waste your money people !!!

26.description: Service was a bit slow , and I only saw 1 waiter. He was nice , the atmosphere was good, and the food was good. The 1/2 lb of shrimp was delicious, I should have ordered that instead of the mofongo. The mahi mahi tacos were also good. I'd recommend the shrimp and tacos, you'll get your money's worth.

25.description: So disappointed- I called to place a takeout order and everything I requested they had run out off!!! REALLY??? How can you run out of your main dishes??? Specially over the weekend!!!

12.description: I would have never thought I'd get a horrible Puerto Rican  jibaritos.  I'm so disappointed and if anything they stir fried the arroz!!!! I take it the rice was in the fridge and that's the way they reheated it. Who asks how do you want your jibarito to be cooked? I told him well done. Instead it was medium rare. And chopped like fajitas. I literally took one bite $22 lunch gone wrong. Horrible experience. It's sad to say at one point I really liked this place.

59.description: This shrimp shack is not whack or shady. I love it though I'm kind of angry this place is basically around the corner from me because I want to eat there ALL THE TIME. If you have a day where you can be a total slob but a classy slob (like I don't eat McD's-I eat good times ethnic food) then have breakfast at Nellie's and a late lunch at Joe's and go balls out Puerto Rican for the day. You won't regret it.

21.description: WOW, this use to be my place for fried seafood. After today, I don't think I'd recommend you look at the menu. However, if you're looking to get grossed out, feel free. I took my brother in law here today (8/7/15) for his birthday, we had the works with 2 IPA to wash it all down. The food and service was good as usual, but when I stood up to go pay; why did a FAT NASTY ASS COCK ROACH decide to join us.  5 secs After confirming what it was, I called the waiter over to show him then the owner comes, he looks, and has the waiter kill then ask me what was it..... Uhmmm, it was A fucking roach!!! Needless to say he just walked out, I paid the $70 tab +$13 for the tip cause the server did his job. However the owner just left and disappeared, WTF REALLLLLLLY?!!!!Compare the video to the wall of the seating, ITS SICK! Thanks for the birthday gift.

17.description: This place is very much so open and DELICIOUS. I had never had a jibarito until I found this place and it was a great first time experience. I ordered a shrimp jibarito, and the shrimp was very well seasoned, it had a good crunch to the plaintain and it wasn't too greasy at all. I also ordered the shrimp empanada which I thoroughly enjoyed. Not sure what kind of sauce is put in it but it was VERY flavorful. Since this was my first time coming here, I also got a banana bread pudding and OMG... Amazing.. I have no complaints about this place. I love the menu selection, the service was good, they have drinks available, and vegetarian options. I intend on visiting this place as often as I can.

10.description: Service was a bit slow , and I only saw 1 waiter. He was nice , the atmosphere was good, and the food was good. The 1/2 lb of shrimp was delicious, I should have ordered that instead of the mofongo. The mahi mahi tacos were also good. I'd recommend the shrimp and tacos, you'll get your money's worth.

5.description: So delicious! Music was super hip, they had South Park on the TV. Shrimp Empanada was my favorite! What's not to love!

3.description: Great food, had the gulf shrimp jibarito and it was phenomenal, also a good selection of craft beer which raises the bar! Would highly recommend!

35.description: This place is great!  I thought this place closed down but they actually remodeled the place. Still small but new seating and decor makes it look fresher and bigger. They also revamped the menu....bigger selection (lobster roll, et.). Will be back with the hubby to try the other items :-)

19.description: Polar Vortex antidote!!!!!I hate winter, strongly dislike it at least, Why???? It might have something to do with the fact that as soon as mercury starts to go down I start craving fatty, fried and high in carbos food. And if I don't have a problem with it at all, my doctor doesn't seem to be in the same page with me. So it is the second day of the polar vortex in early January of 2014 and my friend and I are craving greasy, fried food with bread and come up with this place that we had never been to before. We'll give it a try then.We get there and check out the menu. Decided to have the shrimp Po boy  and the crabby patty jibarito. The Po boy was good but the jibarito was amazing. freshly fried plantain, perfectly seasoned and good fillings, sauced up with the perfect chipotle mayo (or that it what the cook said it was, wouldn't blame him if he lied to me to keep the secret, LOL). Also had fried and sweet potato fries, both were decent. They also have beer.Once we were done, I felt energized and with enough strength to face and fight the polar vortex. JSH, good food, cool service, try the jibaritos

28.description: Everything I've tried here is delish! The shrimp jibaritos are so good. Ceviche is very flavorful and because I love avocados, it could always use a little more :) The hours are perfect! You can catch them on a week day Til midnight. The owner served us and he was very pleasant and offered the right amount of attentiveness. I enjoy it here. Will definitely be a regular

45.description: Hey Joey!  My friends and I came in cause of the restaurant.com deal...food was so good we all agree that we are coming back and calling for delivery. We got the pound of jumbo shrimp, fries, hush puppies, mushrooms, and macaroni salad. Before different sauces we're all good. One of them had too much of a bite for me but the other three were very tasty!  Prices are reasonable for the jumbo shrimp and all of the sides were very reasonably priced as well.  Must admit that we probably would not have stopped in were it not for the deal on restaurant.com. But now we will definitely be back.

33.description: Not a fan of their customer service.  Much to be desired.  Go back to whatever it was your were doing before your "renovation" AKA downward spiral.I went back after months of them being closed only to be greeted as if I had a disease on my face. When I asked for the people I'm used to seeing I was told they no longer work here with a rude and obtuse attitude and with that; i no longer eat here. The food was awesome at one point in time; but I wouldn't bother giving them another chance considering the customer service have much to be desired... I wonder what else is lacking

43.description: Bogus. I never write reviews but they cancelled my delivery order and never informed me. I am starving!

2.description: I'd been putting off ordering from here because I wasn't sure how it would be delivered. I ordered the catfish nuggets and the steak mofongo and both were fantastic! Piping hot and arrived in less than 45 minutes.

18.description: Looking through the pictures for this place made me a skeptic! If you browser you would to but Joey's Shrimp House was a great fine. Limited Menu but some great options. The only disappointment was that the rice didn't have that Puerto Rican flair that I was expecting. It was a little under seasoned but the shrimp made up for that short coming!!!

41.description: I ordered almost everything on the menu. This was last year and I'm now trying to finish my review so please forgive me for if I forget to recall everything. The food was good. Not everything was good though but the owners are super nice. They actually have a decent selection of beers although they are not on draft.

52.description: Back in the day, we had our go- to shrimp place located inside an adjoining restaurant at a gas station in the far south suburbs. I kid you not, this was the best shrimp in Illinois that you could find. Everyone turned up their noses when I told them where it was located. The brave (and smart) who tried the shrimp still lament to me today about how sad they are that the place closed when the gas station was bought out. We are still on that hunt for something comparable so let's start off 2014 on a shrimp tour. Matzo ball soup was so 2013!!! Enter Joey's Shrimp, a hybrid of Puerto Rican food, fish fry spot and New Orleans cuisine. We purchased a pound of jumbo shrimp, a single crab cake patty and se hush puppies. Our mistake was taking the shrimp home and not eating them at the restaurant. But arctic cold has you doing some desperate things. At home, we opened the packaged shrimp. They were breaded and deveined perfectly. Not too thick of a breading, which I assume which was equivalent to a Panko crust. Tails were kept on, nicely seasoned but a great accomplice to the mango habanero sauce. This sauce was addicting! Great Merry and balance of sweet fruit and peppery heat. The spicy mayo was a close second in the sauce category, of this creamy and heat combination sauce. I personally didn't like the crab cake. It was lacking a sort of zest that was incorporated on the other food. I didn't find the sauce appealing either, maybe too much was drizzled on as a garnish. Hush puppies were standard. Get them. Great place for shrimp! I would definitely go back and try the shrimp jibarito!

50.description: Oh my god, a Puerto Rican seafood paradise. Idk why we hadn't heard of this place before nor why we haven't been here, but thank God (literally, ha) for Lent because it led us here yesterday evening for a Catholic-friendly dinner. My fiance and I split fries and hushpuppies (so good and not at all greasy) and we each got a jibarito, crab for me, shrimp for him. So effing good! This is a very hole-in-the-wall type of place with not many tables, but we did not find the service to be rude at all (in fact, the girl behind the counter seemed extra nice). It does take a few minutes to get your food because they actually make it fresh to order--definitely worth the wait! We live just down the street and I cannot wait to come back and try more items off of their menu.

4.description: This place is delicious!!! The shrimp mofongo is so flavorful and it comes with plenty of shrimp. I've also had the shrimp jibarito and it has also been one of my favorites. The arroz con gandules was also pretty good. To much salt for my liking. The only bad thing about this place is that it takes forever to get your food. They only have one chef and I love that everything is freshly made and you can watch him prepare your food. But the wait is too long. If you are starving order ahead. They need another chef to help this guy out. Otherwise what I have tried so far has been delicious.

6.description: This place is great! Service was wonderful, food was amazing and the margaritas were fire!

22.description: I ordered wings after I was home. I discovered they didn't have the sauce I called they said the ran out they tasted bad and I ordered shrimp they gave enough sauce  for 2 of the 8 shrimp  not a good experience

15.description: Decent place to watch a ESPN game, I was sitting for nearly 15 minutes to be attended, not enough choice of food snack mostly salads burgers n hot doggs.

57.description: I'm a fan JOEY!I walk in for a shrimp jibarito and I was excited to see MEDALLA which is like a miller light in puerto rico....only difference in puerto rico you can get them for a $1 which makes it a really popular beer!I love the shrimp jibarito it's what I go for and I'm sure I'll continue to go to for years to come!The crab patty jibarito is also pretty delicious.

20.description: I ordered delivery from here with an estimated time of 45-60 mins. I understand that restaurants get busy on weekends, so after about 1 hr 10 mins I checked up on the order and was told they don't have enough drivers so they can't deliver. A heads up or ANYTHING before an hour later would have been nice... It made me so angry that I went to Taco Bell.

36.description: love this place !!! Great food a must visit

14.description: My expectations were blown away!!  We were expecting cheap frozen shrimp in a basket.  That would have been fine.  Instead, we had fresh shrimp that was lightly breaded right in front of us (we were facing the kitchen), and skirt steak mofongo (puerto rican dish).  UNBELIEVABLE!!  I cannot believe how good it was.  This place is so good!!!  Mango habanero dipping sauce for the shrimp.  Great atmosphere.  Awesome service.  I cannot say enough about this place!!!

29.description: I don't have the words to adequately express how awesome Jenn is.  Like freakin the best.  Having just moved from ny... I was terrified of what it would be like to find a new waxer.. But thanks to yelp I feel I truly found the best.  Jenn uses hard wax which is what I was used to... She's is extremely thorough (i cant stress that enough) clean.. Works quick and efficiently...  She's genuine and it was probably one of the best experiences I had.  Dare I say I had fun?!

42.description: Jen provides the best, THE BEST, eyebrow and brazilian wax I have ever recieved. Best part- it is also one of the most resonably priced places downtown. She provides a quick, painless and most importantly, thorough wax. Her witty conversation and always cheery attitude distract you from the little discomfort that comes along with any wax and before you know it, you are in a better mood than when you walked in and hair-free!

23.description: I really wanted to love this place because selfishly it would be convenient for me to get here from where I live. Booking appointments with Rebecca is easy through the online system, but finding an available time that fits your needs might be a bit more challenging. It is highly recommended that you book far enough in advance. Finding something last minute would be finding yourself in luck. I bought a GiltCity voucher for a full set of natural lashes. Rebecca did an excellent job, and told me she had been doing it for a couple of years and is certified with Xtreme Lashes and always uses their adhesive/glue. I have to say that with all the lashes I have gotten done and having worn extensions for over 2 years that I do like Novalash best. I feel like the lashes are thicker and the glue adheres better. I am glad to have been able to narrow down my search of what I am looking for with regards to my lash extensions.

8.description: I purchased a Gilt City deal for 2 brazilian waxes - can't say enough about Jen! It was extremely easy scheduling an appointment and she was so reachable by text when I needed to reschedule. Her salon is very quaint and cute, it felt like I was in a spa. I never had a hard wax done before and I am officially hooked - Jen was quick and thorough and the wax was almost painless! Thanks girl for the killer wax!

31.description: The BEST in the city!! Hands down, my favorite place for eyelashes and waxes, ever. I literally can't wait until they start offering a wider range of services (which they say they will soon!). Rebecca has been doing my lash extensions for months now and I honestly believe my natural lashes are thicker and healthier- sounds crazy but it's true! She takes her time and makes sure you're 100% pleased with the results. I can't say enough about this place- LOVE!

34.description: I cannot say enough great things about this place which truly is my haven.  I have been seeing Jen for years now, she is the best waxer I've found in the city, not only is she the most thorough, but she's also the cheapest! She's honestly the best. Last time I was there I was admiring her amazing eyelashes which she told me were done by Rebecca who also works at Stella's Haven.  I couldn't resist trying something that I had been thinking about for months because again, the prices were so much more reasonable than others I had seen for eyelash extensions.  I AM HOOKED!! Rebecca takes her time to do a fantastic job, so many people noticed how great my eyes looked but nobody once asked if I had eyelash extensions which I felt was very important--I don't want anyone to know they are fake! I recommend Jen and Rebecca to everyone, I couldn't be happier to have found them.

16.description: I can not believe the jewel that I have found!!!!  Thanks Yelp - thanks to you, I have found my new Brazilian wax and eyelash spa!!!!  Two separate visits:Jen - For the Brazilian wax - I have been getting this service for about 6 years and thought I had a pretty decent esthetician UNTIL I met Jen!  Professional, thorough, AMAZING personality, clean and cute spa area, and friendly service.  Jen took her time and made sure that I was completely hairless!  She did not rush through at all. For me, what makes or breaks any retail/service experience is the customer service.  Stella's Haven is top notch and super reasonably priced!Rebecca - For eyelash extensions - I returned a few days after my wax for a different service and I was greeted like I was a friend!  Winner!  I have not had eyelash extensions before so I had no idea of what to expect other than what I read on their website.  Rebecca walked through the entire process including maintenance, the products that she would be using and of course what to expect during the process.  The process was great and extremely comfortable!  Rebecca knows her lashes and is GREAT at what she does!  I left looking like a million bucks! i will be a eyelash girl going forward.  They are so amazingly natural and comfortable. It looks like I have lush natural eyelashes but it does not feel like I have anything on my eyes.  That is great work in my opinion!I will be a faithful client of Stella's Haven!  Great service with two awesome estheticians.  Thanks Jen and Rebecca!

13.description: I bought a Gilt City for eyelash extensions and Stella's has gained a return customer. Rebecca is amazing, my eyelashes have never looked so good.

11.description: What a sweetheart. I booked a 1:15pm appointment but had the wrong time down on my calendar. At 1:25 she called me and I realized that it was not at 1:45. I jetted over fast and she still accommodated me, even giving me the first time discount.She's organized, clean, super nice, thorough, and the hard wax is way better than other types.I recommend her to everyone and will head back myself!

39.description: Fantastic waxer! I have been going to her for years after I switched from my previous  girl! She is very thorough yet quick! Highly recommend! I drive from the suburbs to see her every month so that should tell you something! :)

37.description: Jen was great: very thorough and super pleasant.

0.description: 5-stars across the board for a reason.Like every other yelp review for Stella's Haven, I can't say enough great things about this business.  I've been coming to Stella's Haven for about 2 years now.Jen is phenomenal.  She is kind, and extremely talented.  I see Jen for waxing and have never been disappointed.  She uses a hard wax so everything comes off quickly and pretty painlessly.   The location is convenient with paid parking right in front or free parking on side streets very close by.  Don't hesitate to book with Jen, you won't be disappointed!

38.description: My first Yelp review! I just moved to Chicago so Yelp has been a huge help. I found Jennifer through this site and emailed her for a last minute appointment. Communication was quick and she was able to fit me in. The location was a bit hidden for someone new like me, but I found it. I kind of felt like I was going into a speakeasy.Jennifer is friendly and really made me feel comfortable through the whole appointment. I am very happy with the results.Other services offered at this location include spray tanning, hair services, and lash services.I will definitely be back!

27.description: I went to Jen because I found a deal on Gilt City.  I was a little hesitant  because I am 28 weeks pregnant but this was the best wax I've had EVER.  First of all, she is the nicest person and made me feel so welcome and relaxed.  Her waxing technique is fast and as painless as it gets.  I never write reviews unless the service or experience blew me away and this did!

32.description: I found this place through a Gilt deal and I'm so happy I did! Jen was super accommodating when I had to reschedule last minute. I highly recommend!

44.description: Jen is an amazing waxer, actually the best Brazilian wax I've ever received. She is super friendly, works fast and is very meticulous. She also tints my eyelashes darker  which is my absolute favorite since mine are really light! Go see Jen pronto, you will love love love her and her services.

24.description: I came here first with a purchase from Gilt City for a Brazilian. I haven't been anywhere else since! After my first time, I immediately purchased a five pack. Jen is professional and does a fantastic job. The place is clean and so cute! Best part is that you can book online and cancel/reschedule whenever, so easy!

7.description: Jen is amazing! Her skills are amazing and she makes your waxing experience as close to painless as she can. Not only this --but she is a complete doll- a blast to chat with. You will feel so relaxed and at ease in the cute space as well. Go to Jen for all your waxing needs!!

40.description: I recently moved here from Seattle and needed to find a new waxer... on my first attempt I nailed it with finding Jen! Like other reviewers, I have experienced a wide range of waxers and Jen is in my top two of all time. My overall experience was wonderful and she made me feel at ease right away. Quick, and as painless as possible were the two highlights... not to mention she is wonderful to chat with as well.

30.description: I love this place!! When it comes to lashes there is no where else to go. Rebecca is wonderful at giving you either a natural or long lash look, both equally fabulous! She is thorough and will make sure it is 100% perfect and how you want to look. I got so many compliments on my lashes and I always pass along her name to others who are interested, most who have now become returning happy customers. If you are looking to add something fabulous to your everyday look this is the place to go! She will make you feel comfortable and make you look gorgeous! Thanks Rebecca :)

1.description: Such a great little gem in the city! Very cozy atmosphere & super clean. I've been going here for a couple years now for Brazilian waxes and Jen is absolutely the best. I recommend her to all my friends.

9.description: Thank god I found this place and thank you to yelp!  Jen is such an amazing esthetician, I find that each time I have gone to her for my brazilian I forget its even happening.  She's clean, she's quick, she's so much fun to talk to.  She uses hard wax and has such strong attention to detail that she will use tweezers as necessary.  What I also love about her is that she really loves to use natural products, so, she uses tea tree oil at the end of each session.  I haven't tried one of her facials yet, but she was explaining to me that she makes her own stuff for it in the back and uses all natural ingredients.  Also, this past weekend I was in desparate need of a wax and there were no available times on the website.  She worked with me to find a time that I could come in, I was so incredibly grateful!

26.description: I recently had my lashes done by Rebecca! I was a little nervous as this was my first go at lash extensions, but I can't say enough great things about Rebecca.  The space was clean and comfortable and she explained each and every step of the process.  She did an amazing job and was incredibly friendly.  She spent lots of time talking me through the care and maintenance.  To top it off, the price simply can't be beat... $175 for a full set of lashes. I will most definitely be back to Rebecca for all my lash needs.

25.description: What a sweetheart. I booked a 1:15pm appointment but had the wrong time down on my calendar. At 1:25 she called me and I realized that it was not at 1:45. I jetted over fast and she still accommodated me, even giving me the first time discount.She's organized, clean, super nice, thorough, and the hard wax is way better than other types.I recommend her to everyone and will head back myself!

12.description: I'm going to echo the stellar track record of Stella's Haven and agree that it's a great place for waxing needs! Like others, I checked it out via a Gilt City deal and was thoroughly charmed by this small business, it's tranquil and hip atmosphere, and it's Owner/Esthetician, Jen.It appears all appointments are booked via the website but if you call and leave a message, you'll get a return call.

21.description: Jen is thorough, professional, and always so friendly and sweet! Highly recommend for eyebrows. Pricing is very reasonable too.

17.description: I really wanted to love this place because selfishly it would be convenient for me to get here from where I live. Booking appointments with Rebecca is easy through the online system, but finding an available time that fits your needs might be a bit more challenging. It is highly recommended that you book far enough in advance. Finding something last minute would be finding yourself in luck. I bought a GiltCity voucher for a full set of natural lashes. Rebecca did an excellent job, and told me she had been doing it for a couple of years and is certified with Xtreme Lashes and always uses their adhesive/glue. I have to say that with all the lashes I have gotten done and having worn extensions for over 2 years that I do like Novalash best. I feel like the lashes are thicker and the glue adheres better. I am glad to have been able to narrow down my search of what I am looking for with regards to my lash extensions.

10.description: I got lash extensions for my wedding and I have received SO many compliments! They truly look amazing, natural but on steroids! As a first timer, I had a lot of questions. Rebecca is super knowledgeable and friendly and definitely knows what she's doing. Very reasonable rates compared to other places I checked. I love them so much, I can't imagine not getting them re-filled... it's so nice not to have to wear mascara!

5.description: I've been to see Rebecca twice now for eyelashes and She. Is. Amazing! I'm an extension newbie and at my first visit I let her know I wanted as natural a look as possible (which can be hard to do since I'm Korean and my eyelashes are non existent.) For my first visit, she took the time to explain everything and what I should/should not expect with the extensions. The application itself was a long process but hey, she's applying individual lashes. One by one. Of course it's going to be a long process! Don't underestimate her mad skills, Rebecca is a pro! When she was done and gave me the mirror I was completely floored. They felt a little weird but I looked so pretty! For almost the entire week after I couldn't stop looking at myself admiring my beautiful new lashes. My friends even commented on how natural they looked. I just got done with my 2nd appointment and am just as happy as the first time. I won't be seeing anyone else when it comes to my lashes!

35.description: Great, friendly service. Comfortable and safe atmosphere.  Jen does a great job waxing and makes you feel like you've known her forever. I'll definitely be back!

19.description: I bought a Gilt City promotion for Stella's Haven and I was extremely happy that I did! Best Brazilian wax that I have gotten in Chicago was from Jen.  She is super nice and does an amazing job.  I would highly recommend her!

28.description: Got my lashes done and loved it! It's clean, super cute, and has convenient parking.  I've had lash extensions before and they barely lasted a week.  I'm on week 2 and they look brand new. I got them done for my engagement photos and will definitely be back.

3.description: I first went to Rebecca for lash extensions before my wedding in April 2014 and I'm still a fan today! These extensions are seriously addicting and Rebecca is all-around awesome. She is personable, professional and knows everything there is to know about lash extensions. We've gone full and long for all my (wedding) events and natural for the 'regular' periods in-between. I rarely wear make-up but I always have lash extensions and Rebecca at Stella's Haven is my go-to gal. Highly recommended!

33.description: Jennifer only uses hard wax for her Brazilians.  This was one of the best waxes I've ever had.  She was sweet and professional and the salon was clean and chic.  So glad to have her in the neighborhood!

43.description: Jenn is hands down the best! Funny, friendly, fast and pain free. I have been waxed with the best technicians from NYC to LA and Jenn is among the best. Her prices are super reasonable and she really is a master at her craft using on the best all natural products. She also offers packages which is really nice. GO see Jenn you will NOT be disappointed.

2.description: That's it...I will say it...Rebecca is the eyelash queen! It was my first time getting eyelash extensions and was a little scared on the whole process. She was so patient with me and explained the entire process and gave me tips on how to keep my lashes in great shape. The application was so relaxing too. She has done a great job with making her space so comfortable, clean and welcoming. Rebecca as a person is so sweet and accommodating. If you ever have any questions or concerns all you do is send her a quick email and she responds right away. Same goes for scheduling. I have a crazy work schedule and can email her to find me a date that works best for me and she does!My lashes look so natural and beautiful. It is one of those things where you know something is different but it is not a crazy change. She can customize a look for you too just tell her exactly what you want. Compared to other places I have researched, her prices are beyond reasonable for the quality of work she does. I really would not go anywhere else, happy to have found her :)

18.description: I always wanted to get lashes and found this spot on Yelp. Easy parking out front, easy to book appointments online, and cute decor! Rebecca, one of the owners, did my lashes and I love them! I will definitely be back to keep up with them. Rebecca was not only very professional but very fun to talk to. I highly recommend this spot.

41.description: Hi Jen.  I really hope you are reading this.  1st off I'm plus size so I was concerned getting my undercarriage waxed. Jennifer assured me that it didn't even matter.  And matter it did not.  She got every nook and cranny!  =-O She was so professional and sweet trying to distract me with questions.  Lol.  It didn't work.  But she tried.  I was satisfied that day but 2days later I can't see myself shaving ever again.  Thank you Jennifer

4.description: My sister referred me to Jen for waxing and I'm thrilled she did!  I had been going to my previous place for over 10 years, but was just kind of 'stuck' ... never took the time to look around for someplace else, even though I was never fully happy with it.  Stella's Haven is exactly what I needed!  Beautiful, comfortable, spa-like space ... warm and inviting .. and Jen was so fun and pleasant to talk to ... she took her time instead of rushing through, and did an amazing job.  She also recommended a brown tint, and I fee like it totally transformed my look .. I'm so happy with it!  I don't have a bad thing to say.  My brows have never looked better.  Thanks again Jen!

6.description: Rebecca is professional and personable making an appointment more like an experience. She's so knowledgeable and the ambiance is simply exquisite, to say the least. I would recommend her any day! Rebecca is the best lasholigist I know and I wouldn't trust anyone else near my eyes/lashes.

22.description: Jen is absolutely amazing. I'm not usually loyal to a waxer, but Jen is IT! I am almost always late to my appointments, and she's always incredibly sweet and accommodating. I also recently had her do my eyebrows as well and was very happy! I'm very particular about my brows, but she did a great job!

15.description: Best wax In a very long time!! I'm so sensitive and this was quick, painless and super easy. Very clean, super cute spot that is cozy and comfortable. Will absolutely come back!

20.description: I bought a Gilt City for eyelash extensions and Stella's has gained a return customer. Rebecca is amazing, my eyelashes have never looked so good.

36.description: The space is comfortable and lovely and chic and Jen is WONDERFUL - genuine and fantastic and great at what she does.

14.description: So happy I found this place through a gilt voucher! Though after going I'd happily come back and pay full price. Jen is amazing with waxing! She is the perfect combination of friendly and professional. She did a great job and was extremely thorough, not a hair left in sight. The salon is also pristinely clean and nicely decorated. Whether it's your first or 100th wax I would definitely recommend coming here!

3.description: Talk about a GEM.My friend and I were driving through Humboldt Park just admiring the community, park, and people and we stumble across this food truck.Mind you I was considering eating at Whitey Castell's (White Castle) before we spotted this truck.I had to try it.Although it was freezing cold and there was about five people in line, I had to see what it was about.For $5 I left with three very tasty and filling greasy goodness that are pastelilllos (essentially empanadas that are huge filled with beef) and huge platanos maduros. ALL THIS FOR $5 we were able to be filled and have our taste buds satisfied.I definitely will recommend this to anyone wanting quick, but tasty Latin street food. Chicago is a city that has the Michelin-ranked restaurants such as Alinea and the best street food in the country, perhaps the world. La Esquina del Sabor adds to that panache.Definitely get the Pastelillos! They are so good!

1.description: This is my favorite little spot for good Puerto Rican food....the alcapurrias are my favorite, I usually try to sample the other items and they are delicious as well. Must stop by to see for yourself, you won't regret it!

0.description: Great and Excellent food! And so fresh. The Lechon frito y Morcilla are two of my favorite foods to get there, been eating there since I was a teenager. It's very good Puerto Rican food, good amount given for very reasonable prices. Try the food there you'll be happy you did and you'll go back for more. Being Puerto Rican myself when I say food is awesome it's awesome. We take great pride in our culture and our food is a huge part of it  YA TU SABE!

2.description: Went here just a week ago and ordered the Pork and Rice and Beans.  10 hours after eating I came down with the worst Food Poisoning ever.  Was sick for at least 24 hours.  I'd stay away from here, or at least stay away from the meat since it is most questionable.

5.description: So-I have been here 3 times and have never been disappointed. I love the rice, the carne frita is pretty darned good, alcapurrias are always fresh-although the last time they were out, the lady in front of me bought the last one, and they had just made 6.. and I was #3 in line. :( had a pastelillo, a papa frita and carne frita with arroz con gandules. Was just there on a Sunday afternoon at 2pm and there was a line. Food was just being cranked out, but it was going to be 10 more minutes before they had more alcapurrias. But I digress (am a little bitter about that, can you tell?) Then today I went to Sabor latino on Kimball and Fullerton, and was so sad. Was not at all happy with the rice. I will go back again and again to the little trailer in the park!

6.description: Took a walk around Humboldt Park today and figured we would stop and pick up dinner from the trailer that always seems to have a line in front of it. The menu is all in Spanish with no english translation at all. The girlfriend and I speak a little bit of spanish but could not translate everything on the menu. We decided on a couple of "mixtas". I had the pork and the girlfriend had the chicken. The rice was tasty but the meat was pretty dry and bland. Most likely we should have been ordering something else but without any explanation we had no idea what to order. That's not their fault, but most likely I will not be back to give them another try.

7.description: I've only tried two items here: the morcilla and the alcapurria. Both were excellent.  The morcilla has alot of spice and no intestinal flavor.  The alcapurria is soft with plenty of pork filling.  Its a good food cart  in the middle of the park, with alot of business.

8.description: As I sd in a previous review about COCO's on Division this place has waaay better flavrful food than any fu-fu wanna- be "fine -dining puerto -rican food restaurant "Yes almost all of the food her is fried ,and yes it is being sold out of a trailor in Humboldt Park .BUt lets not forget that it is smack dab in the middle of Humboldt park .Mostly everything in there is fried and of course  everything thats bad for you ..taste so good !!TrY their "pinchos "A shish kabob with pork and veggies and ask For barbeque sauce .Also have good "carne frita "Fried pork and the best white rice and beans and "arroz con gandules "The Puerto Rican festival starts Tuesday -Saturday June 10 the -14th  so there  will be tons of places to sample Puerto rican food this coming week in Humboldt Park .

9.description: this is set up in a trailer near the northern entrance to humboldt park. my friend always told me he would never eat here because the pig painted on the side looks too much like a rat. regardless, this is an excellent spot for some takeout, a huge pile of roast pork and yellow rice with pigeon peas is six bucks.

10.description: This is one of the best and inexpensive places to eat Puerto Rican Food. CoCo's is good but pricey and more Gourmet than real Puerto Rican food.

4.description: "Errrhmmm... next time you're in the city, let me take you to something I know..." -me telling a guest of mine who was trying Puerto Rican food for the first timeI don't claim to be a Puerto Rican food expert, but I was highly disappointed with the food here after having tried some of the more local restaurants.4 mini jibaritos - Meat was dry, the plantain was tough, pretty much everything a jibarito should not be.  Culprit?  Likely sitting under heat lamp too long and no longer fresh.Carnitas - Hit and miss.  Some pieces were phenomenal with the fat and meat a perfect combination of crisp, smooth, and tender.  Unfortunately, 3/4 of the pieces were too chewy, too fatty (fat was dried like eating cartilage that stuck to your teeth), or the meat was just dried out.  Culprit?  Likely again sitting under the heat lamp too long.Lechon - Soft and tender, the lechon was respectably decent.  Far from good, not horrendous.Yellow rice with pigeon peas - We pretty much filled up on this to fill ourselves.  Rice was fine.  Overall price?  Less tahn $20 for all the food... unfortunately even the frugal side of me has standards for what's enjoyable.  Verdict:  One star.  I'll never be back again.P.S.  I want to note that when I came to get food, it was the evening time (around 6 PM) so perhaps the quality of the food has continued to go down from during the day when the first prepare it... but regardless, there's no excuse for serving up poor quality food, even if your just a trailer set up.  From various other people's reviews, the food quality is likely better earlier in the day.  Unfortunately, I won't be going back to find out.

58.description: All these poor reviews, I don't get what people are expecting.When it's 2am, you're in the neighborhood, and you don't feel like going home, the Continental is there for you with dimly lit arms for an embrace of cheap alcohol. In the winter and late at night during any season, it's an excellent place to wait for the 66 bus which stops literally right outside.

56.description: This place is pretty sweet aside from the location and the bartenders. You have to drive pretty out of the way of most everything to get there, but once you get there there is generally a pretty decent crowd and decent music playing. It has an older crowd than the Wicker Park area, and they seem to be an alternative, chill crowd.The bartenders I have dealt with there suckkkkk. One time I was overcharged $10 on my debit card by a bitchy bartender there... another time I dealt with copious amounts of attitude from another bartender. It seems like if you don't know them, they're not going to be cordial. Oh well! I don't let them ruin my experience while I am there because I always meet up with a good group when I am there.It gets pretty packed on the weekends, so if you plan on going on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared to get smashed by people if you're a shorty.It is a small place and the bathrooms kind of suck, but I don't let that ruin it either!All in all, I say go to Continental if you're into a more intimate style dive bar. :)

29.description: Unless you like to surround yourself with douchebags and all the other kinds of bags (sh*t-, d*ck-, etc), then AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.In a city with very few worthy late late night bars, there are still many better choices.  In fact, any other choice is better than the Continental.TIP: If the bouncer at a bar is the most unpleasant human waste you've ever encountered in your life, it's probably pretty indicative of the overall attitude the owner encourages in his staff, atmosphere, and clientele.  Once again, AVOID AT ALL COSTS, unless you aim to burn this place down.  And then, by all means, go go at once!

42.description: Okay, I admit it. I was wrong. He was right. I came to The Continental kicking and screaming. I didn't want to be taken to this place I had heard nothing but bad things about. Mostly stories consisting about out of control drunk people. Then I read the Yelp reviews and it made me want to run far, far away from the Continental and any guy who would ever want to take me here. I mean which girl wants to be taken to a place that supposedly had disgusting bathrooms and gross fumes of puke? Can you blame me for ruling this place out? Especially when I was in a dress and four inch sparkly heels?So last night after the regular 2:00am last calls we ended up finding our way to the Continental. I had the lowest expectations from this place. I reluctantly agreed because I enjoyed the company of the person I was with, and at the end of the day, if you are amongst good company nothing can be so terrible. As soon as we entered the bar, I was pleasently surprised. At 2:00am, the crowd was very well behaved socializing amongst friends and enjoying good music and drinks. And no pukage smells!! BONUS! The next test was the bathroom...and it was clean!All in all, a great time at The Continental. The only annoying part was when the bar closed and the bouncer started to yell at everyone to clear out. The crowd was pretty well behaved so I didn't really feel the yelling was necessary. So try the Continental, don't be scared of the reviews. I'm sure each night is different. Just have a good attitude and be amongst good company.Cheers!

23.description: Overpriced. So overpriced. Honestly, I only appreciated it for the nice booths for seating - probably a hot commodity when this place is packed - and the friendly girl behind the bar. Otherwise, nothing special.

47.description: When you're out and you've been drinking and that little voice in your head says, "Continental? That sounds like a great idea!"Don't listen to that little voice, in fact make sure that voice boogies out of your head.  The Continental is never a great idea.

8.description: This is one of those "oh, let's have just one more" kind of place. Terrific, friendly bartender and GREAT music selection. Love this place, and will return.

31.description: Fun place to go to when there's nothin to do on a Saturday night! I was in '77 heaven the last time i came here(the boys, the dead boys, the undertones, etc).One of the door guys was a total d*ck tho but whatever...

34.description: It was cool  to stumble upon The Continental last night. A friend of mine said it was a sweet pool shark spot. So we get there and there was only one table up stairs, sort of a bummer, but no biggie.Back down stairs to grab some brews and they had Strongbow and Half Acre Daisy Cutter. Boom I was a happy guy.Back up stairs to play some pool, my buddies played 4 games against these two chicks and lost them all (Ha). I sort of lost my spirit to play at that point. During that time I checked out the upstairs part of the place and it's super cozy with small booths and a couple of arcade games.The tamale dude rolled in with that 6 for 5 special, and he made the night great. Dancing with a tamale in hand.Back down stairs after hours up stairs and actually packed with a good mix of girls and guys (Huge plus).I have a couple other 4am spots that are closer to my house, but this place rocks, good music, cool staff, good vibe.I'll be back to get my game of pool in eventually. They do have a nice table.Oh and those two chicks were the pool sharks of the night.

16.description: If you're looking for a crap fest then this is the bar for you. Open late for those who don't want the night to end. The DJ's can be pretty rad...definitely good taste in music on most nights. Check it out early for a better experience.

13.description: Drunken hipsters crowding on a dancefloor the size of a postage stamp, while they to make out with girls that are thinking "he looks pretty good for an off-night", elbow to elbow, getting beer baths with each bump. I'm getting too old for this. And all that was before 1am! Okay, service was pretty good for being so crowded, cheers, bartender! But next time we're out, kick this ass for a man, and tell me to go home. Thank you for being a friend!

11.description: I really don't like this bar.It's open very late.That's it: that's not just the single positive, that's about the only animating force I can imagine impelling a person to patronize this place.The location is sort of shitty.  The crowd is much shittier.  The space itself is pretty terrible, and--since it's one of *those* post-2:00am joints--there is usually never any space inside the space anyways.So: you travel somewhat out of your orbit, cram into a shitty space with shitty people to drink passable beer (or pay a bit too much for less-than-passable liquor selections), all for the otherwise-mild pleasure of an extra two hours of drinking outside of somebody's house.I've been several times; I've never felt good about the decision before, during, or afterwards.  But it's one of *those* post-2:00am joints, so one ends up there, from time to time.  The problem is: even in that context, it doesn't really rate favorably.

39.description: Uhm where else do you go on the weekend/weekday when you live in bumbleFu*k Chicago? And I mean to dance - like there is some serious dancing here on a Saturday night. I've only gone completely kaput out of my mind and well it's been amazing every single time(this rhymes, these lines). I don't remember who I talked to who I danced with or who bummed me that cigarette.IT DOESNT MATTER.This is a 4am/5am bar. What the hell do you THINK is going on?Drunk, no wait scratch that reverse it, it's WASTED people having a good time. Because 2am is not late enough to be out. For the drinkers, this is a great deal.For the people who are bartenders and get outta work around 1/2am, this is an amazing deal.And for me who gets home SUPA late from work and lives in bumbleFu*k, the Continental is my perfect deal.The bathrooms, yes gross at times...well I say...ITS A bar, not a restaurant. You can't measure the cleanliness of the kitchen by the cleanliness of the bathroom here. People get drunk and pee CRAZILY. The bar may smell like the bathroom  - but hey if you can smell this get the heck out --- your not drunk enough!But when I've gone - it's been a perfectly standard bar bathroom. Just give it a try. You'll have fun, believe me. GO with a GROUP of friends. As only going with one may not be the safest/best of times.Oh- and I'm speaking strictly late night here guys - earlier that 2 it's pretty calm, collected and cool.

37.description: Drunken hipsters crowding on a dancefloor the size of a postage stamp, while they to make out with girls that are thinking "he looks pretty good for an off-night", elbow to elbow, getting beer baths with each bump. I'm getting too old for this. And all that was before 1am! Okay, service was pretty good for being so crowded, cheers, bartender! But next time we're out, kick this ass for a man, and tell me to go home. Thank you for being a friend!

0.description: Lot's of fun with a very friendly staff and a ton of room to find your vibe.  The bar is good for meeting people, but you can also go upstairs for a quiet and intimate space to talk.  The back patio is also a nice spot.

38.description: By far the most worth-it 4 a.m. bar in the city. Not only do they play choice music like Joy Division, New Order, Bowie, etc., but there is plenty of dancing, places to sit or rub up against strangers. Because it's a 4 a.m. bar, nothing starts happening until 2ish. I know the general floorplan, but couldn't tell you any intricate details. And that doesn't really matter. It could be prison for all I know. A prison that plays amazing music. It's not my fault that this is the last place I go before hitting Village Pizza and then finally passing out in my toilet.This is one of my most beloved bars in the city, but I fear I won't be able to show my face around here for a while considering I took off my jeggings, shoes and belt last weekend here and left without them. I guess I didn't need that 47th glass of wine after all. No worries, I got home safe.I will be back, Continental. So, hang onto those items for me. Kthx.

51.description: Are you into Chicago midwest  normative social hierarchies  which means you find button-down-bros with jelled hair, square toed shoes and date rape drugs fascinating? Second on the food pyramid at this late night dark hairy  (watering) hole are the "beards are in so of course have one" hipster bros and the women who love them. And at the Continental every body gets along and is hot for each other.The really sad thing is that this bar sits on the grave  of one what use to be one of the finest dive bars in Chicago, Packaged Goods aka The Pizza Lounge.

27.description: Bathrooms are regularly without soap, so everyone there is passing around fecal residue on every glass and everyone and everything else they touch.Also, there is an employee there (yet another cliche beard intent on displaying his poorly maintained cheap tattoos) who makes a point of asserting his perpetually bad mood.  I would have thought with unemployment as widespread as it is, a business would prefer to hire professionals; or at least employees who do not deliberately offend the customers.  Good Bartenders. Good Music.  Bad vibe.

32.description: I love love love The Continental. Where else can I go for cheap drinks when the other bars close and I don't want the night to end yet?
