I've been going for years and started to recognize a lot of the staff including the bouncers but what is the deal with newer ones lately? There is one in particular who is just awful! Yes, I know the bar is closed and its time to go. I'm collecting my belongings and waiting for the bartender to close out my tab and I will be out. You think I want to stay around any longer when the ugly lights are on? Get a grip bouncers! Don't make me stop coming here because without The Continental my late nights would just suck!

54.description: I wouldn't go out of my way to go here or request The Continental on a night of nothing to do, but that doesn't mean it's not fun. The bartenders are really nice (like supremely nice, godly) and the drinks are reasonable. It's a great place to go once your 2 AM bar is closed. Some of the reviews on here are kind of disturbing and would've made me hesitant to go here had I read them before, but newbies don't be afraid. The Continental will take care of you if you go here with friends and yeah, uh don't take drugs from strangers...duh.

48.description: The Continental was more fun when Erica G. was working there. Which was neck to neck with how fun it was when it WASN'T the Continental, and was the Pizza Lounge. I took a 2 week hike through the Olympic Mountain range in WA, and came back just in time for a birthday party at the Pizza Lounge. We spilled beer, piled our bikes in the adjoining fences, made out on doorways on Chicago ave, and sang karaoke all night. it was fun. that would never happen now. in fact a few years ago, some bike girl got killed in a car accident on was it Xmas eve? it was horrible. If you like the word Continental, I suggest you watch the Christopher Walkin skit about the Continental. that is much better than coming to this soul-less place. AND you don't have to wait in a line  ( I mean come on, Chicago and California? There is no need to wait in line over there, you're apt to get recruited into a gang).

44.description: Great dive-y bar to chill and get drinks. don't love the neighborhood at night though.

24.description: Hilarious bathroom graffiti.Questionable bathroom stall locks.Everyone making out, all the time.Everyone also having a dance party, all the time.Some guy dressed like he fell out of a combination vampire movie/renaissance festival.Some guy dancing his heart out to A-Ha's "Take On Me" with some girl who has half her head shaved.Some weird 30-something getting handsy while admitting that he "doesn't know how to pick up women."That weird 30's something's friend yelling that either his dog or his mother died the other day, and refusing to clarify which one it was.The Continental is weird, you guys. But you can walk there when The Clipper closes. (Just be aware that they WILL kick you out at 3:30am sharp.)

7.description: just one drink... i swear.::blackout::::nekkediness::::slurred speech::::wooooooooooooooooooooohoooooooooooo::and that's all she wrote.once the malort makes an appearance, say goodbye to a 6am wake up call.

49.description: I can't hate on The Continental.  It provides a very important service to us West Siders: Keeping the drinks flowing until 5am on Saturday nights.  One can NEVER underestimate or under appreciate the need for this service.So The Continental... It's very dark.  The drinks are strong.  The people are, well, mostly drunk hipsters that desperately want to make out with someone.  Chances are if you're at The Continental at 4am, you probably want to make out with someone, too, so don't judge, okay?

40.description: hmmmmbeen here twice & both times were never planned.first time after one of my gigs and I have a few brews and the crowd was super hipster.2nd time was a weird after party to a holiday party upstairs and that was just a drunk fest...goodtimescheap drinks & open late.

53.description: I love the Continental! My friend lives a couple of blocks away closer to The California Clipper, so we started the night at the Clipper sadly they close at 2 so we stumbled over here. It is pretty small but when your drunk im sure it doesnt make a difference, the best part of this place is the music. It isn't very focused on some type of music which I think makes it better. PBR's are three bucks drinks arent that expensive so you wont break the bank, people are pretty friendly and by two you will be smelling peoples breaths it so packed. Hard to get a drink but be patient, Dont expect to find somewhere to sit it gets really crowded. All types of people at this joint. Fun fun fun

30.description: I'm surprised at all these bad reviews. I have to defend my old hangout I guess. I rarely go here anymore, but for a while when I lived in Logan Square I would always bike down California Ave. and hang out here. I came here a week or two ago for a few drinks and ran into some people I knew and had a great time, I miss going here. They usually play good music, and the bartenders make REALLY good drinks. They also have some good beers on tap. I always seem to run into people I've met before, or I end up meeting new people, either while inside dancing or outside smoking. I guess I don't really know what the people who gave them bad reviews are expecting from a 4 am bar in West Town/Humboldt Park. If you don't like hipsters then take your gucci purse and fake tan and go back to the Gold Coast, please. I'm sure you can afford the cab. Also, I don't drive but they have parking here, which is always a plus when I'm with a friend who has a car. The only downside, in my opinion, is the fact that, as other reviewers mentioned, they're worse than any other bar in the area about kicking everyone out exactly at 3:30. Come on... most other bars try to get everyone out by around 3:45, but it is 4 AM bar, not a 3:30 bar. What happened to 3:30 being last call??

46.description: On any given Friday or Saturday night:9pm: me: Are you doing anything tonight? roommate: No, just hanging out. you? me: Just hanging out. 11pm: roommate: I'm kind of bored. me: Yea, me too.. **awkward silence...** roommate: We could always go down to the continental later me: Maybe...that place is trouble roommate: Yea, you're right. 1am: me: You dressed? roommate: Yea, let's do it. me: One drink. roommate: One drink **BLUR**5am: me: Should we close our tab? roommate: What about that guy over there. he's been looking at me. me: But he's been making out with him roommate: Let's go next morning: roommate: Let's never do that again me: Is that the guy from the bar in your room? roommate: Yea, he came home with us in the cab. me: Oh. And the cycle continues... Big props to Nasli for keeping our glasses full !!

1.description: Great place to enjoy with friends. Not the best but it'll be a great time.

55.description: Does anyone know what a Detroit alley is??  I was in there with a friend of mine and I guess its a gay bar or it was gay night.. which is fine, but I had too many people trying to pick up my friend.. and they were rather ignorant about it..  but the bar itself was nice.. I may go back but just on another night.. either with a GF or alone.. so no temptation for the gays =)

9.description: Your bar is seriously pissing me off!!! It's 3:40 am, i have all windows closed, but still can't sleep, because there is like 20 drunk assholes outside your bar yelling soo soo loud!!! Come on, people, have some respect! This neighborhood is quiet, but your bar is awful! No respect, no understanding that people around need rest at 4 am! Aren't you supposed to do something about it???

26.description: This place is cool if you want to continue to get the buzz you didn't get at some other bar. The bartenders are a little unfriendly, atompshere is cool.

25.description: Hipstermania! I had a good time here, but I was already pretty drunk. I met some nice people, but I think I was the only non-hipster-bike riding-liberal in the place. The bar is quick. The drinks are a fair price. I'd go back.

12.description: alright, so i just got home from yet another visit to the continental and their door dude needs to get a shout out for being one of the best in chicago - i think his name is matt? raspy voice, you know the one. he controls riled up drunks like no other and makes sure things are taken care of before anything violent occurs, and he has a sense of humor when dealing with drunk girls while still keeping an eye on the ones around him (including my inebriated butt on more than one occasion) when the 4 am vag-vultures start to circle. he's awesome and more memorable than any of their bartenders.also, seriously, the review from 8/8/14 is one of the most classist, sexist, privileged, date-rape-y reviews i've ever read and indicates a way worse attitude than most of the people who end up at continental. accordingly, you can rest easy knowing the douchitude level of continental goers will never be as bad as that of - in the language of the chil'ren - continental haterz.

59.description: I feel like I need to wash my eyes with soap and water. Or maybe bleach!I've said it before, but I'll say it again: the Continental is Chicago's late-night makeout capital. No place is safe-- not the booths, not the bar, and certainly not the restrooms!Restraint, people. Your car is just steps away. Teehee. I guess it's a bit comical, though. But I'm still diggin' on the music here. Bring on the totally extra covers by bands like The Cars and other good music circa 1995 and prior. I mean, does anyone ever tire of hearing Ozzy and the gang's 'Crazy Train' at 4 am (youtube.com/watch?v=xTsv…)?I think not.

21.description: This is one of the places you go to once you're on the roundup of pregaming and just about to finish up the party. Go here for a couple of drinks, it has two floors. Usually packed elbow to elbow around 1AM. Beers are a bit over priced...but hey, you can do that when you're open until 4AM...right?!

17.description: This bar is like a light that attracts mosquitos. They're open til 4 and it's in a questionable area of Humboldt Park so you better bet it's a shit show when the regular bars close.Maybe it was the alcohol (probably) but I recall having a good time here. I have a few fond memories of this bar specifically because I went  here on a couple dates and ended up slobbering all over the person who I now refer to as my significant other.

10.description: I tried to call your phone # but there's no voice message so I'm leaving a message here. I live close to your bar and every night there are drunk people yelling and shouting until 4am. and you do nothing to control people outside your establishment. Every time it happens and you do nothing I will call the police and let them deal with your establishment for disturbing the peace. By city ordinance and being a good business you need to control the sound level outside your establishment.

5.description: Rowdy music, raucous crowd, and damn fine drinks. Pool table on second floor. A lil unaffiliated taco truck parks curbside during the warmer months. Go.

3.description: Best thing about this place is that it is a late night option. Drinks are good, but can't screw up a gin and tonic or a beer.  No food here, just booze. Ambiance is cool and quaint. It is very dark inside, upstairs has a couple of pool tables. Decor is pretty nice. It is a good corner bar for what it is.

35.description: Best 4 o'clock bar in town. Doesn't get too crowded. Great music. Reasonably priced drinks.

19.description: I can't hate on The Continental.  It provides a very important service to us West Siders: Keeping the drinks flowing until 5am on Saturday nights.  One can NEVER underestimate or under appreciate the need for this service.So The Continental... It's very dark.  The drinks are strong.  The people are, well, mostly drunk hipsters that desperately want to make out with someone.  Chances are if you're at The Continental at 4am, you probably want to make out with someone, too, so don't judge, okay?

28.description: expect to be hit on by men in questionable attire.  expect to dance to some possibly awesome tunes.  expect to see someone take their hook up to an inappropriate level.  expect to see someone puking by the dumpsters (don't be surprised if its you, happens to the best of us).  expect to stop by village pizza on the way home.  expect to regret it all in the morning.

45.description: I just spent a half hour laughing at everyone else's reviews of this place.  It's hipster heavy, smells weird, and I had to break up with that bar after I broke up with the guy I picked up there.  Definitely the hot spot for single people looking to make some bad decisions.

33.description: a 4 am bar and the bouncer called the police on my friend for writing his name in a bathroom stall.....cops came in and pulled him away in handcuffs, where I sat outside the cop car trying to get an answer from the police.. why in the world my friend was being arrestedand where he was being and taken to, while the bartenders looked on, adding that only children write on walls. He literally wrote his name inside a bathroom stall. I thought this was a bar? a 4 am bar no less? I could see that being a problem at the hilton....but the Continental? PLEASE.this bar is trying to be "edgy" and slick, but I think they missed the point in the fact that you have to actually believe in more than making money off of late night drunkards to be that way.AVOID!

43.description: terrible everything!!!!! The hipsters and their stench, shitty beer and its the size of a toilet, horrible music and service as well.

2.description: I don't know what's worse about this place. The fact that upon exit or entrance I may be shot, beaten, and/or robbed, or the fact that upon entrance I will inevitably brush up on hundreds of smelly, poorly-dressed hipsters? I still don't get the irony of putting shitty hipster dive bars on the edge of crime-ridden neighborhoods. Is it ironic or are the people who go here just poor? I was dragged here by a friend who fancies hipster women and has a trick for picking them up. Quickly, I realized I do not share his fancy and will never return! However, if there was a 1.5 star option, I would use it on this joint (for which I have a nickname I cannot share on Yelp...). It is MUCH better than the horror you'd find at the Shambles. Yelp needs install a zero star option for that miserable cesspool of a bar. Although their neighbors at Feed make some mean friend chicken & okra!

18.description: When you're out and you've been drinking and that little voice in your head says, "Continental? That sounds like a great idea!"Don't listen to that little voice, in fact make sure that voice boogies out of your head.  The Continental is never a great idea.

41.description: I'm surprised this bar has any reviews.  Because to review the Continental is to admit that you've been to the Continental.But a solid three stars for its dazzling collection of brokedown douche-bots and drunk-wads.  Which of course I have noticed only in passing as I walked or biked by on my way somewhere decidedly else.

52.description: Keeping it at four stars, only because Chris (and most others are) wondeful bartenders.  I wasn't thrilled with the all-Reggae music last Tuesday night though, Jeeeez.

50.description: meh.small bar, ok design, low lights.crowd and dj are up and down.but what else are you doing at 2 am?

4.description: I am trying to understand some peoples reviews about this bar and can't. One talks about how he is afraid of the area, what? Obviously a lincoln park dude that goes to sports bars! It's the city dude, even wicker park isn't safe. Then people bitch about the noise of drunk people outside late. Maybe you shouldn't move next to a late night bar if your worried about the noise! They had to get signatures from everyone in the area to be open till 4:00 and they did. Stop your whining! I love dive bars with good music and the continental is a prime example. The back patio in the summer is a great spot to chill out too, it's really cozy. And for the reviewer that speaks about them telling them to leave right before closing, that is because they have to by law. they have to start getting people out of there before 4:00, they are trying to heard a bar of drunk people so they can't start at 4:00. I always have a good time here and the staff is super friendly. When they are not crazy busy, the bartender Craig will make you some of the best cocktails you have ever had and he is hot too!!! So, if you like a dark dive bar with a good vibe check it out, but go early if you don't like crowds, it gets really busy late night. Go early and get a great cocktail and listen to some good music.

6.description: Fuck this place. Went there at at 2 am. Mind you they close at 4am. Front door guy comes to my table at 3:45am and yells at my table "get up get the fuck up time to go" I'm like "dude chill you close in 10-15 mins chill I'm finishing my drink" he's like "don't tell me to fucking chill get the fuck up NOW" also I'm a woman. He's yelling at me hard at this point so I slide my drink at him and I get up from my seat along with my friends and he's putting his hands on me pushing me and grabbing me hard as fuck. People are pushing him away from me trying to protect me from this crazy fuck. Then he throws my phone in the middle of the fucking road. All I have to say is that I'm fucking shocked. I've never been to a establishment where they put hands on a woman and threw my phone in the middle of a fucking road and broke it, kicked us out before closing, couldn't finish our drinks. This place is sad. The staff sucks. Don't go here. Nothing but rude losers. Still shocked. Completely destroyed my night.

22.description: This is my favorite dive bar in all of Chicago because 1. it's cheap, 2. they have great beers, 3. they have pacman, pinball & pool 4. it's just cool.Not so great/convenient location, but maybe that's a good thing?Good music, kinda metal/punk/hipster scene. Dark & funky. Good artwork/decor.

15.description: if you're here at 1a, you are WAY early.  you gotta stumble in around 230-3a at the earliest.  people are besides themselves at that point, so if you don't even know who you are, what happened 5 minutes ago, where your phone is or what part of the city you're in, you're in the right place.  i've had those nights where you just want to keep going out.  you could go on forever.  i'd say this place could definitely be on the list of blurry places to visit.  the service is deece, the people are okay, no bigs.  there are 2 floors, top floor has the pool table.  this is a neighborhood joint for me, so i'd totally come back.

57.description: I've gone pretty regularly when I lived in the area and never had the drama mentioned in the reviews??? In fact, it was always just me, my company, 2 or three others and the tender. Maybe it was the times that I went but regardless, you couldn't beat the price for the quality of alcohol you got there and the bartender was a real cool cat that could hold down a good conversation about 80's metal bands. You know what talking about 80's metal with a bar tender that actually appreciates 80's metal means don't you? That's right- alcohol Pro Bono. +1 more star for the bartender, metal and for the sake of average weighted star value- may it be a fairer representation of what this establishment has to offer the consumer. also, Rock and Roll FOREVER.

20.description: This place has a rodent problem.  While sitting in a booth last night around 11 :30pm (the booth closest to the door), a mouse fell from above and landed on me.  No word of a lie.  I couldn't tell what is was at first but my husband's face was one of shear terror.  He yanked me out of the booth as I was screaming when I figured out what it was. It scampered away under the table.  Wait staff could not have cared less.  I would have given this place multiple stars but a rodent problem so bad that they are climbing on the pipes and rafters is a serious and total health hazard.  No wonder (and thank god) they don't serve any beers on tap but I would not drink anything there ever again.

36.description: I went here in the wee hours of the night with a friend and everything I heard about the place smelling like wet toilet paper was true. You walk in and the first thing you think of is, damn, is there a sewer leak somewhere. The place was packed in the post 2am glow and there were people mainly dancing with themselves in the tiny dance floor area. Now, most bars I have been to that are open past 2 tend to get more and more packed as you get deeper into the morning. There is a 20-something vibe to the place, and a hipster cold shoulder to it. OK, so why go? They are open. I have other 4 am and 5 am bars I like much more than this place to be sure, but there was one thing I found worth paying attention to. The bartender. She was an amazingly attractive Midwestern blond girl and I felt the need to create a bio for her. As we imagined our bartender coming in from some farm town in Iowa, Indiana, or Ohio and leaving behind a guy named Jake, we also wondered why we were here being mainly sober at 2:30 am, I realized, that other than perhaps the prettiest bartender in the West of West Town Humboldt Park area, there was little to keep us here not being all that drunk and not being 25. Perhaps it is better at 5 pm? Or perhaps at 5pm people are sober, and there is in fact raw sewage coming up through the floor boards?However, I always say something nice. If you are in the area, and in need of drink after two, why not?

14.description: Come drink here. Bring the worst person you know and a cowboy hat. After 6 drinks, she still won't be the biggest bitch in the room wearing a cowboy hat.I'll be across the street, pointing and laughing.

12.description: I have loved blown glass ever since my family took me to the mother country and I saw it done in Venice. So, taking a class would be a great idea - so I think. I had a great time and the instructor was really, really good, but I think I'm too afraid of open flames to really enjoy it. I'm glad I didn't do the long course. I did the ornament making class which I enjoyed - an hour long, not too expensive, and I got a few cool looking ornaments that I MADE ALL BY MYSELF!! Some look weird, but who cares.

7.description: There is lots of stuff in there but no one ever uses it while I'm there. The phone rings and rings.  Always call first, even if they know you are coming...you don't want to hang around outside. Not sure how safe all of the randow equipment is, but there is a lot! It is a big commune kindof place where a person has to 'cut their chops' for the hipsters to dane to hang out. The benefit parties are expensive frat type situation.  Love blowing glass, hate having to go here to do it.

3.description: Here is my customer experience. I have visited Chicago Hot Glass many times over the course of sveral years and the only thing that remains the same is your chances of getting mugged on the street outside. My car was broken into and damaged no less than three times. I had equipment stolen from the studio and was cheated out of blow time by the owners of the business. Relevance.If your a customer and visit this establishment be warned that it is not worth the money or your safety.

1.description: I met one of the artists at the Renegade Craft Fair and signed up to take a class with her.  We were making little pumpkins...I checked out the reviews here the morning of the class and I was a little worried about the trip to this part of the city after what I read...but I came and went with no concern.  Because this was my first experience with any glass studio, I don't know if its the best of the best but Kit was a fantastic instructor.  There were 9 in the group and each person got to try their hand (with help!) in the process.  Due to the cooling time required you need to go back or she would ship your piece to you. I'm definitely looking into another opportunity here!

2.description: I had a wonderful experience with their ornament making class.  The teacher was very patient with me and answered all my questions and helped me fix a few of my mistakes. I walked out of there with a fun morning and several Christmas presents for this season :) Highly recommend.

9.description: I'm a mega-fan of Chicago Hot Glass - probably due a lot to the fact they throw awesome parties!  The demos are always very interesting, although I didn't realize how often those things break while in the process of becoming beautiful.  And at the most recent benefit, after I had carefully selected my new beautiful glass for the evening and to take home, the artist came up to me and was excited I'd chosen his work!I wish the classes weren't so darn expensive, because I'm terribly intrigued with the art and would love to check it out one of these days.  Without firsthand experience of how the classes are run, I know someone who has had a good experience taking classes, but it appears as if others on yelp have mixed feelings.As far as the layout of the studio goes, I would be surprised if there was an optimal way to layout the studio with such a limited amount of space in the city of Chicago.  I really love this place for its kick-ass parties, and hopefully someday I will be able to take one of their most inexpensive (if comparatively meager), blow-your-own-cup classes!

10.description: When you're paying $40+/hr to blow glass you want some basic things in a studio that Chicago Hot Glass does not have. The layout of the studio is bad, and you have to cross a lot of work benches to get to the furnace and annealers. When we were there they did not run the glory holes nearly hot enough and we were wasting huge amounts of time reheating. The location is not so great.So I just read the other reviews and feel like I should qualify my statement. I have been blowing glass for 5 years, and I am willing to make the trip up to Racine, WS to Hot Shop Glass instead of going to Chicago Hot Glass. To be honest, Chicago Hot Glass is a dump.Heating a glory hole can be complicated. It requires the proper ratio of gas to air, simply turning up both is not the solution. We had 2 staff members adjust our glory hole before the third person (the owner himself) was able to get it running properly. I had never had an issue with any the equipment at any of the other studios where I have worked. $40/hr is the cheapest you can rent for at Chicago Hot Glass, and that is for a 10" glory hole. At Hot Shop Glass in Racine you get a 24" glory hole for $35/HR. A 20" glory hole would cost you $55/HR at Chicago hot glass. At the Urban Glass studio in NYC we paid $35/HR for a 10" glory hole. The prices are not competitive.And the layout is terrible. You have to cross other work benches to get from the furnace to your glory hole. Your $40/HR becomes more like $55/HR when you consider all the wasted time.I met the owners and most of the staff at this place. They are really cool people, but they definitely do not know how to run a studio.  I really don't want to rip on this place so hard, but the only thing they have going for them is the convenience of being in the city. When you consider how far away from the city they actually are, there really is no reason to work here.

13.description: A great girls' night our or date night if you tire of the dinner and drinks routine. It's freezing in the winter though because they don't put on the heat (at least they didn't when we were there) which makes sense, because the torch fire keeps you warm while you're working on your piece. I expected an actual class where specific instructions, more details about glass blowing and introductions would be given but our instructor walked us through in 10 minutes then basically stuck by us to make sure we were being safe. It is a really relaxed atmosphere and we each were able to make 5 glass ornaments. Since we are all beginners, on average, we were only able to successfully take home 3 because the other ones either broke or blew up. Easy parking too!

16.description: This place is atrocious. I checked out their "gallery" and they had clear glass tubes filled with condoms, some of which were bloody. They used a permanent marker to write the date on pieces taken out of the annealer, and it ruined a reduced glass piece I made. When I arrived to pick up my work I waited outside a solid steel door for several minutes before anyone came to let me in. In that time two guys asked me for a dollar to  "get on the bus." It's not the kind of place a girl wants to be waiting outside alone.

17.description: This is one of the best glass studios I've been to. It's larger than most and has a good variety in the type of lessons that are available. The staff is knowleageable and some of the instructors are prominent figures within the glass community. I first attended a class during a girl's night event over 5 years ago and have been to a number of their fundraising and community events since. Collectors can watch meet rising stars and get amazing art at reasonable prices. The only discomfort, as with all studios, is the air flow in the summer months as it can get quite hot. As for the other reviewers complaining about the prices it doesn't seem that they've had much experience with similar lessons, especially within a large city with higher maintenance and rent costs. The prices are very reasonable. It's a treat to have this available within the city limits. As for the few other petty issues that people have had, I chalk that up to people who don't have the ability to deal directly with an owner/manager and would rather bitch on a website. Pathetic!

15.description: Scheduled a group of 8 for a private 3 hour lesson.  The group received instruction on how to make our own drinking glass and then, with the help of an instructor, we each made our own.  The staff accommodated our group really well.  There were three glass blowers providing instruction and assistance the whole time and everyone was very friendly and attentive.  The cost for each person was very reasonable for the amount of time spent with us.  And the best part is that we got a hand-made personal souvenir at the end!  Because we were there for a special occasion, one of the professional glass blowers/instructors made a vase for the "man of the hour" as an extra bonus.

0.description: I came here for an event a while back, and there was a glass artist by the name of Etsuko Ichikawa who was demonstrating burnt picture images from the heat of the glass.  It was pretty cool, seeing her work with the glass rod, working with the crazy  melting object, trying to mold it into a particular shape to create images on the paper.  The studio also offers classes (like glassblowing, beadmaking, lampworking, glass fusing, and kiln casting) as well as a glass gallery that showcases the glass artists' work.+glassblowing classes+beadmaking classes+lampworking classes+glass fusing classes+kiln casting classes

5.description: I took the "Holiday Ornament Workshop" and had a great time! The instructors were wonderful and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this place.  I went home with five lovely ornaments :o)

11.description: For the past three years I've been going to their fundraising parties and have had a blast.  It's so cool to watch the artists do their pieces, and they always provide great food and drink during these parties as well.  All the staff are very friendly and gracious, and are real masters of their craft.  Each with their own distinct style and skill.  I have a few friends who have also taken the classes here, and have always come out with a wealth of knowledge and are usually hooked and come back for additional classes because they love the instructors so much.

8.description: This place is awesome. I went for their spring benefit and  thoroughly enjoyed the artist exhibitions and the glass work that was displayed. Definitely worth the admittance fee. I haven't heard much about their lessons but I'm sure they are well worth it. If you'd like to check out the work there you can head over on Saturdays from 1 to 5pm. You'll definitely see me at one of their next events.

4.description: I learned how to blow glass at Chicago Hot Glass six years ago and have been learning from the folks here ever since. It's a great place to learn or observe some wonderful things being made by local Chicago glass artists. The parties are very awesome! I've never observed anything quite like them. You get a lot for your money, including the opportunity to own some handmade pieces. I've seen a lot of people go nuts at their silent auctions, walking out with 10 pieces!The layout works just fine for me. As mentioned above, I learned how to blow glass here, so I feel pretty comfortable working in the studio. I like how the space encourages communication among artists, who are all very friendly. It's a great little community of glassblowers who all seem to inspire one another.The neighborhood is not that bad. I'm a woman.I've learned so much and met a ton of interesting people at CHG...anyone can have a lot of fun here. I feel very fortunate to be a part of this glassblowing studio!

14.description: I think it's strange that so many people are giving this place five stars. I was visiting from out of town and very excited about getting to see a new studio. After reading the reviews, I thought I was in for a treat, but I (a really positive person!) was totally disappointed!Chicago Hot Glass seemed overpriced and run down. It sounds like the parties may be cool, but that doesn't mean it's a good place to blow glass. It seemed like the studio had a really odd, awkward layout. For some reason there are these benches that you have to cross in front of to get to the furnace and annealers. Very strange.Honestly, I'm going to suggest that my friends look into private studio owners. I have only had good experiences with them, and they will most likely be more friendly and less expensive... which... is pretty much what you want, isn't it?The staff who were working when I was there were fine... not particularly good or bad, but I thought they were nice enough that I didn't want to totally pan the place... but it would take a lot more than "nice enough" for me to go back again.

6.description: I showed up with my boyfriend with no idea what to expect....it was even better than I thought! We signed up for the paperweight class through Thomas (glassvisionary.com).  He was super chill and very informative.  We went over the basics right away, watch a demo of what we were going to have to do and then he let us have at it!  I always felt very safe as Thomas was watching our every move making sure we didn't burn ourselves or burn anyone else!  The almost two hours flew by!  And at the end, we had two sweet paperweights to show for it.  I can't wait to pick them up!The studio itself is very real, I like how they don't try to cater to anyone.  You're in a hot glass studio...don't expect the Four Seasons.  It's hot and industrial... people are here to learn and make amazing art.   And that's all there is to it!  I will definitely be back sometime to try my hand at making a vase!

58.description: Boy and I wanted to explore his new neighborhood, so we stopped by Senor Pan for lunch. I ordered the ropa veja sandwich (super flavorful, a bit stringy, even better with some hot sauce) and he ordered a split sandwich of cubano and bistec (kind of bland and boring). The fried chips were a nice touch.Too bad they close at 9PM. This would be a great late night spot for him! Also, great customer service. As complete noobs to Cuban food, the server was very patient when explaining all the ingredients. Also, when we came back for the boy's phone, they had it behind the counter. Thanks!

56.description: Definitely not the best of service. I asked for a recommendations, and was pointed to a piece of pork that was incredibly dry and lackluster. The waitress kept talking to me in very fast spanish. The item I ordered was very dry. Overall experience wasn't very memorable, and I won't come back, especially since they're located almost in the middle of nowhere.

29.description: This location is ByobOur first time here Food was goodStaff super friendlyThe only thing I order mojito  but  they no serve alcoholSo I order a pina colada I expected  a pina cola da  in a glass w/ piece of pineapple and a cherryO surprise they give to me I a plastic cupDon't like at all

42.description: If you are a coffee fanatic, look no further. Their Cuban coffee will have you wide eyed and running your daily marathon in no time. Try the cafe con leche for starters. In need of a bigger kick? Go for the cortadito or, if you're really desperate for a wake me up, try the cortadito doble. You'll soon be saying, "Starbucks who?"  I only wish they were open earlier than 10am on Sunday.

23.description: We had :Smoked pork chops with yellow rice and yucca con mojoChurrasco skirt steak w rice congri and madurosSide of maduros, cortaditos and guyaba cheese pastries.We are: full and contented with leftovers from the pork dish (mine)We will be back to try the sandwiches.Notes: the pork chops were SALTY. As was the yellow rice. I like salt but this was a bit too much. The pork was salty all the way through so it probably was done during the smoking. Please ease up next time BC it is a really great dish! Yucca was perfectly cooked, not overly garlicky, just enough. Onions soaked in lime juice were a tasty touch.He had the steak and let's just say MrPicky cleared his plate. And wants to come back.

47.description: It's time for an update. We came here for lunch after attending a community meeting not very far from this restaurant. I ordered a ropa vieja sandwich (sandwiches are only $5.95 and are huge), and my husband had a Cuban sandwich, while my niece had the same. The sandwiches do not come with anything. However, if you are really, really hungry order a few "sides" or appetizers. We also ordered croquettas de jamon, which were full of incredible sabor with a crispy exterior and tender interior. Excellent! We ordered a side of sweet plantains (generous portion for three people to share). They were perfectly ripe, tender, sweet with crispy edges. Awesomeness!  In addition, they served complimentary fresh, warm Cuban bread, buttered and grilled to a golden brown perfection. It was ethereal. We also had cafe con leche and guava pastelillos (guava pastry with a flaky, light, crispy exterior). I am rating this restaurant with 5-stars. Why? I came to the conclusion that they serve very, very authentic Cuban food. Yes, I know Cuban food, because I was born in Florida and we ate at many, many Cuban restaurants when we lived in Florida. The guava pastries here arrive fresh from a Cuban bakery in Miami, FL. They are super delicious with coffee or hot tea. They aren't super sweet either, and brought me back to my childhood when my Grandfather used to take us to his favorite Cuban bakery. My Grandfather would buy tons of guava pastelillos and other Cuban goodies and we would walk away with two or three boxes from the bakery. The truth is that I gave up sweets years ago, but this was one sweet that was tempting my taste buds. I gave into the temptation and broke down. OMG, I had one, and wow, it was ethereal.Stop going to 90-Miles, because this place is 100 times better. Better food. Better prices. Better service. Hey, stop reading this review and get your ass over to this place. Don't forget to hit the tall Conga (or tumbadora as the instrument is called in Cuba) on your way out of the restaurant (smack it super hard if you had a good time and enjoyed your experience). Twerk it up and down! This place is casual, small and service is always welcoming. This is a family-owned mom and pop restaurant with hard working people who take pride in providing quality hearty food. We got very lucky and found a parking spot in front of the restaurant (on a bitterly cold winter super-windy day). Our total came to $34 and change (excluding tip) -- considering everything that we ordered -- this was a very reasonable lunch. We will definitely return  ;D

8.description: Been wanting to try this place for quite awhile. Everyone raves about it. Delivery was surprisingly fast.Rice was good.But "fried pork chops"?Dont ever get them!They were more like ham steaks.Tasted like a chunk of lunch me.Very dissappointingHad to order from someone else to satisfy my hunger.Maybe ill give them another shot in house so i know what im getting myself into

31.description: This place is great!!!! Another secret place I have been going to for lunch for a year.  True Cuban place with sandwiches and coffee and crowd.  Can't miss it with the Cuban flag outside and in every sandwich.  Have brought 4/5 people here that are Cuban and they sign off on it to.  Get the Cuban and the empanadas

34.description: Went to lunch with my father, brother and son. Good was delicious!  My dad and I split a steak sandwich and media noche, the second sandwich was so amazing. $40 for r three of us with a coffee and guava pastellio to go.

16.description: This little haven of Habana, this trove of delicacies is quite a little gem on the North Avenue strip of grocery stores and hipster hangouts. You'll have to get here on the off lunch hours if you hope to find a seat. I recently patronized this establishment with a friend who was showing me around the neighborhood. She's been a cornucopia of information and spots to hit and yelp about. This one is quite economical and quite good.The servers are also very helpful and courteous, always a plus, because it is easier to be kind to the servers when their natural disposition is to be kind right back.You will find some staples of the Cuban regiment of foods and some Americanizations like breadless sandwiches converted to salads for the carb counter. The sandwiches are reasonably priced and the lunch specials are totally worth it. Just pair it up with your favorite Caribbean drink for a filling meal if you're on a time schedule. They served us relatively fast given it was the lunch hour.If you're in this neck of the woods drop by and fill up on the grub.

13.description: Every so often I get a craving for a Cuban sandwich and this is my go to spot for them. Though I usually get it to go, I do plan to stop in, sit down and explore the menu a bit more, see you soon Señor!

11.description: Decent bistec sandwich, but not on the same plateau as a 90 mile.  Plantain chips were good.

39.description: The menu is pretty standard and the prices are reasonable. Totally unspectacular but totally satisfying if you know what I mean. The sandwiches are probably their best value.Not a place I'd go out of my way to go to, but always there when if you need some comfort food. And yes their coffee is quite good and the staff is friendly. Overall a very solid place to go for a Cuban food fix or even a casual date. Upbeat and always pretty busy.

37.description: Wow. I've been driving past this place for a few years and I'm so glad I finally went in for lunch. I had the best Cuban sandwich I've ever eaten. The yucca was perfect and my friend's croquettas (forgive my spelling!) sandwich was delicious. I picked up the take out menu....I will be a regular at this place.

0.description: At the recommendation of some Cubans, I checked out Señor Pan Cafe and was glad that I did. Cafe con leche. Plantanos fritos y frijoles negros. Ropa vieja. Although I have been accustomed to having plantains in my ropa vieja sandwich, there were none in the sandwich at Señor Pan Cafe. Still the sandwich was outstanding. Ate so much that I  had no room for dessert. Will definitely go back.

38.description: The food was amazing and the service was great. I picked this spot by just browsing Yelp and thought it looked good. I am so glad I stopped it. I order the sweet fried plantains, empanadas, a steak and egg sandwich, and my boyfriend had the cuban sandwich. Everything was amazing and I am excited to go back and try other things on the menu. Don't forget to hit the congo on your way out if you had a good time!

51.description: I've been to their first location on Fullerton and Cicero,  but this one is the friendliest and more intimate of the two. The food is on point on authenticity. I'm here with a close friend that's from Cuba and she agrees that this is very typical to food found at home. The prices are just right and pretty much everything in their menu is somewhere between great and delicious.  The staff is very attentive, even when crowded as it is today. I would have gone five stars, but we got a little push back when my wife asked for a sandwich that was half one thing and half something else. The waitress asked and they accommodated her request. Check this place out if your in the neighborhood. A little taste a Cuba in Chicago. Oh, two more little tid bits. Get their coffee and make sure to pay the conga on your way out.

27.description: Delicious food...Ropa Vieja, Lechon Asado and Bistec en Cazuela were amazing! We also had the yuca frita and it was yummy. Cute place...good for groups and families.

32.description: The food was amazing. I ate the bistec encebollado with black beans, rice and tostones. Everything was perfect. The service was great. We didn't wait for a table and service was very fast. The pastelillos and pastelito de guava were also delicious!! Thank you Senor Pan for an incredible meal. We will definitely be back the next time we are in Chicago.

54.description: This little haven of Habana, this trove of delicacies is quite a little gem on the North Avenue strip of grocery stores and hipster hangouts. You'll have to get here on the off lunch hours if you hope to find a seat. I recently patronized this establishment with a friend who was showing me around the neighborhood. She's been a cornucopia of information and spots to hit and yelp about. This one is quite economical and quite good.The servers are also very helpful and courteous, always a plus, because it is easier to be kind to the servers when their natural disposition is to be kind right back.You will find some staples of the Cuban regiment of foods and some Americanizations like breadless sandwiches converted to salads for the carb counter. The sandwiches are reasonably priced and the lunch specials are totally worth it. Just pair it up with your favorite Caribbean drink for a filling meal if you're on a time schedule. They served us relatively fast given it was the lunch hour.If you're in this neck of the woods drop by and fill up on the grub.

48.description: Had lunch here with the wifey. We both had the steak w/ onions. It came with white rice & black beans. We had some yucca and the fried plantains  w/ garlic.We also tried the trio of empanadas.The service was great, great price and good food. Everything had lots of flavor.

44.description: Omg sooo good! My mouth is still watering! Lol I'm sometimes in the area for work and noticed all the Cuban restaurants. I've never had Cuban so I was curious. I Yelped the best Cuban restaurants. A higher rated one came up,  but I decided to go with this one because the price was a little cheaper, it was closer, and it had a lot of good reviews. Not as many reviews as the other one though.  Sometimes you don't want the hype places because it's too crowded.  Well this place was perfect,  found parking right outside and went in during lunch which wasn't crowded. I decided to get the Cubano sandwich made with ham, pork roast (so tender), swiss (my fav), with pickles and mustard.  It all came together so well. It also came with homemade plantain chips. ..soooo good. They were very thin, light and crispy. Also, not too salty, they put the perfect amount of salt. The whole staff was really nice too! Service was so quick! Clean bathrooms is a plus. Now I have a place to look forward to while in the area. Can't wait to try some of their other menu itmes. Very good!

24.description: I truly enjoy this location .... Today the white rice was not fresh as us Latinos love to eat it... Empanadas were good!

7.description: Husband and I love coming here for both dining in and take out. The food is DELICIOUS and it doesn't break the bank!! We always start with an order of tostones and end with flan. Their steak salad and lechon are my faveys. Service is wonderful as well.

49.description: Great food, great atmosphere, you won't be disappointed! Prices are very reasonable as well....

40.description: I love this place! It's small and quaint. The Cuban espresso is fantastic! I always get the plantain chips with garlic sauce. The garlic sauce is so delicious. All there sandwiches are great - especially the steak and onion with avocado.Although the food is amazing and very filling, I can't give it five stars for a couple of reasons: 1. They need to hire more staff. The two servers are literally running around serving, ringing people up, and making coffee. I get annoyed having to wait for them to bring me the check and run it, so I just end up walking to the register myself. Also, I ordered a coffee with cream (con leche) and it was loaded so much with milk I literally could not drink it. I ended up dumping half of it out after I left and put some more black coffee in it at my place...and I still couldn't drink it! Way too rich. I don't know if that was a bad luck coffee but I will be weary of it the next time I ever order a coffee....

53.description: My husband and I always get takeout from this place and we are fans.  Even though we've never eaten in, the food is always fresh and warm once we get it home (my hubs usually walks to pick up in lieu of delivery).  The Cuban is yummy and my husband's preferred sandwich.  I really like the Sandwich de Croquetas, which is basically just fried potatoes on a sandwich.  So many unhealthy carbs... yum.  Make sure you order a few sides with your sandwiches (or entrees); my favorites are sweet fried plantains and beans and rice.  Definitely worth adding, no matter what you're eating.

30.description: This place is amazing! I've ordered quite a few things off the menu and occasionally tried the daily specials but I mostly order the ropa vieja or the lechon asado! The prices are reasonable and the food is always great! They have a great staff, always friendly and helpful! Can't say enough great things about this place!

46.description: Had my first Cubano here last weekend. After watching the movie chef on Netflix I had to try this ridiculously good looking combination of flavors. This place didn't let down. Good ingredients and reasonable prices make for an A+ experience. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Will be back!

1.description: ProsAuthentic cuisine all the wayThey carry Jupiña soft drinkMedia noche wasn't shy of meatCubanos tasted great & again, not shyBistec empanizado was fantasticBest yellow rice I've had in a long time (very tender)NeutralSomewhat small; may be hard fitting a lot of people in there ConsNo pastelitos de carne

55.description: I love this place! Super affordable and delicious with tasty cafe con leche. Love me some Señor Pan, right around the corner from me!

9.description: Boy and I wanted to explore his new neighborhood, so we stopped by Senor Pan for lunch. I ordered the ropa veja sandwich (super flavorful, a bit stringy, even better with some hot sauce) and he ordered a split sandwich of cubano and bistec (kind of bland and boring). The fried chips were a nice touch.Too bad they close at 9PM. This would be a great late night spot for him! Also, great customer service. As complete noobs to Cuban food, the server was very patient when explaining all the ingredients. Also, when we came back for the boy's phone, they had it behind the counter. Thanks!

26.description: Very cute restaurant, tastefully decorated, but unfortunately the food was disappointing. I ordered the croquetas de pollo...they gave me the ham with cheese and the flavor was a bit strange I almost as if they were made with a blue cheese or goat cheese, which is not my cup of tea.  I ordered the black bean soup.it lacked flavor.  I was looking for  the cumin, bay leave and maybe a hint of cilantro that really enhance the flavor.I also ordered the stewed chicken strips the chicken was tough and the sauce was oily. It came with yucca and it was basically just a boiled yucca with onions.Though the staff was nice and friendly...we won't be going back.

25.description: I've passed this place hundreds of times and never stopped in.  I did so today and had lunch.  Pretty crowded for Saturday lunch (a good sign).  I was choosing a sandwich and Bulmaro the waiter suggested that I take advantage of something they do--forget what it is called--but it is three different small sandwiches that is basically the same size as a regular sandwich.  Same price too.  I got chicken, bistec and ham, cheese and egg.  All three were excellent.  I had to be greedy and order empanadas too.  $3.95 for those and they were surprisingly big.  I'll be back for sure.  Friendly staff, fast service and excellent food!

12.description: Best place for Cuban food. Really tastes like mama's cooking. I had the salmon special today and was amazing...with a little sweet tang to it. Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.

59.description: Stopped in here for a brunch hangover meal and was overly satisfied. I have picked up food here for lunch but decided to try it as a hangover food. Got the super steak and cheese sandwich and the  beef and chicken enchiladas and they were very tasty. I highly recommend stopping in. Good prices and tasty food. Staff was friendly as well. My only complaint is beverages are canned and you have to pay for each one

21.description: After watching the movie Chef, I'd been craving a Cuban sandwich for months. This place really put that craving to rest (RIP). In Houston, I tried a Cuban sandwich at Ruggles and was sadly disappointed. Everything about the sandwich was dry--the bread, the meat. I was lucky enough to come across this cafe while visiting my friend in Chicago. The staff was super friendly and the food came out in under 10 minutes after the 6 of us ordered. The sandwich was amazing... Just as good as the people in Chef made it look. We finished off our sandwiches with some fried plantains, also amazing. But I'm Filipino so I know fried plantain is really difficult to mess up.

17.description: Had lunch here with the wifey. We both had the steak w/ onions. It came with white rice & black beans. We had some yucca and the fried plantains  w/ garlic.We also tried the trio of empanadas.The service was great, great price and good food. Everything had lots of flavor.

10.description: This location is ByobOur first time here Food was goodStaff super friendlyThe only thing I order mojito  but  they no serve alcoholSo I order a pina colada I expected  a pina cola da  in a glass w/ piece of pineapple and a cherryO surprise they give to me I a plastic cupDon't like at all

5.description: Omg sooo good! My mouth is still watering! Lol I'm sometimes in the area for work and noticed all the Cuban restaurants. I've never had Cuban so I was curious. I Yelped the best Cuban restaurants. A higher rated one came up,  but I decided to go with this one because the price was a little cheaper, it was closer, and it had a lot of good reviews. Not as many reviews as the other one though.  Sometimes you don't want the hype places because it's too crowded.  Well this place was perfect,  found parking right outside and went in during lunch which wasn't crowded. I decided to get the Cubano sandwich made with ham, pork roast (so tender), swiss (my fav), with pickles and mustard.  It all came together so well. It also came with homemade plantain chips. ..soooo good. They were very thin, light and crispy. Also, not too salty, they put the perfect amount of salt. The whole staff was really nice too! Service was so quick! Clean bathrooms is a plus. Now I have a place to look forward to while in the area. Can't wait to try some of their other menu itmes. Very good!

3.description: I locked myself in the bathroom and no one would come to help. I was stuck in there for 10 hours. The cook was at least nice enough to slide some fried plantain chips under the door. For being covered in the fuzz from the floor they were pretty good. Next time maybe I'll see if they can slide some chicken under the door.

35.description: Seriously, this is THE place to go for some Cuban sandwiches. Now I am not an expert on Cuban food- I am Mexican and Puerto Rican- but I have had some awful, and so-so Cuban food. At first glance, it looks like another mom&pop shop in Humboldt Park. We went on Easter Sunday and it wasn't busy (around 11, although it got PACKED when we were there). I loved the ambience, touch of old, but the menu had a touch of modern food. We split a Cuban steak sandwich and ordered a sampler platter. Everything was delicious, the food looked great, and the sauces for the platter was yummy! I forgot to tell them no onion for my sandwich, but the bread was soft and flaky (unlike the rock hard bread I've gotten at other places.) It was so great, I am taking my inlaws there today- and these people hardly ever leave the Southside. While this isn't a 5 star restaurant, it definitely has a homey feel. The wait staff is dressed in cute fedoras and button down shirts. The owner was walking around talking to customers. It was clean, delicious, and I WILL be back!

19.description: Their sandwiches are really good and at very reasonable prices. Subway sandwiches are about the same price and have no meat in them! The lechon is my favorite. I was a little disappointed today because I got a milkshake which was soooo watery like it had been sitting there for a while (I think they forgot to give me my food when it was ready) which is why I'm giving them a 4. I paid damn near 4 dollars for a little shake that was more like milk with strawberry flavor added. I ended up throwing it away. I do love ordering lunch from here though.

28.description: I'm from Tampa and I often find myself homesick for a good Cuban sandwich. Senor Pan has the most authentic Cuban flavor I've had in the city. A lot of people rave about Cafecito and 90 Miles but I don't think they compare to this spot. They also have a very friendly staff! They also have some great guava pastries, cafe con leche, and ropa vieja.

45.description: i love this place. absolutely delicious every time i go there. enormous amount of plantain chips in every order. garlic dipping sauce is spectacular. super inexpensive. flavor out the wazoo. i love it. seriously love this place and i can't say enough good things about it. the ropa vieja sandwich is my go to, but i've not been disappointed with anything i've gotten.

33.description: Only giving four stars because I've only tried a few dishes. Delicious cheese and ham empanadas, great cortaditos! Service is always good, and atmosphere is excellent.

43.description: I live a few blocks from this place and have been meaning to try it for quite some time because I have never had Cuban food before. Finally made the trip today and I'm really glad I did! I split the small appetizer platter with my roommate which came with 2 ham croquettas, an emapanada, a tamale, and plaintain chips. The empanada was my favorite along with the garlic sauce (amazing for garlic lovers) that comes with the plaintain chips. I went with the classic Cubano which I can say was the best I've ever eaten. Really good meat, good pickles, good mustard, good bread. Delicious. My roommate got the bistec sandwich which was really good as well. The staff was super friendly. The manager came and introduced himself to us which I thought was very sweet. Clean atmosphere, warm, fun music. Definitely a Humboldt Park gem.

2.description: Legit Cuban sandwiches!My wife and I have been hunting for the best Cuban and this is definitely top 3 in the city.Fries are great too and the staff is the friendliest.Great place!

18.description: I love senor pan!the café con leche is always hot and the food is delicious.  They have a really good salad as well.super affordable unlike other nearby overrated  Cuban spots.love it

41.description: The service is fantastic! The food is delicious! The restaurant is warm and inviting! The prices are great!  This place has the 3 Bs - Bueno, Bonito, y Barato!

52.description: I always call for delivery I run a business about 3 blocks away. I either get the ropa vieja sándwich con papa rellena. Every single time I call I tell them extra sauce because they only fill the container up 1/4 of the way. With that being said they repeat the order back but yet at the delivery time I find myself with 1 container 1/4 of the way filled. Delivery is fast but today I got cold food and it's not that cold out! When it was below zero I received warmer food. Never will go back to this place again. I rather eat mcdonalds than give these guys any more money!

50.description: Awesome place for a cheap delicious meal! Great staff, great atmosphere and great food. And it's byob!

4.description: I love this place! Friendly staff, cozy atmosphere, delicious food. I have never been disappointed with Senor Pan. The Ropa Vieja sandwich is a must! Make sure you add the avocado to it- it's really the cherry on top of an already amazing sandwich.

6.description: Let me start by saying I. AM. CUBAN. I am also a foodie who enjoys great... Not good (there's a difference) food.  I can honestly say that this place is legit one of the best Cuban restaurants in the city. I haven't ventured to try many others but I'm always on the look out for GREAT Cuban eats.  Great Cuban sandwiches, cafe con Leche is awesome and the empanadas are the bomb.  Thank you Senor Pan!

22.description: Their sandwiches are really good and at very reasonable prices. Subway sandwiches are about the same price and have no meat in them! The lechon is my favorite. I was a little disappointed today because I got a milkshake which was soooo watery like it had been sitting there for a while (I think they forgot to give me my food when it was ready) which is why I'm giving them a 4. I paid damn near 4 dollars for a little shake that was more like milk with strawberry flavor added. I ended up throwing it away. I do love ordering lunch from here though.

15.description: I've been to their first location on Fullerton and Cicero,  but this one is the friendliest and more intimate of the two. The food is on point on authenticity. I'm here with a close friend that's from Cuba and she agrees that this is very typical to food found at home. The prices are just right and pretty much everything in their menu is somewhere between great and delicious.  The staff is very attentive, even when crowded as it is today. I would have gone five stars, but we got a little push back when my wife asked for a sandwich that was half one thing and half something else. The waitress asked and they accommodated her request. Check this place out if your in the neighborhood. A little taste a Cuba in Chicago. Oh, two more little tid bits. Get their coffee and make sure to pay the conga on your way out.

57.description: I love senor pan!the café con leche is always hot and the food is delicious.  They have a really good salad as well.super affordable unlike other nearby overrated  Cuban spots.love it

20.description: The lechon pulled pork sandwich is the best in the city. Get it with white cheese and avocado. Its dripping with goodness and onions and its just the best. The deep fried pork chunk meal is also incredible. Everything ive had is. The coffee drinks are great too. The staff is super friendly and the interior of the place is casual and fun. One of my favorite spots.

36.description: Great authentic cuban food this place is a must go to for Cubans that live away from there mothers 100% authentic

14.description: This place is great!!!! Another secret place I have been going to for lunch for a year.  True Cuban place with sandwiches and coffee and crowd.  Can't miss it with the Cuban flag outside and in every sandwich.  Have brought 4/5 people here that are Cuban and they sign off on it to.  Get the Cuban and the empanadas

3.description: Does not deserve a star. The owner does not understand customer service and customer quality. They took the wrong order, they delivered the wrong order and when I called to correct them, the manager, the owner, and the employee, were argumentative, disrespectful, and downright rude. If these people cannot except responsibility for their error, then they should not be in business. I demanded my money back, and the owner said it would take up to two hours for my refund. They called, and they left before they dropped off the money, and yelled that I would have to wait another hour before I received my money. This isn't about the food or my money, this is about these people not taking ownership of their irresponsibility. This is in ill-equipped restaurant run by ill-equipped people

1.description: I don't understand how the OWNER could be so rude and disrespectful. If I could give negative stars I would. I just asked how long before he would have fresh pizza by the slice, because I needed 3, there was only two and you could tell they were Old and dry. Cashier, who I later found out was the owner, chewed my head off. Yelling and telling me this obviously old pizza was fresh, and that I'd have to buy them to get a new.  So I took a picture and he got upset and asked me to leave. I told my friend about what happened,  He said I should be glad I didn't eat there because the have a horrible rat problem.

2.description: I go in to order something other than pizza for the first time. I get an Italian beef with dip on the side , didn't get my dip. That beef so dry. The fries taste like they were throw in the oven from a frozen bag bought from Walmart. My other order was a gyro dinner and this gyro was drowned in sauce to a point where it dropped. Ridiculous amount of sauce . My chicken tenders looked like they could be bought frozen for 2.99 at Walmart as well. They didn't rip apart like most places and my son didn't enjoy them. Over priced for horrible tasting food. Never again! At least I have another place to cross off my list

5.description: I tried the pizza here for the first time and it was actually really good.  The crust was perfect and so was the flavor. Definitely  will be going back.

0.description: best pizza on the westside humboldtpark my team at custom print now off grand love it

4.description: Bella's is my go to pizza joint. I love their thin crust I also request it a little thicker $2 extra because it can be kinda paper thin. My fav from them is the chicken Alfredo. It's so creamy and they give you plenty of Alfredo sauce to dip your bread sticks in. I've never had a bad experience the young man on the phones taking orders is always nice and my order usually is at my front door within the hour. Piping hot ready for me to devour. They are very affordable as well.

1.description: Good Food. I don't think their Jibarito is as good as Papa Cashe's down the road, but they are still verrrrry tasty!

0.description: I guess this is the reincarnation of another Borinquen. This place also claims to be the originator of Jibaritos so I guess they are the same enterprise. My first visit, I had the jibarito with chicken. OMG the chicken was soooooo goood. Jibarito is a sandwich made of fried plantain slices with meat, cheese, lettuce tomatoes and mayo in between. Oh and a LOT of garlic on top. Lots of flavor. Its pretty simple but amazing.I am a fan. Note on the platanos maduros, its a little less maduros. or maybe I just got some unripe ones. I love sweet plantains so a little disappointed with that. but otherwise, I'd come back to try the other things on the menu.

29.description: Great coffee shop. The women working were very nice and friendly. The coffee is good and the donuts from Doughnut Vault are amazing. The decor is super cool too. I could hang out in there for awhile.

42.description: Really cool place, kinda hidden near Augusta and California. The inside is very nice; good lighting, cool feel with all of the decorations etc, and GREAT coffee. I will definitely be making this my go to coffee spot from now on.

23.description: Great coffee and ambiance, even better donuts..

47.description: So excited that this place just opened a block away from me! I was quite sad to see Knockbox go, but I'm glad there is now a substitute. I went to this place on opening day and everything seemed to be running smoothly. It's a cute, small place that has a very chill, comfortable vibe, and the barista (Ryan, I believe) was very friendly and welcoming. Currently their hours are only 7a-3p, which is a bit odd since they serve alcohol, but it sounds like they're extending their hours soon, which would be a plus. Seating is quite limited, so hopefully that will change. I'm also hoping they expand their menu a bit, as there are only a few coffee drinks listed on the menu, plus a handful of alcoholic beverages, but again, I expect this may expand in time.

8.description: C C Ferns is the best coffee I have ever had. I was blessed enough to live two blocks down from it and let's just say I was there almost every day! I'm not sure how to explain the coffee but every sip taste so smooth. Almost like I am drinking a rich mans cup of coffee, I love it. I love that they have cello player come and play sometimes. She is great and really sets the mood for this old school room feel. I love everything about this place even the staff is really nice. I wish I didn't move but I still try to make a trip to get my fix :)

31.description: Love this place! It is really cozy...very tight. I really miss the Knock Box but this place does fill the empty spot in my heart. The barista is very friendly and easy on the eyes. Good coffee and great looking donuts.

34.description: Well what can I not say bad about this place.!!! Hmmmm nothing. All though I was a bit reluctant to start going here after all what happen to our beloved "KnockBox". However I was convinced by my husband to just give it a try. The entire concept is great. Ryan, the barista who seems to be the one always working on my visits here is amazing. Talk about knowing how to make a special coffee cocktail at its best. I am sure some people might complain about not having more of a variety of items to choose from for a snack or a healthier choice. However my personal opinion thank you for having the oh so yummy "Old Fashion Donuts" from no other then the Vault Bakery.!!!;)The experience is amazing and always completely different each time I go, in which I love. The space is small, however I highly enjoy it being that small and intimate at the same time. Hope to see other "KnockBox" followers show some support to this place, after all where else in the City of Chicago can you have a spirit drink, cup of joe, a pastry, a cigar and listen to classical music live.Priceless!!!! Thanks Ryan XXOO-Amiree25@tumblr.com

16.description: This is the best coffee shop. The vibe, the coffee and the staff are all amazing. I hope they continue to carry croissants throughout the day- it sucks when a savory breakfast person wants to go here but all they have is donuts. Sometimes I run to grab coffee at CC ferns and stop in one of the other places nearby for a croissant, quiche etc. for my morning salt tooth.I hope they expand their hours!! I want to come by this place for a night cap with one of their boozy steamers but don't get off until 6 PM :-/

13.description: I'm writing this at 3:45 am maybe this is when I do my best work.C.C. Ferns literally located in the back of California Clipper off Augusta Ave is one quirky place. If you have been to Sodikoff's Roxie's by the Slice, this is the coffee shop version. It looks like Archie Bunkers Place collided with Sanford and Son. A lot of earthy tone colors, dark yellow, greens, brown, jukebox tans. The floors and ceiling look like they haven't been touched in decades. All topped off with a 1950's refrigerator. Despite all this 70's flashback craziness I absolutely love it. There may not be a more chill coffee shop in all of Chicago. You can really get some work done or get that Tinder profile exactly the way you want it. The menu is small not a lot of fruity sweet drinks here. This is for real coffee drinkers. They serve LA Colombe  coffee and their menu pretty much is the same as their shops. Unlike LA Colombe this spot is super small, so you better get here on a slow day at a slow time. Otherwise the California and Augusta intersection is not the most exciting or safest place to be. Just saying! Additionally If you want some of those delicious Donut Vault Donuts get here early they sell out quickly.Two main issues I have with this joint. One is the lack of Donuts. They should have enough donuts to last a majority of the day and not just a few hours. Do they only expect five people to walk through that door? Just imagine the look on their faces when a soon-to-be fat guy whose metabolism is falling faster than Starlin Castro's batting average wants to order three of those things. Shock ensues! My other issue is why do they serve all coffee in to-go cups. Coffee should be in the typical ceramic mugs not paper to-go cups. The container in which a drink is served plays a huge part in a drinks appeal as well as the establishments. Just like certain type of cocktails belong in certain types of glasses, a cup of Joe belongs in a ceramic mug. I'm sure Mr. Sodikoff can find a garage sale and buy up a few throwback cups.Overall you can't beat the vibe and quality of C.C. Ferns. If you love no-nonsense coffee in a quiet relaxed atmosphere then there is no need to go elsewhere. Just be prepared to drink out of a paper cup and probably without a donut.

11.description: The layout was cool and the drinks were made nice but,They only had donuts and all latte sizes are only one shot of espresso

39.description: It's really nice having a coffee shop in the neighborhood again, and this place is beautiful on the inside. The donuts are amazing, and almost all gone the few times I have come. I will say that La Colombe is not really my favorite coffee, and they char the roast for their drip coffee. It would be nice if there was a lighter roast option, and maybe this will be coming in the future. Espresso Drinks were balanced and definitely fitting with the Third-Wave Coffee Scene. The Hours are really inconvenient if you work a 9-5. This place has a lot of potential and I'm excited to see how it gets better over the next few months.

37.description: There is no shortage of good coffee shops in this general area, but I still welcome CC Ferns. This place is just awesome. It's small, is sort of like walking into a antique store. The old tin roof is unrestored and amazing. I came in on a Saturday morning. There were a few people already there drinking coffee, and a couple people in line. One guy behind the counter working hard. I think you have to understand that with one barista, things might take a little time. And honestly, I'm ok with taking my time in such a cool spot. My latte was really good and I had to convince myself not to get another before I left. I sat down and worked a bit (free wi-fi) and enjoyed my stay. A constant flow of customers came in but nothing too crazy. Because this spot is a little off the beat and path, I wouldn't expect it to get as busy as some of the spots down division. I'm happy this area is getting some love lately. Some really cool things are happening in an area that in the past was thought of as dangerous. Im glad CC Ferns is there to be apart of it. PS. Good music, not too loud but relaxing.

0.description: Great atmosphere and taste of coffee. This is one of my favorite and I think coziest coffee shops in Chicago. Latte was so beautiful, amazing texture, taste, and flavor!! Furniture creates antique atmosphere. I liked it a lot! There were small spaces, but layout was great, 20+ seats available! I didn't feel so packed although lots of people there. It is a good place for work, too with free wifi.It seemed doughnut was popular, so I ordered one of them..., but I didn't like it at all. It was just way too sweet for me. I don't understand why everybody is crazy about this Doughnut Vault. I felt Krespy Kreme was much better although Krespy Kreme would be over the top of sweetness. I hope they serve scone or other pastries. Probably European bakeries matches with the antique atmosphere.

38.description: Great vibes, reasonably priced, delicious doughnuts, yummy iced coffee, super friendly barista - imma be here quite often.

27.description: Amazing new shop in the neighborhood. It has an amazing aesthetic and an intimate interior. CC Ferns is, however, disappointing in regards to their 'green'-ness. Positives: They do HAVE washable cups and mugs. CC Ferns serves their doughnuts on a washable, reusable plate. Negatives: The three times I have visited the shop, everyone had been served their drink in a  to-go cup despite the fact that every customer was staying there to drink their beverage. Each patron either had a wax-lined paper cup doubled up, or a plastic cup with a lid if it was an iced drink. CC Ferns also does not offer a recycling bin for those materials. It is such a simple, beautiful shop without many items on the menu. Perfectly curated for high quality products with detail and care put into each. The one detail they missed, however, is their impact on the environment. It would be great to see all customers that are 'dining-in' to be served with washable, reusable glasses or mugs. If someone requests a to-go option, there are many materials that are more environmentally responsible available- plant-based, biodegradable cups for drinks both hot and cold. By serving dine-in customers with washable containers and carry-out drink orders with compostable cups, CC Ferns will completely alleviate the need to offer a recycling bin. And if they don't plan on making either change, a recycling bin is the responsible route. It was great to see a new shop in the neighborhood, but very disappointing to witness the lack of care when it comes to waste. Further, learning that this quarter of the Four-Cornered business is following such a model, it seems as though the other 3 will have the same faults.

32.description: Im in love. I feel like i finally met my coffee shop match. I fell in love at first sight, got to know it, and love it more as we get to know each other moreI always feel like goldilocks when it came to finding the right coffee shop for me. I was going to star lounge for a while, like it, but it was a little too loud for ME. Also not a place i felt comfortable sticking arnd too long but had delicious coffee we still brew at home. Anywayy, CC ferns had the perfect atmosphere for me, very humble and friendly baristas that after 2 weeks already call us by name and know what i get. They carry a selection of donuts from the Donut Vault which can be dangerous! (ive had donuts for breakfast almost 5 days in a row) So good tho. I love CC Ferns and hope it will continue, because it truly makes me feel like an extension of my own living room space.

48.description: The California and Augusta intersection gets a new coffee shop courtesy of Brendan Sodikoff (Au Cheval, Maude's, Donut Vault, etc.). Its located toward the back end of the California Clipper, but the entrance is on Augusta.They do espresso drinks featuring La Colombe coffee and also offers a small range of alcoholic refreshments and donuts. Yum.
