44.description: This place is great. Really simple coffee menu filled with all the classics. The boozy options are really refreshing and there are a few really fun flavor varieties on there. The interior is really small so it was tough to get a seat, most people were sitting for a while which is to be expected because the atmosphere is delightful. It's really laid back and enjoyable. Would definitely recommend and I'll for sure be back

24.description: The coffee is amazing!! Both the drip and cold press are rich, creamy and exactly what you want to want to start your morning. I love the decor, the morning staff are sweet and friendly and it's just what the neighborhood needed. My only criticism is I wish they had a better selection of morning snacks. Don't get me wrong, the enticing platters of Donut Vault donuts is wonderful, but without other options I am forced to eat those delicious calorie traps everyday. Of course I could control temptations better, but I would appreciate the support of CC Fern if they would distract me with a banana or some yogurt instead.

7.description: Go here for the latte of your dreams!  I only ranked four stars because they were having wi-fi issues while I was there, but otherwise, A+.  I loved my pumpkin caramel latte, the vibe was great, and it was a comfortable place to sit and work for a while.  It's small, though, so I might have been lucky to get a table.

40.description: The ambiance of CC Ferns is just fantastic.  Even though the coffee shop has wifi, this is the kind of place where you sit and talk or read and soak it all in. The seating and decor support this great vibe of reading in a 1970s cabana or Elvis's Jungle Room.The coffee itself is quality. (The boozy drink menu looks great with reasonable prices of $7). The espresso is menu is standard, without frills, but you can personalize a drink with almond milk or with vanilla, almond, chocolate, or salted caramel syrups.

30.description: I stopped involuntarily when I crossed the threshold to this place. I was faced with mid century furniture, one wall completely occupied by a humidor, a gleaming coffee bar, a small bar cart with a few choice spirits, early passenger airline advertisement posters, weathered wood wall paneling, a low, crumbling patterned ceiling, and surprisingly, no pretentious employees or patrons. Earnest Hemingway and Bill Burroughs lounged at separate tables, clearly getting a jump on the day. I love coffee, whiskey, and cigars. However, I rarely like places that tout themselves as a place to consume these frivolities, especially coffee shops. CC Ferns is a venue for people that actually smoke Ashton's and drink Laphroaig or an espresso while they read a novel; not people who have seen Mad Men and can afford cigars and scotch and don't remember the last book they read, but people that grew to enjoy said vices organically. The atmosphere caught me off  guard. But now I know.

46.description: cute little place with well-executed drinks. it's more of a 'lingering' coffee bar, IMHO. and that's not a bad thing. big comfy couch, barstools and chairs that seem like they actually want you to stick around and be comfortable. have been a couple of times this week and everyone has been nice, drinks are great and um...doughnut vault--magical, delicious, splendiferous donuts. welcome to the hood, cc ferns. we're glad you're here.

1.description: First time at CC'sAmericano was a bit dry but enjoyable, tried the macchiato as well as their lemon poppyseed donut:: impressed with the flavors.Chill atmosphere+cool music, had a nice time sitting with a small group (We'll be back soon)

9.description: Oh I love a boozy caffeinated drink! Not only can you get coffee drinks here, you can get many of the offerings with booze! Not to mention, the decor is soo inviting and cozy. It's like sitting in a hunting lodge that's hidden from the world. What a hidden gem.

26.description: I'm writing this at 3:45 am maybe this is when I do my best work.C.C. Ferns literally located in the back of California Clipper off Augusta Ave is one quirky place. If you have been to Sodikoff's Roxie's by the Slice, this is the coffee shop version. It looks like Archie Bunkers Place collided with Sanford and Son. A lot of earthy tone colors, dark yellow, greens, brown, jukebox tans. The floors and ceiling look like they haven't been touched in decades. All topped off with a 1950's refrigerator. Despite all this 70's flashback craziness I absolutely love it. There may not be a more chill coffee shop in all of Chicago. You can really get some work done or get that Tinder profile exactly the way you want it. The menu is small not a lot of fruity sweet drinks here. This is for real coffee drinkers. They serve LA Colombe  coffee and their menu pretty much is the same as their shops. Unlike LA Colombe this spot is super small, so you better get here on a slow day at a slow time. Otherwise the California and Augusta intersection is not the most exciting or safest place to be. Just saying! Additionally If you want some of those delicious Donut Vault Donuts get here early they sell out quickly.Two main issues I have with this joint. One is the lack of Donuts. They should have enough donuts to last a majority of the day and not just a few hours. Do they only expect five people to walk through that door? Just imagine the look on their faces when a soon-to-be fat guy whose metabolism is falling faster than Starlin Castro's batting average wants to order three of those things. Shock ensues! My other issue is why do they serve all coffee in to-go cups. Coffee should be in the typical ceramic mugs not paper to-go cups. The container in which a drink is served plays a huge part in a drinks appeal as well as the establishments. Just like certain type of cocktails belong in certain types of glasses, a cup of Joe belongs in a ceramic mug. I'm sure Mr. Sodikoff can find a garage sale and buy up a few throwback cups.Overall you can't beat the vibe and quality of C.C. Ferns. If you love no-nonsense coffee in a quiet relaxed atmosphere then there is no need to go elsewhere. Just be prepared to drink out of a paper cup and probably without a donut.

25.description: Love this place! I'm becoming a regular and I'm finding I can't start my day off without them. It's been a combination of their amazing iced coffee and I've been watching Friends on Netflix. Our morning group is growing. Let me know if you want to join, we are searching for a Ross and Joey. Do yourself a favor and stop in.

12.description: The ambiance of CC Ferns is just fantastic.  Even though the coffee shop has wifi, this is the kind of place where you sit and talk or read and soak it all in. The seating and decor support this great vibe of reading in a 1970s cabana or Elvis's Jungle Room.The coffee itself is quality. (The boozy drink menu looks great with reasonable prices of $7). The espresso is menu is standard, without frills, but you can personalize a drink with almond milk or with vanilla, almond, chocolate, or salted caramel syrups.

21.description: Love it!  It took me a little while to get the courage to go in -- it looks like not much of anything from the outside.  Is it really a coffee shop?  Should I go in?  Should I not go in?  The answer is:  Do It!!!  Once inside, you realize just how much the outside foretells the charm inside.  This place is fabulously retro decorated with a collaboration of 50's, 60's and 70's fixtures that just simply work.  The coffee bar is well curated.  The coffee is strong and delightful, but not bitter like I find the coffee at that chain shop that has taken over every other cool spot I used to enjoy.  I could take or leave the donuts they bring in for the morning crowd, but I'm not there for the food so it doesn't really matter to me.  It's a coffee shop where groups of people actually talk, and others can go for a great cup of coffee and quiet contemplation at a not-rushed pace.  There are no pretentions, and no see-and-be-seen vibe.  I wish they were open a little earlier and a little bit later, but that's just about the only thing bad I can say about this place.  It's now my go-to coffee shop.

17.description: I ventured here strictly for the Sodikoff brand. How could one restaurateur be so incredibly talented?!An inconspicuous, and stupendously excellent cafe, their coffee (drip and mixed) are made for every coffee snob around. It is a living-room style setup, with a large couch, small tables and single cushioned chairs scattered throughout. The noise level is minimal, making it a great place for reading/studying/working. The lighting is dim. Service is prompt. Enjoy, caffeine freaks.

10.description: I planned to just stop in and get a coffee to go, but that changed when I stepped inside.  The space is gorgeous and just envelopes you in a different world.  It's not sleek/modern or cute/shabby chic like some of my other coffee house faves.  This space has some mid century modern living room and rec room vibes, but it's definitely cozy and designed for some in-house-coffee-sipping/lounging. So I stayed in and enjoyed a delicious pumpkin caramel latte (which beats the pants off of SBUX's PSL)  and a coconut old fashioned donut (they carry doughnut vault goodies). Other than the regular coffee staples (espresso, latte, ice coffee)  they also offer "boozy steamers" and which I would love to try the next time I can hang out in the area.  Their Strawberries and Creme sounds luxurious!  crema de alba, strawberry liqueur, milk.

5.description: Gorgeous and sophisticated Pan-American design with boozy steamers and metropolis coffee. I love love love metropolis coffee so of course I was excited for this new spot but sadly no matter how many times I go in the coffee is just not good. It usually tastes burnt or bitter.I tried a regular coffee and a cortado but would much rather get quality coffee at star lounge a few blocks away. Definitely worth checking out for the vibe though and grab a slice of pie from the place next door!

3.description: This place has mad flavor. And not just the coffee but the spot itself too. Very cozy with a mix of tables and desks, chairs and sofas. Good lighting. Funky old school decor with vintage aviation posters on the walls."Strong drip" or whatever their plain ol' coffee is called was pretty good. About $2.50 for a mug drinking in. David P's latte or cappuccino looked pretty tight.I'm getting into photography, can't you tell from my fab Yelp photos? So I was pleased they had books scattered about, one of which was a giant Vivian Maier, "America's Street Photographer," retrospective. I rarely like to linger in a place for longer than 20 minutes but here I think we done killed 1.5 hours or more.They have alcohol too. Great spot to have you a shot or "boozy steamer," which I'm sure are great and to be investigated further at a later check-in.

35.description: Ryan is the best and so is the coffee. The donuts I would eat off the floor.

19.description: Super chill. Local. Yummy donuts. Nice interior design by humboldt house. If you like dark roasted coffee, this is your spot. It's not my thing but it's not a deal breaker. The espresso I got had me grabbing for water to wash out that roasty bitter taste.

28.description: This review is for a private night-time booking at CC Ferns.My fiancé and I held an engagement/going away party at CC Ferns and the whole experience couldn't have gone any better. I made the booking with Lailaw through the Clipper contacts page, she was very responsive and so easy to deal with. Between the service, price and atmosphere - it was more than we had hoped for. We had the space for the whole evening, we got there at about 7pm and we were able to bring in our own food. Jean Tomaro was our private bartender, working behind the coffee counter, we narrowed down the cocktail list and she made everything to order. For payment, we were asked to meet a minimum spend + gratuity. This worked well for us as we just cut off the tab when we hit the minimum and then people bought their own drinks. The atmosphere in there is great at night time, we bought some cigars, had some great cocktails and boozy steamers - it was just smashing.Thanks Lailaw, Jean et al., you guys are killing it!

45.description: I have been looking for a cafe to settle on and finally the search is over. The prices are reasonable, the music is soulful and soothing, and the donuts are some of the best in town. I love the ambiance and the decor. The same people who run this place also run Au Cheval, High Five Ramen and Doughnut Vault. I'm excited to also try the bar attached to the cafe called The California Clipper.

33.description: My favorite coffee shop in all of Chicago. Hands down. Easy vote. Ryan is a saint. The best mocha I have ever had. Always consistent. The decor is beautiful. Extremely comfortable environment that makes you wish this place was open all through the night as well, because I would never leave. Ryan transforms you to a place that could be anywhere.. Paris , London, San Fran, NYC , Chicago..  A haven in the Starbucks world we live in today. Oh, and did I mention it's a one man show? Seriously, Ryan is a saint.

43.description: Spent a few hours this afternoon sipping on iced coffee in this well decorated and bright spot. The surrounding intersection of California and Augusta has been booming over the last year or so and this addition continues that trend. The coffee shop is essentially the rear of California Clipper.Friendly workers, casual environment, and off the relatively beaten paths that are Damen, Chicago, Division, Western, etc.Will certainly be back. Their hours are fairly limited at this point but I overheard someone mention that they may extend them.

2.description: Funky, crusty, high quality. boozy coffeeness. Recommended!  I do like the boozy coffee drinks. My only suggestion would be that they not come in little tea cup size. They are really tasty but need to be a bit larger.

18.description: Love this place! It is really cozy...very tight. I really miss the Knock Box but this place does fill the empty spot in my heart. The barista is very friendly and easy on the eyes. Good coffee and great looking donuts.

41.description: A small but nice addition to this up and coming California and Augusta intersection. Try the whiskey and cream bishes.

4.description: I tried their whiskey & cream coffee and it was excellent! My friend wanted the ginger spice latte, which they were out of, so the barista comped the other drink. The vibe is chill and the crowd is not obnoxious. I highly recommend the boozy steamers.

6.description: Top notch coffee shop. Cool place to drink and chill, great furniture, ceiling, chairs. The boozy steamers are awesome. Seriously one of the best things to pass my lips and a great way to start the day. Tasty pastries and if its your thing, they have a nice cigar selection with tables outside.

22.description: I love this iced coffee!  Actually, I'm obsessed and feel great sadness if I somehow miss the chance to stop in.  The atmosphere is very chill and great for work or socializing.  I love the mid-century decor as well.  It's nice to see familiar neighborhood faces and the great service keeps you coming back.

15.description: Im in love. I feel like i finally met my coffee shop match. I fell in love at first sight, got to know it, and love it more as we get to know each other moreI always feel like goldilocks when it came to finding the right coffee shop for me. I was going to star lounge for a while, like it, but it was a little too loud for ME. Also not a place i felt comfortable sticking arnd too long but had delicious coffee we still brew at home. Anywayy, CC ferns had the perfect atmosphere for me, very humble and friendly baristas that after 2 weeks already call us by name and know what i get. They carry a selection of donuts from the Donut Vault which can be dangerous! (ive had donuts for breakfast almost 5 days in a row) So good tho. I love CC Ferns and hope it will continue, because it truly makes me feel like an extension of my own living room space.

20.description: Great space, even better quality and service AND it's less than a 9 iron from mi casa.  The place is sufficiently bad ass serving up delicious Metropolis coffee and doughnuts from Doughnut Vault.Ten years living in the area and they're finally getting the Cali/Augusta strip on track. Rootstock the pioneer if you will - unless you include the Clipper in that category - you've now got Spinning J's , Haywood and CC Ferns with a soon to be, aptly named Calagusta Cafe and European Grocer coming to a corner near you.  And it will be run the former Exec Chef of Rootstock. Insert "W" here.

36.description: Damn man, These donuts are on point!These donuts, these donuts! Oh man I wish I had this spot back home. Pistachio is my favorite, followed by chocolate coconut. I was here only for the weekend and came here everyday since I stayed. I'd recommend any of the coffee they serve with them. Get your boost of caffeine and sugar here to get our day going.

14.description: Great space, even better quality and service AND it's less than a 9 iron from mi casa.  The place is sufficiently bad ass serving up delicious Metropolis coffee and doughnuts from Doughnut Vault.Ten years living in the area and they're finally getting the Cali/Augusta strip on track. Rootstock the pioneer if you will - unless you include the Clipper in that category - you've now got Spinning J's , Haywood and CC Ferns with a soon to be, aptly named Calagusta Cafe and European Grocer coming to a corner near you.  And it will be run the former Exec Chef of Rootstock. Insert "W" here.

3.description: Best local PR restaurant. Their jibaritos and arroz con gandules are moist and full of flavor. The steak is tender, juicy and delicious. Make sure you go before 4 pm because the frituras aren't as fresh after 4.  The alcapurrias are awesome. Prices are great and although they can use another waitress it's well worth the wait. Enjoy!

1.description: I had 6 people ahead of me .I understand food needs to be warm.but the people ahead of me got served 1,2,3 n left I came with an employee n he got served n he was behind me .the lady totally forget me .

0.description: This place is a local home type of place to come and eat if you like Puerto Rican food. The price is pretty reasonable and the food is pretty good. I've come here numerous of times and I am never really dissapointed. My recent trip I ordered a Jibarito from here with rice and a alcapurria and while the rice was a little hard not usually to my liking but none the less good.  If you are in the area give it a try 6 bucks can go along way here esepcially with this economy!

2.description: I'm only giving this place 1 star because I can't give them a zero! This review is for the north ave location. We ordered the carne quisada and it was horrible. We've been to several PR restaurants and my Boyfriend is Puerto Rican so we know what good PR food is .The carne guisada looked like it was leftovers from the day before! super dry and it looked like they just put tomato sauce on it and threw it in the microwave. Don't go here ! Just go to the Bomba it's a few blocks down and the food is 10x better !

5.description: Love the frituras. Yuca and guineos. If you want authentic Puerto Rican cuisine this it's the place to be.

6.description: I've lived in Humboldt Park for 4 years and for the longest I was eating at Sabor Latino. So one time I decided to try Ponce and their food is much better and their service is much better.  I would never go back to Sabor Latino their restaurant is really gross and the service is atrocious.  Their food is not good either most of it is over-fried and they let stuff sit out for a long time.  Ponce is a nice little place to get that jibarito fix. Ponce Place has much better food and service.

7.description: I'm just learning about Puerto Rican food, and if this place is my introduction I certainly want to learn more. They have these fried breaded balls of potato with seasoned ground beef inside. They have fried plantains. They have Jibarito (a Puerto steak sandwich between smashed plantain as bread). It's all pretty good and I am definitely looking forward to trying more.

8.description: Had the pork with rice and beans, and it was delicious.

9.description: Today my brother in law cousin went to Ponce as usually and brought a Pastellio and little did he know the suprise he was going to get. Upon biting into the Pastellio  he chopped into something hard and broke his tooth, his lip slit open. When he went over to tell them what happened, they laughed at him and offered him a replacement food item. Please Do not give your business to this establishment!!!!!!!!!!!

10.description: good mofongo with shrimp in red sauce! Also the alcapurria de yuca are awesome, pleasant service. Clean and simple.  Would go again.

4.description: Do not go. I have tried all kinds of puertorican restaurants and know great pr food. The food is terrible and flavorless. Bacalaito is super gross, arroz con gandules has 4 gandules and bland, jibaritos have no taste. Service was fine, just really tasteless food. Go to Sabor Latino truck in Humboldt park.

58.description: Came upon this great independent coffee shop, and it was love at first bite and sip! Great pastries and tea. Looking forward to savoring the coffee and sandwiches on my next visit!

56.description: Quiet shop on a weekday afternoon.  I was quickly greeted by the barista and ordered.  She appeared to be the only one working and it took a bit to get my drink which was pretty good.  I think this spot gets stars for ambiance and friendly staff and free wifi.  The drink was good enough to get me back again but I might try something different when I'm in next.Bonus: cute little homemade goods for sale too - fun to support local merchants!

29.description: Super friendly staff, very tasty sandwich (Scream Cheese w/lox) and delicious cold brew coffee. Charming atmosphere and seemingly happy patrons to boot!

42.description: I really like this place (and you also get a 10% discount with check-in).This little cafe is featured on the Indie Coffee Passport and was one of my stops during the dead of winter, in the middle of February.  It was heart-warming to trudge in from the gray slush outside to a modern little nook to have coffee (Metropolis) in a room full of pleasant people.  Despite the snow, there also happened to be some sun.Cup & Spoon doubles as an art gallery (they feature different works on their white walls), they host open mic nights, sell knick-knacks and they have a sense of humor.  See their description of the "Peppermint Cow" Latte below:"Steer yourself in the direction of this udderly bovine, calf-feine free cowcoction. Our hot chocolate unites with a pop of peppermint."Punny right?  It's hard not to love. #punsfordays. (Btw this drink is also on the Indie Coffee Passport menu.)WHAT I ORDERED:Vanilla Essence Latte || 'Madagascar Bourbon Vanilla comes together in a perfect latte harmony with fig and black pepper'WHAT I WOULD DO NEXT:Order a home-made poptart with pour over coffee. The "Vanilla Essence" which sounded so special tasted like a regular vanilla latte (or maybe my tastebuds are kinda hopeless) so I'd opt for a simpler beverage next time. However, I've read some great reviews about this lovely poptart creation and I'm a sucker for pastries.  So the second time 'round I will order one of those, which might just be the tipping point to five stars.You'll have some fun perusing their menu (at least I did) reading names of sandwiches like the "Scream Cheese" and the "Persistence of Pesto." Their baristas are kind and polite, which go a long way. I would definitely come back to this arts-n'-music oriented cafe, maybe for an open mic night.

23.description: This is my neighborhood coffee spot, and I am so happy it's there.  I pretty much always get a cold brew coffee when I stop by, but have tried their pour over as well.  Their sandwiches are quite tasty (I really like the bread) and once in awhile I'll grab some of their pastry items.  Friendly staff, cool changing art exhibits and delicious coffee -- can't really expect more from the place.

47.description: This little coffee shop was right around the corner from where we were staying so naturally we had to check it out. The first time we went I got an americano and the boyfriend got a bottomless drip coffee. Everything was great! No complaints. The space is cute and has some nice art on the wall. A couple people came in while we were there and everyone was so friendly. It seems like a close community and I like that. The next day we came back and got some coffee to-go along with some Strawberry Poptarts. The poptarts are amazing! I wish we were able to try the other flavors they had.

8.description: Greatest latte by far!!!!!!! This place is neat and cozy, good place for hanging out with ur BFFs and do some chatting. I would like to stop by again when I come to Chicago next time!

31.description: Perfectly executed coffee shop, and an excellent place to work. The coffee is exceptional, the food is good (from what I've had), and most importantly to me, the atmosphere and people are friendly and inviting. Love having this in my neighborhood.

34.description: Great (unique) espresso drinks, delicious sandwiches, and a nice setting to work in. Not very big, though, so you won't be guaranteed seating.

16.description: I see why this place has such excellent reviews...I adored their Lumberjack Latte! Get it. And my friend tried the Strawberry Poptart. I know what you're thinking, "A poptart?! I can buy a 6-pack of that shiz for $5 at Jewel!" But ladies and gents, this is no ordinary poptart...it is perfectly crispy yet soft, with a delicious, gooey filling. This is a random plus, but they also have interesting seating...some tables, cozy chairs, and cushions embedded by the window sill. Would definitely return if I'm in the area.

13.description: Great place for coffee and pastries. Got their chai latte (yum) and strawberry vanilla pop tart (great) and with the Yelp check in discount, it was very well-priced. Decor is cute and definitely roomy but cozy at the same time. Only down side is that the wifi is horrible here. Could not get any work done, but did enjoy the pastry and drink.

11.description: It was cold out and there was nothing I wanted more that morning than some piping hot coffee.  I was nearby and knew somebody would be pouring coffee at the Logan Square Indoor Market.  Open every Sunday until the end of March, you'll find them in the backroom corner, next to the musical act for the week.I ordered a black coffee, which was solid, and on a whim ordered the last Strawberry Vanilla Pop Tart.  I've had handmade pop tarts before, but this was by far the best.  First off, it's bigger than your standard malnourished pop tart.  It's much bigger and filled with sweet strawberry jam with vanilla frosting.  But what makes it my favorite is that it has that very same distinct texture of being hard yet chewy.  Just like a pop tart should be.  Otherwise it's just a toaster strudel.I'll be back at the market just to try the other flavors of pop tarts.  I hope C&S will be there every Sunday.

39.description: Really cute space with wi-fi, free street parking, art/ambience, and great coffee. All of your espresso needs plus a range of pour over options. The space is a bit small and so if you're heading there to study then it might be a little bit loud, but warm and friendly nonetheless. Will be coming back for the vanilla and fig latte.

37.description: All I have to say is once you have one of their homemade pop tarts(especially the apple) you will never want to eat another by the Big K!

0.description: Rosa J. typically wants to dedicate her entire day off to explore the neighborhoods of Chicago.  However, she had a dental appointment and was a bit too early to head over to the office.  "Cup & Spoon" was three (3) blocks west from my dentist's office.  Without knowing how her mouth was going to function and feel after the deep cleaning, she better enjoyed a cup of quality coffee before the unknowns welcomed themselves into her life.  I saw "chemex" on the menu and was curious about what that really was.  The nice barista lady explained to me that it was one of the "pour-over" coffee they serve.  Great, let's turn my curiosity into reality and try the "Guatemala."  I tagged a cinnamon/apple poptart to go with my coffee.  I inquired the Yelp check-in offer (10%off) and it was valid.  The pour-over was very smooth and aromatic.  Although I've been visiting various coffee shops in the city and the suburbs, rarely did I pay attention to the "pour-over" options featuring on their special menus.  The baristas were fun, engaging with the patrons, and didn't take themselves too seriously!  I consider all three (3) as positive traits.  Some of the coffee spots in certain neighborhoods are slightly pretentious, and I don't particularly care for this kind of vibe.  I'm definitely coming back for more pour-over coffee, since I have more dental appointments coming up soon.

38.description: Thanks for helping me find this tiny coffee place, Yelp! It's a cute little gem. And I got a lox sandwich on multigrain bread with a side arugula salad for less than $8 before tax. Can't argue with that!

51.description: I'm sooooo glad there's finally a place like this right by my home! The neighborhood is still a little rough around the edges, but there are a ton of small businesses like this coming to the area and it's really become a nice little spot, affectionately called WOW (West of Western). Cup & Spoon is really trying to build the community and always promoting other businesses, which I think is just lovely of them.And the coffee's good, too! Ha. Plain coffee is great, and they have some fun specialty drinks - my favorite part is that the flavored syrups they use are all natural! No corn syrup and chemical junk! A pumpkin latte that won't kill you, my dream come true. The staff are super friendly, there's only a handful of them so it's easy to get to know them. Another thing I REALLY appreciate is that they're dog-friendly if you're just stopping in to order and not planning to hang out inside. I HATE when people tie their dogs up outside, so this is a huge convenience for me. I don't know, it's just really cute, great quality stuff, and a super-friendly environment. I love it.

27.description: I see why this place has such excellent reviews...I adored their Lumberjack Latte! Get it. And my friend tried the Strawberry Poptart. I know what you're thinking, "A poptart?! I can buy a 6-pack of that shiz for $5 at Jewel!" But ladies and gents, this is no ordinary poptart...it is perfectly crispy yet soft, with a delicious, gooey filling. This is a random plus, but they also have interesting seating...some tables, cozy chairs, and cushions embedded by the window sill. Would definitely return if I'm in the area.

32.description: A creative, thoughtful sandwich menu (I like the persistence of pesto and scream cheese), amazing sweets (gourmet POP TARTS! whaaat? yay!), free WIFI, and good coffee. I really like the decor too, the marbley countertop is stunning! Love the WILD ROSES latte and PEPPERMINT COW hot chocolate (yum!). The Lumberjack is ok but strangely salty for my taste :/ and the Vanilla Essence is lacking flavor, not as special as it sounds on the menu. This place is sort of affordable, but for Humboldt Park, not super cheap..The service is HIT OR MISS. Sometimes the staff is friendly, sometimes they're aloof, and sometimes they're just plain rude. Not sure what to expect on any given day..I do wish the place was A LITTLE COZIER?..i kinda lose butt circulation sitting on those hard wooden benches :/

54.description: What an amazing little coffee shop nestled in the new up and coming WOW District of Humboldt Park.  Go for the coffee.... stay for the pastries!  YUM!

48.description: Small, hip(ish) and quiet coffee shop. My visit was extra quiet as there was no music so it felt a bit awkward and strange. I ordered a latte and a strawberry poptart. They have metropolis beans which is a huge deal to me. The poptart was phenomenal. If they weren't 4 bucks I would have taken one to go.If it wasnt for the quietness and strangeness I felt from the lack of music I would have given this place 5 stars.

44.description: It was cold out and there was nothing I wanted more that morning than some piping hot coffee.  I was nearby and knew somebody would be pouring coffee at the Logan Square Indoor Market.  Open every Sunday until the end of March, you'll find them in the backroom corner, next to the musical act for the week.I ordered a black coffee, which was solid, and on a whim ordered the last Strawberry Vanilla Pop Tart.  I've had handmade pop tarts before, but this was by far the best.  First off, it's bigger than your standard malnourished pop tart.  It's much bigger and filled with sweet strawberry jam with vanilla frosting.  But what makes it my favorite is that it has that very same distinct texture of being hard yet chewy.  Just like a pop tart should be.  Otherwise it's just a toaster strudel.I'll be back at the market just to try the other flavors of pop tarts.  I hope C&S will be there every Sunday.

24.description: I always love to check out a new spot for coffee and a pastry. Cup & Spoon is a nice choice as it wasn't very crowded and had a nice vibe and ambiance. Their coffee program uses Chicago's own Metropolis which I'm always a fan of. Their actually drinks were solid, I had the vanilla essence which I was able to taste the vanilla but not so much of the fig or black pepper (but there was black pepper on the bottom of my mug!). The real stand out for me was their pop tarts. Absolutely delicious!

7.description: What a great coffee shop!I was visiting Chicago and noticed all of the good reviews so I made my way to this shop.  I'm glad I did!I tried the Wild Roses drink.  It's a mocha with a special twist and it was delicious.  The Scream Cheese sandwich was perfect for a warm spring day.  Don't pass up the pastries!  I tried a Strawberry Vanilla pop tart.  I'm glad I saved room for that!The space is cosy with lots of natural light and several seating areas.  I parked myself in a comfy chair by the window for awhile while I ate and sipped on my iced coffee drink.The service was great and the staff was friendly.  I highly recommend a stop here.

49.description: Good sandwiches and good drinks! I love coming here on the weekends in the morning. They have a great location, which is particularly super convenient for me. Also, the bread they use for sandwiches and their toast is insanely awesome. And now this review makes me want to walk over there...

40.description: Great service, great espresso/coffee (metropolis), great internet speeds, great food, great atmosphere, great (yet not overwhelming) music, easy location, what more could you ask for?  I spend a fair amount of time in various cafes in the Chicago area for work and school.  If you are looking for a great cafe, check this place out.  It is worth it!  Tip: Try out the Wild Roses specialty drink! It is sweet and flavorful!  The fruit preserves with fun kinds of toast is a nice light, yet filling snack.

53.description: Love this place! Really great selection of pastries (a must in a coffee shop for me) and well-made coffee drinks. Love the vibe, too, genuine and pretty, unpretentious.

30.description: Wanted to support a neighborhood spot, but our experience here was negative. Watery lattes, an impolite staff, and wobbly tables don't make for a good visit. There are much better options in Chicago.

46.description: Duuuuuuuuuuuuuuuude!  This place IS the coffee shop I've sworn I was gonna open myself during drunken rants. It serves metropolis coffee, which they will refill for you FOR FREE!! (MOTHER-FUCKIN" FREE!!!) if you are having it in the shop. it is staffed with NICE hipsters! which is nearly unbelievable for one, and ensures an awesome playlist for two. And they have a sandwich, Sandwich No 5 ( shout out to Lou Bega) which is just turkey, muenster, crusty ass, straight gnarly, rippin fuckin bread, arugula, fat ass tomato, and mustard. NOT A SINGLE SMEAR OF MAYO IN SIGHT!!!!! ITS LIKE A FUCKING SANDWICH UTOPIA!!!! I hate mayo, it literally gives me rage attacks. Like, if I lived in the middle east, I would suicide bomb a mayo village for my cause. Cup and Spoon also has great wifi and art on the walls, etc. Its just a really great coffee shop and I hope it stays here and stays the same. *disclaimer: I am coffeed out of my mind as I write this, sorry for all the "fucks" but everything I wrote is true.

1.description: Well I live only a 1/2 mile away but have just discovered Cup & Spoon. What a cute and welcoming cafe! Not too much seating, only about 7-8 smaller tables along with stools at the coffee bar and one of the windows. I came in midweek around 1pm and got one of the last spots big enough for me to sprawl out. The overall vibe was pretty quiet with most people working on their laptops. Vegan blueberry banana muffin--tasty and not at all dry, which is always a plusVanilla essence latte--delicious BUT I made a terrible mistake and forgot to give them my milk choice so idk if it was delicious because it was made with full fat milk or because it's delicious regardless. Will definitely be coming back to try some more of their baked goods and their other specialty drinks. They also had a menu of sandwiches. Employees were very friendly.

55.description: I've only visited Cup & Spoon on three occasions; however, I visited their pop-up at the Nosh every Sunday at the Logan Square indoor market all last winter. This cute cafe with super cool artwork from featured local artists is definitely a hidden gems in the city.  I remember Rosie (the owner) and Suneil asking me one time, "what makes a great cafe?"  Simply, I told them a great cup of coffee using various brewing methods and beans from a reputable local roaster is important, but service and experience are key to get customers to return......not too difficult.  Based on my experiences, they both always have delivered.  The whole staff are passionate about coffee and the business.  They tend to make you feel welcome, unlike many other of the third-wave coffee roasters/cafes.  And yes, they make a damn good cup of coffee using roasts from Metropolis!  I have yet to try any of the treats they offer, but plan on doing so the next visit.  Kudos to Rosie for a job well done!

9.description: Small, hip(ish) and quiet coffee shop. My visit was extra quiet as there was no music so it felt a bit awkward and strange. I ordered a latte and a strawberry poptart. They have metropolis beans which is a huge deal to me. The poptart was phenomenal. If they weren't 4 bucks I would have taken one to go.If it wasnt for the quietness and strangeness I felt from the lack of music I would have given this place 5 stars.

26.description: This place is so adorable. I ordered a soy latte and sat at a table next to an outlet so I could plug in my laptop while I work. The kind barista brought me my latte in a cup with a saucer and it was delectable on its own. No sugar needed. I stayed there for about an hour and a half and was able to concentrate the entire time. So there you have it! Nice staff, outlets, free WiFi, pleasant ambiance perfect for working.

25.description: Really cute interior and superb staff. Everyone is always really nice and have a smile on if it's 8am in the morning. Great coffee and a very nice spot to do some work. I love this new addition to Humboldt.

12.description: Cup and Spoon is hands down my favorite coffee spot in Chicago. The drinks are high quality and every food item I've had is delicious.  I especially recommend the Lumber Jack Latte. The staff is always friendly and the ambiance is great for catching up with friends or getting work done. Keep up the great work!

59.description: I only ask for outstanding coffee from a coffee shop, but the cappuccino is just so good that I got one every morning. Excellent service with an incredibly friendly staff. Thanks for making my mornings survivable during Riot Fest.

21.description: Friendly service, plentiful coffee options, great sandwiches, and delicious "pop-tarts".  Metropolis is one of my favorite roasters...nice to see it out here.  Good wifi too.

17.description: I stumbled upon this place as I needed a java fix and a place to work before dentist appointment.  I adore ma and pa cafes so this was the perfect choice.  It is super cute and they serve kick ass coffee!  I had a special...wild roses or something latte and it was amazing!  The place is pretty small, but there was plenty of space the time I went around 9ish am.  I saw there were a lot of regulars getting their take outs so that's always a good sign.  Def a place I would visit again when in the neighborhood!

10.description: I really liked this coffee shop because it had cool art and great coffee. However, the customer service is lacking. I was really disappointed with Cup & Spoon because one of the owners (the younger one) was very rude to my friend and I. I had a friend in from out of town. I thought I would take her to Cup & Spoon to get a cup of coffee and chat. When we got there, we were surprised to find that the power went out in the coffee shop. Instead of being apologetic, the owner was rude.  My friend had to use the restroom in the dark. I understand they may have experienced an uncontrollable circumstance, but the way they handled it was completely unprofessional. Finally, when the power came back on I approached the counter to order a cup of coffee. The owner ignored me. Finally, another barista came over to take my order. It took forever. I really regretted bringing my friend to this place.The horrible customer service just left me really disappointed.

5.description: This place is really cool, interesting menu and the baristas were really nice. The only thing that really bothered me is that I was unable to order a sandwich because they were out of almost all their ingredients for multiple sandwiches. That was somewhat upsetting as I walked 30 minutes specifically to try their sandwiches. Next time I guess.

3.description: My favorite coffee in town. The only other place I equally enjoy is Philz back in California... and that is saying a lot!!I highly recommend the vanilla essence latte. The vanilla is incredibly subtle but a perfect addition to the coffee - very comforting drink. I've also had the lumberjack specialty drink which is also good. Also try the pop tarts!  I've had strawberry and vanilla, blueberry, apple cinnamon, and pumpkin nutmeg. All so good!!  I think my favorite is the blueberry.

35.description: I like everything about this place except for their lack of bagels. I'd like to have a bagel and cream cheese rather than toast and jam.

19.description: Really cool space with interesting local art. The cold brew is delicious, and if you want to treat yourself, grab a mini donut! Delicious.

28.description: Great coffee. They know how to make a dry cappuccino!  There's a couple little tables for kids. And death cad for cutie was playing. Awesome!

45.description: I go into Cup and Spoon from time to time because my fiancé works close by. I am always greeted by name and always receive a warm welcome. Also, all of the specialty drinks I have ordered have been amazing. Order the Lumberjack Latte. You will not regret it.

33.description: What a great coffee shop!I was visiting Chicago and noticed all of the good reviews so I made my way to this shop.  I'm glad I did!I tried the Wild Roses drink.  It's a mocha with a special twist and it was delicious.  The Scream Cheese sandwich was perfect for a warm spring day.  Don't pass up the pastries!  I tried a Strawberry Vanilla pop tart.  I'm glad I saved room for that!The space is cosy with lots of natural light and several seating areas.  I parked myself in a comfy chair by the window for awhile while I ate and sipped on my iced coffee drink.The service was great and the staff was friendly.  I highly recommend a stop here.

43.description: Great service, good coffee, and excellent pastries! Rosie was very gracious as we had a large group of ladies gather for coffee. Highly recommend Cup & Spoon as a customer and local small business owner.

2.description: I can't think of a better place to write about for my 500th review.  In my multiple visits to the Chi-re, I definitely make it a point to check out this joint.AMBIANCE- I like that this place has a somewhat minimalistic decor, yet seems very homey.  A handful of tables and chairs scatter this place, with a nice little nook set up in the front window of the shop to catch some sun, people watch, or be seen by people passing by.  This place shares space with an art studio, so the art on the wall changes regularly.  SERVICE- if I had to say one thing this place excels at, it is their customer service.  I must warn you, if you're looking for "fast" coffee, then this ain't your joint.  The baristas here take their time to make you a quality product, and I must say that the various baristas that work here are very engaging and super friendly.  One of them (Mary) even makes kissy faces at me when I come in, though she may just be trying to work a tip:-P  I've come by on occasion and have noticed that a number of baristas address their customers by name, and already know their order- clearly a sign that they've established good relationships, and people keep coming back.MENU- the menu has changed quite a bit since I first visited.  Standard coffee, lattes, etc... when they first started, they have since built onto that and added baked goods (including home made pop tarts), donuts, and sandwiches using ingredients from local suppliers.  While I cannot say sandwiches, they sound terrific, and I'm sure it's only a matter of time before I partake in their deliciousnessnessnessnessness.FOOD- I'm pretty simple when I go to coffee shops, so I stick to simple things like chai lattes.  I have had the pop tarts, and they are quite exquisite.  They rotate the flavors depending on the time of season, so be sure to check 'em out when you go.  OVERALL- a great addition to the neighborhood.  I can definitely kill time here- whether I'm meeting up with people, or just chatting up the baristas, I enjoy going here and definitely feel welcome when I come.  If you happen to be in the area, I'd say it's worth checking out for sure.CELEBRITY RATING- Jim Harbaugh (if you Chicagoans do not know who that is, I don't know what to say)

18.description: I have been to many coffee shops in the Wicker Park/Bucktown area, and I really enjoyed this little coffee shop! The coffee was great, and the environment was very inviting. Space was limited but I was able to grab a seat in the corner. The crowd inside was exclusively hipster men in their early/late 20's, so I felt a little out of place, but it was still an enjoyable experience and I would return in the future!

41.description: Went here to get a feel for the neighborhood and the guy working was so nice. My coffee was excellent as well as my sandwich. My favorite part was sitting in the giant window-facing comfy blue chair.

52.description: Very cute and cozy spot with lovely owners who make great espresso. Free WiFi and comfortable seating. Enjoyed their whey toast with olive oil and herbs while my bf loved the apple cinnamon pop tart and date toast with honey.

50.description: This place rocks.  The Cortado is fantastic, staff is great, and the homemade poptarts are a must!  I try to stop by here whenever I'm remotely close by.

4.description: Honestly the chillest coffee shop I've ever been to. The music is on point and the sweets/coffee are awesomely delicious. The mood is pretty chill. Wish the place were a bit bigger but other than that, the mood is dope.

6.description: I really like this place (and you also get a 10% discount with check-in).This little cafe is featured on the Indie Coffee Passport and was one of my stops during the dead of winter, in the middle of February.  It was heart-warming to trudge in from the gray slush outside to a modern little nook to have coffee (Metropolis) in a room full of pleasant people.  Despite the snow, there also happened to be some sun.Cup & Spoon doubles as an art gallery (they feature different works on their white walls), they host open mic nights, sell knick-knacks and they have a sense of humor.  See their description of the "Peppermint Cow" Latte below:"Steer yourself in the direction of this udderly bovine, calf-feine free cowcoction. Our hot chocolate unites with a pop of peppermint."Punny right?  It's hard not to love. #punsfordays. (Btw this drink is also on the Indie Coffee Passport menu.)WHAT I ORDERED:Vanilla Essence Latte || 'Madagascar Bourbon Vanilla comes together in a perfect latte harmony with fig and black pepper'WHAT I WOULD DO NEXT:Order a home-made poptart with pour over coffee. The "Vanilla Essence" which sounded so special tasted like a regular vanilla latte (or maybe my tastebuds are kinda hopeless) so I'd opt for a simpler beverage next time. However, I've read some great reviews about this lovely poptart creation and I'm a sucker for pastries.  So the second time 'round I will order one of those, which might just be the tipping point to five stars.You'll have some fun perusing their menu (at least I did) reading names of sandwiches like the "Scream Cheese" and the "Persistence of Pesto." Their baristas are kind and polite, which go a long way. I would definitely come back to this arts-n'-music oriented cafe, maybe for an open mic night.

22.description: We wish you were in Portland!  How can you not love this place. Great pop tarts, service, food. And now a patio!!  How cool. Glad to always stop by when I visit Chicago.

15.description: I always love to check out a new spot for coffee and a pastry. Cup & Spoon is a nice choice as it wasn't very crowded and had a nice vibe and ambiance. Their coffee program uses Chicago's own Metropolis which I'm always a fan of. Their actually drinks were solid, I had the vanilla essence which I was able to taste the vanilla but not so much of the fig or black pepper (but there was black pepper on the bottom of my mug!). The real stand out for me was their pop tarts. Absolutely delicious!

57.description: Not much to say here....We stopped in yesterday morning to grab some tea's. The place itself is very minimalistic but still artsy and very clean.  I got an iced berry-hibiscus and she got a hot chai. The Chai was reported as very good and I was thrilled with my tea. Very strong flavor with great color, and sweet enough it didn't need any sweetener. Plus they gave my dog a treat so that instantly gets bonus stars....

20.description: This place is adorable!  If I tried the Vanilla essence; its an interesting combination of flavors with great execution, although I personally could have gone for a little more flavor--didn't really taste the black pepper..  My friend had, I believe, the sunlight through the fog, which was an earl grey latte with vanilla and orange (similar to a london fog), and it was amazing.  I never thought I liked tea or tea lattes but this changed my opinion for sure.

36.description: Great work spot!! Delicious coffee and pastries (apple cinnamon poptart, whuttup), cozy chairs and tables, cool local(?) art on the walls, and a bright and clean vibe.

14.description: We'd done business through them at the Logan Square Farmers Market, but I hadn't been in before. I ordered food from Rangoli a few doors down so I popped over while my food was made. THIS PLACE ROCKED!! It wasn't very busy and it seemed like they were getting ready to start closing duties, but they were happy to see me and they treated me like family. I hung out by the counter and we shared music recommendations and the beverages were awesome. I've been there twice now and I was surprised when I looked at my account and I hadn't rated them yet. Now I have... Good work Cup & Spoon. Surely I'll be by there soon!!

12.description: Having grown up in the South suburbs, there's a special place in my heart for dirty beef/hot-dog/gyro joints. You know it's going to be tasty and cheap when you see that one yellow sign with the submarine cartoon on it - they all have it. After recently moving to the North side, I was delighted to find Best Sub (#2; the original is on Division) right down the street from my place. The good:- Greasy, dirty, cheap (you'll walk out of there only about $5 lighter)- Delicious- Great beef, Vienna franks, Kronos gyros, and gloriously heart-attack inducing burgers- Open until 4 AM every night. The bad: - Slow prep time. Call 10 minutes ahead.- The fries aren't the greatest, but they'll do at 4am.- Expect to encounter an unsavory character or two. It is, after all Humboldt. Oh, and once my roommate and I paid for our meals with Panamanian currency worth about US$2. Another time I paid $9 for my $11 meal, and the guy gave us a huge plate of chicken and fries because it was there and they were closing.

3.description: not the swankiest of places, however they are home to THE BEST FRIES i've had in Chicago. WINNER!  WINNER!  CHICKEN DINNER!   and they don't skimp on the amount.  order them "well done" and they're the perfect amount of crispiness on the outside and fluffy on the inside.also ordered the cheese steak - it is ginormous. split between two peeps or prepare to have a food baby.

1.description: For some reason I'm the customer ...I try to order something and I cant order what I want. I'm telling u what we want to order and u try to tell us what we should order.... Doesn't work that way unless it's chef choice at a downtown rest Food didn't have any salt and since we couldn't order what we had planned and wanted  the food was a turnoff and disappointingI will take my business elsewhere where I can spend it on what I want to order

2.description: I spent over an hour in the snow driving back from the burbs.  There was a quasi homeless guy sleeping in one of the booths.  They used cardboard boxes on the floor to soak up the snow.  The floor was gross.  The homeless guy made the whole place smell like feet.  I had every reason to hate this place and leave a bad review.  Let me just say if you are expecting anything other than basic old school greasy late night food, don't come here.  That being said, this place has some seriously decent food.  I was really surprised.  It is also REALLY cheap.  I think I spent $7 on a foot long philly with fries and a pop.  It was awesome.  -1 star for the unkempt atmosphere and the totally disorganized menu.  I'm being nice to say this is anything less than a sh*thole.  I don't care.  The food tastes good.

9.description: Unless there are two # 2s, the place in Humbolt Park is not Best Sub #2. The Best Sub in Logan Square is the one coined #2. My hubby jokingly says it is named correctly (#2). Anyway, enough potty humor. This place is pretty scuzzy. But it is open really late and the workers here are really nice. I have a soft spot because of several late night Gyros from this place. I love a restaurant that gives you a story, as long as the story is not food poisoning.

10.description: This one and a half star food place gets 5 stars for having a huge menu that includes fried okra, sub sandwhiches, several kinds of fish, gyros, burgers, hot dogs, polish sausauge, shrimp. chicken, pizza puffs, cheese sticks, and a whole bunh of other stuff I can't remember.I enjoy getting the #1 special, which is a big hamburger with all kinds of toppings, fries and a can of soda for 2.49$And they're open until 2 am on weekdays and 4 am on weekends. This place is kind of scary though and you may be solicited, but you don't have to eat there. They're fine with calling and ordering and you go get your food and get the fuck out.

4.description: Big selection of food with really good subs. Chicken wings have a really tasty seasoning to them and the prices are low. Definitely going back again.  Also the people are nice there

6.description: This is just what this neighborhood needs and im not being sarcastic when i say this "ghetto flavor". This is one of those spots where u can just about get anything u could think of. Another big plus is the friendly  cooks and cashier. U can dine in but the crowd changes and sometimes theres a lot of kids waiting to get a fixing of chili cheese fries. You can also modify and combine menu items to make your own creation (ask for double bacon gyro chili cheese burger). The prices are affordable and u wont believe how much food u can get for 10 dollars. They sell everything at a reasonable price so there my go to when i don't  cook. I have tried over 6 different meals and each one is spectacular. On some aspects this restaurant may have competition like jays beef down the street but thats only with italian beef and best sub is second best Italian beef.

0.description: It's a little taste of greasy food when you don't have a lot of money and probably don't feel like venturing far from home if you happen to live in the neighborhood. This place doesn't have the best atmosphere it has been my experience that some homeless people do set up shop inside and pretty much hangout in there, the restaurant itself is kind of run down, buuuttttt (there's always a but) the food is cheap and will suffice when you need it to. Just a tip I always call ahead that way when I get there my food is ready and I can leave as soon as possible.

5.description: Moved away from Chicago for about 10 years,  so alot of the food here is food I've been missing.... One of my favorite spots to eat for something quick,  greasy and good.  I don't know the dude name that's always in there but he looks like an Emilio, so that's what I call him. He always hook me up! ONE OF THE BEST BEST I'VE I'VE BEEN TOO.  THE ONE ON CHICAGO AND KEDZIE, AND ALSO ON ROOSEVELT AND PULASKI TOO!

13.description: 7 days a week this place is open until 3:00am.  The food isn't spectacular but for the genre its very solid.  Their combos are tough to beat and is the perfect stop for those late night drinking or work fests.Dinner tonight:  Double "Whopper" (Includes all the lettuce, tomato, onion+ fixins and a nice roll) with cheese and fries.  They bolted on a fried egg onto the burger per my request ($4.50 + $1.00 egg).  Burger wasn't incredible but compared to stopping at a real fast food place I was the clear winner.  Another friend got the Chicken Nugget combo (includes 8 nugget, fries and a pop) for $2.99!  She remarked that they were pretty good but wished she had gotten the chicken strip combo instead.  I really enjoy the Cheese Steaks and other late night shouldn't but gotta have meals.    This is a place for no frills, cheap, fast food, and if you're a bit nervous with the Humboldt Park hoodlums you may not want to risk it.  But if you're drunk, tired or downtrodden and just need a bite, or if you simply would rather go local and a bit better quality it's the same price as any of the fast food chains.

11.description: You are going to have to trust your taste buds on this one.   The food is good, the menu is huge,  and the prices are low.   That being said,  make sure you get your food and split.   Call in an order if you can.   I had a hard time keeping a straight face when he asked  "for here or to go".  I wanted to ask  "Are you serious???".

8.description: Fried chicken, fried fish, fried shrimp, gyros, burgers, philly steak, yeah one of those places. It's what you expect from a greasy hole in the wall, with great low prices.A chicken sandwich with fries and a drink is less than $5, and come to think of it most meals run about the same. The fish sandwich is solid, and the fries are crispy.Be clear when you order, though, or you'll end up with two sandwiches and a strawberry Crush in your to-go bag.

14.description: their subs may be the best, but i dunno. the hot dogs? not so good. the fried chicken, on the other hand, is so good it makes me weep. especially the half chicken dinner for a measly $5.25 which comes with salad, garlic bread, fries, hot peppers, hot sauce and a half chicken so big it looks more like a half ostrich.

7.description: I've always been a big fan of the old fashion hot dog / Italian Beef / Gyros places. Cheap decent real food that you don't have to wait a long time to get. The guy working there was super friendly which is always a plus. I had the two polish sausages which were decent, a little over cooked, but good for the price. The fry's were really good and crispy.This isn't exactly a place to take a date to, but a great place to sit down and grab a quick bite to eat.

1.description: Sadly gone. The soaps were really nice.

2.description: This is a great new find!  I ordered a gift basket for my cousin's baby shower - full of handmade soaps and other goodies.  I picked up a bar of Gold Rush soap for myself and got a free travel size of chocolate truffle.  I will be back to try their other scents soon!  I love this soap!!

0.description: Very cool shop and great for gifts. A wonderful addition to the neighborhood.

58.description: I think I had way too high expectations because everyone from my burger club said they had the best burger in Chicago.  The wings are just okay but I did like that their fried pickles are sliced and fried.  I ordered the conjugal visit burger because it sounded like Thanksgiving and who doesn't like Thanksgiving food.  I thought the toppings were AWESOME but the actual patty just meh.

56.description: I came here for the first time about a month ago before a concert. We figured it was the most appropriate place to dine before going to Marilyn Manson. I ordered the Possession of Shrooms burger and it was EPIC. It was so delicious and decently priced. The alcoholic beverages are a little pricey, but worth it. I loved the clean bathrooms, service and atmosphere. I live pretty far away, but will be returning again!

29.description: I typically only rate especially good or bad experiences.  I've been to Lockdown three to four times in the past, and the food and service have been ok.   Solid burgers, good beer list and average service.   This past weekend I went there to have some beers with friends.  I realize that don't think of themselves as a sports bar, so I asked the bartender when we arrived if it was ok if we could watch a game there and he agreed (though didn't seem too pleased).  Our friends arrived shortly after.   About ten minutes into the game, they changed all the TVs to the Blackhawks game (it was already on about 5 TVs in the bar).   We asked if they could change one TV back to the basketball game as we had discussed.  The second bartender said no (with no explanation).  When we said the other bartender said it was ok, and that we had invited a number of friends to watch the game there, he said "We aren't a sports bar, he made a mistake."   He didn't seem to see the irony that they were turning every single TV to the Blackhawks game, but claimed they were not a sports bar.   I gave it one last shot - I told him we planned to eat and drink there and would likely spend $300-$400 there.  The bartender told us to go find one of the sports bars on division.While I wasn't expecting fantastic service here, I didn't expect them to welch on their agreement and then be so arrogant when we confronted them with our explanation.  Too many good bars and restaurants out there to deal with this BS.  If they would have said "no" at the outset, I would have been completely fine with that.  But once you strike a bargain with your customer, you gotta keep it.

42.description: The burgers here are very good!  The meat is seasoned very well and you get very large portions.  My wife got the mushroom burger with goat cheese and the flavors were balanced and delicious.I was hesitant to try the stuffed "Warden" burger because I'm not a fan of fakey cold packed cheese spreads like Merks.  I bit the bullet and went for it and I'm glad I did.  the cheese worked very well since it's acidity helps cut the richness of the beef and bacon.  I could taste just the perfect hint of truffle oil in the fried leeks. (Take note Bop 'n Grill fans, this is how you truffle.)For an appetizer we had the fried dill pickles and they were perfect!  Not too much breading, barely any oil and the dipping sauces were great.The hand cut french fries were perfect too.  Everything you want in a crispy fry.The star of the show though is their Mac 'n Cheese.  Mine came a little cold and usually that's enough to get a bad review from me, but I can't.  The flavors were too awesome.  The bechamel was thick and cheesy, the bacon added a nice smokey hint and the fresh green onions took it over the top and tied it all together.  Next time I go back I might get a burger, but I'm DEFINITELY getting a full order of Mac 'n Cheese....And one to go.The service was a little slow at the bar.  The bar tender was meandering about while my drink order sat.  Next time I'll sit directly at the bar so I can ensure he's doing his job.  Otherwise the waitress was attentive and the food came out quickly which is in contrast to what a lot of people have been saying.  However, we went at 2:00pm on a Sunday so your experience may vary.I almost forgot the atmosphere.  Meh.  It's really small and divey. The place looked pretty beat up and I had to swap my chair 3 times due to damage. I didn't really get the whole prison theme but got the metal theme.  I'm a huge Slayer, Megadeth, Testament and Iron Maiden fan but in the end, it's just another bar so no big deal.  Again, since I went on a Sunday afternoon that might be the deal.  I'm sure the place is head bangin' pretty loudly on a Friday/Saturday night.We will definitely be back!

23.description: Looking for a place to relax and talk to your friend? Don't come here. Looking for a place to eat great burgers? Go in and your tastebuds and soul will thank you.I came to Chicago to visit family from California. Most places I've been taken to have vibes that are...not golden state approved to say the least. The servers here are more lighthearted which makes the food taste just a bit better. I play some Disturbed and Slipknot to sleep so the Heavy Metal was not a bother.Of course the food was great. I recommend you try their Mac and Cheese as well. I have only gone once but the next time I visit my old hometown I will most likely go back.

47.description: Best Mac and Cheese and Turkey Burger in the city!

8.description: Best burgers anywhere. Period. Sure it can get loud, but that's part of the fun!!  Never a dull momentStaff has fun too

31.description: Arguably the best burgers in the city.  The entire menu is well put together and the food is always properly cooked.  The overall theme and atmosphere is great.  The only reason I can't give five stars and the only reason I do not frequent Lockdown - the music just gets too loud.  I need to be able to have a conversation at least with the person next to me while enjoying my very delicious food.

34.description: Hello Lockdown.  It has been too long that I've been meaning to visit!I rolled in with a few friends - most of us interested in The Fat Elvis due to some Grand Marnier Flambe respect and a love of peanut butter.  It was a wednesday so we were promptly seated, though the table was a bit wobbly.  It seems like the experience here is mostly geared to a 2-person party, but there are 3-4 tables built for 4 or more.The waitress was friendly, funny, and prompt and got everything done pretty quickly.Draft selections were pretty reasonable at $5-6 for most and $7 for a couple, but local cans were 1/2 off and a great deal!  The drinks came quick and our order wasn't far behind.The Fat Elvis was good, but I wouldn't necessarily say it crossed any thresholds.  I thought the peanut butter would be more overpowering but the flavor was very balanced between burger and sweet desserty PB banana.  The one thing I'd suggest is adding some cheddar (or it could be weird, but maybe even blue cheese) to bring up the level of savory a bit and make the flavor a little more complex.  Definitely a mess-maker with melty peanut butter, so make sure to grab some extra napkins.The Mac 'n cheese I subbed in for my fries was an A+ and a definite winner.  The portion is reasonable and the stuff was really, frankly, very good.  I did try a couple of my friend's fries and the dipping sauce they came with (spicy mayo-ish?) was pretty tasty and the fries were "normal" but cooked just right.The only thing that really surprised us was a friend's Old Fashioned that totaled out to $18.50 with a Maker's Mark equivalent.  I didn't take it for that type of place, but so be it.  Definitely echm Lock Down your beer order.I'll definitely be back for the mac 'n cheese, and maybe I'll have to try The Warden burger for some of that truffle oil goodness.  It definitely smelled strongly and deliciously of it from across the table!

16.description: HEAVEN IS REEEAALLL.GEEZ this place knows how to make some burgers.The veggie burger was out of this world. My boyfriend got the warden and said it was one of the best burgers he's ever eaten.The cheese flying out the middle when squishing it was a sight to be seen.I felt like I was in jail and liked it - Tuesdays half off can't beat it.Would highly recommend if you are looking for some great service.

13.description: Decor/cleanliness/environment: Metal music playing.. Very very loud so u might need to ask your friends or waiters to talk louder. For me, it's unique for me but wish they can turn down the music a little bit (0.5/1)Service: I have been there so many times. Some days it's fast, some days it's not especially on Tuesdays.  Expect an hour or two wait on Tuesdays.  (0.5/1)Food:  Burgers are delicious! Have you seen the meat patty? FREAKIN HUGE! My favorite ones are public disturbance and the bootleg. Even the Mac n cheese is good too.  Love the beers there too.  (2/2)Cost: on Tuesdays they have burgers half price. Most of the burgers are $13 and up. It's not cheap so trust me it's for the best to go on Tuesdays :)  (1/1)

11.description: I can't even believe I've never written a review of Lockdown! Oh the BURGERS! Oh the fried deliciousness everywhere. When I want to eat until the buttons pop off my pants, I'll be sure to scarf down a mouth watering burger here! If you're looking to be adventurous, you should try the Fat Elvis! I mean, seriously...can you think of a more amazing combination of toppings? Peanut Butter, Bananas, Bacon... I'll admit, you'll feel like you're about to pass out after consuming this monster, but it feels so good!In addition to their burgers, they've also got some great fried pickles and chicken wings. Their chicken sandwich is pretty bomb too. They've also got a solid beer list.I've always had great service here and it's nice to sit out on the patio on a hot summer day. They're always blasting rock and metal, so if you don't like it...go somewhere else!It's a must try for the burger enthusiast!

39.description: I entered this establishment with Aspergers... Left with anxiety burgers.Seriously tho, this place is loud and obnoxious, but the burgers are totally worth it.

37.description: Good burgers. Great service. Loved the hard root beer on tap. Enjoyed the music and atmosphere as we ate.

0.description: Hey, folks. I will warn you, I'm a vegetarian so this review is for my fellow vegetarian/vegan friends. In my opinion, Lockdown has the best veggie burger patties I've had in the city. They are made with sweet potatoes and are delicious and fresh. Some of the burger options work well with the veggie patty and my personal favorite is the Possession of Shrooms although the Hawaii 5-0 is also good minus the carnitas (this is vegan unless you add Swiss cheese, which I highly recommend). The sweet potato fries are bomb. I have had their regular fries which are also good, but I think it's criminal to order a burger and not get the sweet potato fries at least once. I go here about once a month, and pretty much always get those sweet potato fries. The poppy seed mustard/sauce that comes with them is also to die for. It's like crack. Perfectly compliments the fries and I always ask for more. I guess I'm just a sweet potato fiend. Give them to me in any form and I'm happy. As for other things, the drinks are decently priced. They have a $5 shot and beer combo, which I almost exclusively drink as it's a metal bar. Somehow that feels appropriate - don't ask me why. Speaking of metal, the place is loud as balls, but that's part of its charm. I would not suggest a first date here (one dude made that mistake, it was kinda funny for me being a semi-regular but I didn't have the heart to dissuade him) because you will be shouting over the Judas Priest or Ozzy or (fill in other metal band here) music videos. It certainly is entertaining to watch as you scarf down food and drink. Oh, and the mac and cheese is epic. $16 for a massive portion with two ingredients from their list. It sounds expensive but you won't regret it. So delicious. Obvi if you're vegan, that ain't for you, but you will still find things to eat. My bf is vegan and we've been there multiple times and he cleans his plate.Also, come on Tuesday nights for half price burgers! I am rambling now (probably because I had a boozy brunch), but if you like burgers (veggie or otherwise), make this your place! Less douchey and tastier than Kuma's!

38.description: I heard the person or persons who started this place was or were fired from Kumas and ripped off the menu. Who cares. They have a cooler spot in a cooler area. I don't know which place is better. Depends on how much sleep the cook got I guess. Long reviews suck. This place rocks. I think the burgers are better than the mac and cheese. Any of them.

51.description: Ugh I keep going back and forth with this place.. And it's all because of the service.we all know if service is not good then we would most likely just deal with the craving for it in another way, such as by going to other restaurants (such as kumas) even it'd it's a bit further.  Well we went in yesterday 10/02/15 at about 430 and we tried to use a gift card. I admit the gift card was a bit old (3years) but we had the receipt showing the amount paid for it, but the waitress made no effort to work with us. At our arrival we asked if she could check it for us and as she was walking away screaming if any1 knew how to check a gift cards value,halfway down the way to the register she turned back saying how they couldn't honor it. We showed the receipt so they could compare maybe bar codes or at least make an effort and she said it didn't matter if we had it because it just didn't work. She asked how much as on it ($50) but for no reason because she kept saying we couldn't do anything. Not a single effort was done. Fine, we were there and wanted to enjoy ourselves, which wasn't the best choice.   At the end of our meal (3 of us prob there 40 min) we still had some of our drinks, half of our food and we're talking catching up and the whole crew made a very very very clear point they wanted us to leave. We were offered l by 2 diff crew members (including bus boy) containers and then the server didn't even ask she just brought us some. We were sitting there, with double the containers needed and it became obvious we had to hurry up and leave.     They toke our plates , tried to clean around us, brought the check and didn't ask if we needed anything else .The bus boy kept standing near us, looking at us with a piercing look multiple times and even the server came by saying "your still here?" In a pretty rude way making us feel really unwanted specially because she didn't even ask if we needed anything else .    It was also odd because others were there before us and were still there , so I'm not sure if they were regulars as they seemed to be pretty chatty w the servers or if we were just targeted on being a mixed group.  Mind u that place was half empty by this time, there were plenty of open seats, tables, even at the bar,no one was waiting, no one seemed to be hustling, they just probably wanted to get things going. We were gonna order more drinks, but after an almost $100 bill, a rejected gift card  and a lack of good customer service, we were done spending our hard earned money there. So we left to another bar. Sad really, as we were already comfortably there.

27.description: Great burgers (with great names) and a pretty cool atmosphere. Definitely more appealing when they have the outdoor seating open. Solid beer selection with daily food or drink specials (for the most part). The burgers are pricey, but the meal is filling and worth a visit.

32.description: There are a lot of intricate burgers here. You should be ashamed of yourself if you can't find something that you like here. I don't even know what else is on the menu since I come to this places specifically for the burgers. I'm a huge mushroom fan and they have a mushroom goat cheese burger that is solid. This is definitely a place I need to return to so I can enjoy each burger on the menu. In addition to delicious burgers, the beer menu is just as impressive. There is enough on the menu that I've never heard of so I usually live on the edge and try something new. The heavy metal theme is pretty sweet from the decor to the music. They usually have cool stuff playing on the TV's so there are things to keep your attention.

54.description: I'm curious to know the back story of why all of these fantastic burgers are named after jail - related incidents...my theory is that someone went to jail without ever having a last supper beforehand and once they were in jail they developed an obsession for burgers (what their last supper would have been) and then named each of his concoctions after the terrible things he saw in jail.  The likelihood that my theory is right is about .005% but the likelihood that the burgers are, in fact, delicious is around 99.9%.  I'd heard from a couple of people that these burgers were comparable to those at Kuma's Corner so I set on my quest to research this claim.  Here are my results: the burger is very juicy and jam-packed with ingredients...and the buns were quite dense and delicious.  Although it tool forever and a day (about 45 minutes to be exact) to get our burgers they were cooked to perfection.  While ordering the burgers I'd debated on the Lockdown Warden and the Cruelty to Animals - I chose the latter.  This burger had so much meat on it that it became difficult to decipher which was which, but it was still quite tastey....just not as tastey as Kuma's (in my humble opinion).However, the mac n' cheese that we ordered with the burger was phenomenal.  Sure, it was an additional $3 to get the mac n' cheese instead of fries with the burger but that extra cost was well worth it.  Oh, anf if you're looking for some good beer -
