they have lots of it and they have the strong Not Your Father's root beer (the stronggg  one) on tap.  It's a popular choice it seems so they should have it in stock if you wish to partake in its magnificence.Now, here's a tip: if, on the weekend,  you're going with a group where some members are under the age of 21 then you have to arrive before 10 pm because that's when they stop letting underage people in.   When we went we were with our friend who is only 20, but thankfully we got there around 8 pm so we were able to eat.  The bouncer (who looked like he came straight outta a Tim Burton movie) almost didn't let us in because he didn't realize it was only 8 pm.  Like Kuma's it's kind of small on the inside of the restaurant but they have some seating outside for when it's nice weather still.  Also, like Kuma's (hmmm, seems like there's some copy-cattin' going on) this is a metal-oriented  bar so you'll hear thay type of music throughout your thug-dinigng experience.  All in all, it's great fun and you will enjoy it!

48.description: A great meal. Wow. I ordered the dill pickles (addicting), mac n cheese (cheesy deliciousness) and the first burger on the menu stuffed with cheese. I was blown away. My meal was perfect paired with a not ur father root beer, I was in heaven. I will Def return to try different burgerd and food. Four stars and not five  because I think even tho good,  it is overpriced for area and atmosphere. But the food is delish. Enjoy.

44.description: In between the food, service, and the ambiance, this place is just a better version of Kuma's Corner.

24.description: After several visits to Lockdown, I was determined to go on a Tuesday for the half price burger special. Today was the day! The burger was delicious, macaroni and cheese did not disappoint. Why only four stars? The temperature inside was around 60 degrees. I was able to enjoy about 1/4 of my burger before it was cold. Had to eat dinner with my coat on and could not wait to leave. Turn the heat on, please!

7.description: I would go back just for the pickle chips! I ordered the Hawaii 5-0 and could not get enough. I barely managed to finish because I was stuffed. One of the best patties of meat I've ever had. The Metal music playing was not too loud at all, and only added to the atmosphere.Please venture out here and try their mouthwatering menu.

49.description: Maybe I made the mistake of coming here during their burger special night. Even after we ordered, I didn't get my food for another 45-60 mins. I ended up eating a half cold burger... -_-Not my kinda scene, but loved the atmosphere; everyone was having a pretty good time. It was different than what I was normally used to.Good beer selection as well.I'd give this place another nice. Hope to update this review soon!

40.description: Wow, wow, wow!! After reading Yelp reviews and scrolling through everyone on here raving about how great Lockdown was, I was determined to check it out for myself. I now am one who can join the others and state that "it is better than Kuma's Corner!!" (and WAYYYY better than Au Cheval) We tried three different burgers, sweet potatoe fries, regular fries and mac n cheese and EVERYTHING was amazing. Sorry Kuma's, I have found a new love.

53.description: Layout was cool dined on a possesion of shrooms burger for my love of the portabellas. Burger cooked perferct. Nice balance of goat cheese and garlic aioli. Not a big fan of hamburgera but had to try this place. Reffered to by a friend. The drink list was awesome, all types of drinks here. 6 pages of all different types of drinks.

30.description: Wow.  Wow... The burgers are incredible. We tried the arson and the big house.  Perfectly cooked.  Incredibly flavorful.  The venue is great.  Death metal/rock/prison ambiance, and fully consistent in the menu.  Was really busy, not a lot of seating, but they worked with us to find a spot.  Highly recommend it.

46.description: Love Tuesdays half price burgers. Gets a bit crowded tho but it's worth it. Def will be back.

1.description: Lock down is in my neighborhood. I started going when I us to live in Bridgeport, I loved their burgers & the mac n cheese was to die for!!! It us to be worth the wait. I moved to Wicker Park about 5yrs ago & was  super excited when I realized how close this place was to me & would go at least 1s a week, rain or shine!!! But as the years have gone by, the excitement that triggered my burger loving relationship with Lock Down has fizzled away. I've slowly stopped going religiously. What was 1s a week trip turned in to 1s a month, 1s every other month & now I haven't stepped a foot in about a year! The truth is I was forced to look for a better burger spot when the mac n cheese stopped being so awesome & the burgers were no longer mouth watering & worth the wait. My relationship with Lock down was sadly over & I've moved on to about 3 other burger spots that meet my expectations. Out of respect to Lock down I will not mention them in this review, because through it all the staff was just about always on point with their service. Had the service also fizzled, this review would go a different way.So thank you Lock down we had a beautiful thing going but I must continue on!...Maybe one day we can't try again.

55.description: My boyfriend and I came in last night for dinner and drinks. I ordered The Fat Elvis which came with peanut butter, bacon, and caramelized bananas. I didn't quite know what to expect since I hadn't ordered a burger like that before. I was pleasantly surprised! Sweet, savory, all in all delicious! My boyfriend ordered the Cruelty to Animals which came with white cheddar, bacon, braised pork, and prosciutto. Both were tasty, filling, and left us with extra to eat for lunch today. The one downside is that they were a little spendy. The average burger there is $15. I wish I had more time in Chicago because I'd definitely be back!

9.description: Has Lockdown out-Kuma'd Kuma's?  It may be true.As you walk in, you are assaulted by a sonic storm cloud, shoving thunder down your ears and out your butt.  Lockdown is LOUD.But it's a good loud.  Metal, of the heavy variety.  This is a place to get drunk and get stuffed and headbang a little.I ordered the Cruelty to Animals burger ($15) - Bacon, White Cheddar, Braised Pork, Prosciutto.  It was awesome.  The mighty pretzel bun could not contain the meat avalanche, and pig parts came sliding out the sides.  I loved every bite.The fries were tasty, but could have used some seasoning.I also enjoyed a Good Juju beer from Left Hand Brewing Company.  It tasted like a boozy ginger ale.  Awesome.There are some drawbacks.  While I sat at the bar, I did get hit with somebody's powerful B.O.  A good way to counteract that is to shove more burger in your face.  It's like a gas mask made of meat.Lockdown is open late and their kitchen doesn't close until 30 minutes before the whole bar shuts down.  That's a win.I will be back to chew through more of the animal kingdom and to further damage my eardrums.Bonus: While I was there I chatted up a roadie for Weezer.  They chose Lockdown to grab food and booze after the 2015 Taste of Chicago concert.

26.description: Disclaimer: DONT Come here for an intimate conversation, come here to give in to your glutinous desires; this is a heavy metal bar and grill & believe me you will hear the heavy metal, good thing you'll be too much in a daze eating that you probably won't even want to talk. I promise that You will find me here any chance I get on a Tuesday night to divulge in their Tuesday 1/2 burger special. 10 ounces of pure premium ground beef, hand made seasoned patties with every type of topping you can imagine. The mac & cheese is almost better than mine and that my friends is some good Mac & cheese. The beer list is extensive and during the summer they open the patio in back. Be aware though, you will wait, and you will wait a long time, but that's just what happens when you go to a place like this. Better than Kumas corner and Umami burger.

25.description: Lockdown is a cool place to have a few drinks and excellent food. It should be everyone's go to place for their Mac & Cheese . My personal favorite burger is the arson. Sometimes this burger can be spicier than other days but always great. The service can be a bit iffy sometimes but generally it's acceptable and the food makes up for it.

12.description: Looking for a place to relax and talk to your friend? Don't come here. Looking for a place to eat great burgers? Go in and your tastebuds and soul will thank you.I came to Chicago to visit family from California. Most places I've been taken to have vibes that are...not golden state approved to say the least. The servers here are more lighthearted which makes the food taste just a bit better. I play some Disturbed and Slipknot to sleep so the Heavy Metal was not a bother.Of course the food was great. I recommend you try their Mac and Cheese as well. I have only gone once but the next time I visit my old hometown I will most likely go back.

59.description: I can't even believe I've never written a review of Lockdown! Oh the BURGERS! Oh the fried deliciousness everywhere. When I want to eat until the buttons pop off my pants, I'll be sure to scarf down a mouth watering burger here! If you're looking to be adventurous, you should try the Fat Elvis! I mean, seriously...can you think of a more amazing combination of toppings? Peanut Butter, Bananas, Bacon... I'll admit, you'll feel like you're about to pass out after consuming this monster, but it feels so good!In addition to their burgers, they've also got some great fried pickles and chicken wings. Their chicken sandwich is pretty bomb too. They've also got a solid beer list.I've always had great service here and it's nice to sit out on the patio on a hot summer day. They're always blasting rock and metal, so if you don't like it...go somewhere else!It's a must try for the burger enthusiast!

21.description: Best burgers anywhere. Period. Sure it can get loud, but that's part of the fun!!  Never a dull momentStaff has fun too

17.description: Love this place! The servers were so awesome they made you feel right at home among the heavy metal Music! The food was delicious and I can't for the life of me think of one bad thing to say! The burgers.......YUM!

10.description: Pretty good food but such a small place gets over crowded especially on 1/2 burger Tuesday's . Then again I been there on a Friday night with no big difference .Got seated in the worst possible seat legit inches from door in the dead of winter. But hey it is what it is I still enjoyed my food the music / atmosphere n that cool hip waitress w the beenie. I have returned and will continue to dine in at lockdown(FAT ELVIS is my favorite burger ) peanut butter , bacon , banana don't knock it TIL you try it

5.description: I'm curious to know the back story of why all of these fantastic burgers are named after jail - related incidents...my theory is that someone went to jail without ever having a last supper beforehand and once they were in jail they developed an obsession for burgers (what their last supper would have been) and then named each of his concoctions after the terrible things he saw in jail.  The likelihood that my theory is right is about .005% but the likelihood that the burgers are, in fact, delicious is around 99.9%.  I'd heard from a couple of people that these burgers were comparable to those at Kuma's Corner so I set on my quest to research this claim.  Here are my results: the burger is very juicy and jam-packed with ingredients...and the buns were quite dense and delicious.  Although it tool forever and a day (about 45 minutes to be exact) to get our burgers they were cooked to perfection.  While ordering the burgers I'd debated on the Lockdown Warden and the Cruelty to Animals - I chose the latter.  This burger had so much meat on it that it became difficult to decipher which was which, but it was still quite tastey....just not as tastey as Kuma's (in my humble opinion).However, the mac n' cheese that we ordered with the burger was phenomenal.  Sure, it was an additional $3 to get the mac n' cheese instead of fries with the burger but that extra cost was well worth it.  Oh, anf if you're looking for some good beer - they have lots of it and they have the strong Not Your Father's root beer (the stronggg  one) on tap.  It's a popular choice it seems so they should have it in stock if you wish to partake in its magnificence.Now, here's a tip: if, on the weekend,  you're going with a group where some members are under the age of 21 then you have to arrive before 10 pm because that's when they stop letting underage people in.   When we went we were with our friend who is only 20, but thankfully we got there around 8 pm so we were able to eat.  The bouncer (who looked like he came straight outta a Tim Burton movie) almost didn't let us in because he didn't realize it was only 8 pm.  Like Kuma's it's kind of small on the inside of the restaurant but they have some seating outside for when it's nice weather still.  Also, like Kuma's (hmmm, seems like there's some copy-cattin' going on) this is a metal-oriented  bar so you'll hear thay type of music throughout your thug-dinigng experience.  All in all, it's great fun and you will enjoy it!

3.description: I don't know why people think this place is so great.  I went here with a friend (who had also previously reviewed) and her review is still true today: this place is super annoying loud, even when it's like 5 p.m. on a Thursday evening.  We went here because we wanted to do a working dinner.  I saw on Yelp that they had Wifi, so I brought my laptop and we came here for dinner, drinks, and work.  Parking was easy, we got in alright, there were tons of tables available so we sat and I pulled my laptop out.  We place our drink orders and I ask for the wifi password... That's when the waitress kindly informs us that they have no wifi and, apparently, never did.  Why would people on Yelp say that they did if it weren't true?  And, also, great... we came here specifically to eat and do work and now I have to waste a ton of my phone data by using my phone as a hotspot.  Super annoying and douchey.The food here isn't even that great.  If you're not getting a burger, don't bother getting any food.  The salads are overpriced and the appetizers were super greasy and burned-tasting.  The beer was fine but even domestics were mostly canned, which sucks because canned beer sucks.  I probably won't come back because this place just isn't anything special and it's sort of douche-y.  The end.

35.description: Ok... Yes it's loud, yes it's a bit crowded but the burgers are OMG!! Had the electric chair and it was perfection! If you are a burger freak..you must go!!

19.description: I love lockdown! I would say it's a tie between kumas too and lockdown. Lockdown has a nice outdoor area to sit down, inside they have a fun rock feel. Their burgers are always juicy and BIG! I always say I'm too full for the fries but their too good to throw away.

28.description: Had the Elvis burger. It was surprisingly good, the combination of peanut butter and banana seems weird but it did work out. The atmosphere in there is different. Not a fan of heavy metal but, the staff and food cause you to forget about the music. Wish they would have a sports event at least on one tv. Ijs

45.description: So surprised by the rude host. "You're not ordering food??!!" Apparently having drinks with friends is something to be scoffed at here. So much for the 'bar' part of the name.

33.description: Yes to it all!! Fatass amazingly tasty burgers!!! Loved the Mac and cheese and the variety of burger options

43.description: We finally made it here and experienced their great 5/8 oz burgers and extensive toppings, as well as their punky jailhouse atmosphere.  The burgers here are just as good and creative as at Kuma's Corner, and there's not any of the waiting.  They also have an extensive whiskey and beer menu.  We tried their Border Patrol and a Citizens Arrest (make your own) with two toppings (wife chose avocado and fuji apple).  I really enjoyed the Border Patrol with the jalapeno flavorings, avocado, and moist and tender carnitas.  All of their burgers look like juicy and delicious messes to eat, and that's fine by me.  The fries that came with the burger were just fine (a side salad is the other included option).  I don't personally see a reason to ever go back to Kuma's Corner when one can come here without the wait, and it's a little bit roomier as well.  My guess on the lack of waiters (pun intended) is that the neighborhood here is not a hang-around sort of neighborhood like Kuma's Avondale.  Our server was normal and friendly.   Tuesdays are half price day but note (and it's no biggie) that their signature Lockdown Warden burger is excluded from the deal.  Easy and free street parking is nearby.

2.description: I came here for the half off burgers Tuesday because why not..? It's a steal! To be honest, I came here a few years back and the first time it was just A-OK so I never really considered going back because it's a little off the beaten path but I had a burger craving.Unfortunately, the second time around was Awesome! I say unfortunately because now I'll have Tuesday conundrums on whether or not to workout or just go and grab a burger here...FML!!! I ordered the Punk B*tch which is topped with a good amount of Prosciutto, slathered with garlic-y mustard aioli, and melted swiss cheese filling in everything in between. The meat was cooked to my preference, Medium and the pretzel bun just sealed the deal. GAMEOVER. As an added bonus the fries were on point too, especially the sriracha (my guess) type of dipping sauce they provide. My total bill including tip came out to $10.74...(you should tip on the original amount vs. the discounted burger amount). Service was friendly and prompt. Atmosphere was well "casual"...read the other reviews. Go here on Tuesdays! Oh yeah the Mac and Cheese here is DELICIOUS too.   Side story: Probably one of the awkward ordering experiences of Daniel Wong. Me: Can I please have the uh Punk uhh...Female Server: Bitch?Me: Yes the Punk Bitch please...thanks...

18.description: Burgers/food: 4.5/5Everything else:2.5-3/5I can say they have really good burgers, mac and cheese and fries. I had heard a lot of good things about this place and was curious to try it out. Their menu is full of Creative names related to law and jail theme. Plus they have many mouth watering options in the menu to choose from.The beer selection was decent, and they dont have a lot of good beers on tap. They do carry cans and bottles of many different beers. They also have a decent wine collection.I will give this a three star because of staff and the service. It seemed they didnt give a ship. Our questions regarding the menu were not answered properly. And the waitress didnt even come once to ask if we need anything or how were we doing, or need another beer. It was wednesday eve and the place wasnt even crowded.

41.description: Ordered through grub hub. Ended up with an inedible wilted pieces of lettuce and no chicken as ordered. Which meant no dinner. Completely disappointed, requested a refund.

52.description: Me and my fiance ordered from here every week when we moved to the neighborhood. Only a couple times I dealt with a rude employee,and the other times the service was great. You would think the burgers look super overpriced but I promise you are getting what you pay for. No matter how hungry I am I always have leftovers. The servings are HUGE and rd literally the best burger around here. I recommend the loaded Mac n cheese as a side...YUM! (I wouldn't take a first date here because you won't be able to hear anything over the blasting rock music but that's just the theme of the bar) it's a great place to hang with friends or even order to go. Food is phenomenal

50.description: HEAVEN IS REEEAALLL.GEEZ this place knows how to make some burgers.The veggie burger was out of this world. My boyfriend got the warden and said it was one of the best burgers he's ever eaten.The cheese flying out the middle when squishing it was a sight to be seen.I felt like I was in jail and liked it - Tuesdays half off can't beat it.Would highly recommend if you are looking for some great service.

4.description: I think if you walked in here really drunk you wouldn't know the difference between here and Kuma's.. Just more TV's! It's definitely not as big as I thought but definitely adequate space with a good sized bar; always a plus. Great beer list with some very obscure choices that you won't see anywhere around town! Surprisingly very large menu with tons of choices & the have their own proprietary blend for the burgers; very high Q beef folks. Tried the "Border Patrol" and it was awesome; great combo of jalapeño pepper jack cheese/ jalapeño relish/ carnitas/ avocado.. cooked a perfect MR! Thing was so big & thick I couldn't figure out how to cut it or eat it.. great fries to boot with just the right amount of sea salt. Service was great from the bartender, I cashed out and went straight to "Couch Patrol"! Get dat did

6.description: Hello Lockdown.  It has been too long that I've been meaning to visit!I rolled in with a few friends - most of us interested in The Fat Elvis due to some Grand Marnier Flambe respect and a love of peanut butter.  It was a wednesday so we were promptly seated, though the table was a bit wobbly.  It seems like the experience here is mostly geared to a 2-person party, but there are 3-4 tables built for 4 or more.The waitress was friendly, funny, and prompt and got everything done pretty quickly.Draft selections were pretty reasonable at $5-6 for most and $7 for a couple, but local cans were 1/2 off and a great deal!  The drinks came quick and our order wasn't far behind.The Fat Elvis was good, but I wouldn't necessarily say it crossed any thresholds.  I thought the peanut butter would be more overpowering but the flavor was very balanced between burger and sweet desserty PB banana.  The one thing I'd suggest is adding some cheddar (or it could be weird, but maybe even blue cheese) to bring up the level of savory a bit and make the flavor a little more complex.  Definitely a mess-maker with melty peanut butter, so make sure to grab some extra napkins.The Mac 'n cheese I subbed in for my fries was an A+ and a definite winner.  The portion is reasonable and the stuff was really, frankly, very good.  I did try a couple of my friend's fries and the dipping sauce they came with (spicy mayo-ish?) was pretty tasty and the fries were "normal" but cooked just right.The only thing that really surprised us was a friend's Old Fashioned that totaled out to $18.50 with a Maker's Mark equivalent.  I didn't take it for that type of place, but so be it.  Definitely echm Lock Down your beer order.I'll definitely be back for the mac 'n cheese, and maybe I'll have to try The Warden burger for some of that truffle oil goodness.  It definitely smelled strongly and deliciously of it from across the table!

22.description: Stopped in on a Friday night via a recommendation from a friend. I wouldn't consider myself a burger expert, but this was one of the best burgers I have ever had. Cooked perfectly, flavor to die for. NOT an intimate dinner setting by any means. Don't come here if you're looking to carry on a conversation. I only gave four stars because I had to leave my coat, hat and scarf on to eat my meal. Turn up the heat please. Also, I sat in a booth and when I left I had someone else's gum all over my jeans, sick.

15.description: love their creamy mac n cheese with the bacon bits and their Billy The Kid Salad.  Normally I find salads as an entrée so incredibly boring but this one has different combinations of interesting things that just work together so well, from the crispy tortilla strips and prosciutto that give it crunch to my favorite, gorgonzola cheese crumbles for flavor. Also with healthy avocado.  The order taking over the phone is efficient and courteous, and once when I called and hung up because there was no answer they promptly called ME back via caller ID!  Good job Lockdown!

57.description: Three words: macaroni and cheese. There's plenty of quirky burgers on the menu, and there's even more variety if you build your own. Personally, I do the veggie burger with cheese and a fried egg. It leaves me beyond full. Mix this with plenty of beverage options and the punk atmosphere, and you'll have a great time.

20.description: Had the Fat Elvis burger (peanut butter, caramelized bananas, and bacon) and it was delicious! Had the mac & cheese and it was the best mac & cheese I've had in my life. A lot better than Kuma's mac & cheese. The best part that there was NO WAIT on a Friday evening which was awesome. They have an excellent selection of craft beers. My wife had the Electric Chair which was also delicious and full of flavor. My second favorite burgers next to Au Cheval's burger. Great place and highly underrated.

36.description: Really cool atmosphere and our waitress was bad ass...don't remember her name unfortunately.  It was't super busy when we went, so no wait and the noise level wasn't brain melting.  On to the burgers - we tried three of them (cruelty to animals, border patrol and punk bitch) and all were excellent with the border patrol probably being the table favorite.  I couldn't call them the best burgers I've ever had, but they are certainly up there.  Fries and Mac were solid renditions of classic burger sides  They also have kimchi, and I had a bowl of that on the side - it was pretty awesome and a nice foil to the other heavier, richer foods on the table.

14.description: My friend prefers Lockdown to Kuma's and I prefer not to wait for lunch so off we went to eat impressively loaded burgers while watching an excellent Guns n' Roses DVD. Service and atmosphere were very friendly but I didn't like their ground beef blend - found it to be on the lean side (and I asked for my patty to be cooked medium rare, in case you were wondering). It wasn't bad, I just love fat and maybe my burger preference has fully switched over to smashed burgers.We got the Burger of the Month: the "Wrongfully Accused" and the kitchen was stupendously generous with the goat cheese - I dipped my fries in what was essentially a separate patty of goat cheese on top of my meat patty.

58.description: What a great little place. The inside is very cozy and the staff is very efficient. However, we were actually the only ones in the entire place for about an hour and this was on a Saturday night. I agree with many as in this is definitely a hidden gem. I came with my mom and boyfriend and everyone really enjoyed their food. I would love to come back if it wasn't so far out of the way. It is sort of in the middle of nowhere it seems and its not the best area to be walking around. But this is a great place and I would definitely recommend it.

56.description: My hubby had a "boys" weekend, and this place was  close to our house. So on a break from Magic tournaments, they all showered to take me out to dinner at La Encantada.I had a frozen raspberry margarita. It was okay, but a little watery.  The guacamole and salsa with the baked chips was very good. I love how the menu says "Not as good as fried."  Own baked La Encantada, because they are tasty.  For my entree, I had the enchiladas poblanas. The sauce was really good, but that's about it.  The garlic potatoes were okay, but I had a few that needed to cook a little longer. The food was okay. The place was empty, so we got a table right away and it was quiet.  Service was a little slow, but it wasn't as bad because we had a group.  Nice artwork :)

29.description: Great food - and with authentic flavor and creation! Most Mexican restaurants don't serve cactus. This place is real - based on other reviews I will stay away from the margaritas but the enchiladas were delightful and I highly recommend the Mexican zucchini which is sweeter than regular zucchini.

42.description: Good ENCHILADAS DE MOLE (had the chicken one also) but I've had better which is not to say this place doesn't deserve the 4 stars. Had the QUESO FUNDIDO, which is basically melted cheese with chorizo and eaten with HAND MADE TORTILLAS (these are amazing). Also tried my friend's GRILLED SKIRT STEAK and it was so tender my mouth wanted more. I'll definitely be back for the steak and tortillas...oh and my side of  NOPALITOS (catcus), which were greatly firm and not slimmy.Margaritas flowed easily, I like mine a tad stronger but still tasty.Service is with a smile and very friendly and polite. Great local spot that isn't divey,  has nice interiors and in an area that provides parking.

23.description: We had a wonderful dinner. Cheerful decor and great service. The waitress recommended the chile en nogada and the crepas de mole with the huitlacoche. All was great. Highly recommended!

47.description: Delicious food, great ambiance/decor and a better value would be tough to find. The neighborhood isn't Lincoln Park but the food, decor and service are better than 95% of what LP/Randolph et al have on offer AND at half the price. Grab a cab here/back and you'll still have money in your pocket after a great meal.The food is not typical northern Mexican fare...it is deeper in flavors and preparations than Sonoroan or Chihuhuan food. They put out delicious authentic mid/southern mexican food like that of Puebla with delicious mole's, etc.. The plates are well composed with smart accompaniments. Mixed drinks were on point and when we went in the summer they had the back patio open which with a margarita in hand quickly transported me to a beach in Mexico.The owner I met was the sweetest woman...I can't recall her name but the three times we have been she has taken great care to make our meals enjoyable. She cares about the quality and it shows. The exact type of business person that deserves success.

8.description: This place is so delicious I'm glad a friend told me about this place. We always get a good service dinning or take out. We have tried the enchiladas poblanas, chile en nogada (my favorite!!) carne asada oaxaqueña n tampiqueña and sopes all are very good!! So far so good and I hope it stays like that because this is defending my place for that yummy uniquely delicious CHILE EN NOGADA!!

31.description: The chips - Um... Reality check, people. They opened a package of Milagro tortillas and put them in the oven. Tasteless.The margaritas - It's a mix and they are weak.The fajitas - Guess what? They come out of a bag. How do I know? She told me. Out. Of. A. Bag.There are sooooo many places in the city that blow this spot away. Don't waste your time or your money.

34.description: I love this place!!! Excellent service from the owner.  The food is delicious!  The spinach burritos with mole are AMAZING!  I like it here since there are both veggie and meat foods so everyone can come.  The space is really nice with artwork from a local artist.  I would like to go here for dinner at least weekly.  The prices are extremely reasonable.  If this place was just a few blocks over in Wicker Park it would be much more expensive.  Worth a trip to Humboldt Park!  I wish I could rate it 6 stars.

16.description: Well, this place is different... in decor that is, odd art on the walls.  The food is decent but unfortunately,  not much past that.

13.description: Woah, why aren't more people coming here for dinner!?  My husband and I recently moved back into the Logan/Humboldt area and we were excited to try out some places near our new place on North Ave.  We came to dinner here on a weeknight and the entire place was DESERTED.  We were a bit wary at first, but then we remembered the stellar Yelp reviews online, so we continued on our dinner odyssey.The food was de-lish.  Drink prices were decent and they had a full bar, so margaritas, sangria or whatever mixed drink you want is made to order. The margs are good but a bit small for my taste (since places like El Cid are serving them up cheap and BIG), but tasty nonetheless.  Beer is reasonable and there's domestics and imports, so go crazy.Apps were delish and clearly all made in-house.  I appreciate an establishment that isn't warming frozen meals but rather making all of the food on-site.  We had some empanadas, small salads and yummy entrees.  I chose to err on the side of vegetarian and all of my choices were yummy.  If offered the option, get the steamed cactus as your side - you won't regret it!  Their menu is fairly large, there's steak, chicken, seafood and veggie options and the plates are a nice size.  Prices are reasonable and the food is so good you likely won't have room for dessert (we didn't). Parking is abundant on North Ave. and they're not too busy on weeknights, so stop on in for a quick meal.  The atmosphere is nice, a bit romantic if that's what you're looking for and the music is nice.  Staff was very friendly and always around when we needed a drink refill.

11.description: My favorite Mexican restaurant In Humboldt Park. Irma is the best food is fresh and authentic. My favorites tortilla soup and enchiladas suizas with steak. Yum!

39.description: This place is amazing food!1  We just can't believe we hadn't come sooner.  After moving back to HP 4 yrs ago, we wish we would of tried this place soon as it opened.We've tried:Queso Fundido (con Chorizo)Enchiladas RojasMargaritasCrepasNopalitosEverything is great, nice ambiance, great service!!!Go try this place!!!!

37.description: GREAT food.  Adorable establishment.

0.description: This place is a hidden gem! the enchiladas poblanos  are delicious, I really wish they were on grub hub

38.description: In the spirit of Cinco de Mayo weekend, I wanted to try a new Mexican spot on Friday night.  Living in Bucktown/Logan/Wicker, we've been to a few of the typical spots, but we generally haven't ventured the other direction into Humboldt.  I got the wife on board and we headed to La Encantada after checking out the Yelp reviews.  Despite being 9 PM on a Friday night, it was not terribly busy....I guess that's probably typical for the neighborhood, but they only had one woman working inside.  She was running around everywhere as the hostess, waitress, and bartender.  I couldn't believe it!  My wife and I figured someone must have called in sick...  BUT, the decor was surprisingly classy and fun, and she worked her butt off to keep us fed and happy.My wife and I ordered several items off the a la carte section -- the tacos were solid, and I really enjoyed my enchilada verde.  We both were shocked that we paid about $8 apiece and got PLENTY of food.  I also had a margarita, which I enjoyed (did not love nor hate, but my pet peeve is when margs are too sweet, and at least that was not the case), we shared the guacamole (DEFINITELY liked), and I had a beer with tomato and lime juice (totally forget what they call it, but it was very refreshing).All in all, solid experience, great value for what you get, and the effort the server put in made up for the slow service just due to how many tables she was serving at once.We will go back.

51.description: An absolutely fantastic find just west of Humboldt Park.  Could people be afeared of coming over this way?  Is that why it is distressingly empty every time I go in?A super warm and lovely room (and a cool little back yard for nice weather) and the staff is equally as warm and lovely.Margaritas are a solid A.  Never bothered with anything other than the regular kind.  No need for the upsell for me.  Nice and smooth.  None of that overuse of sour mix that puckers your face.Everything I have eaten there is exceptional, which bugs me cuz I want to try everything, BUT I don't want to miss out on what I had last time.Previous highlights:  Queso fresco al Oregano for starters and crepas poblanas.  My girlfriend can't NOT order the soups.My fave (so far) is the pollo asado a la tampiquena.  Even the tacos are simply fantastic.  If I've said once, I've said it hundred times: simple things done well---one of life's great pleasures.It's all so fresh and cheery and tasty.  If I could hug a building I would.Oh, and there's ALWAYS street parking galore.

27.description: This Mexican restaurant is definitely going to get a repeat visit from me. With so many Mexican restaurants just in my neighborhood alone, this was a refreshing surprise. Good quality, well priced, and delicious. Ceviche, ensalada napolitos, enchilada de pollo in mole, and spinach enchilada suiza.

32.description: I love this place! From the outside ti is very unimpressive and the neighborhood it is in is very sketchy, but the restaurant is a hidden gem. The tortilla chips are baked fresh (not fried) so they do not feel oily or heavy. Every dish I've gotten from there has been amazing! I especially like their options for sides with your entrees as they are all very unique and delicious! Everything tastes so fresh and amazing! I will be going back many times.

54.description: Didn't realize that there were restaurants this good on the West Side of Humboldt Park!  Having lived here for almost a year, I deeply regret not trying this place before, because it would have been "our spot".  The place is quiet and elegant inside, almost like an art gallery combined with a 5-star hotel bar.  My girlfriend and I started with Picaditos which were surprisingly spicy and delicious, but in a good way...  they seemed to awaken and invigorate my appetite in a way I don't remember happening before.  We also ordered a half pitcher of margaritas, which were served in the classic style (rocks, salted rim)...  excellent.  For entrees we had mole chicken with sweet potato and rice as well as the crepas de huitlacoche (enchiladas with corn/mushroom truffle).  The mole sauce was good, the chicken a bit overdone.  The crepas, on the other hand, were an out-of-the-park home run.  Hard to even describe how delicious this dish was...  you'll have to try it for yourself.  With the crepas, we tried a salad with nopalitos (slices of cactus), which I wasn't sure if I would like.  It turned out to be pretty interesting, sort of like a sliced and sauteed green pepper.  The service was excellent...  like another reviewer said, it was criminal that we were the only ones there (though we went on a Tuesday).  Just a short bus ride down North Ave (or Kimball).  5 stars!

48.description: Agree with the previous review as La Encantada being a well-kept secret... and in this case, i actually want the secret to be out! They deserve all the patronage they can get!Am vegetarian, found many vegetarian options. The Picaditas, little masa rounds topped with crumbly cheese and green sauce among other things were perfect sized accompaniments with our Micheladas. The Napolitos were nicely done, great flavours, it struck me that this is what the desert must taste like. The enchiladas poblanas were tasty inside and out. The Sopa de elote took the prize though, beautifully creamy with layers of flavour. Presentation, service and decor are all thoughtful.Will go back, there are many more dishes to try out!

44.description: We couldn't eat in due to a crazed 3 year old, but got take out instead.This was our first experience with La Encantada, but it won't be our last!The enchiladas poblanos are wonderful.  The poblano cream is flavorful, but not overpowering.  I ordered mine with cheese, but I'm going to try it with spinach next time.  The side of garlic potatoes was delicious, but if you don't like garlic, don't order them. It isn't a subtle amount of garlic.  In addition, my meal came with a fresh side salad and the guava dressing was unique and reminded me of being on a tropical vacation!My husband got the carne asada and raved about it.  It was apparently spicy, but in a good, strong flavor kind of way.The fresh guacamole was wonderful.  A good balance of fresh ingredients and cilantro.The only part that lends me to give them 4 stars instead of 5 was the dessert.  I LOVE flan.  I get it at every restaurant I can.  This one was ok, but lacked that caramel flavor and the flan itself just wasn't as creamy as I prefer.  Not a deal breaker, but a surprise after the wonderful meal we had.Can wait to get a sitter and go back to try out the margaritas.  Don't miss out on this place!

24.description: Got food to go, so my starring is generous, but the staff was friendly while I was picking up and it was very nicely decorated, so I expect that the dine-in experience warrants 4 stars. Steak enchiladas were good, and were also good warmed up the next day. Not spicy. They didn't seem to have a meal/plate order, so my rice and beans were separate. Tons of parking around.

7.description: I've been here several times, the food is excellent and service very good.  There is a lot of attention given to detail and presentation of the entrees. It's a nice place for a date or for couples to relax with a few drinks and outstanding Mexican fare.

49.description: My husband and I came here for a much needed dinner without the kids.  Our original plan was to go to Chilapan, but it was closed on Sunday so we found this place after scouring Yelp for a solid Mexican food alternative.  Thank you Yelpers!This is not a hole in the wall.  The space is clean, and upscale for a Mexican restaurant.   The food is solid.  The presentation is very good.  I like combinations of different flavors and my Chile en Nogado was definitely that.  The rice and beans were delicious (most rice and beans sides are fine, nothing spectacular). It was good enough that I am intrigued to return and try some of the other dishes.  And the price cannot be beat.

40.description: La Encantada is a Gem in our Humboldt Pk Community. I love evrything about it. The Mango Margarita was so tasty and the Diabilta Cocktail lights your fire, as well as the Camarones (Shrimp) in sweet/spicy chipotle sauce. I love their soups, Crepes with Huitlacoche (Corn Truffle), Chile Nogado, all their sauces, and moles. As you can see I am a big fan.I took my family there and being from Mexico they are extremely particular about where they eat. My family loved it and have returned many times. It can become costly, but the end result is a delicious, memorable meal that leaves you satisfied!Thank you Irma for all your hard work!

53.description: Really great food and service.  Prices aren't cheap, but it's not terribly expensive, and the quality of the food is well worth the price.Last time I went, which was on July 10th, I had the enchiladas verdes with steak.  My sides were rice and refried beans.  The steak was well cooked, but tender and amazingly lean, with no fatty pieces or gristle.  The sauce was spicy and delicious, and the crumbly cheese which topped the enchiladas was the perfect compliment of flavor and texture.  I wanted to lick my plate afterwords.Also, the server was amazingly pleasant.  Very kind and adept, but not overly talkative or intrusive.  And her timing was flawless.The only problem is they don't seem to do a lot of business (I've been there twice during lunch time, and my guests and I were the only patrons).  Because of this, I'm concerned that they won't be around much longer.So, I've written this review not only to let folks know how wonderful the food & service are at this place, but also to help ensure that it survives.  The restaurant business is incredibly tough, and there are an overabundance of crappy places that do way too much business.  I really hope this review helps...if you're in the area or planning to be, please have lunch at this place; if you like great Mexican food, you won't regret it!

30.description: We went on a Friday night a little early and were the only customers in the restaurant. So the atmosphere was hampered by that, though generally the decor and layout is nice and inviting. The artwork is below average, think 'local'. The were playing some latin tunes on the speakers and our waitress could be caught occasionally singing along. Glad she felt at home, but unusual. Margaritas were great, guacamole was very good and I liked the unique chips. The service was thoughtful and attentive. But our main dishes were average, nothing interesting about the fair but nice presentation. We found everything to be a little overpriced, $8 margarita? $16 chicken fajitas? Compare to El Cid in Logan or Garcias in Linclon Square which are much nicer and manage to be more affordable and higher volume. Overall our experience went like this: awkward, then delicious, then average, then expensive. Its an ok sit-down date-night place, but we weren't blown away.

46.description: I intended to write this after I visited La Encantada this past summer while visiting Chicago. Alas, life got the better of me, but I loved this place so much, I was determined to write a great review and I'm finally getting to it.Irma is incredible. Her Mexican food recipes are rich in flavor and not heavy. I tried the mole and I am not normally a mole person, but after talking to her about the menu, I decided to give it a chance. I'm glad I did. It was savory and spiced perfectly. I had the mole over cheese enchiladas, which was unique in itself because most moles rely or are made to flavor meat. Unfortunately, we were the only ones in the restaurant. Her location and the lack of a quality staff makes business slow; Irma was working with one other cook. We did, however, get the chance to chat with her more and learn about the restaurant and her background as a result. I truly hope that things continue to improve for the restaurant. La Encantada is a gem and should be a regular stop for anyone in Chicago. I hope I get to return sooner than later.

1.description: It's pricey. Food is alright. Not a typical hole in the wall Mexican restaurant. So you should know, I'm Mexican, and a taco should not cost $4 just because they bring it in a nice plate. Bad choice for good quality Mexican food. Good choice if you want to chat it up, have a drink, look at some wall art, and eat mediocre enchiladas while doing it.

55.description: Everything is great about this place! First and most importantly, the food. They have many dishes you don't see at most other Mexican restaurants. Their molé is superb, and they also make a nice poblano sauce. You have a couple enchilada dishes made with crepes instead of tortillas--delicious! The flavors are always savory leave me wanting more. They also have a full bar!The atmosphere is warm and artsy. The service is friendly. The price is right--actually, comparing the prices to the quality of food and atmosphere, it's a steal. The thing I don't get is why it's not busier. It's such a fantastic restaurant.

9.description: Excellent food in a comfortable setting and a good value. Linen napkins. Full bar. Local artwork on exposed brick walls. Unassuming. Elegant. Owner is spicy, original and authentic and offers regional Mexican food intelligently seasoned and delightfully presented. This is a long-time favorite of mine and I crave her enchiladas rojas or verdes, and I have canonized her mole as holy mole.

26.description: Woah, why aren't more people coming here for dinner!?  My husband and I recently moved back into the Logan/Humboldt area and we were excited to try out some places near our new place on North Ave.  We came to dinner here on a weeknight and the entire place was DESERTED.  We were a bit wary at first, but then we remembered the stellar Yelp reviews online, so we continued on our dinner odyssey.The food was de-lish.  Drink prices were decent and they had a full bar, so margaritas, sangria or whatever mixed drink you want is made to order. The margs are good but a bit small for my taste (since places like El Cid are serving them up cheap and BIG), but tasty nonetheless.  Beer is reasonable and there's domestics and imports, so go crazy.Apps were delish and clearly all made in-house.  I appreciate an establishment that isn't warming frozen meals but rather making all of the food on-site.  We had some empanadas, small salads and yummy entrees.  I chose to err on the side of vegetarian and all of my choices were yummy.  If offered the option, get the steamed cactus as your side - you won't regret it!  Their menu is fairly large, there's steak, chicken, seafood and veggie options and the plates are a nice size.  Prices are reasonable and the food is so good you likely won't have room for dessert (we didn't). Parking is abundant on North Ave. and they're not too busy on weeknights, so stop on in for a quick meal.  The atmosphere is nice, a bit romantic if that's what you're looking for and the music is nice.  Staff was very friendly and always around when we needed a drink refill.

25.description: After reading the other reviews, we decided to try La Encantada and are so glad we did! This place is a gem. Friendly service, nice atmosphere, reasonable prices, and the food is wonderful! The guacamole and salsa are fresh and delicious. We ordered the enchiladas mole and poblanas- both were great- and the Mexican zucchini and cactus sides were a refreshing change of pace. Portions are very generous- you will not leave hungry! As other reviews mentioned, this place is very quiet (we were the only ones in the restaurant the night we went.) Don't be discouraged- give it a try!

12.description: New to the area, and paid a visit based n Yelp reviews.  It won't be the last visit. Exposed brick and a dozen painted canvases give the interior character.  Despite dining at 7pm on a Saturday, the place was half full, so I doubt crowds will be a problem. I ordered pollo en mole, which I always use as a test dish for a new mexican place.  Delicious.  The mole was rich, thick, and with the bitterness that comes from high grade dark chocolate and peppers.  The portion was generous, and the rice and beans good.  I also ordered a steak taco on the side.  Again, the portion was generous and the steak well-seasons.  It's on par with Tacos de Jaliscense,and that's high praise. The two downsides were the margarita and the wait time.   The regular margarita lacked the punch I prefer; perhaps there was too much simple syrup and orange liqueur and not enough tequila and lime.  Whatever the cause, it tasted weak.   Also, we waited nearly an hour for our food to come out.  That wasn't the fault of the two waiters on duty, as I saw then hurrying around and doing the best they could.  Both of them kept our water filled and were very polite.   My guess is that the kitchen was understaffed that evening, but with the place only half full, there's no excuse for it to be that slow.

59.description: The biggest, tastiest $6 steak burrito in the city. Loaded with steak-not a bunch of filler. Great guacamole too. Friendly waitress.

21.description: We absolutely love this place! We ofter go early after work on a Friday night before the crowds, and the food is always excellent. Friendly waitstaff, good drinks and delicious food - what more could you ask for?

17.description: Our favorite place in Chicago. By FAR. Spectacular food, killer deals on a-la-carte items, El Diablito - the most incredible cocktail invented, warm and sophisticated atmosphere. Everyone  should be here. Right now. Get over here! Bring your friends!

10.description: Flat chips.  Poor service.   Very overpriced.   Sad that we traveled out of our way.    No one here.

5.description: Out of the way but worth it.  This restaurant was excellent. Enchiladas Verde were the best I have had. Portions are generous and fairly priced.

3.description: I was nervous to come in late on Sunday. I was the only customer. I'm very impressed. Even the Mexican music was modern and very nice. A hip modern place.I ordered everything alacarte just to get an "idea".  My plate was visually beautiful as if it were a featured dish. My service was perfect. The food was excellent. Quite spicy.  I would come again and not be afraid to bring a date.

35.description: Vegetarian friendly, inexpensive, authentic and delicious.  All entrees chicken, beef and spinach alternatives.  I had the plantain enchilada which comes with one side choice ( mine was spinach and onions).  The sweet potatoes were also given rave reviews.   The refried beans were the best I've had.  Everyone needs to go here.

19.description: Good ENCHILADAS DE MOLE (had the chicken one also) but I've had better which is not to say this place doesn't deserve the 4 stars. Had the QUESO FUNDIDO, which is basically melted cheese with chorizo and eaten with HAND MADE TORTILLAS (these are amazing). Also tried my friend's GRILLED SKIRT STEAK and it was so tender my mouth wanted more. I'll definitely be back for the steak and tortillas...oh and my side of  NOPALITOS (catcus), which were greatly firm and not slimmy.Margaritas flowed easily, I like mine a tad stronger but still tasty.Service is with a smile and very friendly and polite. Great local spot that isn't divey,  has nice interiors and in an area that provides parking.

28.description: Close to home with great food! Margaritas are good but not to strong unless you order them made with a special tequila (ie more expensive). first time there i ordered enchiladas poblanas, what i want was enchiladas de mole poblana, huge difference!! Good but not what i wanted, when i asked the server she said you wanted echiladas with mole sauce. Next time i ordered the enchiladas with mole and they were amazing!friendly service, and good food!

45.description: They make solid margaritas. My favorite appetizers are the queso fundido with chorizo and guac. They make a great poblano sauce so Enchilada poblanas is one of my favorites. Carne Asada Oaxaca is another.

33.description: 1st off I have to say this,  I live all the way in the South Suburbs but, I STILL COME ALL THE WAY WEST FOR THIS RESTAURANT!  I found it coming from a good friend of mines wedding.  We are both fans of Mexican Cuisine and I must say the food that we ordered was Fantastic! I even loved the presentation.  Also to add, the service was extremely exceptional, better than the bigger more "fancier" places.  Plus they have a good bar selection and cocktails.  And they weren't expensive.  The dining are while small, was very nice and intimate (great for date night) police I love the brick décor (great touch).  I recommend this place to everyone.  If you love Mexican food and want great service GO HERE!

43.description: We stopped in here on the basis of the exceptional Yelp reviews...I've now reread them and can't believe they're talking about the same place.  Only four tables occupied despite it being prime-time Saturday night; nevertheless, it took quite a while for anyone to come to our table and when she did, she told us she could only take drink orders, not food orders - too bad, because we were pretty hungry.  We managed to squeak in an order for two bowls of the Elote (corn) soup with our margarita.  The ensuing long wait for these basic items gave us time to look for the "great art" other Yelpers have described, but all we could see was bland, derivative modernist stuff (c'mon, Mexican culture has SO much worthy art for a place like this!).  Ambience like a cafeteria - lights too high, noise from other patrons echoing around the room.  The elote soup, when it finally came, was delicious - initially she had gotten the order wrong and only brought ONE bowl, so we had to wait 10 min more for the second bowl(!)  By then we had decided not to wait around for main courses so took our leave.  Perhaps take-out is the way to go here; otherwise, keep driving. There are plenty of far better Mexican choices in the area.

2.description: If this is even one of your choices for dinner, get your culata off your sofa to try it. The name translates to "the enchanted," and the place is enchanting for sure.We made a reservation for six for a Saturday night at 8. With two friends dropping out in the end, it was even more of a pity that the cute little nugget of good food and hospitality had only one other table busy when we arrived, and two new ones taken when we departed.I say it's a pity, because I took a bus to the train to a bus to get here from the South Loop and it was worth it. We started with guacamole, and it came with healthier, non-greasy, baked tortilla chips that were tasty, as was the guacamole. I'm not saying that good, oily, fried chips aren't healthy for the soul; they are. But the baked ones were a nice change of taste. Oops, I lied. We started with the booze, of course. We tried a half-picture of Diablito, which include tequila, lime, soda, and--wait for it--chile powder. Another change of taste. I wouldn't have it more than a couple times a year (tough to pull my grip off my beloved Manhattan's, even as a die-hard Chicagoan), but the just-a-tad-spicy drink was excellent. A little like I like an occasional Mexican hot chocolate in winter, even if I don't want it regularly.The most-interesting thing on the menu to me was the "Crepas Poblanas con Huitlacoche," which they describe on the menu as "Two rolled crepes filled with corn truffle topped with poblano pepper sauce and melted cheese." The server suggested getting it with mole sauce. The crepes were fantastic. If you haven't tried huitlacoche, it's high time that you did! The mole sauce, too, was good on its own; but it overpowered the dish; so next time I'll try it as is. My friend who had the shrimp fajitas raved about those.You get rice and beans with the meal, or you can substitute one of them for a number of different sides. I went for the nopalitos--the sauteed cactus. It was tasty, with its onions, tomatoes and jalapenos. My friends loved their Mexican zucchini and spinach sides.The fried plantains with the honey-cinnamon cream were a new preparation for me that was delicious, and a perfect ending to the evening.Food is supreme in my book, but I have to mention that the server was especially polite, helpful and attentive.I hope the rent here is cheap enough that they can keep going without a full house on a Saturday night.

18.description: I've lived around the corner from this place for years and never would have thought to stop in until I was craving Mexican Food one night, and boy was I surprised. This place is an absolute gem! The décor, art and ambiance is very tasteful and modern, not what one would assume for the location.  The food is awesome; as authentic as it gets in Chicago. The pollo enchiladas, sope, and guac are delish! Full bar and they don't skimp on the alcohol. I definitely recommend this place as a cute date night spot.

41.description: Really, really good Mexican place in Hombolt Park. Enchiladas to die for, good guac, tequila drinks, and dessert. Try the poblano enchiladas stuffed with corn truffle - if you've never had this, it's delicious and another alternative for those veggie heads.  Just get over the black color and you'll see what I mean. Then pair this with a nice refreshing michelada. This is a lime, salt, and clamato drink with your fave Mexican beer. So good. Also shout outs to their green squash with cheese, mole enchiladas, and rice. Everyone is good here - cant go wrong.

52.description: So my wife and I have been twice, and agree that this is probably one of the best kept secrets in the city.

50.description: Tried this place for dinner tonight and I have nothing but praise for La Encantada. The waitress was polite, helpful and attentive. The atmosphere is welcoming and eclectic-- random art on the walls. Now, the important part... the food :) I ordered the enchiladas poblanos and they were amazing. The sauce is so creamy and comforting. Great rice and refried beans. Their chips are baked and salsa is fresh and delicious.We look forward to going back!

4.description: This place is so great! Off the beaten path. But just a jog from wicker park. Fajitas served over a hot skillet with burner beneath to keep it hot as you dine.  Art on the walls very progressive. Music is low and slow. A kind of current pop/indie Spanish soulful thing. I can't say enough! I hope La Encantada stays alive for years to come!

6.description: Such a random little spot deep into Humbolt Park.  We only found it because we were in search of something we could walk to on the 606 trail.  We wandered in around 8:30 on a Tuesday night and it was empty...never a good sign.  But we don't know the area well so we just decided to go with it.  Sat at the bar, which meant we got to chat with the only person working, who also happened to be the owner.  She was great and very friendly.  Gave us some great menu suggestions, resulting in the Enchilada Verde and the Chili Relleno Queso.  Both come with a side of your choosing, plus rice or beans.  The standout dishes were the enchilada verde (owner's suggestion) and the nopales,  but everything was great!  This would be a great place to go back to with a big group to enjoy a meal and possibly some margaritas!

22.description: The food here was delicious, and the drinks were STRONG. I ordered the sizzling steak fajita's, the cactus salad, and a frozen strawberry margarita. The steak fajitas were on point, sizzling hot and delicious grilled peppers and onions. This was my first time tasting cactus, it was ok, something different, not a fan, but it wasn't bad. (LOL). The margarita that I had was super strong, not for the weak at heart. It had all the Tequila and little of the strawberry. Service was quick and the cost was average. Will definitely be returning.

15.description: This place is a hidden gem! It's in the middle of many other casual carry-out type Latino restaurants. The ambiance is higher end but relaxed. Service is good, food is awesome!

57.description: Great Mexican restaurant.  The only thing I didn't find top notch were the baked tortilla chips. The queso fundido al oregano was a solid starter.

20.description: Food in general was pretty good.  Service was very nice, and paced well.  They adjusted my mother's dinner exactly to her liking which was appreciated.  Dinner potions were a little small.

36.description: The food and service were great, but the margaritas were expensive, weak, and not nearly as good as the food.  We were the only table in the place on a Sunday afternoon.  Service was great.  Food did not come out quickly, but was fast enough.We started with sharing the quesadilla with Huitlacoche, which was perfect.  We each then ordered the carne asada, me the Oaxaca style, with cactus salad.  This was outstanding, as were the corn tortillas served on the side.  The pitcher of standard margaritas was 28 bucks, which is fine if its strong and uses fresh lime.  The mix tasted of limade.  To give you an idea of how weak the drinks are, I usually get soused on half a martini (which is embarrassing, since my peeps are Poles), but I was barely buzzing off of half of a PITCHER.For dessert, we asked for a recommendation....and Mexican fried ice cream it is!  Did not disappoint.Will return, but will stick with beer or micheladas.

14.description: Really, really good Mexican place in Hombolt Park. Enchiladas to die for, good guac, tequila drinks, and dessert. Try the poblano enchiladas stuffed with corn truffle - if you've never had this, it's delicious and another alternative for those veggie heads.  Just get over the black color and you'll see what I mean. Then pair this with a nice refreshing michelada. This is a lime, salt, and clamato drink with your fave Mexican beer. So good. Also shout outs to their green squash with cheese, mole enchiladas, and rice. Everyone is good here - cant go wrong.

29.description: Love love love this pozole ! Three different styles ,generous portions...yummmm

42.description: Employees at Pozoleria San Juan, are really friendly, I felt like as was at home. The food is delicious, prices are not bad highly recommended!

23.description: Obviously this place is known for their Pozole, which is what I stick to...not picky about my pozole so I do enjoy it when I'm in the mood for it...some of the other entrees are a bit overpriced especially for a restaurant that is in the ghetto...okay a little vent here..they claim they have "quesadillas" the "s" in the end indicates its a plural for $3.50..usually when we go with our toddler, she will eat a quesadilla..when we asked how many there were, the waitress claims only one..and its only done in a corn tortilla..so we get ONE corn tortilla with Chihuahua Cheese rolled in half..and this equals to $3.50.? can we say overpriced? (at least a flour tortilla is usually bigger in circumference) their coffee is GOOD if you like the Mexican version with a hint of cinnamon in it..However, PLEASE pay attention to the way they bill you...I recently noticed that they charge $1 for the chips and salsa..even though we never asked them to bring us chips...(not a fan..and feel I stuff myself with them even before the food arrives so I tend to avoid them) I find it deceitful that they bring something out and make it seem its complimentary when in reality they are charging you for it..I am no cheapskate but I am also not of the idea that I should be charged for something without my consent..If they are going to charge for chips and salsa they should disclose it prior to putting it on our tables...So for that bad practice alone they lose most stars...Also..the waitresses are a hit or miss...they are either attentive or completely in their own world

47.description: I like this place....one of the few you can get Pozole seven days a week (most are just weekends) and one of VERY few that have all three varieties available (usually just white and red; green is a relative rarity, from Guerrero only, I think).  Almost everything I've had there was good; they're not particularly cheap but not pricey, either, and on weekends they're one of the few places in that neighborhood open 24/7.  One of the kids who works weekend nights is kind of a snotty lil shithead, but I think he's gone now.  Oh, and though the place is quite clean, you'll reek after you're here, not unusual for Mexican restaurants.

8.description: The green pozole is perfect tastes just like my mothers.. This is definitely the place to come for the green one. I tried the red pozole and I didn't care for it.

31.description: The best pozole in the chicagoland area. I have been in and out up and down searching for some authentic great flavored pozole and I have finally found it. The green pozole is my favorite my wife loves the red one the rest of their food is pretty good I always take it to go. And best of all they have pozole available everyday and are open lonnnnng hours. Its absolutly a must try.

34.description: Went there on a Sunday night and my wife ordered pozole blanco and I ordered the pozole verde.  Both were delicious and and very tasty. I was impressed with spread they bring with pozole which is diced onions, chopped radishes, chopped cabbage, avocado, tostadas & pork skins.  I added all these condiments plus chili pepper & oregano and it reminded me of the times my grandma made this for special family gatherings.My daughter ordered only 1 chicken taco and I tried a bite and that was good too.The only reason I gave 4 stars was because while we were eating there was fruit flies flying around and we got really annoyed with having to eat and every two minutes swiping our hands in the air.  I hope they fix this problem!!I only went here because I saw it on Chicagos Best TV.

16.description: COMPETENT POZOLE, AVAILABLE DAILY, WEEKENDS 24 HRS! Pozole in three varieties (red, white, green) comes loaded with hominy, pork, and the extras (including pork rinds and avocado). But the red broth at least was a bit thin and lacking the silky unctuousness that characterizes the best pozole. And while it was competently seasoned, it was also lacking depth. Garnishes were fresh and plentiful, and there was a basket of tostadas to help you push things around in the bowl. Shaker on table held dried oregano that was powdery and dull. The house-made tamarindo was far better than Jarritos. Smoky red salsa served with basket of chips passes the test. Decent service, good street parking.

13.description: Their pozoles are earthy with lots of flavors going on and goes well with the chicharron

11.description: Obviously this place is known for their Pozole, which is what I stick to...not picky about my pozole so I do enjoy it when I'm in the mood for it...some of the other entrees are a bit overpriced especially for a restaurant that is in the ghetto...okay a little vent here..they claim they have "quesadillas" the "s" in the end indicates its a plural for $3.50..usually when we go with our toddler, she will eat a quesadilla..when we asked how many there were, the waitress claims only one..and its only done in a corn tortilla..so we get ONE corn tortilla with Chihuahua Cheese rolled in half..and this equals to $3.50.? can we say overpriced? (at least a flour tortilla is usually bigger in circumference) their coffee is GOOD if you like the Mexican version with a hint of cinnamon in it..However, PLEASE pay attention to the way they bill you...I recently noticed that they charge $1 for the chips and salsa..even though we never asked them to bring us chips...(not a fan..and feel I stuff myself with them even before the food arrives so I tend to avoid them) I find it deceitful that they bring something out and make it seem its complimentary when in reality they are charging you for it..I am no cheapskate but I am also not of the idea that I should be charged for something without my consent..If they are going to charge for chips and salsa they should disclose it prior to putting it on our tables...So for that bad practice alone they lose most stars...Also..the waitresses are a hit or miss...they are either attentive or completely in their own world

39.description: The pozole here is amazing! I love love love it. But i'm asian, and i was given plenty of awkward stares from the waiters and chefs, but really, im just here for the food. It just kind  of made it seem awkward, and my waiter ended up dropping the plate of tostadas, which made things a bit more awkward too. Usually this doesnt happen, but honestly this is probably the best pozole in chicago, or at least what i know of.

37.description: I liked the red pozole here, but I didn't think it was that flavorful. It was really good, just not great, with a little too much hominy. I really wanted a super flavorful broth, and more of it. Adding some of the pepper flakes improved that, but the star here is actually not the pozole in my opinion.The real reason to go here is the al pastor tostada. It has parmesan cheese sprinkled on top and for some reason, it tastes perfect.  The most delicious al pastor I've ever had was from a little restaurant that served only that in Sayulita, Mexico. Tacos El Ivan.I think this pastor is the only one that comes close, with the intense flavor and sweet pineapple. Go here and just get the al pastor tostadas.

0.description: My to go Mexican spot, my hubby loves their veggie burritos & ceviche tostadas. I have had their green pozole,. it's good & their steak tortas are good as well. Staff is friendly oh & the singer in the upstairs floor is great!

38.description: I was on day 3 of recovering from the flu and a double ear infection. i decided to pick up some Pozole to help with my sinuses and stuffiness.. I can only speak of the red - i wasnt adventurous enough to try the white or green : ). It was delicious! I choose pork for my meat and they were generous with the portion.. there is a little spice to it, so I wouldn't recommend for little ones. I ordered 1 order of the pozole and I was able to get about 3-4 bowls out of it. Can't beat that for under 10 bucks!

27.description: Ufff no que no! This is real. Post party eating done like we do. This place is open late late or early depending on how you living. Pozole verde is how I'm living! I'll be back again and again. Por fin!

32.description: I'm not a big soup fan, but we wanted to try this place out since seeing it on tv. Walking in we thought it was all filled up, but we sat at the last table. There is extra seating up the stairs.I thought hominy was a type of bean til my guy said it's some type of corn. I'm such a newb. So, I went with the Pozole Rojo and my guy went with the Menudo.They sure fill up with the hominy and meat and then you have all the side options. I actually wished it had less and a bit more soup. The flavoring was good, but I didn't really care for the hominy. Didn't really have much taste and it was hard/chewy texture.I wouldn't make a trip just for it, but if I was in the area, I would go back.

48.description: Looks small from the outside but there's plenty of tables.  They have posole and menudo 7 days a weeks.  The posole is available in the three colors of the Mexican flag - red, green and white.  Posole is available with either shredded chicken or pork as the meat stock.On a bad note, sometimes they have the TV and the jukebox on at the same time... LOUD ... VERY LOUD.  That's when you just shut up and eat.Great hours if you need a cure for your hangovers.8 a.m.-1 a.m. Sunday-Thursday; open 24 hours Friday-Saturday

44.description: I love pozole, and when I heard that this place offers three flavors of pozole, I decided that I must try them all. Luckily I went with two friends and so we all ordered a different color each -- white, green, and red. The white option was plain, but that's good because you get to flavor it yourself. I love the green and the red. The red is what I'm used to so that's the one I got, but I think I like the green just a little bit more. I've never added avocado or pork rinds before, but I loved it. It added a different texture to the soup and tasted delicious with it. I wish they had given us some cilantro though, I think that would have made it more flavorful for me.

24.description: The pozole out flat sucks. Maybe if I was drunk would be tolerable. We come in on dinner time the place was almost empty and the service was bad, it took the waitress 10 min to come to our table and she was unsure if we have being serve yet. I order the red pozole witch it didn't have any taste.

7.description: Honest review: tacos gross pozole decent i would not recommend going here theres a ton of better mexican restaurants in chicago the best one was the green pazole it was good but heres the problem the restaurant is far n it is in the ghetto like y will get shot ghetto then there is no parking like anywhere i dont think its worth making the trip for something not that good

40.description: There is an impressive mural of a man cliff jumping to the sea. The place is lit by red white and green neon- to match the pozoles on offer. I saw the stock simmering under a lid. I saw bus tubs full of hominy. I watched an hour long telenovela that ended with a sweating, panting older man begging a woman with intense burning eyes for his pills while apparently dying of a heart attack. The end- a cliffhanger. I had limonada, pozole with chicharrones, gelatina de limon and a lime flavored candy.

30.description: Love that its 24 hours on weekends.  Talk about serving size...you should be very hungry when you go.  It was so cool that I actually had a choice of different pozoles.  Great customer service.  Although, the location was kind of small.  Then again, im claustrophobic so its not that bad.

46.description: I love pozole! Always have always will. Thing is it's hard to get sometimes. Restaurants usually only have it on weekends. This place serves it 7 days a week.  A friend of mine told me about it a few weeks ago. Yesterday I was feeling under the weather. I drove here to grab some. I'm so glad I did :) Ive only had red pozole and he asked me if I wanted red, white or green! I felt like a newb.  I just got the red since that's what I'm used to. I got home and was ready! They give you a half of a avocado, diced onions, lime, cabbage and radish on the side. Oh don't let me forget the crisy tacos and chiccaron (pork rinds) mmmm. It was so good I can't wait to go back home and finish it. And to try the other 2 colors :)

1.description: Ok. Let me start off by saying hooowwwww excited I was about this place. Coming from a super Mexican traditional household, posole is a huge staple. HUGE! And my mother and sister have mastered his amazing stew.  I looked up a few places for posole and this by far had the best ratings .. I dragged my boyfriend here on a Saturday afternoon and raved about how amazing his first posole experience would be.. ( he's white) .. Welp. We both ordered the large chile rojo posole and let's just say I was far from thrilled or excited .. The flavors were very bland, very little spice and almost no salt .. I was so disappointed .. The portion was a good size but because it wasn't very good, I didn't eat much of it.. Maybe they were having a bad day? I'm tempted to try again.. Maybe.

9.description: The green pozole was great. The coffee was good with a hint of cinnamon just the way I like it. Definitely going back to try the pozole blanco and rojo.

26.description: I was only introducted to Pozole a short time ago but it is a fire that is burning brighter in my food universe than most others. This place is what you would expect of a small humbolt park joint, walk down north avenue and save me the trouble of paiting a picture for you, im here for the food! Not the realtive saftey of my car stereo or cleanliness of the urinals.That being said...GO HERE NOW!!!If you are Chicago foodie nothing should matter to you but the food. This place is Pozole heaven. They offer 3 kinds of Pozole, Verde, Blanco and Rojo. All large orders come with Tostadas, Chicharon, Onions, Avacado, and cabbage on the side. Im not ashamed in saying I ate and entire large order by myself.What I Order:Pozole RojoIm not a big fan of verde sauces or salsas and the deep red color and vibrant flavor of this soup/stew will not only warm your body but your life. You will literally feel like a plush stuffed animal bear after you eat this and your stomach will be hugging itself.

25.description: Ufff so good, I loved it will come back here again. The pozole is so good.They sell good deserts and tacos. Great place to come and eat There's even music!!!

12.description: I'm not a big soup fan, but we wanted to try this place out since seeing it on tv. Walking in we thought it was all filled up, but we sat at the last table. There is extra seating up the stairs.I thought hominy was a type of bean til my guy said it's some type of corn. I'm such a newb. So, I went with the Pozole Rojo and my guy went with the Menudo.They sure fill up with the hominy and meat and then you have all the side options. I actually wished it had less and a bit more soup. The flavoring was good, but I didn't really care for the hominy. Didn't really have much taste and it was hard/chewy texture.I wouldn't make a trip just for it, but if I was in the area, I would go back.

21.description: The Pozole is phenomenal. They don't skimp on the meat, nice balance of soup & hominy, veggies are fresh, tostadas & the chicharon are crunchy. But if you're not in the mood for pozole (who says no to pozole?!) They do the usual Mexican fare quite nicely.  Decor & interior design isn't much to look at. Service is solid,  never had a problem whenever I've gone.

17.description: Their pozole and food is really good here. Their prices are right and the family that owns it is very nice.
