I've been eating here now for 6 years and I'm always full and satisfied when I leave San Juan. I would totally recommend this place to anybody interested in authentic Mexican food.

10.description: We saw this place on Check Please. Im not sure how this place has four stars but it shouldn't. And if makes a difference to anyone I am Mexican. First off the salsas were okay and there was one red one awful, it tasted like it had piccalilli in it. The pozole is okay. On the bland side. The pierna tostada cold as in the meat was cold. The carne asada taco was also just okay, the al pastor taco meat was crunchy it was so over cooked. A few reviews below talk about over priced quesadillas and using chihuahua cheese, THE CHEESE IS MUNSTER NOT CHIHUAHUA!!!! Huge difference. There are literally hundreds of fabulous Mexican dives in this city and this is a dive with mediocre food at best. Skip it and keep going!!!

5.description: I thought I was eating good Mexican food in Phoenix, but no way, this Mexican food was the best Mexican food I've eaten in a long time. sorry to my wife there - but I'm talking about food that I've eaten at restaurants . At this my wife pipes in "the beans are real!", and I know that's about the best thing any five foot nothing Latina can say about a Mexican restaurant.I had a wet burrito with carne asada, a couple people in the group at posole blanco, and there was the ever-present carne asada tacos. let's hear it for the tacos! All I can say is what I said earlier: this is about the best Mexican food I've had in a restaurant in my entire life.I'd rate this a 10 out of 10, definitely would do it again.Price wise six of us ate for about 60 bucks.

3.description: This place is awsome, I had the pozole rojo (red pozole ) and I must say it's a very close 2nd place to my mama'pozole.  The hominy was not from a can, which is evident by the taste.  I recommend this for a pozole craving.

35.description: I have 12 years of Pozole eating experience. I have not only eaten Pozole from my friends mothers table who is from Mexico, but I have also made it myself after being taught by her. Needless to say, this Pozole is as good as it gets. And the fact that they serve it 3 different ways(white/verde/red) just makes this place that much better. The kicker though to the whole experience is the Chicharon that accompanies it. Damn!!! I have never tried to dip my Chicharon in some Pozole, but whoa buddy, that salty, pork flavor just kicked up the whole soup by about ten degrees. Why hadn't I ever thought to do it this way is beyond me. So much better than just cracking some tostada into the soup. I literally was leaving the chicharon half-in half-out so it would soak and soften it up. It was killing me it was so damn good. Sheesh, before I forget, the Pozole I tried was the Verde style. Now, I am not sure how you eat your Pozole but I prefer a ton of lime and also a generous amount of salt, since the ingredients in Pozole are not always the most flavorful, especially hominy which is just filler. I also like a mad amount of chopped onion, cabbage and radish to kick it up a few extra notches. Finally, if you are any bit like me, you will ask for a fresh plate of Jalapenos to munch on, especially good with some salt on top, to really bring the entire meal together. Yeah boy, this dish was money!!!Enjoy Suckas'!!!

19.description: Amazing taco/torts and Pozole is amazing. Service is professional but could be better. This is a must go for Mexican food. The horchata is on point!!! Try it you won't regret it. Don't sit near the door in the winter though very breezy.

28.description: Pozole was good. We came on an empty stomach and we still couldn't finish a large bowl. I had the green pozole but will try the red next visit. The green was good but kinda feel like it was "standard good", not bad but not stand out good either. Idk if this was an off day but with all the great reviews and seeing this place on Chicago's Best had me expecting bigger results. So 4 stars for good service, good food and expected pricing. I will come for another try.

45.description: This is the only Pozoleria in Chicago.  Pozole Verde is from the State of Guerrero (acapulco,chilpo,taxco,ixtapa, etc) just like me. So I go here every time I am in the mood for some pozole verde made out of mole verde not salsa verde like other restaurants. They offer authentic Pozole Verde, it can be hot/spicy. Try it with chicharon, avocado, tortilla chips and modelo, tecate or bahemia. mmmm rico! I have been a fan of this place,  it's kind of losing it. There is a new place on North Cicero by Irving Park that also offers Pozole Verde, I think is taking San Juan's place.El mejor pozole verde en el area de Chicago. No te lo puedes perder.

33.description: So effen good.

43.description: I hate to be the jerk who brings their rating down but oh well, I call it how I see it. Had the Green Pozole, it was okay at best. Needed a lot of lime to get the taste to my liking. The garnish options are quite plentiful including avocado and REAL chicharron, but unfortunately this is where the praise ends. I sampled the Red Pozole the better half ordered and the taste was less than appetizing. I wanted to love this place as usually you can only find this stuff usually on weekends and they serve it at all times, but I won't be frequenting this place anytime soon. It just really doesn't do it for me.

2.description: Pozole that hits the spot! They have pozole in green, red, and white, and you can it in regular (pork) or with chicken. They also have other awesome mexican food! Tried their sopes de carne asada. I don't know what they season their carne asada with, but it might as well be crack because its that good and makes you wanna go for more! Small crammed place, but that's just how the building was set up long before they were there. Stop by and you won't be dissapointed!

18.description: Nope! Expected authentic flavors and more veg. The Chicharron had old tortillas stuck to them. The avocado was not ripe and the salsas were bland. Only thing that gets a pass is the soda (it was cold). Won't be back.

41.description: My boyfriend was looking for a rest. that served menudo during the week and so we thought we would give this place a try.  The food was great.  I had a torta which was delicious and my boyfriend of course had the menudo and he thought it was orgasmic.  The price was average and we walked out paying no more than $25 for the meals, including drinks.  The place is small but wasn't crowded, but we did go on a weekday night.We def. will be going back for the menudo the only personal complain is that the rest. is not right off a major expressway which makes it about a 45 minute drive w/o taking traffic into consideration.

4.description: My husband found this delicious place. The Pozole was very very very good! Good amount on everything! Very have to find a good Pozole place. Will come again!!!!

6.description: I love this place!! Whenever I'm in the mood for posole/pozole I come here. They have 3 varieties red,green, & white. I always get the red with chicken. The portions are big. I always leave with leftovers. It's about $10 for one I think. It's been a while since I've been out that way. Totally worth it though. They give you generous amounts of radish,cabbage and lime too. Dammit, now I want some!!! But definitely stop in if you're feeling in the mood for some posole/pozole.

22.description: COMPETENT POZOLE, AVAILABLE DAILY, WEEKENDS 24 HRS! Pozole in three varieties (red, white, green) comes loaded with hominy, pork, and the extras (including pork rinds and avocado). But the red broth at least was a bit thin and lacking the silky unctuousness that characterizes the best pozole. And while it was competently seasoned, it was also lacking depth. Garnishes were fresh and plentiful, and there was a basket of tostadas to help you push things around in the bowl. Shaker on table held dried oregano that was powdery and dull. The house-made tamarindo was far better than Jarritos. Smoky red salsa served with basket of chips passes the test. Decent service, good street parking.

15.description: Not bad, it's a nice little place. Could be a little bigger as far as the seating arrangement goes.  However the Salad is pretty good and so is the Fruit. Unfortunately that was all I could have cuz I had already eaten earlier and we we're going for an Early Father's Day Dinner. But I would be back.

20.description: If you want excellent posole come here! An Uber driver recommended it and I was so glad he did! The location is ruff, I wouldn't go at night but that's just me. We had the nachos also. They were okay, a bit expensive for what they were and there was nothing exciting about them.

36.description: BIG shout out to my coworker and friend Javier. We had been talking at work the other day how much we both like pozole. So he recommended I try this place. This is the perfect cold weather comfort food! Since it's been a few weeks since I've had it, I've been craving it. I asked the 'ole hubby to get some on his way back from work Saturday. It was our first time trying this place! He got an order of green *and* the red pozole. Both were good, but I liked the red best! The portion was HUGE! He paid about $26 but he got two big containers of the pozole, all the trimmings (chicharron, oregano, onion, radish, lime and even avocado!) and two hot chocolates. So I think for the portion size, that was a good deal. We ended up eating it over two meals so I think that is quite a value.Pozole is usually served only on weekends so this place is cool because pozole is their thing -and they serve it ALL THE TIME. This could be dangerous, as it's located on the way home from work. Ah well. It's some good stuff.If you like pozole...give 'em a try!

14.description: Pozole in good but for the price just  make it yourself.  They give you a small  bowl that's supposedly a large,  they charge  about  $2 for tostadas,  aguacate,  chicharrón like  that's supposed to come with it.

3.description: Need a unique gift idea, want to buy cool handcrafted furniture, do you want to see a Wineceros (rhinoceros + wine), do you like Nintendo,  then check out Apartment 528!  This is a great store with something for everyone.  You can buy anything from vintage cameras, to $25 dollar mini screening kits, to a an awesome handcrafted desk.   Also the owners are an amazing husband and wife duo, India and Jerome.  When chatting with them they are like a great movie in that they will make you laugh, cry, and get sentimental. If you are in West Bucktown/East Humboldt Park, I highly recommend you check out this hidden treasure.  Also ask about their cool events like the 8-Bit Nintendo Parties.

1.description: A tightly edited yet inviting shop in the heart of the thriving "West of Western" district in Humboldt Park, Apartment 528 features a mix of artisan made decor, lighting and furniture alongside colorful vintage artwork, blankets, kitchenware and books. Everything is well organized, clean and ready to be integrated into your space. Quirky finds included a first edition copy of "The Shining" and handmade wooden lamps referencing 8-bit video games like Zelda and Mario. The owners, India and Jerome, are veterans of the Chicago vintage scene and are happy to help you find the perfect piece for your home or office.

2.description: Beyond kitsch, this place has amazing one of a kind vintage, repurposed, and recycled goodies for sale.  The shop owners couldn't be nicer, and there is always something new every time I stop in.  A+

0.description: What a fabulous find!  I have reached the point in life where I only buy things that I absolutely love.  (And I mean "love" in capital letters.)  Well, this store has a lot of them.  Look here for unique, truly special things that will bring you joy over a lifetime.  Things that you would take with you if your house was on fire.  Apt 528 has done the hard work of finding and collecting these gems under one roof, so you can simply enjoy the shopping experience.I live in California and found so much cool stuff here, while browsing online.  I could've spent several paychecks, but I limited myself (for now) to shelving.  Think shelving is boring?  Not at this store.  It is art.  Unfortunately, the item was sold out, so I contacted the store to see if they might be replenishing their stock.  India respond.  She is the most lovely, helpful, customer-oriented person ever.  She not only managed to find the item for me, she sent extra pictures, took measurements, and answered all of my questions.  She shipped the items and I am beyond happy.  Love her!  Love the items.  BEST.  STORE.  EVER!!!

3.description: They have a remarkable attention to detail and are very skilled. With a brief glance of a picture, they can replicate anything that you want. I cannot recommend these barbers enough.

1.description: I will start by saying that I'm not really picky when it comes to haircuts. I usually go to a woman who charges $8, but this place is right down the street from me, so I thought I would try it out. It was, without question, the worst haircut I've ever had.Maybe they're used to doing buzz cuts and I threw the guy off by asking for a scissor cut, but I don't think it should be that big a problem in any case. He took around an hour to cut my hair. At first I was appreciating the attention to detail. After a while though, I got the feeling that he had no idea what he was doing. He trimmed tiny amounts of hair and rotated the chair repeatedly. He kept going over the same spots and trimming little bits off like a topiary. I didn't get a really good look at my hair before I left, but I assumed that he got everything really well since he took such a ridiculously long time. By that point I was kind of exhausted from sitting in that chair and repeatedly craning my neck.I handed him a $20 bill and he just took it and said "thanks man". I have no idea how much the cut actually cost, because he didn't give me change back.When I got home, I looked in the mirror and was amazed by how bad my hair looked. I had a mullet in the back, and there were parts of my head where the hair was still long. I ended up trimming it myself so it would look halfway decent.Was he playing a joke on me because I didn't fit in at the shop? Could he truly have been that bad at a basic haircut? I really don't know. I do know that I'm not going back!

2.description: My guy hopped around to different barbers looking for someone who could handle kinky hair, without much success - until we found this place, thanks to Yelp. Joel took his time, was super friendly, and really nailed it. We'll be back.

9.description: Awesome haircut - his use of the straight razor was better than anything I had had at any military post I have been on.  I finally found a barber in Chicago I can rely on.

10.description: Puerto Rican barbers have skills.  After checking yelp for reviews on barber shops in Humboldt Park, I decided to give this place a shot.  I've been cutting my own hair for the last 4 year after dealing with a few barbers on the south side of Chicago.  They always seemed to do something really good, but then mess up something else like my lining or beard.  Anyhow,  I checked Moca Master Cuts out to get my birthday fade.  It was about 11am on last Friday.  The place was not busy at all.  The barber, Oby had me in and out in about 30 mins.  It was a low cut, with razor lining, tapered back. The price was great (without me mentioning that it was my birthday.)  And the atmosphere was pretty chill, which is kinda important to me.

4.description: Best service!!!  I discovered this barber shop thru yelp and the team here are very friendly with great barber skills.  Personally I advise to cut with Joel who is the front man near the door.

6.description: I had my own barber before coming to this place. My brothers come here all the time and keep telling me to go.. well yesterday I finally did. I arrived around 5:40 but it seemed like they were about to close shop. I talked to Joel (the owner) when I walked in the shop and he had no problem in taking me. I showed him a picture of what I wanted.. and thats exactly what I got. Top notch haircut at an EXTREMELY AFFORDABLE price. I highly recommend this place. I will be coming here from now on.

11.description: I Usually cut my own hair however my hairline is receding and lately just haven't been feeling like my haircuts are coming out the way i would like them to. Anyways im no professional i happened to be going to cvs and noticed that Moca Master Cuts just opened . I decided to give Moca a try its within walking distance for me and  I have to take a picture for my company on friday. Im so glad i decided to .. the barber who ended up cutting my hair was Gabbie (I Hope I spelled this right) Not only a professional but a perfectionist. I couldnt be more pleased with the service i had no wait and  not only did i get my hair cut but i requested  my goatee as well as my brows lined up . I look forward to going to Moca again ive decided to take better care of myself by taking the time to groom myself and sometimes that means letting a professional do it . All this time i thought i looked ok but when Gabbie was done with me i looked amazing and i felt good . Give Moca a try you wont be disappointed! Gabbie was able to make my line up look so  good that i may keep my hair this fall rather than whack it bald like i was used to because of my receding high hair line .

5.description: Been going here every couple weeks for the last year and never had a bad experience.  These guys are masters with the clippers and straight razor.  Very reasonable prices too.

7.description: Wow..really awesome Barber Shop. So let me start off by saying I'm a white gay professional guy in his mid-30's..well, late 30's but whatever. When I was in need of a quick cut I considered the PR barber shop that I pass on my way to work since it was a monday and most salons are closed. It's the kind of place with white walls, fluorescent lighting, a huge PR flag and a poster on the wall of a grid of hair cuts shown with numbers. I was pretty intimidated because being gay and having only gone to hair salons or at the very least a fancy barber shop I was a little scared I was going to walk out of there with a "number 4" a tight fade with lines in the side...After going in I soon realized that this is a great place with really talented barbers. I have never had so much time and effort put into a haircut..he used clippers, scissors, a straight razor, everything..I love it. Quick, great, and inexpensive..Joel is the guy I have gone to and he is really Awesome! I'm really glad I put aside my own dumb prejudices and preconceived notions what all these PR barber shops are like..it made me feel dumb. I love going there and I would suggest it to anyone.

8.description: Best hair cut had in years. Ernie does a fantastic job. Always grows in looking great that's a sign of a good hair cut. Regular cuts only 12 bucks. I am glad I found this place,  after searching for a barber for awhile.

0.description: Arrived at the shop around 4ish. Didn't have to wait a single minute. Ernie was my barber and he cut my hair exactly how I wanted. Coming from Brooklyn, NY and having been traveling around quite a bit, finding a competent barber has been tough. Apparently standards are high in NYC. Go figure. I can say with confidence that this is my new go to barbershop in Chicago. It's also good to note that I was extremely pleased with their pricing model. Cheap haircut with exceptional quality. What more can you ask for?

1.description: I'm very selective on where I buy things for my spiritual needs & when I came across this place i was not dissapointed. This place has a wide variety of anything you'd need! The man who runs the shop is very insightful & I trust his judgment/advice. I definitely recommended this place to anyone whether you're already spiritually in tune or just learning to be.

0.description: This place use to be Ricky's Botanica but it is now under new ownership.  They have a great selection of candles, oils, and as the name "Siete Rayos" implies, many items for Palo.  The owners were very friendly and courteous.  If they do not carry an item, they are more than willing to track it down for you.  Their business card states that they can help in difficult cases and that they also do cleansings for yourself, business, or home.

1.description: I went here with a friend for lunch because it's close to the 606 and the Western Blue line stop. We had some wonderful big bowls of noodle soup ($6 each) and split some nigiri sushi (8 pieces for $10). Everything was delicious and very reasonably priced, especially for Logan Square. I will definitely return.

0.description: Excellent food, atmosphere, and service! As a big fan of the previous StickyRice location, I was thrilled by Sweet Rice's recent opening. This location is definitely more intimate, with a rich ambiance and dark wood decor. Absolutely Beautiful! The menu is a bit different - offers a greater variety of Japanese and Korean dishes --but still keeps the tried and true Thai favorites! I love their curry dishes, Thai ice tea, and coconut/rice ice cream!! Most recently, tried the Maki! And was impressed! This place was a bit hard to find, but definitely worth going to!! I will definitely be coming back soon!
